Driver 1 (Rex Watters) was driving south on State Road 446 in a government owned pickup truck when a deer entered the roadway from the east. Mr. Watters was not able to avoid contact with the deer and struck it with the front of the vehicle.

At approximately 1938 hours on 2/7/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 on the east side of the intersection at 3rd Street and Jordan Avenue. V2 was stopped waiting for the light to cycle and V1 idled into the rear of V2. V1 was stopped behind V2 on the east side of the intersection at 3rd and Jordan. D1 advised that she mistakenly thought the light had turned green and lifted her foot from the brake. D1 advised that she idled forward into the rear of V2 before she could correct herself.V2 was stopped on the east side of the intersection at 3rd and Jordan. D2 advised that he was waiting for the light to cycle when he was rear ended by V1. Neither story complained of injury or provided conflicting accounts of the event. Very minor paint transfer occurred between V1 and V2.

V1 is a passenger bus currently operating its scheduled route.Prior to the accident V2 was facing north on Jordan Avenue at 3rd Street. V2 was waiting for the light to turn green to turn left onto 3rd Street. V1 was behind V2 waiting to perform the same action. D2 stated she got the green arrow to turn left. While in the intersection making her left turn, a pedestrian darted out in front of her forcing D2 to slam on her brakes. As V2 stopped, V1 rear ended V2. V2 had minor scuffs and scratches along the entire rear bumper. D1 agreed to the above statement. D1 stated that he was unable to stop V1 in time due to the sudden braking due to the pedestrian running out in front of V2. V1 had no damage and the impact struck the metal bike rack attached to the front of the bus.The pedestrian left the area and the identity is not known.
Vehicle 1 was North bound on I69 when it began to hydroplane and the D1 lost control of the vehicle. The vehicle spun and came to striking the guardrail.
V1 was parked, unoccupied, and facing south bound.

D2 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON SOUTH SARE ROAD, JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF EAST CANADA DRIVE AND SOUTH SARE ROAD.D2 STATED THAT AN AMBULANCE WAS DRIVING SOUTH WITH LIGHTS FLASHING.D2 STATED THAT HE DID PULL OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD IN ORDER TO ALLOW FOR THE AMBULANCE TO PASS.D2 STATED THAT AS HE WAS SLOWING/STOPPED ON SOUTH SARE THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON SOUTH SARE ROAD, JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF EAST CANADA DRIVE AND SOUTH SARE ROAD.D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT REALIZE THAT AN AMBULANCE WAS DRIVING SOUTH, WITH LIGHTS AND SIRENS GOING.D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT COME TO A COMPLETE STOP.D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 THEN MADE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS DISABLED DUE TO THEIR DAMAGE, NOR WAS EITHER VEHICLE TOWED.

D1 WAS DRIVING NORTH ON N. WALNUT ST. D1 BEGAN TO SLOW DOWN AND MAKE A LEGAL LEFT TURN INTO ALL AMERICAN STORAGE. D2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BEHIND D1 AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME. D2 SWERVED AND HIT D1 IN THE BACK DRIVER SIDE BUMPER SCRAPPING DOWN THE ENTIRETY OF THE LEFT SIDE OF V2.D1 STATED HE SAW D2 SLOW TO TURN. D1 STATED HE ATTEMPTED TO MISS D1, BUT MADE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF D2.D2 STATED SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT. D2 STATED D1 HIT HER ON THE LEFT SIDE OF HER REAR DRIVERS SIDE. D2 STATED ALL THE DAMAGE CURRENTLY VISUAL ON THE LEFT SIDE OF HER VEHICLE WAS FROM D1 HITTING HER.

Vehicle 1 and vehicle 2 were traveling east on W 2nd Street. Vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2. At the intersection of 2nd and Rogers both vehicles were going to turn south onto Rogers. Driver of Vehicle 1 stated that the light was green and he thought vehicle 2 was going to take off faster than it did. Driver of vehicle 1 then slammed on the brakes to try and avoid hitting Vehicle 2. Driver of Vehicle 1 was unsure if he made contact with vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 then turned south onto Rogers and slowed down. Vehicle 1 followed vehicle 2 south on Rogers. Vehicle 2 then turned west onto the Hospital property. Vehicle 1 did not see damage to vehicle 2 and because vehicle 2 had not yet stopped, Driver 1 thought an accident may not have occurred and continued to the ambulance bay at the hospital.Both Vehicle 1, an IU Health Bloomington Ambulance Service and driver of Vehicle 2 called to report the accident.Vehicle 1 had no damage and Vehicle 2 had very minor damage to the rear driver's side. Vehicle 1 was an ambulance transporting a patient to the hospital. The EMT that was in the back on the ambulance was sitting on the bench seat. When the driver slammed on the brakes the EMT side toward the front of the ambulance and off the bench. The ambulance did not have the net at the end of the bench to prevent the EMT from falling. The EMT was taken to IU Occupational Health for his injuries, laceration to the head and rib pain.

Vehicle 1 was traveling westbound on main street in the left lane approaching sale Street when an older model red Dodge Durango side swiped Vehicle 1 as it passed. The red dodge Durango left the area.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON S STRAIN RIDGE ROAD WHEN IT HIT AN ICE AND DEBRIS COVERED PORTION OF THE ROADWAY. D1 THEN LOST CONTROL OF V1 AND IT WENT OFF OF THE WESTSIDE OF THE ROADWAY, STRUCK A SPEED LIMIT SIGN, AND STRUCK A MAILBOX.

When I arrived on scene, both vehicles had moved from where the crash occurred. The crash involved a white Ford truck (V1), driven by Ronald Spicer (D1), and a black Honda sedan (V2), driven by Tahar Khan (D2). Neither driver complained of any injuries at the scene.They both told a similar story. V2 was backing northbound in the back parking lot of 1412 N Jordan Ave when V1 was backing out of a east facing parking spot. V2 backed up behind V1 and V1 backed into V2. V1 sustained a very minor scuff to the black plastic piece on the driver side rear bumper. V2 sustained a dent in the driver side front fender and a cracked driver side mirror housing.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 was unable to provide a statement at the scene. D2 stated that she was traveling W/B on W. 2nd Street approaching the intersection at S. Maple Street. D2 stated that V1, which was originally traveling E/B on 2nd Street, entered into her lane of travel. D2 stated that she then steered her vehicle into the E/B lane when V1 struck the rear passenger's side of V2. D2 stated that V2 was spun around and rested on the Northside of the roadway. D3 stated that he was traveling W/B on W 2nd Street approaching the intersection of S. Maple Street. D3 stated that he observed V1 enter into V2's lane of travel. D3 stated that V2 attempted to avoid the accident and was struck on the rear passenger's side. D3 stated that V1 continued forward and then struck the front of V3. All involved parties declined any injuries at the scene. Officer McGlone conducted SFSTs on D1 and an OWI investigation. Officer Lucas, a Certified Breath Test Operator (#A184610) conducted the Breath Test at the Bloomington Police Department Yielding a result of 0.267 g/210L W1 stated that he was traveling behind V1 prior to the collision. W1 stated that V1 was serving in its' lane. W1 stated that he watched as V1 entered into oncoming traffic in the W/B lane colliding with V2 and then V3. W2 stated that he was traveling behind V3 prior to the collision. W2 stated that he only observed V2 spin out of her lane and V1 colliding with the front of V3.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling eastbound on 13th street approaching Indiana Avenue. V2 was traveling northbound on Indiana Avenue approaching 13th Street. V1, who had a stop sign and failed to yield right of way, pulled out in front of V2. V2 was unable to stop in time and collided with V1.D1 stated that she was approaching the stop sign and came to a complete stop on 13th Street. Due to a nearby bridge, along with low lighting, she did not see V2 approaching from her right. She then pulled out in front of V2 and did not see V2 until just before the collision. She stated she made a complete stop at the stop sign and was going under 10 miles an hour when she pulled out onto Indiana Avenue and struck V1 with the front, passenger bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated her headlights were activated prior to collision.D2 stated he was traveling northbound on Indiana Avenue. When he was approaching 13th street, he noticed V1 did not appear to stop at the stop sign. V1 then pulled into his lane of travel and D2 was not able to stop in time. V1 then struck V2 in the intersection of 13th and Indiana Avenue. D2 said he was traveling between 20 and 25 miles an hour when his front, driver's side bumper was struck by V1. His headlights were activated prior to collision.There were no injuries. V2 was able to be driven from the scene. V1 appeared to be in operable condition; however, D1 did not feel safe driving it and contacted a personal tow through AAA.

As I was arriving on scene to crash # 190337, both vehicles were exiting the private drive of 1412 N Jordan Ave. The crash involved a white Ford truck (V1), driven by Ronald Spicer (D1), and a black Honda sedan (V2), driven by Tahar Khan (D2).I observed V1 as it was attempting to exit the private drive and V2 was stopped behind him. V1 instead attempted to backup and backed into V2. I asked D1 what happened and he stated that V2 "came flying up on me" even though I witnessed V2 stopped and not moving behind V1 when the crash occurred.V1 sustained no visible damage separate from crash 190337. V2 sustained multiple cracks in the center of the front grill. Neither driver complained of any injuries at the scene.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.

WHILE TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON GORDON PIKE, UNIT 2 CAME TO A STOP AT THE FLASHING RED LIGHT. UNIT 1 WAS ALSO TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON GORDON PIKE, BEHIND UNIT 2. WHILE UNIT 2 WAS STOPPING FOR THE FLASHING RED LIGHT, UNIT 1 MADE CONTACT WITHT THE REAR BUMPER OF UNIT 2. AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDDENT, ONLY AN INFORMATION EXCHANGE WAS COMPLETED. BOTH DRIVERS STATED THEY AGREED TO ONLY AN INFORMATION EXCHANGE. WHILE ON SCENE, I OBSERVED VERY LITTLE DAMAGE ON THE VEHILCES. BOTH PARTIES STATED THEY DID NOT WANT MEDICAL ATTENTION.ON 02/09/2019, THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 CAME TO THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE TO REQUEST A CRASH REPORT. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE HAD GONE TO THE DOCTOR'S OFFICE AND WAS TOLD SHE HAD A CONCUSSION. SHE ALSO STATED SHE RECIEVED A QUOTE FROM A DEALERSHIP FOR DAMAGE REPAIRS OF OVER $1000.

Complainant called into dispatch stating they could hear what sounded like a vehicle stuck in the yard behind their house. Deputy Greene and I (Lt. Allen Mullis) arrived a few minutes later to find Desmond Gilbert trying to get a 1998 green Oldsmobile out of the yard. Desmond told Deputy Greene he had swerved to miss a deer on Strain Ridge Road and ran off the roadway into the field/yard he was in.Desmond then said he had a friend across the street that might be able to pull him out. As Desmond was leaving the area I asked him how he went off the road and he said he swerved to miss a deer. Upon my inspection of the crash scene it appeared that Desmond had sideswiped a utility pole while driving south on Strain Ridge Road which broke off the passenger side mirror, then went into a ditch, then lost control of the vehicle sending him off into the yard. There were also several circles in the grass where it appeared Desmond had made several trips around they yard, causing damage to the grass. I asked Desmond if he had consumed any alcoholic beverages and he said no. I administered a PBT and Desmond registered a Br.A.C. of (.099) %. At that point Deputy Greene took over the OWI investigation where he transported Desmond to the MCSO for further testing as the weather conditions were extremely cold and windy. Deputy Greene later advised that Mr. Gilbert had passed the field sobriety tests but failed the certified breath test by registering a BAC of (.08). Deputy Greene contacted the prosecutors office and they advised they did not want to pursue prosecution for the OWI.

V1 was traveling northbound on Curry Pike, in the right hand lane, south of Jonathan drive when V1 traveled over the center line and sideswiped V2, in the left hand lane, who was also traveling northbound. D2 stated they had entered a slight curve in the road and V1 continued straight side swiping their vehicle. D1 stated he was not aware of the curve in the road and couldn't remember crossing over the center line.

WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON SOUTH ROGERS ST, UNIT 1 APPROACHED THE BRIDGE. THE NORTH BOUND LANES ON THE BRIDGE WERE COVERED IN ICE. UNIT 1 STATED SHE ENTERED ONTO THE BRIDGE AND LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. SHE STATED THE VEHICLE SLID TO THE WEST SIDE OF THE BRIDGE, AND IMPACTED THE BRIDGE GUARD RAIL. AFTER IMPACTING THE WEST SIDE, THE TRUCK THEN TURNED EAST AND IMPACTED THE EAST SIDE OF THE BRIDGE. UNIT 1 CAME TO A REST FACING EAST, BLOCKING BOTH THE NORTH AND SOUTH BOUND LANES.

On 02/08/2018 I was dispatched to a two-vehicle collision at 8th and Woodlawn Avenue. V1 was traveling northbound on Woodlawn Avenue overtaking a bus just prior to the collision. V2 was stopped in traffic in the northbound lane of Woodlawn Avenue just south of 9th Street just prior to the collision.I spoke with D1, who advised me that he was driving north on Woodlawn Avenue just north of 8th Street. He stated that he noticed a small bus was parked halfway in the northbound lane of traffic letting people off of the bus. He stated that he went around the bus and noticed V2 stopped in traffic at the last second. He stated that he did not have enough time to brake in order to avoid a collision. He stated that the front bumper of his vehicle struck the rear bumper of V2. I spoke with D2, who advised me that he was stopped in traffic in the northbound lane of traffic just south of 9th Street. He stated that while stopped, the front bumper of V1 struck the rear bumper of his vehicle. No injuries were reported to me at the scene. I noticed a blue small bus parked in the northbound lane of traffic just north of 8th Street.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT STREET, NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 6TH STREET.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN THE FAR LEFT LANE TRAVELING NORTH.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID ATTEMPT TO TURN RIGHT IN TO THE MIDDLE LANE, TO CONTINUE NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT STREET.D1 STATED THAT THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT AND THAT SHE WAS IN THE MIDDLE LANE.D2 STATED THAT THERE WAS A GREEN LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF WALNUT AND 6TH STREET.D2 STATED THAT V1 WAS IN THE LEFT LANE NEXT TO V2.D2 STATED THAT V1 DID BEGIN TURNING IN TO THE MIDDLE LANE.D2 STATED THAT THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER HEAD AND NECK, BUT DID NOT WISH TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL. AN AMBUALANCE DID RESPOND TO THE SCENE AND DID CHECK HER OUT.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND NEITHER VEHICLE HAD DISABLING DAMAGE.

Mark Humphrey, driver vehicle 2, said he was sitting in his car (white Ford Fusion) when the woman in the car parked to his right put her car in gear. The woman began backing up and hit the rear right side of his Fusion. Humphrey said the woman looked at him and drove away heading west on E 3rd ST. Humphrey described the other car as a white 4 door car, possibly an older model Buick or Oldsmobile. Humphrey showed me a picture from a McDonalds camera showing a white Buick 4 door car, no visible plate.

The owner of Vehicle 2 (V2) advised that the vehicle was struck while parked in the private parking lot of 608 W Kirkwood Avenue. The owner of V2 advised that his girlfriend had driven the vehicle to her place of employment at the above address. The owner of V2 explained that the vehicle had been parked at the address since 9:30am on the morning of 2/9/19. The owner of V2 stated that V2 was hit sometime between 9:30am and 1:30pm. I was able to observe V2, which did have damage to the rear driver's side bumper area. I did observe scuffs on the vehicle and possible some light colored paint transfer.I was unable to tell the direction of travel of the suspect vehicle. Photographs of the vehicle were taken. I then checked the area for video cameras, but was unsuccessful in locating any that would have caught the accident. V2 was able to be driven from the scene.

D1 STATED SHE DOES NOT KNOW WHAT HAPPENED OR WHY SHE RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND THAT SHE MUST HAVE BLACKED OUT FOR AN UNKNOWN REASON.WITNESS STATED V1 WAS TRAVELLING EASTBOUND WHEN IT SLOWLY STARTED TO VEER LEFT, CROSSING THE CENTER LINE AND RUNNING OFF THE ROADWAY BEFORE STRIKING THE MAILBOX AND UTILITY POLE. NO DAMAGE WAS CAUSED TO THE UTILITY POLE.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE PRIVATE PARKING LOT OF FRESH THYME 2812 E 3RD STREET, IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 AND V2 WERE PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF FRESH THYME. V2 BEGAN BACKING OUT OF THEIR PARKING SPOT NB IN THE PARKING LOT. V1 BEGAN BACKING OUT OF THEIR PARKING SPOT SB IN THE PARKING LOT. V1 COLLIDED WITH V2 IN THE PARKING LOT.D1 SAID SHE WAS BACKING OUT OF HER PARKING SPOT AND COLLIDED WITH V2. SHE SAID V2 WAS MOSTLY OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT WHEN THEIR VEHICLES COLLIDED. D1 WAS NOT FAR OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT WHEN THE COLLISION OCCURRED.D2 SAID SHE WAS BACKING OUT OF HER PARKING SPOT. SHE SAID SHE WAS MOSTLY OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT. SHE SAID THE CRASH OCCURRED BECAUSE V1 HIT HER CAR AS SHE WAS OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT.D1 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HER VALID WISCONSIN DRIVERS LICENSE AND ADMITTED TO DRIVING.D2 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HER VALID INDIANA DRIVERS LICENSE AND ADMITTED TO DRIVING.CASE CLOSED.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 02/09/2019

V1 was in his garage at 2001 S Ramsey drive and V2 was parked on Ramsey drive on the west side of the road facing SB. V1 backed out of driveway onto Ramsey drive and struck V2 in the driver side door with the rear driver side bumper of his vehicle.D1 stated that he was backing up and didn't realize he was so close to V2. He stated he hit him with his driver side rear bumper.

D1 has not been located at the time of this report. V2 was a parked car facing S/B in the private parking lot of 2500 S Rockport Road; CountryView Apartments. Owner of V2 reported the accident post collision at the Bloomington Police Department on 2/11/2019 at 1519 hours.O2 advised that the vehicle was parked on 2/8/2019 at 1520 hours in a parking stall, facing S/B, in the Western section of the private lot. O2 advised that he returned to his vehicle on 2/9/2019 at 1820 hours to discover damage to the front passenger's side bumper and the pieces of a red colored bumper and taillight cover sitting in front of V2. O2 had no further information regarding the collision. At this time based only on the damage to V2 and the items retrieved at the scene, it appears that due to D1 unsafely backing resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 WAS SB ON S PARK AVE. V2 WAS WB ON E 2ND ST. V1 TURNED EB ONTO E 2ND ST AS V2 TURNED NB ONTO S PARK AVE RESULTING IN A COLLISION.D1 SAID HE WAS EB ON E 2ND ST AND GOT TO THE T INTERSECTION OF E 2ND ST AND S PARK AVE, ON THE WEST SIDE OF S PARK AVE. D1 SAID HE TURNED SB ONTO S PARK AVE AND BEGAN TO TURN EB ONTO E 2ND ST. HE SAID V2 TURNED NB ONTO S PARK AVE AND COLLIDED WITH HIM, DAMAGING HIS FRONT DRIVERS SIDE BUMPER.D2 SAID SHE WAS WB ON E 2ND ST. SHE SAID SHE GOT TO THE INTERSECTION AND BEGAN TO TURN NB ONTO S PARK AVE. D2 SAID SHE DID NOT GET FULLY IN THE INTERSECTION AND WAS HIT BY V1, DAMAGING HER FRONT BUMBER.THE WB TRAFFIC OF E 2ND ST AND THE SB TRAFFIC OF S PARK AVE ARE NOT REQUIRED TO STOP AT THE INTERSECTION. TRAFFIC FROM E 2ND ST CAN TURN NB OR SB ON S PARK AVE AND DO NOT HAVE TO STOP. BOTH DRIVERS ADMITTED TO DRIVING THEIR RESPECTIVE VEHICLES AND WERE IDENTIFIED BY THEIR VALID INDIANA DRIVERS LICENSES.CASE CLOSED.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 02/09/2019

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT ON FEBRUARY 9, 2019 AT 7:00 PM SHE DID PARK V2 IN FRONT OF 1840 SOUTH MAXWELL STREET.THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT ON FEBRUARY 11, 2019 AT 11:30 PM SHE DID SEE THAT THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF HER VEHICLE APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN STRUCK BY ANOTHER VEHICLE.THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT V2 WAS PARKED ON THE WEST SIDE OF SOUTH MAXWELL, IN FRONT OF 1840 SOUTH MAXWELL. THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT V2 WAS PARKED FACING SOUTH, WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2 FACING SOUTH MAXWELL.V2 DOES HAVE SCRATCHES ALONG THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE PANEL ABOVE THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE TIRE WAS BENT INWARDS, AND THE DRIVER'S SIDE REAR VIEW MIRROR HAD BEEN NOCKED OFF OF V2.THERE IS NO INFORMATION FOR V1 OR D1.V2 DID NOT SUSTAIN ANY DISABLING DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was on Jordan Avenue at the Law Lane intersection facing south. V2 was on Jordan Avenue at the intersection facing north. As the light turned green, V2 continued north. V1 attempted to turn left (east) onto Law Lane in front of V2. V2's front bumper struck the right corner of V1's front bumper. D1 stated the light at the intersection was red. When it turned green, D1 stated he attempted to turn left onto Law Lane before V2 crossed through the intersection. D1 stated he overestimated how far V2 was away from him and had no time to attempt to get out of the way of V2. V1 had damage to the right corner of the front bumper. There was cosmetic damage along and the bumper no longer sat flush with the quarter panel. D2 stated he was continuing north on Jordan Avenue. D2 stated that V1 attempted to turn across his direction of travel. D2 stated he attempted to stop V2 but due to the wet road conditions he was unable to completely stop. V2 had minor cosmetic damage to the front bumper.Neither driver complained of pain or requested medical attention.

DRIVER # 1 NORTH BOUND IN THE #1 LANE AND LOST CONTROL ON ICE/SLUSH AND SIDESWIPED V#2 THAT WAS IN THE #2 LANE. V#2 THEN SPUN OUT OF CONTROL AND INTO A GUARDRAIL.D#2 COMPLAINED AND CHEST AND ARM PAIN AND WAS TRANSPORTED.
WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON SR 37, UNIT 1 STATED HE DROVE OVER A PATCH OF ICE, LOST CONTROL, AND SLID INTO THE ROCKS ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROAD.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON INTERSTATE 69, UNIT 1 LOST CONTROL. THE DRIVER STATED SHE WAS GOING THE SPEED LIMIT WHEN SHE LOST CONTROL. THE VEHICLE SLID INTO THE GUARD RAIL ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY, IMPACTING THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE.THE VEHICLE THEN CONTINUED TO SLIDE AND IMPACTED THE GUARD RAIL AGAIN WITH THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE.

Driver of vehicle 1 stated she came around the corner near 2175 E Bethel Lane headed West when she said the car started to slide and she went off the road. Vehicle 1 had heavy damage in the front and rear requiring the vehicle to be towed from the scene.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: I69 is a multi-lane interstate with a metal guardrail separating the three northbound and three southbound lanes. V1, red Toyota, was traveling north on I69 in the center lane. V1 began to slide on the snow covered roadway and struck the inside guardrail face with the front of V1. V1 continued to spin counterclockwise after impact and struck the inside guardrail face a second time with the rear of V1.D1, Del Orbe, stated he was traveling north on I69 in the center lane. D1 stated he attempted to move to the left lane. D1 stated he applied the brakes as he moved into the left lane and began to spin on the snow covered roadway. D1 stated he struck the inside guardrail face with the front and rear of V1.Evidence shows damage to the front and rear of V1. Evidence shows the roadway was covered with snow during the accident investigation. Evidence shows tire marks present along the inside shoulder consistent with V1 spinning into the guardrail face in two locations. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail face and support posts. An INDOT damage marker was placed on the damaged guardrail.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: AFTER ARRIVING ON SCENE, I OBSERVED UNIT 1 FACING SOUTH, IN A DITCH AND UNIT 2 FACING NORTH ON THE NORTH LANE OF TRAFFIC. AFTER SPEAKING WITH BOTH DRIVERS, I COULD NOT DETERMINE WHO CROSSED THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROADWAY. BOTH TRUCKS SUSTAINED HEAVY DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE PORTION OF THE VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was southbound on Weimer through a curve when they went into a skid due to the slick road conditions. Vehicle 1 crossed into the northbound lane where Vehicle 1 struck Vehicle 2 as Vehicle 2 was northbound. Vehicle 1 then left the roadway and traveled into a creek on the west side of W. Tapp Road where they came to rest in the water.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of vehicle 1 stated he was traveling south entering the intersection at S. Victor Pike and S.SR 37 when he noticed Vehicle 2 also entering the intersection. He stated that Vehicle 2 did not have a siren or emergency lights on when it entered the intersection, Driver of vehicle 1 stated vehicle 2 struck his vehicle. Driver of Vehicle 2 stated they were traveling north bound on SR 37 with lights and siren on when they entered the intersection and Vehicle 1 failed to yield right of way. There was no damage to vehicle 1 and damage to the air horns of vehicle 2.

V1 was traveling southbound on I69 approaching mile marker 129.0. D1 stated that she struck a patch of ice and began to spin. V1 ran off the east side of the roadway into the grass median an struck a construction barrel and metal median guard rail, coming to a stop in the median. This caused damage to the front and rear of V1.

Other explain in narrative(environmental): V1 swerved to avoid a collision with another motor vehicle that had crossed into V1's lane of travel. V1 was traveling north on Fee Lane. V1 over corrected to avoid a collision with another vehicle that had crossed into V1's lane. V1 then struck the curb. V1 had disabling damage to the passenger side tires, rims, and axles. D1 stated that he was traveling north on Fee towards 11th Street when a vehicle suddenly crossed the double yellow into V1's lane of travel. D1 stated he then swerved to avoid the collison with the other vehicle and instead struck the curb on the side of the road. D1 stated that he had no choice but to swerve in order to avoid the collision with the other vehicle. Other Participant: Alexander Collins was driving the vehicle that V1 swerved to avoid. Collins stated that V1 was far enough away that he thought he had time to turn into the SPEA parking lot, across from 11th Street. Collins stated that V1 was going faster then he thought and so Collins swerved his car back into his original lane of travel missing V1. However, Collins stated that he did see V1 swerve as well and strike the curb. There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles were towed from the scene. However, D1 stated that he would contact Triple A to remove his vehicle from the parking lot at SPEA at a later time.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of vehicle 1 stated he was backing out of his driveway at 611 S. Fieldstone Blvd when he backed into vehicle 2 traveling north on S. Fieldstone Blvd. Driver of vehicle 2 stated she was traveling North on S. Fieldstone Blvd and she saw vehicle 1 pulling out of the driveway but was not able to stop due to the snow conditions on the road. Damage to vehicle 1 was minor rear bumper scratches, Damage to vehicle 2 was minor on the rear passenger door and rear quarter panel.

When I arrived on scene, the vehicle was moved from where the crash took place. The crash involved a white Chevrolet truck (V1) driven by James Arthur (D1).D1 stated he was plowing snow southbound on the top level of the Fee Lane Parking Garage. He reversed northbound and backed into a concrete block that holds the guard cables. When he was backing, the tailgate was down and therefore that was what made contact with the concrete block.V1 sustained heavy damage to the tailgate. It was heavily dented and would no longer close properly. The concrete block did not appear to have sustained any visible damage.V1 was able to be driven from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver two stated he was traveling east on W 6th Street approaching N College Ave when vehicle one backed out of a parking space and struck his vehicle in the right front corner. Driver two stated driver one got out of his vehicle looked at the damage and spoke to him briefly than left the scene in his vehicle south on College Ave. Driver two stated he didn't know any information about vehicle one except that it was an older model Honda SUV.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling northwest on Robinson Road approaching the intersection of Hillsamer Road when it left the north side of the roadway striking multiple trees. The vehicle was towed from the scene and no injuries were reported by the driver. Vehicle 1, a red 2018 Chevrolet Eqiunox, was traveling northwest on Robinson Road approaching the intersection of Hillsamer Road when it left the north side of the roadway, traveled through the small ditch at the intersection, and then continued across Hillsamer before striking three trees on the north side of the roadway. Vehicle 1 came to a rest in the westbound lane approximately 50 feet west of the intersection partially blocking the eastbound lane. Vehicle 1 was towed from the scene to Curry Collision Center by Pritchard's Towing per driver's request.Driver 1, Vladimyr Ward, stated he was traveling northwest on Robinson Rd when he lost traction southeast of Hillsamer Road and began to slide into the oncoming traffic lane. Ward stated he corrected his skid and as he approached the intersection at Hillsamer Road, a newer model white Chevrolet Tahoe or Suburban was traveling left of center coming around the curve. Ward stated he steered right to avoid the car, went off the roadway, and was unable to bring the car back onto the roadway before striking the trees on the north side of the roadway. Ward stated he was uninjured in the crash and stated he did not need to be checked by medical personnel.At the time of the crash, the roadway was slushy and slick and there was a mixture of rain and snow falling. Due to the snowfall, I was able to see tire tracks leaving the roadway just southeast of the Hillsamer road intersection and followed the tracks through the ditch to where Vehicle 1 struck the trees. I was unable to see any marks in the roadway consistent with a vehicle traveling left of center.Hillsamer Road meets Robinson Road at an angle and slopes upwards towards Robinson Road. There is a small ditch on the northeast side of the roadway approaching the intersection and on the north side of the roadway immediately after Hillsamer Road meets Robinson Road continuing along the westbound side of Robinson Road.

On 02/11/2019 at around 1958 hours I arrived at 10th Street and Fee Lane to take a crash report. When I arrived, D1 immediately told me that it was her fault and that she had backed in to V2.D1 stated she was stopped facing eastbound in the straight lane on 10th Street and Fee Lane. D1 stated she wanted to get into the left turn lane so she began to put her car in reverse. D1 stated she did not see anyone behind her when she started backing up. V1 then struck V2.V1 did not sustain any damage.D2 stated that he was sitting in traffic behind V1 facing eastbound on 10th Street. D2 stated that the light had just turned green when he noticed V1 beginning to back up. He stated he did not have time to react and honk his horn at V1 and then V1 struck V2. V2 sustained damage to the front bumper and hood. The bumper had paint chipped off of it and was scratched. The hood was bent up and would not close completely. Once we were about to clear the scene, V2 would not start. D2 stated he had several problems with the car before. Bland's towed the vehicle from the scene.
V1 was traveling northbound on SR 37 near the intersection of Ingram Rd when two deer crossed the road colliding with the front of V2. The collision caused heavy front end damage but was not towed.

SR37 is a four lane (two-way) roadway that is divided by a grass median only. SR37 primarily travels north and south with numerous hills and curves. The intersection of SR37 and E Smithville Rd is a 4-way intersection with SR37 being a throughway and E Smithville Rd being posted with stop signs. Vehicle 1 (White, Chevrolet) was traveling northbound in the left hand lane when a deer entered the roadway through the median and into the path of V1. V1 was unable to stop and the deer struck the front driver's side corner panel and driver's door. Driver 1 (Zachary Conrad) indicated the following: He was traveling northbound on SR37 in the left hand lane at 60mph when a deer ran through the median and into the path of his vehicle. D1 applied the brakes in an attempt to stop and avoid an impact but he was unsuccessful in doing so.The investigating officer located deer fur on the driver's side mirror. It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the reason for this crash is animal in the roadway.RRK

V2 WAS SLOWED IN TRAFFIC NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 AND E ORCHARD LANE DUE TO HEAVY TRAFFIC. V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1 WHILE IT WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. D1 ADMITTED TO FAULT IN THE CRASH. D1 FAILED TO PROVIDE INSURANCE DOCUMENTS FOR V1 AND WAS CITED FOR SUCH.

V1 and V2 were stopped on 17th Street at the intersection with Fee Lane heading East. D1 stated that he saw the light turn green and accelerated while V2 did not accelerate. V1 rear ended V2. D2 stated that the light turned green and there were vehicles in front of him that were turning southbound on to Fee Lane that cause D2 to not accelerate. VEHICLE 1 WAS PARKED IN THE LOT OF 405 WEST 7TH ST BLOOMINGTON INDIANA. VEHICLE 1 WAS WITNESSED BACKING INTO A BARRIER WALL.THE VEHICLE THEN LEFT THE SCENE. UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL.

Vehicle 1 was southbound on N Bottom Road. While southbound 260 feet north of Dittemore Rd a deer moved into the path of V1. D2 APPROACHED THE STOP LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF W 3RD ST AND S LIBERTY DR AS IT TURNED FROM YELLOW TO RED, AT WHICH POINT D2 STOPPED. D1 WAS FOLLOWING BEHIND D2, AND WHEN D2 STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION, D1 HIT THE REAR OF D2.

Driver one stated he was traveling east on W 2nd Street when he looked down at the radio and when he looked up all the traffic was stopped. V2 is a bicycle.V1 was going east on 10th St but turning into a parking lot on the north side of tenth. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 CAME TO BLOOMINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT TO REPORT PRIOR ACCIDENT. D2 ADVISED THAT HE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE, AND HAD JUST TRAVELLED SOUTH THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF KIRKWOOD AVE, WHEN V1 PULLED OUT OF A PARALLEL PARKING SPACE ON THE WEST SIDE OF COLLEGE AVE, COLLIDING WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER OF V2. D1 ADVISED THAT SHE WAS GETTING READY TO PULL OUT OF A PARALLEL PARKING SPACE AND THOUGHT SHE HAD LOOKED, BUT DID NOT SEE V2. D1 ADVISED THAT SHE PULLED OUT AND COLLIDED WITH V2. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS IN THE ALLEY WAY, JUST EAST OF 2800 E BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD, FACING NORTH.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN FACING NORTH, TOWARDS E BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD.D1 STATED THAT ANOTHER VEHICLE WAS DRIVING WEST ON EAST BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD AND DID ATTEMPT TO TURN SOUTH IN TO THE ALLEWAY WHERE V1 WAS STOPPED.D1 STATED THAT HE DID BACK UP V1 FROM THE STOP SIGN SO THAT THIS OTHER VEHICLE COULD TURN SOUTH IN TO THE ALLEYWAY.D1 STATED THAT AS HE WAS BACKING UP THAT THE REAR DRIVER'S CORNER OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO V1.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED BEHIND V1.D2 STATED THAT THE REAR OF V1 DID BACK IN TO THE FRONT OF V2.NO DAMAGE WAS INITIALLY OBSERVED ON V2.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO DIABLING DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was turning left from northbound College Mall Rd onto westbound 2nd St. Driver 1 stated she was following other cars turning left and was struck by vehicle 2 as she crossed the intersection. When I asked her if she had a green turn arrow or not she replied she thought she did. Driver 2 stated he was southbound on College Mall Rd approaching 2nd St in the right lane. Driver 2 stated he had the green light as he approached and entered the intersection. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 was following other cars that had turned left and crossed into his path of travel. D2 stated he was stopping to pick up city trash near 823 S Park Square Drive and that vehicles started to go around him.D2 stated that V1 went around him and cut back into the lane to quickly and struck the driver side front bumper.D2 advised D1 stopped and got out of her vehicle and waved at him and then drove off.I did locate V1 today and updated all the vehicle and driver information. D1 stated that V2 was stopped picking up trash along the road and that she started to go around V2. D1 stated that as she started to go back into the lane D2 started moving forward and struck the side of her vehicle. D1 stated she stopped but that D2 never came up to her vehicle and she did not feel safe to approach D2 so she left the area. All V1 and D1 information was updated.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON SOUTH HIGH STREET.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS PASSING THE INTERSECTION OF EAST ATWATER AND SOUTH HIGHT STREET, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 3RD STREET AND SOUTH HIGH STREET.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT REALIZE THAT V2 WAS STOPPED IN FRONT OF HER.D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, CAUSING V2 TO MOVE FORWARDS, THUS CAUSING THE FRONT OF V2 TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.V1 DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE TO THE FRONT, V2 DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE TO THE REAR AND FRONT OF THE VEHICLE, AND V3 DID SUSTAIN TO THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST ATWATER AND SOUTH HIGHT STREET. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC FACING NORTH ON HIGH STREET.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED BEHIND V3 AND A LINE OF OTHER CARS THAT WERE STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 3RD STREET AND SOUTH HIGH STREET.D2 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS STOPPED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID COLLIDE WITH THE REAR OF V2, CAUSING THE FRONT OF V2 TO THE STRIKE THE REAR OF V3.D3 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, FACING NORTH ON SOUTH HIGH STREET. D3 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED BEHIND SEVERAL OTHER CARS, WHO WERE ALSO STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 3RD STREET AND SOUT HIGH STREET.D3 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3, CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF V3.ALL THREE VEHICLES DID SUSTAIN MINOR DAMAGE, NONE DID REQUIRE BEING TOWED.NO ONE WAS INJURED EITHER.

D1 stated she was making a left hand turn at the intersection of West Third Street and South Cory Lane from West Third Street. D1 thought she could make the turn on a green light, with no arrow, but collided with V2 in the middle of the intersection.D2 stated the same details, saying she was traveling eastbound on West Third Street and when she approached the above mentioned intersection and V1 turned right in front of V2 and D2 could not stop in time.Both vehicles were towed due to disabling damage. No injuries were reported.

D1 and D2 were headed E/B on E Winslow Rd. D1 slowed and stopped at the intersection of E Winslow Rd and S Walnut St Pike, and waited for W/B traffic to clear to make a left turn. As D1 waited for traffic to clear, D2 struck D1 in the rear with his vehicle. Both drivers were evaluated by medical personnel at the scene. D1 was cleared at the scene, however D2 was transported to the hospital via ambulance for further evaluation. V1 was driven from the scene, however V2 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage. D1 stated that he was headed E/B on E Winslow Rd, approaching the intersection of S Walnut St Pike. D1 stated that he saw V2 stopped in the intersection, however he did not see any indication that she was turning or going straight. D1 stated that as he approached V2 he realized that she was not moving, so he slammed on his brakes in an attempt to miss V2, however he was unable. V1 then struck V2 in the rear of the vehicle with it's front. Both drivers then moved their vehicles to a nearby parking lot and called law enforcement.D2 stated that she was headed E/B on E Winslow Rd, approaching the intersection of S Walnut St Pike. D2 stated that she used her turn signal to indicate her intention to turn left, slowed, and stopped in the intersection to wait for W/B traffic to clear so that she could complete her left turn. D2 stated as she waited for a gap in traffic she was struck from the rear by V1. It should be noted that when I arrived on scene I witnessed that the turn signals were operational and functioning, due to the hazards being on.**************************************************************************************************************************************************SUPPLEMENTOn 09/25/19, I, Officer Wood, met with D2 in the lobby of the Bloomington Police Department. D2's information has been updated to reflect that the driver involved in the accident was Jessica Carmona, and not Sylvia Carmona, which was on the initial accident report. A criminal investigation was completed. For further details please see case B19-06009.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON E 3RD ST. V1 REAR ENDED V2 AS IT WAS STOPPED AT AN OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL.D1 STATED THAT SHE SAW V2 STOPPED AT THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL, PRESSED THE BRAKE, BUT V1 WOULD NOT STOP. D1 STATED SHE REAR ENDED V2.V2 WAS STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT OF AN OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 3RD ST AND S. CLARIZZ BLVD. V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT OF THE OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL FACING WEST ON E. 3RD ST. D2 STATED THAT V2 WAS SUDDEN STRUCK IN THE REAR BY V1.
DRIVER'S PASSENGER SIDE TIRES LEFT THE ROADWAY AND DRIVER WAS UNABLE TO RETURN TO ROADWAY AND HIT SEVERAL DECORATIVE ROCKS, BELONGING TO GARDEN VILLA NURSING HOME.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: UPON MY ARRIVAL V1 WAS FACING NORTH ON HARMONY RD AT THE INTERSECTION OF HARMONY RD. AND ROSE CREEK RD. V1 HAD VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END, THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT TIRE AND WHEEL COMPLETELY RIPPED OFF. V2 WAS APPROXIMATLEY 600 FEET FARTHER NORTH ON HARMONY RD FACING NORTH. V2 HAD VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE, THE DRIVERS SIDE TIRE AND WHEEL STILL ATTATCHED TO THE VEHICLE BUT PUSHED OUT OF THE FENDERWELL OF THE VEHICLE. IT WAS TOO DIFFICULT TO TELL WHICH VEHICLE WAS LEFT OF CENTER AS THERE WERE NO SIGNS OF AN EXACT IMPACT LOCATION. D1 STATED WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH ON HARMONY RD., APPROACHING ROSE CREEK RD, SHE CRESTED THE HILL AND SAW V2 HEADLIGHTS. D1 STATED THAT V2 CRESTED THE HILL LEFT OF CENTER HITTING THE FRONT END OF V1 CAUSING SEVERE FRONT END DAMAGE. D2 STATED WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON HARMONY RD, JUST PASSING ROSE CREEK RD, V1 CRESTED THE HILL LEFT OF CENTER COLLIDING WITH THE FRONT END OF V2 CAUSING SEVERE FRONT END DAMAGE. BOTH UNIT 1 AND UNIT 2 STATED THEY SAW EACH OTHERS LIGHTS CREST THE HILL AND ARENT REALLY SURE WHAT HAPPENED FROM THERE BUT BOTH CLAIM THAT THE OTHER PERSON WAS LEFT OF CENTER.P1 WAS A FRONT SEAT PASSENGER IN V1. P1 STATED THAT SHE DIDN'T SEE ANYTHING AND THAT SHE ONLY FELT THE IMPACT. WHILE ON SCENE P1 STATED TO ME THAT SHE WAS NOT INJURED BUT ONCE AT THE HOSPITAL SHE WAS COMPLAINING OF HEAD, NECK AND BACK PAIN. P1 ALSO STATED THAT SHE WAS 19 WEEKS PREGNANT AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.

VEHICLE 2 WAS WEST BOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 WHEN A CAR IN FRONT OF IT PUT ON BRAKES. WHEN VEHICLE 2 SLOWED DOWN, IT WAS STRUCK IN THE BACK BY VEHICLE 1. A PASSENGER IN VEHICLE 2 FELT PAIN IN HER NECK, HOW EVER WAS CHECKED ON SCENE AND SIGNED A RELEASE. BOTH DRIVER 1 AND 2 REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEHICLE 1 CAUGHT ON FIRE AND WAS TOWED TO RICK'S TOWING AFTER FLAMES WERE EXTINGUISHED.VEHICLE 2 WAS DRIVABLE AND WAS DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 was headed W/B on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S Muller Parkway. D1 stopped at the intersection and waited to turn left onto S Muller Parkway, and believing it was clear, began to make his turn. At this time V1 struck V2 in the front of the vehicle with the front of it's vehicle, causing a collision. V1 was able to be driven from the scene, however V2 was towed from the scene due to disabiling damage. D1 was evaluated on scene by EMS personnel and released, however D2 and it's other passenger were taken to the hospital for further evaluation. D1stated he was headed W/B on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S Muller Parkway. D1 stopped at the intersection and waited to turn left onto S Muller Parkway, and believing it was clear, began to make his turn. At this time V1 struck V2 in the front of the vehicle with the front of it's vehicle. D1 stated that he did not see V2 until the moment of impact. D1 stated that he believes that he couldn't see V2 because their headlights were not on. D2 stated that she was headed W=E/B on W 3rd St, appraoching the intersection of S Muller Parkway. D2 stated that as she entered the intersection, V1 pulled directly in front of her vehicle, causing the vehicles to collide. D2 stated that she had no time to react when the collision occured. D2 stated that she believes that her headlights were on at the time of the accident. It should be ntoed that during the course of my investigation I determined that the headlights on V2 were possibly off at the time of the accident, because the light switch was in the "OFF" position on the console of the vehicle.On 02/14/19 at 2018 hours, I, Officer Wood, was contacted by D1, who stated that his correct address was 325 S Muller Parway, Lot #29, and not Lot #28. This ends the supplement.

V1 was backing out of a marked parking stall southwest onto Forrest Avenue. V2 was backing out of a marked parking stall southeast on to Forrest Avenue. V1 and V2 both did not notice the other backing. V1 then collided with the rear passenger side of V2. There was scratch/scuff damage to the rear driver side bumper of V1. There was moderate damage to the rear passenger side fender and quarter panel of V2.D1 stated that she saw traffic was stopped on Forrest, so she began to back out of her stall. D1 stated that her truck was so tall that she could not see the small car backing out at the same time as her. D1 stated that V1 then collided into the rear of V2. D2 stated that he saw traffic was stopped on Forrest, so he began to back out of his stall. D2 stated that he checked his mirrors but did not see any vehicles. D2 stated that when he finally noticed V1 backing up it was too late to avoid the collision. V1 then collided with V2.There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TURNING ONTO ARLINGTON RD, FROM SR 46 WHEN THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HER STOPPED AND PREFORMED A U-TURN. D1 ADVISED THAT SHE APPLIED HER BRAKES TO KEEP FROM HITTING THIS CAR, WHEN V1 "BUMPED" HER BACK BUMPER. D2 ADMITTED V1'S TO STRIKING V2'S BACK BUMBER WITH HER FRONT BUMPER. BOTH PARTIES PULLED THEIR VEHICLES INTO A PARKING LOT OUT OF THE ROADWAY AFTER THE CRASH, AND BEFORE, MY ARRIVAL.

Roadway Id: E DRIVE TO IU MUSIC SCHOOL
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1's direction of travel is unknown at this time as it left the scene of the crash. Vehicle 2 was parked on the north side of the drive to the IU Music School facing north, roughly 300 feet east of Ballantine Road. Driver 1 left the scene of the crash without leaving any information. Owner of Vehicle 2 stated she parked her vehicle at approximately 8:00am and after returning to her vehicle at approximately 5:00pm. She stated she entered her vehicle and upon closing her door she heard pieces of the rear window fall out. No injuries are known at this time. Damage to Vehicle 1 is unknown. Vehicle 2's back window was broken.The suspect vehicle is unknown at this time. There are no cameras or leads at this time.Photographs were taken of the damage and placed into evidence.

When I arrived on scene, both vehicles had been moved from where the crash took place. The crash involved a white Toyota (V1), driven by Janice Nickless (D1), and a green Honda (V2), driven by Matthew Siebert (D2). Neither driver complained of any injuries at the scene.Both drivers told the same story. V1 was following V2 south on N Jordan Ave approaching Law Lane. V2 was attempting to make a left turn onto Law Lane eastbound and so he came to a stop to yield to oncoming traffic. D1 thought V2 was going to make the turn quicker and did not slow down enough. V1 rear ended V2.V1 sustained moderate damage to the driver side front bumper. V2 sustained light scratches and chipped paint on the passenger side rear bumper.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.
D1 was driving west bound on East Sylvania RD when a deer ran into the driver side door of V1, causing minor damage.Photos were taken and logged into evidence. No injuries.

V2 was traveling eastbound on W. State Rd. 45 attempting to turn right on S. Burch Rd. V1 was also traveling eastbound on W. State Rd. 45. D1 stated that he did not see V2 slowing to turn right onto S. Burch Rd. and was unable to stop before rear ending V2. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

Driver 1 stated that he was north on Walnut St approaching the intersection with SR 45/46 Bypass in the right lane. Driver 1 stated vehicle 2 stopped for the red light in front of him and he was unable to stop in time to avoid colliding with vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated he had already been stopped at the red light on N Walnut St when vehicle 1 came up behind him and struck the rear of his vehicle.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD STREET IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE. D1 SAID HE DID NOT REALIZE TRAFFIC HAD STOPPED IN FRONT OF HIM AND HE COLLIDED INTO THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD STREET AND TRAFFIC WAS COMMING TO A STOP. D2 SAID AS SHE HAD JUST CAME TO A STOP, SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. Vehicle 1 appears to have been backing up northwest at an angle going the wrong direction. Vehicle 2 was parked on the northwest side of the parking garage on the first floor at 400 E. 7th Street facing east. Driver 1 left the scene of the crash and did not provide any information.Owner of Vehicle 2 stated she parked her vehicle at approximately 8:00am and returned to her vehicle at approximately 5:30pm. She stated she noticed the damage to the front bumper of her vehicle after returning to her car. She advised her vehicle was not damaged before parking it. Injuries are unknown at this time. Damage to Vehicle 1 is unknown. Vehicle 2 had damage to the front driver side of the bumper.The suspect vehicle is unknown at this time. There are no cameras or leads at this time.Vehicle 2 was parked in the end parking spot extremely close to a large concrete post that sticks out. The post had no damage an there were no broken pieces laying on the ground. Due to this and the damage to Vehicle 2 it was unlikely that this accident could have occurred at this location. If the crash did occur at this location it would have had to be a backing crash at a very specific angle to hit the driver front bumper going slightly around to the driver side and they would have had to stop before striking the post that was very close.

V2 was stopped, facing south, on Range Road at the intersection of 10th Street and Range Road waiting on the light. V1 was traveling south on Range Road approaching the intersection of 10th Street and Range Road. V1 hit his breaks to stop for traffic but was not able to stop in time. V1 then rear ended V2. There was little to no damage on both vehicles. V2 had light paint scuffs. V1 had no visible damage.D1 stated that he saw traffic stopped and hit his breaks but he did not hit his breaks hard enough and was not able to avoid the collision. V1 then rear ended V2.D2 stated that they were stopped in traffic waiting on the light to turn green. D2 stated that she did not see V1 approaching and was hit without warning. D2 stated that V1 rear ended V2. D2 stated that when V1 struck V2 if forced her head backwards causing her head to hit the head rest. D2 complained of pain to her neck, hands, and stated that she also had a severe headache.D2 reported pain in her head, neck, and hands on scene. EMS arrived and checked on D2. D2 did not wish to go to the hospital and signed an SOR. There were no vehicles towed from the scene.

V1 and V2 were traveling E/B on 10th ST. V1 made a improper turn, and V1 and V2 collided with each other. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 advised he was traveling E/B on 10th ST. D2 stated he noticed a white 4 door sedan in front of him slowing or coming to a complete stop with there right turn signal on. D2 advised that he slowed down in traffic and observed V1 make a improper U turn on 10th ST to head W/B. D2 advised that he collided with V2. D2 advised D1 left the scene prior to the officers arrival. D2 advised that he was not injured. It should be noted that I observed white paint transfer on the front left driver side of D2 bumper. Due to V1 improper turn, and V2 following to closely both V1 and V2 collided.

Driver was traveling west bound on SR 45 when a deer entered the roadway in front of her. The deer entered the drivers lane of travel and was struck by the front of her vehicle causing damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 02/15/2019, at 1659 hours, I was dispatched to the parking lot of TIS Bookstore at 1302 East 3rd Street to take a report of a red Chevrolet Corvette that struck another vehicle and continued without stopping.When I arrived, I spoke with J. Rosegarten, who had been driving a rental car that was a black 2019 Nissan Versa. She advised that she was in the left (south lane) of East 3rd Street, which is a two lane, one-way street at this location, preparing to turn left (south) into the alleyway between Kinser Cleaners and TIS Bookstore. As she began to turn in, a vehicle was heading north out of that narrow alley, so she stopped to give them time to reverse. While she was stopped in traffic with her turn signal on and the rear part of her vehicle still in the left lane of East 3rd Street, a red Chevrolet Corvette came up behind the Nissan and sideswiped the rear passenger side bumper. Rosegarten advised that she thought that the driver, who she described as a white woman in her 50s or 60s with frosted blonde hair in a short, styled hairdo, continued westbound. Rosegarten instructed her son to write down the license plate, which he did. The license plate number he provided was 562AWD, which returned to a red 2000 Chevrolet Corvette. I examined the Nissan at the scene and noted two small abrasions on the rear passenger side bumper, with some red paint transfer. Rosegarten also stated that the force of the impact had misaligned the bumper, but it had popped back into place prior to my arrival. I provided Rosegarten with this case number and advised her that I would attempt to locate the driver. I had dispatch put out the vehicle and driver description, but no unit was able to locate that vehicle or driver. On 02/16/2019, I returned to work and contacted Margot H. Scholz, who advised that she had been driving on East 3rd Street yesterday around 1650 hours. Scholz said she did not believe she hit any other vehicle at that time. Scholz, who had since returned to her residence in Columbus, said that there was no prior damage to the Corvette. I asked her to go out to her vehicle and check for damage. She at first did not see any damage, but later confirmed that there was a small scratch near the driver side headlight. Scholz said she would have stopped if she had realized she had hit another vehicle. She was cooperative and provided her insurance information, which I added to this case. There are no charges for leaving the scene as this appears to have been unintentional.************************************************SUPPLEMENT**************************************************On the afternoon of 02/16/2019, I received a call from Margot Scholz. She advised that her husband, the registered owner of the Chevrolet Camaro, had come home and examined the vehicle. She stated that the area near the driver side headlight that she had told me appeared to be a small scratch had been examined and rubbed off by her husband and that he reported it to be dirt rather than damage. She requested that an officer come by to examine their vehicle. I contacted Columbus Police Department for assistance. They dispatched Officer Kummer (badge #248) who examined the Camaro and reported that there was no damage. I advised that I would update the report to include this information.

V1 and V2 were headed East on Interstate 45. Interstate 45 East goes from two lanes to one. V1 was behind V2. V2 was in the left lane and had the right turn signal on to turn in to the shopping plaza to deliver food. D1 stated that he did not see the turn signal and thought V2 was turning left at an entrance a couple hundred feet forward. D1 stated that since he thought V2 was turning left that he could get on the right side of V2 and go around. D1 did not see that V2 was turning right and collided with the passenger side of the trailer on the semi. V1 was partially under the trailer of V2. D1 also stated that he was sitting at the light at 10th and the Bypass waiting to turn left on toe Interstate 45. D1 noted that when he turned left the two left turn lanes merge in to one lane and it can get messy due to the immediate merge. D1 stated that when he turned left he saw V2 in the yellow crossed out area but assumed V2 was stopped there. D1 stated that he sped up to get past the car in the right lane to merge in to the one lane. D1 also stated that he was even with the back of V2 when it began its wide right hand turn. D1 stated that he noticed V2 turning and slammed on his brakes. This is when the V1 and V2 collided. D2 stated that he had his turn signal on to turn right and was making a wide turn since he had a trailer and did not notice V1 starting to go around him and was struck in the middle of the turn. There was minor damage to the passenger side of the trailer of V2. V1 had major damage to the drivers side.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Unit 1 was traveling south on Leonard springs turning into Woodhaven Dr when unit 2 struck the back passenger side of unit 1 Driver 1 stated that he was aware of turning in front of Driver 2, Driver 2 Stated that she was heading North on Leonard Springs when driver 1 turned in front of her.

The vehicle was parked in Ivy Tech Community College parking lot on February 15th 2019 from the hours of 11:30am to 3:00pm. When the vehicle owner came out of the building she noticed damage to the front bumper and vanity plate area of her vehicle. The vehicle owner reported this incident to Ivy Tech staff who attempted to locate the accident on video of the parking lot. At this time Ivy Tech staff is unable to locate footage of the vehicle being struck in the parking lot. There is debris from the from of the vehicle being hit laying on the pavement under the front bumper.On 02/23/2019 I was contacted by Angelo Dambrosio stating that he was the driver of the other vehicle. Mr. Dambrosio was contacted by Ivy Tech Security stating the found footage of the accident on their camera systems. Security staff was able to determine that the other vehicle was Mr. Dambrosio's 2011 Hyuandai Sonata. Mr. Dambrosio did not realize that he had struck the other vehicle and stated that there was no damage to his vehicle. Mr. Dambrosio provided me with all of his information to update the accident report.

V1 and V2 were traveling S/B on State RD 45/46 Bypass. V1 rear ended V2 causing damage to V2.D1 advised that she was traveling S/B on State RD 45/46 Bypass. D1advised V2 was directly in front of V1 and she noticed traffic had become backed up. D1 stated that while traveling S/B she got distracted and looked away and later felt the impact of V1 striking V2. D1 advised that she was not injured. D2 advised that she was traveling S/B on State RD 45/46 Bypass. D2 advised that she noticed traffic had become backed up and she noticed a vehicle in front of her had brake suddenly. D2 advised that she hit her brakes and felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that she was not injured. Due to D1 following too closely, V1 struck V2.

Both Vehicle 1 and 2 were traveling west on Hillside Dr. Vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 slowed almost to a stop for a vehicle directly in front of it turning south onto Olive St. Vehicle 1 failed to slow down and rear ended vehicle 2 causing significant damage to the rear of vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 then turned north onto Weatherstone and left the accident scene. Driver of vehicle 2 was unable to give any information in reference to vehicle 1. Driver 2 had no injuries and was able to drive the vehicle from the scene.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING WEST BOUND ON E SR 46. DRIVER 1 ADVISED AS HE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF E SR 46 AND N BRUMMETTS CREEK RD THAT A DEER RAN INTO THE ROADWAY AND HE SWERVED TO AVOID HITTING IT. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS UNABLE TO CORRECT FROM MISSING THE DEER AND RAN OFF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY INTO THE FLOODED FIELD.

On 02/16/2019 at approximately 0918 hours, I was driving southbound on the State Road 45/46 Bypass approaching East 10th Street in the right lane in unit 224, a fully marked police vehicle. The light was green for my direction (traffic on the Bypass). I observed a gray Honda Civic on East 10th Street turn right onto the Bypass into the immediate path of travel of my squad car without yielding as required with a red light. As a result of the Honda pulling into my path, I had to brake and swerve to avoid a collision. I activated my overhead emergency lights and siren and the Civic pulled to a stop blocking the outlet of East Eastgate Lane onto State Road 46. When I exited the vehicle to go speak to the driver, as I approached the vehicle, the driver took her foot off of the brake and the vehicle began to roll forward. I yelled for her to hit the brakes and put the vehicle in park, but she did not and the vehicle continued forward approximately 10 feet before running off the road and striking the stop sign pole facing west on Eastgate Lane. When I spoke to the driver, Chunling Han, she stated that she only had a Chinese driver's license, which she showed me. She did not have an English translation of her license or her passport with her. Han said she had been in the US for less than a year and had been told that she could drive using her Chinese license. Officer Pesa arrived to assist me. He said Han told him that she had rented the vehicle, a Zipcar, to practice her driving. I issued Han a traffic citation for the original cause of the stop, failing to yield right of way at an automatic signal for turning right on red when it was not safe to do so. The Honda's front bumper had damage to the front bumper from the center line to the passenger side. There was a gouge in the front bumper from the support pole and the bumper was cracked and misaligned as a result of the crash, but could be driven from the scene.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING JOHNSON AVE IN THE NORTHERN LANE. V2 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING JOHNSON AVE IN THE SOUTHERN LANE. V1 BEGAN TO CHANGE LANES INTO THE SOUTHERN LANE AND THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE TRAVELING EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING JOHNSON AVE IN THE NORTHERN LANE. D1 STATED THAT HE BEGAN TO CHANGE LANES INTO THE SOUTHERN LANE AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE V2 WHEN CHANGING LANES.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING JOHNSON AVE IN THE SOUTHERN LANE. D2 STATED THAT V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W 3RD ST IN THE NORTHERN LANE ALONG SIDE OF HIM. D2 STATED THAT V1 THEN CHANGED INTO HIS LANE AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2.W1 STATED THAT V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING JOHNSON AVE IN THE NORTHERN LANE AND V2 WAS ALONG SIDE OF HIM IN THE SOUTHERN LANE TRAVELING EB. W1 STATED THAT D1 TURNED ON HIS TURN SIGNAL THEN BEGAN TO CHANGE INTO D2'S LANE AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2.NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 (CHRYSLER 300) WAS STOPPED FACING EASTBOUND ON 14TH STREET AT WALNUT ST. D1 (CLAIRE DORNER) THOUGHT INTERSECTION WAS A FOUR WAY STOP. V1 PROCEEDED TO CROSS WALNUT ST AND STRUCK V2 WHICH WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT ST. V2 (CHRYSLER SEBRING) WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT ST.D2 (KAYLA ZINK) INDICATED D1 THOUGHT IT WAS A FOUR WAY STOP AND FAILED TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY.D2 STATED WHEN V1 STRUCK HER, IT PUSHED HER INTO UTILITY POLE.UTILITY POLE BELONGED TO DUKE ENERGY. UTILITY POLE SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE. DUKE ENERGY RESPONDED FOR REPAIRS.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: No other officers assistedPrior to the accident V1 was traveling north on Fee Lane approaching Jordan Avenue. V2 was traveling south on Fee Lane approaching Jordan Avenue.D1 stated he wanted to turn left at the intersection of Jordan and Fee. D1 stated he did not see V2 coming south. V1 turned into the lane of travel of V2 and attempted to go west. V1 was struck on the passenger side rear bumper and tire area at a right angle. The rear bumper was ripped off and the airbags deployed inside the vehicle along the passenger side windows.D2 stated she was driving south when suddenly V1 turned in front of her. D2 attempted to stop but was not able to. V2's passenger side front bumper struck V1 at a right angle. V2 was towed due to the tire rubbing along the front bumper and fluids leaking out of the car.

V1 STRUCK PARKED V2 CAUSING DRIVER SIDE DAMAGE TO V2.VI IS POSSIBLY A PURPLE VEHICLE. NO FURTHER INFORMATION.D2 STATED THAT HE RETURNED HOME AND NOTICED DAMAGE TO HIS VEHICLE. DAMAGE OCCURRED BETWEEN 1630-2130 HOURS.

D-1 stated she was traveling West on Baby Creek road in the 8400 block when the sun blinded her for a moment causing her to run off the roadway and strike a utility pole. D-1 stated that she could not see due to the sun and didn't know she had run off the road until she struck the pole. D-1 was not injured and REMC was contacted to fix the pole.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 (white 2010 Subaru) was stopped at a stop sign, on Stanford Road at State Road 45. Vehicle 1 attempted to cross State Road 45, to travel southeast on N. Hinds Road, however failed to yield the right away to Vehicle 2 ( Black 2004 Chevrolet pick-up truck) and struck it in the driver's side.Driver 1 (Virgina Durlacher) stated she was traveling south on Stanford Road, when she came to a stop, at the stop sign at State Road 45. Driver 1 stated she looked both ways and nothing was coming, so she proceeded to go straight to N. Hinds Road when she struck Vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated that she has no idea where Vehicle 2 came from and never seen it. Driver 2 (Andrew Robertson) stated he was traveling east on State Road 45. Driver 2 stated as he passed by the intersection of State Road 45 and Stanford Road, Vehicle 1 struck him in the driver's door. Driver 2 stated he did not see Vehicle 1 pulling into the intersection, therefore was unable to avoid the collision. Based upon the evidence at the scene and driver's statements, I determine the cause of the crash to be failure to yield the right away by Driver 1.

Vehicle 2 was parked in a parking stall on the south side of the parking lot near the front doors to the restaurant. Vehicle 2 was facing south. Vehicle 1 was backing out of a parking stall on the north side of the parking lot. Vehicle 1 was facing north. Vehicle 1 backed into the rear of Vehicle 2. After colliding with the vehicle 2, vehicle 1 then left the accident scene.A witness heard the accident and witnessed vehicle 1 leave the area. The witness was able to get the license plate number off of vehicle 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 2 WAS EASTBOUND ON E 3RD STREET IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE OF THE EASTBOUND LANES. AS HE PASSED THE INTERSECTING ROAD OF S PARK RIDGE ROAD, VEHICLE 2 TURNED LEFT OFF OF S. PARK RIDGE ROAD TO CONTINUE WESTBOUND AND ACROSS THE PATH OF TRAVEL OF VEHICLE 1. VEHICLE 1 WAS STRUCK AT A RIGHT ANGLE BY VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 HAD RIGHT OF WAY. VEHICLE 1 FAILED TO SEE CROSS TRAFFIC WITH VEHICLE 2 HAVING THE RIGHT OF WAY.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on E 3rd St. Between S Faculty Ln. and S Woodlawn Ave. V1 was in the leftmost lane, V2 was in the rightmost lane. V2 attempted to turn left into a parking lot from the right lane, colliding with V1 in the left lane.D1 advised that he was traveling westbound on E 3rd St. approaching the intersection of S Woodlawn Ave. in the left lane of travel. D1 advised that V2 was next to him in the right lane and attempted to turn into a parking lot on the left side of the road, colliding with the passenger side of V1. D1 advised that D2 entered the parking lot, exited his vehicle, spoke to him, then returned to his vehicle claiming that he was gathering his insurance information. When I arrived on scene, V2 was no longer there and D1 hadn't realized that he'd left the area. Officers checked the area but were unable to find V2.W1 advised that he was approximately half a block behind V1 and V2, also traveling westbound on E 3rd St. W1 advised that V2 was in the right hand lane and V1 was in the left. W1 advised that V2 attempted to turn left from the right lane without looking and collided with the passenger side of V1. W1 stopped and stayed near V1 in the street, and also didn't realize that V2 had left the area after the police were called.V1 sustained a broken passenger side rearview mirror as well as scrapes and dents from the front fender to the rear door on the passenger side. V2 would have sustained damage to the front driver's side corner. The only description provided of V2 and D2 were a small dark 2 door Mazda with Illinois plates, and the driver was a white male with brown hair in his early 20s.

D2 was traveling South on Sale Street. D1 traveling East on Vine, entered intersection with Sale Street and was struck by D2. D1's vehicle continued after contact and hit curb and then building located at 505 W Vine St. Did not appear to be any visible damage to building. D2 stated D1 ran stop sign. D1 stated he stopped at the sign, didn't see anyone, and proceeded through intersection.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was westbound on SR 45 east of N Prairie Green Court. V1 came around the curve and lost control on the ice on the roadway. V1 crossed the center line and collided with a tree on the south side of the roadway at 4650 E SR 45. Damage to V1 was extensive and V1 had to be towed from the scene.Driver of V1 stated she was westbound on SR 45 east of Prairie Green Ct. Driver of V1 stated as she came around the curve in the roadway she hit a patch of ice and lost control. Driver of V1 stated the rear of the vehicle began to traverse left and when she tried to correct it she went left of center. Driver of V1 then collided with a tree on the south side of the roadway and came to rest. Driver of V1 was treated and released at the scene by EMS and transported home. V1 was damaged and could not be driven from the scene and was towed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling west on Third Street. At the intersection of College Mall Road, vehicle 2 was attempting to turn south onto College Mall Road. Vehicle 2 had a right green arrow when he started his right turn.Vehicle 1 was traveling north on College Mall Rd. At the intersection of Third Street, vehicle 1 was attempting to make a U-turn and travel south on College Mall Rd. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that the stop light was showing a green left turn arrow and green for the straight lanes.As vehicle 1 began to make the U turn, vehicle 2 was already turning right. Vehicle 1 failed to yield the right away of vehicle 2 and the vehicles collided. Vehicle 1 had damage to the front passenger side and vehicle 2 had damage to the front drivers side. No injuries were reported from this accident and both vehicles were able to drive from the scene.
V1 was backing southeast when D1 unsafely backed into V2 that was parked facing east. Both vehicle were in the private drive of 1951 S. Garrison Chapel Road

Vehicle 1 appears to have been traveling south on Jordan Avenue approximately 650 feet north of 17th Street. Vehicle 2 was parked facing south on the west side of Jordan Avenue approximately 650 feet north of 17th Street.Driver 1 left the scene of the accident.Owner of Vehicle 2 stated she parked her vehicle at approximately 3:00pm on 02/17/2019 and after returning to her vehicle on 02/18/2019 at approximately 7:00pm she located the damage. Injuries are unknown.The damage to Vehicle 1 is unknown. Vehicle 2 had damage to the driver side exterior mirror and front driver fender.The suspect vehicle is unknown at this time. There are no cameras or leads at this time.Photographs were taken of the damage and placed into evidence.It appears Vehicle 1 possibly sideswiped Vehicle 2 while traveling south. Due to the vehicle leaving the scene a diagram was not completed.

Vehicle collision occurred on 2/18/2019. D1 came to IUPD on 2/20/2019 to provide vehicle registration and insurance information.D1 was parked facing eastbound. D2 was driving eastbound, slightly west of D1.D1 began to back westbound while D2 continued to drive eastbound. D1's driver-side rear bumper struck D2's passenger-side front bumper.D1 sustained damage to the driver-side rear bumper. D2 sustained damage to the passenger-side front bumper.

V1 west bound on Elwren road at 9650 W. Elwren Road when D1 ran of the roadway, collided with the mailbox of Travis Stickels and left. I located the vehicle at Greene County Line Road and Oak Haven Drive with a flat tire and damage consistent from striking the mailbox. I investigated Mr. Brummett for O.W.I where was later arrested for O.W.I. and leaving the scene of an accident.Received insurance information on 02/23/2019 and updated it accordingly.

ON FEBRUARY 19TH, 2019, I WAS DISPATCHED TO A PRIOR LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT CALL. THE CALLER STATED HE HAD PROPERTY DAMAGE AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT. AFTER TAKING PICTURES ON SCENE, I LEFT AND DISCOVERED THE VEHILCE THAT WAS INVOLVED TO BE LOCATED JUST SOUTH OF THE SCENE. THE DRIVER LATER SHOWED UP AND STATED HE WAS DRIVING THE VEHICLE AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT. HE STATED HE DID NOT TALK TO ANYBODY AT THE PROPERTY AND ALSO DID NOT NOTIFY LAW ENFORCEMENT. THE VEHILCE WAS TOWED AT THE DRIVER'S REQUEST.

V1 was traveling eastbound on Rogers Rd. V2 was traveling westbound on Rogers Rd. V1 and V2 struck mirrors as they passed each other.D1 stated that he did not think he was left of center and that they just bumped mirrors.D2 stated that he was not sure what D1 was doing and that he did not think he was left of center.V1 and V2 struck mirrors as they passed. There was no available camera footage from the bus. I did not see any crash marks in the roadway.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 AND V2 WERE DRIVING SB ON S COLLEGE AVE. BOTH VEHICLES CONTINUED SB ON S COLLEGE PASSING W 3RD ST. LANES SHIFTED SOUTH OF W 3RD ST. V2 WAS DRIVING IN THE RIGHT LANE AND V1 IN THE LEFT LANE. AS THE LANES SHIFTED V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.D1 SAID HE WAS DRIVING SB ON S COLLEGE AVE IN THE LEFT LANE. HE SAID HE WAS CONFUSED AS THE LANES SHIFTED AFTER W 3RD ST. D1 SAID BOTH VEHICLES GOT CLOSE TO EACH OTHER AND HIS VEHICLE MIRROR CLIPPED THE SIDE OF V2.D2 SAID HE WAS DRIVING SB ON S COLLEGE AVE. HE SAID HE WAS SIDESWIPED BY V1. D2 SAID IT WAS LIKELY BECAUSE OF THE LANE SHIFT THAT V1 CONTINUED STRAIGHT INSTEAD OF MOVING WITH THE LANES.D1 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID INDIANA DRIVERS LICENSE. D2 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID INDIANA COMMERICAL DRIVERS LICENSE. BOTH DRIVERS ADMITTED TO DRIVING THEIR RESPECTIVE VEHICLES.D1 FAILED TO PROVIDE PROOF OF FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY UPON REQUEST. D1 WAS CITED AND RELEASED AT THE SCENE.CASE CLEARED.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 02/18/2019

When I arrived on scene, I met with witnesses Victoria Antonini (W1) and Matthew Richard (W2). W1 stated that she was driving southbound on Jordan Ave past 1430 N Jordan Ave when she observed a white Jeep Patriot (V1) attempting to parallel park. As V1 was attempting to park, it struck the rear bumper of a white Hyundai (V2) then drove away and parked elsewhere.W2 was able to provide the license plate number and stated it parked just up the road. I located both vehicles but could not contact either owners.V1 sustained very minor scratches to the passenger side front bumper. V2 sustained very minor scratches to the driver side rear bumper.The next day I spoke with the owners of both vehicles and collected insurance information. The driver of V1 was Elizabeth Webb (D1). D1 stated that she had no idea she hit another vehicle which was understandable considering the small amount of damage that occurred.

V1 was traveling eastbound on S. Wickens St. just west of W. Leighton Ln. D1 stated that she became distracted by changing the radio station and did not see V2 parked on the curb on the south side of the roadway. V2 was facing west. V1 struck V2 causing damage to the front passenger side of both V1 and V2. Both vehicles were towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON S OLD SR 37 WHEN D1 LOST CONTROL OF V1, WENT OFF OF THE EASTSIDE OF THE ROAD, AND STRUCK TWO MAILBOXES AT THE ADDRESS OF 7887 S OLD SR 37. THE ROADWAY SURFACE WAS EXTREMELY SLICK AND THE ROADWAY WAS COVERED IN ICE IN A VERY SHORT PERIOD OF TIME.

D1 advised she was traveling N. On N. I-69 in the right/slow lane when she observed a lane change ahead. D1 stated that she utilized her turn signal and attempted to make the lane change, but stated that V2 continued North in the left/fast lane and did not allow her to enter the lane of travel. Ultimately a same direction side swipe occurred. D2 stated she was traveling N. On N. I-69 in the left/ fast lane when V1 changed lanes and struck the front of her vehicle. D2 advised that right at the lane merge, D2 thought she had struck a pylon, but it was V1. W1, Micah McQueen, stated he was in front of V2 and saw V1 traveling in the right/slow lane approaching the lane shift, when V1 attempted to merge in front of V2, but did not make it.
