D1 stated he had turned left to go west bound on Gordon Pike from Rogers St prior to V2 turning right to go west bound on Gordon. D1 then stated when V2 got behind him, he was unable to see the front bumper of V2 and tapped his brakes in attempt to get V2 to back off.D2 stated he had turned onto Gordon pike behind V1. When he got behind V1, D1 tapped his brakes to "brake-check" V2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was traveling north on S Rockport Road where he encountered ice on the roadway. D1 stated he tried to turn but the vehicle would not turn. D1 ran off the road and collided with the support cables for a utility pole, #UDWI148550.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 WAS HEADING SOUTH ON S. HENDERSON ST. D1 CAME TO A T-INTERSECTION AT E SOUTHERN DR. AND S. HENDERSON STREET. D1 FAILED TO YIELD TO D2 AND PULLED OUT ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT TURN. THIS CAUSED D2 TO HIT D1 IN THE BACK DRIVER SIDE TIRE. D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S HENDERSON STREET. D2 STATED D1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM AND HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP OR SWERVE RESULTING IN THE ACCIDENT.D1 STATED SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT TURN FROM E SOUTHERN DR. ONTO S. HENDERSON ST IN THE NORTH DIRECTION. D1 STATED SHE LOOKED LEFT THEN RIGHT AND PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION. D1 STATED SHE DID NOT SEE D2 WHO WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S HENDERSON ST. RESULTING IN THE ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON JACOB DRIVE APPROACHING W GATES DRIVE. AS SHE CAME TO THE INTERSECTION WITH GATES DRIVE, V2 TURNED ACROSS JACOB INTO HER LANE AND STRUCK V1 IN THE DRIVERS SIDE. V2 STOPPED AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION AND D2 TOLD D1 THAT SHE WAS GOING TO PULL OVER. D2 THEN DROVE TO WEST 3RD ST, TURNED WEST, AND FLED THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was headed WB on Hillside drive and was about to turn left onto Maxwell street. V2 was EB on Hillside drive approaching Maxwell street. V1 failed to yield the right of way and turned in front of V2. V2 was unable to stop and struck V1 in the front passenger side bumper with the front driver side bumper of his vehicle. V1 then came to a rest against a fire hydrant.D1 stated that she was turning left onto Maxwell street and she stated that her front windshield fogged up and she couldn't see. She then turned left onto Maxwell street and was struck by V2.D2 stated he was EB on Hillside drive and V1 turned left in front of him and he was unable to avoid hitting V1.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND IN LANE 3 OF SOUTH CURRY PIKE. WHILE ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A RIGHT TURN ACROSS LANES VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 WAS ALSO NORTH BOUND IN LANE 4 OF SOUTH CURRY PIKE. BOTH DRIVERS STATED THAT VEHICLE 1'S TURN SIGNAL WAS NOT WORKING. IT WAS LATER TESTED TO BE TRUE THAT THE LIGHT IN FACT WAS NOT WORKING.DRIVER 1 AND DRIVER 2 REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTIONVEHICLE 1 AND VEHICLE 2 WERE BOTH DRIVABLE AND WERE DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Driver was west bound on Schacht Rd when another driver in a black newer model ford sedan came into his lane of travel. Driver stated that the other vehicle was in his lane of travel causing him to move off of the right side of the roadway to avoid a collison. When the driver moved his vehicle to the right side of the roadway he struck a low hanging limb with the right front of his box truck causing damage to the box. The other vehicle involved did not stop and kept traveling east bound on Schacht Rd.

Vehicle 1 was stopped in traffic facing east on 10th Street at Woodlawn Avenue behind Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was was stopped in traffic facing east on 10th Street at Woodlawn Avenue in front of Vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated the left turn arrow turned green and the vehicles began turning next to her. She stated as she watched them begin to move she let off the brake and began rolling forward as she believed the light was green for everyone. As she rolled forward she struck the rear bumper of Vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated she was sitting in traffic when Vehicle 1 struck her vehicle from behind. No one involved complained of injuries.There was no damage to Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the rear bumper.Both drivers agreed at how the crash occurred but Driver 1 stated she did not believe the damage to Vehicle 2 occurred from her. Driver 2 advised that there was no damage to her rear bumper prior to the crash. All the damage to the rear bumper of Vehicle 2 appeared to be fresh.

D1 stated he was traveling east on Popcorn road. D1 stated his window suddenly shattered. D1 did not realize the vehicle's mirrors had collided. D2 stated he was traveling west on popcorn road. D2 stated the collision occurred more west than where the vehicles were currently stopped. D2 stated D1 was on "my side of the road". Vehicle debris was observed in front of 1175 W Popcorn road. Unable to determine who was left of center.

V1 was parked in a marked parking stall facing North at the Campus View Apartment Parking Lot. V2 then struck V1 in an unknown manner leaving minor scratch damage to the front passenger side bumper. V2 then fled the scene without leaving any information. The owner of V1 stated that she arrived at her vehicle today and noticed the damage to her vehicle but had not seen what had happened.There currently are no witnesses, there were no injuries reported, and no vehicles had to be towed. There are no suspects at this time.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH, IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE, ON SOUTH COLLEGE AVENUE.D1 STATED THAT HE HE WAS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF 3RD STREET.D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT REALIZE THAT V2 WAS STOPPED.D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE DID SWERVE, TO THE RIGHT (WEST) IN AN ATTEMPT TO MISS THE REAR OF V2, BUT WAS UNSUCCESSFUL.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS ON SOUTH COLLEGE AVENUE, NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF 3RD STREET.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE, FACING SOUTH, AND THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WITH A RED LIGHT.D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NEITHER VEHICLE SUSTAINED SIGNIFICANT OR DISABLING DAMGE.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling west through the parking lot in the 1600 block of East 10th Street. Vehicle 2 was traveling south through the parking lot in the 1600 block of East 10th Street approaching Sunrise Drive. Driver 1 stated he was attempting to turn south and did not see Vehicle 2. Driver 1 has an International Driving Permit from South Korea (permit number 0010-18-624309).Driver 2 stated she was traveling south in an attempt to exit the parking lot when Vehicle 1 struck the driver side rear door of her vehicle.No one involved complained of injuries.There was damage to the passenger side front bumper of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the driver side rear door.

V1 was in a parking spot in the parking lot of Mother Hubbards (1100 W Allen St Bloomington, IN) facing WB in front of Mother Hubbards entrance ramp. D1 advised she believed she had put the vehicle into park. D1 turned to to give her child, in the back seat, a bottle. When D1 turned, she placed her foot on the accelerator and the vehicle moved forward and struck the ramp that goes into Mother Hubbards. There was damage to the ramp and to the front of V1.

D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, GOING EAST ON EAST HILLSIDE DRIVE, JUST WEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH NANCY STREET.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED NEAR THE INTERSECTION WHEN THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON EAST HILLSIDE DRIVE.D1 STATED THAT HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME, THUS THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED BY KEN'S WESTISDE DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE DONE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: THIS ACCIDENT OCCURRED ON 02/20/2019. D1 REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO A SUPERVISOR ON THAT DAY. P1 CAME TO THE BLOOMINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT ON 02/22/2019 TO FILE A REPORT. V1 HAD A GREEN LIGHT AND WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN ONTO WEST 7TH STREET FROM NORTH WALNUT STREET. AT THE SAME TIME A PEDESTRIAN WAS WALKING NORTHBOUND ON THE CROSSWALK ACROSS 7TH STREET. V1 THEN STRUCK THE PEDESTRIAN AT THE CROSS WALK. D1 STATED HE WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN ONTO WEST 7TH STREET FROM NORTH WALNUT STREET WHEN D1'S VEHICLE STRUCK P1 WALKING NORTHBOUND ACROSS ON THE CROSS WALK OF 7TH STREET. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE P1 WALKING ON THE CROSSWALK AS P1 WAS IN THE BLIND SPOT OF HIS VEHICLE WHERE THE SPOT LIGHT IS LOCATED. P1 STATED SHE HAD THE SIGNAL TO CROSS AND WALKED NORTHBOUD ACROSS 7TH STREET. P1 STATED WHEN SHE WAS ABOUT HALF WAY THROUGH THE CROSSWALK SHE WAS STRUCK ON THE RIGHT HIP/BACK BY V1. P1 STATED AT THE TIME SHE DID NOT FEEL ANY INJURY DUE TO BEING IN SHOCK. P1 STATED ABOUT TWO HOURS AFTER THE ACCIDENT SHE BEGAN TO FEEL PAIN IN HER LOWER BACK. P1 STATED SHE STILL HAS PAIN IN HER LOWER BACK AND HAS SINCE SEEN A DOCTOR.THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO V1, P1 STATED SHE HAD NO VISABLE INJURIES, SO NO PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON 3RD ST AT WALNUT ST. V2 WAS TRAVELING NB ON WALNUT ST AT 3RD ST. AS BOTH VEHICLES ENTERED THE INTERSECTION, THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 AND THE REAR DRIVER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS WB ON 3RD ST AT WALNUT ST. D1 STATED THAT SHE RAN A RED LIGHT AND THE FRONT OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V1 IN THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED THAT SHE WENT NB ON WALNUT IN THE LEFT LANE AT 3RD WHEN HER LIGHT TURNED GREEN. D2 STATED THAT V1 THEN ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND SHE DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO STOP AND THE FRONT OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V1.W1 STATED THAT HE WAS TO THE RIGHT OF V2 ON WALNUT AT 3RD ST. W1 STATED THAT THE LIGHT AT 3RD ST TURNED GREEN AND HE SAW V1 PROCEEDING WB AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED, APPROXIMATELY 30 MPH, THROUGH THE RED LIGHT. W1 STATED THAT V2 AND V1 THEN COLLIDED IN THE INTERSECTION.THROUGH MY INVESTIGATION, I BELIEVE THAT D1 DISREGARDING A RED SIGNAL CAUSED THIS ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: UPON MY ARRIVAL I OBSERVED VEHICLE 1 FACING SOUTH ON STINESVILLE RD. VEHICLE 1 HAD EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE REAR AXLE AND REAR SIDE PANEL. DRIVER 1 OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING NORTH WHEN HE SLID INTO THE DITCH AND HIT A TELEPHONE POLE. THE TELEPHONE POLE WAS LEANING ON A FENCE AND SOME OF THE WIRES WERE DOWN.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: A INTERPRETER FOR D1 STATED THAT D1 WAS WEST ON 7TH ST APPROACHING GRANT. D1 SAID SHE STOPPED AND MADE A RIGHT TURN ON GRANT COLLIDING INTO V2. D2 STATED HE WAS NORTH ON GRANT ST AND HAD STOPPED AT THE 4 WAY STOP AT THE INTERSECTION OF 7TH ST.AND SAW V1 APPROACHING WEST BOUND SLOWLY. D2 SAID AS HE WAS GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, HE SAW V1 ENTERING THE INTERSECTION AND ULTIMATELY COLLIDED INTO HIS VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 advised he was driving V1 east bound on 10th Street behind V2. D1 advised the vehicle in front of V2 stopped in the roadway and V2 also came to a stop. D1 advised he attempted to stop but could not prior to V1 crashing into V2. D2 advised he was driving V2 east bound on 10th Street in front of V1. D2 advised the vehicle in front of him stopped in the roadway and V2 also came to a stop. D2 advised while stopped in the roadway V1 crashed into V2.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS EAST BOUND ON MAY ROAD APPROACHING S LEONARD SPRINGS RD WHEN HE LOST CONTROL OF V1. D1 STATED THAT THE REAR END CAME AROUND DUE TO THE SLICK ROADS AND UPON ATTEMPTING TO CORRECT VEHICLE V1 RAN OFF OF THE ROAD AND STRUCK A TREE.

Curry Pike is a multi-lane undivided county road. There are two lanes northbound and two lanes southbound with a double yellow center line. V2, red Chevrolet, was traveling north on Curry Pike and stopped in the left lane for a school bus. V1, blue Honda, was traveling north on Curry Pike in the left lane behind V2. V1 failed to stop behind V2 and struck the rear of V2. D1, Chasteen, stated she was traveling north on Curry Pike. D1 stated she observed a school bus stopped in the southbound lanes of Curry Pike. D1 stated she observed V2 stop in the left lane ahead of V1. D1 stated she attempted to stop but slid on the wet roadway. D1 stated she struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1.D2, Scott, stated she was traveling north on Curry Pike in the left lane. D2 stated she observed a school bus stop in the southbound lanes with its flashing lights activated. D2 stated she stopped for the school bus when V1 struck the rear of V2.W1, Graves, stated she was standing in her driveway at 1015 N. Curry Pike. W1 stated she was waiting for the school bus that stopped near her driveway. W1 stated V2 stopped for the school bus that was stopped near her driveway. W1 stated V1 failed to stop and struck the rear of V2. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear of V2. D1 was tested by emergency room staff for controlled substance with negative results.

ON 02/21/2019, THE OWNER OF UNIT 2 CALLED THE MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE TO REPORT AN ACCIDENT THAT OCCURRED DURING THE EVENING HOURS OF 02/20/2019. THE OWNER OF UNIT 2 STATED IT WAS A SAME DIRECTION SIDESWIPE, WHILE TURNING FROM WESTBOUND STATE ROAD 46 ONTO SOUTHBOUND I69. THE OWNER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE WAS BEING DRIVEN BY HER SIGNIFICANT OTHER TO THE HOSPITAL FOR A MEDICAL CONDITION. THE OWNER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE TOOK PICTURES OF THE OTHER VEHICLE'S REISTRATION AND LICENSE PLATE.AFTER CONTACTING THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1, I OBTAINED SOME OF THE INFORMATION NEEDED FOR A CRASH REPORT. THE POLICY NUMBER FOR UNIT 1 IS NOT INCLUDED DUE TO THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 NOT PROVIDING IT IN A TIMELY MANNER. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ALSO STATED IT WAS A SAME DIRECTION SIDESWIPE IN THE SAME LOCATION. THE INFORMATION IN THIS CRASH REPORT IS OBTAINED BY BOTH DRIVERS. AFTER THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 ARRIVED AT THE MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE, SHE POINED AT SOME MINOR DAMAGE ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. I CANNOT VERIFY THAT THE DAMAGE POINTED OUT WAS CASUED BY UNIT 1 DUE TO NOT ARRIVING ON SCENE AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT. THE REPORT WAS MADE APPROXIMATELY 16 HOURS AFTER THE REPORTED ACCIDENT OCCURRED.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON WALNUT ST IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE. D1 SAID THAT TRAFFIC HAD STOPPED IN FRONT OF HER AND WHEN SHE APPLIED HER BRAKES, THE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR AND SHE STRUCK V2. D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED NORTH ON WALNUT ST IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE. SHE SAID WHILE WAITING IN TRAFFIC, SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. D2 SAID HER VEHICLE WAS THEN PUSHED INTO THE REAR OF V3. D3 STATED SHE WAS NORTH ON WALNUT ST IN THE EASTERN MOST LN STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. D3 SAID SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V2.

D1, Raymond King, an Indiana University employee, was driving V1, an Indiana University truck (motor pool #023) with plow and salt spreader attachment around 0530 hours. King advised that he had plowed the west drive of Bart Kaufman field (1873 N. Fee Lane) and was making a three point turn to continue back down that drive. While V1 was backing northeast, D1 advised that he could not see a light pole that was just off the road on the north side of the drive due to the dark conditions and V1's rear passenger side bumper struck the light pole (light pole #4095). There was a small dent to the light pole and no new apparent damage to the rear bumper of V1. King contacted IUPD after he completed more of his snow plowing route to make a report. I request a copy of this report be forwarded to INLOCC.

V1 was traveling south bound on South Breeden Road. V1 ran off the west side of the roadway and stuck a utility pole. D1 stated she fell asleep while driving. D1 was arrested for operating while intoxicated.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS WEST BOUND ON REEVES ROAD APPROACHING COUNTY LINE ROAD WHEN HE HIT A PATCH OF ICE WHILE TRAVELING DOWN A HILL WITH A CURVE AND WENT OFF OF TROADWAY. V1 SLID OFF OF THE ROADWAY AND INTO A DITCH. AN AMBULANCE WAS DISPATCHED TO CHECK ON AN INFANT, BUT THERE WERE NO INJURIES. ROADWAY WAS HAZARDOUS WITH ICE.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON SOUTH FAIRFAX RD. VEHICLE 1 SLID ON ICE AND RAN OFF THE RODE.VEHICLE 1 WAS TOWED BY AUTO-MOBILE TO AUTO-MOBILE.DRIVER 1 WAS TRANSPORTED TO MONROE HOSPITAL VIA AMBULANCE FOR FURTHER EVALUATION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was stopped at the stop sign southbound on Grant St at 16th St. Driver 2 advised he was east on 16th St approaching Grant St. Driver 1 stated her view west was blocked by parked cars on the north side of 16th St. Driver 1 stated she was creeping out trying to see around the parked cars and did not see vehicle 2 approaching. Driver 1 stated she then crossed 16th St and was struck by vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated that vehicle 1 pulled out in front of him and he was unable to stop in time to avoid the collision. Vehicle 2 had the right of way.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON KENNEDY DR WHEN SHE CAME TO THE INTERSECTION OF KENNEDY AND RHORER. AFTER STOPPING, SHE PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSETION. UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON RHORER RD WHEN UNIT 1 PULLED OUT. UNIT 2 IMPACTED ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE. UNIT 1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF HER CAR.

V1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY PIKE, JUST THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF PROFILE PARKWAY, WHEN IT CROSSED THE CENTER LINE GOING INTO SOUTHBOUND TRAFFIC. V1 STRUCK A CURB AND DROVE OFF THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY. V1 CONTINUED NORTHBOUND THROUGH THE GRASS, STRUCK ANOTHER CURB AND CAME BACK ONTO THE ROADWAY. D1 STATED SHE WAS NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY PIKE WHEN SHE BELIEVES HER VEHICLE HAD A MALFUNCTION, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO JERK TO THE LEFT. D1 STATED SHE DROVE OFF THE ROADWAY, RUNNING OVER CURBS, AND CAME BACK TO REST IN THE ROADWAY.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 (white 2001 GMC) was traveling west on State Road 46 approximately 2500 feet west of Gettys Creek Road. Vehicle 1 traveled across a patch of ice, crossed the center line and left the roadway to the south. Vehicle 1 hit a tree with the front passenger fender and came to a final rest in a culvert. Driver 1 (Noah Jager) stated he was traveling west on State Road 46 when the rear of Vehicle 1 began to fish-tail on the ice. Driver 1 stated that he had no control of Vehicle 1 and left the roadway. Driver 1 stated he then struck a tree with Vehicle 1.Driver 1 signed a signature of release at the scene to EMS personnel. Based upon the road conditions, evidence at the scene and Driver 1's statement, I determine the primary cause of this crash to be speed too fast for road conditions.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON OLD STATE ROAD 37 WHEN HE LOST CONTROL AND SLID OFF OF THE ROAD. AFTER LEAVING THE ROADWAY, UNIT 1 STRUCK A METAL FENCE, BROKE A FENCE POST, AND STRUCK A TREE. UNIT 1 UNIT 1 HAD FRONT END DAMAGE, BUT WAS TURNED AROUND, AND FACING NORTH SO IT COULD BE TOWED AWAY. UPON MY ARRIVAL TO THE SCENE, I OBSERVED THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 TALKING WITH ANOTHER MALE WHO WAS ATTEMPTING TO TOW UNIT 1 AWAY FROM THE SCENE. IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT BOTH DRIVERS DID NOT HAVE VALID DRIVER LICENSES. DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ALSO EXPLAINED THAT UNIT 1 DID NOT HAVE INSURANCE.THE DIAGRAM DISPLAYS HOW I OBSERVED THE SCENE UPON MY ARRIVAL.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH, FOLLOWING DIRECTLY BEHIND V2, ON PROFILE PARKWAY APPROACHING ZENITH DRIVE. D1 STATED THAT D2 LOST CONTROL ON V2 AND SPUN OUT OF CONTROL BECAUSE OF THE ICE ON THE ROADWAY. D1 STATED THAT SHE SWERVED TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH V2 WHEN V2 SPUN AROUND AGAIN DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1. D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF HER VEHICLE THEN STRUCK THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED THAT SHE DID EVERYTHING SHE COULD TO AVOID THE OUT OF CONTROL V2 BUT WAS UNSUCCESSFUL. D2 AGREED WITH D1 STATEMENTS THAT V2 SPUN OUT OF CONTROL DUE TO ICE ON THE ROADS. D2 STATED THAT SHE TRIED TO CORRECT V2 BUT THE ICE MADE IT DIFFICULT.WHILE ON SCENE MANY OTHER CARS WERE ALSO SLIDING ON THE BLACK ICE ON THE ROADWAY. BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVEABLE AND NEITHER PARTICIPANT WAS INJURED.

Vehicle 1 was parked in the parking lot outside of 3824 West 3rd Street, unoccupied. V2 was backing out of a space next to V1 and the front driver side of V2 collided with the back passenger side of V1 causing minor damage. V2 then left the scene. V2 later returned to the scene. D2 did not exchange information and then left the scene again. Plate obtained for V2 did not match vehicle driven. D1 stated that she was inside of a nearby store when she heard a noise that she thought was a car accident. D1 observed V2 leave the scene. D1 spoke to D2 when D2 returned to the scene. D1 did attempt to obtain D2's information but was unable to.

Both vehicles were located in the 10th St. Parking lot in the south row of the lot facing north. V1 was facing north east, half way into a parking stall. V2 was parked facing north, unoccupied. V1 struck the driver side passenger door of V2 with the front passenger side bumper. Both vehicles sustained minor scratches and dents. D1 stated he was pulling into the parking spot to the left of V2 and misjudged how close he was to V2. D1 stated he struck V2 then reversed. The owner of V2 was not present at the scene. I was unable to make contact with the owner. I left my business card on the windshield of V2.

The crash occurred in the parking lot of 1000 N. Fee Lane located on the east side of the building. V2 was parked (backed-in) in a parking stall facing east. V1 was backing out of the parking stall traveling southeast.D1 stated that she entered the parking spot and found a spot next to V2. D1 stated she was traveling northbound through the parking aisle. D1 stated she started to pull into the parking spot and realized that she would not fit in the parking spot. D1 stated she reversed her vehicle and did not hear anything that resembled a collision. D1 stated that after some time, she found a different parking spot. V1 had damage to the front passenger side bumper. D1 stated that the damage on her vehicle was from a previous accident.O2 stated he did not witness the accident.W1 stated she was sitting in her car with the driver door open when she observed D1 attempt to park in a non-parking spot. W1 stated D1 began to pull partially into the spot and then began to pull out of the spot. W1 stated that as D1 backed from the spot, she saw V1 collide with V2. W1 stated she also heard the collision.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON ISON ROAD NEAR THE ADDRESS OF 5797 ISON ROAD. D1 ADVISED THAT HE ENTERED A CORNER AND LOST CONTROL ON AN ICE COVERED PORTION OF THE ROADWAY, AND WAS UNABLE TO REGAIN CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. D1 STATED HIS VEHICLE THEN LEFT THE ROADWAY, STRUCK A DITCH AND INVERTED. I CALLED THE DRIVER PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL AND HE ADVISED THAT WHILE AWAITING MY ARRIVAL HIS VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS SOUTHBOUIND ON LIBERTY DRIVE TURNING RIGHT ON A RED LIGHT TO GO WEST SR 45/BLOOMFIELD RD.V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON SR 45/BLOOMFIELD RD CROSSING LIBERTY DRIVE ON A GREEN LIGHT.D1 SAID WHEN HE TURNED HE DID NOT SEE ANY SEE WESTBOUND TRAFFIC COMING FROM HIS LEFT. HE SAID WHEN HE TURNED HE WAS HIT AND DOES NOT KNOW WHAT HAPPENED. HE THEN DROVE SOUTH OVER THE CONCRETE MEDIAN AND OVER AN EMBANKMENT HITTING V3 WHICH WAS PARKED IN A PRIVATE PARKING LOT.D2 SAID AS SHE DROVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION IN THE LEFT STRAIGHT LANE V1 PULLED TURNED ONTO SR 45 HITTING HER.WITNESS #1 SAID SHE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON LIBERTY DRIVE WAITING AT THE RED LIGHT TO TURN LEFT ONTO SR 45. SHE SAID V1 TURNED RIGHT ONTO SR 45 ON THE RED LIGHT AND STRUCK V2.WITNESS #2 SAID HE WAS BEHIND V1. HE SAID V1 TURNED RIGHT ONTO SR 45 AND HIT V2. HE SAID V1 THEN CONTINUED SOUTH ACROSS THE MEDIAN AND OVER THE EMBANKMENT AND CAME TO REST AGAINST V3 IN THE PARKING LOT.THERE WAS NO SIGN PROHIBITING A RIGHT TURN ON A RED LIGHT FOR V1.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVE IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE. SHE INDICATED THAT SHE HAD LOOKED AT THE PASSENGER FOR A MOMENT AND COLLIDED INTO V2. V2 WAS PARKED UNATTENDED ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY IN A DESIGNATED PARKING SPACE.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON E. STATE ROAD 45 COMING UP TO MARTIN DRIVE. WHEN HE BEGAIN TURNING ON THE CURVE V1 DROVE THROUGH A LARGE SPOT WHERE A BARREL OF HYDROLIC FLUID HAD SPILLED AND LOST TRACTION. V1 THEN WENT OFF THE ROAD AND STRUCK A DUKE UTILITY POLE.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT SHE ENTERED HER VEHICLE AROUND 1000 HRS THIS MORNING AND DROVE TO A LOCAL BUSINESS. SHE SAID WHEN SHE EXITED THE VEHICLE SHE NOTICED DAMAGE TO THE DRIVERS FRONT BUMPER. SHE INDICATED THAT WHEN SHE GOT INTO HER CAR AT HER RESIDENCE, SHE WALKED AROUND THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE, THEREFORE NOT SEEING THE DAMAGE. SHE INDICATED THERE WAS NO NOTICABLE DAMAGE TO HER VEHICLE ON THURSDAY FEBRUARY THE 21ST. IT APPEARS THAT THE OFFENDING VEHICLE STRUCK V2 WHILE TRYING TO ENTER A PARALLEL PARKING SPACE IN FRONT OF V2.THE DAMAGE CONSISTS OF SCRATCHES TO V2'S FRONT BUMPER. THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR THE CASE.

Vehicle 1 was stopped in traffic, facing Eastbound on Hillside Drive at the Henderson Street intersection. Vehicle 2 was stopped in traffic facing Eastbound on Hillside Drive at the same intersetion, directly behind Vehicle 1.Vehicle 1 began reversing, traveling Westbound, and struck Vehicle 2.Driver 1 stated that she began reversing to let a vehicle reverse out of a parking spot in front of her.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON DUNN ST JUST SOUTH OF 14TH STREET. D1 INDICATED THAT SHE BEGAN TO TURN LEFT ONTO 14TH ST AND DID NOT SEE V2 TRAVELING SOUTH ON DUNN ST. V2 THEN COLLIDED INTO THE PASSENGER REAR OF V1. D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON DUNN ST JUST NORTH OF 14TH ST. D2 INDICATED THAT V1 TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF HER AND SHE COULD NOT AVOID COLLISION.

D1 was traveling N/B on Rogers ST. D2 was traveling E/B on 1st ST. D1 disregarded a stop sign and collided with V2 causing damage.D1 advised that he was traveling N/B on Rogers ST. D1 advised that as he was traveling, he attempted to make a complete stop at the stop sign, when his foot slipped off of the brake pedal. D1 advised that he then struck V2 causing damage. D1 advised that he and his passengers were not injured. It should be noted that his two passengers were underage and the parents of the juveniles transported the males to the hospital to be seen.D2 advised that she was traveling E/B on 1st ST. D2 advised that she came a stop at the stop sign and proceeded through traffic when she was struck V1. D2 advised that D1 told her that he had a brake failure while attempting to stop. D2 was transported to the hospital for her incapacitating injuries. D2 had pain to her neck, chest, and her right leg 6 out of 10. Due to the fact that D1 disregarded the stop sign, V1 struck V2 causing damage to the vehicle.

V1 WAS PULLING INTO THE ADDRESS OF 5101 N BUSINESS 37 AND ENTERED THE PARKING LOT WITH TOO MUCH SPEED, SLID ON GRAVEL THAT WAS IN THE PARKING LOT, STRIKING V2. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED AND SITTING IN A PARKING SPACE WHEN V1 STRUCK V2

Driver 2 came on station to file this report. She stated that on yesterdays date (02/22/2019) at approximately 11:10am, she was south on S Walnut Street approaching Winslow Rd. Driver 2 stated she stopped for the red light and had 5 cars in front of her. She stated she was then rear-ended by a white SUV. Driver 2 then pulled to the right to talk get out of traffic and assumed the suspect vehicle would follow. Driver 2 stated the suspect then continued straight on Walnut without stopped. Minor damage. No injuries reported.

Explain in narrative: Owner 1 stated he pulled the emergency brake after parking in the lot of the Wells Library. It appeared upon looking into the vehicle that the emergency brake was not engaged enough to keep the vehicle in place. V1 rolled out of the parking stall and struck V2 in the rear.V1 was backed into a parking stall facing south, directly across from V2.V2 was parked in a parking stall just south of V1.Owner 1 stated he parked the vehicle and left it in neutral before engaging the emergency brake. When asked if he engaged the emergency brake enough he was unsure.

D1 ADVISED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON NORTH CURRY PIKE WHEN D1 OBSERVED ANOTHER VEHICLE STOPPED IN HIS LANE OF TRAVEL. D1 ADVISED THAT HE ATTEMPTED TO STOP, HOWEVER COULD NOT STOP IN TIME TO PREVENT HITTING VEHICLE 2. V2 STRUCK V3, WHICK STRUCK V4. D4 ADVISED THAT THERE WAS A JEEP STOPPED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROADWAY AND HE STOPPED TO AVOID STRIKING THE VEHICLE. D4 ADVISED THAT HE WAS ABLE TO STOP IN TIME, HOWEVER HE WAS THEN REAR ENDED BY THE OTHER VEHICLES.DRIVER OF THE JEEP, THAT WAS BROKEN DOWN IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROADWAY, TERI BARNETT (812)360-2246 ADVISED THAT HER VEHICLE RAN OUT OF GAS AND SHE TURNED ON HER HAZARD LIGHTS. MS. BARNETT ADVISED THAT SHE HAD ALREADY CONTACTED A PRIVATE TOW COMPANY TO BRING HER GAS, HOWEVER THEY HAD NOT SHOWN UP YET, AND THAT SHE FELT BADLY THAT THE OTHER VEHICLES WERE INVOLVED IN A CRASH BECAUSE SHE WAS UNABLE TO GET OUT OF THE ROADWAY.

V1 is a 26 foot, Penske moving truck.V1 was turning westbound from Indiana Avenue into the Von Lee Parking Lot. V2 was attempting to turn northbound onto Indiana Avenue from the Von Lee Parking Lot.V1's driver-side rear wheel, while turning westbound, struck V2's driver-side front bumper.V1 sustained no damage. V2 sustained damage to the front bumper.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling west on 10th Street approaching Sunrise Drive. Unit 2 was traveling west on 10th Street approaching Sunrise Drive.Driver 1 began turning north into the 10th Street parking lot at Sunrise Drive. He stated he did not see Unit 2 and struck him as he turned with the front area of his vehicle.Unit 2 stated he was traveling in the bicycle lane going west through the traffic light when he was struck by a vehicle turning right. He stated he flipped over the handle bars and struck his head on the ground as he fell.Driver 1 did not complain of any injuries. Unit 2 stated his head hit the ground when he flipped over the handlebars. He advised he was wearing a helmet at the time but that he struggled to make complete sentences and think of words after the accident. Unit 2 also complained of pain to his abdominal area from hitting the handlebars. He was transported by ambulance to IU Health Bloomington Hospital.There was no damage to Vehicle 1 or Unit 2's bicycle.Driver 1 had left before officers arrived. Upon arriving at 1827 E 10th Street, Unit 2 advised after being struck, Driver 1 exited the vehicle and asked if he was okay. He stated he was and Driver 1 parked his vehicle in the lot before returning. Unit 2 stated after returning Driver 1 began speaking with Unit 2 and attempting to change the topic. He stated Driver 1 began telling him that he could give Unit 2 his number and assist him with his Biology class. Unit 2 stated Driver 1 asked several times to take Unit 2 home. Unit 2 stated he told Driver 1 he could not go home and that he was working approximately one block east at 1827 E 10th Street. Driver 1 stated he did not want to take Unit 2 there and asked repeatedly to take Unit 2 home. Unit 2 stated Driver 1 finally agreed to take Unit 2 to 1827 E 10th Street but upon arriving at the location he observed a Police Officer inside and refused to enter the building. Unit 2 stated he had to talk Driver 1 into driving around the building and entering the back door. After getting inside, Unit 2 stated Driver 1 immediately began trying to leave. Unit 2 stated his manager began telling Driver 1 to wait for police to arrive. Unit 2 and his manager advised Driver 1 stated several times "No. No. No." and continued trying to leave. Unit 2's manager told Driver 1 to give her his name and phone number. He gave his name and phone number to the manager before quickly leaving against the wishes of Unit 2 and the manager. Unit 2 stated Driver 1 made it clear he did not want police involved and made several statements to Unit 2 about not getting police involved. Unit 2 stated Driver 1 seemed very nervous and appeared to be "tweaking" like he was on some type of drug. Officers were able to get in contact with Driver 1 and he returned to 1827 E 10th Street. While speaking with Driver 1 he stated he was just in a hurry but refused to answer why he wanted to leave without giving any information. He continued stating it was "complicated". I noticed Driver 1 was speaking slowly and his pupils were extremely constricted. Driver 1 stated he had not taken any medications or drugs. I transported Driver 1 to the IU Police Station for further testing. Officer Wagner was able to assist and obtain Driver 1's insurance information. Driver 1 did not consent to a search of his vehicle. After returning to the IU Police Station I asked Driver 1 to perform the SFSTs. He did not show any clues on HGN, Walk-and-Turn, or One Leg Stand. I checked for Lack of Convergence and it was present. His right eye button hooked out and fail to converge. I asked Driver 1 to perform the Romberg Balance test and he swayed heavily forward, backwards, and side-to-side the entire time. Driver 1 consented to a blood draw and I transported him to the hospital. A blood draw kit was completed and placed into evidence. The blood results returned negative for all the drugs that the lab tests for. The case was sent to the Prosecutor and charges will be pending for Leavin

V1 was traveling east bound on West Reeves Rd. V1 ran off the south side of the roadway, struck a tree and overturned. D1 was confused and visibly shaken up due to the crash; he was not sure what happened. D1 was treated for his injuries on-scene. D1 was transported by Deputy L. Frye to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for an operating while intoxicated investigation.

Both vehicles were driving west on 3rd Street approaching Swain Avenue. V1 was in the north lane and V2 was in the south lane. V1 was in front of V2. V1 attempted to turn south onto Swain Avenue. V1 turned in front of V2 and V2 struck V1. D1 stated she did not realize 3rd Street was a one-way street where they were driving. D1 admitted she turned in front of V2 and cut them off as she was turning toward Swain Avenue. D2 stated that V1 turned from 3rd Street toward Swain Avenue. D2 stated V1 cut her off and she was unable to stop before striking V1. V2's right bumper struck the left rear quarter panel of V1. V1 had minor damage to the left rear quarter panel along with a broken taillight. V2 had minor cosmetic damage to the right front bumper. Neither driver complained of pain in my presence.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on W 3rd St and were at the intersection with S State Road 37 when V2 stopped in the roadway due to congested traffic in front of it. V1 was not able to stop behind V2 before it struck the rear bumper of V2. D1/V1 stated it was stop and go traffic due to heavy congestion in the area and could not stop in time before his vehicle struck the rear bumper of V2 in the roadway. D1 advised his vehicle slid into the rear bumper portion of V2 after he applied the brakes. D2/V2 stated he was forced to stop due to heavy congested traffic in front of him. D2 stated upon doing so his vehicle was struck from behind by V1. V1 sustained heavy front end damage and was towed from the scene due to disabling damage. V2 sustained minor damage to the rear bumper portion was driven away from the scene by D2.

V1 and V2 were traveling E/B on 2nd ST. V1 rear ended V2 due to V1 following to closely.D1 advised that she was traveling E/B on 2nd Street. D1 stated that the traffic signal had turned yellow at the intersection of 2nd and Rogers and V2 which was in front of V1 stopped in the middle of the intersection suddenly. D1 advised that she had to stop abruptly when she rear end V2. D1 advised that V2 was not damaged. D1 advised that she was not injured.D2 left the scene of the accident. Due to D1 following to closely, V1 rear ended V2 causing damage to V1.

Vehicle 1 was traveling Southbound on Washington Street approaching the 3rd Street intersection. Vehicle 1 left the roadway, on the West side of the road, striking the East side of the building located at 250 S Washington Street. Driver 1 was arrested for Operating While Intoxicated.
Driver one stated he was pushing a tree out of the road and the tree flipped up and hit the truck.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 REAR ENDED V2 AT THE INTERSECTION OF 3RD AND PATTERSON. V1 THEN REVERSED AND STRUCK VILLAGE PANTRY SIGN.D1 LEFT THE SCENE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL, WAS NOT LOCATED.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT FACING WEST BEFORE HE WAS REAR ENDED. D2 STATED THAT V1 REVERSED AND STRUCK VILLAGE PANTRY SIGN. D2 STATED THAT D1 RAN OFF.

V1/D1 IS UNKNOWN. LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT. NO WITNESSES, NO CAMERAS, NO SUSPECTS AT THIS TIME.V2 WAS PARKED, BACKED IN UNDERNEATH THE COVERED PARKING AT 701 N. WALNUT ST. OWNER RETURNED TO VEHICLE AND NOTICE AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE STRUCK THE FRONT OF THE 2008 TOYOTA TACOMA SILVER TRUCK. VEHICLE WAS PUSHED FROM NORTH TO SOUTH IN THE LOT. OWNER STATED NEIGHBOR IN THE AREA HEARD A CRASH AROUND 515 AM ON TODAYS DATE.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS ON EAST COVENANTER, HAVING JUST TURNED OFF OF SOUTH COLLEGE MALL.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED AND ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT, NORTH, INTO THE PARKING LOT OF 965 SOUTH COLLEGE MALL ROAD.D2 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS STOPPED, WHILE WAITING FOR TRAFFIC SO SHE COULD TURN LEFT, THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 STATED THAT SHE HAD JUST TURNED EAST ONTO EAST COVENANTER OFF OF SOUTH COLLEGE MALL.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT REALIZE THAT V2 WAS STOPPED.D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

D1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W ST RD 45. D1 HIT A DEER THAT WAS DECEASED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROADWAY.THE UNDERCARRIEGE OF THE VEHICLE WAS DAMAGED MAKING THE VEHICLE INOPERABLE. THE VEHICLE MOVED FROM THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.
VEHICLE 1 WAS BACKING SOUTHBOUND WHEN IT STRUCK VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED WITH NO OCCUPANTS.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 going south in the Wells Library parking lot. V2 was turning west into the Wells Library parking lot from Jordan Ave.D1 stated that she was going south in the Wells Library parking lot going past one of the entrances. D1 stated she saw D2 entering the parking lot as she was passing the entrance. D2 stated she attempted to brake and swerve to get out of the way of D2 but could not and the front of D2 collided with her driver's side door.D2 stated he was turning west into the Wells Library parking lot. D2 stated that as he turned west into the parking lot the sun got in his eyes and he did not see V1 until he collided with her driver's side door.

D1 and D2 were headed E/B on W Country Club Dr, approaching S Walnut St. D2 stopped in traffic due to a red traffic signal. D1 failed to stop in time, causing the front of V1 to collide with the rear of V2. D1 stated that she was headed E/B on W Country Club Dr, approaching S Walnut St. D1 stated that she saw D2 stopped in traffic, but thought that traffic had begun to move again East. D1 stated that by the time she realized D2 was not moving she hit the brakes, however it was too late. V1 then struck V2 in the rear, causing a collision.D2 stated that she was headed E/B on W Country Club Dr, approaching S Walnut St. D2 stated that she stopped in traffic due to a red traffic signal. D2 stated that as she waited for the traffic signal to turn green, she was struck from the rear by V1.

D1 was headed S/B on S Patterson Dr., and stopped at the intersection of W 2nd St. D1 then proceeded through the intersection as the pedestrian, Russell, crossed S Patterson Dr. V1 then struck Russell with it's front passenger side, causing a collison. Russell was transported to the hospital with a complaint of pain in his left knee. D1 was treated at scene and reported no injuries. D1 did state that he had consumed 2 beers at dinner. I did have him complete the field sobriety test Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus, to which he displayed none of the possible 6 clues. D1 stated he was headed S/B on S Patterson Dr., and stopped at the intersection of W 2nd St. D1 stated that he waited for the traffic light to turn green and then proceeded through the intersection. D1 stated that as he proceeded through the intersection he saw Russell walk from the sidewalk and into his lane of travel. D1 stated that he hit his brakes in an attempt to stop and miss Russell, however he was unable. D1 stated that he "clipped" Russell with the front passenger side of his vehicle. Russell stated that was at the intersection of S Patterson Dr and W 2nd St, waiting to cross S Patterson Dr E/B. Russell stated that he believes he had the traffic signal allowing him to cross the intersection, so he and his two friends, Steven Short and Kenneth McRoberts, began to cross S Patterson Dr. Russell stated that as he crossed S Patterson Dr he was struck by V1 as it traveled S/B on Patterson Dr. Both Steven and Kenneth stated that they believed they had the signal to cross the street. Witness #1, Stanley Corson, was located North of the intersection. Stanley stated that he was waiting to turn E/B onto W 2nd St from S Patterson Dr. Stanley stated that the traffic light was green for traffic S/B on S Patterson Dr and for those turning E/B onto W 2nd St, and does not believe that the cross walk signal was allowing pedestrians to cross S Patterson Dr. Witness #2, Erik Scales, was located South of the intersection, headed North on S Patterson Dr. Erik stated that he stopped at the intersection due to having a red traffic signal and waited for it to turn green. Erik stated that he saw Russell and his friends start to cross S Patterson Dr, and believes they did not have the cross walk signal allowing them to cross S Patterson Dr.

D2 was traveling in the driving lane, north on south curry pike, v1 was traveling north on south curry pike in the passing lane. V1 changed lanes and did not observe v2 striking it on the driver's side door and side view mirror. D1 advised that it was her fault, however she is not sure how the damage that v2 has on it was caused by her vehicle. Accident occurred near the constitution ave and curry pike and they both pulled into 1531 s curry pike to await for police.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 WAS DRIVING EB ON BLOOMFIELD RD. V2 WAS DRIVING NB ON S ADAMS ST. V2 BEGAN TURNING LEFT (WB) ONTO BLOOMFIELD FROM S ADAMS ST. V1 COLLIDED WITH V2 IN THE INTERSECTION. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION IT WAS VERY SUNNY AND DRIVERS WERE HAVING DIFFICULTY SEEING.D1 SAID HE WAS DRIVING EB ON BLOOMFIELD RD. HE SAID IT WAS VERY SUNNY AND HE COULD NOT SEE AHEAD VERY WELL. D1 SAID HE COULD NOT TELL WHAT COLOR THE TRAFFIC LIGHT WAS. HE SAID HE GOT INTO THE INTERSECTION AND THEN COLLIDED WITH V2. D1 LATER SAID THAT HE THINKS HE MAY HAVE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT BECAUSE VEHICLES NEAR THE LOCATION BEGAN GOING INTO THE INTERSECTION AFTER THE COLLISION OCCURRED.D2 SAID HE WAS DRIVING NB ON S ADAMS ST. HE SAID HE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT AND BEGAN TO TURN LEFT (WB) ONTO BLOOMFIELD RD. D2 SAID AS HE GOT IN THE INTERSECTION V1 COLLIDED WITH HIM.V1 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID TN DL. V2 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID IN DL. BOTH DRIVERS ADMITTED TO DRIVING THEIR RESPECTIVE VEHICLES.V2 WAS TOWED TO RICKS TOW YARD BY RICKS TOWING, DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 02/25/2019

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED HER VEHICLE WAS PARKED AT HER APARTMENT COMPLEX, LOCATED AT 2301 E 2ND STREET. THE OWNER OF V2 STATED SHE HAD PARKED IT IN THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF HER PARKING LOT. THE OWNER OF V2 BELIEVES HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK WHILE PARKED THERE. THE OWNER V2 STATED SHE NOTICED SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO THE PASSANGER REAR QUARTER PANEL OF HER VEHICLE ON 2/26/2019 AT 08:30PM.AT THIS TIME I DO NOT HAVE SUSPECT INFORMATION FOR V1 OR D1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling west on 1st Street and Vehicle 1 was traveling north on Fess Ave. At the intersection of Fess and 1st, Vehicle 2 stopped at the stop sign before proceeding through the intersection. Vehicle 1 was not required to stop at the intersection and proceeded through. Driver of Vehicle 2 did not see vehicle 1 on the roadway and pulled out in front of vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 then struck vehicle 2 in the front passenger side. Both the vehicles then went off the roadway. Vehicle 2 had major damage to the front and Vehicle 1 had major damage to the front passenger side. Driver and passenger of Vehicle 2 had minor injuries and were checked by IU Health Ambulance Service. Neither were transported to the hospital by ambulance. Driver of vehicle 1 stated he had no injuries. Both vehicles were towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E. WINSLOW RD. D1 STATED TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP AND THERE WAS SPACE TO TURN LEFT ON TO S. BURBERRY LN, WHERE HER APARTMENT IS LOCATED. D1 STATED AS SHE TURNED LEFT, TO GO NORTHWEST, D2 WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON E. WINSLOW RD. IN THE TURN LANE. D1 STATED AS SHE WAS TURNING LEFT V2 MADE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON E. WINSLOW RD IN THE RIGHT TURN LANE PREPARING TO TURN RIGHT INTO HER APARTMENT COMPLEX AT S BURBERRY LN. D2 STATED AS SHE APPROACHED HER INTERSECTION TO TURN, V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HER STRIKING HER VEHICLE IN THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE BUMPER.

Driver left the scene prior to my arrival. Damage was done to the mailboxes at 2520 S Smith Rd and 2500 S Smith Rd. Minor damage was done to the utility pole in front of 2504 S Smith Rd but there was no pole number in sight.I was later able to contact the driver who stated he dosed off and ran off the roadway. D1 also stated his phone broke during the accident and he was unable to make the report at that time.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling westbound on E 17th St. approaching the crosswalk in front of the Devault Alumni Center at 1000 E 17th St. P1 was crossing the street at the crosswalk. V1 failed to yield the right of way and collided with P1.D1 advised that he was traveling westbound on E 17th St. Between N Cottage Grove Ave. and N Forest Ave. D1 advised that he had slowed down because he'd gotten cut off at N Cottage Grove Ave. D1 advised that once he passed the intersection he accelerated again and didn't realize there was a pedestrian in the crosswalk in front of him. D1 advised that he didn't see P1 until he had swiped him with the driver's side of V1. D1 advised that he stopped and checked on him immediately. D1 informed me immediately that he was driving on a suspended license, and that his insurance was "probably expired." D1 was unable to provide a valid insurance card, but advised the name of the insurance company that he had. D1 was issued citations for driving while suspended and failure to provide proof of financial responsibility.P1 advised that he was crossing E 17th St. northbound at the crosswalk near DeVault Alumni Center located at 1000 E 17th St. P1 advised that he was in the crosswalk almost halfway across the road when he observed V1 traveling westbound toward him. P1 advised that he stopped walking but realized that V1 was going to hit him, so he attempted to jump backwards. P1 was unsuccessful, and V1 ran over his feet, knocking him backwards. P1 complained of pain in his feet and tailbone from where he fell, but was standing when I arrived and declined to sit down due to the soreness in his tailbone. An ambulance crew arrived and P1 signed an SOR before driving himself to the hospital. P1 had a notably swollen right foot, but no other physical injuries. V1 sustained no damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were traveling NB on S Walnut Street, approaching Smith Avenue. V1 was in the east lane while V2 was in the west lane. D1 did not notice V2, and changed lanes left, without yielding. D1 stated that she was distracted by her GPS maps navigation. This resulted in V1 colliding with the passenger side of V2, causing non-incapacitating damage to both vehicles.

V1 was facing westbound on 10th Street at the Woodlawn Ave. Intersection. V2 was east of V1 on 10th Street, facingwestbound, at the Woodlawn Ave. Intersection.V1 backed eastbound, striking the front bumper of V2.V1 sustained damage to the rear bumper. V2 sustained damage along the front bumper.D2 has a valid Chinese driver's license. D2 did not have valid insurance at the time of the collision.

Vehicle 2 was traveling north on Leonard Springs Road and vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was attempting to turn left into a private lot at 2910 S Leonard Springs Road. Driver of vehicle 2 turned on their turn signal and was waiting for south bound traffic to clear to make the turn. Driver of Vehicle 1 stated that he thought vehicle 2 was still continuing on the roadway and did not notice that vehicle 2 was stopped. Driver of vehicle 1 noticed vehicle 2 was turning and locked the brakes but was unable to avoid colliding with vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 had significant damage to the rear and vehicle 1 had damage to the front. No injuries were reported in this accident and both vehicles were able to drive away from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D-2 stated she was traveling west on Industrial Drive when V-1 made a left turn in front of V-2 at which point V-2 struck V-1 on the passenger side of the vehicle. D-1 had the same statement as D-2.
D1 was being stopped for a traffic infraction. D1 fled the traffic stop before running off the road and crashing into a fence, a tree and a ditch. D1 was transported to the hospital for a blood draw.

D1 stated she was travelling eastbound on SR 45 46 Bypass approaching N College Ave. D1 stated she did not notice that V2 was braking which caused her to rear end V2. D2 stated he was travelling eastbound on SR 45 46 Bypass when he noticed the vehicle's ahead of him were slamming on their brakes. D2 stated he hit his breaks which is when V1 rear ended him and pushed his vehicle forward causing him to rear end V3. D3 stated she was travelling eastbound on SR 45 46 Bypass. She stated she had the green light but noticed the vehicles in front of her slamming on their brakes. D3 stated there was a dump truck at the front of the line. D3 believes the vehicles in front of her were braking to avoid hitting it. D3 stated after she hit her brakes she was rear ended by V2. All drivers denied medical assistance. D1 stated she hit her head when her airbag deployed in V1. She was advised to seek medical treatment immediately if she experiences any nausea, headaches, or feeling lethargic.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 WAS GOING SE ON S WALNUT STREET PIKE. V2 WAS GOING EB ON E WINSLOW RD. V1 PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND COLLIDED WITH V2. V1 WAS REQUIRED TO STOP AT THE POSTED STOP SIGN ON S WALNUT STREET PIKE. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY.D1 SAID SHE WAS DRIVING SB ON S WALNUT STREET PIKE. SHE SAID SHE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION. D1 SAID SHE PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WITHOUT LOOKING LEFT AND RIGHT TO ENSURE THERE WAS NO TRAFFIC.D2 SAID HE WAS DRIVING EB ON E WINSLOW RD. HE SAID AS HE WAS GOING PAST THE INTERSECTION HE SAW V1 QUICKLY APPROACHING HIM AND HE TRIED TO MOVE TO AVOID THE COLLISION BUT WAS UNABLE TO.D1 WAS IDENTIFIED WITH HER CHINESE DRIVERS LICENSE. D2 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID IN DL.D1 WAS CITED FOR FAILING TO OBEY TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE AND ADDITIONALLY CITED FOR EXPIRED TABS.CASE CLEARED.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 02/27/2019

V1 and V2 were stopped at a red traffic signal on S. Old State Road 37 at W. Church Lane facing southbound in the straight lane. D1 stated that she was distracted by eating a bag of chips and saw the left turn lane traffic start to move so she started to proceed as well, however the traffic signal for the lane V1 was in was still red. V1 crashed into the rear of V2 causing minor damage to both vehicles.

I69 is a interstate that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. Located at the 117.0MM is a exit ramp from I69 to SR45. The crash occurred on ramp F. (I69-117-Ramp F)V1 (2007 gray Kia Rondo) was traveling northbound on I69 at the 117.0MM. V1 attempted to merge onto the exit ramp F and ran off the roadway, striking a guardrail end. V1 came to rest on the ramp facing north.D1 (Shawn Parr) stated she was traveling northbound on I69. D1 stated she attempted to exit I69 and traveled off the roadway striking the guardrail. D1 was not sure why she traveled off the roadway. She was wearing her seat belt.During my investigation, I observed damage to the guardrail end and placed a damage tag on it. I observed heavy damage to the entire front end of V1. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of this crash was Ran Of Roadway. This was determined by damage sustained to the guardrail, V1, and driver statement.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1, black Ford, was traveling north across the eastbound lanes of SR48 as it exited a gas station parking lot. V2, black Toyota, was traveling east on SR48 in the left straight lane. V1 failed to yield the right of way to V2 and struck the rear passenger side quarter panel of V2 with the front left corner of V1. D1, Laughlin, stated he was attempting to exit the gas station parking lot and move to the left turn lane on SR48 west of Curry Pike. D1 stated he did not observe V2 traveling east on SR48. D1 stated he struck V2 as he was exiting the parking lot.D2, Gafford, stated he was traveling east on SR48 approaching Curry Pike in the left lane. D2 stated V1 struck the rear passenger side of V2 as he neared the intersection. Evidence shows damage to the front left corner of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear passenger quarter panel and door of V2.

D1 advised he was traveling South on S. Fairfax Rd. When a deer entered his lane of travel from the East. D1 contacted Central Dispatch to advise of the deer and proceeded to Lakeview Elementaryy (9090 S. Strain Ridge Rd.) where he works.

V2 was parked on the Southeast side of the roadway on East Rock Creek Drive in front of the residence at 2640 E. Rock Creek Dr. V1 was traveling East on Rock Creek Drive and struck the rear end of V2. V1 then fled the scene to the East. V2 was parked and unoccupied at the time of the crash. V1 did not leave information at the scene.V1 is believed to be a silver Nissan passenger vehicle based on debris left behind from the crash. V1 left a trail of coolant that traversed numerous neighborhoods and dead end roads on the East side of Bloomington. At the time of this report, V1 has not been located or identified. V1 is believed to have sustained significant damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle.V2 sustained siginficant damage to the rear driver side of bumper and corner of the vehicle. V2 was pushed partially out of the roadway. At the time of this report, I was not able to make contact with the owners of the vehicle.

Primary Cause (explain in narrative)- D1 pushed on accelerator pedal moving V1 forward.Driver Distracted (explain in narrative)- Reaching to grab a ticket to raise gate arm at parking booth.Non-Vehicle Public Property Damage- Booth gate arm at SRSC parking booth.V1 was stationary but in gear. V1 moved forward prior to striking the gate arm.D1 said she pulled up to the parking booth in V1 facing north east in direction. D1 had trouble reaching for the ticket to raise the gate arm. D1 said she accidentally pushed on the accelerator with V1 moving V1 forward striking the gate arm. V1 had damage to the front hood on the driver side of V1. The gate arm did not appear to have damage. I asked the parking booth attendant if she saw V1 strike the gate arm? Parking attendant said she did not see anything, only heard a noise and turned around. No injuries occurred. Photos of the gate arm and V1 are available.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE, EAST OF S ROCKPORT ROAD, FOLLOWING VEHICLE 2. DRIVER 1 OBSERVED V2 STOP ABRUPTLY IN FRONT OF HER DUE TO ANOTHER VEHICLE TURNING. D1 ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE, BUT V1 SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT. V1 REAR ENDED V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE, EAST OF S ROCKPORT ROAD. D2 OBSERVED THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM STOP ABRUPTLY, SO D2 HAD TO STOP QUICKLY. AS V2 CAME TO A STOP, IT WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

D1 stated that he was stopped in V1 behind V2 at the stop sign on S Rogers St at the intersection of S Old State Road 37 where both vehicles were attempting to turn southbound onto Old State Road 37. D1 stated that he saw V2 pull forward and believed he was proceeding onto S Old State Road 37, at which time he looked left to check for traffic and saw no traffic and therefore started to proceed out into the roadway at which time the front right corner of V1 struck the left rear corner of V2 that he was unaware was still in front of him attempting to pull out onto the roadway. Both vehicles then proceeded into the parking lot of Dodge City Homes at 6200 S. Old State Road 37. D2 of V2 concurred with the statement given by D1. Note: Both vehicles were moved out of the roadway prior to law enforcement arrival.
D1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W ST RD 45 WHEN D1 STRUCK A DEER WITH THE FRONT RIGHT CORNER OF THE VEHICLE.THE DEER WAS NOT FATALLY INJURED.THE DEER LEFT THE SCENE.

Vehicle 1 was traveling south on College Ave in the center lane. Vehicle 2 was traveling south on College Ave in the far left lane just behind vehicle 1. When the vehicles approached the intersection of 10th St, vehicle 1 turned on the left turn signal and attempted to turn east onto 10th St from the middle lane. When vehicle 1 started its turn vehicle 2 was unable to avoid colliding with vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 collided with the rear driver's side passenger door.Driver of vehicle 1 stated that she thought the far left lane was for parking only and was unaware it was another lane of travel. Driver of vehicle 1 also admitted that the accident was her fault.Vehicle 1 had damage to the passenger side near the rear door. Vehicle 2 had damage the the front. Both vehicles were able to drive from the scene and no injuries were reported.

V1 was backing out of a parking space in the parking lot of Salvation Army, 111 N. Rogers Street. V2 was stopped in the parking lot of Salvation Army, 111 N. Rogers Street, in the main aisle of travel waiting on a nearby parking spot to open up. V2 stated that he observed a vehicle deeper in the parking lot backing out, so he decided to wait until the spot open so he could park there. While waiting for the car to back out, V1 backed out of its space and into V2. D1 stated that he never saw V1 behind him and slowly backed out of the space and only noticed V2 once he collided with it. Damage to both vehicle was very minor consisting of scratches and paint chipping.

V2 PARKED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF 6TH ST IN FRONT OF 408 E 6TH ST. V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON 6TH ST WHEN V1 SIDESWIPED V2. V1 THEN PULLED IN FRONT OF V2 AND PARKED ON THE CURB. A WITNESS THAT WAS STANDING ON THE CURB APPROXIMALTEY 50 FT FROM THE INCIDENT ADVISED A WHITE FEMALE APPROX 5'5" GOT OUT OF V1 AND WENT OVER TO V2. D1 THEN SCRIBBLED ON A PIECE OF PAPER AND LEFT IT ON V2 WINDSHIELD. V1 THEN DROVE AWAY. THE WITNESS ADVISED V1 WAS A BLK FORD FUSION WITH IL PLATE AT24063. THE PLATE RETURNED TO A 2017 BLK FORD FUSION TO A PATRICK TIMMONS FROM NAPERVILL, IL. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THE OWNER IS A MALE AND THE WITNESS ADVISED THE D1 IS FEMALE. I WAS UNABLE TO FIND ANY LOCAL CONTACT INFORMATION ASSOCIATED WITH V1 OR THE POSSIBLE D1.THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE FENDER.

V2 was driving westbound in the left hand lane on 3rd Street near the intersection of 3rd and Swain Avenue and V1 was driving in the right hand lane. V1 attempted to turn left at the intersection of 3rd and Swain, crossing into the left lane, and striking V2. I first spoke to D1 who stated she was heading westbound in the right hand lane on 3rd street. D1 stated that as she was driving, she did not realize the road is one-way at this intersection. She also stated that due to minimal signage, she was very unaware of the switch from 2-way traffic to 1-way at Mitchell. It was at this time that she then turned left onto Swain Ave from the right hand lane realizing she had struck the passenger side of V2. I then spoke to D2 who stated that she had been driving straight (westbound) in the left hand lane. She stated that as she was driving past the intersection of 3rd and Swain, her vehicle was struck by V1. She stated she did not realize V1 was going to make the turn and strike her vehicle and that it happened suddenly. Both vehicles sustained significant damage.

Driver one stated she was traveling north on S Curry Pike in the right lane when she lost control of her vehicle and slid into the left lane. Driver one stated she struck the front left corner of vehicle two. Driver two stated he was traveling north on S Curry Pike in the left lane near W Broadway Ave when vehicle one attempted to make a U Turn from the right lane. Driver two stated vehicle one came into his lane and struck his vehicle in the front right corner with her driver side.

D1 stated she was travelling westbound on SR 45 46 Bypass when she noticed to State Troopers merging on ahead of her off of the N SR 37 Ramp. D1 stated the Troopers were running emergent which caused traffic ahead of her to slam on their brakes. D1 stated she could not break in time which caused her to rear end V2. D2 stated she was travelling westbound on SR 45 46 Bypass when she had to brake due to the traffic ahead of her stopping suddenly. After she hit her brakes V1 rear ended her V2. No injuries were sustained during this incident. Citations were issued to D1.

D1 was pulling V1 out of a parking spot at Kroger South parked next to V2. D1 turned too sharply to the right and struck the rear passenger side of V2 which was facing the opposite direction as V1. Both vehicles sustained minor damage.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS WEST BOUND ON BLOOMFIELD ROAD APPROACHING THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT I69. SHE ADVISED SHE WAS FATIGUED BECAUSE OF TAKING PART IN A SLEEP STUDY OVER NIGHT. SHE DID NOT NOTICE UNITL TOO LATE THAT THE LIGHT FOR WEST BOUND TRAFFIC WAS RED AND VEHICLE 2 WAS STOPPED AHEAD OF HER. V1 REAR ENDED V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS WEST BOUND ON BLOOMFIELD ROAD, STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT WITH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT I 69. V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT ROUGHLY 0900 HRS HE WALKED OUT TO HIS VEHICLE AND DISCOVERED THE FRONT PASSENGER BUMPER HAD BEEN STRUCK. THE OWNER WENT ON TO STATE THAT HE HAD BEEN AT 121 EAST KIRKWOOD FOR APPROXIMATELY TWO HOURS AND HE HAD BACKED INTO THE MOST SOUTHERN PARKING STALL LOCATED NEXT TO THE BUILDING. BY THE APPEARANCE OF THE DAMAGE, MORE THAN LIKLEY THIS WAS A BACKING ACCIDENT WHERE THE OFFENDING VEHICLES FRONT PASSENGER FRONT BUMPER STRUCK V2 WHILE EXITING THE ITS PARKING STALL. I VIEWED VIDEO FOOTAGE FROM THE CVS STORE AND OBSERVED TWO DIFFERENT VEHICLES PARKED NEXT TO V2 DURING THE DURATION IT WAS PARKED. I COULD NOT DEVELOPE ANY CONCLUSIVE EVIDENCE FOR THE INVESTIGATION. THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

D2 came to the Monroe County Sheriff's Office to report an accident that had occurred earlier in the morning. D2 stated that she was eastbound on Norway Drive and came to a stop at the intersection with Smith Pike when she was rear ended by V1. D2 stated that she and D1 got out to see that there was damage to both vehicles. D2 stated that they then pulled both vehicles into Molly's parking lot. D2 stated that she had forgot her cell phone at her daughter's house and asked D1 to contact the police for a report. D1 gave D2 her information including her address and cell phone number. D2 stated that she asked D1 if she had contacted the police and D1 responded with, "I thought you were contacting them." D1 then told D2 that she was in a hurry to get her child to the doctor for an appointment because he was really sick. D1 then left the scene. D2 went back to her daughter's house and called the wrong police department. That department told her she would have to come down to Monroe County SO to make a report. I attempted to get D1 to come to station by means of a phone call and also having D2 text as they had texted back and forth. D2 would not return my phone call and stopped texting when D2 told them that the police wanted to speak to her. I was able to have Deputy Alexander Hahn make contact with D1 by arriving at her residence the following morning. D1 provided her information to Deputy Hahn and admitted to being involved in the accident. Deputy Hahn also stated that there was damage to the front of V1.

V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the north-most lane. V2 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the south-most lane.D1 stated he was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave when he signaled his lane change. D1 stated he looked to make sure there were no vehicles in the left lane. D1 stated he proceeded to change lanes and collided with V2. D1 stated he did not see V2 in the left lane. V1 had damage to the front bumper.D2 stated she was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave when V1 collided with her. D2 stated V1 merged into her lane because a bus was stopped in front of him. D2 stated V1 was next to her in the right lane. V2 had damage to the passenger side quarter-panel.

V1 WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF 5227 W AIRPORT RD FACING SB. THE OWNER OF V1 STATED THERE WAS A VEHICLE PARKED NEXT TO HERS WHEN SHE ARRIVED TO THAT ADDRESS. THE OWNER OF V1 STATED THAT AFTER SHE CAME OUTSIDE SHE REALIZED THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE RIGHT REAR OF HER TRUCK BEHIND THE REAR TIRE. I OBSERVED SCUFF MARKS AND A DENT BEHIND THE RIGHT REAR TIRE OF V1. THE MANAGER OF THE ESTABLISHMENT STATED THEY DID NOT HAVE ANY CAMERAS THAT POINTED IN THAT DIRECTION AND NO ONE SAW WHO WAS DRIVING V2. D1 STATED THAT SHE REMEMBERED IT WAS A SMALL WHITE TRUCK THAT WAS PARKED NEXT TO HER WHEN SHE ARRIVED.

V1/D1 STATED "I WAS BACKING UP OUT OF THE PARKING SPACE IN FRONT OF KROGER ON N. KINSER PIKE. I SAW A MAN WALKING FROM THE BUILDING TOWARD ME, I STOPPED AND WAITED FOR HIM TO PASS. I DID NOT SEE THE PED1 WALKING TOWARDS THE STORE FROM THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION. I BACKED UP AND STRUCK PED1 WHO WAS ON CRUTCHES WITH A SMALL CHILD."PED1 STATED "I WAS WALKING IN SLOWLY WITH MY SMALL CHILD, I WAS USING CRUTCHES. ALL OF THE SUDDEN V1 BACKED UP AND STRUCK ME ON MY LEFT SIDE, CAUSING ME TO FALL AND HIT MY HEAD ON THE CONCRETE. MY CHILD WAS NOT STRUCK OR INJURIED".

On March1, 2019 at approximately 8:20a.m. This unit was called to the scene of property damage crash on Old SR 37 North of Whisnand Road, Bloomington, Monroe County, IN. The call had come through Monroe County, who advised that the driver was a male subject with long hair and a hat and that the driver was walking away from the crash north on Old SR 37. The reporting party to Monroe County was James Yount. This unit proceeded to the scene of the crash at 5097 Old SR 37 and met with Sgt. Doug Hutchinson PE 7418 who had arrived before me. The crash was a single vehicle crash where V-1a Grey Chevrolet Impala bearing 2109 IN 410TEN registered to Daniel Adam Hartsburg had left the roadway and struck an AT&T utility pole 8711. The crash caused the pole to snap into two pieces and the vehicle was sitting on the stump of the pole. The driver had left the scene, and Sgt. Hutchinson had checked north of the scene for the driver with negative results. While waiting on the wrecker, Sgt. Hutchinson noticed a cell phone in the car that was ringing. Sgt. Hutchinson could see the telephone number that was calling and the name and he wrote it down. The person calling the phone was Regena Dixon 812-360-0365. This unit had the Post call that number back and obtain information on who owned that phone. The Post contacted me back and advised that Regena Dixon was on the phone along with Daniel Adam Hartsburg. I was advised that the telephone belonged to Daniel Adam Hartsburg, the owner of the car involved in the crash. I was further told that they were at 7230 Old SR 37. Sgt. Hutchinson and I went to that address and spoke with Dixon and Hartsburg.Regena Dixon 10-5-1958 (812) 360-0365 told us that David Jackson had shown up at her residence about 5-6a.m. this morning and let himself inside. Dixon stated that she called out and asked who it was, and Jackson replied that it was David. Dixon said that she got up and asked her daughter Cheyenne (28) where David was to which Cheyenne said that he was in the back bedroom playing video games with Adam. Dixon said that she later saw David in the kitchen when she went to get a drink and David told her that he had to get his tools today. Dixon told me that Jackson resides in South Crest Trailer Park near the back of the park.When we spoke with Daniel "Adam" Hartsburg DOB: 08-24-1974 TX 812-947-8715 he told us that David Jackson had come to his residence 7230 Old SR 37 Bloomington, IN this morning and that Jackson had come into Adams room to fix an entertainment center. Adam told us that Jackson had asked Adam for a ride to work, and that Adam had told Jackson that he could borrow Adams car. Adam further stated that they give Jackson rides because Jacksons license is suspended. When asked, Adam stated that he does not have insurance on the vehicle he loaned to Jackson. Adam described Jackson as a male with long hair and wearing a toboggan hat, which matched the description of the driver the reporting party saw leaving the scene of the crash. Adam said that Jackson worked for a man named Scott, who sub-contracts with Midwest Roofing. Regena Dixon was able to provide a telephone number for Scott of 812-720-0042. Adam did not fit the description of the driver that left the scene according to the reporting party. This unit did not observe any injuries to Adam consistent with being in a car crash.This unit then went to 1206 S. Nancy Street Bloomington, IN and spoke with Scott McCormick, Jacksons boss, who advised that Jackson was supposed to pick up another worker and bring him to the job site with him. Scott said that Jackson had not shown up for work and had not picked up his co-worker either. I showed Scott a BMV photo of Jackson, and Scott affirmed that it was in fact the same David Jackson that did not show up for work today.On March 4, 2019 this unit met with David Jackson in the parking lot of Wendy's restaurant located at the corner of Walnut Street and Rhorer Road. David

On 03/01/2019, at 1731, I was dispatched to the parking lot of the SRSC at 1601 E. Law Lane regarding a hit-and-run to a parked vehicle.When I arrived, I spoke with Nathan McKenzie. McKenzie said he parked his vehicle, a gray Acura TL, (IL plate R964180) pulled in facing east in the second row of parking spaces in the lot around 1620 hours. When McKenzie returned to his car around 1720, he found a dent and scrape from the front edge of the rear driver side wheel well to the center area of the rear driver side door. There are no suspects, witnesses or leads. There are no cameras in the area.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET BEHIND V2. V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET BEHIND V3. V3 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET. ALL VEHICLES WERE JUST WEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF S COLLEGE MALL ROAD. AS V2 AND V3 WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WAITING FOR THE STOP LIGHT AT S OVERHILL TO TURN GREEN, V1 REARENDED V2 WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY CAUSED V2 TO REAR END V3. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 AND THE FRONT OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V3.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON WALNUT STREET IN THE WESTERN MOST LANE. SHE STATED WHEN ENTERING THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH DR. THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL WAS GREEN AND SHE WAS STRUCK BY A VEHICLE. D1 DID NOT RECALL WHERE V2 WAS PRIOR TO THE COLLISION. D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED SOUTH ON WALNUT ST IN THE TURN LANE FOR EAST BOUND SOUTH DR. SHE SAID THE SIGNAL WAS GREEN FOR NORTH/SOUTH TRAFFIC AND WAS PARTIALLY IN THE INTERSECTION WAITING FOR THE SIGNAL TO CHANGE SO SHE COULD MAKE HER LEFT TURN. D2 SAID WHEN THE SIGNAL TURNED RED SHE PROCEEDED TO TURN LEFT AND WAS STRUCK BY V1. W1 STATED HE WAS STOPPED WEST ON SOUTH DR WAITING FOR THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TO CHANGE. HE INDICATED THAT THE SIGNAL TURNED GREEN FOR EAST WEST TRAFFIC AND THEN SAW V1 PROCEED INTO THE INTERSECTION AS V2 WAS MAKING ITS TURN.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: On March 1st 2019, I, Officer Southern, responded to a vehicle crash at the intersection of S. College Mall Rd and E Covenanter Dr. Driver 1 was in the left turn lane on S. College Mall Rd. Driver 1 thought the traffic light had given the green arrow to turn left and it had not. River 1 turned left through the intersection and struck driver 2. Driver 2 was sitting in the left lane heading north on S. College Mall Rd. Driver 2 had the green light and proceeded into the intersection. Driver 2 was then struck by driver 1.

V2 was parked in a spot on 3rd Street facing West. V1 was driving West on 3rd Street in the South lane. In the North lane was a Bloomington Transit Bus. D1 stated that the Bloomington Transit bus started to merge in to the South lane without checking to see if there was anyone in the lane. D1 stated that the Bloomington Transit Bus started to merge and caused him to move V1 out of the way. D1 stated that due to the bus entering his lane he struck the mirror on the passenger side of V2 with the driver's side mirror of V1. There was little to no damage to V1 and the mirror of V2 was broken.V1 is owned by IU and was operated by a working IU employee.

VEHICLE WAS OBSERVED IN A CULVERT BY THE PROPERTY OWNER(GILBERT SNOOKS) AT APPROXIMATLEY 8:17AM. THE VEHICLE WAS UNOCCUPIED AND LOCKED, UPON MY ARRIVAL. THE VEHICLE OWNER WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED HER SON WAS THE LAST ONE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE OWNER'S SON MICHAEL DECKARD ADVISED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS STOLEN SOME TIME IN THE EARLY MORNING HOURS ON 03/02/19 OFF OF 8TH STREET IN BLOOMINGTON, IN. MR. DECKARD STATED HIS FRIENDS TOLD HIM THE VEHICLE WAS STOLEN, HOWEVER HE DID NOT BELIEVE THEM AT THE TIME, AND DID NOT REPORT IT AS BEING STOLEN. BASED ON THE TIRE MARKS THE VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING NORTHWEST ON THOMPSON RIDGE ROAD WHEN IT LEFT THE ROADWAY, STRIKING DECORATIVE LIGHTING, AS WELL AS, A DRIVEWAY MARKER AT THE ADDRESS OF 7145 THOMPSON RIDGE RD.SINCE THE VEHICLE OWNER AND HER SON ADVISE THAT HE WAS NOT THE LAST PERSON IN POSSESSION OF THE VEHICLE AND THE VEHICLE WAS STOLEN. THEY WERE PROVIDED WITH THE CRASH INFORMATION AND ADVISED TO GO TO THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT TO REPORT THE VEHICLE STOLEN. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO HAWKINS, BY HAWKINS TOWING, AND ADVISED TO STORE THE VEHICLE IN SECURE STORAGE UNTIL THEY CAN ADVISE IF THEY WANT TO PROCESS THE VEHICLE FOR THIS CASE.

V2 was driving south on Rogers street at the intersection with west 6th street. V1 was stoppped on 6th street heading west. V1 then entered the intersection and collided with V2 causing moderate damage to the front passenger side of V1 and the front driver side of V2. D2 stated that she was traveling and noticed that V1 was stopped at a stop sign and pulled into the intersection as they were traveling. D2 said that she did attempt to avoid V1 by steering to the right but was unable to avoid it.D1 stated that she was stopped at the stop sign and did not realize that the intersection was not a 4-way stop. D1 assumed the oncoming vehicle would be stopping and entered the intersection.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EASTBOUND ON W. STATE ROAD 46 COMING UP TO N. CURRY PIKE. D1 LOOKED DOWN AT HIS GPS REAL QUICK AND BY THE TIME HE SAW THE LIGHT WAS RED V1 WAS GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK V2 HEAD ON. D1 DID ADMIT TO RUNNING THE REDLIGHT.D2 STATED STATED SHE WAS AT THE STOP LIGHT ON W. STATE ROAD 46 AND N. CURRY PIKE WAITING TO TURN LEFT ONTO N .CURRY PIKE. D2 SAID SHE GOT THE GREEN TURN LIGHT AND STARTED TO TURN LEFT WHEN V1 RAN THE RED LIGHT AND STRUCK V2 HEAD ON.D2 WAS TAKING TO THE HOSPITAL BY EMS.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON KIRKWOOD. V2 WAS PARKED ALONG THE CURB IN A PARKING STALL FACING WB ON KIRKWOOD. V1 SWERVED INTO V2 STRIKING THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE BUMPER CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE. DAMAGE TO V1 IS UNKNOWN DUE TO OTHER INCIDENTS THAT OCCURED AT THE SAME TIME. V2 WAS UNOCCUPITED AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT. THE WITNESS WAS DRIVING BEHIND V1 AND SAW V1 STRIKE THE PARKED V2.

Driver two was sitting at the stop light at SR46 and Sale Street. When she was struck from behind by a black in color pick-up believed to be a Chevrolet. The driver got out and told her that there was not any damage done to the vehicles and when she told him that they were going to pull into the parking lot and call the police, the driver got into his truck and left.Vehicles moved prior to officers arrival.

On 3/2/2019, at 4:45PM, I, Officer Lucas, arrived to a parking stall northwest of the intersection of N. College Ave. and W. 10th St., regarding a report of a vehicle involved in a collision with a parked car and leaving the scene. The information given by the witness and caller, Dylan Miller, described the suspect vehicle as a gray Chevrolet single-cab pickup truck. Miller also described the parked vehicle struck as a red Toyota corolla. I was able to locate a red 2019 Toyota Corolla (KY Plate: 253YTX , VIN: 5YFBURHE2KP906984) parked in a stall, just northwest of the above intersection, with visible damage to the rear driver side bumper.The witness, Miller, stated that V1 was backing up when he heard a loud "bang." Miller stated that when he looked over to where the noise occurred, he witnessed V1 making contact with the rear driver side bumper of V2. Miller stated that when the driver of V1 noticed him watching, V1 immediately left the scene without attempting to provide contact information.Based on the statements from the witness, and the damage done to V2, it is evident that V1 committed unsafe backing, striking V2 on the rear driver side bumper, resulting in visible damage. V1 then left the area without providing contact / insurance information.

V1 WAS HEADING WEST IN THE LEFT LANE IN APPROXIMATELY THE 5200 BLOCK OF WEST STATE ROAD 46 WHEN A DEER RAN OUT IN FRONT OF D1. D1 PULLED HIS VEHICLE INTO A NEARBY PARKING LOT. VEHICLE WAS LEFT IN PARKING LOT AT OWNER'S REQUEST, A TOW TRUCK WAS NOT CALLED. VEHICLE WAS NOT DRIVALBE DUE TO A BUSTED RADIATOR.
