V1 and V2 were traveling N/B on Walnut ST. V1 made an improper turn, and struck V2. D1 advised that she was traveling N/B in the far right lane on Walnut ST. D1 advised that she attempted to turn W/B on Smith Ave before striking V2. D1 advised that she was not paying attention and thought she was in the far left lane when she attempted to turn W/B. D1 advised she was not injured. D2 advised that she was traveling N/B in the far left lane on Walnut ST. D2 advised she was traveling N/B and she felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that she was not injured. Due to D1 improper lane turn usage, V1 struck V2.

V2 AND V3 WERE PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF 620 W KIRKWOOD NEAR S FAIRVIEW ST FACING EAST. V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON FAIRVIEW WHEN V1 SWERVED OFF OF FAIRVIEW ST INTO THE PARKING LOT OF 620 W KIRKWOOD STRIKING V2 IN THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE PUSHING V2 INTO THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V3. V2 AND V3 WERE UNOCCUPIED. THE WITNESS WAS TRAVELING BEHIND V1 AND WITNESSED V1 STRIKE V2, CAUSING V2 PUSH INTO V3. THE WITNESS ALSO ADVISED AFTER V1 HIT V2, V1 THEN REVERSED AND PULL FORWARD STRIKING V2 AGAIN BEFORE DRIVING AWAY. DAMAGE TO V1 IS UNKNOWN DUE TO PREVIOUS DAMAGE ON V1.**Supplement- 3/7/19 Updated insurance company for V3/D3 to Indiana Farm Bureau.

WITNESS 1 STATED, V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON WEST KIRKWOOD AVENUE ABOUT 200 FEET WEST OF NORTH JACKSON STREET WHEN D1 SWERVED AND SIDESWIPED V2, WHICH WAS PARKED LEGALLY ON THE SIDE OF THE STREET.V2 WAS PARKED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE STREET AND NOBODY WAS INSIDE.D1 WAS INVESTIGATED AND LATER ARRESTED BY OFFICER LUCAS FOR OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED.BOTH V1 AND V2 SUSTAINED DISABLING DAMAGE. V2 WAS TOWED BY HAWKINS TOWING DUE TO IT IMPEDING TRAFFIC AFTER BEING STRUCK BY V1.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.

V1 was turning left (southeast) out of Gate 6 off of 17th Street. V2 was stopped east of Gate 6 facing west.D1 stated he turned left (southeast) out of Gate 6 onto 17th Street. D1 stated that V2 was stopped on 17th Street east of Gate 6 facing west. D1 stated V2 was allowing him to turn from Gate 6 onto 17th Street. D1 stated he believed he had enough room to make the left turn. D1 stated that once he made the turn, he realized he did not have enough space and collided with V2. V1 had minor damage to the middle of bus on the driver side.D2 he was stopped on 17th Street just east of Gate 6, facing west, to allow V1 to turn southeast onto 17th Street. D2 stated that V1 turned and collided with the front driver side of the vehicle. V2 had damage to the front driver bumper and quarter-panel. V2 had other damage to the vehicle that was unrelated to this case.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was in the parking lot of Fresh Thyme, 3600 W 3rd Street, traveling westbound. V1 began to turn sharp left, southbound through the parking lot. D1 was attempting to turn into a parking space facing southeast. D1 stated that as she was making the left turn, she heard a noise, and did not know what had happened. V1 continued to drive southeast for approximately 20 feet after colliding with the pedestrian; D1 stopped the vehicle after a bystander yelled for her to stop. D1 stated that she first thought she hit a curb. The pedestrian was standing in the parking lot, waiting to cross north, when V1 struck her while executing the sharp left turn. Visibility was low due to a medium-to-heavy snowfall. The pedestrian was transported to the hospital for non life threatening injuries.Supplement #1: Diagram edited to clarify point of impact and final resting place of V1. Phone number changed for Mindi Carter. Narrative edited to clarify that V1 continued to move after the initial impact with the pedestrian.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1, TRAVELING EAST ON FOURTH ST, STOPPED AT A STOP SIGN ON FOURTH ST AND WHEN IT BEGAN TO ENTER INTO TRAFFIC IT STRUCK V2, TRAVELING SOUTH ON HARRODSBURG RD, AT A RIGHT ANGLE. BOTH VEHICLES THEN PULLED INTO AN ADJACENT PARKING LOT.

Vehicle 1 and Vehicle 2 were both northbound on I-69 south of the 124 mile marker. V1 was in the driving lane and V2 was pulling a trailer and was in the passing lane. V1 began to change lanes and collided with the spare tire mounted to V2's trailer. The impact caused damage to V1 and V2 to loose temporary control of the trailer. Both vehicles pulled off the side of the roadway near the 124 mile marker.Driver of V1, Brandon Hutchison, stated he was northbound on I-69 south of the 124 mile marker in the driving lane. D1 stated he doesn't know how it happened but as he was changing into the left lane he impacted the spare tire mounted on the trailer V2 was pulling. The impact caused damage to the driver's side of V1.Driver of V2, Jim Proffitt, stated he was northbound on I-69 south of the 124 mile marker. Driver of V2 was hauling a trailer and was in the passing lane of I-69. Driver of V2 stated, as he was northbound, V1 changed lanes and impacted the spare tire on the trailer he was hauling. The impact caused D2 to temporarily lose control but was regained without incident. No physical damage was done to the trailer or V2.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON SOUTH I-69 APPROACHING THE 105 MILE MARKER. SEVERAL DEER JUMPED OVER THE RAILING AND ACROSS THE ROADWAY. D1 TRIED TO SLOW DOWN IN ATTEMPT TO MISS THE DEER BUT STRUCK A DEER WITH THE FRONT OF V1.VEHICLE MOVED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

V1 WAS BACKIING NORTH WEST ON HENDERSON JUST OF OF THE INTERSECTIN WITH INDIANA TO START TRASH COLLECTION FOR THE DAY. D1 WAS BACKING TRASH TRUCK AND DID NOT SEE HOW CLOSE HE WAS TO V2 WHICH WAS PARKED ALONG THE WEST CURB OF HENDERSON. V1 STRUCK THE LEFT FRONT OF V2. THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE OF V1 IS WHAT STRICK V2 AND NO DAMAGE WAS DONE TO V1. V2 WAS PARKED ALMOST 3 FEET FROM CURB WHICH WAS PARTIALY A PROBLEM FOR THE TRASH TRUCK TO BACK DOWN THE ROADWAY.

State Road 45 in Monroe County primarily travels north and south bound. Elwren Road primarily travels east and west bound. Vehicle 1 (2005 Gold Toyota Avalon) was traveling northbound on SR45, approaching Elwren Road. Vehicle 2 (2004 Black Jeep Liberty) was stopped on SR45, south of Elwren Road, with its turn signal on, to turn west into a driveway approximately 1500 FT south of Elwren Road. V1 rear ended V2, causing damage to both vehicles. V1 pushed V2 approximately 40 feet north on SR45. The final rest of both vehicles was on SR45 approximately 1500 FT south of Elwren Road. Driver 1 (Rodney Kates) stated he was traveling north on SR45. D1 stated he noticed V2 stopped in the roadway, with its turn signal on. D1 stated he looked down at his dashboard, and looked back up and V2 was right in front of him. D1 stated he did not have time to stop, causing him to collide with V2. D1 stated he should have been paying more attention to the roadway. Driver 2 (Alanna Porter) stated she was sitting stationary to pull into a drive way on SR45. D2 stated her turn signal was on while waiting to turn into the driveway. D2 stated that without warning they were then rear ended by V1.D2 and other occupants in V2 complained of pain, but on several different occasions, refused medical treatment. All occupants in the vehicle stated they did not want medical attention at the scene. Based off the facts and circumstances, I have determined the primary cause to the crash being speed to fast to avoid a collison, with D1 being at fault. Citation was issued to D1 for speed to fast to avoid collison. Citation was issued to D2 for failure to provide financial responsibility.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated he was eastbound on 17th St at Dunn St waiting to turm left onto Dunn St. Driver 2 stated he was west on 17th St at Dunn St. Both drivers advised the traffic light was green for east/west traffic on 17th St. Driver 1 stated that the car in front of vehicle 2 turned left from east 17th St onto Dunn St. Driver 1 thought vehicle 2 was also turning left and proceeded to turn left. Driver 1 stated vehicle 2 didn't turn left and went straight and collided with him. Driver 2 stated the vehicle in front of him turned left and he proceeded straight through the intersection. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 turned left in front of him and collided with him. 17th St westbound has a right turn lane and a straight lane that is also used for left turns.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she had parked her vehicle in the Walmart Parking lot in a parking spot. D1 stated that after she came out of the store there was another vehicle parked in front of her vehicle touching her front bumper. D1 stated that there was not a vehicle parked in the spot in front of her when she went into the store. D1 advised me that she put her vehicle into park and bumped into the other vehicle before she pulled out of the parking spot.The owner of vehicle 2 was inside the store at the time of the accident. The vehicle owner stated that he did not hit the vehicle in front of him when he pulled into the parking spot.Witness Joshua Criss advised me that he saw D1s vehicle bump into V2 causing V2 to rock when it was struck. Mr. Criss was able to take a picture of V1s license plate as it was leaving the parking lot.V1 had left the parking lot prior to my arrival on scene, I was able to locate D1 at her residence.

I was able to speak with D1. He stated he was backing out of his parking spot and struck V2. He stated that V2 was in his blind spot and he did not see V2. D1 stated that he left a note on V2 however it must have blown off. V2 owner came outside and noticed that his vehicle had been struck on the driver side behind the door.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON ROGERS ATTEMPTING TO RUN FROM POLICE. V1 WENT OF THE W SIDE OF THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A MAILBOX AT 2108 S ROGERS ST. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT SB ON ROGERSD1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT REMEMBER GETTING INTO AN ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE TRAVELLING NORTH ON N. WALNUT ST. D1 STATED THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT E 6TH ST AND N. WALNUT HAD TURNED YELLOW AND SHE ATTEMPTED TO CLEAR THE INTERSECTION. D1 STATED SHE THOUGHT SHE WAS IN THE INTERSECTION WHEN THE LIGHT TURNED RED. D1 STATED SHE TRIED TO APPLY THE BRAKES BEFORE RUNNING INTO THE SIDE OF V2 WITH THE FRONT OF V1.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E 6TH ST. D2 STATED HE RECEIVED A GREEN LIGHT FROM THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL SO HE BEGAN MOVING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF E 6TH ST. AND N. WALNUT ST. D2 STATED AS HE WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION D1 STRUCK HIM IN THE PASSENGER SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE. WITNESS STATED HE WAS SITTING ON THE V2 AS A PASSENGER. WITNESS STATED AS V2 WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION OF E 6TH ST AND N. WALNUT VEHICLE 1 STRUCK THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.BASED ON STATEMENTS MADE TO ME, V2 WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E 6TH ST. V2 HAD THE RIGHT AWAY BECAUSE OF THE GREEN LIGHT. AS V2 ENTERED INTO THE INTERSECTION OF E 6TH ST AND N. WALNUT ST, V1 RAN THE REDLIGHT CRASHING INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. THERE IS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V1 AND DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.

Complainant Taylor Hollars, a manager at McDonalds, said that a Black Ford Fusion was turning left in the drive thru approaching the first window. The Fusion passed the first window and struck the McDonald's wall with the driver's side front of their vehicle. The Fusion backed up and continued to the next window. The Fusion was occupied by a black male driver and a white male passenger. Neither men gave identifying or insurance information before leaving the scene. The license plate on the Fusion was unreadable in the video captured and there are no leads at this time.

V1 was traveling west in the alley behind Delta Upsilon towards Ballantine Road. V2 was parked in a marked parking space in the Delta Upsilon parking lot near the alley. V1 then attempted to turn left onto Ballantine Road and did not accommodate for how long V1 was. The rear passenger side bumper of V1 then struck the front bumper of V2. There was little to no damage to V1, there was moderate damage to the front bumper of V2. D1 stated that she was traveling west in the alley and tried to turn onto the main roadway but the alley was too narrow for her to turn. D1 stated that she got over as far as she could but was limited in space due to a telephone pole. D1 stated that she thought she could make the turn. D1 stated that the rear bumper of V1 then struck the front bumper of V2.V2 was parked and unoccupied at the time of the crash. There were no injuries reported at the time of the incident and no vehicles had to be towed.

D2 ADVISED HE WAS STATIONARY IN THE OUTSIDE TURN LANE OF WEST 3RD STREET, TO TURN ONTO 1-69 NORTHBOUND.D2 STATED A WHITE UTILITY STYLE TRUCK WAS NEXT TO HIM, STATIONARY IN THE INSIDE TURN LANE. AFTER THE TRAFFIC CONTROL SIGNAL CHANGED, D2 BEGAN MAKING THE NORTHBOUND TURN. D2 STATED THE WHITE UTILITY STYLE TRUCK ABRUPTLY DECIDED NOT TO TURN NORTHBOUND AND TUNRED BACK EASTBOUND, STRIKING HIS REAR DRIVER'S SIDE PANEL. D2 ADVISED THE WHITE UTILITY STYLE TRUCK CONTINUED EASTBOUND ON 3RD STREET.
D1 STATED THEY STRUCK A DEER WHILE EN-ROUTE TO MEDICAL ASSIST CALL ON FAIRFAX RD. THEY CONTINUED TO THE CALL AND MADE THE REPORT TO MCSO WHO WAS ALSO ON SCENE AT THE MEDICAL ASSIST.

D1 stated she was north bound on S Weimer Road at approximately 25 MPH when a deer entered the roadway approximately 1 ft in front of her vehicle. Collision with deer occurred in roadway in front of 1704 S Weimer Road.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TURNING LEFT FROM THE GAS STATION PARKING LOT AT 2002 S. ROGERS ST, ONTO ROGERS ST.V2 WAS SOUTH BOUND ON ROGERS ST, AT ROCKPORT ROAD.D2 SAID THAT V1 TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF HER, WHICH CAUSED CONTACT, THEN V2 SWERVED AND STRUCK THE MAILBOX ON THE SOUTH WEST SIDE OF THE ENTRANCE.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

I later interviewed driver 1 at IU Health Bloomington Hospital during the process of an OWI investigation; but Driver 1 was having emotional outbursts and was not being cooperative. Driver 1 could not recall the roads they traveled prior to or during the pursuit they were involved in. Nor did Driver 1 say they remembered impacting any other vehicles. Driver 2 was interviewed at the scene and said she was driving S/B on S Rogers Street. Driver 2 said she was slowing down near the concrete dividers near W Driscoll Street when she was hit in the rear bumper on the driver side of her vehicle. Driver 2 said she couldn't see the car approaching her from the rear because no headlights were illuminated. Driver 2 described the car as a gold or silver 4 door sedan as she saw it pull away from the scene. D1 and V1 were located as a result of Officer Bazan witnessing an infraction just post collision and initiated a traffic stop on the vehicle which turned into a pursuit. The pursuit ended near S. Walnut Street and W. Country Club Drive, where D2 would contact dispatch at the same time regarding the accident detailed above. It appears based on the statement provided by the driver's on scene that due to D1 following too closely to V2 and D1's level of impairment did result in the collision between V1 and V2.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 WAS DRIVING EB ON W ROSEWOOD DRIVE. D1 SAID THE COLLISION WITH THE POWER BOX CAUSED HIM TO COLLIDE WITH THE TREE AS WELL.D1 ADMITTED TO DRIVING HIS VEHICLE AND WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VALID INDIANA DL.A COPY OF THE EXCHANGE OF INFO WAS PROVIDED TO EIKO. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Oluwadara Adeosun was driving south on Stadium Drive that exits the Wells Library parking lot (1320 East 10th Street) to turn left (east) onto East 7th Street. Adeosun advised that she was unaware of the stop sign at that intersection and estimated that she was going approximately 20 miles per hour as she turned onto East 7th Street. As she did so, the passengers in her vehicle began to scream at her to stop because of a pedestrian, but Adeosun said she was unable to stop before hitting the pedestrian, Aline Irankunda, with her vehicle. Irankunda stated that she had been walking west on the sidewalk on the north side of East 7th Street and had just begun to cross southwest from the northeast corner of the intersection when Adeosun's vehicle struck her. Irankunda was unsure what part of the vehicle hit her, but she complained of pain and had bleeding and trauma to her left jaw and side of her face from being struck. She also stated that she had a brief loss of consciousness. Adeosun was also unsure of what part of the vehicle struck Irankunda, but from the scene, it was most likely somewhere on the front bumper. Irankunda was transported from the scene by IU Health Bloomington Hospital Ambulance Service for immediate medical attention. I spoke with Irankunda and Adeosun and Adeosun's passengers at the scene and examined the vehicle at that location. Adeosun reported that there was no new damage to her vehicle from the crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

I, OFFICER SHAFFER 1661, WAS ENROUTE TO ANOTHER CALL WITH MY LIGHTS AND SIRENS ACTIVATED. I STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF GATES DR AND W 3RD ST TO CLEAR A RED LIGHT BEFORE DRIVING EAST BOUND ON W 3RD ST. I HEARD A METAL ON METAL NOISE TO MY LEFT AND SAW A SILVER JEEP STRUCK IN THE REAR BY A WHITE PRIUS WHO WAS ALSO STRUCK IN THE REAR BY A SILVER AUDI. I ASKED ANOTHER UNIT TO TAKE MY ORIGINAL CALL SO I COULD WORK THE ACCIDENT. ALL 3 VEHICLES WERE FACING WEST BOUND ON 3RD STREET IN THE SAME LANE.DRIVER 1 SAID HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W 3RD ST WHEN HE LOOKED OVER AND SAW MY POLICE CAR WITH LIGHTS AND SIRENS ACTIVATED. DRIVER 1 SAID AS HE LOOKED BACK TO THE ROAD THE OTHER 2 VEHICLES HAD STOPPED ABRUPTLY AND HE REAR ENDED VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 WAS PUSHED INTO VEHICLE 1 BECAUSE OF THIS IMPACT.DRIVER 2 SAID HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON 3RD ST WHEN HE SAW MY POLICE CAR WITH LIGHTS AND SIRENS ACTIVATED. DRIVER 2 SAID HE HIT HIS BRAKES HARD BECAUSE VEHICLE 3 HAD STOPPED ABRUPTLY INFRONT OF HIM. DRIVER 2 SAID HE DID NOT HIT VEHICLE 3. DRIVER 2 SAID VEHICLE 1 REAR ENDED HIM WHICH PUSHED HIM INTO VEHICLE 3.DRIVER 3 SAID HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W 3RD ST WHEN HE SAW MY POLICE CAR WITH LIGHTS AND SIRENS ACTIVATED. DRIVER 3 SAID HE CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP. DRIVER 3 SAID HE SAW THE WHITE PRIUS COMING UP BEHIND HIM BUT THE PRIUS CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP AND DID NOT IMPACT VEHICLE 3. DRIVER 3 SAID HE FELT VEHICLE 2 REAR END HIM. V1 REAR ENDED V2 AS BOTH UNIT WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON W STATE ROAD 45 APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF W AIRPORT RD.V1 STRUCK THE TRAILER HITCH OF V2 AND HAD MINOR FRONT END DAMAGE, V2 DID NOT HAVE VISIBLE DAMAGE.

D1 was traveling west on State Road 45 near the intersection of Darrell Drive. D1 collided with a deer in the roadway. D1 transported the vehicle to a friends house a short distance down the road instead of having it towed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was stopped facing southwest on Woodbridge Drive waiting to turn westbound on E 10th Street. V1 was traveling southbound on Woodbridge drive, north of V2. D1 intended to turn westbound onto E 10th Street, and failed to come to a complete stop behind V2, resulting in a collision. D1 stated that she misjudged the distance from V2, and also stated that it was still early in the morning, causing her misjudgment.The collision caused damage to V1's headlight, and V2's taillight. Both vehicle were able to be driven after the collision. Neither party stated that they needed medical attention.

Both vehicle 1 and vehicle 2 were traveling west on 3rd St. Vehicle 2 was traveling in the right lane of travel and Vehicle 1 in the left lane. As the vehicles approached the intersection of the north bound on ramp to State Road 37/ Interstate 69, both vehicles attempted to continue west on 3rd St. Vehicle 1 attempted to change lanes, from the left lane to the right lane to avoid being behind a semi. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that he believed the right lane was free of vehicles when he began to merge. Driver of vehicle 2 stated that she was already next vehicle 1 as they approached the intersection. Vehicle 1 attempted to change lanes and hit the rear driver's side corner of vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 had minor damage to the driver's side rear and Vehicle 1 had damage to passenger side front. No injuries were reported and both vehicles were able to drive from the scene.When I arrived at the scene Vehicle 2 was sitting in the center of the right hand lane and vehicle 1 was still partially in the left lane. It appears that Vehicle 1 attempted to change lanes and struck the rear of vehicle 2.

D1 advised she was traveling north bound on the 45/46 Bypass when she observed the lights for the railroad crossing activate. D1 advised when she saw the lights activate she came to a stop in the roadway. D1 advised when V1 came to a stop, V2 crashed into V1. D1 advised she stopped approximately 50 feet south of the railroad tracks.D2 advised she was traveling north bound on the 45/46 Bypass behind V1. D2 advised V1 came to a sudden stop and V2 crashed into V1. D2 advised she did not have enough time to stop prior to the crash. D2 advised V1 came to stop right at the railroad tracks.

D2 STATED HE LAST USED HIS VEHICLE THE PREVIOUS EVENING AND HAD BEEN PARKED SINCE 7PM ON 3/6/2019. D2 STATED HE ATTEMPTED TO ENTER V2 TODAY AND NOTICED HIS VEHICLE HAD BEEN PUSHED OVER THE PARKING CURB. D2 STATED HE DID THEN NOTICE THE DAMAGE TO THE REAR PASSENGER BUMPER OF HIS VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On March 8th, 2019 I, Officer Southern, responded to an accident at the intersection of N. Walnut St. And E 7th St. Upon arrival I was informed that the accident happened on N. Walnut St. Around 20-25 yards from the intersection of E 7th St. Driver one informed me that she was turning onto N. Walnut St from 6th St when she turned driver 1 turned into the far left lane. Driver 1 then proceeded to go straight and merge into the middle lane. Driver 1 then struck driver 2 in the front left side of driver 2's car.Driver 2 stated she was driving straight in the far right lane when driver 1 began merging into the same lane as driver 2. Driver 2 then attempted to swerve out of the way but was struck by driver 1.

3rd Street is a multi-lane divided street that primarily traverses the city of Bloomington in an east and west manner. 3rd Street in the area of the crash is asphalt and has a slight downhill grade for the east bound lanes. Environmental conditions were cloudy, approximately 35 degrees Fahrenheit, and the roadway surface was wet. Snow had previously fallen, but no snow was on the roadway at the scene of the crash.Vehicle 1, a purple Mazda, was east bound in the right lane of 3rd from the I69 / 3rd Street interchange. Vehicle 1 approached a line of traffic on 3rd Street that was stopped for a traffic control device at 3rd Street and Wynnedale Drive. Vehicle 1 began sliding and the front of Vehicle 1 struck the rear of Vehicle 2.Vehicle 2, a green Ford, was facing east bound in the right lane of 3rd Street and at a complete stop due to a red indicator for the traffic control device at 3rd Street and Wynnedale Drive. The rear of Vehicle 2 was struck by the front of Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated that he had just exited Interstate 69 onto 3rd Street and was proceeding east bound on 3rd Street. Driver 1 said that he was in the right lane and saw that traffic was stopped for a red indicator on the traffic control device for 3rd Street and Wynnedale Drive. Driver 1 stated that he was travelling approximately 15 to 20 mph when he applied the brakes to Vehicle 1. Driver 1 said that Vehicle began to slide and the front of Vehicle 1 struck the rear of Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated that he was in the right lane of 3rd Street facing east bound and stopped at a red indicator for the traffic control device on 3rd Street at Wynnedale Drive. Driver 2 said that he had been stopped for approximately 15 seconds when Vehicle 2 was struck in the rear by the front of Vehicle 1. Driver 2 stated that he did not see or hear Vehicle 1 approaching prior to feeling the collision.There was a small debris field in the right lane where Vehicle 1 impacted Vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 and Vehicle 2 were still connected when the reporting officer arrived on scene.

BOTH VEHCIELS WERE TRAVELING WB ON W ZENITH DRIVE APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF N DANIELS WAY. THE ROAD WAS SLICK DUE TO SNOW, WHICH CAUSED BOTHE VEHICLES TO SLIDE. DI STRUCK IN THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE.AFTER THE COLLISION, BOTH VEHICLES MOVED FROM THE POINT OF THE COLLISION TO COOK INC, THEREFORE NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was driving north on Shelburne Drive "too fast", encountered snow, and ran off the roadway.

On 03/08/2019 I was dispatched to a two-vehicle collision at 10th Street west of Jordan Avenue. V1 and V2 were traveling eastbound on 10th Street in between Fee Lane and Jordan Avenue. The front bumper of her vehicle struck the rear bumper of V2.I spoke with D2, who advised me that he was traveling on 10th Street headed eastbound in front of V1. He stated that he was slowing down for traffic and the front bumper of V1 struck the rear bumper of his vehicle.D2 was not injured. D1 had a cut lip from the collision. She was arrested for Operating While Intoxicated and Possession of Marijuana.

V1 was backing out of the driveway at 5855 S. Old State Road 37. V2 was parked behind V1 offset on the passenger side. V1 backed into the rear drivers side of V2 with the rear passenger side of V1. D1 stated that V1 jumped into reverse without her putting V1 into gear.

OWNER OF V1 RETURNED TO THEIR VEHICLE WHICH THEY PARKED SOUTH OF 7TH ST ON WALNUT AT 1100 HOURS. OWNER ADVISED THAT HE LEFT THE VEHICLE AT 0730 HOURS. DAMAGE WAS TO THE DRIVER SIDE MIRROR.NO SUSPECTS OR SUSPECT INFORMATION. NO WITNESSES.

This crash occurred on SR 37, an asphalt roadway that was wet. D1 advised that he was traveling West on E. Whisnand Rd. When he began to lose control of V1. V1 then ran off the roadway and struck utility pole #162554. I spoke with D1and he stated V1was traveling south on Daniels Way in the area of Zeaneth Drive. V1 was NB on S Walnut street and was approaching Hillside drive and in the left lane. V2 was WB on Hillside drive and was stopped at red light at intersection with Walnut street. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS ON THE PARKING LOT OF 3201 W 3RD ST. AS HE PREPARED TO BACK UP, HE CHECKED HIS MIRRORS AND DID NOT SEE ANYONE BEHIND V1. AS HE STARTED TO BACK UP, HE COLLIDED WITH V2 THAT WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND VEHICLE 1.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS PULLING INTO THE PARKING LOT OF 3201 W 3RD ST IN ORDER TO PARK. HE PULLED UP BEHIND V1, BUT BEFORE HE COULD REVERSE INTO THE PARKING SPACE, V1 BACKED INTO V2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Prior to the collision, V1 was traveling west on E 3rd Street approaching S Union Street. V2 had just turned from S Union Street onto E 3rd Street and was also traveling west. When I arrived, V1 and V2 were stopped in the east-bound lane facing west. It was 30 degrees, the road was wet, and it had been lightly snowing. D1 said he was driving west on E 3rd Street at approximately 40mph (posted 25mph). D1 said as he came over the hill that is just east of S Union Street, he saw V2 turning out in front of him. D1 said he applied the brakes, but due to the wet road conditions V1 slid and collided with V2. D2 said she was driving south on S Union Street and when she got to the intersection with E 3rd Street she stopped at the stop sign. D2 said she looked both ways and did not see any vehicles coming. D2 then turned west-bound onto E 3rd Street. Just after finishing the turn D2 said V1 rapidly approached from the east and collided with V2. V1 sustained heavy damage to the front driver's side corner and the airbags were deployed. V1 was towed by Bland's Wrecker Service due to disabling damage. V2 sustained heavy damage to the rear passenger side corner.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 03/08/2019 at 0924 hours I was dispatched to the Village Pantry located off N. Union Street and 10th street in reference to a traffic accident, property damage only. I arrived to the scene and noticed both cars were parked in the parking spots at the Village Pantry. V2 was traveling southbound on Union Street approaching the 10th street and Union Street intersection when V1 pulled out of the Village Pantry parking lot to travel southbound on Union Street. The front middle and left side portion of V1 then struck the middle right portion of V2 on Union Street.V1 was pulling out of the Village Pantry parking lot. V1 was making a right hand turn onto Union Street intending to travel southbound through the intersection of Union Street and 10th Street. As V1 was pulling out of the parking lot onto Union Street, D1 did not notice V2 traveling southbound on Union Street. V1 then collided with V2 on Union Street striking V2 with the front left side of the vehicle.V2 was traveling southbound on Union Street just south of Law Lane. V2 was approaching the intersection of Union Street and 10th Street when V1 pulled out of the Village Pantry parking lot striking V2 in the middle right side portion of the vehicle.D1 stated that he did not see V2 traveling southbound on Union Street as he was pulling out of the Village Pantry parking lot onto Union Street.

V1 was E/B in the private drive of 528 S College Ave; Kroger. V1 began to turn left into a parking lot lane. V1 collided with a stop sign, causing the stop sign to lean to the side slightly.D1 stated that he did not see the sign when he turned.

V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON THE OFFRAMP FROM NORTHBOUND I69 MERGING ONTO EASTBOUND W3RD ST.V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID HE LOOKED DOWN BRIEFLY WHILE MOVING FORWARD AND WHEN HE LOOKED UP V2 HAD STOPPED. HE SAID HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE HITTING V2.D2 SAID AS SHE STOPPED FOR EASTBOUND TRAFFIC BEFORE MERGING V1 HIT HER FROM BEHIND.D1 ADVISED HE DID NOT HAVE INSURANCE ON THE VEHICLE AND WAS CITED FOR THAT.

D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W 3RD ST AND TURNED NORTH ONTO N. GATES DRIVE. D2 STATED TRAFFIC TRAVELLING EAST ON W 3RD ST AND TURNING NORTH WAS MERGING INTO HER LANE SO SHE HAD TO YEILD. D2 STATED AS SHE WAS YEILDING TO TRAFFIC D1 DROVE INTO HER REAR BUMPER.D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W 3RD ST AND TURNED NORTH ONTO N. GATES DRIVE. D1 STATED D2 WAS STOPPED AND HE WAS UNABLE TO PUSH HIS BREAKS INTIME RESULTING IN HIS VEHICLE STRIKING V2 IN THE REAR BUMPER.

V1/D1 STATED "I WAS WESTBOUND ON W. 45/46 BYPASS. I WAS LOOKING AT MY CELL PHONE. I DID NOT SEE V2 STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY. I THOUGHT WE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT. I REAR ENDED V2 AND I TRIED TO SWERVE TO AVOID THE COLLISION."V2/D2 STATED "I WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY ON 45/46 BYPASS, EAST OF N. WALNUT STREET, DUE TO TRAFFIC BEING STOPPED FOR TRAFFIC LIGHT. ALL OF THE SUDDEN I WAS REAR ENDED BY V1 WHO WAS WESTBOUND ON THE BYPASS."

State Road 46 primarily travels east and westbound. Trailway Drive is a private drive that travels northeast.Vehicle 1 (2007 Mazda 6) was traveling westbound on SR46. A tree had fallen across the roadway approximately 1700 FT east of Trailway Drive. V1 struck the tree, causing damage to the front of the vehicle.Driver 1 (Tracy Colwell) stated he was coming home from work,and was going west bound on State Road 46. D1 stated that he was driving, and all of the sudden, noticed there was a tree in the middle of the roadway. D1 stated he did not have time to stop. D1 stated he drove through the large branches causing damage to his vehicle. Based off the facts and circumstances, I have determined the primary cause to this crash is object in roadway. No citations were issued at the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle #2 was traveling east on SR46 in the right hand lane. Driver #2 stated that the vehicle in front of her turned right onto Forest Park Drive, and that as she continued on past the intersection, Vehicle #1 pulled out from Forest Park Drive and struck her vehicle in the right side. Vehicle #2 then went off the south side of SR46, over a curb and sidewalk, and down an embankment. Vehicle #1 was traveling north on Forest Park Drive and was stopped at the stop sign at SR46. Driver #1 stated that he was waiting for traffic to clear so that he could turn right to go east on SR46. Driver #1 stated that an eastbound vehicle turned right onto Forest Park Drive and that he thought Vehicle #2 was in the left lane and that it was clear for him to go. The left front of Vehicle #1 struck the right side of Vehicle #2 just in front of the right rear wheel. Paramedics had been called to the scene and checked to see if Driver #2 was injured, but she stated that she was not.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVE IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE. HE INDICATED THAT HE WAS DISTRACTED WHILE APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF 11TH ST. D1 SAID HE MAY HAVE DISREGARDED THE RED TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT THAT INTERSECTION AND COLLIDED WITH V2. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED EAST ON 11TH STREET WAITING FOR THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TO TURN GREEN AT COLLEGE AVE. HE INDICATED WHEN THE SIGNAL TURNED GREEN, HE PROCEEDED EAST ACROSS COLLEGE AND WAS STRUCK BY V1.

Both vehicles were reportedly traveling west on Main Street/SR46. Driver #1 stated that he was in the right hand lane and that Vehicle #2 was behind him in the right hand lane. Driver #1 stated that he slowed for traffic ahead of him, and that Vehicle #2 struck his vehicle in the rear end, at which time he spun around to the south and ended up at rest facing east on the sidewalk on the south side of Main Street. Driver #2 stated that he had been traveling in the right hand lane originally, but that he had moved to the left hand lane before the stop light at Sale Street, due to the fact that Vehicle #1 had been weaving several times partly into the left hand lane and he wanted to get around him. Driver #2 stated that as he was starting to pass Vehicle #1 in the left lane, that Vehicle #1 swerved over again and hit his vehicle.Driver #1 denied that he was weaving or swerving. The placement of the damage on the vehicles tends to better support Driver #2's version of the incident, as the point of impact on Vehicle #1 was at the left rear wheel area and the damage to Vehicle #2 was just on the right front corner. Also, there appeared to be fresh scuff marks in the left hand lane that could have been left by Vehicle #2 and there were obvious skid marks from Vehicle #1 that started out in the left hand lane, as if Vehicle #1 made contact with the other vehicle on the left side and spun around. Witness #1 was a front seat passenger in Vehicle #2. She also stated that Vehicle #1 was weaving around and was in the right hand lane, and that as they passed the vehicle in the left lane, it swerved over and hit them.Vehicle #2 had moved after the accident and pulled over onto Matthews Drive.

V1 was traveling behind V2 east bound on W. Sims Lane at unsafe speeds for the residential roadway. V2 attempted to turn left into the driveway at 3723 W. Sims Ln. when V1 attempted to pass V2 on the left side. V1 struck the front drivers side of V2 with the front passenger side of V1, then proceeded off the roadway and into a tree. D1 estimated his speed to be approximately 45mph. D1 stated that he was distracted by talking to the front seat passenger and did not see V2 turning into the driveway. D1 stated that he swerved to avoid running into the rear end of V2 and struck the front of V2. Both V1 and V2 sustained disabling damage, however it was not towed due to the vehicle ending up in the owners driveway. D1 was issued two infraction citations for driving left of center and speeding.

V-1, a White 1997 Dodge Truck, was northbound on Smith Pike. V-2, a Tan 2015 Toyota, was northbound on Smith Pike north of V-1. A vehicle pulling a trailer slowed quickly and turned into a private drive off of Smith Pike. V-2 Slowed for the vehicle that turned into the private drive. V-1 failed to slow quickly enough to maintain proper following distance and the front of V-1 struck the rear of V-2.D-2, Sammy Davis, stated that he was traveling north on Smith Pike when a vehicle suddenly turned into a driveway in front of him. Davis went on to say that when he slowed for that vehicle, V-1 did not slow enough and struck his vehicle in the rear.D-1, Kevin Goble, stated that the vehicle ahead of V-2 turned into a driveway, slowing quickly, and that he tried to stop his vehicle but could not do so in time. Goble said that the front of V-1 struck the rear of V-2.The other vehicle which turned quickly into the drive, did not stop at the scene and was not present any longer at the driveway. That vehicle was not struck, nor was it involved in this crash.The cause of this crash if V-1 following too closely to avoid collision.

Driver two stated he was turning left from traveling north on S Clarizz Blvd into a parking lot when vehicle one struck him in the front left corner with the rear left corner of vehicle one. Driver two stated vehicle one was backing up north on S Clarizz Blvd on the southbound side of traffic at the time of the accident.Driver two stated after the accident vehicle one left the scene before giving any information or waiting for the police.

V1 was driving West on East Vermilya Street collecting trash as duties prescribed by the City of Bloomington Sanitation Department. V1was maneuvering through an area with low width clearance and V1 made contact with V2. V2 was parked along the north side of Vermilya Street facing west. There was minor cosmetic damage to the front driver side bumper. Unable to make contact with Driver of V2. Information was left at vehicle on scene.

V1 was traveling westbound on W SR 46. D1 stated she was messing with her radio when she hit a patch of loose gravel on the shoulder of the roadway. D1 stated she then lost control of her vehicle, and careened into the embankment on the west side of the road. The front of the vehicle collided with the embankment, and spun around so the front of the vehicle was facing east.

Driver two stated he was traveling east on E Winslow Rd at S Westmister Way when vehicle one passed him on his right hitting his passenger mirror causing damage. Driver two stated vehicle one was driving really fast and was a green Honda CRV. Driver two stated he attempted to follow vehicle one but lost vehicle one when it turned north onto Highland Ave.

V1 BACKED INTO V2 IN THE PARKING LOT OF INTERSTATE BATTERIES AT 3301 W JONATHON DRIVE. D1 STATED HE DIDNT SEE V2 WHILE BACKING UP AND ADMITTED FAULT. THE VEHICLES WERE PLACED BACK IN PARKING SPOTS AFTER THE COLLISION.

UNIT 2 WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING SPOT WHEN UNIT 1 ATTEMPTED TO PARK BESIDE UNIT 2. WHILE PULLING INTO THE PARKING SPOT, UNIT 1 CONTACTED THE DRIVERS SIDE OF UNIT 2, LEAVING HORIZONTAL MARKINGS ON THE DOORS.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS AT THE INTERSECTION OF W BLOOMFIELD RD AND S SHADELAND DR WAITING FOR THE LIGHT TO TURN GREEN AT W BLOOMFIELD RD AND S ROLLING RIDGE WAY. D2 STATED THAT THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN AND SHE TOOK HER FOOT OFF THE BRAKE AND V1 ROLLED BACK INTO THE FRONT OF V2. D2 STATED THEY BOTH PULLED TO A NEARBY PARKING LOT AND D1 ASKED D2 IF SHE WAS FINE AND THEN LEFT THE SCENE.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE DAMAGE TO V2 IS MAJOR DAMAGE AND WAS DISABLING DAMAGE. D2 KEPT STATING OVER AND OVER THAT WAS WHAT HAD OCCURRED.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE ACCIDENT HAPPENED ONE HOUR PRIOR TO D2 CALLING POLICE. A LOCAL TOW COMPANY ADVISED US THAT THEY WERE CALLED TO TOW V2 BUT FOUND OUT THAT D2 HAD NOT CALLED POLICE SO THEY WOULD NOT TOW.THERE ARE CAMERAS IN THE AREA, SO THIS REPORT IS STILL ACTIVE. I COMPLETED AN ACCIDENT REPORT WITH THE DETAILS D2 GAVE ME. PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN OF V2 AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.

D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON SR 45 APPROACHING PETE ELLIS DR. D2 STATED THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL WAS GREEN AND PROCEEDED TO TURN LEFT. D2 SAID SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND WHILE MAKING HER TURN. D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON SR 45. HE INDICATED THAT THE SIGNAL WAS GREEN AND LOOKED TO HIS LEFT MOMENTARILY AND STRUCK V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Fulerton Pike is a Monroe County roadway that runs east and west. It is constructed of concrete in some areas and asphalt in others. At the location of this accident it was asphalt in construction. The location where this accident occurred was in a roundabout intersection where Fulerton Pike and I-69 exit ramp 115A meet. The roadway was dry and clear of debris. The weather conditions were clear and daylight.Vehicle #1 was traveling north on I-69 exit ramp 115A approaching the Fulerton Pike roundabout and struck Vehicle #2 that was traveling east on Fulerton Pike. Vehicle #1 struck the right rear of Vehicle #2 with the left front of Vehicle #1.Vehicle #1 was traveling north on I-69 exit ramp 115A approaching Fulerton Pike roundabout.Vehicle #2 was traveling east on Fulerton Pike roundabout passing I-69 exit ramp 115A.Driver #1 indicated he looked to his left as he was entering the roundabout and didn't see Vehicle #2 until it was to late. Driver #1 indicated he saw Vehicle #2 just prior to striking Vehicle #2. Driver #1 indicated he got onto his brakes right away and thought they miss but he caught the right rear of Vehicle #2 with the left front of Vehicle #1.Driver #2 indicated he was in the roundabout starting to pass I-69 exit ramp 115A when he saw Vehicle #1 was not stopping or yielding to him. Driver #2 indicated he got Vehicle #2 over to the left as far as he could in an attempt to miss Vehicle #1 but was unable to avoid Vehicle #1.Driver #1 is at fault for this crash. Driver #1 failed to yield the right of way to Vehicle #2 that was in the roundabout. I asked both drivers if they needed any medical attention and both drivers indicated they were not hurt and did not need any medical attention.

On March 12, 2019 Off duty Deputy Mathew Williamson was waiting for the light at Union Valley and State road 46 (on Union Valley) when his light turned green he seen a blue Dodge Van came through the light on State Road 46 heading east and struck a tan GMC Acaida. Deputy Williamson got out and checked on the two drivers and advised that he needed a unit that was on duty to head this way and that there was a infant involved. Once I Officer Dustin White arrived on scene I spoke Peggy Shields the owner of the tan GMC Acaida (V-2) and asked her what happpened. Ms.Sheilds advised that she had a green light and began to drive when she seen a blue van come through the intersection and struck her car in driver/front side of her car. I then went and spoke with Brittany Wallace the driver of the blue Dodge Caravan (V-1) and she stated that she swears that her light was green and that the other lady ran the light. After speaking with both of the drivers Ms. Wallace stated that she injured her left knee in the crash and her two juvenile passengers were not injured at all and stated that she was going to have her husband take her to the hospital. I then spoke more with Ms. Shields and she stated that she injured her neck in the crash and that she was transported to IU Health Bloomington for further evaluation. Bland's towing took both cars and I gave both drivers each others driving information.

On March 12th, 2019, driver 1 was driving south, emergent with lights and sirens on S Morton St where another officer had one person resisting law enforcement. Upon making a hard right turn, attempting to turn around, driver 1 pulled into a parking lot and hit a rock that was sitting in a landscaped area with mulch and other small rocks.

V3 was in the intersection on E. Dillman Rd. facing westbound stopped for oncoming traffic, waiting to make a left hand turn onto S. Empire Rd. V2 was stopped behind V3. V1 crested the hill on E. Dillman Rd. traveling westbound at unsafe speeds and was unable to stop before rear ending V2, which caused V2 to rear end V3. D1 stated that he was traveling too fast. Both V1 and V2 sustained disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN OUT OF THE PARKING LANE THAT HE WAS IN ONTO THE BACK DRIVE OF THE WALMART PARKING LOT. D1 STATED THAT HE THOUGHT HE WAS CLEAR TO TURN AND WHEN HE STARTED, V2 WENT BY HIM AND THE LEFT FRONT OF V1 STRUCK THE RIGHT REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THE SAME.

Owner of V2 stated that a gold pickup truck was attempting to leave a parking spot on the passenger side of his vehicle. The gold pickup's rear driver side tire made contact with the front passenger side of V2 causing minor damage. The gold pickup then left the scene and was not located. No plate or vehicle information was recovered for the gold pickup.Video footage was viewed by officers on scene and did match the statement of the owner of V2. The video showed a gold colored possibly a Ford pickup pulling out of a parking space and colliding with the front passenger side of V2.

This was a rear end accident that occurred on W Parrish Road while the vehicles were coming to a stop at the stop sign at the intersection of N Kinser Pike.Upon arriving on scene, I met with the driver (D2) of the black Chrysler 200 (V2). D2 advised that he was heading east on W Parrish Road exiting Kroger when the vehicle behind him struck the rear of his vehicle as he stopped at the stop sign. D2 stated that the vehicle that rear ended him was a grey Dodge Avenger (V1). D2 advised that Driver 1 (D1) was a white female, 5'3", 120Lbs, with dark hair. D2 reported that both vehicles turned around in order to pull back into the parking lot at Kroger. D2 advised that when he pulled behind V1 in the parking lot that the vehicle was empty. D2 reported that he did not know where D1 had went. I was able to observe both vehicles. V2 had a scratch on the left side of the rear bumper and V1 had multiple scuffs on the front end. I did take pictures of the damage to both vehicles.It should be noted that when I ran the the license plate on V1 that the plate returned to a 2000 White Crown Victoria belonging to Bradley Givens. I was unable to get a match on the vehicle identification number for V1.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS NORTH BOUND ON SR37 APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH OLD 37 WHEN SHE COULD NOT GET ALL THE WAY STOPPED AT THE LIGHT AND REAR ENDED V2. D2 CONFIRMED THAT SHE HAD STOPPED AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AND WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON SR 45 AT CURRY PIKE IN THE LEFT TURN LANE.V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON SR 45 AT CURRY PIKE GOING STRAIGHT.D1 SAID SHE HAD A GREEN LIGHT BUT NOT A GREEN ARROW. SHE SAID SHE WAS FOLLOWING SOMEONE AHEAD OF HER AND TURNED LEFT AND HIT V2.D2 SAID AS SHE DROVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION ON A GREEN LIGHT V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HER AND HIT HER.WITNESS #1 SAID SHE WAS STOPPED ON SOUTHBOUND CURRY PIKE AT THE RED LIGHT. SHE SAID SHE SAW V1 TURN NORTHBOUND FROM EASTBOUND SR 45. SHE SAID SHE SAW V2 COMING WESTBOUND AND THE TWO COLLIDED. SHE SAID SHE DID NOT SEE WHAT COLOR THE EAST/WESTBOUND LIGHTS WERE BUT KNEW HERS WAS RED.OTHER LOCATION OF INVESTIGATION WAS AT THE MONROE HOSPITAL EMERGENCY DEPT.CORRECTION MADE TO INTERSECTING STREET

This was a rear end accident that occurred on W Parrish Road while the vehicles were coming to a stop at the stop sign at the intersection of N Kinser Pike.Upon arriving on scene, I met with the driver (D2) of the black Chrysler 200 (V2). D2 advised that he was heading east on W Parrish Road exiting Kroger when the vehicle behind him struck the rear of his vehicle as he stopped at the stop sign. D2 stated that the vehicle that rear ended him was a grey Dodge Avenger (V1). D2 advised that Driver 1 (D1) was a white female, 5'3", 120Lbs, with dark hair. D2 reported that both vehicles turned around in order to pull back into the parking lot at Kroger. D2 advised that when he pulled behind V1 in the parking lot that the vehicle was empty. D2 reported that he did not know where D1 had went. I was able to observe both vehicles. V2 had a scratch on the left side of the rear bumper and V1 had multiple scuffs on the front end. I did take pictures of the damage to both vehicles.It should be noted that when I ran the the license plate on V1 that the plate returned to a 2000 White Crown Victoria belonging to Bradley Givens. I was unable to get a match on the vehicle identification number for V1.

Driver of vehicle 2 was stopped at a red light on College Ave facing south in the left hand lane at the intersection of 1st street. Vehicle 2 was the front car at the intersection. Vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2. Driver of vehicle 2 stated that vehicle 1 hit her in the rear of her vehicle. Driver of vehicle 2 got out and asked driver of vehicle 1 what they were doing. Driver of vehicle 1 told the female that she rolled forward and he thought she was going. Driver of vehicle 2 stated that the light was still red at the time of the accident. Vehicle 1 then left the area. No direction of travel or make/model of vehicle 1 was known. Vehicle 1 is believed to possibly be a gray SUV.There was minimal damage to the rear of Vehicle 2 and no injuries reported from the accident.

V1 TRAVELLING WEST ON 3RD STREET APPROACHING JORDAN AVE. V1 WAS IN RIGHT LANE AND ATTEMPTED TO MERGE INTO THE LEFT LANE AND STRUCK V2.D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE V2 AS HE MERGED INTO THE LEFT LANE TO TURN INTO THE ALLEY BEHIND MOTHER BEARS.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN THE LEFT LANE TRAVELLING WEST ON 3RD WHEN V1 MERGED INTO HER LANE AND STRUCK HER VEHICLE.

ON 3/14/ 2019 I WAS DISPATCHED TO A VEHICLE ACCIDENT IN THE AREA OF MAIN FOREST ROAD. IT WAS REPORTED BY THE MORGAN COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE THAT THE DRIVER WAS A JOSHUA FULK. AFTER SEARCHING THE AREA FOR ALMOST AN HOUR, BECAUSE IT WAS REPORTED THAT MR. FULK WAS HURT, I LOCATED V1 UP AGAINST A TREE ON MAIN FOREST ROAD JUST SOUTH OF CHERRY LAKE ROAD. MR. FULK, D1, WAS NO WHERE TO BE FOUND AND NEVER REPORTED THE ACCIDENT. I RAN THE PLATE OF V1 WHICH CAME BACK TO RICHARD CLAPPER. MR. CLAPPER WAS CALLED AND SAID THAT HE WANTED US TO TOW THE CAR BACK TO HIS HOUSE AND THAT HE DIDN'T NEED A REPORT BECAUSE HE WAS A BODY SHOP OWNER. AS I SEARCHED FOR INSURANCE INFORMATION INSIDE THE VEHICLE TO COMPLETE THE ACCIDENT REPORT DUE TO THE FACT THAT WE WERE UNSURE IF D1 WAS HURT, I FOUND THAT THE PLATE ON V1 DID NOT BELONG TO V1. V1 IS SHOWING IN THE BMV SYSTEM TO BELONG TO MR. PRATHER. MR. CLAPPER STATED TO ME THAT HE HAS OWNED THE VEHICLE FOR 9 YEARS BUT MR. PRATHER HAD JUST RENEWED THE PLATES FOR 2019. D1 DID CALL IN TO DNR AND STATE THAT HE WAS DRIVING THE VEHICLE BUT HAS NEVER SHOWED UP TO SPEAK TO ME SINCE HE HAS A WARRANT OUT FOR HIS ARREST. FROM WHAT I CAN TELL V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH WEST ON MAIN FOREST ROAD JUST SOUTH OF CHERRY LAKE LANE WHEN IT LOST CONTROL, SPUN OUT AND STRUCK A TREE ON THE DRIVERS SIDE CAUSING SEVERE DAMAGE. THERE WERE NO SIGNS OF INJURY AT THE SCENE AND D1 DID NOT TELL DNR THAT HE WAS HURT. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO ANY OTHER PROPERTY OTHER THAN V1. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO KEN'S WESTSIDE TOWING UNTIL THE PROPER OWNER CAN BE LOCATED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: CRIMINAL CASE COMPLETED. MISDEMEANOR SUMMONS ON DRIVER 1 FOR LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT (B MISDEMEANOR). DRIVER WAS INTERVIEWED AT HIS HOUSE 2389 S BRANDON COURT.D1 STATED HE WAS IN AN ACCIDENT IN SAM'S CLUB PARKING LOT. D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING EAST IN PRIVATE LOT OF SAM'S CLUB. D2 STATED V1 CUT IN FRONT OF HER FROM A PARKING STALL AND THEY COLLIDED.WITNESS CORROBORATED THESE STATMENTS AND PROVIDED LICENSE PLATE OF V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W. BLOOMFIELD RD AND WAS NOT PAYING ATTENTION AND RAN THROUGH A RED LIGHT AT W. BLOOMFIELD RD AND S. LIBERTY DR INTERSECTION. D1 STATED AS HE RAN THE RED LIGHT, D2 CRASHED INTO HIM CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER BUMPER OF THE VEHICLE.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. LIBERTY DR. D2 STATED AS SHE PROCEEDED THROUGH S. LIBERTY DR. AND W BLOOMFIELD RD. INTERSECTION WITH A GREEN LIGHT, D1 RAN A RED LIGHT HEADING EAST ON W. BLOOMFIELD ROAD. D2 STATED SHE WAS ABLE TO HIT HER BREAKS, BUT STILL CRASHED INTO THE REAR DRIVER BUMPER OF V1. D2 STATED SHE SUSTAINED SMALL DAMAGE TO HER FRONT BUMPER.WITNESS STATED D2 WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. LIBERTY AND ATTEMPTED TO DRIVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF W. BLOOMFIELD RD. WHEN D1 RAN A RED LIGHT TRAVELLING EAST ON W BLOOMFIELD RD. WITNESS STATED THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED AT THE INTERSECTION OF S. LIBERTY DR. AND W. BLOOMFIELD RD.

D1 (GUS LINNE) WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON GATES DRIVE. D1 ADVISED HE WAS UNCERTAIN WHAT HAPPENED, HOWEVER, INDICATED HE MAY HAVE FELL ASLEEP.V1 (FORD TRANSIT) LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A TREE. V1 SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE FRONT END DAMAGE.TREE HAD A SMALL AMOUNT OF BARK MISSING BUT NO SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE. V1 TOWED BY AUTO MOBILE SERVIES. V1 IS A WORK VEHICLE FOR RIVERWAY PLUMBING LLC.D1 ISSUED CITATION FOR DRIVING WHILE SUSPENDED INFRACTION.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUND ON SR 46W NEAR HENDRICKS RD WHEN A DEER JUMPED OUT IN FRONT OF HER CAR. SHE STATED SHE COULD NOT AVOID IT. THE VEHICLE SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE BUT WAS DRIVABLE. SHE LEFT THE SCENE AND REPORTED THE ACCIDENT ONCE SHE ARRIVED AT HER WORK. THE DEER WAS LOCATED IN THE AREA THE DRIVER STATED IT WOULD BE AND IT WAS PUT DOWN

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Non-vehicle public property damage item - Other explain in narrative: A crosswalk sign and pole.Prior to the collision V1 was traveling north on S Henderson Street intending to continue north through the intersection with Atwater Avenue. V2 was traveling east on Atwater Avenue intending to continue east through the intersection. D1 said he was driving north on S Henderson Street, below the speed limit, and as he approached Atwater Avenue the automated traffic signal turned yellow. D1 said the light was still yellow as he continued straight. As D1 entered the intersection he saw V2 coming from the west and honked, but did not have time to avoid the collision. The front driver's side corner of V1 struck the front passenger side corner of V2. V1 was pushed to its right and came to a stop in the right-hand lane on Atwater Avenue. D2 said he was driving east on Atwater Avenue at approximately 25mph and the automated traffic signal at the intersection with S Henderson Street was green for east-bound traffic. D2 said the light had been green as long as it was in his view. D2 said as he approached the intersection he saw V1 pulling forward, but believed it would stop. D2 said since he had the green light he continued through the intersection. The front driver's side corner of V1 struck the front passenger side corner of V2. As a result of the impact, V2 was pushed and continued traveling northeast. V2 then struck a curb, went off the roadway, and struck a crosswalk sign and pole where it finally stopped. V1 sustained heavy damage to the front driver's side corner and wheel. The airbags were also deployed. V1 was towed by Bland's Wrecker Service due to disabling damage.V2 sustained heavy damage across the front end. The airbags were deployed, and fluid was leaking from underneath the vehicle. V2 was towed by Bland's Wrecker Service as a result of disabling damage.The crosswalk sign and pole were still standing and functioning after the collision, but there were dents and scratches on its base. The pole is also leaning slightly.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 ADVISED HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. CLEAR CREEK DRIVE TOWARDS SOUTH ROGERS STREET. A FEMALE ON A BICYCLE CAME NORTH OFF OF S. MADISON STREET AND RAN INTO THE LEFT FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE, SPUN AROUND AND HIT THE PASSENGER REAR DOOR. FEMALE ON THE BICYCLE STATED SHE WAS RIDING HER BIKE WITH HER FRIEND HEADING NORTH ON S. MADISON STREET. HER FRIEND CROSSED W. CLEAR CREEK DRIVE AND SHE THEN FOLLOWED. FEMALE STATED SHE DID NOT LOOK BOTH WAYS AND RAN INTO THE DRIVERS SIDE OF V1.FEMALE WAS TAKEN BY EMS TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON TO BE CHECKED OUT.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SR 37S IN THE LEFT LANE, SHE STATED SHE NOTICED A LINE OF CARS BEHIND HER AND SHE STATED SHE BEGAN MOVING TO THE RIGHT LANE WHEN SHE IMPACTED VEHICLE 2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS TRAVLING NORTHBOUND ON SR 37S, HE WAS BEHIND VEHICLE 1 AND MOVED TO THE RIGHT LANE DUE TO VEHICLE 1 SPEED BEING SLOW. HE STATED AS HE PASSED VEHICLE 1 IT CAME OVER INTO THE RIGHT LANE STRIKING HIS DRIVER SIDE DOOR AND CAUSING HIM TO LOSS CONTROL OF HIS VEHICLE, HE ENDED UP IN MEIDAN. VEHICLE 1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE FRONT BUT VEHICLE WAS DRIVERABLE. VEHICLE 2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT, DRIVER DOOR, REAR DRIVER SIDE PASSENGER DOOR AND REAR QUARTER PANEL. VEHICLE 2 WAS DRIVABLE. AMBULANCE FROM IU BEDFORD WAS IN THE AREA AND STOPPED TO OFFER ASSISTANCE BUT WAS NOT CALLED BY DISPATCH OR EITHER DRIVER. DRIVER AND PASSENGER OF VEHICLE 2 WAS TALKED TO BY AMBULANCE PERSONNEL BUT REFUSED ANY CARE AS DID THE DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1.

Unit 1 was traveling Northbound on ST RD 37 at the inter-section of OLD ST RD 37. While slowing for traffic, unit 2 drove into the back of unit 1. Both vehicles pulled onto the side of the road at OLD ST RD 37. Minor damage to both vehicles.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE TRAVELING EB ON W SR 46, EAST OF W HEDRICK ROAD.V1 REAR ENDED V2, AS VEHICLE V2 WAS SLOWING DOWN TO TURN INTO 9464 W STATE ROAD 46.D1 ADVISED THAT HIS BRAKES LOCKED UP AND FAILED WHICH CAUSED HIM TO REAR END V2.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN INTO HER RESIDENCE AND GOT REAR ENDED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was headed N/B on S Walnut St. D2 was headed S/B on S Walnut St. D1 attempted to make a left turn into 2020 S Walnut St; Sonic. As D1 made the left turn she did not see D2 headed S/B on S Walnut St, and pulled into his lane of travel, causing a collision between V1 and V2. D1 stated that she was headed N/B on S Walnut St. D1 stated that she got into the median to make a left turn into 2020 S Walnut St; Sonic. D1 stated that she began to make her left turn believing the roadway to be clear. D1 stated that she was then struck by V2 in the front passenger side. D1 stated that she never saw V2, and that it appeared out of nowhere. D2 stated that he was headed S/B on S Walnut St. D2 stated that as he was passing 2020 S Walnut St; Sonic, D1 turned from the median into his lane of travel. D2 stated that he had no time to react, causing V2 to Strike V1 in the front passenger side.

WHILE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON OLD SR 37 JUST SOUTH OF ORCHARD LANE, UNIT 2 WAS SLOWING DUE TO CONGESTED TRAFFIC. UNIT 1 WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND UNIT 2 AND DID NOT SLOW DOWN. UNIT 1 STRUCK UNIT 2 ON THE REAR PASSENGER CORNER OF UNIT 2. BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABELING DAMAGE. THE JUVENILE PASSENGER OF UNIT 2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN, AND WAS SEEN BY MEDICAL ON SCENE. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 WAS GIVEN STANDARD FIELD SOBRIETY TESTS ON SCENE AND WAS DETAINED FOR AN OWI INVESTIGATION. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 WAS LATER CHARGED WITH OWI AND OWI PER SE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated was attempting to cross SR 45 from S Harmony Rd to S Garrison Chapel Rd when he drove into V2. He stated he looked both ways but did must not have seen V2 approaching.D2 stated he was traveling on SR 45 when V1 pulled out, into the intersection and collided with his vehicle.An unidentified witness stated there was a third vehicle involved that ran into the back of V2 then drove off, westbound on SR 45. The only identifiers for V3 was that it was a silver 4-Door Passenger Car, unknown make or model. Other units and agencies were unable to locate V3 after it left the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED SB ON MORTON AT 7TH. V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON 7TH THROUGH MORTON AFTER STOPPING AT A STOP SIGN. V1 PROCEEDED SB ON MORTON AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED SB ON MORTON AT 7TH. D1 STATED THAT HE DROVE SB INTO THE INTERSECTION AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED WB ON 7TH AT MORTON. D2 STATED THAT HE PROCEEDED WB INTO THE INTERSECTION AND, WHILE IN THE INTERSECTION, V1 BEGAN TO PROCEED SB AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. INJURED PARTY IN V2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF LOSS OF HEARING IN HER RIGHT EAR FROM THE SIDE AIRBAG GOING OFF.

D1 advised he was traveling east bound on Atwater Avenue in the lane to go straight through the intersection of Atwater Avenue and Henderson Street. D1 advised he then starting to merge into the turn lane with the intention of turning north bound onto Henderson Street. D1 advised when he merged over V1 crashed into V2. D1 advised he did not see V2 prior to the crash.D2 advised she was traveling east bound on Atwater Avenue in the north bound turn lane when V1 merged into the turn lane and crashed into V2.

D1 STATED THAT A SEMI TRAILER TRUCK HAD STOPPED IN THE SOUTH LANE IN THE EAST BOUND LANES TO LET V1 OUT. HOWEVER, V2 WAS HEADING EASTBOUND IN THE NORTH LANE AND WHEN V1 MADE THE LEFT TURN, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS EASTBOUND IN THE NORTH LANE WHEN THE SEMI TRAILER TRUCK STOPPED IN THE SOUTH LANE BUT D2 DID NOT KNOW IT WAS STOPPING FOR V1 SO D1 COULD TURN AND WHEN V1 TURNED TO GO WESTBOUND, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.V1 HAS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER AND V2 HAS MAJOR DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE. THE DAMAGE TO V2 GOES FROM THE PASSENGER FRONT TIRE TO THE PASSENGER REAR TIRE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS PULLING OUT OF SUNOCO GAS STATION SOUTH BOUND. DRIVER 1 STATED SHE DID NOT SEE ANYONE APPROACHING AND ATTEMPTED TO CROSS TRAFFIC ONTO SOUTH OLD CAPITAL PIKE.VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 ON THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL, WHILE VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON SOUTH VICTOR PIKE.DRIVER 1 AND DRIVER 2 WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTION.VEHCILE 1 AND VEHICLE 2 WERE BOTH DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

On 3/18/2019, I was sitting at the light at the 45/46 Bypass and 17th Street preparing to turn west on 17th Street. The light for northbound traffic then turned yellow and then red. Driver 2 stopped for the light and driver 1 rear-ended her. No injuries reported

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE MALL RD IN THE WESTERN MOST LANE. D1 INDICATED THAT TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP AND SHE WAS STOPPED IN THE ROAD WAY. D1 SAID SHE WAS NOT PAYING ATTENTION AND LIFTED HER FOOT OFF THE BRAKE. D1 SAID HER VEHICLE ROLLED FORWARD AND STRUCK V2 FROM BEHIND. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED SOUTH ON COLLEGE MALL RD IN THE WESTERN MOST LANE. HE SAID WHILE WAITING FOR TRAFFIC TO MOVE, HE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. D2 HAD A HELMET MOUNTED CAMERA THAT I VIEWED.THE IMAGES SHOW V1 MOVING TOWARDS V2, THEN D2 REACTING SO THE CONTACT.

While patrolling in the area of S Walnut Street and 2nd Street I observed a blue passenger car to be disabled and sitting in the intersection. Upon further investigation, I was advised that at three car accident had just occurred and that one of the vehicles had left the scene.I first spoke with Driver 2 (D2) who advised that she had the green light and was heading eastbound on 2nd street after being stopped at the intersection of S Walnut Street. D2 reported that as she went into the intersection a maroon van (V1) heading northbound on S Walnut Street disregarded the red light and hit her vehicle (V2). D2 advised that after V1 hit her that V1 left the scene heading eastbound on 2nd street. D2 explained that she did not see the driver or anyone in V1 due to the accident happening so quickly. I then requested that D2 pull her vehicle into the parking lot at Big Red Liquors in order to get out of the roadway. I then spoke with Driver 3 D(3) who advised that he was stopped facing westbound on 2nd Street at the intersection of S Walnut. D3 advised that as V1 hit V2 that V1 also immediately hit the front passenger side of his vehicle (V3). D3 described V1 to be a maroon van. D3 advised that he could not see the driver of V1, but reported that there was an African American male wearing dark clothing in the passenger seat. D3 reported that V1 then continued eastbound on 2nd Street without stopping. V3 was already in the Big Red Liquors parking lot when I arrived on scene. I then spoke with several witnesses on scene. W1 advised that she was two cars behind V2 on 2nd Street when the accident occurred. W1 reported that as V2 got the green light and entered the intersection that V1 ran the red light heading northbound on S Walnut Street. W1 advised that V1 hit V2 on the front passenger side of the vehicle. W1 reported that V1 then proceeded to leave the scene heading eastbound on 2nd Street. W2 advised that he was in the parking lot area of Sahara Mart when he witnessed the accident. W2 stated that he observed V1 heading norhtbound on S Walnut Street when it struck V2. W2 stated that V1 then rode onto the curb by Big Red Liquors and proceeded East on 2nd Street. W3 advised that he was in his vehicle at Walnut Street and 2nd Street when he observed V1 drive eastbound on 2nd through a solid red light and hit several vehicles. It should be noted that it is believed W3 was confused about the direction V1 was traveling in. I was able to observe damage to both vehicles on scene. V2 had heavy front end damage on the passenger side. V2 had to be towed from the scene due to disabling damage. I then observed V3 which had damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle. It was able to be driven from the scene. I was able to take photographs of both vehicles. It should be noted that other officers were able to locate the maroon van. The maroon van had damage to it that is consistent with hitting the other vehicles.The driver has not been identified at this time.

DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON HARTSTRAIT ROAD, SHE CAME OVER THE HILL LOACTED JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION WITH RATLIFF RD. SHE STATED UNIT 2 WAS STOPPED, ATTEMPTING TO TURN WEST ON RATLIFF, WHEN SHE STRUCK THE REAR END OF UNTI 2. UNIT 1 STATED SHE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED WB ON E 9TH ST AT N WASHINGTON ST AT A STOP SIGN. V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON WASHINGTON APPROACHING 9TH ST. AS V2 CROSSED 9TH ST SB, V1 PROCEEDED WB AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED WB ON 9TH ST AT WASHINGTON ST AND SAW V2 TRAVELING SB. D1 STATED THAT SHE FELT DISTRACTED AND THOUGHT THAT D2 HAD A STOP SIGN SB. D1 STATED SHE PROCEEDED WB AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS SB ON WASHINGTON AT 9TH ST. D2 STATED THAT HE SAW D1 BEGIN TO PROCEED WB ON 9TH ST AND HE SAW THAT SHE WAS NOT STOPPING AS HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V2. D2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN AND REDNESS TO THE LEFT SIDE OF HIS FACE.THROUGH MY INVESTIGATION, I BELIEVE THAT D1 FAILING TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY CAUSED THIS ACCIDENT.

Vehicle 1 was approaching North Oard Road westbound on West State Road 48 when a deer entered the roadway from the south side of the roadway near the Monroe County Airport perimeter fence. As the deer entered the westbound lane it collided with the front bumper/hood area of vehicle 1 resulting in extensive damage. The deer was found deceased at the corner of North Oard Road & W SR 48.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E STATE ROAD 45. V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E STATE ROAD 45. AS V1 APPROACHED THE SLIGHT HILLCREST NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF E ETTER DR, THE ROADWAY OBSTRUCTED HIS VIEW OF STOPPED TRAFFIC AHEAD. V1 ATTEMPTED TO VEER LEFT OF CENTER TO AVOID REARENDING ANOTHER VEHICLE, HOWEVER, WAS UNABLE TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH V2 WHO WAS TRAVELING IN THE WB LANES. THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V2 AND THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED IN AN OPPOSITE SIDESWIPE. V1 THEN PROCEEDED UP THE EMBANKMENT INTO THE GRASS AREA OF 1200 N RUSSELL ROAD CHURCH CAUSING MINOR LANDSCAPING DAMAGE TO THE GRASS.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS UNABLE TO SEE STOPPED TRAFFIC DUE TO THE HILLCREST.D2 STATED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE AND AVOID COLLISION WITH V1 BUT WAS UNABLE TO.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS UNABLE TO SEE V2 BEHIND HIS PARKING SPOT AND BACKED INTO V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS BEHIND V1 IN HER VEHICLE FOR A FEW MINUTES PARKED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DRIVING LANE OF THE PARKING LOT DROPPING SOMEONE OFF. D2 STATED THAT WHEN D1 STARTED BACKING UP V1 SHE HONKED THE HORN OF V2 HOWEVER V1 KEPT BACKING UP. D2 STATED THAT V1 KEPT COMING BACK AND HIT THE LEFT REAR OF V2.

On 3/19/2019 at 1559 hours, I was dispatched to the Redbud parking lot in reference to a property damage accident. D1 was on scene and informed me that V1 was backing out of a parking spot, heading northwest, when V1 struck V2. V2 was parked unoccupied in the parking spot next to V1 when it was struck. V1 scraped the middle right side of V2 with the left front side of the vehicle while attempting to back out of the parking spot. D1 informed me that she was backing her vehicle out of a parking spot and accidentally scraped her vehicle into the middle side of V2 while she was backing V1 in the northwest direction out of her parking spot. D2 was not present at any point of the investigation. Attempts to contact D2 through phone call and residence visit were unsuccessful. In addition to leaving my business card with my contact information and case number attached on the windshield of V2, I left another business card with my contact information and case number at D2's residence. D2's insurance information will be updated as it is presented.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of Vehicle 1 stated he was pulling away from the loading dock area when he dropped something, he stated he reached down to pick up what he dropped and when he looked up he saw vehicle 2 in his path but was not able to stop in time to prevent him hitting vehicle 2.Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he was leaving the business when he was struck by vehicle 1 on the passenger side between the cab of his pickup truck and the bed. Vehicle 1 sustained damage to the front driver side fender, headlight and grill. Vehicle 2 sustained damage to the bed and cab on the passenger side of the truck.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON THE I69 EXIT RAMP TO TAPP RD. UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON TAPP RD. UNIT 1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO MERGE ONTO THE ROUND ABOUT AND STRUCK THE PASSENGER SIDE OF UNIT 2.

Unit 1 was traveling south, towards 6th Street, out of the parking garage of 400 E. 7th Street. Unit 2 was walking west on the sidewalk on the north side of 6th Street approaching the parking garage entrance.Driver 1 stated she was attempting to exit the parking garage to turn east. She stated she stopped several feet away from the roadway to check and make sure it was safe to proceed. Driver 1 advised she noticed a vehicle slowly attempting to pull into the garage through another exit to the west of her but stated that it appeared they were possibly not going to turn. Driver 1 stated she had already checked to her left (east) before checking to the right (west) and noticing the vehicle. She advised that she waited several seconds before beginning to slowly roll forward as she continued watching the vehicle. Driver 1 stated after noticing the vehicle was making the turn, she looked forward and noticed a female in front of her vehicle with both hands on the hood. Driver 1 advised the female was towards the driver side of the vehicle and as she continued rolling the woman was jumping back. Driver 1 stated she was slowly rolling forward at the time and was not traveling very fast. She advised that she did not feel anything before or after seeing Unit 2 contacting her vehicle. Driver 1 stated the female jumped back approximately 3 times before she was able to stop and immediately asked if the female was okay. Driver 1 advised the female stated she was okay before beginning to walk away. Driver 1 stated Unit 2 continued walking down the sidewalk until two Bloomington Police Officers stopped her and asked if she was okay. Driver 1 stated she exited her vehicle and listened to the female telling the officers she had pain in her leg but that she was okay. At this point, Driver 1 advised that the Bloomington Police Officers told the female she should get a report just to be safe. Driver 1 advised that Unit 2 then returned to the scene with the officers.Unit 2 stated she was walking west on the sidewalk when she reached the parking garage entrance. She advised that she stepped off the curb and to continue crossing to the other section of sidewalk. Unit 2 advised she was unaware of any vehicles exiting the garage as she stepped off the curb. Unit 2 stated she took approximately 2 steps when she was struck by Unit 1 on the right side of her body. She advised that she believed Unit 1 was traveling extremely fast and struck her significantly hard. Unit 2 stated after being struck the vehicle continued moving forward and she was able to turn and place her hands on the hood in an attempt to push herself backwards and not fall. Unit 2 stated Unit 1 came to a stop as she reached the roadway. Unit 2 stated that Driver 1 was rude when speaking with her. Unit 2 advised Unit 1 was more telling her she was okay, rather than asking.While speaking with Unit 2 she appeared extremely upset.I spoke with the Bloomington Police Officers that advised they did not see the accident occur. They only noticed the female with her hands on the hood of the vehicle. They advised that the female began walking and they asked if she was okay. They stated at that point, IU Police was contacted to make a report. Unit 2 stated she had pain in her lower right leg. She was checked out by ambulance and was not transported. Unit 2 advised that she would possibly going to the doctor for her injuries. There was no damage to Unit 1. There were hand prints from Unit 2 in the dust on Unit 1. The hand prints are on the front driver side of the hood. There appeared to be other places where dust had been wiped off but it is unclear what these are from.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W. CHURCH LANE CROSSING S. OLD STATE ROAD 37 AT BECKS CROSSING. D1 STATED HE DIDNT KNOW IF THE HE HAD THE RED LIGHT OR D2 HAD THE RED LIGHT AND V1 STRUCK V2 HEAD ON AT A RIGHT ANGLE.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON S. OLD STATE ROAD 37 GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AT BECKS CROSSING. V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1 HEAD ON AT A RIGHT ANGLE AND V2 THEN CONTINUED ON INTO A VACANT BUILDING LOCATED AT 5370 S. OLD STATE ROAD 37. D2 WAS TRANSPORTED BY EMS TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON TO BE CHECKED OUT.A COUPLE WEEKS LATER I WAS ADVISED THAT THERE IS VIDEO FOOTAGE REGARDING THE ACCIDENT. THE FOOTAGE WAS RECORDED BY THE GAS STATION LOCATED AT THE CORNER OF S. WALNUT ST AND S. FAIRFAX RD. UPON REVIEWING THE SECURTITY FOOTAGE I NOTICED IT WAS SOMEWHAT DIFFICULT TO SEE, HOWEVER I COULD SEE THE STOP LIGHTS AND IT DOES APPEAR THAT V1 DRIVES THROUGH THE REDLIGHT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS SITTING AT THE STOP SIGN AT E 10TH AND N GRANT, FACING NORTHBOUND. D1 STATED THAT HE THOUGHT THE INTERSECTION WAS A 4-WAY STOP, AT WHICH TIME, D1 STATED HE PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION WHEN HE WAS STRUCK ON THE REAR DRIVER SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE BY D2.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EASTBOUND ON E. 10TH ST TOWARDS N. GRANT WHEN D1 PULLED OUT INTO THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT HE ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE, BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP HIS VEHICLE, STRIKING D1 ON THE REAR DRIVER SIDE.BASED ON THE DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES, AND STATEMENTS FROM BOTH DRIVERS, D1 FAILED TO YIELD TO ONCOMING TRAFFIC AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 10TH AND N. GRANT, RESULTING IN D2 STRIKING HIS VEHICLE.

Driver 1 stated she was pulling into a parking space at 2455 N Tamarack Trl and felt a bump, but she stated she didn't think she hit vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was parked in a parking space facing west. Witness 1 and 2 were standing behind the accident scene and observed vehicle 1 turn left into the parking space and collide with vehicle 2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was facing eastbound behind V2 on Law Ln, west of Union St. V2 was also facing eastbound on Law Ln, west of Union St. V1 sustained heavy front end damage, while V2 sustained heavy rear end damage. D1 stated she was traveling east on law Ln and noticed a car coming to a stop in front of her. D1 stated she did not realize how quick V2 was stopping and could not stop in time. D1 stated she could not remember if she slid on the wet pavement or just could not stop in time. D1 stated she rear ended V2 who was stopped at a cross walk. D2 stated she was traveling east on Law Ln approaching a cross walk. D2 stated there were 3 girls crossing in the cross walk so she came to a stop. D2 stated she was the rear ended by V1.There were no injuries at the scene. Neither vehicle was towed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were both at the intersection when V1 attempted to turn left onto S Rogers St from W 4th St and struck V2 as it was traveling north on S Rogers St. V1/D1 stated he attempted to turn left onto S Rogers St from W 4th St when he struck V2 as it was traveling northbound on S Rogers St. V2/D2 stated she was traveling northbound on S Rogers St when V1 entered her lane of travel as it was attempting to turn left onto S Rogers St from W 4th St directly in front of her. V1 sustained minor front end damage as result from the collision. V2 sustained minor damage to the front right 1/4 panel as result from the collision. D2 sought medical attention for a complaint of pain after refusing emergency medical services at the scene.

DRIVER 1 IN UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON ST. RD 46 AND TURNED EAST ONTO ARLINGTON RD TRAVELING AT A RATE OF SPEED TO HIGH FOR THE WEATHER AND ROAD CONDITIONS WHICH WERE EXTREMLEY WET. DRIVER 1 IN UNIT 1 SLID INTO AN EMBANKMENT. DRIVER 1 UNIT 1 THEN PULLED THE VEHICLE INTO A LOCAL PARKING LOT.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON S OLD SR 37, JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION WITH RHORER RD, WHEN IT BEGAN TO SLOW DOWN DUE TO TRAFFIC. AS V1 WAS DOING THIS, D1 NOTICED THAT A DRINK CARRIER IN THE SEAT NEXT TO HIM WAS BEGINNING TO FALL FORWARD. D1 LOOKED DOWN TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE AND V1 STRUCK V2 WHICH THEN STRUCK V3. D3 ADVISED THAT HER NECK WAS SORE BUT SHE WAS UNSURE IF IT WAS DUE TO THE ACCIDENT. WHILE THERE WERE NO CLEAR SIGNS OF DAMAGE TO V3 THERE WAS A SMALL LIGHT ON THE RIGHT REAR THAT WAS SLIGHTLY DETACHED FROM THE BUMPER.

On 03/20/2019 I was dispatched to a property damage accident at Fee Ave and the SR 45/46 Bypass. V1 and V2 were traveling eastbound in the left lane of the Bypass and were stopped in traffic. There were two to three cars in front of V2 waiting at the light as well. As V2 approached the intersection of Fee Ave and the Bypass, traffic slowed and V2 slowed to a stop just before entering the intersection.
