V1 accelerated too quickly behind V2 and did not have enough time to stop resulting in V1 striking the rear left portion of V2. Sergeant Collins was flagged down and made aware of the accident. He directed the vehicles to move to the shoulder of Fee Ave just south of the intersection of Fee Ave and the Bypass where they awaited my arrival.V1 had been stopped behind V2 in the left eastbound lane of the Bypass for a red light at the intersection of Fee Ave. When the light turned green, V1 accelerated quickly and did not expect V2 to stop as there was a green light. V2 stopped just prior to entering the intersection on a green light in order to avoid being in the middle of the intersection in the event that the light turned red. Traffic was stopped ahead which is why D2 made the decision to stop at the intersection rather than continue into the middle of the intersection. D1 stated he struck V2 with the front portion of his vehicle due to his quick acceleration. V2 had been stopped in the left lane of the bypass for a red light at the intersection of Fee Ave and the Bypass traveling eastbound. When the light turned green, V2 began to accelerate to travel eastbound through the intersection. Traffic had slowed ahead of V2 so she began to slow to a stop so that she would not be stuck in the middle of the intersection in the event that the light were to turn red. As V2 came to a stop, V1 struck the left rear portion of V2. D2 stated that she did not stop suddenly but slowed to a stop instead.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2/D2 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. 17TH ST GOING STRAIGHT THROUGH THE LIGHT, ALL OF THE SUDDEN V1 MADE A LEFT HAND TURN IN FRONT OF ME AT THE INTERSECTION OF N. COLLEGE AVE AND W. 17TH ST. WE COLLIDED IN THE ROADWAY. I STOPPED MY VEHICLE ON 17TH ST. AND V1 PULLED INTO A SPOT ON N. COLLEGE INFRONT OF SQUARE DONUTS. A YOUNG BLACK FEMALE RAN OVER TO ME AND ASKED IF I WAS OK, AND WAS SORRY. I TOLD THE FEMALE I WOULD MOVE MY CAR AROUND TO WHERE SHE PARKED. WHILE DOING THAT I SAW THAT SAME FEMALE TAKE OFF RUNNING AWAY AND INTO OR NEAR CEDARVIEW APTS. I LEFT THE AREA BECAUSE I COULD NOT FIND HER AND HAD TO GO TO WORK. I CALLED IUPD WHILE AT WORK AND THEY TOLD ME TO CALL BPD TOMORROW. I DROVE MY CAR HOME WITH BOTH AIRBAGS DELOYED."B19-11319D2 FIRST STATED TO ME ON TWO DIFFERNT OCCIASION OF EXPLAING THE ACCIDENT THAT HE WAS IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE, ONCE HE TURNED AROUND AND LOOKED AT THE INTERSECTION HE REALIZED THAT THE FAR RIGHT LANE WAS A RIGHT TURN ONLY, HE THEN CHANGED HIS STORY TO "I WAS IN THE MIDDLE LANE GOING STRAIGHT".V1/D1 WAS INTERVIEWED ON 3-22-19 AT 0811 AM WITH HER PARENT, MRS. KEITH PRESENT. JUV D1 STATED "I WAS STOPPED IN THE LEFT TURN LANE ON W. 17TH ST WAITING TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN, V2 WAS IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE, CLOSEST TO THE GAS STATION. ALL OF THE SUDDEN WE COLLIDED WITH EACH OTHER IN THE INTERSECTION. I RAN OVER TO D2 AND CHECKED IN ON HIM, HE TOLD ME HE WAS GOING TO PULL AROUND. IT WAS DARK, RAINING AND I WAS ALONE. I RAN AWAY TO THE CVS 2 BLOCKS AWAY AND CALLED MY MOTHER. I TOOK MY MOTHERS BOYFRIENDS CAR TO GO VISIT A FRIEND AT BRISCOE QUAD ON IU CAMPUS. I DID NOT HAVE PERMISSION TO USE, AND HE DID NOT KNOW I WRECKED IT TILL THE NEXT MORNING."VIDEO OF THE CRASH IS NOT AVAILABLE. UNKNOWN WHAT LANE OF TRAVEL V2 WAS IN.
D1 STATED THAT HE WAS WEST BOUND ON CHURCH LN FROM ROGERS WHEN DEER RAN INTO THE SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE DOING DAMGE. VEHICLE DRIVABLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 advised she was traveling west bound out of a parking lot into another parking lot. D1 advised she began to turn north bound when V1 crashed into V2. D1 advised she did not see V2 prior to turning.D2 advised she was traveling north bound through a parking lot when V1 crashed into V2.

On 3/21/2019 at approximately 03:42 hours I was dispatched to 2849 E Buick Cadillac BLVD in reference to an Accident PD. Upon arrival, I observed V1 and V2 facing each other on the south part of the road in the parking area. V1 was facing westbound angled and partially in the grass with the air bags deployed. V2 was facing westbound with heavy front end damage D1 explained that he was driving eastbound when he tried to find something under his seat. D1 stated that he looked down and then collided with V2. It should be noted that V2 was parked and did not have anyone inside of the vehicle during the crash. Due to D1 looking under the seat and becoming distracted resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

D1 advised he was traveling east bound on 10th Street. D1 advised while passing cars on the left he observed V2 and he thought it was going to keep going straight. D1 advised while passing V2 on the left, V2 began to turn left at the intersection of 10th Street and Walnut Grove. D1 advised while passing V2, V2 crashed into V1. D1 advised he did not see V2's turn signal activated until he was at the front driver side window. D2 advised he was traveling east bound on 10th Street when he began to turn north bound onto Walnut Grove. D2 advised while starting to north bound, V2 and V1 crashed into each other. D2 advised he believed he had his turn signal activated.D1 advised he did have pain in his right knee but refused treatment.

On March 21st, 2019, I, Officer Southern responded to a call for a hit and run. Upon arrival Driver 2 informed me that while sitting at a stop in the drive through line at Wendy's, Driver 1 tried to get out of the drive through line and backed up. When Driver 1 backed up Driver 1 backed into Driver 2 and then drove off in an unknown direction. Driver 2 then pulled into a parking space and called 911.

Unit 1 was merging onto W Maple Grove Rd, merging to proceed eastbound. Unit 2 was travelling westbound on W Maple Grove Rd. As Unit 1 was attempting to merge, the Driver claimed there were 2 trees blocking her view of traffic coming from the west. Unit 1 proceeded to enter roadway and Unit 2 collided with Unit 1, impacting on the rear drivers side. Unit 1 suffered damage to front and rear drivers side and Unit 2 sustained damage to front drivers side.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET PIKE, ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO EAST RHORER ROAD. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 ON THE DRIVER SIDE DOOR. VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON EAST RHORER ROAD AND WAS STRUCK IN THE INTERSECTION.ALL INVOLVED IN ACCIDENT WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND WERE DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

V1 WAS NORTH ON WALNUT JUST SOUTH OF OLD ST RD 37. D1 SAID SHE HAD RECIEVED A TEXT MESSAGE FROM A FRIEND AND SHE CHECKED HER PHONE WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD. V1 THEN RAN OFF ROAD TO THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE STREET, INTO A LIGHT POLE CONTINUED NORTH OFF THE ROAD AND INTO A SECOND LIGHT POLE BEFORE STOPPING JUST NORTH OF MOTEL 6 IN THE GRASS.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 03/21/2019 at 0959 hours I was dispatched to a property damage accident at 3rd Street and Indiana Avenue. V1 was in the right lane of 3rd street behind a bus that was stopped at a bus stop east of the 3rd Street and Indiana Avenue intersection. D1 initiated the left turn signal for V1 and attempted to go around the stopped bus. As V1 was attempting to pass the bus, V1 pulled into the left lane of 3rd street and clipped the right side mirror of V2. V2 was heading west on 3rd Street in the left lane when V1 pulled into the left lane and struck V2's passenger side mirror with V1's driver's side mirror. D1 stated she was driving west bound behind a bus that came to a stop at a bus stop just east of the 3rd street and Indiana Avenue intersection. D1 was traveling west in the right lane. D1 stated that she initiated her left turn signal in effort to pass around the stopped bus. In doing so, D1 stated that V2 drove by quickly in the left lane and the two vehicles collided. D1 was not sure if she had moved into the left turn lane yet when the collision occurred. D2 stated that he was traveling west bound in the left lane on 3rd Street when he saw V1 behind a stopped bus. As D2 was traveling west, he witnessed V1 pull out of the right hand lane into the left lane he was traveling in. In an effort to avoid a collision, D2 stated he attempted to move V2 farther left into the left lane. V1 then struck V2's right side mirror with it's left side mirror. The only damage that occurred was the left side mirror of V1 and the right side mirror of V2.D2 informed officers that he had auto insurance through The General and would contact officers when he arrived to work to provide a policy number. After repeated attempts to make contact with D2, Officer Werner contacted The General and was informed that D2 has never been insured by that company. A citation was completed and will be mailed to D2 for Operating without Financial Responsibility.

V1 PULLED OUT OF 1201 W ALLEN ST, MAKING A RIGHT HAND TURN. V1 LOST CONTROL, AND WENT INTO THE ONCOMING LANE, STRIKING A CURB AT 1100 W ALLEN ST. V1 THEN WENT OVER THE CURB CRASHING INTO A TREE AND A METAL ROD IN THE FLOWER BED. V1 PROCEEDED TO FLIP AND CAME TO A REST ON THE DRIVERS SIDE OF THE VEHICLE ON SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF THE BUSINESS AT 1100 W. ALLEN ST. D1 THEN FLED THE SCENE. W1 ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE THE VEHICLE, BUT HEARD TIRES SQUEALING AS A VEHICLE LEFT 1201 W ALLEN ST AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. W1 ADVISED SHE THEN HEARD A LOUD CRASHING NOISE, AND CAME OUTSIDE TO FIND V1 ON ITS SIDE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 (V1), driven by Flyod Vorice (D1), was eastbound on Atwater Avenue when it attempted to merge into the right lane in front of Vehicle 2 (V2), a transit bus driven by Christopher Bomgardner. As V1 attempted to merge, it struck the front driver's side bumper of V2, which was also eastbound on Atwater Ave. The collision occurred approximately 100 feet west of S Woodlawn Ave on E Atwater Ave.D1 stated as he was driving eastbound on Atwater Ave, he wanted to get around V2. D1 stated he thought V2 was stopped on the roadway and drove around the bus and then attempted to turn into V2's lane and collided with V2.D2 stated he was driving eastbound on Atwater Ave approaching the intersection of Woodlawn Ave. D2 stated as he was driving, V1 attempted to drive around V2 and then attempted to turn into V2's lane of travel. D2 stated that V1 collided with V2.

V2 (JEEP SAW) WAS SLOWING OR STOPPED IN TRAFFIC ON 17TH ST TRAVELING EASTBOUND.V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1 (FORD RANGER).D1 (CHRISTOPHER BRANAM) INDICATED HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME TO AVOID COLLISION AND REAR ENDED V2.D1 CITED THE WET ROADWAY SURFACE AS A FACTOR. D2 (JOSPEH KIELAR) ADVISED HE HAD A COMPLAINT OF HEAD PAIN AND LOWER BACK PAIN. D2 REFUSED AN AMBULANCE. D2 ADVISED HE HAD PRIOR HEAD PAIN/INJURY BUT THE ACCIDENT CAUSED THE PAIN TO RETURN. NEIITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED.

Pedalcyclist (P1) stated he was going down hill (Vernal Pike). P1 stated he was watching cars and that D1 didn't have his turn signal on. P1 figured D1 was going straight. P1 stated when D1 turned, both turned into each other. P1 stated he was riding on the sidewalk, on the left (south) side of the roadway.Driver 1 (D1) stated he was traveling east on Vernal Pike then turned right (south) onto Industrial Park Drive. D1 stated he didn't seen P1 or any lights on P1's bike. D1 stated once he turned onto Industrial Park Drive, he collided with P1. Deputy observed reflectors on P1's bicycle however no lights were observed on the front or rear of the bicycle.

V2 WAS PARKED, UNOCCUPIED AND FACING NORTH OUTSIDE THE ADDRESS WHEN IT WAS STRUCK BY AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE WHICH DID NOT PROVIDE ANY CONTACT OR VEHICLE INSURANCE INFORMATION. V1/D1 INFORMATION AS WELL AS DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE IS UNKNOWN.V2 SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE RIGHT REAR 1/4 PANEL.

V1 was S/B on N Dunn Street approaching a left-hand curve onto E 13th Street. V1 ran off the roadway during the curve and ran up the length of a cable that anchors a utility pole. The vehicle became stuck on top of the cable, with the rear bumper in the ground and the front bumper on the cable, leaving the front end up at a 45 degree angle in reference to the ground. D1 fled the scene on foot.D1 admitted over telephone that he lost control of the vehicle during the turn.

D1 (KEVIN TSOI) ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND IN ALLEYWAY. D1 CITED THERE WAS A GLARE FROM THE SUN, CAUSING HIM TO RUN OFF ROADWAY.D1 STRUCK UTILITY POLE. NO DAMAGE TO UTILITY POLE.EXTENSIVE DRIVER'S SIDE FRONT END DAMAGE TO TOYOTA RAV 4. D1 WILL HAVE PRIVATE TOW DONE TO REMOVE VEHICLE FROM ALLEYWAY.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2, black Ford, was stopped in the northbound lane of Old SR37; however, V2 was facing in a northeast direction at the intersection with SR37S. V1, silver Dodge, was stopped in the northbound lane of Old SR37 behind V2. V1 moved forward while V2 was still stopped at the traffic signal and the front of V1 struck the rear of V2.D1, Jacobs, stated she was stopped in the northbound lane of Old SR37 at SR37 behind V2. D1 stated she observed the northbound left turn arrow change to green and she began to move forward. D1 stated she did not realize V2 was still stopped and she struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1.D2, Cochran, stated he was stopped in the northbound lane of Old SR37 at SR37 with a red traffic signal. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2 while he was stopped at the traffic signal.Evidence shows damage to the front right bumper cover of V1 consistent with an impact with the tow hitch at the rear of V2. Evidence shows damage to the left rear bumper of V2. Evidence shows the traffic signal was operating correctly during the accident investigation.

V1 and V2 were both traveling westbound along E 3rd St when at the intersection of S Overhill Dr, V1 struck the rear bumper portion of V2. Both vehicles sustained minor damage, however, D2 had a complaint of pain and was treated and released at the scene by emergency medical personnel. V1/D1 stated he was traveling westbound within the congested traffic along E 3rd St when his vehicle struck the rear bumper portion of V2 as it stopped in front of him. D1 stated his vision had been interfered with by the sun, which was shining directly into his face, causing him to not see V2 stopping in front of him. V2/D2 stated she was traveling westbound on E 3rd St when traffic in front of her stopped due to heavy congestion in the area. At that time, D2 stated her vehicle was struck from behind by V1. D2 stated she had a complaint of pain to her neck region and was treated and released by emergency medical personnel at the scene. V1 sustained minor damage to the front bumper portion of the vehicle. V2 sustained minor damage to the rear bumper portion of the vehicle.Both vehicles were driven away from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was entering lane of travel from the drive of 2447 S Smith Pike, when D1 claims the view was obstructed from utility pole and D1 did not see V2. As a result, V1 failed to yield right of way to V2.V2 was south bound on Smith Pike, when V1 failed to yield right of way to V2 and resulted in a right angle collision.W1 was behind V2 who advised V1 failed to yield right of way to V2 resulting in the collision, could not advise if speed was a factor as he was behind V2.P1 stated the view was obstructed and V2 appeared to be traveling at a high rate of speed.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, COUNTY OF MONROE, STATE OF INDIANA.V1 AND V2 WERE SB ON S PATTERSON DR. V2 STOPPED FOR A RED LIGHT AND V1 REAR ENDED V2.D1 SAID HE WAS SB ON S PATTERSON DR. HE SAID HE DID NOT THINK V2 WAS GOING TO STOP FOR THE LIGHT SO WHEN V2 STOPPED HE REAR ENDED V2.D2 SAID HE WAS SB ON S PATTERSON DR. HE SAID THE LIGHT WAS RED SO HE STOPPED FOR THE RED LIGHT. D2 SAID V1 THEN REAR ENDED HIM.BOTH DRIVERS ADMITTED TO DRIVING THEIR RESPECTIVE VEHICLES. BOTH DRIVERS WERE IDENTIFIED BY THEIR VALID IN DL.OFFICER S. ROSE 1665 03/22/2019

V1, V2 and V3 were traveling E/B on 2nd ST. V1 rear ended V2 which caused V2 to rear end V3 causing damage to all three vehicles. D1 advised that she was traveling E/B on 2nd ST. D1 stated that she rear ended V2 due to the fact that she was not paying attention and did not observe that the traffic control signal had turned red. D1 advised that she had a complaint of pain to her chest. D1 advised that her two children Adalee (12/12/13) and Olivia Hellyer (08/31/16) were inside of V1 and advised that both children had a scratch and complaint of pain to the right side of their neck from the seat belt during the crash. D1 and both children were treated on scene. D2 advised that she was stopped at the red traffic control signal E/B on 2nd ST. D2 advised that while stopped in traffic she felt the impact of V1 rear ending V2. D2 advised that when V2 was struck, she collided with V3 causing damage. D2 advised that she had a complaint of pain to her left shoulder 6 out of 10 and advised that she would follow up with her primary care doctor. D3 advised that she was stopped at the red traffic control signal E/B on 2nd ST. D3 advised that she then felt the impact of V2. D3 advised that she had a complaint of pain to her back 7 out of 10 and was treated on scene. Due to the fact the D1 was following to closely, V1 struck V2 which caused V2 to collide with V3.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 03/22/2019 I responded to the area of the IU Foundation entrance off of the Bypass 45/46 in reference to a two-vehicle collision. I arrived and noticed a silver Chevrolet Silverado (V2) and a maroon Chevrolet Trailblazer (V1). V1 was turning left (south) from the Foundation entrance and V2 was turning left (east) from the Bypass 45/46 into the Foundation entrance just prior to the collision.I spoke with V1, who advised me that he was driving in the Foundation Entrance Lot. He came to the stop sign and started to turn left (south) into the Bypass 45/46. He advised me that V2 was in the southbound lane of the Bypass 45/46. He stated he noticed him at the last minute and the front bumper of his vehicle struck the driver's side of V2. He advised me that V2 was attempting to turn left into the Foundation Lot and the collision occurred in between the north and south lane of traffic in the intersection. I spoke with V2, who advised me that he was traveling south on the Bypass 45/46 attempting to turn left into the IU Foundation parking lot. He stated that as he started to turn, the front bumper of V1 struck the rear driver's side tire of his vehicle. He stated that V1 was coming from the Foundation lot and was attempting to turn left just prior to the collision.

Weather and Roadway Conditions-Clear, Dry, Dark and Light TrafficPrimary Cause-Vehicle 1 struck a deer in the center lane of northbound I69 south of the 123.5 mile markerVehicle 1 was traveling northbound on I69 just south of the 123.5 miler marker. Deer was traveling east bound across I69 just south of the 123.5 mile marker. Vehicle 1 struck the deer with its front bumper in the center lane of I69 just south of the 123.5 mile marker. Vehicle 1 pulled off on the shoulder just north of this location. The remains of the deer came to final rest in the center lane.Driver 1 stated that he was in the center lane traveling approximately 55MPH. Driver 1 said the deer came out of nowhere and he was unable to avoid hitting the deer.Observations-Vehicle 1 had heavy front end damage where it struck the deer. There was also a large amount of deer hair in the grill and radiator area. The radiator was damaged and was leaking fluid. This made Vehicle 1 unable to be driven from the scene. The remains of the deer was found just south of the 123.5 mile marker. I moved them to the right shoulder so it did not cause a secondary crash.

V1 was on the 5th Floor of the Fee Lane parking garage heading east. As V1 took the sharp left turn west to continue down the parking garage, V1's right front bumper struck a concrete parking garage support pole. D1 stated he was traveling down the parking garage. D1 stated while taking the turn, he believes he must have been distracted or his hand slipped off the steering wheel. D1 stated the right front bumper of his vehicle then struck the concrete support pole. V1 had heavy right front damage. It appeared the crash had also caused fluids to leak from V1. D1 stated he did not think it could be driven and requested a tow. The concrete pole had no damage to it. The pole had marks from previous collisions and I was unable to distinguish old marks with any new marks. D1 did not complain of pain or request medical attention in my presence.

D1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S OLD SR 37. D1 STATED SHE SAW A PACK OF DEER CROSSING THE ROADWAY. SHE THOUGHT SHE WAS IN THE CLEAR, DUE TO THE PACK OF DEER HAVING ALREADY CROSSED THE ROAD. D1 SAID ONE DEER RETURNED ACROSS THE ROAD AT THE LAST MOMENT. D1 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE DEER.D1 THEN MOVED HER VEHICLE INTO A NEARBY DRIVEWAY. THE DEER, HIND LEGS PARALYZED, CRAWLED OFF THE ROADWAY AND INTO A NEARBY YARD. D1 DID NOT REQUEST AN AMBULANCE. THE DEER WAS PUT DOWN.

Driver 2 stated he was driving south through the parking lot near 3546 John Hinkle Pl. Driver 2 stated that vehicle 1 backed out of a parking spot and collided with his vehicle as he was driving by. Driver 1 stated he was backing out of the parking spot and collided with vehicle 2.

V1 was in a parking spot on the west side of the Foster Circle Drive facing west. V2 was driving north on the Foster Circle Drive. As V2 was driving past V1, V1 backed into V2. V1's left rear bumper struck the area above V2's left rear tire. D1 stated while he was backing out and did not see V2 traveling behind him. D1 said he then struck V2. V1 had minor cosmetic damage to the left rear bumper. V2 stated he was traveling north on the Foster Circle Drive. D2 stated he did not see V1 backing out until after V2 had already been struck. V2 had minor cosmetic damage and a slight dent above the left rear tire.Neither driver complained of pain or requested medical attention in my presence.

V1 was north bound on Breeden Road at Crum Road when D1 traveled left of center to avoid a pot hole resulting in a opposite direction sideswipe with V2. V2 was south bound on Breeden Road at Crum road when D1 opposite direction sideswiped V2.I was not able to observe any large potholes in the immediate area of the accident.

V1 WAS BACKING SB OUT OF A PARKING SPACE AT 970 S ADAMS STREET AND STRUCK V2 THAT WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND THROUGH THE PARKING LOT.D1 CLAIMED THAT SHE WAS MOSTLY OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT AND LOOKED BEFORE SHE BACKED AND DID NOT SEE ANOTHER VEHICLE.D2 ADVISED THAT V1 BACKED INTO HER VEHICLE.FOLLOWING THE COLLISION, BOTH VECHLES MOVED FROM THE POINT OF COLLISIONT TO ADJACENT PARKING SPACES. THEREFORE NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED.
V1 WAS TRAVELIMG W ON WINSLOW RD.A DEER RAN INTO THE ROAD FROM THE NORTH AND V1 STRUCK THE DEER. THE DEER RAN INTO THE NEIGHBORHOOD TO HE SOUTH. THE VEHCLE IS DRIVABLE, AND THERE ARE NO INJURIES.

V2 WAS STOPPED WAITING TO TURN S ONTO KENT RD. D2 STATED HE SAW V1 APPROACHING AND NOT SLOWING DOWN , D2 STATED THAT V1 REAR ENDED HIM. D1 STATED SHE REAR ENDED V2 WHEN SHE COULD NOT SLOW DOWN QUICKLY ENOUGH.
DRIVER 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON I69 AND HAD A DEER RUN OUT IN FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE. D1 STATED THAT HE COULD NOT AVOID THE DEER.

DRIVER STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON SR 446 WHEN HER VEHICLE LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK THE MAILBOXES FOR 6999 AND 7599 E WALDRIP CREEK ROAD AND DAMAGED HER VEHICLE. DRIVER ADVISED SHE WAS ABLE TO RETURN THE VEHICLE TO THE ROADWAY AND SAFELY STOP TO CALL POLICE.DRIVER DECLINED MEDICAL FOR HER GRANDDAUGHTER WAS IN THE CAR WHEN CRASH OCCURED. CHILD HAD OBVIOUS SINGS OF INJURY. THE ACCIDENT HAPPENED NEAR STATE ROAD 446 AND E WALDRIP CREEK ROAD.

On 03/23/2019 at 1113 I was enroute to a personal injury accident at Milo B Sampson Road and the SR45/46 Bypass. When I arrived, Officer Cook was out with two vehicles. A deputy and an ambulance were also on scene. Officer Cook informed me that one male in V2, identified as John Ginther, had complained of neck pain but was cleared by EMS. V1 and V2 had both been traveling east in the right lane of the bypass approaching Milo B Sampson Road. V2 came to a stop as traffic was coming to a stop. V1 had been following behind V2 and did not have time to stop. Due to following too closely, V1 collided with the rear end of V2.D1 stated that she was traveling east on the Bypass in the right lane behind V2. D1 stated that she was experiencing a panic attack while driving and also stated that the sun was in her eyes. V1 states because of these factors, she did not have enough time to stop safely and collided with the rear of V2. D2 stated that she was traveling east on the Bypass in the right lane in front of V1. D2 stated that she came to a stop rather quickly as traffic stopped in front of her. D2 also stated that she looked up in her rear view mirror and noticed V1 was approaching and it appeared that the two vehicles were about to collide. D2 also mentioned that it appeared that D1 was on her phone at the time of the collision. John Ginther, a passenger of V2, complained of neck pain following the collision. EMS came to the scene and accessed John Ginther where he refused to be transported to Bloomington Hospital.V1 was towed via flatbed tow by Sturgis Tow Company.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and v2 were traveling south on College Avenue; when v1 merged from the center lane into the east, colliding with v2. The primary cause of the accident is V1 failing to yield to V2.

Vehicle 2 was parked in the parking lot of 110 E Winslow Rd facing north. Vehicle 1 was parked next to vehicle 2 in the parking lot also facing north. Driver of vehicle 1 backed out of the parking spot southeast.. After backing out of the spot driver of vehicle 1 began driving forward and tried to turn to the west. The driver of vehicle 1 was unable to turn sharp enough to avoid hitting vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 struck vehicle 2 in the rear causing minor damage to the rear of vehicle 2 and significant damage to the front passenger side of vehicle 1. No injuries were reported from the accident.

THE ORDER OF THE VEHICLES WAS MESSED UP UPON ENTRY. FROM BACK TO FROM THE ORDER IS V1, V3, V2, V4.V4 WAS ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT TURN INTO A DRIVEWAY ACCROSS THE ROAD ON S. OLD SR 37 AND DUE TO ONCOMMING TRAFFIC THEY STOPPED. V2 STOPPED BEHIND V4. V3 STOPPED BEHIND V2.V1 DIDN'T SEE THEM STOPPED AND D1 REAR ENDED V3. WHEN V3 WAS HIT D3 STATED HE RELEASED THE BREAK PEDAL OF V3 WAS PUSHED INTO V2. D2 STATED THAT WHEN SHE WAS HIT IT PUSHED V2 INTO THE TRAILER HITCH OF V4.THERE WASN'T ANY VISIBLE DAMAGE TO V4. V2 SUSTAINED A HOLE IN THE FRONT BUMPER FROM THE TRAILER HITCH OF V4 AS WELL AS REAR END DAMAGE FROM V3. V3 SUSTAINED FRONT AND REAR END DAMAGE. V1 SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE CAUSING IT TO HAVE TO BE TOWED.

V1 was traveling westbound in the parking lot near Rose Avenue and Jones Street (Forest East Parking Lot). V2 was parked in a marked parking stall facing west in the lot. V1 then approached V2 to park in the marked parking stall directly behind V1. V1 got too close to V2 and could not stop due to lack of breaking. V1 then rear ended V2. There was minor damage to the rear bumper of V2 and minor damage to the front grille of V1.D1 stated that he was trying to park his vehicle in the marked parking stall and the brakes failed to work properly so he struck V2 because he was unable to come to a complete stop. D1 also stated that the vehicle did not belong to him and that he did not know if V1 had insurance. D1 then pointed me to the owner of the vehicle who stated that the vehicle did not have insurance. Chance Wesley, The owner of V2 stated that he was standing next to V2 when V1 began to attempt to park behind V2. Wesley stated that V1 slowed down but did not come to a stop before colliding with the rear of V2. Wesley stated that he could not tell why V1 did not stop. There were no injuries reported at the scene. V1 was towed by Bland's Towing due to the vehicle not being properly insured and possible brake failure. D1 was cited for operating a vehicle without financial responsibility and for operating a vehicle with expired plates.

D1 and D2 were headed W/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the intersection of S Oakdale Dr. D1 attempted to merge from the left hand lane into the right hand lane so that should could make a right turn onto S Basswood Dr. As D1 merged lanes, she did not see V2 to her right, causing a collison. D1 stated that she was headed W/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the intersection of S Oakdale Dr. D1 stated that she was in the left hand lane and attempted to merge into the right hand lane so that she could turn right onto S Basswood Dr. D1 stated that she did not see V2 until the collsion occured between V1's passenger side and V2's front drive side. D2 stated that he was headed W/B on S Bloomfield Rd., approaching the intersection of S Oakdale Dr. D2 stated that as he approached the intersection and was passing V1 on the right side, V1 began to merge into his lane, leaving him no where to go. D2 stated that he tried to hit his brakes, however he could not stop V2 from striking V1. D2 stated he didn't know if D1 was trying to merge lanes, or if she was trying to turn onto S Basswood Dr, based on her merging as they entered the intersection.

D1 stated that she was initially traveling E/B on W. Grimes Lane approaching the intersection a S. Walnut Street. D1 stated that she entered into the right turn lane where V2 was sitting stopped. D1 stated that it was at this time the front passenger's side of V1 collided with the rear driver's side of V2. D2 stated that she was sitting stopped at the intersection of W. Grimes Lane and S. Walnut Street; waiting to turn S/B onto Walnut Street. D2 stated that the light was red and she was waiting for S/B traffic to clear prior to making her turn. D2 stated that it was at this time V1 collided into the rear driver's side of V2. At this time, based on the damage to both vehicles and the statements provided by both drivers at the scene; due to D1 following too closely to V2, and the roadway surface conditions, resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

V1 WAS ON FIRE. BFD EXTINGUISHED FIRE.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELLING NORTH ON INDIANA AND PASSING 15TH STREET WHEN HIS VEHICLE BEGAN SMOKING AND THEN CAUGHT FIRE. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS LYFT DRIVING AT THE TIME. D1 STATED THAT HE PARKED HIS VEHICLE ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD, GOT OUT, AND CONTACTED EMERGENCY SERVICES.

On 04/04/2019 at 12:08am, I met with pedestrian Ryan Blum at his residence to take this report. I later spoke with D1 over the phone to obtain his information and account of the incident. Blum was being dropped off by D1 near his residence when his left foot was run over by V1. Blum had received an Uber ride from D1 and was dropped off on N. Union Street approximately 150 feet south of the intersection of E. 10th Street and N. Union Street. V1 had pulled off on the east side of the northbound lane of N. Union Street to drop off Blum. Blum exited the vehicle from the rear passenger side door of V1. Blum then reached back into V1 to retrieve his backpack and food. While Blum was retrieving his belongings from the backseat of V1, D1 took his foot off the brake. As a result, the rear passenger side tire ran over Blum's left foot. Blum began to yell in pain and D1 got out of the vehicle to check on Blum's condition. Blum asked for D1's name and phone number and was given D1's nickname of Kasey and his phone number. Blum then asked D1 to leave the scene. D1 drove off in V1. Blum called a friend to take him to IU Health Bloomington Hospital. Blum was driven there approximately 5 minutes after the collision occurred. D1, an Uber driver, stated he was dropping off pedestrian Ryan Blum near Blum's residence. D1 parked on N. Union Street approximately 150 feet south of the intersection of E. 10th Street and N. Union Street. V1 had pulled off on the east side of the northbound lane of N. Union Street to drop off Blum. D1 noticed Blum exit the rear passenger door of V1. D1 then started to use his cell phone to confirm a pickup of another Uber rider he was going to pick up. D1 did not know that Blum had got back into V1 to retrieve his belongings. As a result of not knowing Blum was still in the vehicle, D1 took his foot off of the brake pedal and ran over Blum's left foot by accident. D1 got out of the vehicle to check Blum's condition. D1 gave Blum his nickname of Kasey and his cell phone number. Blum then asked D1 to leave the scene and he did. Blum was admitted to the hospital at 08:08pm and was released at 09:26pm. X-rays were taken of Blum's left foot and the diagnosis was a deep contusion in his left foot.Blum contacted IUPD for a report of the incident on 04/04/2019 at 12:08am.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHEAST ON ST RD 46 APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH SMITH PIKE. THE EAST/ WESTBOUND TRAFFIC HAD THE RED LIGHT, WHERE V2 AND V3 WERE STOPPED AT THE LIGHT. V1 FAILED TO STOP IN TIME AND REAR ENDED V2 WHICH THEN STRUCK V3. D1 ADMITTED TO NOT HAVING ANY INSURANCE ON HER VEHICLE AT THE TIME OF THE CRASH. IT SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED THE THE RETURN ON THE VEHICLE INDICATES V1 IS A RED JEEP HOWEVE THE JEEP HAS BEEN PAINTED A BLACK COLOR, BY THE PREVIOUS OWNER. D2 AND D3 BOTH STATED THEY WERE STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT WHEN THEY WERE STRUCK FROM BEHIND. NONE OF THE DRIVERS OR PASSENGERS OF V2 OR V3 ACCEPTED MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE, HOWEVER, DID ADVISE THEY MAY SEEK TREATMENT ON THEIR OWN AFTER LEAVING THE ACCIDENT SCENE.D1 STATED SHE WAS NOT INJURED IN THE ACCIDENT AND WAS ISSUED A UTT FOR OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT INSURANCE.

When I arrived on scene, both vehicles had been moved from where the crash occurred. The crash involved a blue Hyundai (V1), driven by Daniel Jacobowski (D1) and a silver Mercedes (V2), driven by Nicole Potrawski (D2). Neither driver complained of any injuries at the scene.Both drivers stated the same thing. D1 was working as a Chinese food delivery driver. V1 was behind V2 as they drove south on Jordan Ave approaching Law Lane. V2 stopped at a red light. D1 stated the food he was delivering started to shift in his car seat so he reached over to secure it. When D1 looked back up at the roadway he was about to crash into V2. D1 stated he pushed on the brakes and swerved to the right but was unable to avoid a collision.The driver side front bumper of V1 crashed into the passenger side rear bumper of V2.V1 sustained moderate damage to the driver side front bumper and fender as well as the front driver side rim. V2 sustained moderate damage to the passenger side rear bumper.Both vehicles were able to be driver from the scene.

V1 and V2 were both traveling southbound on S College Ave and had just driven through the intersection with W 4th St when V1 attempted to change lanes and struck V2. V1/D1 stated he had been traveling southbound in the center lane and was attempting to change lanes into the left lane when his vehicle struck the front right 1/4 panel of V2. V2/D2 stated he had been traveling southbound in the far left lane when his vehicle was struck by V1. D2 stated as a result of the impact, his vehicle was then forced into a concrete traffic barrier which had been placed along the east side of the road. D2 stated upon his vehicle making contact with the concrete traffic barrier, his front left tire became damaged and flattened. V1 sustained damage to the driver's side area between both the driver and rear passenger (driver's side) door.V2 sustained damage to the front right 1/4 panel and passenger side headlight assembly area. In addition, the front driver's side wheel and tire were damaged, causing D1 to change to a spare tire. Both vehicles were driven away from the scene.

V1 was traveling southbound, in the left hand lane of traffic, on the State Road 45/46 Bypass approaching the intersection at Tenth Street. V2 was traveling southbound, in the right hand lane of traffic, on the State Road 45/46 Bypass approaching the intersection at Tenth Street. The light at the intersection turned red and a vehicle in front of V1 came to a slow. V1 then attempted to merge into the right hand lane of traffic to avoid the vehicle. V1 did not notice V2 in the right lane. V1 then sideswiped V2. There was light damage to the passenger side of V1. There was light damage to the drivers side of V2. D1 stated that he was traveling south approaching Tenth Street and saw a vehicle in front of him begin to slow. D1 stated that he then attempted to merge lanes and did not see V2 approaching to his right. V1 then merged lanes and sideswiped V2. D2 stated that he was traveling straight going south on the Bypass approaching Tenth Street. D2 stated that he saw the light turn red and began to slow but was still in a forward motion. D2 stated that he then noticed V1 begin to merge toward V2. V1 then sideswiped V2. There were no injuries reported at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRYING TO PARK THE RENTAL VEHICLE TO RETURN IT. D1 STATED AS SHE WAS PARKING THE VEHICLE, SHE ACCIDENTALLY HIT THE ACCELERATOR INSTEAD OF THE BREAK CAUSING HER VEHCILE TO DRIVE EAST DIRECTLY INTO THE CLEAR CREEK.I ARRIVED AND LOCATED D1 STANDING IN THE PARKING LOT OF HERTZ CAR RENTAL AND V1 LOCATED IN CLEAR CREEK WITH ALL 4 TIRES FLAT ON THE BOTTOM OF THE CREEK. I COULD VISIBILE SEE DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER AND HOOD OF THE V1. WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS REMOVED FROM THE WATER I WAS ABLE TO SEE DAMAGE ON THE UNDERCARRIAGE, FRONT BUMPER, AND PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO KENS WESTSIDE AT THE REQUEST OF D1.D1 WAS OPERATING ON HER PERMIT WITH A VALID LICENSED DRIVER ABOVE THE AGE OF 25 YEARS OLD.

D1 advised he was traveling West on Anderson Road when he entered the curve that is a northwestern curve, the rear end of V1 came from behind him and slid to the south/southwest. After this, the front end of V1 went into a ditch on the East side of the roadway. After entering the ditch, the front end of V1 traveled up an embankment causing V1 to roll onto its left side.

D1 stated that she was traveling S/B on N. Kinser Pike, North of the intersection at W. Skyline Drive. D1 stated that upon cresting the hill on the curve she observed a Fire truck traveling N/B with lights and sirens. D1 stated that she began to pull over to the side of the roadway, when D1 stated her vehicle locked up and she collided into the rear driver's side of V2. D2 stated that she was also traveling S/B on N. Kinser Pike, just North of the intersection at W. Skyline Drive. D2 stated that she observed a Fire Truck traveling N/B with lights and sirens activated when she pulled partially off the roadway in the private driveway of 2601 N Kinser Pike. D2 stated that it was at this time V1 collided into the rear driver's side of V2. At this time, based on the driver's statements at the scene that due to D1 improperly attempting to pass V2, and the possibility of a steering malfunction resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

V1, V2, AND V3 WERE TRAVELING NORTHEAST ON PATTERSON DR AT 2ND STREET. ALL THREE VEHICLES STOPPED FOR THE RED LIGHT. V1 STARTED TO GO AND STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR, CAUSING V2 TO STRIKE V3 IN THE REAR.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED BEHIND V2. HE WAS LOOKING AT HIS EMAIL ON HIS PHONE WHILE STOPPED AND MISTOOK THE GREEN TURN ARROW THAT CAME ON AS A GREEN LIGHT. HE THEN STARTED FORWARD AND STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR.D2 AND D3 BOTH STATED THAT THEY WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC AND STRUCK FROM BEHIND.V1 DID STRIKE V2 IN THE REAR, CAUSING V2 TO STRIKE V3 IN THE REAR, CAUSING DAMAGE TO ALL THREE VEHICLES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling N/B on College Mall RD. V2 was traveling S/B on College Mall RD. V1 attempted to turn W/B at the intersection of 2nd & College Mall RD before striking V2.D1 advised that she was traveling N/B when she attempted to turn W/B at the intersection of 2nd & College Mall RD. D1 advised that she thought the traffic control turning signal was yellow when she proceeded through the intersection striking V2. D1 advised that she was not injured. D2 advised that she was traveling S/B on College Mall RD while the traffic control signal was green. D2 advised that she was then struck by V1. D2 advised that she was not injured.Due to the fact that D1 failed to yield right of way, V1 struck V2 causing damage to the vehicle.

V2 WAS PARKED IN THE KROGER PARKING LOT, CLOSEST TO COLLEGE AVE. AT 9:57PM THERE IS A BLACK 4D PASSENGER CAR THAT BACKS INTO V2. V1 DID NOT STOP AFTER THE ACCIDENT. V1 LEFT SOUTH OUT OF THE KROGER PARKING LOT, AND PULLED ONTO S COLLEGE AVE.I REVIEWED THE CAMERA FOOTAGE. I WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE ITS MAKE/MODEL, OR THE LICENSE PLATE.PHOTOGRAPHS FROM V2 WERE TAKEN. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE DRIVERSIDE REAR BUMPER.A CRIMINAL CASE REPORT WAS ALSO CREATED FOR THE LEAVING THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT.

D1 STATED SHE CAME AROUND THE CORNER AT S COLLEGE DR AND W CLEAR CREEK DR THEN RAN OFF THE ROAD JUST AFTER THE CORNER AND HIT THE SPEED LIMIT SIGN AND BUSH. D1 DOES NOT KNOW WHAT CAUSED HER TO RUN OFF THE ROAD.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS ON THE EXIT RAMP FROM I 69, IN THE LANE TO GO WEST ON SR 45. D1 DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 IN THE LANE IN FRONT OF HER, SLOW SIGNIFICANTLY. WHEN D1 NOTICE V2 WAS SLOWED IN FRONT OF HER, SHE ATTEMPTED TO STOP, BUT SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT. V1 REAR ENDED V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS ON THE EXIT RAMP FROM I 69, IN THE LANE TO GO WEST ON SR 45. D2 SLOWED TO CHECK EAST/WEST TRAFFIC, WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON SR 46 AT THE INTERSECTION WITH E 10TH ST BEHIND V2. D1 DIDN'T NOTICE UNTIL TOO LATE THAT V2 HAD STOPPED. V1 REAR ENDED V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON SR 46 AT THE INTERSECTION WITH E 10TH ST. HE OBSERVED TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HIM SLOW TO A STOP, SO D2 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. AT THAT TIME, V1 REAR ENDED V2.

V1 WAS FOUND IN THE SOUTHBOUND LANE OF THE 114.5 MILE MARKER OF I-69. THE VEHICLE APPEARED TO HAVE RAN OFF THE ROAD ON THE RIGHT SIDE, STRINKING A GUARD RAIL. THE VEHICLE THEN CONTINUED SEVERAL FEET BEFORE COMING TO A STOP. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT OCCUPIED UPON OUR ARRIVAL.THE GUARDRAIL WAS HEAVILY DAMAGED. A WITNESS ADVISED THAT HE SAW A WHITE VAN PICK UP AN INDIVIDUAL AND CONTINUE SOUTHBOUND ON TO S IN-37. A BILL OF SALE WAS FOUND IN THE GLOVE COMPARTMENT OF THE VEHICLE, INDICATING IT WAS SOLD TO A SHANDA TIPTON AND KEVAN BUGH, BUT THERE IS NO EVIDENCE TO INDICATE WHO THE DRIVER WAS.

WHILE BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE, UNIT 1 STRUCK UNIT 2 ON THE REAR BUMPER OF BOTH VEHICLES. UNIT 1 STATED THAT DUE TO THE OTHER PASSENGER AND THE 2 DOGS INSIDE OF THE CAB, HE WAS DISTRACTED. IT WAS ALSO BROUGHT UP THAT UNIT 1 COULD HAVE JUST PULLED FORWARD TO LEAVE, BUT DUE TO THE SCHOOL'S PHYSICAL EDUCATION ACTIVITIES IN THE PARKING LOT, THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 HAD TO BACK OUT TO LEAVE. UNIT 1 HAD MOVED TO ANOTHER PARKING SPOT PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL. UNIT 2 WAS UNOCCUPIED.

V1 was traveling north in the left hand lane on South Curry Pike just south of Farmers Ave. V2 was directly beside V1traveling north in the right hand lane on South Curry Pike just south of Farmers Ave. D1 did not see V2 beside him and attempted to make and abrupt turn onto Farmers Ave. V1 struck V2 in the driver side of the vehicle. No injuries were reported.

OWNER OF V2 FOUND NEW DAMAGE TO HER CAR THIS MORNING WHERE IT WAS PARKED, IN FRONT OF 1311 S. ROGERS ST APT B. THERE WAS RED PLASTIC TAIL LIGHT PIECES IN THE LOT, NEAR A SILVER CAR (V1), WHICH BELONGED TO APT A. V1 ALSO HAD DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER REAR CORNER, CONSISTENT WITH THE DAMAGE TO V2. SEVERAL PEOPLE FROM APT A HAD ACCESS TO THE KEYS THIS MORNING, BUT DENY HAVING BACKED INTO V2.NO REPORTED INJURIES.**3/28/19** UPDATED TO INCLUDE D1 INFORMATION, PER PARENT REPORT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was westbound on Vernal Pike when V2 pulled out in front of him from Thomas Road and he was unable to stop in time. D1 also stated that D2 had stated to him that she thought the intersection was a 3-way stop. D2 stated to me that when she pulled onto Vernal Pike, she did not see V2 until she was already in the intersection. She then attempted to swerve out of the way before the collision. D2 also showed pictures of where her vehicle ended up after the collision.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON W SR 45 WHEN IT BEGAN TO STOP TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO S GREENE COUNTY LINE RD. WHILE V1 WAS STOPPED V2, TRAVELING EAST, REAR ENDED V1. D1 ADVISED SHE SIGNALED THE TURN WELL BEFORE THE INTERSECTION. D2 ADVISED THAT D1 NEVER SIGNALED AND SHE STOPPED ABRUBTLY. D2 HAD BRUISING AND ABRASIONS ON HER LOWER RIGHT LEG AND A COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HER NECK.

This accident occurred at the Atwater Parking Lot (800 E Atwater Ave). V1 was parked next to V2 and began turning northeast out of a parking stall. V2 was parked in a parking stall.O2 stated she and W1 were walking to her vehicle when she noticed V1 pulling out of the parking stall. O2 stated V1 was parked on the left of her vehicle. O2 stated that as V1 pulled out of the parking stall, V1 collided with V2. O2 stated that when V1 collided with her vehicle, D1 backed up and attempted to pull out of the parking stall again. O2 stated V1 successfully pulled out of the parking stall the second time. O2 stated she and W1 attempted to alert V1 of the accident but were unsuccessful. V2 had damage to the front driver side bumper.O2 described the offending vehicle as a blue SUV. O2 stated that V1 parks in the lot everyday. O2 stated she would check the lot on 03/27/2019 to see if V1 is located.W1 corroborated O2's story. W1 stated V1 had an "In God We Trust Plate" with the letters Y and H and the number 4. W1 was not able to provide a complete license plate number.On 03/27/2019, the Atwater Parking Lot was checked numerous times for V1. V1 was not located in the parking lot.On 03/28/2019 at 0830 hours, I received an email from O2 advising me that she had found the offending vehicle in the Atwater Parking Lot. In the email, O2 attached a photograph of the vehicle, the license plate and the damage. The vehicle is a 2007 GMC Yukon, bearing IN license plate YHV413. I advised O2 that I would investigate it further when I returned to work on 04/01/2019.On 04/01/2019, I ran the license plate through the BMV Database. I contacted D1 and asked to speak to her in person regarding the incident. D1 admitted to me that she was in possession of the V1 on 03/26/2019. D1 also admitted to me that she was the driver of the V1 when the accident occurred on 03/26/2019. D1 corroborated O2's version of events. D1 admitted to me that as she was traveling northeast attempting to pull out of the parking stall, she collided with V2. D1 stated that she backed her vehicle up after colliding with V2 and took a wider turn in order to pull out of the parking stall. D1 advised that when she collided with V2, she did not think she had caused any damage. However, D1 stated she did not exit her vehicle to check for any damage on V2. D1 also stated she did not check for damage on her vehicle. Throughout our conversation, D1 admitted several times the she was in the wrong for not contacting the police when she collided with V2.After speaking with D1, I went to the Atwater Parking Lot and confirmed the damage on D1's vehicle. The damage was in the rear passenger side wheel well. The damage is consistent with the damage on V2.D1 was issued a misdemeanor citation for leaving the scene of an accident (A-Mis).

This crash occurred on Curry Pike. Curry Pike is a multi-lane, undivided road that primarily runs north and south. The weather was clear at the time of this crash. Vehicle #1, a 2001 Chevrolet 1500 pickup truck was north bound on Curry Pike. Vehicle #1 was in the right lane when he slowed down and attempted to make a U turn in the middle of the road. Vehicle #2 a 2007 Chevrolet 1500 pickup truck was also north bound on Curry Pike in the left lane. Driver #1 did not see vehicle #2, attempted a U turn and was struck by vehicle #2. Driver #1, Sylvester Page stated that he was attempting a U turn on Curry Pike and did not see vehicle #2. As vehicle #1 was in the process of the U turn, it was struck by vehicle #2. Driver #2, James Harris stated that he was north bound on Curry Pike in the left lane. As he approached vehicle #1 who was in the right lane slowing down, vehicle #1 attempted a U turn and turned in front of him. Driver #2 could not avoid a collison with vehicle #1. Evidence on the scene indicates this crash was caused by vehicle #1 making unsafe lane movement.

On March 27th, 2019 at approximately 2020 hours, I, Officer Southern met with Driver 2 of an LSA accident at the police department. Driver 2 stated that he was driving west on State Rd 45 and was attempting to merge into the left lane. Driver 2 stated that a truck in the left lane next to Driver 2 began speeding up and swerved into Driver 2's car and ended up hitting Driver 2's car on the front drivers side quarter panel and the rear drivers side quarter panel. Driver 2 stated that Driver 1 was in a Toyota Tundra but did not get a license plate number or any other vehicle identifiers. Based on Driver 2's statement and the damage to the vehicle, the accident occurred due to Driver 1's unsafe merging into Driver 2's lane.

V1 was traveling northbound on Henderson Street. V2 was traveling eastbound on Atwater Avenue. Both V1 and V2 entered the intersection prior to the crash occurring.D1 said he was traveling northbound on Henderson Street in V1 in the far right lane. D1 said the light was yellow at the intersection of Henderson Street and Atwater Avenue. D1 said he proceeded through the intersection. D1 said as he went through the intersection V2 entered the intersection. D1 said he honked the horn and attempted to brake but was unable to avoid striking V2 with V1. Vehicle incurred damage to the front end. V1 was towed by Hawkins Towing. D2 said he was traveling eastbound on Atwater Avenue in V2 and was in the middle lane. D2 said he assumed the light was green and entered the intersection of Henderson Street and Atwater avenue like normal. D2 said he was two thirds of the way through the intersection when he heard a horn honk. D2 said V2 was truck by V1 in the rear passenger tire, and fender area of V2. V2 also incurred damage on the rear driver side causing V2 tire to go flat. V2 was also towed by Hawkins Towing. There are no witnesses and neither driver admitted responsibility for the crash.

D1 STATED SHE WAS REVERSING OUT OF A PARKING STALL AND DID NOT SEE V2 AND BACKED UP INTO V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT WHEN V1 REVERSED OUT OF THE PARKING STALL AND INTO V2.NO INJURIES REPORTED.V1 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER REAR BUMPER AND V2 HAD MAJOR DAMAGE TO THE ENTIRE PASSENGER SIDE.V2 WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE BY A TOW ARRANGED BY D2.

V1 WAS IN THE DRIVE THRU AT MCDONALDS NORTH FACING EB BEHIND V2. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2. NO VISIBLE DAMAGE WAS SEEN ON V1. D1 ACKNOWLEDGED THAT SHE COLLIDED WITH V2 AND THEN FAILED TO STOP AND PROVIDE INFORMATION. DRIVER DID NOT WISH TO PURSUE CRIMINAL CHARGES AS ALL OF D1 INFORMATION WAS ABLE TO BE OBTAINED.D1 STATED THAT SHE ACKNOWLEDGED THAT SHE COLLIDED BUT THOUGHT D1 GAVE HER A "THUMBS UP" MEANING THERE WAS NO DAMAGE, THEREFORE SHE DID NOT STOP.D2 STATED THAT HIS VEHICLE WAS BUMPED, D1 GAVE HIM A THUMBS UP, THEN FAILED TO STOP AND EXCHANGE INFORMATION AS THEIR WAS DAMAGE TO HIS VEHICLE.

State Road 45 is a multiple lane state highway and in this area runs east and west. It is divided by a raised curb. Liberty Drive is a local city street that primarily runs north and south. Vehicle #1 a gray 2008 Subaru Legacy was south bound on Liberty Drive attempting to turn right (west) onto State Road 45. The light for Liberty Drive was red. Vehicle #1 pulled onto SR 45, did not see vehicle #2 who was west bound on SR 45 and collided with it. Vehicle #2 a gray 2008 Pontiac Vibe was west bound on State Road 45 when vehicle #1 pulled off of Liberty Drive and collided with vehicle #2.Driver #1 Alan Belth stated that he was attempting to turn right onto SR 45 from Liberty Drive. Driver #1 added that his light was red and he did not see vehicle #2 coming. As vehicle #1 pulled onto SR 45 it collided with vehicle #2.Driver #2 Robert Mullen stated that he was west bound on SR 45 when Vehicle #1 pulled onto SR 45 from Liberty Driver and the vehicles collided. Driver #1 added that his light was green. Evidence on the scene indicates that vehicle #1 failed to yield at the traffic control device and pulled out in front of vehicle #2. Vehicle #2 was towed by Sturgis Towing.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS EAST BOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVENUE APPROACHING N ROGERS ST. D1 DID NOT SEE THAT VEHICLE 2 HAD ENTERED THE ROADWAY FROM AN ADJACENT PARKING LOT. WHEN D1 NOTICED V2 IN HER LANE, SHE ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE LEFT, BUT COULD NOT AVOID COLLIDING WITH V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE EXITED THE PARKING LOT ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF KIRKWOOD AND TURNED EAST ONTO THE ROADWAY. AS VEHICLE 2 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, IT WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

Witness Trent Higgins was traveling behind Vehicle #1, heading west on State Road 46, when Vehicle #1 crossed over the center line and went off the south side of the roadway. Witness Higgins said it appeared the driver fell asleep.Neither the driver or passenger claimed any injuries at the time of the crash.The driver stated the vehicle was insured through JD Byrider but she didn't know the name of the insurance company.

D2 STATED SHE WAS SLOWED AND ALMOST STOPPED AT 2920 S LEONARD SPRINGS RD DUE TO MAKING A RIGHT HAND TURN INTO THE BUSINESS AND THAT'S WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2.D1 STATED THAT HE DIDN'T REALIZE SHE WAS SLOWING DOWN AND ALMOST STOPPED. D1 STATED WHEN HE SAW V2 BRAKE LIGHTS HE SLAMMED ON V1 BRAKES BUT DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH ROOM AND V1 REAR ENDED V2.NO INJURIES REPORTED.V1 WAS TOWED DUE TO MAJOR DISABLING DAMAGE AND V2 WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE WITH MAJOR REAR END DAMAGE.

D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT FACING EASTBOUND AT THE INTERSECTION OF WEST BLOOMFIELD RD AND SOUTH OAKDALE DR WHEN V1 REAR ENDED HER.D2 STATED V1 THEN MOVED OVER INTO THE OTHER LANE AND CONTINUED EASTBOUND ON WEST BLOOMFIELD RD. D2 STATED IT WAS AN OLDER TAN COLORED JEEP WITH A WHITE MALE DRIVING AND MULTIPLE OTHER INDIVIDUALS INSIDE THE VEHICLE.D2 DID GET A PICTURE OF V1 BUT THE PICTURE IS BLURRY AND A LICENSE PLATE CAN'T BE SEEN. THAT PHOTOGRAPH AND PHOTOGRAPHS OF V2 WERE LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.THERE WERE NO INJURIES REPORTED AND V2 SUFFERED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER.D1 WAS LATER FOUND AND I WAS ABLE TO OBTAIN THE INFORMATION TO COMPLETE THIS REPORT. D2 WAS NOTIFIED BY TELEPHONE OF THE INFORMATION AS WELL.

Both V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on E. 3rd Street. V1 was in the outside (left, or south) lane to go westbound and V2 was in the inside (right, or north) lane to go westbound. V1 merged into V2 lane of travel causing vehicles to collide. D1 said he was traveling west on E. 3rd Street in V1 and was in the outside lane of travel. D1 said V2 was on the inside lane of travel. D1 said he was wanting to pull into the first entrance for the Circle K located at E. 3rd Street and Indiana Avenue. D1 said as he approached he turned on his passenger side turn signal to merge over into the inside lane to turn into the Circle K. D1 said when he merged V1 was struck by V2. V1 had damage to the rear passenger side quarter panel. D2 said he was traveling westbound on E. 3rd Street in V2 and was in the inside lane. D2 said V1 was traveling on the outside lane. D2 said he could not see due to being in a blind spot if V1 had its turn signal on. D2 said V1 cut in front of him to change lanes. D2 said V1 and V2 struck. D2 said the incident happened very quickly. V2 had minimal damage to the front driver side bumper.

V1 WAS DISCOVERED TO BE INVERTED APPROX 25 FEET OFF WEST STATE ROAD 45 IN THE YARD OF 8840 UPON MY ARRIVAL TO SCENE. AFTER INVERTING V1 CAUGHT ON FIRE BUT WAS QUICKLY CONTAINED BY THE FIRE DEPT. D1 LOST CONSCIOUSNESS BEFORE MY ARRIVAL AND WAS ENTRAPTED IN V1. I SPOKE WITH A WITNESS WHO STATED THEY WERE DIRECTLY BEHIND V1 WHILE TRAVELING WEST BOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 45. THE WITNESS STATED V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY IN FRONT OF THEM. AFTER DOING SO V1 WENT DOWN A SMALL HILL AND HIT A TREE. THIS CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO OVERTURN. MEDICAL PERSONNEL BELIEVED D1 POSSIBLY SUFFERED A MEDICAL PROBLEM WHILE DRIVING.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN

V1 and V2 were backing from parking spaces in a private lot. V1 struck V2 as it backed out.D1 stated she was backing from her parking spot and struck V2 as it was backing from a parking spot.D2 stated that he was backing from a parking spot and had stopped to pull forward when he was struck by V1.W1 stated that she observed V2 back from its spot and had stopped to pull forward. V1 then backed from its spot and struck V2 while it was stopped.V1 did strike V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

Owner of V2 showed me V2, which had damage to the rear driver side bumper. There was no paint transfer, but there was a gash.A witness left a note saying the license plate may be; CV972. I was unable to get a return through Indiana. They did not leave any contact information, or vehicle description. I completed a criminal case for the leaving the scene of an accident.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 446 WHEN A TRUCK TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND WAS IN OPPOSING LANE OF TRAVEL. DRIVER 1 STATED HE SWERVED TO AVOID CONTACT AND RAN OFF THE ROAD INTO THE DITCH. NO DESCRIPTION OF THE TRUCK WAS ABLE TO BE OBTAINED.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTION.VEHICLE 1 WAS NOT DRIVABLE AND TOWED BY KENS WESTIDE.

V1 was traveling southbound on Walnut Street and V2 was traveling Westbound on E Hillside Drive through the intersection when D1 ran the red light and struck D2. D1 stated that she was traveling southbound on Walnut St but could not remember what happened before the collision. D2 stated that she was traveling westbound on E Hillside Drive and was almost through the intersection and had a green light when D1 struck her vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 2 stated she was east on 10th Street approaching the intersection with Lincoln when she saw that Driver 1 started to pull in front of her. Driver 2 stated that she attempted to avoid the collision but it was too late and she could not. Driver 1 and Driver 2 collided. Driver 2 did not have a stop sign.Driver 1 stated that he was north on Lincoln and stopped at the stop sign at 10th St. He stated that he didn't see Driver 2 and began to pull into the intersection. Driver 1 collided with Driver 2. Driver 1 did not have the right-of-way.Driver 2 did suffer an abrasion to her right arm but refused medical at the scene.

D1 ADVISED HE WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF A DUMPSTER ON THE EAST SIDE OF 503 W KIRKWOOD. V1 THEN STARTED TO REVERSE OUT OF THE PARKING AREA, AS V1 WAS REVERSING, D1 TRIED TO SWING WIDE TO GET OUT FROMT HE AREA OF THE DUMPSTER, WHEN HE STRUCK V2. D1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE V2 PAKRED BEHIND HIM. D2 STATED HE HAD BEEN INSIDE OF THE V2, HOWEVER V2 WAS PARKED AND TURNED OFF. D2 STATED V2 WAS PARKED A CAR LENGTH BEHIND V1. D2 STATED HE LEFT PLENTY OF SPACE FOR V1 TO GET OUT. V1 STRUCK V2 ON THE PASSNEGER SIDE FRONT BUMPER. V1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE TIRE AREA OF THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE.

Officer Mark Norris took pictures and measurements of V2.On 03/28/2019 at 1723 hours I was dispatched to the Fee parking garage on 709 N. Fee Lane in reference to a hit and run accident property damage only. V2 had been parked in the Fee parking garage on the fourth floor from 0730 hours until around 1630 hours. D2 left the garage in V2 around 1630 hours to go back to his residence during a break from work. When D2 was back at his residence he noticed damage on the driver's side of V2 on the quarter panel extending onto the front driver's side door. The damage was a large dent. There was no paint transfer from V1 on the vehicle of V2. D2 stated that he drove back to the garage after his break and contacted IUPD of a hit and run. D2 stated that he had been parked on the fourth floor of the parking garage all day and someone must have struck his vehicle with their vehicle. V2 was parked backed into a parking spot facing south. D2 stated that V2 was parked three or four spots west from the lane of travel inside of the garage. It is believed that V1 was rounding a corner to travel westbound on the fourth level in the garage when V1 struck V2. At this time there is no evidence of what kind of vehicle struck V2. There is also no time frame as to when V2 was struck. D2 believes that V2 was struck sometime between 0730 hours and 0430 hours inside the parking garage. There are no cameras inside of the parking garage on the fourth floor.Pictures and measurements of the vehicle were taken. The point of impact on V2 was 18.5 inches from the ground. Pictures of the damage of V2 have been submitted into evidence.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST APPROACHING THE STOP LIGHT AT THE INTERCHANGE FOR 3RD ST AND I69. V2 WAS IN THE TURN LANE TO THE LEFT OF V1 SLIGHLY BEHIND V1. DRIVER OF V1 STATED HE WENT TO CHANGE LANES FROM THE STRAIGHT LANE TO THE TURN LANE AND FAILED TO SEE V2. DRIVER OF V2 STATED SHE WAS APPROACHING THE STOP LIGHT IN THE TURN LANE WHEN V1 PULLED IN FRONT OF HER. V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE FRONT RIGHT PORTION OF V2. V1 was parked in a parking spot approximately 50 feet northeast of V2. V1 was backing out of the parking spot in the southwest direction. V1 changed directions while backing, now traveling south, and collided with V2. The left rear portion of V1 struck the left rear portion of V2 during the collision. V2 was parked at the time facing south with no occupants in the vehicle. D1 then moved V1 into a parking spot across the alley directly south of V2. D1 left his contact and insurance information on the windshield of V2 and waited for IUPD to arrive. I left my business card with the case report number on the windshield of V2 with a note for the owner of V2 to call me.D2 made contact with me at a later date through email and provided the insurance company, policy number, and information of the vehicle owner.

Tawny Ramsey reported that Cody Porter was backing out of a parking space next to her van after a domestic disturbance. Ramsey reported that Porter hit the rear passengers side fender area as he was backing out. Porter left the scene without stopping.

D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE WHERE V2 HAD COME FROM.V2 WAS STOPPED AT THE OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL OF THE INTERSECTION OF S. COLLEGE MALL RD. AND E. COVENANTER DR. FACING EAST ON E. COVENATER DR. V2 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION TO TURN LEFT ONTO S. COLLEGE MALL RD. AND TRAVEL NORTH. FACING EAST WAITING FOR THE OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL TO CHANGE. D2 STATED THAT THE LIGHT CHANGED AND HE HAD A GREEN ARROW TO TURN LEFT. V1 was going north on Union St approaching 10th St. V2 was also going north on Union St approaching 10th St.D1 stated she was going north on Union St and saw that the light was green at the intersection of 10th St and Union St. D1 stated that she did not realize that V2 was slowing down to turn and she collided with her rear bumper.D2 stated he was going north on Union St about to turn east onto 10th St. D2 stated that he slowed down to let pedestrians cross the street before he made his turn. NARRATIVE:A 2-vehicle crash occurred on Interstate 69 south bound, south of the Tapp Road exit near mile marker 115. I69 is a divided 6-lane north-south highway, which connects Evansville and Indianapolis by way of Bloomington. The center median is paved with a permanent concrete barrier topped by reflectors, separating the north and south lanes of traffic. Both shoulders are paved and approximately one car-width, with the left bounded by the center concrete divider wall and the right lane bounded by a metal guard rail. The shoulder on both sides of the driving lanes are delineated with a white reflective painted fog line. The lanes of travel are divided by a broken white lines in this area. West Tapp Road, a 2-way paved city road, passes over I69 by way of an overpass approximately 1000 feet to the north of where the collision occurred. The roadway on the morning of Friday, March 29, 2018 was cloudy, with roads wet from earlier rain and mist. There were no signs of fluids or foreign substances on the roadway. Vehicle 1 (V1), was a blue 2006 International Harvester 2-door tractor (MI registration RA65675), pulling a flatbed 1995 trailer (MI registration C258089) containing a load of telephone poles. Vehicle 2 (V2) was a 2016 4-door blue Ford Fusion passenger car. Debris from V2 colliding with the center concrete barrier was present and scattered behind V2 on the inner shoulder of the highway. V2 had come to rest perpendicular to and facing into the concrete median on the inside shoulder, while V1 had come to a controlled stop on the outer shoulder approximately one quarter mile south. I made contact with both drivers and received verbal confirmation that neither were injured. Both individuals were standing outside of V2 when I arrived. Driver 2 (D2) stated that he had "A little tightness between his shoulder blades' but was otherwise okay. Driver 1 (D1) stated that he was uninjured and that his vehicle had not sustained any damage. Both drivers refused medical treatment. V2 sustained damage to the entire front end, doors, and rear end. The rear bumper was ripped off and parts of the rear bumper and undercarriage were dragging on the roadway. The airbags did not deploy. The rear trunk and front left door were buckled, to the extent that neither would open. The windows and windshield were not broken. The portion of the rear bumper with the license plate was torn off by the impact with the wall. D1 stated that he had been driving straight in the center lane proceeding southbound at approximately 55 miles per hour when he began to change lanes into the right lane of traffic, nearest the outside shoulder. As he conducted the lane change, he did not notice the adjacent car off to the front right corner of his cab and merged, striking the left rear corner of V2 with the right front corner of his bumper. He stated that he was alerted to the other car by the sounds of screeching tires and became aware of the vehicle in front of him, spinning out of control and passing in front of, to the left of, and behind him before striking the inner wall. D2 corroborated this story, stating that he had felt the impact of the truck's bumper pushing his back end to the right. This caused his car to spin out, passing in front of the truck and into the passing (left) lane facing northbound while sliding backwards. He then continued to rotate counter-clockwise, skidding into the wall, with the back end of the vehicle striking the wall first. The car then sharply rotated another 180 degrees counterclockwise and impacted the wall again, coming to rest in that position.From investigation of damage pattern, debris field, physical damage to V2, as well as oral interviews with the drivers, it is likely that the following incident occurred: V1 was driving southbound in the center lane, while V2 was adjacent and just ahead of him in the right most lane. V1 attempted to change lanes into the right lane, striking the left rear quarter panel of V2 and causing him

V1 was traveling westbound on Lost Mans Lane near the intersection of Truesdel Drive when it collided with a tree. Upon my arrival, there was no driver in the vehicle. I attempted to make contact with the vehicle owner at his home but didn't appear to be a valid address. Vehicle did have heavy front end damage and was towed.

D1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E SR 45, WENT AROUND A CORNER AND DUE TO SLICK/SNOWY ROADS SLID OFF OF THE ROADWAY TO THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF THE ROAD AND THROUGH THE FENCE OF 7020 E SR 45. V1 ENDED UP IN THE FIELD INSIDE OF THE LAND OWNERS FENCE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 was traveling southbound on I69 just south of milemarker 131. Driver 1 stated he was in the left hand land and began to proceed into the right hand lane to avoid the ditch of the left lane. Driver 1 stated he was traveling approximately 56 MPH. Driver 1 stated when he proceeded into the right hand lane he began to lose control of his vehicle and struck the guardrail. Once he struck the guardrail he further lost control and crossed both lanes before running off the roadway. Driver 1 declined medical personnel. Vehicle 1 sustained rear passenger damage and was towed by Hawkins.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH ON S OLD SR 37, UNIT 1 STATED HE DROVE THROUGH AN AREA OF STANDING WATER THAT WAS ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. AFTER LEAVING THE ROADWAY, UNIT 2 STRUCK A UTILITY POLE, SNAPPING IT IN HALF. UNIT 1 THEN CONTINUED THROUGH A FENCE, DAMAGING APPROXIMATELY 40 FT OF FENCING, BEFORE COMING TO A REST IN A FIELD. THE VEHICLE WAS APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET OFF OF THE ROADWAY. DUE TO THE DAMAGE ON THE UTILITY POLE, THERE WERE NO CLEAR INDICATORS OF WHAT COMPANY OWNED THE POLE, BUT MONROE COUNTY CENTRAL DISPATCH ADVISED SMITHVILLE OF THE INCIDENT. THE PROPERTY OWNER OF THE FENCE WAS ALSO ON SCENE AND SPOKE WITH THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ABOUT THEIR CONTACT INFORMATION.

Weather and Roadway Conditions-Snowing, dark, roadway slick and snow covered.Primary Cause and contributory cause-Vehicle 1 was traveling too fast for the current roadway conditions and ran off roadway.Vehicle 1 was traveling northbound on I69 just south of the 106.5 mile marker in the right lane. Vehicle 1 traveled into a slight curve to the right and started to lose control. The rear of Vehicle 1 started to rotate counter clock-wise. Vehicle 1 continued to rotate counter clock-wise until it was completely sideways with the passenger side doors facing northbound. At this point, Vehicle 1 left the roadway and struck the beginning of a guard rail with its front right fender. This impact caused the rear of Vehicle 1 to continue to rotate counter clock-wise until it was traveling backwards into the ditch. Vehicle 1 came to final rest a short time later in the ditch facing in a southwestern manner.Driver 1 stated that he noticed that the roadway was starting to get slick and reduced speed. Driver 1 said that even after dropping speed, he felt that the rear of his vehicle was unstable. Driver 1 indicated that at one point, he felt the rear of Vehicle 1 start to rotate counter clock-wise. Driver 1 stated that shortly after that he lost control of the vehicle.Observations-I observed tire tacks in the dirt/gravel that show the path of travel of Vehicle 1 into the guard rail and to final rest into the ditch. Approximately 15 feet of the guard rail was completely removed and curled up. Vehicle 1 had heavy damage to the passenger side of the vehicle. Vehicle 1's windows was shattered on the passenger side. Passengers1) Linda Alms (Wife)2) Amy Alms (Daughter)Driver 1 and the 2 passengers reported no injuries.Enforcement Actions-Driver 1 was cited for Speed Too Fast for Current Conditions (IC 9-21-5-4). Driver 1 stated that he understood why he was receiving the citation. A damage tag was placed on the guardrail.

Unit 1 was moving eastbound in the parking lot of Kroger (clear Creek). As unit 1 turned into a parking space, they turned at a very bad angle of approach, resulting in Unit 1 striking unit 2 on the rear drivers side. Small dent and paint damage

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THEY PARKED THEIR VEHICLE AT 302 S COLLEGE AVENUE AROUND 1:00 PM ON MARCH 30, 2019 AND WHEN THEY RETURNED TO THEIR CAR AROUND 4:00 PM ON THE SAME DAY, THERE WAS DAMAGE TO V2'S REAR BUMPER. UNIT 1 AND DRIVER 1 IDENTIFIED AS WINTER, EDWARD WERE TRAVELING EAST ON ST. RD. 46 WHEN AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE MOVED LEFT OF CENTER, CAUSING UNIT 1 TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY. UNIT 1 DROVE THROUGH LIVESTOCK FENCING AND INTO A FLOODED PASTURE.

D1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON W STATE ROAD 46, AND WAS TURNING LEFT ONTO W ARLINGTON ROAD. D1 HAD A GREEN LIGHT ALSO, BUT NEEDED TO YIELD TO D2 WHO WAS TURNING. WHEN D1 FAILED TO YIELD TO D2, D2 COLLIDED WITH D1'S FRONT PASSENGER DOOR.D1 THEN INITIALLY DROVE OFF, LEAVING THE SCENE, BUT EVENTUALLY STOPPED AND SPOKE WITH D2. Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON I-69 NORTH WHEN IT LOST CONTROL, BEGAN TO SPIN, AND STRUCK THE CONCRETE MEDIAN BARRIER WALL.D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 45-50 MPH, DUE TO WEATHER, NORTH ON I-69 NORTH WHEN SHE LOST CONTROL OF V1. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was turning South from the McDonald's parking lot (located at 1919 S Walnut Street). Vehicle 2 was traveling Southbound on Walnut Street, merging into a center turn lane to turn into Starbucks (located at 1921 S Walnut Street). Vehicle 1 collided with Vehicle 2 while both vehicles were in the center turn lane.Driver 1 stated that he did not see Vehicle 2 and stated that he had no place to go.Driver 2 stated that she was turning into Starbucks when Vehicle 1 came out of the McDonald's parking lot, causing the accident.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON I-69 AT THE 130 MILE MARKER, UNIT 1 BEGAN TO PASS A SLOWER MOVING VEHICLE. WHILE RETURNING TO THE RIGHT HAND LANE, UNIT 1 LOST CONTROL AND IMPACTED THE GUARD RAIL FACE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE INTERSTATE. UNIT 1 CONTINUED BACK ACROSS ACROSS THE INTERSTATE TO THE WEST SIDE AND IMPACTED THE GUARD RAIL ON THE WEST SIDE. THE VEHICLE THEN CAME TO A REST AGAINST THE WEST GUARD RAIL. THERE WAS DAMAGE SUSTAINED TO BOTH THE FRONT AND REAR SIDES OF THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER, MR. DARNELL DAVIS, AND A PASSERBY HAD MATCHING STORIES OF THE INCIDENT. ALL 7 OCCUPANTS WERE LOCATED IN ANOTHER VEHICLE ON SCENE SO THEY COULD STAY DRY/WARM. THIS VEHICLE STOPPED TO ASSIST THE FAMILY. THERE WERE 5 CHILDREN THAT OCCUPIED THE BACK SEAT OF THE NISSAN ALTIMA PASSENGER CAR. I DID NOT LOCATE ANY CAR SEATS FOR THE CHILDREN. ALL 7 OCCUPANTS WERE TRANSPORTED TO IU BLOOMINGTON HEALTH FOR TREATMENT. IT WAS REPORTED TO ME, BY MR. DAVIS, THAT HE WAS THE ONLY ONE THAT DID NOT SUFFER AN INJURY. MR. DAVIS WAS GIVEN 5 CITATIONS DUE TO THE LACK OF CHILD RESTRAINT SYSTEMS.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 03/30/2019 at 02:04AM I was dispatched to the area of 430 East Kirkwood Ave in reference to a vehicle accident. I was advised that one of the vehicles involved was a blue dodge dart and that the driver would be waiting in the area. Once I reached this location I spoke with Tam Jules, he stated he was stopped in traffic facing east in front of 430 E. Kirkwood when a dark blue or dark colored Buick pulled around him. He stated that the car pulled in front of him and as he done so he struck the front drivers side corner panel and bumper causing light damage to both. Jules said the driver was a white male that was heavy set. As Jules got out to talk with the male, Jules said the male became very confrontational with and and then shortly left the area without providing him with any information. Jules said he vehicle left east bound from his location. I then completed a vehicle accident field report and provided that to Jules, I asked officer Doyle to assist with this case by checking the area for the suspect vehicle. Officer Doyle was unable to locate the vehicle at this time. I advised Jules that his accident report would be updated once the other driver is located and that I would also be completing a sate crash report for this case. This was my only involvement with this case.

Owner of vehicle one believes someone hit her car but is not sure when or where. The vehicle has damage to the rear driver's side. Vehicle owner stated that she though the accident may have occurred while parked at work however after reviewing video surveillance she does not think the accident happened there.Vehicle owner believed a neighbor may have hit her car while parking behind her. After speaking with the neighbor and possible people driving the vehicle I was not able to determine if the two vehicles were involved in an accident or not. Vehicle owner believes the accident may have happened on 03/31/2019 at night but is not positive when. I spoke with other neighbors in the area and there are no witnesses to the accident.At this time it is unknown when or where the accident may have occurred, however Vehicle 1 does have damage that would be consistent with damage from a motor vehicle accident.

Driver 1 stated she was turning left from eastbound 3rd St onto Heritage Rd. Driver 2 stated he was southbound on Heritage Rd approaching 3rd St. Driver 1 stated when she turned left onto Heritage Rd she drove across vehicle 2's travel lane and collided with the front of vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated he was approaching the stop sign at 3rd St but had not reached it yet and was still rolling to a stop when vehicle 1 drove across his path as it was turning left from 3rd St and collided with his car.

All 3 vehicles were traveling west on 3rd St in the right hand lane. Vehicle 3 was in the front followed by vehicle 2 and then vehicle 1. At the intersection of 3rd St and the north bound on ramp to State Rd 37 all three vehicles were attempting to continue west on 3rd St. All three driver's stated the light at the intersection was green and traffic was congested and moving at slow speeds. Driver of Vehicle 1 stated that vehicle 2 came to a sudden stop in the intersection and he was unable to avoid rear ending vehicle 2. After Vehicle 1 hit vehicle 2 and pushed vehicle 2 into vehicle 3. Driver of vehicle 2 confirmed the events given by driver of vehicle 1. Driver of vehicle 3 was unsure how the accident occurred. Vehicle 1 had minor damage to the front driver's side. Vehicle 2 had significant damage to the rear and vehicle 3 had no damage that was seen. No injuries were reported from this accident. Vehicle 2 was towed from the scene due to damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was headed East on E Cathcart St, approaching S Sare Rd. D2 was headed South on S Sare Rd, approaching E Cathcart St. D1 attempted to make a left hand turn onto S Sare Rd, and as he did he entered and stopped in the S/B lane of travel of S Sare Rd, causing a collision between the left front of V1 and the right front of V2. D1 stated that he was headed East on E Cathcart St, approaching S Sare Rd. D1 stated that he attempted to make a left hand turn onto S Sare Rd, and had pulled up, possibly into the S/B lane of travel of S Sare Rd. D1 stated that he saw V2 approaching and had a feeling he was going to get hit. At this time V2 struck V1 in the left front. D2 stated that she was headed South on S Sare Rd, approaching E Cathcart St. D2 stated that as she approached the intersection she saw V1 pull into her lane of travel and stop. D2 stated that she tried to avoid V1 by slamming on her brakes, however she was unable to stop in time. At this time V2 struck V1 in the front left side. It should be noted that during the investigation of the accident I did observe the S/B lane of travel and saw approximately 20 feet of skid marks from V2, indicating her intent to avoid V1.
