On 04/02/2019, I was dispatched to 2222 E 10th Street reference an accident that occurred on 10th Street and the Indiana Rail Road bridge just east of Jefferson Street. V1 was traveling southwest on 10th Street approaching Jefferson Street. V1 is a 2014 Caterpillar Backhoe LoaderD1 stated he was traveling southwest on 10th Street approaching the rail road underpass in a Caterpillar 430F Backhoe when he lowered the backhoe in order to go under the underpass. D1 stated as he went under the underpass, the backhoe struck the bridge. D1 stated he did not lower the backhoe enough in order to clear the rail road underpass. D1 stated that when the collision occurred, the Caterpillar 430F came to an abrupt stop and sent W1 into the windshield. D1 stated W1 was sitting down next to him. V1 is a one person vehicle. D1 stated W1 injured his face and knee in the collision. V1 did not appear to have damage from the collision.W1 corroborated D1's version of events. W1 stated his head hit the windshield when the Caterpillar Backhoe Loader struck the underpass. W1 had a laceration to his forehead, nose and left knee. W1 refused to go to the hospital with the ambulance.Photographs were taken and are attached to the case.There is a posted sign which lists the clearance of the bridge east of the sign. The clearance for the bridge is listed at 11'

Driver of Vehicle 1 stated he was driving east on SR45 E when he looked away momentarily, he stated he was not aware of the sharp curve in front of him and became airborne before he knew what had happened. The vehicle ended up on its side in a field located at 5890 E SR 45. The vehicle caught fire as the driver exited the vehicle. Vehicle was a total loss due to fire.
BOTH DRIVERS STATED THAT V2 WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT WHEN V1 BACKED OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT, INTO V2.

I was traveling south on Curry Pike near the intersection of Gifford Dr. I observed V1 stuck on the railroad track with vehicle damage.D1 stated that he had miss judge the turn and crashed onto the railroad tracks. D1 had been drinking and was transported to Bloomington Police Department for and OWI investigation.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: TRAFFIC WAS STOPPED ON STATE ROAD 46 HEADING WEST NEAR THE LIGHT OF UNION VALLEY RD. ALL PARTIES STATED THAT TRAFFIC WAS STOPPED IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE OF WESTBOUND TRAFFIC AND AN OPENING WAS MADE FOR V1 TO TURN INTO CVS. V1 PROCEEDED ACROSS BOTH LANES NOT CHECKING THE NORTHERN LANE. AS V1 WAS CORSSING THE NORTHERN LANE V2 COLLIDED WITH V1. V1 ROLLED AND LANDED ON IT'S ROOF.

WHLE TRAVELING NORTH ON SR 37, SOUTH OF THE MONROE DAM ROAD EXIT, THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT A PIECE OF DEBRIS FELL OFF OF A TRAILER THAT WAS ALSO TRAVELING NORTH AND STRUCK THE FRONT OF UNIT 1. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT SHE PULLED OVER AND CALLED DISPATCH, WHO THEN ADVISED HER TO MAKE A REPORT AT A LATER TIME. THE INCIDENT OCCURED AT APPROXIMATELY 4:10 PM ON 04/02/2019 AND I TOOK THE REPORT ON 04/03/2019 AT 4:43 PM. I DID OBSERVE SCRATCHES AND A SMALL CRACK ON THE FRONT BUMPER ON THE PASSENGER SIDE. I CANNOT DETERMINE THAT THE DAMAGE WAS CASUED FROM THE INCIDENT DUE TO THE TIME DIFFERENCE. THE DRIVER DID GIVE A LICENSE PLATE OF THE TRAILER AS K340527, BUT I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIND A RETURN FROM THE INBMV. ALL OF THE INFORMATION IN THIS REPORT WAS TAKEN FROM THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was eastbound on E. 3rd Street continuing through the intersection with S. Woodscrest Drive. Driver 1 of Vehicle 1 stated that she continued through the light as it was turning yellow.Vehicle 2 was facing westbound on E. 3rd Street in the left turn lane to turn south on S. Woodscrest Drive. As Vehicle 2 turned left/south onto Woodscrest on the yellow light, Vehicle 2 was struck by Vehicle 1.Witness 1 was westbound on E. 3rd Street, in the southern most westbound lane, coming to a stop at the yellow light as he witnessed the collision. Witness 2 was stopped at the red light facing northbound on S. Woodscrest at E. 3rd Street where she witnessed the collision.

V1 WAS PARKED FACING W/B IN THE DAIRY QUEEN PARKING LOT. V2 WAS PARKED DIAGONALLY BEHIND V1 IN A PARKING STAHL. AS V1 BACKED UP, IT STRUCK V2 ON THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT DOOR AND CORNER PANEL, LEAVING DAMAGE. D2 WAS STANDING IN LINE AT DAIRY QUEEN, WHEN SHE OBSERVED THE INCIDENT. D2 STATED A TALL WHITE MALE, WEARING A PURPLE SWEATSHIRT AND BLUE JEANS EXITED THE VEHICLE, LOOKED AT THE DAMAGE, THEN FLED THE SCENE SOUTHBOUND. NO OTHER VEHICLE INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE FOR V1, OTHER THAN A BLUE SUBARU LEGACY. ON APRIL 13TH 2019 I REVISED THE ACCIDENT NUMBER FROM B19-12380 (INCORRECT) TO THE CORRECT NUMBER B19-13280.

Vehicle 3 was stopped or slowed in traffic. Vehicle 3 was struck from behind by Vehicle 2. Driver 3 of Vehicle 3 advised no damage and left prior to making report. Vehicle 2 was stopped or slowed in traffic. Vehicle 2 was struck from behind by Vehicle 1, which caused Vehicle 2 to roll forward into Vehicle 3. Vehicle 2 sustained damage to both the front and rear of the vehicle as a result of the collision. Vehicle 1 was slowing in traffic and struck the rear of stopped or slowed Vehicle 2.

On 04/03/2019, while on patrol, I saw a red Ford Focus Zipcar rental car parked and unoccupied off the road and on the grass near 1801 E 7th Street, Beech Hall, Union Street Apartments. The vehicle was unoccupied and had damage to the front passenger side. An adjacent sign post for Zipcar Parking was bent northwest and twisted. I observed skid marks where it appears that the Zipcar accelerated out of the parking space on the north side of East 7th Street, hopped the curb, traveled over the sidewalk, struck the sign post with the front passenger side quarter panel and continued on, causing damage to the front passenger quarter panel, wheel well and the leading edge of the passenger side front door. Officer Pesa arrived on scene and contacted Zipcar. They advised that they could not provide Officer Pesa with any further information at the time other than to say that they were informed of the crash at 1634 hours. I had dispatch issue a case number and this case number was provided to Zipcar. When I obtain further information from them, I will supplement this case. The vehicle came to a rest out of the roadway and was not blocking the sidewalk. Zipcar advised that they would send a team to retrieve the vehicle and get it back into a space or towed for repairs.

V1 and V2 were sitting on Woodlawn facing North at the stop light for 17th Street. Both vehicles were in the turn lane to turn West on 17th Street. D1 and D2 stated that there was an IU campus bus on 17th Street attempting to turn South on Woodlawn. D1 stated that he started to back up in order to give the bus room to turn. D1 stated that V2 did not start moving and struck V2. D2 stated that V1 backed up and struck the passenger side of the front bumper with the hitch of V1. There was no damage to V1. V2 had a crack in the front bumper.

D1 stated he was traveling east when V2 suddenly stopped. D1 stated he rear ended V2. D2 stated he was traveling eastbound and approached a vehicle stopped in the middle of the roadway. D2 stated the vehicle did not have it's hazards on and caused D2 to slam on his breaks causing V1 to rear end him. A passenger in V2 had a complaint of pain but refused medical services at the time of the accident.

V2 was traveling southwest on SR 45/46, approaching 17th St. V1 was also traveling southwest on SR 45/46, approaching 17th St behind V2. V1 struck the rear passenger side bumper of V2, with the front driver side bumper. D1 stated he was traveling behind V2 approaching 17th and the Bypass. D1 stated V2 began to stop rapidly, approximately 100 ft north of the intersection, because of traffic coming to a stop. D1 stated when he realized traffic was coming to a stop, he slammed on his breaks but could not stop in time. D1 stated he veered to the right slightly, but could not switch lanes because there were cars in the right lane. D2 stated she was traveling in front of V1 and noticed traffic was coming to a stop. D2 stated she came to a stop and that is when V1 struck her from behind. V1 was towed due to airbag deployment and disabling damage. There were no injuries reported on scene.

Both vehicles were traveling south on Jordan Avenue approaching 10th Street. V2 came to a stop in traffic. V1 was unable to come to a stop quick enough and rear ended V2 at approximately 5 miles per hour. Although there was very minor damage to both vehicles, D2 requested a report. D1 stated she had to come to an abrupt stop in traffic and was unable to stop in time. D1 stated she was not traveling at a very high rate of speed. V1 had a minor scratch on the front bumper and a cracked left fog light. D2 stated he also came to an abrupt stop due to traffic. D2 stated then V1 rear ended V2 at a low rate of speed, approximately 5 miles per hour. V2 had very little cosmetic damage to the rear bumper.Both drivers stated they did not need medical attention.

V1 and V2 were on the south side of Memorial stadium in the parking lot. V1 was in a parking spot facing North. V2 was driving through the parking lot heading East. D1 stated that she started to back out of the parking spot and did not notice V2 was coming behind her. D1 stated that since she did not see V2 she proceeded to back out and struck the drivers side door of V2 with the bumper of V1. D2 stated that she was heading East out of the parking lot. D2 stated that she also did not see V1 backing out. V1 has damage to the bumper and V2 has damage to the drivers side door.
V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON I69 NEAR MM 109 AND HIT A LARGE TURKEY WHICH DAMAGED HIS WINDSHIELD.NO DIAGRAM NEEDED FOR THIS CRASH.

I spoke with owner of V2 Nicholas Irmscher who reported this hit and run accident on 4/10/2019. Irmscher said the incident initially occurred on 04/04/2019 between 9:00am and 6:00pm, but was unable to give an exact time frame when the incident occurred. Irmscher was unable to give an exact area of where the crash occurred, but based on directions, and description given, possibly occurred in the Students Informatics Study Building Parking Lot located at 821 E. 10th Street. Irmscher said his vehicle (V2) was parked on the north side of the building stationary in the parking lot. When he came outside he observed damage to the driver side door where white paint transfer was visible. When speaking with Irmscher at the IUPD Station I observed the damage to his vehicle.Irmscher has no suspect or suspect vehicle information.Photos of the damage to V2 was taken and available. Not knowing the direction of travel for V1 and V1 positioning, I was unable to place V1 accurately. After speaking to Irmscher I went to the location where I was unable to locate any surveillance cameras in the area.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON ROGERS RD JUST EAST OF THE STANDS. HE INDICATED THAT HE DID NOT REALIZE V2 HAD SIGNALED TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO THE STANDS AND WAS SLOWING. D1 SAID HE COULD NOT AVOID COLLISION AND STRUCK V2 FROM BEHIND. D2 STATED SHE WAS WEST ON ROGERS RD AND SIGNALED TO TURN ONTO THE STANDS RD. SHE INDICATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED WAITING ON TRAFFIC WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1.

This accident occurred in the parking lot north of 1309 E 10th Street. V1 was backing up from a parking stall traveling south. V2 was stopped in the drive of the parking lot facing east.D1 stated she was backing up her vehicle from the parking stall, traveling south. D1 stated she looked both ways and proceeded to back up when she collided with V2. D1 stated she did not see V2 parked behind her when she collided with him. V1 had damage to the rear-end of the vehicle.D2 stated he was parked on the drive of the parking lot waiting to pick someone up. D2 stated he was facing east when V1 backed into his vehicle. D2 stated that just prior to the accident, he had placed his vehicle in 'drive' but did not accelerate at all. V2 had significant damage to the driver side door and rear driver side door.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE IN THE AREA S MADISON ST. D1 OBSERVED V2 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC ON COUNTRY CLUB IN THE EAST BOUND LANE. D1 ATTEMPTED TO APPLY THE BRAKE, BUT MISSED THE PEDAL. V1 REAR ENDED V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE IN THE AREA OF S MADISON ST. V2 WAS STOPPED IN BACKED UP TRAFFIC WHEN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

WHILE UNIT 1 WAS PARKED, UNIT 2 ATTEMPTED TO PARK NEXT TO UNIT 1. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED THAT WHILE TURNING INTO THE PARKING SPOT, HER FOOT SLIPPED, CAUSING HER TO LOSE CONTROL AND STRIKE UNIT 1. UNIT 2 LEFT THE SCENE DUE TO FAMILY CONCERNS, BUT WAS ABLE TO BE REACHED THE NEXT DAY AND WAS COOPERATIVE WITH COMPLETING THE CRASH REPORT. UNIT 2 DID LEAVE THEIR NAME AND NUMBER ON UNIT 1 PRIOR TO LEAVING THE SCENE.

On 04/05/2019 at 1719 hours, I was dispatched to IUPD for a prior hit and run accident that occurred near 3rd and Fess Avenue. V1 was traveling west on 3rd Street near Fess Avenue changing from the right lane of traffic to the left lane of traffic just prior to the collision. V2 was in front of V1 on 3rd Street traveling west just prior to the collision going straight. I arrived at IUPD and spoke with D2. He advised me that around 1655 hours, he was driving westbound on 3rd in the right lane of traffic. He stated that V1 was just behind him and was a green bus that had just dropped off passengers. He stated that V1 started to change into the left lane of traffic, but did not turn wide enough to avoid a collision with his vehicle. He stated that near the middle rear of the passenger's side of V1 struck the rear driver's side of his vehicle. He stated that he felt the vehicles collide and the driver of the bus stopped for a few seconds, but continued west on 3rd Street. D2 advised me that he pulled over to stop for an exchange of information, but the bus continued driving. D2 followed the bus, taking pictures of the license plate and bus number. He identified the bus as a Bloomington Transit bus, but could not see D1. After driving for a short while following V1, D2 left to make the report. I noticed fresh scratches on the driver's side rear quarter panel of the vehicle. He showed me pictures of the bus.I contacted Bloomington Transit and met with the driver of bus 0553 at 3rd and Jordan Avenue. V2 followed me to the area for the exchange of information. I spoke with D1, who advised me that he was driving the bus around the time frame of the collision and drove westbound on 3rd Street, but did not know that his vehicle collided with another vehicle. I noticed a small amount of damage to the middle of the passenger's side on the bus. A small silver part of the bus was broken. I spoke with the Transit Bus supervisor, Larry Weber, who stated that there is video footage from the bus that he would send to his supervisor. I asked him to send him a copy of the footage for my report. D2 advised me that he was not injured because of the collision.I was given a thumb drive from the Bloomington Transit office. Video footage of the collision is attached to it and it was booked into evidence at the IU Police Department. The video verified D2 recollection of the collision.

V1 was slowing down behind V2 at a red traffic signal facing south on Jordan Ave. at the intersection at Atwater Ave.V2 was stopped at a red traffic signal facing south on Jordan Ave. at the intersection at Atwater Ave.D1 stated she looked to her left and was watching another driver on the road. When she thought the traffic signal turned green she began to continue south and collided with D2.D2 stated he had been stopped at a red traffic signal when he was suddenly hit from behind. V1 has paint transfer on the center section of the front bumper. V2 has paint transfer on the center section of the rear bumper.

V1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE ON THE 7TH FLOOR OF THE PARKING GARAGE AT 245 N COLLEGE AVE. V2 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED ON THE SAME LEVEL OF THE PARKING GARAGE.D1 SAID HE WAS BACKING UP DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM V2. HE SAID WHEN HE BACKED UP HE HIT THE REAR DRIVER SIDE CORNER OF V2'S BUMPER.D1 SAID IT WAS ABOUT 6:00 PM ON FRIDAY APRIL 5TH. HE LEFT A NOTE WITH HIS NAME, PHONE NUMBER, INSURANCE CO AND POLICY NUMBER ON V2.I SPOKE TO HIM BY TELEPHONE TO GET MORE INFORMATION.

D2 STATED THAT ON 04/05/2019 SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC JUST WEST OF WALNUT ST ON GRIMES LANE. SHE INDICATED THAT SHE HEARD A SCREECH AND LOOKED IN HER REAR VIEW MIRROR AND SAW V1 CLOSING AND COLLIDE INTO THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE. D2 SAID SHE MOTIONED FOR D1 TO PULL INTO A LOT ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY AND SHE PULLED IN, V1 CONTINUED EAST ON GRIMES. D2 SAID SHE PULLED BACK OUT ONTO GRIMES THEN PROCEEDED SOUTH ON WALNUT ST. D2 SAID SHE THEN TURNED EAST ONTO HILLSIDE DR AND SAW V1 A FEW CARS IN FRONT OF HER. D2 SAID SHE THEN SAW V1 PULL INTO HERITAGE APARTMENTS LOCATED AT 1600 EAST HILLSIDE DR. D2 SAID SHE PULLED INTO THE COMPLEX AND SAW D1 EXIT THE VEHICLE. D2 SAID SHE CONFRONTED D1 AND SAID " YOU HIT ME". D1'S RESPONCE WAS "PROVE IT" AND WALKED OFF, ACCORDING TO D2. SHE THEN INDICATED THAT SHE CALLED 911 AND REPORTED THE INCIDENT.D2 WAS ABLE TO PROVIDE A PHOTOGRAPH OF THE OFFENDING VEHICLES LICENSE PLATE AS WELL AS THE DISCRIPTION OF D1. SHE DESCRIBED THE DRIVER AS A WHITE MALE IN HIS 30S OR 40S WITH BROWN HAIR. SHE ALSO DESCRIBED HIM AS MEDIUM BUILD AND APPROXIMATELY 5'08" TALL. THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION AT THIS TIME.

Driver 1 was traveling eastbound on 7000 block West Tabor Hill Road. Driver 1 stated another vehicle was traveling westbound so he got close to the edge of the roadway when he began running off the roadway and the roadway began to crumble. I did observe pieces of the roadway in his eastbound lane and also observed tire marks. Driver 1 stated he then attempted to correct back onto the roadway when he crossed both lanes and proceeded into a ditch where he came to rest. Driver 1 was out of the vehicle upon my arrival. I did observe a Smithville telephone and internet box (box SAI24A) that was ran over. Vehicle 1 sustained damage to the front end and was towed out by Chandler's Tow Service.

D2 HAD DROPPED SOMETHING IN THE VEHICLE. D2 PULLED OFF THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND ACTIVATED THE CAR FLASHERS TO ATTEMPT TO RETRIEVE THE OBJECT.D1 STRUCK D2'S VEHICLE ON THE LEFT REAR QUARTER PANEL ATTEMPTING TO AVOID THE COLLISION. FROM THE MARKS IN THE GRASS WHERE D2 WAS PARKED IT APPEARED THAT D1 WAS CLOSE TO THE FOG LINE WHEN THE VEHICLES MADE CONTACT. D2 MOVED FROM THE SCENE PRIOR TO OUR ARRIVAL DUE TO NOT WANTING TO SPEAK WITH D1. UPON SPEAKING WITH D1 I DETECTED AN ODOR OF ALCOHOL EMITTING FROM D1'S BREATH.I CONDUCTED SFST'S ON D1 WHICH D1 PASSED AND HAD A PBT RESULT OF .053 GRAMS OF ALCOHOL PER 210 LITERS OF BREATH. BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED FROM THE SCENE DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

V1 was eastbound on West 2nd Street near Adams Street. V1 was actively fleeing from pursuing Police Officers. V1 was directly behind V2.V2 was eastbound on West 2nd Street just east of Adams Street. V2 was directly in front of V1. D1 did not wish to answer questions about how the accident happened. However, based upon statements from pursuing officers as well as surveillance camera footage obtained from Hoosier Express Car Wash, the following information was obtained about the accident. As D1 was actively leading Police Officers on a high speed pursuit (speeds said to be approximately 80mph), she approached the rear of V2. D2 saw in his rear view mirror that V1 was approaching at a high rate of speed. He therefore tried to turn right into the parking lot entrance of Hoosier Express Car Wash off of West 2nd Street. As V2 was turning right into this parking lot, V1 struck V2 in the left half side of the rear bumper. V2 then rotated clockwise before the front left tire hit a curbed median in the car wash parking lot entrance. This caused V2 to go airborne and flip one full rotation. V2 ultimately landed on the east side of this curbed median and came to a final rest facing in a northerly direction. After striking V2, V1 rotated approximately 180 degrees and then continued to travel east while facing west. V1 left the south side of the roadway just east of the car wash entrance. V1 ran over a street sign before coming to a final rest facing a southwestern direction. D1 and D2 were both transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital. D1 was bleeding heavily from unknown wounds. D2 was found to have a fractured or broken collarbone. D1 was suspected of being under the influence of alcohol and/or drugs of some kind.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED AT 1230 HRS TODAY, SHE WALKED OUT TO HER VEHICLE WHICH WAS PARKED ON THE NORTH EAST SIDE OF THE MORTON/ 6TH STREET INTERSECTION AND NOTICED IT WAS DAMAGED. SHE INDIACATED THAT SHE HAD PARKED IT AROUND 2000 HRS LASTNIGHT. THE DAMAGE TO V2 WAS LOCATED ON THE DRIVERS FRONT BUMPER AREA AND WAS PRETTY SIGNIFICANT. THERE WERE PIECES OF THE OFFENDING VEHICLES TAIL LIGHT LENSE ON THE GROUND AROUND THE FRONT OF V2. I COLLECTED THE PIECES AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE GENERAL MANAGER OF LITTLE ZAGREBS RESTURANT TO SEE IF THE BUISNESS SECURITY CAMERA'S CAUGHT THE INCIDENT ON VIDEO. MR. EARNEST WAS ABLE TO LOCATE THE OFFENDING VEHICLE ON VIDEO FROM A CAMERA LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE BUILDING. THE OFFENDING VEHICLE CAME INTO VIEW AT 0225 HRS AND WAS SEEN BACKING INTO V2. V1 THEN LEFT NORTH OUT OF CAMERA VIEW. THE VIDEO WAS NOT THE BEST QUALITY DUE TO BEING DARK OUT AND RAINING. IT APPEARED THE OFFENDING VEHICLE WAS A DARK COLORED COMPACT VEHICLE. THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

WITNESS BRAUNEL SAW V1 SOUTH BOUND ON WASHINGTON ST, THEN TURN RIGHT ON DODDS ST. IN THE PROCESS OF TURNING RIGHT, V1 LEFT THE ROAD ON THE SOUTH WEST CORNER, STRIKING THE STOP SIGN THERE, KNOCKING IT OVER. THE VEHICLE THEN LEFT THE SCENE, WEST ON DODDS ST. WITNESS SAID THE DRIVER WAS A WHITE FEMALE, POSSIBLY IN HER 50'S.THE PLATE RETURNED TO LINDA M. SHAW, WHO WE COULD NOT LOCATE. NO INJURIES REPORTED.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PARKING LOT OF 1935 S. LIBERTY DRIVE.D1 SAID HE PULLED IN, THEN NEEDED TO BACK UP TO TURN AROUND, AND DID NOT SEE V2 DRIVING TOWARD THE EXIT.D2 SAID THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WESTBOUND TOWARD THE EXIT WHEN V1 BACK UP INTO V2.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37. VEHICLE 1 LEFT THE PARKING LOT ON THE EAST SIDE OF OLD STATE ROAD 37 S, AND TURNED ONTO OLD STATE ROAD 37 S.VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN RIGHT FRONT PASSENGER SIDE WHILE ATTEMPTING TO PULL INTO NORTHBOUND TRAFFIC ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37. DRIVER 1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 APPROACHING.BOTH DRIVER 1 AND DRIVER 2 WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE. VEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVEN FROM SCENE. VEHICLE 2 WAS LEFT IN PARKING LOT DUE TO NOT BEING INSURED.

Driver two stated she was driving west on E Covenanter Dr approaching S College Mall Rd when she made a left hand turn into a gas station parking lot. Driver two stated vehicle one past her driving east on E Covenanter Dr and she began her turn. Driver two stated during her turn vehicle one stopped and began to back up. Driver two stated vehicle one backed into her driver side with the rear of his vehicle. Driver two stated vehicle one left the scene driving north towards the mall.

South Curry Pike south of Industrial Boulevard is a two lane (two-way) roadway with Curry Pike being a through way roadway that primarily travels north and south. Vehicle 1 (2009, Kia Spectra) was traveling southbound directly behind Vehicle 2 (2016, Kia Sportage) when V1 then rear ended V2 as it came to an abrupt stop. Driver 1 (Paul Wegener) indicated the following: He was traveling south behind V2 when both vehicles came to a stop. They both then began to travel southbound again and once they began to move, V2 came to a sudden stop again and he attempted to apply his brakes but was unable to stop and struck the rear of V2.Driver 2 (Benita Tabor) indicated the following: She was traveling southbound when she came to a stop in a line of traffic. The traffic then began to move and so did she. One traffic began to move south, there were numerous cars in front of her that came to a sudden stop causing her to slam on her brakes. She was then rear ended by V1.Neither D1or D2 reported any injuries nor did they request any medical assistance. It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the reason for the crash is following too closely and that D1 is at fault.RRK

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W. MCNEELY ST AND WENT TO CHECK HIS PHONE. D1 THEN RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND TRIED TO GET BACK ON THE ROAD AND ENDED UP FLIPPING V1.UPON FURTHER SPEAKING TO D1 THERE WAS AN ODOR OF AN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE COMING FROM HIS PERSONS BREATHE. DEPUTY PITTMAN WITH THE MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE CONDUCTED FIELD SOBRIETY IN WHICH D1 FAILED. D1 TESTED ON A PORTABLE BREATH TEST .222. D1 WAS THEN TAKEN TO STATION FOR A CERTIFIED BREATH TEST IN WHICH WAS .222.

D1 ADVISED HE WAS HEADING NORTH ON S. YONKERS ST WHEN HE SAW A CAT UNDER A TRUCK PARKED. D1 STOPPED AND REVERSED HIS CAR TO LOOK AT THE CAT AND BACKED INTO V2. D2 ADVISED HE WAS DELIEVERING A PIZZA TO AN ADDRESS ON S. YONKERS AND V2 WAS PARKED. V1 THEN STARTED TO REVERSE AND BACK INTO THE BACK OF HIS VEHICLE.VEHICLES MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 HAD STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT 10TH AND WASHINGTON. D1 SAID HE LOOKED BOTH WAYS BUT DID NOT SEE V2 COMING EAST ON 10ST AND PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF V2. D2 SAID HE WAS EAST ON 10TH WHEN V1 PULLED OUT OF WASHINGTON AND HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME TO AVOID THE ACCIDENT. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY ON 10TH ST.

V1 is marked IUPD car #91 and D1 was an on-duty police officer on patrol. D1 was driving eastbound in the right lane of Atwater Avenue approaching Park Avenue when a vehicle in the left lane caught his attention by driving erratically. D1 reported this vehicle started veering toward the lane divider, causing him to look to his left to observe it. D1 stated he then inadvertently started veering toward the right, himself, away from that vehicle. V1's front passenger tire collided with the right-hand curb, immediately causing it to burst. There was no other damage to the vehicle and the tire was replaced with a spare. Photos were taken of the damaged tire.

UNIT 1 WAS PARKED AT THE GAS PUMP AT THE ADDRESS OF 5100 S. VICTOR PIKE, BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA. UNIT 2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING SPACE ADJACENT TO UNIT 1. UNIT 2 BEGAN BACKING OUT OF THE PARKING SPACE AND STRUCK THE REAR END OF UNIT 1. UNIT 2 THEN LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT. I ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE THE DRIVER OF THE VEHICLE AT THE REGISTERED OWNERS ADDRESS, HOWEVER FAILED TO LOCATE THE VEHICLE OR DRIVER.

V1 and V2 were traveling southbound on SR 46. V2 was in the left turn lane as V1 attempted to go around V2 into the other turn lane. V1 struck V2 as it attempted to pull into the 2nd turn lane. V1 then fled the area. V2 pulled into a private parking lot.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was facing Southeast on West Fountain Drive and stopped on the Northwest side of the intersection with North Crescent Road. V2 was traveling Northwest on W Fountain Dr. V1 began to move slowly towards V2 before accelerating rapidly and striking the front driver side of V2. V1 continued to drive into V2 before V1 fled the scene to the South. V1 left the scene and did not provide information. V1 was reported to be a black or dark colored Dodge Avenger. V1 was reported to have sustained significant damage to the front driver side of the vehicle. D1 was reported to be a black male subject in his mid 20s with bald hair. V2 sustained moderate damage to the front driver side of the vehicle. D2 stated that she was not injured and did require medical attention at the scene. V2 was towed from the scene by Kens Westside Towing to the Minton Body Shop. Witness reported that V1 initially left the scene and later returned to the scene. Witness attempted to stop the suspect and speak with him, but the suspect would not exit the vehicle. The suspect then drove away without making contact with the other party.The criminal case in currently active.
V1 struck deer as it was traveling northbound on Sare Rd.

V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY IN THE 4600 BLOCK OF S GARRISON CHAPEL ROAD. D1 WAS TRAPPED INSIDE V1 UNTIL FIRE AND EMS COULD EXTRACT THE DRIVER. D1 WAS IN POSSESION OF ILLEGAL DRUGS. D1 ONE WAS INJURED AND INCOHERENT SO I COULD NOT PERFORM A PROPER INTERVIEW. NO INSURANCE WAS LOCATED DUE TO THE CONDITION OF THE VEHICLE.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN.

V1 was turning southbound onto N Jordan Avenue from E 17th street. V2 was stopped in traffic facing northbound on N Jordan Avenue at E 17th street, preparing for an eastbound turn.D1 stated she cut her turn too close, and when she saw V2 out of her blindspot, it was too late and V1 struck V2.D2 stated that V1 turned too tightly and struck V2.Damage to V1 was minor scratches and scrapes.Damage to V2 was minor scratches and scrapes and a piece of the bumper broke off.There were no reported injuries.

D1 left the scene of he accident.The homeowner of 1220 W Arlington RD stated he left at 8:45 PM and returned at 10:00 PM and noticed that his mailbox had been destroyed. There were tire marks from V1 going into the yard and through his mailbox and the mailbox post.

UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUND ON E. ST. RD. 46. UNIT 1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY, STRICKING A CULVERT. UNIT 1 THEN RAN INTO A DITCH. UNIT 1 CAME TO A REST IN THE DITCH LAID OVER SLIGHTLY ON THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT MRS. BEATTY, LISTED IN THE PERSON INVOLVEMENT SECTION, IS THE OWNER OF PROPERTY DAMAGED DURING THIS ACCIDENT. MRS. BEATTYS DRIVEWAY AND CULVERT WAS DAMAGED DUE TO THE ACCIDENT.

UNTIS RESPONDING DISCOVERED THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 WALKING WESTBOUND ON AIRPORT RD. THE VEHICLE WAS DISCOVERED AND LATER TOWED. THE VEHICLE ONLY HAD 1 TIRE REMAINING INTACT, AND WAS MISSING THE FRONT AND BACK BUMPERS. THE PROPERTY WHERE THE ACCIDENT HAPPENED SHOWED SIGNS OF THE VEHICLE LEAVING THE ROADWAY JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF SPICER LN AND S GARRISON CHAPEL RD. THE TIRE MARKS ENTERED A ROCK CULVERT, CONTINUED INTO THE YARD, AND THEN RAN INTO A LARGE MOUND. AFTER THE VEHICLE LEFT THE MOUND, THERE WERE NO TIRE MARKS IN THE YARD FOR APPROXIMATELY 70-80 FT. THE TIRE MARKS THEN RETURNED IN THE NEIGHBORING PROPERTY, AND CONTINUED OUT OF THE YARD, BACK INTO THE ROCK CULVERT, AND RETURNED TO THE ROAD. SCRATCH MARKS WERE LEFT FROM THE POINT THE VEHICLE RETURNED TO THE ROAD TO WHERE THE VEHICLE WAS LATER LOCATED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: On April 7th 2019 at approximately 21:59 hours I was dispatched to the intersection of Henderson St and Winslow Rd. Upon arrival, I observed both V1 and V2 in the middle of the intersection with heavy front end damage. V1 was facing southwest in the intersection and V2 was facing eastbound. First, I spoke with D1. D1 explained that she was traveling westbound on Winslow Rd when she started to turn southbound at the intersection of Winslow Rd and Henderson St. D1 stated that she did not see on the oncoming vehicle and collided with V2. D1 stated that it was her fault. I then spoke with D2. He explained that he was traveling eastbound on Winslow Rd when he entered the intersection of Winslow Rd and Henderson St when V1 pulled in front of him. Due to D1 failing to yield the right of way to V2 resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

W1 called to report that V1 struck V2. He stated that V2 was parked and V1 attempted to parallel parked behind V2. W1 stated that a male and a female got out of V1, but he was unsure who was driving. W1 said that both individuals appeared intoxicated. V1 left the scene, and parked in a near by parking lot. V1 had damage to the passenger side front bumper. V2 had damage to the driver side rear bumper. The paint transfer on both vehicles is consistent with W1's statements.I attempted to contact the owners of the vehicles, but I was unable to contact them. I completed a criminal case for the Leaving the Scene of an Accident.I photographed the damage from both vehicles. A copy of the field form was left with both vehicles.ADD 4/12/2019.I was contacted by the V2s owner. She advised that they were going to handle the accident civilly. The criminal case is now inactive.

V2 was parked on the top level of the Jordan Parking Garage next to V1. When V1 pulled out of the parking spot, turning right, V1 struck the driver's side front end of V2. The owner's daughter, who typically drives the vehicle, arrived at IUPD to report the vehicle crash that occurred today at approximately 5:00 PM. The daughter stated that she had parked her vehicle in the Jordan Parking Garage at approximately 4:45 PM on the upper level of the garage. When she arrived back at the vehicle at approximately 7:30 PM, she noticed that there was new damage to the front end (driver's side) of her vehicle. She stated that there was a note placed on V2 with D1's information.Upon follow-up, I made contact with D1 who stated that V1 was parked just to the left of V2. While he was pulling out and turning right out of a parking spot, he felt V1 make contact with V2 hitting V2's driver's side front end. D1 stated that he just made too sharp of a turn in his truck and he believed that was how he hit V2. D1 stated that he was headed out of town, so he left a note with his personal information as well as insurance information.

Unit 1 travelling Westbound around 7785 Lampkins Ridge Rd, approx 1 mile East of intersction with Deer Trace. Unit 1 moving through a low gradient left turn, went off the road, ending up on a tree which caused damage to the front bumper and headlight.

V1 was traveling south on Jordan Avenue approaching the north entrance to the Musical Arts Center. As V1 passed the north entrance, V1 drifted left (east). V1 went over the curb, destroyed a tree and some of the landscaping, and then went back into the road before stopping just north of the south exit of the Musical Arts Center. D1 stated she believed she saw something that caught her attention and caused her to turn left. D1 also stated she looked down briefly at her phone because her mom was calling. D1 could not provide any more explanation. D1 did not complain of pain and when asked and stated she did not need EMS. V1 had heavy damage to the front left wheel and bumper. Photographs were taken of the Indiana University landscaping that was damaged during the crash.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON N RUSSELL RD. FEMALE PASSENGER STATED THAT D1 PASSED OUT AT THE WHEEL AND SHE STATED "HIS EYES WERE ROLLED BACK IN HIS HEAD". V1 ENDED UP OFF N RUSSELL RD TO THE EAST OF THE ROAD COMING TO A STOP WITH THE FRONT END LIFTED UP BY A COUPLE OF SMALLER TREES. EMS STATED THAT D1'S BLOOD PRESSURE WAS RATHER LOW ON SCENE AND HE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL TO BE EVALUATED FURTHER. D1 WAS ON MULTIPLE MEDICATIONS FOR HEART ISSUES HE STATED AND THOUGHT THAT MIGHT HAVE BEEN WHAT HAD DONE IT. THE PASSENGER WAS LOOKED AT BY EMS FOR PAIN IN HER LEG AND WAS TREATED ON SCENE THEN SHE ASKED PRITCHARDS TO TAKE THE CAR TO THEIR HOUSE AND SHE RODE WITH PRITCHARDS.

D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED FACING EAST BOUND ON SR46 WITH HIS TURN SIGNAL ON TO TURN LEFT ONTO FOSTER FISCUS. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. V1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUND ON SR 46 WHEN SHE LOOKED DOWN AT SOMETHING AND REARENDED V2 WITH A GLANCING BLOW TO THE RIGHT REAR OF V2. V1 THEN WENT OFF OF THE ROAD AND DOWN AN EMBANKMENT. BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVEABLE. V1 HAD TO BE PULLED OUT DUE TO MUD, BUT CHOSE TO HAVE A FAMILY MEMBER DO THIS. NEITHER DRIVER COULD PRODUCE AN INSURANCE CARD, BUT STATED THEY HAD INSURANCE.

On 04/08/2019 at 1349 hours, I was dispatched to the Poplars Building reference a hit-and-run accident. I arrived on scene and met with Officer Hartley. Officer Hartley advised me W1 had told him that a vehicle had struck a parked vehicle and did not stop.The V2 was parked on the north side of 7th Street just west of Dunn Street facing west. V1, described as a silver Toyota Camry bearing an unknown state license plate BG12361, was traveling westbound on 7th Street just west of Dunn Street.W1 stated that V1 was traveling westbound on 7th Street and swerved into V2, striking it on the driver side mirror. V1 then continued westbound towards Grant Street and turned northbound. W1 described V1 as a silver Toyota Camry bearing an unknown state license plate BG12361.O2 stated she had the vehicle parked in a parking space and did not see the accident.There are no known suspects at this time.

BOTH V1 AND V2 WERE TRAVELING SB ON S LIBERTY DR JUST NORTH OF W CONSTITUTION AVE. D2 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT INTO THE PARKING LOT OF AUTHOR SOLUTIONS AND V1 WAS BEHIND V2. D1 STATED THAT SHE GOT DISTRACTED BECAUSE SHE THOUGHT A BUG HAD FLOWN INTO HER VEHICLE AND SHE WENT TO SWAT AT IT. D1 STATED WHEN SHE LOOKED UP SHE SAW V2 SITTING WITH THEIR TURN SIGNAL ON AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO V1 REAR ENDING V2.

V2 WAS STOPPED IN THE LEFT TURN LANE AT THE INTERSECTION OF W 3RD ST AND CURRY PIKE HEADING EAST ON 3RD. V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON 3RD STREET APPROACHING THE 3RD ST/ CURRY PIKE INTERSECTION. AS V2 ATTEMPTED TO TURN ONTO CURRY PIKE THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES. BOTH VEHICLES WERE ABLE TO BE DRIVEN AWAY FROM THE SCENE.D2 STATED THAT SHE HAD BEEN WAITING AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT FOR THE GREEN ARROW TO INDICATE THAT SHE COULD TURN LEFT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. AFTER D2 SAW THE SIGNAL SHE BEGAN TO DRIVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND WAS STRUCK BY V1.D1 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION THE LIGHT HAD JUST TURNED YELLOW. AS SHE WAS ENTERING THE INTERSECTION V2 TURNED LEFT AND INTO HER LANE OF TRAVEL. D1 SAID THAT SHE DID NOT HAVE TIME TO REACT AND ATTEMPT TO STEER AWAY FROM THE CRASH.

On 04/08/2019, at 1309 hours, I was dispatched to the Tenth Street Lot north of the intersection with East 10th Street and North Campbell Drive. When I arrived, I spoke with Savannah Miller, who advised that she had parked her red 2015 Honda Civic around 0900 today. The vehicle was parked facing south (backed into a space) on the west side of the lot in the third row. When Miller went out to her vehicle around 1300 hours, today, she discovered new damage where it appears that her parked car was struck by another vehicle.Miller pointed out a dent to the front edge of the hood on the passenger side near the edge of the front grille. Black plastic molding on the underside of the grille was broken off and was missing. There were significant abrasions through the paint on the front bumper between the centerline and passenger side. It appeared that a vehicle with a bumper higher than the Honda had struck the parked vehicle, causing damage. There was no note left, no witnesses, and there are no surveillance cameras in the area. There are no other leads.

Vehicle #1 was turning east onto SR46 from northbound Curry Pike in the left lane of two right turn lanes and to the left of vehicle #2. Vehicle #2 was also turning east onto SR46 from northbound Curry Pike in the right lane of the two right turn lanes. While attempting to complete the right turn vehicle #1 drove into vehicle #2's turn lane striking vehicle #2. Vehicle #1's right front fender struck vehicle #2's left front fender. Vehicle #1's right side mirror also struck vehicle #2's left side mirror.Driver #1 initially felt that she was in the right lane of the two right hand turn lanes but then stated she was in the left lane of the two right hand turn lanes. She also stated that she struck the vehicle next to her because her passenger yelled at her that she was about to strike the vehicle and it startled her and she felt she would not have hit the vehicle if she were not startled. Driver #2 stated that she was making her right turn when the vehicle to her left came into her lane and struck her vehicle.Both witnesses stated that vehicle #1 was in the left lane of the two right turn lanes and merged into the right lane of the two turn lanes striking vehicle #2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was headed N/W on S Walnut St Pike, approaching S Walnut St. D2 was headed N in the left lane on S Walnut St, approaching S Walnut St Pike. D1 attempted to cross S Walnut St at the time D2 was passing S Walnut St Pike, causing a collision between the front of V1 and the passenger side of V2. D1 stated that she was headed N/W on S Walnut St Pike, approaching S Walnut St. D1 stated that she stopped at the intersection, checked both ways for traffic, and believing the roadway was clear, proceeded to cross S Walnut St headed to a local business. D1 stated that as she crossed S Walnut St her vehicle struck V2 in the passenger side. D1 stated that she never saw V2 until the collision and is not sure how she did not see the vehicle in the first place. D2 stated that she was headed N on S Walnut St, approaching S Walnut St Pike. D2 sttaed that as she passed S Walnut St Pike V1 pulled out into her lane of travel. D2 stated that she attempted to miss V1 by guiding her vehicle into the median, however V1 still struck V2 in the passenger side.

Driver 1 stated he was west on 3rd St approaching Jefferson St. Driver 2 stated she was west on 3rd St, near Jefferson St, slowing to stop behind traffic on 3rd St. Driver 1 stated he was distracted by a fire truck in the fire station lot to his right. Driver 1 stated when he looked back at the road, traffic had slowed in front of him. Driver 1 stated he then collided with the rear of vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated that has she was stopping for traffic she was hit from behind by vehicle 1.

I met with D1 at his place of employment approximately 27 minutes after the crash.Other Explain in Narrative - Type of Crash - Collision with Tree, not on a roadway.D1 advised he was backing up V1 east bound and struck a tree.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS MAKING A NB TURN ONTO S OLD STATE ROAD 37 FROM ORCHARD LANE AND PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF V2 THAT WAS TRAVELING SB ON S OLD SR 37.D1 STATED THAT LOOKED BEFORE PULLING OUT BUT DID NOT SEE V2.D2 STATED THAT V1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM.FOLLOWING THE COLLISION, BOTH VEHICLE MOVED FROM THE POINT OF COLLISION OUT OF THE ROADWAY. NO DIAGRAM.

D1 was headed South on S Banta Ave, approaching W Country Club Rd. D1 had previously injected narcotics, which had caused him to lose consciousness. As D1 lost consciousness V1 continued to head South on S Banta Ave, across W Country Club Rd, and eventually resting against a chain link fence in the ditch South of W Country Club Rd. For further details please see the case report completed by Officer Mitchell.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 4/9/2019 at approximately 1020hrs, a collision involving a passenger car and a pedestrian on a skateboard occurred at the entrance on the Mellencamp Sports Pavilion at 1800 N Dunn St. The passenger car was northbound on the roadway and turned left (west) into the entrance. The pedestrian was southbound on the roadway. The passenger car turned in left (west) in front of the pedestrian, failing to yield to the pedestrian and the pedestrian collided with the rear passengerside of the the passenger car.D1, Marot, stated he was northbound in the Athletic Orange Lot and was attempting to turn into the Mellencamp Pavilion from the service drive that connects the Athletic Orange Lot to the Athletic Purple Lot, just east of the Pavilion. D1 stated he didn't see any southbound traffic on the service drive and turned left (west) into the entrance. D1 stated as he was turning, V1 was impacted by Pedestrian 1 (P1) who was on a skateboard. P1, Wolf, stated he was southbound on the service drive on the east side of the Mellencamp Pavilion approaching the Athletic Orange Lot. P1 stated as he was about to pass the entrance to the Mellencamp Pavilion when V1 turned left in front of him. P1 stated he didn't have time to react and impacted the passengerside of V1 and was knocked to the ground.P1 suffered several injuries to his person. Injuries included several abrasions & bleeding to both hands, minor "road rash" to the left side abdomen, abrasions & bleeding to his chin, abrasions and swelling of his right knee and pain to his right foot. P1 was treated at the scene and was released by medics to seek treatment on his own.

V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON STATE ROAD 46 IN THE SOUTHERNMOST WESTBOUND LANE OF A ONE WAY PAIR WHEN V1 ENTERED HIS LANE FROM THE NORTHERNMOST WESTBOUND LANE AND STRUCK THE SIDE OF V2. THE COLLISION HAPPENED IN THE INTERSECTION OF S.R. 46 AND MATTHEWS DRIVE AS V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN SOUTH ON MATTHEWS FROM THE WRONG LANE. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY. V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE SIDE.BOTH VEHICLES WERE MOVED TO THE INTERSECTION OF MATTHEWS DRIVE AND VINE STREET FOR SAFETY WHILE I CONDUCTED MY INVESTIGATION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON MONROE STREET JUST NORTH OF 11TH STREET. SHE INDICATED THAT V1 PULLED OUT OF THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB WHICH IS LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY. D2 STATED SHE VEERED LEFT BUT COULD NOT AVOID COLLISION. D1 STATED SHE WAS EXITING FROM THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB ONTO MONROE STREET. SHE INDICATED THAT HER VIEW WAS OBSTRUCTED FROM A PARKED VEHICLE JUST NORTH OF THE EXIT. D1 SAID SHE PROCEEDED OUT INTO THE ROADWAY AND WAS STRUCK BY V2.
Driver was not looking and ran off the road into the ditch.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling west on E 3rd Street approaching S Ballantine Rd. Unit 2 and Unit 3 were pedestrians crossing E 3rd Street from the north side to the south, on the west side of the intersection with S Ballantine Rd. There is not a marked crosswalk where they were crossing. When I arrived on scene, V1 was stopped off the road on the south side of E 3rd Street. U2 and U3 were laying in the roadway receiving medical attention. U3 had blood around her head. D1 said she was driving west on E 3rd Street and the sun was in her eyes so she could not see. Once D1 could see through the glare she saw U2 and U3 crossing, but it was too late to stop before colliding with them. Once D1 saw U2 and U3 she applied the brakes and swerved to the left, traveling over the curb and off the roadway. No skid marks were located on the roadway.U2 and U3 were receiving medical attention when I arrived on scene. They were both transported by ambulance to IU Health Bloomington Hospital. After clearing the scene, I went to IU Health Bloomington Hospital where I was able to speak with U2. U2 told me she was crossing the street with U3, who is blind and walks with a cane. U2 said she looked and saw V1 to the east, but thought there was plenty of time to cross. U2 said they reached the southern lane of travel when she was suddenly struck by V1 and recalls flipping over and landing on her side. U2 said her left hip and left knee hurt. There was also bruising on her left ankle. U2 said she was told by medical personnel that she hit her head on V1's windshield, but she did not remember that and did not have any head pain. I was unable to speak to U3 due to her need for medical attention and tests. Visitors of U3 told me she has a large bump and blood on her head, and said that she was experiencing back pain. W1 told me he was going west on E 3rd Street next to V1 and slightly behind it. W1 said he saw pedestrians in the roadway crossing, but D1 must not have. W1 estimated that V1 was traveling over the posted speed limit of 25 MPH. W1 estimated V1 was traveling between 30 and 35 MPH. W1 said the sun was likely in D1's eyes, and V1 did not slow down before the collision. W2 was outside on the balcony at 1200 E 3rd Street when he saw V1 approaching U2 and U3. W2 estimated that V1 was traveling between 30 and 35 MPH. W2 said V1 did not slow down prior to the collision, and he did not hear V1's tires make any noise consistent with braking hard. W2 said U2 was hit directly by the center of V1, and he heard U2's head hit V1's windshield. W1 said that U3 was struck by the passenger side corner of V1 and clipped by it. W3 was a passenger in V1 and sitting in the front passenger seat. W3 said he was looking down at his phone, but when he looked up he saw U2 and U3 in the road. W3 then yelled for D1 to stop, and D1 applied the brakes. D1 had consumed alcohol prior to the accident. Officer Haluda completed an OWI investigation. Blood draw results are pending. Charges may be filed pending the results of the blood draw. V1 sustained damage to the windshield, which was struck by U2's head. The windshield had pieces of U2's hair stuck in it. V1 was towed by Bland's due to the windshield's unsafe state. Photographs of the scene and V1 were taken. There were no skid marks present on the road.On 07/15/2019 Officer Haluda received the toxicology report for alcohol analysis and drug analysis from the Indiana Sate Department of Toxicology. The alcohol analysis result was 0.070 g/100 mL. The drug analysis result was positive for THC, measured at 1.7 ng/mL.

No other officers assisted with this investigation.Prior to the accident V1 was facing southwest on a gravel drive at the Indiana University Sailing Center. The drive continued to a boat dock and the drive was perpendicular to the water of Lake Lemon. The location of the accident occurred at the GPS grid coordinates of 39.255187, -86.406882.D1 stated that V1 was briefly parked along the gravel drive and he was working to clear brush from the area. His co worker was in the passenger seat and the passenger left the passenger side door open to V1. D1 didn't realize that the coworker left his door open. D1 got into V1 and put it in reverse. As he was reversing a metal pole that was sticking out of the ground collided with the open passenger door. The door was bent backwards (towards the front bumper), causing the door panel where it meets the front quarter panel to bend and dent. Pictures of the damage were taken. There was no visible damage to the pole.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS IN THE LEFT TURN LANE OF E. HILLSIDE DR. WAITING TO TURN LEFT TO TRAVEL NORTH ON S. HIGH ST. V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION WITH A GREEN LIGHT, NO ARROW, WHEN THE OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL TURNED YELLOW. V1 TURNED LEFT AND WAS STRUCK BY V2, WHICH WAS TRAVELING WEST ON E. HILLSIDE DR. D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION OF S. HIGH ST. AND E. HILLSIDE DR. WAITING TO TURN LEFT AND TRAVEL NORTH ON S. HIGH ST. D1 STATED THAT THE LIGHT, WHICH WAS GREEN, TURNED YELLOW, AND SHE TURNED LEFT TO TRAVEL NORTH ON S. HIGH ST, BUT WAS STRUCK BY V2.V2 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON E. HILLSIDE DR. V2 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION OF S. HIGH ST. AND E. HILLSIDE DR. AND STRUCK V1, WHICH HAD TURNED LEFT FROM E. HILLSIDE DR.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON E. HILLSIDE DR. AND SAW A GREEN LIGHT ON THE OPERATIONAL TRAFFIC SIGNAL. D2 STATED THAT THE LIGHT TURNED YELLOW AS SHE WAS TRAVELING THROUGH IT. D2 STATED THAT V1 TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF HER AND SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP TO AVOID A COLLISSION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling north in the left lane on College Mall Rd. Vehicle 1 was pulling out of the drive of 1199 S. College Mall Rd and attempting to cross the north bound lanes to travel south on College Mall Rd. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that before crossing the north bound lanes he checked for on coming vehicles and did not see vehicle 2 traveling north.Vehicle 1 proceeded into the lane of travel. Vehicle 2 then struck vehicle 1 in the front driver's side. Both vehicles were towed due to disabling damage and no injuries were reported from this accident.

D1 stated she was traveling southbound on N Illinois St approaching the intersection at W 11th St. D1 stated the steering wheel locked up on her to the right and when she attempted to hit the breaks V1 did not stop. This caused her to go over the curb and collide with a stop sign. A passenger was injured and was transported to the hospital.

Welmir Drive is a two lane two way asphalt road that runs through the Whitehall Square Parking Center. Welmir Drive becomes a T-intersection at Curry Pike with a left and right turn lane on Welmir Drive. V1, Dodge Charger, was stopped on Welmir Drive in the right turn lane facing west at Curry Pike. V2, Honda Civic, was stopped behind V1 on Welmir Drive in the right turn lane. V1 began to back up and struck the front of V2 with the rear of V1.D1, Deel, stated he was stopped on Welmir Drive in the right turn lane at Curry Pike. D1 stated a vehicle was stopped along the driver's side of V1 on Welmir Drive in the left turn lane. D1 stated he was going to back in a southeast direction to reposition V1 behind the other vehicle stopped in the left turn lane. D1 stated he initially checked behind V1 and did not observe V2. D1 stated he began to back at which time the rear of V1 struck the front of V2. D2, Claerbout, stated he was stopped in the right turn lane of Welmir Drive behind V1. D2 stated D1 began to back and the rear of V1 struck the front of V2. Evidence shows no visible damage to the rear of V1. Evidence shows no visible new damage to the front of V2. D2 indicated there was existing minor damage to the front of V2 prior to the collision with V1. D2 stated the hood latch seemed to be damaged as a result of the impact. V1 is an Indiana State Police Commission # 2514, Mileage: 106,145.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING SB ON I69 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF I69 AND W SAMPLE RD. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE BELIEVED HE FELL ASLEEP AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY STRIKING THE CABLE MEDIAN LOCATED TO THE NORTH OF THAT INTERSECTION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 of V1 was traveling west on E. 3rd St. D2 of V2 was traveling north on S. Walnut St. D1 of V1 stated that he was driving west with his lights and sirens and came to the intersection of E. 3rd St and S. Walnut St. D1 stated that he had a red light and slowed down but did not come to a complete stop and saw other cars stopped around him. D1 then stated that he proceeded into the intersection when he was struck in the rear drivers side quarter panel by D2. D2 of V2 stated that he had a green light and he was driving north when the car next to him came to a sudden stop. D2 stated that he heard sirens but could not see where they were coming from. D2 stated that he then proceeded into the intersection and struck D1 in the rear drivers side quarter panel.

V1 was traveling west bound on East Smithville road. V1 ran off the north side of the roadway. V1 went through a culvert and a fence before coming to rest. D1 was under the influence of alcohol and was taken to IU Health Bloomington Hospital, by ambulance, for treatment. An OWI investigation was also conducted by Deputy Keller-Kuhn at the hospital.

UNIT 1 WAS BACKING UP, TRAVELING NORTHBOUND, AND UNIT 2 WAS TURNING LEFT FROM FAIRFAIX ROAD, ALSO HEADING NORTH. WHILE ENTERING THE DRIVE, THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE DID NOT THINK UNIT 1 WAS MOVING THAT FAST AND THAT SHE COULD ENTER THE DRIVE WITHOUT AN ISSUE. DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE UNIT 2 WHILE BACKING UP. THE TWO UNITS COLLIDED WITH THEIR REAR BUMPERS. THE INFORMATION PERTAINING TO THE USPS TRUCK IS NOT COMPLETE DUE TO THE POST OFFICE NOT ANSWERING PHONE CALLS. THE INDIVIDUAL AT THE SCENE OF THE INCIDENT STATED THE INFORMATION ABOUT THE TRUCK WOULD HAVE TO BE OBTAINED AT THE OFFICE. SEVERAL PHONE CALLS WERE MADE WITH NO ANSWER.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was stopped at the intersection of East 17th Street and North Fee Lane facing eastbound in the left hand turn lane. D1 stated that he was behind one vehicle in the turn lane while waiting for the signal to turn green. V2 was also stopped at the intersection of East 17th Street and North Fee lane on the opposite side of the intersection, in the westbound straight lane. D1 stated that when the light turned green the vehicle in front of him turned northbound onto North Fee Lane. D1 said that he did not see V2 traveling westbound from the other side of the intersection because his view was obstructed by the vehicle in front of him. D1 stated that while attempting to make the turn he realized he did not have enough time to avoid V2 as it approached. He stated that he was unable to avoid V2 because he was already making the turn and did not have enough time to react. D1 said he then struck the front end of V2 as he traveled through the intersection. D1 also informed me that he did not have a green turn arrow and the light was solid green at the time. D2 informed me that she had the solid green light and began traveling west, straight through the intersection. She stated that V1 began to make the left hand turn in front of her and proceeded to hit her vehicle nearly head on as she crossed through the intersection. None of the occupants complained of pain or were injured from the accident.
Driver 1 stated that her brakes had failed, and she left the roadway to avoid traffic and struck a town owned street lamp post.

Vehicle 1 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass at Range Road behind Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass at Range Road in front Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated he was traveling behind Vehicle 2 when it came to a stop in traffic. He stated he began attempting to stop and he started skidding until he struck the rear of Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated she was stopped in traffic for approximately 30 seconds or more before she heard Vehicle 1 skid and strike the rear of her vehicle. No one involved complained of pain.There was a large amount of damage to the front of Vehicle 1. There was a large amount of damage to the rear of Vehicle 2.There were photographs taken of the accident as well as the skid marks behind Vehicle 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was at a stop sign on E. 19th facing west. V2 was driving north on N. Walnut St. D1 of V1 stated that she pulled out into oncoming traffic thinking that V2 was turning right onto E. 19th St. D2 of V2 stated she was driving straight on N. Walnut and was struck on the passenger side quarter panel and passenger side door by V1.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were heading southbound on E Atwater Ave when V1 struck V2 on the rear right 1/4 panel. V1 then struck the curb on the west side of the roadway. V1/D1 stated she felt her car lose control and attempted to correct it, however, she then struck V2. D1 stated after striking V2 her vehicle then struck the curb causing damage to the front right tire/wheel. V2/D2 stated he was struck by V1 as he was traveling southbound on E Atwater Ave. V1 sustained damage to the front left 1/4 panel and also the front right tire/wheel. V2 sustained damage to the rear right 1/4 panel.V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

V1 was traveling south bound on Strain Ridge Road. V1 ran off the west side of the roadway and struck a fire hydrant. V1 then left the scene of the crash. A witness, John Stewart, saw the crash and and took a picture of V1. After the crash, V1 crashed again on East Smithville Road and was located by law enforcement. The vehicle and driver were identified.

Interstate 69 is a four lane, two way interstate that runs primarily north and south. At the time of the crash traffic was light to moderate. It was overcast but daylight outside as well. Vehicle 1, a black 2013 Audi A4, was traveling south on I69 just north of the 130 mile marker. As the vehicle continued south on I69, a deer attempted to cross the roadway from the left (east) side of the interstate. It crossed directly in front of V1. V1 struck the deer. V1 came to a controlled stop on the right shoulder of I69 just south of the 130 MM. Driver 1, Benjamin Blagg, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the far left lane. As he approached the 130 MM D1 said he saw two deer in the median on the left. At that time D1 stated that he slowed down and merged into the center lane. D1 said while he was still traveling south a third deer appeared from the left side and attempted to cross the interstate directly in front of him. D1 reports that he had no time to stop or slow down before hitting the deer. After the strike D1 told me he drove his car to the right shoulder before coming to a controlled stop.Evidence shows heavy damage to the windshield and all along the driver side of V1. Evidence shows animal fur logged in the driver side damage and windshield. Evidence showed a dead deer approximately 100 feet north of the 130 MM.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN ON EAST COTTAGE GROVE AVENUE, FACING WEST, AT THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH INDIANA AND EAST COTTAGE GROVE.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID LOOK BOTH WAYS, NORTH AND SOUTH, AND DID NOT SEE ANY VEHICLES.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID THEN PROCEED ACROSS NORTH INDIANA.D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V2 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER DOOR OF V1, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH V1 AND V2.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON NORTH INDIANA.D2 STATED THAT V1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO CROSS NORTH INDIANA IN ORDER TO PROCEED WEST ON COTTAGE GROVE AVENUE.D2 STATED THAT HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME AND THE FRONT OF HIS MOPED, V2, DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER FRONT DOOR OF V1.D2 STATED THAT HE DID THEN GET LAUNCHED FROM V2 ACROSS THE FRONT OF V1 UNTIL COMING TO A STOP IN THE ROADWAY OF NORTH INDIANA.D2 WAS BLEEDING FROM HIS FACE AND HAD SCRATCHES/BRUISES ON HIS ARMS AND LEGS.D2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE IU BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL IN AMBULANCE 206 WHERE HE WAS TREATED FOR HIS INJURIES.

UNIT 2 WAS PARKED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE PARKING LOT LOCATED AT 2002 S YOST AVE. AS SEEN ON SECURITY CAMERA FOOTAGE, UNIT 1 WAS BACKING UP TO LEAVE. AND STRUCK UNIT 2. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 THEN GOT OUT OF THE CAR, LOOKED AT UNTI 2, AND THEN PROCEEDED TO LEAVE THE AREA. THERE WAS VISIBLE DAMAGE TO BOTH UNITS.WHILE SPEAKING TO THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ON THE PHONE, SHE STATED THAT SHE WAS UNAWARE SHE STRUCK ANOTHER VEHICLE. THE FOOTAGE CLEARLY SHOWS THIS IS INCORRECT. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ALSO STATED SHE DID NOT KNOW IT WAS A CRIME TO LEAVE THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT.

V1 was driving southbound on the 45/46 bypass approaching the intersection at E 17th street. V2 and V3 were stopped in traffic at the red traffic signal also facing southbound.D1 stated that she did not have time to stop when she observed V2 stopped, causing V2 to strike V1. D1 did not indicate that she was distracted but that she did not expect traffic to be stopped ahead of her.D2 stated that he was stopped in traffic waiting on the light when V1 struck V2, causing V2 to strike V3.D3 stated she was stopped in traffic waiting on the light when V2 struck V3.There was minor damage (dents and scratches) to all 3 vehicles. V1 had minor front bumper damage. V2 had minor front and rear bumper damage. V3 had minor rear bumper damage.There were no reported injuries.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON ROGERS STREET GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF DODDS STREET.V2 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON DODDS STREET AND ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT ONTO ROGERS STREET.V1 DISREGARDED THE STOP SIGN AND CAUSED THE FRONT OF V1 TO HIT THE DRIVERS SIDE OF V2.D1 ADVISED THAT HE WAS USING HIS GPS AT TIME OF ACCIDENT AND WAS DISTRACTED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of vehicle 1 stated that he was pulling out of the CVS parking lot at N. Curry Pike across from W. Broadway Ave. A large dump truck stopped to let him out, when he pulled out he went into the far north bound lane and struck Vehicle 2. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated that he was traveling north on N. Curry Pike when Vehicle 1 pulled out in front of him. He hit vehicle 1 on the driver side front causing heavy damage to the front of vehicle 1 and to the passenger side front of vehicle 2. Both vehicles were towed from the scene.

V1 was purchased on 04-10-2019 and was improperly plated with a plate from another vehicle. The crash occurred in a private parking lot. D1 was attempting to make a right turn into a parking space and struck V2 on the front passenger side bumper of V1, and striking V2 on the rear driver side quarter panel or bumper of V2.V2 was parked in a parking space and was unattended. Minor damage to both vehicles. No injuries were reported.

V2 WAS PARKING FACING SOUTH IN THE PARKING LOT OF 350 S. LANDMARK AVE, WHEN V1 BACKED INTO IT. V1 WAS SEEN BY WITNESS PAGE BACK OUT OF A NEARBY PARKING SPACE, INTO V2, THEN THE DRIVER GOT OUT TO LOOK AT DAMAGE. DRIVER WAS DESCRIBED AS A W/F/30'S WITH BLONDE HAIR. THAT DID NOT MATCH THE REGISTERED OWNER OF V1, WHO I HAVE NOT LOCATED YET.**4/14/19 I LOCATED CONTACT FOR THE REGISTERED OWNER OF V1, WHO SAID THE CAR WAS BEING USED BY JESSICA JOHNSON. I LOCATED HER BY PHONE, AND SHE SAID SHE STOPPED AND LOOKED, THOUGHT IT WAS VERY MINOR, AND LEFT HER NAME AND PHONE NUMBER ON A NOTE IN THE DOOR OF V2. SHE SAID SHE DID NOT SEE ANYONE AROUND V2, SO SHE LEFT. SHE PROVIDED ALL HER INFORMATION TO ME.MS. JOHNSON'S INSURANCE IS PROGRESSIVE INSURANCE, POLICY #919406642, PHONE 800-776-4737.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Driver one stated she driving south on S Liberty Drive when her grandchild scared her and she looked back checking on the child. Driver one stated she possibly crossed the center line and struck vehicle two in the front driver side corner and then continued and struck vehicle three in the front driver side corner.Driver two stated he was driving north on S Liberty Drive when vehicle one crossed the center line and struck his vehicle in the front left corner. Driver two stated he was complaining of chest pain.Driver three stated she was behind vehicle two when he honked his horn at vehicle one and then vehicle one struck her vehicle in the front left corner after vehicle one crossed the center line.

D1 STATED HE WAS RIDING 3RD IN A GROUP OF 3 MOTORCYCLES THROUGH A CURVE NEAR E SALT CREEK DR WHEN HE STRUCK A HOLE IN THE ROADWAY THAT CAUSED HIM TO LAY THE MOTORCYLE ON ITS SIDE. HE THEN STATED HE FELL FROM THE MOTORCYCLE BUT DOES NOT KNOW MUCH AFTER THAT.D1 ALSO MOVED THE MOTORCYCLE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Vehicle 1 was facing Eastbound on Covenanter Drive, just East of the Auto Mall Road intersection. Vehicle 1 pulled over to the side of the road at a marked bus stop to let passengers on.Vehicle 2 was traveling Eastbound on Covenanter Driver and merged around Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 began turning into the drive (south) to Kroger, when Vehicle 2's passenger side of his trailer struck the driver side of Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated that he was stationary when he was struck by Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated that Vehicle 1 was parked on a yellow curb and was not moving when the collision occurred. Driver 2 stated that he did not think he struck Vehicle 1 originally.

D1 stated he was traveling northbound on S. Liberty Drive approaching a vehicle stopped in the roadway. D1 stated he went around the vehicle on the left side to pass. While passing the stopped vehicle, V2 was turning left in front of him to which D1 stated the collision occurred. D2 stated he was waiting at a stop sign to make a left turn to head south onto S. Liberty Drive. D2 stated a vehicle stopped allowing him to make the turn. D2 pulled out to turn when V1 passed the stopped vehicle and collided with the front driver side of his V2. I spoke with a witness who stated she was waiting at the same intersection the crash occurred. She stated that traffic had stopped to allow V2 to make a turn. When V2 pulled out to turn, V1 crossed the double yellow line to pass a stopped vehicle causing the collision between V1 and V2. There were no injuries during this accident.

V1 was sweeping/cleaning the street along the curb when it struck V2, which was parked along the curb. V2 was unoccupied. Both vehicles were located on E 9th St just east of the intersection with N Grant st. V1/D1 stated he was sweeping/cleaning the street along the curb when he attempted to begin steering the vehicle around V2. D1 stated he was unable to avoid striking the vehicle when he initiated his attempt to go around the vehicle. V2 was parked and unoccupied.V1 did not sustain any visible damage. V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper and rear hatch door.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she backing out of a parking spot in the front row of the BMV located at 1531 S Curry Pike. D1 stated that she looked both ways before and during backing out of the parking spot and did not see anyone coming. D1 stated that she did not see V2 until the vehicles collided. There was no visible damage to Vehicle 1.D2 stated that he was traveling in a parking aisle of the parking lot of the BMV. D2 stated that he did see V1 backing out of the parking spot and that he continued down the aisle. D2 stated that his vehicle was was struck in the front bumper by V1 when it was backing out of the spot. D2 stated that he should have waited for V1 to back out of the parking spot.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE PRIVATE PARKING LOT OF 415 E 4TH ST, IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA.V1 WAS PARKED FACING NORTH IN THE PARKING LOT. V2 WAS STOPPED BEHIND V1 AWAITING TRAFFIC. V1 BEGAN BACKING (SB) AND COLLIDED WITH V2.D1 SAID HE WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT. HE SAID HE BEGAN BACKING UP AND HIT V2 BECAUSE HE DID NOT SEE HIM.D2 SAID HE WAS STOPPED IN THE PARKING LOT FOR TRAFFIC. HE SAID V1 BACKED INTO HIM.D1 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS VIRGINIA DRIVERS LICENSE. D2 WAS IDENTIFIED BY HIS IN DL. BOTH DRIVERS ADMITTED TO DRIVING THEIR RESPECTIVE VEHICLES.

V1 was traveling southbound on Fee Lane approaching the 17th Street and Fee Lane intersection. D1 noticed he was traveling in the left turn lane with the intention to continue southbound on Fee Lane through the intersection. When D1 noticed he was in the wrong lane, he moved V1 into the straight/right turn lane. As V1 was traveling into the straight/right turn lane, D1 did not notice V2 traveling in the straight/right turn lane and ended up striking V2. V1's front passenger side wheel made contact with the front driver side portion of V2. There was minimal damage to V1's front passenger side wheel.V2 was traveling southbound on Fee Lane in the straight/right turn lane while approaching the intersection of 17th Street and Fee Lane. V2 was intending to turn right onto 17th Street at the intersection to travel westbound on 17th Street. As V2 was approaching the intersection, V1 changed lanes into the straight/right turn lane and collided with the front driver side portion of V2. There was minimal to moderate damage to the front driver side bumper and fender on V2. Both vehicles were able to drive away from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 SAID SHE WAS TRYING TO TURN LEFT FROM A PARKING LOT IN THE 300 BLK OF S. WALNUT ST, ONTO WALNUT ST. AS SHE DID, V1 STRUCK V2 WHICH WAS NORTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST., IN THE LEFT LANE.D2 SAID SHE WAS NORTH BOUND WHEN V1 TURNED OUT, TRIED TO SWERVE BUT THE VEHICLES STRUCK.D1 SAID HER VIEW OF NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC WAS PARTIALLY BLOCKED BY PARKED VEHICLES ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE STREET, AND DID NOT SEE V2 WHEN SHE PULLED OUT.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

V1 was south bound on Walnut Street Pike and V2 was stopped or slowed in traffic at Walnut Street Pike and Fairfax Road. D1 was looking east when she did not stop and rear ended V2. D1 and D2 both had seat belts on and no injuries at the scene.D1 admitted to not having insurance and was cited the same.

V2 and V3 were both stopped on southbound State Road 37 at the traffic control signal at the intersection of S. Victor Pike. D1 stated that she could not get stopped in time before rear ending V2, which caused V2 to rear end V3 due to the faulty brakes on V1. Both D2 and D3 stated that they saw V1 in their rear view mirrors and estimated its speed at approximately 40-50mph when it rear ended V2. Both V1 and V2 were towed from the scene due to disabling damage, and D2 was transported from the scene by EMS for complaint of pain to her neck and back.
D1 stated he was southbound on Louden Rd when he sneezed, causing him to jerk the wheel and run off the roadway.

Wayport Road is a two lane asphalt frontage road that runs primarily north and south along the east side of I69. V1, black Pontiac, was traveling south on Wayport Road north of Sample Road. V1 traveled left of center before striking the guardrail face along the east side of the roadway. V1 continued south while rotating and struck the guardrail face a second time. V1 came to final rest with the front of V1 resting against the guardrail face. D1, Burns, stated he was traveling south on Wayport Road. D1 stated he diverted his attention from the roadway to check his cell telephone. D1 stated he swerved to the left as he approached the left hand curve in the roadway. D1 stated he lost control of V1 and began to slide left of center. D1 stated he struck a guardrail along the east side of the roadway. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail face consistent with an impact. Evidence shows yawmarks present on the roadway leading from the southbound lane of Wayport Road to the area of impact from V1.

D1 stated he was coming home from French Lick casino via south IN-37. D1 took the northbound ramp leaving S IN-37 to enter northbound I-69. D1 stated when taking the on-ramp, he swerved to miss something, which caused him to lose control of the vehicle. The vehicle then ran off the road into the median between the on-ramp and I-69. V1 collided with a ditch within the median, which according to D1 sent the vehicle slightly airborne before coming to a stop in the median.D1 did have airbag deployment, and requested an ambulance for head and neck pain. D1 was treated and released on scene.D1 admitted he did not have insurance on the vehicle, neither through U-Haul, nor through his own insurance company. He received a citation for operating a vehicle without proof of financial responsibility.

V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1 TRAVELLING N/B ON S WEIMER WHEN A DEER ENTERED THE ROADWAY. V1 REAR ENDED V2 UPON V2 SLOWING DOWN TO ALLOW THE DEER TO CROSS THE ROAD.D1 STATED THAT HIS INSURANCE INFORMATION WAS ON THE REGISTRATION, BUT I WAS UNABLE TO LOCATE IT. D1 STATED THAT HE WOULD PROVIDE D2 WITH THE INFORMATION ON 4/13/19

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING WESTBOUND AND OPERATING LEFT OF CENTER WHEN HE CRESTED THE HILL AND APPROACHED THE TURN. AT THAT POINT, HE NOTICED V2 AND ATTEMPTED TO STOP, CAUSING THE BRAKES TO LOCK UP AND COLLIDE WITH V2.D2 STATED HE CAME AROUND THE CURVE AND SAW V1 IN HIS LANE OF TRAVEL PRIOR TO V1 SLIDING AND COLLIDING WITH HIS VEHICLE.

V2 was stopped in the private drive of 2916 W Alder CT when V1 was backing up and collided with V2.V1 left the scene after the accident.There was minor damage to V2 and an unknown amount of damage to V1.The owner of V2 did not wish to pursue any criminal charges.The damage on V2 was captured on BWC 1613, no injuries reported.

Owner 1 advised she parked her vehicle on April 13th 2019 around 5pm and then returned to her vehicle on April 14th 2019 around 11:40am. Owner 1 noticed damage to the driver side rear bumper and the taillight was busted. The suspect vehicle is possibly white in color due to finding white paint transfer on the rear bumper of V1.No other suspect information in this accident.

Vehicle Use (Explain In Narrative)- V1 is a 'Bird' or 'Lime' motorized, electric powered scooter. V1 was traveling east on the north sidewalk of Jones Avenue approaching the exit to the Read Circle Drive. V2 was exciting the Read Circle Drive south. V1 struck V2 as V2 was stopped checking for oncoming vehicular traffic on Jones Avenue. As V1 approached the exit of the circle drive, V1 failed to stop and struck the front right quarter panel of V2. D1 did not stay on scene of the accident. D2 stated as she was exiting the circle drive she came to a complete stop to check for traffic coming from the east. D2 stated after a brief pause, V1 crashed into D2. D2 had a large dent and heavy cosmetic damage on the right front quarter panel.D2 stated D1 declined medical attention and was persistent for D2 to leave the scene. D2 stated D1 eventually left the scene without giving her any information.
Unit 1 was traveling south on I-69 beside unit 2, also traveling south on I-69. Unit 1 slipped a belt in the engine bay. Unit 2 was struck by the belt slipped from unit 1.

Driver 1 stated he was going south on Old State Road 37 in the area of Robinson Road when a deer entered the roadway and was struck. Driver 1 stated the deer was struck in the front right fender of the car. There were no marks are the car but there was a very small blemish (crack in the plastic bumper). I found no visible damage but the driver stated they needed the report as per county policy.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was pulling out of the parking lot at 1414 N Jordan to turn southbound onto Jordan avenue. V2 was driving southbound on N Jordan avenue approaching 1414 N Jordan avenue.D1 stated that she stopped, check both ways, and pulled onto N Jordan Avenue. D1 stated that V2 then struck V1. D1 stated that V2 was travelling at an estimated speed of 50 miles per hour, and that she did not see the vehicle prior to pulling out.D2 stated that she was travelling southbound on N Jordan avenue when V1 pulled out in front of V2. D2 stated she did not know how fast she was driving.Damage to V1 consisted of scratches to the rear driver side rim. There was no other damage.Damage to V2 consisted scratches and dents to the front driver side bumper.There were no reported injuries.

THIS OCCURRED IN THE PRIVATE PARKING LOT OF KROGER; 500 S LIBERTY DRIVE, IN THE CITY OF BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA.V1 AND V2 WERE EB EXITING THE PRIVATE LOT OF KROGER. V2 WAS STOPPED FOR TRAFFIC. V1 REAR ENDED V2.D2 SAID SHE WAS WAITING TO EXIT THE PARKING LOT OF KROGER. SHE SAID V1 REAR ENDED HER, THEN LEFT THE SCENE.THERE IS NO VEHICLE DESCRIPTION FOR V1. D2 ADMITTED TO DRIVING AND WAS IDENTIFIED BY HER VALID IN DL.CASE INACTIVE, DUE TO NO SUSPECT INFORMATION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 stated that he was traveling west bound on E. 2nd St. Near the intersection with S. Grant St. When V1 failed to yield the right of way and struck his vehicle. D1 stated traveling northbound on S. Grant St. Near the intersection with E. 2nd St. When she stated that V2 was traveling to fast and she didn't see him when she entered the intersection causing her to strike his vehicle.

V1 and V4 were driving southbound on the bypass at Range. V2 and V3 were stopped in traffic at the traffic light for 10th street. D1 stated that she was driving southbound and was distracted and did not have time to stop before striking V1 into V2. V2 struck V3 after V1 struck V2. D1 advised there was a white Dodge dually that struck V1 which was marked V4.
