D1 stated that V4 did not cause V1 to strike V2, but that V4 struck V1 after the initial collision.D2 stated she was sitting stopped in traffic when V1 struck V2 causing V2 to strike V3.D3 stated she was sitting stopped in traffic when V2 struck V3.V4 fled the scene and was not located.Damage to V1 was scratches to the front bumper.Damage to V2 was scratches to the rear and front bumper.Damage to V3 was scratches to the rear bumper.There were no reported injuries.

State Road 46 is a State Highway that primarily runs east and west. At this location it has two lanes running east and west. This crash occurred in the east bound lanes. Vehicle #1, a 2016 Toyota Corolla, was eastbound on State Road 46 approaching College Avenue. Vehicle #2, a 2005 Honda CRV, was also traveling eastbound on State Road 46 in front of vehicle #1. Vehicle #2 had stopped for traffic that was backed up from the intersection. Vehicle #1 could not stop and struck vehicle #2 in the rear. Driver #1, Kane Barrett, stated that he was behind vehicle #2 traveling east on SR 46 when his cellular phone charger became tangled at his feet. As driver #1 attempted to free the charger he did not see vehicle #2 stop and was unable to get vehicle #1 stopped before the collison. Driver #2 Sharon Roth stated that vehicle #1 was following her too closely and as she stopped vehicle #2 for stopped traffic, vehicle #1 struck vehicle #2 in the rear. Evidence on the scene indicates that vehicle #1 was following vehicle #2 too closely when driver #1 became distracted by the cell phone charger. Driver #1 could not get vehicle #1 stopped and struck vehicle #2 in the rear.

D1 (STEVEN BLYSTONE) WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC AT RED LIGHT. STEVEN ADVISED THE VEHICLE(S) IN FRONT OF HIM MISSED THE TRAFFIC LIGHT. STEVEN DECIDED TO REVERSE AND INTENDED TO GO ANOTHER WAY. STEVEN DID NOT SEE V2 (TOYOTA SCION) BEHIND HIM AND BACKED INTO IT. D2 (MILTON HINNANT) WAS STOPPED AT TRAFFIC LIGHT BEHIND V1 (JEEP W/Y). MILTON ADVISED JEEP REVERSED INTO HIS VEHICLE. MILTON HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HIS KNEE AND WAS TRANSPORTED BY BHASS.

State Road 446 is a two lane, two way asphalt highway that runs primarily north and south. At the time of the crash it was overcast outside, but the roadway was dry. SR 446 is a very curvy road between Lawrence and Monroe County and is heavily traveled by motorcycles every year. Several motorcycle involved crashes occur on this highway every year. At the time of the crash traffic was low to moderate. Vehicle 1, a purple 2003 Yamaha YZF motorcycle, was traveling north on SR 446 near the Chapel Hill Rd. intersection. As V1 approached a right hand curve just north of the intersection, V1 lost control. V1 crossed the double yellow line in the center of the road then ran off the left (west) side of the roadway. V1 hit a traffic sign pole in the grass on the west side of the road before going down a short embankment and coming to a stop. Driver 1, Gavin Lutz, said he was traveling north on SR 446 just north of the Chapel Hill Rd. intersection. D1, told me that as he approached a right hand curve he hit a patch of gravel that was at the beginning of the curve near the center of the road. D1 said he continued straight forward while his bike wobbled. D1 advised me that he ran off the west side of the roadway and hit a traffic sign (curve advisory sign) with the rear wheel on his motor cycle. D1 told me that after that he believed he flipped over and fell off of his bike. Witness 1, Cameron Turpin, said he was traveling north on SR 446 in his truck directly behind V1. W1 said he watched as V1 entered into the right hand turn. W1 said it appeared as V1 was going too fast into the curve and lost control. W1 told me V1 never regained control and went off the roadway and struck a road side sign pole. After hitting the sign pole W1 said V1 spun down the embankment before coming to a stop on its side. Witness 2, Tyler Sheppard, advised that he as traveling north on SR 446 on his motorcycle directly behind V1. W2 said he watched as V1 enter into the right hand turn. W2 said it appeared as V1 was going too fast into the curve and lost control.Evidence shows the motorcycle was totaled due to damage all over the bike. Evidence shows D1 was transported to the hospital due to his injuries obtained during the crash. Evidence shows the roadway seemed clear. Evidence shows a broken down curve ahead sign. Evidence shows tire marks on the left side of roadway where the motorcycle left the roadway leading to where the sign use to stand.

OWNER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE PARKED INSIDE OF JUMP N JOEYS, UNIT 1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE. SHE STATED THAT SHE WAS POSITIVE THAT THE DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED WHILE AT JUMP N JOEYS, AND NOT PRIOR TO ARRIVING THERE.BSHE STATED SHE HAD RECENTLY PURCHASED THE CAR, AND WAS AWARE OF ITS CONDITION. I ASKED AN EMPLOYEE OF JUMP N JOEYS AND THEY STATED THAT THERE WERE NO CAMERAS OUTSIDE. I ASKED THE DRIVER OF THE PARKED VEHICLE NEXT TO UNIT 1 IF THEY HAD IMPACTED WHEN ARRIVING AND THEY STATED THEY DID NOT. THERE WAS A SMALL DENT SUSTAINED TO THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE DOOR, BUT I CANNOT DETERMINE WHAT CAUSED THE DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was driving west on W. 3rd St. V2 was driving north on S. College Mall Rd. D1 stated that he was driving west on W. 3rd St when he got into the wrong lane and made a right turn onto S. College Mall Rd. D1 stated that once he turned right he struck V2. D1 also stated that once he struck V2, V2 slid and hit a concrete barrier which caused the car to flip on its side. Part of the concrete barrier on the east side of the road was destroyed. D2 stated that he was driving north on S. College Mall Rd and had a green light. D2 stated that he proceeded through the intersection when he was struck by V1. D2 stated that once he was hit by V1 he slid which caused him to hit a concrete barrier and his vehicle turned on it's side.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Traffic Control: RR CROSSING GATES AND MEDIAN BARRIER
NARRATIVE: V2 was W/B on E 3rd Street approaching S Grant Street and collided with the driver's side of V1. V1 was stopped at the stop sign on S Grant Street at the intersection of E 3rd St. V1 pulled out in front of V2 and V2 collided with it. D1 then fled the scene and was stopped by police at 1650 W Bloomfield Rd.D1 stated that she did not remember being in an accident.D2 stated that she was W/B on E 3rd Street and V1 pulled out in front of her vehicle, and stopped in the roadway. D1 stated that she attempted to brake, but could not due to the wet pavement.D1 was cited for leaving the scene of an accident and transported by the Ellettsville Police Department for an OWI investigation.

V1 and V2 were facing south on S Rose Ave. at the stop sign at the E 3rd St. intersection. V1 began backing up, colliding with the front of V2.D1 advised that he was facing south on S Rose Ave. at the stop sign at E 3rd St. D1 advised that he began to pull forward to go, but realized there was another vehicle on E 3rd St. that he might collide with. D1 advised that he began to back up to get out of the lane of travel for E 3rd St. and as he was backing up, collided with V2.D2 advised that she was facing south on S Rose Ave. behind V1. D2 advised that they were waiting at the stop sign at E 3rd St. D2 advised that V1 began to pull forward, so she pulled slightly forward as well, when V1 suddenly backed up into the front of V2.V1 sustained minor damage to the rear bumper.V2 sustained paint transfer and scrapes to the front bumper cover.D1 is an international student at IU and possessed an international driver's license.

Monroe County Emergency Dispatch was advised of a crashed vehicle on its roof in the area of North Old SR 37 at the Sample Road intersection at approximately 5:30 AM on April 15, 2019. Fire Department personnel determined that no one was inside the vehicle and that the engine was cold to the touch. While attempting to locate the registered owner to conduct a welfare check, the owner/driver of the vehicle contacted dispatch to report the collision. Driver 1 states that he was operating vehicle 1 northbound on North Old State Road 37 approaching the Sample Road intersection when a southbound vehicle came over the center divider line and nearly collided with his vehicle. Driver 1 states taht he swerved to avoid the collision which caused his vehicle to exit the northwest corner of the intersection into a ditch and row of trees before rolling onto its roof. Driver 1 states that he did not have any cellular phone service at the scene of the crash to contact emergency services and decided to walk to a nearby friends house at 8551 North Old SR 37 where he later contact Monroe County Dispatch to report the collision. Based on the vehicle's engine being cold to the touch when law enforcement and fire personnel arrived, it is believed that the collision occurred earlier in the morning on April 15 and driver 1 waited a considerable amount of time to report the collision to emergency services. Driver 1 smelled of alcohol during the investigation and provided a portable breath test sample of .050 BrAC. Based on the undetermined amount of time between the collision occurring and the investigation, no operating while intoxicated investigation was conducted. However based on damage to roadway signs and private property and fencing, driver 1 was issued a misdemeanor citation for failing to remain at/or report the collision.Vehicle 1 was towed to the 8551 N Old SR 37 address at the request of the owner by Hawkins Towing. See Monroe County Sheriff's Office report for additional information regarding this investigation.
V2 was parked and unoccupied and an unknown vehicle struck the drivers side rear bumper and left the area. The owner discovered the damage on 4/13/19 at 1100hrs.

D2 stated that they were stopped at the stoplight on W 3rd St at the intersection of S College Ave, in the north lane, headed eastbound, when their vehicle was struck from the rear by V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS ON THE PARKING LOT ADJACENT TO S ROGERS STREET, WAITING TO TURN LEFT/NORTH ONTO ROGERS STREET. AN UNINVOLVED DRIVER STOPPED ON NORTH BOUND ROGERS AND WAVED FOR D1 TO ENTER THE ROADWAY. D1 DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH. AS V1 TURNED LEFT/NORTH OUT OF THE PARKING LOT, IT WAS STRUCK BY V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON ROGERS STREET APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S ROCKPORT ROAD. AS V2 PASSED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, HE OBSERVED V1 EXIT THE PARKING LOT TO HIS RIGHT AND ENTER THE ROADWAY DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM. V2 COLLIDED WITH V1.

V1 was traveling west through the Atwater Parking lot. V1 attempted to turn left and park in a marked parking stall. V1 did not leave enough space for a proper turn and side swiped V2 which was parked in a marked parking stall facing south. V1 collided with parked V2. D1 stated that she was attempting to park and accidentally hit the side of V2. D1 stated that she thought she had enough room to make the turn. V2 was unoccupied. There was minor damage to the rear drivers side door and fender of V2. There was minor damage to the front passenger side bumper of V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was facing westbound on W 3rd Street waiting to make a left turn onto the southbound ramp of SR 37. D1 stated a vehicle in the oncoming lane waived at him to make his turn. When D1 made the turn V2 collided with the passenger side of his V1. D1 did not sustain any injuries.D2 stated she was travelling eastbound on W 3rd Street entering the intersection of the southbound ramp of SR 37. D2 stated as she was going through the intersection V1 turned in front of her causing her to T-bone V1. D2 was transported by EMS to the hospital.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: SR45 is a highway that runs primarily in a eastern and western direction through Monroe County. Kinser Pike is a local road that runs in a northern and southern direction and intersects with SR45. The intersection of SR45 and Kinser Pike is a four-way intersection that uses traffic control signals for vehicular traffic flow. The traffic control signals were functioning properly at the time of the crash. V1 (2016 gray Ford Focus) was preparing to make a left turn from eastbound SR45 onto northbound Kinser Pike. V2 (2008 black Chevrolet Colorado pickup truck) was traveling westbound in the right lane of SR45. As V2 entered the intersection V1 failed to yield and attempted to make a left turn in front of V2. V2 then struck V1 in the passenger side rear door and fender area. This action caused V1 to rotate in a clockwise direction coming to final rest in the southbound lane of Kinser Pike facing west. V2 came to rest on the shoulder of SR45 westbound. D1 (Daniel Dundas) stated that he was traveling eastbound on SR45. He was attempting to make a left turn onto Kinser Pike northbound and did not see V2. D1 stated that he traveled in front of V2 and was struck on the passenger side by V2. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 (Jacob Cox) stated that he was traveling westbound in the right lane on SR45. D2 stated that V1 turned in front of him and he attempted to stop, but was unable to. D1 stated that he struck V1. He was wearing his seat belt. W1 (Susan Matheus) stated that she was stopped in traffic on Kinser Pike northbound on the south side of the intersection. W1 stated that east and westbound traffic had a green light. W1 stated that V1 made a left turn in front of V2. V2 struck V1 in the passenger side. W1 stated that V1, rotated clockwise and came to a stop in the southbound lanes of Kinser Pike on the north side of the intersection. During the course of my investigation, I observed debris on the roadway in the intersection where the crash occurred. I, also observed disabling damage to V1 on the passenger side, rear door and fender. V2 also had disabling damage to the entire front end. D1 did not report any injuries. At the conclusion of my investigation, D2 stated that he had bruising on his lower left arm from the airbag. D2 denied any medical treatment at the scene.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Failure To Yield on the part of D1. This was determined by both drivers and witness statements as well as damage sustained by both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1/V1 left the scene prior to my arrival and is not known at the time of this report. D2 stated that he was headed East on W 3rd St., approaching SR 37. D2 stated that as he approached SR 37 V1 drove along side him on his drivers side, and then merged into his lane prior to being clear of his vehicle, causing the passenger side of V1 to strike the drivers side of V2. D2 stated that D1 then acted as if nothing had happened, and proceeded into his lane and took the exit onto SR 37 South. D1 was unsure of the make, model, or color of V1, but did state that it had a handicap Indiana license plate. D2 described D1 as a older female with grey hair.The investigation into the leaving the scene of the accident is ongoing.

V1, V2, V3 were traveling S/B on College Ave. V1 rear ended V2 which caused V2 to rear end V3 causing damage to all three vehicles. D1 advised that he was traveling S/B on College Ave. D1 advised that he observed traffic backup S/B on College Ave, but proceeded through the intersection. D1 advised that he took his eyes off the road for a second when he rear ended V2. D1 advised that he was not paying attention. D1 did not have any injuries.D2 advised that she was traveling S/B on College Ave. D2 advised that she was stopped in traffic due to the traffic control signal turning red. D2 advised that she then felt the impact of V1 rear ending V2. D2 advised that the impact from V1 caused V2 to rear end V3. D2 advised that she had a complaint of pain of 2 out of 10 to her back but refused medical attention.D3 advised that he was traveling S/B on College Ave. D3 advised that while stopped in traffic, he felt the impact of V2 rear ending his vehicle. D3 advised that he did not have any injuries. Due to D1 following to closely, V1 rear ended V2 which caused V2 to rear end V3 causing damage to all three vehicles.

D1 STATED THAT HE ATTEMTED TO BRAKE FOR THE RED LIGHT ON SR46/CURRY PK BUT WAS UNABLE TO IN TIME TO AVOID A COLLISION. STATED THAT THE ROAD MUST HAVE BEEN SLICK FROM THE RAIN. W1 STATED THAT V1 REAR ENDED V2 WHILE V2 WAS SITTING STATIONARY AT THE STOP LIGHT.ROAD CONDITION WAS WET, BUT NOT SLICK. HAD BEEN RAINING ALL DAY AND SURFACE OILS WASHED AWAY.

Driver 1 stated she was driving west on W 3rd Street approaching S College Ave when she was distracted and followed the car in front of her through the intersection which was displaying a red light at the time she entered the intersection. Driver 1 stated she was hit by vehicle 2 on the rear passenger side. Driver 1 stated she didn't have insurance.Driver 2 stated she was south on S College Ave when she got a green light at the W 3rd Street light and proceeded into the intersection. Driver 2 stated she hit vehicle 1 in the passenger side as vehicle 1 ran a red light.

Driver one stated that he was attempting to leave the alley of the sheriffs office. He stated that he attempted to turn left but had to make a wide turn do to a squad car parked at the left edge. He stated that he swung the vehicle wide to the right and his trailer clipped the parked squad car on the right of him.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS BACKING SOUTHBUND OUT OF THE PARKING LOT AT 210 EAST KIRKWOOD WHEN IT FAILED TO YEILD TO V2, WHICH STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER OF HER VEHICLE. D1 STATED STATED SHE WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT WHEN D2 STRUCK THE REAR END OF HER VEHICLE. D1 STATED D2 GAVE HER AN OLD EXPIRED INSURANCE CARD BUT REFUSED TO GIVE HER NAME OR PHONE NUMBER AND THEN LEFT THE SCENE.D2 LEFT THE SCENE WITHOUT GIVING THE REQUIRED INFORATION TO V1 AND I HAVE BEEN UNBALE TO SPEAK WITH HER YET.D2 CAME TO THE POLICE DEPARTMENT LATER IN THE EVENING TO SPEAK WITH ME ABOUT THE ACCIDENT. D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE ALLEY WHEN V1 BEGAN BACKING OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT AND IT STRUCK HER VEHICLE.

Thomas Mobley witnessed a grey GMC Sierra disregard a road closed sign, drive off of the roadway, and hit 2 wooden stakes that were marking places for future work. The driver of the vehicle knowingly drove through a closed roadway and drove into the grass to bypass signage. The truck left the scene without exchanging his information even after speaking with Mobley after the accident.

D1 was headed East on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of SR 37. D2 was traveling North from SR 37 on the on ramp to W 3rd St. D2 stopped at the intersection, waited for a green traffic signal, and then proceeded to turn left onto W 3rd St. In the process of the turn V2 was struck on the front drivers side by the front of V1. During the course of the investigation it was determined that D1 disregarded a red traffic signal, causing the collision. D1 stated that he was headed East on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of SR 37. D1 stated that as he crossed the intersection V1 struck V2. D1 stated he did not remember if he had a green or red traffic signal, and stated that it was possible it was red and than he ran it. D2 stated that she was headed North on SR 37 and took the on ramp to W 3rd St. D2 stated that she stopped at the intersection and waited for a green traffic signal to indicate that she could go. D2 stated that she did get the green traffic signal and proceeded to enter the traffic lane to make a left turn onto W 3rd St. D2 stated that as she entered the traffic lane V2 was struck by V1. D2 stated that she was 100% confident that she had the green traffic signal and that D1 ran through the intersection while the traffic signal was red.- Supplement - On 04/21/19 I, Officer Wood, was informed by D2's insurance agent that the vehicle listed for V2 and insurance provider were incorrect. I have fixed both issues.

APRIL 18, 2019 I RESPONDED TO A REPORT OF A SEMI TRUCK THAT HAD KNOCKED DOWN THE STOP SIGN ON ROGERS STREET AT ROGERS STREET. UPON ARRIVAL I SAW THE SIGN WAS KNOCKED OVER. I WAS UNABLE TO LOCATE THE BLACK SEMI THAT REPORTEDLY KNOCKED IT DOWN. I TOOK PHOTOS AND CALLED FOR STREET DEPT TO COME AND PUT ANOTHER SIGN UP. ONCE THEY ARRIVED I LEFT.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E SMITHVILLE RD, WHEN AROUND A CURVE THEN DOWN A HIT AND RAN OFF THE ROAD A HIT A GROUP OF MAILBOX.D1, A HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT, WENT TO SCHOOL AND I TOOK THE REPORT FROM D1'S PARENTS.IT WAS RAINING DURING THE TIME OF THE COLLSION, D1 WAS LIKELY TRAVELING TOO FAST FOR THE WEATHER CONDITIONS.FOLLOWING THE COLLSION, D1 MOVED APPROX. 150 FEETS FROM THE POINT OF COLLISION AND PARKED SAFELY OFF THE ROAD. THEREFORE NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS BACKING V1(WITH TRAILER) IN THE PARKING LOT OF 5100 S VICTOR PIKE. D1 STATED THAT AS HE WAS BACKING UP TO LOAD HIS TRAILER HE NUDGED THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF HIS TRAILER. D1 STATED THAT HE JUST DIDN'T SEE V2.P1 STATED THAT HE WAS SLEEPING IN THE CAB OF V2 WHEN HE FELT V1 STRIKE V2 WITH HIS TRAILER. V2 STATED THAT THERE WAS INTERNAL DAMAGE TO HIS CAB OF V2.NEITHER VEHICLE WERE DAMAGED TO THE POINT THAT THEY NEEDED TOWED. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED TO ME.

Driver 1 stated that he was driving on Ratliff Road when a squirrel ran out and he swerved to miss it, dropping the drivers side tires off the side of the road. From there he failed to correct in time and struck one of the landscaping trees at the Zion Church of the Nazarene, located at 6287 W. Ratliff Road, Bloomington, In 47404.RICKS TOWING CAME TO THE SCENE AND PULLED TO VAN OFF OF THE TREE. VAN WAS MOBILE, SO IT DID NOT NEED TO BE TOWED.

At approximately 1815 hours on 4/19/2019 both V1 and V2 were east bound on 10th Street, approaching the intersection of 10th and Sunrise Drive. V1 unsuccessfully attempted to brake and collided with the rear bumper of V2. D1 advised that she had been traveling east bound on 10th, at approximately the intersection of 10th and Campbell Street, when she began braking to avoid a collision with V2. She stated that she began to decelerate, but then hydro-planed into V2. D1 advised that she had been following V2 at what she considered a safe distance. There was significant damage to the front bumper and hood of V1. D2 advised that she had been traveling east bound on 10th, just east of the intersection of 10th and Campbell, when she was rear ended by V1. She stated that she had not seen a vehicle rapidly approaching in her mirrors, nor had she suddenly braked. There was very minor scraping and paint damage to the rear bumper of V2, however there appeared to be moderate damage to the under carriage. Both D1 and D2 advised that they had been traveling very near the 25mph speed limit in the moments leading the crash. Neither party complained of injury. The road condition was wet and there was very slight rainfall, however there was no standing water. Bland's towed V1 to 1200 N Jordan Avenue.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON BUSINESS 37, RETURNING FROM A LONG TRIP, AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY DO TO BEING TIRED. D1 WAS REPORTED AS A PERSON THAT MAY WANT TO HARM HERSELF BUT D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT TRY TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY ON PURPOSE. THE ACCIDENT CAUSED SEVERE DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE, AS IT WAS FOUND ON ITS ROOF. THE VEHICLE DID NOT HAVE A LICENSE PLATE ON IT, IT ONLY SAID "TAG APPLIED FOR". THE VIN CAME BACK TO ANOTHER FAMILY BUT IT WAS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN RECENTLY PURCHASED BY D1. D1 HAD CUTS AND BRUISING ON HER LOWER ARM. WE TRIED TO GET D1 TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL FOR HER INJURIES BUT SHE REFUSED AND SAID SHE WOULD GO LATER.W1 STATED THAT V1 WAS SWERVING IN FRONT OF HER AND THEN VEERED OFF THE ROADWAY, FLIPPING OVER AND LANDING ON ITS ROOF. W1 STATED THAT D1 TOLD HER THAT SHE HAD BEEN DRIVING FROM ALABAMA AND FELL ASLEEP WHILE DRIVING.D1 DID NOT SHOW ANY SIGNS OF IMPAIRMENT AT THE TIME OF CONTACT WITH DEPUTIES.
D1 AND V1 LEFT THE SCENE.V2 WAS STRUCK ON THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE QUARTER PANEL. NO WITNESSES NO CAMERAS.CRIMINAL CASE COMPLETED. END.

Driver 1 stated he was stopped at the stop sign and thought it was a four-way stop and that it was his turn to proceed. Driver 1 stated he proceeded through the intersection driving west when vehicle 2 hit him on the passenger side. Driver 1 stated he then ran into the front bumper of vehicle 3 barley hitting the vehicle.Driver 2 stated she was driving south on S Kingston Drive when vehicle 1 drove through the intersection. Driver 2 stated she slammed on her brakes but it happened to fast she hit vehicle 1 in the passenger side.Driver 3 stated she was stopped at the intersection facing east when vehicle 1 drove into the intersection and was hit by vehicle 2 and vehicle 1 ran into her front bumper. Witness 1 stated he was behind vehicle 2 when vehicle 1 ran a stop sign and caused the accident.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: At the scene of the crash, SR 46 is a multi-lane, two way highway with a center turn lane. It was raining, causing the roadway to be wet.Vehicle #1 is blue, 2013, Jeep SUV that was traveling eastbound on SR46, preparing to stop at the intersection of N. Union Valley Road. Vehicle #2 is a white, 2018, Chevrolet passenger car that was also traveling eastbound on SR46 preparing to stop at the intersection of N. Union Valley Road. Vehicle #1 was behind Vehicle #2. Vehicle #1 and Vehicle #2, were slowing down and preparing to stop at the lighted signal of the intersection. Vehicle #1 then struck Vehicle #2 in the rear. Both vehicles then came to rest in the interesection. Vehicle #1 sustained damage across the entire front end. Vehicle #2 sustained intrusive damage to the entire rear end. Driver #1, Cassie Bailey, stated she was traveling eastbound on SR46. She was slowing down for the red light. When she attempted to apply the brakes to stop, she slid into Vehicle #2. She was unable to avoid the collision.Driver #2, John Richardson, stated he was stopped at the intersection of SR46 and Union Valley Road when Vehicle #1 slid into the back of his car. He stated he never saw Vehicle #1 until the impact. I, Trooper Bault of the Indiana State Police, was a witnesses to the crash itself. Vehicle #2 had stopped at the intersection of SR46 and N. Union Valley Road for a red light. As Vehicle #2 was coming to a stop, Vehicle #1 collided with the rear of Vehicle #2. Based on the facts from this investigation, it is this investigating officer's opinion that the primary cause of this crash is speed too fast for roadway conditions on the part of Driver #1. This was determined based on the marks in the roadway leading to final rest and the damages sustained to both vehicles, and myself visually observing the crash. GLB

Driver 1 (D1) advised that she was attempting to exit the parking lot of 3100 S Wanut Street to head south on S Walnut Street. D1 advised that she had gotten distracted and was concentrating on finding a place to enter traffic. D1 advised that when she found an opening that she attempted to turn out of the parking lot and had lost sight of the pillar on the property. D1 explained that she cut the turn too sharp and that the rear passenger side door of her vehicle hit the pillar and knocked it over. I was able to observe damage to both the pillar and the rear passenger door of her vehicle. The vehicle was able to be driven from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was travelling Westbound on 17th St near St.Paul's Catholic Church going straight when V1 turned left from 17th St. into the church parking lot striking V2's front end. I first spoke to D1 who stated that he was on 17th Street near St.Paul's Church when he attempted to turn left into the parking lot. D1 stated there was a lot of traffic and so he had been waiting a short time before he could make the left turn. D1 stated that he saw a vehicle's headlights heading westbound, however he felt that he had plenty of time to make the turn before the vehicle got close. D1 also stated that several vehicles were pulling out of the parking lot in front of him so he had a hard time seeing. D1 made the left turn, and he stated that while making the turn he heard a car horn and wheels screeching, so he slammed on his brakes. At this time, he saw V2 as V1 made contact, striking V2. I then spoke to D2 who stated she was heading Westbound on 17th Street going straight. D2 stated that she suddenly saw V1 make a left turn into the parking lot out in front of her. D2 stated she slammed on the brakes so that her foot was on the floorboard, however she advised it was too late, as V1 had already struck the front end of V2. V1 has damage to the passenger side front bumper. V2 sustained damage to the front end and the license plate on the front of the vehicle.

V2 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT EB AT 303 E KIRKWOOD AVE. V1 WAS TRAVELING NB IN THE PARKING LOT. THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. D1 LEFT THE SCENE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.D2 STATED THAT V2 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT EB AT 303 E KIRKWOOD AVE WHEN THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1. D1 THEN EXITED THEIR VEHICLE AND YELLED AT D2 ABOUT THE ACCIDENT. D2 STATED THAT IT APPEARED THAT D1 WAS MORE CONCERNED ABOUT DAMAGE TO HER OWN VEHICLE AND, WHEN D2 REQUESTED THAT THE EXCHANGE INFORMATION, D1 ENTERED V1 AND LEFT THE SCENE.DAMAGE TO V2 CAPTURED ON BWC 1613.THERE WAS NO CAMERA FOOTAGE THAT CAPTURED THE PLATE NUMBER FOR V1.

V1 WAS PARKED LEGALLY ON THE WEST SIDE OF N MONROE ST NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH N ORRIS DR. THERE WAS ONE OCCUPANT IN THE BACKSEAT OF V1. THIS OCCUPANT ATTEMPTED TO OPEN THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR OF V1. UPON DOING SO, V2 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON N MONROE ST AND STRUCK THE DOOR OF V1. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON N MONROE ST WHEN, NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH N ORRIS DR, V2 WAS PASSING V1 WHICH WAS PARKED, AND V1'S DRIVER'S SIDE DOOR OPENED, AND V2 STRUCK V1'S DRIVER'S SIDE DOOR.

D2 was traveling East on West St Rd 46. D2 turned on his turn signal and slowed to make a right hand turn into Chicago Pizza (5621 W ST RD 46). D1 did not see D2 turning and was traveling to fast to avoid hitting the drivers side rear of the vehicle. D2 then continued into the Chicago Pizza parking lot and D1 continued down to the next parking lot.

V1 was driving east bound on smith street approaching the intersection with s Lincoln. V1 did not observe the stop sign and drove into the intersection. V2 was traveling north on S Lincoln st when V1 entered her lane of travel. V1 then collided with the front driver side of V2 causing damage to both vehicles. V2 was towed from the scene.D1 stated that she was driving and she did not see the stop sign at all when she entered the intersection. D1 then entered the intersection without yielding to the stop sign and collided with V2.D2 stated that she was driving north on Lincoln when she noticed V1 entering the intersection. D2 said that she did attempt to steer away fron V1 but was unable to in time.

D1 ADVISED HE WAS BACKING OUT OF HIS PARKING SPACE AND DID NOT SEE V2. D1 THEN BACKED V1 INTO THE PASSENGER FRONT DOOR OF V2.D2 ADVISED SHE HAD JUST BACKED OUT OF HER PARKING SPACE AND WAS PUTTING HER CAR INTO DRIVE WHEN V1 STRUCK V2 ON THE PASSENGER FRONT DOOR. THERE WAS DAMAGE ON THE PASSENGER REAR DOOR NOT FROM THIS ACCIDENT.BOTH VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

V1 was traveling E/B on 4th ST. V2 was traveling N/B on Walnut ST. V1 disregarded the traffic control signal and struck V2 causing damage to the vehicle.D1 advised that he was traveling E/B on 4th ST. D1 also stated that the traffic control signal was green on 4th ST. when he proceeded through the intersection colliding with V2. D1 advised that he was not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling N/B on Walnut ST. D2 stated that the traffic control signal was green on Walnut ST. when he proceeded through the intersection. D2 advised that he observed V1 entering the intersection, when he slammed on his brakes before he collided with V1. D2 advised that he was not injured. W1 advised that she was standing at the corner of 4ht & Walnut St facing N/B. W1 advised that she observed V2 proceeded through the intersection going N/B on Walnut ST. while the traffic control signal was green. W1 advised that she then heard a loud noise when she observed V1 collide with V2. W1 advised that D1 traffic control signal was red when he proceeded through the intersection.Due to D1 disregarding the traffic control signal, V1 struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

V1 WAS PARKED IN A SPOT AND WAS STRUCK BY AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO HER DRIVER SIDE DOOR AND TO RIGHT REAR QUARTER PANEL. NEIGHBOR AT THE COMPLEX ADVISED THAT ON 04/19/2019 THEY OBSERVED A WHITE TRUCK PULLING A TRAILER IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD AND APPEARED TO ATTEMPT TO BACK INTO A PARKING SPOT NEAR V1. THE NEIGHBOR COULD NOT CONFIRM IF THIS VEHICLE STRUCK V1 OR NOT. PAINT TRANSFER ON V1 INDICATES THAT THE UNKNOWN VEHICLE THAT STRUCK V1 COULD HAVE POSSIBLY BEEN BLUE OR HAD BLUE PAINT. V1 WAS MOVED FROM THE PARKING SPOT THAT IT WAS PARKED IN WHEN ACCIDENT OCCURRED AND MOVED TO A DIFFERENT SPOT. PHOTOGRAPHS OF THE DAMAGE WERE TAKEN.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON 3RD STREET APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH LANDMARK AVENUE. AS V1 CAME TO THE INTERSECTION, HE ADVISED THE LIGHT TURNED YELLOW. D1 DECIDED TO CONTINUE INTO THE INTERSECTION, BUT OBSERVED V2 ENTER THE INTERSECTION FROM THE SOUTH. D1 ATTEMPTED TO APPLY THE BRAKES, BUT V1 SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT. V1 COLLIDED WITH VEHICLE 2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT ON NORTH BOUND LANDMARK AT THE INTERSECTION WITH 3RD ST. D2 ADVISED THE LIGHT FOR NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC TURNED GREEN, SO HE STARTED TO TURN THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. D2 OBSERVED V1 APPROACHING FROM THE WEST AND DID NOT BELIEVE THE VEHICLE WAS GOING TO STOP FOR THE RED LIGHT. D2 ATTEMPTED TO ACCELLERATE QUICKLY THROUGH THE TURN, BUT COULD NOT AVOID BEING STRUCK BY V1.
V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W WAMPLER ROAD, RAN OFF THE ROAD AND FLIPPED ONTO IT ROOF INTO A DITCH.D1 STATED THAT HIS BRAKES LOCKED UP WHICH CAUSED HIM TO DRIVE OFF THE ROAD AND FLIP THE VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 AND V2 WERE TRAVELING WB ON SR 45/46. V2 STOPPED DUE TO THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TURNING RED. V1 CONTINUED AND COLLIDED WITH V2. V1 LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT.D2 SAID D1 INITALLY STOPPED AND TOLD HER TO PULL INTO THE NEARBY MCDONALDS PARKING LOT. WHEN D2 WENT TO HEAD TOWARDS MCDONALDS, V1 RAPIDLY PULLED OFF AND LEFT THE SCENE.V2 IS A TEAL TRUCK, NO OTHER IDENTIFIERS.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING NB ON S PATTERSON DR WHEN HE STRUCK A STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION OF S PATTERSON DR AND W 3RD ST. D1 THEN SAID HE GATHERED THE DEBRIS AND PUT IT INTO HIS VEHICLE. D1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT.

D2 stated that he was attempting to leave the parking lot through an alleyway on the west side. As D2 went to enter the alleyway a white SUV driving north through the allleyway struck the front bumber of V2 on the driver side. V2's front bumber was pulled off of the vehicle. V1 continued through the alleyway and did not stop after the collision. D2 stated that the vehicle was driving down the alleyway very fast and did not attempt to stop at all after the collision.

D1 of V1, D2 of V2 and D3 of V3 were all driving east on W. Country Club Dr. D1 stated that he pressed his brakes trying to come to a stop and slid into the back of V3. D3 stated that she was driving straight coming to a stop when she was rear ended by V1. D3 then stated that her car hit the back of V2 from the force of being rear ended. D2 stated that he was going straight when V3 hit the back of his vehicle.Based on the drivers statements at the scene due to D1 following too closely and the wet weather conditions caused the accident between V1, V2 and V3.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON ROMAN'S WAY AT 1:30 AM.D1 STATED THAT HE DID RUN OFF OF THE ROAD, AND DID STRIKE AN OBJECT.D1 DID NOT KNOW WHAT HE HAD STRUCK. D1 STATED THAT HE DID GET NERVOUS AND DROVE V1 TO HIS GRANPA'S ADDRESS, LOCATED AT 4306 E WHITLEY. THE OWNER OF THE MAILBOX AT 947 ROMAN'S WAY, IDENTIFIED AS ANTHONY GOUTY 812-545-9186, STATED THAT AT APPROXIMATELY 1:30 AM THIS MORNING THAT HE DID HEAR WHAT SOUNDED LIKE A TRAFFIC ACCIDENT WEST OF HIS HOME.MR. GOUTY STATED THAT HE DID GET UP THIS MORNING AND DID SEE THAT HIS MAILBOX HAD BEEN STRUCK BY A VEHICLE, V1, AND THAT THE REMNANTS OF HIS MAIL BOX WERE SCATTERED THROUGHT ROMAN'S WAY, ALONG WITH PARTS OF V1.THERE WERE TIRE TRACKS LEADING TO WHERE MR. GOUTY'S MAILBOX HAD BEEN.MR. GOUTY DID SEE THAT THERE WAS A PART NUMBER ON ON OF THE PIECES IN THE ROADWAY.MR. GOUTY DID SEARCH THE PART NUMBER IN GOOGLE AND DID SEE THAT THE PART NUMBER RETURNED TO A CHEVY COLORADY.MR. GOUTY STATED THAT HE DID THEN WALK IN HIS NEIGHBORHOOD LOOKING FOR A CHEVY COLORADO WITH DAMAGE TO THE FRONT, UNTIL HE DID EVENTUALLY LOCATE V1 AT 4306 E WHITLEY DR.V1 DID HAVE SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF THE TRUCK AND MR. GOUTY'S MAILBOX WAS SHATTERED AND DESTROYED.MR GOUTY DID NOT WISH TO PURSUE CRIMINAL CHARGES AGAINST D1 FOR LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON NORTH UNION STREET.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT, WEST, ONTO EAST 7TH STREET.D1 STATED THAT HE DID HAVE ANOTHER LARGE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM BLOCKING HIS VIEW NORTH.D1 STATED THAT HE DID ATTEMPT TO TURN LEFT ONTO 7TH STREET WHEN THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF V2, RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 LATER STATED THAT HE WAS ACTUALLY STOPPED AND THAT V2 ACTUALLY RAN INTO HIM.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON NORTH UNION STREET.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 7TH STREET AND NORTH UNION STREET WHEN V1 DID ATTEMPT TO TURN LEFT, WEST, ONTO EAST 7TH STREET.D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF V2 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT OF V1, RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO THE LEFT SIDE OF HER ABDOMEN AND HER LEFT LEG. D1 WAS TREATED ON SCENE BY AMBULANCE STAFF, BUT DID REFUSE TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL FOR FURTHER TREATMENT.D1 DID HAVE ABRASIONS TO THE SHINS OF BOTH OF HIS LEGS. D1 WS TREATED BY AMBULANCE STAFF BUT DID REFUSE TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL FOR FURTHER TREATMENT.BOTH V1 AND V2 WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE. KEN'S WESTSIDE DID TOW BOTH VEHICLES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling east bound on Atwater Avenue and proceeded through the intersection of Atwater and Henderson Street. V2 was traveling northbound on Henderson Street approaching the intersection of Atwater and Henderson. Both vehicles pulled over onto Indiana Avenue after the crash. All parties advised they did not need medical attention. D1 said she was traveling east bound on Atwater in V1. D1 said she proceeded through the intersection of Atwater and Henderson Street. D1 said V1 then struck V2. V1 had damage to the front bumper area. I asked D1 what color of light she had. D1 said she was not sure what color the light was, but then said the other vehicle had the right away, and wasn't contesting it.D2 said he was traveling north bound on Henderson Street and saw the light turn green from Hunter Avenue. D2 said he was in the right hand lane, but then switched lanes to the left lane due to another vehicle wanting to turn right. D2 said he still had the green light to proceed through the intersection. D2 said he tried to avoid V1 by speeding up to get through the intersection. D2 said that's when V1 struck V2 on the driver side door area of V2. The passenger of V2 Becky Conner was on scene, but left to get another vehicle so they could make it to the airport on time. Both parties were given exchange information. Supplemental information to report: Diagram was updated.

V1 WAS PARKED ON THE N SIDE OF 11TH ST FACING WB. V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON 11TH ST. THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER'S DOOR OF V1.PORSHANAE REEDY, DRIVER OF V1 PRIOR TO PARKING IT, STATED THAT SHE HAD HER FRONT DRIVER SIDE DOOR OF V1 OPEN AND V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON 11TH ST. PORSHANAE ADVISED THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE DOOR, CAUSING DAMAGE.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS WB ON 11TH ST WHILE V1 WAS PARKED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE STREET. D2 STATED THAT PORSHANAE WAS IN V1 AND OPENED THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE DOOR AS V2 PROCEEDED WB ON 11TH ST. D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER DOOR OF V1.

V1 was parked in the parking lot of 3030 E Amy LN. P1 and P2 were standing next to the passenger door of V1 facing S/B in the parking lot.V1 was facing S/B in the parking lot on private property. D1 had been drinking when he decided to leave a friend's residence. P1 and P2 were standing next to V1 speaking with D1 about a prior incident that occurred at the residence. D1 advised that he left driving E/B and stated that he never struck P1 and P2 prior to leaving.P1 advised that he was standing next to V1. P1 advised that he was drug by V1 when D1 put V1 into reverse. P1 advised that he had injury to his right elbow but refused medical treatment.P2 advised that she was standing next to V1. P2 advised that she was drug by V1 when D1 decided to put V1 Into reverse to leave the residence. P2 advised that she had a complaint of pain and bruises to her back, both lower legs, and her right hand. P2 refused medical treatment. Due to D1 unsafe backing, V1 caused injury to P1 and P2.

V2 was travelling eastbound on 10th Street near the intersection of 10th and Walnut Grove Street. V2 was stopped due to eastbound traffic on 10th Street when V1 rear-ended V2. The accident occurred at 10th and Walnut Grove, however due to traffic on the road, the vehicles moved to the IU Health Center parking lot. I first spoke to D1 who stated she was traveling eastbound on 10th Street at Walnut Grove when she all of a sudden saw a vehicle stopped in traffic ahead of her. D1 stated she hit her brakes, however she was not fast enough before V1 struck the rear end of V2. I then spoke to D2 who stated she was traveling eastbound on 10th Street at Walnut Grove. D2 stated there were several vehicles in front of her who were stopped in traffic, so she was also stopped due to traffic. D2 stated that all of a sudden she felt V1 hit V2 from behind while she was stopped in the roadway. V1 sustained damage to the front bumper and V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Officer C.Werner was the initial officer on scene and assisted with information gathering.Vehicle Use (other Explain in Narrative) - V1 is a Lime E-Scooter that is a motor vehicle by Indiana definition.D1 was traveling southbound on Jordan Avenue in a marked bicycle lane. D1 was traveling approximately 15 mph which is the max speed of a Lime scooter.D2 was attempting to pull out of a private parking lot and onto Jordan Avenue.D1 stated that he noticed V2 attempting to exit the parking lot and onto Jordan Avenue. He continued to state that V2 pulled forward a few inches and then stopped which made him think that V2 saw him. V2 then pulled out of the parking lot and hit him in his right leg. He had complaint of pain to his right leg along with minor abrasions to both legs from falling onto the pavement. An ambulance was called for him but he declined medical treatment.D2 stated that she was attempting to leave a parking lot and pull onto Jordan Avenue. She stated at no time did she notice D1 traveling southbound towards her. She then saw an opening and hit her accelerator. She then struck D1 center mass on her vehicle. The impact caused damage to the front bumper and grill of her vehicle.W1 stated that she was about 10 feet north of the accident location and observed the collision. She stated that she did not believe D1 was traveling at any excessive speed and was in the marked bicycle lane. The impact caused D1 to go up onto the hood of V2 and then onto the ground.Picture were taken of the damage and of the injuries which are attached to the case.

D2 stated that she then pulled onto the side of E Morningside Dr and waited for V1 to meet her, however V1 continued North on S Smith Rd. A criminal report was completed on the accident, however the investigation into the accident is complete due to D2 not wanting to pursue criminal charges at this time.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS EAST BOUND ON DODDS ST, STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION WITH S WALNUT ST. D1 LOOKED SOUTH FOR ONCOMING TRAFFIC, BUT DID NOT NOTICE V2 APPROACHING. AS V2 CAME TO THE INTERSECTION, V1 ENTERED ITS PATH. V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET, JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF PINEWOOD AND SOUTH WALNUT STREET.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SLOWLY IN TRAFFIC, DUE TO HEAVY CONGESTION IN THE AREA.D2 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET THAT A SILVER TOYOTA MINIVAN DID REAR END HER VEHICLE.D2 STATED THAT D1 DID GET OUT OF V1, AFTER BOTH VEHICLES HAD PULLED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.D2 STATED THAT D1 DID TELL HER THAT HE SHOULDN'T BE DRIVING.D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 HAD SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE.D2 STATED THAT D1 DID THEN GET BACK IN TO THE DRIVER'S SEAT OF V1 AND DID PROCEED TO DRIVE SOUTH ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET.V2 DID SUSTAIN VERY MINOR DAMAGE, CONSISTING OF SCRATCHES TO THE REAR AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT.D2 STATED THAT SHE COULD NOT REMEMBER THE PLATE OF V1, BUT SHE STATED THAT IT BEGAN WITH 850.

NARRATIVE:A 2-vehicle crash occurred on State Road 45 (SR45), southeast of Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana, beginning near the intersection of Breeden Road and ending near 9995 SR45. SR45 is a 2-lane asphalt paved bi-directional highway that runs primarily northeast-southwest, and connects the city of Bloomington with Crane Naval Surface Activity. The area where the crash occurred is divided by a double-striped solid yellow line. The westbound lane is bounded by a large shoulder for vehicles to pass west-bound vehicles turning left onto Breeden road, which tees into SR45 and proceeds due south. The roadway on the evening of 22 April, 2019 was dry and clear of debris. The sky was overcast but clear, and there were no obvious signs of preexisting foreign objects or debris on the road surface. Traffic was light in the area at the time of the accident. Vehicle 1 (V1), was a black 1998 Jeep Grand Cherokee (IN registration AZU468), driven by Driver 1 (D1), Steven Taylor (DOB 01/16/1977). Vehicle 2 (V2) was a 2012 Black Honda Pilot SUV (IN registration FAC372), driven by Driver 2 (D2), Janet McIntosh (DOB 04/23/2019). V1 came to an uncontrolled stop in a steep ditch on the right (north) side of SR45 approximately  mile to the west, (vicinity of 9995 SR 45) , while V2 came to a controlled stop on the right shoulder of SR45 E, just east the T-intersection of Breeden Rd. and SR 45 (vicinity 9534 SR45).The crash was initially witnessed by both Mr. Larry Conder, who lives at 9534 SR 45, and Trooper Mark Raper, who was off-duty at the time. I was dispatched to the scene and arrived after both vehicles had come to a stop off the roadway. Trooper Raper had already confirmed that both drivers were relatively stable. When I arrived at the scene, I shut down both lanes of traffic, which remained closed until both vehicles were cleared from the roadway. Bloomington Fire/Rescue was on scene to assist with medical needs. I made contact with both drivers to check on their wellbeing; both refused treatment. D1 had a visible bloody abrasion on his upper scalp in the crown of his hair but appeared otherwise uninjured. D2 had no visible injures and stated that she was fine, with only a slight friction burn on her fingers from the airbag deployment. D1, whose vehicle had come to rest in an uncontrolled manner in the ditch, spoke with firefighters before subsequently completing a Statement of Refusal (SOR) refusing treatment or examination. The airbags in V1 were not deployed, while the steering wheel airbag in V2 had deployed. V1 displayed severe damage to the front end and undercarriage of the vehicle and was missing both front wheels. The left front wheel was located approximately 150 yards to the west of V2 in the driveway of an adjacent home. The right front wheel was located in the ditch in front of V1. V2 had the grill smashed and hood buckled. Neither vehicle was drivable due to incapacitating damage. A linear scrape from the front left brake rotor of V1 contacting the roadway was clearly visible, beginning east of the site of the initial collision between V1's driver's side wheel and V2, and the ditch where V1 came to rest. D1 stated that he had been rounding the right hand curve on SR 45 westbound near the roundabout of West Sparks Road, when he heard a loud bang. He looked back into his side mirrors and observed a large object had come off his vehicle and made contact with a vehicle proceeding east. D1 stated; 'the next thing I knew, the whole front end drops on the ground and I'm in the ditch. I figured I was going to hit a tree.' D1 stated that he had been alone in the vehicle, which is titled to his father, and that he was heading home when the accident occurred. He stated that he tried to stop as fast as he could comprehend what had just happened, but due to his brakes failing, was unable to stop before he had effectually left the immediate scene of the accident and crashed into the ditch. He also advised that he and his son had just

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: At the time of this accident, I was behind D2 in traffic traveling southbound on Range Road towards State Road (SR) 45. D1 was traveling northbound on Pete Ellis Drive towards SR 45. D2 was traveling southbound on Range Road towards SR 45.The following is the observation by Officer Pesa: I need retrained on crash reports.I was traveling southbound on Range Road approaching SR 45 behind D2. As we were approaching SR 45 the traffic control signal turned yellow for southbound and northbound traffic on Range Road/Pete Ellis Drive. I observed that D1 was already in the intersection attempting to make a left turn (westbound) onto SR 45 when D2 had just entered the intersection. As D1 started to make the turn, D2 collided with D1. It appeared to me that D2 had sufficient amount of time to brake in order to avoid the collision. I did not observed D2 apply the brakes until the collision occurred. It appeared that D2 may had been distracted while traveling southbound on Range Road crossing SR 45.D1 stated he was traveling northbound on Pete Ellis Drive approaching SR 45. D1 stated he entered the intersection as the traffic control signal had turned yellow and was turning left (westbound) onto SR 45 when D2 collided with him. D1 stated that D2 had her left turn signal activated (to turn eastbound on SR 45) which is why he began to turn. D1 stated that D2 continued straight instead of turning. V1 had heavy front-end damage and was towed from the roadway.D2 stated she was traveling southbound on Range Road approaching SR 45 when the traffic control signal had turned yellow. D2 stated she had a left turn signal activated. D2 stated she intended to turn left (eastbound) onto SR 45 but decided against it when she got into the intersection. D2 stated she thought she deactivated her turn signal and continued straight. D2 stated she was passed the middle of the intersection when D1 collided with her. D2 denied being distracted and stated she may had been looking at me through her rear-view mirror V2 had heavy front-end damage and towed from the roadway..

V1 was parked in a parking space at 907 S College Mall road facing west. V2 was parked in parking space facing east at 907 S College Mall road. V2 backed up to the southwest and V1 started to back up to the northeast. Both vehicles hit in the travel portion of the parking lot. V1 was damaged on the driver side rear bumper and V2 was damaged on the rear drivers side bumper also. D1 stated that she looked behind her and didn't see anyone behind her. She stated she backed up and hit V2.D2 stated that she had backed up and was about to put her vehicle in drive to move forward when she was hit by V1. She stated she saw V1 backing up and could not get out of her way before she was hit.

V2 was traveling southbound on N. Union Valley Rd. cresting a hill. D2 stated that there was a gold or silver colored car with at least one flat tire traveling northbound on N. Union Valley Rd. in the southbound lane of travel as she crested the hill. The suspect vehicle sideswiped V2 also causing V2 to run off the roadway. D2 was treated at the scene for minor injuries and V2 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH ORCHARD LANE. IN SLOWED TRAFFIC VEHICLE 2 WAS BRAKING AND WAS STRUCK IN THE REAR END BY VEHICLE 1.PARTIES INVOLVED WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

On 4/22/2019 a collision occurred in the Jordan Avenue parking garage located at 150 N Jordan Ave. V1, a 2015 Mazda 3 driven by Jonathon Beckmeyer, was attempting to pull into into a parking space when its front passengerside bumper impacted the rear driver-side bumper area of V2, a parked 2014 Chevrolet Sonic.D1 stated he was westbound in the parking lot and attempted to turn southwest into a parking space next to V2. D1 stated he misjudged the parking space and impacted V2 with V1.

D1 stated he was in the far right turn lane facing South on Walnut Street and started to turn onto the Bypass to head West towards Kinser Pike. D1 stated he is unsure where D2 came from but believes V2 was doing a U-turn and struck him in the back driver side tire causing disabling damage to V1.D2 stated he was in the inside lane of 2 turn lanes at the Bypass and Walnut Street facing East. D2 was behind another vehicle and the light turned green. D2 stated he started to turn North bound onto Walnut Street heading towards McDonald's.D2 stated he heard the vehicle in front of him honk their horn and then noticed V1 in front of him but he did not have enough time to stop and struck V1 in the driver side. D2 stated he believes that D1 ran the red light and was in fact not turning from Walnut Street onto the Bypass. Their were no witnesses and I was unable to locate any cameras in the area that might have captured the accident. I also did not locate any debris in the intersection to determine the exact location of the accident and neither driver knew exactly where they collided. Due to most of the damage being on the passenger front of V2 and the damage being on the back driver side tire area of V1 it does appear that D2 used improper turning and collided with V1.SUPPLEMENTI had to change the year for V2 from a 2019 to a 2015.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Officer Dreadfulwater assisted with information gathering.Other (location of investigation) - The investigation was conducted on scene and on station. D2 has an in-car camera that could potentionally have evidence of who is at fault in the accident. D2 was unable to access the camera and the MicroSD card was brought to station to see if an Evidence Technician could gain access to the footage.D1 was traveling eastbound on Atwater Avenue approaching the Henderson Street intersection. D1 stated that a van was in the adjacent lane next to her and both her and the van began to proceed through the green light of the intersection. D1 stated she was traveling approximately 20-25 mph prior to the collision.D2 stated she was traveling northbound on Henderson Street approaching the Atwater Avenue intersection. D2 stated she was traveling a slow speed as she began to proceed through the green light of the intersection.Both parties stated that they had a green light as they proceeded through the intersection. V1 struck V2 with the front bumper of V1. V2 was struck on the driver side of the vehicle with the primary amount of damage done to the rear half of V2. There are no known witnesses.V1 was towed for disabling damage as the airbags were deployed. D1 was also cited for not having insurance and for being a suspended driver.V2 was able to be driven from the scene.The case will updated accordingly once we are able to determine the status of the SD card.*****Update 05/03/2019****Our evidence technician was able to access the SD card of the in-car camera; however, the last footage available appeared to be from several years ago. The footage also did not show any accidents at the intersection named above. The SD card will be returned to D2. At this time, it is unknown who actually ran the red light as there are no other known camera footage to view.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET AND STARTED TO ENTER THE CENTER TURN LANE. D1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE ANYBODY BEHIND HIM AND WHEN HE ENTERED THE TURN LANE HE SIDESWIPED V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET AND HAD ENTERED THE CENTER TURN LANE. V1, V2, V3 AND V4 were traveling southbound on Old SR 37 approximately 1000 feet north of SR 37. D4 and D3 were stopped or slowed in traffic when D2 who was slowing for traffic was rear ended by V1. V1 rear ended V2 who rear ended V3 who rear ended V4. All vehicles sustained damage and V4 required a tow. D1 sustained airbag injuries

Driver 1 (D1) advised that she was distracted and looking at things on the other side of the roadway. D1 advised that the front end of her vehicle made contact with the rear end of V2. V1 was towed from the scene due to being incapacitated. V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W SR 45 AND HIT A DEER CAUSING FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE DAMAGE.FOLLOWING THE COLLISION, D1 MOVED THE VEHICLE FROM THE POINT OF COLLISION TO A NEARBY DRIVEWAY, THEREFORE NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED.

V1 was in the far right turn lane on S. Curry Pike. V2 was in front of V1 in the far right turn lane on S. Curry Pike. V1 was turning right into the parking spot at Wal-Mart when she struck the opened door of V2. V2 was parked loading her kids and purchases into the vehicle when D1 struck the left rear door of V2. No injuries on scene. D1 did not have insurance with her and was supposed to call back in with it.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 was traveling north on Walnut Street in the middle of three lanes when he said a silver car came out of the alley to his right. He stated that he swerved towards the silver car to try and avoid collision. Driver 1 stated he was able to avoid the silver car but rear-ended vehicle 2. Driver 1 complained of pain to his back and side.William Wade had pain to his back, neck, head, and knee. He stated that he would be seeking treatment at his place of employments clinic.

V2/D2 STATED "I WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY SOUTHBOUND ON N. KINSER PIKE. I WAS UNABLE TO STOP MY PICKUP TRUCK AND TRAILOR. I REAR ENDED V2. IN THE ROADWAY."

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling eastbound on Law Lane approaching Jordan Ave. V2 was traveling westbound on Law Lane approaching Jordan Ave.D1 stated he was traveling eastbound on Law Lane approaching Jordan Ave. D1 stated he entered the intersection when the traffic control signal had turned yellow. ON 04/25/2019 AT THE LISTED TIME, UNIT 2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING SPOT FACING NORTH. UNIT 1, A POSTAL TRUCK WAS TRAVELING NORTH IN THE PARKING LOT. UNIT 2 EXPERIENCED A MECHANICAL ISSUE AND LOST BREAK CONTROL. UNIT 2 COLLIDED WITH UNIT 1 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE RIGHT REAR BUMPER.

ON THE ABOVE DATE AND TIME UNIT 1 WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT FACING WEST. RETURNED TO HIS VEHICLE FROM WORK AND REALIZED UNIT 2 HAD STRUCK HIS VEHICLE WHILE PARKED. UNIT 2 HAD LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT AND NO INFORMATION FOR THIS UNIT WAS AQUIRED.

Interstate 69 runs primarily north and south. In this particular area there is a grass median. The weather was cloudy and raining at the time of the crash. Vehicle #1 2015 Kia Sorrento was north bound on I-69 when a deer entered the travel lane from the west side. The deer successfully made it across the south bound lanes, but was not able to make it across the north bound side and was struck by vehicle #1. Driver #1 Kenneth Buzzard stated that he was north bound on I-69 when a deer ran from the west side onto the north bound side. Driver #1 was unable to avoid hitting the deer. Evidence on the scene indicates a deer came into the roadway and was struck by vehicle #1. Vehicle #1 was towed to Bloomington by Ken's Westside.

V1 was parked in front of 907 S College Mall road facing east. V2 was in parking lot at 907 S College Mall road and was moving south. V1 backed up and struck V2 in front of the driver side door with the rear driver side bumper of his vehicle causing damage to both vehicles. D1 stated that he was in a hurry and backed up and hit V2. He stated he didn't see her behind him. D2 stated that she was moving south in the parking lot looking for a parking spot when she was struck by V1.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON S. ROCKPORT RD COMING UP TO W. VICTOR PIKE. D1 TRIED TO MAKE A LAST MINUTE TURN ONTO W. VICTOR PIKE AND V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND FLIPPED ONTO ITS TOP. BOTH DRIVER AND PASSENGER WERE CHECKED OUT BY EMS ON SCENE AS THEY ARE JUVENILES AND THEIR PARENTS SIGNED SOR.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS WAITING AT THE STOP SIGN OF THE PARKING LOT OF KROGER JACKSON CREEK. V1 PULLED OUT OF THE PARKING LOT TO TURN LEFT AND TRAVEL SOUTH ON S. COLLEGE MALL RD. V1 FAILED TO YIELD TO ON COMMING TRAFFIC AND STRUCK V2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE, SENDING V2 IN THE AIR AND IT LANDING INVERTED.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS WAITING AT THE STOP SIGN OF KROGER PARKING LOT. D1 STATED THAT HE LOOKED AND DID NOT SEE ANY VEHICLES AND BEGAN TO ENTER THE INTERSECTION. D1 STATED THAT HE BELIEVES V2 WAS TRAVELING VERY FAST AND THAT'S WHY HE DID NOT SEE IT.V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON S. COLLEGE MALL RD. V2 WAS STRUCK ON THE PASSENGER SIDE BY V1.D2 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT REMEMBER WHICH LANE SHE WAS IN, BUT SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON COLLEGE MALL RD. D2 STATED THAT V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1.
V1 STRUCK PARKED V2. V2 THEN STRUCK V3, WHICH THEN STRUCK V4. V2, V3, AND V4 WERE ALL PARKED.D1 STATED THAT SHE WRECKED INTO THE VEHICLES BUT DID NOT ELABORATE.ALL VEHICLE OWNERS WERE NOTIFIED.

Unit 1, a vehicle, was attempting to back up south on Indiana Avenue from 6th Street. Unit 2, a bicyclist, was traveling west across Indiana Avenue at 6th Street.Unit 1 advised he had accidentally began turning the wrong way onto 6th Street and to avoiding driving the wrong way, Unit 1 stated he backed up to continue north on Indiana. Unit 1 stated as he backed south on Indiana Avenue he struck Unit 2. He stated he was unable to see Unit 2.Unit 2 was not cooperative but advised officers he was headed west crossing Indiana Avenue at 6th Street when he was struck.Unit 1 advised that Unit 2 was screaming in pain when he was struck. Upon officer arrival, Unit 2 was standing and collecting his belongings. He refused medical from the ambulance on scene but stated his hip hurt.There was no damage to the vehicle or bicycle.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON W SR 48 WHEN D1 LOST CONTROL OF V1 WHILE TRAVELING THROUGH A CURVE. V1 THEN WENT OFF OF THE SOUTHSIDE OF THE ROADWAY, SPUN, AND STRUCK V2, V1'S REAR BUMPER CONTACTING THE DRIVERS SIDE OF V2, WHICH WAS PARKED. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING AT THE POSTED SPEED LIMIT BEFORE V1 HYDROPLANED AND WENT OFF OF THE ROAD.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was traveling N/W on S Walnut St Pike, approaching S Walnut St. D2 was traveling South on S Walnut St, approaching S Walnut St Pike. D1 stopped at the intersection and waited for traffic to clear. D1 then believed the roadway to be clear and proceeded across S Walnut St into a nearby parking lot. As D1 crossed the right lane of S/B traffic, V2 struck V1, causing a collison. D1 stated that she was traveling N/W on S Walnut St Pike, approaching S Walnut St. D1 stated that she stopped at the intersection and waited for the roadway to clear. D1 stated that she believed the roadway to be clear, and saw that the left S/B lane of travel stopped. D1 stated that she then proceeded across S Walnut St, and as she crossed the road V2 struck V1 in the rear passenger side. D2 stated that he was traveling South on S Walnut St, approaching S walnut St Pike. D2 stated that as he was approaching the intersection he saw that traffic was stopped in the left lane. D2 stated that his lane was clear, so he proceeded into the intersection V1 pulled into his lane of travel, causing V2 to strike V1 in the rear passenger side.

VEHICLE 1 WAS BACKING OUT OF DRIVEWAY AT 8852 SOUTH MORRISON COURT. VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ONTO SOUTH MORRISON COURT. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK THE BACK OF VEHICLE 2 WHILE VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF NEXT DOOR DRIVEWAY 8840 SOUTH MORRISON COURT.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND DECLINED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was driving in the IU Wells Library parking lot headed straight, south, looking for a parking spot. V1 was stopped in traffic in the Wells Library parking lot looking to turn right to head south through the lot. I first spoke to D1 who stated that he was looking to turn right so that he could move into a different lane as there were no spots to park. D1 stated he had been looking right (to the south) for spots, saw a spot, and then continued driving. D1 stated that was when he all of a sudden realized that he had driven out in front of V2. V1 failed to check to both the left and the right to ensure no oncoming traffic was moving, so while turning right, V1 struck V2. I then spoke to D2 who stated that he was going straight through the parking lot to find a parking spot. While going straight, D2 stated he saw D1 near the exit of the parking lane, however he stated he figured D1 had seen him driving and would yield to him. D2 then stated he realized D1 had not seen him coming, attempted to swerve left, however was unable to prevent V1 from hitting V2. V1 sustained damage to the front left bumper and V2 sustained damage to the passenger side rear door.

V1 WAS TRAVELING S/B ON GRANTST. V2 WAS PARKED N/B ON GRANT ST. V1 STRUCK V2 WHILE PARKED CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER SIDE MIRROR.V1 LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT.OWNER OF V2 ADVISED THAT HER VEHICLE WAS PARKED N/B ON GRANT ST. OWNER OF V2 ADVISED THAT SHE NOTICED DAMAGE TO HER MIRROR AROUND 10:50 AM THIS MORING. OWNER OF V2 ADVISED THAT SHE DID NOT HAVE ADDITONAL INFORMATION FOR V1.DUE TO D1 IMPROPER LANE USAGE, V1 STRUCK V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER SIDE MIRROR.

On 04/26/2019 at approximately 03:45 hours, I responded to 4th and College Avenue regarding a prior accident. The BMW was registered to Christopher Bailey. I contacted Bailey by phone and he advised on 04/25/2019 at approximately 20:30 hours, he collided with a plastic water filled barrier near 4th and College Avenue. The barrier does not have a placard advising the owners name. According to Bailey, he was driving east bound when his windshield fogged up and he didn't see the plastic and concrete barrier. Consequently, D1 collided with the plastic and concrete barrier.After the collision, Bailey advised he parked his vehicle at 4th and Walnut Street; where he contacted his insurance company.I believe the plastic barrier may be owned by Strauser construction.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S HENDERSON ST WHEN A PEDESTRIAN 1 RAN FROM THE SIDEWALK AND INTO THE ROAD AND STRUCK V1 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE WINDOW AND DOOR CAUSING THE FRONT WINDSHIELD AND A DENT IN THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE DOOR. V1 was traveling N/B on Hawthrone DR. V2 was traveling E/B on Atwater Ave. V1 disregarded the stop sign at the corner of Hawthrone DR and Atwater AVE and struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles.D1 advised that he was traveling N/B on Hawthrone DR. D1 advised that he thought the intersection was a 4 way stop and proceeded into traffic. D1 advised that he then collided with V2. D1 advised that he was not injured.D2 advised that he was traveling E/B on Atwater Ave. D2 advised that he then observed V1 approaching the intersection, when he felt the impact of V1. Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling westbound on 10th Street approaching Walnut Grove Street. V2 was traveling westbound on 10th Street approaching Walnut Grove Street in front of V1. At the time of the accident, it was raining and the roadway was wet.D1 stated she was traveling westbound on 10th Street approaching Walnut Grove Street when she observed V2 suddenly brake in front of her. D1 stated V2 applied her brakes due to pedestrians walking into the crosswalk. D1 stated she applied her brakes and began skidding. D1 stated she could not stop in time and rear-ended V2. V1 had no visible damage to the vehicle.D2 stated she was traveling westbound on 10th Street approaching Walnut Grove Street when pedestrians began to enter the crosswalk. Monroe Street is a local two-lane, two way road in Bloomington that primarily runs north and south. It was raining at the time of the crash. V1 Blue 2005 Pontiac Vibe was stopped facing northbound on Monroe Street, waiting to turn right onto State Road 45/46 bypass behind vehicle #2. Driver #1, Judith Poling stated that she thought vehicle #2 was going straight, so she went to go around vehicle #2 on the right. As she turned onto SR 45/46 vehicle #2 also turned right and they collided. V2 White 2005 Chevrolet Tahoe was stopped at the stop sign facing northbound on Monroe Street waiting to turn right onto State Road 45/46 bypass. Driver #2, James Riggins stated that as he was making the right turn, his vehicle and vehicle #1 struck. Driver #1 stated that he did not see vehicle #1 prior to the crash. Evidence on the scene indicates that on Monroe Street there is no right turn lane. Vehicle #1 had to go around vehicle #2 on the shoulder. This crash was caused due to improper lane usage.

SR45/SR46 Bypass is a four lane State Highway that is separated by a raised rumble strip portion of concrete. The location of this collision occurred at a four way intersection with Monroe Street to the south and Stonelake Drive to the north. The weather consisted of light rain and the roadway surface was wet.V1, Jeep Liberty, was traveling north on Monroe Street at the Bypass. V2, Chevrolet Malibu, was stopped along the center raised strip of concrete on the Bypass immediately to the west of the intersection with Monroe Street. V2 was occupied by Chase D Conner, DOB 2-28-1998, who was sitting in the driver's seat and Boone W Smith, DOB 5-13-1997, who was sitting in the front passenger seat. The occupants of V2 are employed by the Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) and were completing inspections of the drainage structures along the median portion of the Bypass. An INDOT dump truck was parked along the median of the Bypass to the east of Monroe Street with an arrowboard attached to its rear to warn traffic traveling west on the Bypass. The dump truck was occupied by Chad Lamastus, DOB 9-3-1974. V1 began to make a left turn to travel west on the Bypass. V1 began to spin and struck the front right corner of V2 as it was parked along the center median section. V1 continued to spin after impact with V1 until it was facing north in the eastbound left turn lane of the Bypass. V1 then traveled west along the Bypass and D1 failed to stop after impact. Both occupants of V2 indicated their attention was focused on inspecting the center drainage structure when they felt an impact by V1. The vehicle was described as a brown sport utility vehicle and continued west on the Bypass after impact. The occupants were unable to provide a description of damage that occurred on V1. W1, Anthony Eads, stated he was stopped in the southbound lane of Stonelake Drive at the Bypass. W1 indicated he observed V1 accelerate northbound from Monroe Street and begin to turn west onto the Bypass. W1 indicated he could hear what seemed like tire spin when V1 spun as it was making the left turn. W1 stated V1 spun and struck the front of V2. W1 stated he observed V1 leave the scene after impact and traveled west on the Bypass. W1 stated he began to follow the vehicle and his front seat passenger, Foster Tiller, was able to take a photograph of the rear of V1 when they stopped on SR46 at Curry Pike. W1 stated V1 was occupied by a white female with dark colored hair. W1 stated V1 traveled south on Curry Pike from SR46 and he returned to the accident scene to provide the photograph to the other involved vehicle occupant. W1 agreed to send me a copy of the photograph that was taken which is attached to this report. Evidence shows damage to the front passenger fender, front passenger side bumper cover and passenger side headlight assembly of V2. Evidence shows yawmarks were present along the westbound lane leading across the front of V2. Evidence shows a portion of broken amber plastic lens was present along the roadway during the accident investigation. The photograph provided by W1 was a brown Jeep Liberty with Indiana registration ANY132. A records check indicated the vehicle was registered to Christopher Miller, 4500 S. Dunlap Road, Bloomington, IN. I traveled to 4500 S. Dunlap Road but there was no vehicles present at the residence. I determined via social media search that Christopher Miller was currently engaged to Nataley Kinser. Kinser is a white female with dark colored hair. I was unable to locate Kinser or Miller after checking the above address numerous times throughout the day. On Monday, April 29, 2019 at approximately 7:45 pm, I traveled to 4500 S. Dunlap Road and observed the brown Jeep Liberty with Indiana registration ANY132. A white male was present outside the residence who identified himself verbally as Christopher Miller. Miller confirmed he was engaged to Nataley Kinser and summoned her outside. I spo

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling south on Woodlawn Avenue approaching the 11th Street intersection. There was a bus stopped at a designated bus stop on the west side of Woodlawn Avenue north of 11th Street.D1 stated he began to pass the stopped bus and accelerated as he attempted to pass. He stated that as he accelerated, the rear tires began to spin on the wet pavement and V1 began to rotate sideways. D1 stated that the vehicle slid sideways traveling southwest through the 11th Street intersection. The vehicle struck a curb on the northwest corner of the intersection, then slid over the curb and sidewalk on the southwest corner of the intersection. The vehicle then struck a light pole, an irrigation control box, and a house located at 822 East 11th Street.W1, W2, and W3 gave very similar accounts of the actions involved in the incident. There were no discrepancies.A portable breath test was given on scene and D1 provided a sample of .05 BrAC. D1 refused a chemical breath test and was taken to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for a blood draw.V1 was towed by Sturgis Towing due to disabling damage. D1 was arrested for Operating While Intoxicated IC 9-30-5-2.The light pole, irrigation control box, and the house located at 822 E. 11th Street belong to Indiana University.On 09/24/2019, The Indiana State Department of Toxicology issued the drug report for the blood test that was requested for Turk. The tests by NMS Labs concluded that Turk had the following:1) 25 ng/mL of blood of Alprazolam2) 8.1 ng/mL of blood of Delta-9 Carboxy THC3) 1.1 ng/mL of blood of Delta-9 THC

On 4/25/2019 at 0344am I responded to the intersection of 11th and Fountain Drive in regard to a vehicle accident. On my arrival to the accident I observed a red Volkswagen Jetta facing to the south west that collided into a directional sign and came to rest in the woods. It appeared that vehicle 1 was traveling west on 11th street when it left the roadway and the front bumper collided with a street sign and its post before coming to rest just off the roadway. The driver of the vehicle was absent from the vehicle and could not be located. An attempt to locate the owner of the vehicle was made at 1000 west Church Lane but was unsuccessful. This case is active pending speaking with the owner of the vehicle to determine who may have been driving the vehicle during the time of the accident.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET WHEN HE ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO WEST SMITH AVENUE, BUT COLLIDED WITH V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET WHEN V1 STARTED TO MAKE A LEFT TURN, CAUSING V1 TO COLLIDE WITH V2.D2 STATED SHE HAD A HEADACHE AND HER UPPER LIP WAS NUMB DUE TO IT STRIKING THE STEERING WHEEL. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING STALL IN FRONT OF 319 E VARSITY LN, FACING WEST, WHEN HE ATTEMPTED TO BACK HIS CAR OUT INTO THE PARKING LOT. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE D2'S VEHICLE, AND CONTINUED BACKING, STRIKING THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF D2'S FRONT QUARTER PANEL, DAMAGING THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE TIRED2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT TRAVELING NORTHBOUND, WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK BY D1 BACKING OUT OF THE PARKING STALL IN FRONT OF 319 E VARSITY LN. D2 STATED THAT BY THE TIME SHE WITNESSED D1 STARTING TO MOVE FROM THE PARKING STALL, SHE DID NOT HAVE TIME TO STOP HER VEHICLE OR MOVE OUT OF THE WAY.BASED ON THE STATEMENTS TAKEN AND THE DAMAGE AT THE SCENE, MY INVESTIGATION YIELDED THAT D1 FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY TO A VEHICLE ALREADY IN MOTION, BACKING HIS VEHICLE INTO THE DRIVER SIDE OF D2
