Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: NARRATIVE:A 2-vehicle crash occurred on Interstate 69 north bound, at the junction of the ramp from Fullerton Pike onto I69 northbound near the 112.5 mile marker. I69 is a divided 6-lane north-south highway, which connects Evansville and Indianapolis by way of Bloomington. The center median is paved with a permanent concrete barrier topped by reflectors, whih separates the north and south lanes of traffic. Both shoulders are paved and approximately one car-width, with the left bounded by the center concrete divider wall and the right lane bounded by a metal guard rail. The shoulder on both sides of the driving lanes are delineated with a white reflective painted fog line. The lanes of travel are divided by a broken white lines in this area. Fullerton Pike, a 2-way paved city road, passes over I69 by way of an overpass approximately 500 feet to the south of where the collision occurred. The roadway on the afternoon of Friday, April 26, 2018 was cloudy but clear, with the road surface dry. There were no signs of preexisting fluids or foreign substances on the roadway. Vehicle 1 (V1), was a 2006 blue-grey Chevrolet Cobalt 4-door passenger car, (TN registration BZL642). Vehicle 2 (V2) was a white Peterbilt 2012 semi tractor (IN registration 2036940), pulling a 2012 aluminum HEI bulk carrier trailer (IN registration P720388). V2 had come to a controlled stop on the shoulder just past the end of the merge lane of the exit ramp from Fullerton Pike onto I69, on the right shoulder. V1 had also come to a controlled stop behind V2 on the right shoulder.I was travelling northbound when I observed both vehicles pulled over on the right shoulder just past the end of the exit ramp leading from Fullerton Pike onto northbound I69. I activated my emergency lights and made contact with both drivers, ensuring that neither of them were injured. Both drivers were outside the vehicles when I arrived on scene. Vehicle 1 (V1) had heavy damage to the exterior of the driver's side door, the exterior metal of which was torn. Additionally the rear left tire was flattened. There were various marks and abrasions to the left side of the vehicle. Vehicle 2 (V2) had light damage to the slotted aluminum running board on the exterior of the right (passenger) side exterior fuel tank. Driver 1 (D1)(Rivera) stated that she lived in Tennessee until recently and had just moved back to Indiana. She stated that she was merging onto I69 from Fullerton Pike and simply didn't see the truck as she changed lanes from the ramp into the right-most of the 3 northbound lanes. She stated that she 'simply merged right into the right into him', coming into contact with the tractor cab. She then immediately swerved away from the contact after becoming aware of the truck to her left. Driver 2 (D2)(Collings) stated that he was driving straight in the right-most lane of travel when he observed the vehicle coming down the ramp overtaking him from the rear. He was unable to merge into the lanes to his left to make space for the incoming vehicle, which continued to merge until it ran out of lane and came into contact with the right side of his vehicle. He had continued to drive straight within his lane of travel until the crash, at which time he braked and came to rest on the right side of the road on the shoulder. Based upon my investigation of the scene, the physical damage to both vehicles, and the interviews of both drivers, it is likely that the following occurred: V1 merged into the side of V2, which was unable to change lanes due to its large size and the heavy traffic. As such, D1 is at fault for failure to yield the right of way to vehicles in the northbound lanes of travel, resulting in V1 colliding into and sideswiping V2.

V1 AND V2 WERE BOTH EASTBOUND AND AT THE INTERSECTION WHEN V1 STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER PORTION OF V2.V1/D1 STATED SHE WAS EASTBOUND AND COMING UP TO THE INTERSECTION AND NOTICED VEHICLES APPEARED STOPPED DUE TO THE TRAFFIC LIGHT. D1 STATED SHE THEN BEGAN SLOWIN DOWN AND GLANCED DOWN TO GET A DRINK FROM HER SODA. D1 STATED AFTER DOING SO SHE REALIZED HER VEHICLE WAS ABOUT TO IMPACT THE REAR BUMPER OF V2 AND DID SO, CAUSING DAMAGE. V2/D2 STATED SHE HAD BEEN STOPPED AT THE LIGHT, HOWEVER, THE LIGHT CHANGED TO GREEN AND SHE BEGAN TO ACCELERATE. HOWEVER, PRIOR TO DOING SO, D2 STATED SHE SAW V1 IN HER REAR VIEW MIRROR APPROACHING AT WHAT APPEARED TO BE A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. DUE TO THIS, D2 STATED SHE BEGAN TO ACCELERATE IN ATTEMPT TO PREVENT V1 FROM COLLIDING INTO HER VEHICLE, HOWEVER, SHE WAS UNSUCCESSFUL AND HER VEHICLE WAS IMPACTED BY V1. V1 SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE AND WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE. V2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER PORTION AND WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

On 04/26/2019, at approximately 1303 hours, I was dispatched to Bland's Auto at 2200 North Walnut Street, to meet with a motorist who advised that he had just been run off of the road by an aggressive driver who had left heading toward Ellettsville. After getting information regarding the suspect vehicle, I put that information out over the radio to officers and deputies and had dispatch provide that information to Ellettsville Police. When I arrived, I met with the complainant Darrell Poer, the driver of a black BMW Z3 convertible, (IN PE plate, IUKXAZ) and witness Dominic Dpoffo. Poer advised that he had been driving westbound on the East State Road 45/46 Bypass near East 17th Street around 1259. Poer advised that there was a red Dodge Ram pickup truck in the right lane that was going slower than he was, so Poer moved from the right lane into the left lane to attempt to pass the truck. As Poer pulled into the left lane, the truck accelerated sharply, preventing him from being able to pass, so Poer got back into the right lane behind the truck. As they continued on the Bypass between 17th Street and North Fee Lane, the truck slowed down as it approached a car ahead of it. Poer again moved into the left lane to try to pass the Dodge. As he began to pull alongside the truck, the driver of the truck jerked the steering wheel sharply to the left, into the passing lane that Poer was in. Poer advised that he also had to jerk his wheel to the left to avoid a collision with the truck, and as a result, his driver side wheels and tires struck the raised curb median. Poer pointed out damage to both front and rear driver side rims and the front driver side tire from the impact with the curb. Poer said he went to pull over after striking the curb, but the truck continued on without stopping, so Poer continued on, following the Dodge, catching up with the Dodge at the traffic light at North Dunn Street. Poer then pulled around the truck west of the intersection and stopped ahead of it, exiting his vehicle to speak with the driver. Poer described the truck's driver as a husky white male in his late fifties or early sixties with sandy brown hair, a mustache and beard and wearing a long-sleeved high-visibility construction type shirt. As Poer approached the truck, he said he asked the driver "What are you doing? You ran me off of the road intentionally!". Poer said the male answered, "I've got the right of way! I've got the right of way!", remaining in the truck and then drove around Poer's vehicle and left, heading westbound on East State Road 46 toward Ellettsville. Dpoffo advised that he witnessed the entire sequence of events, from the intersection of East 17th Street to the point where Poer spoke with the truck driver while driving west on the Bypass in his own vehicle. Dpoffo said that when Poer initially tried to pass the red truck, the driver "gunned it" so aggressively that Dpoffo, who was following behind in his own vehicle, backed off from 5 or 6 car lengths behind in the left lane, to 10 or 11 car lengths behind. When I asked Dpoffo more regarding that, he said that he thought this was going to turn into a more serious incident based on the behavior of the truck driver so he backed off for safety reasons. When Poer attempted to pass the Dodge truck a second time, Dpoffo said he witnessed the truck jerk sharply into the passing lane so that the truck veered halfway into that left lane. This action caused Poer to have to also jerk left to avoid the truck and the BMW's driver side wheels struck the curb. Dpoffo also witnessed when Poer exited his vehicle and spoke with the truck driver. Dpoffo characterized Poer's tone and approach as "non-aggressive" and just wanting to ask why that had happened. Dpoffo said he noted the truck's license plate and he was the one who had provided it to after the truck driver left the scene. While no officers located the truck, the license plate Dpoffo provided, IN CL plate AA581, returned to a 2014

D1 stated that she was parked facing east in a space on the east side of the IMU Pay Lot #2. When D1 began to back southwest out of the space, the rear driver side bumper of V1 struck the front driver side bumper and quarter panel of V2, which was parked facing east to the southwest of V1's original parking space. V1 had scratches and gouges to the rear driver side bumper. V2's front driver side bumper and quarter panel both sustained moderate damage from the crash and the bumper was hanging down from the anchors.

V1 was on SB ramp from I69 to SR 45 west and V2 was in front of V1. Both vehicles had come off the ramp and were in the far right lane on SR 45 west. V2 came to a stop so he could turn into the lane to the left of him. V1 didn't realize V2 had stopped and struck V2 in the rear bumper with the front bumper of his vehicle.D1 stated that he was behind V2 and he advised he was looking to the left to see if any traffic was coming so he could merge into the left lane. He stated when he turned back to the front, V2 was stopped in front of him and he stated he bumped V2.D2 stated that he had come off the ramp and was stopped waiting to merge into the left lane. He stated he was then hit in the rear by V1.

A Vehicle traveling south bound on E SR 45 locked up the brakes on the vehicle, missed a 90 degree curve to the right, departing the roadway to the south. Upon departing the roadway, a series of mail boxes where hit damaging them, a road sign with a right pointing directional sign was struck and damaged. The vehicle then stuck a guide wire to an AT&T telephone pole. Upon striking the guide wire, 3 telephone poles were broken approx 20' above the ground to the east, and to the north, 2 poles where bent over. Approx 1/4 of a mile worth of AT&T telephone lines where pulled down and where laying on the ground. The vehicle then departed the area in an unknown direction. Vehicle parts left at the scene suggest the vehicle is a possible late 90's model GM truck or SUV. A passenger side mirror and part of the vehicle side trim where left at the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE MADE A U-TURN ON W PROFILE PARKWAY PULLING INTO A SMALL UNMARKED DRIVE TO TURN AROUND AS SHE PULLED OUT SHE SAID SHE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 AND HIT VEHICLE 2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR QUARTER PANEL NEAR REAR TIRE. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. PROFILE PARKWAY WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK ON THE SIDE BY VEHICLE 1.

Driver one stated she was driving north on N Lincoln Street approaching 7th Street when she slowed for the stop sign and then proceeded through the intersection. Driver one stated she didn't see the bicyclist and she hit the bicyclist with the front of her vehicle in the intersection.Bicyclist stated he was riding east bound on E 7th Street when he slowed for the stop sign at N Lincoln Street and proceeded through the intersection. Bicyclist one stated the lights on his bicycle were on or working and he never came to a complete stop. Bicyclist stated he was hit by vehicle one and he was refusing medical but was brought to the hospital by a friend. Witness one stated he was walking east on E 7th Street just before N Lincoln Street when he saw vehicle one run the stop sign and hit the bicyclist.

Both bicyclist (B1) and V2 were traveling eastbound on 10th Street. B1 was in the bike lane and V2 was in its lane of travel. B1 turned left into V2 lane of travel causing V2 to strike B1 rear tire.B1 said he was traveling eastbound on 10th street. B1 said he came to the road entrance where he turned to go northbound across 10th Street into the 10th Street Lot. B1 said he heard the bus and then turned left. B1 said his Trek 930 bicycle was then struck on the rear tire by the driver side front bumper. B1 said he was informed video footage of the crash would be made available. B's bicycle had damage to the rear bike tire area. D2 said he was traveling eastbound on 10th Street in V2. D2 said they were in front of Wright Quad on 10th Street. D2 said B1 was in the bike lane traveling eastbound. D2 said V2 was in his lane. D2 said he pulled up approximately a bus length on 10th Street. D2 said that;s when B1 turned left in front of V2 heading towards the parking lot on north side of 10th Street (10th Street Lot). D2 said that;s when V2 front driver side bumper struck the rear of the Bicycle. V2 had a light scuff mark on the black trim of V2 front bumper. D2 said there will be video footage available. Witness 1 Sharon Aikman "said she was traveling westbound on 10th Street and bus was traveling eastbound on 10th Street. Aikman said she believed the bicyclist was on the sidewalk. Aikman said she saw the bicyclist look back and then turn to go northbound across 10th Street. Aikman said the front of V2 driver side tire struck rear of bicycle."Witness 2 Sean McGill said "bicycle crossed street as bus was coming on. McGill said bicyclist was not at crosswalk with lights and was hit. McGill said seemed to not be the fault of the bus driver. McGill said cyclist looked as bus had right away".Witness 3 Silvia Reyes said "I was on the bus and the bus driver was doing fine until someone crossed without looking with the bike and hit him".Witness 4 Joshua McCulley Sr. was gone prior to police arrival. I attempted to call McCulley twice and got no answer. D2 said the video footage of the crash would be available in the afternoonAll parties said they did not need medical attention.

V1 (PONTIAC G6/GT) WAS NORTHBOUND ON KINSER PK. D1 (SHYANNA YOKLEY) ADVISED VEHICLES TRAVELING IN FRONT OF HER SUDDENLY BRAKED. D1 ADVISED SHE REAR ENDED V2 (BUICK PARK AVENUE). V2 (BUICK PARK AVENUE) WAS NORTHBOUND ON KINSER PK.D2 (ROBERT SHETTERLEY) ADVISED VEHICLES TRAVELING IN FRONT OF HIM SUDDENLY BRAKED. D2 ADVISED HE STOPPED IN TIME TO AVOID REAR ENDING V3 (UNKNOWN MAKE/MODEL), HOWEVER, V1 REAR ENDED HIM. D2 STATED V1 PUSHED HIM INTO V3 (UNKNOWN MAKE/MODEL). D2 STATED V3 HAD NO DAMAGE AND THEREFORE LEFT. V1 SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE FRONT END DAMAGE. V2 SUSTAINED MINOR REAR END DAMAGE AND A SCUFF MARK ON FRONT BUMPER FROM BEING PUSHED INTO V3. NEITHER VEHICLE NEEDED TOWED.

I, Indiana Conservation Officer, Lt. Angela Goldman was dispatched to a car/deer crash on April 29, 2019 on Southbound I69 at the 112 mile marker.When I arrived there was a green Jeep wrangler pulled off the on the side of the interstate. It had been operated by Lucas Miller. There was damage to the front, left corner of the jeep. Miller advised a deer had crossed the interstate in front of him, traveling west to east and he struck it with his Jeep. Miller advised the deer was still alive but had a broken back. There was deer hair present in the bumper of the Jeep. Miller stated that as I pulled up the deer crawled into the bushes alongside the interstate. I opted to not attempt to put the deer down for fear it would try to run back into the busy interstate traffic. The deer never came back out of the bushes during my interaction with Miller.Damage to Miller's vehicle included hood and bumper damage. He was wearing a seat belt. There were skid marks on the roadway where Miller had attempted to stop prior to striking the deer.Miller was able to drive his vehicle from the scene and a wrecker was not needed.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S ROCKPORT RD AND RAN OFF THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY, HIT A FENCE AND TREES AND CAUSED PROPERTY DAMAGE. D1 LEFT THE SCENE.I LATER MADE CONTACT WITH D1 AT HER RESIDENCE. D1 STATED THAT ACCIDENT OCCURRED AT APPROX. 1 AM, AND CLAIMED A DEER RAN OUT IN FRONT OF HER WHICH CAUSED HER TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY.THE PROPERTY OWNER DID NOT WANT TO PURSUE CHARGES AGAINST D1 FOR LSA.

D1 advised he was driving east on E SR 46 near county line road when he believes he fell asleep and left the roadway. D1 advised he had been feeling flu like symptoms when he woke up. Unable to find plate on the 2012 worldwide trailer attached to the semi, at the time of the crash. Vehicle struck and damaged a large portion of the guard rail as well as the mailboxes for 9701 E SR 46 and 9865 E SR 46. Fluid leaked from the vehicle and HAZMAT steps were taking by PPCVFD to prevent further contamination of the stream. D1 REFUSED TREATMENT FOR MINOR ABRASIONS ON SCENE.

V1, Jeep Grand Cherokee, was traveling north on SR45 north of Stanford Road. V1 traveled off the right, east side, of the roadway along a grass ditch. V1 returned to the northbound lane of SR45 then back off the right, east side of the road a second time. V1 continued along the grass ditch where it struck a guide wire with the rear passenger side quarter panel and bumper cover. V1 traveled back onto the northbound lane of SR45 before traveling off the right, east side of the roadway a final time and came to final rest along the grass ditch. D1, Christenberry, stated she was traveling north on SR45. D1 indicated a dog entered the roadway and she swerved to the right to avoid impact. D1 stated she lost control of V1 before leaving the roadway several times. D1 stated she struck a guide wire before coming to final rest along a grass ditch. Evidence shows tire marks leading from the northbound lane of SR45 consistent with the path described above. Evidence shows a guide wire was damaged consistent with an impact by V1.

D1 stated he was traveling eastbound on 10th approaching the intersection at Sunrise when he did not notice traffic stopped at a red traffic signal in front of him. D1 stated he tried to stop but slid into the back of a V2. D1 stated after the collision both drivers got out. Once out of the vehicle D1 stated the other driver took a picture of his insurance card and got D1's phone number. After words D2 stated his car had no damage and left the scene before I arrived. Due to the heavy damage on D1's vehicle it would be highly probable that the second car would in fact have damage to the rear. D2 did not remain on scene and was unable to be contacted.D1 has heavy front end damage all the way across and airbag deployment on the driver side. D1's vehicle was towed from the scene due to heavy front end damage and airbag deployment. D1 refused all medical attention. D2 damage is unknown at this time.

An unknown vehicle traveling southbound on South Old State Road 37 slid off the roadway into the yard of 7780 South State Road 37. The vehicle slid through the yard and struck a brick driveway indicator. The driveway indicator belongs to 7796 South State Road 37.The vehicle left the scene and there are no indicators of make or model.

Monroe County HWY Department was patching pot holes when vehicle one (1) drove by with its chipper shoot loose. The chipper shoot on vehicle one (1) then hit vehicle two (2) along its driver side hitting the ladder to the dump bed of vehicle two (2), side view mirror and fender. Vehicle number one (1) continued driving away with another vehicle following. Vehicle one (1) was Indiana Tree Company bucket truck towing a chipper. Robert Bandy who is a boss with Indiana Tree Company arrived later and gave some information on the truck involved. Mr. Bandy could not supply insurance or the driver or the driver information for the accident report. Mr. Bandy advised the driver returned to the company to drop the vehicle off and then left in his personnel vehicle to go home. Robert Bandy is the Boss over the Tree Company 812-668-0158

Vehicle 1 was SB, on SR 446 South of Swartz Ridge Road. A deer ran from the East side of SR 446 into the path of V-1. The front of V-1 struck the deer. The crash caused V-1 to have to be towed to disabling damage.

V1 was traveling southbound on State Road 45/46 bypass towards the intersection at 17th Street. V2 was traveling north on the bypass turning left, west, onto 17th Street. V2 entered the intersection at 17th and the Bypass to turn left and yielded at the green light. V1's light was yellow turning red. The traffic light turned red before V1 entered the intersection. V2 turned as the light turned red. V1 was traveling at too high of a speed to stop for the light. V2 then entered the intersection to complete the turn. V1 then struck V2. V1 had disabling damage to the entire front end. V2 had disabling damage to the front end and passenger side of the vehicle. D1 stated that he was traveling towards 17th Street and had the green light. D1 stated that the light then turned yellow and he continued at a speed of approximately 60 miles per hour. D1 stated that he entered the intersection as the light was still yellow. D1 stated that V2 then turned while he still had the yellow light. V1 then struck V2. D2 stated that she was turning off of the bypass towards 17th Street. D2 stated that while her light was green she had entered the intersection to turn and was stopped waiting for traffic to clear. D2 stated that the light then turned red and she proceeded to turn onto 17th street thinking that traffic had stopped for the light. D2 stated that V1 then disregarded the light and struck V2. Witness: George Theodore stated that he was two cars back behind V2 in the left turn lane to turn onto 17th Street from the bypass. Theodore stated that V2 was yielded in the middle of the intersection waiting to turn. Theodore stated that the light then turned red and V2 began to turn. Theodore stated that V1 then disregarded the lighted signal and struck V2. Theodore stated that he believed that V1 was traveling at approximately 45 miles per hour but did not appear to slow down for the light. Theodore stated that V1 had plenty of time to stop for the yellow light and he did not. Both vehicles were towed from the scene due to disabling damage. There were no injuries reported at the scene.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PARKING LOT OF BLOOMINGTON BONE & JOINT, 639 S. WALKER ST.V2 WAS ENTERING THE PARKING LOT, MAKING A RIGHT TURN AROUND A LARGE BUSH ON THE END OF ROW.V1 WAS BACKING OUT OF THE FIRST PARKING SPACE ON THAT ROW. V1 BACKED INTO V2 AS V2 WAS TURNING, THEN STOPPED, THEN BACKED UP AGAIN INTO V2.D1 SAID HE DID NOT SEE V2 TURN BEHIND HIM, AND INTIALLY THOUGHT HE STRUCK THE CURB.D2 SAID SHE STARTED HONKING AT V1 AS IT BEGAN BACKING OUT, BUT IT STRUCK V2 IN THE LOT.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

Driver 1 stated she was driving north on SR 46 when the traffic in front of her came to a stop. Driver 1 stated she went to stop but on accident she missed the brake pedal and hit the gas causing her to rear end vehicle 1.Driver 2 stated she was stopped in traffic on SR 46 near E Eastgate Ln when she was rear ended by vehicle 1.

ON 04/30/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON EAST STATE ROAD 46. UNIT 1 STRUCK A DEER WITH THE FRONT RIGHT FENDER. UNIT 1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE FRONT RIGH FENDER AND AROUND THE HEADLIGHT. VEHICLE HAD MOVED TO A PRIVATE DRIVE OFF THE ROADWAY AND THE DEER WAS LOCATED IN A DITCH NEAR BY UPON MY ARRIVAL.

D1 stated that she was going through the intersection at 3rd street and Kimble Drive heading East.D1 stated she had a green light and that V2 pulled in front of her off of Kimble Drive and struck the front driver side of her vehicle. D2 stated he was facing South on Kimble Drive getting ready to pull onto 3rd Street to head East. W1 stated her light was red and that V2 had a green light coming from Kimble Drive.W1 stated that when V2 proceeded through the intersection he was struck by V1 which caused V2 to go over the median and enter the West bound traffic.

THE STOP SIGN AT THE ITNERSECTION OF EAST ATWATER AND SOUTH CLIFTON AVENUE APPEARES TO HAVE BEEN STRUCK BY V1, THE DESCRIPTION BEING UNKNOWN.THERE ARE TIRE TRACKS HEADED EAST ON ATWATER, WHICH THEN RUN OFF OF ATWATER AND TOWARS SOUTH CLIFTON AVENUE UNTIL RUNNING TOWARDS THE STOP SIGN AND INTERSECTION SIGN OF EAST ATWATER AND SOUTH CLIFTON AVE.THE STOP SIGN POLE IS NOW BENT AND THE GREEN INTERSECTION SIGN HAS BROKEN OFF OF THE POLE AND FALLEN TO THE GROUND, BENDING THE SIGN.THERE IS NO VIDEO FOOTAGE AT THIS TIME AND THERE IS NO SUSPECT INFORMATION.

V1 and V2 were traveling W/B on Arlington RD. V1 struck V2, causing damage to V2.D1 was traveling W/B on Arlington RD. D1 saw V2 directly in front of V1 and attempted to brake. D1 stated that while attempting to stop, his vehicle brakes locked up and he was unable to stop V1. D1 advised that he attempted to swerve off the road, to avoid V2 before he struck V2. D1 advised that he had a complaint of pain to his left arm and was treated on scene.D2 advised that she was traveling W/B on Arlington RD, stopped in traffic attempting to turn onto Gourley Pike. D2 advised that while stopped, she felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that she was not injured. Due to D1 brake failure, V1 struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

V1 was driving southeast into a parking stall in the Poplars Parking Garage on the third level. V2 was parked facing northwest in a parking stall located below the parking stall that V1 was parking in.D1 stated that as she was parking V1, her foot slipped off of the brake pedal and she collided into the cable barrier separating the parking stall and the level below. There was a wood block attached to the cable barrier. She stated that the wood barrier broke and pieces of the wood fell on top of V2 that was parked in a stall below.There was damage to front passenger side bumper of V1 and to the hood and passenger side rear view mirror of V2. There were no injuries.

UNIT 2 WAS A PEDESTRIAN RIDING A BICYCLE ON W. COOLIDGE AND DID NOT YEILD TO THE ONCOMING TRAFFIC TRAVELING ON S. ROGERS ST. D1 OF V1 (UNIT 1) WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON S. ROGERS ST AND STATED THAT A FEMALE ON A BICYCLE WENT IN FRONT OF HER AND SHE SLAMMED ON HER BRAKES. D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS ABLE TO AVOID HITTING THE FIRST FEMALE ON THE BICYCLE AND THEN UNIT 2 STRUCK THE FRONT OF HER CAR. THE FRONT OF V1 DID SUSTAIN SOME MINOR SCRATCHES TO THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE AND IT DID NOT APPEAR THAT THERE WAS ANY DAMAGE TO THE BIKE THAT UNIT 2 WAS RIDING. BASED ON THE WITNESS STATEMENTS GIVEN BY STEPHANIE COLE, D1 WAS UNABLE TO AVOID UNIT 2 HITTING THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE.UNIT 2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT FOR HER INJURIES WHICH INCLUDED ABRASIONS TO HER RIGHT ARM AND A BROKEN RIGHT ELBOW.STEPHANIE COLE, A WITNESS, STATED THAT SHE SAW BOTH FEMALES ON BICYCLES TRAVELING ON W. COOLIDGE TOWARDS S. ROGERS ST. STEPHANIE STATED THAT SHE SAW IN HER REAR VIEW MIRROR THE FIRST FEMALE ALMOST GET STRUCK BY V1 AND SAW V1 TRY TO STOP. STEPHANIE THEN STATED THAT SHE SAW UNIT 2 HIT THE FRONT OF V1.

On 5/1/2019 at approximately 1156hrs, I investigated a crash in the north parking lot of 901 E 10th Street (informatics Building). A gray Toyota Prius struck a silver Kia Soul as it was pulling into a parking space.D1, Zackary Dunivin, was driving a gray Toyota Prius (V1) and was east bound in the parking lot from Woodlawn Ave. D1 stated he began turning left (north) into a parking space and "wasn't paying attention" and impacted the rear driver's side bumper of V2, a silver Kia Soul.V2 was occupied by the owner, but was parked and not in motion.

V1 and V2 were traveling northbound on Walnut Street Pike. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N COLLEGE AVE IN THE FAR LEFT LANE. D2 ADVISED V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N COLLEGE AVE IN THE CENTER LANE JUST AHEAD OF THEM. V2 ATTEMPTED TO TAKE A LEFT HAND TURN ONTO W 8TH ST TRAVELING EB FROM THE CENTER LANE. V1 THEN STRUCK V2. D1 ADVISED THEY ATTMEPTED TO MERGE INTO THE LEFT LANE TO AND THEN TURN EB ONTO W 8TH ST, HOWEVER THEY DID NOT SEE V2. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO V1 ON THE DRIVER SIDE DOORS AND TO THE FRONT BUMPER OF V2.
Driver one disregarded the traffic light at the intersection of State Road 46 W and Matthews Drive pulling into the path of vehicle two.. Both vehicle moved prior to officers arrival no diagram.

I was dispatched to 6962 S Fairfax RD in reference to a accident LSA. When we arrived we located V1 on McCormick Rd just north of the accident scene. witnesses stated that there was a female driver that fled north from the location of the vehicle. I observed significant damage to the front of V1 and both wheels of V1. Photos were taken. I then went to the initial scene of the crash at 6977 S Fairfax Rd and spoke to a witness, Vicki Gans, who saw V1 after it traveled north east on Strain Ridge Rd and crossed Fairfax Rd and into the yard of 6977 and damaged a concrete wall and a tree along with landscaping. Mrs. Gans also stated she saw V1 back out of the yard with significant front end damage and attempt to travel north of S Fairfax Rd. I located vehicle parts on the ground at the point of impact. I followed the gouges in the roadway to where V1 was abandoned. I checked that parts with the damage to the front of V1 and found the parts matched perfectly. I spoke to the resident of 6977 S Fairfax Rd, Christopher Robertson, and advised him of the damage to his property. After a search of the area and some investigation D1 was located at 6375 S Sanders, Main St. D1 stated she was driving D1 during the crash and acknowledged hitting the tree then fled the scene because she didn't have a drivers license and she was scared of being in trouble. The owner of V1 also arrived on scene and provided me with information about D1 and where to find her. He also provided me with insurance information for V1. D1 was arrested and charged with leaving the scene of an accident causing property damage. V1 was not drivable and was towed form the scene and D1 did not appear injured as a result of the crash.

V1 and V2 were heading South on Jordan Avenue approaching the 7th Street intersection with traffic. D1 stated that she was behind V2 heading South on Jordan. D1 stated that she thought V2 was going farther than it did and she rear-ended V2. D2 stated that he was behind multiple vehicles at the intersection of 7th Street and Jordan Avenue. D2 stated that he was gradually pulling forward when V1 rear-ended him. There was minor damage to both vehicles.D1 was unable to provide insurance after multiple phone calls.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was east on 3rd Street approaching Parkridge Road. She stated that she was preparing to turn left into the gas station from the left hand lane. Driver 1 stated that there was a truck driving west that was going to turn left in front of her. Driver 1 stated that she did not see Driver 2 because the truck was blocking her view. Driver 1 turned left into the path of Driver 1 and they collided. Driver 1 had a complaint of pain to her head and thigh and was transported to the hospital.Driver 2 stated he was west on 3rd street approaching Parkridge Road when Driver 1 turned in front of him. Driver 2 stated he could not avoid the accident. Driver 2 had complaint of pain to his hand and back. The front passenger in Vehicle 2 had complaint of chest pain and the backseat passenger also had a complaint of chest pain. All 3 subjects were transported to the hospital for treatment.

V1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON ROGERS STREET AT 1ST STREET.V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON 1ST STREET AT ROGERS STREET.D1 SAID HE WAS LOOKING AT HIS NAVIGATION MAP AND RAN THE STOP SIGN AND HIT V2.D2 SAID AS HE CROSSED ROGERS STREET V1 HIT HIM.

ON 05/01/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON CHAPEL HILL RD. A DEER RAN OUT INTO THE ROADWAY CAUSING UNIT 1 TO SWERVE IN AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID THE DEER. WHILE SWERVING UNIT 1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY STRIKING A TREE CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE.

9305/01/2019 1815 hoursV1 and V2 collided on Jones Avenue as V1 was backing northbound out of a parking spot onto Jones Ave when V1 struck V2. V2 was traveling eastbound on Jones Ave when V1 backed into V2. V2 was traveling eastbound on Jones Ave east of Jordan Avenue when D2 observed V1 backing out of a parking spot along Jones Ave. V1 was backing north out of a parking spot onto Jones Ave while V2 was traveling eastbound on Jones Ave. D1 did not see V2 traveling as she was backing out of the parking spot and struck V2 on the middle rear passenger side of the vehicle with the rear bumper of V1. D2 honked V2's horn to warn D1 that V1 was about to collide, but V1 continued to back out of the parking spot until the vehicles collided. IUPD was then notified of the collision.

D1 stated she was heading East on Country Club Drive approaching the B-line Trail. D1 stated she noticed traffic stopping due to the trail crossing. D1 stated that she had plenty of distance to stop her vehicle but when she pushed her brakes the brakes would not work.D1 stated her vehicle then struck V2 in the rear. D1 stated when V2 pulled out of the roadway into a small parking area, she also pulled her vehicle out of the road.D1 stated she had to hit a curb in a small parking area to get the vehicle to stop. D2 stated she was stooping in traffic due to the trail crossing and was struck in the rear by V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was in the middle of the intersection of W. State Rd 45 and W. Industrial BLVD attempting to turn left onto Walmart Dr. V2 was driving East on W. State Rd 45. V3 was sitting in the left turn lane facing west on W. State Rd 45 behind V1. D2 of V2 stated that he was driving east on W. State Rd 45 and had the green light when V1 turned left and struck the rear drivers side quarter panel of V2. D3 of V3 stated that she was sitting in the left turn lane on W. State Rd 45 facing west and saw V1 enter the intersection attempting to turn left. D3 stated that she saw V1 strike V2. D3 stated that after V2 was struck, V2 slid into V3. D3 also stated that she did not remember 100% if the light was green but she thinks it was green. Other Location of Investigation: The IUPD station.Primary Cause: Other (driver) - D2 advised he thought V2 had enough room to turn without crashing into V1, it turned out V2 did not have enough room before crashing into V1.The witness (W1) advised V1 was parked facing southbound on the Circle Drive of McNutt Quad. W1 advised she was sitting in the driver's seat of V1. W1 advised the liftgate to V1 was open when V2 drove past V1. W1 advised when V2 drove past V1 it crashed into the liftgate causing minor damage. W1 advised V2 is a white bus. W1 advised she spoke with D2 and D2 advised he would call his company and they would take care of the damage. W1 advised the Driver of V2 then left the scene.D2 was able to meet me at the police station after the crash occurred. D2 advised he was driving through the Circle Drive of McNutt Quad when V2 crashed into V1. D2 advised he thought V2 had enough room to turn without crashing into V1. D2 advised he spoke with W1 after the crash and they came to an agreement that his company would take care of the damage without a crash report. Vehicles were parked on both sides of McNutt Circle Drive making it difficult for large vehicles to proceed through freely.

D2 STATED THEY WERE DRIVING THEIR RED PONTIAC (VEHICLE 2) EAST ON W 11TH ST APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH N MONROE ST. THERE WAS A DARK COLORED FORD EXPLORER (VEHICLE 1) IN FRONT OF THEM DRIVEN BY D1 GOING EAST ON W 11TH ST ALSO AT THE INTERSECTION OF N MONROE ST. D1 THEN TURNED LEFT GOING NORTH ONTO N MONROE ST. D2 ALSO TURNED LEFT GOING NORTH ONTO N MONROE ST. Unit 1 was travelling westbound on state rd 46, just east of the Arlington Rd intersection. Driver was briefly distracted, then was unable to stop in time for slowing traffic. Unit 1 impacted Unit 3 at the rear, unit 2 was then impacted forward and then impacted unit 2. Driver of unit 1 sustained injuries and was transported to IU health, drivers of unit 2 and 3 were checked on scene and released. All vehicles were towed from site due to them all being immobile.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS EASTBOUNDON SR 45/46 BYPASS AT KINSER PIKE.V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS TURNING LEFT ONTO KINSER PIKE.D1 SAID THE LIGHT TURNED YELLOW AS HE APPROACHED AND WHEN HE WENT THROUGH V2 TURNED IN FRONT OF HIM AND THEY COLLIDED.D2 SAID AS SHE TURNED LEFT ON A YELLOW LIGHT V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HER AND THEY COLLIDED.WITNESS #1 SAID HE WAS EASTBOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS AND HAD STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT AT KINSER PIKE. HE SAID V1 WAS IN THE LEFT LANE AND WENT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION ON A RED LIGHT AND HIT V2.WITNESS #2 SAID SHE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON KINSER PIKE AT SR 45/46 BYPASS IN THE LEFT TURN LANE. SHE SAID SHE WAS ATTHE FRONT OF THE LEFT TURN LANE AND HAD A GREEN LIGHT TO GO EAST. SHE SAID V1 THEN RAN THE RED LIGHT FOR EASTBOUND TRAFFIC AND HIT V2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 is a large boom truck.D1 stated he was traveling North on Walnut Street at approximately 35-38MPH and crested the hill at 11th street. D1 stated due to the wet pavement the rear of his vehicle started to slid.D1 stated he tried to correct his vehicle and over corrected and struck V2.D1 stated he was still trying to correct his vehicle but he started striking all the other vehicles. I could not make contact with any of the owners to the other vehicles to provide them with the information. V3,V4,V5,V6, were all towed from the area due to disabling damage and being in the roadway.

9305/03/2019Officers Sung and Koontz assisted with information gathering.Primary Cause (driver distracted - explain in narrative): D1 stated he was looking over his left shoulder and looking at his side mirrors in order to switch lanes. When he looked back forward he was unable to stop in time and he collided with V3.On the SR 45/46 Bypass, vehicles were traveling west in the right hand lane near the Genesis Church entrance off of the Bypass. V5 and V4 had slowed to a complete stop for stopped traffic ahead of them. D3 observed V5, V4, and other traffic come to a stop ahead of her. D3 slowed to a crawl about to stop completely when V1 did not see traffic stop and collided with the rear end of V3. The force of the collision then sent V3 forward colliding with V4. The force from V3 colliding with V4 sent the front part of V4 into the rear end of V5. V2 was traveling west bound behind V1 and observed V1 attempt to stop suddenly behind V3. V2 attempted to stop in time to avoid colliding with V1, but was unable to stop in time and collided into the rear portion of V1 with the front end of V2.While D1 was traveling west bound in V1 behind V3, he stated that he was looking at his side mirrors to see if he could move to the left lane. While D1 was looking at his mirrors, he did not recognize that traffic was stopping ahead of him. D1 then slammed on the brakes in an attempt to avoid a collision with V3. D1 stated that he was traveling at around 40mph. Due to his speed and being distracted by looking at his mirrors, he did not have enough time to stop for the stopped traffic ahead of him, which resulted in the collision with V3 and the collisions involving V2, V3, V4, and V5. D2 stated that she was driving behind V1 and noticed V1 stop suddenly. V2 was traveling at around 40mph and the sudden stopping of V1 did not allow her enough time to stop, which resulted in V2 striking the rear end of V1. V5 was stopped in traffic in front of V4 when the collision happened. There was no damage sustained to the vehicle from V4 so D5 has been left out of this report. D5 stated that she did not need to be in the report due to sustaining no damage or injuries. D5 stated she would contact IUPD if she notices any damage due to the collision at a later time.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED ON SMITH ROAD AT 3RD STREET HEADING SOUTH. V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON SMITH ROAD APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH 3RD STREET.D1 SAID AS SHE SAT AT THE LIGHT V2 HIT HER FROM BEHIND.D2 SAID AS HE BRAKED HE SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT AND REAR ENDED V1.
D2 STATED HE WAS TURNING ONTO FORREST PARK FROM ST RD 46 WHEN D1 WENT AROUND AND STRUCK THE LEFT REAR BUMPER OF V2. BOTH VEHICLES MOVED TO PARKING LOT PRIOR TO ARRIVAL. ONLY MINOR DAMAGE.

V2 was parked facing southbound on Sunrise Drive when another vehicle (V1) swiped the passenger side of V2 while it was unattended. V1 immediately left the scene. I spoke to the owner of V2. She stated that earlier today, she had parked her vehicle on the side of Sunrise Drive so that she could help her son move out of his dorm. When she returned at approximately 3:00pm, she noticed the damage to her vehicle. The vehicle sustained a large scratch along the passenger side doors. The damage appears consistent with a sideswipe from another vehicle. At this time, there are no suspects or leads on the vehicle that left the scene. I have not completed a crash diagram as it is unclear exactly how the crash occurred.

V1 is an IU Building Services van, fleet #22217. V2 was a parked box truck. V1 was westbound on 8th and V2 was parallel parked in a space on the north curb.D1 stated he was driving his van through heavy congested traffic, attempting to avoid several vehicles in the area - including one vehicle blocking part of the roadway ahead of him. D1 stated that the wide mirrors on his van on the passenger side just barely scraped the side of V2, causing very slight scrapes on the mirrors of V1 and a black streak down the side of V2. The marks on V2 appeared to be able to be completely rubbed off by hand with no lasting damage.I took photographs of both vehicles. While I was doing so, the driver of V2 showed up to ask what was going on. He did not wish to make a report or pursue the matter any further, and stated he did not see any damage to his vehicle.

D1 stated he was turning left into a private drive from the center turn lane. D1 stated that no cars were coming and when he made the turn, V2 came out of nowhere and collided with V1.D2 stated she was traveling southbound on South Walnut Street in the west lane when V1 turned in front of V2 and D2 did not have enough time to stop and V2 collided with V1.D1 had a complaint of pain to his head but was treated on the scene and was not transported by ambulance.D2 thought she may have broken her arm but it was actually extremely sore, her neck was also extremely sore, she was treated at the scene and then transported to the hospital by ambulance.Photographs were taken and logged into evidence.

Both vehicles are in the northbound lanes of S.College Mall Rd. At the intersection with E. 3rd St. V1 is in the near right turn lane. V2 is in the adjacent lane that proceeds straight through the intersection. Upon receiving a green light both vehicles proceed straight and in the intersection V1 sideswipes V2 due to improper lane usage.V2 followed V1 as it turned onto E. 7th street and continued to E. Longview Ave and then to E. Longview Ave and S. Pete Ellis Dr.D2 stated it appeared as if the driver of V1 was evading her and attempting to avoid stopping following the collision.V1 may have damage to the passenger side. V2 has damage on the rear driver side door in the form of scratches, scrapes, and paint transfer.SUPPLEMENT 1: ADDED D1 INFORMATION

Driver 2 stated he was in a verbal altercation with the driver of vehicle 1 at a different location and then left and drove to the parking lot of 2100 S Walnut St. Driver 2 stated once he was in the parking lot he was turning his vehicle around when vehicle 1 entered the parking lot and hit his vehicle in the front driver corner. Driver 2 stated he exited his vehicle and vehicle 1 backed up and then drove forward and hit his vehicle again on the driver side before leaving the scene of the accident. Driver 2 stated he read the license plate to dispatch but the plate returned to a Jeep Cherokee and wasn't valid.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE ON E STATE ROAD 46. V2 WAS TRAVELING THE SAME DIRECTION JUST IN FRONT OF V1. AS V2 BEGAN TO SLOW ITS SPEED DUE TO BRAKING TRAFFIC AHEAD, V2 WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND SUBSEQUENTLY COLLIDED WITH V2. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE AND HIS VEHICLE BRIEFLY BEGAN TO SLOW, THEN HIS BRAKES FAILED.D2 STATED THAT ONCE HE BEGAN TO BRAKE DUE TO TRAFFIC AHEAD, V1 WAS UNABLE TO GET STOPPED BEFORE COLLIDING WITH HIM.

V2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING SPACE AND D2 HAD ALREADY SHUT OFF AND STEPPED OUT OF THE VEHICLE. D1 DROVE V1 INTO THE PARKING SPACE TO THE LEFT OF V2. D1 MISTOOK THE GAS FOR THE BREAK IN V1, JUMPED THE CURB AND THE RIGHT FRONT OF V1 STRUCK THE LEFT FRONT OF V2.

Vehicle 1 and Vehicle 2 were both parked on a private driveway when Vehicle 2 struck Vehicle 1 as it was backing out. No injuries were reported and both vehicles were drivable. Vehicle 1, a white 2016 Dodge Charger, was parked in the driveway of 7183 Mt Tabor Rd in Ellettsville, IN facing south and directly east of Vehicle 2. There was no driver and no passenger inside the vehicle when it was struck by Vehicle 2 as it backed out of its parking spot. Vehicle 1 was moved to the far east end of the driveway prior to my arrival and suffered minor damage to the passenger side front fender and front door. Vehicle 2, a gray 2004 Toyota Sienna, was parked in the driveway of 7183 Mt Tabor Rd in Ellettsville, IN facing north and directly west of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 began to back out of its parking spot and as it did, struck Vehicle 1 with the passenger side corner of the front bumper. Vehicle 2 was moved to the far east end of the driveway prior to my arrival and suffered minor damage across the front bumper. Driver 1, Joseph Durnil, stated he was moving Vehicle 2 from where it was parked and when he began backing out of his spot, cut the wheel too soon and struck Vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated he was uninjured in the crash.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W. GIFFORD JUST PASSED ENDWRIGHT RD WHEN SHE CAME UP TO THE CURVE IN THE ROAD AND WENT OFF THE ROADWAY. D1 STATED SHE DOES NOT REMEMBER ANYTHING AFTER THAT. V1 STRUCK A TREE AND DID APPEAR TO HAVE FLIPPED. D1 AND HER JUV PASSENGER WERE CHECKED OUT ON SCENE AND RELEASED. SPOKE TO THE HOMEOWNER OF WHERE V1 STRUCK THE TREE AND ENDED UP IN HER YARD AND HAS BEEN ADDED.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was going down to the boat ramp at Salt Creek State Recreation Area to hang out with her boyfriend, the passenger. The road for the boat ramp ends in water. D1 said the water level was much higher than it was during her previous visits. D1 said when she realized the water was unusually high, she slammed on the brakes, but the vehicle did not stop due to the wet roadway. D1 said she collided with the water, and put the vehicle into reverse, but the vehicle was already too deep. Both D1 and the passenger were able to get out of the vehicle via the windows, and were able to call for her parents. D1 said the vehicle became totally submerged, but the headlights could still be seen at the time of her parents arrival.Upon my arrival, both occupants were in D1's mother's vehicle. Neither were injured. I went to the ramp to see if I could locate the vehicle, but it was totally submerged, and not visible. I spoke with Sgt. Teague, who elected to wait until daylight to call out the Dive team due to the danger of diving at night, and the fact that it wasn't an emergency situation. The tow company is unknown at the time of this report.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET BEHIND V2 WHO WAS BEHIND V3. AS V1 PROCEEDED THROUGH THE TRAFFIC CONTROL SIGNAL, THE FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY SENT THE FRONT OF V2 INTO THE REAR OF V3.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO GET THROUGH THE LIGHT BEFORE IT TURNED TO YELLOW AND SAW VEHICLE IN FRONT OF V2 AND V3 MOVING, HOWEVER, MISTAKENLY PROCEEDED TOO FAR BEFORE COLLIDING WITH V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that he was exiting a private drive to the exit of Urban Air. D1 was facing east attempting to turn left and go north to enter the turn lane to State Road 46. He states that he was watching traffic and once he began exiting onto Smith Pike the collision occurred. D1 believes that V2 was traveling at a high rate of speed down the hill on Smith Pike and contributed to the collision.V2 was traveling north on Smith Pike approaching the intersection with State Road 46. D2 states as he came down the hill he was entering the turn lane to travel west on State Road 46. He stated that the light was green, however, he was slowing because of traffic. There were no observable signs left on the roadway from tire marks. Unable to determine speed at time of impact. Air bags on V2 did deploy, unknown if D2 or D1 were wearing their seat belt at the time of impact.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES

D2 STATED THAT HE THEN DROVE AWAY FROM D1 IN ORDER TO AVOID ANOTHER COLLISION.D1 INTENTIONALLY COLLIDING THE FRONT OF V1 WITH THE FRONT OF V2 CAUSED THIS ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W KIRKWOOD AVE. D1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN NORTH ONTO N. WALNUT ST. D1 STATED SHE DID NOT YEILD TO D2 COMING WEST ON W. KIRKWOOD. D1 STATED V1 HIT V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.D2 STATED HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON 2 KIRKWOOD AVE. D2 STATED HE HAD A GREEN LIGHT AND D1 TURNED NORTH IN FRONT OF HIM. D2 STATED D1 HIT HIS VEHCILE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

V1 was traveling east on 17th Street near Fess Avenue. V2 was traveling west on 17th Street towards Fess Avenue. V1 then attempted to turn left into Gate 6 of the Memorial Stadium Parking Lot and crossed the center line. V2 was traveling at a high rate of speed and was not able to stop for V1. V2 then struck V1. There was disabling damage to the rear of V1. There was disabling damage to the front of V2. D1 stated that he was traveling east on 17th Street and wanted to turn into Gate 6. D1 stated that he saw V2 approaching and thought that he had enough time to make the turn. V2 then attempted to make the turn into Gate 6. D1 stated that V2 then struck the rear of V1 causing it to spin. D1 stated that V2 was going at an extremely high rate of speed. D1 estimated the speed of V2 to be around 50 miles per hour.D2 stated that she was traveling west on 17th Street and was approaching Gate 6. D2 stated that V1 then turned in front of her rapidly and she was not able to avoid a collision with V1. D2 stated V2 then struck V1. D2 stated that she was going "pretty fast" but V1 pulled into her lane of travel.V1 and V2 both had to be towed from the scene by Bland's Towing due to disabling damage. D2 complained of pain to her right wrist and arm but refused medical treatment on scene. The rear right hand passenger of V1 complained of neck pain but refused medical treatment on scene.SUPPLEMENT: 05/09/2019 - D1 HAS A TWIN BROTHER NAMED MICHEAL WITH THE SAME DATE OF BIRTH AND SIMILAR DRIVERS LICENSE NUMBERS. DISPATCH MADE A MISTAKE AND PRINTED OFF MICHEALS INFORMATION AND ADDED IT TO MY CASE FOR THE ORIGINIAL CRASH REPORT. I HAVE EDITED THE CRASH REPORT AND CASE INFORMATION TO SHOW THAT THE DRIVER WAS IN FACT MARK KRIPPINGER (OLN:K615-5476-4047) AND NOT HIS BROTHER MICHEAL FOR THIS ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 (VICTORIA HICKMAN) WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON 3RD ST APPROACHING PATTERSON DR.D1 WAS IN THE MIDDLE LANE, HOWEVER, THOUGHT SHE WAS IN THE TURN LANE TO GO NORTHBOUND.D1 TURNED NORTHBOUND FROM 3RD ST ONTO PATTERSON DRIVE FROM MIDDLE LANE. Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Unit 1 was traveling southbound on ST RD 446. Unit 2 was stopped in the roadway waiting for another vehicle in front of it to turn left on to Rush Ridge Rd. While stopped in the roadway, Unit 2 was traveling south on ST RD 446 and impacted Unit 2 in the rear end. Unit 2 was pushed off the side of the road into a small ditch, while Unit 1 pulled off the road on to Rush Ridge Rd.

V1 was traveling south on Jordan Avenue, just south of Lingelbach Lane, and was stopped or slowed in traffic. V2 was traveling north on Jordan towards Lingelbach. V1 then attempted to make a U turn on Jordan. V1 did not notice V2 approaching around the line of traffic and crossed the center line to turn north on Jordan. V2 did not have enough time to stop for V1. V2 then struck V1. There was moderate damage to the front bumper and front passenger side of V1. There was moderate damage to the front passenger side bumper and front passenger side fender of V2. D1 stated that he was facing south on Jordan stuck in a line of traffic and wanted to turn around to avoid congestion. D1 stated that he could not see any vehicles approaching and attempted to make a U turn. D1 stated that V2 then struck V1. D2 stated that she was traveling north on Jordan. D2 stated that V1 then crossed the center line into her lane of traffic. D2 stated that she did not have enough time to stop and struck V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE, NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF WEST 14TH STREET, WHEN V1 MERGED INTO THE LEFT LANE, NOT SEEING V2 WAS ALREADY THERE, AND SIDE SWIPED V2.D1 STATED SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO MERGE INTO THE LEFT LANE TO MAKE A TURN AND WHEN SHE DID SO SHE DID NOT SEE V2 WAS ALREADY IN THE LEFT LANE. D1 STATED HER VEHICLE THEN STRUCK V2.D2 STATED HE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE WHEN V1 BEGAN TO MERGE INTO HIS LANE, THEN STRIKING HIS VEHICLE.

On 5/5/2019, I met with Miguel Palacios at the Indiana University Police Station. Palacios escorted me to his 2016 Kia Sorento bearing IN plate K366444 that was parked in the IUPD parking lot. I noticed damage to the rear driver side bumper and tail light of the vehicle.Palacios parked his vehicle at the Memorial Stadium Orange Athletic Lot on 5/4/2019 for the 2019 Indiana University Commencement Ceremony at approximately 10:30 hours. After the ceremony at approximately 1300 hours, Palacios was pumping gas at a nearby gas station and noticed the damage to his vehicle. I asked if he noticed the vehicle parked on the driver side of the vehicle and was told that a family member parked on that side of him but did not know anything about the damage.Palacios stated that the vehicle was parked somewhere near the middle of the of the Orange Lot between Memorial Stadium and Assembly Hall, but was uncertain as to exactly which parking stall.There are no witnesses or leads as to the offending vehicle.

BOTH D1 AND D2 WERE EAST BOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 NEAR THE NORTH SMITH PIKE INTERSECTION. D1 TOOK HIS EYES OF THE ROAD TO LOOK AT SOMETHING OFF THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND REAR ENDED D2. NO DAMAGE TO D2 ONLY MINOR DAMAGE TO D1. VEHICLES WERE MOVED BEFORE MY ARRIVAL.

***SUPPLEMENT*** 05/13/2019CRASH DID NOT HAPPEN IN OUR JURISDICTION. CHARGES ARE BEING FILED AGAINST PARTY IN THIS CRASH REPORT. MARCY BENNETT WAS SHOPPING AT THE IGA GROCERY STORE. SHE ARRIVED AT APPROXIMATELY 3:00PM AND RETURNED TO HER VEHICLE THAT WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT AROUND 4:00PM. WHEN SHE RETURNED THERE WAS HEAVY LEFT SIDE DAMAGE TO HER VEHICLE. THERE ARE NO SUSPECTS AT THIS TIME. WILL FOLLOW UP WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was stopped at a stop sign facing west on 14th St., attempting to cross Indiana Avenue. D1 pulled into the roadway and did not see V2 approaching from the south coming north. V1 struck V2 on the front driver side bumper of V1 causing damage to the front bumper of V1. V1 struck V2 on the rear passenger side quarter panel of V2. There was no complaint of pain from either driver. D1 admitted responsibility for the crash. V2 had the right of way on Indiana Ave.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 was traveling north on South Leonard Springs Road approaching the intersection with Tapp Road. D1 was facing west, stopped and awaiting to turn north onto Leonard Springs Road. V1 failed to yield the right of way and pulled into the lane of travel of D2, consequently colliding. D2 could not recall how the event occurred. Another Deputy arrived on scene shortly to make sure the vehicle were moved out of the roadway safely. While doing so he was flagged down by an unknown witness that stated that D2 pulled out in front of D1 and due to the wet pavement slid when D1 applied his brakes but was unable to avoid collision because of on coming traffic in the south bound lanes.Both vehicle had began moving out of the roadway prior to my arrival.

BOTH DRIVERS STATED THAT UNIT 2 APPLIED THE BRAKES DUE TO ANOTHER MOTOR VEHICLE TURNING ONTO A TURN AROUND ON I69. UNIT 1 DID APPLY BRAKES, BUT STRUCK UNIT 2 ON THE REAR BUMPER. UNIT 1 WAS TOWED DUE TO THE DAMAGE SUSTAINED TO THE FRONT END.

I was on patrol when I observed V1 sitting half in a parallel parking space and half in the lane of travel, with no lights on. There were two people standing in front of the vehicle (D1 & D2) looking at it. I pulled up behind them, activated my emergency lights, and exited my vehicle to check on their welfare.The two individuals stated they had just been involved in a traffic collision but were both not hurt. D2 stated he was in the midst of actively backing his vehicle into a parallel parking space on the east edge of the roadway just south of 4th Street when he was suddenly struck from behind by V1. He was not sure where she came from. D1 told me she was eastbound on 4th and turned right (south) onto Dunn when she collided with V2. She gave several different accounts of which lane she turned into, but the only one that would have made sense is if she had turned into the far lane (unless she turned into the close lane and then immediately made an unsafe lane change into the left lane). D1 did not want any police assistance with the crash and told me she just wanted to go home. D1 showed signs of intoxication and was arrested for Operating While Intoxicated. Her vehicle was impounded.
Unit 1 was parked in the parking lot at 5230 S OLD ST RD 37. Unit 2 was backing from a parking space and backed into Unit 1, making impact on the rear passenger side quarter panel.

V1 was traveling north on South Old State Road 37. V1 went west off the roadway striking an embankment and rolled over resting on its top.D1 stated that a deer ran out in the roadway causing her to run off the roadway.D1 was given field sobriety testing resulting in an arrest

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D1 STATED HE WAS TURNING LEFT OUT OF ARBY'S INTO THE 3RD STREET LEFT HAND TURN LANE (FOR SOUTH GATES DRIVE) WHEN HE STRUCK V2. DEPUTY WALLS WAS ASSISTING A FEMALE ON A CALL AND WAS BACKING HIS CAR UP WHILE IN THE PARKING LOT OF TEXAS ROADHOUSE. DEPUTY WALLS WAS GOING TO PROVIDE A RIDE FOR THE FEMALE AND WAS ABOUT TO LEAVE THE PARKING LOT. DEPUTY WALLS HIT A CURB AND DID NOT REALIZE THERE WAS A LARGE ROCK NEAR THE CURB AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE ROCK CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE UNDERSIDE AND REAR BUMPER OF THE CAR. THE FEMALE HAD NO INJURIES AND DECIDED TO WALK TO HER DESITNATION RATHER THAN WAIT ON A RIDE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was attempting to merge onto I-69 Southbound off the Sample Rd exit. V2 merged into the middle lane with out yielding to V1. V1 was traveling at highway speed and had to swerve to the left to avoid V2 causing V1 to loose control striking V2. V1 spun to the left coming to rest against the guard rail. Deputy Hutchens submitted dash cam footage and pictures into evidence.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON BREEDEN RD, APPROACHING FREELAND LN, WHEN A DEER RAN IN FRONT OF HER. D1 STATED THAT SHE SWERVED TO MISS THE DEER. D1 STATED THAT ONCE SHE SWERVED HER TIRES GOT INTO THE GRASS AND PULLED HER INTO THE DITCH. D1 STATED THAT SHE THEN HIT THE UTILITY POLE NUMBER UDWI 143371. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D1 stated they were driving eastbound on W Country Club Dr, towards the intersection with S Walnut St, and stated traffic was backed up on W Country Club Dr. D1 stated that he was going approximately 10-15 miles per hour and looked down for a moment, and looked back up, and was not able to stop his vehicle in time from hitting the rear of V2. D1 stated he was at the light behind V2 when he thought V2 was starting to pull forward so he pulled forward and rear-ended V2.

D1/V1 left the scene prior to my arrival. V2 was parked in the parking lot of 500 S Liberty Dr at the time of the accident. The owner of V2 returned from shopping to find the rear passenger side of her vehicle damaged with fresh scrapes. Allen stated that D1 then left the scene after going into the store for less than 2 minutes. The investigation into the crime of leaving the scene of an accident is ongoing.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON N ADAMS STREET BEHIND V2. AS V2 STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT W 11TH STREET AND N ADAMS STREET, V1 WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME CAUSING THE FRONT OF V1 TO COLLIDE WITH THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THAT ALL OF HER PASSENGERS WERE WEARING SAFETY BELTS.

Driver 2 stated he was west on SR 46 in the left straight lane. Driver 2 stated he stopped for the traffic light at Kinser Pk after it turned red. Driver 2 stated shortly after stopping he was hit from behind by vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated she was behind vehicle 2 and thought the light was green and when she realized vehicle 2 had stopped for the red light she was not able to stop in time and collided with the rear of vehicle 2.

D1 stated that they parked their vehicle in the parking lot of Bloomington High School South at approximately 0645 hours. D1 stated the next time they saw their vehicle, which stayed parked and did not move, was approximately 1527 hours, at which point D1 noticed white scraping and denting to their driver's side rear end of the vehicle that was not there previously. D1 was not able to provide additional information on the offending vehicle; I am waiting to follow up with camera footage provided by the school in attempt to identify the offending vehicle, presumably a white vehicle.Supplement update: Updated state report with offender vehicle information and offending driver information. D2 admitted to running in to V1 without leaving necessary paperwork. D2 also admitted to driving a vehicle without ever have received a valid driver's license. Diagram also updated to reflect offending vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver attempted to pass a vehicle waiting in line and ran up on to the curb hitting a fire hydrant.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Union Valley Road is a two lane county road that runs in a north / south direction. The area of the collision occurred just to the north of a hillcrest. V2, silver Toyota Sienna, was traveling north on Union Valley Road south of McNeely Street. V1, tan Chevrolet Tahoe, was traveling north on Union Valley Road behind V2. V2 stopped in the roadway. V1 was unable to stop behind V2 and truck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D1, Fultz, stated she was traveling north on Union Valley Road behind V2. D1 stated D2 stopped suddenly due to a squirrel that was in the roadway. D1 stated she was unable to stop in time to avoid impact with V2. D1 stated she struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D2, Polley, stated he was traveling north on Union Valley Road. D2 stated he stopped in the roadway to avoid a squirrel. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2.Evidence shows minimal visible damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows minimal damage to the rear bumper cover of V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 stated they were traveling westbound on West Third Street when V1 tried to enter the lane of traffic making a left hand turn and in doing so V1 collided with V2.D1 stated that he was trying to enter the traffic lane and one lane of traffic stopped to let him enter the traffic lane but as he entered into the traffic lane, V1 collided with V2.Photos were taken and logged into evidence.Both passengers in V2 were transported to the hospital by ambulance and treated for injuries. No injury to D1.V1 suffered minor front end damage and V2 suffered disabling damage to the front passenger side.

D2 was driving north on Dunn St at the intersection with SR 45/46. D2 performed a legal U turn to avoid heavy traffic at the intersection. As D2 was driving south on Dunn a white pickup truck also attempted to perform a U turn and the pickup truck's front passenger side collided with the rear driver's side of V2, causing minor damage to V2 and unknown damage to V1. D2 then slowed to the shoulder of the road and V1 drove past and continued without attempting to exchange driver information. D2 then attempted to follow V1 south on Dunn St but was unable to maintain sight of V1. D2 then called 911 to report the incident.
V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 46 JUST EAST OF FRIENDSHIP ROAD WHEN D1 STATED HIS RIGHT TIRE LEFT THE ROADWAY.V1 WENT INTO A DITCH ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD WHERE IT COLLIDED WITH A TREE.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE, AT THE INTERSECTION WITH ROGERS ST.D1 SAID HE WAS DISTRACTED BY HIS PET CAT, ALSO IN THE CAR WITH HIM, LOOKED DOWN, THEN ROLLED FORWARD INTO V2, CAUSING DAMAGE.D2 SAID SHE WAS STOPPED AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT, AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

D1 stated that he was exiting the terminal of the Bloomington Transit Center and pulled on to S Walnut St and entered into the left turn lane near the intersection with W 3rd St. D1 stated that he moved forward in order to give room to other vehicles behind him, at which point V1 struck the rear of V2. D2 stated they were stopped at the stoplight at S Walnut St and W 3rd St in the left turn lane, behind a line of cars, when she felt her vehicle get struck from behind.Supplement: opened to find different accident. On 5/7/2019 at 1334hrs, I investigated a crash involving a delivery box truck that struck a railroad overpass structure at 13th Street and N Indiana Ave. The box truck was too tall to clear the overpass safely.D1, Ricky G Trueblood, stated he was southbound on Indiana Ave approaching the intersection of 13th Street when he noticed the railroad overpass. D1 stated he normally would not have taken that route, however there was road construction that forced him to make a detour. D1 stated he drove slowly and believed V1 would clear the overpass. D1 stated as he was slowly moving southbound, the top of V1's cargo box collided with the railroad overpass structure. There was no obvious damage to the railroad overpass, however Indiana Railroad was contacted and informed of the collision.A sign displaying the bridge height is displayed at the overpass.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was driving southbound from N Dunn St and entered into the intersection with E State Rd 45/46. D1 stated she believed she had the green light. D1 stated that as she entered into the intersection, she looked up through her moonroof for a moment in order to check her canoe that was fastened to her roof. D1 stated she was almost completely through the intersection when she was struck on the passengers side by D2. D2 stated he was traveling eastbound on E State Rd 45/46 and was approaching the intersection with N Dunn St in the southmost lane. D2 stated he had a green light when he entered into the intersection. D2 stated that V1 pulled out in front of him in the intersection, at which point V2 struck V1. D3 stated he was traveling northbound on N Dunn St and was approaching the intersection with E State Rd 45/46. D3 stated the light was green as he entered into the right turn lane on N Dunn St, south of the intersection. D3 stated he yielded for a moment to check for traffic coming from the west, at which point he observed V2 run in to V1. D3 stated V2 then struck V3 as V2 slid across the road. W1 stated he was south of the intersection at the time of this accident, on the sidewalk on the east side of N Dunn St. W1 stated that he saw D1 enter into the intersection when D1 had a red light. W1 stated that D2 approached the intersection of E State Rd 45/46 and N Dunn St with a red light, but changed to a green light before D2 entered into the intersection, at which point W1 observed V2 strike V1, and then observed V1 and V2 run in to V3.5/8/19 2115 hours: Supplement Update of D1 statement: D1 called in after reading the initial state report narrative. D1 wanted to make it clear that she believed she had a green light when she entered into the intersection; D1 stated she was stopped at a red light on N Dunn St, north of the intersection, when she looked up for a moment to check her canoe on top of her vehicle. D1 stated that an unknown vehicle behind her honked their horn, at which point D1 entered into the intersection.5/11/19 2104 hours: Supplement Update of accident: After further review of body camera footage, I have now come to the conclusion that D2 should be listed as the at-fault driver, not D1. W1 stated that he observed the stoplight which D1 was traveling through turning from green to red as D1 drove through the intersection. This also correlates with D3's statements. It is my belief that D1 entered into the intersection when the stoplight was green, and was dominating the intersection as the stoplight turned red, meaning D1 had the right of way, and D2 failed to yield the right of way to D1.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 45 46 BYPASS AND THAT SHE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE, DUE TO SIGNS STATING THAT THE LEFT LAND WOULD BE CLOSED SOON.D2 STATED THAT TRAFFIC WAS CONGESTED AND THE VEHICLES IN FRONTOF HER DID COME TO AN ABRUPT STOP.D2 STATED THAT V2 DID COME TO A COMPLETE STOP IN TRAFFIC.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON THE STATE ROAD 45 46 BYPASS, IN THE RIGHT LANE.D1 STATED THAT THE VEHICLES IN FRONT OF HER DID COME TO AN ABRUPT STOP DUE TO TRAFFIC CONGESTION.D1 STATED THAT V1 DID COME TO A STOP, BUT THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING INI DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.V1 WAS TOWD BY STRYKER TOWING DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.NO ONE WAS INJURED.

V1 was parked facing west in the parking lot of 2721 E. 3rd St; Best Buy. V1's owner stated that she and her husband went inside Best Buy for about 20 minutes. When they came back out they noticed their car had been hit. V1 had damage to the front passenger side quarter panel.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON N MORTON ST N OF 6TH ST. V2 WAS STOPPED AFTER BACKING FACING WB JUST EAST OF MORTON ST. V1 TRAVELED NB AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT FORKLIFT OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS NB ON MORTON N OF 6TH ST. D1 STATED THAT THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT FORKS OF V2.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN A PARKING GARAGE ENTRANCE E OF MORTON FACING WB. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS PARTIALLY IN THE ROADWAY AND SAW V1 APPROACHING NB. D2 STATED THAT HE WAVED D1 TO PROCEED NB BECAUSE HE BELIEVED THAT HE HAD ENOUGH ROOM. AS V1 PROCEEDED NB, THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT FORKS OF V2.THE FORKS OF THE FORKLIFT WERE A FEW FEET OFF OF THE GROUND AND V1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE STRUCTURAL PILLARS AND WINDOWS OF THE VEHICLE.

Both vehicles were in the drive through line at Kroger Pharmacy on the south side of building. V1 began backing up while in line for an unknown reason and ran into the front of V2. V2 was still stopped in the drive thru line behind V1.

V1 AND V2 WERE BOTH TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON W STATE ROAD 45/46 BYPASS AND WERE AT THE INTERSECTION WITH N KINSER PIKE. V2 WAS TRAVELING IN THE LEFT HAND WHEN V1 ATTEMPTED TO ENTER HER LANE OF TRAVEL FROM THE LEFT HAND TURN LANE IN AN ATTEMPT TO MERGE AND STRUCK BOTH THE DRIVERS SIDE REAR PASSENGER AND DRIVERS SIDE DOOR OF V2 BEFORE IT CONTINUED TO TRAVEL WESTBOUND ON THE BYPASS WITHOUT STOPPING TO PROVIDE DRIVER INFORMATION NOR VEHICLE INSURANCE INFORMATION. IT SHOULD BE NOTED D2 STATED SHE WAS ONLY 85% ON THE ACCURACY OF THE PLATE INFORMATION SHE PROVIDED TO BOTH OFFICER AND DISPATCH WHICH DID RETURN TO THE VEHICLE DESCRIBED AS THE SUSPECT VEHICLE. D2 STATED AS SHE WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND IN THE LEFT LANE AND AS SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK BY V1 AS IT ATTEMPTED TO ENTER HER LANE OF TRAVEL FROM THE LEFT HAND TURN LANE. V1 DAMAGE IS UNKNOWNV2 SUSTAINED MINORE DAMAGE TO BOTH THE DRIVERS SIDE REAR PASSENGER DOOR AND DRIVERS SIDE DOOR.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.V1 was stopped in the straight/right turn lane on Fee Lane at the 17th Street intersection and was in front of V2.V2 was stopped behind V1.D1 stated that he was unfamiliar with the area as he is not from Bloomington. At the stoplight, D1 stated that he was in the wrong lane and actually wanted to be in the 'left only' turn lane that was to his left. He then put his vehicle in reverse and struck V2 which was directly behind him.D2 stated he was stopped behind V1 and saw V1 activate its reverse lights and proceed backwards. D2 stated he honked his horn to prevent V1 from backing into him but by then it was too late. V2 WAS PARKED AT THE IGA PARKING LOT (4600 W RICHLAND PLAZA DRIVE). THE VEHICLE THAT WAS PARKED NEXT TO V2 ATTEMPTED TO BACK OUT OF IT'S PARKING SPACE AND IN DOING SO TURNED TO SHARP AND HIT V2. V1 was traveling west on E 3rd Street towards the intersection with S Dunn Street. V2 then entered the intersection and the front driver side collided with the front passenger side of V1 causing both vehicles to be inoperable.D1 stated that as she was driving into the intersection she was not paying attention and did not remember what color the light was as she entered the intersection. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED, FACING WEST, ATTEMPTING TO TURN SOUTH TO EXIT THE KROGER PARKING LOT.D2 STATED THAT V1, WHICH SHE DESCRIBED AS A NEWER MODEL DODGE RAM PICKUP, DID BEGIN TO BACK UP OUT OF ITS PARKING SPOT, WHICH WAS JUST SOUTH OF WHERE V2 WAS STOPPED.D2 STATED THAT THE REAR DRIVER'S CORNER OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE DOOR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE DOOR OF V2.D1 STATED THAT THE DRIVER OF V1 DID GET OUT OF V1, LOOKED AT THE CARS AND SAID THERE WAS NO DAMAGE.D2 STATED THAT SHE DID TELL D1 THAT SHE WAS GOING TO CALL POLICE TO REPORT THE ACCIDETN.D2 STATED THAT D1 DID THEN RETURN TO HER VEHICLE AND DID LEAVE THE AREA.D2 DESCRIBED D1 AS BEING AN OLDER WHITE FEMALE.V1 WAS NOT LOCATED. THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT HE HAD PARKED V2 IN THE TARGET PARKING LOT AT APPROXIMATELY 9:00 AM.THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT HE RETURNED TO V2 AT 1945 HOURS AND FOUND V2 HAD BEEN STRUCK ON THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER.THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT A NOTE WAS LEFT ON THE FRONT OF V2 WHICH STATED THAT THE LICENSE PLATE NUMBER OF THE VEHICLE THAT BACKED INTO HIS VEHICLE IS 511WE.THE OWNER OF V2 IS THE MANAGER OF TARGET AND HE MENTIONED THAT HE WOULD ATTEMPT TO GET VIDEO FOOTAGE OF THE INCIDENT FROM LOSS PREVENTION.ON MAY 16, 2019 I DID VIEW FOOTAGE OF THE INCIDENT AND I DID MAKE CONTACT WITH D1.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN, SOUTH EAST, INTO A PARKING SPOT IN THE TARGET PARKING LOT.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TURNING LEFT AND THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER CORN OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR DRIVER'S CORNER OF V2.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT REALIZE THAT THERE WAS DAMAGE TO V2.D1 STATED THAT THERE IS NO DAMAGE TO V1.D1 DID PROVIDE THE NECESSARY INFORMATION FOR THE STATE REPORT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT, NORTHEAST, OUT OF THE PARKING LOT OF 822 SOUTH AUTO MALL ROAD.D1 STATED THAT THERE ARE BUSHES ALONG THE ENTRANCE TO THE PARKING LOT WHICH MAKE IT DIFFICULT TO SEE CARS DRIVING NORTH AND SOUTH ON AUTO MALL ROAD.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID ATTEMPT TO TURN LEFT AND THE FRONT LEFT CORNER OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON AUTO MALL ROAD.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS PASSING THE ENTRANCE TO 822 SOUTH AUTO MALL ROAD.D2 STATED THAT SHE COULD NOT SEE V1 AS SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH.D2 THEN STATED THAT V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN LEFT, NORTHEAST, AND THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND NO ONE WAS INJURED.

On 05/09/2019 I was dispatched to a two-vehicle collision on 17th Street just west of St. Paul's Catholic Church. V1 and V2 were driving east on 17th Street just prior to the collision. V2 was in front of V1 just prior to the collision.I spoke with D1, who advised me that he was headed eastbound on 17th Street just west of St. Paul's Catholic Church. He stated that V2 was directly in front of him. He stated that V2 slowed down and he could not slow down enough in time to avoid a collision. He stated that the front of his vehicle struck the rear of V2. He stated that he did not see brake lights from V2.I spoke with D2, who advised me that he noticed a pick up truck attempting to back up on to 17th Street. He stated that he slowed down because he noticed this. He stated that as V1 and V2 were heading eastbound, the front of V1 struck the rear of his vehicle.All parties stated that they were not injured due to the collision.I checked and noticed that V2 had one functioning brake light and it was on the rear driver's side of the bumper.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was drive west on E 2nd Street when she stopped at the stop sign at S Jordan Ave. Driver 1 stated she began to proceed through the intersection when vehicle 2 came out of no where and she hit vehicle 2 in the front passenger corner. Driver 2 stated he proceed to drive through the intersection when vehicle 1 ran the stop sign and hit his vehicle in the front passenger corner with the front passenger corner of her vehicle.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUN ON WEST 3RD ST WHEN DO TO THE RAIN AND FAILURE TO MAINTAIN STOPPING DISTANCE REARENDED V2 WHICH CAUSED V2 TO REARENDED V1. V2 was Easttbound on S.R. 46 going through the intersection of Hartstraight Road. V2 was in left hand eastbound lane with right of way. V1 turned off of Hartstraight Road and sideswiped V2.
