Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST, APPROACHING RHORER ROAD.V1 WAS TRYING TO TURN LEFT (NORTH) FROM A SIDE LOT, ONTO WALNUT ST. D1 SAID THAT ANOTHER DRIVER, STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, WAVED HIM OUT. HE STARTED TO MAKE THE LEFT TURN, AND DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE STRAIGHT LANE.D2 SAID THAT V1 TURNED LEFT INTO HIM, STRIKING V2, CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE NORTH BOUND ON ROGERS ST, AT HILLSIDE DRIVE.D1 SAID SHE SAW V2 STOPPING IN TRAFFIC, TRIED TO BRAKE, AND SLID FORWARD, REAR ENDING V2.D2 SAID THAT HE WAS STOPPED, AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HIS BACK AND NECK, AND WAS TAKEN TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 AND V2 WERE AT THE INTERECTION OF S WALNUT ST AND E KIRKWOOD AVE WHEN V1 STRUCK V2, CAUSING IT TO THEN STRIKE A FIRE HYDRANT ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION. V1/D1 STATED HE WAS NORTHBOUND ON S WALNUT ST WHEN ATTEMPTED TO STOP DUE TO THE RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION, HOWEVER, DUE TO THE SPEED OF HIS VEHICLE AND THE ROADWAY SURFACE CONDITION BEING WET, IT CAUSED HIM TO SLIDE INTO THE INTERSECTION WHERE HIS VEHICLE THEN STRUCK V2 AS IT WAS PROCEEDING EASTBOUND THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. V2/D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E KIRKWOOD AVE AND HAD ENTERED THE INTERSECTION WITH S WALNUT ST. UPON DOING SO, D2 STATED HER VEHICLE WAS THEN STRUCK ON THE REAR RIGHT PASSENGER SIDE BY V1 WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO STRIKE THE FIRE HYDRANT ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION. V1 SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER PORTION OF THE VEHICLE. V2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE REAR RIGHT PASSENGER SIDE 1/4 PANEL AS WELL AS FRONT BUMPER DAMAGE TO THE COLLISION WITH THE FIRE HYDRANT. IT SHOULD BE NOTED, UPON PHYSICAL INSPECTION OF THE FIRE HYDRANT THERE APPEARED TO BE NO VISIBLE DAMAGE CAUSED BY V2. BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED ON PINEHURST ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE STREET FACING EAST. VEHICLE 1 WAS WEST BOUND ON PINEHURST. V1 DRIFTED TO THE RIGHT AND STRUCK V2 HEAD ON. V1 THEN FLED THE SCENE.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING NORTH ON THE B-LINE TRAIL ON A LIME SCOOTER. D1 STATED AS HE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF W 1ST ST. HE INCREASED HIS SPEED. D1 STATED HE DID NOT STOP AT THE STOP SIGN. D1 STATED WHEN HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION HE WAS STRUCK BY V2. D1 STATED HE HAD SCRAPES AND ABRASIONS TO HIS KNEES AND ELBOWS, BUT NO OTHER INJURIES.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W. 1ST ST. D2 STATED SHE NEVER SAW D1 UNTIL D1 DROVE IN FRONT OF HER VEHCILE. D2 STATED V2 MADE CONTACT WITH D1 AND HE FELL FROM THE SCOOTER.W1 STATED D2 WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W 1ST ST. W1 STATED D1 WAS TRAVELLING NORTH ON THE B-LINE TRAIL. W1 STATED D1 DID NOT STOP AT THE STOP SIGN AND ENTERED INTO THE INTERSECTION WHERE D1 WAS STRUCK BY D2.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE SOUTH BOUND ON COLLEGE AVE, JUST NORTH OF 1ST ST., IN THE LEFT LANE.D2 SAID SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D1 SAID HE SAW V2 STOPPING, TRIED TO BRAKE, SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT INTO V2.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

V1 was traveling north through the parking lot of 1531 S. Curry Pike and made a left turn into a parking space, when D1 improperly turned colliding with the front right of V2. V2 was parked facing east in a proper parking space, when it was struck by V1. D1 left a note on the windshield of V2 indicating that he struck the vehicle.

V1 was attempting to back up eastbound in the road approaching Woodburn Ave. While backing the rear driver side of V1 hit the back driver side door of V2. D1 left the scene prior to my arrival. V2 was parked and unoccupied. D2 stated that he did not witness the event. D2 did have a home security system that had a camera facing his vehicle. I could witness the accident on D2's phone but I was unable to read a plate number or determine the make of the vehicle. It did look like a small, dark colored SUV. Through my investigation I have determined that V1 used improper backing which caused the rear driver side of V1 to hit the rear driver side door of V2.

Brandy Hulett, the lsat person to drive V2, stated V2 was parked in the parking lot outside of Dollar Tree at 200 N Gates Dr from 0800-2000 hours. A witness, who did not leave their information, left a note on V2 that they observed a teal van with Indiana plate WIL901 hit V2's rear passenger's side bumper while it was parked in the lot at 1850 hours and left the scene without leaving any information.The following diagram is an approximation of the event that took place, since there were no cameras in the area to follow up on.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS TRAVELING NB ON I 69 JUST NORTH OF THE OVERPASS FOR E SAMPLE RD. DRIVER 1 STATED SHE THOUGHT SHE SAW SOMETHING FLY INTO THE ROAD BUT WAS UNSURE WHAT IT WAS AND THAT IT STRUCK THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. UPON INSPECTING THE AREA WHERE SHE STATED THE OBJECT HIT I OBSERVED WHAT APPEARED TO BE A LARGE AMOUNT OF DEER HAIR, BLOOD, AND PARTIALLY CHEWED VEGETATIVE MATTER THAT BASED UPON MY EXPERIENCE IS CONSISTENT WITH STRIKING A DEER. I WAS UNABLE TO LOCATE THE DEER IN THE AREA. THE VEHICLE HAD MOVED OFF THE ROAD TO THE SHOULDER PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

D1 stated he was stopped at a red light facing northbound on N Kinser Pike. D1 stated he thought traffic was moving forward and began to accelerate. D1 advised he rear ended V2. D2 stated he was stopped at a red light facing northbound on N Kinser Pike. D2 stated V1 rear ended his vehicle. A passenger in V2 was injured during this accident complaining of pain in her back. She did not get transported by EMS.

9305/10/2019 V1 is an Indiana University owned garbage truck. V1 had turned west off of Fee Lane onto unnamed private drive #1 at the Andy Mohr baseball field to empty a dumpster near the field. V1 traveled onto private drive #1 and drove the vehicle in the northwest direction in order to back the vehicle onto private drive #2 in order to reach a dumpster located near the baseball field. Due to the height of where D1 was sitting in the vehicle, D1 did not see a red pole that was just to the left of private drive #1. As V1 was traveling in the northwest direction on private drive #1, the left front portion of the vehicle struck the pole causing damage to the pole and V1. D1 is an IU worker and drives a garbage truck. He stated that he frequents the Andy Mohr field location for a dumpster that is near the baseball field off of private drive #2. He normally reaches the dumpster by turning west onto private drive #1 off of Fee Lane and then makes a left hand turn onto private drive #2 and travels southbound on that drive to reach the dumpster. D1 stated that today when he went to empty the dumpster, a vehicle was sitting next to the dumpster making his usual route of reaching the dumpster difficult. Due to the vehicle being next to the dumpster, D1 stated he would instead travel just past private drive #2 and then back V1 south onto private drive #2 to reach the dumpster. While adjusting the vehicle in order to back onto private drive #2, V1 struck the pole that was sitting just to the left of private drive #1. He stated that he could not see the pole and thought he was clear of the pole while positioning his vehicle to back onto private drive #2 where the dumpster was located.Pictures were taken of the garbage truck (V1) along with photos of the pole that was damaged.

Driver 1 was traveling southbound in the 6600 block of North Shuffle Creek Road. Driver 1 stated he began attempting to reach for his glasses and while doing so he crossed the center line and into the ditch which had several feet of standing water. Driver 1 was able to exit the vehicle and was out upon my arrival. Vehicle 1 was in standing water upon arrival and was towed by Pritchards. Driver 1 declined medical personnel.

V1 was backing down W Ocean Dr after just retrieving mail at his mailbox. V2 was backing out of his driveway at 5415 W Ocean Dr to check his mail at his mailbox. Neither D1 nor D2 saw one another backing and rear ended each other. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

V1 was in parking lot behind 730 E Atwater street and was preparing to park. V2 was parked in the same lot and was facing NB. V1 struck V2 in the passenger side rear quarter panel with the front driver side bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was going to park and had to maneuver around another parked car. She stated she thought she had room to still get parked. She said as she was trying to turn into the parking space, she hit V2 with the front bumper of her vehicle.

D1 WAS DRIVING EAST ON E ATWATER AVENUE APPROACHING S SWAIN AVENUE. D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING ABOUT 20 MPH AND IT WAS WET OUT. D1 STATED HE TRIED TO TURN OFF ATWATER ONTO SWAIN AND HIT A WET SPOT AND SLID AND ENDED UP IN CULVERT ON EAST SIDE OF ROAD.D1'S INSURANCE INFORMATION WAS IN THE CAR WHICH WAS ON ITS SIDE AND UNSAFE TO OBTAIN. D1 COULD NOT ACCESS IT VIA A PHONE APPLICATION EITHER. NO DAMAGE TO PUBLIC PROPERTY.NO INJURIES NO PICTURES. END.

V1 was NB on Park avenue and was preparing to back into his driveway with his moving truck. V2 was parked on the east side of the street facing NB just south of the driveway V1 was going to back into. V1 got too close to V2 and hit V2 in the driver side front quarter panel with the passenger side front tire of his vehicle causing damage to V2. V1 didn't appear to have any damage.D1 stated that he got close to V2 so he could then pull across the roadway so he could back into his driveway. He stated he just got too close and hit V2.

I was dispatched to the area of 7281 Holland Hill Ln in reference to a vehicle that ran off the roadway. I responded to the area and V1 was located at a dead end to Holland Hill Ln in a wooded area. D1 stated he was driving the vehicle when it left the roadway and struck a group of trees at the end of the dead end roadway. D1 also stated he had been drinking. I could detect the odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from D1's exhaled breath. I did observe V1 wedged between trees in a wooded area with front end damage and damage to both side. Deputy Moxley also responded and conducted an OWI investigation and obtained a PBT result of .15. D1 was not injured in the crash and V1 was towed due to disabling damage.Gave D1 a copy of my contact information to contact me with insurance information. I gave D1 till 2:30 am on 5/12/19 and he did not contact me with insurance information.

ON 05/11/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON HINKLE ROAD. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 IDENTIFIED AS ROBERT BOOZE RAN OFF THE ROADWAY STRICKING A TREE. UPON STRICKING THE TREE UNIT 1 ROLLED UPSIDE DOWN COMING TO A REST ON HINKLE ROAD FACING WEST.

Vehicle 1 was westbound on West Sample Road from Interstate 69 when a deer entered the roadway near the ninety degree turn in the 300 Block of West Sample Road. Driver 1 had mistakenly exited onto Sample Road thinking that it was the Liberty Church Road exit in Morgan County and was not familiar with the sharp curve on this road and was also alarmed by the deer entering the roadway. Driver 1 ultimately continued straight through the curve and into a utility pole. The collision caused the utility pole to become dislodged at its base and it also snapped approximately 6 feet above ground level. No injuries were reported and driver 1 was not impaired on drugs/alcohol.

V1 was SB on Walnut street and was behind V2 in the straight lane, stopped at traffic light at Rhorer road. V1 started to move forward and struck V2 in the rear bumper with the front bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was stopped at a red light and she thought the light turned green so she started to move. V2 was still stopped at a red light and she struck V2 in the rear bumper. She stated she later realized the light she saw turn green was the left turn arrow.D2 stated she was stopped at a red light and V1 hit her from behind.

V1, AN AMBULANCE, RESPONDED TO A PERSONAL INJURY ACCIDENT ON N OLD SR 37. AFTER ARRIVING ON SCENE D1 BEGAN TO MOVE V1 OFF OF THE ROADWAY AND INTO A DRIVEWAY AT 4498 N OLD SR 37. WHILE TURNING RIGHT INTO THE DRIVEWAY V1 STRUCK A LOW ROCK/CONCRETE WALL THAT SEPERATED THE DRIVEWAY FROM A DITCH. THERE WERE NO OBVIOUS SIGNS OF DAMAGE TO V1; HOWEVER, THE WALL WAS DAMAGED.I WAS ON SCENE ASSISTING WITH THE PERSONAL INJURY ACCIDENT WHEN I WAS INFORMED ABOUT THIS ACCIDENT; THEREFORE, MY DISPATCH AND ARRIVAL TIME ARE THE SAME.

Upon arriving on scene I observed that Unit 1 had continued traveling straight through a 90 degree turn in the roadway. Unit 1 ran off the roadway, over corrected went back on the roadway, then ran off the other side of the roadway and collided with several trees. Driver 1 showed signs of intoxication and Deputy Dillon conducted an OWI investigation. Driver 1 had multiple injuries to her face and was transported the the hospital by ambulance.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Old State Road 37 is a two lane road that primarily runs north and south. In the area of Bethel Lane Old State Road 37 has one lane northeast and one lane southwest. Bethel lane intersects with Old State Road 37 on the east side of Old SR 37 with a T intersection. There is a stop sign on Bethel Lane and through traffic on Old State Road 37 has the right of way.Vehicle 1 was traveling east on Bethel Ln and came to the intersection at Old State Road 37. Vehicle 1 attempted to make a left turn onto Old State Road 37 to go southwest. Vehcile1 turned into the patch of vehicle 2 that was heading northeast. Vehicle 2 impacted vehicle 1 on the driver's side between the driver's side front and back door. Vehicle 1 was pushed off the west side of the roadway into a ditch where it came to an uncontrolled stop. Vehicle 2 came to a stop in the south bound lanes of Old State Road 37.Driver 1 stated he following his brother who was in front of him. He stated his brother made the left turn onto Old State Road 37. Driver 1 stated he pulled up to the stop sign and came to a stop. He stated he looked both ways and saw that traffic was clear. Driver 1 stated when he started to pull across the northbound lanes of Old State Road 37 he noticed vehicle 2 come over the hill. He stated he attempted to accelerate to get across the road but his tires did not get traction on the wet pavement and just spun. He stated he was then struck by vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated she was traveling northeast on Old SR 37 approaching Bethel Lane. She stated vehicle 2 pulled out in front of her and she was unable to stop before striking vehicle 1. She stated she saw vehicle 1 pull up to the stop sign and it did not appear that he mad a complete stop before pulling out in front of her.Witness 1 stated she was traveling west on Bethel Lane approaching Old State Road 37 behind Vehicle 1. She stated she saw vehicle 1 pull across Old State Road 37 and into the path of vehicle 2. She stated she witnessed the crash but she could not advise if vehicle 1 came to a stop at the stop sign before pulling onto Old State Road 37.Driver 1 was transported to IU Bloomington Hospital with complaint of pain to his neck, chest and abdomen. He was transported via IU Health ambulance 2164.I met with Driver 1 at the hospital. He was alert and talking. He was able to give me a statement of what he thought happened during the crash. Hospital staff stated driver 1's injuries did not seem to be life threatening but still needed to run test to determine the extent of any internal injuries he may have.

Spoke to D1 who stated he was traveling south on S Fairfax Rd. D1 stated he ran off the road in the area of 8235 S Fairfax Rd and ran into a ditch. I observed V1 in a deep ditch with both doors pinned shut by the ditch. D1 climbed out of the drivers window to exit climbed. I also observed tire marks north of the 8235 address and into the grass and across the driveway for 8235 and into the ditch. I could detect the odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating form D1's breath. D1 stated he had been drinking Jim Beam at a friends house just prior to driving. Deputy Moxley then conducted an OWI investigation. D1 was not injured in the crash. V1 was towed due to disabling damage and an OWI investigation. Deputy Moxley obtained a PBT result of .155.

V1 ran off the roadway traveling South on S. Cory Ln. V1 struck and drove up onto guide lines for a utility pole.D1 was arrested for Operating While Intoxicated.There was damage to the front bumper, and undercarriage to V1. There was damage to the guide wires for the utility pole.D1 deny any injuries.

D1 stated she was pulling onto Walnut Street from 19th Street to head North.D1 stated that she pushed the gas to her vehicle and the vehicle would not turn. D1 stated the vehicle went off the road over the curb.D1 stated she tried to stop but the car slid and struck the guard rail that surrounds a retention pond. W1 stated that he was behind V1 and it appeared to him that D1 was passed out or asleep. W1 stated he got out of his vehicle and started walking to V1 to check on D1.W1 stated as he approached the window of V1, D1 pushed the gas and went across Walnut Street, off the road and then hit the guard rail.

V1 was traveling westbound on W. State Road 46 just west of W. Arlington Rd. D1 stated that he had prom the prior night and had a high school football camp the entire day the next day and believes he possibly fell asleep at the wheel. V1 ran off the north side of the road way and into a fence cause disabling damage to V1.

Vehicle 1 was southbound on S. Henderson St approaching Brenda Lane when it went left of center and struck the curbed traffic median. Front end and undercarrriage damage. Subject passed field sobriety tests however blew a .06 on PBT, cited for IC.

The daughter of the owner V2 reported another vehicle hit V2 while she was on vacation. She reported she left May 13, 2019 at 5:00 AM and when she returned to V2 on May 18, 2019 during the afternoon, another vehicle had hit V2.It appears that V1 tried to pull into the parking space next to V2, and when V1 did that, it collided with V2. It appears that V1 is black in color, due to the paint transfer.Photographs were taken of V2 and logged into evidence.

ON 05/13/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 46 BEHIND UNIT 2. UNIT 2 WAS ALSO TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 46. ANOTHER UNKNOWN UNIT IN FRONT OF UNIT 2 QUICKLY CAME TO A STOP TO TURN INTO A LOCAL BUISNESS, CAUSING UNIT 2 TO ABRUPTLY COME TO A STOP. UNIT 1 WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE STRICKING THE REAR OF UNIT 2. UNIT 2 HAS DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER AND UNIT 1 HAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON EAST 3RD ST. D1 STATED HE THOUGHT HE HAD A GREEN LIGHT. D1 STATED D2 PULLED IN FRONT OF HIM. D1 STATED HIS VEHICLE IMPACTED V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING NORTH ON SOUTH LINCOLN ST. D2 STATED SHE HAD A GREEN LIGHT. D2 STATED D1 RAN A RED LIGHT GOING WEST OF EAST 3RD ST. D2 STATED V1 STRUCK HER CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES. W1 STATED HE WAS INSIDE HIS STORE AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH LINCOLN ST. AND EAST 3RD ST. W1 STATED HE HEARD A LOUD CRASH AND WENT OUTSIDE. W1 STATED WHEN HE WENT OUTSIDE THE LIGHT FOR D1 WAS RED. W1 STATED IT WAS 1-2 SECONDS BEFORE HE CAME OUTSIDE AFTER HEARING THE CRASH. W1 STATED D1 WAS STILL INSIDE HIS VEHICLE WHEN HE CAME OUTSIDE.

V1 was traveling northeast bound on East State Road 45. A pedestrian was riding his bicycle on the east side of the roadway, traveling northeast bound. V1 struck the rear of the bicyclist. There was a separation of units and the bicyclist came to rest approximately 25 feet north of the location of the crash. The bicycle was propelled into a ditch on the east side of the roadway and came to rest against a culvert, approximately 50 feet from the location of the cash.V1 then fled the scene of the accident after the crash. The bicyclist had incapacitating injuries as a result of the crash and was transported by ambulance to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for treatment. He succumbed to his injuries shortly after. On May 20th, 2019, V1 and D1 were located. V1 was processed by evidence technicians and D1 was questioned by detectives. D1 stated she thought she hit a deer. D1 was charged with leaving the scene of an accident as a Level 5 Felony.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.Other (environmental - explain in narrative) - A vehicle, only described as a gray Volkswagen, had swerved into the path of V3 which caused V3 to quickly apply their brakes to avoid collision.V3, V2, and V1 were traveling in a line on westbound SR 46 in the southmost lane. An unidentified vehicle was in the adjacent lane to the right of V3. The northmost lane became closed ahead of the vehicles due to mowing and utility work.D3 stated that the unidentified vehicle was approaching a lane closure and needed to get into the same lane as V3. D3 slowed down and made several attempts to let the vehicle over but the vehicle would not merge. V3 then began to accelerate past the vehicle; however, the vehicle then decided to merge. This caused D3 to brake suddenly to almost a stop. D3 noted that the driver of the vehicle was on their cell phone and did not appear to be paying attention.D2 witnessed the unidentified vehicle merge into the lane of V3 and V3 quickly apply their brakes. D2 was able to stop in time, but barely. After braking, V1 struck the back of V2. This propelled V2 into the back of V3.D1 stated that he also observed the unidentified vehicle merge suddenly into the path of V3. He saw both V3 and V2 stop and he also quickly applied his brakes. He stated that he was traveling approximately 45 mph prior to the collision, but continued to slide into the back of V2.There were no injuries and none of the vehicles needed towed.

V1 WAS TRAVEILING NORTH ON SYCAMORE APPROACKING HICKORY WHEN IT WENT LEFT OF CENTER AND STRUCK V2. D2 STATED THAT D1 WENT LEFT OF CENTER, D2 TRIED TO AVOID THE CRASH BUT D1 KEEP GOING LEFT OF CENTER. STUDENT ON BUS THAT WAS NOT INJURED:OLIVER FARRIS - FATHER - TRISTAN FARRIS - PHONE NUMBER FOR FATHER 517-526-3686VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL

D2 advised she was traveling N. On S. Hickory Drive when she saw V1 approaching the intersection and failed to stop. Next thing she knew, V1 had struck her vehicle and spun them around. D1 was in great pain and had complaint of pain to his neck and leg. He began to say that V2 was traveling north and he tried to stop for them, at which point D2 stepped in and stated that D1 did not stop for the stop sign. D1 was traveling East on W. Belle Ave and struck V2 at the intersection of S. Hickory Drive and W. Belle Ave. Two of the three passengers of V2 advised that D1 failed to stop for the stop sign. It should be noted that the other passenger, Luther, advised he didn't see what had happened.

V1 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED ON THE GROUND LEVEL OF THE IU HEALTH PARKING LOT AT 601 W 2ND STREET.V2 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE TO THE SOUTH OF V1.WITNESS #1 SAID HE SAW V2 HIT V1 WHILE BACKING OUT. HE SAID D2 WAS A WHITE FEMALE WITH BROWN HAIR DRIVING A BLUE LATE 90'S DODGE RAM EXT CAB. HE SAID D2 LOOKED AROUND AND THEN DROVE UP TO ANOTHER LEVEL OF THE PARKING GARAGE. WITNESS #1 SAID IT HAPPENED ABOUT 9:30 AM. BPD WAS CONTACTED AT 10:40 AM AND WE DID NOT LOCATE V2 IN THE PARKING GARAGE.SUSPECT VEHICLE NOT LOCATED.

V1 was traveling E/B on 3rd ST. V2 was traveling N/B on Lincoln ST. V1 disregard the traffic control signal and struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles.D1 advised that she was traveling E/B on 3rd ST. D1 advised that she noticed she was going the wrong way 3rd ST. D1 advised that she was not paying attention and disregard the traffic control signal and struck V2. D1 advised that she was not injured.D2 advised that he was traveling N/B on Lincoln ST. D1 advised that his traffic control signal was green and he proceeded through the intersection heading N/B. D2 advised that he then felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that he was not injured.Due to D1 disregard the traffic control signal, V1 collided with V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

Driver one was traveling east on State Road 46. Vehicle two was stopped in the roadway as traffic had stopped in front of Driver Two's vehicle while another vehicle was turning. Driver One's vehicle struck Driver Two's vehicle in the rear. Both vehicles were operational upon my arrival. I asked them to pull into the business parking lot at 5641 W. State Road 46. Driver One's vehicle had damage to the front end while Driver two's vehicle had damage to the rear.

V1 was parked and unoccupied along N Washington St near the intersection with E 20th St when it was struck by an unknown vehicle (V1), which left the scene without providing vehicle ownership nor vehicle insurance information.V1/D1 information is unknown. V2 was parked, facing north when it was struck by V1, causing damage to the front left 1/4 panel area.

D1 STATED THAT A WHITE VAN REAR ENDED V1, WHICH CAUSED HIM TO REAR END V2, AND WHICH CAUSED V2 TO REAR END ANOTHER VEHICLE THAT DID NOT SUFFER ANY DAMAGE.D2 STATED THAT V1 REAR ENDED V2 AND CAUSED HER VEHICLE TO ROLL INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE, WHICH DIDN'T SUFFER ANY DAMAGE.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT V1 HAS NO DAMAGE TO THE REAR.V1 AND V2 SUFFERED VERY MINOR DAMAGE. THE VEHICLE THAT V2 ROLLED INTO DID NOT HAVE ANY DAMAGE, THEREFORE WAS NOT APART OF THIS REPORT.V1 HAD A COMPLAINT OF BACK PAIN AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.

D1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S FAIRFAX ROAD NEAR CHERRY LN. D1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY JUST NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION, HITTING THE ENMANKMENT IN A NEARBY YARD. THE VEHICLE THEN ROLLED MULTIPLE TIMES, COMING TO A STOP ON CHERRY LN.D1 WAS SEEN BY THE COMPLAINANT TRYING TO HIDE BEER CANS BEHIND A NEARBY BUSH. UPON ARRIVAL, DEPUTIES OBSERVED SEVERAL BEER CANS THAT HAD BEEN SPILLED NEAR THE SCENE OF THE CRASH, AS WELL AS THE BEER CANS HE ATTEMPTED TO HIDE.D1 SHOWED NUMEROUS SIGNS OF BEING INTOXICATED; SLURRED SPEECH, ABUSIVE ATTITUDE TOWARD LAW ENFORCEMENT, SMELL OF AN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE EMINATING FROM HIS EXHALED BREATH, RED, GLASSY EYES, AND FAILURE/ REFUSAL OF STANDARDIZED FIELD SOBRIETY TESTS. D1 WAS DETAINED FOR FURTHER OWI INVESTIGATION. D1 REFUSED TESTING. D1 WAS TAKEN FOR A BLOOD DRAW AT BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL, AND WAS LATER ARRESTED FOR OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED- ENDANGERMENT.D1 REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT.THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO HEAVY, DISABLING DAMAGE TO ALL AREAS OF THE VEHICLE.A STREET SIGN/ STOP SIGN WAS DAMAGED IN THE CRASH, AS WELL AS A FIRE HYDRANT. I WAS NOTIFIED VIA VOICEMAIL ON MY 15TH BY DELMAR FROM SMITHVILLE COMMUNICATIONS THAT A SMITHVILLE FIBER HANDHOLE WAS DAMAGED IN THE ACCIDENT AS WELL.

Vehicle 1 was traveling Eastbound on State Road 45 at the intersection of Liberty Drive. Vehicle 2 was directly in front of Vehicle 1, also traveling Eastbound on State Road 45.Vehicle 2 slowed down to let two jaywalkers cross the road, even though Vehicle 2's light was green.When Vehicle 2 slowed, Vehicle 1 rear ended Vehicle 2.Driver 1 stated that the jaywalkers crossing the street at the incorrect time forced Vehicle 2 to stop, which caused the collision.Driver 2 stated that he slowed down to prevent injuring the two people crossing the street, when he was hit by Vehicle 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling S/B on S Washington St, turning E/B onto 3rd ST. P1 was walking S/B on Washington St. V1 failed to Yield, and struck P1.D1 was traveling S/B on Washington ST, attempting to turn E/B onto 3rd ST. D1 advised that she got distracted as she was turning onto 3rd ST and struck P1. D1 advised that she did not see P1 walking across the street. D1 advised that she was not injured.P1 advised that she was walking S/B onto Washington ST. P1 advised that she had the cross walk signal, and proceeded into the intersection. P1 advised that she then felt the impact of V1 as she was struck on the right side of her body. P1 stated that she rolled over onto the top of the hood of V1 and fell onto the ground. P1 advised that she had a 5 out of 10 pain to her neck and a complaint of pain to her buttock. P1 was treated on scene. Due to D1 failing to yield, V1 struck P1 causing injury.

On 05/14/2019 unit 1 was traveling west backing out of a parking spot. Unit 2 was parked facing east. Unit 1 struck unit 2 while backing out of the parking place. Unit 1 had some damage on the rear bumper and unit 2 had some damage to the front bumper.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Curry Pike is a local road that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. Jonathan Drive is also a local road that runs in a eastern and western direction and intersects with Curry Pike. The four way intersection of Curry Pike and Jonathan Drive is straight/level. Traffic signals control traffic flow at the intersection and were fuctioning properly at the time of the crash.V1 (2005 red Ford Focus) was traveling northbound in the center lane of Curry Pike. V2 (2014 white Ford F150) was southbound on Curry Pike attempting to make a left turn onto Jonathan Drive. V1 entered the intersection and struck V2 in the right passenger side door area. D1 (Erin McCart) stated that she was traveling northbound on Curry Pike. D1 stated she had a yellow light and had entered the intersection and struck V2. She was wearing her seat belt.D2 (George Webb) stated that he was traveling southbound on Curry Pike in the left turn lane. D2 stated that the traffic signal for the left turn lane had just turned yellow as he was attempting to turn. V1 then struck his vehicle on the passenger side. He was wearing his seat belt.W1 (Damon Pell) stated that he was traveling southbound in the left turn lane directly in front of V2. W1 stated that he and V2 where turning as the traffic signal was changing from green to yellow. W1 stated that V1 traveled through a red traffic signal and struck V2. During the course of my investigation, I observed debris in the middle of the intersection from V1. I observed heavy damage to the right front bumper and fender area of V1. V2 had damage to the right passenger side door area. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash was Failure To Yield Right Of Way on the part of D1. This was determined by damage to both vehicles, driver and witness statements.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS GOING THROUGH THE ROUNDABOUT ON E SAMPLE ROAD AT THE INTERCHANGE OF THE INTERSTATE 69 EXIT NORTHBOUND. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY THROUGH THE ROUNDABOUT INTERSECTION. D1 ADMITTED TO NOT SEEING V2 AND PULLING OUT STRIKING V2. D1 FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY. THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGES TO BOTH VEHCILES.
V1 WAS TRAVELING NB OUT OF THE PARKING LOT WHEN D1 LOOKED TO THE RIGHT AT ANOTHER VEHICLE. V1 THEN DRIFTED LEFT AND STRUCK A LIGHT POLE.

V1 and V2 were north bound on Curry Pike at SR 46 when V1 made an unsafe lane movement resulting in a same direction sideswipe. D1 stated he did not see V2 in his rear view mirror and during his lane change collided with V2. No injuries on scene. V1 called for his own tow truck.

I69 is a multi-lane divided Interstate that runs primarily north and south with a grass median.V1, black Lincoln, was traveling north on I69 in the right lane. V1 struck a deer with the front left corner before coming to a controlled stop along the northbound emergency shoulder. D1, Brown, stated she was traveling north on I69 in the right lane. D1 stated a deer entered the roadway from the right to left. D1 stated she was unable to avoid collision and struck the deer with the front left corner of V1.Evidence shows damage to the front left corner of V1.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON I-69 NEAR THE 115 MILEMARKER WHEN A DEER CROSSED THE HIGHWAY. D1 STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO AVOID STRIKING THE DEER HOWEVER SHE WAS UNABLE TO DO SO. D1 ADVISED AFTER SHE STRUCK THE DEER SHE WAS ABLE TO SAFELY DRIVE AWAY FROM THE IMMEDIATE CRASH SCENE AND PULL TO THE SHOULDER OF THE INTERSTATE.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.Driver Factor (explain in narrative): Driver stated he was driving an electric vehicle that had 'one pedal driving' where when he lets off accelerator, the vehicle will brake automatically. Driver stated that he let off the accelerator, but he may have accidentally hit it again to disengage the brake. V1 was stopped at a stop light waiting for it turn green.V2 was approaching V1 to also stop at the stop light.D1 stated he was driving an electric vehicle that had 'one pedal driving' where when he lets off accelerator, the vehicle will brake automatically. Driver stated that he let off the accelerator, but he may have accidentally hit it again to disengage the brake. V1 then collided into the back of V2.D2 stated he was stopped at the stop light and had been stopped there for approximately a minute. He was then rear ended by V1.There were no injuries and neither vehicle was in need of a tow.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 2 stated she was east on the 45/46 Bypass approaching the N Walnut intersection. She stated that her light was green and that she was traveling in the left hand lane. Driver 2 stated that Driver 1 turned eastbound from N Walnut onto the 45/46 Bypass and entered her lane. Driver 2 attempted to stop but was unable to avoid collision.Driver 1 stated he was north on Walnut approaching the 45/46 Bypass intersection. He stated that he looked left and did not see Driver 2. He then turned right onto the Bypass and proceeded into the left hand lane. Driver 1 and Driver 2 collided. Driver 1 failed to yield the right-of-way to Driver 2.No one in Vehicle 1 reported injuries. Driver 2 complained of pain to her left arm and was afraid it could be broken. She was transported to the hospital by her husband.

V1 was west bound on SR 48 approximately 750 feet west of Cave Road. V2 was east bound on SR 48 approximately 750 west of Cave Road. D1 traveled left of center while trying to untangle her shoe from the accelerator resulting in an opposite direction sideswipe to V2. V2 was west bound when V1 traveled left of center and collided with V2. V2 and T1 were damaged as a result and T1 had to be towed.D1 sustained complaint of pain to head, neck and back that required to be transported. D1 used all safety equipment possible.

D1 ADVISED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON N. BUSINESS 37 COMING UP TO I-69 WHEN A TIRE ON HIS TRAILER FELL OFF AND STRUCK AN ONCOMING VEHICLE.D2 ADVISED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON N. Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS

05/17/201993Officer Hall assisted with information gathering on scene.Primary Cause - Driver Distracted (explain in narrative) - V1 was traveling north on the 45/46 Bypass. D1 looked over at his right side mirror to change lanes and did not realize traffic had come to a crawl in front of him. Due to looking at his mirror to change lanes, V1 struck V2. Vehicles 1, 2, and 3 were traveling north on the 45/46 Bypass just north of the 10th street intersection. V1 was traveling north, just north of the 10th street intersection on the 45/46 Bypass in the left lane. Traffic in front of V1 had started to slow. Because of the slowing traffic, D1 looked at his right side mirror to see if he could change lanes. When he looked in front of him again, he struck the rear of V2. The force of the impact pushed V2 slightly onto the concrete median separating the north and south bound lanes on the Bypass. V1 was traveling around 20 mph. V2 was traveling north, just north of the 10th street intersection in the left lane. As traffic began to slow in front of him, D2 slowed his vehicle to a crawl. He was then struck from behind by V1. The force of the collision slightly pushed V2 onto the concrete median separating the north and south bound lanes on the Bypass. The force of the collision also pushed V2 into V3, striking V3 in the left rear portion of the vehicle. V3 was traveling north on the Bypass just north of the 10th street intersection in the left lane. V3 was traveling between 20 and 30 mph in traffic when V2 struck the vehicle on the left rear portion of the bumper. V1 was towed by Ken's Westside Towing by flatbed tow with damage to the front left portion of the vehicle.V2 was towed by Ken's Westside Towing by flatbed tow with damage to the front left and rear portions of the vehicle. V3 was able to drive away from the scene without issue.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON EAST 10TH STREET AT THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 10TH STREET AND NORTH DUNN STREET.D1 STATED THAT AS HE WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH DUNN STREET AND EAST 10TH STREET THAT A BICYCLIST, D2, DID GO THROUGH THE STOP SIGN AT 10TH AND DUNN STREET.D1 STATED THAT THE BICYCLIST WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON DUNN STREET.D1 STATED THAT HE COULD NOT STOP V1 AND THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID STRIKE THE BICYCLIST AND THE BIKE TRAVELING SOUTH.OFFICER CAMBLE DID SPEAK WITH SEVERAL WITNESSES WHILE ON SCENE, THEY ARE ADDED TO THIS REPORT.THE WITNESSES DID STATE THAT THE BICYCLIST, D2, WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON DUNN STREET AND THAT HE WAS TRAVELING FAST.THE WITNESSES DID STATE THAT D2 DID GO THROUGH THE STOP SIGN ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION WITHOUT STOPPING AND THAT D2 WAS STRUCK BY V1.THE BICYCLIST, D2, DID SUSTAIN SEVERAL INJURIES INCLUDING A FRACTURED SKULL, AVULSION TO HIS LEFT FLANK, AVULSION TO RIGHT SHOULDER, BLACK EYES, AND CUTS AND ROAD RASH TO HIS BODY. D2 IS CURRENTLY AT THE IU BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL BEING TREATED FOR HIS INJURIES. D2 WAS TRANSPORTED THERE BY AMBULANCE.D1'S VEHICLE WAS TOWED BY AUTO MOBILE DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

V1 was WB on E Thornton drive and was approaching S Maxwell street. V2 was NB on S Maxwell street and was approaching Thornton drive. V1 failed to stop at the stop sign and pulled out in front of V2. V2 hit V1 in the driver side front bumper with the passenger side front bumper of his vehicle.D1 stated that he "rolled thru" the stop sign and then heard V2 hitting his horn. He stated he was unable to get stopped before V2 struck him. D2 stated he was going straight and he saw V1 not stop at stop sign. He stated he was unable to get stopped before striking V1.

V2 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOPLIGHT ON E 3RD ST FACING E/B. WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2, THE DRIVER OF V1 EXITED HIS VEHICLE AND APPEARED INTOXICATED TO D2. D1 ASKED D2 TO JUST EXCHANGE INFORMATION, AND WHEN D2 SAID NO, D1 GOT BACK INTO HIS VEHICLE AND LEFT E/B ON 3RD ST WITHOUGH EXCHANGING INFORMATION.AFTER FULL INVESTIGATION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT V1 BELONGED TO A CLAUDIO SAINZ. PHOTOGRAPHS OF V1 HAVE BEEN TAKEN AND THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION HAS BEEN MAILED TO EACH PARTY.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO BACK V1 OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT HE WAS IN AT THE GAS STATION BUT DIDN'T SEE V2 DUE TO PAYING ATTENTION TO A LARGE TRUCK PARKED NEXT TO HIM AND ATTEMPTING NOT TO HIT THE TRUCK. D1 BACKED V1 INTO THE RIGHT REAR OF V2.

This crash occurred on State Road 46 which is an undivided four lane highway that primarily runs east and west. The weather at the time of the crash was clear and 84 degrees. Vehicle #1 a 2018 Ford Transit van was east bound on State Road 46 behind vehicle #2, a 2007 Pontiac G6 who was also east bound. As vehicle #2 approached the automatic signal it changed to yellow and then to red. Vehicle #2 slowed to a stop and vehicle #1 struck vehicle #2 in the rear. Driver #1 Gregory Beavers stated that he was behind vehicle #2 as the light was changing. Driver #1 stated that he thought vehicle #2 was going to continue through the light and he was going to follow, however vehicle #2 stopped for the light and he struck vehicle #2 in the rear. Driver #2 Abagail Martin stated that she was east bound on State Road 46 approaching Arlington Road. As the light changed, Driver #2 slowed to a stop for the traffic light. Driver #2 stated that vehicle #1 struck her vehicle in the rear. Evidence on the scene indicates vehicle #1 was following too close to vehicle #2 and was unable to get stopped and struck vehicle #2 in the rear.

Vehicle 2 was traveling east on E 17th St. Vehicle 1 was attempting to turn west onto E 17th St. From the parking garage on the north side of 17th near 345 E 17th St. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that he turned to wide and crossed the center line and did not see vehicle 2 until he was already in the roadway. Driver of vehicle 1 attempted to turn and go straight across 17th St to avoid the collision. Driver of vehicle 2 was unable to avoid vehicle 1 and the vehicles collided. Vehicle 1 has moderate damage to the passenger side front door and Vehicle 2 has minor damage to the front. No injuries were reported from this crash.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON 1-69 NORTH OF THE 129.5 MILE MARKER WHEN D1 STATED SHE WENT OFF THE ROAD AND LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE.D1 WAS TAKEN TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL FOR MEDICAL TREATMENT AND A BLOOD DRAW. D1 BLEW A .085 AFTER APPROXIMATELY 4 HOURS AT THE HOSPITAL AND ADMITTED TO TAKING VALUUM. RESULTS OF THE BLOOD DRAW ARE PENDING.

V-1 owner stated that he had parked his truck and trailer in the parking lot at 4850 S State Road 446 while fishing for the day. After returning to his vehicle he noticed that another vehicle had struck the right side of his trailer fender causing damage. There where no other vehicles close to V-1 when he found the damage therefore it is unknown who stuck V-1.

Vehicle 1 was a 1977 John Deere tractor pulling pulling a disc behind it. Vehicle 1 was traveling Northbound on South Strainridge Road approximately 1000 feet south of the intersection of Strain Ridge Road and Stone Ridge Road. Driver 1 stated that he had slowed down and got over as much as he could, however there was a stump and electrical box near the side of the road that did not allow the him to fully avoid center of the road.Vehicle 2 was traveling Southbound on Strainridge Road approximately 1000 feet south of the intersection of Strain Ridge Road and Stone Ridge Road. Vehicle 2 struck the disc trailer vehicle 1 was pulling. Driver 2 stated while he was approaching a hill crest he did see the tractor, however did not see it was pulling a disc until it was too late to avoid an accident.

V1 was traveling southbound on I69 near mile marker 127 when D1 stated his vehicle pulled to the left and he over corrected causing him to lose control of the vehicle. V1 hit the guard rail and spun coming to rest in the middle of the road. The passenger in the 3rd row right seat, Mr. Cox, was ejected from the vehicle. The passenger had severe head trauma and broken left leg and was air lifted to Methodist Hospital in Indianapolis. He was not wearing his seat belt.The passenger in the 3rd row center, Mr. Shively, was also ejected from the vehicle and had a laceration on his head. He was transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for treatment. He was not wearing his seat belt.The passenger in the 3rd row back left was injured. She had lacerations on her face. She was transported to IU Health for treatment. Due to the crash involving serious bodily injury, D1 had Indiana Implied Consent read to him and consented to Standardized Field Sobriety Tests and a Indiana State Department of Toxicology Blood Draw. Mr. Stier showed no signs of impairment. Pictures were taken and Accident Reconstructionist Deputy Bennett Dillion was on scene and will supplement this report.

IT WAS REPORTED THAT THE FEMALE PASSED OUT WHILE ON THE BACK OF THE MOTORCYCLE AND FELL OFF. THE FEMALE STATED THAT SHE WAS NOT FEELING WELL, AND LEANED FORWARD TO SPEAK TO HER HUSBAND, THE DRIVER. I-69 is an interstate (multiple lanes with grass median) that runs primarily north and south. I-69 is constructed of sections of asphalt and concrete. The area where the crash took was straight and level. The roadway was dry and clear. It was dusk and dark.Vehicle #1 was traveling south on I-69 south at Sample Road (125 mile marker). As it approached the overpass at Sample Road at the 125 mile marker a deer entered the roadway from the east and crossed the north bound lanes. After crossing the north bound lanes the deer continued west and Vehicle #1 struck the deer with the left front of Vehicle #1. Vehicle #1 continued south bound on I-69 south and came to a controlled stop off the roadway just north of State Road 46 (mile marker 120).Vehicle #1 was traveling south on I-69 north of Sample Road (exit 125).Driver #1 indicated he was driving south just north of Sample Road. Driver #1 indicated he saw a deer cross into the south bound lanes just before striking it with the front left of Vehicle #1. Vehicle #1 sustained damage to the left front and side, along with the left side mirror. Driver #1 indicated he came to a controlled stop with Vehicle #1 at a safe location just north of State Road 46 (mile marker 120) on the right shoulder of I-69 south.Driver #1 collided with the deer with Vehicle #1 just north of Sample Road. Vehicle #1 was not towed and damage was not disabling. Damage to Vehicle #1 was observed to the left front, side mirror (taken off by collision) and left side. Deer hair was also observed at collision area of Vehicle #1.

I, Michael Smolen (W1), was riding in the front passenger seat at the time of the crash. Austin Rearick (D1) was driving a white Ford police interceptor (V1) in emergency mode on the way to a dispatched call.V1 was headed north on Woodlawn Ave and passed through the intersection at 17th St. North of the intersection, at Gate 4, was a designated construction zone marked "Road Closed" with signage. The asphalt had been removed from the roadway and large gravel rocks had been placed as a service drive into the construction zone. The service drive was very uneven.D1 decided to drive north through the construction zone and within the first few feet of the zone, the front bumper dipped downward and struck the large gravel rocks that make up the service drive. D1 stated that he did not know he struck anything.V1 sustained two scrapes to the front bumper that resulted in the white paint being removed.No injuries were sustained. V1 was able to be driven from the scene.

Driver 3 stated she was stopped in the left lane of southbound SR45/46 Bypass behind backed up traffic from the traffic light at 3rd St. Driver 2 stated he was stopped behind vehicle 3. V1 and V2 were both traveling southwest on Arlington Road while V2 was slowed or stopped to turn left and V1 rear ended V2. D1 stated he looked down and during that time rear ended V2.

VEHICLE 1 COLLIDED HEAD ON WITH WITH THE REAR RIGHT BUMPER OF VEHICLE 2. SR46 is a two lane State Highway that runs primarily east and west. The eastbound lane consists of a downhill grade. The roadway was dry and there was moderate traffic during the time of this collision.V1, gray Hyundai, was traveling east on SR46 west of Bender Road, behind V2. V2, red Nissan, was traveling east on SR46 west of Bender Road, in front of V1. V1 struck the right rear corner of V2 in the eastbound lane of SR46 before leaving the south side of the roadway. V1 struck a driveway drainage structure at 6196 E. SR46 and continued off the roadway to the south of SR46. V1 struck two ATT above ground utility junction boxes as it continued along the south side of SR46. V1 rolled and came to final rest in the wooded area along the south side of SR46.D1, Williams, stated he was traveling east on SR46 back to his residence on E. Bender Road. D1 stated he did not recall what occurred prior to the collision. D2, Krejci, stated she was traveling east on SR46 west of Bender Road. D2 stated V1 attempted to pass V2 then V1 swerved to the right due to oncoming traffic. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2 as V1 left the roadway to her right. D2 stated V1 continued off the roadway before coming to final rest along the south side of SR46. D2 stated she stopped V2 on E. Bender Road after the collision.Evidence shows damage to the right rear corner and right rear wheel of V2. Evidence shows damage to all sides, top and undercarriage of V1. Evidence shows tire marks leaving the eastbound lane of SR46, crossing the private drive at 6196 E. SR46 and continuing along the south side of the roadway. Evidence shows damage to the drainage culvert and landscaping along the driveway at 6196 E. SR46. Evidence shows damage to two (2) ATT above ground utility junction boxes. D1, Williams, admitted to the consumption of an alcoholic beverage prior to the collision. A PBT was administered at the scene with a positive result of .195 % BrAC at approximately 5:32 pm. D1 was transported the IU Health Bloomington Hospital for his injuries and submitted to a blood draw. The results are pending the Indiana State Department of Toxicology examination. See Incident Report 19ISPC005740.W1, Martin, stated she was traveling west on SR46 approaching V1 and V2. W1 stated she observed V1 traveling east in the westbound lane. W1 stated V1 swerved to the right behind V2 before leaving the south side of SR46. W1 stated V1 rolled after leaving the roadway. Other occupants inside V2:1. Front Passenger: Dave Debikey, DOB 8-20-1971, 2412 S. Brown Avenue, Bloomington, IN.2. Right Rear Passenger: Emily Krejci, DOB 4-19-1973, 6575 W. Airport Road, Bloomington, IN.3. Left Rear Passenger: Kelli Debikey, DOB 4-1-1979, 2412 S. Brown Avenue, Bloomington, IN.4. Middle Rear Passenger: Greysan Debikey, DOB 12-22-2009, 2412 S. Brown Avenue, Bloomington, IN.On Sunday, July 14, 2019, I updated this report with toxicology results for D1, Williams. Williams had a Blood Alcohol Content of .235 g/100 mL.

IT SHOULD BE NOTED THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT THIS LOCATION (SOUTH WALNUT ST AND EAST 4TH STREET) WAS COMPLETELY OUT DUE TO A LOCAL POWER OUTAGE.V2 WAS STOPPED ON EAST 4TH STREET AT WALNUT STREET WHERE THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL WAS OUT. DRIVER OF VEHICLE ONE ADVISED HE WAS PULLING INTO A PARKING SPACE AT 739 W WYLIE ST. AS HE PULLED INTO THE SPACE, THE BRAKES FAILED TO STOP THE VEHICLE, CAUSING V1 TO DRIVE OVER THE CURB AND STRIKE THE BUILDING.
