No other officers assisted with this investigation.Type of Crash (other explain in narrative) - V1 collided with an overhead, concrete awning.V1 is a cargo (catering) truck and was driving southbound on the private drive of 101 N Jordan Avenue.V1 was driving in the private drive and approached an overhead, concrete awning (marquis). The overhead awning is not clearly marked that it is low hanging and D1 continued to attempt to drive under it. V1 then struck the awning and broke off approximately 14 light bulbs. Due to the height of the truck, it is difficult to determine if any damage was sustained to the truck.There are no injuries. This accident happens frequently largely in part that there is no signage warning drivers of the low hanging awning.Pictures of the damage are attached to the case.

V1 WAS EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE, EAST OF ROCKPORT RD. D1 SAID SHE STARTED BRAKING FOR A SLOWING CAR, FELT V1 SLIDE, OVER CORRECTED, AND V1 WENT OFF THE ROAD TO THE SOUTH, AND ROLLED OVER ONTO THE DRIVER'S SIDE.JUVENILE PASSENGER REMAINED IN CAR SEAR IN BACK, AND WAS REMOVED IN THE SEAR BY THE FIRE DEPARTMENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was pulling from a private lot onto Grimes Lane. V1 was traveling eastbound on Grimes Lane and was attempting to pull into the private lot. V1 pulled out and struck V2.D1 stated that he did not see V2 and he attempted to pull out onto Grimes Lane, striking V2.D2 stated that he was eastbound on Grimes Lane, signaled his turn into the private lot and was struck by V1 as it pulled out of the lot.V1 did fail to yield to V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

D1 stated he had started in traffic behind V2 when he looked away from the road for an unknown reason and when he looked back V2 had stopped. D1 then attempted to stop his vehicle but was unable to do so in time, colliding with V2 and pushing V2 into V3.

DRIVER 1 AND DRIVER 2 WERE TURNING RIGHT OFF OF I-69/ SR 37 ON TO WEST 3RD STREET WHEN VEHICLE 1 SIDE SWIPED VEHICLE 2 ON THE DRIVERS SIDE OF VEHICLE 2. DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS UNAWARE OF SIDE SWIPING ANOTHER VEHICLE.DRIVER 2 STATED HE WAS TURNING WHEN VEHICLE 1 SIDE SWIPED HIS VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE DRIVERS SIDE MIRROR AS WELL AS THE DRIVERS SIDE BODY. VEHICLE 1 SUSTAINED NO VISIBLE DAMAGE.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON S CORY LN WHEN THE DRIVERS SIDE MIRROR STRUCK THE DRIVERS SIDE MIRROR OF V2 WHICH WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND. BOTH D1 AND D2 ADVISED THAT BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PROPER LANE AND THE COLLISION WAS LIKELY DUE TO V2 HAVING TO MOVE, WHILE STAYING IN ITS LANE, DUE TO ROADSIDE FOLIAGE.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS WEST BOUND ON 10TH ST, JUST WEST OF N MORTON ST. D1 OBSERVED THE BACKHOE THAT HAD THE LOADER BUCKET PARTIALLY IN THE ROADWAY ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE STREET. AS V1 APPROACHED THE BACKHOE, AN UNINVOLVED VEHICLE WAS TRAVELLED EAST ON 10TH ST. D1 WAS WATCHING THE APPROACHING VEHICLE AND DIDN'T REALIZE HE WAS CLOSE TO THE LOADER BUCKET OF THE BACKHOE. V1 STRUCK THE LOADER BUCKET.THE BACKHOE WAS IN THE ALLEY WITH THE LOADER BUCKET PARTIALLY IN THE ROADWAY. THERE WAS A PLACARD ON THE SIDEWALK APPROXIMATELY 10 FEET EAST OF THE BACKHOE. THERE WAS NO ACTIVE TRAFFIC DIRECTION.

V1, V2, and V3 were traveling S/B on Rogers ST. V1 rear ended V2, which caused V2 to collide with V3 causing damage to all vehicles.D1 advised that he was traveling S/B on Rogers ST. D1 advised that he got distracted and did not see that V2 was completely stopped in the road way. D2 advised that he then attempted to slow down but was unsuccessful and collided with V2. D1 was not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling S/B on Rogers ST. D2 advised that V2 had come to a complete stop due to traffic, when he then felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that the impact from V1 caused V2 to rear end V3 causing damage. D2 was not injured. D3 advised that she was traveling S/B on Rogers ST. D3 advised that V3 was completely stopped in the road way due to traffic. D3 stated that she then felt the impact of V2. D3 was not injured. Due to the fact that D1 was following too closely, V1 struck V2 which cause V2 to collide with V3.

D1 stated he was eastbound on W Arlington Rd with a pallet in the bed of his truck. As he crossed over I69, the wind caught the pallet, blowing it out of the truck and into the roadway. As the pallet hit the roadway, V2 was approaching the overpass going eastbound. D2 stated he was unable to react in time to avoid the pallet as it collided with V2.

THE WITNESS, TONY CARROLL, STATED THAT HE DID SEE A SILVER SUV, V1, DRIVEN BY A YOUNG WHITE FEMALE, DRIVING EAST ON EAST 2ND STREET.TONY STATED THAT V1 DID PROCEED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 2ND STREET AND SOUTH HENDERSON AND THAT THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2.V2 DID SUSTAIN MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER AND THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2.V2 WAS PARKED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF EAST 2ND STREET, JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH HENDERSON AND EAST 2ND STREET.V2 WAS NOT TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

V1 was backing east in a private drive. V2 was parked facing southeast. V1 struck V2 while backing.D1 stated that she did not see V2 behind her and had forgot that it was parked there. While backing, she struck V2.

THE DRIVER OF THE SEMI WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN IN THE SOUTHCREST TRAILER PARK AND STRUCK A UTILIY POLE. THE LIGHT POLE WAS LEANING AT ALMOST A 45 DEGREE ANGLE. THERE WAS SLIGHT DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER.

V2 was stopped at the stop sign at the intersection of E. Rhorer Rd. and S. Walnut Street Pike facing eastbound on E. Rhorer Rd. V1 was traveling eastbound on E. Rhorer Rd. behind V2. D1 stated that he looked down briefly and did not see V2 stopped at the stop sign. V1 rear ended V2 causing disabling damage to both vehicles. D1 was given approximately 48 hours to provide insurance information and has yet to do so.

V1 was parked in a parking space facing east on the east side of Foster Gresham located at 1000 N. Fee Lane. V2 was parked in a parking space facing west just west of V1.I met with Stephanie Schneider on scene. Schneider stated that she parked V2 in that space at approximately 1430 hours. When she returned to V2, she found that V1 had rolled from a parking space into the rear of V1.I met with Jun Young Choi. Choi stated that he parked V1 in a parking space on east side of Foster Gresham located at 1000 N. Fee Lane. He stated that he parked the vehicle at approximately 1400 hours for a test. He stated that he engaged his parking brake and left the vehicle in neutral.As I observed V1, I noticed that the vehicle was in neutral and parking brake was engaged. There was minor damage to the rear bumper of V1 and V2. There were no drivers or injuries.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: The scene of the crash was the intersection of Airport Road and Bunger Road. Both roads are two way, two lane roads. Airport Road runs primarily east and west, while having the right of way at the intersection. Bunger Road primarily runs north and south, while having a stop sign at the intersection. The roadway was dry and the weather was clear.Vehicle #1 (black, 2015 Nissan) was northbound on Bunger Road and stopped at the intersection of Airport Road. Vehicle #2 (red, 2010 Ford) was eastbound on Airport Road, approaching Bunger Road. V#1 proceeded to turn left (northwest) onto Bunger Road in front of V#2. At the same time, V#2 came to a stop in the middle of the eastbound lane of Airport Road due to the driver seeing V#1 pulling out. V#1 turned left, but did not go completely into the westbound lane of Airport Road, staying partially in the eastbound lane. The driver's side front corner of V#1 struck the driver's side front corner of V#2.Driver #1 (Kayla Curtis) stated that she had stopped at the intersection and proceeded to turn left onto Airport Road. She advised that she did not see V#2. She also said that she did not turn wide enough and was partially in the eastbound lane of Airport Road when she hit V#2.Driver #2 (Mary Johnson) stated that she was eastbound on Airport Road and observed V#1 begin to turn off of Bunger Road in front of her. D#2 said she came to a stop to avoid a collision, however, V#1 was partially in her lane and struck her vehicle.Neither driver was injured in the crash. Both vehicles were driveable and did not have to be towed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of vehicle 1 stated that he was attempting to turn left on to N. Bottom Rd from W. Lawson Rd when he struck vehicle 2 on the passenger side. Driver of vehicle 1 stated he never saw vehicle 2 until he struck it. The driver of Vehicle 2 stated she was driving north on N. Bottom Rd when her vehicle was struck on the passenger side by vehicle 1. The rear of Vehicle 2 ended up in a ditch and was damaged to the point that is was undriveable and required to be towed from the scene. Vehicle 1 had damage to the front bumper but was not disabled.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PULL OUT OF THE USED CAR LOT ONTO STATE ROAD 46. D1 STATED AS HE PULLED ONTO STATE ROAD 46 HE REALIZED D2 WAS DRIVING TOWARDS HIM. D1 STATED HE ATTEMPTED TO BACKUP INTO THE USED CAR LOT. D1 STATED BEFORE HE WAS ABLE TO BACKUP INTO THE USED CAR LOT, D2 MADE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT DRIVE SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.D2 STATED HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON STATE ROAD 46. D2 STATED AS HE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROAD 46 AND N. WALNUT HE SAW D1 ATTEMPTING TO PULL OUT OF THE USED CAR LOT. D2 STATED D1 THEN BACKED UP INTO THE USED CAR. D2 STATED AS HE DROVE BY D1 PULLED OUT INTO THE SIDE OF HIS VEHCILE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TURNING LEFT FROM DODDS ST, ONTO WALNUT ST.V2 WAS NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT ST, IN THE LEFT LANE.D1 SAID HE WAS VERY TIRED FROM WORKING OVERNIGHT, THOUGHT V2 HAD CLEARED THE FRONT OF V1 WHEN HE PULLED OUT, STRIKING V2.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

ON 6/6/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH FAIRFAX ROAD. UNIT 1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY CAUSING UNIT 1 TO COLLIDE WITH A FENCE. UNIT 1 TO CAME TO REST INVERTED ON A BANK ON THE EAST SIDE OF SOUTH FAIRFAX ROAD
D1 STATED HE WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT AND COLLIDED WITH V2 THAT WAS PARKED APPROXIMATELY 20 FEET BEHIND V1.

Driver one stated he was behind vehicle two when vehicle two had it left turn signal on and began to break quickly. Driver one stated he couldn't stop as quick and to avoid an accident he swerved to the left between two construction cones into the closed lane. Driver one stated end ended up in the left lane when vehicle two came over into the lane and struck his vehicle.Driver two stated she was in the right lane and began to slow to change lanes and make a turn. Driver two stated she looked behind her and noticed vehicle one lost control of his vehicle and then came up on her left side striking her vehicle in the front left corner with the front right corner of his vehicle.

V1 was traveling southbound on Smith Pike approaching the intersection of Smith Pike and Woodyard Road. V2 was directly in front of V1 traveling southbound on Smith Pike approaching the intersection of Smith Pike and Woodyard Road. V3 was directly in front of V2 traveling southbound on Smith Pike approaching the intersection of Smith Pike and Woodyard Road. V3 slowed in traffic due to stopped vehicles in front of her. V2 slowed in traffic behind V3. V1 did not see V2 slow in traffic and V1 struck V2 pushing V2 into V3.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 advised she was turning right from W. Johnathon Drive onto N. Curry Pike. When I inquired with D1 if she had the green light to proceed N. On N. Curry Pike she could not advise, but stated that vehicles traveling S. On Curry Pike to turn East onto W. Johnathon Drive were turning.D2 stated he was traveling N. On N. Curry Pike and proceeded through the intersection of N. Curry Pike and W. Johnathon Drive with the green light when V1 pulled onto N. Curry Pike striking the middle right of V2.

Vec 1 moved prior to my arrival. Vec 1 driver stated he was east bound on hwy 46 in the far right lane. Driver stated that a deer came across the roadway in front of him. Driver stated he did not have time to react to avoid the deer. Vec 1 was struck first in the left front bumper, the deer then spun around and struck vec 1 in the left side front door. Upon my arrival the deer was still alive but injured. Deer was still in roadway, i put the deer down and pulled deer out of roadway.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 ADVISED SHE WAS TURNING LEFT FROM E DILLMAN RD ONTO S OLD SR 37 AND THOUGHT THE INTERSECTION WAS A FOUR WAY STOP. D1 ADVISED V2 STRUCK V1 IN THE DRVIERS DOOR AREA, CAUSING DAMAGE THAT RENDERED V1 INOPERABLE. D1 ADVISED ME SHE WAS HAVING PAIN IN THE LEFT ARM/CHEST AREA. SHE WAS CHECKED OUT BY EMS ON SCENE AND SIGNED A RELEASE FORM DENING FURTHER MEDICAL TREATMENT.D2 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON OLD SR 37 AND V1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM FROM E DILLMAN RD. D2 ADVISED HE ATTEMPTED TO STOP BUT SLID INTO D1 IN THE DRIVERS DOOR AREA. V2 SUSTAINED SUBSTAINTIAL FRONTEND DAMAGE, RENDERING IT INOPERABLE. D2 DENIED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE.

W1 STATED SHE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT OF CVS LOCATED AT 512 S COLLEGE MALL RD WHEN SHE OBSERVED V1 PULL INTO A NORTH FACING PARKING STALL LOCATED IN FRONT OF V2. SHE SAID V1 THEN STRUCK A POLE THAT WAS SUPPORTING A HANDICAP SIGN AND THE SIGN SURGED OVER AND STRUCK THE HOOD OF V2. D1 STATED WHEN PULLING INTO THE PARKING SPACE HE TAPPED THE POLE. THE OWNER OF V2 WAS NOT PRESENT AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS NORTH BOUND ON I69 IN THE RIGHT LANE. BETWEEN MILE MARKER 115 AND 116, THE RIGHT PASSENGER SIDE TIRE BLEW CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO VEER OFF THE ROADWAY TO THE RIGHT. V1 RAN INTO A ROCK CULVERT WHERE IT CAME TO REST.

WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON MADISON, V1 STRUCK A MAILBOX AND THEN STRUCK V2 WHICH PUSHED V2 INTO V3. D1 DIDN'T REALIZE HE WAS DRIVING WHEN I SPOKE WITH HIM. VEHICLES 2 AND 3 WERE PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED DURING THE TIME OF THE COLLISION.

MR NORRIS HAD PARKED V1 IN TH PARKING SPACE AT THE BURGER KING PARKING LOT AT 2498 S WALNUT ST.V2 WAS PARKED AT THE WEST END OF THE SAME PARKING LOT.MR NORRIS SAID HE PUT V1 IN PARK AND WALKED INTO BURGER KING. HE SAID SOMEONE THEN APPROACHED HIM AND SAID THAT HIS VAN HAD HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE IN THE LOT.BURGER KING'S VIDEO FOOTAGE SHOWED MR NORRIS PARKING THE VAN AND WALKING TOWARD THE STORE. V1 THEN STARTED ROLLING BACKWARD OUT OF THE PARKING SPACE AND HITTING V2. THE VIDEO DID NOT SHOW ANYONE GETTING IN THE VEHICLE.PRIIMARY CASUE LISTED AS OTHER/V1 BECAUSE MR NORRIS SAID HE PUT IT IN PARK AND WALKED INSIDE BURGER KING.

D1 was traveling north on Smith Pike approaching the intersection with Forrest Park Drive. D1 stated that as she came over the hill crest, V2 was stopped or slowed in traffic. V1 collided with the rear of V2. V1 then traveled into on coming traffic colliding with V3 in south bound traffic.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS ON WEST BOUND KIRKWOOD AVENUE IN THE LEFT LANE, STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT WITH S ADAMS STREET. WHEN THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN, V1 TURNED SOUTH ONTO ADAMS ST. AFTER COMPLETING THE TURN, D1 STARTED TO MERGE INTO THE RIGHT LANE. D1 DID NOT SEE THAT V2 WAS ALREADY IN THE RIGHT LANE. AS V1 CHANGED LANES, IT STRUCK V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS WEST BOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVENUE IN THE RIGHT LANE, STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT WITH S ADAMS STREET. WHEN THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN, V2 TURNED SOUTH ONTO S ADAMS STREET, FOLLOWING THE RIGHT HAND LANE. AFTER COMPLETING THE TURN, D2 NOTICED V1 STARTED TO DRIFT OVER INTO THE RIGHT LANE. D2 TRIED TO SHIFT TO THE RIGHT FURTHER, BUT COULD NOT GET CLEAR BECAUSE OF THE CURB. V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1.

Vehicle 1 was on the ramp from northbound State Road 37 to southbound I-69 in Bloomington when it struck the concrete barrier wall on the left side of the roadway. Vehicle 1 sustained disabling damage to the driver's side front and rear tires and was towed from the scene to Bloomington.Vehicle 1, a red 2017 Dodge Caravan, was traveling northbound on the ramp from northbound State Road 37 to southbound I-69 at the 114 exit when it left its lane, struck the concrete barrier wall on the northwest side of the lane, and came to a rest partially in the roadway on the left shoulder. Vehicle 1 was towed from the scene by Ken's Westside Service and Towing to Bloomington.Driver 1, Dennis McClure, stated he was driving on the ramp from northbound State Road 37 to southbound I-69 at the 114 exit. Driver 1 stated as he began to turn right to follow the ramp, there was a glare from the sunset and he was unfamiliar with how sharply the ramp curved. He stated he was unable to turn in time to avoid striking the barrier wall and then pulled the vehicle as far off the roadway as he could after the collision.At the scene there were scuffs and paint transfer on the barrier wall where the ramp begins to curve to the right back towards I-69. The driver and all passengers were picked up and transported home by a family member.

D2 advised that he was slow/stopped in traffic on N. Smith Pike traveling South. D2 stated V1 struck his vehicle from behind. D1 advised she was traveling S. On N. Smith Pike. D1 stated taht she attempted to brake, but her brakes felt like they had gone to the floor, but did not depress on the brakes hard enough. Ultimately striking the rear end of V2.

D1 of V1 was driving south on S. Rogers St. D2 of V2 was driving south on S. Rogers St. V1 then slammed on their brakes and slid in the road ultimately rear ending V2. D2 of V2 stated he was going straight and was then rear ended by V1. Their were witnesses to this collision and those witnesses stated that V1 slammed on the brakes and rear ended V2. Witnesses then stated that D1 of V1 left the scene of the accident.

9306-07-2019Officer N. Lewis assisted with information gathering at the scene.Both vehicles were traveling west on 3rd Street just east of S. Swain Ave. V1 was in the right lane and V2 was in the left lane.V1 was traveling west on 3rd Street intending to make a left hand turn on S. Swain Ave to travel southbound. D1 stated she was in the right lane on 3rd Street and was not aware she was traveling on a two lane one way street. As V1 was approaching S. Swain Ave, D1 looked left to see if any vehicles were approaching her and did not see anything. She then attempted to turn left onto S. Swain Ave from the far right lane. While making her turn, she did not realize V2 was in her blind spot in the left lane traveling west alongside her and struck the middle right side of V2. V2 was traveling west on 3rd Street in the left lane. D2 stated she was traveling straight when V1 hit the middle right side of her vehicle from the right lane as they approached S. Swain Ave. V1 sustained damage to the left front side of the vehicle.V2 sustained damage to the middle right side of the vehicle.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.3rd Street is a one way, two lane westbound roadway at the accident location. V1 was in the north-most lane and was attempting to turn left onto southbound Jordan Avenue. V2 was in the south-most lane of 3rd Street and was attempting to go straight.D1 stated that he did not realize that 3rd Street was a one way road and was in the north-most lane. He then wanted to turn southbound onto Jordan Avenue. Due to not realizing 3rd Street was one way, he then made an unsafe turn and cut in front of V2. V2 then collided into his vehicle.D2 stated she was in the south-most lane and was wanting to go straight through the Jordan Avenue intersection. V1 then turned into her lane of travel without much warning and she was unable to stop in time. D2 estimated her speed at 35 mph. 3rd Street is a 25mph zone.There were no injuries. There was front, corner damage to both vehicles; however, both vehicles appeared to be safe to drive from the accident location.

V2 WAS FACING WEST ON KIRKWOOD IN THE TURN LANE TO GO SOUTH ON ROGERS. D2 STATED THAT V1 TRAVELING NORTH ON ROGERS TRIED TURNING EAST ONTO KIRKWOOD AND WHEN IT DID, IT TURNED EAST IN THE WEST BOUND LANE OF KIRKWOOD. D2 STATED THE ANGLE WAS SHARP AND V1 DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH ROOM TO MAKE THE TURN AND RUBBED UP AGAINST V2 WHILE IT SAT AT THE LIGHT AND CONTINUED EAST FOR ANOTHER BLOCK AND PARKED. D2 THOUGHT THE DRIVER OF V1 WAS PARKING TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION SO D2 EXITED HIS VEHICLE TO MAKE CONTACT. D2 THEN STATED AS HE GOT CLOSE TO V1, IT LEFT NORTH ON MADISON WITHOUT LEAVING ANY INFORMATION. D2 STATED HE WAS ABLE TO GET A PLATE NUMBER OF AQE227 BEFORE V1 WAS ABLE TO GET AWAY BUT COULD NOT TELL WHO THE DRIVER OF V1 WAS OR HOW MANY PEOPLE WERE IN THE VEHICLE. THE PLATE OF V1 DOES RETURN TO A MAROON CHEVY SUV BUT I WAS UNABLE TO LOACTE IT TO VERIFY THAT IT WAS INDEED THE VEHICLE INVOLVED.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE HAD TURNED SOUTH INTO THE RIGHT LANE ONTO CURRY PIKE FROM AN ADJACENT PARKING LOT, JUST SOUTH OF W 3RD ST. D1 DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE LEFT LANE. AS D1 STARTED TO CHANGE LANES, V1 STRUCK V2DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE HAD JUST TURNED FROM EAST BOUND 3RD ST TO S CURRY PIKE AND WAS IN THE LEFT LANE WHEN V1 CHANGED LANES AND COLLIDED WITH V2.

Fairfax Road is a blacktop county road in Monroe county that runs primarily North and South and is two lane. The area of the crash is straight and level and on this particular day the surface was dry and just before daylight. D1, Regina Kinser, stated that she was traveling SB on Fairfax road at Harbor Hill when a deer suddenly jumped from the East side of the roadway and into her path. Mrs. Kinser said that she was going under the speed limit as she was slowing down to turn into the parking lot of the Fairfax Inn Market where she works which was approximately 60 feet from the crash site. She said that she applied her brakes and steered to the west in an attempt to avoid colliding with the deer but was unable to avoid the collison. She said that she struck the deer with the front passenger side bumper of the vehicle causing damage to that area of the vehicle. Mrs. Kinser further stated that the deer kept running after being struck.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING SB ON S VICTOR PIKE IN THE 5200 BLOCK. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE BELIEVES HE FELL ASLEEP WHILE DRIVING BECAUSE THE NEXT THING HE KNEW HE HAD STRUCK A MAILBOX AND TREE LOCATED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD AT 5280 S VICTOR PIKE.
UNIT 1 WAS BACKING UP AND BACKED INTO UNIT 2. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE WHEEL WELL AREA.

V2 was parked on in a private parking lot at 7502 W. State Road 46. V1 was passing by V2 in the private lot and came too close to V2 side swiping V2 on the rear quarter panel with the front drivers side of V1. V2 was unoccupied at the time of the crash. Both vehicles sustained minor damage.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS DRIVING WEST ON TAPP ROAD APPROACHING THE ROUNDABOUT WITH ADAMS ST. V1 WAS DRIVING EAST ON TAPP ROAD FROM THE ROUNDABOUT WITH ADAMS. V1 THEN VEERED INTO THE WESTBOUND LANE. V2 THEN STEERED INTO THE EASTBOUND LANE IN AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID V1. V1 THEN VEERED BACK INTO THE EASTBOUND LANE AND COLLIDED WITH V2. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE WITHOUT EXCHANGING DRIVER INFORMATION. D2 STATED THAT SHE OBSERVED V1 DRIVING IN HER LANE OF TRAVEL. D2 STATED THAT V1 WAS DRIVING IN HER LANE TO THE POINT THAT SHE BELIEVED THAT V1 WOULD DRIVE OFF OF THE ROADWAY ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD. D2 THEN SAID THAT SHE SWERVED INTO THE EAST LANE TO AVOID THE COLLISION WITH THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE THEN SEEMED TO REALIZE IT WAS GOING OFF OF THE ROAD AND IT VEERED BACK INTO THE EASTBOUND LANE AND COLLIDED WITH V2. D2 SAID THAT SHE WAS APPLYING HER BRAKES DURING THE INCIDENT AND HAD DRASTICALLY REDUCED HER SPEED BY THE TIME OF IMPACT. D2 STATED THAT SHE THEN ATTEMPTED TO GET V1 TO STOP BUT V1 CONTINUED EAST ALONG TAPP ROAD.D1 WAS FOUND BY OFFICER WOODS AND PLACED UNDER ARREST DUE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE INCIDENT.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 was traveling E. On E. Sample Road traveling down a large hill. D1 stated that the rear wheels began to slide and V1 then ran off the roadway and struck an embankment. After striking the embankment V1 rolled approximately three times, and finally came to rest in the west bound lane of travel. A neighbor in the area advised they saw V1 traveling down the roadway and heard the accident, but did not witness it. They did state that D1 may have been going too fast, but simply a speculation.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS GOING SB AFTER THE RAIN AND WENT AROUND A CORNER TOO FAST, SLID OUT AND WOUND UP ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY IN A DITCH. NO MAJOR PROPERTY OR VEHICLE DAMAGE. CRASH REPORT DONE DUE TO THE DRIVER NOT BEING THE REGISTERED OWNER. SFST'S WERE ADMINISTERED DUE TO THINKING I DETECTED THE SMELL OF ALCOHOL EMINATING FROM THE DRIVERS EXHALED BREATH.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Unit 1 was traveling westbound at the intersection of St Rd 37 and Old St Rd 37. Upon passing through the intersection, continuing west, as she rounded the curve, unit 2, which was traveling eastbound on Old St Rd 37, approaching the intersection, was left of the center line. At this point, unit 1 and 2 impacted head on. Unit 1 impacted on the front drivers side, rolling and coming to a stop inverted on the north side of the road. Unit 2 impacted on the front drivers side, spinning and coming to a stop facing the wrong direction in the eastbound lane. Driver of Unit 1 sustained injuries and was transported to IU Health for evaluation. No major injuries were found. Passenger of Unit 1 sustained no injuries. Driver of Unit 2 sustained no injuries.Ashley Lamb, witness to the accident, stated that Unit 2 was across the center line as they approached the curve before the intersection.

Keaira Abrams was driving her 2009 Infinity south on the SR 46 bypass in Bloomington. As she approached the stop light at 10th Street she started slow down and stop for traffic. Olivia Balmer was driving her 2003 Jeep behind Ms. Abrams. When Ms. Balmer started to brake and slow down her tires started to slide on the wet pavement and her vehicle collided with Ms. Abrams vehicle. There was minor damage done to both vehicles.

I69 is a 70mph interstate. At certain locations it is divided by a metal guardrail and other locations it is a grassy median.V1 (2016 White Charger) was traveling south on I69 near the 106mm. V1 is an Indiana State Police Vehicle that was conducting speed enforcement looking for violators. V1 attempted to cross the grassy median to stop a violator heading north. V1 collided with a metal guardrail approximately 100 feet north of the 106 mile marker that was not visible from the roadway. D1 (Trooper Seth Parker) was driving south on I69. He was patrolling the interstate observing for violators. He attempted to cross the median to stop a violator heading north. He advised the grass was very tall and he did not see the guardrail.I witnessed minor damage to the front left bumper of the vehicle.No enforcement action was taken. No injuries were reported. Vehicle was driven from scene. A damage tag was placed at the scene. ISP Commission #: 2727Mileage: 95733

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling westbound on E. Anderson Road at speeds too fast for the weather conditions. As V1 attempted to take the curve just east of N. Old State Road 37, D1 stated that the tires on V1 caused V1 to run off the southside of the roadway and overturn in the ditch. V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. STATE ROAD 37 COMING UP TO W. CHURCH LN. D1 LOOKED DOWN AND HIS DASHBOARD TO LOOK AT THE GAS GAGE, AND WHEN D1 LOOKED UP HE NOTICED V2 WAS STOPPED IN FRONT OF HIM. D1 TRIED TO BRAKE BUT DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH ROOM TO STOP AND V1 REAR ENDED V2.D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP LIGHT WHEN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D2 AND A PASSENGER WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL TO BE CHECKED OUT.V1 HAD MINOR FRONT END DAMAGEV2 DID NOT APPEAR TO HAVE ANY DAMAGE.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was turning east bound from a private drive on West State Road 45, directly across from South Duncan Road. V2 was traveling west bound on West State Road 45. D1 lost control of his vehicle as he was turning and crossed the center line. V1 struck V2 head on. The witness stated he saw V1 turn onto West State Road 45 at a high rate of speed to get in front of another vehicle when he lost control of the vehicle. He further explained D1 lost control of his vehicle and cross the center line before striking V2 in the west bound lane.

Driver 1 stated she was traveling westbound on East State Road 45. Driver 1 began approaching a sharp curve and slowing down and stated she believed she was within her lane however collided with Driver 2 who was traveling eastbound. Driver 2 stated she observed Driver 1 cross left of center into her eastbound lane before correcting. Driver 2 stated this occurred again and she believed she was going to have a head on collision with Driver 1 however they sideswiped. Vehicle 1 sustained minor damage along the driver's side while Vehicle 2 sustained minor damage along the passenger side. Vehicle 1 was towed by Pritchard towing. Driver 1 was arrested for Operating while Intoxicated after completing Standard Field Sobriety Testing, a PBT, and a certified breath test.

D1 WAS DRIVING EB ON W 3RD ST APPROACHING THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT S CURRY PIKE. D1 QDVISED HIS LIGHT WAS GREEN AND STATED MULTIPLE VEHILCES WERE TAKING A LEFT HAND TO TURN SB ON CURRY PIKE. D1 ADIVSED HE SLOWED DOWN FOR THE VEHILCES THEN CONTINUED FORWARD, AS V1 WAS DRVING THROUGH THE LIGHT, D1 STATED V2 THE STRUCK HIM. THE AIRBAGS DELPOYED IN V1 AND D1 HAD A LARGE BRUISE ON HIS LEFT ARM.V2 WAS TRAVLING WB ON W 3RD ST. V2 WAS IN THE LEFT HAND TURN LANE TO TURN SB ON S CURRY PIKE. D1 STATED THE LIGHT WAS A GREEN TURN ARROW. AS V2 WENT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, V1 STRUCK V2 ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE.*SUPPLEMENT: THE DAMAGE TO V2 WAS ADJUSTED, V2 WAS STRUCK ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE DOOR AND THE DAMAGE WAS IN THAT AREA.
WHILE UNIT 2 WAS BACKING UP TO LEAVE, IT STRUCK UNIT 1. UNIT 1 WAS PARKED IN A DESIGNATED NO PARKING AREA. THE AREA IS DESIGNED TO GIVE UNIT 2 ENOUGH SPACE TO BACK OUT OF THE SMALL PARKING LOT.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE HEADING WB ON N ST RD 45 46 BYPASS WHEN THEY APPROACHED THE STOP LIGHT ON N FEE LN.D2 ADVISED HE STOPPED AT THE LIGHT WHEN IT WAS RED AND ADVISED HE THEN GOT REARENDED BY V1. V2 WAS THEN PUSHED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION ON ITS SIDE AND D2 SUSTAINED A CUT TO HIS HAND AND THE RIDE SUSTAINED ROAD RASH ON HER ABDOMEN AND HAND.D1 ADVISED HE ATTEMPED TO STOP AT THE LIGHT HOWEVER WHEN HE APPLIED THE REAR BRAKE, HE LOST CONTROL AND WHEN D1 APPLIED THE FRONT BRAKE IT WAS TOO LATE AND HE REAR ENDED V1. D1 WAS TRANSOPRTED TO THE HOSPITAL AND ADVISED HIS BIGGEST COMPLIANT OF PAIN WAS HIS KNEE.

Vehicle 2 was traveling south on S College Mall Rd. At the intersection of E Covenanter Vehicle 2 stopped at a red light and was sitting stationary waiting for the light to change green. Driver of vehicle 2 stated that he was stationary at the light but the turn arrow was green. Vehicle 1 was also traveling south on S College Mall Rd. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that vehicle 2 had came to a sudden stop at the light and he was unable to avoid rear ending vehicle 1. Vehicle 1 had minor damage to the front and Vehicle 2 had moderate damage to the rear. No injuries were reported from this accident. Driver of vehicle 1 was cited for driving while suspended. The passenger in vehicle 1 was arrested for an unrelated cause therefore vehicle 1 had no driver and was a road hazard. Vehicle 1 was towed from the scene because it was a road hazard.
THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT SHE THOUGHT SHE HAD APPLIED THE BRAKES IN TIME, BUT SLIGHTLY IMPACTED UNIT 2 PRIOR TO COMMING TO A COMPLETE STOP.

Both V1 and V2 were facing southbound on Range Road at the intersection of 10th Street and Range Road. V1 was directly behind V2. No injures occurred.Directly west of Range Road on 10th Street were several construction vehicles parked on the north side of 10th Street. This is from the previous construction completed, making it hard for vehicles making a right hand turn to pull out onto 10th Street going westbound. D1 said he was sitting stationary southbound in V1 with the traffic light red on Range Road. D1 said V2 moved forward to make a right hand turn on red. D1 said V2 stopped due to not being able to turn. D1 said V1 struck V2 in the rear. V1 had damage to the front passenger bumper area.D2 said he was sitting stationary southbound in V2 with the traffic light red on Range Road. D2 said V1 was directly behind him. D2 said he went to move forward to see around the construction vehicles in V2 to make a right turn on red. D2 said he had to stop. D2 said V2 was then rear ended by V1. V2 had damage to the rear driver side bumper. Photos of the vehicle damage were taken.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S SMITH ROAD AT THE INTERSECTION OF E MORNINGSIDE DRIVE. V2 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S SMITH RD AT THE INTERSECTION OF E MORNINGSIDE DRIVE. AS V1 BEGAN TO ATTEMPT TO TURN EB ON E MORNINGSIDE DRIVE, V2 ALSO BEGAN TO ATTEMPT TO CONTINUE NB ON S SMITH RD. ONCE BOTH VEHICLE WERE IN THE INTERSECTION, THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED THAT HE CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP AT THE STOP SIGN. D1 ALSO STATED THAT IT WAS HIS TURN TO ENTER THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED THAT SHE ALSO CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP AT THE STOP SIGN. D2 ALSO STATED THAT IT WAS HER TURN TO ENTER THE INTERSECTION. THE COLLISION HAPPENED DIRECTLY IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION.

ACCORDING TO BOTH DRIVERS, V1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO EXIT CIRCLE S, LOCATED AT 4200 W. ST. RD. 46, BLOOMINGTON, IN 47404, WHEN A BOX TRUCK ATTEMPTED TO TURN INTO THE BUSINESS. V1 ATTEMPTED TO EXIT WESTBOUND AND ENDED UP GOING WIDE AND STRIKING V2 IN THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY ON STATE ROAD 46 WESTBOUND. NO CRASH DIAGRAM DUE TO BOTH VEHICLES MOVING OUT OF THE ROADWAY AND INTO THE PARKING LOT PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Both V1 and V2 were traveling northbound on I-69 at the Sample Rd. Interchange side by side. V1 was traveling in the left lane and V2 was in the right lane. D1 stated that she attempted to merge into the right lane without looking and sideswiped V2. D1 was unable to provide proof of insurance and was also issued a citation for driving while suspended.
WHILE UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING ON ARLINGTON, THE DRIVER SUDDENLY STOPPED TO AVOID SMALL ANIMALS IN THE ROADWAY. UNIT 2 WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND REAR ENDED UNIT 1.

D1 STATED HE WAS BACKING OUT ONTO W 4TH ST. D1 STATED HE LOOKED BEHIND HIM AND BEGAN BACKING UP. D1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE D2 AND BACKED INTO THE SIDE OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED HE TURNED EAST ONTO W. 4TH ST. D2 STATED D1 WAS BACKING OUT OF HIS PARKING SPOT. D2 STATED D1 BACKED INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

State Road 45 is a two lane two way highway that runs primarily east and west. At the time of the crash it was day light outside and traffic was medium to heavy. Bunger Rd. is a two lane two way road that runs north and south. At the intersection where the crash took place there is a slight high just east of the intersection. Vehicle 1, a gold 1998 Chevy truck pulling a black 2000 open ended trailer, was traveling west on SR 45 near the Bunger Rd. intersection. Vehicle 2, a white 2016 Chevy van, was traveling east on SR 45 nearing the Bunger Rd. intersection. V1 lost control and swerved into the oncoming east bound traffic lane. V2 was side swiped by V1's trailer. V2 pulled over shortly into a close by drive way on the south side of the road way. V1 continued swerving out of control west bound on SR 45. V1's trailer finally broke loose from V1. V1 was pushed off the north side of the roadway into a tree. After hitting the tree the vehicle swung around in the ditch before getting logged into another tree. V1 came to rest in a ditch against a tree facing east. The trailer that had been attached to the V1 continued west on SR 45 before coming to stop in the roadway approximately 50 feet west of V1. Driver 1, Paul Frye, told me he was driving west on SR 45 near the Bunger Rd. intersection. D1 said all of a sudden he could feel the trailer he was pulling start to pull him from side to side. D1 told me he tried to gain control of his truck by over steering but was unsuccessful. D1 stated that he was not sure what happened because, it happened so quickly, but that he spun out of control before running of the road and crashing into a tree. Driver 2, Kayleena Myers, said she was traveling east on SR 45 near the Bunger Rd. intersection. D2 said she watched as V1 was traveling west on SR 45 swerving from side to side. D2 said that it appeared as if D1 would gain control of his vehicle before passing her. D2 said she slowed down almost to a stop when she realized that V1 was not gaining control and still coming at her in the east bound lane. D2 she watched as V1 missed her van but side swiped her vehicle with the trailer D1 was pulling. Evidence shows heavy damage to V1. Evidence shows a light scuff mark along the driver side of V2. Evidence shows swerving tire marks along the west bound lane of SR 45 just west of the Bunger Rd. intersection. Evidence shows the hitch where V1 would have been attached to the trailer was malfunctioning and the chains broken off. **It is this Troopers belief that the hitch on the trailer was broken prior to the crash, causing the trailer to break loose and cause the crash. ** Driver 1 signed paperwork with the on scene EMS crew stating he was denying medical transport or treatment but stated he was going to go to hospital with wife (who showed up on scene later) with complaints of neck/head pain. D1 appeared to sustained an abrasion on back of his head.

I Officer Hall was approached at 1401 N. Dunn Street (Convenient Food Mart) by V2 owner Robert Rood about V2 being backed into by V1 in the parking lot. Both vehicles and parties were on scene. V1 was facing southbound in the parking lot and V2 was facing westbound in the parking lot.I spoke with D1 who said there was a Nissan making several attempts to park in a parking space next to her as she was trying to back out of her space in V1. D1 said she tried giving the Nissan more room as she was backing out causing V1 to back into V2. D1 pointed out that she obtained damage to the lower light fixture that was broken out on the passenger side rear bumper. I asked about the damage on the rear passenger side of the vehicle panel? D1 said that was old damage. Nissan was not on scene. I spoke with owner of V2 Rood. Rood said he was sitting in V2 parked stationary in the parking lot. Rood said his vehicle was not running. Rood said he felt a bump and saw V1 backed into V2. V2 had minor damage to to the driver side bumper. No injuries occurred.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON W. RHORER RD COMING TO THE INTERSECTION O S. WALNUT STREET PIKE. D1 DID NOT NOTICE THE STOP SIGN UNTIL HE WAS AT THE FOURWAY AND ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE HOWEVER V1 COULD NOT STOP IN TIME AND STRUCK V2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. WALNUT STREET PIKE AND HAD STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT S. WALNUT STREET PIKE AND W. RHORER RD. SHE THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE FOUR WAY AND V1 WENT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK V2 ON HER PASSENGER SIDE.BOTH VEHICLES MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

V1 was backing out of the East/West Alley in the 600 block of N. Dunn, going West bound. D1 did not look in the direction she was backing up and struck V2. V2 was legally parked just north of the intersection.

O2 stated that today around 1800 HRS he noticed V2 had damage on the passenger side. The damage indicated that the suspect, V1, had swiped it while either backing out or pulling into a parking spot.V2 was parked in a spot facing westbound when the damage was found. No information on the suspect V1. A local report will be completed. Please see case#B19-23757 for more information on this.

V1 and V2 were both traveling eastbound on E Hillside Dr and at the intersection with S Lincoln St when V1 struck the rear end bumper portion of V2. D1/V1 stated she was traveling eastbound when she attempted to stop behind V2 as traffic had stopped in the roadway ahead of both her vehicle and V2. However, due to the close proximity of her vehicle to V2, she was unable to do so, causing her vehicle to collide into the rear bumper portion of V2.D2/V2 stated he had also been traveling eastbound and had been forced to stop due to the vehicle in front of him attempting to turn left onto S Lincoln St. Upon doing so, D2 stated his vehicle was then struck from behind by V1. V1 sustained significant damage to the center and right front portion of the vehicle and was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper portion, however, it was driven from the scene.

V1 was traveling south through the SRSC parking lot. V2 was parked facing east in the lot. V1 attempted to turn left and park in the lot. V1 did not visually estimate the space between V1 and V2 correctly. V1 then struck V2. V1 had minimal damage to the passenger front bumper. V2 had moderate damage to the rear driver side bumper and fender. D1 stated that she was attempting to turn left into a parking space and did not leave enough room to miss V2. D1 stated that she thought she could make the turn but then V1 struck the rear of V2. V2 was parked. There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed.

Vehicle 1 struck in the night while parked/unattended. Complainant says a loud crash awoke neighbors at approximately 0200. No info on violator vehicle other than a grey car.Violator vehicle, Vehicle 2, was located 3 blocks away, parked an unattended. Vehicle 2 had corresponding damage to that of Vehicle 1. Also, the piece of body panel left by the offending vehicle at the scene of the crash did match and fit Vehicle 2.I attempted to locate the registered owner of Vehicle 2, but was unsuccessful.On 7/3, the registered owner of the vehicle came to BPD and identified the driver from this incident as Kinzie Raper. Kinzie Raper was subsequently located and arrested for this and other charges. She admitted to having been driving at the time of the crash.

V1 was traveling in an unknown direction of travel. V2 was parked and unoccupied. V1 struck V2. V1 then fled the scene. V2 had moderate damage to the front passenger side fender and bumper. V1 fled the scene.V2 was parked and unoccupied.The person in possession of V2, INTEL PINTAKAEW, stated that he had parked to go to the gym and returned a few hours later to find that V2 that had fresh damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle and there was no information left from the other driver. No vehicles had to be towed and there were no injuries reported at this time. V1 has not been located at this time.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON W SR 45 IN THE APPROX. 8800 BLOCK. V1 RAN OFF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD, THEN RETURNED TO THE ROADWAY AND OVERCORRECTED, THEN CROSSED THE CENTER LANE AND RAN OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAWAY. V1 WENT THROUGH A YARD AT 8828 W SR 48, CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE LANDSCAPE AND CAME TO REST AGAINST A FRONT PORCH.D1 STATED THAT SHE BRIEFLY RAN OFF THE ROAD WHILE TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON W SR 45, OVERCORRECTED AND RAN OFF THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROAD.THE PROPERTY AT 8828 W SR 45 APPEARED TO BE UNDER RENOVATION, IT WAS UNCLEAR WHO OWNED THE PROPERTY.

D1 stated he was entering the construction site and observed V2 parked along side of the road. D1 stated V2s mirrors should have been folded in. V1s passenger mirror collided with V2s driver side mirror.Witness1 stated V2 was unoccupied at the time of the collision. W1 did not observed the collision but stated he heard it.Parties exchanged information prior to law enforcement arrival, D1 then left the scene and continued on his way. Computer error caused discrepancies in the Driver information exchange. Parties were provided with correct case number. Crash report and driver exchange was corrected after departing the scene.

D2 Statement: D2 stated that he was riding V2 east on W.17th St. and turned right onto N. Crescent Rd. D2 stated that V1 was going north on N. Crescent Rd and crossed the double yellow center line at the intersection of W. 17th and N. Crescent. D2 stated that V1's movement caused him to collide V2 into V1.D1 Statement: D1 stated that he was driving V1 north on N. Crescent Rd and stopped at the intersection of W. 17th and N. Crescent. D1 also stated that V2 was going east on W. 17th St and abruptly turned south on N. Crescent Rd. D2 stated that he had seen D2 drop on the ground but he is unaware of V2 colliding with V1. V1 stated that he left the scene believing V1 did not strike V2Witness: Stephanie stated that she had seen V1 crossing the center lane as it was approaching the intersection. Stephanie also stated that as V2 was turning south on N. Crescent Rd, it collided with the rear driver tire of V1. She mentioned that D1 exited V1 then went back in V1 and left the scene.Based on the above statements and circumstances, I have come to a conclusion that V1 crossed the center line on N. Crescent Rd, prior to W 17th, and that V1's actions caused V2 strike V1.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE NORTH BOUND ON ADAMS ST, TOWARD THE RIGHT CURVE ONTO KIRKWOOD AVE.D1 SAID THAT HE TRIED TO CHANGE LANES FROM LEFT LANE TO RIGHT LANE, AND THAT D2 (IN RIGHT LANE) SPED UP TO CUT HIM OFF. THEN AS THEY CURVED ONTO KIRKWOOD, D2 SUDDENLY BRAKED IN FRONT OF V1. D1 SAID HE TRIED TO BRAKE BUT REAR ENDED V2 IN THE ROADWAY.D2 SAID THAT V1 TRIED TO CUT HIM OFF ON ADAMS, THEN SPED UP AT HIM AS THEY TURNED ONTO KIRKWOOD AVE. HE DENIED BRAKE CHECKING AND SAID THAT V1 SPED UP AND REAR ENDED HIM IN THE ROADWAY.NO INJURIES REPORTED.
D1 WAS HEADING WEST ON MCNEELY NEAR VINCA LANE WHEN A DEER RAN OUT OF THE WOODS AND STRUCK V1 ON DRIVERS SIDE.

V1, an electric scooter, was traveling in a construction zone southbound on N Jordan Ave. South of E 10th St. and struck uneven pavement, causing it to topple over, throwing both passengers.D1 advised that she was on the front of V1 driving it, and P1 was standing behind her. D1 advised that she was traveling southbound on N Jordan Ave. just south of the intersection of E 10th St. D1 advised that she did not know that she was in a construction zone because the construction barriers had been moved. D1 advised that she did not see that the pavement was torn up and when she hit the uneven pavement, the scooter toppled over and threw both D1 and P1. D1 sustained scrapes to her hands and knees and shins. D1 was not transported for treatment.P1 advised that she was on the back of V1, an electric scooter, riding southbound on N Jordan Ave. just south of the E 10th St. intersection. P1 advised that the pavement was torn up and neither her nor D1 noticed until the scooter struck the uneven pavement and toppled over, throwing both of them. P1 advised that she hit the ground and everything hurt. There were no visible injuries, just the complaint of pain and hand tremors. P1 was transported to the hospital for treatment. V1 appeared to have some scratches to the paint, but was otherwise unharmed. The ID number of the Lime-S Scooter was 212-997.W1 advised that he was walking northbound on the sidewalk on the west side of N Jordan Ave. near the collision. W1 advised that V1 was traveling southbound on N Jordan Ave. just south of the intersection of E 10th St. W1 advised that V1 was in the construction zone and as soon as it got to the uneven pavement, D1 lost control and V1 toppled over throwing both riders from the scooter.
V1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A DRIVEWAY AT 4156 W BELLE AVE AND BACKED INTO V2 THAT WAS PARKED FACING EASTBOUND IN THE EASTBOUND LANE OF W. BELLE AVE.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST, JUST SOUTH OF NORTH DRIVE.D1 SAID SHE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE, SIGNALED A RIGHT TURN, THEN STARTED TO TURN RIGHT INTO SONIC AT 2020 S. WALNUT ST, AND STRUCK V2.D2 SAID SHE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE, AND THAT V1 CAME FROM BEHIND HER IN THE LEFT LANE, AND TURNED RIGHT INTO V2.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

D1 NOT INJURED. V1 DROVE SOUTH INTO BUILDING OF 4019 W 3RD STREET; 420 SMOKE SHOP. V1 BROKE LARGE STORE WINDOW AND CAUSED A SMALL CRACK IN OTHER WINDOW. BOTH WINDOWS SEPARATED BY BRICK COLUMN. BRICK COLUMN HAS SMALL AMOUNT OF DAMAGE. V1 HAS DAMAGE TO FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE. D1 STATED THAT THE GAS PEDAL GOT STUCK WHEN HE WAS TRYING TO PARK GOING SOUTH INTO SPOT. DRIVER DID NOT SMELL OF ALCOHOL OR ILLEGAL DRUGS, NO CRIME.LANDLORD ADVISED BY STAFF AND STAFF GIVEN A FIELD FORM.

On 6/13/2019 at approximately 4:07pm, I, Officer Aaron Byerley, was dispatched to an accident located at 3905 S Walnut Street.V2 was stopped in traffic heading south on Walnut Street. D1 of V1 stated that she was driving south on Walnut and looked down at her phone. When D1 looked up from her phone, she realized that the V2 was stopped in traffic in front of her. V1 was unable to stop in time and hit the back of D2's trailer. The rear of D2's trailer and the rear of V2 were both damaged as a result of this accident.V1 was towed due to disabling damage to the front of the vehicle by Ken's Westside.This accident can be confirmed by Dreama Barden, who witnessed the accident.

D1 stated she was westbound on SR 46 when her steering wheel locked up, pulling her vehicle to the left, over the center line and into the eastbound lane. While V1 was in the eastbound lane, they collided with V2, pushing V2 off the roadway and into a fence. After V1 hit V2, V1 left the road and also hit a fence that belonged to the same owner. The fence belonged to Mr. Neidigh at 8700 W SR 46, Bloomington. Mr. Neidigh's Phone number is 812-327-3144.

On 06/13/2019 D2 stated she was turning left (west) from Cory Lane on to W Third when D1 disregarded the red light on W Third Street and struck V2 on the front right bumper. D2 stated the D1 accelerated and left the scene. D2 stated she had the green light in her lane. D2 stated she tried to follow V1 but lost sight after she had to stop at a red light.

Officer Pesa assisted with traffic control and initial information gathering.V2 was in a left-only turn lane behind additional vehicles traveling northbound.V1 was traveling northbound in the west-most straight lane.D2 stated that he was in the left-only turn lane and was behind unrelated vehicles attempting to also turn left. As D2 was slowly traveling forward, V1 struck his right, front passenger door area.D1 stated that she was initially in the northbound, west-most lane and realized that she needed to merge into the left-only turn lane. She then merged into the left-only lane and did not see V2. She then collided with V2 using her front, driver side bumper. None of the parties involved complained of pain during the investigation. Both vehicles had damage, but both appeared to be safely driven from the scene.D1 was also cited for not having a child properly restrained in the backseat.

Driver 2 stated that he was south on SR 45/46 just past 7th St in the left lane, slowing to change lanes into the left turn lane. Driver 2 stated that there had been a car behind him as he approached 7th St. Driver 2 stated that the car turned onto 7th St and the SUV that eventually hit him was behind that car. Driver 2 stated that the SUV accelerated rapidly after the other car turned and proceeded to run into the rear of driver 2's car, sending it into several spins across the median into oncoming traffic. Driver 2 stated the other vehicle then left the scene without stopping. Witness 1 stated that he was north on SR 45/46 passing the accident. He stated that he observed a silver SUV traveling very fast come up behind vehicle 2 and collide with the rear of vehicle 2, sending it spinning across the median. Witness 1 advised that the SUV continued on without stopping. Witness 2 was not at the scene and I was unable to make contact with them. Driver 1 was located later in the day and made the following statement. Driver 1 stated that he was in the left lane of SR 45/46 southbound when vehicle 2 changed lanes from the right lane into the left lane in front of him. Driver 1 claimed that vehicle 2 hit the front of his vehicle as it was changing lanes, causing vehicle 2 to spin out in what driver 1 called a "pit maneuver". The damage to vehicle 1 was not consistent with the impact happening from a lane change from vehicle 1's right. Driver 1 also stated that he was eating a breakfast sandwich at the time of the accident.

D1 stated he was using his cell phone as he was approaching the intersection at N Curry Pike and W Woodyard Rd when he rear-ended V2. V2 was pushed into V3, which was pushed into V4. D1 also admitted to drinking alcohol prior to operating the vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was pulling off of Harmony Rd to make a left hand turn west bound onto SR 45 when she pulled into the path of V2. V2 was east bound on SR 45 when V1 pulled into his lane of travel. V2 struck V1 in the drivers door area causing heavy damage and airbag deployment on V1.

D1 statement: D1 stated that he was driving V1 south on S. Walnut St. And lost control of V1. D1 also stated that his loss of control of V1 cause it to strike V2 and V3, which were parked in the parking lane..V2 owner's statement: Owner of V2 stated that he was inside his residence and heard a loud noise. When he came outside, he noticed V1 had already collided with parked V2 and V3.V3 owner's statement: Owner of V3 was not on scene at the time of collision. Upon arrival, the owner of V3 stated that he did not know about the collision until notified by Bloomington Police Department.SUPPLEMENT: 06-21-2019CORRECTED THE CASE NUMBER FROM B19-097 (WRONG) TO B19-24100 (CORRECT).

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were traveling eastbound on 3rd Street. V1 attempted to pass another vehicle, running into V2 which was next to V1. V2 then struck a curb and a tree causing V2 to overturn.D1 stated that she was attempting to pass a vehicle in front of her and did not check her blind spot. She then struck V2.D2 stated that she was traveling east on 3rd Street when V1 struck her in the side causing her vehicle to overturn.V1 did fail to yield to vehicle 2 causing damage to both vehicles.

V1 and V2 in the parking lot of 2510 S. Leonard Springs Road. V1 was backing into a parking space next to V2 when D1 unsafely backed over the line into the right rear side of V2. V2 was parked and occupied by the passenger but vehicle was not on at the time.Minor damage to both vehicles

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S ROGERS STREET APPROACHING W COOLIDGE DRIVE. D1 STATED SHE WAS GOING THE SPEED LIMIT. D1 STATED SHE SAW A GROUP OF BICYCLISTS COMING EAST ON W COOLIDGE DRIVE AND CONTINUED, AS SHE DOES NOT HAVE A STOP SIGN. D1 STATED THE BICYCLE THEN STRUCK HER SUV AS THE BICYCLE TRIED TO TURN. DAMAGE SCRAPE DOWN PASSENGER SIDE AND BUSTED OUT MIRROR OF PASSENGER SIDE.V2 IS A BICYCLE. V2 WAS GOING EAST ON W COOLIDGE DRIVE APPROACHING S ROGERS STREET. V2 WAS TRYING TO CROSS STREET AND TURN NORTH. V2 STATED BIKE HAS NO BRAKES. V2 STATED V1 WAS SPEEDING AND CONFUSED HIM BY SLOWING THEN SPEEDING UP AGAIN. V2 STATED HE WAS NOT AWARE THAT V1 COULD JUST CONTINUE SOUTH AND DID NOT HAVE TO YIELD TO HIM (ON THE BICYCLE). I INFORMED HIM V1 DID NOT HAVE A STOP SIGN AND THAT BICYCLES ALSO HAVE TO OBEY THE RULES OF THE ROAD.V2 STATED HE TRIED TO TURN LEFT AND AVOID A HARD COLLISION AND STRUCK V1. DAMAGE TO FRONT TIRE/WHEEL OF BICYCLE. D2 HAS A SCRAPE ON HIS RIGHT KNEE AND NO OTHER VISIBLE INJURY. PICTURES TAKEN OF DAMAGE AND SMALL INJURY.I HAVE CALLED POSSIBLE WITNESS TWICE AND THEY DID NOT PICK UP INCLUDING LEAVING A VOICEMAIL.I CALLED THE BICYCLIST'S MOTHER TWICE AND IT RINGS ONCE AND GOES TO A VOICEMAIL THAT IS NOT SET UP.

D1 stated he was facing eastbound in the Bucceto's parking lot waiting to pull out onto S. Liberty Drive to head north. D1 stated a vehicle in front of V2 waived him to pull out onto Liberty Dr. D1 stated he turned into the outside lane of S. Liberty Drive and while doing so was struck by D2 on the rear passenger side of his V1. Damage was observed on the rear passenger side of V1. D2 stated he was in travelling northbound on S. Liberty Drive. D2 stated he went to merge into the left turn lane when V1 turned out in front of him causing him to slam on his brakes. D2 stated the front drivers side of his V2 struck V1. Damage was observed on the front drivers side of V2. There were four passengers on the bus during the accident. No injuries were reported.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: On 6/14/2019 at approximately 2:11pm, I, Officer Byerley, was dispatched to a vehicle accident near the accident of S Walnut Street and E Rhorer Road.Upon arrival, I made contact with Danielle Martin, who witnessed the accident. Danielle was sitting in a vehicle traveling southbound two vehicles behind D2 of V2. Danielle stated that the vehicle sitting in front of D2 was stopped and was waving D1 to pull into traffic from the west side of S Walnut. V1 pulled out into traffic, crossing the south bound lane, and attempted to head north on S Walnut. D2 was attempting to pass the stopped vehicle in front of him and merge into the left turn lane when V2 collided head on with V1.D1's injuries from the crash consisted of bruised knees, swelling in the right knee with a little numbness, right hip pain, neck pain, and bruising and small abrasions on the lower part of her arms.D2's injuries consisted of neck pain and shoulder pain, as well as chest pain with some numbness. It should be noted that D2 had recently had heart surgery.The passenger in V2, Christina Potts, had complaints of knee pain and right shoulder pain from her seat belt.
AS A VEHICLE IN FRONT OF V2 BEGAN TO SLOW DOWN V2 DID SO AS WELL. AS V2 WAS SLOWING TO A STOP V1 STRUCK THE REAR PASSSENGER SIDE BUMPER OF V2.

V1 was traveling west in the parking lot. V2 was parked facing south in the parking lot. V1 attempted to turn south into the parking spot next to V2. V1 did not estimate his turn properly. V1 then struck V2. There was scratch/scuff damage to the drivers side of V2. There was moderate paint damage to the front passenger side of V1. D1 stated that he was attempting to park in the space. D1 stated that he went to turn left into the space and did not leave enough room to make the turn. D1 stated that V1 then struck the side of V2. V2 was parked and unoccupied. There were no injuries and no vehicles had to be towed. Both vehicles are owned by Enterprise Rent A Car and are self insured.

Vehicle 2 was parked in the parking lot of Target. While Vehicle 2 was parked and unattended, Vehicle 1 struck Vehicle 2, causing damage.Vehicle 1 fled the scene of the accident before Driver 1 could be identified.

I arrived on scene just after Lt Mullis and Deputy Hutchens. Deputy Hetchens was conducting an OWI investigation with D1. V1 was traveling south on S Fairfax Rd in the area of Cherry Ln. V1 crossed the center line and left the east side of the roadway at the intersection and traveled through the front yard of 5625 S Fairfax Rd causing damage to the yard and then striking a wooden retaining wall causing damage to the wall. It appeared by the skid marks in the yard of the residence and the damage to the wall that V1 had been traveling at a high rate of speed just prior to leaving the roadway. Deputy Hutchens obtained a PBT result from D1 and it was .128. D1 did not appear injured in the crash. V1 was towed due to disabling damage. Photos were taken of the scene and V1. Lt Mullis spoke to the home owner, Nancy Leonard (812) 361-7893, who stated her sister in-law had just gotten up to take out the dog and heard a loud bang and walked outside and saw D1 sitting in V1, and V1 was against the retaining wall. Nancy then called 911.

Driver of vehicle 1, Hayden, was stopping in traffic for an approaching ambulance, when he was rear ended by vehicle 2.Driver of vehicle 2, Bunch, stated that Hayden had stopped quickly for the ambulance, and he wasn't able to stop before running into the rear of vehicle 2.Driver 1, Hayden, stated that he had some neck pain and his passenger, Grace Hayden, was complaining of some shoulder and hip pain.Also, other than the rear damage to vehicle 1, the impact also dislodged a portion of the dash away from the vehicle about 1 to 2 inches.

Driver of vehicle 1, Hillenburg, stated that he was stopped in traffic for an approaching ambulance, when he was rear ended by vehicle 2.Driver of vehicle 2, Miller, stated that she was unable to stop when she saw vehicle 1, and rear ended his semi trailer.The owner of vehicle 2 was able to drive the disabled vehicle to a gas station temporarily to later have it towed on his own.A tow truck from Ken's Westside was called by the owner of vehicle 1, to wench the rear bumper of the trailer away from the tire that it was pended against before it could be driven away.
D1 SAID SHE WAS TURNING RIGHT INTO A PARKING SPACE BEHIND THE BUILDING, ACCIDENTIALLY HIT GAS AND NOT BRAKE. JUMPED THE CURB, AND STRUCK THE CORNER OF THE BUILDING CAUSING DAMAGE. NO INJURIES.

V1 was southbound on South Sare Road, approaching the intersection of East Canada Drive, when it struck the rear end of V2, which was stopped at a stop sign at the intersection. D1 stated she was behind V2, who was stopped at the stop sign, when she thought that V2 was about to go through the stop sign. D1 stated she started to drive forward when V2 stopped and she struck the rear end of V2. D2 stated she was stopped at the stop sign when V1 struck the rear end of her vehicle.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave. V1 was in the right lane and V2 was in the left lane.D1 stated she was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the right lane. D1 stated she needed to make a left turn (southbound) onto Swain Ave. D1 stated she checked her mirrors and proceeded to make the turn. D1 stated that as she was switching lanes and attempting to make the turn onto Swain Ave, she collided with V2. D1 stated V2 was in her blind-spot and did not see the V2. V1 had heavy damage to the rear driver side of the vehicle.D1 admitted to consuming alcoholic beverages earlier in the day. D1 had an odor of alcoholic beverage emitting from her exhaled breath. D1 performed SFSTs and did not exhibit any clues. D1 provided a preliminary breath sample of .00. No enforcement action was taken against D1.D2 stated he was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the left lane. D2 stated that as he was approaching Swain Ave, V1 attempted to turn onto Swain Ave and collided with him. D2 stated he attempted to avoid colliding with V1 but was unsuccessful. V2 had damage to the front passenger side bumper of the vehicle.

D1 WAS SOUTH ON COLLEGE MALL RD IN RIGHT LANE BEHIND V2. D2 STATED A VEHICLE STOPPED IN FRONT OF HIM AND HE BRAKED TO SLOW DOWN TO KEEP FROM HITTING THAT VEHICLE AND V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR. D1 STATED THAT WHEN THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN AND TRAFFIC STARTED TO GO, SUDDENLY V2 BRAKED AND SLOWED AND D1 DID NOT HAVE TIME TO STOP BEFORE STRIKING V2 FROM THE REAR.

Driver 1 stated he was traveling southbound on Interstate 69 approaching the the College Avenue exit at mile marker 123. Driver 1 stated as he was entering the ramp exit his phone that was sitting on his passenger seat began to ring and he looked over at it and attempted to answer it. Driver 1 stated he then went straight through the ramp exit into the grass field and continued in attempt to get back onto the roadway but went into an embankment where he collided with a collection of rocks. Driver 1 declined medical personnel. Vehicle sustained front and driver side damage along with air bag deployment. Vehicle 1 was towed by Kens Westside to Ricks Towing.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOPLIGHT, FACING E/B, ON THE STATE ROAD 45/46 BYPASS, IN THE RIGHT LANE OF THE TWO LEFT HAND TURN LANES TO TURN N/B ON N WALNUT ST. V2 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOPLIGHT AT THE SAME INTERSECTION, FACING S/B ON N WALNUT ST IN THE LEFT MOST TURN LANE FOR THE LEFT HAND TURN LANES TO TURN E/B ONTO THE BYPASS. V3 WAS NEXT TO V1 IN THE LEFT HAND LANE OF THE TWO LEFT HAND TURN LANES, FACING E/B, STOPPED AT THE STOPLIGHT. V4 WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND V3. UPON THE STOPLIGHT TURNING GREEN FOR V1, V3, AND V4 TO TURN N/B ONTO S WALNUT, BOTH V1 AND V3 BEGAN TURNING LEFT. V1 ACCELERATED TOO QUICKLY IN THE RAINING CONDITIONS AND LOST CONTROL, VEERING IN FRONT OF V3. V3 SUBSEQUENTLY STRUCK V1 ON THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE DOOR. AS THIS OCCURED, V1 WAS STILL IN MOTION, AND CONTINUED TURNING TO THE LEFT, EVENTUALLY STRIKING V2 AS IT WAS STILL STOPPED AT THE STOP LIGHT. V4 WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND V3 DURING THE TURN AND THE ACCIDENT, AND UPON THE SUDDEN BRAKING AND ABURBT STOP OF V3, V4 REAR ENDED V3.

VEHICLE #1 WAS WEST BOUND ATTEMPTING TO ENTER NORTH MOUNT TABOR ROAD FROM A GRAVEL LANE ON THE EAST SIDE OF NORTH MOUNT TABOR ROAD AND APPROXIMATELY 183 FEET NORTH OF COWDEN ROAD AND TO THE NORTH OF VEHICLE #2. VEHICLE #2 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED FACING EAST EIGHT FEET EAST OF NORTH MOUNT TABOR ROAD ON THE SAME GRAVEL LANE AND SOUTH OF VEHICLE #1 APPROXIMATELY 183 FEET NORTH OF COWDEN ROAD. VEHICLE #1'S RIGHT FRONT WHEEL BECAME STUCK THE DRAINAGE DITCH ALONG NORTH MOUNT TABOR ROAD. DRIVER #1 ATTEMPTED TO BACK OUT OF THE DITCH AND STRUCK VEHICLE #2 IN THE DRIVER'S SIDE MIRROR WITH THE LEFT REAR CORNER OF VEHICLE #1. AT THE TIME OF THE CRASH THERE WAS HEAVY RAIN FOLLOWING A TORNADO WITH NO LIGHTING IN THE AREA.DRIVER #1 STATED HE WAS TRYING TO BACK OUT OF THE DITCH AND DID NOT SEE HE WAS BACKING INTO VEHICLE #2.

I arrived on scene and spoke to D1 and he stated V1 was traveling north on I69 just south of exit 114 when high winds picked up the front of his vehicle and when it came back down the vehicle was pointed toward the guardrail . D1 stated he lost control of V1 and it struck the guardrail. D1 stated he was able to get V1 onto the shoulder of the road. I observed damage to the front of V1 consistent with striking a guardrail. There was also severe weather in the area and possible tornado activity at the time of the crash. D1 was not injured in the crash. V1 was towed due to disabling damage.

V1 was traveling west on West Bolin Ln and hit a tree that had fallen across the roadway. V1 drove over the tree before stopping. D1 stated that he did not see the tree across the road because of the heavy rain.

D1 SAID HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON MONROE ST, APPROACHING 12TH ST, AND ANOTHER VEHICLE WAS PASSING HIM NORTH BOUND. D1 SAID THAT VEHICLE HAD VERY BRIGHT HALOGEN HEADLIGHTS, AND WAS CROWDING THE CENTER LINES TOWARD HIM. HE SAID HE SWERVED TO THE RIGHT TO AVOID IT, AND STRUCK V2, THEN V3.V2 AND V3 WERE PARKED ON THE WEST SIDE OF MONROE ST, FACING SOUTH. BOTH OWNERS WERE FOUND AND NOTIFIED.D1 ARRANGED A PRIVATE TOW OF V1, DUE TO DAMAGE. NO INJURIES REPORTED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was backing out of parking spot in Menards parking lot when he left his rear passenger door open. The passenger door struck V2 in the drivers side causing damage to both vehicles.

D-1 stated he was traveling east bound on E. Robinson Rd. When D-1 believes he fell asleep but not sure. V-1then ran off the north side of the roadway striking a tree. D-1 was given SFST's and PBT and passed all tests.

6/15/2019Officer Nathan KoontzOn the above date, I was stopped in traffic on East 3rd Street facing west in the far left turn lane of the State Road 46/College Mall Rd. intersection in marked unit 224. I noticed a black SUV turn left onto eastbound 3rd Street from State Road 46. As the vehicle made the turn, it "fish tailed" and began to drive toward my vehicle. Just before colliding into my patrol car, the vehicle hit the median on 3rd Street and changed direction to go south across 3rd Street. The vehicle then collided with a concrete post in the grass on the south side of 3rd Street. The vehicle did not stop, it regained direction and fled eastbound on 3rd Street.I initiated my emergency lights, then crossed the raised median of 3rd Street and went eastbound on 3rd in emergency mode attempting to catch up to the vehicle. As I approached the Smith Road intersection, I saw a black SUV in the distance turn north from 3rd Street into a business parking lot. I attempted to find the vehicle in two parking lots on the north side of 3rd Street, but was unable to locate the vehicle. The black SUV that I saw turn into a lot was not the vehicle in question. I determined that I was unable to locate the vehicle and went to the Burger King located at 3rd and College Mall Road. I met with Officer Cooksey who was in the office of Burger King looking at video footage. Video footage captured the vehicle crossing 3rd Street and colliding with the concrete post. The license plate of the vehicle was unreadable. The vehicle appeared to be an older model black GMC Jimmy or perhaps a Yukon. Officer Cooksey and I were unable to determine exactly what model of SUV the vehicle was.The concrete post was a short concrete post that is believed to be part of the Old National Bank that was formerly located at that location. It is believed that the post belongs to Burger King. There is no further information regarding this case. The vehicle, its owner and occupants are unknown at this time. This case is inactive.

On 6/15/2019, I was dispatched to a property damage accident at 220 E 3rd Street.I spoke with D1 of V1 who stated that while driving over a raised cross walk in the parking lot, the trailer that was attached to the trailer came unattached and hit the back of V1 in the bumper just as V1 was coming to a stop. It appeared that the locking mechanism was not properly engaged.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were southbound on South Interstate 69 in Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana near mile marker 114.5. V1 was operating in the number four lane while V2 was operating in the number one lane and transitioning into the number two lane to avoid an object in the roadway. V1 began to lose rear traction north of the Rockport Road overpass and began rotating clockwise. Driver 1 appears to over-correct the loss of traction and causes V1 to rotate counter clockwise across lane three and two where it strikes V2 in the passenger side doors/quarter panels. V1 continues into the center median wall and V2 maintains control and pulls off onto the right shoulder.The entire collision sequence was recorded by a vehicle mounted camera inside vehicle 2. Video footage is available from the Monroe County Sheriff's Office. This area was experiencing heavy rain and winds at the time of the collision.

VEHICLE 1 (SUBARU LEGACY) WAS SLOWING OR STOPPED SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AT KIRKWOOD. AS DRIVER 1 (EMILY TUCK) WAITED FOR A PEDESTRIAN TO CROSS THE CROSSWALK, HER VEHICLE WAS REAR ENDED BY VEHICLE 2 (JEEP CHEROKEE) DRIVEN BY ANDREW TODD.VEHICLE 2 (JEEP CHEROKEE) WAS GOING SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AT KIRKWOOD. DRIVER 2 (ANDREW YOUNG) REAR ENDED VEHICLE 1 (SUBARU LEGACY). AFTER VEHICLE 2 (JEEP CHEROKEE) REAR ENDED VEHICLE 1 (SUBARU LEGACY), VEHICLE 2 (JEEP CHEROKEE) WAS REAR ENDED BY VEHICLE 3 (HONDA ACCORD).VEHICLE 3 (HONDA ACCORD) WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE APPROACHING KIRKWOOD. VEHICLE 3 (HONDA ACCORD) REAR ENDED VEHICLE 2 (JEEP CHEROKEE) AFTR IT CAME TO A SUDDEN STOP.

VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND IN WEST GIFFORD RD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF WOODSIDE DRIVE, WHEN A TREE BRANCH FELL ON HIS CAR. DRIVER 1 STATED THAT PART OF THIS SAME TREE FELL ON ANOTHER ONE OF HIS VEHICLES PRIOR TO THIS OCCURANCE. DRIVER 1 WAS ADVISED BY HIS INSURANCE COMPANY, IF IT HAPPENED AGAIN TO CALL POLICE TO RECEIVE A REPORT.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND DENIED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.VEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Veh #2 was unoccupied and parked on the west side of the parking lot of the Taco Bell at 3811 W SR46, facing west. Veh #1 was backing from a parking space directly east from Veh #2. Driver #1 stated that she was unfamiliar with driving such a large vehicle and as she was backing up, the right rear of the U Haul truck she was driving struck the right rear of Veh #2.

Both vehicles were in the IU Athletic Blue Lot south of Assembly Hall. V1 was facing north in a spot to the south west of V2. V2 was parked facing south. V1 drove forward and attempted to turn right (east) to exit into the aisle. V1 took the turn too sharp and the right passenger side of V1 struck the right rear corner of V2. V2 was unoccupied. D1 stated he simply took the turn to sharp and struck V2. There is minor damage to V1 near the right rear passenger door. V2 has minor dents and cosmetic damage to the right rear corner.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: I69 is an interstate (multiple lanes with guard rail and grass median) that runs primarily north and south. I-69 is constructed of sections of asphalt and concrete. The area where this crash took place was curved with a downward grade. The roadway was wet with water moving across it. It was daylight and cloudy, with heavy rain.Vehicle #1 was traveling north on I-69 north of 130mm in the left lane. As it started to ascend down and slightly turn at the curve just north of the 130mm the vehicle hydroplaned due to the moving water over the roadway. Vehicle #1 then drifted to the median where the front of the vehicle collided with the guard rail, before turning 180 degrees and colliding with the guard rail with the right rear. Vehicle #1 came to rest just north of the impact area, between the fog line and guard rail.Vehicle #1 was traveling north on I-69 north of the 130mm in the left lane.Driver #1 indicated she was just driving along when she noticed water moving across the roadway, just north of the 130mm on I-69 north. Driver #1 indicated that the vehicle began to lose control and drift toward the median guard rail, as she attempted to steer away. Driver #1 indicated she was unable to avoid colliding with the guard rail with the front of Vehicle #1, along with the second impact of the right rear of the vehicle. Driver #1 indicated she was eventually able to control the vehicle between the fog line and guard rail in the median north of the 130mm on I-69.The evidence shows the impacted area of the entire front bumper, the right front tire (flat) and the right rear of the vehicle. Driver #1 indicated she wanted a crash report and believed the damage to be over $1,000.00. Vehicle #1 was towed by Pritchard's Towing in Bloomington.

V1 AND V2 WERE TRAVELING NB ON S CURRY PIKE, JUST SOUTH OF W FARMER AVE WHEN THEY COLLIDED. V1 HAD FRONT END DAMAGE AND V2 HAD FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE DAMAGED1 STATED THAT HE WAS IN THE AREA OF S CURRY PIKE WHERE IT SPLITS FROM ONE NB LANE TO TWO NB LANES. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING NB AND ACTIVATED HIS TURN SIGNAL TO GET INTO THE LEFT LANE WHEN D2 SPED PAST HIM AND HE CAME INTO CONTACT WITH V1.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NB ON S CURRY PIKE IN THE RIGHT HAND LANE WHEN V1 GOT INTO HER LANE AND STRUCK HER. FOLLOWING THE COLLISION, BOTH VEHICLES MOVED FROM THE POINT OF THE COLLISION AND MOVED OFF OF THE ROAWAY.NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED SINCE BOTH VEHICLES MOVED FROM POINT OF IMPACT AND MOVED OFF THE ROADWAY.

ALL VEHICLES WERE IN THE EASTBOUND LANES OF EAST 3RD STREET JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION WITH SOUTH PARK RIDGE ROAD. D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING EASTBOUND IN THE LEFT LANE WHEN THE VEHICLE DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER CHANGED LANES ABRUPTLY. D1 STATED ALMOST IMMEDIATELY AFTER SHE REAR ENDED V2 DUE TO NOT SEEING V2 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. V2 WAS THEN PUSHED INTO THE REAR OF V3.D2 AND D3 GAVE A SIMILAR ACCOUNT OF THE ACCIDENT. V2 AND V3 WERE STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY DUE TO A VEHICLE UP AHEAD WAITING TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN.V1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER. D1 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER CHEST AND ABRASIONS ON HER RIGHT AND LEFT ARMS. SHE ALSO HAD AN ABRASION ON HER RIGHT HAND. SHE WAS TREATED BY EMS ON SCENE AND DECLINED TO BE TRANSPORTED.V2 HAD DAMAGE TO THE REAR AND FRONT BUMPERS.V3 HAD DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER.SUPPLEMENT 1: ALL OTHER DRIVERS AND PASSENGERS WERE SEEN BY EMS BUT DECLINED TREATMENT DUE TO NOT BEING INJURED.

D1 stated he was eastbound on State Road 46 near W Flatwoods Rd when he looked off the roadway at some of the damage that was caused by a tornado the night before. D1 then stated that when he looked back, V2 was slowing to stop but D1 was unable to stop his vehicle in time to avoid colliding with V2. V2 was then pushed into the back and side of V3 before resting in front of V3

D1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON OLD SR RD 37 IN THE 6700 BLK AND STRUCK A DEER IN THE ROADWAY. D1 CONTINUED TO DRIVE SOUTH TO THE PARKING LOT OF A CHURCH LOCATED AT 6055 N OLD SR 37 IN ORDER TO GET TO A SAFE LOCATION AND BE OUT OF THE DARK UNLIT ROADWAY, V1 SUSTAINED FRONT END DAMAGE BUT WAS DRIVEABLE AND DID NOT REQUIRE TO BE TOWED. THE DEER WAS NOT LOCATED HOWEVER THERE WAS FUR AND BLOOD COMPACTED IN THE GRILL/ FENDER AREA OF V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was stopped facing east on 14th Street at the Walnut Street intersection and began to move forward. V2 was northbound on Walnut Street approaching the 14th Street intersection.D1 stated she was stopped facing east on 14th Street at the Walnut Street intersection in V1. She stated that she crept forward a little to get a better view of north bound traffic on Walnut Street. She stated that she moved a little too far on to Walnut Street and collided with V2.D2 stated he was north bound on Walnut Street approaching 14th Street in V2. He stated that V1 was stopped facing east on 14th Street. D2 stated that as he approached, V1 moved forward on to Walnut Street and collided with his vehicle.There was damage to the front passenger side bumper and quarter panel of V1 and damage to the front driver side bumper and quarter panel of V2. Neither party complained of pain. Neither vehicle was towed due to disabling damage.

V1 was heading South on College Avenue approaching 3rd Street.V1 disregarded the red light and struck V2. V2 was heading West on 3rd Street approaching College Avenue. V2 went through the intersection and was struck by V1. D1 stated that he was timing the lights going South on College Avenue. D1 stated as he approached the intersection at 3rd Street he saw the light changing that was for traffic heading East/West. D1 was not sure what color his light was but that he was timing the light so his had to be green. D1 explained that there should be a 3 second delay between lights for them to change so he thinks D2 ran the red light. D2 stated she was heading West on 3rd Street approaching College Avenue. D2 stated she had a green light.D2 stated as she was going through the intersection, D1 ran the red light and struck the front of her vehicle. Witness1 and Witness2 stated they were in the turn lane of 3rd Street attempting to turn South on College Avenue. W1 and W2 advised that they had a green light along with D2.
