W1 and W2 advised that D1 ran his red light heading South and struck V2. After the vehicles collided V1 rolled onto it passenger side and came to a stop in the East bound lanes of 3rd Street. D1 was issued a citation for disregarding a lighted signal.D1 did not have a complaint of pain.D2 had complaint of pain to left knee and chest.

On 6/19/2019, I spoke with the owner of V2, Kyle Dugger, who informed me that his vehicle was struck on 6/16/2019 at approximately 8:30PM.Dugger provided video footage from 1412 S. Monon Dr. (four Seasons Gun Shop) of an unknown V1 backing out from the parking lot, located behind 1404 S. Walnut St., striking a parked unoccupied V2 on the front driver side, and leaving the scene without attempting to provide information. The only information that could be gained from the video is that V1 is a light colored passenger car.Based on the footage provided from Dugger, owner of V2, V1 struck a parked V2 while backing out of a private lot, leaving the scene without attempting to contact Dugger.On 7/7/2019, I located the suspected D1, who did admit to striking parked V2 the night of 6/16/2019. D1 was subsequently cited, and insurance information was gathered from D1.

D-1 stated that he was traveling West on State Road 46 east in the 5000 block when he ran off the roadway for an unknown reason. Once V-1 left the roadway on the north side it collided with a utility pole causing it to snap then struck a stone column belonging to the homeonwer of 5005 E St Rd 46. D-1 refused medical on scene and his vehicle was towed due to the damage. Duke energy had to respond to the scene to repair the pole.

On 6/16/2019, at approximately 1:52PM, I arrived to 302 N. Rogers St. Parking lot regarding a report of a vehicle leaving the scene after an accident. I made contact with D2, who stated that she was inside the building attending church services when the accident occurred.D2 stated that between approximately 11:00AM AND 12:50PM, an unknown D1 struck the rear passenger side of her parked vehicle, causing damage. D2 stated that when she parked her vehicle on the North side of 302 N. Rogers St., there were no other vehicles parked near V2, and she was not able to provide any possible description of D1/V1.Based on the damage to V2, my investigation has yielded that an unknown V1/D1 attempted to pull into the parking space to the west of the unoccupied V1, striking the parked V2 on the rear passenger side, and left the scene without attempting to provide any contact/insurance information.

V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S COLLEGE AVE. D2 ADVISED THEY HAD A GREEN LIGHT, AS THEY WERE PASSING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF W 3RD ST, V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1 BY TURNING IN FRONT OF V2. THIS COLLISION FORCED V2 EAST WHERE IT STRUCK V3 WHICH WAS STOPPED ON ARLINGTON ROAD. D2 ADVISED THAT THE TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE WAS YELLOW AS HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION. D1 ADMITTED FAULT.

D1 STATED SHE PULLED INTO THE PARKING LOT NORTH BOUND AND STOPPED TO BACK WEST INTO A VACANT PARKING SPACE. D1 STATED AS SHE WAS BACKING, SHE STRUCK THE DRIVERS REAR BUMPER OF V2 WHICH WAS PARKED UNATTENDED IN THE SPACE NORTH OF THE VACANT SPACE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS GOING NORTH AND TURNING EAST ON TO ROUND ABOUT AND DID NOT SEE DRIVER 2 WHO WAS ALREADY IN THE ROUND ABOUT .

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING A LEFT TURN AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH STATE ROAD 37 AND EAST SMITHVILLE ROAD TRAVELING EAST. VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 37. VEHICLE 1 WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 2 IN THE PASSENGER SIDE WHILE VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING THE TURN.DRIVER 1 AND PASSENGER WERE TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH WITH CHEST AND NECK INJURIES. DRIVER 2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH FOR CHEST AND ANKLE PAIN.BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED DUE TO DAMAGE BY HAWKINS TO HAWKINS. SIDE AIRBAGS WERE DEPLOYED IN BOTH VEHICLES. DRIVER AND PASSENGER AIRBAGS DEPLOYED IN VEHICLE 2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On 6/17/2019 at approximately 6:52pm, I, Officer Byerley, was dispatched to a personal injury accident at 3001 E 3rd St involving three vehicles.Upon arrival, I made contact with a witness named Zoe Punske. Zoe stated that she saw V1 traveling East and sitting in the center turn lane. Zoe then stated that V1 began making a left turn towards the entrance of Taco Bell. Zoe stated that when V1 made the left turn, V1 then hit V2 head on. Zoe stated that after the two vehicles collided, V2 was hit by V3, then V2 spun around and ended up backwards on the curb in front of Taco Bell. This account was also confirmed with the drivers of V1 and V2.The driver and passenger of V2 were transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for treatment and later discharged. D1 stated that he was fine and did not need any medical treatment. D2 stated that she had pain in her head, neck and back, as well as her chest. The passenger in V2 had a small cut on her forehead, as well as a small scrape on her stomach from her seat belt. D3 stated that he was fine and did not need any medical treatment.D3's statement was inconsistent. D3 stated that V1 went into the turn lane going in fact West and turned in front of V2 and V3, cutting them off. This contradicts all other statements and is not able to be proven to be correct at this point.*On 6/26/2019, I added the insurance policy number for D2.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH STREET IN THE LEFT HAND TURN LANE. V2 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH STREET IN THE STRAIGHT/RIGHT TURN LANE. V1 ATTEMPTED TO CHANGE LANES TO THE STRAIGHT/RIGHT TURN LANE, COLLIDING WITH THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE TIRE OF V2. V1 THEN CONTINUED DRIVING SB ON N PETE ELLIS DRIVE FAILING TO STOP AT THE SCENE.D1 WAS NOT ON SCENE FOR A STATEMENT.D2 STATED THAT V1 MERGED INTO HIS LANE CAUSING THE COLLISION. D2 STATED THAT THE MALE DRIVER DID NOT APPEAR TO REALIZE THE COLLISION HAD OCCURRED.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON 3RD STREET AT DUNN STREET.V2 WAS EASTBOUND ON 3RD STREET APPROACHING DUNN ST.D1 SAID HE WAS IN THE LEFT WESTBOUND LANE IN THE CURVE. HE SAID A TRUCK TO HIS RIGHT WAS COMING INTO HIS LANE SO HE MOVED OVER AS FAR AS HE COULD TO THE LEFT TO AVOID IT. HE SAID THE BACK OF HIS TRAILER WENT INTO THE OTHER LANE STRIKING V2.D2 SAID AS SHE DROVE EAST, THE TRAILER PULLED BY V1 CAME INTO HER LAND AND HIT V2.PRIMARY CAUSE LISTED AS OTHER (DRIVER) BECAUSE D1 SAID THE VEHICLE NEXT TO HIM WAS COMING INTO HIS LANE AND HE MOVED TO AVOID IT.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 45 WHEN IT RAN OFF THE ROAD AND STRUCK A GAURD RAIL NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH BREEDEN ROAD.DRIVER 1 STATED THAT HE MUST HAVE DOZED OFF AND WHEN HE CAME TWO HE JERKED THE WHEEL AND RAN OFF THE ROAD.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND DECLINED MEDICAL TREATMENTVEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM SCENE
Drive 1 stated he was going south on State Road 446 when a deer entered the roadway and ran into his vehicle.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N HARTSTRAIT RD WHEN A DEER CAME OUT INTO THE ROADWAY AND V1 STRUCK THE DEER WITH THE LEFT FRONT. D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN FRONT OF THE DRIVEWAY TO 3760 N HARTSTRAIT RD WHEN SHE STRUCK THE DEER AND THEN PULLED OFF OF THE ROADWAY INTO THE DRIVEWAY OF 3650 N HARTSTRAIT RD.

On 6/21/2019 at approximately 4:29pm, I, Officer Byerley, was dispatched to the Bloomington Police Department lobby in regards to a report of an accident where the other driver left the scene.Upon arrival, I made contact with Richard Hans, the owner V2. D2 stated that he parked his vehicle in the Morton Street Parking Garage located at 220 N Morton Street on 6/17/2019 at approximately 4pm, and parked on the third level in spot 363. D2 stated that he returned to his vehicle on 6/18/2019 at approximately 8am and discovered that his driver's side mirror had been hit and damaged.I called Ryan Daily, City Hall, who informed me that he would have one of his employees look into the video footage for the dates and times listed in attempt to identify a possible suspect.I was wearing BWC 1669 during this incident and it appeared to be in good working order.

I observed the operator in her car at the bottom of an embankment on the north side of State Road 46 facing westbound. Tire tracks indicated that the car had been driven through an unplanted agricultural field, down an embankment and was stuck in soft ground. Damage was visible to the front bumper, rear bumper, rear side glass, passenger side, and the tire was off of the passenger side front wheel. The operator was still attempting to drive the vehicle. Upon speaking with the driver I was concerned she was suffering from a medical emergency. The operator stated she was returning from the hospital after submitting to a blood test. She stated she had been experiencing "blackouts" and she also advised that she suffered from hypoglycemia. She stated she could not remember what happened or how she had gotten there. I did not detect any signs of illegal drug use. Monroe County Ambulance Service and local township fire First Responders arrived to provide a medical assessment of Mrs. Sullivan. Bland's Wrecker Service towed the vehicle. Public property and private property damage was limited to minimal tire tracks in the soft soil. Damage to the vehicle is believed to have occurred from driving over the embankment.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was driving V1 south on S. Walnut St. And was turning east on Hillside Dr. D1 also stated that the traffic light at the intersection was solid green in her side but without a green left arrow. D1 stated that while she was in the middle of the turn, V2 struck V1 in the front passenger corner.D2 stated that she was driving V2 north on S. Walnut St. D2 also stated when she was approaching the intersection of S. Walnut St. And E. Hillside Dr. The traffic light was solid green in her direction. D2 also stated that while she entered the intersection, the driver of V1 failed to yield for oncoming traffic and entered the intersection to turn east. D2 explained that due D1's action, V2 struck V2 in the front passenger corner.W1 stated that he was driving his vehicle west on E. Hillside dr. And stopped at the traffic tight at the intersection of S. Walnut St. And E. Hillside dr. Witness 1 stated that V1 was being driven south on S. Walnut St. and was attempting turn east on E. Hillside Dr. W1 also stated that V2 was being driven north on S. Walnut St. W1 stated that the driver of V1 failed to yield to oncoming traffic and entered the intersection of S. Walnut St. And E. Hillside Dr. at the same time with V2 which made the 2 vehicles collide with each other.The traffic light was operational.

THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING SOUTHWEST ON SR 45 NEAR RUSSELL RD, SHE OBSERVED UNIT 1 TRAVELING TOWARD HER WHILE IN HER LANE. UNIT 2 STATED THAT DUE TO UNIT 1 TRAVELING IN THE WRONG LANE, SHE SWERVED TO THE LEFT INTO THE LANE WHERE UNIT 1 WAS SUPPOSED TO BE. UNIT 2 STATED SHE DID THIS TO GET OUT OF THE PATH OF UNIT 1. UNIT 2 WAS STRUCK ON THE PASSENGER SIDE DOOR.THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED SHE DID NOT REMEMBER WHAT HAPPENED AT THE TIME OF THE CRASH. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED SHE HAD CONSUMED ALCOHOL PRIOR TO THE CRASH AND WAS LATER ARRESTED FOR OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED.

V1 was traveling eastbound on State Road 45/46 approaching the intersection of State Road 45/46 and North Fee Lane. D1 advised me that a deer ran into the roadway from the south side of State Road 45/46. D1 stated that he then struck the backside of the deer with the front left bumper area of V1, just west of the intersection.

THE OWNER OF UNIT 1 STATED SHE CAME OUT TO HER VEHICLE ON 6/18/2019 AND OBSERVED THE DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE REAR BUMPER. THERE WAS SEVERAL BLACK SCUFF MARKS AND A DENT LEFT ON THE BUMPER. SHE STATED IT WAS NOT THERE THE DAY BEFORE, AND SOMEBODY MUST HAVE HIT IT DURING THE NIGHTTIME HOURS.

VEHICLE 1 WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN ONTO WEST STATE ROAD 46 TRAVELING WESTBOUND AT THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH SMITH PIKE AND WEST STATE ROAD 46. VEHICLE 1 RAN OFF ROADWAY AND STRUCK THE CURB DISABLING THE VEHICLE.DRIVER 1 STATED THE STEARING LOCKED UP AND FORCED VEHICLE 1 OFF THE ROADWAY.DRIVER 1 AND PASSENGER WERE NOT INJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEHICLE 1 WAS DISABLED AND TOWED BY HAWKINS.

V2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING SPOT FACING WB. V1 APPEARED TO HAVE BACKED UP AND STRUCK THE PASSENGER SIDE DOOR OF V2. THERE WAS WHITE PAINT TRANSFER ON V2. THERE IS A CAMERA NEARBY ON THE BUILDING NEXT TO THE PARKING LOT. OFFICERS WILL ATTEMPTED TO OBTAIN FOOTAGE FROM THE ECURITY CAMERA IF IT CAPTURED THE CRASH.SUPPLEMENT: D1 INFORMATION WAS ADDED

D1 WAS BEING PURSUED BY OFFICER ABBOTT IN THE 1800 BLOCK OF SOUTH RENWICK BLVD. V1 STRUCK A CURB AND WENT ONTO THE ROAD JUST SOUTH OF 1891 S RENWICK BLVD. THEN V1 WAS ABLE TO TURN AROUND AND PROCEED NORTHBOUND. V1 THEN STRUCK A CURB, RAN OFF THE ROAD INTO THE YARD OF 1891 S RENWICK BLVD AND STRUCK A CITY STREET SIGN FOR THE INTERSECTION OF RENWICK AND SEMINARY.V1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT BUMPER. THE CITY STREET SIGN WAS DISLODGED. MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE USED HAWKIN'S TO TOW THE VEHICLE.IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT D1 WAS OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED.

D1 STATED HE HAD EXITED ONTO KINGSTON DR FROM A LOCAL BUSINESS THAT IS LOCATED ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY. HE SAID AS HE MADE HIS RIGHT TURN ONTO KINGSTON, HE SAW THAT THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL WAS GREEN. D1 SAID HE ASSUMED TRAFFIC WAS MOVING AND HE COLLIDED INTO THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED NORTH ON KINGSTON DR AND WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. HE SAID HE VEHICLE THEN SURGED FORWARD AND STRUCK V3. D3 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC NORTH ON KINGSTON. SHE SAID WHILE WAITING FOR THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TO CHANGE, SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V2.

D2/V2 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND ON N. GATES DRIVE. V1 WAS STOPPED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SOUTHBOUND LANE NOT MOVING. THE CAR INFRONT OF ME PASSED V1 ON THE RIGHT. I ASSUMED V1 WAS BROKEN DOWN IN THE ROADWAY. I WENT TO PASS V1 ON THE RIGHT, IN THE RIGHT TURN LANE. I DID NOT SEE ANY TURN SIGNAL ON THE TRUCK OR TRAILOR OF V1. AS I STARTED TO PASS V1, V1 MADE A RIGHT HAND TURN INTO MY VEHICLE."D1/V1 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND ON N. GATES DRIVE. I WAS IN THE MIDDLE STRAIGHT LANE. I THOUGHT I HAD MY TURN SIGNAL ON. I STARTED TO MAKE A RIGHT HAND TURN, WHEN ALL OF THE SUDDEN I COLLIDED WITH V2 WHO WAS PASSING ME SOUTHBOUND IN THE RIGHT TURN LANE."V1 IMPROPER TURN, IMPROPER LANE USAGE.V2 IMPROPER PASSING.

BASED ON THE MARKS IN THE GRASS JUST WEST OF THE COLLISION, V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON E. MILLER DR., CROSSED THE CENTER AND INTO ONCOMING TRAFFIC, HOPPED THE CRUB, STRUCK A FENCE LOCATED IN THE YARD OF 1712 S. HUNTINGTON DR., JUMPED BACK OVER THE CURB, AND CONTINUED EAST BOUND ON E. MILLER DR. V1 LEFT THE SCENE.WHEN LOCATED, V1 HAD DAMAGE ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CRASH, AND D1 WAS ARRESTED FOR OWI, LSA, RLE, VEH. THEFT.

Vehicle 1 was traveling northbound on South State Road 37 between South Old State Road 37 and West Dillman Road when a deer ran into the roadway and collided with the front driver side bumper and quarter panel. The collision resulted in extensive damage to the entire front end of the SUV. The deceased deer was located in the left-hand lane near the SUV.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT HE WAS CRESTING THE HILL EB ON E BOLTINGHOUSE RD TRAVELING TOWARDS E BETHEL LN. WHERE E OLD MEYERS RD INTERSECTS. D1 STATED THAT WHEN HE CAME OVER THE HILL A CAR WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN ONTO OLD MEYERS FROM THE OPPOSING LANE HOWEVER THEY HAD CROSSED THE CENTER LINE. D1 STATED THAT HE AVOIDED A COLLISION WITH THAT VEHICLE HOWEVER IN DOING STATED HE "LOST CONTROL" OF HIS VEHICLE, RAN OFF OF THE ROADWAY INTO A UTILY POLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS NORTHBOUND AT THE OFF RAMP OF SR 37/I69 AT THE INTERSECTION OF SR 46 WEST. V2 WAS EASTBOUND ON SR 46 AT THE RAMP.D1 SAID SHE STOPPED TO WAIT ON TRAFFIC BEFORE PULLING OUT. SHE SAID WHEN SHE THOUGHT IT WAS CLEAR SHE PULLED ONTO WESTBOUND SR 46 BUT DID NOT SEE V2 COMING. SHE SAID WHEN SHE ENTERED THE HIGHWAY SHE COLLIDED WITH V2.D1 SAID HE SAW V1 STOP TO WAIT ON TRAFFIC AS HE APPROACHED. HE SAID SHE WAS WATCHING TRAFFIC FROM THE OTHER DIRECTION AND PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM AND THEY COLLIDED.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.3rd Street is a one way, two lane roadway that travels westbound.V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street, in the north-most lane, near the Swain Avenue intersection.V2 was also traveling westbound on 3rd Street, in the south-most lane, near the Swain Avenue intersection. V2 was in the adjacent lane and slightly behind V1.D1 stated she believes she was actually in the south-most lane and directly in front of V2. D1 continued to state that she then made a left, southbound turn onto Swain Avenue. As she was turning, V2 collided into the rear, driver-side portion of her vehicle.D2 stated that V1 was in the north-most lane, the adjacent lane to him, and slightly ahead of him. V1 then turned into his path of travel. D2 stated that he was unable to stop in time as it happened quickly and he collided into V1 with the front, passenger portion of his vehicle. He was not sure the speed he was traveling prior to the collision.The damage to the vehicles are most consistent with D2's version of the story. D1's version meant that D2 would have driven up onto the sidewalk or grass to sustain the vehicle damage. There are no known cameras in the area.Both vehicle sustained damage; however, they both appeared to be in safe operating condition. There were no injuries.There are both signs and road markings that indicate 3rd Street is a one way street before the accident location.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRVING SOUTH ON N. STATE ROAD 69 HEADING TOWARDS BLOOMINGTON. D1 ADVISED IT WAS RAINING AND SLOWED DOWN HOWEVER HER VEHICLE STARTED SLIDING AND SHE COULD NOT CORRECT V1 AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY. V1 WENT OFF THE ROADWAY AND FLIPPED ONTO ITS TOP.

Other Location Of Investigation: V1 and V2 both had exchanged insurance information and V2 had left the scene prior to my arrival. V2 is a box truck used by Soft Touch Moving. Soft Touch Moving is located a 3150 S. Walnut Street, Monroe County. I obtained vehicle and insurance information for V2 at this location.Environmental Factor: The area of Dittemore Rd. Had previously been struck by a tornado. Clean-up of the area by construction equipment, to include Dittemore Rd. was occurring during the time of the crash. Construction workers were directing traffic and was shifting westbound traffic into the eastbound lane.Dittemore Road is a county road that runs in a eastern and western direction through Monroe County. Denny Road is also a county road that runs in a northern and southern direction and intersects with Dittemore Rd. 1050ft west of the crash.V1 (1996 red International 4700) had been moved from the roadway prior to my arrival. V2 (2015 white Ford E350) had left the scene and was not at the scene during my investigation. V1 was in the westbound lane facing east. V2 was in the eastbound lane going west due to construction redirecting traffic. V1 was backing in the westbound lane and struck the passenger side of V2 with its tailgate. V2 was stationary at the time it was struck.D1 (John May) stated he was backing up to the Gradall in the westbound lane. D1 stated he could not see V2 because it was in his blind spot. D1 stated he struck V2 with his tailgate. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 (Ryan Molzon) stated that he was stopped in the eastbound lane going west. V1 was backing and struck his vehicle on the passenger side. He was wearing his seat belt.During the course of my investigation, I observed no damage to V1. I did observe damage to V2 on the passenger side door, mirror, and front of the box just behind the cab. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause is Unsafe Backing on the part of D1. This was determined by driver statements and damage sustained to V2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON OLD 37 AND TOOK THE CURVE AT BOLTINGHOUSE TO FAST. V1 OVER CORRECTED AND HIT A TREE HEAD ON CAUSING SEVERE FRONT END DAMAGE. THERE WAS NO DRIVER ON SCENE. TOW TIME TOWING ARRIVED ON SCENE AND ADVISED THAT MORGAN WILLMAN CALLED ASKED THEM TO TOW THE VEHICLE. HAWKINS TOWING ALREADY HAD THE VEHICLE LOADED. I SPOKE TO MS. WILLMAN ON THE PHONE WHO SAID THAT D1 WAS ACTUALLY DRIVING THE VEHICLE AND THAT SHE WAS JUST THE INSURANCE POLICY HOLDER. MS. WILLMAN STATED THAT D1 CALLED HER FROM THE SCENE AND SHE BROUGHT HIM HOME. D1 COMPLAINED THAT HE HAD BLACKED OUT AFTER THE WRECK. D1 SAID THAT HE GOT DIZZY WHILE AT HOME AND FELL AND HIT HIS HEAD. D1 WENT TO THE HOSPITAL AND WAS SEEN BY THE ER DOCTOR FOR A CUT TO HIS HEAD THAT HE SUFFERED AT HOME. MS. WILLMAN STATED THAT THE ACCIDENT ACTUALLY HAPPENED AROUND 12:30AM OR 1 AM.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E. MILLER DR. D1 STATED HE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF E. MILLER DR. AND S. HIGHLAND AVE. D1 STATED HE CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP AND LOOKED BOTH WAYS, BUT DID NOT SEE ANOTHER VEHICLE. D1 STATED HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND D2, WHO WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. HIGHLAND AVE., DID NOT STOP AT THE STOP SIGN. D1 STATED D2 RAN INTO THE SIDE OF HIS VEHCILE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. HIGHLAND AVE. D2 STATED HE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION OF S. HIGHLAND AVE. AND E. MILLER DR. D2 STATED HE WAS ALMOST ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHEN D1, WHO WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E. MILLER DR., DID NOT STOP AT THE STOP SIGN. D2 STATED HE SWERVED IN AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID D1, BUT WAS UNABLE TO AVOID THE COLLISION WHICH RESULTED IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.IT SHOULD BE NOTED, BOTH D1 AND D2 STATED THE OPPOSITE DRIVER ADMITTED TO NOT STOPPING.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING ON W. ARLINGTON RD. D1 STATED HE REALIZED D2 WAS STOPPED AND ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT ONTO W. GOURLEY PK. D1 STATED HE ATTEMPTED TO APPLY HIS BRAKES, BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP. D1 STATED HE SLID INTO THE REAR OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO HIS VEHICLE.D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED ON W. ARLINGTON RD. D2 STATED HE WAS WAITING ON TRAFFIC SO HE COULD TURN LEFT ONTO W. GOURLEY PK. D2 STATED WHILE WAITING TO TURN, V1 MADE IMPACT WITH THE REAR OF HIS VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE.

Officer Hall was informed by D2 that D1 left the scene in V1. V3 was stopped in traffic in the left hand lane for south bound traffic and V2 was directly behind V3. All parties were on the north side of 10th Street on the 46 Bypass in the south bound lane. D2 said she was southbound on the 46 Bypass in the lane of travel at the intersection of 10th Street and Bypass in V2 for southbound. D2 said she applied V2 brakes, and came to a stop that was two car lengths back from V3. D2 said she was directly in behind V3 and directly in front of V1. D2 said she then felt a light tap from V1 which struck the spare tire on the rear of V2. D2 said this caused V2 to push forward striking V3 in the rear. D2 said she felt as if D1 did not know they struck V2 with V1. D2 said V1 then pulled off and turned in an unknown direction. I asked D2 if she had any vehicle or driver information for D1 and V1? D2 said she did not other than she thought it was a black car. D2 said she observed no damage to the front or rear of V2. After speaking with D2 I Officer Hall looked at the front and rear of V2 and observed no damage to V2.D3 said he was on the 46 Bypass in the lane for traveling southbound at the intersection of 10th and Bypass in V3. D3 said he was approaching the light and coming to a stop due to cars in front of him stopping. D3 said he believed the light was red due to cars in front stopping where V3 came to a complete stop. D3 said he observed V2 which was directly behind V3 approaching quickly when looking in his rear view mirror. D3 said he attempted to get into the left hand turn lane which was directly next lane to him so V2 would avoid hitting V3. D3 said he was half way into the turn lane. D3 said he felt a bump on the rear right bumper area of V3 by V2. D3 said they then pulled into the lot to avoid traffic congestion. I asked D3 if he observed another vehicle hit V2? D3 did not know and was unable to provide any information. V3 observed damage to the right rear passenger bumper area of V3. Once back on IUPD Station I looked to see if there was any video footage available to further investigate this crash. I was unable to locate any video footage.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling east bound on West State Road 45. V2 was slowing in traffic in preparation to turn north bound on South Bunger Road. V1 crashed into the rear of V2. After the collison, V1 ran off the south side of the roadway and came to rest after striking a culvert. D1 stated he attempted to stop for V2 but his vehicle was unable to stop in time due to the road conditions. VEHICLES WERE MOVED OUT OF THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

V1 appeared to be traveling westbound on E State Road 46 when it crossed the center line and ran off the south side of the roadway. D1 was standing near the vehicle but was unable to communicate what had happened or why he ran off the road.Marijuana and drug paraphernalia was located in the vehicle and D1's blood was drawn for analysis.

V1 and V2 were facing east on 10th Street at the red light just east of the intersection of 10th and Sunrise. V1 was stopped directly behind V2. D1 let off the gas, and that was when V1 struck the rear end of V2 which was still stopped at the light. I spoke to D1 who stated that she was facing eastbound on 10th Street and was stopped at the red light. D1 stated that she she looked up at the light, saw that it was green, and then let off the brake. D1 stated she did not ever press the gas on V1. D1 stated that it was at this time, after she let off the brake, that V1 struck the rear end of V2. D1 stated that she must have been distracted as she didn't realize she would hit V2 so suddenly. I then spoke to D2 who stated he was stopped at 10th and Sunrise facing eastbound. D2 stated that he had been stopped at the light which he saw was red. D2 also stated that there were a couple other vehicles in front of him also stopped at the red light in traffic. D2 then stated out of nowhere he felt the rear end of V2 get struck by V1. There is damage to the rear bumper and license plate of V2 as well as the front right fender. V1 sustained damage to the front bumper.

I was facing North from 2560 E. 3rd St. and witnessed the crash.D1 backed south west out of a parking stall. The rear view was obstructed by a bike rack and bicycle. D1 back until he struck D2. D1 did not possess an Indiana drivers license but did have a Colombia driver's license. D2 backed south east out of a parking stall. The rear view was obstructed by large balloons in the back seat. D2 backed until he struck D1.

D1 stated that she was heading South on College Avenue approaching 8th Street.D1 stated she was in the middle lane and tried to turn onto 8th Street to head East. D1 stated that she did not see V2 in the far left lane and as she turned she struck V2. D2 stated she was heading South on College Avenue in the far left lane approaching 8th Street.D2 stated that V1 turned from the middle lane towards 8th Street and struck the front passenger side of her vehicle.
V1 WAS WEST ON COUNTRY CLUB DR APPROACHING THE LIGHT AT ROGERS RD. D1 BECAME DISTRACTED BY CHILDREN IIN BACK SEAT AND DID NOT NOTICE THE V2 WAS STOPPED FOR LIGHT. V1 REAR ENDED V2

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS STOPPED ON VINE ST ATTEMPTING TO CROSS SALE ST. D1 ATTEMPTED TO CROSS SALE ST BUT COLLIED WITH V2. V2 WAS HEADING SOUTH ON SALE STREET. D1 WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE ANY INSURANCE. VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

A RED CHEVY BLAZER OR SUBURBAN WAS SEEN BY VARIOUS HOME OWNERS LEAVING THE ROAD WAY AND HITTING A BLACK CHAINLINK FENCE ON WICKENS RD BELONGING TO 3807 AND 3811 S. BUSHMILL DR BLLOMINGTON IN 47403. THE VEHICLE LEFT BEHIND THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR VIEW MIRROR AND DRAGGED A PORTION OF THE FENCE ALMOST A MILE FROM THE POINT OF IMPACT. UNABLE TO LOCATE THE VEHICLE BUT HAVE PICTURES OF THE VEHICLE APPROACHING THE FENCE

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was stopped at the stop sign at the exit from the IU Credit Union Lot onto Woodscrest Dr. Driver 2 stated she was north on Woodscrest Dr passing the exit from the IU Credit Union lot. Driver 1 stated she was going to pull across Woodscrest Dr and did not see vehicle 2 approaching. Driver 1 stated she started to pull across the road and collided with vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 pulled out and collided with her vehicle. Vehicle 2 had the right of way.

V1 STRUCK PARKED V2 WHILE V1 WAS TRAVELLING NORTH ON WALNUT STREET APPROACHING 15TH STREET.D1 STATED THAT SHE MUST NOT HAVE BEEN PAYING ATTENTION AS SHE REAR ENDED PARKED V2 WHICH WAS ON THE SIDE OF THE ROADWAY.D2 WAS INSIDE HIS RESIDENCE AND HEARD THE NOISE. V2 WAS PARKED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was waiting to pull out of the Greiner Engineering parking lot to go south on N Curry Pike. While he was waiting the far lane was backed up but a vehicle had given him enough room to pull through. D1 then noticed V2 in the near lane driving northbound on Curry Pike a little distance away and attempted to pull out of the parking lot and enter the roadway when V2 collided with his vehicle. D2 stated she was northbound on Curry Pike in the right lane when V1 pulled out in front of her.The witness, who was in the parking lot behind V1, stated V2 did not appear to slow down or attempt to stop prior to the collision.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT OF KROGER SOUTH (4025 S OLD ST RD 37) WHEN V2 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT. D1 STATED SHE DIDN'T SEE V2 BACKING OUT OF THE SPOT AND WAS UNBALE TO STOP IN TIME BEFORE V1 HIT V2.

O2 stated that he parked V2 along the sidewalk across from the Colonial Crest Apartment Leasing office and went inside the office. O2 also stated that when he came out of the office, he had seen damage to the rear passenger side bumper of V2.D1 stated that she had left the above leasing office, backed her car onto the road and drove away. D1 also stated that she did not notice colliding V1 with V2.W1 stated that she had seen V1 backing out of the parking space and colliding with V2 in the rear passenger corner.W2 stated that she had seen V1 backing out of the parking space and colliding with V2Supplement: 6/22/19D1 came into BPD headquarters to provide her insurance information.O2 stated that he does not want to pursue charges.Updated V1 insurance information.

V2 was parked in a private parking lot at the address of 9554 East Northshore Drive. V1 was turning right in the parking lot in an attempt to turn around and launch a boat which was on the trailer. The passenger side of the trailer attached to V1 struck the front driers side of V2. D1 stated he asked D2 to back his truck up so he would have more room but D2 denied his request. D1 still attempted to pull past V2 but stuck V2 with the the trailer. The trailer attached to V1 was recently purchased and was not registered.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PARKING LOT OF THE GAS STATION AT 3939 W. THIRD ST.D1 SAID HE TURNED LEFT AWAY FROM THE PUMPS AND MIS-JUDGED THE DISTANCE, STRUCK V2.V2 WAS PARKED FACING THE BUILDING.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

D1, D2 and D3 headed W/B on SR 46, on the overpass of SR 37. D3 stopped in traffic, causing D2 to stop. D3 was unable to stop his vehicle in time, which caused V1 to strike V2 in the rear, which then caused V2 to strike V3 in the rear. All vehicles were able to be driven from the scene. D1was headed W/B on SR 46, on the overpass of SR 37. D1 stated that as he went through the construction area, V2 stopped adruptly in the roadway due to traffic, causing V1 to strike V2 in the rear. D2 was headed W/B on SR 46, on the overpass of SR 37. D2 stated that V3 stopped in front of her, due to traffic, so she also stopped. D2 stated that she her vehicle was struck from the rear by V1, which then caused the front of her vehicle to strike V3 in the rear. D3 was headed W/B on SR 46, on the overpass of SR 37. D3 stated that he stopped in the roadway due to traffic. D3 stated that he looked in his rear view mirror and saw V2 stop behind him, and then saw V1 fail to stop, thus striking V2 in the rear, which then caused V2 to strike his vehicle in the rear.

Officer Harris requested another unit to the area of W. 3rd St. and S. Patterson Dr. for an accident that he was involved in.Officer Harris was in the area of an accident that he was sent to at this intersection. It should be noted that V1 for this accident was also involved in the original accident that Officer Harris was dispatched to. The vehicles were facing West bound on W. 3rd St. just East of S. Patterson Dr.Officer Harris told me that he was parked behind the two vehicles from the original accident. He instructed the vehicles to move out of the roadway. While sitting in his parked patrol vehicle (135) behind V1, V1 put their vehicle into reverse and struck his vehicle. He stated that he attempted to use his air horn to alert D1, but V1 had already struck V2.D1 stated that she put her vehicle into reverse instead of drive and struck V2. There was damage to the front bumper to V2. It appeared that parts of the bracket holding the front bumper were now broke. V1 had damage to the rear bumped. It appeared that the rear bumper had several small cracks (spider webbing).There were no injuries reported.Photographs were taken by Lt. Tate.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS FACING EAST ON 6TH ST ATTEMPTING TO TURN INTO 316 W 6TH ST. V2 WAS WEST ON 6TH ST. AS V1 STARTED TO TURN INTO THE LOT OF 316 W 6TH, ANOTHER VEHICLE STARTED TO EXIT THE LOT AND V1 SLOWED APPROACH INTO THE LOT. V2 WHICH WAS WEST BOUND DID NOT HAVE TIME TO STOP BEFORE STRIKING V1. V2 HAD RIGHT OF WAY WEST BOUND.

Other Location Of Investigation: D1 was flagged down at the 116MM of I69 and was advised that he had struck another vehicle with his camper. The crash had occurred northbound I69, just north of the 106MM of I69. I made contact with D1 at the 116MM and D2 was escorted by Trooper Nash to my location from the 106MM.Primary Cause-Driver Factor: D1 failed to make sure he could change lanes safely. D1 attempted to travel from the right lane to the left lane and struck V2 on the passenger side.I69 is a interstate highway that travels in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. In the area of the crash the roadway is straight with a uphill/grade. V1 (2015 black Dodge Ram 3500) was towing a camper (2018 brown Mesa Ridge) northbound on I69, north of the 106MM in the right lane. V2 (2016 blue Nissan Versa) was traveling northbound I69 in the left lane alongside V1. V1 attempted to change lanes and traveled into the left lane striking V2 in the passenger side. V1 continued traveling until coming to a stop at the 116MM of I69. V2 came to a stop at the 109MM of I69. Trooper Nash escorted V2 to the 116MM where the crash investigation was completed.D1 stated that he was traveling northbound on I69 in the right lane behind a tractor trailer, which was traveling at a reduced speed. D1 stated he attempted to change lanes to pass the tractor trailer. D1 stated he did not see V2 in the left lane and struck V2 with his camper. D1 stated that he was unaware that he had struck V2 and continued traveling until he was flagged down by another motorist. D1 stated that the motorist advised him that he had stuck a vehicle. D1 then waited for law enforcement to arrive. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 stated that he was traveling northbound in the left lane on I69 near the 106MM. D2 stated that V1 changed lanes and struck his vehicle on the passenger side with the camper being towed by V1. D2 then traveled to the right shoulder of I69 near the 109MM and waited for law enforcement. He was wearing his seat belt.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the left side of the camper. I observed damage to the entire right passenger side of V2. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash was Unsafe Lane Movement on the part of D1. This was determined by drivers statements and damage sustained to the camper and V2.

V1 and V2 were traveling N/B on Walnut ST. V1 attempted to merge into the center lane before striking V2. D1 advised that he was traveling N/B on Walnut ST. D1 stated that while traveling, he observed a semi truck stopped in the far right lane directly in front of him. D1 advised that he turned on his left turning signal and began to merge into the center lane, when V1 was struck. D1 advised that he was not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling N/B on Walnut ST. D2 advised that he then felt the impact of V1 colliding with V2. D2 was not not injured. Due to D1's unsafe lane movement, V1 struck V2 causing minor damage to both vehicles.

V1, a motorized scooter, was traveling east on E Atwater Ave. between S Fess Ave. and N Park Ave. D1 attempted to travel onto the sidewalk from the street, causing a crash.D1 advised that he was traveling eastbound on E Atwater Ave. approaching S Park Ave. D1 advised that he was attempting to drive up onto the sidewalk because he was uncomfortable on the street. D1 advised that as he attempted to drive onto the sidewalk he lost control of the scooter and crashed. D1 had scrapes and road rash all over his hands and face, as well as a bump on his head. IU Health Ambulance Service advised that he did not need to go to the hospital and he signed an SOR.W1 advised that he was traveling eastbound on E Atwater Ave. approaching S Park Ave. when he observed D1 attempt to drive onto the sidewalk in front of 730 E Atwater Ave. W1 advised that when D1 attempted to get onto the sidewalk, he lost control of the scooter and tumbled several times. W1 advised that he stopped to help and as he was approaching D1 observed that D1 was unable to get up initially. W1 stated that when D1 did stand up he was very unsteady and stumbled for several moments before regaining his footing.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH AT 11TH AND MORTON. D1 STATED SHE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN THEN PULLED INTO THE INTERSECTION WHEN V2 STRUCK HER AS V2 DROVE WEST. D1 HAD A TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE AND DUTY TO YIELD TO WEST/EAST TRAFFIC.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W 11TH STREET APPROACHING N MORTON STREET. D2 STATED V1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HER AND THE VEHICLES STRUCK. D2 HAS NO TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE AND WAS SIMPLY PROCEEDING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. SUPPLEMENT: 06/23/2019ADDED ENFORCEMENT ACTION.CHANGED THE ORDER OF STATEMENT GIVEN.

Officer P. Pesa and Officer Aydt assisted in the crash investigation.I spoke with D1 on scene. D1 was vague on the events of the crash and stated several times "it all happened so fast". D1 could only recount he was driving V1 southbound on the 45/46 Bypass when a red vehicle appeared in front of V1 and it came to a stop. D1 advised when he observed the red vehicle he swerved V1 out of the way. D1 could not remember if he was in the left or right lane when he swerved. D1 could not remember which direction he swerved. While speaking with D1 I observed his speech to be slow and he was not quick to answer questions.Officer Aydt and I spoke with W1. W1 advised he was standing on Tulip Tree Drive by Hilltop Gardens when he heard the screeching of tires coming from the area of the 45/46 Bypass. W1 advised he observed V1 traveling southbound on the sidewalk and grass area on the west side of the southbound lane. W1 advised V1 then went back onto the southbound lane, drove over the curb raised median, across both northbound lanes of travel before coming to a rest on the sidewalk on the east side of the 45/46 Bypass. W1 advised when he first look up he also observed a burgandy in color SUV in the right lane of the southbound lane and it appeared to have stopped. Officer Pesa spoke with W2. W2 advised he was out on a run traveling northbound on the sidewalk on the west side of the 45/46 Bypass. W2 advised that he looked up when he heard the noise of screeching tires. W1 advised that he saw V1 on the sidewalk approaching him at a high rate of speed. W2 advised that he had to jump out of the way of V1 in order to avoid being struck. W2 advised D1 overcorrected V1, which sent V1 onto the curb, then raised median and onto northbound traffic. W2 advised that V1 crashed on the sidewalk on the east side of the 45/46 Bypass.Officer Pesa conducted an OWI investigation. After the OWI investigation was complete Officer Pesa spoke with D1 about the crash. D1 advised that he was traveling southbound on the 45/46 Bypass in the right lane when he dozed off. D1 stated he woke up and saw a vehicle in front of him and swerved. D1 advised he does not remember if the vehicle in front of him applied its breaks, but he stated he swerved to the right and was on the sidewalk. D1 advised he was not sure what all occurred as he closed his eyes and did not open them until V1 came to a stop on the sidewalk on the east side of the 45/46 Bypass.On 11/04/2019 I was advised of the blood results of this case. On 10/25/2019, the Indiana State Department of Toxicology sent the results for Buggs' blood draw. The following are the results from the toxicology lab: 1. THC 6.2 ng/mL of blood. 2. THC-COOH 95 ng/mL of blood.

I-69 at the 119.0mm is a multi-lane interstate with 3 lanes northbound and southbound with a cement/concrete center barrier. It is constructed mainly of asphalt with areas of concrete. It is straight and level at the location of this crash. The interstate was wet due to heavy rain at the time of this accident. It was daylight and overcast.Vehicle #1 was traveling north on I-69 north of the 119.0mm in the far right lane when Vehicle #1 drifted onto the right shoulder of the interstate striking a construction barrel then a large digital sign board. Vehicle #1 then left the roadway, down a slight ditch and struck a fence where it came to rest.Vehicle #1 (A Gray, 2010, Mazda, Mazda 3)was traveling north on I-69 north of 119.0mm.Driver #1 (Skyler Dawn Bergfeld Phillips-Grubb) indicated she was traveling north on I-69 when she noticed there was a spider near the left side of her head. Driver #1 indicated she reached for a napkin to grab the spider and put it out her window when she heard and felt a loud bang and the next thing she knew it felt like she was off the roadway and then came to a stop. Driver #1 indicated all she was trying to do was get rid of the spider and didn't realize she had drifted off the roadway. Witness #1 (Jeff Vandiver) indicated he was in the far right lane about 200 yards behind Vehicle #1. Witness #1 indicated it was raining hard (pouring) and all he saw was Vehicle #1 drift to the right and get tied up with the electronic road sign and then down the ditch to the fence.Witness #2 (Tousif Ahmed) indicated he was in the middle lane about a car length behind Vehicle #1 and they were running about the same speed. Witness #2 indicated Vehicle #1 suddenly moved to the shoulder of the interstate and struck the large digital sign and then went down the ditch. Driver #1 indicated she was distracted by a spider in the passenger compartment of Vehicle #1 which caused her to crash. There is no evidence to prove either way as to what caused the accident. With the lack of markings on the roadway and the statements of both witnesses Driver #1 must have been distracted inside Vehicle #1 to cause Vehicle #1 to drift onto the shoulder causing this accident. Driver #1 was checked by EMS personnel and she signed a release form refusing medical treatment or transportation to hospital. Drive #1 reported she was wearing her seatbelt and there was airbag deployment. The sign board was a Signalisation Board (Ver-Mac INC.) with a VIN: 1V9US4128JH223165.N 39 10.601W 086 33.721

Unit 1 was Westbound on St Rd 46, coming to a stop at the traffic signal at the intersection if N Curry Pike. Unit 2 was also traveling Westbound behind Unit 1. Whilst coming to a stop at the intersection, unit 2 applied its brakes, however the vehicle hydroplaned and continued moving, impacting with unit 1 in the rear. Unit 1 sustained damage to the rear but was still drivable, Unit 2 sustained front end damage and was towed from the scene.

On 6/22/2019 Officer Berry attempted to conduct a traffic stop on V1. D1 then fled in V1. During the pursuit, D1 drove through the yard of 3950 Larry Wayne Drive attempting to flee from the officers. D1 fled the scene after driving through the front yard. This resulted in ruts throughout the yard. Due to D1 failing to stop for officers and trying to flee through the yard of of 3950 Larry Wayne Drive resulted in the accident.

V2 was parked facing south along the west side of N Grant St when it was struck by v1/d1, who was described by witness as attempting to parallel park in front of v2. W1 advised V1 struck the driver's side door area and did not provide any driver contact information nor vehicle insurance information prior to leaving the scene. D1 information is unknown. V1 was described by w1 as being a large, pick-up truck, silver in color, occupied by 1 white male, who appeared older. V2 was parked and unoccupied when it was struck on the driver's side door, leaving minimum damage. W1: stated she was standing on the sidewalk directly beside where the incident took place and advised it appeared the older white male driver of V1 was attempting to parallel park when it struck the driver's side door of V2. W1 stated the driver then drove away and turned right to travel westbound on E Kirkwood Ave. V2 sustained damage to the driver's side door.

Spoke to D1 and he stated V1was traveling north on I69 in the area of MM 109.5. D1 stated it was raining very hard and was restricting his visibility so he slowed his vehicle. D1 stated he lost control of V1 and V1 slid into the median causing significant damage to the front of V1. D1 was not injured in the crash and V1 was towed to the owners residence at the owners request due to disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Narrative By Chief Deputy,William Jay HuimphreyEllettsville Police DepartmentJune 22 2019 Time 10/10amDriver #1 TurnerDriver #2 StickelsDriver #1 going East Bound On Temperance St. Just East of Sale St.in the right lane of travel . This would be #2 Lanes one way going East Bound. Vehicle #1 was changing lanes to get in the left lane driver #1 did not see Vehicle #2 in the left lane. Driver #1 Vehicle struck right side of Vehicle #2 causing damage to right side of vehicle #2.Damage Vehicle #1 Left FrontVehicle #2 right side

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling east bound on west state road 46. V2 was traveling west bound on West State Road 46. The witness was in front of V2. V1 crossed the center lane and struck V2, head on, in the west bound lanes of travel. The witness stated he saw V1 traveling east bound in the west bound lanes and veered to miss him. He stated he saw V1 strike V2 behind him. D2 was transported from scene by ambulance to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for medical treatment. She had complaint of pain to her wrist and a contusion on her head.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was headed W/B on SR 45, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D2 was headed E/B on SR 45, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D1 then proceeded to make a left turn onto N Kinser Pike as D2 was coming through the intersection, causing a collision. D1 stated was headed W/B on SR 45, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D1 stated that as he entered the intersection he believed the right of way to be clear to make a left hand turn, so he proceeded. DF1 stated that as he made the left turn onto N Kinser Pike he was struck by V2 in the rear, passenger side of vehicle. D2 stated he was headed E/B on SR 45, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D2 stated that as he entered the intersection V1 then proceeded to make a left hand turn directly into his lane of travel, causing V2 to strike V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling south on S College Mall Rd. Vehicle 2 was attempting to pull out of 720 S College Mall Rd and travel north on S College Mall Rd. 720 S College Mall Rd is at the same intersection as College Mall Rd and Buick Cadillac Blvd. The intersection is controlled by a four way traffic control signal. The traffic control signal was not working due to a power outage caused by weather. Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he pulled up to the light at 720 S College Mall Rd and treated the intersection as four way stop before proceeding into the intersection. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that he had just left the hospital and was tired. When he approached the intersection he did not see a red light so felt he could proceed through without stopping. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that vehicle 2 then pulled out into the intersection and vehicle 1 struck vehicle 2 in the front driver's side.Because the traffic light was not functioning at the time, the intersection should have been treated as a four way stop. Driver of vehicle 1 failed to yield the right of way to vehicle 2 by not stopping at the intersection.No injuries were reported from this accident. Vehicle 1 was able to drive from the scene and vehicle 2 was towed due to disabling damage.
D2 was traveling southbound in V2 in the parking lot when D1 backed out ( westbound) of a parking spot and struck V2 in the front left side with the back left of V1.

D1 AND V1 LEFT THE SCENE WITHOUT PROVIDING ANY INFORMATION AS REQUIRED BY LAW. CRIMINAL CASE COMPLETED.O2 STATED THAT HIS VEHICLE WAS PARKED OUTSIDE HIS APARTMENT AND HEARD A LOUD NOISE AT APROXIMATELY 06:30 PM. O2 ALSO STATED THAT WHEN HE CAME OUTSIDE, HE SAW HIS VEHICLE WAS PUSHED AGAINST ANOTHER VEHICLE PARKED NEXT TO HIS. O2 MENTIONED THAT HE SAW DAMAGE ON THE REAR BUMPER OF HIS VEHICLE AND IT APPEARED TO BE CAUSED BY AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE. THE REASON V1 IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN DRIVING SOUTHWEST AND NOT WEST IS BECAUSE THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE SIDE OF THE VEHICLE WHICH WOULD HAVE INDICATED THAT.O3 WAS NOT AWARE OF THE ACCIDENT UNTIL I NOTIFIED HER. V3 WAS PARKED NEXT TO V2 JUST TO THE WEST.

Spoke to D1 and she stated V1 was traveling west on E SR 46 in the area of Gettys Creek Rd when a deer walked into the roadway from the north into the path of V1. D1 stated she swerved to avoid the deer and it continued into the path of V1 causing V1 to strike the deer on the right side of V1. D1 stated she continued west on E SR 46 until she could find a safe place to pull off the roadway. Deputy Keller-Kuhn assisted and located the deer at the intersection of E SR 46 & Gettys Creek Rd. I observed the front of V1 and saw damage consistent with striking a deer. V1 was drivable and D1 and her passenger were not injured in the crash.

I69 is a multi-lane asphalt roadway that is separated by a cable barrier near the area of this collision. There is an on ramp from Sample Road to the northbound lanes at the area of this collision.V1, white Lexus, was traveling north on I69 in the left lane approaching the 126 mile marker. V1 swerved to the left with the driver's side tires entering the inside gravel shoulder. V1 then began to rotate in a clockwise direction and traveled across the northbound lanes of I69. V1 struck the guardrail face along the east side of I69 and came to final rest facing south along the outside emergency shoulder. D1, Lin, stated she was traveling north on I69 in the left lane. D1 stated two vehicles were entering the Interstate from the on ramp. D1 stated the second vehicle was a white passenger vehicle and immediately moved into the left lane as it entered the Interstate. D1 stated she swerved to the left to avoid impact with the white vehicle and lost control of V1. D1 stated she struck the guardrail with the front of V1. D1 indicated the white vehicle did not stop and continued north on I69. D1 was unable to provide a detailed description or registration number for the white vehicle. W1, Nelson, stated he was traveling north on I69 in the right lane. W1 stated he observed two vehicles entering I69 north from the on ramp. W1 stated the second vehicle was a white passenger vehicle. W1 stated the white vehicle immediately moved to the left lane to pass the other vehicle. W1 stated V1 swerved to avoid the white vehicle then slid across the roadway into the guardrail. W1 was unable to provide a detailed description or registration number for the white vehicle. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail face. Evidence shows yaw marks present in the inside gravel shoulder and across the northbound lanes of I69 to the guardrail face. Environmental Factor: Other (environmental): Other vehicle actions.

Driver one stated he was driving south on S College Ave behind vehicle two when vehicle two came to a sudden stop. Diver one stated he hit his brake and attempted to stop but because vehicle two stopped so quickly and it was raining his brakes were ineffective and he slid into the rear bumper of vehicle two. Driver two stated she was south on S College Ave just south of W 2nd Ave when the vehicle in front of her went to turn right into the Kroger parking lot. Driver two stated she slowed and than stopped for the vehicle in front of her and to let another vehicle out onto the road but she was hit by vehicle one in the rear bumper by the front of vehicle one. Driver two stated she applied the brakes and then was hit a second time by vehicle one because she believes vehicle one bounced off of her vehicle after the first time.Driver two stated there is camera footage of the accident at the Kroger store near the accident but due to the two driver statements being identical there was no need for the camera footage. Driver two stated her head and neck also started to hurt after leaving the scene of the accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver #1 stated he was driving south on I-69 and fell asleep. Driver #1 stated he works two jobs and was dozing off as he was driving south on I-69 and ran into the back of vehicle #2.Driver #2 stated she was driving south on I-69 and saw deputies on the left and right shoulder of the highway with their red and blue lights on. Driver #2 stated she slowed down and signal to change lanes from the far left lane to the center lane of the highway. Driver #2 stated she didn't see Vehicle #1 and was struck from behind.The passenger of Vehicle #2, Rene Blubaugh, was observing her daughter, Delaney Blubaugh, (Driver #2) as she was operating Vehicle #2 on a learners permit. Rene stated her daughter was nearing the end of her permit and would be getting her operators license soon so she was letting Delaney operate without much input from her. Rene stated she was being very observant of Delaney's driving and believed she had done everything correct and didn't know how they were struck from behind. It was at this time I informed both occupants of Vehicle #2 that Driver #1 stated he had fallen asleep. The collision did significant damage to the front left portion of Vehicle #1. I did speak with Driver #1 outside of the vehicle and administered HGN test for intoxication but I did not observe any signs of impairment or odor of alcoholic beverages. The driver did appear tired as he had previously stated. Driver #1 requested to drive his car from the scene and was able to do so.Vehicle #2 was towed from the scene by Hawkins Towing.
V2 was parked facing SE in the Kroger parking lot. V1 struck V2 in the driver side rear quarter panel and left the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 reported he was turning from the turn lane into jiffy treat and struck another vehicle.Driver 2 reported she was driving east in the left lane and vehicle two pulled out in front of her

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that they were driving V1 south on S College Mall RD. D1 drove through the intersection of S College Mall RD and E Covenanter DR when she was struck from the east side of the intersection by V2 in the front driver side. V1 stopped in the guard rail just south of E Covenanter DR on S College Mall RD.D2 said they were driving V2 west on E Covenanter DR approaching S College Mall RD. D2 came to a complete stop at the intersection of E Covenanter DR and S College Mall RD before proceeding west. V2 then struck V1 with the front passenger side of V2 into the front driver side of V1. D2 said D1 did not stop of slow down at the intersection. It should be noted there was a light signal that was not operational at the time of the crash.A Witness advised D2 was driving West on E Covenanter DR after stopping at the intersection. D2 then continued west through S College Mall RD striking D1 who did not stop or slow down at the intersection. D1 then stopped on the guard rail and D2 pulled over.

On 6/23/2019 at approximately 3pm, I, Officer Byerley, was dispatched to assist a motorist near the intersection of S Rogers and W 3rd Street.Upon arrival, I made contact with D1, Grigoriy Belyayev. D1 stated that he was driving V1 N on Rogers St., between W. Smith and W. 3rd St., when a tree limb fell on top of his car. D1 advised no injuries.After speaking with D1, I did visibly notice substantial damage to top and front hood of V1, which still had a large section of tree stuck through the windshield. Upon Officers clearing the intersection of debris. D1 arranged for a private tow through his insurance company.Based on statements made by D1 and my observations on scene, it is my conclusion that while D1 was driving north bound on S Rogers, between W 3rd and W Smith, a tree limb fell and landed on V1, causing damage.

VEHICE 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 446 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF GRUBB ROAD. A TREE HAD FALLEN ACROSS THE ROAD AND DRIVER 1 SWERVED TO MISS THE TREE AND RAN OFF THE ROAD.DRIVER 1 WAS TAKEN TO MCSO FOR OWI INVESTIGATION.VEHICLE 1 WAS TOWED TO CHANDLERS BY CHANDLERS

VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING A LEFT TURN TRAVELING WESTBOUND AT THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 AND EAST SAMPLE ROAD. WHILE ATTEMPTING THE LEFT TURN VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL.. VEHICLE 1 DID NOT CLEAR THE EASTBOUND DRIVE LANE OF EAST SAMPLE ROAD. VEHICLE 2 WAS AT THE STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION FACING EASTBOUND ON EAST SAMPLE ROAD.DRIVER 1 AND DRIVER 2 WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEHICLE 1 WAS TOWED PERSONALLY TO RESIDENCE AND VEHICLE 2 WAS TOWED TO PRITCHARDS BY PRITCHARDS

V1 EXITED THE ROUNDABOUT AT RENWICK BLVD AND MOORES PIKE, TRAVELLING E/B ON MOORES PIKE. V1 RAN OFF OF THE ROADWAY ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE STREET, RAN OVER A PEDESTRIAN CROSSING SIGN, COLLIDED WITH AN ELECTRICAL BOX (#NNI3845 A), AND THEN COLLIDED WITH THE NW CORNER OF 2501 E CARGILL DR BEFORE COMING TO A STOP AND GETTING STUCK IN THE GRASS NEAR THE BUILDING. A POWER OUTAGE OCCURRED AFTER THE BOX WAS STRUCK. D1 THEN PROVIDED A WITNESS WITH CONTACT INFORMATION AND LEFT THE SCENE.WITNESS 1 STATED THAT HE WAS INSIDE HIS APARTMENT AND HEARD A CRASH. WITNESS 1 WENT OUTSIDE AND RECEIVED LICENSE PLATE AND CONTACT INFORMATION FROM D1.OFFICER FABRIS LOCATED D1 AND V1 AT 1104 S PARK AVE. D1 ADVISED THAT SHE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND RAN OFF THE ROAD, AND PROVIDED CONTACT INFORMATION PRIOR TO LEAVING THE SCENE.

Driver one stated she was driving north on N Arlington Road when she feel asleep or passed out. Driver one stated she woke up once her vehicle came to a stop and noticed all the damage. Driver one stated she wasn't hurt but her mother brought her to the hospital to get checked out.Witness stated he was driving south on N Arlington Road when he saw vehicle one leave the roadway driving north just south of 20th Street. Witness stated driver one went into the ditch and hit a covert which cause the vehicle to go airborne about two feet and then cross the road and continue into the ditch hitting a tree and then coming to a rest.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD. V2 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN FROM ROLLING RIDGE WAY TO GO WESTBOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD.D1 DID FLEE FROM THE SCENE.D2 STATED THAT V1 RAN A RED LIGHT AS SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT AND STRUCK HER VEHICLE.V1 DID FAIL TO YIELD TO V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D1 STATED SHE WAS PARKED IN A PARKING STALL FACING SOUTHWEST. D1 STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO REVERSE AND TRAVEL EAST IN THE WRONG DIRECTION OF A ONE WAY ALLEY. V2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING STALL FACING SOUTHWEST. V2 WAS NOT OCCUPIED OR IN MOTION DURING THE ACCIDENT.

V2 was traveling southbound on N. Mt. Tabor Rd. attempting to turn left into the driveway of 7704 N. Mt. Tabor Rd. V1 was traveling behind V1 southbound on N. Mt. Tabor Rd. D1 stated that he did not believe that V2 used its turn signal and was unable to avoid rear ending V2. V2 was pushed off the west side of the roadway and into a bush. D2 stated that she thought did use her turn signal. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage and D2 was treated at the scene for a complaint of pain to her back.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: On 06/24/2019 at 1233 hours, I was dispatched to a two-vehicle collision at Gate 9 of the Memorial Stadium. V1 was turning left, south, onto Dunn Street from the Bypass 45/46. The driver lost control of the vehicle due to the wet surface and struck V2. V2 was stopped in the left, west, turn lane of Dunn Street.I spoke with D1, who advised me that he was on the Bypass 45/46 headed west approaching Dunn Street. He started to turn on Dunn Street and lost control of his vehicle due to the rain and wet pavement. He stated that he spun around and the front bumper of his vehicle struck the driver's side of V2.I spoke with D2, who advised me that he was stopped in traffic in the left, west, turn on Dunn Street. He stated that he noticed V1 attempting to turn left, south onto Dunn Street from the Bypass 45/46. He advised me that the vehicle started "fish-tailing" and the front bumper of V1 struck the driver's side of his vehicle.

On June 24, 2019, at approximately 8:01 am, I was requested by Central Dispatch to respond to Union Valley and Indiana State Road 46 W about a property damage accident. Central Dispatch also advised that one of the vehicles had left the scene and had given the Indiana license plate of the car (BEU576).I arrived on the scene, and before I could speak with the complainant who was identified by Indiana Drivers license as Linda J Duncan, Central Dispatch advised that deputy Mathew Williamson had found the vehicle and the driver on Carmola Drive. I got the complainant's driver and vehicle information as well as took pictures and advised her that I would email her the info as soon as I could. I arrived at 4513 Carmola drive and observed a white male who identified himself as Austin Stephens sitting in the driver's seat. Deputy Williams had already conducted a license check, and it showed that Stephens's driving privileges were showing suspended infraction. According to a witness who was identified as David Reid Wilson II, advised that he was sitting a couple of cars back on Union Valley Drive when he observed the accident. Wilson told me that the vehicle that was at fault then ran the red light and headed eastbound on S.R. 46 W and then turned on to Smith Pike and then turned on to Carmola but could not find the vehicle when he was able to turn on to Carmola.A second witness identified herself as Abagail Boatright told me that she was behind the vehicle, and it caught her eye because she believed that the driver sped up as he went over the hill and down toward the intersection where Duncan was sitting. Boatright stated that she observed the collision and then noticed the suspect's car back up and appear to flee the area trying to get away.After I arrived, I advised Stephens that I would be issuing him three citations. The first one is for leaving the scene of an accident, the second one is for Driving while suspended, and the third is for disregarding the automatic signal at the intersection of Union Valley Road and Indiana State Highway 46 West.No diagram vehicles moved prior to officers arrival

On 6/25/2019 I arrived at an accident at the intersection of Woodlawn Ave & 2nd St. I observed V1 facing westbound on 2nd St with heavy front end damage just to the west of the intersection. I also observed V2 with heavy front end damage in the middle of the intersection facing northwest.I spoke with W1 who stated that she was parked in a parking space near the intersection when she observed V1 disregard the stop sign going west on 2nd Street and collide with V2 who was entering the intersection. W1 stated that it was D1's fault because she disregarded the stop sign and that V2 had the right of way. W1 also stated that D1 was driving around 40 mph. D2 explained that she came to a stop at the intersection of Woodlwan Ave & 2nd St (going northbound) when she entered the intersection and was struck by V1. D2 stated that V1 did not stop at the stop sign and that she was driving around 35-40 mph. D1 stated that was she going westbound on 2nd Street when she failed to stop at the stop sign and collided with V2. D1 explained that she was not going to lie to me and that she just didn't stop at the stop sign. Due to D1 failing to stop at the stop sign resulted in the accident between V1 and V2.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. 3RD STREET. D1 ALSO STATED THAT SHE FAILED TO NOTICE THE RED TRAFFIC LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF W. 3RD STREET AND S. CURRY PIKE, AND REAR ENDED V2, WHICH WAS STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. 3RD STREET AND STOPPED FOR THE RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF W. 3RD STREET AND S. CURRY PIKE. D2 ALSO STATED THAT D1 FAILED TO STOP AND REAR ENDED V2.BOTH V1 AND V2 SUSTAINED VERY MINOR DAMAGE.ONE PASSENGER OF V2, KENDRA, WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL FOR A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER LOWER BACK.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

On 6/25/2019, I, Officer Byerley, was dispatched at 5:49pm to a three vehicle property damage accident at the intersection of W Bell Ave and S Curry Pike.Upon arrival, I made contact with D1, Jason Bell. D1 stated that he was driving south in the left lane on Curry Pike when he briefly looked up and to the left at something that caught his attention. D1 stated that he looked back at the road in front of him and noticed the vehicles in front of him were coming to a stop. D1 stated that he went to brake and his foot did not get a full placement on the brake pedal, but instead the bottom of his foot pressed down on the side of the brake pedal, giving him the inability to come to a stop before hitting V2.D2 stated that she was driving south on Curry Pike in the left lane when the vehicles in front of her started braking. D2 stated that she began braking and noticed V1 was approaching her from behind. D2 stated that she turned her wheel to the left and pulled up a little further to give V1 more room to stop. D2 stated that V1 was unable to stop in time and rear ended her, causing her to rear end V3.D3 stated that she was stopped in traffic facing south in the left lane on Curry Pike when she was suddenly rear ended by V2.It should be noted that the passenger in V2 did have a complaint of back pain, but his father denied immediate medical attention. It should also be noted that the child left with the mother to be seen by the doctor on their own time.Based on my observations and interviews with the three drivers, it is my conclusion that D1 was distracted while driving and failed to stop in traffic before striking V2, which caused V2 to strike V3.

GROHMAN STATED THAT ANOTHER VEHICLE CAME INTO HER LANE AND SHE WAS FORCED OFF THE ROADWAY.MS. GROHMAN STATED THAT SHE HAD TWO BEERS THAT NIGHT AND WAS TOO SCARED TO STAY AT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT. MS. GROHMAN STATED THAT SHE DIDNT THINK THE DAMAGE TO HER CAR WAS THAT BAD.
