Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Driver 2 stated she was east on 10th St just past Range Rd. Driver 2 stated a trailer being pulled behind a pickup truck was westbound on 10th approaching her. Driver 2 stated the trailer disconnected from the truck and crossed into her lane, colliding with the front of her vehicle. Driver 1 stated he was westbound on 10th St pulling a trailer. Driver 1 stated he hit a large bump in the road and the trailer disconnected from the hitch and swerved into the eastbound lane and collided with vehicle 2.

UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 45 FROM THE MONROE COUNTY AND GREENE COUNTY LINE. WHILE ENTERING A CURVE, THE SEMI TRUCK AND TRAILER OVERTURNED ONTO THE PASSENGER SIDE. THE TRAILER CONTAINED LOGS WHICH WERE ALL THROWN FROM THE TRAILER. THE SEMI TRUCK SLID ON ITS SIDE BEFORE COMING TO A REST AGAINST A CEMENT BARRIER ON A BRIDGE. THE DRIVER WAS TEMPORARILY TRAPPED DUE TO THE TOP OF THE CAB COLLIDING WITH THE CEMENT BARRIER. THE DRIVER HAD AN OBVIOUS ABRAISION TO HIS LEFT ELBOW AND ALSO COMPLAINED OF BACK AND SHOULDER PLAIN. DUE TO THE APPROXIMATE 20 LOGS THAT WERE LOST FROM THE TRAILER, THERE WERE 2 REPORTS OF PRIVATE PROPERTY DAMAGE. THE RESIDENTS OF 9360 W SPARKS RD STATED THEY SUFFERED $150 IN DAMAGE AND THE RESIDENTS AT 9191 W STATE ROAD 45 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO APPROXIMATELY 100 FT OF FENCING.

Traffic was backed up on westbound W State Road 45 at S Burch Rd due to a log truck that crashed and spilled logs onto the road. V1 was traveling westbound in the eastbound lane to get around the traffic. D1 stated that he was doing this because the logs spilled on the roadway were his and he needed to get to the crash scene to help secure the load. V2 was backed up in traffic and attempted to turn left onto S Burch Rd. V2 crashed into V1 as it was turning left and V2 was passing traffic in the opposite lane. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

V1 WAS BACKING IN THE PARKING LOT OF TJ MAXXV2 WAS PARKED IN A LEGAL PARKING SPOT DIRECTLY BEHIND V1. V1 BACKED INTO V2, LEAVING DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED. DRIVER OF V1 LEFT THE SCENE WITHOUT PROVIDING INFORMATION TO V2 OWNER. WITNESS STATED STATED THE ABOVE OCCURED. WITNESS PROVIDED SUSPECT VEHICLE PLATE NUMBER. V1 WAS WAS NEVER LOCATED.

State Road 37 is a four lane two way highway that runs primarily north and south. At the time of the crash it was daylight outside and traffic was light to medium.Vehicle 1, a red 2018 GMC Sierra pickup truck, was traveling north on SR 37 in the left lane behind Vehicle 2, a gray 2004 Ford Ranger pickup truck. Both vehicle were approaching the Smithville Rd. intersection in the left lane. On approach to the intersection V1 merged into the right lane and started to pass V2 in the right lane. While passing V2, V1 merged back into the left lane. When it did this V1 hit the front passenger side bumper of V2 with its rear driver side bumper. V1 continued down the road never stopping. V2 pulled over and stopped in the grass median. Driver 1, William Fredrick, stated he was traveling north on SR 37 directly behind V2. D1 said for the past 7 to 8 miles V2 had been occupying the left lane prohibiting traffic to follow in the left lane. D1 said there had been a vehicle in the right lane next to V2, however as they approached the Smithville Rd. intersection that vehicle sped up so there was room to pass V2 in the right lane. D1 said he merged into the right lane so he could pass V2. D1 said that he thought there was a vacant spot in the left lane in front of V2. When he realized this he looked at the young man in V2, honked his horn, and then merged into the left lane. D1 stated that when he merged he felt a little bump. D1 said he noticed V2 stopped the grass median as he drove away. (D1 drove to a doctor's appointment in Bloomington, IN where he noticed his bumper was damaged from hitting V2.)Driver 2, Matthew Gaines, stated he was traveling north on SR 37 directly in front of V1. D2 said there was a vehicle traveling north in the right lane right next to his vehicle as well. D2 said that the vehicle to his right sped up going well pass him. D2 said that when the other vehicle sped down the highway V1 merged into the right lane and drove up next to him. D2 said V1 honked his horn at him then merged into the left lane just in front of his vehicle. D2 said V1 struck the front passenger side bumper of his truck with the rear driver side bumper of V1. D2 stated he pulled over and stopped in the grass median as V1 drove north on SR 37 with his hazard lights blinking. Witness, Jesse Bales, was sitting in the front passenger seat on V2. W1 states that while they were traveling up the road on SR 37, V1 passed V2 in the right lane. W1 then say as V1 was passing V2, V1 honked its horn then tried to merge into the left lane directly in front of him. W1 says V1 stuck V2. While V2 pulled over W1 watched as V1 drove away with hits hazard lights on never stopping. Witness 2, Rick Dorris, was driving his car behind vehicle's 1 and 2. W2 watched as V1 tried to pass V2 in the right lane. W2 states that after passing V2, V1 merged back into the left lane. While doing so V1 struck V2. W2 observed as V1 drove away and V2 pulled over into to grass median. W2 followed V1, called law enforcement, and identified the license plate number on V1. W2 lost sight of V1 as it exited SR 37 onto Fullerton Pike. Evidence shows heavy damage to the rear driver side bumper of V1. Evidence shows heavy damage to the front passenger side bumper of V2. Evidence shows that V1 left the scene of the crash and never returned. Evidence shows D1 never contacted law enforcement.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that all she knows was that she was turning and the other vehicle hit her. D1 stated that she was going eastbound on W Bloomfield RD and was turning northbound to S Liberty DR. D1 stated that she had a flashing yellow arrow, which means she must yield to oncoming traffic, who has the green light.D2 stated he was going westbound on W Bloomfield RD approaching S Liberty DR, when V1 turned in front of him, not giving him enough time to stop.W1 stated the same details as D2, stating that V1 turned in front of V2, while V2 had a green light.Photographs were taken and logged into evidence. Minor injuries and both cars were towed due to disabling damage.
BOTH UNITS WERE TRAVELING NORTH ON OLD 37. UNIT 2 SLOWED TO A STOP TO TURN WEST ON TO NORTHCLIFF AVE. UNIT 1 STATED THAT HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME, AND COLLIDED WITH UNIT 2.

For purposes of this accident report, V1 is a lawn mower, or a stand-on mower (ferris z2) The operator of the mower advised while he was cutting grass on private property, the mower lost traction and began to slide down the large embankment, and ultimately continued over the embankment and on top of a parked vehicle. It should be noted that the embankment is approximately 25-30ft high. V2 was the vehicle that was parked at the bottom of the large embankment where the mower landed after going over the side of the embankment.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WENT STRAIGHT OUT OF PARKING SPOT AND STRUCK V2.D1 STATED HE STRUCK THE BUS AFTER PULLING OUT OF SPOT.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELLING WEST WHEN THE V1 STRUCK THE FRONT RIGHT BUMPER OF THE VEHICLE.W1 STATED THAT V1 REVVED ENGINE AND PULLED OUT OF PARKING SPOT FAST AND STRUCK V2.

V2 was parked on Lingelbach Lane east of Union Street facing west. V1 was backing up headed north from a parking spot on Lingelbach Lane. The rear bumper of V1 collided with the front bumper of V2.D1 stated that he was backing out of his parking spot on Lingelbach Lane and thought he had more space than he did. D1 stated he then heard a loud noise and he advised that the back bumper on the passenger side of his vehicle hit V2 on the front driver side bumper. D1 stated that he was at fault for the collision. D2 stated that she was facing westbound on Lingelbach Lane parked when she saw V1 begin to back out of his parking spot. D2 stated she saw V1 back into her vehicle from a parking spot. D2 advised that the rear passenger side bumper of V1 collided with the front driver side of her vehicle. D2 stated that as soon as D1 noticed he had hit D2, he pulled forward slightly and stopped, then exited his vehicle.There were no reported injuries.

BOTH UNITS WERE TRAVLING WEST ON STATE ROAD 46. UNIT 2 BEGAN TO STOP DUE TO TRAFFIC. UNIT 1 DID NOT SLOW IN TIME AND COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF UNIT 2. BOTH OCCUPANTS OF UNIT 2 STATED THAT THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 WAS ON HER CELL PHONE. UNIT 1 DRIVER DID NOT HAVE A VALID LICENSE AND WAS GIVEN A MISDEMEANOR CITATION.

D1 WAS BACKING V1 OUT OF A PARKING SPOT IN THE GAS STATION PARKING LOT. D2 WAS DRIVING V2 EB ATTEMPTING TO EXIT THE PARKING LOT OF THE GAS STATION ONTO S LEONARD SPRINGS RD. D1 DID NOT SEE V2 AND AS HE WAS BACKING UP THE RIGHT SIDE OF V1 CONNECTED WITH THE RIGHT FRONT OF V2. D1 HAD ENOUGH MOMENTUM TO BACK V1 ACCROSS V2 FROM THE REAR DOOR TO THE FRONT TIRE. V1 HAD DAMAGE DOWN THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE VEHICLE.V2 HAD DAMAGE TO THE RIGHT FRONT OF THE FRONT BUMPER.

No other officers assisted with the investigation.When I arrived on scene, D1 and D2 were in a verbal argument about the accident. Both parties were separated as I gathered their accounts of what happened.V1 was parked in valid parking stall that was perpendicular to Law Lane and was attempting to back out onto Law Lane.V2 was traveling westbound on Law Lane and approaching the Jordan Avenue intersection. V2 then began to come to a stop behind an unrelated vehicle that was completely stopped at the red light. This placed V2 directly behind and perpendicular to V1.D2 stated that he was traveling westbound on Law Lane and approaching a stopped vehicle at the Jordan Avenue intersection at a low rate of speed. At that time, V1 backed from their parking stall and collided with the front, passenger portion of his vehicle. The damage was at the front of the door where it meets with the front quarter panel and bends inward. The damage caused the front passenger door to no longer open correctly as it now made physical contact with the quarter panel. Both occupants, O1 and O2, both agreed with D2's side of the story and gave the same accounts.D1 stated that she was backing her SUV out of the parking stall and began to hear the beeping from her reverse sensors. She then stated that she made slight contact with V2. She stated that the contact would have been on the rear, passenger part of the vehicle and not the front, passenger portion of the vehicle as D2 alleged. D1 was adamant she did not cause the damage to V2 and claimed the damage to V2 was likely from a prior incident.*The height of V1's rear bumper was consistent with the damage location to V2. The damage to V2 did appear new as the front passenger was unable to exit the vehicle correctly without causing further damage to the door and quarter panel.There are no other witnesses or cameras in the area. Both vehicles were able to be driven safely from the scene and none of individuals involved complained of injury.

Drive 1 stated that he was driving through the parking lot of 528 S College Ave, Bloomington, IN, 47403, attempting to make a left turn.Driver 1 stated that he didn't see a street sign in the parking lot, and struck the sign on the left front of his vehicle.

Unit 1 was travelling Westbound on W ST RD 46, approaching the intersection of N Curry Pike. Whilst trying to determine the correct route that the posted construction detour was directing him, Unit 1 did not notice that traffic was coming to a stop and impacted with Unit 2 which was directly in front of him.

D1 reported the collision approximately 24 hours after it occurred. D1 stated on the previous afternoon, June 29, 2019, he parked his pickup and boat trailer in the lot at Four Winds Marina. D1 stated his vehicle was parked, unoccupied between the hours of 11:30A and 4:30P. D1 stated when he returned to his vehicle, he observed damage and a note left on his vehicle. The note had a phone number for D2.I was able to speak with D2 by telephone. D2 identified herself as the driver that collided with V1. D2 also provided her vehicle information. D2 stated her trailer wheel collided with V1. D2 stated V1 was unoccupied so she left a note with her phone number.I did not observe the collison scene. Photographs were taken of V1 since it was brought to the Sheriff's Office.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was turning south bound from West Cowden Road, onto N Mt. Tabor Road. V2 was Traveling north bound on North Mount Tabor Road. As V1 was turning south bound, V2 crashed into him. D1 stated he looked both directions before entering Mt. Tabor Road and did not see V2. There is a hill crest approximately 50 feet south of West Cowden Road on North Mt.Tabor Road which could have obstructed his view of V2.V2 was moved out of the roadway, prior to my arrival.

On 06/29/2019 at 1608 hours, I was dispatched to a two-vehicle collision at 10th St and Bypass 45/46. V2 was stopped in the southbound lane of Bypass 45/46 just north of the intersection of 10th and the Bypass. As he was stopped at the light waiting for traffic to go by, he was rear ended by V1. V1 was directly behind V2 in the southbound lane.I spoke with D1, who advised me that he was in the southbound lane of Bypass 45/46 stopped at the traffic light. He stated that V2 was directly in front of him. Both vehicles were stopped at the light. He stated that the traffic light turned green and he started going straight. He stated that he was distracted by grabbing a water bottle and the front bumper of his vehicle struck the rear bumper of V2.I spoke with D2, who advised me that he was in the southbound lane of Bypass 45/46 stopped at the traffic light. He stated that the light turned green and he was waiting for a car in front of him to start in traffic. He stated that as he was stopped he felt the front bumper of V1 collide with the rear bumper of his vehicle.No injuries were reported at the scene.

V1/D1 IS LSA.V2/D2 STATED "I WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN FROM W. KIRKWOOD AVE. V1 WAS IN THE LEFT TURN LANE, I WAS IN THE SECOND LEFT TURN LANE/STRAIGHT/RIGHT TURN LANE. AS V1 AND MYSELF MADE THE LEFT HAND TURN, V1 MERGED INTO MY LANE OF TRAVEL AND SIDESWIPPED ME WITH HER FRONT BUMPER. V1 CONTINUED WESTBOUND. AT A STOP LIGHT ON W. 3RD ST I GOT OUT OF MY CAR AND APPROACH AN ELDERLY FEMALE WHO WOULD NOT ROLL DOWN HER WINDOWS AND TOLD HER SHE HIT MY CAR. SHE IGNORED ME AND CONTINUE TO DRIVE WESTBOUND ON W. 3RD ST."I HAVE LEFT SEVERAL VOICEMAIL MESSAGES WITH OWNER OF V1. I WILL ATTEMPT TO LOCATE HER UPON RETURN TO WORK ON 7-3-2019.

Unit 1 was travelling Southbound on N Union Valley Rd. Just North of the intersection with Meadowvale Rd, Whilst coming to a stop in traffic, Unit 2, which was following too closely, impacted with the rear of Unit 1. No injuries and both units drove away from scene.

V1 (TOYOTA COROLLA) WAS SOUTHBOUND WITHIN THE 1700 BLOCK OF NORTH COLLEGE AVENUE.D1(NICOLE FULLMER) ADVISED SHE WAS UNFAMILIAR WITH THE AREA AND WAS USING HER GPS TO GET TO YOGA.D1 ADVISED THE GPS TOLD HER TO TURN RIGHT.D1 IMMEDIATELY TURNED RIGHT FROM THE OUTSIDE LANE.D1 ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE IN HER BLIND SPOT AS SHE ATTEMPTED TO TURN.V2 (BMW 335I) WAS SOUTHBOUND WITHIN THE 1700 BLOCK OF NORTH COLLEGE AVENUE.D2 (ROBERT HOUSTON) ADVISED HE WAS SOUTHBOUND IN THE INSIDE/RIGHT LANE. D2 ADVISED V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN RIGHT FROM THE OUTSIDE LANE AND COLLIDED WITH HIS VEHICLE. D1 ADMITTED FAULT IN THIS ACCIDENT.

V1 was EB on E 3rd street and was in the right lane following V2. V2 turned right into a parking lot and V1 struck V2 in the driver side rear bumper with the passenger side bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that V2 was initially in the left lane and in front of them. She stated he was driving on the center dividing lane and then moved over in front of them. She stated he turned on his turn signal to turn right and as he was turning in, he stopped completely still partially in the road. D1 stated she could not go around him on the left due to other cars in that lane. She stated she struck V2 in the driver side rear bumper with the front passenger side bumper of her vehicle.D2 stated that he was turning right into a parking lot and was struck in the rear by V1. He stated that he didn't stop completely in the road, he stated he had his turn signal on and slowed down and then slowed down again as he started to turn right. He stated he was then hit.
D2 STATED HE PULLED INTO THE DRIVEWAY AND PARKED BEHIND V1 AND WHILE HE WAS PARED THERE, V1 BACKED INTO V2.

Contributory Cause- Vehicle Factor- Vehicle#1 was traveling southbound on Interstate 69 near the 105.0 mile marker when the front left tire deflated causing Vehicle#1 to lose control and go into the center grass median.Interstate 69 is a multi-lane road with two lanes going north and two lanes going south divided by a center grass median in the area of the 105 mile marker in Monroe County. The speed limit is 70mph and the roadway is straight in this area. The area has no street lights and it was daylight at the time of the crash.Vehicle#1 (Maroon 2010 Nissan Maxima) was traveling south on Interstate 69 near the 105 mile marker. Vehicle#1 was driven by Driver#1 (Daniel J Caldwell) when the left front tire went flat causing Vehicle#1 to lose control and travel off the east side of the Interstate causing the driver's side front left and rear left tire to be removed from the rims. Driver#1 stated that he was traveling at approximately 65 miles per hour traveling southbound in the left lane on Interstate 69, when his left tire went flat. He then attempted to keep control of the vehicle, but was unable to keep it on the roadway and slid into the median. I observed damage to Vehicle#1. The left front tire was off the rim, and the left rear tire was off the rim. Vehicle#1 also appeared to have a rear axle broken. The left rear tire was facing inward. The Vehicle traveled off the roadway into the center grass median and I observed damage to the ground.

Vehicle 1 was traveling west on 17th street. When approaching the stop light at the intersection of Kinser Pike, vehicle 1 was attempting to turn left on N Kinser Pike and another vehicle passed vehicle 1 in the straight lane and then turned abruptly in front of vehicle 1. Driver of vehicle 1 turned sharply to avoid hitting the other vehicle and went across the roadway and hit a stop light on the south east side of the intersection. Vehicle 1 has damage to the front of the vehicle and the stop light was knocked down and onto the top of vehicle 1. Driver stated he was the only one in the vehicle at the time of the crash. Officer McGlone reviewed video footage of the accident from the Marathon gas station on the south west corner of the 17th and Kinser intersection. In the video McGlone stated that Vehicle 1 appears the go left of center, cross the roadway and strike the stop light pole. Driver and passengers exit the vehicle run across the road and then the driver returns to the scene.No injuries from this accident.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTHBOUND ON N. WAYPORT RD FROM CHAMBERS PIKE, WHEN A DEER CROSSED THE ROAD. D1 TRIED TO SWERVE TO MISS THE DEER AND RAN V1 OFF THE ROADWAY AND INTO A DITCH. D1 THEN EXITED THE VEHICLE AND WALKED BACK TO HER RESIDENCE ON E. CHAMBERS PIKE. I MADE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER SHORTLY AFTER FINDING THE VEHICLE. D1 ARRANGED TO HAVE THERE PERSONAL WRECKER COME AND GET THE VEHICLE THE NEXT MORNING AND STATED THEY KNEW THE HOMEOWNERS AND WOULD FIX THE DAMAGE TO THE YARD.V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND CAME TO A REST AT 8740 N. WAYPORT RD, BLOOMINGTON, IN. I TRIED MAKING CONTACT WITH THE HOMEOWNER THAT NIGHT, HOWEVER NO ONE WAS HOME. THE FOLLOWING DAY I MADE CONTACT WITH THE HOME OWNERS SON AND HE ADVISED HIS PARENTS WERE AWARE AND WERE NOT WORRIED ABOUT THE TORN UP GRASS.

D1 STATED HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO DRIVE HOME. D1 STATED HE WENT AROUND A CURVE AND "THEN IT HAPPENED". I TRIED MUTLIPLE TIMES TO GET AN ACTUAL DESCRIPTION OF WHAT HAPPENED FROM D1, BUT HE WAS UNABLE TO DO THIS. I DID ASK D1 IF HE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN PRIOR TO ENTERING THE ROAD WAY AND D1 CONFIRMED HE DID STOP.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W. 1ST ST. D2 STATED SHE NEVER SAW D1 UNTIL HE MADE IMPACT WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF HER VEHICLE. D2 STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE AND MISS D1, BUT DID NOT HAVE TIME. D2 STATED BY THE TIME SHE GOT OUT OF HER VEHICLE, D1 WAS ALREADY SITTING ON THE EDGE OF THE ROAD. W1 STATED D1 HAD JUST LEFT HIS HOUSE. W1 STATED THEY OBSERVED D1 DRIVE UP A PRIVATE RAMP TO THE HOSPITAL. W1 STATED D1 THEN BEGIN PEDALING HIS BICYCLE AS FAST AS HE COULD DOWN THE RAMP TOWARDS THE ROAD. W1 STATED D1 DISREGARDED THE STOP SIGN AND DROVE DIRECTLY INTO THE SIDE OF V2. W1 STATED D1 QUICKLY GOT UP AND MOVED TO THE SIDEWALK AND SAT DOWN.

V1 was traveling west bound on State Road 45/46 through the two lane divided construction area just east of the I69 overpass.D1 stated he was traveling west bound and drove left of center. D1 was unable to maintain control of the vehicle and drove off the embankment. D1 made numerous attempts to turn around and drive back up the embankment. Due to the wet conditions and incline D1 was unable to regain access to State Road 45/46. After leaving the roadway D1's vehicle struck a Lane merging sign. D1's vehicle came to rest facing north east, just east of I69 near the overpass.There was moderate damage all around D1's vehicle. D1 was ultimately arrested for Operating While Intoxicated and Possession of a Narcotic drug. Results for drug and alcohol are pending. Blood analysis by ISDT revealed D1's BAC was .100. Drug analysis was cancelled at the request of the Monroe County Prosecutor's Office.

V1 was traveling E/B on 3rd ST. V2 and V3 were traveling S/B on Gates DR, turning E/B on 3rd ST. V1 disregard the red traffic control signal and struck V2. V2 then collided with V3 in attempts to avoid V1. D1 advised that he was traveling E/B on 3rd ST. D1 stated that while traveling E/B, he proceeded through the intersection, while the traffic control signal was red. D1 advised that he thought the traffic control signal was yellow when he struck V2. . D1 was not injured. D2 advised that he was stopped at the traffic control signal at the intersection of 3rd & Gates DR. D2 stated that he proceeded through the intersection while having the green turn arrow to travel E/B on 3rd ST. D2 advised that he then felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that he attempted to swerve to avoid the collision when he struck V3. D2 advised that he was not injured. D3 advised that she was stopped at the traffic control signal at the intersection of 3rd & Gates DR. D3 advised that she proceeded through the intersection while having the green turn arrow to travel E/B on 3rd ST. D3 advised that she then felt the impact of V2. D3 was not injured. Due to D1 disregarding the traffic control signal, V1 struck V2 which caused V2 to collide with V3.

Driver 1 stated that she was traveling southbound on SR 446 when a vehicle traveling northbound came around a curve almost entirely in the southbound lane. Driver 1 swerved to the right to avoid colliding with the other vehicle and ran off the road striking the end of the guard rail. Driver 1's vehicle sustained significant damage to the right front and passenger side front fender and passenger side door. There was also minor damage to the right side of her boat trailer near the tire. The guard rail also sustained significant damage.

Vehicle was westbound on East State Road 45 at N. Russell Road when it appears to have left the roadway, ramped an embankment, struck some trees, and came to rest on the ground in the landscaping and lawn of 3911 Tamarron Court.

V2 WAS PARKED IN A NORTH/SOUTH RUNNING PARKING LINE, FACING EAST, IN THE PARKING LOT OF 100 E MILLER DRIVE.MR. SMITH, WHO WAS STANDING NEXT TO HIS VEHICLE WHICH WAS PARKED A SHORT DISTANCE FROM V2 STATED THAT HE DID SEE A WHITE DODGE VAN ATTEMPTING TO BACK OUT OF THE COMPLEX TOWARDS E MILLER.MR. SMITH STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE THE VAN COLLIDE INTO V2, BUT HE STATED THAT THAT THE WHITE DODGE VAN APPEARED TO BE STRUGGLING TO BACK UP AND HAD TO PULL FORWARDS SEVERAL TIMES.MR. SMITH STATED THAT HE BELIEVES THAT THE WHITE DODGE VAN REAR ENDED V2.MR. SMITH STATED THAT THE REAR PASSENGER CORNER OF THE DODGE VAN APPEARED TO HAVE DAMAGE AND THAT IT DID HAVE BLACK PAINT TRANSFER CONSISTENT WITH THE COLOR OF V2.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER OF V2 WAS DAMAGED AND DID APPEAR TO HAVE WHITE PAINT TRANFER ON THE CORNER.V2 WAS NOT TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.THERE IS NO SUSPECT INFORMATION FOR THE DODGE VAN, V1.MR. SMITH COULD NOT SEE THE DRIVER OF THE DODGE VAN AND DID NOT SEE THE LICENSE PLATE.

V1 was headed E/B in the parking lot of 528 S College Ave. V1 attempted to make a left turn, N/B, when it struck a stop sign/concrete barrier. V1 sustained damage to the front, driver's side, which did disable the tire. D1 left the scene prior to my arrival. V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage and being abandoned in the middle of the business roadway.

Vehicle 2 was parked, backed into a parking space facing north on the lot. Vehicle 2 was occupied by the Owner. Vehicle 1 was backing out of a spot opposite of Vehicle 2, also facing north in the lot. Vehicle 1 backed into Vehicle 2 as it remained stationary. Vehicle 1 then left the scene without making the reporting requirement.

D2 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP LIGHT AT STATE ROAD 46 WEST & NORTH CENTENNIAL DR WHEN SHE WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. D1 STATED THAT HE HAD BRAKE ISSUES AND HE THOUGHT THERE MIGHT BE AN AIR BUBBLE IN THE BRAKE LINES. BOTH CARS WERE DROVE FROM THE SCENE. BOTH PARTIES STATED THEY DID NOT WANT AN AMBULANCE TO COME CHECK THEM OUT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT OF 345 S CURRY PIKE, PREPARING TO TURN SOUTH ONTO CURRY PIKE. D1 OBSERVED NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC BACKED UP FROM THE LIGHT AT W 3RD ST. D1 OBSERVED V2 APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH, BUT BELIEVED IT WAS GOING TO SLOW/STOP FOR THE TRAFFIC BACK UP. V1 TURNED OUT OF THE PARKING LOT, BUT HAD TO SLOW HIS TURN BECAUSE OF APPROACHING SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC. V1 WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 2 IN THE ROADWAY. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS NORTH BOUND ON CURRY PIKE APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH WEST 3RD ST. D2 DID OBSERVED NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC BACKED UP AT THE STOP LIGHT, BUT THE LEFT TURN LANE WAS CLEAR. AS SHE CAME TO THE TURN LANE, SHE OBSERVED V1 PULL OUT OF THE ADJACENT PARKING LOT INTO HER PATH. D2 TRIED TO SWERVE QUICKLY, BUT COULD NOT AVOID V1. WITNESS 1 ADVISED SHE OBSERVED V2 NORTH BOUND ON CURRY PIKE. SHE DID NOT SEE WHERE V1 HAD COME FROM. SHE SAW V2 SWERVE ABRUPTLY AND COLLIDE WITH V1.
V1 STRUCK V2. D1 LEFT THE SCENE.D2 STATED SHE NOTICED DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE. DAMAGE TO FRONT BUMPER AND THE GRILL WAS SMASHED IN.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE NORTH BOUND ON CURRY PIKE IN SLOWED TRAFFIC. D1 SAID SHE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE, AND TRIED TO MAKE A U-TURN (WEST) TO GET OUT OF THE TRAFFIC, AND PULLED IN FRONT OF V2, WHICH WAS NORTH BOUND IN THE LEFT LANE.D2 SAID V1 SUDDENLY TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF HIM, HE TRIED TO BRAKE BUT STRUCK V1, CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.BOTH DRIVERS HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN, BUT DID NOT GO TO THE HOSPITAL.

ON 7/1/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON RICHLAND DRIVE AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY ON A CURB. UNIT 1 STRUCK UNIT 2 PARKED ON THE SIDE OF THE ROADWAY FACING WEST ON RICHLAND DRIVE. UNIT I SIDESWIPPED UNIT 2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRON PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER AND DAMAGE DOWN THE PASSENGER SIDE OF UNIT 2. UNIT 1 SHOWED SIGNS OF DAMAGE FROM THE CURB AND SIDESWIPPING UNIT 2. THE DRIVER TO UNIT 1 WAS NOT LOCATED AT THE SCENE AND HAD LEFT THE SCENE TO RETURN HOME. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 LATER IDENTIFIED AS DANIEL FLEENER AND AN OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED INVESTIGATION FOLLOWED.

During the course of an operating while intoxicated investigation it was determined that vehicle 1 was traveling north on Hawthorne Dr from 2nd St and left the roadway, striking a light post on the east side of the road.

V1 WAS TRAVELLING EASTBOUND ON SR 48 JUST EAST OF CAVE RD WHEN A DEER ENTERED THE ROADWAY. D1 STATED THE DEER CAME FROM THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD AND COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT LEFT SIDE OF HER VEHICLE. THE DEER WAS LOCATED ON THE NORTHSIDE OF SR 48.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was pulling out of her driveway located at 7218 E State Road 45. D1 stated she looked left, did not see any vehicles approaching. D1 stated she looked right, saw a vehicle approaching however it appeared far away. D1 stated she then pulled out onto the roadway. D1 stated she did not remember much after that. D1 stated she was struck on the driver (left) side. D1 stated after the collision, she was on the front passenger (right) side of her vehicle. D2 stated he was driving east on SR 45 at 45 MPH when he observed D1 entering the roadway from a driveway. D2 stated D1 pulled out in front of him and he had no chance to apply the brakes. V2 passenger stated she observed D1 pulling out of a driveway and that D1 appeared to be moving fast. V2 passenger stated there was no time to say "looks like she isn't going to stop". All occupants where transported to Bloomington Hospital.

V1 was traveling north bound on North Louden Road. D1 stated a squirrel ran out into the roadway and she swerved to try to avoid hitting it. V1 ran off the west side of the roadway and drove partially through an agricultural field which was planted. Douglas Jacobs is the owner of the crops which were damaged as a result of the accident.
Driver 1 stated she was pulling into a parking spot in the Target lot. Driver 1 stated she misjudged the turn and struck the rear of vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was parked in a space.

Vehicle 1 was on Gates Drive at the intersection of 3rd Street, facing South, while in the outer most turn lane to turn East. Vehicle 2 was also on Gates Drive at the intersection of 3rd Street, facing South, in the inner most turn lane to turn East. Vehicle 1 was directly West of Vehicle 2 as both vehicles waited for the traffic light to turn green.When the light turned green, both vehicles began turning East. Vehicle 2 left its lane of travel and merged into Vehicle 1's lane of travel. Vehicle 2 collided with Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated that Vehicle 2 came into his lane of travel and caused the collision.Driver 2 stated that Vehicle 1 came into her lane of travel and caused the collision.When Deputy Ruiz arrived, the cars were at located in Vehicle 1's lane of travel.

V1 was parked in front of 507 E Graham drive facing west and V2 was parked facing North in front of 513 E Graham drive. V1 backed up to the NE and struck V2 on the driver side in the middle of the vehicle with the driver side rear bumper of his vehicle. D1 left the scene because he did not know he hit a vehicle. There was some minor damage on his rear bumper.

V1 STRUCK V2 ON THE REAR RIGHT QUARTER PANEL.D1 LEFT THE SCENE.D2 STATED THAT THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON 07/02/19, HOWEVER REPORTED IT ON 07/10/19. D2 MADE REPORT AT 220 E 3RD STREET; BLOOMINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT. D2 STATED THAT SHE RETURNED TO HER VEHICLE OUTSIDE KROGER JACKSON CREEK AND NOTICED DAMAGE. D2 STATED THAT SOMEONE HAD LEFT A NOTE ON HER WINDSHIELD STATING THAT SOMEONE HAD WITNESSED A OLDER MALE IN A WHITE CAR HIT HER VEHICLE.THIS CASE IS STILL UNDER INVESTIGATION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT OF 115 SOUTH STATE ROAD 46 AND THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT, SOUTHEAST, IN THE PARKING LOT.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT SEE V2 GOING STRAIGHT, WEST, IN THE PARKING LOT.D1 DID THEN TURN LEFT INTO V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER OF V1 AND DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER OF V2.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST IN THE PARKING LOT OF 115 SOUTH STATE ROAD 46, GOING STRAIGHT, WHEN V1 DID TURN LEFT INTO V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.NEITHER DRIVER REQUIRED MEDICAL ATTENTION.

V3 was stopped a the traffic light heading south at the intersection of 45/46 and North Kinser Pike. V2 was stopped at the light in front of V3. V1 then collided with the rear of V3 causing damage and propelling V3 into the rear of V2. V1 then left the scene heading west without attempting to stop and exchange information. The driver of V2 exited his vehicle to check for damages, did not observe damages and then left the scene as well without exchanging information. The driver of V3 then contacted police to file a report.D3 stated that she did not see V1 during the incident and she was unable to tell me what type of vehicle was V2. Damage on V3 matches statement made by D3. No witnesses were on scene.

V1 AND V2 WERE TRAVELING SOUTH ON SMITH PIKE AT WOODYARD ROAD WHEN V2 WAS STOPPED OR SLOWED IN TRAFFIC. AS V1 WAS APPRAOCHING THE REAR OF V2 D2 DID NOT STOP AND COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2. BOTH DRIVERS HAD SEAT BELTS NO INJURIES.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS EAST BOUND ON WEST WOODYARD JUST EAST OF INTERSECTION WEST WALCOTT LANE. VEHICLE 1 CROSSED THE CENTER LINE AND STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN A CURVE WHILE VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING WEST BOUND ON WEST WOODYARD ROAD.BOTH VEHICLE 1 AND 2 WERE DISABLED AND TOWED TO RICK'S TOWING BY RICK'S TOWING.ALL OCCUPANTS WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.

D1stated he was traveling north on S Old SR 37 at approximately 45-50 MPH when he encountered gravel in the roadway. D1 stated he over corrected and ran off the road. I observed no gravel in the roadway. The only gravel I observed was a driveway, off to the east side of the roadway. I observed tire marks leading from the gravel drive, across the roadway, to D1s crashed vehicle.D1 showed signs of fatigue; slow speech, heavy eyelids, and stated he finished an overnight work shift earlier this morning. D1 also stated he has a Suboxone Rx, 8mg, 3x daily. D1 stated he took his last does approx. 3-4 hours earlier. D1 was administered SFSTs and passed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: The intersection of Fountain Dr and 11th St is a Y-intersection with southbound Fountain Drive traffic having the right of way to continue onto Fountain Drive or 11th St. NB Fountain Drive is posted posted with a stop sign and westbound 11th St traffic has the right of way to continue northbound onto Fountain Dr but being required to use due regard and yield to southbound traffic while turning south (left) onto Fountain Dr. Traffic turning south (left) from 11th St onto Fountain drive have to cross a double-yellow traffic control line in order to complete the turn. Vehicle 1 (white, Chevrolet Malibu) was traveling westbound on 11th St and conducted a left hand turn in order to travel south onto Fountain Dr. Vehicle 2 (gray, Ford Crown Victorian) was traveling southeast on Fountain Dr continuing straight onto Fountain Dr south of 11th St when V2 turned in front of V1. V1 then struck the right rear of V2 with the front left of V1. Driver 1 (Diane Guzik) stated that she was traveling WB on 11th St when she turned south onto Fountain Dr and V2 hit her. D1 stated that V2 was far back when she turned. D1 told Law Enforcement to check the phone of D2 and that she was not at fault. D1 continued on to attempt to state that there were pieces of broken car in the roadway that showed they were no longer in the intersection indicating that D1 had not turned in front of D2 but that D2 had rear ended D1.Driver 2 (Lily Tolliver) stated that she was traveling SB on Fountain Dr when V1 turned south onto Fountain Dr in front of her. D2 stated that she applied her brakes and swerved in an attempt to avoid the collision but was unable to do so and struck V1.It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the reason for the crash is Failure to yield right of way and that Driver 1 is at fault. The damage sustained to V1 is on the right rear passenger side and not the very rear of the bumper. The damage sustained by V2 is on the driver's side of the vehicle and not on the very front of the vehicle. The location of the damage to both vehicles show that it was not a rear end collision as indicated by D1 and supports a left turn crash as stated by D2.RRK

V1 was driving East on SR 45/46. V2 was stopped on the light on SR 45/46 at the Dunn St. Intersection facing East. D2 stated that he was stopped at the light on SR 45/46 waiting for the red light to turn green when V1 rear ended him. V2 had a trailer on the back of it. D1 stated that she remembers turning left off of Walnut Avenue to head East on SR 45/46 but does not remember anything after that. I asked D1 what had happened and she stated that she fell asleep while she was driving. D1 stated that she woke up when V1 struck V2s trailer. The airbag was deployed in V1s vehicle. V1 was towed to Ken's Westside due to the airbag being deployed. I noticed D1 had an abrasion to her wrists from the airbag and had an ambulance show up. D1 did not complain of any injuries or pain until I mentioned her wrists. D1 signed the signature of release form. When the ambulance showed up D2 stated that his neck was hurting, I had the ambulance check him out. D2 was transported by ambulance 2164.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

The front tire of V1 possibly hit the underside of V2's rear bumper causing damage to it. V1 then got up and left area. D2 stated that she heard V1 crash as she passed by him at stop sign. She heard a loud bang on her vehicle. She stated she told the male to stay and get checked but he just cursed at her and then left on his motorcycle.

I69 is a multi-lane Interstate with three lanes northbound and three lanes southbound that are separated by a guardrail median.V1, Chevrolet Malibu, was traveling south on I69 in the middle lane. V1 began to slide on the wet roadway and traveled off the west, right, side of the roadway. V1 struck the guardrail along the west side of the roadway and came to rest facing north along the southbound outside shoulder. D1, Horton, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the middle lane. D1 stated the roadway was wet due to heavy rain. D1 stated he attempted to slow by pressing the brakes. D1 stated he lost control of V1 and began to slide to the right. D1 stated he struck a guardrail then came to final rest along the right shoulder. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail face consistent with an impact by V1. Evidence shows the roadway was wet during the accident investigation. Evidence shows airbags within V1 were deployed as a result of the impact. D1 was examined by EMS personnel but refused medical treatment at the scene.

On Thursday July 3, 2019 at 6pm I was working off duty security at the Monroe County Fairgrounds. A female walked up to me and said she had hit another vehicle in the parking lot. She told me the license plate and I was able to track the other party down.The parking lot at the Monroe County Fairgrounds is a grass lot with dirt lanes separating the parking spots.V1 (2010 Chevy Malibu) was backing east out of a parking spot. Due to vehicles being parked next to it D1 could not see well. V1 stopped to let multiple vehicles pass before it could exit its spot. When it re-started backing up the rear bumper collided with the front bumper of V2 (2004 Honda Civic). D1 (Courtney Ankney) advised she was backing out. She advised she couldn't see because of the vehicles parked next to her. She advised she stopped to let multiple vehicles pass before she continued to back up. Once clear she continued to back up hitting V2 which was parked in the spot behind her. I witnessed minor damage to the rear bumper of V1 and minor damage to the front bumper of V2. I did witness V2's front bumper was sticking out into the lane of travel. When I asked the owner she advised they couldn't back in all the way because of a big truck that was parked behind them that was no longer there.No enforcement action was taken and both vehicles were drivable.

VEHICLE 1 WHILE FACING EAST WAS BACKING WEST BOUND IN THE PARKING LOT OF 21 EAST DILLMAN RD. VEHICLE 1 BACKED INTO FRONT RIGHT BUMBER OF VEHICLE 2. VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANNY MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

D1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN EB FROM OARD RD ONTO ST RD 48.D1 STATED THAT A VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING FAST GOING WB ON 48 AND D1 ACCELERATED TO MISS THE VEHICLE AND WENT INTO A DITCH DIRECTLY ACCROSS FROM OARD RD. D1 IDENTIFIED HERSELF AS ERIN SHIPLEY-COURTER AND STATED SHE HAD BEEN DRIVING THE VEHICLE. UPON GATHERING MS. SHIPLEY-COURTERS INFORMATION I DETECTED THE ODOR OF ALCOHOL EMMITTING FROM ONE IF NOT BOTH THE OCCUPANTS OF THE VEHICLE. UPON ASKING MS. SHIPLEY COURTER IF SHE CONSUMED ALCOHOL SHE STATED NO. MS. SHIPLEY THEN STATED THAT SHE HAD CONSUMED ALCOHOL HOURS AGO. DEPUTY BENNETT DILLON PROCEEDED TO RUN MS. SHIPLEY-COURTER THROUGH SFST WHICH SHE FAILED.MS. SHIPLEY COURTER WAS THEN OFFERED A PBT WHICH REGISTERED .201 GRAMS OF ALCOHOL PER 210 LITERS OF BREATH. MS. COURTER WAS TAKEN ON STATION AND GIVEN A CERTIFIED TEST WHICH REGISTERED .173 GRAMS OF ALCOHOL PER 210 LITERS OF BREATH. THE VEHICLE WAS REMOVED FROM THE DITCH AND TOWED BY BLANDS.

D2 WAS ON PATROL IN HIS FULLY MARKED PATROL VEHICLE, TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON I-69 SOUTH, WHEN HE OBSERVED V1 SWERVING ALL OVER THE ROAD, TRAVELING SOUTH AS WELL, AND UNABLE TO MAINTAIN ITS LANE. AN ATTEMPT WAS THEN MADE TO STOP V1; HOWEVER, V1 FAILED TO YIELD TO V2 AND CONTINUED SOUTHBOUND ON I-69 AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. THE SUBSEQUENT PURSUIT WENT ON FOR SEVERAL MILES ON I-69 BEFORE V1 EXITED ONTO W SR 45 IN GREENE COUNTY AND TRAVELED EAST TOWARDS BLOOMINGTON. THROUGHOUT THIS LENGTHY PURSUITE V1 CONTINUED DRIVING ERRATICALLY TO INLUDE GOING LEFT OF CENTER, TRAVELING WELL IN EXCESS OF THE POSTED SPEED LIMIT, AND AT ONE POINT ON I-69 V1 TRAVELED SOUTHBOUND IN THE NORTHBOUND LANE. NEAR W SR 45 & ELWREN RD A TIRE DEFLATION DEVICE WAS SUCCESSFULLY DEPLOYED AND V1'S PASSENGER SIDE TIRES DEFLATED AND CAME OFF OF V1. D1 STILL CONTINUED TRAVELING EAST WHILE DRIVING ON TWO RIMS. AS THE PURSUIT BEGAN TO ENTER INTO THE URBAN AREA OF BLOOMINGTON, AT THE INTERSECTION OF W SR 45 & INDUSTRIAL BLVD, D2 INITIATED CONTACT WITH THE REAR END OF V1 TO BRING V1 TO A STOP AND TO PREVENT ANY FURTHER RISK TO THE PUBLIC. V1 SUBSEQUENTLY CAME TO A STOP NEAR THE INTERSECTION. D1 WAS THEN TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.

Driver one stated he was backing up in the parking lot when he went to put the vehicle in drive. Driver one stated the throttle in his vehicle went wide open launching his vehicle forward. Driver one stated he had his foot on the brake as hard as he could but that didn't stop the vehicle from hitting the tree. Driver one stated he wasn't under any medication or pain killers. Driver one stated his legs were very swollen prior to the accident.Witness one stated vehicle one was backing up in the parking when he backed into a bush and then went forward. Witness one stated he heard the engine rev-up and the vehicle go forward at a high speed into the tree and bench. Witness one stated after vehicle one hit the tree it rolled back and the engine was still reving up.Witness two stated she was in the passenger seat when driver one was backing up and she told him he was getting to close to the bush. Witness two stated driver one then put the vehicle in drive and they drove forward into the tree. Witness two stated driver one was having medical problem and just had surgery on his knee. While listening driver one speak to medical personnel he stated he didn't recall the accident. Driver one was not slurring his speech and didn't have any other signs on impairment.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: I69 is a multi-lane divided interstate that is separated by a guardrail median near the area of this collision. There are three lanes northbound and three lanes southbound.V1, white Mercedes, was traveling south on I69 in the center lane. V2, silver Chevrolet, was traveling south on I69 in the center lane behind V1. V1 began to slide across the roadway. V2 slowed but was unable to avoid impact with V1. V2 struck the passenger side of V1 with the front left corner of V2 in the left, number 1, lane of I69 southbound. V1 came to final rest facing northwest in the number 1 lane of I69 southbound. V2 came to final rest facing south in the number 1 lane of I69 southbound. D1, Perry, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the center lane. D1 stated there was significant rainfall and the roadway was wet. D1 stated he lost control of V1 and began to slide across the roadway. D1 stated V2 struck the side of V1 as he was sliding across the roadway. D2, Thomas, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the center lane behind V1. D2 stated there was significant rainfall and the roadway was wet. D2 stated he observed V1 begin to slide ahead of him. D2 stated he began to slow and moved into the left, number 1, lane. D2 stated V1 continued to slide across the roadway and he was unable to avoid collision. D2 stated he struck the passenger side of V1 with the front of V2.Evidence shows the roadway was wet during the accident investigation. Evidence shows damage to the passenger side of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front left corner and driver's front wheel of V2.

CRASH OCURRED IN RONT OF THE YARD OF 4344 S WALNUT ST PK. D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SB ON S WALNUT ST PK AND WAS ON HIS CELL PHONE WHEN HE RAN OFF THE ROADWAY INTO THE DRAINAGE DITCH ON THE PROPERTY OF 4344 S WALNUT ST PK. IT TOOK THE FRONT RIGHT TIRE COMPLETELY OFF THE VEHICLE AND DRIVER FOR TOWTIME STATED THAT IT TOTALLED THE CAR DUE TO FRAME DAMAGE. UPON LOOKING AT THE PROPERTY WHERE THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED THERE WAS NO SUBSTANCIAL DAMAGE TO THE PROPERTY, JUST SMALL SCUFF MARKS IN THE GRASS. THE DRAINAGE PIPE HAD NO VISIBLE DAMAGE.

V1 WAS DRIVING WESTBOUND ON E. 3RD ST. NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH S. STATE ROAD 446. A FEW SECONDS PRIOR TO ARRIVING IN THE INTERSECTION A DARK GRAY CHEVROLET EQUINOX MADE A LEFT HAND TURN FROM THE EASTBOUND LANES OF E. 3RD ST ONTO A PRIVATE DRIVE AT THE INTERSECTION. THIS VEHICLE FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY BY PULLING OUT ACROSS V1'S LANE OF TRAVEL.D1 STATED HE RAN OFF THE ROAD TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH THE CHEVROLET EQUINOX. V1 HIT A CURB AND CAME TO REST ON AN EMBANKMENT. V1 HAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER AND BOTH FRONT AXLES APPEARED TO BE BROKEN. THE TWO VEHICLES DID NOT COLLIDE.A WITNESS ON SCENE PROVIDED AN INDIANA LICENSE PLATE NUMBER FOR THE EQUINOX OF WC1684. DISPATCH WAS UNABLE TO GET A RETURN ON THE PLATE AS GIVEN. I WAS UNABLE TO GET CONTACT INFO FOR THE WITNESS DUE TO HER LEAVING BEFORE I WAS ABLE TO SPEAK WITH HER AGAIN. SHE DID CONFIRM V1'S STATEMENTS.SUPPLEMENT #1: RECEIVED CORRECTED CRASH DESCRIPTION BY D1. UPDATED NARRATIVE AND DIAGRAM.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING WB ON W SAMPLE RD. DRIVER 1 ADVISED THE NEXT THING HE KNEW IS THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN A FIELD. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WENT TO HIS RESIDENCE LOCATED AT 876 W SAMPLE LANE AND GOT HIS FATHER AND THEN RETURNED TO THE SCENE DUE TO NOT HAVING ANOTHER MEANS OF COMMUNICATION. OWNER OF PROPERTY ADVISED THAT AFTER THE CRASH HAD OCCURED THAT THEY OBSERVED THE DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 TO BE ACTIVELY SEIZING.WHEN VEHICLE 1 LEFT THE ROADWAY IT STRUCK A BASKETBALL HOOP LOCATED IN THE DRIVEWAY OF 7469 N CANYON CT BEFORE COMING TO A STOP IN AN OPEN GRASS FIELD TO THE WEST OF THAT RESIDENCE. VEHICLE 1 HAD MOVED PRIOR TO ARRIVAL OF OFFICERS ON SCENE. DRIVER 1 IS OPERATING UNDER A SPECIAL DRIVING PRIVLEGES FROM THE MONROE COUNTY COURTS.

V1 was traveling North on North Walnut Street approaching the intersection with Old State Road 37 when a deer entered the roadway. V1 attempted to swerve to miss the deer, but was unable to avoid a collision. V1 struck the deer on the passenger side of the vehicle. V1 sustained moderate damage to the rear passenger side fender and bumper and minor damage to the passenger side rear door and front passenger side fender. D1 stated that he was not injured and did not need medical treatment. V1 was drivable and was driven from the scene by D1. The deer was not located and believed to have to fled the scene. Evidence of the deer was left on the vehicle with both hair and blood on the rear passenger fender.
V-2 was stop at the stop light near the intersection of State Road 46 and Smith Pike. V-1 stated that she believe she may fell asleep for a second and collided with the rear of V-2.

D1 stated that he was driving south on N Headley Rd when a deer ran out in front of him. D1 stated that he swerved to the right to avoid hitting the deer. D1 ran off the side of the road and hit a tree with the passenger side of the vehicle, and then hit a metal support wire for a telephone pole head on.

D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED FACING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH ROCKPORT ROAD AT THE INTERSECTION OF WEST TAPP ROAD. D2 STATED V1 REAR ENDED V2. D2 THEN STATED HE GOT OUT OF THE VEHICLE TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION WITH D1, HOWEVER, D2 STATED SHE WAS IN A HURRY AND LEFT THE SCENE. D2 WAS ABLE TO GET THE LICENSE PLATE OF V1.OFFICERS THEN WENT TO THE ADDRESS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LICENSE PLATE ON V1 AND FOUND THE OWNER OF THE VEHICLE, WHO STATED THAT WAS HIS DAUGHTER'S VEHICLE. OFFICERS THEN WENT TO WHERE THE DAUGHTHER WAS LOCATED AND THE DAUGHTER WAS DETERMINED TO BE D1. D1 STATED SHE DID NOT BELIEVE SHE REAR ENDED V2. D1 STATED D2 DID GET OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND ASK FOR HER INFORMATION BUT D1 BELIEVED THERE WAS NO ACCIDENT SO SHE CONTINUED ON HER WAY.OWNER OF V1 DID STATE THE DAMAGE ON V1 WAS ALREADY THERE AND THERE WAS NO NEW DAMAGE.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN OF BOTH VEHICLES AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE. NO INJURIES REPORTED. THERE IS MINOR DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES, HOWEVER, THE OWNER OF V1 STATING THE DAMAGE WAS PREVIOUS.NO LAW ENFORCEMENT ACTION WAS TAKEN.

V2 WAS STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT ON 2ND STREET AT THE INTERSECTION OF 2ND AND COLLEGE AVE. WHILE V2 WAS STOPPED, V1 COLLIDED INTO THE REAR BUMPER OF V2 WITH V1 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES. D1 STATED THAT D2 CAME TO A QUICK STOP AT THE RED LIGHT AND D1 TRIED TO STOP BUT COULD NOT. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT FOR APPROXIMATELY 3-4 SECONDS WHEN HE WAS HIT IN THE REAR BUMPER OF HIS VEHICLE BY D1. D2 STATED HIS VEHICLE WAS PUSHED INTO THE CROSSWALK.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN OFF OF THE KETCHUM ROUNDABOUT TO PROCEED NB ON S OLD SR 37. DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 AND PULLED OUT STRIKING THE VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 ADVISED HE WAS NB ON S OLD SR 37 IN THE AREA OF S OLD SR 37 AND THE SOUTHERN INTERSECTION OF S OLD SR 37 AND THE KETCHUM ROUNDABOUT. DRIVER 2 ADVISED VEHICLE 1 PULLED OUT TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN AND STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE REAR DRIVERSIDE OF THE VEHICLE. DRIVER 2 ADVISED THERE WAS NOT A WAY TO AVOID THE ACCIDENT.VEHICLES HAD MOVED FROM THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

The owner of V1 stated she left her car parked on June 29, 2019 around 8:00 AM and left town. When the owner of V1 returned to her vehicle on July 7, 2019 around 2:00 PM, her vehicle had a dent in the rear bumper. It appears that somebody had backed into her vehicle and did not stop and leave any information.V1 suffered minor damage to the rear bumper, photographs were taken and logged into evidence. No video surveillance in the apartment complex.

Driver 1 was traveling southbound on Interstate 69 near mile marker 122.5. Driver 1 stated she was in the left lane of travel when she observed a blown out tire in the roadway. Driver 1 stated that she then quickly attempted to avoid the tire and also a rim in the roadway. Driver 1 stated she began to cross all lanes of travel and could not control the vehicle. Driver 1 then ran off the roadway and proceeded down an embankment approximately 100 feet into small trees before coming to rest in the woods. I did observed tire marks from the guardrail across all three lanes of travel through the right hand shoulder and down the embankment. Driver 1 declined medical personnel. Vehicle 1 sustained damage throughout the vehicle due to driving down the embankment over and through small trees. Vehicle 1 was towed by and to Chandler's Towing.

V1 AND V2 BOTH TRAVELING SB ON I-69. D1 STATED THAT V2 WAS STOPPED IN THE "SLOW LANE" DUE TO THERE BEING A TRUCK ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE SB LANES ON FIRE AND EVERYONE WAS TRYING TO GET OVER. D2 THOUGHT HE WAS STILL TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY 40 MPH WHEN HE WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. NO OTHER PEOPLE ON THE ROADWAY CAN ATTEST FOR WHAT EXACTLY HAPPENED.V1 SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE AND V2 HEAVY REAR END DAMAGE. D1 WAS EVALUATED BY EMS ON SCENE AND REFUSED TREATMENT STATING HE WAS UNINJURED. D2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL VIA AMBULANCE WITH MINOR FACIAL BLEEDING AS WELL AS SEEMED TO BE A LITTLE CONFUSED WHILE ON SCENE.

VEHICLE 1 WHILE FACING NORTH AND WAS BACKING UP IN THE PARKING LOT OF 4010 SOUTH STATE ROAD 446, PINE GROVE PENTECOSTAL CHURCH. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE RIGHT REAR BUMPER WHILE VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED. VEHICLE 2 WAS FACING SOUTH IN THE PARKING LOT.BOTH DRIVERS WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON E. 1ST ST. D1 STATED HE ATTEMPTED TO PULL TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD TO PARK IN FRONT OF HIS HOUSE. D1 STATED AS HE ATTEMPTED TO PULL OVER, THE BACK PASSENGER SIDE OF HIS VEHICLE MADE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED HE WAS NOT IN THE VEHICLE AS IT WAS PARKED AND HE WAS INSIDE HIS HOME.

D1 WAS TURNING LEFT INTO THE PARKING SPOT TO THE LEFT OF V2. D1 THOUGHT SHE WAS GOING TO BE ABLE TO TURN INTO THE SPOT WITHOUT ISSUES HOWEVER WHEN D1 STARTED V1 INTO THE SPOT V1'S RIGHT FRONT STRUCK THE LEFT REAR OF V2. V2 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED. UNABLE TO FIND THE REGISTERED OWNER OF V2 AND UNABLE TO FIND A TELEPHONE NUMBER FOR THEM EITHER. PRINT OUT WILL BE LEFT WITH THE VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was eastbound on 3rd Street in the left of the two straight lanes. V2, IUPD marked patrol unit 224, was eastbound on E 3rd Street approaching S Woodscrest Drive behind V1. D2, an on-duty police officer, was attempting to initiate a traffic stop on D1 for observed violations committed while driving through campus. Both vehicles had moved into the parking lot of the Sprint Store (2500 E 3rd St) before I arrived.D1 stated she was headed eastbound when she suddenly saw V2's emergency lights. I asked her when she first saw the emergency lights and she pointed to the Christian Science Church (second building west of the intersection, on the north side of the street) and said she was driving past it. I asked her where the collision took place and she estimated it was in front of the first house west of the intersection, and claimed it was definitely before she actually reached the intersection itself. She said she was not from this area and was looking for a safe place to pull over, when she observed the traffic signal at 3rd & Woodscrest start to change. She said she did not want to run the light, so she braked and was then impacted in the rear by V2. I asked D1 and her passenger if they were injured and they both said "no." V1 had a few existing scrapes and dings on its rear bumper, but D1 pointed out what appeared to be a small, fresh dent in the center. It appeared to be damage caused by the front license plate bracket on V2.D2 stated he was attempting to initiate a traffic stop for several erratic driving violations but that D1 did not react to his police car's emergency lighting equipment. Suddenly, in the middle of the intersection at 3rd & Woodscrest, he said V1 came to an abrupt stop in the intersection. D2 said he then attempted to brake but started skidding and could not come to a full stop before colliding with the rear of V1. There was no visible damage on V2.Dash-mounted camera footage of the crash shows V2's emergency lights had been activated for approximately eleven seconds prior to the collision. D1 does not yield to the emergency lights and does not yield for the first ten seconds, continuing to drive in the left lane despite there being no traffic at all that would prevent her from moving right as required by law. V1 is shown to come to a very abrupt stop, past the stop line and crosswalk, in the middle of the intersection while the traffic signal was yellow. V2 then collides with the rear of V1 less than a second later.
According to witnesses V1 was traveling at a high rate of speed WB on 12th Street. V1 side swipe v2 and left the scene. V2 was parked. V1 was a black four door.

V1 and V2 were traveling west on SR 45/46. V1 and V2 were both in the left lane of travel. V1 was directly behind V2. As V1 and V2 were traveling west, they came to the intersection of SR 45/46 and Fee Lane. At that intersection, construction was occurring, and the traffic was all pushed into the left lane by using construction cones. This construction caused traffic to slow down in that location. V2 had to slam on the brakes to avoid hitting another vehicle in front of him that had come to a sudden stop. V1 could not react in time, and struck V2 in the rear end, with the front bumper. There were no injuries. D1 stated she was following V2 through the intersection, and she saw V2 come to a sudden stop because of another car in front of V2 also coming to a sudden stop. D1 said did not have time to react, but tried to avoid V2 by turning to the right. D1 said she struck V2 in the passenger side rear bumper, with the driver side front bumper of her vehicle. D1 did not report any injuries. D2 said he was traveling through the intersection, and had to slam on his brakes to not hit another vehicle in front of him that had come to a sudden stop. D2 said when he stopped, he noticed V1 was about to collide into the back of him, but he could see the vehicle to to stop and turn to the right to avoid him. D2 said V1 then struck his passenger side rear bumper, with the driver side front bumper of V1. D2 did not report any injuries.V1 and V2 were both able to drive away from the scene. There was heavy damage to the driver side front bumper of V1 There was moderate to heavy damage on the passenger side rear bumper of V2.

V1 was WB on E 3rd street and was in the right lane near Swain avenue. V2 was also WB on E 3rd street and was in the left lane near Swain avenue. V1 made an unsafe lane change and struck V2 in the passenger side front bumper with the driver side front quarter panel of his vehicle. D1 stated that he was in the right lane and was trying to get into the left lane. He stated he did not see V2 and he struck her vehicle. D2 stated she was in the left lane and V1 merged into her lane and she was unable to avoid being hit by him.

I69 is a multi-lane interstate that is divided by a concrete wall near the area of this collision.V1, blue Mazda, was traveling south on I69 in the left, number 1, lane. V2, white Ford, was traveling south on I69 in the right, number 3, lane. V1 moved across the center lane and into the right, number 3, lane while V2 was still occupying the number 3 lane. V1 struck the driver's left rear corner of V2 with the passenger side of V1. D1 is unknown.D2, Pendergrass, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the right lane. D2 stated a blue Mazda was traveling south in the left lane. D2 stated the driver of V1 moved across the center lane and continued into the right lane. D2 stated V1 struck the driver's left rear corner of V2. D2 stated the driver of V1 did not stop after impact, but pulled along side of him waived and mouthed that he was sorry and kept going. D-2 stated he could not catch the suspect vehicle.Evidence of minimal damage was observed on V-2 in the left rear of the vehicle. V-2 is a lineman utility bucket truck. D-1 was described as a white male with dark hair and no further identifying information was available. The cause of this crash was V-1 unsafe lane movement.

The owner of V2 stated that she parked V2 outside of her business at 4015 W 3rd Street, facing south, on 7/3/2019 at approximately 1600 hours; this is the last time the owner can verify there was no damage to V2. The owner of V2 stated that the vehicle was moved on 7/5/2019 and parked in the adjacent parking spot to the west. The owner of V2 noticed damage to the rear driver's side of the vehicle at approximately 1030 hours on 7/8/2019. There are no known suspects and no camera footage of the incident. No information is known about V1 or the circumstances around how the damage was created.

Driver one and driver two both stated that a third vehicle slammed on their brakes, causing both of them to slam on their brakes to avoid hitting the third vehicle. Vehicle two was able to stop successfully, and vehicle one rear-ended vehicle twovehicles moved prior to officers arrival

On July 8, 2019, At approximately 7:34 am, I, was dispatched to 4630 W Nestle Down Drive about a personal injury accident where a vehicle had run into a tree, and a nurse who was on scene had started CPR.Upon officers arrival, I noticed a white Ford Focus sitting with a heavily damaged front end, touching a tree and firefighters and paramedics on scene performing CPR.Witnesses advised that they had observed a white vehicle driving at what they thought was unsafe speed. A little while later they heard a crash and a car horn when they went out to see what it was the noticed that the white car had crashed into a tree. The car and crash scene was photographed. There were no skid or acceleration marks before the tree. It is believed by medical personnel that the driver, identified by Indiana Driver's license as Leigh Anne Lancour, had died just before hitting the tree.

BOH VEHICLES WERE TRAVELING NB ON CURRY PIKE, V1 SIDE SWIPPED V2. V2 WAS IN THE LEFT LANE AND V1 ATTEMPTED TO SWITCH FROM THE RIGHT LANE TO THE LEFT AND STRUCK V2.D1 STATED THAT HE HAD HIS TURN SIGNAL ON AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO SWITCH LANES. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN THE LEFT LANE AND V1 GOT INTO HER LANE AND SIDE SWIPPED HER. D1 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER ARM AND NECK BUT DECLINED AN AMBULANCE.

I WAS UNABLE TO SPEAK TO D1 AS HE WAS IN AND OUT OF CONSCIOUSNESS AND TRANSPORTED BY EMS TO THE HOSPITAL. HOWEVER I DID SPEAK TO A BYSTANDERED WHO STATED D1 WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. MAEFIELD ST WHEN THE BACK TIRE OF V1 GOT LOSE AND D1 LOST CONTROL OF V1 AND STRUCK A TREE ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. D1 WAS THROWN OFF V1 AND INTO THE ROADWAY.

V1 AND V2 WERE IN THE RIGHT SOUTH BOUD LANE OF STATE ROAD 37 AT VICTOR PIKE. V2 WAS DISABLED AS IT RAN OUT OF GAS WITH ITS HAZARDS ON WHILE V1 WAS BEHIND ANOTHER VEHICLE THAT SWERVED QUICKLY TO AVOID THE COLLISION. D1 DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO REACT DUE TO FOLLOWING TOO CLOSELY AND REAR ENDED V2. D1 HAD HIS SEAT BELT ON, D2 TOOK THIER SEAT BELT OFF DUE TO BEING DIABLED IN THE ROADWAY.

D1 stated that he was driving V1 northeast exiting the Wendy's drive thru. D2 stated that he turned too wide, crossing the solid yellow line, and collided with V2. D2 stated that she was driving V2 west to enter the Wendy's drive thru. D2 stated that V1 then came around the corner and collided with her rear driver's side. D1 turned too wide, crossing the solid yellow line into oncoming traffic, resulting in a collision with V2.

V2 AND V3 WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC AT A RED LIGHT ON W SR 45 AT W INDUSTRIAL BLDV FACING WEST BOUND. V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W SR 45. D1 ADVISED SHE LOOKED DOWN FOR A BRIEF MOMENT AND WHEN SHE LOOKED UP, TRAFFIC HAD STOPPED. V1 THEN REAR ENDED V2, THIS THEN PUSHED V2 INTO THE REAR OF V1. D1 REQUESTED AMBULANCE DUE TO BEING PREGNANT. AMBULANCE ARRIVED AND CHEKCED D1, D1 SIGNED AN SOR. D2 ADIVSED V2 WAS STOPPED BEHIND V3 ON W SR 45. D2 ADVISED SHE COULD NOT SEE THE LIGHT FROM HER LOCATION. WHILE STOPPED, V1 REAR ENDED V2 AND PUSHED V2 INTO THE REAR OF V3. D2 ADVISED SHE HAD CHEST PAIN BUT REFUSED TO BE TRANSPORTED BY THE AMBULANCE. D3 ADIVSED V3 WAS STOPPED ON W SR 45 WAITING TO GET INTO THE TURN LANE AND TURN SB ON W INDUSTRIAL BLDV. D3 ADVISED THE LIGHT WAS RED. WHILE V3 WAS STOPPED, V2 THEN STRUCK THE REAR OF V3. D3 ADIVSED SHE NOR HER CHILDREN WERE INJURIED. SUPPLEMENT: MORE DETAILS FOR THE DRIVER'S NARRATIVES WERE INCLUDED.

V2 WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED ON THE EDGE OF A PRIVATE DR FACING NORTHWEST. D1 WAS REVERSING SOUTHWEST ONTO A PRIVATE DRIVE FROM A PRIVATE DR ATTEMPTING TO BACK UP TO A DUMPSTER. V1 STRUCK THE FRONT PASSENGER BUMPER OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE WHOLE BUMPER.

V2 was parked in a private parking lot at 221 N Rogers. The owner of V2, Jody Chatelain, returned to her vehicle at approximately 1530 hrs and found damage to her driver's and back rear driver side doors.Based on my investigation, an unknown V1 backed out of the parking spot to the left of V2, and struck V2 on the drivers door and rear driver side door causing damage. V1 then left the area without trying to contact the vehicle owner or Law Enforcement to report the accident. This investigation is ongoing.

V2 was parked in the parking lot facing southeast and unoccupied outside the residence of the complainant at 2391 S Worthington Lane when it was struck by V1. V1/D1 information is unknown at this time as they did not provide any information to V2.V2 was parked in the parking lot facing southeast and unoccupied outside the residence of the complainant, 2391 S Worthington Lane when it was struck by V1. Damage to V2 indicates it was struck by a vehicle that was backing up, however, there were no witnesses to the incident. No information pertaining to driver/owner contact information nor vehicle insurance has been provided to V2/owner.

V1 was traveling northbound on Walnut Grove from 10th Street. V2 was unattended and parked stationary. OP1 said he was away from his vehicle. OP1 said he was informed by Andrea who was passenger in V1 that her husband struck side mirror of V2 with V1 when turning. D1 said he was traveling NB in V1 on Walnut Grove. D1 said he went to avoid a pot hole and got to close to V2 with V1. D1 said he struck the driver side mirror of V2 with passenger side of V1. No damage was observed to V1. Photos of V1 and V2 were taken.

Drive of Vehicle 1 stated she backed into vehicle 2 which was parked at Walmart. She then attempted to find the owner of the vehicle to exchange information. I arrived and located the owner of vehicle 2 and provided both parties a copy of the initial accident report.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON SOUTH COLLEGE MALL, IN THE LEFT LANE, AND WAS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 2ND STREET AND SOUTH COLLEGE MALL.D1 DESCRIBED HOW HE DID NOT REALIZE THAT V2 WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT AND DID THEN REAR END V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V1 AND DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF V2.D2 DID GIVE THE SAME ACCOUNT. HE DID STATE THAT HE WAS STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF EAST 2ND STREET AND SOUTH COLLEGE MALL, IN THE LEFT LANE, WHEN V1 DID REAR END V2. NEITHER VEHICLE WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

V1 was WB on W Country Club drive and following V2 near Banta avenue. V2 was stopped for traffic and was struck from behind by V1. There was a lane closure on this road due to tree trimming.D1 stated that she was stopped in traffic and then traffic began to move forward. She stated she reached back to give something to her son behind her and when she looked back, V2 was stopped again. She stated she was unable to avoid hitting him.D2 stated that they were stopped in traffic and then began to move. He stated traffic stopped again and when he stopped, he was hit from behind by V1.

V1 was traveling north on East Howard Road. V1 ran off the roadway and struck a utility pole's guide wires. One of the guide wires were broken at the base.D1 stated that she had not drove East Howard Road at night and was not aware the was a sharp curve at the crest of the hill. D1 stated she tried to stop but was in gravel and could not stop.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was exiting gas station parking lot and pulling westbound into the turn lane, crossed eastbound traffic and path of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was eastbound on Winslow Road crossing S. Walnut Street when he struck Vehicle 1 crossing his path of travel on Winslow. Vehicle 1 failed to yield right of way of eastbound Vehicle 2.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON W. KIRKWOOD AVE. D1 STATED V2 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HER. D1 STATED THE BRAKE LIGHTS OF V2 WENT OFF SO SHE THOUGHT SHE WAS MOVING. D1 STATED SHE ACCELERATED AND HER VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH THE BACK OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC TRAVELLING WEST AND W. KIRKWOOD AVE. D2 STATED V3 WAS STOPPED IN FRONT OF HER. D2 STATED V1 HIT THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE CAUSING HER THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE TO COLLIDE WITH THE REAR OF V3.D3 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED FACING WEST ON W. KIRKWOOD AVE. D3 STATED SHE WAS WAITING ON TRAFFIC SO SHE COULD TURN SOUTH INTO A GAS STATION. D3 STATED WHILE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC V2 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.

Veh2 was travelling south on N Curry Pike. Veh1 was travelling directly behind them. For an unknown reason, Veh1 struck Veh2 in the rear. Upon EMS arrival, driver 1 was unconscious and was taken to the hospital where he regained consciousness. He stated that he had been drinking just prior to the crash, and didn't remember anything after having left work which was about 1/2 mile north of the accident. A blood draw was administered

V1 and V2 were both traveling northbound on S Walnut St and were at the intersection with Kirkwood Ave when V1 attempted to turn left from the center lane and struck V2 as it attempted to continue northbound on S Walnut St. V1/D1 stated she was attempting to turn left at the intersection from the center lane when her vehicle struck V2. D1 stated she heard the collision but did not see V2 prior to hitting it. V2/D2 stated he was traveling north in the far left lane when V1 attempted to turn left in front of him. D2 stated he utilized his horn and attempted to swerve away from V1, however was unsuccessful due to the size of his vehicle. V1 sustained damage to the drivers side door. V2 sustained damage to the front right bumper portion.W1 stated she was in her vehicle directly behind V2 when she saw V1 attempt to turn left from the center lane directly in front of V2 and made impact.

Hit and Run Accident: Suspect vehicle is red with a tail light busted out. V2 was parked in a parking spot on the second floor of the Poplars Parking Garage with no one inside. There was damage to the rear passenger side bumper of V2. The tail light from V1 was broken in pieces on the parking garage floor beside the rear of V2. The way V2 was parked I am unsure what direction V1 was heading and the angle that it struck V2.Supplement:D1 came to station on 07/11/2019 to confess to the accident. D1 stated that on 07/10/2019 he was back down the ramp in the parking garage because he did not want to drive all the way to the top of the garage in order to exit. D1 stated that while he was backing up and turning so that he could make the way to the exit he felt a bump. D1 stated that he thought he might have hit a hitch and did not think he did any damage to his vehicle or the other vehicle. D1 stated that people were beginning to get lined up behind him and that he got flustered and just left. D1 stated that he did not know there was any damage to V1 until his wife asked him what he had done to the vehicle. There was damage to the rear passenger bumper and tail light of V1.

V1 backed out of a parking space facing south and collided with the front of V2. V2 was parked in a parking row on the north side of the drive facing south as well. V1 was then seen leaving the scene without attempting to exchange information with the owner of V2. All events were seen by a witness nearby.V1 was not located.

ELIZABETH HEWITT ADVISED SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PARK WITHIN STALL ON SOUTH SIDE OF CAMPUS FAMILY DENTAL.ELIZABETH HEWITT PRESSED THE ACELERATOR INSTEAD OF THE BRAKE CAUSING HER TO RUN OVER THE CURB AND INTO THE SOUTH EXTERIOR WALL OF CAMPUS FAMILY DENTAL. TOYOATA CAMRY SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.CAMPUS FAMILY DENTAL SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE. INFO FOR CAMPUS FAMILY DENTAL IS DR. ERIC HEIN 01/06/1971

D1 told me they were driving V1on 07/10/2019 around 1500 hours. D1 was parked near the intersection of E 14th Street and N Forrest Avenue. D1 reversed in V1. D1 then struck a low hanging chain link wire that was strung between metal poles. D1 struck the chain fence with the driver's side rear of V1 just below the tail light where there was minor damage. I did not observe any damage to the chain. There were no other parties involved in the collision.A witness inside of V1 confirmed the statements of D1.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. WALNUT AND STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF S. WALNUT ST. AND HILLSIDE DR. D1 STATED WHILE STOPPED HER FOOT SLIPPED OFF THE BREAK AND SHE ROLLED INTO THE REAR OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHCILES.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTH ON S. WALNUT ST. AND STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF S. WALNUT ST. AND HILLSIDE DR. D2 STATED THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN AND THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM DID NOT MOVE. D2 STATED THIS IS WHEN V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF HIS CAR CAUSING DAMAGE TO HIS VEHICLE.

Primary Cause - Driver Distracted - D1 advised he was looking left, making sure traffic was clear, when V1 crashed into V2. D1 advised he was turning northbound from 10th Street onto SR 45/46 Bypass behind V2. D1 advised when the light turned green he proceeded forward. D1 advised while proceeding forward he looked left to make sure traffic was clear. D1 advised when he was looking left, V1 crashed into V2. D2 advised she was turning northbound from 10th Street onto SR 45/46 Bypass. D2 advised she started proceeding through the intersection but came to a stop when she observed a pedestrian using the crosswalk. D2 advised after she stopped, V1 crashed into V2.

State Road 48, in this particular area is a 4 lane divided highway, that is straight and level. Vehicle 1 (gray 2018 Jeep) was traveling east on State Road 48, just east of Curry Pike, in the far right lane. Vehicle 2 (red 2016 Ford Fusion) was traveling east on State Road 48, just east of Curry Pike, in the far right lane, in front of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 began to slow its speed, due to stopping traffic and Vehicle 1 struck Vehicle 2 in the rear end. Driver 1 (Brooking) stated she was traveling east in the far right lane and did not realize Vehicle 2 had slowed its speed so quickly and was unable to avoid collision with Vehicle 2. Driver 2 (Amstutz) stated she was traveling east in the far right lane and traffic in front of her began to slow down, so she began to slow down. Driver 2 stated that is when Vehicle 1 struck her vehicle in the rearend. Driver 2 stated her neck hurt as a result of this crash and was transported to Bloomington Hospital for treatment. As a totality evidence, I determine the primary cause of this crash to be unsafe speed to avoid a collision, by Driver 1.

Vehicle 1 was parked in a parking stall near the southwest corner of the building located at 3811 West State Road 46 (Taco Bell). Vehicle 2 was parked, unoccupied, and not running in a parking stall directly to the south of Vehicle 1. Driver 1 was backing Vehicle 1 out of the parking stall. Driver 1 turned too sharply to the left causing Vehicle 1 to collide with Vehicle 2.There was moderate damage to the passenger side of the front bumper on Vehicle 1 and moderate damage to the driver side front and rear doors of Vehicle 2. Photographs of the overall collision scene and the vehicles were taken.No injuries were reported to this officer at the scene of the collision.

Driver of vehicle 2 stated that the driver of vehicle 1 pulled out of the Speedway Gas Station at 3585 W State Road 46 heading East and struck his car in the passenger side rear quarter panel leaving black marks and scratches. The driver of vehicle 1 failed to stop and continued East bound. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he was traveling East bound on State Road 46 stopped in traffic in front of the Speedway when Vehicle 1 struck his car. Was able to identify the driver of Vehicle 1 but unable to make contact or locate him.

D1 advised that he was parked backed into a parking space in the Briscoe back parking lot, facing south near the loading dock/dumpster area on the north end. D1 was driving V1, Indiana University owned Motor Pool vehicle #1128. As D1 pulled out of the parking space, he turned right (west) to leave the lot. D1 explained that he turned too sharply when leaving the space, not realizing that there was a yellow post and barricade system just to the west of his parking space. V1's front passenger side struck the post just to the rear of the front wheel well, causing dent and gouge that extended into the front edge of the passenger side front door. I request that a copy of this report be forwarded to INLOCC for review.

D1 stated that were traveling northbound on N Walnut St when they were approaching the intersection with E 9th St. D1 stated that they were attempting to turn west on to E 9th St, but could not tell me what lane they were in. D1 stated that V2 then came from behind them and struck V1. D2 stated that they were traveling northbound on N Walnut St approaching the intersection with E 9th St. D2 stated they were the the left lane on while traveling on N Walnut St, and intended to go straight. D2 stated that V1 then came from the middle lane on N Walnut St and attempted to turn into the left lane in order to turn on to E 9th St, at which point V1 collided with V2. D2 also noted that before the collision, D2 saw a cell phone in the hand of D1 resting on the steering wheel. W1 stated they were traveling northbound on N Walnut St following V2. W1 stated that he observed V1 turn in to V2 from the middle lane of N Walnut St at the intersection with E 9th St, at which point the vehicles collided.

D1 stated that he was driving V1, and was distracted due to an argument he had just had when leaving his residence. D1 stated that as he was driving straight on N Adams Street, he bumped into V2. D1 stated that he then got scared and left the scene, driving to his residence. D2 stated that he was driving his fire department pickup truck, V2, southbound on N Adams Street. D2 stated that he was slowed in traffic at W 6th Street when he felt V1 bump into V2's tow hitch. D2 stated that D1 then turned V1 away and drove off the scene. D2 followed V1 and called law enforcement. There was no visible damage to either vehicle. D1 was arrested for leaving the scene of the accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON CURRY PIKE AND WAS TURNING WEST ON TO GRAND AVE. TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP IN THE LEFT HAND, SOUTHBOUND LANE OF CURRY PIKE. THE RIGHT HAND, SOUTHBOUND LANE OF CURRY PIKE WAS STILL FLOWING. UNIT 1 STOPPED TO TURN LEFT, AND WAS WAVED ON BY A DRIVER IN THE STOPPED TRAFFIC. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED SHE INITIALLY STAYED IN HER LANE, AND DID NOT PROCEED ONTO GRAND. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 THEN DECIDED TO TURN, BUT COULD NOT SEE THE TRAFFIC IN THE RIGHT HAND LANE. UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON CURRY PIKE WHEN UNIT 1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN. THE VEHICLES COLLIDED AT THE INTERSECTION OF GRAND AVE AND N CURRY PIKE.
