UNIT 1 DOES HAVE INSURANCE, BUT DID NOT HAVE THE POLICY NUMBER WITH HER WHILE ON SCENE.

Driver #1 stated he was going north on Breeden Road at approximately 55 mph in a 35 mph zone when he lost control of his vehicle. Vehicle one left the west side of the roadway and struck a utility pole. The pole was cut in half and the power was off in the area. Driver #1 stated he had been drinking beer prior to the crash at a friends house.Driver #1 stated he did not currently have insurance on the truck.

D2 stated she had backed out of her parking spot so a friend could get into the vehicle, due to her being in a wheelchair. D2 stated she was completely stopped, when V1 reversed and backed into V2.D2 described D1 has an older white male with white hair and glasses. D2 could only state it was a silver car and nothing further.V2 had minor rear end damage. Photographs were taken and logged into evidence. No injuries reported.

V1 was at the gas pump #1 when it attempted to drive away after refueling. In doing so, D1 had failed to remove the nozzle attached to the gas pump from her vehicle's fuel port, which then caused it to "break-away," from the machine. As a result of this incident the gas pump then became inoperable. D1 then proceeded to drive away with notifying the business nor providing and contact or vehicle insurance information. V1/D1 information is unknown. Only make/model and partial plate information of V1 were able to be captured from surveillance footage. Property damaged: Gas Pump belong to business: Wayne Fueling System, Model# B/12, Serial# 40829D. Approximate Repair Cost $800. Damage to V1 is unknown.

V1 was backing from parking space and the rear driver side of V1 collided with the rear passenger side of V2. V2 was parked and unoccupied at the time of the collision.D1 stated he was attempting to back and did not see the V2.

V1 WAS EASTBOUND AT 900 E 2ND ST.V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID WHEN HE TRIED TO STOP BEHIND V2 HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED IN TIME AND REAR ENDED IT.D2 SAID WHEN HE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC V1 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND INJURING HIS NECK AND BACK.

V1 and V2 were traveling eastbound on 3rd St. Both Vehicles were stopped for a red light. V1 struck V2 in the rear.D1 stated that she was stopped at a red light behind V2. The light changed green and she started to go before V1 did. She then struck V2 in the rear. D1 stated it was her fault.D2 stated that she was sitting at the red light when it changed green. She was about to go, when she was struck from behind.V1 did strike V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

V1, A ZERO TURN LAWN MOWER WAS MOWING ON AN EMBANKMENT, ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A TURN AND DROVE OFF A LEDGE AND HIT V2 IN THE DRIVER'S SIDE.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN AND DROVE OFF THE LEDGE AND HIT V2.

Driver 1 (D1) advised that he was traveling northbound on Adams Street when he attempted to go under the railroad bridge. D1 stated that he thought the vehicle would fit under the bridge. D1 advised that the vehicle was too tall and struck the bridge. D1 reported that he was able to back the vehicle out from underneath the bridge. D1 was able to drive the vehicle from the scene and return it to the Uhaul rental business.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that he was driving NB on N Union Valley Rd and was beginning to turn left into the driveway of 5025 N Union Valley Rd. (this address is directly across from where W Lost Mans Ln intersects with N Union Valley Rd) He stated that he didn't see D2 coming at him on N Union Valley Rd southbound. He stated D2 attempted to miss him and went off the west side of the road after they struck each other on both driver's side front quarter panels. D2 lost control of his vehicle and then went east across both lanes of N Union Valley Rd and struck a guard rail head on and came to a stop. All parties stated the exact account of events. Sturgis towing was called to tow vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 was driven away.

V1 and V2 were both traveling north on Headley Rd. V1 was behind V2. V1 attempted to pass V2 on the left. The right side of V1 side swiped the left front corner of V2, by the wheel. V1 passed V2, then V2 rear ended V1. V1 tried passing V2 on a steep grade and the road also had no lane control. D1 explained that V2 was traveling at a low rate of speed and even came to a stop at the top of a hill in the road. D1 stated he saw no vehicles coming the opposite direction and stated there was no lines in the roadway. D1 then passed V2 on the left. D1 stated that while he was passing V2, V2 sped up and pushed him off the road. There did appear to be tire marks on the side of the road where D1 stated he had to drive V1. V2's left front corner struck V1's right side. D1 stated after he was able to get in front of V2 and V2 then rear ended him. V1 had cosmetic damage to the right side and also a minor dent on the rear bumper. D2 stated she was traveling at a speed she estimated between 20 and 30 miles per hour. D2 explained V1 was following her very closely down the road. D2 stated V1 then passed V2 on the left and V1 side swiped V2 as they passed. D2 then stated as V1 got in front of her she sped up slightly to get the plate number of V1 due to the side swipe. D2 stated V1 then slammed on their brakes, causing V2 to rear end V1. V2 had cosmetic damage to the left front quarter panel and also to the front bumper. No one involved requested medical attention.

V1 was parked facing EB in parking space at CVS store. V2 was traveling NB through the parking lot at CVS. V1 backed up and struck V2 in the passenger side rear quarter panel and tire with the rear driver side bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was backing up and did not see V2 behind her. D2 stated she was headed out of the parking lot and V1 backed up and struck her vehicle.

V1 was traveling south on S SR 446. Vehicle departed the road to the left. Traveled in the ditch, side swiped the rock wall. Vehicle continued south in the ditch, struck a rock which flipped the vehicle onto its roof. All occupants were able to exit the vehicle on their own. The driver was give a SFST test which she passed with a .00 PBT. However she exhibited signs of a possible head injury and was transported to the IU Emergency Department. The other 3 occupants claimed they were not injured, declined treatment and departed the scene. Vehicle was towed due to disabling damage.

Vehicle 1 was backing southbound, and vehicle 2 was backing northbound out of parking spots at 4025 South Old State Road 47, Kroger at Clear Creek Crossing. Vehicle 1 pulled up immediately to call police and vehicle fled the scene in an unknown direction. Video surveillance was investigated, however it was unclear to whom the driver was. Driver 1 was uninjured and declined any medical attention.Vehicle 1 was drivable and driven from the scene.

Both V1 and V2 were backing out of parking spots in the Walmart parking lot at the same time and backed into each other. Both vehicles sustained minor damage to the rear driver's side. V1 was facing west and backing eastbound. V2 was facing east and backing westbound. D1 spoke no English so it was difficult to understand what happened from his perspective. D2 stated that both vehicles were backing at the same time and did not see each other prior to backing into each other. D1 had a Colombian drivers license.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS GOING EASTBOUND ON WEST 3RD STREET WHEN V2 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HER AND THE TWO VEHICLES STRUCK. D1 STATED HER LIGHT WAS GREEN.D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT WAITING TO TURN WESTBOUND ONTO WEST 3RD STREET AND WHEN HIS LIGHT TURNED GREEN HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND THAT'S WHEN V1 STRUCK V2.D1 STATED A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER CHEST FROM THE SEAT BELT. D2 STATED A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HIS LEFT HAND DUE TO THE AIRBAG.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE. BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on Winslow Rd. Both vehicles stopped at the stop sign. V1 then struck V2 in the rear.D1 stated that he was stopped at the stop sign and that V2 started to move forward. He also started to go and V2 stopped and he was unable to avoid striking V2 in the rear.D2 stated that she was stopped at the stop sign and was struck from behind by V1.V1 did strike V2 in the rear causing damage to both vehicles.

D1 continued southbound on S. Curry Pike and was not present for the accident investigation.D2 advised he was traveling South on S. Curry Pike, in the approximate 700 block in the right/slow lane, when he saw the black vehicle next to him in the left/fast lane begin to come into his lane of travel. D2 stated he moved his vehicle to the right at which point he ran off the roadway and struck a mailbox located at 710 S. Curry Pike. V2's front right and rear right tires had been damaged and deflated possibly due to hitting the raised curb. V2 was retrieved by Kens Westside towing.

V2 was traveling eastbound on N Mt Gilead Rd. D2 stated that there was a gold or brown color Chevy Impala traveling westbound on N Mt Gilead Rd in the eastbound lane. D2 stated that he was unable to avoid crashing into V1. D2 stated that V1 left the scene of the accident. The only description D2 could provide was that V1 had a temporary paper plate and left the scene towards E State Road 45.

V1 was in apartment complex parking lot and was headed toward the exit, which was to the south. V2 was parked in a parking space near 3321 E John Hinkle place and was facing west. V1 came around corner and struck V2 in the passenger side rear bumper with the front passenger side bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was turning left and had turned to speak to her passenger who was being scratched by a cat. She stated when she looked forward again, she struck the parked V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was EB on E 4th street at S. Dunn street. V2 was SB on S. Dunn street at E. 4th street. V2 started into the intersection to go straight and V1 then started to turn right onto S. Dunn street. V1 struck V2 in the passenger side rear quarter panel with the driver side front bumper of his vehicle causing damage to both vehicles.D1 stated that he had stopped at stop sign and was going to turn right onto S. Dunn street. He stated he saw V2 stop but didn't realize she had started into the intersection and he struck her as he was turning.D2 stated that she and V1 both stopped at stop sign and she then started into intersection. She stated as she was in intersection, she saw V1 start to turn and she tried to avoid but was unable to do so.
VEHICLE 1 SIDESWIPED VEHICLE 2 WHILE BACKING OUT OF PARKING SPACE. Vehicle 2 was parked and unattended. This was observed by witnesses.

I arrived on scene and I observed V1 off the east side of the roadway and into a tree. I also observed the top of the vehicle was crushed in and the D1 was trapped in V1. I also observed skid marks on the roadway leading up to the crash. It appeared the vehicle was traveling north on S Old SR 37 just south of Wylie Rd. The skid marks appeared to swerve left of center and back across the roadway. D1 later identified himself and was transported due to his injuries. The vehicle was towed due to disabling damage. I went to the ED and spoke to D1 and he stated he had been drinking prior to driving his vehicle. D1 submitted to a PBT and the result was .075. D1 stated he didn't remember what happened during the crash. D1 further stated he didn't have insurance on the vehicle due to he thought he had 30 days to insure it. D1 was seen by the IU Health ED staff and he had a broken Clavical and several other injuries.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S WALNUT ST PK AND HAD STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION OF E WINSLOW RD. D1 ADVISED THEY LOOKED BOTH WAYS BEFORE PROCEEDING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. D1 ADVISED THEY DID NOT SEE V2. V2 STRUCK V1 ON THE DRIVER SIDE CAUSING DAMAGE TO V1'S FRONT DOOR AND FRONT AXIL. V1 WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE.V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E WINSLOW RD APPROACHIG THE INTERSECTION OF S WALNUT ST PK. AT THIS INTERSECTION TRAFFIC ON E WINSLOW HAS THE RIGHT OF WAY, TRAFFIC ON S WALNUT ST PIKE HAD A STOP SIGN. D2 ADVISED SHE SAW V1 STOP, AS SHE PROCEEDED WB, V1 TRAVELED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK THE FRONT OF V2 CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE TO V2 FRONT BUMPER.WITNESS WAS TRAVELING BEHIND V2, GOING WB ON E WINSLOW RD. WITNESS SAW V1 STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN, V1 THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND V2 STRUCK THE DRIVER SIDE OF V1. EVERYONE ON SCENE ADVISED THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

Vehicle appeared to be traveling south on North Old State Road 37 in the 6600 block. It traveled left of center in a curve and ran off the roadway, consequently, colliding with a fence and down a ditch. Nobody was located at the accident site. Attempted to make contact at the registered owners address on Floyd Drive but nobody answered the door.Victim of fence: Gary Clarke, 7088 N Old State Road 37
D1 SAID HE WAS NORTH BOUND ON ADAMS ST, JUST NORTH OF 7TH ST, AND STRUCK THE OVERHEAD RAIL ROAD BRIDGE DUE TO THE HEIGHT OF V1.NO INJURIES.

D1 STATED THAT HE REAR ENDED V2, WHICH CAUSED V2 TO GO AROUND V3, HOWEVER, V2 SIDESWIPED V3 DURING THAT PROCESS. D1 STATED V1 THEN CAME TO REST INTO V3, CAUSING MORE DAMAGE ON THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR BUMPER.D2 STATED THAT V2 WAS STOPPED BECAUSE OF TRAFFIC AND V1 REAR ENDED V2, WHICH CAUSED V2 TO SIDESWIPE V3.D3 STATED V3 WAS STOPPED BECAUSE OF TRAFFIC AND V2 CAME AROUND AND SIDESWIPED V3.BOTH OCCUPANTS OF V3 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN THEIR NECKS, BUT WERE NOT TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL.ALL THREE VEHICLES WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE. PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.

ON 07/15/2019 BETWEEN 1630 AND 1645 HOURS AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE STRUCK A STONE BARRIER ON THE EDGE OF 2424 N. DUNN STREET'S FRONT YARD. PART OF THE STONE BARRIER HAS COLLAPSED.IT IS BELIEVED THAT V1 PULLED INTO THE DRIVEWAY OF 2424 N. DUNN STREET IN ORDER TO TURN AROUND DUE TO THE ROAD BEING BLOCKED UP AHEAD. ONCE IN THE DRIVEWAY THE VEHICLE BACKED UP INTO THE GRASS IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE TURN DUE TO THE DRIVEWAY NOT BEING WIDE ENOUGH. HOWEVER, WHILE BACKING INTO THE GRASS V1 WENT TOO FAR AND STRUCK THE STONE BARRIER AND LEFT THE SCENE.

UNIT 1 WAS DELIVERING A MOBILE HOME TO SOUTHCREST LOCATED AT 315 WEST GORDON PIKE. THE SEMI DRIVER STATED THAT HE WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN ONTO A LANE WHEN HE COLLIDED WITH UNT 2. THE DRIVER STATED THAT HE HAD SPOTTERS BUT COULDNT UNDERSTAND THEM. UNIT 2 WAS PARKED ON THE SIDE OF THE LANE AND HAD DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER'S DOOR AS WELL AS THE DRIVER'S SIDE FRONT QUARTER PANNEL.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S SR 446 GOING AROUND A CORNER. D1 STATED THAT THE REAR END OF V1 STARTED TO DRIFT DUE TO THE WET SURFACE OF THE ROADWAY. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS UNABLE TO RECOVER THE VEHICLE AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY STRIKING A UTILITY POLE WITH THE RIGHT REAR OF V1.THERE WAS AIRBAG DEPLOYMENT ON BOTH DRIVERS AND PASSENGER SIDE AND THE RIGHT REAR OF THE VEHICLE CAME OFF OF THE VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was facing westbound preparing to make a left hand turn onto W Fountain Dr. D1 advised she could not see oncoming traffic due to a tree line on the east side of the road. When D1 began to pull out onto the roadway she collided with the rear of V2 that was traveling northwest. Damage was found on the front passenger side of V1. D2 stated he was traveling northwest on W Fountain Drive. While passing the entrance to the Indiana Dance Co; 2110 W. Fountain Drive, D2 stated V1 struck the rear passenger side of his vehicle. D2 did have a complaint of back pain but did not request immediate medical service.

Driver of Vehicle 1 stated he thought Vehicle 2 had entered State Road 37 North from S. Victor Pike but when he looked over he realized Vehicle 2 was still there and struck Vehicle 2 in the rear bumper. Vehicle 1 had front end damage. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he was waiting to enter N State Road 37 from S. Victor Pike when he was struck from behind by Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had rear bumper damage

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling North on S. Curry Pike at the intersection with West 3rd Street in the left hand turn lane waiting to turn left. V2 was traveling South on S. Curry Pike approaching the intersection with W. 3rd Street. V1 attempted to turn left, but was unable to make it through the intersection safely. V2 struck the driver side of V1. Both vehicles were able to move out of the roadway.V1 sustained moderate damage to the front driver side of the vehicle. D1 stated that she was not injured and declined medical attention at the scene. D1 stated that the traffic signal had just changed to yellow as she was attempting to make a left turn. D1 stated that if she had not hit the brakes, V2 would have struck the side of her vehicle instead of the front. V1 was driven from the scene by D1.V2 sustained moderate damage to the front driver side of the vehicle. D2 stated that she was in the far right hand lane of travel. D2 stated that the traffic signal had just changed to yellow as she was approaching the intersection when V1 turned in front of V2. V2 was driven from the scene by D2.

D1 was traveling S. On N. I-69 on the ramp to Business 37. (College Ave Exit). D1 stated that the vehicle in front of him jammed on their brakes, at which time he braked and the rear tire slid out from the motorcycle. The motorcycle then traveled into a guard rail and then traveled back across the ramp to the North side of the roadway. D1 was bleeding upon my arrival and advised his most complaint of pain was his back and his legs. The motorcycle was taken from the scene as D1 was transported to IU Health Hospital.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 2 stated he was south on the SR 45/46 Bypass approaching 17th St. Driver 2 stated that he had the green light and was going into the intersection when vehicle 1 turned right from 17th St into vehicle 2's lane. Driver 2 stated he was not able to avoid vehicle 1 and collided with the rear of vehicle 1. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 never stopped and left the scene without providing any information.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was traveling southbound on N.Curry Pike through the intersection at W. Woodyard Rd. when V1 was turning right onto N. Curry Pike from W. Woodyard Rd. and struck V2 on the passenger side. D2 stated that he had a green light and V1 hit him as V1 was turning right. D1 stated that he was turning right on a red light since he thought no traffic was coming and crashed into V2. W1, who was traveling behind V2 also stated that V2 had the green light on N. Curry Pike. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

Interstate 69 is a multiple lane, two way interstate in this area of Monroe County. At this particular mile marker, Interstate 69 has a on ramp from College Avenue at mile marker 123.5Vehicle 1 (White 2017 MCI Bus) was traveling north on the College Avenue on ramp, merging on to north bound Interstate 69. Vehicle 2 (White 2015 International box truck) was traveling north on Interstate 69, in the middle driving lane at mile marker 123.5Driver 1 (Tincher) stated after merging onto northbound 69, she checked her mirrors to change lanes to the middle lane, did not see Vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated that was when she began to merge to the center lane and struck Vehicle 2. Driver 2 (Johnson) stated he was traveling north on Interstate 69 in the middle lane. Driver 2 stated he seen Vehicle 1 merge onto the interstate from College Avenue and then just kept merging into his lane striking his vehicle, knocking the passenger side glass out of the window.After reviewing the evidence, speaking with both driver's, I determine primary cause of this crash to be unsafe lane movement by Driver 1.

V1 AND V2 SIDE SWIPED EACH OTHER WHILE GOING AROUND A CURVE ON BOTTOM ROAD APPROX 500 FEET WEST OF E WILEY ROAD. D1 WAS GOING SOUTHWEST AND D2 WAS GOING NORTHEAST. D1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE V2 THAT IT WAS IN HIS BLINDSPOT. D2 STATED THAT D1 WAS LEFT OF CENTER CAUSING THE ACCIDENT

V1, V2 and V3 were traveling N/B on Walnut ST. V1 struck V2 which caused V2 to rear end V3 causing V3 to the ejected from her moped. D1 advised that she was traveling N/B on Walnut ST, driving through the intersection of Kirkwood Ave. D1 advised that while traveling N/B V2 was directly in front of V1. D1 advised that she attempted to merge lanes, as traffic started to back up. D1 advised that while doing so V1 struck V2 causing damage to V2. D1 advised that she then saw V2 collide with V3 causing D3 to fall onto the hood of V2. D1 left the scene, and later reported this incident at BPD. D2 advised that he was traveling N/B on Walnut ST, driving through the intersection of Kirkwood Ave. D2 advised that as traffic began to back up, he began to slow down and come to a complete stop. D2 advised that he then felt the impact of V1, which caused V2 to collide with V3. D2 advised that D3 fell onto the hood of V2 and fell onto the ground. D2 advised that he was not injured. D3 advised that she was traveling N/B on Walnut ST, driving through the intersection of Kirkwood Ave.D3 advised as traffic began to back up, V3 came to a complete stop. D3 advised that she heard a loud noise directly behind her, which she described as a vehicle accident. D3 advised that she then felt the impact of V2. D3 advised that when V3 was struck, she fell onto the hood of V2 and then onto the ground. D3 advised that she had a complaint of pain of 8/10 to her buttock, and a 5/10 pain to her left leg. D3 was transported to Bloomington Hospital from the scene for further treatment. W1 advised that he was sitting in the passenger seat of V2. W1 advised that while traveling N/B on Walnut ST, driving through the intersection of Kirkwood Eve he noticed that traffic was backup. W1 advised that D2 began to slow down and come to a complete stop when he was rear ended by V1. W1 advised that the impact from V1 caused V2 to collide with V3 causing D3 to fall onto the hood of the V2, landing on the ground. W1 advised that he was not injured. Due to the fact that D1 was following to closely, V1 struck V2, which caused V2 to strike V3 injuring D3.

D1 ADVISED SHE WAS BACKING OUT OF HER DRIVEWAY LOCATED AT 5351 COBBLESTONE ST AND DID NOT OBSERVE V2 AND STRUCK V2 WITH HER VEHICLE. D1 AND D2 HAD ALREADY EXCHANGED INFORMATION UPON MY ARRIVAL, HOWEVER, A REPORT WAS ALSO REQUESTED. MINOR DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES AND NO INJURIES OR COMPLAINT OF PAIN.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: Shirley Leach V1 owner advised that her vehicle was parked in row 7 of Walmart parking lot facing east. When Ms. Leach came out of Walmart from shopping she noticed a dark colored SUV parked against the front bumper of her vehicle. Ms. Leach retrieved the license plate number YNE549 off of the SUV. Ms. Leach then went inside to have Walmart staff page the SUV owners over the intercom. When Ms. Leach returned to her vehicle the SUV was gone. Ms. Leach did not notice any visible damage to her vehicle but when she tried to leave the parking lot her vehicle would not move. Ms. Leach's vehicle would go into drive and reverse however the vehicle would not pull itself out of the parking spot. Ms. Leach did state that she recently had work done to her car by a mechanic that worked on her brakes and did an inspection of the vehicle.I checked with Walmart management who stated there is no video cameras in that row of the parking lot. I was able to run the license plate of the SUV and get a return with Mrs. Fields information. I made contact with Mrs. Fields at her residence on the evening of July 17th 2019. Mrs. Fields stated that she was at Walmart on 7-7-19 at approximately 350pm and that she had parked in row 7. Mrs. Fields stated that she did not hit any vehicles when pulling in or out of the parking space at Walmart. I did check the front bumper area of Mrs. Fields SUV and did not notice any visible damage. Mrs. Fields also stated that she did not remember a vehicle parked in front of her when she pulled into the parking space.V1 did not appear that it had been pushed on by another vehicle that would have caused damage to the drive train.

D2 SAID SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON LIBERTY, STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION WITH BLOOMFIELD RD, AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. BOTH CARS THEN PULLED INTO A PARKING LOT. D1 SAID HE DID NOT HAVE ANY INSURANCE ON V1. D2 SAID THERE WAS DAMAGE, SO SHE CALLED 911. D1 THEN GOT IN V1 AND LEFT NORTH BOUND ON LIBERTY DRIVE.D1 WAS DESCRIBED AS A WHITE MALE / 20'S / BROWN BUZZ CUT HAIR.V1 WAS DESCRIBED AS A BLUE/TEAL 2 DR CAR, WITH INDIANA TEMPORARY PLATE K47984. I DID NOT GET A RETUR ON THAT PLATE, AND OTHER OFFICERS FAILED TO LOCATE V1 IN THE AREA.

D1 AND D2 WERE BOTH STOPPED WAITING TO GO THROUGH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT NORTH SMITH PIKE. D1 STATED THAT HE LOOKED DOWN FOR A SPLIT SECOND AND DIDN'T REALIZE THE VEHICLE INFRONT OF HIM HADN'T MOVED. D2 STATED THAT THE LIGHT HAD TURNED GREEN AND HAD JUST STARTED TO MOVE WHEN HE WAS REAR ENDED BY THE PEPSI TRUCK. NEITHER PARTY COMPLAINED OF ANY PAIN OR REQUESTED AN AMBULANCE.

D1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE WHEN SHE REAR ENDED V2 WHICH WAS PARKED IN A PARKING SPOT.D1 STATED SHE WAS TALKING TO THE PASSANGER IN THE VEHICLE AND WASN'T PAYING ATTENTION. V2 WAS OCCUPIED BUT WAS PARKED. DRIVER OF V2'S PHONE NUMBER 812-361-0182

The crash occurred in the Assembly Hall Parking Lot. V1 was facing south and was in the 2nd row closest to the the building. V2 was facing north and in the first row by the sidewalk. D1 said he was backing out of his parking space in V1 which would be north for a direction of travel. D1 said V1 and V2 backed into each other, and V2 backed out quickly from his parking space. I asked D1 if he ever heard D2 honk V2 horn. D1 said no. I asked if he saw D2 ever wave his hand prior to the collision. D1 said no. I asked D1 if he ever waved his hand or honked V1 horn as V2 was backing out to get D2 attention. D1 said he did not. V1 had a dent in the driver side rear bumper section of the vehicle. D1 said he pulled his vehicle forward directly forward back into the parking space and waited for police to arrive. D2 said he was already backing out of his parking space in V2. D2 said he was in the middle between the rows. D2 said he honked his horn and waved his hand prior to get the attention of D1. D2 said thats when V1 backed into V2. V2 had light damage to the driver side rear bumper area. There was no video cameras in the parking lot able to be located for this accident.
V1 and v2 were traveling north on curry pike near loroy ave. D1 stated she was changing lanes and did not see v2 as she was looking to merge. V1 side swipped V2 .

V1 WAS EAST BOUND ON STATE ROAD 46 AND HAD A RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF HARTSTRAIT RD.V2 WAS NORTH BOUND ON HARTSTRAIT ROAD AND HAD A GREEN LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROAD 46 AND V2 WAS TURNING WEST BOUND ON STATE ROAD 46.V1 WENT THROUGH THE RED LIGHT AND V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS NORTH BOUND ON MADISON ST APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH W GRAHAM DRIVE. D1 ADVISED HE DID NOT SEE THE STOP SIGN FOR NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC AS THERE WAS A TREE PARTIALLY OBSSTRUCTING HIS VIEW. AS V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION, HE OBSERVED V2 APPROACHING FROM THE EAST. D1 ATTEMPTED TO ACCELERATE, BUT COULD NOT AVOID BEING STRUCK BY V2. V1 WAS PUSHED INTO THE NORTH WEST CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION, WHERE IT COLLIDED WITH THE SOUTH BOUND STOP SIGN.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS WEST BOUND ON GRAHAM DRIVE APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S MADISON STREET. THERE ARE NO SIGNS REGULATING EAST/WEST TRAFFIC. AS V2 CAME TO THE INTERSECTION, V1 CROSSED DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF IT. D2 COULD NOT AVOID COLLIDING WITH VEHICLE 1.THE NORTH BOUND STOP SIGN ON MADISON ST IS PARTIALLY OBSTRUCTED BY THE TREE/LIMBS/LEAVES ON THE SOUTH EAST CORNER OF THE INTERSTION.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on Ridgemont Ct. V1 struck V2 in the rear and then left the scene.D2 state that she was being followed and that she had attempted to turn down a side road which was a cul-da-sac. V1 then struck her vehicle and later fled the scene. D1 is known to her.V1 did strike V2 in the rear causing damage. V1 then fled the area.

V1 was north bound on Union Valley Road at Meadowvale Drive, when he reached for a candy bar. As a result he ran off the roadway and collided with a utility pole. The utility pole broke in half and heavy disabling front end damage to v1.

3rd Street is a two lane, one direction of travel road. D1 was driving westbound on 3rd Street in the north-most lane. D2 was driving westbound on 3rd Street in the south-most lane. D1 stated she was driving V1 when she saw a bus preparing to stop and let students off close to the intersection of 3rd Street and Highland Avenue. D1 stated she saw the bus and saw students begin to exit the bus and attempt to cross the street. D1 stated that she then attempted to merge into the south-most lane when she hit V2 with the driver side of her vehicle close to her tire, striking V2 on the rear passenger side. D1 stated she did not know how fast she was traveling at prior to the collision.D2 stated she was driving in the south-most lane headed straight when she saw V1 begin to merge into her lane. D2 stated that V2 hit V1 on the rear passenger side of her vehicle to avoid a bus that was parked in the north most lane of 3rd Street.No injuries were reported at the time of the investigation. Both vehicles appeared to be in safe operating condition and were allowed to leave the scene.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THEY DROPPED THEIR VEHICLE OFF AT BARNEY'S ALIGNMENT SERVICES, 2507 W 3RD ST, ON 7/18/2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 1700 HOURS. THE OWNER OF V2 PICKED UP HIS VEHICLE ON 7/19/2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 1700 HOURS, AT WHICH TIME AN EMPLOYEE FROM THE BUSINESS STATED THEY RECIEVED INFORMATION FROM A DIFFERENT CUSTOMER WHO ALERTED THE BUSINESS THEY HAD STRUCK V2 WHILE IT WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT; THIS PERSON WROTE DOWN THEIR NAME AND PHONE NUMBER (DANIEL BRADLEY, 812-325-6522). I ATTEMPTED TO CALL BRADLEY BUT COULD NOT MAKE CONTACT WITH HIM. I DID LEAVE A VOICEMAIL REQUESTING THAT BRADLEY GIVE ME HIS INFORMATION FOR THE ACCIDENT FORM. THIS FORM WILL BE UPDATED WHEN I RECIEVE BRADLEY'S INFORMATION FOR D1/V1.UPDATE 7/19/19 AT 21:15 HOURS:SPOKE WITH D1 VIA TELEPHONE AND ADDED INFORMATION FOR D1 AND V1. D1 STATED HE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE AT WHICH TIME V1 STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER OF V2. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DISTRACTED AT THE TIME OF BACKING OUT, AS HIS DAUGHTER WAS SAYING GOODBYE TO HIM WHILE V1 WAS MOVING.

V1 was NB on N. Morton street and was near E. 11th street. V2 was EB on E. 11th street and was turning right, onto N. Morton street. V1 had to go left of center to be able to make the right turn onto E. 11th street. V2 had turned right onto N. Morton street and then had to pull to the far right of the lane to avoid V1. The back of the trailer of V1 struck the driver side rear quarter panel of V2 as he was making his turn.D1 stated that he needed to swing to the left to be able to make his right turn. He stated V2 turned and then stopped. He stated he waived at her to go past him but she stopped. He stated he made his turn and didn't even know he had clipped her car.D2 stated that she had turned onto Morton street and then saw she needed to get over to the right to allow the semi(V1) to swing out and make his turn. She stated she was on the far right side of the road and as V1 finished his turn, the back of the trailer hit the driver side rear of her vehicle.

Narrative By Chief Deputy William Jay HumphreyEllettsville Police DepartmentJuly 19th 2019Time 0810amDriver #1 AynesVehicle #2 Parked side of RoadwayDriver of Vehicle #1 backing out of drive way 532 Blackfoot Drive. Driver did not see parked Vehicle #2. Vehicle #1 struck left side rear door of Vehicle #2 causing damage.

On 7/19/2019, at approximately 6:00PM, I arrived on the scene of an accident that occurred just south of the intersection of 17th St. And N. Walnut St.D1 informed me that she was traveling northbound on N. Walnut St., when she attempted to merge from the easternmost lane, into the westernmost lane, striking D2 on his passenger side and causing damage.D2 informed me that he was traveling northbound on N. Walnut St., when D1 attempted to merge into his lane, striking the passenger side of his vehicle.Based on the statements from both parties, and the damage to both vehicles, my investigation yields that D1 attempted to merge into another lane, striking D2 on the passenger side of his vehicle, causing damage to both V1 and V2..

V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street, in the north lane, prior to the crash. V2 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street, in the south lane, prior to the crash. 3rd Street is a one-way westbound road.V1 began to attempt to turn south onto Swain Avenue from the north lane of 3rd Street. While attempting this turn from the north into the south lane, V1's front, driver-side bumper struck V2's front, passenger side bumper. V1 sustained damage to the front, driver-side bumper and the driver-side door. V2 sustained damage to the front, passenger-side bumper and passenger-side door.D1 informed me that they used their turn signal to indicate their turn, but did not see V2.
D1 stated he was tired from working at the farm all day and was unable to stop in time before colliding with V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Constitution Avenue is a two lane asphalt city street that intersects with Curry Pike. Curry Pike is a multi-lane two way city street that has a center left turn lane. There is a stop sign on Constitution Avenue with a left turn lane. V2, green Mini Cooper, was traveling west on Constitution Avenue at Curry Pike. V1, black Mitsubishi, was traveling west on Constitution Avenue behind V2. V2 was stopped in the right turn lane waiting to turn north onto Curry Pike. V1 moved forward and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D1, Branch, stated she was stopped on Constitution Avenue behind V2. D1 stated she believed V2 made the right turn onto Curry Pike as she was moving forward to check for oncoming traffic. D1 stated she did not realize V2 was still stopped and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1.D2, Wright, stated she was stopped on Constitution Avenue at the stop sign waiting to make a right turn onto Curry Pike. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2 as she was waiting to make the turn. Evidence shows minimal damage to the front bumper cover of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear bumper cover of V2.
Vehicle 2 pulling through parking space wide and struck Vehicle 1 while Vehicle 1 was parked and unattended. Vehicle 2 then left the area.

D1 immediately stated that he was "at fault" when I arrived on scene. D1 said that he was behind V2 facing southwest, preparing to turn westbound onto E 3rd Street from State Road 46. D1 stated that V2 then came to a stop to yield to westbound traffic, and he struck the back of V2. D2 gave the same account of the incident as D1. D2 stated that she was stopped, yielding to westbound traffic prior to turning westbound onto E 3rd Street from State Road 46. D1 stated that she was then struck in the rear by V1. V1 was following too closely to V2, not allowing enough reaction time to stop, resulting in a collision. V1 suffered heavy front end damage and V2 has minor damage to the spare tire. Both drivers stated that they were not injured and did not need medical attention.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was parked in a parking space on the south side of 6th Street. V2 was traveling eastbound on 6th Street. V1 backed in front of V2.V1 stated that they were approximately 6 feet back out into the lane of travel when the crash occurred.V2 stated that she was driving on 6th street and V1 back in front of her and she was unable to avoid it.V1 did fail to yield to V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

This was a one vehicle accident that occurred on W 11th Street just west of the W Fountain Drive intersection. The vehicle did run off the roadway and create property damage by hitting a utility pole.I was unable to speak with Driver 1 (D1) in regards to the incident due to his medical condition. D1 advised that he could not recall what occurred. The passenger advised that as the vehicle (V1) was traveling westbound on 11th Street and passed the intersection of W Fountain Drive that D1 ran off the roadway and struck the utility pole. Witness 1 advised that V1 had passed her vehicle on the double yellow on W 11th street prior to coming to the intersection with Fountain Drive. W1 advised that she then lost sight of V1 and that as she came to the turn and intersection she observed V1 to have ran off the road and struck the utility pole. Both driver and passenger in V1 were transported to the hospital via ambulance. V1 was towed due to incapacitating damage.

V2 WAS NORTH BOUND ON LEONARD SPRINGS RD, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH STAPLETON AVE.V1 WAS TURING LEFT FROM STAPLETON ONTO LEONARD SPRINGS.THERE IS A HILLCREST JUST SOUTH OF STAPLETON AVE, SO NEITHER DRIVER COULD SEE THE OTHER.D1 SAID SHE TURNED LEFT AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V2.D2 SAID HE CAME OVER THE HILL AND COULD NOT AVOID V1 WHICH WAS SUDDENLY DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V2.NO REPORTED INJURIES.**8/27/19 D1 FATHER CALLED TO DISPUTE LOCATION AND V1 DESIGNATION. NO CHANGE TO STATE REPORT.**

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON W 2ND STREET APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH PATTERSON DRIVE, PREPARING TO TURN LEFT. HE ADVISED THE LEFT TURN ARROW WAS GREEN, SO HE STARTED HIS TURN. D1 DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 APPROACHING FROM THE EAST. AS HE TURNED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, VEHICLE 1 WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS WEST BOUND ON 2ND ST APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH PATTERSON DRIVE. HE ADVISED THE LIGHT FOR WEST BOUND TRAFFIC WAS GREEN. AS HE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION HE OBSERVED VEHICLE 1 TURNED ACROSS HIS LANE. VEHICLE 2 STRUCK VEHICLE 1. THERE WERE NO INDEPENDANT WITNESSES. THE TRAFFIC LIGHT APPEARED TO BE FUNCTIONING PROPERLY.

Unit 1 was travelling eastbound on Andy Way, approaching the intersection with Norway Dr. The driver suffered a seizure at this point and failed to follow the roadway, going off the roadway, into a yard and hitting a collection of mailboxes. Unit 1 got back on to the roadway and carried on eastbound on Norway Dr.Driver of Unit 1 managed to return to his house, recognising that he had hit something but had no recollection of what. Wife of driver returned to scene to report what had happened. Driver suffers from Temperal Lobe Focal seizures. Only damage was to mailboxes and front end of Unit 1.

THE CP STATED THAT SHE WAS THE PASSENGER AND OWNER OF THE VEHICLE INVOLVED IN THE ACCIDENT.THE CP STATEDT THAT HER SISTER WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON WAMPLER WHEN A LARGE WHITE TRUCK WAS TRAVELING NB AND FORCED THEM OFF THE ROAD. THE CP STATED THAT HER AND HER SISTER WHO SHE STATED WAS ASHLEY FRAZIER WALKED TO SEPERATE HOUSES TO USE A PHONE DUE TO NOT HAVING SERVICE IN THE AREA. THE CP STATED THAT SHE MADE CONTACT WITH THE HOMEOWNERS OF THE PROPERTY THE CRASH OCCURED.UPON MY ARRIVAL I MADE CONTACT WITH THE CP WHO STATED THAT SHE DID NOT KNOW WHERE HER SISTER WENT. OTHER DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE HER IN THE AREA BUT WERE UNSUCCESSFUL.THE CP AND OWNER OF THE VEHICLE WAS A SUSPENDED DRIVER WHO HAD THE ODOR OF ALCOHOL ON HER BREATH.THE CP STATED THAT SHE WAS NOT DRIVING AND WAS GOING TO WORK. SHE PROVIDED HER SISTERS NUMBER BUT I WAS UNSUCCESSFUL ON MAKING CONTACT. THE CP AND CAR OWNER FAILED TO PROVIDE ME WITH INSURANCE INFORMATION ON SCENE. I ATTEMPTED SEVERAL TIMES THROUGHOUT THE DAY BUT SHE WOULD NOT PROVIDE THIS INFO.AT THIS TIME I COULD NOT LOCATE A DRIVER OF THE VEHICLE AND THE OWNER STATED SHE WAS IN FACT NOT DRIVING. THE VEHICLE WAS PULLED OUT FROM THE DITCH AND LEFT ON THE PROPERTY WITH THE HOME OWNERS PERMISSION.I MADE CONTACT WITH MS. FRAZIER AT HER PLACE OF WORK.UPON PULLING INTO THE BUSINESS I NOTICED MS. FRAZIERS CAR WAS IN FACT AT WORK.I MADE CONTACT WITH HER AND ASKED HOW THE VEHICLE HAD MADE IT TO WORK. SHE STATED THAT SOMEONE DROPPED HER OFF.I IMMEDIATELY STATED THAT WE WILL GO PULL THE FOOTAGE SHOWING HER PULLING IN DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE STORY DID NOT MAKE SENSE. MS. FRAZIER ADMITTED TO DRIVING TO WORK.MYSELF AND DEPUTY WILLIAMSON BEGAN TO QUESTION MS. FRAZIER ABOUT THE CRASH THAT OCCURED WITH HER VEHICLE. MS. FRAZIER CONTINUED TO STATE THAT HER SISTER WAS IN FACT DRIVING. WE INFORMED MS. FRAZIER THAT THE BEST OPTION FOR HER WOULD TO BE TO TELL THE TRUTH DUE TO THE FACT THAT HER SISTER WAS LOOKING AT LSA CHARGES. MS. FARZIER STATED THAT SHE WAS IN FACT DRIVING AND STATED THAT SHE WAS SCARED DUE TO THE FACT THAT HER LICENSE WAS SUSPENED.SHE STATED THAT SHE HAS BEEN TRYING TO GET HER LICENSE BACK FOR AWHILEL AND KNEW THAT THIS MISTAKE WOULD DELAY THAT PROCESS. MS. FRAZIER ALSO STATED THAT HER INSURANCE HAD LAPSED AND WAS NO LONGER ACTIVE. MS. FRAZIER WAS CITED FOR DRIVING WHILE SUSPENDED AND HAVING NO INSURANCE.

V1 was traveling S/B on College Ave. V2 was traveling E/B on Kirkwood Ave stopped at a red traffic control signal. V1 attempted to turn W/B on Kirkwood and struck V2. D1 left the scene of the accident.D2 advised that he was traveling E/B on Kirkwood Ave. D2 advised that while stopped at the intersection of Kirkwood/ College Ave, V1 attempted to turn W/B onto Kirkwood Ave. D2 advised that due to the fact that V1 was large, he attempted to put V2 into reverse to give V1 enough room to complete his turn. D2 advised that D1 accelerated while completing the turn and struck V2.D2 advised that he was not injured. Due to the fact that D1 had made an improper turn, V1 struck V2 causing damage to V2.

V1 was traveling South on Windfree Lane approximately 500 feet north of Salt Creek Drive when D1 ran off the roadway into a utility pole. The pole #177694 belonging to Duke Energy just received some small scuffs while the vehicle sustained heavy front end damage.

On July 21, 2019, around 7:20 pm, I, ICO Lance LaBonte, was notified of a property damage vehicle accident on Fairfax Rd near the beach. I arrived on scene around 7:40 pm. When I arrived on scene there was a black Chevy Suburban in the middle of the road, and a gray Lexus just north of the Suburban off the west side of the road. There was front end damage on the driver's side of the Suburban, and damage all along the driver's side of the Lexus. I obtained information for both the vehicles and the driver's of the vehicles. Lynn Whittington said she was driving the Suburban north on Fairfax Rd. She said she was probably driving too fast as she approached a curve in the road. She ran off the east side of the road striking a property sign, and when she came back onto the road she over corrected. This caused her to drive into the south bound lane and then strike the Lexus on the driver's side. The driver of the Lexus was Jason Wanzell and confirmed everything that Mrs. Whittington had told me. Both vehicles were towed by Prichard's Towing.

D1 stated that he was going south in the parking lot of 3230 S Walnut Street. D1 Stated that he did not see any vehicles behind him and he started to back his car. D1 started that he started going North backing his car when he hit V2 in the front bumper. D2 stated that he was driving south through the parking lot of 3230 S Walnut Street. D2 stated that he saw D1 starting to back up in the lane of travel. D2 stated that he honked his horn but it was to late and V1 backed into V2.

V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON SOUTH COLLEGE AVE AT THE INTERSECTION OF WEST 3RD STREET, WHEN HE HAD TO ABRUPTLY STOP DUE TO AN AMBULANCE RUNNING LIGHTS AND SIRENS THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. WHEN V2 ABRUPTLY STOPPED, V1 STRUCK THE REAR END OF V2.D1 STATED HE HAD TO ABRUPTLY STOP DUE TO AN AMBULANCE GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHEN V1 STRUCK THE REAR END OF HIS VEHICLE. D1 STATED HE STRUCK THE REAR END OF A VEHICLE INFRONT OF HIM, ALTHOUGH THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER OF HIS VEHICLE OR THE OTHER VEHICLE.D2 STATED HE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE WHEN VEHICLES INFRONT OF HIM BEGAN TO ABRUPTLY STOP AND HE STRUCK THE REAR END OF V2.

OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT SHE PARKED V2 IN THE PARKING LOT OF TARGET, AND LATER CAME OUT AND OBSERVED DAMAGE TO HER PASSENGER SIDE REAR DOOR. THERE WAS NO CLEAR VIDEO FOOTAGE SHOWING A CAR STRIKING THIS SIDE OF V2. HOWEVER, VIDEO FOOTAGE DID SHOW WHAT LOOKED LIKE A DARK COLORED VAN BACK OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT NEXT TO V2 AT 1855 HORS. IT IS POSSIBLE THIS VEHICLE STRUCK V2 AT THIS TIME, BUT NO OTHER INFORMATION WAS AVAILBLE ON THIS VEHICLE. THERE WERE NO WITNESSES TO THIS ACCIDENT.

During the course of a commercial burglary, the driver reversed Vehicle 1 out of an enclosed garage bay and through a closed overhead door. This pulled down the overhead door and caused damage to the rear, top and front of the vehicle.Driver 1 was interviewed and invoked his Miranda Rights.

V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AT MILE MARKER 130 WHILE GOING SOUTHBOUND. D1 INDICATED SHE WAS IN THE FAR LEFT PASSING LANE WHEN ANOTHER VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HER CUT HER OFF IN THE PASSING LANE FORCING HER TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY. WITNESS 1 HEATHER INDICATED THE SAME STATEMENT. KRISTOFF WAS THE DRIVER THAT SWITCHED LANES CAUSING V1 TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY. KRISTOFF STATED HE WAS TRYING TO ENTER THE PASSING LANE FROM THE CENTER LANE AND DID NOT SEE V1 UNTIL IT WAS TOO LATE.
D1 stated he was pulling out of a parking spot when he cut the turn too sharp and collided with V2.There was very minor damage but a report was requested by DNR Supervisors.

V1 was traveling southbound in a gravel driveway at 1910 E. Schacht Road. V1 left the roadway and drove through the back yard of 2050 E. Schacht Road, striking a small tree. V1 backed up and struck a fence then proceeded back on the roadway southbound on the gravel driveway at 1910 E. Schacht Road. V1 then ran off the roadway a second time striking a culvert an coming to rest on some trees. D1 was removed from V1 and an OWI Investigation was conducted.

Driver of Vehicle 3 stated she was at a complete stop waiting on the car in front of here to turn south on to Lori Ln when she was struck from behind by Vehicle 2. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he was stopped in traffic behind Vehicle 3 when he was struck from behind from Vehicle 1. The Driver of Vehicle 1 stated she was not able to stop when she saw the cars in front of her had stopped. She struck vehicle 2 which was pushed into vehicle 3.Vehicle 3 had rear end damage, Vehicle 2 had front and rear damage, Vehicle 1 had slight front end damage.

Driver 1 (D1) advised that as he was heading westbound on State Road 45/46 that his equipment that was on his trailer was too high and made contact with the east side of the bridge. The bridge is for the roadway of N Arlington Road. D1 stated that he believed that his equipment would fit under the bridge due to not seeing any signs that suggested otherwise. Driver (D2) advised that she was traveling eastbound on State Road 45/46 and passing under the bridge for the N Arlington Drive overpass. D2 advised that when the equipment hit the top of the bridge that several items of debris struck her vehicle causing damage to the front driver's side door area and also breaking the side view mirror. The Indiana Department of Transportation arrived on scene to inspect the bridge and also perform a commercial vehicle inspection.It should be noted that the equipment that was being hauled belonged to Crone Logging LLC. The equipment itself was Tigercat model number LX830D and serial number 83073089 with estimated cost of approximately $600,000.The equipment that was in the roadway was towed to Ken's Tow Lot by Ken's Westside Towing.

V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON ADAMS ST AT KIRKWOOD AVE.V2 WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND V1.D1 SAID AS HE DROVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION HE COLLIDED WITH V2 AND WAS NOT SURE WHAT HAPPENED.D2 SAID AS HE DROVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION V1 MOVED INTO HIS LANE AND THEY COLLIDED.D1 SAID IT HAPPENED AS THEY STARTED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHEN THERE WAS ONLY ONE LANE BUT ROOM TO HIS RIGHT TO PASS.

V1 was traveling E/B on Kirkwood Ave. V2 was parked on Kirkwood Ave, unoccupied. V1 approached the intersection on Kirkwood/ College Ave, when he struck V2 while parked. D1 advised that he was traveling E/B approaching the intersection of Kirkwood/College Ave. D1 advised that as he attempted to turn S/B onto College Ave, he struck V2 while parked. D1 advised that he observed that he had knocked V2's driver side mirror off. D1 advised that he not was injured.O2 advised that V2 was parked on Kirkwood Ave. O2 advised that she observed that her driver side mirror had been damaged.Due to D1 unsafe lane movement, V1 struck V2 causing damage to the drivers side mirror.

I69 is a highway that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. The crash occurred, 100ft north of the 123.5MM. The roadway is straight/level in the area of the crash. In the area of the crash, I69 has four traffic lanes allowing for vehicles to merge onto I69 from Old SR37. The forth lane ends approximately 100ft north of the exit.V1 (2005 red SAAB) was traveling northbound and had just exited onto I69 northbound from Old SR37. V2 (2016 white Honda Pilot) was northbound in the right lane on I69. V1 attempted to change lanes from the merge lane and struck V2 on the right passenger side.D1 (Noah Thorpe) stated he was traveling northbound on I69 from the exit ramp of Old SR37. D1 did not see V2 and attempted to change lanes, striking V2 on the right passenger side. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 ( Ashley Starr) stated she was northbound on I69 in the right lane next to the merge lane. D2 stated V1 attempted to change lanes and struck her on the passenger side. She was wearing her seat belt. During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the driver's side front fender and door area of V1. I observed damage to the entire right passenger side of V2. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Unsafe Lane Movement on the part of D1. This was determined by drivers statements and damage sustained to both vehicles.

V2 WAS PARKED FACING WB IN FRONT OF 205 E 20TH STREET IN A LEGAL PARKING STALL THAT SITS PARALLEL WITH THE ROADWAY ON THE NORTH SIDE OF E 20TH STREET. V1 WHICH IS UNKNOWN AND HAVE NO DESCRIPTION OF IT, IT IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN TRAVELING WB ON E 20TH STREET AND ATTEMPTED TO TURN INTO THE PARKING LOT TO 205 E 20TH STREET. AS V1 TURNED INTO THE LOT, IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE VEHICLE TOOK THE TURN TOO SHARP AND STRUCK THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE BUMPER OF V2.THE OWNER OF V2 ADVISED THAT SHE HAS NO SUSPECT VEHICLE DESCRIPTION. IT IS NOT 100% KNOWN HOW V1 STRUCK V2, HOWEVER, BASED ON THE DAMAGE AND LAYOUT, THIS WAS THE BEST ESTIMATE OF WHAT HAPPENED.

V1 was stopped at the intersection of 1st/Walnut ST. V2 was traveling N/B on Walnut ST. V1 advised that he believed his traffic control signal was green and proceeded through the intersection. V2 stated that she also had a green traffic control signal and proceeded through the intersection colliding with V2. D1 advised that he was traveling E/B on 1st ST, stopped at the intersection of 1st/ Walnut ST. D2 advised that the traffic control signal turned green and he proceeded to turn N/B onto Walnut ST. D1 advised that he then collided with V2. D1 advised that he was not injured. D2 advised that she was traveling N/B on Walnut ST, going through the intersection at 1st/ Walnut ST. D2 advised that while traveling in the far left lane, she then felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that the traffic control signal was green N/B. D2 advised that she was not injured. It should be noted that D1 and D2 advised that they each had a green traffic control signal. Due to these claims and no witnesses, I could not determine fault.

V1 STRUCK A PRIVATE BUILDING THAT IS OCCUPIED BY A PUBLIC BUSINESS. D1 STATED SHE WAS PULLING TO A PARKING SPOT AND INSTEAD OF HITTING THE BRAKE SHE MUST HAVE HIT THE GAS PEDAL, WHICH PROPELLED V1 INTO A BUILDING.THE BUILDING IS LOCATED AT 1713 NORTH COLLEGE AVENUE, SUITE 3, BLOOMINGTON, IN. THE BUILDING IS OWNED BY 328 SOUTH WALNUT PROPERTY LLC AND THEIR ADDRESS IS 328 SOUTH WALNUT STREET. THE PHONE NUMBER FOR THE PROPERTY MANAGER (LAURIE MILLER) IS 812-322-9662. THE PROPERTY IS INSURED BY WEST BEND, POLICY NUMBER, 1864333.V1 SUFFERED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END AND D1 DID NOT REPORT ANY INJURIES. HOWEVER, PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE DUE TO THE DAMAGE TO THE BUILDING.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON MILLER ST APPROACHING WALNUT STREET.V2 WAS STOPPED IN THE WESTBOUND LANE OF MILLER DR IN FRONT OF V1.V3 WAS WESTBOUND ON MILLER DR STOPPED IN FRONT OF V2.D1 SAID V2 STOPPED SUDDENLY AND HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE REAR ENDING HER.D2 SAID AS SHE SAT IN TRAFFIC V1 HIT HER FROM BEHIND AND THAT PUSHED HER INTO THE BACK OF V3.D3 SAID AS HE SAT IN TRAFFIC V2 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.

V1 is a delivery truck and trailer. D1 advised he pulled V1 into the parking lot just north of 408 N Union Street. D1 advised he started backing up V1, west bound, with the intention to cross the street into a loading dock area. D1 advised when he started backing up V1 crashed into V2. D1 advised he did not see V2 prior to the crash. D1 advised he checked his mirrors before backing and advised V2 must have been in his blind spot.D2 advised she pulled into the parking lot, east bound, behind V1. D2 advised she V1 then began backing up and crashing into V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was traveling eastbound on W Kirkwood Avenue, approaching the crosswalk at the B-Line Trail. D1 stated that she slowed down in order to yield to pedestrians, and then proceeded through the intersection. At that time V1 struck the cyclist. D1 stated that she did not see the cyclist when she slowed down and looked both ways. The cyclist stated that he was traveling southbound on the B-Line Trail, approaching W Kirkwood Avenue, when he entered the crosswalk. The cyclist stated that he was not sure if V1 was going to stop so he applied the brakes after entering the crosswalk, the cyclist stated that it was too late however. The cyclist had minor injuries, with a minor bleed on his right elbow. The cyclist requested to be transported to the hospital. EMS workers heard the cyclist say that he wished "to get a new bike out of this." The cyclist also admitted to having drank two shots of alcohol earlier in the morning, but he did not appear intoxicated at the time. Photographs were taken of the damage to the bicycle and V1.

VEHICLE 1 WAS PARKED LEGALLY ON THE STREET OUTSIDE OF THE RESIDENCE OF 436 S WESTERN DRIVE. VEHICLE 1 WAS STRUCK BY WHAT APPEARS ANOTHER MOTOR VEHICLE BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 8PM 24 JUL 2019 AND 10 AM 25 JUL 2019. DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE APPEARS TO BE A SAME DIRECTION SIDE SWIPE BY AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE. VEHICLE 1 WAS BROUGHT TO THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT AND WAS NO LONGER AT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT AT THE TIME OF THE REPORT.

V2 WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT OF OFFICE DEPOT AT 100 N GATES DR HEADING EAST TOWARD THE STORE. V1 WAS PARKED IN THE LOT EAST OF THE STORE.WITNESS #1 SAID SHE WAS TO THE NORTH AND SAW V1 PULL INTO THE PARKING LOT TO THE SOUTH OF V2. SHE SAID WHEN IT PULLED IT IN IT HIT THE FRONT PASSENGER FENDER OF V2 WITH IT'S FRONT PASSENGER SIDE. SHE SAID V1 STOPPED AND BACKED UP THEN PULLED INTO THE SPACE BRIEFLY THEN DROVE TOWARD THE STORE AND PARKED. SHE SAID THE WINDOWS WERE TINTED AND SHE COULD NOT SEE ANYTHING INSIDE V1.SHE TOLD THE OWNER OF V2 AND HE WENT OUT AND TOOK PHOTOS OF THE DAMAGE TO V1 BUT DID NOT TALK TO ANYONE. THERE WAS RED TRANSFER PAINT ON V1 MATCHING V2.WITNESS #1 SAID THE PLATE ON V1 WAS IN145 AS AN IU COLLEGE PLATE. WHEN I RAN THE PLATE IT CAME BACK TO A WHITE FORD F150 WHICH IS WHAT SHE SAID IT WAS. OTHER LOCATOIN OF INVESTIGATION WILL BE TRYING TO MAKE CONTACT WITH V1'S OWNER AND PROCEED FROM THERE.JULY 26, I MADE CONTACT WITH D1 BY PHONE. SHE SAID SHE PULLED INTO A PARKING SPACE NEXT TO ANOTHER CAR AND KNEW SHE WAS CLOSE TO IT BUT DID NOT THINK SHE HIT IT. SHE SAID SHE DID HAVE RED PAINT ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE FENDER OF HER WHTIE TRUCK.SHE WAS GIVEN THE CRASH NUMBER FOR THIS.OCT 29, 2019 REPORT SUPPLEMENTED TO CORRECT YEAR OF V1 TO 2018.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON W 12TH STREET AND BEGAN TURNING ON N ILLINOIS STREET. V1 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V2 AND THEN COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V3.THERE WERE NO WITNESSES ON SCENE.D1 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS TURNING ONTO ILLINOIS STREET A VEHICLE WAS DRIVING SOUTH. D1 SAID THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO AVOID THE VEHICLE BY ACCELERATING AND LOST CONTROL COLLIDING WITH V2 AND V3.I WAS NEARBY ON A RELATED CALL AT 924 N LINDBERGH. I VISUAL OBSERVED V1 ACCELERATING SOUTH AWAY FROM MY LOCATION. V1 THEN TRAVELED EAST ON 11TH STREET TO NORTH ILLINOIS TO WEST ON 12TH STREET AND THEN COLLIDED WITH V2 AND V3 AFTER TURNING NORTH ON ILLINOIS AGAIN. I WAS ABLE TO HEAR V1 ACCELERATING DUE TO THE HIGHTENED NOISE FROM THE ENGINE. I DID ALSO HEAR THE COLLISION OCCUR FROM MY LOCATION AT 924 N LINDBERGH.

V1 STRUCK A DEER AT THE INTERSECTION OF BRUMMETTS CREEK ROAD AND FLEENER ROAD. DAMAGE TO V1 WAS A SMASHED IN WINDSHIELD AND KNOCKED OFF PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR. EVIDENCE SUGGESTS THE DEER JUMPED INTO V1. D1 STATED SHE WAS ONLY DRIVING APPROX 25-30 MPH. I DID OBSERVE THE DEER THAT WAS STRUCK.

D1 WAS ARRIVING TO 4905 S ROGERS ST WHICH WAS A BED AND BREAKFAST THAT HE WAS STAYING AT. HE WAS DRIVING A 15FT UHAUL TRUCK AND HAD DRIVEN FROM ILLINOIS THAT DAY. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS NOT FAMILIAR WITH THE AREA AND WAS SLOWLY DRIVING INTO THE DRIVEWAY TO ENSURE HE WAS IN THE RIGHT PLACE. D1 NEGLECTED TO REALIZE THAT THE BUILDING HAD A COVERED DRIVE THROUGH FOR GUESTS AND THE HEIGHT OF THE UHAUL TRUCK WAS TOO HIGH TO GO UNDER IT. D1 DROVE V1 INTO THE COVER WHICH KNOCKED ALL 4 POSTS OFF THEIR FOUNDATION AND ALSO DISLODGED THE BRICKS FROM THE HOUSE CREATING AN APPROXIMATE 5 INCH GAP BETWEEN THE BRICKS AND THE HOUSE. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS NOT PAYING ATTENTION AND DIDN'T REALIZE THE TRUCK WOULD HIT.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN ON SCENE AND WILL BE TURNED INTO EVIDENCE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: NO DIAGRAM....BOTH VEHICLES MOVED TO PRIVATE DRIVE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.D2 STATES THAT HE WAS IN THE TURN LANE WESTBOUND ON STATE ROAD 46 PASSING JACK'S DEFEAT CREEK SHOPPING CENTER ATTEMPTING TO TURN INTO THE PRIVATE DRIVE JUST WEST OF THE SHOPPING CENTER WHEN V1 STRUCK HIM IN THE REAR TIRE AS SHE LEFT JACK'S DEFEAT SHOPPING CENTER. D1 STATES THAT SHE GOT INTO THE CENTER LANE BEFORE BEING STRUCK BY V2.

VEHICLE 1 (WHITE PICKUP) STRUCK VEHICLE 2 (TOYOTA PRIUS) AND LEFT THE SCENE OF ACCIDENT. ACCIDENT OCCURRED WITHIN KROGER NORTH PARKING LOT. TOYOTA PRIUS WAS STRUCK ON PASSENGER SIDE REAR CORNER. SEE CASE REPORT FOR DETAILS.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON N. MOUNT TABOR JUST NORTH OF BOTTOM RD. A DEER RAN ACROSSED THE ROAD AND V1 STRUCK THE DEER WITH THE FRONT BUMPER CASUSING DAMAGE TO THE HOOD, FRONT BUMPER, AND PASSENGER DOOR.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TURNING ONTO S CURRY PIKE FROM W BELLE AVE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WITNESSED VEHICLE 2 BUT THOUGHT THEY WERE GOING TO TURN WEST ONTO W BELLE AVE. DRIVER 1 DIDN'T REALIZE THAT THE VEHICLE 2 WAS JUST CHANGING LANES AND PULLED OUT STRIKING VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE WAS SB ON S CURRY PIKE WHEN VEHICLE 1 PULLED OFF OF W BELLE AVE STRIKING HER VEHICLE. DRIVER 2 WAS UNABLE TO AVOID THE COLLISON.

V2 WAS STOPPED TRAVELING WEST IN TRAFFIC AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT ON W 2ND STREET AT WALKER STREET. V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST AND SLOWING DOWN WHILE APPROACHING STOPPED TRAFFIC. V1 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF V2 AND DISABLING DAMAGE TO V1. V1 WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE DUE TO THE DAMAGE CAUSED.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WAITING FOR THE LIGHT TO TURN GREEN WHEN SHE FELT V1 COLLIDE WITH THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE. D2 STATED THAT THE FORCE CAUSED HER VEHICLE TO MOVE FORWARD SEVERAL FEET.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS SLOWING DOWN AS SHE APPROACHED STOPPED TRAFFIC. D1 SAID THAT AS SHE WAS APPLYING THE BRAKES HER FOOT SLIPPED OFF OF THE PEDAL DUE TO HER SHOES AND HER VEHICLE ROLLED FREELY COLLIDING WITHT THE REAR OF V2.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON E. WINSLOW RD. D1 STATED TRAFFIC BEGAN TO MOVE AND SUDDENLY CAME TO A STOP. D1 STATED SHE APPLIED HER BREAKS ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOOR, BUT HER VEHCILE DID NOT STOP. D1 STATED HER VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH. D1 STATED SHE DID HIT HER HEAD ON HER STEERING WHEEL, BUT REFUSED EMS. PRIOR TO LEAVING D1 STATED SHE DID INTEND TO GET CHECKED OUT BY A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON E. WINSLOW RD. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF HIS VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.

Vehicle 1 was traveling west on 3rd Street in the north lane approximately 100 feet west of Swain Avenue. Vehicle 2 was also traveling west on 3rd Street in the south lane.Driver 1 stated he was traveling west on 3rd Street in the north lane when he attempted to make a lane change to the south lane. He stated he had looked for other vehicles and had not seen any before attempting to change lanes. Driver 1 stated as he began changing lanes he struck the rear passenger side of Vehicle 2 with the front driver side of Vehicle 1.Driver 2 stated she was traveling west on 3rd Street in the south lane when Vehicle 1 attempted to change lanes striking her passenger rear side. None of the parties involved complained of any injuries.There was damage to the front driver side fender, light, and bumper of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the passenger rear door, wheel, and bumper.

Other Location Of Investigation: I conducted a follow up with the passenger at IU Health Bloomington Hospital.Injury status: D1 (Dustin Smith) sustained an abrasion on his lower left arm and had bruising on his left shoulder. The front passenger (Angela Jewell) complained of lower, left arm pain.Contributing Factor: D1 fell asleep and causing him to run off the roadway.SR37 is a highway that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. Smithville Road is a county road that runs in a eastern and western direction. Smithville Road intersects with SR37 300ft south of the crash.V1 (1998 brown Chevrolet Blazer) was traveling northbound in the right lane on SR37. V1 traveled off the roadway onto the east shoulder and then traveled northwest across both northbound lanes. V1 entered into the median and rolled over multiple times before coming to final rest in the median facing east.D1 (Dustin Smith) stated that he was traveling northbound on SR37. D1 stated he fell asleep and traveled to the east shoulder area of SR37. He over corrected and traveled across both north lanes of SR37 into the median. D1 stated his vehicle overturned, but was unsure of how many times. He was wearing his seat belt. W1 (Myria Smith) stated she was traveling northbound on SR37 behind V1. W1 stated she was not close enough to see what happened, but saw V1 overturning. She was unsure of how many times V1 overturned.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the entire body of V1. I, also observed clothing and other debris through out the median in the area of the crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Ran Off Roadway on the part of D1. This was determined by driver and witness statements, and damage sustained to V1.

V1 was backing east onto the sidewalk in the 500 block of N Sunrise Avenue in order to load objects into the pick up truckD1 stated that she had the rear tailgate up on the camper shell on V1, and that when backing onto the sidewalk the glass portion of the camper shell struck a tree on the top of the camper, causing the glass to break.D1 estimated that the shell will have to be replaced.There was no other damage.A photo of the broken camper shell window was taken.

V1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT STREET FROM MILLER DR.V2 WAS DIRECLTY IN FRONT OF V1 STOPPED WHILE WAITING ON TRAFFIC SO HE COULD TURN LEFT.D2 SAID V1 CAME UP BEHIND HIM QUICKLY AND TRIED TO CHANGE LANES BUT HIT HIM. HE SAID THEY BOTH PULLED INTO A NEARBY PARKING LOT AND WAITED FOR THE POILICE.D2 SAID BEFORE I ARRIVED V1 SAID SHE HAD TO GET TO AN APPOINTMENT AND LEFT. HE SAID HE GAVE HIM THE NAME OF "MAGGIE HALL" AND LIVED AT 1029 AZELEA LANE AND HER INSURANCE IS WITH SAFE AUTO.D2 TOOK PICTURES OF V1 INCLUDING THE LICENSE PLATE AND I WAS ABLE TO GET MORE INFORMATION WITH THAT.

V1 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF 4243 W STEBU LANE. THE OWNER REPORTED IT BEING STRUCK BY ANOTHER VEHICLE BETWEEN 10PM ON 7/25/2019 AND 11AM ON 7/26. THE OTHER VEHICLE FLED THE SCENE.NO COLLISION DIAGRAM AS THE VEHICLE HAD BEEN MOVED

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: 3RD Street primarily travels east and west bound and intersects South Park Ridge Road on the east side of Bloomington. South Park Ridge Road primarily travels north and south.Vehicle 2 (Gold 2012 Toyota Corrola) was traveling eastbound on 3RD Street and was approaching the intersection of South Park Ridge Road. Vehicle 1 (Gray 2010 Land Rover L2H) was stationary at South Park Ridge Road facing north. V1 pulled onto 3RD Street, striking V2 in the rear right door causing damage on V2. V1 had damage to the right portion of the front of the vehicle. V1 and V2 pulled into the parking lot of Circle K, to await Law Enforcement. Driver 1 (Svitlana Pokhodina) stated she was on South Park Ridge Road facing north. D1 stated she looked both ways and begun to pull out onto 3RD Street. D1 stated she then struck V2. D1 stated she did not see V2, and Struck V2.Driver 2 (Audrey Hall) stated she was traveling east on 3RD Street and was at the intersection of Park Ridge Road. D2 stated that V1 pulled out while she was passing the intersection. D2 stated she had not time to brake or avoid the collision, and was then struck by V1.Based off the facts and circumstances, I have determined the primary cause of the crash was D1 failed to yield the right of way to D2. I have determined this by the driver statements, and by the damage on the vehicles. No citations were issued at the crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was traveling E/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the N/B exit onto SR 37. D2 was traveling W/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the N/B exit onto SR 37. D1 made a left turn onto the N/B SR 37 exit. D2 continued through the intersection, striking V1 in the passenger side, causing a collision. D1 stated that he was traveling E/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the N/B exit onto SR 37. D1 stated that he stopped at the intersection, waited for the green left turn signal, and then proceeded to make the left turn onto the N/B SR 37 exit. D1 stated that at this time he was struck by V2 on his passenger side. D1 stated that he never saw V2 until after the collison occurred. D1 stated that he was 100% positive that he was given the green left turn signal prior to making his left turn. D2 stated that he was traveling W/B on W Bloomfield Rd., approaching the N/B exit onto SR 37. D2 stated that as he continued through the intersection V1 pulled directly into his lane of travel, causing V2 to strike V1 in the passenger side. D2 stated that he was 100% positive that he had the green traffic signal, indicating that he had the right of way to continue straight.

V1 was EB on grimes and struck something at the intersection of Morton. Debris was in the roadway. D1 stated that she believed that she blew the front driver tire out which caused the damage but the tire was inflated. Nothing near the intersection had been struck and due to the large amount of damage the accident could not have occurred anywhere else. I believe V1 struck another vehicle but V2 left the scene. D1 was cited for Illegal consumption.

Driver 2 stated she had just pulled out of the McDonalds lot to go south on Walnut St. Driver 2 stated she stopped for traffic on Walnut St just after pulling out and was hit from behind by vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated she was waiting for traffic to clear in order to pull out of the McDonalds lot to go south on Walnut St. Driver 1 stated she thought traffic was going to clear and she pulled out onto Walnut St and ran into the rear of vehicle 2.

D2 WAS DRIVING SB THROUGH THE PARKING LOT AND CAME TO A STOP AT THE SOUTH END OF THE LANE. D1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT IN THE PARKING LOT AND WHEN SHE BACKED OUT OF THE SPOT, D1 BACKED V1'S LEFT REAR CORNER INTO THE LEFT SIDE OF V2.

V1 WAS BACKING FROM PARKING SPACE. THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE WITHOUT ATTEMPTING TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION. BYSTANDERS ON SCENE ATTEMPTED TO GET THE DRIVERS ATTENTION VERBALLY BUT D1 DID NOT STOP. D1 WAS LATER CONTACTED BY OFFICERS AND ARRESTED FOR OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED AND LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT.PICTURES WERE TAKEN OF BOTH VEHICLES. V1 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE BUMPER. SILVER PAINT CHIPS WERE FOUND ON THE DAMAGED AREA THAT MATCHED THE COLOR AND SHAPE OF PAINT MISSING FROM V2. V2 HAD DAMAGE TO REAR PASSENGER FENDER AND PAINT CHIPPED OFF.

D2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON SR 446 AND STATED THAT SHE SAW KIDS ON THE BRIDGE ABOUT TO JUMP INTO LAKE MONROE. D2 STATED THAT SHE SLOWED TO APPROXIMATELY 20 MPH TO TELL THE KIDS NOT TO JUMP BECUASE IT WAS ILLEGAL. D2 STATED THAT WHEN SHE LOOKED UP SHE SAW V1 COMING UP BEHIND HER SO SHE ATTEMPTED TO SPEED UP BUT IT WASN'T ENOUGH TIME AND V1 HIT THE BACK END OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SB AND IT APPEARED TO HIM THE V2 WAS STOPPED ON THE BRIDGE OF 446 JUST BEFORE CUTRIGHT. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO SLOW DOWN WHEN HIS TIRES BEGAN TO SKID. D1 STATED THAT V2 DID NOT SPEED UP FAST ENOUGH RESULTING IN THE REAR END COLLISION.V1 HAD FRONT END DAMAGE AND WAS OFF THE ROADWAY IN THE PARKING LOT TO CUTRIGHT AND D1 GOT A PERSONAL TOW VIA AAA.V2 WAS STILL PARKED IN THE ROADWAY UPON MY ARRIVAL WITH REAR END DAMAGE HOWEVER THE PLASTIC AROUND THE RIGHT REAR TIRE WAS PUSHED BACK AND D2 WAS ABLE TO DRIVE V2 AWAY FROM THE ACCIDENT.

According to the witness, Ryan Heeb, an older green truck (V1) struck V2 in the parking lot of 1523 S Piazza Drive with the front of V1 causing damage to the rear driver's side bumper of V2 which was parked in a parking spot. Heeb stated V1 then left the area without leaving any contact or insurance information.

D1 and V1 left the scene without providing information. D2 stated that he parked his vehicle in the surface parking lot for the Graduate Hotel on 7/27/2019 at approximately 5pm. D2 stated that the car was parked in the lot all night. D2 stated that he returned to his vehicle around 11:30am on 7/28/2019, and drove to the university stadiums to show his children the area. D2 stated they got out of the vehicle to look around, and that's when he noticed the damage to his vehicle. There was a large dent above his rear driver's side tail light, as well as a dent above the rear driver's side door.I drove through the area of the parking lot and the surrounding areas, and was unable to locate any cameras on any buildings that would have captured the incident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS TRAVELINGTHROUGH THE INTERSECTION OFTHE SR 45/46 BYPASS AND NORTH WALNUT STREET, EASTBOUND, WHEN IT IS BELIEVED, V1, FAILED TO YIELD TO THE RIGHT OF WAY TO V2. CONSEQUENTLY, V1 TURNED LEFT ON A RED TRAFFIC LIGHT, TO TRAVEL NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT STREET, PRIOR TO COLLIDING WITH V2. A WITNESS TO THE ACCIDENT ADVISED HE WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT BEHIND V1, WHEN D1 DISREGARDED THE TRAFFIC LIGHT, TURNING INTO THE PATH OF V2. D2 ADVISED THE SAME ACCOUNT OF THE ACCIDENT AS THE WITNESS.D1 INITIALLY ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON WEST SR 45/46 BYPASS TO TURN LEFT ON NORTH WALNUT STREET FROM THE SOUTH TURN LANE ON A GREEN LIGHT. AS D1 TURNED LEFT, D1 ADVISED V1 AND V2 COLLIDED. WHEN ADVISED THE WITNESS TO THE ACCIDENT INFORMED ME, D1 HAD A RED LIGHT, D1 AGREED WITH THE WITNESSES ACCOUNT OF THE ACCIDENT.

D2 stated he was stopped at the stop sign to turn northbound on State Road 37 from Smithville Road when V2 rear ended his vehicle. D2 then stated that D1 did stop and speak with him but did not stay for the police report because D1 stated to D2 that he had drank a few beers prior to the collision. D1 did provide D2 with a business card for his company, John Peters Roofing Inc, with contact information and advised D2 to contact him the next day and he would provide D2 with all of the information needed for the crash report.D1 did contact me the next day and provided as much information as he was given for the report. I was unable to complete all of the information, however, the insurance company for D1 did state to D2 that they would handle the accident.ON 9/9/2019, I was contacted by D1 in order to update the vehicle 1 and Driver 1 information for the report.

D1 was located in the emergency room of Monroe Hospital. Staff advised he arrived a 9:45A.M. D1 stated he was the driver and only occupant in the vehicle this morning. D1 recalled striking the curb at approximately 15 MPH and running over weeds. D1 claimed did not know he struck a traffic sign.

D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NB ON 446 IN THE 1500 BLOCK.SHE STATED SHE DIDNT KNOW HOW SHE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE BUT STATED THAT THE VAN PULLED LEFTFROM THE ROADWAY AND SHE WAS UNABLE TO REGAIN CONTROL.THE VEHICLE STRUCK A THE MAILBOX AT 1550 S. STATE ROAD 446 THEN STRUCK TEH DITCH CAUSING THE VHICLE TO SPIN AROUND FACING SB. THE VEHICLES AIRBAGS DID DEPOLY ON BOTH SIDES OF THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER HAD A BLOODY NOSE AND WAS VERY DAZED UPON SPEAKING WITH HER. SHE WAS TAKEN TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON FOR EVALUATION.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS PULLING INTO THE PARKING LOT OF 2907 S MCINTIRE DRIVE, PREPARING TO PARKING IN A PARKING SPACE. AS SHE PULLED INTO A SPACE ADJACENT TO THE BUILDING, HER VEHICLE LURCHED FORWARD EVEN THOUGH HER FOOT WAS ON THE BRAKE, CAUSING V1 TO CONTACT THE SUPPORT POSTS FOR THE BUILDING. D1 ADVISED SHE HAS HAD 2 OTHER INCIDENTS WHERE V1 SURGED/LURCHED FORWARD WHILE SHE WAS SLOWING/OR STOPPED. THIS HAS NOT BEEN DIAGNOSED BY A MECHANIC.

Vehicle 2 was traveling north on Smith Rd and Vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 slowed and then came to a stop for a vehicle in front of him that was turning west onto Grandview Dr at the intersection of Smith and Grandview. Driver of Vehicle 1 stated that she did not realize vehicle 2 had came to a stop. When she applied her brakes it was to late. Driver of vehicle 1 also stated she did not feel the brakes were working properly which was likely caused by the wet road conditions. Vehicle 1 struck vehicle 2 in the rear cause minor damage to the front of vehicle 1 and minor to moderate damage to the rear of vehicle 2. No injures were reported and both vehicles were able to drive from the scene.Driver of vehicle 1 was not able to locate an insurance card in the vehicle at the time of the accident and stated that the vehicle was not hers but she believed it did have insurance. Vehicle 1 belongs to the driver's roommates mother and the driver did not have contact information for the owner. I attempted to contact the roommate for the insurance information but he was also unable to provide insurance information. I was later contacted by the driver who stated that vehicle 1 had no insurance. No citation was written for this incident because the driver did not knowingly drive it without insurance and the owner did not give permission for the driver to use the vehicle. The roommate gave permission but did not know if there was insurance.

V2 WAS STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT IN THE SOUTH-BOUND LANE ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH WALNUT AND STATE ROAD 45/46. WHILE STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT, V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR BUMPER OF V2 WITH THE FRONT BUMPER OF V1 CAUSING DAMAGE. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was driving west on US 45/46. V2 was slowing due to traffic also going west on US 45/46.D1 stated she was driving west on US 45/46 and noticed that V2 was slowing due to traffic. D1 stated she attempted to stop but her wheels started to slide due to the wet road. D1 stated she could not stop in time and collided with the rear bumper of V2.D2 stated that he was going west on US 45/46 and was slowing due to traffic when V1 collided with his rear bumper.

V1 was traveling North on Dunn Street, approaching the intersection of Dunn Street and Varsity Lane. V1 was pulling a semi-trailer. The trailer of V1 clipped some low hanging power wires that went from one side of the road to the other. The wires were hanging too low in that location.When the trailer clipped the wires, it pulled both poles towards each other, causing the wires to drop down even lower. The wires were so low, even small passenger cars could not continue. Duke Energy and Comcast were called to the scene. Both companies were able to fix their lines, and traffic then resumed as normal. The was no damage to V1 or the trailer it was pulling. This report is for information purposes.

V1 was headed East on 10th Street approaching the railroad over pass near the T-intersection with Jefferson Street. D1 stated that she was going about 25mph heading East on 10th Street approaching the railroad overpass when she realized she was going too fast. D1 stated that she thinks she was going to fast and was headed towards the concrete post holding the railroad up in the middle of the road. D1 stated that when she noticed she was heading for that she over corrected and struck the concrete barrier on the East side of 10th Street when the road curves and the railroad goes over 10th Street. V1 struck the concrete barrier with the front passenger side. There was significant damage and the vehicle was towed. The airbags were deployed. D1 was checked out by ambulance and signed a form stating she did not wish to go to the hospital.The railroad was called and informed of the crash.

Country Club Dr. is a two lane two way road that runs primarily east and west. S Walnut St is four lane two way road that runs primarily north and south. Both roads are made of asphalt. The intersection is run by a fully operational traffic light. At the time of the crash it was daylight and traffic was light to moderate. Vehicle 1, a gray 2013 Ford Mustang, was facing east on Country Club Dr. in the Walnut St intersection directly behind Vehicle 2, a white 2009 Ford F150. V2 was waiting to turn north (left) onto Walnut St. when V1 stuck it from behind. Both vehicles came to a controlled stop after the hit. Driver 1, Aaron Chestnut, was in his car facing east on Country Club Dr. at the Walnut St. intersection directly behind V2. D1 said when he was rolling up behind V2 he attempted to apply his brakes. D1 told me that even though he pushed on the brake pedal his car continued to travel forward. D1 said he stuck the rear of V2 with his car.
