Driver 2, Jeffrey Minyo, was sitting facing east on Country Club Dr. in the Walnut St. Intersection. D2 told me that while he was sitting there V1 struck his truck from the rear. D2 he never saw it coming. Evidence shows damage to the front bumper of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear bumper of V2.

Owner of vehicle 2 stated she parked her vehicle in the parking stall on the south side of W 6th Street around 0830 hours and when she returned around 0930 hours she noticed there was damage on the passenger side of her vehicle. After looking at the damage on vehicle 2 I concluded vehicle 1 was turning right into the parking stall next to vehicle 2 and made the turn too wide hitting vehicle 2 with the right driver side corner of their vehicle and than left the scene.

V2 was traveling westbound on W third street through the intersection of W third and the south-bound on ramp to I-69 when V1, who was traveling westbound on W third street turned south-bound, crossing the east-bound lane on W third street, and struck V2 with the front left bumper of V1 causing damage to the driver side rear quarter panel on V2. V1 then left south-bound on I-69.

D1 stated he observed D2 stopped in traffic. D1 applied the brakes and slid into the rear of D2.D2 stated they were stopped in traffic, heard screeching tires, and was hit in the hear by D1. Vehicles moved out of the roadway prior to my arrival.

V2 OWNER CAME TO THE BLOOMINGTON PD TO REPORT AN ACCIDENT ON 7-29-19 AT 1740PM AT 3600 W. 3RD ST. OWNER WAS STOPPED IN THE PARKING LOT BY THOMAS MACDONALD WHO PROVIDED THE LICENSE PLATE OF V1. CLAIMING V1 HAD JUST STRUCK HER VEHICLE WHILE SHE WAS LOADING GROCERIES INTO HER TRUNK. D2 NEVER SAW V1/D1 AND DOES NOT REMEMBER WHICH DIRECTION V1 WAS TRAVELING. D2 DID NOT OBTAIN A TELEPHONE NUMBER FROM THE WITNESS. VERY MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER.V1/D1 WAS LOCATED AT 854 E. SHERWOOD HILLS DR ON 07-30-2019 AT 1220PM. D1 ADMITTED TO BEING IN THE PARKING LOT OF 3600 W. 3RD ST, FRESH THYME PARKING. D1 REMEMBERS THE OLDER GOLD BUICK (V2) PARKED DIRECTLY INFRONT OF V1. D1 STATED I BACKED OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT AND PULLED FORWARD INTO THE LANE OF TRAVEL TO LEAVE THE PARKING LOT. D1 THEN STATED SHE PULLED OUT AND LEFT AND WAS NOT NEAR V2. D1 DENIES BEING INVOLVED IN ANY ACCIDENT, AND THERE IS NO VISIABLE DAMAGE TO V1.NO OUTSIDE VIDEO AT FRESH THYME. UNABLE TO LOCATE THE WITNESS. UNKNOWN IF ACCDIENT OCCURED AND IF V1 IS ACTUALLY THE SUSPECT IN THE ACCIDENT.

V1 WAS IN A PARKING LOT AT 4935 W. ARLINGTON ROAD PULLING NORTHBOUND THROUGH A PARKING STALL. V2 WAS PARKED IN A PARKING STALL FACING SOUTH DIRECTLY NEXT TO V1. V1 TURNED TOO SHARP AND STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER OF V2.

D1 of V1 left the scene of the accident and left no information.D2 of V2 stated that she parked her rental car at her daughter's apartment on 7/28/2019 around 3pm. D2 stated that she inspected the vehicle at this time in preparation of her returning the vehicle the next day, and did not see any damage on the vehicle. D2 stated that there was no vehicle parked next to her car when she parked, and the vehicle stayed parked all night in the same spot. D2 stated that when she returned to her vehicle on 7/29/2019 around 11am, there were still no vehicles parked next to her vehicle.D2 stated that she left her daughter's apartment and arrived at the Kroger gas station at 1175 S College Mall Road to get gas around 11:15am. D2 then stated that after getting gas, she parked in the Kroger parking lot. D2 stated that she went into Kroger to eat lunch with her daughter and grandson. D2 stated the she parked facing south, and does not remember what vehicles were parked next to her. D2 stated that she left Kroger after lunch, and drove to Hertz to return the vehicle. Hertz informed D2 of the damage on the passenger side of the front bumper. D2 stated that she did not hit anything while she was driving or parked, and D2 believes her vehicle was hit while it was parked at Kroger.

WHILE TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON STATE ROAD 37, JUST NORTH OF SMITHVILLE ROAD, UNIT 1 STRUCK A DEER THAT RAN INTO THE ROAD WAY. THE DRIVER STATED THAT SHE DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO REACT TO THE DEER, AND ATEMPTED TO SWERVE TO MISS IT. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER SIDE HEADLIGHT AREA.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W STATE ROAD 46, WENT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF W ARLINGTON ROAD AND REAR ENDED V2. THIS CAUSE A CHAIN REACTION OF V2 REAR ENDING V3 AND V3 REAR ENDING V4.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING EB AND CAME UP TO A SINGLE LINE OF STOPPED VEHICLES AND REAR ENDED ANOTHER VEHICLE.ALL OTHER DRIVERS STATED THAT THEY WERE REAR ENDED.THE EASTBOUND LANES OF WEST STATE ROAD 46 TRANSITIONED TO A SINGLE LANE AS VEHICLES APPROACHED THE NEXT CROSS STREET, N CURRY PIKE.D1 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL FOR POSSIBLE INJURIES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was westbound on E. 3rd Street in the right/northernmost westbound lane. Vehicle 2 was passing a city bus that was facing westbound in the left/southernmost westbound lane, preparing to turn left and south onto S. Park Ridge Road. As Vehicle 2 passed the bus, Vehicle 2 struck the passenger side of Vehicle 1 while Vehicle 1 was eastbound, turning left/north onto S. Park Ridge Road across westbound traffic. Vehicle 1 was eastbound and turned left/north onto S. Park Ridge Road and crossed the path of Vehicle 1 who had the right of way.

V1 WAS ON S OLD STATE ROAD 37, IN THE SB LANE AT THE INTERSECTION OF W CHURCH LANE WHEN V2 SLIGHTLY ROLLED BACK AND STRUCK THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE WITH A TRAILER CAUSING MINOR FRONT END DAMAGE. D1 STATED THAT V2'S TRAILER ROLLED BACK INTO HER CAUSING FRONT END DAMAGE. D1 STATED THAT SHE ATTEMPT TO GET D2'S ATTENTION HOWEVER THE VEHICLE CONTINUED SB ON S FAIRFAX ROAD.I LATER CONTACT V2; HE WAS UNAWARE THAT HE ROLLED INTO V1. THE COLLISION WAS COMPLETELY ACCIDENTAL AND IF HE KNEW HE BACKED INTO V1, HE WOULD HAVE STOPPED. NO CRIMINAL CHARGES FOR LSA ARE BEING FILED.SINCE BOTH VEHICLES DID NOT REMAIN AT THE POINT OF IMPACT, NO DIAGRAM WAS COMPLETED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was S/B on S Rogers St, preparing to turn left onto W 3rd St. V2 was N/B on S Rogers St, preparing to cross the intersection of W 3rd St. Both vehicles had a green light. V1 turned in front of V2 and the vehicles collided head on.D1 stated that she did not see V2 as she prepared to make the turn.D2 stated that he was driving straight through the intersection when V1 collided with his vehicle.
D1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON OLD ST RD 37.D1 STATED THAT HE SWERVED TO AVOID A DEER AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY.D1 RAN INTO THE DITCH ON WEST SIDE OF SOUTH OLD STATE RD 37 AND HARRODSBURG RD.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS EXITING A PARKING LOT WESTBOUND JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH CURRY AND WEST JONATHAN DRIVE. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE RIGHT BACK TIRE AS VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY PIKE. VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING IN THE RIGHT LANE OF TWO NORTHBOUND LANES OF NORTH CURRY PIKE.BOTH DRIVERS WERE UNINJURED AND REUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEHICLE 1 HAD BUMPER DAMAGE, HOWEVER THE BUMPER WAS STABALIZED AND VEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE. VEHICLE 2 HAD A FLAT RIGHT REAR TIRE. THE TIRE WAS CHANGED AND VEHICLE 2 WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

V1 and V2 were on the East side of University East Apartments. D1 stated that believes he was already out of the parking spot on the East side of the building when his vehicle was struck in the rear. D2 stated that she was pulling through the lot very slowly when V1 backed out of the spot and V1 struck V2. V2 struck the rear of V1 with the front drivers side. There was damage to V2. V1 had only a few scratches on the rear bumper.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON N LIBERTY DR APPROACHING W CONSTITUTION AVE. D1 STATED V2 STOPPED SUDDENLY TO TURN LEFT AND D1 REAR ENDED V2.D2 STATED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON N LIBERTY DR APPROACHING W CONSTITUTION AVE TO TURN LEFT. D2 STATED HE DID NOT SLAM ON HIS BRAKES TO TURN. D2 STATED HE SAW V1 DRIVING QUICKLY TOWARDS HIM TO REAR END HIM AND HE ACCELERATED RAPIDLY TO AVOID THE WRECK.PICTURES TAKEN.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS IN A PARKING SPACE IN FRONT OF 3440 S COVENANTER DRIVE, PREPARING TO BACK UP. D1 OBSERVED V2 DRIVING BEHIND HER, BUT THOUGHT HE CONTINUE PASSED HER AND WAS CLEAR. AS D1 STARTED TO BACK UP, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.DRIVER OF V2 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST BOUND THROUGH THE PARKING LOT. AS V2 PASSED BEHIND V1, V1 BACKED INTO V2.

VEH 1 TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY HAULING A 1999 MAROON JEEP GRAND CHEROKEE LAREDO BEARING IN PLATE SRE984 ON A TRAILER. THE TRAILER CAME OFF OF VEHICLE 1 AND RAN INTO THE PROPERTY OF 900 NORTH CURRY LOT 64.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEH 1 WAS NOT DAMAGED AND DRIVEN FROM SCENE.TRAILER AND VEH ON TRAILER WERE TAKEN BY KENZ AND PRITCHARDS TO KENS WEST SIDE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of Vehicle 1 stated that she was pulling out of the parking area near Subway at the Clear Creek Crossing Shopping Center when she struck vehicle 2 that had entered the shopping plaza from Rhorer Road. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated she was pulling into the shopping plaza when she was struck on the rear passenger side door by Vehicle 1. The accident occurred in the parking area of the shopping plaza. Vehicle 2 sustained damage to rear passenger door. Vehicle 1 sustained damage to from driver side bumper and headlamp.

Driver two stated he was driving south in the middle lane on S College Ave at W Kirkwood Ave when he had a green light and vehicle one entered the intersection from the west going east on Kirkwood. Driver two stated he hit vehicle one on the driver side with the front of his vehicle.Driver one stated he was driving east on W Kirkwood Ave at S College Ave when the sun was glaring on the light signal and he thought he had a green light. Driver one stated he proceeded into the intersection but then saw he had a red light not a green light and was hit by vehicle two. Witness one stated vehicle two had a green light driving south on S Walnut Street in the middle lane.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she turned right on W SR 45 from liberty drive. D1 entered into traffic and collided with d2D2 stated she was traveling west on SR 45. D2 stated D1 pulled into her (D2) lane. D2 stated she (D2) had the green light.

DRIVER 1 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON SR46W WHEN HER VEHICLE STOPPED WORKING. THIS OCCURED APPROX 50 FEET WEST OF JUDY ST ON SR46W. DRIVER 1 STEPPED OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND ATTEMPTED TO PUSH VEHICLE OFF THE ROADWAY BY HERSELF. DRIVER 1 WAS NOT ABLE TO MOVE HER VEHICLE DUE TO THE SIZE AND WEIGHT OF THE VEHICLE. DRIVER 1 LOST CONTROL AS SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PUSH THE VEHICLE AND STRUCK DRIVER 2 VEHICLE AS HE WAS WESTBOUND ALSO ON SR46W. DRIVER 2 COULD NOT AVOID DRIVER 1 VEHICLE AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO GO AROUND DRIVER 1 VEHICLE IN THE TURN LANE AS IT ROLLED BACKWARDS AND STRUCK DRIVER 2 VEHICLE IN THE FRONT.
D1 and d2 both stated they were eastbound on State Road 46 just east of Arlington Road when V1 drifted left in V2's lane, colliding with the front passenger wheel of V2.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB THRU THE PUBLIC ACCESS ROAD LOCATED IN FRONT OF 2721 E 3RD STREET ATTEMPTING TO PARK IN THE LOT. V2 WAS ALREADY PARKED FACING NB IN A PARKING STALL. AS V1 TURNED LEFT TO PULL INTO THE PARKING STALL LOCATED TO THE EAST OF V2, THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1 STRUCK THE PASSENGERS SIDE WHEEL AND DOOR AREA OF V2. V1 THEN BACKED OUT OF THE PARKING STALL WITHIN SECONDS AND LEFT THE AREA WITHOUT PROVIDING ANY INFORMATION FOR V2.D2 SUPPLIED ME WITH VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SHOWING THE STATEMENT ABOVE IS ACCURATE.D1 DECIDED THAT SHE DID NOT WISH TO SPEAK WITH ME WITHOUT A LAWYER.

UNIT 1 WAS STOPPED AT A MAILBOX DELIVERING MAIL. THE RESIDENCE ACROSS THE ROAD HAD A BOX THAT NEEED TO BE DELIVERED TO THE DOOR. UNIT 1 ABRUPTLY TURNED FROM THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD TO GO ACROSS TO THE DRIVEWAY ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE. UNIT 2 STATED THEY OBSERVED UNIT 1 WITH ITS FLASHING LIGHTS, AND SLOWED TO ENSURE IT WASNT MOVING. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE BEGAN TO PROCEED SLOWLY AROUND UNIT 1 WHEN IT SUDDENLY TURNED LEFT. UNIT 1 STRUCK UNIT 2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR DOOR AND QUARTER PANNEL. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED SHE ASKED THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 IF SHE SAW THEM, AND UNIT 1 DRIVER STATED THAT SHE DID NOT.

The location of the crash occurred in the east bound lane of SR 46 just west of Friendship Road in Monroe County. SR 46 is a two lane, two way road. Traffic was intermittenly heavy on this day.Vehicle #1, a 2016 silver Dodge caravan, was east bound on SR 46 when it ran off the south side of the road crashing head-on into a tree. V1 sustained heavy and disabling damage to its entire front and middle portions.Driver #1, Oliver Williams III, was interviewed at the Bloomington Hospital due to the nature of his injuries. D1 stated he was traveling east on SR 46. D1 was escorting his passenger to Brown County from Terre Haute. D1 stated he just stopped at a gas station to stretch their legs and were back enroute to Brown County when he thinks he jerked the wheel to the right because he may have been too far left of center. Next thing D1 knew they were running off the road and into grass before he tried applying the brakes. D1 was unable to stop V1 from colliding into the tree. D1 sustained a large cut to his right wrist, cuts to the face from the glass from the windshield, and a possible broken left knee. It's highly likely these injuries could have been mitigated using the seat belt. Passenger #1, Alexzander Sizemore, was also interviewed at the Bloomington hospital due to his injuries. P1 stated he was reading and had his head rested on the headrest when he felt V1 jerk. The jolt caused him to look up and the next thing he knew D1 was off the road and trying to apply the brakes in the grass but V1 did not stop. P1 braced for impact. P1 sustained cuts to his hands and head.Witness #1, Isaiah Winter, was driving east in a red mini-van on SR 46 located directly behind V1. W1 saw V1 drift left of center and then jerk or over correct and then run off the road. W1 did not see brake lights until V1 was already in the grass and then strike a tree.

D1 was sitting at the stop light at W. 3rd St and Profile Parkway waiting to turn left onto W 3rd St. D2 was in front of her at the stop light in a green Ford Ranger. The Ford Ranger then began to roll backwards and struck the front of V1 causing damage to the bumper of V1. The driver of the Ford Ranger then threw his hands up and then drove off south onto Park Square Dr and did not stop.D1 stated that she honked her horn when the Ford Ranger began to roll backwards but he continued to roll and struck her vehicle. D1 attempted to get a picture of the Ford Ranger but was unable to get a clear picture of the license plate. At this time I do not have any information on the Ford Ranger or its driver.

RECEIVED REPORT OF A VEHICLE ON A ROCK WALL WITH WHEELS SPINNING AND THE DRIVER ASLEEP IN FRONT OF 1205 N MAPLE ST. DRIVER 1 SAID SHE WAS DRIVING THROUGH THE APARTMENT COMPLEX AND THEN SHE WAS UP ON THE STONE WALL AND DOES NOT KNOW HOW IT HAPPENED.D1 SAID SHE HAD USED HEROINE METH AND XANAX EARLIER AND WAS ARRESTED FOR OWI.OTHER LOCATON OF INVESTIGATION WAS AT THE IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL WHERE OFFICER BYERLEY GOT A BLOOD DRAW FOR DRUGS.V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON THE SOUTH END OF THE DRIVE OF THE APARTMENT COMPLEX AND DROVE UP ONTO A RETAINING WALL.

D1 was not on scene upon Law enforcement arrival however she did contact Law Enforcement at the time of the collision. D1 had to leave to get to work. I made contact with D1 at her residence. D1 stated her vehicle's tire "blew". D1 then applied the brakes and the vehicle began to slide. D1 stated she had no control over the vehicle.

When I arrived on scene, the vehicles had been moved from the location of the crash. The crash involved a silver Hyundai (V1), driven by Alexandra Margets (D1), and a parked silver Ford (V2), owned by Junhua Xu (O1). D1 stated that she was not injured.D1 stated that she was backing out of her parking spot when the passenger side doors struck the driver side rear bumper of V2 which was parked and unoccupied.V1 sustained moderate scratches to the passenger side doors. V2 sustained moderate scratches to the driver side rear bumper.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.

V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE TURNING LEFT ONTO 2ND STREET.V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE IN THE LEFT TURN LANE TO GO EAST ON 2ND STREET.V1 IS A TRACTOR TRAILER. HE HAD TO SWING WIDE TO MAKE THE TURN. D1 SAID AS HE WAS MAKING THE TURN V2 TRIED TO TURN LEFT BESIDE HER AND IT HIT THE MIDDLE OF HIS TRAILER.D2 SAID AS SHE TURNED LEFT V1 TURNED INTO HER.PRIMARY CAUSE LISTED AS OTHER BECAUSE V1 WAS ALREADY MAKING THE TURN WHEN V2 RAN INTO THE SIDE OF IT.

When I arrived on scene, the vehicles had been moved from the location of the crash. The crash involved a silver Jeep (V1), driven by Caleb Tyner (D1), and a white BMW (V2), driven by Sondra Pischel (D2). None of the parties involved in the crash complained of any injuries at the scene. V1 was driving north on the 45/46 Bypass from 3rd St in the left lane of travel and V2 was in the right lane. V1 attempted to change lanes into the right lane and crashed into V2.The passenger side rear fender of V1 collided into the driver side front bumper of V2. V1 sustained light scratches to the passenger side rear fender and rear door. V2 sustained scratches to the driver side front bumper, wheel well, and wheel.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.

D2 advised she was backing out of her parking space when V1 struck the rear end of her vehicle. D2 stated that D1 struck the rear of her vehicle twice during this incident. D1 stated she was backing out of her parking space and advised she checked around and did not see any other vehicles, but did admit to hitting V2. D1 also admitted to hitting V2 twice, but it was all an accident. Both vehicles backing out of their respective parking spaces at the same time.
V2 was parked in front of 1318 S Washington Street facing South. Owner of V2 is unsure who struck her vehicle.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON SAMPLE ROAD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF CANYON CT AND SAMPLE ROAD. D1 ADVISED HE WAS TEXTING ON HIS CELL PHONE AND DID NOT SLOW DOWN IN TIME TO MAKE THE TURN. V1 LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK REMC POLE #18989045 CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO POLE.

Weather Conditions-Clear, Dry, Daylight with Pavement Dry.Primary Cause-Vehicle Factor-Other: Vehicle 1 was an unoccupied vehicle that rolled down a hill out of a parking lot and ran off into a ditch striking a small concrete wall. Vehicle 1's gear selector was in neutral position and the parking brake was not set.Vehicle 1 was parked (in neutral and parking brake not set) at 1999 North Packinghouse Road Bloomington Indiana. At some point, Vehicle 1(unoccupied) began to travel in reverse northbound out of its parking space. Vehicle 1 continued on its path of travel northbound across the parking lot, down hill and across the access road onto the parking lot of 1500 North Packinghouse Road Bloomington Indiana. The vehicle came into the east most section of the parking lot and then into the ditch just east of the parking lot. After making contact with the ditch, Vehicle 1's rear end turned slightly to the east. After traveling through the ditch, Vehicle 1 struck a concrete wall. It then rolled south for a short distance and came to final rest in the ditch.Witness 1 admitted he was the last person to operate Vehicle 1. Witness 1 said that it was a friend's car and that he was not used to driving a manual transmission vehicle. Witness 1 also said that he forgot to set the parking brake. Witness 1 called later and stated that he didn't set the emergency brake all the way.Observations-I witnessed the crash occur. I noticed inside Vehicle 1, the gear selector was in neutral position and the parking brake was not set. Vehicle 1 had damage on the right side of the rear bumper from hitting the concrete wall. The concrete wall had a minor scuff on it from the collision.

V1 was unattended parked in the driveway at 4700 E. State Road 45. It appears that D1 failed to put V1 into park and V1 rolled across E State Road 45 and into the yard belonging to 4791 E. State Road 45. V1 came to a stop striking and damaging a Blue Spruce tree in the yard of 4791 E. State Road 45. The owner of the tree valued it at approximately $1,000.

Driver #1 was being stopped for a false license plate on Vehicle #1 when driver #1 began fleeing from police. The vehicle finally crashed when occupants and driver #1 jumped out of the vehicle while it was still moving. Vehicle #1 continued a short distance after everyone jumped out and struck a fire hydrant in the 1700 block of S. Ramsey Drive.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PARKING LOT AT 4023 W. THIRD ST. D1 SAID HE TRIED TO PULL OUT OF A PARKING SPACE, AND STRUCK V2 WITH THE TRAILER HE WAS TOWING WITH V1.V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

D1 was traveling south on Harstrait Road while D2 was traveling north on Hartstrait Road near the intersection with Dallas Ln. D1 stated that his mirrors were pulled in on his truck and believed that D2's mirror crossed the center line causing a collision. D2 states that she believes that the mirrors met on the center of the line. Due to no physical evidence or witness, I am unable to establish a faulted driver. "left of center" was selected only because program would not let me advance without faulting a party.

UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH ON SR 446, HE WAS GOING TO TURN ONTO S KNIGHTRIDGE RD. UNIT 1 ORIGINALLY HAD A LEFT TURN SIGNAL ACTIVATED, AND WAS GOING TO TURN LEFT, OR EAST, ONTO S KNIGHTRIDGE RD. THE DRIVER THEN EXPLAINED HE NEEDED TO TURN RIGHT, OR WEST, INSTEAD. HE STATED HE TURNED RIGHT, AND DID NOT SEE UNIT 2 APPROACHING HIS LOCATION. UNIT 2 STATED THAT THEY OBSERVED UNIT 1 WITH THEIR LEFT TURN SIGNAL ACTIVATED. UNIT 2 STATED THAT WHEN UNIT 1 BEGAN TO TURN RIGHT, THEY WERE ALREADY TRAVELING PSAT HIS LOCATION, AND COULD NOT GET OUT OF THE WAY IN TIME.

V-1, A BLACK 2016 Ford F150 Pickup truck bearing 2020 IN TK325MOW was NB, SR 37 at Walnut Street in the right turn lane waiting to turn. V-2, a Black 2019 Kia Sorrento bearing 2019 IN 592BBQ was in front of V-1 in the right turn lane of NB SR 37 at Walnut Street. V-2 started to make the right turn, but stopped to check for oncoming traffic. V-1 also started to make the right turn behind V-2, however V-1 did not realize V-2 was stopping and the front of V-1 struck the rear of V-2.D-1 stated that they were waiting to turn right and and as they started making the turn, V-2 stopped and he hit her in the rear of the vehicle.D-2 stated that she started to turn and stopped to check traffic and was struck in the rear by V-1.The cause of this crash is V-1 following too closely.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN FACING NB ON N SMITH ROAD AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 10TH STREET. V2 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH STREET. V1 ATTEMPTED TO PULL OUT INTO RIGHT-OF-WAY TRAFFIC TO HEAD WB ON E 10TH STREET AT WHICH POINT THE FRONT OF V2 AND THE REAR OF V1 COLLIDED. V2 THEN CONTINUED AHEAD INTO A DITCH WHERE IT CAME TO REST.D1 STATED THAT THERE WAS ANOTHER VEHICLE NOT INVOLVED WHO WAS TRAVELING IN FRONT OF V2 WITH THEIR RIGHT TURN SIGNAL ON AND TURNING SB ONTO N SMITH ROAD. D1 STATED HE BELIEVED THAT V2 WAS GOING TO ALSO TURN SB ONTO N SMITH ROAD THEREFORE HE TURNED OUT INTO TRAFFIC WHICH CAUSED THE COLLISION.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH STREET WHEN V1 TURNED OUT IN FRONT OF HER CAUSING THE COLLISION. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID THE COLLISION AND ENDED UP COMING TO REST IN THE DITCH.

BOTH DRIVERS OF THE UNITS ADVISED THAT ANOTHER VEHICLE WAS TURNING ONTO SCHACHT RD FROM S FAIRFAX. A VEHICLE FOLLOWING THE VEHICLE TURNING, APPLIED THE BRAKES LATE, FORCING UNIT 2 TO BRAKE SUDDENLY. UNIT 1 STATED HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME, AND REAR ENDED UNIT 2.BOTH UNITS WERE MOVING ONTO SCHACHT FROM FAIRFAX WHEN I ARRIVED. AFTER I LEFT THE SCENE, UNIT 1 PERSONALLY CALLED FOR A TOW TRUCK.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON IN STATE ROAD 45/46. D1 STATED V2 JUST STOPPED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROADWAY AND HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME. D1 STATED THE FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH THE BACK OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH.D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELLING EAST ON IN STATE ROAD 45/46. D2 STATED HE CAME TO A STOP IN TRAFFIC AND D1 RAN INTO THE REAR OF HIS VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLE. DRIVER AND PASSENGER OF V2 DENIED INJURIES AT THE ACCIDENT CITE, BUT STATED THEY INTENDED TO GET CHECKED OUT AT THE HOSPITAL AT A LATER DATE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 AND V2 WERE AT THE INTERSECTION OF S WALNUT ST AND W COUNTRY CLUB DR WHEN V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN LEFT DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V2. V2 STRUCK V1 AS RESULT OF DRIVER ACTION. V1/D1 STATED HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT FROM S WALNUT ST ONTO W COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE WHEN HE WAS STRUCK BY V2 AS IT WAS HEADING SOUTHBOUND ON S WALNUT ST. D1 STATED THE LIGHT HAD CHANGED TO YELLOW SO HE ATTEMPTED TO TURN BEFORE IT CHANGED TO RED AND STATED HE DID NOT SEE V2 PRIOR TO DOING SO. V2/D2 STATED HE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON S WALNUT ST AND HAD A GREEN LIGHT AS HE WAS CONTINUING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHEN V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM. D2 STATED HE COULD NOT AVOID COLLIDING INTO V1 DUE TO THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE VEHICLES. V1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE FRONT RIGHT AND RIGHT PASSENGER SIDE. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON ALLEN ST AND DID NOT SEE A STOP SIGN LOCATED AT THE INTERSECTION OF ALLEN AND ADAMS. UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELIING SOUTH ON ADAMS AND WAS PROCEEDING INTO THE INTERSECTION WHEN THE TWO UNITS COLLIDED. IT WAS STATED ON SCENE THAT UNIT 1 DID NOT SEE THE STOP SIGN, THERE FOR DID NOT STOP AT IT.

At the location where the crash took place, State Road 46 is a four lane, two way road that is split by a grassy/curbed median that runs primarily east and west. West and east bound SR 46 are split by the median, but at the location of the crash there is a lane that runs south where west bound SR 46 (and south bound Grant St.) can turn to go east on to SR 46. At the time of the crash it was clear outside, the roadway was dry, and traffic was moderate. Vehicle 1, a 2005 Chevy Silverado, was traveling west on SR 46 approaching the Grant St. intersection. As V1 attempted to travel south onto the Grant St. and turn around, V1 lost control. V1 continued east over the curb, into the grass median, and into a tree. After deflecting off the tree V1, was forced eastwards in the median. V1 finally came to a stop against some street signs located in the median facing east. Driver 1, Eric Richardson, stated he was traveling west on SR 46 getting ready to turn south onto Grant St. D1 said he tried to apply his brake but that when he stepped on brake pedal vehicle began to accelerate. D1 stated he was unable to get his vehicle to stop or slow down before his truck continued westward over the curb and into the grass median. D1 said he never lost consciousness after hitting tree with his truck. Evidence shows heavy damage to front of truck. Evidence shows heavy damage to tree. Evidence shows damage to street sign.**On arrival to the scene of the crash, D1 showed several signs of intoxication from alcohol and possibly narcotics. After going through some standard field sobriety testing D1 consented to take a blood draw. That blood is being analyzed by the State Police Lab. Charges will be filled at a later date.

GATES DR. D2 STATED SHE TURNED EAST ONTO W 3RD ST. D2 STATED D1 THEN CAME INTO HER LANE AND V1 HIT HER VEHICLE CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH. D2 WAS UNABLE TO GIVE SPECIFICS ABOUT WHICH LANE SHE TURNED INTO AND HOW THE TWO VEHICLES MADE CONTACT.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT OF 601 W 2ND ST. AS HE TURNED LEFT INTO A PARKING SPACE, HIS FOOT SLIPPED OFF THE BRAKE. V1 COLLIDED WITH V2 IN A PARKING SPACE. OWNER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS SITTING IN V2 IN A PARKING SPACE ON THE LOT 0F 601 W 2ND, WHEN V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.

Upon my arrival vehicle 1 and 2 were parked stationary in the parking lot. V2 was parked in front of V1. Both vehicles were facing southbound. There was a small space between V1 and V2 where neither vehicle was touching one another when I arrived.Primary Cause (explain in narrative) Driver 1 said she pulled forward to park V1 and did not feel V1 bump V2 in the rear. Driver 1 said she arrived around 9am and V2 was already parked unattended in the parking space in front of her. D1 said she pulled into the parking space directly behind V2 to park. D1 said she knew she was close to V2 with V1, but did not think she bumped the rear of V2 with V1 because she did not feel anything. D1 said when she came outside at around 5pm from her work day the owner of V2 told her they observed V1 front bumper touching the rear bumper of V2. D1 said she never left the area once she parked V1 this morning. There was no damage observed to V1.Owners of V2 (Kimberly and Jason Wood) Kimberly said she and her husband Jason arrived to the parking lot at 0745am-8am this morning and she pulled through the parking space to park like they always do. Kimberly said the only vehicle near them was the next parking space over the their left when they arrived. Kimberly said she and her husband Jason never left through out the day so the vehicle had been parked in the same spot since they arrived this morning to go to work. Kimberly said when they came out to leave to go home for the work day they observed the front bumper of V1 was nudged against rear bumper of V2. There was very minimal damage observed the bumper of V2. When looking at how V1 and V2 were positioned and aligned, it appeared V1 could have bumped V2 causing minor damage to the rear bumper of V2. Photos of the vehicles were taken and available. I was unable to locate any video footage for this incident.

O2 stated he did not remember what vehicle was parked next to him. O2 stated he did not have any information about the offending vehicle. There are no cameras located outside the SRSC facing the loading dock parking lot.

D1 stated that he was backing out of a parking space, going southeast, when he struck V2 as it was traveling behind V1. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Pete Ellis Dr. is a two lane, two way road that runs primarily north and south. East 3rd St. is a four lane, two way road that runs primarily east and west. The intersection where those roads meet is operated by a fully functional traffic light. At the time of the crash, it was daylight, the roadway was dry, and the traffic was heavy. Vehicle 1, a 1999 International truck (INDOT Attenuator), was traveling in the right turn lane from south Pete Ellis Dr. to east SR 46. Vehicle 2, a 2004 green Mazda 6, was sitting in traffic (at the light) in the left lane of Pete Ellis Dr. V2 getting ready to turn west onto SR 46. V1 made a wide right hand turn to go east on SR 46 and side swiped the passenger side of V2. Both vehicles came to a control stopped in the intersection, but moved to a close by parking lot before law enforcement arrived on scene. Driver 1, Kenneth Stout, stated he was traveling south on Pete Ellis Dr. attempting to turn east on SR 46. D1 told me that while he attempted to turn right he side swiped V2, which was sitting in traffic in the left turn lane, with the rear driver side of his attenuator. D1 said after hitting the car he pulled his vehicle into the parking lot located at the north east corner of the intersection to exchange information with the driver of V2. Driver 2, Janet McCoy, told me she was sitting facing south on Pete Ellis Dr. in the left lane at the stop light of the SR 46 intersection preparing to turn east onto SR 46. D2 told me that while she was sitting in traffic V1 side swiped the passenger side of her car with the rear driver side of the truck. D2 told me that after the hit she followed V1 into the parking lot to exchange information. Evidence shows damage to the whole passenger side of V2. Evidences shows no damage to V1. Evidence shows traffic was heavy at the time of the crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: State Road 46 is a four lane, two way road divided by a grass median that runs primarily east and west. Curry Pike is two lane two way road that runs north and south. The intersection is controlled by a fully operational traffic light. At the time of the crash traffic was moderate to heavy. Vehicle 1, a black 2010 Dodge Caliber, was traveling east on SR 46 in the south bound turn lane (onto Curry Pike). Vehicle 2, a light blue Ford Transit Connect Van, was stopped in traffic in the south bound turn lane (onto Curry Pike) just east of the Curry Pike intersection. V1 struck the rear end of V2. Both vehicles came to a controlled stop after the hit. Driver 1, Tae-Min Moony, stated he was traveling West on SR 46 in the south bound turn lane directly behind V2. D1 said he watched as the turn light turned green and other traffic started to merge forward. Seeing this action, D1 said he started to accelerate. D1 said V2 never moved and because of this, D1 struck the rear end of V2. Driver 2, Allen Creel, said he was stopped in traffic in the south bound turn lane from west bound SR 46. D2 told me that while sitting in traffic he felt his van get struck from the rear. D2 told me he was driving and his daughter Angela Creel was sitting in the passenger seat. Evidence shows minor damage to the front bumper of V1. Evidence shows minor damage to the rear bumper of V2. Evidence shows traffic was moderate at the time of the crash. **All individuals involved were checked out by medical personnel who showed up on scene. All individuals were cleared and denied any other medical treatment at the time. Driver 2 and his passenger (Allen Creel and Angela Creel) advised me that they were going to hospital to have back/necks scanned for any injuries they may have obtained during the crash. D2 told me he had prior back issues and wanted to have it checked out for that reason.

D1 stated he was on E Kings Road turning right to go westbound on E SR 46 when an unsecured lawn mower, that was sitting in the bed of V1, fell out of the bed and into the lane of V2.D2 also stated she was eastbound on SR 46 at Kings road when V1 turned on SR 46 and the lawn mower fell into her lane of travel.

Driver 1 was attempting to pull into the Kroger fuel station at 4025 South Old State Road 37 in Bloomington, Indiana with vehicle 1 and did not allow enough room for the vehicle's long wheelbase. While turning from the south to the west into the fuel pump stall directly south of the attendant station, vehicle 1's passenger side C-pillar and step side section of the pickup bed collided with a large metal Bloomington Heral Times newspaper stand. The collision caused minor scratching to the passenger side rear door and C-pillar and extensive damage to the front passenger corner of the pickup bed. The newspaper stand door/latch was also damaged and did not function properly after being separated from the pickup truck. Driver 1 voluntarily performed the horizontal gaze nystagmus field sobriety test at the scene and did not display any indicators of alcohol or drug impairment.

D1 STATED THAT THEY WERE PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF CHILDS ELEMNETARY SCHOOL, AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO BACK OUT OF A PARKING SPACE, AT WHICH POINT THE REAR DRIVERS SIDE OF V1 STRUCK THE REAR PASSENGERS SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED SHE DID NOT SEE V2.D2 STATED THEY WERE WAITING IN A LINE OF CARS TO PICK THEIR CHILD UP AT CHILDS ELEMENTARY SCHOOL. D2 STATED THAT THEY OBSERVED V1 BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE WHILE THERE WAS MINIMAL ROOM FOR V1 IN THE LINE OF CARS. D2 STATED THEN V1 BACKED IN TO V2.

Unit#2 stated she was stopped in traffic preparing to head N/B on College Mall road. Unit#2 stated traffic was heavy. Unit#2 stated Unit#1 then cut in front of Unit#2 thus hitting Unit#2. Unit#2 stated Unit#1 then took off after hitting the bus. Unit#1 later crashed into another vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was in the West most lane, facing north, attempting to turn left onto 17th Street from State Road 45/46. D2 was headed south in the east most lane on State Road 45/46. D1 stated she was attempting to make a left turn coming off of State Road 45/46 to drive west on 17th Street. D1 stated that she began turning as the light turned yellow. After she started turning, she realized she should not have because she saw V2 coming the opposite direction. D1 stated she was then struck on the passenger side on the rear of her vehicle. D1 stated that after being struck she could not move her car and exited the vehicle. D1 had a minor cut on her left hand that had some light bleeding. There was visible damage to the entire rear of the vehicle. The glass on the back windshield was destroyed and the entire trunk and bumper area were severely damaged. The rear passenger side next to the back tire was seriously dented, and the passenger side airbags were deployed. D1 stated that D2 did not slow down as she turned, but the crash was her fault.D2 stated he was driving south on State Road 45/46 when D1 pulled out in front of him trying to turn onto 17th Street as the light turned yellow. D2 stated he attempted to swerve and slow down, but was unable to get out of the way and struck V1. D2 stated that V2 shut off as soon as he hit V1. V2 was damaged only on the front passenger side of the vehicle with a large dent. D2 stated that he had his headlights on due to the inclement weather. D2 stated he was traveling 40 miles per hour prior to the crash but attempted to slow down and believed he was going 35 miles per hour at the point of impact. D2 stated that the front bumper had fallen off previously and he had put it back on with bungee cords. During the crash, the bumper again fell off. D2 was not injured. D2 did not have proof of insurance and was unable to obtain insurance information from the owner of V2. D2 was issued a citation for operating without insurance.V1 and V2 were both towed by Bland's due to disabling damage.

V1 was traveling north on Leonard Springs Road approaching an intersection with Walnut Leaf Drive near the business of Wal-Mart. V2 was traveling in front of V1. D2 states that a unknown driver in front of her proceeded to turn without warning causing her to slow in traffic. Consequently, V1 struck the rear end of V2. Both parties pulled into Wal-Mart out of the roadway, prior to my arrival.

D1 stated he was traveling south on Fairfax road at approximately 40 MPH. D1 stated he had a nose bleed and reach into his glove box to retrieve a napkin. D1 stated he briefly glanced down. D1 then veered to the side, ran off the roadway and collided with the utility pole. D1 was transported to the Bloomington Hospital.

The driver of V1 was traveling north on College Mall Road, just south of the intersection of Third Street and College Mall Road. The driver of V2 advised that he was traveling north on College Mall Road and was directly in front of V1. The driver of V2 reported that he was at a complete stop at the light and that the front bumper of V1 then struck the rear bumper of V2. The driver of V2 reported that after striking his vehicle, the driver of V1 then got into the right hand land to go north/straight, and while doing so, then struck the front driver side of a Bloomington Transit Bus. V1 then went between V2 and the city bus and continued north on SR 45/46 without stopping. The accident between V1 and V2 was considered a separate accident from that of the collision of V1 and the Bloomington Transit bus, and therefore a separate state report was completed for that incident. The collision between V1 and the bus was only mentioned in this narrative and the case report (B19-32778). A separate case report was completed for the accident between V1 and the Bloomington Transit bus (B19-32780).

V1 was parked in the SRSC employee parking lot facing south. V2 was parked to the right of V1. V2 backed out of its space, collided with V1, and left the scene.Owner 1 advised that she parked V1 in the employee parking lot of the SRSC at 1815 hours. O1 advised that there was a red pickup to her right when she parked. O1 advised that at 1935 hours when she returned to her vehicle, V2 was gone and there was fresh damage on the right rear of V1.There are no cameras in the area, and O1 was unable to recall any more details about V2. I photographed the damage to V1.

V1 and V2 were heading westbound on 3rd Street. V1 was in the North lane while V2 was in the South lane. D2 stated that V1 was in the North lane when she noticed that the turn signal was on for V1 to turn left. D2 stated that when she noticed this she thought that V1 was going to just get behind V2 in order to turn. D2 stated that instead of doing that V1 turned left on to Swain Avenue from the North lane causing V2 to strike V1. D2 stated that at this point she has slowed down to pretty much a complete stop while V1 continued to turn on to Swain Avenue causing more damage to the side of V1. D1 stated that she was from out of town and did not realize that 3rd Street turned in to a one way with two lanes going the same direction. D1 stated that she decided to turn left on to Swain Avenue and that V2 side swiped V1. V1 was towed by enterprise. There was significant damage to V1 all along the drivers side. The driver's door would not shut. V2 had damage to the hood and it was unable to be open.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling south bound on I 69 in the left lane. The driver stated it was raining and he lost control of his vehicle sliding around to face north bound and hit the cable wires and slid backwards until he stopped. 5 post supporting the cable wires were torn down and V1 had damage to the front bumper, passenger side, and right rear.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS A BICYCLE PEDALING S/B ON B LINE TRAIL. V1 FAILED TO STOP, ENTERING INTO ROADWAY AND WAS STRUCK BY V2, WHO HAD RIGHT OF WAY. THERE WAS A STOPSIGN FOR V1 TO STOP AND HE DID NOT.

D1 stated that she got in her car to leave Steak 'N Shake. V1 was parked on the North side of the restaurant, facing North. D1 stated that when she put her car in reverse, she did not see any vehicles coming, so she began to back out of her parking spot. D1 stated that as she continued to back out, she was hit by V2.D2 stated that he was driving West to exit the Steak 'N Shake parking lot. D2 stated that as he was driving, V1 suddenly backed out of the parking spot, causing V2 to collide with V1. V2's front passenger side bumper hit the rear passenger side bumper of V1.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON WINSLOW ROAD, JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH WALNUT STREET.D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE THEN ATTEMPTED TO TURN RIGHT, SOUTH, IN TO THE PARKING LOT OF THE MARATHON GAS STATION LOCATED AT 2601 S. WALNUT STREET WHEN A SMALL, OLD RED TRUCK DID REAR END V2.D2 DID NOT SEE THE DRIVER OF V1, BUT STATED THAT V1 DID CONTINUE DRIVING EAST ON WINSLOW ROAD WITHOUT STOPPING OR EXCHANGING ANY INFORMATION WITH HER.V2 DID SUSTAIN MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR PASSENGER CORNER AS A RESULT OF THE IMPACT.V1 WAS NOT LOCATED.

V1 was in the driveway at 215 E Burks drive facing NE. V2 was parked facing SE on the west side of the road. V1 backed out of driveway and struck V2 in the driver side door with the driver side rear bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was backing out of the driveway and just did not see V2 parked across the road.

V1 was pulling into the Goodwill parking lot at 1284 S. Liberty Dr. behind the parking row V2 was backing out of. D1 stated that V2 backed into the passenger side of V1. V2 was backing out of a parking spot in the Goodwill parking lot. D2 stated that she looked behind her prior to backing out and no cars were coming. D2 stated that she then proceeded to back out of the spot and backed into V1. D2 felt that V1 was traveling at speeds too fast for a parking lot. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

V2 was sitting at the red stop light at SR 48W and Daniels Way when V1 rear ended V2. V1 was directly behind V2 in line headed west bound on SR 48. D1 stated that he thought D2 was going to take off so he started to as well and hit V1 in the rear bumper.D2 was taken to IU Bloomington Hospital for a blood draw for an operating while intoxicated investigation.Witness Stephen Miller who was sitting in the lane just to the right of both vehicles stated he saw V1 rear end V2..

D1 STATED HE HAS HAD RECENT ISSUES WITH HIS BRAKES BUT THEY WERE CHANGED OUT. D1 STATED HE WAS DRIIVNG WEST ON E 1ST ST APPROACHING S HENDERSON ST AND NOTICED HIS BRAKES BECAME SOFT. D1 STATED HE WAS TRYING TO STOP AT S HENDERSON ST AND REAR ENDED V2 WHEN TRYING TO STOP. WHEN ASKED D1 STATED HE WAS NOT ON HIS PHONE OR DISTRACTED.D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED ON E 1ST ST AT S HENDERSON ST WAITING TO PROCEED AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.**8/15/2019: supplement to download and print information exchange form **

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING NB AND S WALNUT ST AND V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S WALNUT ST. THE WITNESS WAS TRAVELING SB ON WALNUT.SB TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP DUE TO ANOTHER ACCIDENT FURTHER SOUTH ON S WALNUT ST. V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S WALNUT ST AND WAS IN THE CENTER TURN LANE TO TURN WB INTO A PRIVATE PROPERTY. D1 ADVISED A MAROON SUV HAD STOPPED AND WAVED D1 ON. V1 PROCEEDED TO TURN AND V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE WESTERN SB LANE. V2 ADVISED HE WAS PROCEEDING SB ON WALNUT STREET AND TRAFFICK WAS BACKED UP DUE TO ANOTHER ACCIDENT. D2 ADVISED V1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM AND STRUCK THE FRONT OF HIS VEHILCE.WITNESS WAS BEHIND THE MAROON VEHICLE. WITNESS ADVISED THEY DID NOT SEE THE MAROON VEHILCE WAVE D1 ON BUT THE VEHILCE DID LEAVE ROOM FROM D1 TO TURN. AS D1 WAS TURNING, SHE SAW V2 TRAVELING SB AND WITNESSED THE ACCIDENT.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON 3RD ST AT THE INTERSECTION WITH CURRY PIKE, STOPPED BEHIND VEHICLE 2. D1 THOUGHT TRAFFIC WAS MOVING, SO HE TOOK HIS FOOT OFF THE BRAKE AND STARTED TO ACCELERATE. VEHICLE 2 HAD NOT MOVED YET. V1 REAR ENDED V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON 3RD ST AT THE INTERSECTION WITH CURRY PIKE, STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, WHEN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: ALL VEHICLES WERE TRAVELING WB ON W 3RD ST. JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF S GATES DR. V1 AND V3 WERE TAVELING IN THE SOUTHERN WB LANE AND V2 WAS TRAVELING IN THE NORTHERN WB LANE.D1 ADIVSED TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP IN THE SOUTHERN LANE SO HE ATTEMPTED TO GO AROUND. HE SIGNALED TO GO INTO THE NORTHERN LANE. PRIOR TO MERGING HE DID NOT SEE ANY VEHILCES, WHILE HE WAS MERGING HE SAW V2 AND V1 COLLIDED WITH V2. D1 ADVISED HE ATTMEPTED TO SWERVE AWAY FROM THE COLLISION AND STRUCK V3 IN THE SOUTHERN WB LANE. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE PASENGER SIDE FRONT WHEEL AND THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT BUMPER. V2 LEFT THE SCENE AND DID NOT LEAVE ANY VEHICLE INFORMATION. D1 DESCRIBED THE V2 AS BEING A LARGE BLACK SUV, POSSIBLY AN ESCALADE OR EXPEDITION. D3 DID NOT SEE V2. THERE IS UNKNOWN DAMAGE TO V2. D3 ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE EITHER VEHICLE UNITL V1 STRUCK V3 IN THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER. THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE BUMPER. ALL VEHILCES WERE DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W GOURLEY PIKE AT THE INTERSECTION AT N MONROE ST. V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N MONROE STREET AT THE SAME INTERSECTION. V2 PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AS HER DIRECTION DID NOT HAVE A STOP SIGN. V1 CONTINUED WB ON W GOURLEY PIKE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND COLLIDED WITH V2. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2. BOTH VEHICLE THEN CAME TO REST IN A NEARBY DITCH AFTER STRIKING A STOP SIGN AND A FIRE HYDRANT.D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE INTERSECTION AND PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WB. D1 STATED THAT SHE FELT THAT V2 WAS TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED WHICH SHE CONSIDERED UNSAFE FOR THAT AREA OF TRAVEL.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SB ON N MONROE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK BY V1. D2 STATED THAT V1 BOUNCED OFF OF HER VEHICLE AND BOTH VEHICLES WERE THEN SENT INTO THE NEARBY DITCH.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTBOUND ON S OLD STATE ROAD 37 AND ATTEMPTED TO MAKE AN EASTBOUND TURN INTO 5511 S OLD STATE ROAD 37 WHEN IT CROSSED INTO THE PATH OF V2 THAT WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND AND CAUSED A COLLISION.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO GO AROUND A TRUCK AND TURN INTO HER RESIDENCE.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND AND V1 TURNED INTO HER LANE OF TRAVEL.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 stopped at the stop sign on Clubhouse Drive and then proceeded across traffic on N. Kinser Pike, crossing the path of travel of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 struck Vehicle 1 at a right angle.

D1 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH IN THE RIGHT LANE ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET, NEAR THE COMMUNITY FORD DEALERSHIP, LOCATED AT 2200 SOUTH WALNUT STREET.D1, AS HE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE, EXPLAINED THAT V2 DID COME TO AN ABRUPT STOP AND THAT HE DID NOT HAVE TIME TO STOP.THE FRONT OF V1 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH CARS.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET IN THE RIGHT LANE WHEN THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HER, V3, DID BEGIN TO SLOW DOWN AND COME TO A STOP.D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE HAD COME TO A FULL STOP AND WAS BEHIND V3 WHEN THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, FORCING V2 TO MOVE FORDWARDS AND THUS RESULTING IN THE FRONT OF V2 MAKING CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.D3 ADVISED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC BEHIND A SEMI TRUCK WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH WALNUT STREET IN THE RIGHT LANE.D3 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS AT A COMPLETE STOP WHEN THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.V1 AND V2 WERE BOTH TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.D2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE IU BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL DUE TO PAIN TO HER NECK AND BLEEDING FROM HER NOSE.D1 DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HIS NECK AND WAS SEEN BY EMT'S WHILE ON SCENE.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT D1 DID LATER CALL IN TO THE POLICE DEPARTMENT STATING THAT HE BELIEVES THAT ROSA DE SANTIAGO, WHO I LISTED AS D2, WAS NOT THE CORRECT DRIVER OF V2, BUT THAT IT WAS ACTUALLY D2'S BROTHER, IDENTIFIED AS OSCAR DE SANTIAGO, WHO WAS A PASSENGER IN V2.I DID SPEAK WITH D3 AND SHE DID CONFIRM FOR ME THAT ROSA DE SANTIAGO WAS THE DRIVER OF V2.

I, Indiana Conservation Officer (ICO) Cpl. Brian Bailey on August 9, 2019 at or about 1003 hours was notified by ICO central dispatch of a motor vehicle accident involving a state owned vehicle. Dispatch advised the accident had occurred the previous day.I contacted Sadie Dainko and arranged a time to meet her to complete a report. I arrived at 1188 Sewell Road in Monroe County at or about 1545 hours. I obtained information for Sadie Dainko and the state owned white 2019 Ford F150 she was operating. I also obtained the information for Jacob Gumbel and the blue Toyota Rav 4 that was damaged. Sadie also advised Stewart Hamilton was a passenger in the vehicle when this incident occured. I asked Sadie why she waited to have the report completed. Sadie advised she did not have the information for the vehicle she was operating so she waited until the following day so she could speak with her supervisor. Sadie Dainko (vehicle 1) advised she was leaving her driveway at or about 2110 hours on August 8, 2019. She put the vehicle in reverse and did not realize Jacob Gumbel's vehicle (vehicle 2) was parked behind her. Sadie Dainko backed vehicle 1 rear bumper into vehicle 2 driver's side rear door. This collision caused damage to the rear driver's side door of vehicle 2. This did not cause damage to vehicle1. I spoke with Jacob Gumbel and he advised the same sequence of events.

Driver #1 stated he had been on Lake Monroe and consumed alcoholic beverages. Driver #1 said he was attempting to leave the boat ramp in Vehicle #1 when he ran off the paved drive, down a hill and into a drainage ditch. This caused damage to the front right portion of Vehicle #1 and possible damage to the ditch.

V1/D1 STATED "I WAS LEAVING THE SERENDIPITY SALON AT 309 S. HICKORY DR. AS I WAS BACKING OUT, ALL OF THE SUDDEN MY VEHICLE SPUN, AND WE COLLIDED WITH THE BUILDING OF 303 S. HICKORY DR. I AM NOT SURE WHAT HAPPENED."

When I arrived on scene, the vehicle involved in the crash had been moved. The crash involved a white garbage truck (V1) that was driven by Patrick Hacker (D1). D1 did not complain of any injuries at the scene.D1 stated he was backing up to the dumpster on the north side of 802 E. 13th St. when he accidentally crashed the driver side rear corner of the truck into the concrete wall/dock area.The driver side rear corner of V1 sustained light damage. The concrete wall/dock area sustained a gouge out of it that was approximately a foot long and two inches deep. The overall safety of the concrete structure appeared to be unaffected.V1 was able to be driven from the scene.

WHILE TRAVELING WEST ON KIRKWOOD AVE, V1 REAR ENDED V2, WHICH WAS PARKED, CAUSING V2 TO PUSH INTO V3. WHILE PARKED ON KIRKWOOD, V2 WAS HIT BY V1 CAUSING IT TO BE PUSHED INTO V3WHILE PARKED ON KIRKWOOD, V3 WAS REAR-ENDED BY V2. V1 LEFT THE SCENE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL BUT WAS DESCRIBED TO ME AS A GRAY PASSENGER CAR. OWNER 2 STATED THAT HE WAS NOT IN THE AREA DURING THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT BUT WAS MADE AWARE BY A WITNESS. OWNERS 3 WAS NOT IN THE AREA DURING THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT. W1 STATED THAT WHILE AT THE GAS STATION LOCATED AT KIRKWOOD AND ROGERS, HE HEARD THE CRASH AND WHEN HE LOOKED UP AND OBSERVED A GRAY "KIT CAR". W1 DESCRIBED THE CAR AS A GRAY PASSENGER CAR WITH AFTERMARKET PARTS. W2 STATED THAT SHE WAS WOKE UP BY THE ACCIDENT AND WHEN SHE LOOKED, SHE OBSERVED A GRAY CAR LEAVING THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT. SHE WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE THE MAKE AND MODEL OF V1.

ON 8/10/19 I WAS DISPATCHED TO AN ACCIDENT WITH UNKNOWN INJURY. UPON ARRIVAL D1 TOOK OFF ON FOOT IN AN ATTEMPT TO LEAVE THE SCENE. D1 WAS LOCATED A SHORT TIME LATER WITH BLOOD COMING FROM HIS FACE AND A SEAT BELT MARK STARTING AT HIS LEFT SHOULDER AND ENDING AT HIS RIGHT HIP. DO TO THE BLOOD INSIDE THE VEHICLE AND D1 INJURIES WE BELIEVE D1 WAS THE DRIVER. A PASSENGER WAS THROWN FROM THE VEHILCE AND WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE SCENE. INDIANA STATE TROOPER ERIC RUSSELL, ACCIDENT RECONSTRUCTIONIST, ARRIVED ON SCENE AND BEGAN HIS INVESTIGATION. THE EVIDENCE ON SCENE SHOWED THAT V1 LEFT THE ROADWAY AT GARRISON CHAPEL ROAD AND STATE ROAD 48. V1 WAS TRAVELLING WEST ON STATE ROAD 48 FROM CAVE ROAD. ONCE V1 LEFT THE ROADWAY IT CONTINUED WEST THROUGH THE GRASS BARELY MISSING TREES AND UTILITY POLES. V1 SLID THROUGH THE GRASS APPROXIMATELY 100 YARDS BEFORE HITTING A SMALL CREEK BED. V1 THEN FLIPPED UP AND HIT A TREE. WHEN V1 HIT THE TREE IT CAUSE THE V1 TO SPIN AND ROLL. WE BELIEVE THAT DURING THIS TIME IS WHEN THE DECEASED WAS THROWN FROM THE FRONT PASSENGERS SEAT AND OUT INTO THE GRASS. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE VEHICLE THEN LANDED ON TOP OF THE DECEASED BEFORE COMING TO A STOP NEAR THE DECEASED. THE DECEASED SUFFERED SEVERE HEAD TRAUMA CAUSING HIS DEATH INSTANTLY. D1 WAS TAKEN TO THE HOSPITAL WHERE A BLOOD DRAW FOR OWI CAUSING DEATH WAS PERFORMED. D1 WAS ALSO SEEN BY ER DOCTORS. D1 HAD CUTS TO HIS FACE AS WELL AS A BROKEN BACK. D1 BROKEN BACK WAS SO SEVERE THAT IF HE MOVED THE WRONG WAY HE COULD HAVE BEEN PARALYZED. D1 WILL REQUIRE SURGERY TO REPAIR HIS BACK. AT THIS TIME PROBABLE CAUSE AFFIDAVITS HAVE BEEN SENT UP TO THE PROSECUTORS OFFICE BY DEPUTY T. WALLS FOR MULTIPLE CHARGES. TROOPER RUSSELL WILL COMPLETE HIS PORTION OF THE ACCIDENT REPORT AND FORWARD MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE A COPY. I HAVE NOTHING FURTHER AT THIS TIME.

V1 was driving north on N. Illinois St when it ran off the road. V1 came to a stop into bushes facing north west off the roadway just north of the intersection of W. 11th St and N. Illinois St. D1 of V1 was not identified or located.

V1 was traveling north bound on S. Fairfax Rd. just north of E. Cleve Butcher Rd. and ran off the east side of the roadway and into a fence. W1 stated that he was traveling behind V1 and saw V1 traveling at speeds he believed to be unsafe and get "speed wobbles" causing V1 to run off the roadway and into a fence. D1 stated that he believed he was traveling no faster than the posted speed limit of 40mph. V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage and D1 was transported from the scene for immediate medical attention. The owner of Fairfax Storage was contacted in regards to the damaged fence and was given the crash report number.

D1 stated he was traveling eastbound on W. Bloomfield Road going through the intersection at S Oakdale Drive. D1 stated once he went through the intersection he hit a patch of sand that caused him to lose control of his motorcycle. D1 stated he ran off the roadway which threw him off the bike. D1 suffered abrasions on both arms and stated he hit his head during the accident. D1 was assessed by EMS, but refused to be transported to the hospital. Due to D1 showing indicators of possible alcohol impairment he was ran through SFST's. At the conclusion of these tests it was determined D1 would not be detained for an OWI investigation. For more information on this please reference local case# B19-33312.I spoke with a witness who stated he was behind D1 when the accident occurred. W1 advised he was traveling eastbound on W. Bloomfield Road and was originally in front of D1. W1 advised upon going through the intersection at S. Oakdale Drive, he witnessed D1 accelerate at an unsafe speed to go around W1 in the right hand lane. While doing so, W1 stated D1 hit a sand patch and wrecked. W1 stated he checked on D1 to make sure he was ok. When asked, W1 stated he believed the accident occurred due to D1 traveling at an unsafe speed.

D1 stated he was at 2894 S. College Mall Rd. For the purpose of work, Door Dash. D1 stated he parked on the side of the private drive in front of Red Robin with his hazzards on while waiting to pick up an order. D1 stated College Mall Security asked him to move his vehicle to a parking spot because it was a fire lane. D1 stated he argued with security stating it was not marked as a fire lane and did not have to move his vehicle. D1 stated security began taking photographs of his license plate. D1 stated once his delivery was ready, he picked it up and entered into his vehicle. D1 stated security was standing in front of his vehicle preventing him from leaving. D1 stated he backed up in an attempt to gain distance from security. D1 stated when he backed up, he backed into the curb. D1 stated the security again stepped in front of his vehicle. D1 stated he was unable to back up any further so he "bumped" security with his vehicle. D1 stated he then turned around and left the parking lot to finish working.P1 (security) stated he saw D1 parked in the roadway obstructing traffic. P1 stated he asked D1 to leave and D1 became irate with him. P1 stated he gave D1 five minutes to move his car prior to calling police. P1 stated D1 still had yet to move his vehicle after five minutes so he began calling police. P1 stated he stood in front of the vehicle to prevent it from leaving. P1 stated D1 advised him he would be struck with the vehicle if he did not get out of the way. P1 stated while on the phone with police, D1 hit him with his vehicle, and then turned around and left.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON I69S IN THE PASSING LANE, WHEN IT CROSSED THE CENTER LINE AND STRUCK V2 IN THE DRIVER SIDE REAR QUARTER PANEL. D2 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT HEAR ANYTHING JUST FELT A LARGE IMPACT AND OBSERVED V1 CONTINUE NORTH PAST THE CRASH SCENE AND CAME TO A REST NEAR THE HARMONY ROAD OVERPASS. D1 SHOWED SIGNS OF IMPAIRMENT ON SCENE AND WAS TRANSPORTED FROM THE SCENE FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION BY DEPUTY QUALTERS. D2 DENIED MEDICAL FROM MEDICAL STAFF ON SCENE.

D1 STATED SHE WAS NORTH ON WALNUT STREET IN THE CENTER LANE AND STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF 3RD STREET. D1 SAID SHE THOUGHT THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TURNED GREEN AND SHE PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION WHERE SHE COLLIDED WITH V2. D2 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON 3RD STREET IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE. D2 SAID THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL WAS GREEN AS SHE PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION. D2 SAID SHE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID COLLISION AND WAS STRUCK BY V1. W1 INDICATED HE WAS BEHIND V1 IN STOPPED TRAFFIC AND OBSERVED V1 ENTER THE INTERSECTION ON A RED TRAFFIC SIGNAL.

VEHS WERE TRAVELING SB ON S ROGERS ST. V2 STOPPED WITH TURN SIGNAL AND YIELDED TO NB TRAFFIC TO TURN EB ON W COOLIDGE DR. D1 ADVISED THEY DROPPED A WATER BOTTLE ON THE GROUND AND REACHED FOR IT AND DID NOT SEE V2 HAD STOPPED, WAITING TO TURN. V1 REAR ENDED V2. FRONT OF V1 WAS DAMAGED. REAR OF V2 WAS DAMAGED. D2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF HEAD PAIN DUE TO THE IMPACT BUT REFUSED MEDICAL AND DID NOT WANT AN AMBULANCE.

D1 stated that he was traveling westbound on W 3rd Street approaching S Muller Pkwy. D1 stated that he did not notice V2 slowing to a stop in front of him until the last second. D1 stated that he slammed on his breaks and swerved to the left, but still collided with V2. D1 had a cut with minor bleeding on his right leg, he was treated on scene and not transported to the hospital. A photograph was taken of D1's injury. D2 stated that he was traveling westbound on W 3rd Street behind V3. D2 stated that V3 stopped at the railroad tracks and he slowed behind them. D2 stated that he did not realize V1 was behind him and not stopping until the collision. D2 had a burn on his right wrist as well as neck pain, he was transported to the hospital. D3 stated that she was heading westbound on W 3rd Street when she stopped at the railroad tracks at S Muller Pkwy. D3 stated that V3 was then struck in the rear by V2 after it was struck by V1. D3 was transported to the hospital for a complaint of pain and high blood pressure.

OLD STATE ROAD 37 WHEN V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HIM, CAUSING A HEAD ON COLLISON.BOTH VEHICLE DRIVERS AS WELL AS A PASSENGER IN V1 WERE ALL TRANPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL BY EMS.WITNESS CARLY 812-369-3695

D1 stated that he was traveling westbound on E 4th Street just west of S Dunn Street. V1 was traveling north on S. Walnut Street Pk. when it crest the hill, lost control, struck a retaining wall on the east side of S. Walnut Street Pk., flipped rear over front, struck the sign in the front yard of Apostolic Bible Church 3291 S. Walnut Street Pk., barrel rolled, and came to a stop in the field on the north side of the church. D1 stated that he was traveling north on S. Walnut Street Pk. When he swerved to pass a vehicle turning right into the church parking lot. D1 stated that he lost control.V2 was traveling south on S. Walnut Street Pk. when V1 struck the retaining wall. Pieces of the retaining wall flew into the roadway and struck the front of V2 while she was driving.D2 stated that she was driving south on S. Walnut Street Pk. when she saw V1 "flying" over the crest of a hill traveling north on S. Walnut Street Pk. D2 stated that she saw V1 return to the roadway in the middle of the road, still traveling at a high rate of speed. D2 stated that she immediately braked to avoid a collision, however V1 lost control and swerved to the right and struck the retaining wall on the east side of S. Walnut Street Pk. D2 stated that when V1 struck this retaining wall, pieces of the stone wall scattered everywhere including striking her vehicle as she was still moving south bound on S. Walnut Street Pk. D2 stated that she watched as V1 flipped rear over front several times after it had hit the retaining wall, then struck the church sign causing V1 to barrel roll, then skid to a stop in the field just north of the church.W1 was traveling south on S. Walnut Street Pk. and stated she saw V1 go airborne off the hill crest while it was traveling north on S. Walnut Street Pk. at a high rate of speed. W1 stated she believed V1 was going "at least 80mph"W2 was traveling north on S. Walnut Street Pk. and had slowed to turn left onto E. Burks Dr. W2 stated that V1 passed him on the left at a high rate of speed when V1 went over the hill just north of the intersection of S. Walnut Street Pk. and E. Burks Dr.

V1 AND V2 WERE TAVELING WB ON W TAPP RD. V2 WAS TURNING NB ON S LEONARD SPRINGS RD AND WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN. V1 PLANNED ON TURNING SB ON S LEONARD SPRINGS RD. V1 ADVISED SHE INCHED FORWARD AND REARENDED V2. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT PASSNEGER BUMPER OF V1 AND DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER BUMPER OF V2.BOTH VEHS WERE DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 attempted to make the turn behind the 2500 building as it travel southeast. V1 appeared to have been traveling at a high rate of speed and left the road way. V1 struck a concrete step at the start of the walkway outside of apartment 2605 causing damage to both V1 and the walkway. D1 stated that he had been drinking, 1573 conducted a Operating While Intoxicated investigation at that time.
D1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON ST RD 46 WHEN HE FELL ASLEEP. D1 STATED HE OVER CORRECTED, WHEN HE WOKE UP, AND HIS VEHICLE SLID ACROSS BOTH LANES OF TRAVEL AND CAME TO A REST IN A DITCH.

Explain in Narrative:Location of Investigation - The investigation was conducted at IUPD headquarters.Primary Cause - The primary cause of the accident is unknown.Type of Crash - The type of crash of the accident is unknown.V2 was parked in the southwest side of the 10th Street parking lot, at 1600 E 10th Street between the hours of 1255 hours and 1620 hours unattended facing south. The position and direction of V1 is unknown.Other Participant 1 (OP1) stated that she parked the vehicle in the southwest part of the parking lot facing south at approximately 1255 hours on 08/13/2019. OP1 stated that she returned to her vehicle at approximately 1615 hours on the same day and noticed that there was damage to the rear bumper on the driver side. OP1 stated she was not in the vehicle when the crash occurred. There was white paint rubbed on the bumper. OP1 stated that she looked for the other driver's information and could not locate any and could not locate the driver. There is no evidence or information to suggest what happened at the time of collision. There is no exact time for when the collision occurred. There is no known information of the other vehicle that left the scene other than that the vehicle is white. Pictures of the damage to V2 were taken. There was no prior damage to the vehicle before the crash. There is no collision diagram because there is no information to explain what and how V2 was hit.

Driver one backed into driver two while waiting at the stop sign of Second Street and Temperance Street. Driver one thought he was too far into the travel portion of the eastbound lane and attempted to back up not realizing that vehicle two had pulled up behind him.

Contributory Cause-Driver Factor- Speed too fast for weather conditions: Driver 1 was traveling too fast for the wet roadway conditions. D1 should have driven at a reduced speed to avoid losing control.Vehicle 1 ( White 2007 Mack CV&) was traveling northeast on SR446, north of E. Hays Road in Monroe County. Vehicle 1 traveled off the east side of the roadway. Vehicle 1 then spun clockwise, striking a tree. This resulted in damage to the front and driver's side of vehicle 1.Driver 1 (Levi D. White) advised that he was traveling north on SR446, northeast of E. Hays Road. He advised that as he continued north he could feel the roadway was slick. He advised that he felt as though he had no control of his vehicle and slide off the east side of the roadway. Driver 1 advised that he was not injured in the crash.Upon arrival at the scene I witnessed a white dump truck off the roadway facing east. The roadway was wet in the area of the crash. Observations at the scene were consistent with report given by Driver 1. Vehicle 1 was towed at owner's request by Weaver's Wrecker Service.

V2 was stopped in the northbound lane waiting to make a left turn into a hotel parking lot. V1 then collided with the rear of V2 causing disabling damage to the rear of V2 and the front of V1. V1 had airbag deployment upon impact.D2 stated that he was stopped waiting to make a left hand turn and then V1 collided with the rear of his vehicle. D2 stated that he did not have any pain at the time of the incident.D1 stated that she observed V2 stopping to turn left into the parking lot and she both attempted to stop and steer to the right. D1 stated that as she attempted to stop a light came on her dash that stated "service stabilize track" and she was not able to move her steering wheel. D1 stated that she was able to brake and reduce her speed but still collided with V2.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on Winslow Rd. V1 struck V2 in the rear.D1 stated that she put her car in drive and did not see the brake lights of V2 while pulling forward. She did strike V2 in the rear.D2 stated she was stopped and was struck by V1 in the rear.V1 did strike V2 in the rear causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling east on Atwater Ave. Vehicle 1 was traveling north on Mitchell Street. At the intersection of Atwater and Mitchell vehicle 1 stopped at the stop sign and was attempting to continue north on Mitchell. Driver of vehicle one noticed that on the east side of the intersection the roadway is two way two lane road and had a stop sign for west bound traffic as well. On the west side of the intersection the roadway is two lanes, one way, east bound traffic only. Driver of vehicle 1 believed that since she had a stop sign and vehicles on the east side of the intersection had a stop sign that the vehicles on the west side of the intersection would have to stop as well. However, the west side of the intersection does not have a stop sign. Vehicle 2 was traveling east and was on the west side of the intersection with no stop sign and was attempting to travel east through the intersection. Vehicle 1 pulled into the intersection and failed to yield the right of way to vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 hit vehicle 2 in the passenger side causing moderate damage to the passenger side of vehicle 2 and the front of vehicle 1. No injuries were reported from the accident and both vehicles were able to drive from the scene.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVE APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S MAPLE ST. D1 OBSERVED V2 STOPPED IN THE LANE IN FRONT OF HIM, SO HE STARTED TO APPLY THE BRAKE. AS V1 SLOWED, THE BRAKE FAILED TO STOP THE VEHICLE, CAUSING V1 TO REAR END V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVE AT THE INTERSECTION WITH S MAPLE ST. D2 HAD TO STOP IN THE LANE TO ALLOW FOR A BICYCLE DELIVERY PERSON. WHILE V2 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, IT WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1/V1 was headed E/B on W. 3rd St., approaching the intersection of S. Cory Ln. D1 entered the intersection and began to make a u-turn to head W/B on W. 3rd St. As D1 made the u-turn V1 struck V2 as it proceeded through the intersection. D1 stated that he was headed E/B on W. 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S. Cory Ln., where he intended to make a u-turn. D1 stated that as he approached the intersection he saw that he had a green left turn sugnal, giving him the right away. D1 stated that a vehicle was in front of him and made a u-turn. D1 stated that he then follow the vehicle in making a u-turn, and in the process was struck on the front passenger side by V2. D1 stated that he did not check to see if he had the green left turn signal giving him the right of way prior to making the u-turn, and had assumed he had the right of way based on the vehicle in front of him. D2 stated that she was headed W/B on W. 3rd St., in the right lane, approaching the intersection of S. Cory Ln. D2 stated that she had a green traffic signal giving her the right of way to continue through the intersection, so she proceeded straight. D2 stated that as she continued through the intersection V1 made a u-turn and entered her lane of travel, causing V2 to strike V1. A witness to the accident was standing in a parking lot to the North of the intersection. The witness stated that he could clearly see that D1 did not have a green turn signal giving him the right of way when D1 began to make his u-turn.

DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, FACING SOUTH ON SOUTH HENDERSON ST, NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH HENDERSON AND EAST WINSLOW, WHEN SHE THOUGHT SHE SAW THE LIGHT TURN GREEN AND OTHER CARS MOVING, SO SHE ACCELERATED CAUSING HER TO REAR END VEHICLE 2. SHE ADVISED SHE WAS NOT PAYING FULL ATTENTION TO THE ROAD BUT WAS NOT ON HER CELLPHONE.DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC AND VEHICLE 1 REAR ENDED HER.WITNESS 1 STATED SHE WAS IN A VEHICLE IN THE SAME LANE OF TRAFFIC AS VEHICLE 1 AND VEHICLE 2, WHEN SHE LOOKED UP AND HEARD A LOUD CRASH AND SAW DRIVER ONE PUT HER HANDS UP IN THE AIR. WITNESS ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE DRIVER 1 USING A CELLPHONE OR BEING DISTRACTED BY ANYTHING ELSE.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS SB ON N CURRY PIKE NEAR W PROFILE PKWY. DRIVER 1 ADVISED TRAFFIC SUDDENLY STOPPED DUE TO AN AMBULANCE TRAVELING NB ON CURRY PIKE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE HITTING VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE WAS SB ON N CURRY PIKE JUST S OF THE INTERSECTION OF N CURRY PIKE AND W PROFILE PKWY. DRIVER 2 ADVISED TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HER HAD TO STOP SUDDENLY DUE TO AN AMBULANCE TRAVELING NB ON N CURRY PIKE AND THAT SHE STOPPED SUDDENLY TO AVOID STRIKING THE CARS IN FRONT OF HER. DRIVER 2 ADVISED IT WAS AT THIS TIME SHE WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 1.

D1 is unknown. D1 fled scene once V1 collided with V2D2 stated he was traveling east on State Rd. 45/46. D2 stated while traveling, V1 crossed from the right lane into the left lane and struck the back passenger bumper of his vehicle. D2 stated V1 immediately began speeding away from the scene of the accident.Front seat passenger (P1) stated he was riding in the front seat of V1 traveling east on State Rd. 45/46. P1 stated V1 crossed from the right lane into the left lane and struck V2 in the back passenger bumper. P1 stated V1 begin speeding away immediately and left the scene.Witness 1 (W1) stated she was traveling east on State Rd. 45/46 behind V2. W1 stated V1 moved from the right lane into the left lane striking V2 in the back passenger bumper. W1 stated V1 begin speeding away immediately.D1 was located. D1 stated V2 pulled out in front of her while she was traveling east on State Road 45/46. D1 stated she attempted to stop, but the breaks on V1 are not great and she was unable to stop causing her to collide with the rear of V2.

D2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W SR 46 STATED SHE WAS SLOWING WITH TRAFFIC WHEN D1 WAS UNABLE TO STOP V1 IN TIME. V1 STRUCK THE RIGHT REAR OF V2 WITH THE MIDDLE TO LEFT FRONT OF V1.V1 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END. V2 HAD DAMAGE TO THE RIGHT REAR BODY AS WELL AS THE RIGHT REAR WHEEL WAS CANTED IN.

D2 was sitting at the intersection of Lake Ridge Dr and Pointe Ridge Ln facing north bound stopped at the stop sign. V1 struck V2 in the rear drivers door area with the left front bumper of his vehicle causing damage to both vehicles.D1 stated that he turned too wide and struck V2 in the drivers side.

V1 was backing into a parking space in the parking lot at 1800 N. Range Road.D1 stated he was backing V1 east into a parking space near a garbage dumpster located on the east side of 1800 N. Range Road. He stated that he was looking at his passenger side rear view mirror and did not notice how close he was to the dumpster that was sitting on his driver side. He stated that he collided into the dumpster with the rear driver side of V1.There was damage to the rear driver side window pillar. The dumpster was not damaged. There were no injuries.

Driver 1 (D1) advised that he was traveling eastbound on W Highway 45/46 in the area of N Kinser Pike. D1 stated that he did not release that the vehicle in front if him and stopped. D1 stated that he did not observe the tail lights of the vehicle in front of him to come on. D1 explained that his vehicle (V1) then struck the rear end of vehicle 2 (V2). Driver 2 (D2) reported that she was also heading eastbound on W Highway 45/46 in the area of N Kinser Pike. D2 advised that traffic had backed up and she had come to a stop. D2 explained that V1 was traveling behind her and did not come to a stop. D2 stated that the front end of V1 struck the rear end of V2. I was able to observe there to be damage to the front end of V1. I was also able to observe damage to the rear end of V2.D1 was seen on scene by ambulance staff and it was determined he did not need to go to the hospital. D1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON FAIRFAX RD JUST SOUTH OF SCOTT LN.D1 STRUCK A DEER THAT WAS CROSSING THE ROADWAY. THE DEER WAS NOT AT THE SCENE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

D1 stated he was traveling north on S Old State Road 37 at approximately 40-45 MPH. D1 stated he saw D2 apply their brakes. D1 also applied his brakes but claimed his brakes failed. D1 stated he heard a grinding noise. D1 stated he continued rolling then collided with D2.D2 stated he was traveling north on S Old State Road 37. D2 stated he was coming to a stop with traffic. D2 looked in his rear view mirror and saw D1 approaching fast. D2 tried to swerve out of the way but was unable to. D2 was struck by D1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE INTERSECTION OF CURRY PIKE AND 3RD STREET.D1 STATED THAT SHE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT, HOWEVER WAS UNSURE IF SHE HAD A TURN ARROW AND PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND ATTEMPTED TO TURN EAST ON 3RD STREET WHEN V1 AND V2 STRUCK.D2 STATED THAT SHE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT AND PROCEEDED STRAIGHT THROUGH THE INTERESECTION, HOWEVER SLOWED DOWN DUE TO THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF V1 TURNING EAST ON TO 3RD STREET AFTER THE TURN ARROW HAD EXPIRED. D2 STATED THAT AFTER THE FIRST VEHICLE DISREGARDED THE TURN ARROW, V1 ALSO ATTEMPTED TO TURN EAST ON 3RD AFTER THE TURN ARROW HAD EXPIRED. D2 STATED THAT V1 THEN STRUCK HER VEHICLE.
