D2 stated that D1 continued, striking his vehicle with the trailer.Rogers Rd is a very narrow road and it is very difficult for 2 vehicles to pass each other.

V1 WAS PARKED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY, ON N RIDGEWOOD DRIVE, FACING WEST. V1 WAS IN FRONT OF 4333 N RIDGEWOOD DRIVE AND WAS STRUCK BY A SILVER SUV (V2) THAT WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON N RIDGEWOOD DRIVE. THE OWNER OF THE VEHICLE WAS NOT ABLE TO ADVISE THE VEHICLE TYPE OR A PLATE NUMBER FOR V2.

Driver one stated that he was headed north on Friendship Road attempting to locate a suicidal individual. Driver one was looking down a gravel pull-off on the side of the roadway when he sideswiped a bridge. Photos were taken by Deputy Logan Frye.

Vehicle 1 was traveling northbound on I69 near the 104.5 mile marker when it struck a deer in the roadway. The deer entered the passenger compartment of the vehicle and came to a rest in the passenger's side foot well. The vehicle suffered disabling damage and was towed from the scene by the driver's father.Vehicle 1, a white 2012 Ford Escape, was traveling northbound on I69 near the 104.5 mile marker when it struck a deer in the roadway. Vehicle 1 came to a controlled rest on the right shoulder of I69 north of the 104.5 mile marker and suffered extensive damage to the hood, front driver's side fender, windshield, and roof. Driver 1, Phillip Hart, stated he was traveling northbound on I69 when he struck a deer in the roadway, causing it to enter his vehicle through the windshield. At the scene Hart was examined by medical personnel and was transported by EMS to IU Health Bloomington as a precaution due to the extent of the damage to the vehicle. At the scene, the deceased deer was removed from Vehicle 1.

Both vehicle 1 and vehicle 2 were traveling east on E Winslow Rd. Vehicle 1 was directly behind vehicle 2 when approaching the T intersetion with S Allendale Dr., which is an all way stop. Driver of vehicle 2 stated that the vehicle in front of him went through the stop and he pulled up to wait his turn. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that normally people roll through the stop sign when traffic is light and he expected vehicle 2 to do the same. Vehicle 2 came to a complete stop and driver of vehicle 1 stated that he believes his foot slipped off the brake and possibly hit the gas pedal slightly and he was unable to get stopped and rear ended vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 had light damage the the front and vehicle 2 had moderate damage to the rear. Both vehicles were able to drive away and no injuries reported.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. FAIRFAX RD WHEN THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM SLAMMED ON THEIR BRAKES AND V1 REAR ENDED V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. FAIRFAX RD AND STARTED TO SLOW DOWN TO TURN ONTO E. SANDERS SECOND WHEN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1VEHICLES MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

The south bound I69 off ramp to Bloomfield rd. is a one way one lane asphalt road. At the time of the crash traffic was light to moderate. It was daylight outside and the roadway was dry. Vehicle 1, a black 2006 Lexus passenger car, was traveling south from I69 towards Bloomfield road on the off ramp. V1 left the roadway and continued traveling west down into an embankment, through a fence, and into several stacks of roofing insulation that were setting in a parking lot, several hundred feet away from the off ramp. V1 came to a stop in the parking lot with roofing insulation on top of it. Driver 1, Cedric Hoskins, told me he was traveling south on the off ramp coming from south bound I69 going towards Bloomfield Rd. D1 said there was a vehicle that was traveling in front of him that suddenly slowed down. D1 said to avoid hitting the vehicle in front of him he directed his car west off the off ramp. D1 said he tried to apply his brakes but instead of slowing down his car continued west off the roadway, down the embankment, through a fence, and into several stacks of roofing insulation that were setting along the edge of the parking lot located at 1913 S Liberty Dr. Evidence shows damage all over V1. Evidence shows damage to approximately $4000 worth of roofing insulation. Evidence shows damage to some fencing just west of the off ramp. Evidence showed tracks leading from the off ramp westwards through the grass, through the fence, and into the parking lot located at 1913 S Liberty Dr.

V2 WAS TRAVELING NB ON W GOURLEY PIKE, APPROACHING A CURVE, WHILE IN THE APEX OF THE CURVE, V1 CAME AROUND THE TURN TRAVELING EB. D2 ADVISED V1 CAME LEFT OF CENTER IN THE APEX OF THE CURVE AND STRUCK V2 ON THE REAR DRIVER SIDE. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THERE WAS SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO THE AREA V2 WAS STRUCK AT. D1 ADVISED BOTH VEHS WERE TRAVELING AT AN UNSAFE SPEED AND THEY COLLIDED IN THE TURN CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V1. BOTH VEHS WERE TOWED FROM THE SCENE DUE TO THE DAMAGE. D1 WAS TAKEN FOR AN OWI INVESTIGATION AND THE RESULTS OF THE TOXICOLOGY TEST ARE PENDING.

D1 was traveling south bound on I69 in the middle lane. D2 was traveling south bound in the outside lane closest to the concrete barrier. D1 stated that he was attempting to pass a motorist in front of him and did not see D2. Consequently, making an unsafe lane change and striking D2 in the passenger side rear in a same direction side swipe.

V1 and V2 were backing out of opposite parking spots in the Walmart parking lot at the same time. V2 backed into the rear passenger side door of V1. D1 did state that he saw V2 at the last second, however was unable to avoid hitting him. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage.

Vehicle 1 was traveling through the parking lot at Bloomington High School South on the southeast corner of the school near the South Drive intersection.Vehicle 1 struck a concrete curb, causing damage to the vehicle.Vehicle 1 then left the scene of the accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: I, Indiana Conservation Officer (ICO) Joseph Tenbarge, was patrolling eastbound on State Road 46 West, in Monroe County, coming into Ellettsville, on Friday, August 16, 2019, at approximately 1448 hours, in a fully marked ICO patrol commission. As I was patrolling eastbound I observed a silver Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) stopped in the middle of State Road 46 West near the intersection of Red Hill Road. As I passed the vehicle I observed that the operator, a white female, later identified by Indiana operators license as Darla Turner had the vehicle in reverse and was backing up. I immediately initiated my emergency lights and turned around to determine why she was backing up in the middle of a state highway.As I was heading west bound back towards Darla Turner, I observed several plastic pieces in the middle of State Road 46 West at the intersection of Red Hill Road. I also observed a four (4) door car stopped at the stop sign of State Road 46 West and Red Hill Road with front end damage. The four (4) door car was being operated by a white male later identified by Indiana operators license as Robin White. I turned onto Red Hill Road and exited my vehicle behind Darla Turner who had turned onto Red Hill Road by the time I approached the crash scene.I exited my truck and spoke with both Darla Turner and Robin White. Both Darla Turner and Robin White provided me with their valid operators license, valid registration, and valid insurance information. Darla Turner explained that Robin White had pulled into traffic on State Road 46 West and she struck the front operators side of his vehicle. Robin White described the same incident explaining that he saw an opportunity to get onto State Road 46 West and attempted to take that opportunity to turn left (east bound) onto State Road 46 West from Red Hill Road. Neither Darla Turner nor Robin White were injured in the accident and neither Darla Turner nor Robin White requested a tow truck for their vehicles. Both vehicles appeared to be in operable condition. I completed an ARIES crash report and provided both Darla Turner and Robin White with the report number and the way to get the report.

V1 was driving east on W. Country Club Dr. V2 was stopped at a red light at the intersection of W. Country Club Dr and S. Walnut St. V3 was also stopped at a red light in front of V2 at the intersection of W. Country Club Dr and S. Walnut St. D1 of V1 stated that he did not press the brakes and rear ended V2 causing V2 to be pushed into the rear end of V3. D2 stated that she was stopped at the red light behind V3 when she was rear ended. D3 stated that she was stopped at the light when she felt V2 rear end her vehicle. D2 and her passenger had a complaint of pain and were evaluated by medical staff but refused treatment. D1 was taken into custody for Operating a Vehicle While Intoxicated.

Vehicle 2 was parked in spot 26 at 610 E Hillside Dr. Vehicle 1 arrived in the same parking lot from the southwest entrance for a delivery. Vehicle 1 went to the north entrance to turn around. While vehicle 1 was backing into spot 28 directly next to vehicle 2, Vehicle 1 struck the front passenger side of vehicle 2 with the rear passenger side of vehicle 1 causing moderate damage to vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 then pulled out of the parking spot and went back to the south west entrance and made the delivery. It did not appear the driver knew an accident had occurred. Vehicle 1 then left the area.The property management allowed me to watch surveillance footage of the incident. After watching surveillance video of the incident I was able to track down the driver of vehicle 1 and gather the information for this accident. In the video the driver never gets out of the truck after the accident. After speaking with driver 1, he advised he did not know the accident had occurred. Driver of vehicle 1 did stay on scene after the accident to make deliveries and does not appear anxious as if he knew the accident had occurred and he was trying to flee. No injuries were reported.

D2 stated he was travelling northbound through the parking lot. D2 stated he passed V1 which was facing westbound waiting to turn. D2 stated as he passed V1 it suddenly accelerated striking the rear passenger side of his V2. D2 stated V1 proceeded to go over a curb and through the grass before leaving the scene of the accident without exchanging the proper information. D2 denied needing any medical assistance. A local investigation was conducted. Please referance case number B19 34070.It was discovered that minutes after this accident occurred, V1 was involved in a second accident. A separate OWI investigation was conducted due to the driver showing signs of impairment. This case number is B19-34073.

V1 was traveling behind V2 southbound on N. Curry Pike in the 900 block. V2 was slowing for a stopped vehicle in front of it that was turning left, yielding to northbound traffic. V1 was unable to stop before rear ending V2. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage during the crash.

Sixth Street is a two lane two way road that runs primarily east and west. College Ave is a one way two lane road that runs primarily south. At the time of the crash there, were several cars parked along the south side of the road located near 158 W 6th St., Bloomington IN. Traffic was light to moderate and it was daylight outside. Vehicle 1, a white 2020 Isuzu box truck, was traveling east on 6th street from College Ave. V1 attempted to park in front of 158 W 6th St. next to Vehicle 2, a maroon 2007 Lincoln TownCar. V1 struck the rear driver side bumper of V2. V2 was pushed up onto the side walk. Driver 1, Dexter Butts, stated that he was traveling east on 6th St just east of the College Ave. Intersection. D1 told me he tried to park his truck in front of 158 W. 6th St.. D1 said he thought he had cleared V2, which was also parked in front 158 W 6th St., while attempting to park his truck. D1 told me he struck the rear driver side bumper of V2 with the rear passenger side bumper of his truck. D1 also told me that when he hit V2, V2 was pushed forward up onto the sidewalk. Both vehicles came to a stop after the strike. Evidence shows damage to the rear driver side bumper of V2. Evidence shows that V2 was parked at the time of the crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 STATED HE WAS HEADING NORTH ON 1ST ST WHEN D1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HIM. D1 WAS HEADING WEST ON RITTER ST TURNING SOUTH ON 1ST ST. VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.
V1 was backing out of a parking space, eastbound, at the address of 2129 S. Yost Ave. V2 was parked behind V1 facing East. D1 did not see V2 and V1 backed into the driver side of V2.

D1 advised she was traveling south on S. Leonard Springs Rd. When she states she sneezed, at which point V1 traveled to the right and V1 struck a mailbox at 3220 S. Leonard Springs Rd. D1 stated after she struck the mailbox she swerved left and was in the opposite lane of travel and over corrected and struck a utility pole with the right rear of V1.

OWNER OF V2 WAS INSIDE OF CVS AND A WITNESS, JEDIDIAH BECHTEL, TOLD HER A VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH HER VEHICLE AND LEFT. BECHTEL GAVE OWNER VEHICLE INFORMATION INCLUDING MAKE MODEL COLOR AND LICENSE PLATE. I CHECK BMV DATABASE AND THE PLATE DID MATCH THAT VEHICLE. OWNER THEN WENT OUTSIDE TO FIND A NOTE ON HER VEHICLE THAT DID NOT CONTAIN ANY CONTACT INFORMATION. I WAS ABLE TO VIEW VIDEO FOOTAGE AND OBSERVED A GOLD FORD ESCAPE BACKING FROM A PARKING SPOT AND COLLIDING WITH V2 CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V2. I WAS ABLE TO OBTAIN INFORMATION FOR THE OWNER BUT THE DRIVER OF V1 WAS A MALE AND DID NOT MATCH THE DESCRIPTION OF THE DRIVER.

Other location of investigation: Due to injuries sustained during the crash, I spoke with Driver #1 at IU Health Hospital in Bloomington, Monroe County, IN. I gathered Driver #1's statement regarding the crash approximately one and half hours after the crash occurred. A PBT (portable breath test) was administered approximately one and half hours after the crash and the result obtained was .000 alcohol concentration equivalent.Wayport Rd is a local, county road that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. The roadway where the crash occurred is curved with a slight uphill grade. There are both fog and center lines on the roadway. The roadway was dry and the crash scene was illuminated by sunlight. Vehicle #1 (Red 2008 Ford Focus) was traveling southbound on Wayport Rd approximately 1,500 feet north of Sample Rd. Vehicle #1 traveled southwest off the roadway traveling through a fence. After traveling through the fence, the front left of Vehicle #1 struck an embankment, causing Vehicle #1 to perform a rollover, coming to a final rest in an inverted position facing southwest. Driver #1 (Makayla B. Grubb) stated she was traveling southbound on Wayport Rd at an unknown speed. Driver #1 stated while traveling southbound Vehicle #1 began traveling right off of the roadway. Driver #1 stated she attempted to maneuver Vehicle #1 back onto the roadway, but overcorrected the steering. She then steered right causing Vehicle #1 to traveling southwest off of the roadway. Driver #1 stated after Vehicle #1 left the roadway she remembered the vehicle traveling through a fence, but advised she did not remembered what occurred after. Driver #1 advised she suffered a possible broken left arm and a possible concussion. Driver #1 advised prior to the crash she was mental distracted. Driver #1 advised she was not wearing her safety belt when the crash occurred. Upon my arrival to the scene of the crash, I observed medical personnel attempting to load Driver #1 onto a gurney. Driver #1 was loaded into an IU Health ambulance and transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital for her injuries. I observed Vehicle #1 inverted on the southwest side of Wayport Rd facing southwest. I observed significant damage to the front, top and left side of Vehicle #1. I observed multiple pieces of debris scattered throughout the crash scene. I observed tire marks on the right side of the roadway where Vehicle #1 initially traveled partially off the roadway and marks showing Vehicle #1 coming back onto the roadway prior to leaving the roadway completely.

The location of this crash was located on the west side of a roundabout that connected four separate streets. High Street travels to the north, E. Rodgers St travels to the East, a Private Drive Travels to the south and E. Winslow Road travels to the west.Vehicle 1 (Black, 2015, Ford Focus) was traveling southwest exiting the roundabout onto E. Winslow Street. V1 then attempted to drive west on E. Winslow Road when it struck a deer that ran into the roadway.Driver 1 (Courtney Freeman) indicated the following: She was driving west when a deer suddenly entered the roadway from the north side. D1 stated that she did not have time to brake and struck the deer which disabled her vehicle. It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the reason for this crash was a deer in the roadway. During the course of the investigation, Deer fur was located on the vehicle.RRK

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N OLD STATE ROAD 37. AS V1 CONTINUTED SB TOWARD THE INTERSECTION OF E MEL CURRY ROAD, A DEER CROSSED THE ROADWAY IN FRONT OF V1 LEAVING IT KNOW WHERE TO GO. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE DEER JUST NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SB ON N OLD STATE ROAD 37 JUST NORTH OF E MEL CURRY ROAD. D1 STATED THAT AFTER HITTING THE DEER, THE DEER RAN OFF EB.

UNIT 1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO EVADE LAW ENFORCEMENT. WHILE TRAVELING WEST ON KIRKWOOD, THE DRIVER LOST CONTROL AND COLLIDED WITH UNIT 2 WHICH WAS PARKED ON N RITTER STREET. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 THEN EXITED THE VEHICLE AND RAN.THERE WAS MARKS IN THE DIRT THAT SHOWED UNIT 2 HAD BEEN MOVED SEVERAL FEET DUE TO THE COLLISION. On 08-17-2019, at approximately 6:15 pm, V1 traveled northwest in the parking lot of Taco Bell, located at 2400 S Walnut Street in Bloomington. V1 ran over the curb of the drive-through, striking and damaging the menu sign. V1 proceeded northwest in the parking lot where it ran over another curb located in the northwest corner. V1 went into a heavily wooded area where it came to rest facing west.D1 stated that he was feeling tired and stopped in the Taco Bell parking lot to rest for a few moments. He stated that he attempted to put his vehicle in park and it went into reverse and he jumped the curb. He stated that the vehicle has not been running properly lately. Damage to V1 consisted of a broken front windshield, heavy damage to the underbody, axle and side panels.Witness stated she was working as an employee at Taco Bell, when an individual advised her of a male asleep inside of his vehicle in the parking lot. She stated she advised her manager who went outside to check on the male. She stated the male woke up and stated he was fine. She stated he was located in the south part of the parking lot, facing north. She stated that he then began to drive, drove over the curb of the drive-through and into the mulch bed, continuing over the curb into the wooded area. She stated that she immediately called 911 and multiple people from the car dealership ran toward the vehicle.Trooper Richard Klun and I arrived on scene and began the investigation. Trooper Klun stated that he detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from D1's person. Trooper Klun conducted an investigation, suspecting D1 to have been operating while intoxicated. Trooper Klun documented his investigation under case number: 19ISCP009700. D1 was transported to the hospital for a blood draw, (results are pending).Investigation at the scene was inconsistent with D1's statement. V1 was located in the northwest portion of the parking lot in a heavily wooded area, facing west. Witness statement indicated that prior to V1 driving into the woods, it was parked in the south lot, facing north. Had V1 had been in reverse, as D1 stated, it would not have traveled in that direction. V1 would have had to have been put into drive and driven forward to be consistent with evidence located at the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was traveling south on S. College Mall Rd. D1 stated she was stopped at a stop light waiting to turn east. D1 stated she was unsure if she had a green arrow or just a green light. D1 stated as she turned left, V2 was traveling north. D1 stated she attempted to stop and honk, but was unable to in time. D1 stated she did see that V2 had headlights on. D1 stated her vehicle collided with the front of V2 causing damage to both.D2 stated she was traveling north on S. College Mall Rd. D2 stated she was traveling with the normal flow of traffic. D2 stated as she entered into the intersection, V1 attempted to turn left in front of her. D2 stated she was unable to stop and her vehicle collided with V1 causing damage to both.**** Supplement**** D1 contacted me and wanted to amend her statement from being what is previously stated to that she remembers she had a green arrow and not just a green light. D1 stated she now remembers this because she went back and looked at the light and noticed it did have a green arrow and this is how she knows she had a green arrow.

V1 was headed North on Henderson Avenue. V2 was headed East on Atwater Avenue. D2 stated that as he was going through the intersection he noticed V1 was coming and attempted to avoid V1 but was unable to. D2 stated that he also had a green light. V2 was towed due to significant front end damage. D1 was issued a citation for driving without a license. There is a camera through city streets at that intersection. I am attempting to get video footage of the accident.

Vehicle 1 was westbound in the southern most of the two westbound lanes. She stated that she sneezed and swerved her vehicle and struck vehicle 2. She stated he then backed up and struck her car.

Unit 1 was travelling northbound, in the center lane on S ST RD 37, approsching the Fullerton Pike exit. Unit 2 was also travelling Northbound, in the left hand lane. UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING WEST ON 45, THERE WAS A COW IN THE ROADWAY. THE DRIVER STATED SHE WAS UNABLE TO SLOW DOWN OR AVOID THE COW IN TIME WITHOUT LOOSING CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. VEHICLE 1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 37 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST DILLMAN ROAD. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK A DEER IN THE ROADWAY. DRIVER SIDE AIRBAG WAS DEPLOYED.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTION.VEHICLE 1 WAS DISABLED AND TOWED TO RICKS BY RICKS.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT AT ADVANCE AUTO, 302 S. CORY LN. V2'S OWNER WAS TOLD THAT V1 HAD BACKED OUT AND SIDESWIPED HIS TRUCK, AND WHEN HE WENT OUTSIDE, V1 HAD LEFT THE SCENE.V1 WAS DESCRIBED AS A 1996 VW JETTA WITH A WHITE MALE DRIVER.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

SPOKE WITH ALL DRIVERS IT WAS STATED THAT V3 WAS STOPPED AT LIGHT AND V2 WAS STOPPED BEHIND V3 AND THAT V1 STRUCK THE REAR OF V2 PUSHING V2 INTO THE REAR OF V1 STRIKING THE TRAILER HITCH. Driver of vehicle 1 was not able to come to a stop and collided with Vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 has no visible damage from the accident and Vehicle 2 has moderate damage to the rear. No injures were reported and both vehicles were able to drive from the scene.

Driver 2 stated he was south on the SR 45/46 Bypass in the right lane. Driver 2 stated traffic was backed up from 3rd St to near 7th St and was stop and go. V1 WAS PARKED IN A PRIVATE DRIVE AT 7430 W. ISON RD NEAR A TREE. A TREE LIMB FELL ON A SQUAD CAR DURING A RAIN STORM ON 08/20/2019, AT APPROX. 5:02 PM CAUSING A MICRO-DENT TO THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE HOOD.

D1 stated she was traveling northbound on S. Walnut Street Pike and advised a vehicle ahead of her suddenly stopped to make a right hand turn. At approximately 1720 hours on 8/20/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 approximately 50 feet west of the intersection of 3rd and Swain. V1 was stopped in traffic in the north lane and V2 was traveling west in the south lane. As V2 was passing the intersection of 3rd and Swain, V1 made lane movement into the south lane and the vehicles collided. The collision caused the driver side front tire of V2 to strike the south curb. D1 stated that she had been stopped in traffic in the north lane and attempted to perform a lane change into the south lane. D1 stated that she signaled, allowed the signal to blink approximately 6 times, checked her blind spot, and then started into the south lane. D1 stated that as soon as she moved into the south lane V2 struck her vehicle. D1 stated that both drivers were probably at fault. The driver side front tire was out of alignment, the vehicle was no longer drivable, and there was cosmetic damage to the vehicle above the tire well.D2 stated that she had been traveling westbound on 3rd in the south lane. D2 stated that as she was approaching the intersection at 3rd and Jordan, V1 abruptly pulled into her lane and the vehicles collided. D2 stated she was driving the speed limit, 25mph, and that the lane movement had happened too quickly to allow her to stop her vehicle. There was impact damage to the area near the passenger side tire and there was damage to the driver side tire from striking the curb. Neither party claimed injury or requested medical attention.

ALL VEHICLES WERE IN THE RIGHT TURN LANE OF E. 3RD ST IN THE EASTBOUND LANES. V1 HYDROPLANED DUE TO RAIN AND MOISTURE ON ROAD SURFACE. V1 WAS UNABLE TO BRAKE FULLY BEFORE REAR ENDING V2. THIS COLLISION PUSHED V2 INTO THE REAR HITCH OF V3.V1 HAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER AND HOOD.V2 HAS DAMAGE TO BOTH THE FRONT AND REAR BUMPERS.V3 HAS NO VISIBLE DAMAGE. D3 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER HIP. FRONT PASSENGER IN V3 HAD A HEADACHE. NO MEDICAL TREATMENT NEEDED ON SCENE.

The damage to V2 was on the rear bumper, there was no visible paint transfer from V1. The damage has been photographed and submitted as evidence. I could not locate any cameras that would have captured this incident.There are no known suspects at this time.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S COLLEGE AVE. V1 APPROACHED THE LIGHT OF W 7TH ST AND TURNED LEFT (EB ON W 7TH ST). WHILE V1 WAS TURNING, D1 SAW V2 OVER THE LINE IN THE TURN LANE TO TURN SB ON COLLEGE AVE. D1 ADVISED THEY CHECKED THE MIRRORS ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF V1 AND WHEN D1 LOOKED BACK AT V2, V2 HAD STOPPED AND V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V2. V1 HAD DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER SIDE. V2 WAS WB ON W 7TH ST STOPPED AT THE LIGHT IN THE TURN LANE TO GO SB ON COLLEGE AVE. D2 ADVISED SHE WAS STOPPED OVER THE LINE. V1 THEN STRUCK V2 ON THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE BUMPER. BOTH VEHS SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED IN THE LEFT OF TWO EAST BOUND LANES OF E. 3RD ST. WAITING TO TURN LEFT ONTO S. OVERHILL DR. V1 BEGAN TO TURN LEFT, FAILED TO YIELD TO ONCOMING TRAFFIC, AND WAS STRUCK BY V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN THE LEFT OF TWO EAST BOUND LANES OF E 3RD ST. D1 STATED THAT THE TRAFFIC IN THE LEFT LANE OF TWO WEST BOUND LANES WAS BACKED UP. D1 STATED THAT ANOTHER DRIVER, WHO WAS IN THE LEFT LANE OF THE TWO WEST BOUND LANES OF E 3RD ST., WAVED HIM TO TURN IN FRONT OF HIM. D1 STATED THAT HE INCHED HIS WAY INTO THE LEFT TURN AND BEGAN TO TURN LEFT WHEN V2 STRUCK V1. V2 THEN STRUCK A LIGHT POLE (#25) OWNED BY DUKE.V2 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON THE RIGHT IF TWO WEST BOUND LANES OF E 3RD ST. V1 TURNED LEFT FROM EAST BOUND LANE OF E 3RD ST. IN FRONT OF V2. V2 STRUCK V1 AND THEN STRUCK THE LIGHT POLE.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON E 3RD ST. IN THE RIGHT OF TWO WEST BOUND LANES. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING AT A SPEED OF ABOUT 30-35MPH. D2 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT SEE V1 UNTIL IT WAS TURNING IN FRONT OF HER. D2 STATED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE, BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME TO PREVENT A COLLISSION. D2 STATED THAT SHE STRUCK V1 AND THEN STRUCK THE LIGHT POLE.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT TRAFFIC ALONG E 3RD ST. IN THE AREA OF THE CRASH, BACKS UP DUE TO THE RIGHT OF THE TWO WEST BOUNDS LANES MERGES INTO THE LEFT LANE OF THE TWO WEST BOUND LANES. TRAFFIC WAS BACKUP IN THE LEFT LANE, BUT THE RIGHT LANE WAS FREE-FLOWING.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 ADVISED V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON S ROGERS ST. AS V1 APPROACHED THE 900 BLOCK OF S ROGERS ST, V2 PULLED OUT OF THE PARKING LOT OF 919 S ROGERS ST. D1 ADVISED HE BRAKED AND ATTEMPTED TO SLOW DOWN BUT WAS UNABLE TO DUE TO THE ROADS BEING WET. V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2. THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER OF V1. D2 ADVISED V2 PULLED OUT OF THE PARKING LOT OF 919 S ROGERS ST. D2 STATED SHE SAW V1 BUT BELIEVED THERE WAS ENOUGH SPACE FOR HER TO PULL INTO THE ROADWAY. ONCE SHE WAS IN THE ROADWAY, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2. THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO V2 BACK BUMPER. IT SHOULD BE NOTED, D2 DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF BACK PAIN BUT REFUSED AN AMBULANCE. BOTH VEHS WERE DRIVER FROM SCENE.

On August 20th 2019 at approximately 21:30 hours I was dispatched to 3400 S Sare Rd in reference to an accident LSA. .Upon arrival, I observed a 2013 Green Mini Cooper facing northbound with damage to the driver's side door. I checked the windshield and the immediate area for a note, but did not locate one. I then spoke with O1 (owner of vehicle 1).She explained that she parked the vehicle in the parking stall around July 22nd and then left the country. She returned home tonight (8/20/19) to find that the vehicle had been struck by another vehicle. O1 stated that the vehicle had not been moved while she was gone and that she does not know of a suspect vehicle. She also explained that she did not have insurance on the vehicle due to her leaving the country. The damage to V1 appeared to be from when V2 backed out of the parking stall, but it is unknown.On August 21st 2019 Officer Sager met with O1 who explained that she found V2. Officer Sager located D2 who explained that he was exiting (backing) out of the parking stall when he struck V1, which was parked. Officer Sager observed damage to V2's front passenger side area and V1's driver's side. It should be noted that D2 explained that he left a note on the vehicle. Due to V2's unsafe backing resulted in the accident.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. SMITHVILLE RD PASSING S. ZIKES RD. D1 CAME TO A CURVE IN THE ROAD AND THERE WAS A LOG AND BRANCH IN THE ROADWAY. D1 SWERVED TO MISS THE BRANCH AND WHEN SHE HIT HER BRAKES IT PUT V1 INTO A SPIN AND RAN OFF THE ROAD AND INTO A TREE.THERE WAS A LOG AND BRANCH THAT WAS MOVED OUT OF THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Vehicle 1 was seen by Deputy Gaitani back into vehicle 2 however no driver was in the vehicle when it struck vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was parked at 315 W Gordon Pike Lot 46. The owner of vehicle 2 stated he saw the driver of vehicle 1 flee the scene before the arrival of Deputy Gaitani. In a check of vehicle 1 it was determined that vehicle 1 was a stolen vehicle reported to Indiana State Police.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON E. UNIVERSITY ST., APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF E. UNIVERSITY ST. AND S. HENDERSON ST. V1 PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK V2.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON E. UNIVERSITY ST. D1 STATED THAT SHE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN LOCATED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E UNIVERSITY ST. AND S. HENDERSON ST., AND LOOKED BOTH WAYS. D1 STATED THAT SHE MUST NOT HAVE SEEN V2 AND THOUGHT IT WAS A FOUR-WAY STOP BECAUSE SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK V2.V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON S. HENDERSON ST. WHEN V1 ENTERED IN THE INTERSECTION OF E. UNIVERSITY ST. AND S. HENDERSON ST AND STRUCK V2.D2 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON S. HENDERSON ST. WHEN V1 ATTEMPTED TO CROSS THE INTERSECTION OF E. UNIVERSITY ST. AND S. HENDERSON ST. AND STRUCK V2.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THIS INTERSECTION IS A TWO-WAY STOP, EAST/WEST.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver one was sitting at the intersection of Ritter Street and First Street at the stop sign she then started across the intersection. Driver one did not see driver two who was northbound on First street approaching the intersection. Driver one pulled out into driver two, causing minor damage to both vehicles.NO diagram vehicles moved prior to arrival.

The accident occurred on SR 46 with the intersection of 10th Street. D1 and D2 moved their vehicle out of intersection so they would not block traffic. D1 stated that she was traveling behind V2 when D2 slammed on her brakes due to traffic stopping for the light. D1 stated that she believes she would have stopped in time if it weren't for loose gravel on the road. D1 stated that she slid right in to the back of V2. D2 stated that she was coming up on the intersection when she had to suddenly stop due to the light changing and cars in front of her stopping and was rear ended. There was very minor damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED AT END OF PARKING STALL AISLE WAITING TO CROSS THE SERVICE DRIVE HEADING NORTH. V2 WAS DRIVING ALONG THE SERVICE DRIVE HEADED WEST. V1 ATTEMPTED TO CROSS THE SERVICE DRIVE INTO ANOTHER PARKING LOT BEFORE V2 HAD FULLY PASSED V1'S POSITION. V1 STRUCK THE REAR DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL OF V2 CAUSING DAMAGE.

Driver 2 stated he was westbound through the parking lot of 1722 N Walnut St when vehicle 1 backed out of a parking space and collided with his vehicle. Driver 1 stated he was backing out of a parking space and did not see vehicle 2 and collided with it.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was traveling east on SR48 near the intersection with Field Stone Blvd. D1 was traveling west on State Road 48 and in the left turn lane to travel south on Field Stone Blvd. D2 stated that he slowed while approaching the intersection allowing an unknown vehicle to travel in front of him. V1 attempted to make a left turn and follow the unknown vehicle. Consequently, D2 and D1 collided.

V1 was parked on a private drive on Fourwinds property unoccupied. V1 owner was nearby and heard a loud noise and found that a large limb from a tree had fallen on the rear passenger side of the truck causing damage to the bed.

On 08/21/2019, at 1439 hours, a cadet working student move-ins advised that there had been a minor crash on the Forest Circle Drive. Shortly thereafter, they requested an officer respond to the scene to take a report. When I arrived on scene, I met with Kristy Curtis, the owner of a black Honda CR-V, bearing IN CM plate UCY815. Curtis advised that the driver of the other vehicle, later identified as Tsehainesh Teklezghi, backed a black Nissan Rogue (IN PC 658UP) into Curtis's parked Honda, while trying to leave. I spoke with Teklezghi, who stated that she had decided to move the Nissan from the Forest Circle Drive and accidentally backed it (backing southeast) into the parked Honda, which was facing west. Teklezghi said that there was no damage to her vehicle's rear bumper. There were a few scrapes to the front bumper of Honda CR-V toward the driver side from the impact. When I had dispatch run Teklezghi's information, they advised that her license was suspended, with a prior conviction. When I ran Teklezghi's information on my MDD, I was able to view a driver's license photo which matched her and see that she had several recent violations on her license history and a history of failures to appear. Teklezghi was also unable to provide proof of insurance for the vehicle that she was driving, advising that the Nissan belonged to her son's father. I called for a tow truck and arrested Teklezghi for Driving While Suspended, Prior, a class A misdemeanor. Officer Schmitt performed an inventory of the vehicle and Sergeant Snyder handled the tow through Auto Mobile. The Nissan will be held for proof of insurance and valid driver. I handcuffed Teklezghi and searched her incident to arrest. I double-locked the cuffs and checked them for tightness, readjusting them and double-locking again when she complained of pain, stating that she had prior problems with her left wrist. I placed her in the rear of unit 224 and transported her to Monroe County Jail, where I booked her in on a charge of Driving While Suspended, Prior. I request that a copy of this case be forwarded to the Monroe County Prosecutor's Office for review. Copies of the remand sheet and tow/inventory forms are attached to this case.*****************************************SUPPLEMENT**************************************************************On 08/22/2019, Gezaie Ghirmay, the owner of the black Nissan Rogue, came to retrieve his vehicle. Ghirmay has a valid driver's license and showed proof that his vehicle was insured at the time of the crash. I have added that information to this case and contacted the insurance agent of Ms. Curtis to inform them of this information.

V2 WAS PARKED IN A PRIVATE PARKING LOT, 322 E KIRKWOOD AVE, FACING NB FROM THE HOURS OF 1600 - 1900. WHEN THE OWNER OF V2 WALKED TO HER VEH, SHE SAW THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER SIDE. BASED ON THE DAMAGE, V1 MAY HAVE BEEN REVERSING FROM THE PARKING STALL NEXT TO V2. D1 LEFT A NOTE ON V2 WITH A PHONE NUMBER. HOWEVER WHEN THE NUMBER IS CALLED, THERE IS NO ANSWER AND THE VOICEMAIL IS FULL. V1 IS BELIEVED TO BE BLUE OR GREEN DUE TO THE PAINT TRANSFER ON V2.

Explain in Narrative Roadway Surface: The roadway is brick. V1 was traveling westbound on 9th Street going straight. V2 was parked facing westbound by the south side curb. D1 stated she had dropped off Other Participant 1 (OP1) by V2. D1 stated she saw OP1 get into her vehicle (V2) on the rear passenger side of the vehicle. D1 stated she thought that OP1 had already entered into the vehicle and did not see that the rear passenger side door of V2 was not closed. D1 stated she continued to drive westbound on 9th when she struck the rear passenger side door of V2 with the driver side rear quarter panel of V1. OP1 stated that she was being dropped off by D1 next to V2 when she went into the rear passenger side door of V2. OP1 stated that she had the rear passenger side door open and was reaching into the vehicle to grab some belongings. OP1 stated that shortly after, she heard D1 hit her rear passenger side car door with the rear driver side quarter panel of V1. OP1 stated that her rear passenger car door could not close due to the damage. There were no injuries. At the request of OP1, Hawkins Towing was called to take V2 due to the damage to her door.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was traveling east on W Mcneely Street at approximately 40 MPH. D1 tried to slow down as she approached the intersection with North Union Valley however she claimed her vehicle hydroplaned. D1 tried to turn left to avoid a collision but the vehicle continued straight. D1 stated she could not stop for the stop sign at the intersection. D1 collided with D2.D2 stated he was traveling north on N Union Valley Road at approximately 35 MPH. D2 stated that D1 slid through the intersection. D2 stated he could not stop to avoid a collision.

V1 and V2 were traveling eastbound and at the intersection of W 3rd St and S Gates Dr when V1 crossed over into V2's lane of travel as V2 was preparing to turn left. V1 made contact to V2 near the front right 1/4 panel, causing minor damage to both vehicles. D1 appeared to have suffered from an unknown medical condition at the time of the incident. D1/V1 stated he was operating the vehicle and began to have sharp pains in both his chest and head and soon after blacked out, stating he did not remember what happened. D2/V2 stated he was preparing to turn left from W 3rd St onto S Gates Dr when he noticed V1 began to cross into his lane of travel. In doing so, D2 stated he noticed D1 appeared to be clutching his chest, indicating he may be suffering from an unknown medical condition. D1 was transported from the scene due to his health condition and was later interviewed at IU Health while receiving treatment. V1 sustained minor damage to the front left 1/4 panel of the vehicle and was towed from the scene due to D1 being transported for medical treatment. V2 sustained minor damage to the front right 1/4 panel of the vehicle and was driven away from the scene.

D1 was traveling westbound on Third Street. D2 was traveling westbound on Third Street.D1 stated that she was traveling westbound in the south most lane attempting to turn south onto Swain Avenue traveling at approximately 15 miles per hour. D1 stated that as she was attempting to complete the turn V2 hit V1 on the front driver side door section of her vehicle. D1 stated she had used her signal as she attempted to turn. D1 believed that D2 was behind her prior to the crash.D2 stated that he was driving in the north most lane traveling westbound at approximately 30 miles per hour. D2 stated that there was another vehicle in front of him as he attempted to merge into the south most lane. D2 stated that V1 suddenly merged in front of him and struck V2's front passenger side quarter panel. Both parties stated that they moved their vehicles after the crash.No injuries were reported.

Driver 1 was traveling east on Miami Street. Driver 1 stated he missed his turn onto Shawnee Drive because he was looking at his GPS on his phone. Driver 1 then drove through a Guard Rail at the dead end of Miami Street and into a small creek.Driver 1 vehicle was heavily damaged in the front end and possibly the under carriage. Damage to the Guard Rail was extensive and will require remounting and possible complete replacement.

Vehicle 1 (V1) was traveling northwest on Patterson Drive approaching 2nd Street. Pedestrian (P) is believed to walk from the wooded area to the southeast of 2nd Street and Patterson Drive behind two office buildings. Driver 1 (D1) says someone walked out into the roadway in front of his car. He applied the vehicle's brakes but he was unable to stop in time. D1 says he struck the pedestrian. The vehicle then slid to a stop and the pedestrian fell to the roadway. Neither D1 nor his passenger were injured. The pedestrian was severely injured and was not conscious and unable to speak since the accident. Initial responding Officers suspected the pedestrian had been drinking based upon their observations.

The bicyclist reports that she had stopped at the white line on eastbound 7th St at the stop sign with Indiana Ave in the middle of the lane. She advised that vehicle 1 turned left from Indiana Ave and cut across the east bound lane where the bicyclist was stopped, colliding with the front wheel and handle bars of the bicycle. Driver 1 stated she didn't see the bicyclist in the road. Driver 1 also advised that she might have cut the corner when she had turned left.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on 3rd street.At 727 E 3rd Street, V2 began to break due to traffic congestion. V1 began to slow as well, however were following too closely, and struck V1's rear bumper.V1 sustained damage to their front bumper. V2 sustained damage to their rear bumper.

Driver 2 stated she was west bound on 3rd St approaching College Mall Rd in the right turn lane. Driver 2 stated that the traffic signal changed to red and the car in front of her stopped. Driver 2 stated she stopped and was then hit from behind by vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated she was behind vehicle 2 when vehicle 2 came to a sudden stop. Driver 2 stated was unable to stop and collided with vehicle 2.

D1 stated he was traveling east on E. Moores Pk. D1 stated he was in the turn lane attempted to turn north onto S. College Mall Rd. D1 stated D2 passed him on the left side of a double yellow line attempting to get into the turn lane. D1 stated D2 made contact with the front driver side of his vehicle causing damage to his vehicle. D1 stated he attempted to stop after the accident. D1 stated he watched D2 cross the intersection and pull into the next lot. D1 stated he left and later called his father who advised him to return to the scene.D2 stated he was traveling east on E. Moores Pk. D2 stated he was in the left turn lane preparing to turn left. D2 stated D1 attempted to enter into the same turn lane. D2 stated D1 collided with the right side of vehicle causing damage to his vehicle. D2 stated he crossed the intersection and pulled into the movie theater parking lot. D2 stated he was unsure where D1 went after the accident.Witness 1 (W1) stated he witnessed the accident. W1 stated D2 was in the left turn lane. W1 stated D1 attempted to enter into the turn lane and collided with D2. W1 stated D1 eventually pulled over at Dicks Sporting Goods. W1 stated he advised D1 to return to the scene of the accident prior to getting in trouble.

W1 STATED THAT SHE SAW A LARGE TAN SUV SLIDE THROUGH THE STOP SIGN WITHIN THE APARTMENT COMPLEX, RUN OFF THE ROADWAY INTO HER GRASS, AND STRIKE THE LIGHT POST. W1 STATED THAT SHE WITNESSED TWO WHITE MALES GET OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND RUN BACK UP THE HILL UNTIL SHE LOST SIGHT. W1 STATED THAT THE VEHICLE, STILL BEING DRIVEN BY A BLACK MALE, BACKED UP AND DROVE FURTHER INTO THE APARTMENT COMPLEX UNTIL SHE LOST SIGHT. AN OFFICER LOCATED A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION GIVEN BY W1 IN THE PARKING LOT AT THE TOP OF THE HILL. WHEN LOOKING AT THE VEHICLE, IT WAS RECENTLY DRIVEN AND HAD DAMAGE AND DEBRIS ON THE FRONT BUMPER.

Driver number 1 stated that he was traveling on Woodyard road and went to turn onto Smith Pike. Once he turned onto Smith Pike traffic was stopped to let an emergency vehicle go by. Driver 1 didn't realize traffic was stopped until it was too late. Driver 1 struck vehicle 2.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET ABOUT TO TURN NB ONTO S PETE ELLIS DRIVE BEHIND V2. AS V2 BEGAN TO TURN NB, V2 BEGAN TO SLOW WHICH RESULTED IN THE FRONT OF V1 STRIKING THE REAR OF V2. DAMAGE TO V1 WAS VISIBLE ON THE RIGHT FRONT BUMPER AND HEADLIGHT AREA AND DAMAGE TO V2 WAS VISIBLE ON THE REAR BUMPER AND TAILLIGHT AREA.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING BEHIND V2 WAITING TO TURN NB ON S PETE ELLIS DRIVE. D1 STATED THAT AS D2 STOPPED FOR PEDESTRIANS IN THE ROADWAY, SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME TO AVOID THE COLLISION.D2 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS TURNING NB ONTO S PETE ELLIS DRIVE, SHE HAD TO STOP TO WAIT FOR PEDESTRIANS IN THE ROADWAY WHO WERE CROSSING. D2 STATED THAT AS SHE STOPPED FOR THE CROSSWALK, SHE WAS STRUCK BY V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: ****UPDATE**** 09/04/2019OWNER OF V2 WAS NOT THE ACTUAL DIRVER OF THE VEHICLE. OWNER OF V2 DID NOT GIVE PERMISSION TO THE FEMALE THAT WAS DRIVING THE VEHICLE ON 08/22/2019 AND THAT FEMALE IS UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME. BODY CAMERA FOOTAGE OF FEMALE THAT WAS DRIVING THE VEHICLE WAS COMPARED TO VEHICLE OWNER AND THEY WERE NOT THE SAME FEMALE. D1 STATED THAT HE HAD A TURN ARROW TO TURN LEFT ONTO OUTBACK CT OFF OF STATE ROAD 46 WEST. AS HE TURNED ONTO OUTBACK CT V2 HIT HIS VEHICLE. D2 STATED THAT ALL LIGHTS WERE GREEN FOR EAST BOUND TRAFFIC. D2 ENTERED INTO THE INTERSECTON AND HIT D1 WHO TURNED INFRONT OF HER. V1 was driving north on US 45/46 towards 10th St. V2 was also going north on US 45/46 towards 10th St slowing in traffic.D1 stated she was driving north on US 45/46 when she realized that V2 was stopping for traffic. D1 stated she attempted to stop but her tires slid on the road and collided with the rear of V2.D2 stated she was driving north on US 45/46 when she stopped due to traffic. D2 stated that when she stopped V1 collided with her rear bumper.
Driver was east bound on SR 46 in a long left hand turn when she ran off of the right side of the roadway. The vehicle continued down a small embankment and came to rest in a soy bean field.

V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON ROGERS STREET AT DODDS ST.V2 WAS ALSO SOUTHBOUND DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID WHEN V2 STOPPED IN FRONT OF HIM HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE REAR ENDING IT.D2 SAID SHE WAS TURNING LEFT INTO A PARKING LOT JUST SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION. SHE SAID SHE HAD TO WAIT ON NORTHBOUND TRAFFIC TO CLEAR BEFORE SHE COULD TURN AND THATS WHEN V1 REAR ENDED HER. SHE SAID SHE HAD HER TURN SIGNAL ON.

At the place of the crash State Road 46 is a four lane two way asphalt road that runs primarily east to west. At the time of the crash it was overcast and raining outside. Traffic was medium to heavy. Vehicle 1, a silver 2013 Ford Escape, was traveling east on SR 46 approaching the Arlington Rd. intersection directly behind V2. Vehicle 2, a maroon 2010 Nissan Altima, was facing east on SR 46 just west of the Arlington Rd. intersection directly behind V3. Vehicle 3, a blue 2014 Ford F150, was sitting on SR 46 facing east at the Arlington Road's fully operational stop light intersection. V1 ran into the back of V2. V2 was hit and pushed into V3. V3 was stuck in the rear from V2 only. All vehicle came to a controlled stop after the crash. Driver 1, Hailey Seaford, stated she was in traveling east on SR 46 approaching the Arlington Rd. intersection in her silver colored Ford Escape. D1 told me that she saw V2 stop in front of her and attempted to stop by applying her brakes. D1 said her vehicle continued forwards and struck the rear end of V2, pushing it into V3. Driver 2, Rita Fish, stated she was topped in traffic facing east on SR 46 just west of the Arlington Rd. intersection directly behind V3. D2 told me that while she was sitting there she was struck from the rear by V1. D2 said V1 pushed her Maroon Nissan into V3.Driver 3, Tracy Welty, told me he was stopped at the east bound stop light at the corner of SR 46 and Arlington Rd. D3 told me that he was facing east at the light when he was hit from behind by V2. D3 never saw it coming. Evidence shows damage to the front bumper area of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front and rear bumpers of V2. Evidence shows minimal damage to the rear of V3. Evidence shows it was raining and the ground was wet at the time of the crash.

V1 WAS BACKING INTO A PARKING SPACE AT COMMUNITY FORD AT 2200 S WALNUT ST.V2 WAS PARKED TO THE WEST OF V1.D1 SAID HE DID NOT THINK HE HIT V2 BECAUSE THE BACKUP SENSOR DID NOT SOUND. AFTER PARKING, D1 LEFT THE VEHICLE THERE FOR SERVICE. V1 WAS PRESSED AGAINST THE FRONT GRILL/BUMPER OF V2.

Driver of vehicle 1 stated he was going east of E. Sample Rd when he attempted to slow down at the curve, he stated due to the wet road conditions his vehicle slide off the road and into a tree. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy damage to passenger side front end and was towed from the scene.
D1 stated she was turning into her parking spot when she turned to sharp and collided with v2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS EXITING ONTO N WALNUT ST FROM THE MCDONALDS PARKING LOT. D1 INDICATED THAT NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE WAS TURNING INTO MCDONALDS. D1 SAID AS HE BEGAN TO MAKE HIS LEFT TURN AND ENTER THE WESTERN NORTH BOUND LANE, HE WAS STRUCK BY V2. D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON WALNUT IN THE WESTERN LANE. HE SAID AS HE APPROACHED MCDONALDS, V1 PULLED OUT INTO TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HIM AND HE COULD NOT AVOID COLLISION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 was north bound on walnut street approaching the intersection of walnut and grimes. Driver 1 was in the eastern most lane of n walnut street. Driver 2 was easbound on Grimes passing through the intersection of grimes and walnut street. This is normally an intersection controlled with a traffic light but the traffic light was not functioning, and no colored lights were on at all, thus it should have been functioning as a 4 way stop. V1 entered the intersection and struck v2 in the front passenger side tire. D1 stated she was looking down at her phone and looked up thinking it as her turn to go and struck v2. D2 stated he was proceeding though the intersection and was struck by v1. V2 was nearly all the way though the intersection by the time v1 entered and struck him.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling south bound on South State Road 37 in the left lane. V2 was traveling south bound on South State Road 37 in the right lane. Traffic was merging from the right lane to the left lane due to construction blocking the right lane with barrels. V2 attempted to merge in front of V1 and side-swiped V1 on the passenger side. V2 then stuck a construction barrel and pulled to the side of the road.The witness stated V2 was traveling in the right lane at a high rate of speed to merge into traffic at the last opportunity before the right lane was blocked. She stated she was watching V2 and saw it merge into the side of V1.

Driver 2 stated he was stopped in traffic in the left lane of southbound SR 46 between 7th St and 3rd St. Driver two stated he was hit from behind by vehicle 1. Driver 1 stated she was behind vehicle 2 when she looked down for a second and when she looked up, traffic had stopped. Driver 1 stated she wasn't able to stop in time and collided with vehicle 2.
D1 stated he was backing out of his driveway and collided with v2.

Driver 2 stated he was at the gas pumps on the far eastern side of the lot at 4405 E 3rd St. Driver 2 stated he pulled away from the pumps to go west through the lot when vehicle 1 quickly backed away from the pump next to the one vehicle 2 had been at. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 backed into his vehicle. Vehicle 1 had sheets of drywall hanging several feet out the back of the truck bed and the drywall collided with the side of vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated he had pulled into the lot and was turning to pull up next to the gas pumps. Driver 1 stated he wasn't able to make the turn so he backed up to reposition. Driver 1 stated he did not see vehicle 2 approaching and collided with vehicle 2.

V1 and V2 were both traveling south on SR 45/46 approaching the intersection of SR 45/46 and 10th Street. The lighted signal was red for vehicles traveling south. All cars came to a stop. V1 was directly behind V2 in the left lane of travel. The light turned green, and V1 ran into the back of V2. D1 stated he wasn't really paying attention to the lighted signal, and had been thinking about work, and family life at home. D1 said he saw the cars in the right lane move out of the corner of his eye, and he hit the gas pedal to go. D1 said he quickly realized V2 was still stopped in front of him, but he didn't have time to react, and ran into the back of V2. D2 stated she was stopped in traffic, and was suddenly struck in the rear end by V1. V2 had light damage to the rear bumper, which also caused the back hatch to become very difficult to close. V1 had minor damage to the front bumper. Only paint transfer. Both D1 and D2 denied needing medical attention. The passenger in V2 also refused medical attention, but seemed to be rubbing her neck, so I again asked if she was sure she didn't need medical attention. And again, the passenger denied needing medical attention.

D1 WAS BACKING V1 INTO THE DRIVEWAY OF 6391 E COX RD WHEN THE LEFT REAR OF V1 STRUCK THE LEFT REAR OF V2 WHICH WAS PARKED IN THE DRIVEWAY UNOCCUPIED.THERE IS A SLIGHT SCUFF MARK TO THE LEFT REAR OF V2 AND NO DAMAGE VISIBLE TO V1.

D1 came into the Monroe County Sheriffs Office to report that she had struck a vehicle in the Kroger south parking lot with her vehicle. D1 did not notice she had damage until she returned home and discovered it. D1 stated that the other vehicle was a white passenger car driven by a female. D1 went back to Kroger to locate the vehicle but it was gone. As of now there is no other information on the other vehicle and no one has reported an accident at Kroger where one vehicle had left the scene.

D1 stated that he was traveling southbound on N College Street approaching the intersection of W 7th Street. D1 stated that he believes he entered the intersection when the traffic light was still yellow, but that he does not exactly remember and it is possible it had just turned red. D1 stated that he suddenly then collided with V2.D2 stated that she was stopped at the traffic light on W 7th Street waiting to travel west through N College Avenue. D2 stated that she began to drive forward right as the traffic light turned green, and then V2 was struck by V1 on the passenger side. D2 believes that V1 ran the red light. D1 chose to have AAA tow V1 due to damage. D2 drove V2 off the scene.

Vehicle 1 was traveling west on 3rd Street approaching Jordan Avenue in the north lane. Vehicle 2 was traveling west on 3rd Street approaching Jordan Avenue in the south lane. Driver 1 stated his GPS told him he missed his turn. He advised he attempted to make a last minute turn south on Jordan Avenue and did not see Vehicle 2 until he struck them in the front passenger door.Driver 2 stated she was going straight when Vehicle 1 turned in front of her at the last second. She advised that she hit her horn and hit her brakes but was unable to stop in time. Driver 2 advised Vehicle 1 struck her with the front driver's side of the vehicle.No one involved complained of injuries.There was damage to the front driver's side bumper of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the front passenger side door.

D2, D3, AND D4 ALL STATED THAT THEY WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS GOING THE SPEED LIMIT AND ALL OF A SUDDEN, V2 STOPPED AND D1 STATED HE DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO STOP AND V1 REAR ENDED V2. WHICH CAUSED V2 TO REAR END V3 AND THEN CAUSED V3 TO REAR END V4.V1 AND V2 WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND LOGGED INTO EVIDENCE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was northbound on Union Valley attempting to turn left across traffic into the Richland Plaza Parking lot. D1 was turning across from W Lynwest Dr. D1 stated that a vehicle had stopped short so that he had enough room to cross traffic to make his turn. D1 stated that he did not see V2 in the right hand southbound lane of Union Valley and was unsure there was a right hand lane there. As D1 crossed traffic he struck the left front fender and drivers door area of V2.D2 stated that he was traveling southbound on Union Valley Rd approaching SR 46 intersection. D2 stated that as he was traveling SB on Union Valley he was struck in the drivers door area by V1. D2 was i the right hand lane that allows you to turn right or go straight across SR 46.

D1 was traveling the wrong way in a one way Southbound, on Henderson street approaching the intersection of 2nd street and Henderson street. D1 did not stop, and as a result, D2 collided into the front passenger side of V1 as he was attempting to travel East. D2 stated that D1 did not stop and she was traveling South in a one way North, and as a result she entered the roadway in front of him and he collided into the front passenger side of the her vehicle. D1 did not realize she was traveling the wrong way in a one way. Neither vehicle was towed and there were no injuries.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: South Sare Road is a local, city road that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County, Indiana. East Cathcarst Street is also a local, city street that runs in an eastern and western direction and intersects with South Sare Road. On this day it was approaching dusk and the roadway was dry. The crash scene was in the city limits.Vehicle #1 (2012 Black Mercedes) was facing east bound and stopped on East Cathcarst Street at South Sare Road. Vehicle #2 (2015 White GMC 1500) was south bound on South Sare Road approaching East Cathcarst Street. Vehicle # 1 pulled out and turned left at the intersection and was struck by Vehicle #2 with the front driver's side bumper in the rear driver's side tire. Vehicle #1 came to a controlled stop on the right side of South Sare Road facing northeast. Vehicle #2 came to a controlled stop in the intersection of South Sare Road and East Cathcrast Street facing south.Driver #1 (Xiyan Liu) stated he stopped at the stop sign at the intersection, looked both ways and started to pull out when his vehicle was struck by Vehicle #2 in the driver's side rear tire. Driver #1 also stated that he did not see Vehicle #2 when he was stopped at the stop sign. Driver #2 (Jonathan L. Holmgren) stated he was south bound on South Sare Road when Vehicle #1 pulled out in front of him after stopping at the stop sign. Driver #2 stated that he was traveling approximately the speed limit of 35 mph.Witness #1 stated that she was in the passenger seat of Vehicle #2. As Vehicle #2 was coming up to the intersection, Vehicle #1 pulled out in front of them, causing Vehicle #2 to hit Vehicle #1 in the rear driver's side tire with the front driver's side bumper.I arrived and observed Vehicle #1 pulled off the road way on the right side of South Sare Road. The driver's side rear tire of Vehicle #1 was bent and the vehicle had damage to the body around the tire. Vehicle #2 was still in his lane facing south on South Sare Road. The front driver side bumper had been damaged in the crash. It appeared that Vehicle #1 had turned from the stop sign in front of Vehicle #2 with not enough time to clear Vehicle #2. Vehicle #2 then struck Vehicle #1 in the rear driver's side tire.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON OLD SR 37 APPROX 500 FT N OF W GOURLEY PIKE. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT OLD SR 37 WAS CLOSED AND UNDER CONSTRUCTION. THE ROAD WAS MOSTLY DIRT AND THERE WERE DEEP DITCHES ALONG THE ROAD. V1 WENT OFF OF THE LEFT (WEST) SIDE OF THE ROAD INTO A DITCH WHERE THE DRIVER SIDE STRUCK A LARGE CONCRETE PIPE THAT WAS STANDING VERTICALLY.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS NB ON OLD SR 37 TRYING TO GET THROUGH TO THE PARK. D1 STATED THAT, AS HE DROVE NB, HIS VEHICLE WENT OFF THE LEFT (WEST) SIDE OF THE ROAD. D1 STATED THAT HE THEN CLIMBED OUT OF V1 THROUGH THE DRIVER WINDOW AND FELL INTO THE LARGE CONCRETE PIPE WHICH WAS APPROXIMATELY 5 FT DEEP AND HAD A HARD BOTTOM.WHILE BEING SEEN BY AMBULANCE STAFF, IT APPEARED THAT D1 HAD SUFFERED A BROKEN L LEG FROM HIS FALL FROM THE VEHICLE. D1 ALSO HAD MINOR ABRASIONS ON HIS ARMS AND THE TOP OF HIS HEAD.

D1 did not provide any information involving the accident. W1 stated that V1 ran off the road and hit V2. W1 stated that the male looked like he overdosed before running off the road and hitting V2. W1 stated that V1 ran off the road from W 2nd Street into the parking lot of 1185 W 2nd Street. V1 then traveled south through the parking lot when it struck V2.D1 did refuse a chemical test and a blood draw was completed.

V1 was traveling eastbound on 17th Street. V2 was traveling westbound on 17th street.D1 stated he was driving east on 17th Street intending to turn into the parking lot of 1413 E 17th Street. D1 stated he saw V2 traveling west towards him, but thought he could complete the turn in time. D1 stated as he was about to finish the turn, the front passenger corner of V2 struck the rear passenger quarter panel of V1.D2 said she was traveling west on 17th Street about to pass 1413 E 17th Street. D2 said that V1 suddenly made a left turn in front of her into the parking lot. D2 said she was traveling at approximately 30mph and did not have time to avoid the collision. V1 sustained damage to the rear, passenger side bumper. V2 sustained damage to the front, passenger side bumper.

D1 is unknown, LSAD2 stated V2 was parked in the parking lot at 309 N. Walnut St. While she was eating dinner. D2 stated when she came out she was told a white Dodge Charger had made contact with the drivers side of her vehicle causing damage. D2 was unable to obtain any plate information from V1.

The crash involved a red Ford (V1), driven by Julie Hoff, and a red Toyota (V2), driven by Nesrin Omer (D2). None of the parties involved complained on any injuries at the scene.D1 stated she was driving west on 3rd St near Swain Ave in the right lane of traffic when V2 approached at around 50mph and struck the driver side front fender of her car. D1 stated that she was attempting to continue straight in her lane when she was crashed into.D2 stated that she was driving west on 3rd St near Swain Ave in the left lane of traffic when V1 attempted to either change lanes into the left lane or make a left turn onto Swain Ave. As V1 was doing so, they crash in the passenger side front fender of V2. D2 stated she was just trying to continue straight in her lane of traffic.There were no tire marks to suggest a high rate of speed for either car and the final resting place for both vehicles was within approximately seven feet of each other. Both vehicles ended up in the left lane of traffic with V1 resting its driver side front tire on the left curb.V1 sustained heavy damage to the driver side front tire and entire front bumper. V2 sustained moderate damage to the passenger side front door and fender. V2 also had much previous damage all around the vehicle.V1 was towed by Bland's Towing and V2 was able to be driven from the scene.

Other location of investigation: Driver#1 (Darian C Gibbons) was transported from the crash scene to IU Bloomington Hospital to be interviewed and evaluated. Driver#1 stated that he could not remember how the crash occurred. Driver#1 declined to do standard field sobriety tests. A search warrant was obtained for Driver#1's blood and a medical evaluation was conducted. Primary Cause- Driver Factor- Improper Lane Usage- Driver#1 was not properly using the left lane and drifted out of the lane and struck Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3 that were parked. Driver#1 should have used the left lane properly to avoid striking Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3.Walnut Street is a two lane one way street with lane markings in Monroe County. The speed limit is 30 miles per hour and the roadway is straight in this area. The area has street lights and it was dark at the time of the crash. Vehicle#1 (Black 2012 Ford Mustang) was traveling northbound in the left lane on Walnut Street just north of 15th Street at an unknown speed. Vehicle#1 drifted out of the left lane, struck Vehicle#2 (Silver 2018 Hyundai Accent) and Vehicle#3 (Black 2015 Toyota Corolla) and then overturned 180 degrees coming to final rest facing northeast. At the time of the crash, Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3 were unoccupied and properly parked on the west side of the roadway on Walnut Street.Driver #1 stated he could not remember how the crash occurred.I observed no skid marking in the roadway or any private property damage. Vehicle#1 had heavy damage to the front left side. Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3 had heavy rear end damage consistent with Vehicle#1 striking both Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3 from the rear. Vehicle#1 came to a final rest facing northeast on its top after striking both Vehicle#2 and Vehicle#3. Driver#1 was a habitual traffic violator and operating while intoxicated. This incident is documented under criminal incident 19ISPC010019. This crash is still under investigation. A supplemental report will be submitted documenting the following information:1.) Toxicology results

V2 WAS GOING WB ON W SR 46 AT THE N CENTENNIAL DR INTERSECTION WHEN V1 CAME UP BEHIND HIM. D1 STATED HE WAS FALLING ASLEEP AT THE WHEEL AND RAN INTO THE REAR END OF V2. THERE WAS SLIGHT DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END OF V1.V2 HAD BODY DAMAGE TO THE LEFT REAR PORTION OF THE REAR BUMPER AND THE TRUNK LOOKED OUT OF PLACE FROM THE BODY ON THE RIGHT SIDE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: WHILE HEADING WEST ON 4TH ST, V1 SLOWED DOWN AND THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE CROSSWALK. V1 THEN COLLIDED WITH V2 CAUSING INJURY.WHILE HEADING SOUTH ON THE B-LINE TRAIL, V2 FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY, PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND THEN COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V1. D1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING WEST, HE SLOWED DOWN AND PROCEEDED THROUGH THE CROSSWALK WHEN V2 HIT HIS CAR. D2 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH ON THE B-LINE TRAIL IT WAS HIS FAULT THAT HE DIDN'T STOP. HE ADMITTED THAT HE DIDN'T YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY, PROCEEDING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WHERE HE COLLIDED WITH V1 CAUSING INJURY TO HIMSELF. W1 STATED THAT WHILE ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE CROSSWALK, THEY OBSERVED V1 SLOW DOWN AND THEN PROCEED THROUGH THE CROSSWALK. THEY THEN OBSERVED V2 DRIVE THE SCOOTER INTO THE INTERSECTION WITH NO REGARD TO THE VEHICLE ON THE STREET THEREFORE COLLIDING WITH V1.

The scene of the crash was the four-way intersection of Kirkwood Avenue, where Adams Street travels north and 3rd Street travels south. In this area, Kirkwood Avenue is a multi-lane, two way road. There are two lanes on westbound Kirkwood Avenue. The left lane of westbound Kirkwood is a "turn left only" lane, while traffic in the right lane can either turn left, go straight, or turn right. There are two southbound lanes of 3rd Street, so that traffic in both the left and right lanes of westbound Kirkwood Avenue can turn left into the corresponding lane. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the roadway was dry.Vehicle #1 (white Infinity) was traveling westbound, in the left lane, on Kirkwood Avenue at the intersection of 3rd Street. Vehicle #2 (white Volkswagon Jetta) was also traveling westbound, but in the right lane, on Kirkwood Avenue at the same intersection. Both V#1 and V#2 were making left hand turns (traveling in a southwest direction) onto 3rd Street. V#1 made a wide turn, drifting from the left lane into the right lane. As V#1 drifted into the right lane, it struck V#2 in the driver's side front quarter panel.Driver #1 (Gwendolyn Berry-Firnbach) stated she was in the left lane of Kirkwood Avenue, turning left onto 3rd Street. She advised she did not know that there were two left turn lanes, but still thought she stayed in her left lane during the turn.Driver #2 (Joshua Olmsted) stated that he was in the right lane of Kirkwood Avenue, turning left onto 3rd Street. He advised that V#1 drifted into his lane and struck V#2.The passenger of V#1 also told me that D#1 did drift into the right lane as she completed her turn.None of the occupants in either vehicle were injured. Both vehicles sustained minor damage and were able to be driven from the scene.

On 08/25/2019 I was just west of the intersection of Range Road and 10th Street on 10th Street clearing debris out of the road way. There were several wooden fence posts in the roadway. There were several vehicles backed up behind my squad car and V1 was attempting to drive around my vehicle slowly going eastbound on 10th Street. The vehicle rolled over several of the posts before I could clear them out of the roadway and one of the posts got stuck under the vehicle. D1 removed the post from the car and then noticed a noise coming from the driver's side front tire. The noise was air being released from the tire. I inspected the tire and saw that there was a nail in it and that was the cause of the noise.The nail most likely came from the wooden post that was in the roadway. The vehicle was parked in a valid spot.

V1 and V2 were traveling southbound on SR 46. V2 was stopped in traffic. V1 struck V2 in the rear.D1 stated that she did not realize traffic was stopped and was unable to avoid striking V2.D2 stated that she was stopped and was struck from behind by V1.V1 did strike V2 in the rear causing damage to both vehicles.

D1 stated he saw the light turn green and thought that V2 was moving. D1 stated he tried to stop but struck V2 in the rear. D2 stated she was starting to move due to the light turning green and then was struck in the rear by V1.

V1 and V2 were raveling northbound on Sare Rd. V2 stopped at a crosswalk and was struck from behind by V1.D1 and D2 stated that they were traveling northbound on Sare Rd. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH NORTH DRIVE. V1 was parked on the east side of Mitchell street and was in front of V2, which was parked on the west side of Mitchell street. On 08/27/2019 at around 1808 hours, an officer going off duty called out with a crash at 17th Street and Jordan Avenue. I arrived to take over for that officer. I spoke with D2 who stated she was facing westbound on 17th Street attempting to turn left into a private drive to 1305 N. Jordan Avenue. D2 stated she was completely stopped when she saw V1 coming up behind her and he was not stopping. V1 then struck V2. V2 sustained damage to the lower passenger side bumper. There were several dents and scratches on the bumper and the exhaust pipe on the lower passenger side was bent downward.I then spoke with D1 who immediately stated he had been having brake problems for a while now. D1 stated he had brake fluid stored in his trunk because he had to continuously fill his brake fluid. D1 stated he had made a complete stop at the Jordan Avenue stop sign and waited to turn left (west) onto 17th Street. D1 stated that he thought it was safe to turn so, as he began turning, he noticed V2 stopped in the roadway. D1 stated he tried to stop but stated his brake lines went out again and he rear-ended V2. V1 sustained damage to the front driver's side. The driver's side headlight was cracked and pushed inward. The bumper was also crumpled and cracked. The hood was bent and pushed upward. I noticed a small amount of liquid coming out from under the front of the vehicle but I could not tell if it was brake fluid or if it was just water from the air conditioning. V1 was towed from the scene by Chandler's.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

She was unable to avoid striking the bike. D1 also stated it appeared the bicyclist could not stop prior to entering the intersection.The bicyclist advised he was unable to stop at the intersection due to the wet roadway and was struck by V1 as he was going thru the intersection.

V1 REAR ENDED V2 DUE TO STOP AND GO TRAFFIC AND WAS UNABLE TO BRAKE IN TIME.V1 HAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER. V2 HAS DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER. D2 WAS TREATED ON SCENE AND THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL D2 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER BACK AND RIGHT SIDE OF HER BODY.

V1 then struck the rear of V2 which was parked just south of V1. The force of this impact pushed V2 into the driver's side of V3 which was parked to the right of V2. V2 was also pushed into the Tow Time building resulting in damage to both V2 and the building. V2 and V3 were unoccupied at the time. All of this occurred in the Tow Time Parking lot which is private property.
