On Tuesday, August 27, 2019 at 14:53, Michael Clephane responded to a crash on I69 southbound near the 121.5 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. D1 was offered a PBT test at the scene at approximately 15:07, and the results were 0.000Vehicle 1, blue Toyota, was traveling south on I 69, in the far left hand lane, near the 121.5 MM when for unknown reasons left the roadway to the left. V1 tapped the guardrail and careened back across all three lanes of southbound I 69 and off the roadway to the west, down an embankment and into the tree line. D1, Carolyn D. Webster, stated she was not sure of what happened. D1 said she remembered she was traveling south on I 69 and everything was fine, and then she was in the tree line. D1 said she was traveling from the New Palestine area to her doctor's appointment in Bedford, IN at the time of the crash. W1, Rebecca Gallagher, who was also traveling south on I 69 just behind V1 stated the following: V1 swerved to left side of road towards the guardrail. V1 spun and careened off roadway to the right and down the embankment and came to rest in the trees. W1 said when she stopped and got out of her vehicle, D1 was screaming for help and she and others helped walk D1 up the hillside.D1 had unsafe lane movement as V1 left the roadway for unknown reasons, which initiated the crash.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON N TUNNEL ROAD, WENT THROUGH A CURVE, LOST CONTROL AND RAN OFF THE ROAD.D1 STATED THAT THE REAR END OF HIS VEHICLE BEGAN TO SLIDE AND HE WENT OFF THE ROAD.IT WAS RANING AND THE ROAD WAS SLICK DURING THE TIME OF THE WRECK.

Officer McGlohn helped direct traffic away from the scene of the crash to protect the scene. Officer Lewis took pictures of the crash which are attached to the case.D1 was in the south most lane on Atwater Avenue traveling east. D2 was traveling south on Jordan Avenue.D1 stated she was driving eastbound on Atwater Avenue. D1 had very little recollection of the event and was unaware of how fast she was going and did not know if she had a red or green light. D1 stated that she was driving straight and believes she was struck by D2. D1 stated she was wearing her seat belt. V1 was towed due to disabling damage. V1 had severe damage on her driver side front door and across the front of the vehicle. D1 had complaint of pain on her neck, chest, and knees. D1 was assessed by EMS on scene but refused transport. D2 stated he was headed southbound on Jordan Avenue. D2 stated that he had a green light and was driving straight at approximately 15-20 miles per hour when V2 pulled in front of him. D2 stated he believed D1 struck his vehicle traveling at a high rate of speed. D2 stated he was wearing his seat belt. V2 was towed to disabling damage. D2 had severe damage across the entire front bumper of his vehicle. D1 did not complain of pain and was not treated on scene. Other Participant 1 (OP1) stated she was facing east on Atwater Avenue stopped at the red light displayed. OP1 stated that she saw V1 run the red light and drive in front of D1. OP1 stated that D2 had the green light. OP1 stated that because V1 pulled out in front of V2, V2 struck the driver side of V1 with the front bumper. OP1 did not know or give an estimate of how fast V1 or V2 traveled. Both vehicles were towed by Chandlers Towing due to disabling damage.OP1 had a passenger in the car who reaffirmed the statements that OP1 made. The evidence of the vehicles indicated that D2 struck D1 due to D1 running the red light.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND MOORES PIKE APPROACHING COLLEGE MALL RD.D1 SAID HER BRAKES WERE NOT WORKING WELL AND SHE WAS NOT GOING TO GET STOPPED BEFORE THE INTERSECTION SO SHE SWERVED TO THE RIGHT STRIKING A PEDESTRIAN CROSSING SIGNAL POST.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was stopped facing south on Milo B Sampson Ln waiting to turn eastbound onto SR 45/46. V2 was traveling westbound on SR 45/46 in the right lane approaching Milo B Sampson Ln. V3 was traveling eastbound on SR 45/46 in the left lane approaching Milo B Sampson Ln.D1 stated he was traveling southbound on Milo B Sampson Ln approaching SR 45/46 and stopped at the stop sign at the intersection. D1 stated he wanted to turn eastbound onto SR 45/46 and proceeded into the intersection. D1 stated he misjudged the distance between himself and V2 and began his turn. D1 stated he pulled out in front of V2 and collided with V2 and then does not remember what else happened. V1 had heavy front-end damage. V1 was towed from the roadway.D2 stated she was traveling westbound on SR 45/46 in the right lane approaching Milo B Sampson Ln when she observed V1 at the stop sign. D2 stated she saw V1 edge closer into her lane of traffic and began to swerve into the left lane in an attempt to avoid a collision. D2 stated that V1 then proceeded into the intersection and collided with her vehicle. D2 stated she attempted to swerve into the center turn lane and was unsuccessful. D2 stated after V1 collided with her, V1 then went into oncoming lanes and collided with V3. D2 stated that V1 went across four lanes of traffic and into the westbound lanes and ended up approximately 300 feet from the initial crash. D1 will be contacted to provide insurance information.D3 stated she was traveling eastbound on SR 45/46 in the left lane approaching Milo B Sampson Ln when V1 collided with her head-on. D3 stated she saw V1 coming towards her and wondered why the vehicle was not stopping. D3 stated was unable to avoid the collision.W1 stated he was on SR 45/46 facing east in the center turn lane when the collision occurred. W1 stated that V1 was on Milo B Sampson Ln attempting to turn onto SR 45/46. W1 stated that V2 was traveling westbound on SR 45/46 in the right lane. W1 stated V3 was traveling eastbound on SR 45/46 in the left lane. W1 stated that V1 had entered the intersection in front of V2 and collided with V2. W1 stated that after V1 collided with V2, V1 proceeded into the eastbound lanes and swerved to miss a vehicle. W1 stated that after V1 swerved to miss a vehicle in the eastbound lane, V1 collided with V3 head-on. W1 stated that V1 proceeded into the westbound lanes and came to a stop near the intersection of Dunn Street and SR 45/46.The evidence gathered at the scene corroborate W1's version of events.08/30/2019 SUPPLEMENT: D1's insurance information was added to the case.

D2 STATED SHE WAS HEADED EAST ON SR46W IN THE NORTH LANE WHEN V1 WHO WAS IN THE SOUTH LANE PULLED INTO HER LANE STRIKIKNG THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER WITH THE LEFT REAR OF THE THE TRAILER V1 WAS TOWING. On Friday, August 30, 2019 at 06:52, Mark Clephane responded to a crash on N Gates Dr south of the intersection of W Jacob Dr. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. Trp. Daniel Crozier PE 7883 assisted in this crash investigation and took photographs. The vehicles had been moved from the roadway to the parking lot across SR 48 from the location of the crash prior to this unit's arrival. S/Trp Mark Raper PE 6473 had arrived prior to my arrival and checked the truck and determined that it did not meet the criteria for a commercial motor vehicle and did not require an inspection.Vehicle 1, white Dodge Charger, Indiana State Police commission #3581 mileage 60752 was being operated by Trp. Richard Klun PE 8503 and was going straight south on Gates Drive South of Jacob Drive. This unit administered a PBT to Trp. Klun with a result of 0.00.Vehicle 2, yellow International 430 Box Truck, was being operated by Michael Abbitt southbound on Gates Drive next to Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 turned on his left turn signal and then proceeded to move into the right lane with the passenger side middle of the truck striking the front left of Vehicle 1.Driver 2, Abbitt, stated that he was going south on Gates Drive and that he turned on his turn signal and did not see Vehicle 1 veer around him. Driver 2 said that his passenger side struck Vehicle 1. When asked about wearing a seat belt, Driver 2 stated that he did not have a seat belt of any kind on at the time of this crash. When asked a second time if no lap nor shoulder belt was in use at the time of this crash, Driver 2 again said that he was not wearing any kind of restraint.Driver 1, Klun, stated that he had been behind Vehicle 2 and that Driver 1 turned on his turn signal then moved into the right lane on Gates Drive. As Vehicle 1 came beside Vehicle 2, Vehicle 2 came over into Vehicle 1's lane and the right middle of Vehicle 2 struck the left front of Vehicle 1.Vehicle 1 is equipped with an in-car camera system that captured this crash on video. In the video Vehicle 1 is in the right lane and coming up beside Vehicle 2 in the left lane. Vehicle 2 comes over into the right lane and strikes Vehicle 1. As the crash progresses it is seen on the video that Vehicle 2 had turned his left turn signal on, however Vehicle 2 moved into the right lane causing this crash.The cause of this crash is Vehicle 2's unsafe lane movement.

Walnut Street is a local two lane roadway in the city of Bloomington that is a one way and runs in a Northern direction. 15th Street is a local two lane roadway that is located in the city of Bloomington and runs in a Eastern to Western direction. The roadway was dry and clear of debris at the time of the accident. The roadway is straight with no grade. The crash occurred at night and was dark with street lights. V2 (2012 White Chevy Captiva) was traveling north on Walnut Street in the right lane. V1 (2005 White Honda Accord) was also traveling north bound in the left lane of Walnut Street. V1 then attempted to merge into the right lane to turn off of Walnut Street. V1 then struck V2 on the driver side back passenger door with the front right corner of the front bumper. D1(Venessa Scott) stated that she was traveling approximately 40MPH north on Walnut Street in the left lane. She stated that she was traveling home and needed to turn off of Walnut Street on the right. She said she attempted to merge into the right lane and struck V2. D2(Sierra Witham) was traveling northbound on Walnut Street in the right lane. She stated she was driving straight in the right lane and did not notice V1 trying to merge and struck her vehicle. During the course of my investigation I observed a dent in the driver side passenger door of V2 and damage to the right corner of the front bumper of V1.

V2 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC HEADING WB. D2 WAS UNABLE TO ADVISE WHAT COLOR THE LIGHT WAS.V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W 3RD ST, D1 ADIVSED BOTH VEHS WERE IN THE CENTER LANE WB. D1 ADVISED V2 SLAMMED ON THE BRAKES AND STOPPED DUE TO TRAFFIC, D1 ADVISED THEY ATTEMPTED TO STOPPED BUT WHEN D1 APPLIED THE BRAKES ITEMS ON HIS LAP FELL TO THE FLOOR BOARD AND HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME. V1 REAR ENDED V2. D2 ADVISED V2 WAS ALREADY STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN V2 REAR ENDED HIM. D2 ADVISED HE SAW V1 APPROACHING AND BELIEVED HE WAS TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED THAT PREVENTED HIM FROM STOPPING IN TIME. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V1 AND THE REAR OF V2. BOTH DRIVERS DECLINED AMBULANCE AND TOW TRUCK.

On Friday, August 30, 2019 at 16:00, I, Trp. Samuel Wagner, was dispatched to a crash on State Road 48 at the intersection of S Hickory Dr., Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana. I arrived to the location of the crash at approximately 16:05. Both vehicles were pulled off the road into the parking lot of the Old National Bank located at 4191 West 3rd Street. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. State Road 48, in the area where the crash occurred, is a primarily east-west 4 lane divided highway, with center turn lane. Approximately 830 feet to the east is a major intersection where SR 48 intersects with Curry PIke, a local 4 lane undivided highway that runs primarily north-south. Both drivers were wholly uninjured and refused medical treatment. Vehicle 1 (V1), a white Nissan passenger car, had sustained substantial damage to the front end, with the grill smashed and pushed into the radiator, the hood buckled, and damage to the headlights and bumper. Vehicle 2 (V2), a maroon Ford SUV, had sustained damage to the rear bumper and showed white paint transfer marks. Both vehicles were drivable and did not require towing. There were no readily apparent skid marks or debris on the roadway. The traffic at this time of day was heavy in all directions. When interviewing both drivers, their statements about what had occurred were both virtually identical, and are given as follows: V1, a white Nissan passenger car, bearing Indiana registration TMO220, and driven by Driver 1 (D1), Maureen Langley, was going east in the left of two eastbound lanes, when it encountered a large amount of slowed and stopped traffic approaching the intersection of SR 48 and Curry Pike. V2, a maroon Ford Escape, bearing Indiana temporary plates K598115, was driven by D2, Mabel Smith, and had recently come to a complete stop in the left lane prior to the collision. V1 began slowing behind V2, which was stopped due to the heavy traffic waiting at the intersection to the east. However, as the traffic moved forward slightly, D2 briefly released the brakes, causing the brake lights to cease being illuminated. D1, who stated that she was distracted at that moment, said that she only 'registered that D2's brake lights were not illuminated', so she assumed she was still moving forward and was not stopped, and accelerated forward, colliding with the rear end of V2, which had begun applying the brakes again, coming to a full stop. Driver 2 agreed that she had simply released the brakes to move forward slightly before reapplying them when she felt a collision from the rear. Both drivers had then moved their vehicles out of the roadway to the parking lot adjacent to the intersection of SR 48 and Hickory Drive. There were no witnesses that remained to make a statement regarding the collision. Based upon my investigation, the evidence at the scene, and the statements of both drivers, which agreed with one another, it likely that the following occurred; due to distraction and following too closely, V1 failed to yield to slowing and stopped traffic, colliding with the rear of V2, which had only briefly released the brakes and was at or nearly at a complete stop in heavy traffic, waiting for a red light to change. As such, D1 is primarily at fault for the collision.

D1 advised that he was driving eastbound on East 10th Street approaching the intersection with North Union Street. D1 stated that V2, which was ahead of him, also eastbound, stopped in traffic. D1 stated that he applied his brakes, but was unable to stop before rear-ending the stopped V2. D2 stated that he had stopped in traffic at the intersection of East 10th Street with North Union to allow the car ahead of him to turn. While D2 was stopped in traffic, V2 was rear-ended by V1. There was no damage to V1 from the collision. V2 had scuffs and marks on the rear center and passenger side rear bumper. After the crash, both drivers pulled into the parking lot of Village Pantry where they contact IUPD. I spoke with both drivers and inspected their vehicles at that location. D2 complained of pain in his neck. IU Health Bloomington Hospital paramedics examined D2 at the scene. He was not transported and signed a release form. D1 advised that he had just purchased V1 the previous evening and had not yet registered the vehicle or purchased insurance. After speaking with D1, he obtained auto insurance through Progressive while at the scene and agreed to leave the vehicle parked and avoid driving the vehicle until he a temporary plate or had his current license plate transferred to the vehicle. As of the time of the crash, V1 did not have valid insurance. I issued D1 a citation for Operating without Proof of Financial Responsibility, 9-25-8-2.

On 08/31/2019, at 1041 hours, I was dispatched to 910 East 17th Street, the Marching Hundred Hall, to take a report of a hit-and-run to a parked vehicle.When I arrived, I spoke with Ben Handel, the owner of a gray 2015 Dodge Grand Caravan. Handel stated that he parked his van on the east side of the Marching Hundred Hall around 0900 hours this morning, facing west. When he returned to his van around 1040 hours, he found a large dent to the rear hatch of the van in the center to driver side of the hatch. The damage was high up and the bumper was intact, making it appear to have been struck by a taller vehicle. Once I returned to station, I checked nearby video cameras, but none show the area where Handel's van was parked. There are no witnesses and no leads at this time.

According to witness and complainant, V1 was stolen by unknown male. V1 reversed, striking V2 in the rear passenger side scraping the fender. V1 then reversed into V3 into the driver's side door and the driver's side front bumper. There is a dent in the driver's door of V3 and the front driver's side bumper was pushed in. According to the witness, V1 then drove north out of the neighborhood and, as of the time of this report, has not been located.

The individual in possession of V2, Elizabeth Milligan, stated that it was parked on the fifth floor of the Park on Morton parking garage at 710 N Morton Street. V2 was pulled forward into parking spot #281 facing south. V2 appeared to have been struck on the rear passenger side and was pushed to the east. V2 has damage to the rear passenger side and there was debris on the ground. There appeared to be white paint transfer on the damage to V1.Milligan stated that V2 was last seen with no damage at 12:00am on 8/31/2019 and the damage was discovered at 12:00pm on 8/31/2019. There are no known suspects at this time. There are no cameras on the fifth floor of the parking garage.

Primary Cause- Driver- Factor- Improper Lane usage- Driver#1 (unknown) was traveling eastbound in Vehicle#1 (unknown make or model) on 8th Street just east of Walnut Street and drifted out of the lane and struck Vehicle#2 that was properly parked and unoccupied at the time of the collision on the south side of 8th Street. Driver#1 should have used the lane properly to avoid striking Vehicle#2.In this section of 8th Street in Monroe County 8th street is a straight and level street with no lane markings. The speed limit is 30 miles per hour. The area has street lights and it was dark at the time of the crash. 8th Street is a one way roadway eastbound. Vehicle#1 (unknown make or model) was traveling eastbound on 8th street appropriately 108 feet east of Walnut Street and struck the left side of Vehicle#2 (Gray 2011 Honda CR-V). Vehicle#1 then left the scene.This action caused deep gouge markings and scratches to the left side of Vehicle#2. At the time of the crash, Vehicle#2 was unoccupied and properly parked on the south side of 8th Street. Driver#1 or Vehicle#1 was not located after the crash.The owner of Vehicle#2 (Faisal Ahmed Rasooli) stated that he parked Vehicle#2 on the south side of 8th Street on August 30, 2019 at approximately 6:30 P.M. On August 31, 2019 at approximately 2:31 A.M. he stated that he went to check on his car and noticed that it had been side swiped on the left side. Nobody witnessed the crash occur. I observed no damage to the roadway or any private property damage.

V1 was parked in the southwest side of the blue lot (the blue lot is just south of Wilkinson Hall) facing north. V2 was backing up going south in the southwest side of the blue lot. D1 stated that his vehicle was parked in the southwest side of the blue lot. D1 stated he returned to his vehicle at approximately 2155 hours and noticed his passenger side front door would not open. D1 stated he did not see any vehicles around the scene of the crash and did not find any driver's information on or near his vehicle. D1 stated he did not see who hit his vehicle. There was visible damage to the passenger side front door which would not open. There was white paint transfer on the front passenger side quarter panel. Other Participant 1 (OP1) stated he saw a white SUV back into V1 and then exited the parking lot westbound onto 17th Street. There are no known suspects at the time. There were no reported injuries. Photographs of the damage were taken.

Interstate 69 in the area of the 116 mile marker, is located in Monroe County Indiana, is straight, with a slight grade and has 3 lanes in both directions, separated by a concrete wall. Vehicle 1 (Gray 2005 Chevrolet pickup) was traveling north on Interstate 69 around the 116 mile marker, in the center northbound lane. Vehicle 2 (Silver 2016 Nissan suv) was traveling north on Interstate 69 around the 116 mile marker, in the center northbound lane, in front of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 1 was traveling at an unsafe speed and ran into the rear of Vehicle 2, causing extensive damage to both vehicles. Driver 1 (Jacob Kindred) stated he was traveling north, came over the hill and there was Vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated he did not see if Vehicle 2 was applying any brakes prior to impact. Driver 1 stated he may have briefly dozed off prior to hitting Vehicle 2. Driver 2 (Gary Allen) stated he was traveling north and had his cruise set at the posted speed limit of 55 miles per hour. Driver 2 stated he looked in his rear view mirror and could see Vehicle 1 approaching him at a very high rate of speed. Driver 2 stated there was nothing he could do and Vehicle 1 slammed into the rear of him. Witness 1 (Danny Murray) stated he was traveling north on Interstate 69, in the far left lane, several 100 feet behind Vehicle 2. W1 stated that Vehicle 1 passed him at such a high rate of speed, that it scared him when he went by. W1 stated he witnessed Vehicle 1 never hit the brakes and slam into the rear of Vehicle 2. Based upon witness statements, driver statements, the fact that Vehicle 1 was traveling fast enough to hit a moving vehicle, going the same direction at the posted speed limit, to cause the amount of damage that it did and to transfer transmission fluid from Vehicle 1 all over the rear of Vehicle 2, I determine the primary cause of this crash to be unsafe speed by Driver 1. Driver 1 was offered a portable breath test and registered a .068%. Driver 1 did not show signs of intoxication.Driver 1 was cited for speed too fast to avoid collision. I.C. 9-21-5-1

D1 stated she was driving south on Fee Ln approaching 17th St. D2 stated he was stopped in the right lane facing south at the intersection of Fee Ln and 17th St on Fee Ln.D1 stated she was driving south on Fee Ln approaching 17th St when a water bottle in her car fell to the floorboard. D1 stated that when she went to brake to stop behind V2 the water bottle got stuck under her brake pedal and prevented her from stopping. D1 stated that she could not slow down due to the water bottle and she collided with V2's rear bumper. D2 stated that he was stopped at the intersection of Fee Ln and 17th St facing south on Fee Ln when V1 collided with his rear bumper.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE PRIVATE DRIVE IN FRONT OF 2539 EASTGATE LANE BETWEEN 1430 AND 1600 HOURS. V2 HAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER,GRILL, AND HOOD AREA. V2 WAS PARKED IN A PARALLEL PARKING SPOT. IT IS ASSUMED THAT V1 BACKED INTO V2 WHEN IT WAS ATTEMPTING TO LEAVE IT'S PARKING SPOT.

D2 stated that she was driving westbound on Eastland Plaza approaching the S College Mall Road intersection. D2 stated that the traffic control light at S College Mall Road was green for east and westbound traffic the entire time she saw it. D2 stated that as she was crossing the intersection, her passenger's side was struck by V1. V2 was incapacitated due to the damage to the passenger side and had to be towed. D1 stated that she was driving southbound on S College Mall Road, in the right lane, approaching Eastland Plaza. D1 stated that she was distracted by her stereo and she ran through the red traffic control signal. D1 stated multiple times that she was at fault and did not stop for the red signal. V1 had front end damage but did not require a tow on scene. No injuries were reported on scene from either vehicle.Supplement 1: V2 information was incorrect due to out of date registration being given to officer. V2 information corrected.

D2 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN NORTTHBOUND ON STANFORD ROAD FROM WEST STATE ROAD 45. D2 WAS OPERATING A TRACTOR. HE STUCK HIS LEFT ARM OUT TO SIGNAL THE INTENTION TO TURN. V1 WENT AROUND V2 TO PASS. D1 SAID HE DIDNT SEE D2 SIGNAL WITH HIS ARM. WHILE PASSING. V1 SIDE SWIPED THE TRACTOR

CYCLIST ADVISED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT STREET, NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION WITH BURKS DRIVE, ON THE SHOULDER OF THE ROAD. HE DECIDED TO TURN EAST(LEFT) AND DID NOT SEE V1 APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH. AS HE TURNED INTO THE ROADWAY, HE COLLIDED WITH V1. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST, NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION WITH BURKS DRIVE. D1 OBSERVED THE CYCLIST TRAVELLING SOUTH ON THE SHOULDER OF THE ROADWAY. AS V1 CAME ALONG SIDE THE CYCLIST, IT TURNED INTO THE PATH OF V1. D1 SWERVED TO THE LEFT INTO THE NORTH BOUND LANE, BUT COULD NOT AVOID HITTING THE CYCLIST.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHWEST ON SR 446 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SR 446 AND PINE GROVE RD WHEN D1 STATED A DEER JUMPED IN FRONT OF THE CAR CAUSING D1 TO LOSE CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. V1 RAN OFF THE ROAD JUST SOUTH OF PINE GROVE RD, HITTING THE CURB, AND HITTING THE BUILDING AT 4303 SR 446. V1 WENT THROUGH A CONCRETE WALL COMING TO REST APPROXIMATELY 40FT INSIDE. D1 AND PASSENGER 1 BOTH SUSTAINED INJURIES AND WERE TREATED ON SCENE BUT NOT TRANSPORTED.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT ST IN THE MIDDLE LANE. V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND IN THE LANE WEST OF V1. AFTER PASSING THE INTERSECTION OF WALNUT ST AND 7TH ST D1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN V1 LEFT INTO A PARKING LOT OF 309 N WALNUT ST. WHILE TURNING LEFT V1 COLLIDED INTO PASSENGER SIDE OF V2 WITH DRIVER SIDE OF V1. THE COLLISION CAUSED V2 TO STRIKE A CURB AND ENTER THE PARKING LOT BEFORE COMING TO A STOP.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON I-69, STATED SHE "SPUN OUT" SPINNING APPROXIMATELY 3 TIMES HITTING THE FRONT END AND REAR END OF V1 AGAINST THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADS GUARD RAIL. V1 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR END.

OWNER OF VEHICLE HAD PARKED HER VEHICLE IN THE QUARRY APARTMENT COMPLEX PARKING LOT ON SATURDAY (08/31/2019) AROUND MIDNIGHT AND RETURNED TO HER VEHICLE AROUND 3:00PM ON SUNDAY (09/01/2019). WHEN SHE RETURNED TO HER VEHICLE SHE NOTICED DAMAGE TO THE DRIVERS SIDE FRONT AND REAR DOORS CONSISTENT WITH A SIDESWIPE FROM ANOTHER VEHICLE. THERE ARE CAMERAS IN THIS PARKING LOT WHICH WILL BE REVIEWED TO FURTHER THIS INVESTIGATION.

D1 STATED HE KNEW HE WAS GOING TOWARDS SR 446 ON CHAPEL HILL AND THE NEXT THING HE KNEW HE WAS BEING TALKED TO BY THE OWNER OF THE PROPERTY HE HAD JUST DROVE THROUGH AND HE THOUGHT HE WAS ON A JOB SITE.V1 WAS DRIVEN SOUTH EAST OFF CHAPEL HILL ROAD THROUGH THE YARD OF 9745, HITTING THE LEAN-TO ON THE SHED AND THEN INTO A TREE IN THE BACK YARD. D1 STATED HE WAS ALRIGHT AND REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE.

D1 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR, IN THE SOUTH-MOST LANE. D1 STATED THAT THEY ATTEMPTED TO CHANGE LANES AND TURN LEFT IN TO THE NORTH-MOST LANE OF E 3RD ST. D1 STATED THEY LOOKED BACK TO THEIR BLIND SPOT, TAKING THEIR EYES OFF OF THE ROAD FOR A BRIEF MOMENT, WHILE CHANGING LANES. D1 STATED V1 THEN SOON AFTER STRUCK THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST IN THE NORTH-MOST LANE, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR. D2 STATED THEY WERE BEHIND V3 WHEN V3 SUDDENLY SLOWED THEIR VEHICLE, WHICH RESULTED IN V2 SUDDENLY SLOWING DOWN AS WELL; THIS CREATED A SPACE OF APPROXIMATELY 5 FEET BETWEEN THE FRONT OF V2 AND REAR OF V3. D2 STATED THEY WERE THEN STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY V1, WHICH MOVED V2 TO STRIKE THE REAR OF V3. D3 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR, IN THE NORTH-MOST LANE. D3 STATED AN UNKNOWN BLUE BMW VEHICLE WAS IN FRONT OF V3, WHICH SUDDENLY SIGNALED A LEFT TURN IN TO THE NEARBY BIG RED LIQOUR STORE AND CAME TO A SUDDEN STOP. THIS CAUSED D3 TO THEN SUDDENLY SLOWE THEIR VEHICLE TO A STOP. V3 WAS THEN STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY V2.

DRIVER 1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON MOORES PIKE AND LOOKING TO TURN LEFT, NORTH, ONTO FENBROOK LANE. HE REALIZED WHERE THE TURN WAS TOO LATE AND TURNED ANYWAYS, THINKING HE COULD MAKE IT ONTO FENBROOK SAFELY. WHEN HE TURNED HE TURNED HEAD ON INTO A "THE FIELDS" LIGHTED SIGN AND THROUGH THE SURROUNDING LANDSCAPING.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS PULLING INTO A PARKING SPOT NEXT TO VEHICLE 2 WHEN THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF VEHICLE 1 STRUCK THE OPENED DOOR OF VEHICLE 2. BOTH OCCUPANTS OF VEHICLE 2 ADVISED THE SAME INFORMATION AS WELL AS THE WITNESS FROM VEHICLE 1.

V1 was backing up from a parking space located at 1336 N Washington (facing southwest) when it backed into a garage door( causing damage) of an apartment located at 1333 N Washington street.1336 and 1333 N Washington have a shared parking lot. V1 then left the area and was stopped at the intersection of 19th and Washington. See related crash b19-36892.

V1 was turning left (southeast) in the shared parking lot of 1336 and 1333 North Washington Street after just being involved in a related collision ( b19-36887) at the same time and address. While turning left, V1 struck V2, which was parked facing southwest in the parking stall, on the back right tire, v1 backs up and then again pulls forward, striking V2 a second time on the right side of the rear bumper. V1 one back up and then pulls forward where he strikes V2 with V1 a third time. The third time V1 struck V2, V1's right headlight shattered and scraped the bumper of V2. V1 then left the area.

THE DRIVER OF UNIT ONE 1 WAS DELIVERING FOOD. WHEN THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A U-TURN AND ATTEMPTED TO BACK UP AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE MAILBOX AT 524 NORTH CHANDLER DRIVE. VERY LIGHT DAMAGE THE MAILBOX WAS SLIGHTLY LEANING. THE OWNER OF 524 NORTH CANDLER DRIVE IS GAYLE HIGGINS

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS NORTH BOUND THROUGH THE PARKING LOT OF 550 S LANDMARK AVENUE. D1 STOPPED AT A STOP SIGN AND DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 APPROACHING FROM THE WEST. AS D1 TURNED RIGHT(EAST), V2 COLLIDED WITH V1. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS EAST BOUND THROUGH THE PARKING LOT OF 550 S LANDMARK AVENUE. A V2 TRAVELLING EAST, V1 PULLED INTO HIS LANE OF TRAVEL. D2 COULD NOT AVOID COLLIDING WITH V1.

When I arrived on scene, both vehicles had been moved from where the crash took place. The crash involved a gray Jeep (V1), driven by Seth Sigel (D1), and a white BMW (V2), driven by Jango Glackin (D2). None of the parties involved in the crash complained of any injuries at the scene.Both drivers told the same story. V1 was following V2 east on 10th St when they came to a stop in the right turn lane at the red light at the 45/46 Bypass. V2 was going to make a right turn on red when it noticed other traffic had the right away and came to a stop. D1 stated he thought V2 was going to turn, but they stopped and he could not stop quickly enough. V1 rear ended V2.V1 sustained light damage to the front plastic bumper. V2 sustained moderate damage to the rear bumper.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON SR 46 APPROACHING 10TH ST. V2 WAS TRAVELING NB ON 46 JUST N OF V1. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TALKING ON THE PHONE GOING NB ON SR 46 APPROACHING 10TH ST WHEN D2 SUDDENLY STOPPED IN FRONT OF HIM. D1 STATED THAT HE HIT HIS BRAKES, BUT DID NOT STOP IN TIME AND THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS NB ON SR 46 APPROACHING 10TH ST AND WAS SLOWING DOWN TO COME TO A STOP IN TRAFFIC. D2 STATED THAT SHE SAW V1 APPROACHING HER VEHICLE QUICKLY AND SHE COULD SEE D1 ON THE PHONE. D2 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 CAUSING A COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HER NECK. D2 DENIED MEDICAL SERVICES AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.DAMAGE CAPTURED ON BWC 1613
V2 WAS PARKED IN THE JIFFY TREAT PARKING LOT. OWNER OF V2 WAS IN DRIVERS SEAT ATTEMPTING TO EAT HER ICE CREAM WHEN V1 PULLED IN. V1 ATTEMPTED TO TURN AROUND AND IN DOING SO HIT V2 WHILE BACKING UP.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was driving south on College Ave and was attempting to merge into the left turn lane. V2 was driving in the left turn lane driving straight. The front driver side of V1 collided with V2. V1 then pulled off of the roadway and V2 stopped behind them. D2 exited his vehicle, checked on D1 and then left the scene traveling south on College Avenue. D2 did not exchange information before leaving the scene. D1 stated that she was traveling south and attempting to change lanes so she could turn east on 3rd street. D1 stated that she collided with a black suv causing damage to her vehicle. The driver of the suv asked her if she was ok, checked his vehicle for damage and then left the scene.A license plate was obtained from the vehicle and the owner was unable to be contacted at this time.

Driver was attempting to turn off of That Rd into the parking lot of Clear Creek Trail. Driver was distracted and turned to soon before the driveway and ran off of the north side of the roadway. The vehicle went over a culvert pipe and into a small drainage ditch coming to rest i over the culvert pipe.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was attempting to turn eastbound onto 10th Street from Indiana Ave and V2 was driving northbound on Indiana Ave near the intersection of 10th and Indiana. V1 turned left onto 10th Street hitting the front end of V2. I first spoke to V1 who stated she had been trying to turn east on 10th Street in the left turn lane. V1 stated she saw the light turn green, and without thinking, believed she had the right away. V1 then turned left on 10th Street at the green and V1 struck the front end of V2. I then spoke to V2 who stated that she was heading north on Indiana Avenue. V2 stated she had a green light. As she was passing through the intersection, V2 stated she suddenly felt V1 strike the front end of V2.

D2 WAS HEADED WEST ON EAST 3RD STREET, IN THE FAR RIGHT LANE.D2 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, JUST WEST OF SOUTH CLARIZZ BOULEVARD, WHEN THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DISABLING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V2.D1 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON EAST 3RD STREET. D1 STATED THAT SHE LOOKED TO HER RIGHT, IN THE DIRECTION OF THE CAR LOT AT THIS INTERSECTION. D1 DID NOT REALIZE THAT V2 WAS STOPPED, SO THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2.V1 WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS NORTH BOUND ON CURRY PIKE AT THE INTERSECTION WITH W 3RD ST, IN THE LANE TO TURN WEST. THE TRAFFIC LIGHT WAS RED. D2 ADVISED V1 PULLED UP AND STOPPED DIRECTLY BEHIND V2. AFTER A FEW SECONDS, V1 REAR ENDED V2. DRIVER 1 WAS NOT RESPONSIVE AT THE SCENE AND COULD NOT GIVE A STATEMENT AT THE HOSPITAL.

Sullivan advised she was traveling south on south Washington street when she came to a complete stop at 4th and Washington street. As Sullivan entered the intersection on her 2013 sun tour bicycle, Sullivan advised d1 disregarded the stop sign at 4th and Washington Street. Sullivan advised d1 was traveling east on 4th Street at the time of the accident. A witness observed the accident and followed d1 to the Taste of India restaurant where the obtained the license plate number.D1 advised that she was traveling east on 4th Street and she came to a complete stop at 4th and Washington Street.D1 advised she entered the intersection and thought she had struck a pot hole. D1 advised she did not see a bicyclist at the intersection. D1 continued to the restaurant where she waited to pick up her boyfriend. D1's driving behavior after the accident was not consistent with an attempt to escape the area. D1 remained in the area, and at a close proximity to the accident scene. I did not observe any damage to v1.I took the initial report at 220 E. Third Street, Bloomington, Indiana 47404. I also spoke with D1 at 3918 Bushmill Drive, Bloomington, Indiana 47403.

Vehicle 1 was traveling east on 3rd Street approaching the intersection of Dunn Street in the left lane. Vehicle 2 was traveling east on 3rd Street approaching the intersection of Dunn Street in the right lane.Driver 1 left the scene of the accident.Driver 2 stated that he was traveling in the right lane when Vehicle 2 quickly swerved into his lane with no warning, or turn signal, and struck the driver's side front bumper of his vehicle causing him to leave to roadway and drive onto the sidewalk. Driver 2 advised that Vehicle 1 immediately reentered the left lane and drove away. He stated that he then reentered the right lane and began following the vehicle. Driver 2 stated Vehicle 1 then moved into the right lane and continued driving. Driver 2 advised he was able to obtain a photograph of the plate on the vehicle and could see the driver of the vehicle before pulling over to contact police. He stated he was able to describe the male.Driver 2 advised that the driver was a white male with short white hair. After describing the male I asked Driver 2 if he would be able to identify the driver with a photograph. He stated he could and I showed him the BMV photograph for the male registered owner of Vehicle 1. Driver 2 advised that this was the male that struck him. I asked Driver 2 if it was possible that Driver 1 could have not noticed that he was involved in an accident. Driver 2 stated that the collision sounded extremely loud and had enough force to cause his vehicle to go off the roadway. Driver 2 also stated that when he began following the vehicle he noticed Driver 1 stared straight forward and, in Driver 2's opinion, avoided making any eye contact with him in the mirrors of the vehicle.No one involved complained of any injuries.I was able to obtain Driver 1's home address in Bedford, Indiana through the Indiana BMV. Lawrence County Sheriff's Department assisted me in going to Driver 1's address to speak with him. When Driver 1 answered the door with his wife he smelled strongly of the odor of alcoholic beverage and his eyes were bloodshot. I began explaining why I was there and Driver 1 immediately began denying driving the vehicle. His wife claimed she was driving her vehicle in Bloomington, Indiana today. When I asked where she was driving her vehicle she immediately stated "3rd Street." His wife then began stating repeatedly that she had no idea that she struck someone. She stated that she had located the damage but was unsure of when it had occurred and was going to contact the insurance company in the morning. I asked Driver 1 how much he had to drink and he immediately stated that he had not started drinking until he got home. I explained to Driver 1 that the subject in the vehicle he struck identified him and he continued denying the accident. I then explained to Driver 1 that I was issuing him a misdemeanor citation for Leaving the Scene of an Accident. Driver 1 stated that the damage on the vehicle was just a scuff from rubber and denied much of the damage. Deputy Roberts advised that when he stepped away with Driver 1's wife to get the insurance he advised her that she could be arrested for lying to the police to cover up for her husband's accident. Deputy Roberts advised that she stated "Yeah, but you don't have to live with him."Photographs were taken of the damage to both vehicles and placed into evidence. There were several gouges and dents as well as black transfer, from the bumper of Driver 2's vehicle, on the rear passenger door, quarter panel, and rear bumper of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had minor damage to the driver's side front bumper.Due to the vehicles being moved a diagram was not completed.

W1, CHAD STEPHAN WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT STREET BEHIND V2, WHEN HE OBSERVED V1 DISREGARD THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT 10TH AND WALNUT STREET AND COLLIDE WITH V2. PRIOR TO THE ACCIDENT, W1 ADVISED V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON WEST 10TH STREET. D2 ADVISED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON WALNUT STREET WHEN SHE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF 10TH AND WALNUT STREET ON A GREEN LIGHT. AS D2 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION ON A GREEN LIGHT, D2 ADVISED V1 DISREGARDED THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AND COLLIDED WITH HER VEHICLE. AFTER THE ACCIDENT, D2 ADVISED D1 EXITED HIS VEHICLE AND BEGAN PUNCHING HER VEHICLE WINDOW.D1 ADVISED HE WAS STOPPED ON WEST 10TH STREET AND NORTH WALNUT ON A RED LIGHT. AS HIS LIGHT TURNED GREEN, D1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION ON A GREEN LIGHT AND WAS STRUCK BY V2. D1 ADISED V2 DISREGARDED THE TRAFFIC LIGHT. D1 ADVISED PRIOR TO THE ACCIDENT HE WAS WATCHING A YOUTUBE VIDEO. D1 WAS FOUND TO BE IN POSSESSION OF MARIJUANA AND PARAPHERNALIA. D1 IS ALSO BEING INVESTIGATED FOR OWI.THE INVESTIGATION ALSO OCCURRED AT IU HEALTH HOSPITAL.

OWNER OF VEHICLE 2 ADVISED SHE PARALLEL PARKED ON PIAZZA DRIVE FACING NORTH THEN VISITED A LOCAL BUSINESS. WHEN SHE RETURNED TO HER VEHICLE AT 11:53 AM, THERE WAS DAMAGE TO HER VEHICLE CONSISTENT WITH A SAME DIRECTION SIDESWIPE, LEAVING WHITE PAINT TRANSFER ON THE OWNER'S VEHICLE. THERE ARE NO SUSPECTS AT THIS TIME, HOWEVER, THE BLOND GENIUS BUSINESS DOES HAVE SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS OVER THIS AREA. INVESTIGATION IS PENDING FOLLOWING OBTAINING THIS FOOTAGE.

D2 stated she was travelling westbound in the left lane on W SR 45/46 approaching the intersection of N. College Ave. D2 advised traffic in front of her suddenly stopped causing her to do so as well. D2 stated she looked in her rear view mirror and observed V1, described as a white truck, approaching quickly. According to D2, she heard tires squealing then saw V1 swerve into the right lane. While V1 swerved over, D2 stated she was struck/swiped on the rear passenger side of her vehicle. D2 stated due to heavy traffic she was unable to follow V1. D2 advised she pulled over and waited for V1 to come back and exchange information, but it did not return. A local investigation is being conducted ref case#B1937312. No injuries were reported.

Primary Cause (Other Driver) - Explain in narrative: There is no known information about the primary cause. No suspects or vehicle information is known. Type of Crash -Explain in Narrative: It is unclear what type of crash this is as there is no information about what caused the crash. Driver Factors -Other driver Explain in Narrative: There are no known driver factors as to what caused the crash. Vehicle Factors- Other Explain in Narrative: There is no information as to what, if any, vehicle factors caused the crash. Environmental Factors- Other Explain in Narrative: It is unclear if there were any environmental factors that caused the crash.V1 was parked in the Green Lot facing north (which is just south of the Tennis Center at 1833 N Fee Lane) in the northeast part of the parking lot. D1 stated that he parked his vehicle in the green lot sometime around 0457 and 0500 hours on 09/04/2019. D1 stated he returned back to his vehicle at approximately 1645 hours and drove to his residence. D1 advised that when he arrived at his residence and got out of his vehicle at approximately 1800 hours, he noticed damage to his rear driver side bumper. D1 stated he also noticed damage to the rear driver side bed of the truck. D1 did not see any contact information on his vehicle from the other driver.There is no known information on who the other driver is or what the other vehicle looked like. The damage is consistent with another motor vehicle striking it, but there is no known information on what the vehicle is. Photographs of the damage were taken and are attached to the case.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON THIRD STREET GOING THROUGH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT MADISON STREET.V2 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON MADISON STREET GOING THROUGH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT THIRD STREET.V1 DISREGARDED THE STOP LIGHT AND HIT V2 IN THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE WITH FRONT OF HER CAR.D1 ADMITTED THAT SHE FAILED TO STOP AT THE STOP LIGHT CAUSING THE ACCIDENT.

D1 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR, IN THE NORTHERN-MOST LANE. D1 STATED THEIR CELL PHONE FELL DOWN TO THE FLOORBOARD, AT WHICH POINT D1 REACHED DOWN TO GRAB THE PHONE, DISTRACTING THEM FROM DRIVING. V1 THEN STRUCK THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR, IN THE NORTHERN-MOST LANE APPROACHING A LINE OF VEHICLES THAT WERE STOPPED, WAITING FOR THE GREEN LIGHT AT E 3RD ST AND S CLARIZZ BLVD. D2 STATED THEY WERE SLOWING THEIR VEHICLE WITH AN APPROPRIATE SIZED GAP BETWEEN V2 AND V3. V2 WAS THEN STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY V1, WHICH CAUSED V2 TO STRIKE V3. D3 STATED THEY WERE STOPPED IN A LINE OF CARS IN THE NORTHERN-MOST LANE ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR. V3 WAS THEN STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY V2, CAUSING V3 TO STRIKE THE REAR OF V4. D3 COMPLAINED OF NECK PAIN FROM THE CRASH, BUT WAS NOT TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. D4 STATED THEY WERE STOPPED IN A LINE OF CARS IN THE NORTHERN-MOST LANE ON E 3RD ST, PAST THE INTERSECTION WITH S KINGSTON DR. D4 STATED V4 WAS STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY V3 WHILE V4 WAS SITTING IN TRAFFIC.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON 9TH STREET AND HAD STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF COLLEGE AVE. SHE INDICATED THE A MOTORIST WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY ON COLLEGE AVE AND SHE ASSUMED IT WAS A FOURWAY STOP. D1 SAID SHE PROCEEDED ACROSS COLLEGE AND COLLIDID WITH V2. D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE IN THE WESTERN MOST LANE. HE SAID AS HE WAS PASSING 9TH STREET, HE WAS STRUCK BY V1.

Spoke to D1 when I arrived on scene and he stated V1 was traveling east across the parking lot near the front of the building at 3585 W SR 45, Walmart Super Center. D1 stated he attempted to make a left hand turn to travel north into row 10 when he miss judged the turn and struck the stop sign at the end of the row causing damage to the sign and significant damage to V1's left front wheel. The stop sign was held up by a concrete post and the post was pushed off center. D1 was able to pull the concrete sign post out of the asphalt so not to damage it further by towing V1. V1 was towed due to disabling damage and D1 was not injured in the crash.

DRIVER 1 STATED HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN HE TURNED AROUND TO TALK TO HIS DAUGHTER IN THE BACKSEAT. WHEN HE TURNED BACK AROUND HE SAW THE OTHER (TURNING) LANE MOVING AND ACCELERATED ON THE GAS PEDAL, REAR ENDING VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN SUDDENLY HER VEHICLE 2 WAS REAR ENDED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 SAID SHE WAS HEADED EAST ON STATE ROAD 46 AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO FIGURE OUT HOW TO GET TO THE WEST BOUND DIRECTION SO SHE TURNED LEFT FROM THE SOUTH LANE TO TURN ON FIRST STREET BUT DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE NORTH LANE AND TURNED IN FRONT STRIKING THE FRONT OF V2. D2 SAID SHE WAS DRIVING EAST WHEN V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HER.

D1 SAID HE PULLED OUT FROM O'RIELLY'S AUTO WEST BOUND IN THE MEDIAN AS HE WAS TRAVELING V2 TURNED INTO TURN LANE. D2 SAID HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN AROUND WHEN V1 CAME SPEEDING PAST HIM IN THE TURN LANE AND HE DID NOT SEE HIM UNTIL HE WAS GOING PAST AND STRUCK THE FRONT LEFT FENDER.VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.

V1 and V2 were in the parking lot at 2600 E. 10th Street. D1 stated that she was in a parking spot facing West and was backing up to leave when her vehicle struck V2. D1 stated that she did not see the vehicle in her rear view camera and her vehicle did not beep at her telling her there was another vehicle. D1 stated she is unsure what happened. D2 stated that he was in a parking spot facing East. D2 stated that he backed out of the parking spot and put the vehicle in drive to leave when V1 struck his vehicle. V1 struck V2 with the drivers side rear bumper and tail light. V2 was struck on the drivers side rear bumper and tail light.

V1 and V2 were headed East on 10th Street approaching the intersection with Range Rd. D1 stated that it was his fault. D1 stated that he turned his head to look out the window when he did not see V2 stopped and rear ended V2. D2 stated that he was traveling East in traffic when he was rear ended. V1 rear ended V2. There was minor damage to V2 and a few cosmetic damages to V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver one who was eastbound on SR46 W attempted to change lanes near Third Street. Driver one did not see Driver two and struck the driver's side rear corner panel. Both vehicles pulled into the Ellettsville Exchange parking located in the 200 blk of E Temperance (Sr46W).NO diagram because vehicles moved before officers arrival.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE EASTBOUND LANES OF E. 3RD STREET AT THE INTERSECTION WITH S. WOODSCREST DR. V1 WAS BEHIND V2. V1 REAR ENDED V2.V1 DID NOT HAVE VISIBLE DAMAGEV2 HAD DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER AND DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL. OCCUPANTS OF V2 REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT.

D1 stated she was pulling out of a parking stall when she mistook the gas for the brake while turning her vehicle to the right. When she pressed the gas, V1 collided with V2; which was parked and unoccupied.

D1 TURNED WB ON W BLOOMFIELD RD FROM S LANDMARK AVE. D1 ADVISED WHEN SHE TURNED THE SUN WAS SETTING AND BELIEVED ANOTHER VEHICLE WAS ABOUT TO HIT HER. V1 THEN SWERVED TO THE RIGHT AND STRUCK A CURB CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT PASSENGER TIRE. V1 HAD TO BE TOWNED FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was SB on Woodlawn avenue and was stopped at stop sign at E. Hillside drive. V2 was WB on E. Hillside drive and was approaching Wooodlawn avenue. V1 failed to yield the right of way and pulled out to turn left onto Hillside drive. V2 struck V1 in the front bumper area with the front passenger side bumper of her vehicle. D1 stated that she was stopped at stop sign and waiting of traffic to turn left onto Hillside dr. She stated that she saw a few cars in the right turn lane to turn NB on Woodlawn avenue. She stated she thought it was ok to turn and pulled out. She was then hit by V2.D2 stated she was going straight and V1 pulled out in front of her and she was unable to avoid hitting her. She stated that she was never in the right turn lane.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON CORY LANE TURNING LEFT TO GO EAST ON 3RD STREET.MR OWENS WAS RIDING A LIME AN ELECTRIC SCOOTER WESTBOUND ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF 3RD STREET CROSSING CORY LANE IN THE CROSS WALK.D1 SAID HE WAS TURNING RIGHT ON A YELLOW LIGHT AND LOOKED TO HIS LEFT FOR TRAFFIC. HE SAID HE DID NOT SEE MR OWENS COMING FROM THE RIGHT AND HIT HIM.MR OWENS SAID HE HAD A WALK SIGNAL AND AS HE CROSSED 3RD STREET V1 HIT HIM.

Unit 1 was traveling south on S. SR 37 just south of the intersection with Smithville Road when it struck a road construction Variable Message Sign that was on the shoulder of the roadway. The vehicle also struck and damaged an unknown amount of orange traffic barrels that were around the sign. Estimated value of the sign is approximately $15,000 to $20,000. The vehicle the spun 180 degrees and came to a stop in the grass on the west side of SR 37. Driver 1 was intoxicated and did not admit to operating Unit 1. She said that there were 4 other people in the car and they ran from the scene after the accident. Driver one did have marks on here left shoulder that I know through my experience to be commonly caused by a seat belt during an accident. The driver's side air bag did deploy but the passengers side air bag did not deploy. Driver 1 was also the registered owner of the vehicle. The witness said that she was a good distance behind Unit 1 when she saw unit 1 spin out and go off of the roadway. The witness said that she stopped to check on Unit 1 when she observed Driver 1 in the driver's seat of Unit 1 and appeared to be trying to start Unit 1. Deputy Moxley conducted an OWI investigation and Driver 1 was arrested.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON WINSLOW, JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH WALNUT AND EAST WINSLOW.D1 EXPLAINED THAT TRAFFIC HAD BEEN SLOW, BUT HAD BEEN MOVING. HE DID CONTINUETO DRIVE EAST WHEN TRAFFIC CAME TO AN ABRUPT STOP, RESULTING IN THE FRONT OF V1 MAKING CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2.V1 WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON WINSLOW, JUST EAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH WALNUT.D2 STATED THAT TRAFFIC WAS SLOW AND THAT V2 WAS AT A COMPLETE STOP WHEN IT WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT DUE TO NECK PAIN.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS GOING SOUTHBOUND THROUGH AN ALLEY AND LOOKED BOTH WAYS BEFORE ENTERING TRAFFIC AND POSSBILY BECAUSE OF THE SUN, DID NOT SEE V2 AND V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND WHEN V1 ENTERED THE TRAFFIC LANE AND V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.BOTH VEHICLES WERE TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE, NO INJURIES REPORTED.

DRIVER 1 OF VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO PULL OUT OF TRAFFIC INTO A PARKING SPACE WHEN SHE CUT HER TURN TOO SOON AND HER BACK BUMPER MADE CONTACT WITH PARKED VEHICLE 2. OCCUPANT OF VEHICLE 2 STATED VEHICLE 1 WAS TRYING TO GET INTO THE PARKING SPACE AND TURNED INTO HIS FRONT BUMPER.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling east bound on Chamber's Dr when it struck V2. V2 was parked and unattended when it was struck. D1 stated that she had pain in her chest, she was transported to Monroe Hospital for treatment. Both owners were provided a field report. Officer Fabris took pictures of the damage.

DRIVER ONE WAS DRIVING HIS VEHICLE 1 SOUTH ON COLLEGE WHEN ANOTHER VEHICLE EMERGED FROM SMITH AVENUE, TURNING NORTH ON COLLEGE. COLLEGE AVENUE IS A ONE WAY GOING SOUTH. AS HE SAW THIS VEHICLE APPROACHING HE LAID HIS BIKE DOWN CAUSING HIM INJURY TO HIS PERSON AND DAMAGE TO HIS VEHICLE 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling westbound in an alley attempting to pull onto southbound Dunn St. V2 was traveling southbound on Dunn St. V1 struck V2 as it pulled from the alley.D1 stated he was inching out from the alley onto Dunn St and did not see V2 in time. He struck V2 as it passed.D2 stated she was driving south on Dunn St and was struck by V1 as she passed the alley.V1 did fail to yield to V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON EAST WINSLOW AND APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF WINSLOW AND HENDERSON.D1 EXPLAINED THAT AS HE WAS IN THE INTERSECTION THAT THE GREEN LIGHT DID TURN RED, SO HE DID HIT THE GAS IN ORDER TO GET OUT OF THE INTERSECTION. D1 WAS TRYING TO TURN LEFT, SOUTH, ON TO SOUTH HENDERSON.THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 WAS STRUCK BY THE FRONT PASSENGER'S CORNER OF V2 RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 DID TELL ME THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON WINSLOW AND THAT WHILE SHE WAS TRAVELING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF HENDERSON AND WINSLOW THAT THE LIGHT DID TURN RED AND V1 DID TURN LEFT, SOUTH, IN FRONT OF HER.D2 DID HIT HE GAS IN ORDER TO GET THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, NOT EXPECTING V1 TO TURN SOUTH, RESULTING IN THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF V2 MAKING CONTACT WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 SAID THAT SHE WAS HEADED EAST AND HAD TURNED HER TURN SIGNAL ON TO TURN RIGHT. WHEN SHE REALIZED IT WAS NOT HER TURN SHE CANCELLED THE SIGNAL. AND THAT SHE SEEN D1 LOOK TO THE EAST AND THEN PULLED OUT TO TURN LEFT WHEN SHE STRUCK V1 AS HE PULLED OUT. D1 SAID THAT HE SAW THE TURN SIGNAL AND THOUGHT V2 WAS TURNING SO HE THOUGHT HE HAD ENOUGH TIME TO TURN LEFT AND CHECKED EAST THEN PULLED OUT AND WAS STRUCK IN THE FRONT DRIVERSIDE OF VEHICLE.
V1 WAS TRAVELING NB ON N STARNES ROAD, LOST CONTROL, AND RAN OFF THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY INTO A CREEK.D1 STATED THAT HIS HANDLE BARS BEGAN TO SHAKE CAUSING HIM TO RUN OFF THE ROAD.

D1 STATEDTHAT HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON SOUTH WOODCREST DRIVE AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT AT THE BEND IN FONT OF 880 SOUTH WOODCREST DRIVE.D1 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS GOING 25 MILES PER HOUR WHEN TURNING AND THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF V1 DID STRIKE AN ORNAMENTAL ROCK, LOCATED NEAR THE DRIVEWAY OF 880 SOUTH WOODCREST DRIVE AND THAT V1 DID THEN CONTINUE TO RUN OFF THE ROAD AND STRIKE 880 SOUTH WOODCREST'S MAILBOX.V1 WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was in the parking lot of the Circle K gas station at the corner of Kirkwood and Rogers street. V2 was EB on Kirkwood approaching the stop light at Rogers street. V1 failed to yield the right of way and pulled out and struck V2, who was in the left turn lane. V1 struck V2 in the passenger side doors with the front driver side bumper of her vehicle.D1 stated that traffic had stopped in the straight lane and a driver motioned her out. She then drove across the straight lane and was going to the left turn lane. She stated she didn't see V2 coming in the turn lane and she hit him as he drove by her.D2 stated he was in the left turn lane approaching the stop light when V1 pulled into his lane and he was unable to avoid hitting her.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS PULLING OUT FROM THE GAS PUMPS INTO THE LANE OF TRAVEL IN THE KROGER PARKING LOT. DRIVER 1 ADVISED THE GAS STATION BUILDING BLOCKED HIS VIEW OF SB TRAFFIC IN THE LANE OF TRAVEL. DRIVER 1 ADVISED WHEN HE PULLED OUT HE DID NOT SEE V2 UNTIL IT WAS TO LATE AND WAS UNABLE TO AVOID HITTING IT.DRVER 2 ADVISED HE WAS SB IN THE LANE OF TRAVEL IN THE KROGER PARKING LOT WHEN V1 PULLED OUT FROM THE GAS STATION PUMPS STRIKING HIS VEHICLE. DRIVER 2 WAS UNABLE TO AVOID A COLLISON WITH V1.

I was dispatched to the IUPD parking lot for a property damage crash. Upon arrival and speaking with both parties on scene I was advised the crash occurred in the SRSC parking lot. Both parties came to IUPD to file the report. D1 said he was in the second parking row area near the corner and believed he was facing east in a parking space in V1. D1 said he was backing out and didn't see anyone at the time backing up. D1 said he got on the curb in the parking lot and said that's not good so he went to readjust. D1 said he readjusted and when backing up he backed into V2 driver side front door with the rear bumper area of V1. V1 had minor scuff marks on the right side of the bumper area. D2 said he was parked in the second parking row facing the building in V2. D2 said he believes he was facing west in direction. D2 said he started backing up when he saw V1 started backing up at the same time. D2 said he honked his horn to alert D1. D2 said V1 backed into V2 driver side door causing a big dent. No injuries reported from either party.

V2 PARKED IN THE TACO BELL PARKING LOT FACING SB. OWNER OF V2 (O2) ADVISED V1 WAS PARKED DIRECLY BEHIND V2 FACING NB. O2 STATED V1 THEN REVERSED SW OUT OF IT'S PARKING STALL AND INTO THE REAR OF V2. CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER SIDE BUMPER. O2 STATED HE HONKED THE HORN PRIOR TO V1 IMPACTING THEM. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE. O2 BELIEVED D1 MAY NOT HAVE REALIZED HE STRUCK V2. V2 PROVIDED V1 PLATE INFORMATION AND ADVISED D1 WAS AN ELDERLY WHITE MALE. O2 DID NOT KNOW IF THERE WAS ANY DAMAGE TO V1. O2 ADVISED NO INJURIES AND DID NOT WISH TO PURSE CRIMINAL CHARGES.

Driver one stated he was in the left turn lane turning left from W Kirkwood Ave onto S Adams Street when he left his lane traveling into the right lane hitting vehicle two in the driver door with his front passenger corner,Driver two stated she was in the right turn lane making a left turn from W Kirkwood Ave onto S Adams Street. Driver two stated vehicle one was on her left side when vehicle one crossed into her lane hitting her vehicle in the driver door.

D2 STATED HE WAS IN BACKED UP TRAFFIC AND HE WAS COMPLETELY STOPPED WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2.D1 STATED THAT HE WAS ALSO IN BACK UP TRAFFIC AND SOMETHING FELL ON HIS FLOOR BOARD AND WHEN HE LOOKED UP V1 COLLIDED WITH V2 AT A SLOW RATE OF SPEED.MINOR DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 STATED HE HAD PAIN TO HIS NECK, FELT DIZZY, AND ALSO HAD PAIN IN HIS LEFT KNEE. D2 REFUSED TREATMENT AND STATED HE WOULD TAKE HIMSELF TO THE HOSPITAL IF NECESSARY.PHOTOGRAPHS WERE TAKEN AND UPLOADED INTO EVIDENCE.

V1 was traveling N/B on College Mall RD. V2 was traveling W/B on 3rd ST. V1 struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles. D1 advised that she was traveling N/B on College Mall RD, when she noticed a vehicle was stopped in the middle of the intersection. D1 advised that while in the intersection, she attempted to maneuver around the unknown vehicle to get out of the intersection because her traffic control signal had turned red. D1 advised that while attempting to go around the unknown vehicle she struck V2. D1 advised that she was not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling W/B on 3rd ST. D2 advised that he noticed a unknown vehicle stopped in the middle of the intersection. D2 advised that his traffic control signal had turned green and he attempted to maneuver around the unknown vehicle heading W/B on 3rd ST. D2 advised that he then felt the impact of V1. D2 was not injured.

On Friday, September 6, 2019 at 11:20, Mark Clephane responded to a crash on I69S at the 128 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry.Vehicle 1, black 2018 GMC Sierra Pickup truck, was travelling south on I-69 at the 128 Mile Marker when a deer ran from the west side of I-69 and into the path of Vehicle 1. The front of Vehicle 1 struck the deer causing multiple airbags to deploy around the passenger compartment.Driver 1 stated that he was travelling south on I-69 in the driving lane when a deer jumped the fence between the access road and I-69 and ran into the path of V-1. Driver 1 stated that he attempted to avoid the deer, but could not do so, and the front of V-1 struck the deer.There were no witnesses to this crash.The cause of this crash is the deer in the roadway.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. STATE ROAD 46 CROSSING OVER I-69 WHEN SHE TOOK HER EYES OF THE ROAD AS THERE WAS A BUG ON HER WINDOW. D1 TRIED TO REMOVE THE BUG AND WHEN SHE LOOKED UP V1 REAR ENDED V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. STATE ROAD 46 CROSSING OVER I-69 AND STARTED TO SLOW DOWN AS THERE WAS TRAFFIC. UPON SLOWING DOWN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 WAS STOPPED ON GOURLEY PIKE, FACING WESTBOUND, AT NORTH KINSER PIKE. V2 PROCEDED STRAIGHT THROUGH THE INTERSECTION V1, WHO WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN OFF OF GOURLEY PIKE NORTHBOUND ONTO NORTH KINSER PIKE, PULLED INFRONT OF V2. V2 THE STRUCK V1 ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE MOTORCYCLE, CAUSING D1 TO FALL OFF THE MOTORCYCLE. D1 REFUSED MEDICAL ATTENTION.D1 STATED HE WAS NOT SURE WHICHE VEHICLE ARRIVED AT THE STOP SIGN FIRST, BUT SAID AS HE WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN, V2 WENT STRAIGHT AND STRUCK HIM.D2 LEFT THE SCENE AND HAS NOT BEEN LOCATED.W1 WAS A PASSENGER IN V2. W1 STATED THEY GOT TO THE STOP SIGN AND CONTINUED WESTBOUND THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. W1 STATED AS THEY DROVE THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, V1 MADE A LEFT HAND TURN IN FRONT OF THEM AND THEY STRUCK THE MOTORCYCLE.

V1 HAD THE EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIREN ACTIVATED, PULLED OUT FROM THE TRAINING CENTER DRIVE BEHIND A SHORT BUS, EASED INTO NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC, AND REAR ENDED V2, WHICH WAS PARTIALLY PULLED HALF WAY ONTO THE EAST SHOULDER.D1 STATED THAT SHE HAD ACTIVATED HER EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIREN TO RESPOND TO AN EMERGENCY CALL. D1 STATED THAT AS SHE WAS LEAVING THE TRAINING CENTER DRIVE ON S. WALNUT ST. A SHORT BUS HAD PULLED FORWARD IN STOPPED TRAFFIC SOUTH BOUND TO ALLOW FOR ROOM FOR V1 TO EXIT THE TRAINING CENTER DRIVE. D1 STATED THAT SHE PULLED THROUGH THE SPACE THAT SOUTH BOUND DRIVER'S HAD CREATED FOR HER, AND EASED HER WAY FORWARD TO TURN NORTH BOUND. D1 STATED THAT SHE SAW A BLUE CAR PASS IN FRONT OF HER TRAVELING NORTH BOUND AND WAS WAITING FOR AN ORANGE CAR TO YIELD TO HER EMERGENCY LIGHTS, WHICH WAS BEHIND THE BLUE CAR. D1 STATED THAT ONCE SHE SAW THAT THE ORANGE CAR HAD YIELDED TO HER EMERGENCY LIGHTS, D1 TURNED TO TRAVEL NORTH BOUND. D1 STATED THAT SHE HAD THOUGHT THE BLUE CAR HAD PULLED FURTHER NORTH AND OFF OF THE ROADWAY, BUT APPARENTLY IT HAD NOT BECAUSE SHE REAR ENDED THE BLUE CAR. D1 STATED THAT V2 WAS HALF WAY ON THE ROADWAY AND HALF ON THE SHOULDER WHEN SHE STRUCK IT. V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON S. WALNUT ST. V2 PULLED HALF WAY ONTO THE SHOULDER AND STOPPED TO YIELD TO V1, WHICH HAD ITS EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIREN ACTIVATED. V2 WAS STRUCK ON THE REAR BY V1.D2 STATED THAT HE HAD SEEN V1 WITH THE EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIREN ACTIVATED, AND HAD PULLED TO THE SIDE. D2 STATED THAT HE THOUGHT HE HAD GIVEN V1 ENOUGH SPACE, BUT WAS STRUCK ON THE REAR.
V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON CURRY PIKE D1 ADVISED HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME STRIKING VEHICLE V2 IN THE REAR OF VEHICLE. THERE WAS NO COMPLAINT OF PAIN OR SIGNS OF INJURY ON ANY PARTIES INVOLVED.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS, JUST WEST OF WEST STONE LAKE DRIVE, WHEN IT STRUCK THE REAR END OF V2. D1 STATED V2 CAME TO A SUDDEN STOP INFRONT OF HER AND SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND STRUCK THE REAR END OF V2.D2 STATED V1 STRUCK THE REAR END OF HER VEHICLE AFTER THE CAME TO A STOP IN TRAFFIC.

Upon arrival V1 the only vehicle was facing eastbound in the parking lot with the rear of V1 into a tree with a broken limb, and broken light pole. No other vehicles involved. Driver William Folden was standing by the vehicle upon arrival. I spoke with the operator William Folden. Folden said he was checking on his last delivery at Stonebelt, and was out of the vehicle making a phone call regarding his last delivery. Folden said when he exited V1, he put the safety brake on. Folden said the safety brake is to keep the vehicle from rolling backwards. Folden said V1 rolled backwards due to V1 may have still been in gear. Folden said the vehicle rolled backwards destroying a small light pole and breaking a a tree limb on the tree. I observed no damage to V1. Folden had no injuries. Folden had all proper information for the company vehicle, but the policy number was not provided on the insurance form where it appeared it need hand written in. I attempted to call the insurance company to get the policy number, but they were closed. After speaking with Folden I had IUPD Dispatch contact Indiana University Work Order Control regarding the damages. I took photos of the scene. The photos are available upon request.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 ADVISED SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON OLD STATE ROAD 37 WHEN V1, WHO WAS AT THE STOP SIGN ON BETHEL LANE PULLED INTO HER PATH OF TRAVEL. D2 ADVISED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO AVOID STRIKING V1 HOWEVER WAS UNABLE TO AVOID THE CRASH. D2 DENIED MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE D1 WAS TRANSPORTED FROM THE SCENE WITH HEAD INJURIES.SPOKE WITH D1 AT HOSPITAL AND SHE ADVISED SHE THOUGHT THE INTERSECTION WAS CLEAR BEFORE SHE PULLED ONTO OLD 37 FROM BETHEL LANE AND DIDNT SEE V2 WHEN SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND WAS STRUCK.WITNESS KIP SMITH ADVISED HE WAS A WITNESS TO THE ACCIDENT AND THAT HE OBSERVED V1 PULL IN FRONT OF V2 CAUSING THE ACCIDENT.

When I arrived on scene, I observed a black Honda (V1) next to a light post in the Eigenmann parking lot and three females outside of the vehicle. None of them complained of any injuries at the scene. The driver, Haley Rivera (D1), stated she was driving northeast through the parking lot and did not see the light pole. V1 crashed the driver side front tire into the concrete base of the light pole.V1 sustained heavy front end damage to the driver side of the vehicle and wheel area. V1 was towed by Chandler's Towing due to disabling damage.

V1/D1 IS UNKNOWN. LEFT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT. UNKNOWN EXACT DATE OR TIME. KINGSLEY.NO WITNESSES, NO VIDEO CAMERAS IN THE AREA.

D1 AUSTIN COLLINS WAS EASTBOUND ON DIXIE ST. D1 MADE A U-TURN IN THE AREA OF DIXIE ST AND FAIRVIEW ST. D1 ADVISED HE LOST CONTROL AFTER MAKING U-TURN AND STRUCK LIGHT POLE. D1 CITED PROBLEMS WITH PASSENGER SIDE FRONT TIRE AS THE CONTRIBUTING FACTOR. D1 DID NOT REPORT ACCIDENT TO POLICE. D1 CALLED ANOTHER PERSON TO TRANSPORT HIM TO HOSPITAL. OFFICER AUSTIN BULL CONDUCTED AN OWI INVESTIGATION. D1 DOES NOT HAVE OPERATOR LICENSE.

Kyle Kennedy stated that he parked his mother's car in front of Verizon at 2894 E 3rd Street. He stated that when he returned, he found damage to the back passengers side bumper. Kennedy stated that he reported the accident to Mall security and Verizon. At this time there are no witnesses and no video of the accident.

ALL VEHS WERE WB ON W 2ND ST. V2 AND V3 WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC DUE TO THE INTERSECTION OF W 2ND ST AND S PATTERSON ST BEING BACKED UP AND THE LIGHT WAS RED. V3 ADVISED THEY WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN THEY WERE REAR ENDED BY V2. D2 ADVISED THEY WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. D2 STATED SHE HEARED THE SQUEAL OF TIRES BRAKING WHEN V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. THE IMPACT THEN PUSHED V2 INTO V3.D1 ADVISED THEY WERE STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. D1 ADVISED THEY LEFT THEIR FOOT OFF THE BRAKE AND ROLLED INTO V2. PASSENGER OF V2 REFUSED EMS TRANSPORT BUT EMS DID RECOMMEND SHE GO TO THE HOSPITAL FOR AN EVALUATION. ALL THREE VEHILCES WERE DRIVEN FROM SCENE.
V2 was stopped in traffic east bound on W Airport road with V1 directly behind V2. D1 stated that when V2 stopped, he did not stop and rear ended V2 causing minor damage.

UNIT 1 WAS REAR ENDED AT THE INTERSECTION OF W SR 46 AND N CURY PIKE. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT THEY WERE SLOWING IN THE TURN LANE WHEN THEY WERE REAR ENDED BY A BLACK CHEVY EQUINOX. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT THE DRIVER OF THE BLACK EQUINOX WAS AN AFRICAN AMERICAN FEMALE WITH CHILDREN IN THE BACKSEAT. THE DRIVER OF THE BLACK EQUINOX ASKED UNIT 1 IF SHE HAD REAR ENDED HER, AND UNIT 1 STATED SHE DID. BOTH UNITS PULLED TO THE SHOULDER, AND WHILE UNIT 1 WAS RETREVING HER INSURANCE INFORMATION, THE BLACK EQUINOX SPED OFF.THE OCCUPANTS IN UNIT 1 IDENTIFIED THE LICENSE PLATE AND THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE WAS ABLE TO LOCATE THE VEHILCE LATER. THE OWNER OF THE EQUINOX WAS QUESTIONED AND DENIED EVERYTHING. THE INVESTIGATION IS STILL PENDING.

V1 WAS INVOLVED IN A LEAVING THE SCENE ACCIDENT. WHEN I RESPONDED THERE WAS NOONE AROUND V1. D1-ULAND STATED HE DID NOT CONTACT THE POLICE BECAUSE HE DIDNT HAVE A PHONE AND HE WALKED TO A FRIENDS RESIDENCE A FEW MILES AWAY. D1 WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE INSURANCE INFORMATION OVER THE PHONE. V1 WAS IMPOUNDED.

D1 stated he was traveling east on State Road 45/46. D1 stated he saw V2 stopped in front of him because of traffic and attempted to apply his breaks. D1 stated he was unable to stop in time and crashed into the rear of V2 causing damage to both vehicles.D2 stated he was traveling east on State Road 45/46 and was stopped in traffic. D2 stated while stopped in traffic, V1 crashed into the rear of his vehicle. D2 stated the impact of V1 into the rear of his vehicle caused his vehicle to strike V3 in front of him who was also stopped in traffic. D2 stated he sustained damage to both the front and back of his vehicle.D3 stated he was traveling east on State Road 45/46 and was stopped in traffic. D3 stated while stopped in traffic he saw V1 collide with the rear of V2 which caused V2 to collide with the rear of his vehicle. D3 stated when V2 crashed into his vehicle it caused damage to both vehicles.

V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD APPROACHING ROLLLING RIDGE WAY. V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC..V3 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V2 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC.D1 SAID HE LOOKED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD BRIEFLY AND WHEN HE LOOKED BACK UP TRAFFIC AHEAD HAD STOPPED. HE SAID HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE COLLIDING WITH V2.D2 SAID AS HE SAT IN TRAFFIC AT THE RED LIGHT V1 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND WHICH PUSHED HIN IN THE BACK OF V3.D3 SAID AS HE SAT IN TRAFFIC V2 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.OTHER LOCATION OF INVESTIGATION WAS AT IU HEALTH ED WHERE PASSENGER IN V1 WAS TRANSPORTED BY AMBULANCE.

This crash occurred on N. Jordan Avenue, which is a local city street that is two way and that primarily runs east and west. Parking along both sides of the street is permitted. The weather at the time of the crash was clear and the roadway was dry. Vehicle #1, a 2009 Lexus ES350 passenger car, was travelling west on Jordan Ave. when it approached the scene of another crash that had the roadway unpassable. Vehicle #1 attempted to turn around in the middle of the roadway and backed into vehicle #2 that was parked. Vehicle #2, a 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee, was unattended and parked on the south side of Jordan Ave. facing east. Driver #1, Samantha Massoni, stated that she was attempting to turn around in the middle of the roadway and backed into vehicle #2. Evidence on the scene indicates that Driver #1 was attempting to turn around in the middle of the road and struck vehicle #2 that was parked. Neither vehicle needed towed.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY FACING NB ON S DAVISSON ST. OWNER OF V2 BELIEVED V2 WAS STRUCK EARLY IN THE MORNING. OWNER OF V2 DID NOT SEE THE INCIDENT AND DOES NOT HAVE ANY INFORMATION ON V1.THERE APPEARED TO BE EITHER SILVER OR WHITE PAINT TRANSFER.

Both Driver 1 and Driver 2 were traveling southbound on North Smith Pike. Driver 2 was stopped in traffic behind another vehicle at a stop sign when she stated she got rear ended by Driver 1. Driver 1 stated he was approaching the intersection when he stated his ABS (automatic brake system) in his car went out and when he pressed the break it went down into the floorboard which he then collided with Driver 2. Sgt. Williamson arrived on scene as both vehicle were still in the roadway and had both vehicles move out of the roadway into a parking lot close by. Sgt Williamson stated he observed no issues with Vehicle 1's brakes as Driver 1 moved the vehicle into the parking lot. Vehicle 1 sustained front bumper damage as Vehicle 2 sustained rear bumper and damage to their tow hitch. Neither vehicle required a tow service and both driver's declined medical personnel. Driver 1 was unable to provide a policy number for his insurance.

V1 was found on 10th St. facing west bound off the roadway, just north of the railroad bridge. The vehicle was unoccupied and officers checked the area but did not locate anyone involved in the accident.V1 struck a large manhole and pushed the manhole cover approximately 15 feet onto the side walk. The vehicle had heavy damage to the front and the driver side airbag had been deployed. V1's front end was also inside the manhole. The manhole had been damaged and also slid across the sidewalk, gauging the pavement. The concrete surrounding the manhole was scraped and torn away from the impact from the car. I did notice the strong odor of alcohol inside vehicle, as well as a unidentified liquid on the dash. I performed a BMV records check and determined the vehicle returned to Jadon Bliss.Ken's arrived on scene to remove and tow V1.I was able to make contact with D1 on 09/11/2019. D1 stated he was driving alone in V1 and was unfamiliar with the area. D1 stated he did not see the curve, turned to much, and hit the brakes to much. D1 stated after the accident he had his brother pick him up and left the area. D1 stated he later saw officers removing V1 from the manhole. D1 also stated he thought V1 just ran off the roadway and did not know he hit anything. I filed probable cause affidavit requesting a warrant for Leaving the Scene of an Accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 had been travelling northbound on Indiana Avenue preparing to turn left on 9th Street. V1 turned left onto 9th St. and collided with a pedestrian walking northbound on the crosswalk. I first spoke with the pedestrian who was struck. He stated that he was just heading home to N Dunn. While walking northbound near 9th and Indiana on the crosswalk, he all of a sudden felt a vehicle strike him on his right side. The pedestrian stated he was wearing his ear buds and could not hear anything, so he just remembers being struck. He stated he hit the hood of the car and then fell to the ground. He stated the pain was coming from his right hip, however he sustained a small abrasion to his right elbow. EMS transported the pedestrian to IU Health Bloomington Hospital due to his injuries. Officer Harden was conducting an OWI investigation on the driver after noticing signs of intoxication, so she was able to speak to him about the accident. D1 stated that he had been heading northbound on Indiana Avenue nearing 9th Street when he then turned left. As he turned left onto 9th St, he struck the pedestrian. D1 stated he did not see the pedestrian crossing the road as it was very dark. He remarked "Who walks here at night?" Officer Harden administered a certified chemical breath test to D1 which returned with a reading of .141% BrAC. D1 was booked into the Monroe County Jail for Operating While Intoxicated, Endangerment and Operating While Intoxicated With an ACE > .08% BrAC.

VEHICLE 1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH FAIRFAX ROAD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF ALEXIS WAY WHEN IT LEFT THE ROADWAY ON THE EAST SIDE OF SOUTH FAIRFAX ROAD. THE VEHICLE ROLLED AT LEAST ONE TIME BEFORE COMING TO A STOP ON THE EAST SIDE OF SOUTH FAIRFAX ROAD FACING WEST.DRIVER 1 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON FOR COMPLAINTS OF CHEST PAIN.VEHICLE WAS NOT DRIVABLE AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO STRYKER TOWING BY STRYKER TOWING.

Unit 1 was facing westbound turning right (north) onto Jordan Ave from 7th St. Unit 2, a bicycle, was also westbound on 7th proceeding straight through the intersection. Unit 2 was along the far-right edge of the roadway, in the street. The witness was facing northbound on Jordan at 7th.Driver 1 stated she stopped at the stop sign and started to turn right when Unit 2 suddenly collided with her vehicle on the northeast corner of the intersection. She said Unit 2 did not stop at the stop sign and seemingly came out of nowhere. The witness completed a written sworn statement stating they observed the collision. The witness stated Unit 1 did stop at the stop sign and Unit 2 did not. She said it appeared the two did not ever see each other prior to colliding.Unit 2 was unconscious when first responders arrived, but regained consciousness almost immediately thereafter. She was wearing a helmet. She had a deep abrasion to her right cheek. She complained of pain in her left knee and her right elbow. She was transported by ambulance to the hospital. I went to the hospital and spoke with her about the collision there. She said she did stop at the stop sign but it was farther back (to the east) and away from the intersection. She told me she was going straight and thought that Unit 1 was stopped to let pedestrians cross the street.Driver 1 showed no signs of intoxication, but was advised of Implied Consent due to the injuries in the crash. She consented to a PBT and it registered .000 BrAC.Photos were taken of the scene.

DILLMAN RD WHEN V1 CAME ACROSS THE MEDIAN AND STRUCK V2 IN THE DRIVERS SIDE.WITNESS BRAD BLACKWELL 812-320-0058

D1 stated that he was going eastbound on State Road 45/46 Bypass when he must have "spaced out" and he collided with V2, which caused V2 to hit V3.D2 and D3 stated the same details, as they were stopped at the red light when they were rear ended.
