Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was stopped at the stop sign on 11th Street and Fee Lane. P2 was traveling southbound on Fee Lane approaching 11th Street. D1 was located at her home. P2 was located at Briscoe Quad.D1 stated she was stopped at the stop sign on 11th Street and Fee Lane facing east. D1 stated that she proceeded to go into the intersection and observed P2 at the last moment. D1 stated she applied her brakes immediately but was unable to avoid a collision with P2. D1 stated she pulled up through the intersection to check on P2. D1 stated she went around the block to park and return to the scene. D1 stated that she parked and went back to the scene but was unable to locate P2. D1 stated she waited at the scene for approximately 15 minutes in case P2 returned. D1 stated P2 did not return and she left. V1 had damage to the front driver side bumper and fender. P2 stated that he was traveling southbound on Fee Lane approaching 11th Street when he observed V1 at the stop sign on 11th Street. P2 stated he continued southbound when V1 pulled out in front of him attempting to turn left. P2 stated that when V1 pulled out in front of him, he and V1 collided. P2 stated he was thrown off of his bicycle and over V1's hood. P2 stated he landed on the ground and sustained several injuries. P2 stated D1 then took off and left the scene. P2 had sustained injuries to his right knee, right and left legs, and right and left arms. P2 refused medical treatment by the ambulance service.

D1 advised she was driving V1 east bound on 10th Street and began turning into the Crosstown parking lot on the north side of 10th Street. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling west on east 3rd St in the left hand lane. Driver of vehicle 1 was attempting to pull onto 3rd St from the east entrance of 2901 E 3rd St, KFC, and travel east. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that the right lane traffic was stopped at the light of Pete Ellis Dr. A vehicle in the right lane of west bound traffic allowed vehicle 2 to pull in front of him. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that she did not see any vehicles coming in the left hand lane and proceeded to cross the lane in an attempt to travel east. Vehicle 2 was in the left lane of travel approaching the intersection when vehicle 1 pulled out. Driver of vehicle 1 failed to yield the right of way to vehicle 2 when pulling onto the roadway and crossing the lanes. Driver of vehicle 2 was unable to avoid colliding with vehicle 1 and struck vehicle 1 in the front driver's side. Vehicle 1 had significant damage to the front driver's side and was towed from the scene due to damage. Vehicle 2 had moderate damage to the front and was able to drive from the scene. Driver of vehicle 1 was considered of the speed of vehicle 2 since it "suddenly appeared". Driver of vehicle 2 stated she was traveling at 30 miles per hour and was in the left lane well before the accident occurred. I believe driver of vehicle 1 was unable to see vehicle 2 due to the traffic in the right lane.No injuries were reported from the accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

As D2 made her turn, D1 also attempted to turn into 1115 S Walnut St, by passing D2 in the N/B left lane of S Walnut St. The front passenger side of V1 then struck V2 in the passenger side, casing a collision. D1 stated that he was headed S/B on S Walnut St, approaching the intersection of E Grimes Ln, D1 stated that he was directly behind D2, and both drivers were in the left hand turn lane. D1 stated that D2 had her turn signal on to turn left, and believed she was turning left onto E Grimes Ln. D1 stated that as he passed D2 she then turned left in front of him, causing V1 to strike V2 in the passenger side. D2 stated that she was in the left hand turn lane and had used her turn signal to indicate her intent to turn left into the above address. D2 stated that as she attempted to make her turn, D1 attempted to pass her, using the N/B lane, causing V1 to strike V2 in the passenger side.

V1 was traveling east bound on West State Road 45, directly behind V2. V2 was stopped in the roadway, preparing to turn into a parking lot. V1 crashed into the rear of V2 and then ran off the roadway.

THE OWNER OF V1 DISCOVERED THAT V1 WAS STRUCK BY V2 ON THE MORNING OF 9/11/2019.V2 PULLED INTO A PARKING SPACE NEXT TO V1 AND SCRAPED THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR CORNER CAUSING A MINOR DAMAGE.I LOCATED D2 WHO STATED THAT SHE PULLED INTO THE PARKING SPOT ON 9/10/19, AT APPROX. 8 PM. On 09/11/2019, I was in uniform and on duty in my fully marked Indiana State Police car when I was dispatched to a report of a single vehicle crash involving an off-duty trooper with an object in the roadway. The location of the crash was Indiana State Road 37 northbound, approximately one half mile north of the ramps for Monroe Dam road. State Road 37 in this area is a asphalt 4-lane divided highway, that runs primarily north-south, connecting the cities of Bloomington to the north with Bedford to the south. It has a shoulder approximately one vehicle wide bordering the outside lane and has painted lane control devices. The road surface at this time was dry, and the sky was cloudy, with normal low light nighttime conditions. Traffic was moderate at the time of the collision. When I arrived, I observed a gray Dodge Charger unmarked police vehicle bearing Indiana passenger plates 340NTB pulled into the highway crossover located at approximately 8787 IN 37, Bloomington, IN 47403. The vehicle had damage to the front lower left corner of the bumper cover (driver's side) with paint loss and cracking of the finish, showing evidence of an impact. The crate was destroyed and the fragments were further south of where the vehicle had come to a controlled stop. There were no injuries to the driver, and the vehicle remained drivable. The airbags did not deploy. The commission number was 3888 and the mileage was 130600. The driver was Sergeant Doug Hutchinson of the Indiana State Police and was driving in an off-duty status at the time of the crash. Driver 1 (D1) stated that he was north bound on State Road 37 in the left lane. D1 said that as he approached the hill crest and curve he observed a plastic crate in the left lane of travel. Driver 1 stated that he did attempted to avoid the object but was unable to safely do so. The front driver's side corner of Vehicle 1 struck the plastic crate.After interviewing the driver and photographing the damage, I left the scene to complete my accident report. The vehicle was driven away from the scene without incident.

On Wednesday, September 11, 2019 at 18:30, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on SR37N approximately 975 feet north of Victor Pike. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. SR37 is an active construction area to the south of the collision site. V1, silver Toyota, was traveling north on SR37 north of Victor Pike. V1 traveled off the east side of the roadway and struck a guardrail. V1 spun clockwise after initial impact and came to final rest along the east shoulder facing to the south.D1, Covey, stated he was traveling north on SR37 north of Victor Pike. D1 stated he was utilizing his left foot to operate the foot pedals due to a prior injury to his right leg. D1 stated he looked down momentarily to adjust and inadvertently traveled off the right side of the roadway. D1 stated he struck the guardrail, spun then came to final rest facing south along the shoulder.Evidence shows damage to the front right corner and wheel of V1. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail end and face along the east side of SR37. Primary Cause of this collision is D1 indicated he was distracted due to utilizing his left foot which contributed to V1 failing to maintain lane.

D2 STATED THAT HE WAS SLOWED OR STOPPED IN TRAFFIC JUST WEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF WINSLOW AND HENDERSON, FACING EAST.D2 WAS FACING EAST WHEN THE VEHICLE BEHIND HIM, WHICH HE DESCRIBED AS A BLACK SUBARU, ATTEMPTED TO PASS HIM ON HIS DRIVER SIDE.THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR DRIVER'S CORNER OF V2.V1 DID CONTINUE DRIVING UNTIL TURNING NORTH ON SOUTH HENDERSON WITHOUT EXCHANGING INFORMATION.A WITNESS, WHO D2 ONLY IDENTIFIED AS SAMANTHA ELLIS, DID SEE THE ACCIDENT AND DID PHOTOGRAPH THE LICENSE PLATE FOR V1 AS IT LEFT THE AREA.I WILL SUPPLEMENT THE STATE REPORT WHEN I MAKE CONTACT WITH THE OWNER OF V1.ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2019 I MADE CONTACT WITH D1.D1 DID NOT REMEMBER BEING INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDETN AT HENDERSON AND WINSLOW; HOWEVER THERE WAS DAMAGE CONSISTING OF SCRATCHES CONSISTENT WITH A SAME DIRECTION SIDE SWIPE ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF V1. DUE TO THIS DAMAGE BEING OBSERVED, D1 DID PROVIDE ME WITH HIS INSURANCE INFORMATION AND IT WAS ADDED TO THE REPORT.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS BACKING AND WAS WATCHING THE OWNER OF THE PROPERTY LOCATED AT 8211 N LEE PAUL WHEN SHE HIT A POWER JUNCTION BOX BELONGING TO REMC. THE DRIVER STATED SHE WAS FOCUSED ON WATCHING THE OWNER OF THE PROPERTY AND DIDNT SEE THE POWER BOX. THE VEHICLE PUSHED THE BOX OFF OF ITS FOUNDATION BUT DID NOT DAMAGE ANY WIRES NOR DAMAGE THE BOX ITSELF. THERE WERE SCRATCHES ON THE REAR BUMPER OF VEHICLE 1

Both drivers stated they were westbound on State Road 46 in the turn lane to turn south on N Curry Pike. D1 was behind D2. Both claim there was a 3rd vehicle present (two cars ahead of D2) that slammed on its brakes causing both drivers to also slam on their brakes. D1 rear ended D2 however D2 did not crash into the vehicle in front of him, and that vehicle did not crash into the vehicle who allegedly slammed on its brakes.Drivers stated the collision occurred at the intersection on W State Road 46 and N Curry Pike but they moved the vehicles out of the roadway near N Curry Pike and Lintel Drive.

V1 V2 AND V3 WERE AT THE STOP LIGHT OF W SR 46 & N CURRY PK. V1 AND V2 STATED THEY BELIEVED THE LIGHT HAD TURNED GREEN. V2 STARTED IN TRAFFIC WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2 PUSHING V2 INTO V3. V1 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END.V2 WAS TOWED DUE TO DAMAGE TO THE REAR END AND FRONT END.V3 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR END.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. STATE ROAD 48 COMING UP TO THE INTERSECTION WHEN SHE STATES THE TRAFFIC LIGHT TURNED YELLOW AND V1 WAS STRUCK BY V2.D2 STATED SHE WAS SITTING AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT ON S. KIRBY ROAD WHEN HER LIGHT CHANGED TO GREEN. SHE PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION NORTH BOUND AND V1 CAME THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND V2 STRUCK V1 ON THE FRONTDRIVERS SIDE.I SPOKE TO MULTIPLE WITNESSES IN WHICH THEY STATED V1 RAN THE RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION. WITNESSES CONTACT INFORMATION HAS BEEN ADDED.

Owner of V2 stated that he parked V2 at the Fairfield Inn and Suits, 120 S Fairfield Drive, at around 0000 hours on 09/11/2019. Owner of V2 stated that he went out to the parking lot at approximately 1000 hours and noticed damage to V2. Owner of V2 found a note on V2, however the note only had a phone number that could not be reached. The damage to V2 had white paint transfer on it. The damage appeared consistent with a white SUV sized vehicle. No vehicle in the parking lot had any damage or appeared to be a possible suspect vehicle. There are no cameras on the hotel or in the parking lot. I was unable to find a return in our local database for the phone number provided on the note.

This crash occurred on Gourley Pike, just west of Kinser Pike. Gourley Pike is a local / city street that primarily runs east and west. The weather at the time of the crash was clear, sunny and 88 F.Vehicle #1, a black 2007 Ford Focus, was attempting to pull out of a private drive on the south side of Gourley Pike, attempting to turn east (right) onto Gourley Pike. Vehicle #2, a white 2005 Cadillac STS, was travelling west on Gourley Pike. Vehicle #1 pulled onto Gourley Pike, crossed the center line as it turned and struck vehicle #2 near the driver side rear door with vehicle #1s front driver side bumper. Driver #1, Abbagail Henry, stated that she thought could pull onto Gourley Pike without hitting vehicle #2 but misjudged the distance of vehicle #2. Driver #1 said that her front driver side bumper struck vehicle #2 near the back driver side door.Driver #2, Dennis Stillions, stated that he was westbound on Gourley Pike when vehicle #1 pulled out of a private drive and struck his vehicle. Driver #1 stated that he had nowhere to go to avoid the collision. Evidence on the scene indicated that vehicle #1 failed to yield to vehicle #2, crossed the center line and struck vehicle #2. Both vehicles were drivable.

DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING STRAIGHT WHEN SHE SAW VEHICLE 1 BACKING OUT. DRIVER 2 STOPPED HER VEHICLE UPON NOTICING THIS. SHE SAID THAT VEHICLE 1 CONTINUED TO BACK OUT EVENTUALLY MAKING CONTACT WITH HER VEHICLE. DRIVER 1 THEN DROVE AWAY FROM THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT.OFFICER WAS ABLE TO MAKE CONTACT WITH DRIVER 1 DUE TO THE PLATE INFORMATION COLLECTED BY DRIVER 2. UPON MAKING CONTACT, DRIVER 2 STATED HE WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE WHEN HE BUMPED ANOTHER VEHICLE. HE STATED HE LEFT THE SCENE BECAUSE HE DID NOT THINK THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE OTHER VEHICLE.DRIVER 1 WAS ISSUED A CITATION FOR LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT.

V1 was in the left lane on S. Walnut street headed NB and was stopped in traffic at 1st street traffic light. V2 was in front of V1 and V3 was in front of V2. When traffic started to move, V1 struck V2 in the rear which caused V2 to move forward and strike V3 in the rear.D1 stated that he was stopped in traffic and then traffic started to move. He started forward and then traffic stopped suddenly. He stated that his brakes are not good and he was unable to get stopped and he struck V2 in the rear bumper causing it to hit V3.D2 stated that he was stopped and traffic started to move and so did he. He said V3 stopped suddenly and he was able to get stopped and then was hit from behind by V1 which caused him to move forward and strike V3. D3 stated that he was stopped behind another vehicle. He said the light turned green and he started to move. The vehicle in front of him stopped suddenly in the road and he then had to stop suddenly. He stated he was then hit from behind by V2.

Veh 1 was backing out of a parking space in the Mcdonald's parking lot. It was near the entrance drive. Veh 2 entered the parking lot. Driver 1 failed to see Veh 2 pulling into the lot and backed into Veh 2's pass side rear qtr panel. Veh 1 sits high enough off the ground it made it difficult to see Veh 2 behind him. It was his trailer hitch which impacted Veh 2. Also 3 yr old Miriam Grile was correctly seated in a car seat behind driver's seat of Driver 2. There were no injuries to any involved parties.

Owner of vehicle 1 stated she had parked in front of the Goodwill at 1284 Liberty drive and when she came out she noticed deep scratches on her rear bumper. She stated that she had just came from another store and had put things in her trunk so she was sure the scratches were not there before she arrived at the Goodwill. Vehicle 1 had scratches on the top of the rear bumper but no other damage.

D1 stated he was traveling west on State Road 46. D1 stated he had a drink from Starbucks and had dropped it. D1 stated he looked down to retrieve his drink and when he looked up it was too late to stop and he ran into the back of V2 causing damage to both vehicles. D1 had a complaint of pain to his chest from his seat belt and a small scrape to his left knee.D2 stated he was traveling west on State Road 46. D2 stated she was stopped in traffic. D2 stated she saw V1 fast approaching the rear of her vehicle then collided into her. D2 had a complaint of pain to her lower right leg and a complaint of pain to her head.D3 stated she was traveling west on State Road 46. D3 stated she was stopped in traffic when V1 collided into V2 causing V2 to collide with the rear of her vehicle. D3 did not have any injuries.The front passenger of D2 had a complaint of pain to her back and knees and was transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital via EMS 301.The back left passenger had a complaint of pain to her head.The back right passenger had a complaint of pain to her back.The sign damaged belonged to Milestone Construction LP.

V1 REAR-ENDED V2 AS V2 WAS SLOWING DOWN IN TRAFFIC AND ATTEMPTING TO TURN INTO 4611 N STATE ROAD 37 BUSINESS.THERE WAS A LANGUAGE BARRIER WITH D1, HOWEVER I WAS INFORMED THAT HE SLOWED DOWN AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN INTO HIS RESIDENCE. I DID OBSERVE THE TURN SIGNAL STILL ON INDICATING A LEFT TURN AT THE CRASH SCENE.D2 STATED THAT THAT V1 STOPPED IN FRONT OF HER, WHICH CAUSED HER TO REAR END V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: On Thursday, September 12, 2019 at 16:34 hours, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on W Bayles Rd at the intersection of N Northwoods Ln. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry.V1, bronze Ford, was traveling east on Bayles Road, attempting to make a left, north, turn onto Northwoods Lane. V2, black Nissan, was traveling west on Bayles Road approaching Northwoods Lane. V1 failed to yield the right of way to V2 and began to turn left across the westbound lane. V1 struck the front of V2 with the front of V1. Both V1 and V2 came to final rest in the westbound lane of Bayles Road.D1, McKee, stated he was traveling east on Bayles Road and was attempting to make a left turn onto Northwoods Lane. D1 stated he did not see V2 traveling west on Bayles Road. D1 stated he began to make the left turn when the front of V1 struck the front of V2. D2, Boltinghouse, stated she was traveling west on Bayles Road. D2 stated V1 began to make a left turn and she was unable to avoid the collision. D2 stated the front of V1 struck the front of V2 in the westbound lane of Bayles Road. Evidence shows impact occurred in the westbound lane of Bayles Road at Northwoods Lane. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front of V2. Passenger in V2 was treated at the scene for an abrasion on the left leg by EMS

D1 stated he reached over to grab something from the passenger seat, D1 drifted to the side of the lane and side swiped a piece of construction equipment. D1 stated he drove down the road, turned around and came back to the scene however no one was around to speak with about the collision. Witness who observed the collision confirmed the worker for that equipment were away for lunch at the time.I was able to meet with D1 the following day at his residence to complete the collision report.To equipment that was struck belongs to Miller Pipeline. It is described as a Vermer D24x40 s/n 1vrx200f7111000452

BOTH VEHICLES WERE ON NORTH OLD STATE ROAD 37, BETWEEN WALNUT ST AND DUNN ST.D1 SAID THAT SOUTH WEST TRAFFIC WAS AT A STANDSTILL, SO HE MOVED TO MAKE A U-TURN, TO GO BACK TO DUNN ST. AS HE STARTED HIS TURN, HE STRUCK V2, WHICH WAS NORTH EAST BOUND.D2 SAID HE HAD TURNED RIGHT ONTO OLD 37, AND V1 SUDDENLY TRIED TO TURN IN FRONT OF V2.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 was turning into the parking lot of Burger King South off of Country Club Drive. D1 was east bound on Country Club when she turned north into the parking lot of Burger King. When D1 was turning in Simon Brown came across west bound in D1s lane of travel. Simon Brown was struck with the front of D1s vehicle. Simon was knocked down and suffered minor cuts and abrasions to his face. D1 stated that she did not see Simon crossing the driveway. Simon stated that he was not paying attention and had his head phones on very loudly. Simon stated that he crossed in front of D1s vehicle.Both parties came to the Monroe County Sheriffs Office to make a report of the incident.Simon was taken to IU Health Emergency Room by his mother in her vehicle to have his injuries assessed.

D1/V1 left the scene prior to my arrival. A criminal investigation into the accident is inactive at this time. V2 was parked in a marked parking space East of the owners residence, 1405 W 13th St. V2 was struck by unknown vehicle on the rear drivers side, causing cosmetic damage. V2 was able to be driven from the scene.

V1 was traveling west on Third Street passing Highland Avenue in the left lane of traffic. V2 was traveling west on Third Street passing Highland Avenue in the right lane of traffic. V1 attempted to change lanes into the right lane of traffic. V1 did not notice V2 in the right lane. V1 then side swiped V2. V1 had moderate damage to the entire passenger side. V2 had moderate damage to the entire drivers side. D1 stated that he did not notice V2 in the opposite lane and attempted to change lanes. D1 stated V1 then side swiped V2. D2 stated that she was traveling straight when she noticed V2 begin to merge into her lane. D2 stated that she could not avoid V1. V1 then struck V2. There were no injuries and no vehicles had to be towed at the scene.

Collision occurred in the parking lot (private property) of Circle K gas station/convenience store located at 504 W. Temperance St., Ellettsville, IN 47429. V2 was parked facing southeast at a fuel pump (Pump #3). V1 was attempting to pull up to an adjacent fuel pump (Pump #2). As V1 entered the fuel pump area, D2 opened the driver's door to V2. V1 collided with V2 causing minor damage to the driver's door of V2 and minor damage to the front passenger-side quarter panel of V1. V2's driver's door would not close after the collision.No injuries were reported to this officer at the scene of the collision. Photographs of the damage to both vehicles as well as an overall photograph of the general area where the collision occurred are available upon request. Body-worn and in-car camera video is also available upon request.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Unit 1 was traveling west on 3rd Street approaching the intersection of 3rd Street and Woodlawn Avenue. Unit 2 was on a bicycle traveling east on the south side of the roadway on 3rd Street approaching the crosswalk on Woodlawn Avenue.Driver 1 advised she began turning south on Woodlawn Avenue and did not see Unit 2 crossing the crosswalk. Driver 1 stated she believed she struck Unit 2 with the center of her front bumper but then advised it was possibly closer to the driver's side of the front bumper. She advised that she was unable to see Unit 2 well due to the height of the truck but stated she did know that Unit 2 did not fall. Driver 1 stated she struck Unit 2 at a very low speed.Pedalcyclist riding Unit 2 stated she was crossing the crosswalk while the walk sign when Unit 1 began turning. Pedalcyclist was crying and advised she believed she struck the passenger side of Unit 1 but stated she was unsure. She believed she fell but was unsure if she hit her head while not wearing a helmet. Due to this she agreed to be checked out by medics. While speaking with medics Pedalcyclist stated she remembered being struck and stated she did not fall. She advised she did not hit her head and was not injured. Pedalcyclist stated she was just very shaken up by the accident.No one involved complained of injuries.There did not appear to be any damage to Unit 1 or Unit 2.Due to the Units being moved and the subjects being unsure of the point of impact a diagram was not completed.

V2 WAS PARKED IN PARKING LOT. OWNER OF V2 CAME OUT OF BUSINESS WHEN SHE SAW D1 BACK INTO HER VEHICLE. SHE ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH V1 BUT HE DROVE OFF. OWEN COUNTY INDIANA SHERIFF'S OFFICE WENT TO D1'S RESIDENCE AND MADE CONTACT WITH OWNER. HE STATED HE TALKED TO A FEMALE ON SCENE THAT STATED IT WAS OK AND TO JUST LEAVE. WHEN SPEAKING TO V2 OWNER SHE STATED THAT WAS SOMEONE ELSE AND SHE NEVER SPOKE TO D1. V2 OWNER DID NOT WISH TO PURSE ANY CRIMINAL CHARGERS AGAINST D1. D1 STATED HE WAS BACKING OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT AND JUST DIDN'T SEE V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 CAME TO POLICE STATION TO FILE A ACCIDENT REPORT THE DAY AFTER THE INCIDENT. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON 16TH STREET AND WAS APPROACHING AN INTERSECTION WHEN V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION TRAVELING NORTH. D2 STATED THAT HE DID NOT HAVE A STOP SIGN BUT V1 DID HAVE A STOP SIGN THAT IT DISREGARDED. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS ABLE TO REDUCE HIS SPEED SIGNIFICANTLY BEFORE THE IMPACT BUT STILL COLLIDED WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF V2 AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1.OFFICER ROMOSER SPOKE WITH D1. ROMOSER INFORMED ME OF THE FOLLOWING. D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON GRANT AND STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION WITH 16TH STREET. D1 STATED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO CLEAR THE INTERSECTION AND THAT A BUSH WAS OBSTRUCTING HER VIEW TO THE WEST. D1 BELIEVED THAT NO VEHICLES WERE COMING AND SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION DRIVING SOUTH. AT THAT TIME V2 WAS ENTERING THE INTERSECTION DRIVING EAST AND COLLIDED WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1. D1 ALSO STATED THAT SHE BELIEVED THAT V2 WAS TRAVELING TOO FAST BECAUSE HE "CAME OUT OF NOWHERE". IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT D1 DID STATE THAT HER VIEW WAS OBSTRUCTED TO THE WEST BEFORE SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION, CAUSING HER TO BE UNABLE TO OBSERVE ONCOMING VEHICLES.

V1 was turning into a parking spot next to V2. D1 struck V2 on the left side of V2 resulting in less than $1,000 damage as a paint scuff. There was no observable damage to V1 just the visible camp paint transfer on V2.

Narrative By Chief Deputy William Jay HumphreyEllettsville Police DepartmentDate 09-12-2019Report # E19-05043Driver #1 lania GarrisonDriver #2 Jeremy HamiltonDriver #1 going North 4455 Hartstrait Rd. Driver #1 said was turning heater Knob her vehicle went (left Of Center) and struck Vehicle #2 going South Bound on Hartstrait Rd.Driver #2 said Vehicle #1 went Left Of Center and struck his drivers side on his vehicle #2.(Driver #2 was trapped inside of his Vehilce had to be cut out.) Transported to Bloomington Hospital.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON SOUTH KINGSTON AND WAS ABOUT TO PASS THE INTERSECTION FOR THE NORTH ENTRANCE OF TARGET, LOCATED AT 2966 E 3RD STREET WHEN V1 DID DRIVE WEST THROUGH THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED THAT SHE COULD NOT STOP AND THAT THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 WAS STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN ACROSS FROM THE ENTRANCE TO TARGET, ATTEMPTING TO CROSS KINGSTON TO GET TO TARGET.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THERE IS NOT A STOP SIGN FOR SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC ON KINGSTON.D1 EXPLAINED THAT TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP AND HE DID NOT SEE ANY CARS DRIVING SOUTH ON KINGSTON SO HE DID START DRIVING THORUGH THE INTERSECTION. AT THAT POINT D1 STATED THAT THE FRONT OF V2 MADE CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1. V1 WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.
V-2 WAS STOP IN TRAFFIC V-1 DID NOT SEE V-2 STOP. V-1 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V-2

V1 and V2 were both traveling southbound on College Ave when V1 attempted to turn left onto W 8th St from the center lane and struck V2 as it was attempting to continue southbound in the far east lane.D1 stated he was attempted to turn left from the center lane after realizing he was about to pass W 8th St and struck V2. D1 stated he did not see D2 prior to making contact with the vehicle. D2 stated he was southbound in the far left (east) lane when V1 attempted to turn left onto W 8th St directly in front of him. D2 stated he was unable to avoid making contact with V1 due to the close proximity of the vehicles. V1 sustained minor damage to the front drivers side 1/4 panel. V2 sustained damage to the front passenger side 1/4 panel as well as the passenger side door. Both vehicles were driven away from the scene.

D1 WAS DRIVING SOUTH THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF COLLEGE MALL AND E 3RD STREET. D1 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS IN THE LEFT LANE AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN RIGHT IN TO THE RIGHT LANE WHEN THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER OF V1 MADE CONTACT WITH A HORSE TRAILER, TR348ZWS, BEING PULLED BY V2.THE HORSE TRAILER SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER. V1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE FRONT PASSENGER CORNER.D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE MALL IN THE INTERSECTION OF 3RD AND COLLEGE MALL WHEN SHE DID SEE V1 ATTEMPT TO TURN RIGHT AND DID MAKE CONTACT WITH HER HORSE TRAILER.

V2 and V3 were stopped in traffic facing N/B on N SR 46, approaching E 10th Street, in the left lane. V1 approached from the rear and struck the rear end of V2, which caused V2 to strike V3.D1 stated that she activated the brake as she approached V2, and looked down before the accident took place. D1 estimated that she was going 20 MPH at the time of collision.

Driver one stated she was stopped in traffic facing west on E 3rd Street behind vehicle two when she though vehicle two started to move so she began to move. Driver one stated she hit the rear of vehicle two with the front of her vehicle. Driver two stated she was stopped in traffic when vehicle one hit the rear of her vehicle.

V1 and V2 were involved in a rear to rear collision. D2 stated that D1 was eating while driving and believed it contributed to the collision. D1 stated that she began honking the horn when she believed there was going to be a collision between the vehicles. I put in a request to the Speedway mgnt for them to pull video, however, they stated it would be over a week for them to processes this. Both D1 and D2 believed it was the other parties fault. Unable to establish fault. Insurance will have to reach out to Speedway privately if they want to recover video.

D1 advised he was backing V1 up, south bound, into a loading dock area. D1 advised while backing up V1 crashed into V2. D1 advised he then began to drive V1 forward and bent the front bumper of V2.V2 as parked and unoccupied facing north

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W STATE ROAD 45 AND STRUCK BY A TIRE THAT FELL OFF OF A TRAILER FOR V2 AS IT WAS PULLING EB OUT OF 4385 W STATE ROAD 45.D1 STATED THAT HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK BY THE TRAILER FROM V2.D2 STATED THAT THE AXLE ON THE TRAILER THAT HE WAS PULLING BROKE CAUSING THE COLLISON WITH V1.NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED BECAUSE BOTH VEHICLE MOVED FROM THE POINT OF IMPACT. \

Driver 1 was traveling southbound on South Harmony Road approaching the 7800 block. Driver 1 stated that he was going too quickly, approximately 45-50 mph in the 35 mph zone. Driver 1 stated as he attempted to go around the curve he hit a wet spot on the road which he stated due to his speed and his bald tires he began losing control and went off the roadway. Driver 1 struck two mailboxes then collided head on with a tree. Driver 1 and one rear seat passenger declined medical personnel. Three additional passengers within the vehicle required medical attention due to complaint of pain for their leg, knee, and chest. Each of the three were transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy front end damage and was towed by Ken's Westside.

VEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH ROGERS STREET NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST WALLS DRIVE. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VHEICLE 2 THAT WAS SLOWED OR STOPPED IN TRAFFIC. VEHICLE 2 WAS PUSHED FORWARD AND STRUCK VEHICL 3 IN THEH REAR. DRIVER 2 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH DUE TO COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN NECK. VEHICLE 3 WAS DRIVABLE AND WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS IN LINE TO EXIT PARKING LOT WHEN VEH IN FRONT OF HER HIT THE BRAKES, D2 SAID THAT SHE HIT HER BRAKES AND WAS ABLE TO STOP. WHEN V1 STRUCK HER IN THE REAREND. D1 SAID THAT SHE HIT HER BRAKES WHEN SHE SAW V2 BRAKE LIGHTS COME ON AND FOOT SLIPPED OFF BRAKE AND IT GAS PEDAL. D1 THEN SAID BY THE TIME SHE GOT BACK OG THE BRAKE SHE HIT V2 IN THE REAR END.

On 09/13/2019 at around 1824 hours I arrived at Eastgate Lane and the 45/46 Bypass in regards to a crash. Indiana State Police was already on scene. I spoke with D1 who stated she was driving and did not have a valid license. She only had an ID card and had never received a license through Indiana. She stated she was driving northbound in the left lane on the 45/46 Bypass traveling at around 25-30mph. She stated that V2 suddenly stopped and D1 was unable to stop in time. V1 rear-ended V2.V1 sustained damage to the front bumper where it was pushed in and up. D1 stated the car was smoking and leaking fluid prior to my arrival and Chandler's came to tow the vehicle out of the roadway. D1 received a citation for driving while never having received a license.I then spoke with D2 who was complaining of neck and left shoulder pain. ISP already had called for an ambulance. D2 would later be transported to the hospital and her husband moved the car. D2 stated she was driving in the left lane going northbound on the 45/46 Bypass approaching Eastgate Lane. D2 stated she was traveling at about 30mph and was slowing in traffic when D1 rear-ended her. V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper where it was dented.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on 10th Street. V1 struck V2 in the rear.D1 stated that she was westbound on 10th Street and did not see V2 stopped to make a left turn. She then struck V2.D2 stated that she was westbound on 10th Street and was stopped in traffic to make a left turn onto Dunn St. She was struck from behind by V1.V1 did strike to V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling southbound on Highland Ave and Atwater Ave. V2 was traveling eastbound on Atwater Ave approaching Highland Ave.D1 stated she was stopped at the stop sign on Highland Ave just north of Atwater Ave when she waited for a bus to pass in the left lane on Atwater Ave. D1 stated that when the bus passed, she looked right and did not see any vehicles eastbound on Atwater Ave. D1 stated she proceeded through the intersection and collided with V2. V1 had heavy damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle.D2 stated he was traveling eastbound on Atwater Ave approaching Highland Ave in the right lane. D2 stated there was a bus in the left lane as they were traveling eastbound. D2 stated that V1 proceeded southbound through the intersection and collided with him. D2 stated he could not avoid the collision. V2 had damage to the front-end of the vehicle.

V1 was traveling behind V2 northbound on N. Curry Pike in the 900 Block. D1 stated that he was looking down at his cell phone and did not see V2 stop, causing V1 to rear end V2. V2 left the scene of the accident and D1 was unable to provide any type of vehicle description for V2. V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON BASSWOOD DRIVE IN THE LEFT TURN LANE, AT THE INTERSECTION WITH W BLOOMFIELD RD. V1 WAS DIRECTLY BEHIND V2. WHEN THE LEFT TURN GREEN ARROW ACTIVATED, V2 STARTED INTO THE INTERSECTION. D1 STARTED TO PULL FORWARD AS WELL, BUT DID NOT NOTICE V1 STOPPING ABRUPTLY UNTIL IT WAS TOO LATE. V1 REAR ENDED V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 WAS SOUTH BOUND ON BASSWOOD DRIVE IN THE LEFT TURN LANE, AT THE INTERSECTION WITH W BLOOMFIELD ROAD. WHEN THE GREEN ARROW ACTIVATED, V2 STARTED INTO THE INTERSECTION. D2 THEN NOTICED AN UNINVOLVED 3RD VEHICLE DISREGARD THE RED LIGHT FOR EAST BOUND TRAFFIC AND ENTER THE INTERSECTION. D2 APPLIED THE BRAKES SUDDENLY TO AVOID STRIKING THIS VEHICLE. V2 WAS THEN REAR ENDED BY V1.

D1 WAS TRAVELING NB WHEN ANOTHER VEH, BLK PICK UP WAS GOING SB IN THE LANE. THE PARTIES IN THE PICKUP STARTED THROWING WATER BALLoONS AT V1. V1 REVERSED SB TO AVOID THE PICK UP. V1 THEN CONTINUED TO REVERSE AND TURNED ATTMEPTING TO TURN AROUND. V1 REVERSED NE AND REVERSED INTO V2. D1 ADVISED SHE WAS FOCUSING ON THE BLACK PICKUP THROWING THE WATER BALLONS AT V1 AND DID NOT SEE V2. V1 SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR DRIVER SIDE BUMPER. V2 SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE BUMPER. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED AT THE TIME OF IMPACT. CONTACT WAS MADE WITH THE OWNER OF V2, HOWEVER THE OWNER IS CURRENTLY OUT OF TOWN.

Prior to the collision, V1 and V2 were traveling east on E 10th Street approaching N Park Avenue. V1 was behind V2. When I arrived on scene, V1 and V2 had both been pulled off onto N Park Avenue. D1 said he was driving east on E 10th Street at the speed limit (30mph) and must have been looking down at his speedometer when V2 suddenly applied the brakes. When D1 noticed V2 slowing he also applied the brakes but it was too late to avoid the rear-end collision. D2 said she was driving east on E 10th Street when the vehicle in front of her applied their brakes suddenly. D2 also began slowing down when V1 struck the rear of V2 . V1 sustained damage to its front bumper, headlights, and hood. V2 sustained damage across the rear bumper.

D1 stated they were driving southbound on S State Rd 46 in the eastern-most lane, past the intersection with E 7th St. D1 stated they took their eyes off the road in front of them to locate the turn lane ahead of them. While doing this, D1 stated that he then struck the rear of V2. D1 stated he did not think he was traveling very fast, rather, the momemtum of the weight of V1 along with its trailer are responsible for the severity of the crash. D2 stated they were stopped in a line of traffic on S State Rd 46, in the eastern-most lane, past the intersection with E 7th St. D2 stated that V2 was suddenly struck from the rear by V1. D2 was later transported to the hospital for a complaint of pain in the neck. V2 had a passenger in the front seat, who was also transported to the hospital due to complaint of pain in the back. This passenger stated their seat belt came undone during the accident. D3 stated they were stopped in a line of traffic on S State Rd 46, in the eastern-most lane, past the intersection with E 7th St. D3 stated that V3 was suddenly struck from the rear by V2.

Vehicles were coming to a stop due to traffic for an IU Football game. As V3 and V2 were coming to a stop due to the traffic back up, V1 failed to stop and struck V2 in the rear which caused V2 to collide with V3 in the rear.

D2 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE. HE SAID WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH, V1 MERGED INTO HIS LANE AND STRUCK HIS VEHICLE.

BOTH VEHS WERE TOWED FROM THE SCENE. NEITHER PARTY HAD A COMPLAINT OF INJURY.

D1 REPORTED HE HAD STRUCK A DEER BETWEEN 0500 AND 0600 HRS ON TODAYS DATE NEAR THE ROUNDABOUT OFF TAPP AND ADAMS. Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling northbound on the N Jordan Ave. Extension when he observed V2, a motorized Lime Scooter, traveling directly at him. V1 stopped so as to not run into V2, V2 did not stop and hit V1 head on, before leaving the scene. D1 advised that he was driving for Uber/Lyft during the IU home football game. D1 advised that at approximately 0102 hours he turned north onto the N Jordan Ave. Extension from E 17th St. D1 advised that heavy traffic and pedestrian congestion was causing him to drive incredibly slowly. D1 stated that at some point in the area of 1410 N Jordan Ave. he observed V2, the Lime Scooter, traveling directly at him in his lane of travel. D1 advised that he stopped V1 in the roadway and began yelling at Operator 2 to not hit his car. D1 advised that O2 hit V1 anyway. O2 was described as a white college aged male with brown hair. D1 stated that he exited his vehicle and told the male not to leave, but the male got back on his scooter and left anyway. V1 sustained several dents and gouges to the hood.

V2 was parked facing S/B on N Clark Street, directly across from 302 N Clark St. V1 was facing E/B in the driveway of 302 N Clark St. V1 backed up and collided with the driver's side door of V2. V1 had damage on the rear right bumper. V1 then fled the scene.D1 was located at 4290 W Crestwood Drive. D1 stated that she felt a bump while backing, but believed she had gone into a ditch. D1 was arrested for leaving the scene of the accident.The owner of 302 N Clark St provided camera footage of the accident.

D1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E SAMPLE RD NEAR 700 E SAMPLE RD. W1 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF A DOWNED TREE FACING WB WITH HIS FLASHERS ON IN AN ATTEMPT TO WARN OTHER DRIVERS OF THE DOWNED TREE. DUE TO W1'S LIGHTS, D1 COULD NOT SEE THE DOWNED TREE. D1 HIT DOWNED TREE, CAUSING THE TREE TO SNAP IN HALF AND CAUSING HIS VEHICLE TO GO AIRBORNE. THE VEHICLE LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A TREE. V1 WAS FOLLOWING V2 SOUTH BOUND IN TRAFFIC ON IN45/46 BYPASS. Vehicle 1 ( White 2002 Ford F150) was traveling east on W. 3rd Street at N. Gates Drive. Vehicle 1 was in the right, eastbound lane. Vehicle 2 ( Gray 2016 Jeep Cherokee) was turning east from N. Gates Drive on to W. 3rd Street. Vehicle 2 was in the right turn lane. Vehicle 3 (Gold 2000 Ford F150) was turning east from N. Gates Drive on to W. 3rd Street. Vehicle 3 was in the left turn lane. Vehicle 1 disregarded the red light and continued through the intersection. Vehicle 1 struck both vehicles 2 and 3 as they turned on to W. 3rd Street. This resulted in damage to the front passenger side of vehicles 2 and 3. As well as damage to the front drivers side of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 1 then came to rest on the raised concrete divider facing northeast.Driver 1 (Joseph A. Smith Jr.) advised that he was traveling east on W. 3rd Street. He advised that he thought he had the green light when he drove through the intersection at N. Gates Drive. Driver 1 advised that as he drove through the intersection he attempted to change lanes but was unable to avoid striking vehicles 2 and 3. Driver 2 ( Timothy W. Fleener) advised that he was turning from N. Gates Drive on to W. 3rd Street. Driver 2 advised that he witnessed that he had the green turn arrow before proceeding into the intersection. Driver 2 advised that as he was turning, his vehicle was struck by Vehicle 1. Driver 2 advised that he was unable to avoid the collision.Driver 3 (Timothy Wood Fagan) advised that he was turning from N. Gates Drive on to W. 3rd Street. Driver 3 advised that he witnessed that he had the green turn arrow before proceeding in to the intersection. Driver 3 advised that as he was turning, his vehicle was struck by Vehicle 1. Driver 3 advised that he was unable to avoid the collision.I was assisted at the scene by the Monroe County Sheriffs Department. All vehicles involved in the crash were driveable. No injuries were reported by any of those involved.The cause of this crash was disregarding a traffic signal by Driver 1. Had Driver 1 obeyed the red light and brought his vehicle to a stop and not continued through the intersection, this crash would not have occurred.

D2/V2 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND ON N. COLLEGE AVE. I WAS IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. WE COLLIDED IN THE ROADWAY IN THE 800 BLK OF N. COLLEGE AVE.D1/V1 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND ON N. COLLEGE. I WAS TRYING TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN FROM THE RIGHT LANE, I LOOKED UNDER THE RAILROAD UNDERPASS AND AS I STARTED MY TURN, ALL OF THE SUDDEN V2 WAS COMING AT US FAST, I TURNED INTO A DRIVEWAY AND WE COLLIDED IN THE ROADWAY."

D1 stated that he had just turned right (west) onto East 3rd Street from South Jordan Avenue and wanted to turn left at the next cross-street west, South Highland Avenue, to get to the parking lot of TIS Bookstore (1302 E. 3rd St). East 3rd Street is a two-lane, one-way street westbound at this location. D1 advised that he turned into the right lane of East 3rd Street. D1 said he signaled to change lanes into the left lane of East 3rd intending to then turn left (south) onto South Highland. D1 told me that V2 had just turned left (west) out of the Village Pantry parking lot (1320 East 3rd Street), into the left lane of East 3rd Street. D1 advised that he changed lanes into the left lane, not realizing that V2 had come up alongside of V1 more quickly than he anticipated. D2 stated that he had just turned left onto East 3rd Street from the Village Pantry parking lot and was traveling westbound in the left lane when D1 turned left across his path as if he was trying to turn left onto South Highland. V1's rear driver side above the wheel well struck the front passenger side bumper and headlight assembly of V2. There was a dent and scrape above the rear driver side wheel well of V1 from the crash. V2's front passenger side headlight was broken and the front passenger side bumper was damaged as well. There were no injuries and both vehicles could be driven from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Monday, September 16, 2019 at 12:59, Mark Clephane responded to a report o f a crash at 3585 State Rd 45 in the Walmart Parking Lot located in Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. M/Trp. Clephane was told the crash was near the grocery entrance of Walmart. Upon my arrival, there were two ambulances at the grocery entrance, and they were transporting a subject for a medical issue with no crash involved. Observing no crash, M/Trp. Clephane advised radio and left. A short time later, radio advised the crash actually being located in row 10 of the parking lot and that one vehicle had left the scene of the crash. Vehicle 1, red 2019 Chevrolet Spark, bearing Illinois temporary plate 669U162 which had expired on 6/12/2019 was making a U-turn through parking slots and in between parked cars, west of row 10. Vehicle 2, red 2015 Toyota Sienna min-van, bearing Indiana registration RNE284 is going straight south in Row 10 of the Walmart Parking Lot. As V-2 traveled south in Row 10, V-1 made a U-turn through empty parking spaces between parked cars, and as V-1 was finishing his U-turn between parked cars, the front left of V-1 struck the right side of V-2.After the crash, both vehicles backed into empty parking spaces and both drivers got out of their respective vehicles. Driver 2 Elizabeth Byrge, stated that Driver 1 Anton Cowens made the statement that the vehicle was his girlfriend's car. Cowens then left the vehicles and ran inside Walmart through the Grocery Entrance. Cowens went straight to the Customer Service Desk where he spoke with a black female, who was up at the register attempting to return some items. Cowens makes a brief statement to the female, Zeshawn Lewis who is the registered owner of the car, and then Cowen leaves running back out of Walmart. Cowens returns to the where the crashed cars are parked and goes around the passenger side of Vehicle 2 with Elizabeth Byrge to observe the damage. Cowens then walks around the vehicle and over to his girlfriends' vehicle where Cowens gets in and drives away leaving the Walmart lot towards Liberty Drive.Driver 1, Elizabeth Byrge stated that Driver 1 was wearing a blue polo shirt, black male, with his hair cut short. Byrge stated that the male driver told her he was driving his girlfriend's vehicle. Byrge was able to provide the temporary Illinois license plate number for V-1 being 669U162. This unit then contacted Bloomington Post and had them run the information through IDACS and then through the Illinois Authorities and was able to obtain that the vehicle was owned and registered to Zeshawn Lewis, had been purchased at Kingdom Chevrolet Inc., and had an expired temporary plate which had expired on 6-19-2019. Bloomington Radio was able to further advise that Zeshawn Lewis had a date of birth of 10/10/1996. This unit then met with Walmart Loss Prevention Specialist Chad Otto and we reviewed multiple cameras and transactions involved in this incident. Video of the crash and it's aftermath as described above if captured on video. Also not mentioned earlier, when Lewis' return is declined, Walmart's system did not keep her identifying information, however she is still on the video. When Lewis leaves Walmart, after having Cowens come in and speak to her basically in her ear, Lewis leaves by means of going out of the Pharmacy side exit and walks completely out of the camera ranges in the parking lot walking toward the back side of Sam's.This unit continued to investigate and was able to obtain contact numbers for Lewis' parents in Chicago and spoke with them by telephone. Lewis's father said that his daughter had "taken a bad turn" and that she was staying with what he called at first a clown, then corrected himself and stated Cowens. Mr. Lewis stated that he would contact his wife, Betty Lewis, and she might have further. A short time later, Betty Lewis called the Post and informed t

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling eastbound in the 9000 Block of West State Road 48 in Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana shortly before 0500 AM. A recent, light rain shower had made roadway conditions throughout the west and northwest parts of Monroe County slippery. Driver 1 states he was operating near the posted speed limit of 55 MPH while navigating a sweeping left turn between West State Road 43 and West Vernal Pike. Driver 1 reported a loss of traction with the roadway as vehicle 1 slid towards the lower ditch on the inner radius of the curve. Upon entering the ditch, vehicle 1's rear pickup bed/bumper collided with the embankment and caused the vehicle to roll approximately two times before landing back on the tires within the ditch and perpendicular to the roadway. Driver 1 reported minor abrasions to his arms and neck sustained during the collision and stated he is diabetic. Responding EMS checked blood sugar levels and general vital signs and determined that immediate medical attention was not required. Driver 1 left the scene with his father. Vehicle 1 was removed from the scene by Ken's Westside Towing to their storage lot in Bloomington, Indiana.

D1 stated that her vehicle rolled in to V2. D1 stated that she rolled in to the back of the trailer of V2. There was very minor damage to both vehicles.

V2 was traveling north on Cramer Circle when it veered off the roadway striking V1 as V1 was sitting unoccupied in the drive way of 3805 S. Cramer Circle. He looked out his window and saw a black SUV back out of his drive and speed away. While we were on scene of the hit and run accident V2 showed back up to the scene. NARRATIVE: D1 that V1 was parallel parked along the south side of E. 4th Street, facing east. D2 stated that she was driving V2 eastbound on E. 4th Street approaching S Indiana Avenue. D2 stated that she noticed V1 appeared to be waiting for an opportunity to merge out of its parking space, but she believed that D1 saw her vehicle and would stop. D2 stated that as she was passing by V1, it struck her rear passenger side. D1 failed to yield right of way to the eastbound traffic on E. 4th Street, resulting in a collision.

Lauryn Johnson, daughter of Owner 2, called IUPD after discovering fresh damage on the rear bumper of Vehicle 2 (V2). V2 was parked in a parallel parking space on Fisher Ct, facing northbound. Vehicle 1 (V1) was parked directly behind V2 facing the same direction.Damage to V2 consisted of light scrapes to the driver's side corner of the rear bumper. There was matching fresh damage on the passenger's side corner of the front bumper of V1. V1 also had older damage all over the front bumper.The complainant said the damage was not on V2 when she last parked, but noticed it right away especially because V1 was parked extremely close to V2.I was able to contact Driver 1 (D1) by telephone and asked her to return to her vehicle. She said she parallel parked around 1:30PM after returning from class, and knew that she did not have much room because there was a vehicle behind her that she was being cautious about avoiding as she backed into the space. She said she did not realize she made contact with V2 and was very apologetic.

V1 was traveling east bound on State Road 45/46 approaching the 17th St. intersection, in the far right hand lane, slowing down to stop at the red traffic signal.V2 was stopped facing east bound on State Road 45/46 at the 17th St. intersection, in the middle lane. D1 stated he was traveling east bound and did not realize he was drifting into the right hand lane before striking V2 in the rear.D2 stated she was stopped awaiting the traffic signal to change when she was struck from behind. V1 had damage to the front passenger side bumper and the bumper was pushed into the tire making it undriveable. V1 was towed by Ken's West Side to D1's home. V2 had damage to the rear driver side bumper.

V1 then struck V2 in the rear passenger side, which then caused V2 to strike V3 in the rear passenger side. D2 stated that she was then struck by V1, which then caused her vehicle to strike V3. V2 sustained moderate damage to the rear passenger side and mid driver's side. D3/V3 was parked in a marked parking space. Contact was not made with the vehicle owner, however a copy of the accident form was left on the windshield of the vehicle.

V1 COLLIDED WITH V2 AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH STATE ROAD 37 AND SOUTH STATE ROAD 37. V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON STATE ROAD 37 AND V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHWEST ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37. D1 ran off roadway.

D1 WAS BACKING OUT OF HIS DRIVEWAY, HE STATED HE LOOKED BOTH WAYS BUT MUST HAVE MISSED D2. THERE WERE TALL PLANTS NEXT TO DRIVEWAY WHICH WOULD MAKE IT HARD TO SEE AROUND THEM WHEN BACKING.D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVEING SOUTH WHEN D1 BACKED OUT OF THE DRIVEWAY AND INTO THE SIDE OF HER VEHICLE. BOTH DECLINED MEDICAL. D2 CONTACTED OWN PRIVATE TOW TO HAVE IT TOWED BACK TO RESIDENCE. APPEARED TO BE DAMAGE TO WHEEL AND AND SUSPENSION.VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.
Driver one attempted to stop before hitting driver two but was unable to do so  both vehicles westbound and Indiana State Road 46 near Enwright Drive. No Diagram vehicles moved before my arrival.
V2 WAS PARKED ON THE PRIVATE LOT AT 790 S. BASSWOOD DR. WHEN V1 STRUCK THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE PORTION OF HIS VEHICLE BETWEEN 09/16/2019 AT 1830 HOURS AND 09/17/2019 AT 1000 HOURS.

Vehicle 1 was attempting to park facing north on the north side of University Avenue approximately 145 feet east of the intersection of Ballantine Road. Vehicle 2 was parked facing north on the north side of University Avenue approximately 150 feet east of the intersection of Ballantine Road.Driver 1 advised she was attempting to park next to Vehicle 2. Due to the vehicles being moved and the subjects being unsure of the exact spots they were in a diagram was not completed.

RIDGEVIEW DR WHEN V1 TRIED TO MAKE A U-TURN IN FRONT OF HER CAUSING HER TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY AND STRIKE V1

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: P1 stated that he was on his bicycle preparing to cross W. 2nd St northbound at the intersection of S. Patterson Dr. P1 advised he had the walk signal and when he entered the roadway was struck by V1 on his left side. P1 stated he was not knocked off his bicycle. P1 had a complaint of pain on the left side of his hip. P1 was checked by EMS but refused transport at this time. D1 stated she was facing east on W. 2nd Street preparing to make a right hand turn onto S. Patterson Drive. D1 advised she saw P1, but did not believe he was crossing. When she went to make the turn P1 stepped out onto the road and she slightly tapped him. D1 did not report any injuries at this time.

D1 was traveling south in the parking lot. D2 was parked facing south in the parking lot.D1 stated he was driving in the parking lot headed south when he noticed D2 was parked facing south. D1 stated he attempted to drive around D2's parked vehicle and thought he had more space than he did due to a food truck occupying a significant amount of the parking lot. D1 stated he then struck D2's side mirror with the passenger side of his vehicle. D1 stated that he was at fault since he thought he had more room than he actually did. D1 stated he did not have any damage to his vehicle but stated there was paint transfer on D2's side mirror.D2 then left the scene without giving D1 any information in regards to his insurance or name. D1 stated that he got D2's license plate which was an Indiana CM plate UFM955 which came back to a 2004 Silver Lexus GX7. D2 stated he was unfamiliar with the law and had no malicious intent. D2 provided his information willingly. D2 stated that he was parked in the parking lot facing south. D2 stated D1 struck his vehicle and lightly damaged the side mirror of D2's vehicle which left paint transfer.There were no reported injuries.

V1 and V2 were traveling E/B on W 4th ST. V1 struck V2 while backing. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 stated that around 6:30pm she was traveling E/B on W 4th ST. D2 stated that a black Toyota Sequoia was directly in front of her vehicle, slowing down. D2 stated that another vehicle came to a stop abruptly, and D1 slammed on it's brakes. D2 stated that she then noticed that D1 started to back up. D2 stated that she then felt the impact of D1 colliding her her vehicle. D2 stated that she didn't notice any damage to her vehicle until 9:00pm. Due to D1 unsafe backing, V1 struck V2.

Primary Cause- Driver- Other- Vehicle#1 was stopped perpendicular in the roadway at the time of the crash. Driver#1 had previously crashed (Crash number 201900328606) into the guardrail and was stationary at the time of this crash. Vehicle#2 was unable to to avoid striking Vehicle#1 in the roadway. Vehicle#3 struck debris in the roadway.Interstate 69 is a multi-lane road that has two lanes of travel going north and two lanes of travel going south in Monroe County. The roadway is straight in the area of the 109.2 mile marker southbound and is divided with a center grass median and guardrails. The roadway has no grade and is marked with center lines and fog lines. The crash scene was dark with no ambient light from street lights or nearby residences. At the time of the crash the weather was clear and the roadway was dry.Vehicle#1 (Red 2006 Lexis) was stopped perpendicular (facing east) in the southbound lanes of Interstate 69 near the 109.2 mile marker. Driver#1 had previously crashed into a guardrail and came to final rest in the middle of Interstate 69. Vehicle#2 (2002 Pink Peterbilt) was traveling southbound in the right lane and struck Vehicle#1 in the driver's side rear. This action caused Vehicle#1 to rotate counterclockwise and come to a final rest against the median side guardrail, facing north. Vehicle#2 lost control and continued southbound, leaving tire marks on the roadway in the right lane. Vehicle#2 traveled to the left and struck the median guardrail at the Harmony Road overpass. Vehicle#2 continued through the median in a southeasterly direction and struck the northbound side guardrail median. Vehicle#2 then crossed the northbound lanes of Interstate 69, overturned and traveled down an embankment and came to final rest on its passenger's side off the roadway, facing southeast. Vehicle#3 (White 2015 Kenworth) was southbound in the right lane behind Vehicle#2 and struck debris from Vehicle#1 causing damage to the front left bumper. Vehicle#3 came to a controlled stop on the the southbound shoulder near the 109 mile marker. Vehicle#1 and Vehicle#2 were towed from the scene by Ken's West Side Towing. Vehicle#3 was released from the scene.Driver#1 could not remember many details of the crash. She stated that she went out for a drive and did not have a specific destination in mind. Driver#1 stated she was traveling southbound on Interstate 69. She became sleepy and woke up after she struck a guardrail. She did not remember being stopped in the middle of Interstate 69 or Vehicle#2 striking her vehicle. Driver#1 stated that she had on her seat belt at the time of the crash, and she was not using her mobile phone. Driver#2 ( Keith A. Williamson) stated that he was traveling southbound in the right lane on Interstate 69 near the 109.2 mile marker traveling around 65-70 miles per hour. Driver#2 stated he heard the front of his truck strike something in the roadway and believed that he struck a deer but was not sure. After striking the object, he stated that he saw "red dust" and believed that he struck a deer. He lost steering and crossed the center median and flipped over. Driver#3 ( Brad Allen) stated that he was a safe distance behind Vehicle#2 (approximately 300 feet) and saw Vehicle#2 cross the median and did not witness anything else.I arrived on scene and observed Vehicle#2 flipped on its right side partially in the northbound lane. Vehicle#2 had heavy damage to the front left side consistent with striking Vehicle#1. Vehicle#2 was loaded with multiple metal coils, weighting approximately 30,000 pounds total. Most of the metal coils fell off as a result of the crash. Vehicle#3 had a dent in the front left bumper and a cracked hood. This was consistent with striking debris in the roadway after Vehicle#2 struck Vehicle#1. Crash reconstruction was performed by Sgt. Eric Russell and is documented under case number 19ISPC011161.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON BURMA ROAD WHEN HE DIDN'T NOTICE THAT HE WAS ALREADY AT THE TURN ON TO SIMPSON CHAPEL ROAD. D1 STATED THAT HE VEERED TO THE RIGHT DRIVING THROUGH THE DITCH COLLIDING WITH A ROCK THAT WAS IN A DITCH. THE COLLISION CAUSED HIM TO HAVE A FLAT TIRE AND MINOR DAMAGE TO THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE TRUCK BED. NO INJURIES AND THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TOWED.

D1 stated that she was stopped at the stop light behind V2 when her foot slipped off of the brake pedal. D1 advised that sandals she was wearing are very slick on the bottom and are hard to stay on the pedals.D2 stated that she was stopped at the stop light when she was hit from behind by V1.

Explain in Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: The driver of the vehicle did not know the exact location as to where the crash occurred but believed the location in the report is where the crash occurred (Just South of 1051 E 17th Street in the Blue Lot. There is no official address for the Blue Lot). Primary cause of crash: It is unknown what the primary cause of the crash is.Type of crash: It is unknown what type of crash occurred. Driver Factors V2: It is unknown what or if any driver factors contributed to D2 since they left the scene.Vehicle Factors V2: It is unknown what or if any vehicle factors contributed to V2 since they left the scene. Environmental Factors V2: It is unknown what or if any environmental factors contributed to V2 since they left the scene.V1 was parked in the west side of the Blue Lot facing south. It is unknown which direction or position V2 was in.D1 stated that he had parked his vehicle in the Blue Lot at approximately 1050 hours. D1 then returned to his vehicle at approximately 1315 hours. D1 did not notice any damage until approximately 1425 hours. There was white paint transfer on the front bumper and front driver side quarter panel. There was also visible damage to the front bumper as well. D1 stated that there was no identifying information as to who drove the other car on or near his vehicle. D1 also stated he was missing his front license plate as a result of the crash. There are no known suspects. The only identifying information is that the other motor vehicle is white due to the paint transfer.

Interstate 69 is a multi-lane road that has two lanes of travel going north and two lanes of travel going south in Monroe County. The roadway is straight in the area of the 109.2 mile marker southbound and is divided with a center grass median and guardrails. The roadway has no grade and is marked with center lines and fog lines. The crash scene was dark with no ambient light from street lights or nearby residences. At the time of the crash the weather was clear and the roadway was dry.Vehicle#1 (2006 Red Lexis GSG) was traveling southbound on Interstate 69 in the left lane near the 109.2 mile marker. Vehicle#1 was unable to maintain its lane and drifted out of the left lane onto the east shoulder and ran off the roadway and struck the end of the guardrail. Vehicle#1 came to a final rest perpendicular (facing east) to the roadway in the right lane. Driver#1 (Dan Lynh Nguyen) stated that she was going out for a drive and did not have a specific destination in mind. She began traveling southbound on Interstate 69 and remembered going south of Bloomington. Driver#1 stated that her headlights and taillights were working at the time of the crash. Driver#1 also stated that she did have on her seat belt at the time of the crash and she was not on her cell phone, or texting. Driver#1 stated that she does not remember how fast she was going at the time of the crash. All she remembered is going southbound and being sleepy and waking up when she struck the guardrail.After the crash, Vehicle#1 came to final rest facing east in the right lane of Interstate 69. Vehicle#1 was then involved in another crash that is documented under 2019327592. This second crash was reconstructed and is documented under Indiana State Police case number 19ISPC011161.

V1 was facing south backing out of a parking stall. V2 was traveling west going straight. V1 did not noticed V2 approaching. V1 backed into V2. There was minimal damage to the rear bumper of V1. There was moderate damage to the driver side fender of V2. D1 stated that he was attempting to back out of the parking stall and could not see around the vehicle parked next to him. D1 stated that he continued to back out and did not notice V2 approaching. D1 stated V1 then backed into V2. D2 stated that he was traveling straight when V1 backed out of a parking stall quickly. D2 stated that V1 then backed into V2 before V2 had time to avoid the collision. There were no injuries and no vehicles had to be towed from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS TURNING EASTBOUND ONTO WEST COUNTRY CLUB DR WHEN V2 COLLIDED WITH V1 IN THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED HE ENTERED THE CENTER TURN LANE, DRIVING WESTBOUND ON WEST COUNTRY CLUB DR WHEN V1 PULLED INTO THE INTERSECTION AND HE COULD NOT STOP AND V2 COLLIDED WITH V1.NO INJURIES REPORTED.V2 WAS TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

D1 advised that she pulled over to the side of the road east of the bus stop on East 3rd Street just west of the intersection with North Jordan Avenue. D1 STATED HE HAD BACKED FROM A SOUTH FACING SPACE AND PLACED HIS VEHICLE IN DRIVE. D1 SAID BEFORE HE COULD PULL AWAY HE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V2. D2 STATED SHE WAS BACKING FROM A NORTH FACING SPACE AND PLACED HER VEHICLE IN DRIVE. D2 STATED SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. DUE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCE OF THE ACCIDENT AND STATEMENTS PROVIDED BY BOTH DRIVERS, I WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE FAULT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TURNING SOUTH ON LEONARD SPRINGS RD FROM WOODHAVEN DRV2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON LEONARD SPRINGS RDV1 FAILED TO YEILD RIGHT OF WAYV2 STRUCK V1. DRIVER OF V1 WAS THROWN FROM MOPED AND SUSTAINED INJURIES TO HIS HEAD, NECK, AND RIBS. DRIVER OF V2 DID NOT SUSTAIN ANY INJURIES. DRIVER OF V2 STATED HE DID NOT SEE V1 PRIOR TO HITTING HIM. DRIVER OF V1 STATED HE DID NOT SEE V2.

V1 was traveling E/B on W 7th ST. V2 was traveling S/B on N Washington ST. V1 struck V2 causing damage.D1 advised that he was traveling E/B on W 7th ST. D1 advised that he came to a complete stop at the intersection, and proceeded through the intersection. D1 advised that he then collided with V2. D1 advised that he did not see any vehicles at the intersection when he proceeded E/B. D1 was not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling S/B on N Washington ST. D2 advised that he came to a complete stop at the intersection, when a unknown vehicle traveling E/B proceeded through the intersection. D2 advised that when he had the right of way he proceeded through the intersection when he saw V1 at the stop sign on W 7th ST. D2 advised that he started to honk his horn in the middle of the intersection when he saw V1. D2 advised that V1 and V2 collided with each other. D2 advised that he was not injured. It should be noted that D1 and D2 gave conflicting stories. Due to the information received received and no witness around, I could not determine who was at fault.

D2 CAME INTO THE LOBBY TO REPORT THAT SHE HAD STRUCK A VEHICLE AT THE INTERSECTION OF S HENDERSON ST. AND E UNIVERSITY ST. V1 was driving on the sidewalk south of Woodburn hall attempting to turn on N Forrest ave. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON I 69, BETWEEN W 3RD AND W 2ND ST. AS V1 TRAVELLED SOUTH, A SEMI TRACTOR TRAILER OVER TOOK V1 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE. V1 and V2 were in the southwest parking lot of the Courtyard Marriott when V1 struck V2 which was parked and unoccupied. V1/D1 stated she was attempting to exit her parking stall with the vehicle when she struck V2. D1 stated she thought she had enough clearance to turn out of the stall, however, vehicle clearance was tight due to the close proximity of other vehicles within the parking lot. V2/D2 was parked and unoccupied. V1 sustained no visible damage. V2 sustained significant damage to the left, drivers side area of the vehicle. V2 owner was unable to be located after several attempts to do so.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE EAST BOUND ON COUNTRY CLUB DRIVE, BY MADISON ST. IN BACKED UP TRAFFIC.D1 SAID HE LOOKED DOWN FOR A SECOND AND REAR ENDED V2.D2 SAID V2 WAS STOPPED WHEN REAR ENDED BY V1.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

Both vehicles were facing west on 10th Street at the intersection of State Road 45/46 Bypass. Both vehicles were on the east side of the intersection in the turn lane for turning north on the Bypass. V2 was in front of V1. D1's foot slipped off the brake and V1 rolled into V2. D1 stated while waiting at the intersection he was attempting to see the traffic light. D1 stated the glare form the sun was making it difficult to see the light. D1 believes while he was moving around to see the light his foot slipped off the brake and his car rolled into V2 at low speeds. V1 had no damage. D2 stated he was also sitting at the light attempting to see the light. D2 stated the glare from the sun was obstruction his view also. D2 stated while he was trying to see the light V1 rolled into the back of him. V2 had no damage. D2 did state he felt some pressure on his back when he was hit but was uninjured at the moment and did not require an ambulance. Neither vehicle had damage but D2 insisted a report be done in case his vehicle experienced problems on the way home or his back pain become more apparent.

V1 was parked facing south in the Fee Lane parking garage. V2 was also parked facing south in a parking spot behind V1.The emergency brake on V1 was not engaged properly when the driver parked the vehicle. It appeared that the vehicle rolled backwards with nobody in it and then struck the front bumper of V2.V2 was parked behind V1 and there was nobody in the vehicle when it was struck.

D1 stated they were traveling westbound on E 3rd St, near the intersection with S Overhill Dr, in the southern-most lane. D1 stated that they observed V2 rapidly decelerate in front of them, at which point D1 quickly braked, but was not able to respond in time from striking the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D1 stated that V1 does not have good brakes. D2 stated that they were traveling westbound on E 3rd St, near the intersection with S Overhill Dr, in the southern-most lane. D2 stated that the vehicle in front of them quickly decelerated, at which point D2 had to respond by quickly decelerating as well. It was at this point that D2 stated they felt V1 strike the rear of V2.

DRIVER ONE STATED HE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON KINSER PIKE WHEN HE NOTICED VEHICLE 2 STOPPING TO TURN LEFT ONTO SKYLINE DRIVE. D2 STATED THAT V1 HAD BEEN FOLLOWING HER REALLY CLOSE FOR QUITE SOMETIME. AS THEY APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF SALE/REEVES AND THOMAS D2 ATTEMPTED TO PULL OVER SO D1 COULD GO AROUND. V1 was south bound on E SR 45 approximately 150 feet south of Brummetts Creek when a deer entered D1's path of travel and resulted in a collision. V1 sustained damage to the left front 1/4 panel and hood.

V1 was pulling out of the gas station (facing North) located at the intersection of W 17th and Kinser Pike. While pulling out, V1 pulled out in-front of a uninvolved vehicle, causing that vehicle to make a quick stop, no collision occurred. On Thursday, September 19, 2019 at 12:10, Mark Clephane responded to a crash on I69 northbound near the 120.5 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry.Vehicle 1, a black 2012 Dodge bearing 2020 IN IU Plate WE3148 was being driven by Heidi Murphy on I-69 North at the 120.5 mile marker. As V-1 traveled north behind another vehicle in the far right (driving lane) the vehicle in front of V-1 swerved to miss a hay bale in the roadway. D-1 attempted to miss the hay bale, but she could not, and the front right of V-1 struck the hay bale causing damage to V-1.Heidi Murphy said that she was traveling north on I-69 behind a vehicle and that vehicle swerved to miss a bale of hay in the road. Murphy stated that she tried to swerve, but could not miss hitting the hay bale. Murphy told this unit that her son had been taken to Riley Children's Hospital in Indianapolis and she was on her way there. The cause of this crash is the hay bale in the traveled portion of the interstate

I RESPONDED TO A 911 CALL AT THIS RESIDENCE. V1 AND V2 BOTH TRAVELING EB ON W SR 46. D1 STATED HE SAW V2 SLOWING DOWN ALMOST COMING TO A STOP ON W 46. V1 WAS UNABLE TO STOP AND RAN INTO THE BACK OF V2

When I arrived on scene I observed V1 off the east side of the driveway into a wall and a tree. There was significant damage to the front of V1 and the tree. I spoke to D1 and he had poor balance, slurred speech, and poor dexterity.D1 seemed to have a hard time concentrating on my requests for documents. I asked D1 if he had been drinking and he stated no. I did not detect the odor of alcohol. I looked at D1's eyes and didn't see any Nystagmus and pupils looked normal. I asked D1 if he was on any medications and he said a lot of them. I asked for his phone number and he seemed confused and gave me a partial number including letters. D1 was asked who his supervisor was at the factory and he couldn't remember. Due to D1 being confused I asked if he was diabetic and he stated he was. I requested an ambulance to check D1. I spoke to D1 about what happened and he stated he was traveling east in the parking lot and turning a corner to travel north and ran off the east side of the roadway. I observed marks in the grass consistent with V1 leaving the roadway. V1 was towed due to disabling damage. I spoke to the EMT's and they advised that D1 may have suffered a stroke causing the crash. D1 was transported BY UNIT 212 for treatment.

AS D1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION OF 8TH AND ROGERS STREET, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2. V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON ROGERS STREET PRIOR TO THE ACCIDENT.

Driver was west bound on State Road 45 when a deer entered the roadway in front of him. The driver was unable to avoid hitting the deer with the right front of his vehicle causing damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

THE LIGHT FOR NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC WAS GREEN, BUT THERE WAS NO GREEN ARROW LIGHTED. AFTER THE TRANSIT BUS TURNED, D1 DID NOT SEE V2 APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH. D1 STARTED TO TURN THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND WAS STRUCK BY V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON ROGERS ST APPROACHING THE INTERESECTION WITH W 2ND ST. V1 was travelling in the #1 lane on the E SR 45/46 bypass approaching E 10th street. V2 was travelling in the #2 lane on the E SR 45/46 bypass approaching E 10th street. D1 advised that she realized too late that vehicles were stopped in front of her, and instead of rear ending the vehicle in front of her at high speed, she made an abrupt lane change, which caused the passenger side rear door to strike the front driver side bumper of V2. D2 advised that he was driving on the bypass approaching E 10th street when V1 merged quickly into the #2 lane, striking V2 with V1.Damage to V1 consisted of a deep dent in the rear passenger side door.Damage to V2 consisted of the front bumper being cracked and bent.Both vehicles were driven from the scene and there were no injuries reported.

Vehicle 1 was turning south off the the pavement into the grass area of the RV Parking Lot at 701 E 17th Street. Witness 1 was traveling south through the grass area of the RV Parking Lot at 701 E 17th Street in a golf cart just south of Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated he was waiting in the lot behind vehicles in the lot when he spoke with an ESG employee assisting with parking, Witness 1. Driver 1 stated he asked Witness 1 if he could turn right into the grass area to the south. He stated that Witness 1 told him to back up and then follow him. Driver 1 stated the male then got on the golf cart and began heading through the lot. Driver 1 stated he backed up a short ways and then turned right. He stated as he turned into the grass he immediately struck a red concrete and metal pole. Driver 1 stated that he believed he was backing up to get around the vehicle in front of him, and not to miss the pole. Driver 1 advised he never saw the pole.Witness 1 stated he told Driver 1 to back up and then follow him through the grass lot to an area he could park. Witness 1 stated he got on a golf cart and began traveling south through the lot when Vehicle 1 backed up and began turning into the grass, striking the pole.No one involved complained of any injuries.There was a large amount of damage to the front of Vehicle 1. The pole had came out of the ground and was laid on its side but did not appear to have any other damage.Photographs were taken of the damage.

At approximately 1715 hours on 9/20/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 in the Eigenmann south parking lot. V1, backing southbound out of a parking spot, collided with V2, travelling west through the lot. D1 stated that she had not been backing at an unreasonable speed.D2 advised that he had been driving through the parking lot at a slow speed when suddenly V1 backed out, colliding with V2. D2 stated that he had not rapidly accelerated or made any sudden changes in driving behavior.W1 was contacted at 1000 hours on 9/21/2019. W1 was present on the sidewalk just northwest of the collision during the event. W1 corroborated D2's version of the events.No party claimed injury or requested medical aid.

AS SHE TURNED HER VEHICLE 2, VEHICLE 1 CHANGED LANES RAPIDLY IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION, CAUSING VEHICLE 1 TO STRIKE VEHICLE 2.NO INJURIES.
