D2 stated he was traveling west on E SR 45. D2 stated D1 cut in front of him and did not wait for him to pass. D2 stated there was no time to react.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was driving north on S Rose Ave attempting to cross 3rd St. V2 was driving west on 3rd St approaching Rose Ave.D1 stated that he was driving north on S Rose Ave attempting to cross 3rd St. D1 stated that traffic was heavy but a driver going east stopped to let him continue through the intersection. D1 stated that he then attempted to go north through the intersection when V2 collided with his rear passenger side door.D2 stated that he was going west on 3rd St approaching Rose Ave. D2 stated that V1 drove right in front of him while attempting to go through the intersection. D2 stated he attempted to brake but could not stop in time and collided with the rear passenger side door of V1.

WHILE UNIT 2 WAS PARKED, UNIT 1 BACKED INTO UNIT 2. UNIT 1 DID NOT REALIZE, AND LEFT THE AREA. AFTER BEING NOTIFIED, UNIT 1 RETURNED AND WAS COOPERATIVE. UNIT 2 HAD A BROKEN HOK AND SOME SCRATCHES ON THE SIDE. UNIT 1 ALSO HAD SOME SCRATCHES AND WAS MISSING A REFLECTOR.

KELLY JANOS, WHO IS THE DAUGHTER OF THE OWNER OF V2, WAS EATING IN PANERA BREAD, 2748 E 3RD STREET, WHEN HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK BY ANOTHER VEHICLE.I DID WATCH SECURITY CAMERA FOOTAGE OF THE INCIDENT.V2 WAS PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF PANERA BREAD, FACING WEST, NEXT TO THE DRIVE THROUGH LANE FOR THE BUSINESS.V1, WHICH APPEARED TO BE A GOLD IN COLOR SUV, WAS ATTEMPTING TO PULL IN TO THE DRIVE THROUGH BUT STRUCK THE CURB.V1 DID THEN ATTEMPT TO BACK UP, BUT DID THEN BACK IN TO THE REAR OF V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF V2.V1 DID THEN LEAVE THE SCENE WITHOUT EXCHANGING INFORMATION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON COLLEGE MALL AND WAS STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF EAST COVENANTER.D2 EXPLAINED THAT SHE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT TO TURN LEFT, EAST, ON TO COVENANTER BUT THE LIGHT DID THEN TURN YELLOW. THE NORTH BOUND VEHICLES ON COLLEGE MALL DID ALSO HAVE THE YELLOW LIGHT AND DID BEGIN TO SLOW DOWN EXCEPT FOR A NEWER MODEL BLACK 4-DOOR VEHICLE.D2 DID ATTEMPT TO TURN LEFT, DURING THE YELLOW LIGHT, BUT V1 DID ACCELERATE AND THE FRONT DRIVER'S CORNER OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT DRIVER'S CORNER OF V2 RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.V1 DID NOT STOP TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BUT CONTINUED NORTHBOUND ON COLLEGE MALL.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V2 was approaching the stop light at S. Old State Road 37 & W. Church Ln. southbound in the left turn lane. The light was red for southbound traffic. V1 was facing east on W. Church Ln. at the stop light. V2 was attempting to turn left on S. Old State Road 37 to go north. D1 stated that she had the green turn arrow to turn left. D1 stated that as she was turning left, a vehicle that was facing west on W. Church Ln. started to turn right onto S. Old State Road 37 to go north as well. D1 stated that she swerved to her left to avoid hitting that vehicle and crashed into V2. Both vehicles were towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

D1 stated he was backing out of a parking spot and did not see V2.D1 stated he struck V2 in the driver side.D2 stated she was driving South on Tamarack Trail and saw V1 pulling out of the parking spot. D2 stated she thought V1 was going to stop so she continued driving.D2 stated when she noticed V1 was not going to stop she sped up to try to avoid the crash.D2 stated that V1 hit her in the driver side of her vehicle.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON W SR 46 ON THE I-69 OVERPASS. V2, V3, AND V4 WERE TRAVELING EB ON W SR 46 ON THE I-69 OVERPASS RESPECTIVELY. AS TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF V1 BEGAN TO BRAKE, V1 HAD A BRAKE FAILURE AND SWERVED LEFT INTO ONCOMING TRAFFIC IN ORDER TO AVOID A REAR END COLLISION. WHILE DOING SO, V1 STRUCK THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2, CONTINUED ON DUE TO DEFECTIVE BRAKES, AND STRUCK THE FRONT OF V3. V3 THEN GOT PUSHED INTO THE CONSTRUCTION WALL AND THEN PUSHED BACK INTO THE FRONT OF V4.D1 STATED THAT HER BRAKES FAILED HER WHEN SHE ATTEMPTED TO STOP AND THEREFORE SHE SWERVED, HOWEVER, WAS UNABLE TO AVOID OTHER VEHICLES.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EB AND OUT OF NO WHERE, HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK AND SHE FELT HER AIRBAG STRIKE HER IN THE FACE.D3 STATED THAT HE OBSERVED V1 COLLIDE WITH V2 AND THEN HAD TIME TO PROCESS THAT V1 WAS ABOUT TO COLLIDE WITH HIS VEHICLE, HOWEVER HE HAD NO WHERE TO GO TO AVOID THE COLLISION.D4 STATED THAT SHE OBSERVED V1 VEERING INTO ONCOMING TRAFFIC AT WHICH POINT SHE SLAMMED ON HER BRAKES, HOWEVER, THE COLLISION BETWEEN V1 AND V3 PUSHED V3 INTO THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE IN THE PARKING LOT OF COUNTRYVIEW APARTMENTS, 2500 S. ROCKPORT RD, NEAR THE 800-900 BUILDING. D1 SAID HE WAS TRYING TO BACK OUT OF A PARKING SPACE, AND DID NOT SEE V2, WHICH WAS EAST BOUND IN THE PARKING LOT. AS V1 BACKED OUT, IT STRUCK V2, CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

D1 STATED HE WAS BACKING WEST FROM A PARKING SPACE LOCATED ON ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE LOT. D1 INDICATED THAT WHILE BACKING HE STRUCK V2. D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH IN THE DESIGNATED LANE AND WHILE DOING SO , WAS STRUCK FROM V1, WHICH WAS BACKING FROM A EAST FACING PARKING SPACE.

V1 AND V2 WERE BOTH BACKING OUT OF PARKING SPACES ACROSS FROM EACH OTHER. THEY WERE IN THE TJ MAXX PARKING LOT.D1 SAID SHE HAD FINISHED BACKING AND HAD PUT IT IN GEAR TO GO FORWARD WHEN V2 HIT HER.D2 SAID AS SHE WAS BACKING, SHE AND V1 REAR ENDED EACH OTHER.PRIMARY CAUSE LISTED AS OTHER/DRIVER BECAUSE BOTH CLAIMED THE OTHER WAS BACKING AT TIME OF CRASH.

V1 WAS NORTHBOUND ON LEONARD SPRINGS RD APPROACHING SR 45.V2 WAS NORTHBOUND ON LEONARD SPRINGS RD IN THE LEFT TURN LANE.V3 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC NORTHBOUND ON LEONARD SPRINGS RD AT SR 45.D1 SAID HE WAS DISTRACTED BECAUSE HE WAS SO TIRED. HE SAID WHEN HE NOTICED V3 STOPPED AHEAD OF HIM HE TRIED TO STOP AND/OR SWERVE TO AVOID COLLISION. HE SAID IN DOING SO HE HIT V2 AND V3.D2 SAID AS HE WAS IN THE TURN LANE V1 TRIED TO GO BETWEEN HIM AND V3 AND HIT BOTH.D3 SAID AS SHE SAT IN TRAFFIC V1 HIT HER.

D1 stated that they were traveling northbound on N Indiana Ave and approached the intersection with E 10th St. D1 stated that the vehicle in front of them entered the intersection, so D1 followed. D1 stated they were approximately halfway through the intersection when they were struck on the passengers side by V2. When asked if the stop light at the intersection for D1 was red, D1 stated "it was too late" after they had entered the intersection. D2 stated they were traveling westbound on E 10th St, approaching the intersection with N Indiana Ave. D2 stated that they entered the intersection on a green light. D2 stated that upon entering the intersection, D2 noticed V1 traveling through the intersection out of peripheral vision, and V1 continued through the intersection until V2 struck the passengers side of V1. D3 stated that they were stopped at the red light on N Indiana Ave in the right turn lane in order to turn westbound on to E 10th St. D3 stated that they observed V1 enter the intersection, followed by V2, which struck the passengers side of V1. D2 stated that then V1 spun by this impact and struck the front drivers side of V3. W1 stated they were traveling behind V2 on E 10th St, approaching the intersection with N Indiana Ave. W1 stated they observed D1 enter the intersection from the south on a red light, and then observed D2 enter the intersection on a green light. W1 stated D2 was unable to avoid striking V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Thursday, October 3, 2019 at 17:00, I, Trooper Samuel Wagner, was on duty and in uniform, patrolling in my fully marked State Police Car, when I was dispatched to a property damage crash. I responded to a crash on Ramp D 100 SR37, which is a ramp from both east and west lanes of SR 48, also known as 3rd Street West, Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana. The ramp is a curve and descending grade to the south. At the top of the ramp is a y-junction, where eastbound traffic turning south onto the ramp to I69 south must yield to traffic entering the ramp from the westbound left turn lane. The road is asphalt with painted lane control and a yield sign in this area. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. The vehicles were still driveable and had moved from the ramp further south onto I69 and were pulled over on the shoulder approximately 50 feet south of where the merging lane terminates into the right lane of I69 southbound. Vehicle 1, (V1) a 1997 camouflage (primarily green) painted S10 pickup truck bearing Indiana plates BKA436 and driven by Rebekah Mathis (DOB: 11/02/2001) was stopped on the shoulder behind Vehicle 2 (V2) and displayed damage to the right front bumper, which was hanging off on the ground.. V2 was a 2019 white Volkswagen beetle bearing Indiana plates 907ZZG and driven by Ana Hernandez (DOB: 08/32/1994) and displayed damage to the rear bumper and left rear quarter panel, with green paint transfer. Both drivers gave a concurrent statements, which were identical; namely, that V2 was merging from SR48 eastbound onto the ramp to I69 south, when it encountered a vehicle coming down the ramp having turned from the left turn lane of SR 48 westbound. V2 braked (in accordance with the yield sign, which faces traffic coming from SR 48 eastbound) and V1 failed to stop in time to avoid a collision. V1 swerved left to try to avoid V2 but was unable to avoid a collision. After the collision, both parties removed their vehicles to the shoulder of I69 southbound and called 911. Both drivers were uninjured and stated that they did not require medical attention. D1 used a knife and pliers to remove the portion of the front bumper that was hanging down on the ground. Both vehicles were still driveable and were removed from the scene under their own power. There were no witnesses to the collision that remained on scene. Based on the statements of the drivers, the evidence visible during the accident investigation, it is my opinion that the following likely occurred: V2 was approaching the Y-intersection at the top of the ramp when it encountered another exiting driver, and braked to allow it to pass. V1 was following too closely or was not aware of V2 braking and collided with the rear bumper. As such, driver 1 (Mathis) is at fault for the collision.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH ST APPROACHING THE N SMITH RD INTERSECTION. AS V1 WAS TRAVELING, THE BICYCLIST WAS ATTEMPTING TO CROSS THE STREET FROM THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE TO THE NORTHERN MOST LANE JUST WEST OF THE INTERSECTION WHILE TRAVELING WB. AS V1 APPROACHED THE AREA, THE BICYCLIST CROSSED AND COLLIDED WITH THE PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EB AND SAW ONE BICYCLIST AT THE LAST MINUTE THAT SHE HAD AVOIDED. D1 ALSO STATED THAT IT JOLTED HER AS ANOTHER BICYCLIST THAT SHE DID NOT SEE RAN INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF HER VEHICLE. D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT SEE EITHER BICYCLIST AND THAT NEITHER HAD ANY REFLECTORS OR LIGHTING ON THEIR BICYCLES. D1 STATED SHE BELIEVES SHE WAS TRAVELING AT APPROXIMATELY 45 MPH.THE BICYCLIST WAS UNABLE TO BE INTERVIEWED DUE TO TREATMENT AT THE HOSPITAL AND WAS UNAVAILABLE.W1 STATED THAT HE AND THE VICTIM WERE RIDING BIKES ON N SMITH RD AND TURN WB ONTO E 10TH ST. W1 STATED THEY TRAVELED WB ON E 10TH ST A SHORT DISTANCE THEN CROSSED ALL LANES OF TRAVEL. W1 STATED THAT THERE WERE NO VEHICLE IN THE AREA WHEN HE CROSSED, HOWEVER, WHEN THE VICTIM CROSSED, THERE WAS.ON 11/15/2019, I SPOKE WITH W1 AGAIN. W1 STATED THAT V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 10TH STREET APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF S SMITH ROAD. W1 STATED THAT HE CROSSED THE ROAD INTO THE WB LANES OF E 10TH STREET OFF OF S SMITH ROAD AT THE INTERSECTION AND THAT THE BICYCLIST CROSSED THE ROAD WEST OF THE INTERSECTION. W1 STATED THAT V1 SWERVED LEFT HE BELIEVES IN AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH THE BICYCLIST, HOWEVER, THE FRONT PASSENGERS PORTION OF THE VEHICLE STRUCK THE BICYCLIST. ON 11/18/2019 I SPOKE WITH THE BICYCLIST WHO STATED THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO CROSS THE E 10TH STREET AND PROCEED TO THE WB LANES. THE BICYCLIST STATED THAT WHEN HE LOOKED ON 10TH STREET, HE DID NOT SEE ANY VEHICLES. THE BICYCLIST STATED THAT AS HE CROSSED, HE WAS STRUCK BY A VEHICLE, HOWEVER, HE DOES NOT KNOW WHAT PART OF THE VEHICLE STRUCK HIM. THE BICYCLIST STATED HE BELIEVED THE VEHICLE SWERVED TO AVOID HIM, HOWEVER, HE DOES NOT KNOW WHETHER SHE SWERVED LEFT OR RIGHT.ON 1/2/2019, I ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT D1 VIA TELEPHONE, HOWEVER I WAS NOT ABLE TO MAKE CONTACT WITH HER.

V1 was traveling northbound on N Dunn St. approaching the intersection at E 17th St. V2 was in the intersection having just turned northbound, but had to slow down to wait on another vehicle to turn left when V1 struck V2.D1 was traveling northbound on N Dunn St. approaching E 17th St. D1 advised that his traffic light at the intersection was green so he continued through the intersection, not realizing that V2 had just turned left onto N Dunn St. from eastbound on E 17th St. D1 advised that V2 then stopped to wait for another vehicle to turn left and he was unable to stop before colliding with V2. D1 advised that he jerked his steering wheel to the left to attempt to avoid the collision but failed.D2 advised that she was traveling eastbound on E 17th St. at the intersection of N Dunn St. waiting to turn left. D2 advised that the light turned yellow while she was waiting in the intersection so she completed her turn once the oncoming traffic stopped, but as soon as she turned a vehicle in front of her stopped abruptly to turn left. D2 stated that she stopped to wait behind the vehicle and V1 rear ended her.V1 sustained some light damage to the front bumper on the right side.V2 sustained a broken rear bumper cover.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE WB SIDE OF N MADISON ST FACING SB. V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N MADISON ST AND MANEUVERED AROUND A FIRE TRUCK AND STUCK THE DRIVER SIDE MIRROR OF V2. V1 THEN CONTINUED SB ON N MADISON ST. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT IN THE AREA WITNESSED THE ACCIDENT. NO INFORMATION WAS OBTAINED FROM V1.

WHILE UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON TOWER RIDGE RD, THE UNIT RAN OFF THE ORADWAY AND STRUCK A TREE. AFTER STRIKING A TREE, UNIT 1 THEN SPUN AROUND AND CAME TO REST ON ANOTHER TREE.

MS ROGERS PARKED HER VEHICLE IN A HANDICAPPED PARKING SPACE IN THE EAST END OF THE MENARDS STORE AT 1285 S LIBERTY DRIVE. MS ROGERS WAS SHOPPING IN THE STORE FOR APPROX 2 HOURS. Vehicle 1 appeared to be heading east through the south part of the parking lot at 880 N Walnut Grove Avenue. BOTH UNITS WERE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON INTERSTATE 69. UNIT 2 WAS IN SLOWED TRAFFIC DUE TO CONSTRUCTION. On 10/4/2019, at 4:17PM, I, Officer Lucas, was dispatched to a call referencing V2 being struck at some point between 8:30AM and 4:15PM, by an unknown V1. While on scene, I did observe damage consistent with a same-direction sideswipe to the rear driver side of V2. I spoke with the owner of V2, who informed me that she parked her vehicle in the lot of 114 N. Madison St., at 8:30AM, in a parking stall facing southbound. The owner of V2 advised that when she returned to her vehicle at 4:10PM, she observed the damage to V2.Based on the damage and statements from the owner of V2, my investigation has yielded that a parked V2 was struck by an unknown V1/D1, at some point between 8:30AM and 4:10PM, at which time, and unknown V1/D1 then left the scene without attempting to contact the owner of V2.

V1 was parked stationary in the circle drive for the Music Arts Center. V1 had damage to the driver side and passenger side of the attached enclosed box trailer. The over hang to Music Art Center also had damage with broken bulbs and the concrete over hang had scuff marks.Primary Cause, Type of Crash, and Property Damage- explain in narrative: D1 thought when turning around with V1 using the circle drive of Music Art Center had enough room for clearance. D1 said he was traveling northbound in V1 on Jordan Avenue and missed his turn due to his GPS and construction. D1 said he turned into the Music Arts Center circle drive located on the east side of the building to turn around to go back south on Jordan Avenue. D1 said it was dark outside and when he went to go under the over hang in V1 for the Music Art Center thought he had enough clearance to make it under. D1 said V1 was not able to clear the over hang striking the north side of the over hang. The enclosed box trailer accrued damage on the driver and passenger side. The over hang had scuff marks on the concrete and broken light bulbs. Photos were taken of the scene and damage. IUPD Dispatch was notified to contact IU Work order Control to report the incident.

I was driving northbound on Indiana Avenue from 4th Street and witnessed the collision.V1 was driving southbound on Indiana (the wrong way) and turned right (west, the wrong way again) onto 6th Street at a high rate of speed. V1 lost control and left the roadway during the turn, running over the curb and ultimately entering the parking lot north of the Von Lee building. Once in the lot, V1 then collided with a metal fence surrounding some dumpsters. The collision caused disabling damage to V1 as well as damage to the fence.D1 told me that he was working for Jimmy John's and was making a trip between two of their stores, when he mistakenly turned the wrong way on Indiana. He said that when he realized he was going the wrong way, he tried to quickly turn off before getting into a head-on collision with northbound traffic, but took his turn onto 6th too fast and lost control of V1. He explained that he was very tired from working all night and just was not paying enough attention to any of his driving.D1 was cited for Driving the Wrong Way on a One-Way Road. Since V1 was out of the roadway, he made his own towing arrangements. The fence he struck and damaged is property of the Indiana University Foundation. I took photographs of the scene.

DEPUTIES WERE CALLED TO THE REPORT OF A SUSPICIOUS VEHICLE PARKED IN THE ROADWAY NEAR 4675 W WOODYARD RD. UPON MY ARRIVAL, I OBSERVED V1 IN THE ROADWAY, AND D1 ENTERING ANOTHER VEHICLE DRIVEN BY HIS MOTHER. D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING EB ON W WOODYARD ROAD. D1 SAID HE TOOK THE CURVE NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF W WOODYARD RD AND N LOESCH RD WHEN FRONT PASSENGER SIDE TIRE POPPED.UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION, TIRE TRACKS AND MARKS ON THE PAVEMENT INDICATED THAT D1 HAD LEFT THE ROADWAY WHILE ENTERING THE INTERSECTION, AND HIT A CULVERT ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE ROAD. THE VEHICLE THEN DRAGGED THE DAMAGED TIRE ALONG THE ROADWAY, BEFORE COMING TO A STOP IN FRONT OF 4675 W WOODYARD RD.D1 DID NOT REQUEST MEDICAL ATTENTION. D1'S MOTHER ADVISED ME THAT D1 HAD BEEN WORKING SINCE 4 AM AND WAS VERY FATIGUED.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THERE THERE WAS EVIDENCE OF A PREVIOU CRASH. THE PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR WAS NOT PRESENT, AND THERE WAS A LARGE DENT IN THE FRONT RIGHT SIDE OF THE VEHICLE, AS WELL AS A WHITE SCRATCH. D1'S MOTHER TOLD ME THAT CRASH WAS NOT REPORTED. IT SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED THAT A BLACK GREASE/OIL-LIKE MATERIAL WAS FOUND ON THE GROUND UNDER V1, AND APPEARED TO HAVE LEAKED FROM THE VEHICLE.

D2 SAID HE WAS TURNING LEFT FROM W STATE ROAD 46 ONTO RICHLAND PLAZA AS HE WAS TURNING LEFT V1 STRUCK THE REAR OF V2. D1 SAID THAT V2 WAS TURNING AND MAY HAVE STARTED TO TURN BUT IT LOOKED AS IF V2 HAD NOT ENTERED TURN LANE. D1 THEN SAID SHE DID NOT STOP FAST ENOUGH AND STRUCK THE REAR OF V2.

V2 was facing south on College Avenue, at the 17th Street traffic light. V1 turned north on College Avenue. College Avenue is a one way south. V1 attempted to pass V2 by driving over the curb on the east side of the street. In doing so, V1 sideswiped V2,D1 was under the influence and unable to remember what happened. D1 was investigated for Operating While Intoxicated and determined to be under the influence of a Central Nervous System Depressant and Cannabis following a DRE evaluation by Sgt. Moulden. V1 had damage along the driver's side of the vehicle. D2 stated he looked up from his phone while stopped at the light and noticed V1 driving at him. D2 stated V1 tried to go around him by driving up the curb but side swiped his vehicle. V2 had damage to the front bumper and rear quarter panel on the driver's side. Both denied medical attention.NMS Labs tested D1's blood and detected THC was present.

V2 WAS PARKED ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF E. 2ND ST. FACING EAST BETWEEN S. WOODLAWN AVE. AND S. HAWTHORNE DR. V2 WAS STRUCK ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE SIDE MIRROR, BREAKING THE GLASS AND DAMAGING THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE BUMPER BY V1. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED. V1 LEFT THE SCENE.V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON E. 2ND ST. AND STRUCK V2 ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE WITH V1'S PASSENGER SIDE CAUSING DAMAGE TO V2 AND THE PASSENGER SIDE SIDE MIRROR OF V1 TO COME OFF AND FALL TO THE GROUND. V1'S MIRROR WAS RECOVERED AT THE SCENE. THE MODEL NUMBER LISTED ON THE INSIDE OF THE RECOVERED RED AND BLACK MIRROR INDICATED THAT IT MAY BELONG TO A 2013 TOYOTA RAV 4.

VEHICLE WAS EASTBOUND ON WEST POPCORN ROAD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH KETCHAM ROAD. DRIVER 1 SWEVRED TO MISS AN ANIMAL IN THE ROADWAY AND RAN OFF THE SOUTH SIDE OF ROAD. DRIVER 1 OVERCORRECTED AND CROSSED TO THE NORTH SIDE OF WEST POPCORN ROAD RUNNING OFF ROAD AGAIN. VEHICLE 1 HIT A DITCH AND FLIPPED ONTO THE TOP OF THE VEHICLE.DRIVEE WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT. DUE TO DRIVER 1 BEING A MINOR, HIS MOTHER SIGNED FOR PAPERWORK FROM EMS.VEHICLE 1 WAS DISABLED AND TRANSPORTED TO RICKS TOWING.

Vehicle 1 and 2 were descending a steep hill, westbound on West Tapp Road approaching the South Adams Street roundabout in Bloomington, Indiana. Approximately 100 feet east of the traffic circle, vehicle 2 encountered numerous deer crossing the roadway and began braking. Vehicle 1 attempted to stop, however driver 1 states that the vehicles braking system did not perform as expected. Driver 1 initially made an evasive steering input off the north side of the roadway to avoid vehicle 2. After avoiding a collision with the deer, vehicle 2 continued traveling westbound. At this time vehicle 1 and 2 were parallel, however as vehicle 2 pulled ahead of vehicle 1, vehicle 1 steered back onto the roadway behind vehicle 2. Moments later, vehicle 2 arrived at the traffic circle and slowed to a stop to yield to traffic within the circle. Vehicle 1 was again unable to stop and collided with vehicle 2's rear bumper and pushed the vehicle into the traffic circle. Vehicle 1 collided with vehicle 2's rear bumper a second time before finally coming to a stop. Deputy Dillon had was descending the Tapp Road hill westbound at the same time these events unfolded and captured the collision sequence on a vehicle mounted dash camera. Dash camera and body camera footage is available by request to the Monroe County Sheriff's Office. Driver 1 & 2 declined medical attention and stated that they were not injured during the collision. Driver 2 commented on the force of the collision and did not rule out the possibility of soreness at a later time.Vehicle 1 was leaking coolant from a broken radiator resulting from the collision, however no obvious defects were detectable regarding the braking system. An inspection of the braking system was not able to be conducted at the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was turning southbound onto S Walnut Street from the McDonalds at 1919 S Walnut Street. D1 stated that she was turning left into the east southbound lane on S Walnut Street. D1 stated that she did not notice V2 already in the lane, and sideswiped it as she merged into the lane. D2 stated that he was traveling southbound on S Walnut street in the east lane. D2 stated that he noticed V1 turn left out of McDonalds into the center turn lane. D2 stated that V1 then merged into his lane, striking the rear driver's side of V2.V1 and V2 pulled off of the roadway after the accident and into the parking lot at 1900 S Walnut Street. Neither driver requested medical treatment and neither vehicle had disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE HAD A GREEN LIGHT TO HEAD WEST BOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46, THROUGH NORTH UNION VALLEY ROAD. D2 STATED SHE HAD A GREEN LIGHT TO TURN OFF NORTH UNION VALLEY ONTO WEST STATE ROAD 46. AS D2 PULLED INTO THE INTERSECTION D1 T-BONED HER VEHICLE. OFF DUTY OWEN COUNTY UNIT #60-13 WAS HEADING EAST BOUND AND STATED HE HAD A RED LIGHT, WHICH MEANS WEST BOUND SHOULD HAVE A RED LIGHT AT WELL. NEITHER DRIVER WISHED TO BE TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL.

Vehicle 1 was traveling Westbound on 3rd Street at the intersection of Pete Ellis Drive. Vehicle 2 was directly in front of Vehicle 1, also traveling Westbound on 3rd Street. Vehicle 2 stopped due to a heavy traffic volume. Vehicle 1 then rear ended Vehicle 2.Driver 1 stated that he dropped rice in his vehicle and bent over to pick it up, which caused him to collide with Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated that he was stopped when Vehicle 1 rear ended him.

V1 and V2 were traveling south on SR46, and crossed the intersection of SR46 and 10th street. V1 was directly behind V2 in the left lane. Traffic was slowing down, and almost coming to a stop. V2 slowed down and was about to stop, when V1 struck V2 in the rear end. D1 stated she saw V2 coming to a stop, and when she hit her brakes, the vehicle started sliding on the wet pavement, and she was not able to get stopped in time before striking V2 in the rear end. D2 said the traffic in front of her was coming to a stop, and she was slowing down, about to come to a stop. D2 said V1 then struck her vehicle in the rear end.V1 had heavy damage to the front end. V2 had minor damage to the rear bumper.

While v2 was stopped at the stop light at the intersection of Hillside and Henderson on Hillside facing west), V2 was struck on the back left bumper by V1. D2 stated he could see V1 sliding towards his vehicle and he tried to get out of the way but could not move the truck due to other traffic being at the interesection. V1 struck V2 causing damage to both vehicles. V1 stated while she was traveling west on Hillside, she hit her brakes to come to a stop at the light but due to the wet pavement, her vehicle slide, striking V2 in the left rear bumper causing damage to both vehicles. D1 stated she slide into the back of V2. It should be noted that it had been raining prior to the accident and the pavement was wet.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS NB ON S SR 37 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF S SR 37 AND S VICTOR PIKE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE LOOKED DOWN AT HER GPS AND THAT WHEN SHE LOOKED UP SHE REALIZED TRAFFIC HAD SLOWED. DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID HITTING VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING NB ON S SR 37 JUST S OF THE INTERSECTION OF S SR 37 AND S VICTOR PIKE. DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN VEHICLE 1 STRUCK HER IN THE REAR. DRIVER 2 DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HER BACK AND NECK BUT REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE AND STATED SHE WOULD FOLLOW UP WITH HER OWN DOCTOR.
D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING ON THE OFF RAMP FOR I69 AT MILEMARKER 123 WHEN HE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE DO TO WEATHER CONDITIONS AND STRUCK THE GUARD RAIL ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD

D2 stated that she was driving west on 3rd Street, just past Jefferson Street, when the vehicles in front of her began braking. D2 stated that she began braking, and "wasn't going very fast" when V2 was hit from behind by V1. D2 stated that she had a complaint of pain in her head that she believed was from the accident. D2 was transported to IU Health Bloomington Hospital by ambulance for a complaint of head pain.D1 stated that she was driving west on 3rd Street, just past Jefferson Street, when V2 began breaking. D1 stated that she hit her brakes, and began sliding on the roadway because of the rain, and hit the back of V2. D1 stated that she wasn't driving very fast because of all the traffic when she initially hit her brakes.I spoke with a witness, Joyce Huck, and her statement confirmed the statements made by both D1 and D2.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON N. LINCOLN ST NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH E. 15TH ST WHEN SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AS THERE WAS NO STOP SIGN AND WAS STRUCK BY V2 AS SHE WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON E. 15TH ST. Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES

THERE WAS A MALE SITTING WITH V1 THAT STATED THE FEMALE DRIVER LEFT PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL. WHEN ASKED WHO THE VEHICLE BELONGED TO, THE MALE SAID THE DRIVER WHO HAD LEFT. DRIVER 2 ADVISED HE NOTICED V1 AND ATTEMPTED TO GET OUT OF ITS WAY BUT WAS UNABLE TO DO SO AND WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 1.

V2 WAS WESTBOUND IN THE NORTHERNMOST WESTBOUND LANE OF WEST STATE ROAD 46 APPROACHING CONSTABLE DRIVE WHEN V1 (TRAVELLING IN THE SOUTHERNMOST WESTBOUND LANE) ATTEMPTED TO MOVE INTO THE NORTHERNMOST WESTBOUND LANE AND STRUCK V2. V2 HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY.

No other officers assisted in the investigation.3rd Street is a two lane, one way road.Both vehicles were near the Highland Avenue intersection.V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street in the northmost lane.V2 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street, slightly behind V1, in the southmost lane.D1 stated that he was attempting to make a southbound turn onto Highland Avenue from 3rd Street and did not see V2. D1 SAID HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST, THEN TRYING TO TURN LEFT (EAST) ONTO HILLSIDE DR. HE WAS AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT, AND PROCEEDED TO TURN LEFT ON THE GREEN LEFT ARROW. D1 STATED HE WAS NORTHBOUND ON THOMAS ROAD WHEN A DEER STARTED CROSSING IN FRONT OF THE VEHICLE FROM THE WEST. HE THEN BEGAN TO SLOW THE VEHICLE WHEN A SECOND DEER JUMPED INTO THE VEHICLE FROM THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.V2 was stopped on Union Street attempting to make a left hand turn in order to pick up a passenger. V2 could not make the turn due to incoming traffic.V1 was approaching V2 and was unable to stop in time. V1 then collided with V2.D1 stated she knew V2 was attempting to turn and acknowledged V2 had their turn signal on. D1 stated she thought V2 had turned and did not realize they were still stopped. D1 then collided into the back of V2. He was attempting to make a left turn and had his turn signal on. As he was waiting for oncoming traffic to pass, V1 collided into the back of his vehicle.There were no injuries reported on scene. Neither vehicle needed towed as it appeared both could be safely operable.

Damage to V1 was to the front end and was significant.Damage to V2 was the rear end and was significant.Photos were taken of each vehicle an added to the case.

Driver of vehicle 1 stated she was in the intersection at S.Old State Road 37 and W. Church Ln when a large white pick up truck rear ended her vehicle. V1 WAS LISTED AS A STOLEN VEHICLE. This crash occurred on the shoulder of Interstate 69. Interstate 69 is an interstate that primarily runs north and south. The weather at the time of the crash was sunny and 74F.Vehicle #1 is a white 2010 Dodge Charger fully marked Indiana State Police car. Vehicle #1 was in park and Trooper Julie Deel was exiting the vehicle when vehicle #2 backed into the front of vehicle #1. Trooper Deel had stopped vehicle #2 for a traffic infraction on Interstate 69. Vehicle #2 is a Gray 2016 Ford Focus. Vehicle #2 backed into vehicle #1 on the shoulder of Interstate 69. Trooper Julie Deel who was operating vehicle #1 prior to the traffic stop stated that she had stopped vehicle #2 for speeding. Trooper Deel stated that she put vehicle #1 in park, exited the vehicle and observed vehicle #2 rolling backwards toward her vehicle. Trooper Deel could not get driver #2 attention before vehicle #2 struck vehicle #1. Driver #2, Noah Yazel stated that once he was stopped by Trooper Deel, he placed his vehicle in what he thought was park. Yazel stated that after the crash he looked down and he had placed his vehicle in reverse and not park, causing vehicle #2 to roll into vehicle #1. Minimal damage to both vehicles and both were able to be driven away.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling south on S High St. Vehicle 1 was traveling east on E Hunter Ave. At the intersection of Hunter and High, vehicle 1 stopped at the stop sign. The intersection is a one-way stop, therefore north/south traffic on High does not stop. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that after stopping, she looked to the left, then the right and believed both directions were clear and attempted to turn left to travel north on High St. Driver of vehicle 2 did not see vehicle 1 already traveling south on High and failed to yield the right of way. Vehicle 1 struck vehicle 2 in the front passenger side tire causing significant damage to the passenger side of vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 had moderate damage to the front of the vehicle. Vehicle 2 was towed due to disabling damage and vehicle 1 was able to drive from the scene. No injuries were reported from this accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

SHE THEN LOOKED NORTH AND SAW A VEHICLE GOING SOUTHBOUND. WHILE STOPPED SITTING AT A TRAFFIC LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 AND SOUTH STATE ROAD 37, VEHICLE 1 WHILE FACING EAST, BACKED UP WESTBOUND ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 INTO VEHICLE 2. HOWEVER WHEN HE BACKED UP INTO VEHICLE 2.BOTH DRIVERS WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND WERE DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D2 stated he was traveling north through the lot when V1 pulled out in front of him.V1 has damage to the driver side front fender and bumper. V2 has damage to the passenger front bumper.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED SHE HAD PARKED AT 0730 HRS IN A WEST FACING PARKING SPACE. SHE INDICATED AT AROUND 0800 HRS. W1 CAME INTO HER PLACE OF EMPLOYEMENT AND INDICATED THAT SHE JUST OBSERVED SOMEONE HIT OWNER 2'S VEHICLE AND LEFT THE SCENE. W1 OBTAINED A INDIANA REGISTRATION NUMBER OF 567RKO. SHE ALSO DESCRIBED THE OFFENDING VEHICLE AS AN OLDER SMALL SUV GREEN IN COLOR. W1 ALSO INDICATED THAT A MALE, WHO WAS DESCRIBED AS MID 30'S AND HAVING DARK HAIR, GET INTO THE VEHICLE AND STRUCK V2 AS HE WAS BACKING FROM A WEST FACING SPACE JUST SOUTH OF V2. W1 SAID V1 SPEED OFF NORTH THROUGH THE LOT AND OUT OF SIGHT. THE PROVIDED PLATE NUMBER DID RETURN TO A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DISCRIPTION. I DID GO TO THE ADDRESS THAT WAS PROVIDED BY THE BMV FOR MR. MARSTON AND DISCOVERED IT WAS VACANT.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY AT THE INTERSECTION OF WEST WOODYARD ROAD. VEHICLE 1 WAS APPROACHING A DISABLED VEHICLE IN LANE 3, AND WHILE ATTEMPTING TO CHANGE LANES VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE LEFT SIDE JUST BEHIND THE DRIVER DOOR. VEHICLE 2 WAS NORTHBOUND ON NORTH CURRY IN LANE 4.ALL PARTIES INVOLVED WER UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

V2 was parked in a parking stall unoccupied. The damage to V2 is consistent with a side swipe of V1 parking or pulling out of the parking stall and side swiping V2. The damage to V2 is consistent with a side swipe as the black paint transfer on V2 is scratched along the front passenger door to the middle of the rear passenger door. Which appears to have occurred if V1 scraped along side of V2 as V1 was pulling into or out of the parking stall next to V2. The owner of V2 stated that this vehicle is a work vehicle that she only drives at work. The owner of V2 stated that she picked V2 up from her work place and it did not have any damage to the vehicle. The owner of V2 stated that her first stop of the day was at Bell Trace Nursing Home where she parked in the back of the lot. The owner of V2 stated that after leaving Bell Trace Nursing Home she went to the Cascades Golf Course for her second stop and there were no other vehicles in the parking lot. The owner of V2 stated that when she came outside and returned to V2, she noticed the black paint transfer along the passenger side of her vehicle. Therefore with these being the only two stops, the owner of V2 stated that she believed the accident occurred at the Bell Trace Nursing Home.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.The investigation was taken about a block away and around the corner from the accident location.V1 had just dropped off a fare (Uber) and was beginning to merge back into traffic into the straight lane from the right-turn only lane. B1 was traveling in the straight lane slightly behind V1.V1 had dropped off a fare and was attempting to merge from the right-turn only lane and into the straight lane. V1 stated there was a bus in front of him that he was trying to get around as well. He did not see B1 approaching from behind as B1 was already in the straight lane. V1 then sideswiped B1 as B1 was passing. The handlebars from B1 caused light damage to the front, driver side quarterpanel of V1.B1 stated she was already in the straight lane and did not notice V1 pull into her lane of travel. She then sideswiped the front, driver side quarterpanel which caused her to wreck onto the pavement. The accident caused her right knee and lower right leg to sustain abrasions and complaint of pain. B1 did not want EMS notified. B1's bicycle had minor damage to the handlebars but was still able to be ridden from the scene.

Officer Hall assisted with traffic control.Driver Distracted (explain in narrative) - D1 stated he was looking at his radio and did not notice traffic had stopped ahead of him.V2 was stopped in traffic as traffic in front of her was also stopped. V1 was approaching V2 from the rear.D1 stated that he was looking at his radio and was traveling at approximately 25 mph prior to the collision. When he looked back at the road he noticed V2 was stopped. He was unable to stop in time and did not have much time to react. He then collided into the back of V2. The impact deployed his airbags. D1 did not complain of pain but stated the airbag deployment caused the skin on his left thumb to turn red. V1 was unable to be driven safely. It was towed by Auto Mobile Services.D2 stated she was stopped in traffic as the traffic in front of her was also stopped. D2 stated she looked in her rearview mirror and noticed D1 approaching her. She stated there was nothing she could do an V1 collided into her vehicle. D2 suffered heavy rear-end damage but was safely able to be driven from scene.

V1 and V2 are both Indiana University vehicles. V1 is operated by the Safety Escort and has fleet designation 18818. V2 is a Facility Operations truck designated 073.V1 was facing southbound but backing northbound out of a parking space. V2 was unoccupied and parked, facing northbound, in front of a motor pool garage door bay. D1 stated she was backing out of the space and "messed up the angles." She then also explained she frequently backs out of the same space and she is used to there not being anything behind her, but today when the truck was present she was not expecting it to be there. V1 backed into the rear of V2, damaging the rear bumpers of both vehicles. No one was injured.Photographs of the damage were taken.

Driver 1 was traveling westbound on East Ramp Creek Road in the 3600 block. While traveling westbound Driver 1 stated a deer came onto the roadway which he was unable to avoid and collided with the deer on his front bumper damaging it. Vehicle 1 sustained front bumper and grill damage. Driver 1 did not sustain any injuries, declining medical services and a tow. I did locate the deer in the driveway of 3611 East Ramp Creek Road.

VEHICLE 2 WAS DISABLED AND TOWED TO AUTO MOBILE BY AUTO MOBILE.

D1 STATED SHE NOTICED A VEHICLE IN FRONT OF BEGIN TO BRAKE THEN SLAM ON THEIR BRAKES. SHE STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE AND FELT THE BRAKES START TO PUMP AND SLIP. IN DOING SO, HER VEHICLE LEFT THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY, COLLIDING WITH A TREE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS LEAVING THE PARKING LOT OF 2642 EAST 3RD STREET, ATTEMPTING TO TURN RIGHT, EAST, ON TO EAST 3RD STREET.D1 EXPLAINED THAT HE THOUGHT V2 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN IN TO THE ENTRANCE TO 2642 E 3RD STREET, SO HE DID PULL RIGHT ON TO EAST 3RD STREET.THE FRONT OF V2 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER SIDE OF V1, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D2 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON 3RD STREET IN THE RIGHT LANE WHEN V1 DID TURN OUT OF THE ENTRANCE/EXIT OF 2642 EAST 3RD STREET.D2 STATED THAT HE DID NOT HAVE TIME TO STOP, THUS THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF V1.

D1 was arrested for Operating a vehicle while intoxicated. D2 was transported to the hospital due to possible injury to his neck and back. D1 stated he was facing eastbound on W. 2nd St in the left turn lane. D1 stated V2 began to move forward but suddenly stopped. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE SOUTH BOUND ON GATES DRIVE, STOPPED IN TRAFFIC BEHIND VEHICLE 2. THE LIGHT TURN GREEN AND THAT VEHICLE DID NOT MOVE, IN THE WRONG LANE OF TRAVEL. ALL OF THE SUDDEN I WAS REAR ENDED BY V1."

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS

V1 was traveling southbound on Jordan Ave approaching Jones Ave. V2 was stopped at the crosswalk facing south on Jordan Ave and Jones Ave in front of V1.D1 stated he was traveling southbound on Jordan Ave approaching Jones Ave when he realized V2 was stopped in front of him. VEHICLE 1 WAS PARKED IN A SPOT AT 1284 SOUTH LIBERTY DRIVE FACING SOUTHBOUND. VEHICLE 2, A BLACK CADILLAC ESCALADE BACKED UP OUT OF A PARKING SPOT NORTHBOUND AND STRUCK VEHICLE 1. VEHICLE 2 FLED THE SCENE WITHOUT NOTIFYING THE OWNER OF VEHICLE 1.

NARRATIVE: V2 was slowed in traffic attempting to turn west onto E. Varsity Lane. V1 was driving north on N. Dunn St. V1 rear ended V2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D1 was in the southbound lane attempting to travel south. D2 was in the southbound lane attempting to travel south. D3 was in the southbound lane attempting to travel south. D1 stated he was traveling southbound in the south bound lane of SR 45/46. D1 stated he began to slow down due to traffic in front of him beginning to stop. D1 stated that he then began to brake, and due to the wet road conditions, his vehicle slid into the back of D2. D1 had damage to his front bumper. D2 stated he was stopped in traffic due to the red light on SR 45/46 attempting to continue southbound. D2 stated he was then suddenly struck by D1 on the rear bumper of his vehicle. D2 stated the impact then caused D2's vehicle to collide with D3's rear bumper. D2's vehicle had damage to his rear bumper and front bumper. D3 stated he was stopped in traffic due to the red light on SR45/46, attempting to continue southbound. D3 stated he was suddenly struck by D2's vehicle. D3 stated he believed another vehicle had hit D2's vehicle which caused D2 to hit his vehicle. D3 pulled off to allow traffic to continue. D3 complained of back pain on scene. EMS evaluated him on scene but D3 stated he was fine and would seek his own treatment. D3 had damage to his rear bumper.D1's vehicle was towed due to disabling damage as his vehicle would not start and his front driver side tire was unable to move. There were no other reported injuries.

D2 stated that he was traveling south on State Road 46, just past E 17th Street, when the traffic in front of him was stopped. D2 stated that he began braking as well, and came to a stop in traffic. D2 stated that he was suddenly rear ended by V1. D2 stated that he attempted to turn left and get out of the roadway, so he and D1 can exchange information. D2 stated that D1 did not follow D2 out of the roadway, but instead D1 continued driving south on State Road 46.D2 stated that he continued driving south and eventually caught up with D1 at the intersection of State Road 46 and E 10th Street. D2 took a picture of V1 at that time, but D1 still did not pull off to the side of the road to exchange information. D2 stated that he called the police, who advised him to pull off to the side of the road, and D2 complied, and observed V1 continue to drive south onto College Mall Road.

D1 STATED SHE REAR ENDED V2 WHILE ATTEMPTING TO STOP IN TRAFFIC.D2 STATED THEIR VEHICLE WAS COMPLETELY STOPPED WHEN V1 HIT THEM.OFF DUTY STATE POLICE OFFICER ORIGINLLY ARRIVED ON SCENE AND HAD VEHICLES MOVE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.
V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON W STATE ROAD 48, ENTERED A CURVE IN THE 8800 BLOCK AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY INTO A DITCH.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF E 19TH ST FACING EB. V1 IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BACKED INTO THE AREA OF THE FRONT DOOR OF THE DRIVER'S SIDE. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED AND NO ONE WITNESSED THE ACCIDENT AND V1 DID NOT LEAVE ANY INFORMATION. THIS OCCURRED BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 1600 TO 1847 HOURS ON 10/11/2019.
V-1 ran off the south side of Sample road and struck several trees before going into a ravine.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Veh 2 was pulling a 14000 rated trailer (TR 271zlw) NB on S CURRY PIKE JUST AT THE INTERSECTION OF BEASLEY DRIVE. VEH 1 WAS ALSO TRAVELLING NB ON S CURRY PIKE RIGHT BEHIND VEH 2. VEH 2 BEGAN SLOWING DOWN. VEH 1 WAS TRAVELLING TOO FAST AND OR TOO CLOS ON THE WET ROAD TO VEH 2 AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP AND COLLIDED WITH REAR END OF THE TRAILERBEINIG PULLED BY VEH 2. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO VEH #2'S TRAILER OR TO VEH 2. VEH 1'S FRONT END WAS DAMAGED BUT BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. NO PHOTOS WERE TAKEN EXCEPT BY DRIVER 1. THERE IS NO DIAGRAM AS THE VEHICLES HAD BOTH BEEN MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was traveling N. On N. Brummetts Creek Road and was stopped at the intersection of N. Brummetts Creek and E. SR 45. D1 advised he attempted to turn left, and travel West on E. SR 45, but struck V2. D2 advised she was traveling East on E. SR 45 when V1 hit the side of her vehicle as she was passing N. Brummetts Creek Road. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N FESS AVE AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 11TH STREET. V2 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 11TH STREET APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION AT N FESS AVE. AS V1 PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, THE FRONT OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE PASSENGERS SIDE OF V2 AT A RIGHT ANGLE. AFTER THE INITIAL COLLISION BETWEEN THE TWO VEHICLES, THE IMPACT FORCED THE REAR OF V1 AROUND IN A CLOCKWISE DIRECTION AT WHICH POINT THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE COLLIDED WITH THE STOP SIGN LOCATED ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT SB AND NB TRAFFIC ON N FESS AVE HAVE STOP SIGNS AS ONE WAY EB TRAFFIC DOES NOT.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SB ON N FESS AVE AND STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT E 11TH ST. D1 STATED THAT AS SHE PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, V2 COLLIDED WITH HER VEHICLE. D1 STATED THAT THE IMPACT CAUSED HER VEHICLE TO CIRCLE AROUND AND THEN COLLIDE WITH THE STOP SIGN. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING EB ON E 11TH ST COMING UP ONTO THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT V1 RAN THE STOP SIGN PULLING OUT IN FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE. D2 STATED HE APPLIED THE BRAKES IN ATTEMPT TO AVOID THE COLLISION, HOWEVER COULD NOT AVOID IT.ALL PARTIES INVOLVED DECLINED MEDICAL ATTENTION ON SCENE, HOWEVER, D1 DECIDED TO GO SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION ON HER OWN TIME.

V1 and V2 were in the left lane going straight on SR 45/46. V1 and V2 were at the intersection with 17th Street. D2 stated that he had just come to a stop at the red light when V1 rear ended him. D1 stated that she attempted to stop in time but did not and rear ended V2. There was minor to no damage done to the rear of V2. V1 had damage to the hood.

Driver one was assisting officers trying to get a vehicle stopped. Driver one took the sample road exit ramp from I69. Driver 1 was going to fast and ran through the roundabout hitting the curbing causing three tires to go flat and some rim damage.

On 10/12/2019 at approximately 2:23am I attempted to conduct a traffic stop on this vehicle and it failed to stop. The vehicle traveled north on I-69 approximately 3 miles where it eventually left the roadway and drove down an embankment, through a fence, then onto another city street (Fountain). The vehicle went off the roadway a short time later and at the intersection of Lemon Ln and Fountain and got stuck in a ditch. The vehicle had fresh black paint in and returned to a red and white Dodge pickup. The two occupants fled from the scene and could not be located. We attempted to contact the registered owner but did not locate anyone at the residence listed on the license plate return from the BMV.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

That caused Vehicle 2 to go into a skid and continue through the intersection and into Vehicle 3 as Vehicle 3 was parked and attended on the southeast corner of the intersection.

V1 WAS TRAVELLING WESTBOUND ON W BELLE AVE. IT APPEARS THE VEHICLE ATTEMPTED TO EITHER MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN OR LOST CONTROL AT S VILLAGE CT. THIS SECOND COLLISION WAS WORKED BY COUNTY DEPUTIES.W1 ADVISED THAT V1 THEN FLED THE SCENE HEADING SOUTH ON PARK SQUARE DR. V1 WAS LATER LOCATED AT ENDWRIGHT AND AIRPORT RD OUT IN MONROE COUNTY. D2 stated he was in the left lane of 3rd Street heading East bound.D2 stated that V1 was in the right lane also heading East bound.D2 stated that just before getting to Pete Ellis Drive V1 merged over into his lane and struck the front bumper on the passenger side of his vehicle.D2 stated that he is unsure if D1 knew they collided. When I arrived on scene, I spoke with the four occupants of a red Volkswagen (V2), driven by Luke Haskett (D2). The occupants stated that they were stopped at the red light going southbound on Indiana Ave and 10th St when they were rear-ended by a blue/black Chevrolet Equinox with an IU license plate starting with E-Y and ending with 5-7. They stated the driver was a white male with black/brown hair and around 20 years old. None of the occupants complained of any injuries at the scene. V2 sustained moderate damage to the rear bumper, trunk, and passenger tail light. It was able to be driven from the scene. Officers located a Chevrolet Equinox (V1) at 431 N Woodlawn Ave with front end damage to the bumper, grill, and hood. Officers spoke with Peter Lamagna, son of the registered owner, who stated that another member of his fraternity was driving the car but did not know who exactly.On 10/14/19, I met with Freddy Rao (D1) at IUPD who admitted to driving V1 and fleeing the scene.

V 1 WAS INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT HIT AND RUN FOR BLOOMINGTON PD (CASE# B19-43346) V1 WAS ALSO REPORTED STOLEN BY THE OWNER TO BLOOMINGTON PD (CASE#B19-43361) V1 STRUCK A STREET SIGN AT BELLE AVE AND VILLAGE CT (BLOOMINGTON PD CASE) AND THEN BACKED UP AND STRUCK A FENCE WHICH WAS ONE FOOT INTO BLOOMINGTON PD (BPD) JURISDICTION. NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS WEST ON 4TH ST AND STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN LOCATED AT WASHINGTON ST. D1 SAID V2 WAS STOPPED JUST PRIOR TO HIM AND WAS LOOKING RIGHT AS IF THEY WERE GOING TO TURN RIGHT. D2 SAID V1 HAD APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION FROM THE EAST ON 4TH AND STOPPED JUST AFTER HER. D2 SAID SHE THEN PROCEEDED SOUTH INTO THE INTERSECTION WHERE SHE WAS STRUCK BY V1.

At this time, V2 was traveling northbound in the right lane in what D1 described to be his blind spot. V1 sideswiped V2 causing damage to the drivers side of V2 and very minimal damage to the rear passenger portion of V1.

V1 WAS TURNING S/B ONTO S DUNN ST FROM E 4TH ST. V1 STRUCK A PARKED CAR ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD, THEN RAN OFF ROAD, STRIKING THE BARRIER WALL OF A PRIVATE HOUSE (502 E 4TH ST). V1 THEN BACKED UP, PULLED BACK INTO THE ROADWAY, FLEEING FROM OFFICERS FOR SEVERAL BLOCKS AND WAS SUBSEQUENTLY ARRESTED. AN ATTEMPT TO CONTACT THE OWNERS OF 502 E 4TH ST WAS MADE, BUT NO CONTACT WAS MADE. V1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE IN FRONT OF S 501 MULLER PARKWAY.V2 WAS DRIVING NORTH THROUGH THE LOT AT 501 S MULLER PARKWAY.D1 SAID V2 WAS GOING FAST THROUGH THE LOT AND AS SHE BACKED UP THEY COLLIDED.D2 SAID AS HE DROVE TOWARD THE STOP SIGN V1 BACKED UP INTO HIM. HE SAID HE WAS NOT GOING FAST.

On 10/14/2019 at approximately 1141 hours, I was dispatched to the IUPD Lobby to speak with the complainant Monte William's regarding a property damage crash that occurred yesterday 10/13/2019 and wanted to make a report. IUPD dispatched advised he was sent over from Bloomington Police Department Lobby to make a report since that part of the Bypass is IUPD area. Upon arrival I spoke with William's. I asked Williams what occurred. William's said he thought the incident occurred around 1600 hours. William's said he was traveling southbound on the 45/46 Bypass in the far left straight lane in his Volkswagen Jetta with Indiana plate UOH798. William's said there was another vehicle he identified as a silver Nissan Altima with Michigan plate CBV3560 in the lane next to him. William's said the Altima began merging over where he was getting closer to the curb. William's said the Altima then was in his lane of travel in front of him. Williams said he thought the Altima might have struck his vehicle, but was not sure at the time.William's said he then began following the Altima where it got into the turn lane after changing lanes a few times turning east onto Third Street. William's said during this time he was on the phone calling police, which he was talking to Central Dispatch. William's said during this time he was asked if he was following the vehicle and he replied yes. William's said he then observed the female driver pull into a gas station off east Third Street. I asked William's which one. William's said he believed it was the Speedway at E. Third Street and Kingston Drive. William's said he pulled into the Kmart parking lot to turn around and sat there for a minute. William's said he then made it over to where the Altima was parked, and sat directly behind the vehicle. Williams said the driver was a white female, approximately 20-25 years of age, blonde hair, with a black coat and possibly red glasses exit the Altima. William's said he observed the female on the phone, and thought she was calling police as well. I asked William's why he didn't get out of the vehicle and speak with the driver. William's said he did not know at the time if the Altima had actually struck his vehicle because he did not feel the vehicle's collide. William's also said he did not want to get into an argument with the other driver. William's said he was also waiting on the police to arrive. William's said after waiting a reasonable amount of time for the police to respond, and the female driver of the other vehicle leaving he went back home. William's said he did not notice the minor damage to his vehicle right front fender quarter panel until he got home yesterday late afternoon. William's then told me he just wants the lady to pay for the damage to his vehicle. William's said that he was going to continue to look for the vehicle, and if located going to call the police to come out. While speaking with William's, I conducted a vehicle registration check for the Nissan Altima through IUPD dispatch. I was informed the plate information given by William's returned to a 2014 Chevrolet Cruze out of Michigan instead of the Nissan Altima he described. I then requested IUPD dispatch to contact IU Parking Operations to see if there was any vehicles with a parking permit registered to the vehicle. IUPD Dispatch advised Parking Operations did not have a vehicle with the Michigan plate CBV3560 assigned to any type of parking permit. IUPD Dispatched when requested also advised the registered owner of the vehicle is not a registered student or employee affiliated with Indiana University.I then took photographs of the minor damage to front right quarter panel on the Jetta. After speaking with William's, I drove to the Speedway gas station and spoke with the District Manager Angel Harris. I explained to Harris why I was there and if we could view the video footage. Harris said yes. During this time we viewed cameras 12 (Pumps) and 6 (Dispenser) from 1500-1700 hours

The owner of vehicle 2 stated he had parked his truck on Smith Ave facing west on the north side of the road just west of Jackson St. He stated vehicle 1 struck his truck and then fled west from the scene. The scene of the accident indicates vehicle 1 appeared to have been westbound on Smith Ave and left the roadway to the south then came across the road and struck vehicle 2.
Driver stated he was west bound on East Dillman Rd when a Deer jumped out of the woods on the south side of the road into the path of his pickup truck , Driver stated he was unable to miss the deer.

V1 AND V2 WERE BOTH TRAVELING WEST ON E STATE ROAD 45/46 BYPASS AND WERE AT THE INTERSECTION WITH N DUNN ST WHEN V2 WAS FORCED TO STOP SUDDENLY DUE TO TRAFFIC ON THE ROADWAY DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THE VEHICLE. IN DOING SO, V2 WAS THEN STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1, CAUSING DAMAGE. V1/D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND WHEN V2 APPEARED TO STOP SUDDENLY IN FRONT OF HIM. UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME, D1 STATED HIS VEHICLE THEN STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER PORTION OF V2. D1 STATED THERE APPEARED TO BE A VEHICLE WHICH SWITCHED INTO THE TRAVEL LANE DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V2, WHICH APPEARED TO CAUSE V2 TO APPLY ITS BRAKES. V2/D2 STATED TRAFFIC WAS MOVING SLOW ON THE ROADWAY IN FRONT OF HIM AND THE VEHICLE DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM STOPPED SUDDENLY WHICH CAUSE HIM TO APPLY HIS BRAKES IN ORDER TO AVOID A COLLISION. D2 STATED HIS VEHICLE WAS THEN STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1. V1 SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE AND WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE BY CHANDLERS DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE. V2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER PORTION AND WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE BY D2. D1 COMPLAINED OF NECK PAIN AS RESULT FROM THE COLLISION, HOWEVER, HE WAS TREATED AND RELEASED BY MEDICAL PERSONNEL AT THE SCENE.

SR 37 is a state highway that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County, Indiana. On this day it was dark and the roadway was dry. The crash scene was in a rural setting.Vehicle #1 (2014 Red Chevrolet Equinox) was traveling south on SR 37 in the left lane. Vehicle #1 struck a deer that had ran across SR 37 from the west. After Vehicle #1 struck the deer with the front end of the vehicle, the deer ran into the grass median.Driver #1 (Tracy Brown) stated that she and her family were traveling south on SR 37 when she struck a deer with the front end of her vehicle. Driver #1 stated the deer came from the west side of the roadway and ran in front of her vehicle. The deer then ran off and was located in the grass median. I arrived and observed Vehicle #1 parked on the left side of SR 37. There was heavy damage to the front end of the whole car. I located hair that looked consistent with deer hair on the front end of the vehicle. All air bags did deploy, but no one was injured. EMS (# 2159) was on scene but no participants were transported to the hospital. Vehicle #1 was towed by Chandler automotive and towing to their lot in Bloomington, IN.

D2 STATED THAT HER VEHICLE WAS PARKED AT THE GAS PUMP AND SHE WAS NOT INSIDE IN IT. D1 STATED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO GET HER VEHICLE (V1) IN BETWEEN V2 AND THE GAS PUMP BUT THERE WASN'T ENOUGH ROOM AND SHE SIDESWIPED V2. V1 DID NOT HAVE PROOF OF INSURANCE, UPON CALLING AMERICAN FAMILY WHO SHE STATED SHE WAS INSURED THROUGH THEY STATED SHE HAS NOT HAD A POLICY SINCE 2017. V1 WAS TOWED FROM THE ACCIDENT SCENE AND D1 WAS ISSUED A CITATION.

V1 AND V2 WERE TRAVELING WEST ON SR 45/46 BYPASS JUST WEST OF DUNN STREET.V1 REAR ENDED V2 WHILE THE VEHICLES WERE SLOWING IN TRAFFIC.D1 ADVISED THAT HE WAS LOOKING AT SOMETHING IN HIS VISOR AND COULD NOT GET STOPPED IN TIME.

On Monday, October 14, 2019 at 16:40, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on I69 near the 113 mile marker in the southbound lanes. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. I69 is a multi-lane Interstate that runs primarily in a north/south direction with a grass median. V1, black Toyota, was traveling south on I69 in the right lane near the 113 mile marker. V1 struck a deer with the front passenger corner and came to a controlled stop along the southbound emergency shoulder. D1, Castillo, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the left lane. D1 stated he observed a deer standing in the grass median so he slowed and moved to the right lane. D1 stated the deer jumped into the southbound lanes and struck the front passenger corner of V1. D1 stated he was unable to avoid collision with the deer. Evidence shows damage to the front passenger corner, hood and fender of V1. Evidence shows a deer was lying along the southbound emergency shoulder behind V1.

V2/D2 STATED "I WAS WESTBOUND ON W. TAPP RD. I WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY, WITH MY LEFT TURN SIGNAL ON, WAITING ON EASTBOUND TRAFFIC. ALL OF THE SUDDEN AS I MADE MY TURN I HEARD A LOUD BANG ON MY CAR, I LOOKED OUT MY WINDOW AND SAY A MOTOCYCLE AND DRIVER LAYING IN THE ROADWAY. I EXITED MY VEHICLE, AND THE DRIVER STATED TO ME, "IM SORRY IT WAS MY FAULT". I NEVER SAW V1 COMING UP ALONG SIDE OF ME."V1/D1 WAS INTERVIEWED AT THE IU HEALTH EMERGENCY ROOM 11. D1 STATED "I WAS WESTBOUND ON W. TAPP RD. ALL OF THE SUDDEN THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF ME SLAMMED ON THIER BRAKES, TO AVOID REAR ENDED THAT VEHICLE, I WENT LEFT OF CENTER TO PASS ALL OF THE VEHICLES, AS I WAS DOING SO, V2 MADE A LEFT HAND TURN INTO MY VEHICLE. I DO NOT HAVE A MOTORCYCLE ENDORSEMENT, I WAS TRYING TO AVOID A COLLISION, THAT IS WHY I WAS PASSING ON THE LEFT."W1 STATED "I WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY DIRECTLY BEHIND V2. ALL OF THE SUDDEN I HEARD A LOUD NOISE OF A MOTORCYCLE REVERING HIS ENGINE, AND THEN SAW V1 PASSING ME ON THE LEFT ON A DOUBLE YELLOW AS V2 WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN INTO 1351 W. TAPP RD. V1 MUST'VE PASSED ATLEAST 4-5 CARS THAT WERE STOPPED BEHIND ME, V1 WAS GOING FAST".W2 STATED "I WAS 3 CARS BEHIND V2, V1 CAME FROM SEVERAL CARS BEHIND ME PASSING ON THE LEFT, REVERING HIS MOTORCYCLE ENGINE AS A FAST SPEED. AS V2 STARTED TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN, THEY COLLIDED IN THE ROADWAY. IM SURE V2 NEVER SAW OR HEARD V1 PASSING ON THE DOUBLE YELLOW."

V1 WAS TRAVELLING NORTHBOUND ON I-69 NEAR THE 114.5 MILE MARKER WHEN A DEER ENTRED THE ROAD FROM THE EAST SIDE. D1 STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO STOP BUT WAS UNABLE TO. V1 STRUCK THE DEER CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Monday, October 14, 2019 at approximately 6:45 AM I responded to the parking lot of Dollar General, located at 5225 W. State Road 46, to assist Deputy Michael Greene of the Monroe County Sheriff's Office with a vehicle collision investigation. The collision occurred at the intersection of West State Road 46 and North Lakeview Drive.Upon speaking with Deputy Greene I learned that Vehicle 1 was attempting to merge into eastbound traffic on West State Road 46 and collided with Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was traveling east in the northern-most (fast or passing) lane. Vehicle 1 failed to yield the right-of-way to Vehicle 2 and collided with Vehicle 2 causing moderate damage to the rear door on the driver's side of Vehicle 2 and moderate damage to the front bumper and front quarter panel on the passenger side of Vehicle 1.No injuries were reported to this officer at the scene of the collision.Photographs of the damage to both vehicles were taken. Copies of those photographs are available upon request.Body-worn camera footage is also available upon request.

D1 stated that he was driving west on East 3rd Street, in the right lane, just west of Kingston Drive, when he put on his signal to merge into the left lane. D1 stated that he looked over his shoulder and thought he was clear to change lanes, and as he began to change lanes, the rear driver's side fender of V1 hit the front passenger side bumper and fender of V2.D2 stated that he was driving west on East 3rd Street, in the left lane, just west of Kingston Drive, when D1 suddenly put on his left turn signal while simultaneously merging into the left lane. D2 stated that the rear driver's side fender of V1 hit the front passenger's side bumper and fender of V2.

VEHICLE 1 MADE A LEFT TURN TRAVELING WESTBOUND ONTO SOUTH CHARLIE STREET NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH ROGERS STREET. VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING TO FAST TO MAKE THE TURN AND DRIVER 1 WAS UNABLE TO CORRECT. VEHICLE 1 CONTINUED THE TURN AND TRAVELED NORTHBOUND INTO A DRIVE WAY AT 5925 SOUTH CHARLIE STREET. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE LEFT REAR BUMBPER AND QUARTER PANEL. VEHICLE 2 WAS PARKED IN THE DRIVEWAY OF 5925 SOUTH CHARLIE STREET, AND WAS FORCED INTO THE CLOSED GARAGE OF THE RESIDENCE. OCCUPANTS OF VEHICLE 1 WERE UNINJURED AND DECLINED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.VEHICLE 1 WAS DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.VEHICLE 2 WAS LEFT AT THE RESIDENCE AND WILL BE TOWED TO SHOP AT INSURANCE DISCRETION.

D1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON E. EARL YOUNG WHEN D1 APPLIED BRAKES AND SHE ADVISED THE ABS KICKED ON SO SHE LET OFF THE BRAKES. V1 THEN STARTED TO PICK UP SPEED AND D1 APPLIED BRAKES AGAIN AND STARTED TO FISH TAIL. D1 TRIED TO CORRECT V1 HOWEVER RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND FLIPPED ONTO THE DRIVERS SIDE AND INTO A CATTLE GATE. OWNERS NAME OF THE CATTLE GATE IS RONALD G ARNOLD 5397 E. EARL YOUNG RD.

V1 was passing V2, traveling northeast in the parking lot of 1400 E. 3rd Street. V2 was parked in the lot in the lane of travel.D1 stated she was passing V2 that was parked in a non-parking space in the parking lot of 1400 E. 3rd Street. She stated that she was traveling northeast as she attempted to pass V2. As she passed V2, the rear driver side fender collided into the rear passenger side bumper of V2.There was damage to the rear fender of V1 and to the rear passenger side bumper of V2. There were no injuries.
D1 was south bound on I-69 at approximately 100 feet north of MM 110. When a deer ran into the right side of D1's vehicle.

D1 stated that he was backing out of his parking spot and did not see any vehicles coming. D1 stated that as he continued to back out of his parking spot, he ran into V2. The rear bumper of V1 hit the driver's side rear door and fender of V2.D2 stated that he was driving south through the parking lot of the apartment complex, when D1 backed out of his parking spot, hitting V2.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON WEST 3RD ST IN FRONT OF LONG JOHN SILVERS (3811 W 3RD ST).V2 WAS STOPPED DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1 DUE TO TRAFFIC.D1 SAID WHEN V2 STOPPED HE WAS UNABLE TO GET STOPPED BEFORE COLLIDING WITH IT.D2 SAID THE CAR IN FRONT OF HIM STOPPED SO HE HAD TO STOP. HE SAID V1 THEN HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.

Officer Hall assisted with witness information, photographs, and traffic control.Officer Koontz assisted with traffic control.V1 was traveling 45-50 mph on southbound SR 46 approaching the stoplight at 17th St. V1 was in the southmost lane of SR 46.V2 was northbound on SR 46 waiting at the stoplight at 17th Street to make a left, westbound turn onto 17th Street.V3 was 17th Street waiting to make a left, northbound turn onto SR 46. D1 stated that he was traveling southbound on SR 46 approaching the stoplight at 17th Street. D1 stated that the stoplight was yellow as he reached the white stop line for the intersection. D1 stated he did not see it change red. D1 continued through the intersection and collided with V2 which was making a left, westbound turn onto 17th Street. The impact caused heavy damage to the front of V1 which would later be towed by Chandlers Towing for disabling damage.D2 stated she was on SR 46, behind another vehicle, waiting to make a left, westbound turn onto 17th Street. D2 stated the vehicle in front of her was taller and she had a difficult time seeing the roadway in front of her. D2 continued to state that she believes she had a solid green light and proceeded to follow the car in front of her through the intersection. As she was in the intersection, V1 collided in the rear, passenger side portion of her vehicle. The collision caused her to spin clockwise with the momentum also causing her to roll backwards into V3. V2 was towed by Chandlers towing due to disabling damage to the rear, passenger side wheel. D3 stated she was stationary on 17th Street waiting for the light to turn green so she could make a left, northbound turn onto SR 46. While stationary, her light turned green for several moments. At this time, she witnessed the collision take place in front of her. She stated due to the timing of the collision, she believes V1 ran the red light. She also approximated V1's speed at 50 mph. During the course of the collision, D3 stated that V2 spun clockwise, and due to the momentum, rolled into the front of her vehicle. Damage to V3 was relatively minor and was able to be driven from the scene.W1 said he was sitting stationary in the turn lane on 17th Street to go southbound on SR 46 and was directly behind W2 who was in a blue Mercury. W1 said he looked up and the light turned green. W1 said V2 was in the turn lane turning to go westbound onto 17th Street. W1 said V1 was traveling southbound on SR 46 and came through the intersection. W1 said V1 struck V2 on the rear passenger quarter panel. W1 said V2 spun 360 degrees clockwise and rolled back into V3. W2 could not indicate if V1 or V2 was primarily responsible.W2 did not say anything different or beneficial to the report. W2 did not observe the collision until they heard the collision.There were no injuries reported at the time of the investigation.
D1 stated she was traveling north on I69 at the speed limit in the left lane. D1 stated a deer entered the roadway from the median. D1 collided with the deer.
D1 was traveling west on vernal pike when a cow ran across the road and d1 struck the animal causing damage to front and front right of car. The animal and animal owner were not located.

D1 stated he was parked facing west in the parking lot of his apartment complex. D1 stated he was going to class so he entered his vehicle and began backing out. D1 stated as he was backing out, V2 ran into the back passenger quarter panel of the vehicle causing damage to both vehicles.D2 stated she was traveling south in her parking lot. D2 stated as she was traveling south, V1 backed out in front of her. D1 stated she was unable to stop and the front right passenger side of her vehicle collided with the back passenger rear quarter panel of V2 causing damage to both.

MARK BEEBE, WHO WITNESSED THE ACCIDENT, STATED THAT V2 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF THE IU CREDIT UNION, LOCATED AT 105 EAST WINSLOW, FACING SOUTH TOWARDS EAST WINSLOW.MARK EXPLAINED THAT V2 WAS PARKED IN THE HANDICAP PARKING SPOT FACING SOUTH AND THAT V1 WAS PARKED BEHIND V2, FACING NORTH.MARK WITNESSED V1 ATTEMPT TO BACK OUT OF ITS PARKING SPOT AND THUS REAR ENDED V2, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO V2. V1 THEN LEFT THE AREA WITHOUT PROVIDING PROOF OF INSURANCE.MARK COULD NOT SEE WHO THE DRIVER OF V1 WAS BUT DID WRITE DOWN THE PLATE OF V1, IT BEING BEV237, AND DID PUT IT ON THE WINDSHIELD OF V2.

V2 WAS PARKED AT 115 S STATE RD 46 IN FRONT OF THE MOE'S RESTUARANT AT OR AROUND 2100 HOURS. V2 WAS STRUCK AT SOME POINT IN THE REAR PASSENGERS SIDE. BOTH DRIVERS WERE NB ON S OLD SR 37 N OF THE INTERSECTION OF S OLD SR 37 AND S FAIRFAX RD. DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC DUE TO THE LANE CLOSURE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION. DRIVER 2 ADVISED WHILE SHE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC THAT SHE WAS REAR ENDED BY VEHICLE 1.DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TRAVELING NB WHEN HE SAW VEHICLE 2 STOPPED IN TRAFFIC DUE TO THE CONSTRUCTION. V1 WAS PULLING OUT OF A PRIVATE DRIVE ACROSS FROM THE INTERSECTION OF W 2ND ST AND S MAPLE ST. D1 ADVISED HE DID NOT SEE ANY VEHILCE TRAVELING WB SO HE TURNED LEFT TO TRAVEL WB. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN TO PROCEED SOUTHBOUND ONTO S HENDERSON ST FROM E HILLSIDE DR. V2 WAS TRAVLELING EASTBOUND ON E HILLSIDE DR APPROACHING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION TO CONTINUE ONTO E HILLSIDE DRIVE PAST S HENDERSON STV1 TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF V2. V2 WAS UNABLE TO STOP STRIKING V1 WITH THE FRONT RIGHT OF V2'S BUMPER WITH THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE TIRE AND BUMPER OF V1. D1 STATED THAT SHE HAD A GREEN LIGHT, BUT DID NOT REMEMBER HAVING A LEFT HAND TURN ARROW. D1 STATED THAT AS SHE TURNED SHE REALIZED V2 WAS GOING TOO FAST AND SHE WAS UNABLE TO MAKE THE TURN OR STOP AND GO BACK IN TIME. D1 STATED THAT SHE SWERVED HARDER TO AVOID A T-BONE IMPACT TO HER VEHICLE. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS GOING STRAIGHT INTO THE INTERSECTION WHEN V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF HIM. D2 STATED THAT HE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT, BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND DID NOT HAVE A CHANCE TO REACT.

V2 TURNED SOUTHBOUND IN THE WALMART PARKING LOT BETWEEN ROW 4 AND 5. V2 CUT ACROSS THE PARKING LOT AND STRUCK V2 WHILE IT WAS DRIVING IN A DESIGNATED LANE OF TRAVEL IN THE PARKING LOT. A WITNESS ON SCENE CONFIRMED THE STATEMENT.

D1 STATED HE WAS EASTBOUND ON E SR 46 NEAR KINGS RD WHEN THE DEER JUMPED IN FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE. HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO THE COLLISION. D1 WAS ABLE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE HIS RESIDENCE AT 5715 E SR 46 PRIOR TO CALLING TO REPORT THE ACCIDENT.THE DEER WAS LOCATED NEAR 5230 E SR 46 AND HAD TO BE PUT DOWN DUE TO INJURIES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was east bound on Bunger Road at Airport Road, V2 was southbound on Airport Road at Bunger Road. V1 failed to yield right of way to V2 and resulted in a right angle collision. D1 stated she thought it was a four way stop.W1 was behind V1 and observed V1 fail to yield right of way to V2.

This accident was a one vehicle property damage accident that involved the vehicle striking a tree.Upon arriving on scene, I was able to locate Vehicle 1 (V1). It should be noted that there was no driver in the vehicle and there was also no one around the vehicle. I was able to observe a large amount of damage to the front of the vehicle where it had struck a tree. I was also able to observe that the airbags in the vehicle had deployed. I was unable to locate a driver at the scene. I was able to speak with a witness who advised that he did not witness the accident, but observed a male and female to grab a bag out of the vehicle and walk westbound on W Alexander St and then north on N Gates Dr. The vehicle had to be towed due to incapacitating damage.

WITNESS STATED SHE WAS BEHIND VEHICLE 1 HEADING EAST ON EAST 1ST STREET WHEN SHE WITNESSED VEHICLE 1 SIDESWIPE VEHICLE 2 AND VEHICLE 3 AND DRIVE AWAY. SHE DID NOTE THAT VEHICLE 1 SEEMED TO BE SWERVING BEFORE AND AFTER SIDE SWIPING THESE VEHICLES. WITNESS ALSO NOTED VEHICLE 1 DROVE PAST THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENTS SEVERAL TIMES AND DID NOT STOP NOR CALL POLICE.SUPPLEMENT: DRIVER 1 WAS LOCATED AND ADVISED SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON 1ST STREET AND VEERED OUT OF THE WAY OF AN ONCOMING VEHICLE AND REALIZED SHE HAD HIT SOMETHING. SHE DID NOT HAVE A PHONE TO CALL POLICE AND WAITED TO DO SO WHEN SHE ARRIVED AT HER RESIDENCE. DRIVER 1 DID PROVIDE VEHICLE AND INSURANCE INFORMATION.

BOTH DRIVERS STATED THEY WERE EB ON W SR 46 ON THE W SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION OF W SR 46 AND N SMITH PK IN THE LEFT LANE OF TRAVEL. DRIVER 1 ADVISED VEHICLE 2 WAS STOPPED AT THE LIGHT DUE TO TRAFFIC AND SHE ACCIDENTLY ROLLED INTO IT. DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS STOPPED AT THE LIGHT DUE TO TRAFFIC AND VEHICLE 1 STRUCK HER VEHICLE.
Driver # 1 stated he swerved to miss a deer and ran off the roadway and ran into a tree.

D1 stated he was traveling south on Strain Ridge Road at approximately 35 MPH. D1 stated he was "swatting a fly" which caused him to slightly run off the roadway. D1 collided with the mailbox at 7558 S Strain Ridge Road. D1 continued south and pulled over at 8035 S Strain Ridge Road. Law Enforcement attempted to make contact with the property owner at 7558 S Strain Ridge however no one answered the door.

Explain in Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: D2 pulled off on to the circle drive of Forest Quad (which is just north of 3rd Street) to allow traffic on Union Street and 3rd Street to run smoothly. This is where I met with her to discuss the incident.Unit 1 Vehicle Factors: It is unknown what or if any vehicle factors contributed to the crash as D1 left the scene.Unit 1 Environmental Factors: It is unknown what or if any environmental factors contributed to the crash as D1 left the scene.D2 was stopped at the stop sign of Union Street at the intersection of Union Street and 3rd Street facing south. D1 was traveling on 3rd Street headed east making a left hand turn to begin traveling north on Union Street. D2 stated she was stopped at the stop sign of Union Street facing south attempting to turn right to begin traveling west on 3rd Street. D2 stated she was waiting for traffic to clear so she could turn right. D2 stated D1 was driving what she believed was a Kia Soul traveling on 3rd street. D2 stated D1 was driving east to begin to attempt to make a left turn to begin traveling north on Union Street. D2 stated D1 then turned into her vehicle, striking V2's driver side bumper with V1's driver side front door. D2 stated that D1 then left the scene in a hurry and never exited their vehicle to exchange information. D2 stated D1 was a male. I observed white paint transfer on V2's front bumper. V2 had a broken light on the front bumper that was falling out. D2 was not injured and her vehicle was not towed. Pictures of the damage to V2 were taken and are attached to the case.

Driver of V1 stated that he was driving south on S. Basswood drive, while a rabbit jumped in front of his vehicle. According to Driver 1, he tried to swerve out in order to save the rabbit, and his vehicle struck the curb, then struck the bus stop shelter located by the sidewalk, and went off road. The front end of the vehicle went into the wood line, before coming to a complete stop.

Vehicle 1 was parked in a line of cars waiting for a passenger at a high school parking lot.Driver 2, in vehicle 2, was backing from a parked position and struck vehicle 1, not seeing it parked in the drive.

D1 was headed W/B on W Industrial Dr., approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D2 was also headed W/B on W Industrial Dr., directly behind V1. D1 then struck a vehicle parked at the stop sign of the intersection, however the impact did not cause any damage. D1 then went to back away from the scene, at which point she struck V2 on the front bumper, causing damage. D1 then left the scene of the accident, however D1/V1 was located shortly after. D1 stated she was headed W/B on W Industrial Dr., approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D2 stated she then struck a vehicle parked at the stop sign of the intersection. D1 stated that she then attempted to back away from the other vehicle and did not realize V2 was behind her, at which point V1 struck V2. D2 stated that she was headed W/B on W Industrial Dr., approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike, directly behind V1.D2 stated that V1 first struck a vehicle at the stop sign of the intersection, and then backed into V2 as she left the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE STOPPED AND THE STOP SIGN ON W FLATWOODS RD AT N COUNTY LINE RD AND SAW V2 APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH. SHE THOUGHT THE INTERSECTION WAS A 4-WAY STOP AND CONTINUED THROUGH, IN THE PATH OF V2.D2 STATED HE WAS DRIVING ON THE GRAVEL PORTION OF THE ROAD AND ATTEMPTED TO STOP WHEN HE NOTICED V1 PULLING OUT IN FRONT OF HIM BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE THE COLLISION.N COUNTY LINE ROAD IS GRAVEL STARTING AT, AND SOUTH OF, W FLATWOODS RD. PART OF THE GRAVEL HAS SPILLED INTO THE INTERSECTION WITH ASPHALT UNDERNEATH.
