OWNER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WENT INSIDE THE BUSINESS TO SHOP AND WHEN SHE RETURNED VEHICLE 2 HAD BEEN DAMAGED AND A NOTE HAD BEEN LEFT ON THE WINDSHIELD WITH A CONTACT NUMBER. THE PHONE NUMBER WAS NOT WRITTEN DOWN CORRECTLY AS THE NUMBER CALLED WAS NOT TO A PERSON INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT.TARGET CAMERAS DID CAPTURE VEHICLE 1 PULL INTO A PARKING STALL PARALLEL TO VEHICLE 2 THEN TURN RIGHT AND SIDESWIPE THE LEFT SIDE OF VEHICLE 2. VIDEO SHOWS DRIVER 1 EXIT VEHICLE 1, LEAVE A NOTE AND DRIVE AWAY.OWNER OF VEHICLE 2 DOES WISH TO PURSUE CHARGES PENDING SUSPECT VEHICLE AND DRIVER ARE LOCATED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.Location of Investigation (see narrative): The investigation was conducted at IUPD headquarters (1469 E 17th Street) where I spoke with B1 (unit 2). I would speak with D1 (unit 1) over the telephone approximately 30 minutes later. D1 had went home for the weekend and was about 1 hour away.B1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching an unnamed private drive about 75 feet east of Mitchell Street. The drive is on the north side of 3rd Street.D1 was exiting the drive and attempted to make an eastbound turn. B1 stated the accident took place at around 1545 hours on 3rd Street. He stated he was riding in the designated bicycle lane and traveling approximately 10-15 mph. As he approached the private drive, V1 exited the drive and into his path. B1 believes V1 did stop at the posted stop sign. B1 stated he was unable to stop in time and collided with the front, driver side quarter panel of V1. The impact caused him to go up onto the hood of V1. B1 and D1 talked briefly and exchanged basic information. B1 stated that his lower right leg became sore after the collision and he went to the hospital for X-Rays. B1 also stated that his bicycle is badly damaged, and along with the medical expenses, wanted to make a report.I then contacted D1 over the telephone who stated he had left Bloomington and would not be back for several days. D1 stated that he was attempting to turn out of the drive and turn eastbound onto 3rd Street. He stated he looked both ways, but did not see B1 approaching from the east. He then pulled from the drive where B1 collided with his vehicle.Neither the bicycle nor the vehicle were present during the time of the report. A crash diagram was attempted to the best of my understanding.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was travelling northbound on S. Faculty avenue attempting to make a turn westbound onto E 3rd. Street. V2 was travelling westbound on E 3rd street at S. Faculty avenue.D1 stated that he did not see V2 when he got ready to turn onto E 3rd street. D1 attempted to turn V1 and at that time the front of V1 struck the rear driver side tire of V2. V1 is a 2 seater 4x4 Kubota with a dump bed. V1 is an orange Kubota used by Landcsape services by Indiana University and was being driven on the roadway. The front attachment for a snow plow is what struck V2.D2 stated he was driving V2 westbound on E 3rd street when V1 struck V2.There was no damage to V1.There was a scratch to the rear driver side tire and hubcap of V2.There were no reported injuries.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS WAITING TO TURN SOUTHBOUND ONTO CURRY PIKE FROM A PRIVATE DRIVE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY. SHE NOTICED NO VEHICLES IN THE SOUTHBOUND LANES BUT DID NOTICE A LINE OF TRAFFIC IN THE RIGHT LANE OF THE NORTHBOUND LANES. SHE STATED THAT SHE BELIEVED SHE HAD ENOUGH TIME TO PULL OUT IN FRONT OF THE VEHICLES SAFELY TO CROSS THE NORTHBOUND LANES AND DRIVE SOUTH ON CURRY PIKE. SHE THEN PULLED OUT ONTO CURRY PIKE AND COLLIDED WITH V1 THAT WAS IN THE LEFT LANE GOING NORTHBOUND ON CURRY PIKE.D2 JUST STATED SHE WAS NORTHBOUND ON CURRY PIKE WHEN V1 PULLED OUT IN ATTEMPT TO CROSS THE NORTHBOUND LANES DIRCELTY IN THE PATH OF HER VEHICLE (V2). SHE ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE TO AVOID THE COLLISION BUT WAS STRUCK IN THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. AFTER THE COLLISION, V2 RAN OFF THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A ROAD CONTRUCTION SIGN. A JUVENILE WAS IN V2 AND HAD COMPLAINTS OF HEAD AND NECK PAIN AND WAS CHECKED ON SCENE BY EMS BUT NOT TRANSPORTED BY AMBULANCE TO THE HOSPITAL.W1 STATED HE WAS NORTHBOUND ON CURRY PIKE A COUPLE OF VEHICLES BEHIND V2 WHEN HE NOTICED V1 PULL OUT IN FRONT OF MULTIPLE VEHICLES CAUSING THEM TO BRAKE OR SLOW DOWN PRIOR TO V1 HITTING V2. W1 ALSO STATED V1 DID SWERVE LEFT IN ATTEMPT TO AVOID THE COLLISION. W2 STATED SHE WAS BEHIND V1 IN THE PRIVATE DRIVE ALSO WAITING TO PULL OUT AND DID NOT SEE V2 IN THE LEFT LANE WHEN V1 STARTED TO ENTER THE ROADWAY.AT THIS TIME, I DO NOT HAVE THE INJURED JUVENILES NAME OR POLICY NUMBER FOR V2.On 10/24/2019. I was able to get the injured juveniles name. The juvenile was treated at scene and taken to the hospital by a family member after the crash.Both vehicles insurance information has been updated.

OWNER OF D2 PARKED AT 639 S. WALKER ST AT APPROXIMATELY 815 AM. WHEN SHE RETURNED AT APPROXIMATELY 1005 AM SHE FOUND NEW DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER REAR CORNER OF V2. SHE ALSO FOUND MATCHING DAMAGE TO THE CAR PARKED NEXT TO HER (V1) ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE FRONT CORNER, AT A CONSISTENT HEIGHT AND LOCATION TO SOMONE TURNING RIGHT INTO THE PARKING SPACE NEXT TO HER.I LATER LOCATED THE OWNER OF V1 INSIDE THE BUSINESS. HE DENIED STRIKING V2, BUT COULD NOT PROVIDE A CLEAR PICTURE OF WHEN THE DAMAGE OCCURRED TO V1. NO REPORTED INJURIES.
V2 WAS TURNING OFF SR 46 ONTO FOSTER FISCUS WHILE V1, WHO WAS CONTINUING EAST ON SR 46, STRUCK V2'S LEFT TAILLIGHT WITH V1'S DRIVERSIDE SIDEVIEW MIRROR AS V1 WAS TRYING TO PASS V2 ON THE SHOULDER.

Contributing factor- Other Participant #1: (2006 dark blue Dodge Durango) was east bound on SR 46. Other Participant #1 started to cross the centerline. As Other Participant #1 cross the centerline it traveled all the way into the oncoming lane of the highway. Other Participant # 1 swerved back into its lane as travel before being struck by Vehicle #1. SR 46 is a State Highway that runs in an eastern and western direction through Monroe County, Indiana. SR 46 in that areai s curvy with hills. There are fog and centerlines on SR 46. On this day it was sunny and the roadway was dry. The crash scene was in a rural area.Vehicle #1 (2010 silver Kia Soul) was west bound on SR 46. Vehicle #1 swerved to the right and drove partially off the roadway to avoid striking an oncoming vehicle (Other Participant #1) who was left of center. Vehicle #1 came back on the roadway and went across the centerline. Vehicle #1 then over corrected and went back off the roadway on the right side of the roadway. Vehicle #1, after leaving the roadway, was in the grass on the north side of SR 46 and tried to get back on SR 46. While trying to re-enter SR 46 Vehicle #1 hit a ditch with the front end. Vehicle #1 was stopped by the ditch. Other Participant #1 (Jerry D. Bell) stated he was traveling eastbound on SR 46. Other Participant #1 stated that he crossed the centerline as he was going around the curve. Other Participant #1 stated that as he was coming back to his lane of travel, Vehicle #2 was starting to go off the roadway to avoid hitting him. Other Participant #1 stated that he noticed Vehicle #1 stopped off the roadway and turned around to come back and check on him. Other Participant #1 stated the he was travelling approximately the speed limit of 45 mph.Driver #1 (Christopher J. Driver) stated that he was traveling westbound on SR 46. Driver #1 stated that he noticed Other Participant #1 crossing the centerline almost all the way into his lane of travel. As Other Participant #1 started to go back into its lane Driver #1 went off the right side of the roadway to avoid hitting Other Participant #1. Driver #1 stated that once Other Participant #1 passed he tried to come back onto the road and over corrected. Driver #1 stated he started to cross the centerline himself and over corrected again causing him to run off the roadway, on the north side of SR 46. Driver #1 stated that after leaving the roadway he tried to re-enter SR 46 and struck a ditch that he could not see causing his vehicle to get stuck.Witness #1 (Ricky L. Crouch) stated that he was traveling east bound on SR 46 behind Other Participant #1. Witness #1 stated that he had been behind Other Participant #1 for approximately 3.4 miles and in that distance Other Participant #1 had crossed the centerline approximately 10 times. Witness #1 stated that Other Participant #1 crossed the centerline and Vehicle #1 got off the roadway to avoid hitting Other Participant #1. Witness #1 stated that after passing Vehicle #1, Other Participant #1 keep driving east and turned around to come back.I arrived and observed Vehicle #1 at its final rest point. Vehicle #1 was sitting with the front end against an embankment in the ditch. Witness #1 was parked to the east and Other Participant #1 was behind him, both off the roadway. I observed tire tracks in the tall grass were Vehicle #1 had driven off the roadway.
An unknown vehicle was traveling west on 17th St and ran off of the road on the north side of the road, colliding with the sign for 1410 N Walnut St. The vehicle left the scene without stopping.

D1, D2 and D3 were all headed E/B on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D2 and D3 were stopped at the red traffic light at the intersection. D1 attempted to merge from the left lane of the E/B roadway into the right lane, at which point V1 struck the rear of V2. V2 was then pushed forward and struck the rear of V3. D1 stated that she was headed E/B on W 3rd St in the left hand lane, approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D1 stated that as she approached the intersection she attempted to make a lane change into the right lane. D1 stated that as she merged lanes she looked behind her to check for vehicles. D1 stated that she did not see vehicles in front of her in the right lane when she merged. V1 then struck V2 in the rear of the vehicle. D2 stated that he was headed E/B on W 3rd St in the right hand lane, approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D2 stated that he then stopped in traffic at the intersection. D2 stated that as he waited for the traffic light to turn green V2 was struck from the rear by V1, which caused V2 to strike V3 in the rear. D3 stated that she was headed E/B on W 3rd St in the right hand lane, approaching the intersection of S Curry Pike. D3 stated that she then stopped in traffic at the intersection. D3 stated that as she waited for the traffic signal to turn green she looked into her rear view mirror and saw V1 strike V2, which then caused V2 to strike V3.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver one stated she was turning left from the parking lot of 2211 S High Street onto S High Street when she didn't see vehicle 2 driving south and she hit the driver side of vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated it was her fault.Driver 2 stated she was driving south on S High Street when she was hit by vehicle 1 on the driver side.

V1 was travelling southbound on N Jordan Avenue approaching E 10th street. V2 was stopped in traffic, also travelling southbound on Jordan at E 10th street.D1 stated that she did not see that V2 was stopped, and bumped V1 into V2.D2 stated that she was stopped in traffic waiting to go southbound on Jordan avenue, when V1 bumped into V2.There was some minor scratches and a dent to the front bumper of V1.Damage to V2 was not readily visible, except for a scratch on the trailer hitch and the rear bumper above the hitch was slightly bent. At the time, both drivers agreed to an information exchange. D2 requested a report several days later, which is why the report was not completed until 10/25/2019There were no reported injuries.

When I arrived on scene I spoke to D1 who stated he was the only occupant of V1 during the crash. D1 appeared to have an injury to the back of his head D1 stated V1 was traveling south on S SR 37 and approaching the intersection of S SR 37 & S Victor Pk when he fell asleep and V1 ran off the east side of the roadway and across thee grass median. D1 stated V1 then rolled over and into the north bound lanes of S SR 37. I observed tire marks on the south bound side of the roadway that lead up to where the vehicle crossed the grass median. I also observed V1 inverted at the end of the tire marks consistent with D1's statement. Deputy T Reynolds spoke to a witness, Keith Martin, who confirmed the same account of events relayed by D1. D1 refused treatment and V1 was towed due to disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON LYNWEST DRIVE. AFTER STOPPING, UNIT 1 PROCEEDED TO TURN SOUTH ONTO UNION VALLEY. UNIT 1 ENTERED THE ROAD WAY IN THE PATH OF UNIT 2, WHO WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME. THERE WAS LIGHT DAMAGE TO UNIT 1 DRIVER SIDE FRONT BUMPER. UNIT 2 HAD LIGHT DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE HEADLIGHT. AN OFF DUTY LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER STOPPED TO INFORM ME THAT UNIT 2 HAD BEEN DRIVING WRECKLESSLY. HE STATED THAT UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED AND MADE SEVERAL UNSAFE LANE MOVEMENTS. THE OFFICER STATED THERE WERE ALSO OTHER INDIVIDUALS THAT STOPPED AND SAID THE SAME THING ABOUT THE DRIVING BEHAVIOR. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 ALSO STATED UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. I DID NOT OBSERVE ANY DRIVING BEHAVIOR, BUT WAS INFORMED OF IT.

PASSENGER OF VEHICLE 1 CALLED POLICE AT 1500 TO REPORT AN ACCIDENT SHE WAS INVOLVED IN AT 0300 THAT HAD NOT BEEN REPORTED TO POLICE. SHE ADVISED DRIVER 1 WAS SPEEDING AND DRIVING ERRATICALLY ON PEACHTREE LANE WHEN HE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND STRUCK A TREE HEAD ON. PASSENGER DID HAVE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER BACK AND BRUISING ON ARMS AND LEGS.IT SHOULD BE NOTED, VEHICLE 1 IS NOT CURRENTLY PLATED AS THE OWNER OF THE VEHICLE JUST RECENTLY PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE FROM ITS PREVIOUS OWNER.DRIVER 1 WAS ISSUED A CITATION FOR DRIVING WHILE NEVER BEEN LICENSED.

V1 was backing NB out of a parking space at 4025 S Old State Road 37 when it backed into V2 that was traveling EB through the parking lot.D1 stated that she back into V2, D2 stated the V1 backed into his vehicle.Both vehicles moved to parking spaces after the collision, therefore no diagram.

Interstate 69 near the 111.5 mile marker is a rural four-lane interstate with a grass median. The roadway primarily runs in a northeast-southwest direction and the speed limit is 70 miles per hour. Vehicle # 1 was traveling southwest on Interstate 69 rounding a sweeping curve to the right. Vehicle # 1 struck a deer head-on before coming to a controlled stop off the right shoulder. The deer came to rest on the shoulder near the fog line. Driver # 1 said she was traveling in the right lane and did not see the deer until too late. Driver # 1 said the deer ran in front of her left to right. Driver # 1 was unable to take any evasive action prior to the crash.

D1 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON SWAIN, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF SWAIN AND EAST ATWATER.D1 STATED THAT SHE COULD NOT REMEMBER EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED BUT THAT SHE WAS DRIVING ACROSS ATWATER, ON SWAIN, AND THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1 WAS STRUCK BY THE FRONT DRIVER'S CORNER OF V2.D2 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS DRIVING EAST ON ATWATER IN THE RIGHT LANE, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH SWAIN.D2 STATED THAT D1 DID GO THROUGH THE STOP SIGN AT SWAIN RESULTING IN THE FRONT OF V2 MAKING CONTACT WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V1.IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THERE IS NO STOP SIGN ON ATWATER, ONLY ONE ON SOUTH SWAIN.

V1 was traveling N/B on Walnut ST in the turning lane. V2 was traveling N/B on Walnut in the center lane, attempting to turn E/B on E10th ST. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 was traveling N/B on N Walnut ST in the center lane, attempting to turn E/B on E 10th ST. D2 stated that while attempting to turn from the center lane, she noticed V1 a in the turning lane on Walnut ST. Ulyssea stated that V1 reversed and went around V2. D2 stated that V1 then reversed again and struck the driver side door of her vehicle. D2 advised that she observed V1 to be a red Jeep. Ulyssea mentioned that she was not able to get a good description of the driver or license plate information.

V2 WAS EAST BOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS, JUST WEST OF MONROE ST.V1 WAS EAST BOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS, BUT HAD TURNED INTO THE MEDIAN TO TURN AROUND TO GO BACK WEST ON THE BYPASS.D2 SAID AS HE WAS PASSING V1, V1 PULLED FORWARD AND STRUCK V2'S TRAILER.D1 SAID HE WAS LOOKING FOR WEST BOUND TRAFFIC AND PULLED TOO FAR FORWARD.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON EAST BENNINGTON BOULEVARD WHEN HE STARTED AROUND A CURVE IN THE ROADWAY.D1 EXPLAINED THAT AS HE WAS PROCEEDING WEST THAT HE DID RUN OFF THE ROAD NEAR 4013 E BENNINGTON BOULEVARD, HIT THE CURB AND THEN STRIKE A BLACK LIGHT POLE.THE POLE, WHICH DID NOT HAVE A NUMBER LOCATED ON IT, WAS NOCKED TO THE GROUND AND V1 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE AND THE WINDSHIELF.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on SR 46 in construction. V1 did strike V2 as it attempted to merge into the lane V2 was traveling in.D1 stated that she was in the left lane attempting to merge into the right lane due to construction. She stated as she did so V2 did speed up striking her in the right rear. She advised V1 rammed her twice. She was scared and kept driving and was going to inspect her vehicle for damage and call police after she arrived at work.D2 stated that he was driving in the right lane and thought V1 was going to merge behind him as the vehicle immediately behind him had left room for V1 to do so. As he looked forward, V1 sped up to go around him and then attempted to merge into his lane, striking his left front bumper.V1 did fail to yield to V2 causing damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND OUT OF PARKING LOT OF 1285 SOUTH LIBERTY DRIVE ATTEMPTING A LEFT TURN WHEN IT STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE RIGHT REAR QUARTER PANEL. VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ATTEMPTING TO AMKE A LEFT TURN INTO PARKING LOT OF 1285 SOUTH LIBERTY. DRIVER 1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 AND PROCEEDED TO MAKE A LEFT TURNALL OCCUPANTS INVOLVED WERE UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND WERE DRIVEN FROM SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON 4TH STREET GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AT LINCOLN STREET.V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON LINCOLN STREET GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AT FOURTH STREET.D1 ADVISED THAT SHE HAD A LARGE GLARE FROM THE SUN AS SHE WAS GOING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND COULD NOT SEE WELL.V1 FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY TO V2 AS THE FRONT OF V1 STRUCK THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE OF V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION OF N STARNES RD AND W REEVES RD, UNIT 2 WAS ALSO ENTERING THE INTERSECTION. UNIT 1 HAD A STOP SIGN AND UNIT 2 DID NOT. UNIT 2 STATED THEY DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO STOP TO AVOID UNIT 1, AND STRUCK THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED SHE HAD A SLIGHT COMPLAINT OF PAIN, BUT DID NOT GET TRANSPORTED FROM THE SCENE BY EMTS.

V2 was stopped in traffic on W 17th St. V1 was traveling behind V2 and D1 stated that she was unable to stop in time before rear ending V2. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage. D1 was unable to provide proof of insurance at the time of the crash and has not provided proof of insurance to this date.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 was traveling westbound on West State Road 48 approaching the intersection of West Profile Parkway. Driver 1 stated that the traffic light turned yellow, as it did he continued traveling westbound through it. Driver 1 stated Driver 2 also continued through the yellow light turning onto West Profile Parkway which he collided with the rear of Driver 2. Driver 2 stated she was in the turn lane for West Profile Parkway facing eastbound on West State Road 48. Driver 2 stated the light turn yellow and she proceeded to turn and was collided by Driver 1. Driver 2 stated that Driver 1 accelerated through the intersection, was "flying" and ran the red light. Witness on scene advised she stopped at the traffic light while in the right hand lane of westbound West State Road 48. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy front right damage and Vehicle 2 sustained heavy rear end damage. Both driver's declined medical personnel. Both vehicles were towed by Bland's wrecker service and were transported to Pritchard's tow yard.
UNIT 1 WAS BACKING UP TO RETURN TO A HOUSE TO DROP OFF A PACKAGE. UNIT 1 IS A USPS POSTAL TRUCK. UNIT 1 THEN BACKED INTO UNIT 2, WHICH WAS PARKED ON WEST LADD AVE.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT THEY WERE TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON E BUICK CADILLAC BLVD WHEN OFFICERS WERE ATTEMPTING TO PULL THE VEHICLE OVER. D1 THEN TURNED NORTHBOUND ON TO S COLLEGE MALL RD, WHERE D1 CONTINUED TO DRIVE NORTH FOR A SHORT DISTANCE, AT WHICH POINT D1 CROSSED THE MEDIAN AND ENTERED THE SOUTHBOUND LANES, HITTING V2 HEAD ON. D1 STATED THAT THEY CROSSED THE MEDIAN DUE TO BEING CHASED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON S COLLEGE MALL RD IN THE EASTERN MOST LANE WHEN THEY OBSEREVD V1 CROSS THE MEDIAN AND THEN STRIKE V2 HEAD ON.

D1 stated he was traveling north on Starnes Road at approximately 35 MPH. D1 stated he looked away from the roadway to turn on the defrost on his vehicle. When he looked up, D1 was heading off the roadway. D1 described over correcting by turning from one side of the roadway to the opposite side then finally running off the roadway and colliding with a utility pole in the front yard of 3770 Starnes Road. The property owner for the address 3750 Starnes Road called in and stated the power line running from the damaged pole to her residence had been damaged. Specifically the cable anchor attaching the line to her residence had been ripped from the side of the house. The power line was now laying on the ground.

V1 was traveling southbound on S State Road 37 just south of S. Victor Pike. D1 stated that a deer ran in front of him in the roadway and he was unable to avoid hitting it. V1 was towed from the scene due to disabling damage.

Vehicle #1 was traveling west on 10th just east of Jefferson.Vehicle #1 was traveling west 10th when Driver #1 entered the curve at an unreasonable speed. Vehicle #1 left the roadway striking the railroad overpass structure head on. Driver #1stated he was unfamiliar with the road in the area and was unable to make the curve.Further investigation at the scene showed that the Driver was impaired. The driver was treated at the scene after complaining of chest pain. He was later transported to IU Health Bloomington for a blood draw to determine his alcohol level. Those results are pending.

WITNESSES STATED THEY WERE INSIDE THEIR VEHICLE WEST ON BLUE RIDGE, WAITING TO TURN ON TO WALNUT WHEN THEY SAW VEHICLE 2 HEADING NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT MOVING SLOWLY AND VEHICLE 1 MOVING EXTREMELY FAST NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT. THEY ADVISED VEHICLE 1 ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE AROUNDTHE RIGHT SIDE OF VEHICLE 2, HIT THE REAR RIGHT BUMPER OF VEHICLE 2, THEN LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND CRASHED INTO A FENCE THEN STRUCK TREE OFF TO THE RIGHT SIDE OF NORTH WALNUT. UPON HITTING THE TREE VEHICLE 1 BECAME AIRBORNE AND OVERTURNED.THE OWNER OF THE FENCE WAS NOTIFIED OF THE DAMAGE AND EMAILED A COPY OF THE CRASH REPORT.DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS GOING NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT WHEN SHE HEARD A SERIES OF LOUD NOISES AND FELT HER VEHICLE MOVE, AND REALIZED SHE HAD BEEN REAR ENDED BY VEHICLE 1.DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS COMING FROM THE DOWNTOWN BLOOMINGTON AREA AND HEADED TOWARDS SPENCER, WHEN SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON NORTH WALNUT AND WENT TO ROLL DOWN HER WINDOW WHEN SHE SUDDENLY CRASHED. THESE EVENTS WERE THE LAST SHE CAN RECALL. DRIVER 1 DOES HAVE A DIAGNOSED SEIZURE DISORDER. EMS STATED DRIVER 1 HAD POSSIBLY HAD A SEIZURE WHICH CAUSED THE COLLISION.
Vehicle 1 was traveling Westbound on Tapp Road at the intersection of Deborah Drive. A deer ran into the roadway in front of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 1 struck the deer, causing damage to the vehicle.

V1 was traveling South from the Jackson Heights Apartment entrance across W. 17th Street towards N. Jackson Street. V2 was traveling West on W. 17th Street on a scooter in the bike lane. V1 disregarded the stop sign and failed to yield the right of way to V2. V1 entered the intersection and collided with V2. The rider of V2 was able to get off the scooter in time to avoid being struck directly by V1. The rider collided with the driver side of V1 causing damage to the driver side mirror. V1 continued traveling South without stopping. The rider of V2 was transported by EMS to IU Health for a complaint of pain to his chest.

Gretchen Anderson, a witness, stated that D1 began backing out of her parking spot in the IU Health Bloomington Hospital parking garage, when V1 hit V2 as she was backing out of her parking spot. Gretchen stated that D1 pulled back into her parking spot, sat there for a minute, and then pulled out of the parking spot again and left the scene. The driver's side rear fender and bumper area of V2 had silver scrape marks on it from V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was EB on E Hillside drive and was slowing for traffic near Clifton avenue. V2 was in front of V1 and was already stopped in traffic. V1 failed to get stopped and struck V2 in the rear bumper. D1 stated that she saw traffic stopped and wasn't real sure why she didn't get stopped. She said she hit V2 in the rear.D2 stated that she was stopped in traffic and she looked in her rear view mirror and saw that D1 was not looking at the road and saw her hit her in the rear.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS TURNING RIGHT ONTO UIONVALLY RD FROM CVS PARKING LOT AND DID NOT SEE ANY VEHICLES COMING AS D1 PULLED OUT HE STRUCK V2 AND THOUGHT IT MAY HAVE COME FROM THE THE WEST. D2 STATED HE HAD DROVE STRAIGHT (NORTH) FROM THE LIGHT AT STATE ROAD 46 ONTO UNIONVALLY RD AND WAS STRUCK ON THE FRONT PASSENGERSIDE. V2 WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE.

V1 was traveling southbound on N Wayport Rd south of E Ellis Rd. N Wayport Rd comes to an end approximately 300 feet south of E Ellis Rd. V1 continued straight and went through a fence, down an embankment and came to a stop in a culvert. D1 was taken from the scene for immediate medical attention. I was able to speak with D1 the next day about the crash. D1 stated that the last thing he remembers is traveling south on N Wayport Rd and does not remember the crash. D1 stated that he does not have any pre existing medical conditions that he knows of. To this date, D1 has been unable to provide proof of insurance for either the pickup truck nor the trailer.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON EAST HILLSIDE NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF EAST HILLSIDE AND SOUTH HUNTINGTON WHEN A DEER DID RUN INTO THE ROAD WAY, COMING FROM THE SOUTH SIDE OF HILLSIDE.D1 EXPLAINED THAT HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME AND THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DEER, RESULTING IN THE FRONT OF V1 SUSTAINING DAMAGE.

VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING A LEFT TURN FROM WEST CHURCH LANE AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37. VEHICLE 1 ENTERED THE TURN TO QUICKLY AND RAN OFF THE ROAD STRIKING A SIGN AT 5337 SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37.DRIVER 1 WAS TRANSPORT BY AMBULANCE TO IU HEALTH FOR NECK PAIN.VEHICLE 1 WAS DISABLED AND TRANSPORTED TO KENS WESTSIDE BY KENS WESTSIDE.

THE OWNER OF V2 STATED THAT SHE HAD PARKED V2 IN THE PARKING LOT OF 1500 E 3RD STREET, FACING EAST.THE OWNER OF V2 EXPLAINED THAT WHEN SHE CAME BACK OUT TO V2 AFTER EATING SHE DID SEE THAT ANOTHER VEHICLE HAD STRUCK THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.THE DAMAGE CONSISTED OF SCRATCHES AND WHITE PAINT TRANSFER ALONG THE ENTIRE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.THERE IS NO INFORMATION IN REGARDS TO V1 OR D1.
Driver of V-1 stated she was trying to park in a parking spot at Kroger grocery store and struck the back left side bumper of V-2 while it was parked causing damage to both V-1 and V-2.

D1 stated that she was driving south on N Walnut Street, and that the traffic was congested. D1 stated that traffic in front of her began accelerating, so she accelerated as well. D1 stated that the vehicle in front of her, V2, began braking, and D1 thought she was going to accelerate instead of brake. D1 stated that she was turning down her radio when V2 began braking, and D1 stated that she began braking, but could not stop in time, and rear ended V2.D2, who was driving a rental car from Enterprise, stated that she was driving south on N Walnut Street, and that the traffic was congested. D2 stated that she was slowly moving forward due to the traffic, when she was suddenly rear ended by V1. D2 did purchase insurance through Enterprise when she rented the vehicle.

Owner 1 stated he parked her vehicle in the front handicap parking space around 1800 hours and went inside to shop with her mother. Owner 1 stated she returned to her vehicle around 1830 hours and located damage to her rear passenger side corner. I observed the damage and from the paint transfer on the vehicle I believe the suspect vehicle to be red. Also from the damage and location of the vehicle 2 I believe that vehicle 1 was turning north in the parking lot and hit the rear corner of vehicle 2 with the passenger side of their vehicle.

At approximately 1255 hours on 10/20/2019 a crash occurred between V1 and V2 in the 10th Street parking lot. V1 was parked and V2 backed and sideswiped V1. There was paint transfer and scraping to the driver side rear bumper of V1.W1 advised that she heard scraping noises while walking toward the SRSC. She looked and witnessed a black Dodge Nitro, V2, back into V1. She stated that the vehicle moved toward 10th and the driver got out, checked his car, and then left and headed east on 10th.V2 was unable to be located.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated they were traveling north on Old State Road 37, making a left hand turn into the private drive of 6280 S Old State Road 37, Mays Green House. D2 stated that she was waiting at the exit only drive of 6280 S Old State Road 37 getting ready to turn onto Old State Road 37. D2 states that she does not recall if she began to pull out onto the roadway before or after the collision. Unsure of if the collision occurred within the roadway or on the private drive. Unable to establish fault with pulling into an exit only on a private drive or failing to yield right of way from D2 for the entering vehicle.

Unit 1 was travelling Southbound on I69, approaching mile marker 122.5. Unit 1 was in the right hand lane, and while travelling on this stretch of road, which is not lighted, struck an object that was in the roadway. Unit 1 sustained damage to the front bumper on the passenger side. Upon investigation, the object was identified as a tree stand, used for deer hunting.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling westbound on Graham Dr. V2 was traveling northbound on Henderson St. V1 pulled out in front of V2, striking V2,D1 stated that she did not see V2 and that she pulled out onto Henderson St and Struck V2. She did state it was her fault.D2 stated that she saw V1 starting to pull out in front of her and attempted to stop but could not avoid being struck by V1.V1 did fail to yield to V2, causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THEY WERE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN ON N MONROE ST AND W STATE RD 45. D1 STATED THEY WERE ATTEMPTING TO ENTER TRAFFIC AND CROSS TRAFFIC LANES IN ORDER TO DRIVE WESTBOUND ON W STATE RD 45.D1 STATED THEY ENTERED THE EASTBOUND LANES OF W STATE RD 45 AT AND ALMOST MADE IT TO THE MEDIAN TURN AREA AT WHICH POINT V2 STRUCK THE REAR DRIVERS SIDE OF V1.D2 STATED THAT THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON W STATE RD 45, NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH N MONROE ST, WHEN D2 OBSERVED V1 ENTER INTO TRAFFIC FROM THE SOUTH. D2 STATED THEY PUSHED DOWN THEIR BRAKES, BUT WAS UNABLE TO AVOID STRIKING V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Officer Smolen assisted with information gathering, administering breath tests, and traffic control.Officer Khan assisted with information gathering, photographs, and traffic control.V1 was traveling northbound on SR46 and waiting at the 17th Street intersection to make a left turn.V2 was traveling southbound on SR46 and proceeding through the 17th Street intersection.D1 stated that he was waiting to make a left turn onto westbound 17th Street from the SR46 bypass. D1 stated that his light was yellow when he began his turn. D1 stated that V2 may have been traveling quickly as he did not see V2 approaching until it was too late. V2 then collided into V1. This caused V1 to spin almost 180 degrees and pushed V1 onto a concrete median. It is unclear if V1's headlights were illuminated as both headlights were broken upon my arrival. D1 complained of hip pain upon my arrival and was unable to walk without assistance. He was eventually transported via ambulance to IU Health hospital. D1 stated he was wearing his seatbelt and his airbags deployed. The vehicle sustained heavy front-end damage and had to be towed by Kens Westside due to disabling damage.D2 stated that he was traveling southbound on SR46 approaching the 17th Street intersection. D2 stated he had a yellow light as he was approaching the intersection. D2 did not know how fast he was traveling and did not see V1 pull into his lane of travel due to the heavy rain. V2 then collided with V1 which sent V2 past the southeast corner of the intersection and into a metal fence. V2's airbags deployed and both occupants stated they were wearing their seatbelt. D2 complained of chest pain upon my arrival and was eventually transported to IU Health hospital. V2's front passenger, P2, was also transported due to chest and back pain. V2 was towed to Kens Westside due to disabling damage.D2 has been living in the United States for approximately 20 years. D2 does not have a drivers license. He was issued a misdemeanor citation for Operating a Vehicle Without Ever Receiving a License. Refer to the IUPD ARMS report under the same case number for more info.At the end of the collision, V2 struck an Indiana University owned fence. Pictures of the accident, along with pictures of the fence, have been attached to the case.

The driver of vehicle one was eastbound on Indiana State Road 46, approaching the Smith Pike intersection. When he decided to change lanes, drive one did not notice that cars were coming to a stop, and he rear-ended driver two, causing minor damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was heading North on Lincoln Street approaching 4th Street. D1 stated that she momentarily stopped at the stop sign and did not see V2.D1 stated she proceeded through the intersection and was struck by V2.D1 stated due to her not seeing V2 she was unsure if it was her turn to go through the interection or V2's. D2 stated that he was heading West on 4th Street approaching Lincoln Street.D2 stated that he stopped at the stop sign and noticed V1 approaching the stop sign heading North on Lincoln. D2 stated that it appeared that V1 was going to stop so he proceeded through the intersection. D2 stated he was also trying to make a phone call at the time and he was unsure if V1 actually stopped at the stop sign. D2 stated as he proceeded through the intersection he struck V1 on the passenger side. After V1 was struck by V2, D1 lost control of the vehicle which spun around and struck V3 which was parallel parked on the West side of Lincoln Street just North of 4th Street.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.V1 was traveling westbound on 10th Street approaching an "S" turn just before reaching Jefferson Street. V1 was traveling approximately 40 mph in a 30 mph zone on wet roads.D1 stated that his girlfriend and he were running late for class which caused him to travel faster than he usually would. He stated he was traveling about 40 mph before he realized that he had a sharp turn ahead. He stated he hit his brakes and began to slide on the asphalt. He then went off the roadway and collided with a metal barricade meant to stop cars from traveling onto the sidewalk. V1 went partially under the barricade and caused the vehicle to become wedged. The passenger, P1, complained of back and neck pain. An ambulance arrived on scene and checked out P1. P1 ultimately declined a hospital visit and was released from scene. V1 had to be towed due to disabling damage by Blands towing.There was no damage to metal barricade.

V2 WAS SLOWED TO ALLOW A VEHICLE TO TURN WHEN V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR. D1 ADVISED THAT HE ATTEMPTED TO STOP BUT WITH THE WET ROADS HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME. BOTH DRIVERS WERE ASKED IF THEY WERE INJURED AND DENIED INJURY. D2 STATED SHE BELIEVED SHE HAD "WHIPLASH" HOWEVER WAS UNDER THE CARE OF A CHIROPRACTOR AND WOULD SEEK TREATMENT LATER IF REQUIRED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was driving south on N Lincoln Street, and came to a stop at the stop sign at the intersection of E 16th Street. D1 stated that she looked and could not see any traffic coming from either direction, and stated that the parked vehicles on the street hindered her ability to see down the street. D1 stated that she thought she was clear to drive through the intersection, and was then struck by V2. The front end of V2 collided with the front passenger side bumper, and scraped down the passenger side front and rear doors.D2 stated that he was driving east on E 16th Street, and as he was approaching the intersection of N Lincoln Street, he observed V1 sitting at the stop sign. D2 stated that D1 pulled out into the intersection, and he hit his brakes to avoid hitting V1, but could not stop in time, and collided with V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Explain in Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: The crash occurred on Jordan Avenue, but both parties drove to IUPD to make the report. D1 was facing west in the parking lot just west of Read Hall attempting to make a left turn on Jordan Avenue to begin traveling southbound on Jordan Avenue. D2 was driving northbound on Jordan Avenue attempting to continue to drive northbound on Jordan Avenue. D1 stated he was attempting to exit the parking lot just west of Read Hall. D1 stated he looked both ways before trying to turn left. D1 stated that he then realized that D2 was coming and tried to get out of D2's way but was struck by V2. V1 had damage to the front driver side door and damage to the front bumper on the driver side including the driver side headlight. D1 did not complain of injury. V1 was not towed. D2 stated he was driving north on Jordan Avenue going approximately 30 miles per hour. D2 stated V1 then pulled out in front of him and V2 struck V1. D2 stated he attempted to swerve to avoid hitting D1, but struck V1 with V2's front bumper. V2 had damage to his front bumper on the passenger side. D1 did not complain of injury. V2 was not towed.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON MCNEELY ST WHEN SHE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION AT UNION VALLEY RD. THERE IS A HILL JUST PRIOR TO THE INTERSECTION. THE DRIVER STATED THAT WHILE APPLYING HER BRAKES, SHE BEGAN TO LOSE TRACTION. MCNEELY ST IS A T-INTERSECTION WITH N UNION VALLEY. AFTER UNIT 1 WAS UNABLE TO STOP, UNIT 1 LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK 2 GATES AND A FENCE POST. ALSO STRUCK WAS A BURIED FIBER OPTIC CABLE MARKER. THE VEHICLE WAS ABLE TO DRIVE OUT OF THE FIELD AND DID NOT NEED TOWED. THE PROPERTY OWNER IS MR. COURTLAND STIMSON WHO RESIDES AT 5920 N UNION VALLEY RD. HE WAS MADE AWARE OF THE DAMAGES AND GIVEN THE CRASH REPORT NUMBER.

D1 was not present for the report, I called D1 and got her information. The accident happened on 10/21/2019 at approximately 2030 hours. D2 came to station to report the accident without D1 present. D2 stated that she attempted to report the accident last night when it happened but was told she had to go to station to make the report by central dispatch. D2 stated that she was on the 45 Bypass facing West waiting to turn left on to Dunn Street when she was rear ended. D2 stated that she had been sitting there a while when she was rear ended. D2 stated that she pulled in to the parking lot of the church on the corner of Dunn Street and the 45 Bypass. D2 stated that D1 eventually stopped and gave her all of the information she needed to make a report. I called D1 and asked her if she was able to come to station to let me see her vehicle since D2 wanted to make a report. D1 stated that there was no damage to her vehicle and that she gave D2 all of her information. I asked D1 what had happened and D1 stated that she thought her foot was on the brake when she realized it wasn't she rear ended D2. I looked at V2 and there were cracks all along the bumper. D1 stated that there was absolutely no damage to V1.

V1 was NB on S College Mall road in the right lane and was approaching the traffic light at Eastland Plaza. V2 was in the College Mall and was stopped at traffic light at College Mall road. V2 got a green light and V1 failed to stop at the red light. V1 hit V2 in the driver side front with the passenger side front of her vehicle causing damage to both vehicles.D1 stated that she just didn't see the red light and she drove into V2. D2 stated he was stopped and then got a green light to turn left onto College Mall road. He stated as he pulled into the intersection, he was struck by V1.W1 was behind V1 and she stated that she saw the light turn red and she backed off from V1 because she saw that she was not going to stop. She said V1 ran the red light and struck V2.

V1 was WB on South drive and was approaching a stop sign. V2 was NB on South drive and was pulling on the west side of Bloomington South high school. V1 disregarded the stop sign and struck V2 in the passenger side rear of the bus with the front passenger side bumper of his vehicle. V1 then left the area.D1 later stated that he did stop at the stop sign but then started forward not realizing that he bus in front of him had not cleared from being in front of him. He then told me he wasn't 100% sure he had hit the bus so he left. He also told me that his drivers license was suspended. D2 stated he was driving toward the school and he saw V1 coming toward him. He stated he felt V1 hit him and he thinks that there was no way V1 could have stopped at the stop sign.

P2 was crossing 10th Street, in front of 1759 E 10th Street, from the south side of the street to the north side of the street. V1 was traveling eastbound on 10th Street in front of 1759 E 10th Street. W1 was traveling westbound on 10th Street in front of 1759 E 10th Street. Prior to the accident, the road surface was wet as it had been raining heavily. P2 stated she was waiting to cross 10th Street from the south side of the street to the north side of the street in front of 1759 E 10th Street. P2 stated she looked west and then looked east and crossed the road. P2 stated she did not look west again before crossing. P2 crossed the street in a non-crosswalk area where no traffic control devices were present. P2 stated that as she crossed the roadway she was struck by V1. P2 stated she fell to the ground and stayed there until she was transported by ambulance. P2 had injuries to her left elbow, arm and left side of her face.D1 stated he was traveling eastbound on 10th Street in front of 1759 E 10th Street when P2 stepped out in front of his vehicle. D1 stated he applied his brakes but was unable to avoid colliding with P2. D1 stated that the road was wet and that if it had not been he would have been able to completely stop. D1 stated P2 struck the front of his vehicle. D1 stated P2 fell to the ground. V1 had minor damage to the front of the vehicle. W1 stated he was traveling westbound on 10th Street in front of 1759 E 10th Street when he observed P2 walk into traffic and get struck by V1. W1 stated P2 was looking down as she crossed the street. W1 stated he did not see if P2 looked before crossing. W1 stated that V1 had applied its brakes and was slowing down in order to avoid colliding with P2. W1 stated V1 came to a complete stop as V1 collided with P2.Photographs of the vehicle and injuries are attached to the case.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver one who was heading north on Louden road stopped at the stop sign at the intersection of Ratliff rd and did not see driver 2 approaching from the south and pulled out and in front of here causing significant damage to both vehicles after the collision.
V1 was traveling westbound on W State Road 48 at speeds too fast for the weather conditions. V1 ran off the north side of the roadway causing disabling damage to the front of V1.
MS MAYES ADVISED SOMEONE HIT V1 SOMETIME BETWEEN 8:00 AM AND 12:00 PM WHILE IT WAS PARKED FACING SOUTH ALONG 500 S FESS AVE.PRIMARY CAUSE LISTED AS OTHER/DRIVER 1 BECAUSE D1 LEFT THE SCENE.

D1 of V1 was traveling east on W. 2nd St where D1 stated that his steering wheel locked up and he began to drive towards a pole that holds the traffic control devices. D1 stated that he attempted to steer out of the way but was unable to. D1 stated that he hit the pole to the traffic control devices and that is when his vehicle went inverted. The pole to the traffic control device was not damaged. It should be noted that D1 stated that he has insurance through Progressive however he was unsure of the policy number. I informed D1 that he needed to call Progressive and have them send his insurance information to the BMV and asked D1 to email me the policy number for his insurance. D1 had a minor abrasion to his left wrist but declined medical treatment.

Interstate 69 is a multiple lane interstate that runs primary north and south. In this particular area the Interstate is divided by a guardrail and trees. Vehicle 1 (silver 2018 Hyundai) was traveling north on Interstate 69 at approximately the 130 mile marker, in the right lane. Vehicle 1 collided with a deer, causing extensive damage to the front of Vehicle 1. Driver 1 (Peter Scheckebier) stated he was traveling north on Interstate 69 and noticed a deer on the right side of the roadway, that was entering the travel portion of the Interstate. Driver 1 stated he thought he was going to avoid collision with the deer but was unsuccessful, striking the deer with the front of his car.Primary cause of this crash was deer in the roadway.

V2 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVE. APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF 2ND ST. V2 SLOWED FOR TRAFFIC AT THE INTERSECTION AS THE STOP LIGHT WAS CHANGING TO REDUPON COMING TO A STOP, V2 WAS STRUCK IN THE REAR BY V1V2 RECEIVED SLIGHT DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF THE VEHICLED1 THEN FLED THE SCENE AFTER THE ACCIDENT FAILING TO PROVIDE ANY INFORMATION AND CONTINUED WEST ON 2ND ST. D1 AND V1 WERE LATER LOCATED, WHERE D1 WAS ARRESTED ON MULTIPLE CHARGES

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.V2 was on west 10th Street attempting to make a northbound turn onto the SR46 bypass.V1 was behind V2 also attempting to make a northbound turn onto the SR46 bypass.D1 stated that he was behind V2 and attempting to turn right (northbound) onto SR46. The traffic light was red and V1 and V2 had to yield to northbound traffic. D1 stated he though V2 had proceeded north and he looked to his left to see if he was free to turn as well. D1 stated he saw an opening and pressed his accelerator. He then ran into the back of V1 as V1 did not actually proceed north onto SR46.D2 stated she was waiting for an opening to make her northbound turn onto SR46. While waiting for an opening, V1 rear-ended her.D2 stated she had minor complaint of pain in her neck and back. She declined medical attention. V1 had moderate damage to the front of the vehicle which required a tow. Blands towing would later arrive and tow the vehicle due to disabling damage.

V1 and V2 collided in the middle of the intersection located at W. SR 46 and N. Curry Pike. D1 stated she was attempting to turn South on N. Curry Pike when V2 struck the rear end of her vehicle. She stated that she was in the turn lane, however I informed her that there was only one turn lane from W. SR 46 to turn S. On N. Curry Pike. D2 stated he was turning left onto N. Curry Pike from W. SR 46 and discovered he was pushing a small vehicle, V1, in the intersection. W1 who was an off-duty law enforcement officer with the Monroe County Sheriff's Office got out of his personal vehicle to direct traffic. I saw this as I was traveling through the area and thought the semi had broken down or was impeding traffic, but was able to continue on. Deputy Ruiz made contact with me a short time later and informed me that the Semi was involved in an accident. Deputy Ruiz informed me after I conducted my investigation what had happened. Deputy Ruiz informed me that V1 was in the West bound lane to continue West on W. SR 46, and V2 was in the turn lane, but when the light turned green V1 turned in front of V2 instead of continuing West bound as it should have given the lane it was positioned in. W2 also informed me that he was the third vehicle behind V2 at the intersection. W2 advised that he did not see where V1 came from, but advised that V2 was turning properly to turn S. On N. Curry Pike, but ultimately V2 struck V1.

V1 WAS PARKED AT 514 W 2ND ST.V2 WAS PULLING THROUGH THE LOT.AN UNKNOWN WITNESS TOLD OWNER OF V2 THAT A DILIVERY TRUCK FROM OFFICE THREE SIXTY HIT HER CAR AND LEFT. UPON CALLING THAT COMPANY I LATER MET WITH D2 WHO SAID HE DROVE THROUGH THE LOT BUT DID NOT KNOW HE HIT ANYTHING.THERE WAS WHITE TRANSFER PAINT ON THE STEP/GUARD ON THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR OF V1 CONSISTENT WITH THE DAMAGE ON V2. THAT DAMAGE MATCHES THE DIRECTION D1 SAID HE WENT THROUGH THE LOT.

The female in possession of V2 advised she had parked her vehicle in a parking spot facing south. When she returned to her vehicle, damage was found on the rear driver side. V1 had fled the scene without leaving any contact information. Red paint transfer was located on V2. A local investigation is being conducted. Please referance case#B19-44670 for more information on this.

V1 was traveling southbound on Fee Lane prior to the accident. V2 was traveling southbound on Fee Lane prior to the accident.V2, who was south of V1, slowed to make a turn eastbound onto Jordan Avenue. V1, who was following too closely to V2, struck the rear bumper of V2. V1 sustained damage to the front bumper of the vehicle. V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper of the vehicle.D1 stated that he was following too closely to V2. D1 also stated that he looked down briefly, and when he looked up, V2 was stopped waiting to make a turn. D2 stated that she was stopped to make a turn eastbound onto Jordan Avenue from Fee Lane when V1 struck her rear bumper.D2 complained of head pain at the end of the accident investigation, however, she refused medical care on scene.

V1 was parked in a parking space, perpendicular to University Avenue approximately 198 feet east of S Ballantine Road. V1 was backed into the spot, with the front of the car facing southwest. V2 was driving northwest on University Avenue. D1 said he was slowly pulling out of the parking space, and trying to look for oncoming traffic. However, another SUV was parked directly next to V1, so he could not see around it and his view of V2 was obstructed. D1 said he heard the engine of V2 revving as it went by, and believed it was traveling too fast for the area. D1 said as he pulled forward, V2 passed by and the passenger side of V2 made contact with the front of V1.D2 said he was driving northwest at approximately 15mph when V1 suddenly pulled forward into V2. D2 was unable to avoid the collision and came to a stop after completely passing V1. D2 said the initial contact was made between V1's front bumper and V2's front passenger side quarter panel.V1 sustained damage across the entire front bumper, consisting of long scratches and a few cracks. V2 sustained damage across the entire passenger side from front bumper to rear bumper. The damage on V2 was dents and long scratches.

D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED AT LIGHT WHEN IT CHANGED THE CARS IN FRONT OF HER STARTED TO MOVE AS SHE WAS GETTING READY TO MOVE V1 STRUCK THE REAR RIGHT OF V2. D1 STATED HE WAS CHANGING LANES WHEN THE LIGHT CHANGED AND STRUCK THE REAR OF V2 NOT REALIZING V2 HAD NOT STARTED MOVING. BOTH VEHICLES MOVED TO PARKING LOT PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.

V1 was traveling westbound through the Von Lee parking lot. D1 informed me that she attempted to make a left hand turn into an open parking spot. She stated that she turned too wide while attempting to park and struck the rear driver side bumper of V2 with the front right side of V1's bumper. V2 was unoccupied and parked in a marked spot during the time of the collison. D1 was unable to provide an insurance policy number during the investigation. The owner of V2 could not be located but I left a note on it.On 10/24/2019 I spoke to both parties involved in the accident and received their respective insurance information.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS AT THE STOP SIGN AT N. TUNNEL RD AND E. STATE ROAD 45. D1 STARTED TO MAKE A RIGHT TURN TO HEAD WEST ON E. STATE ROAD 45 AND STATED HE DID NOT SEE ANOTHER VEHICLE. D1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF V2 WHICH CAUSED V2 TO HIT V1 IN THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE.D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON E. STATE ROAD 45 COMING UP TO N. TUNNEL RD. V1 PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF V2 CAUSEING V2 TO HIT V1 IN THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE. D1 ADVISED HE DID NOT SEE V2 WHEN PULLING OUT INTO THE ROADWAY.

D1 ADVISED SHE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. STATE ROAD 46 WHEN SHE WAS COMING UP TO THE CONSTRUCTION. V3 IN CAME TO A STOP IN FRONT OF HER AND SHE APPLIED HER BRAKES AND STOPPED. V2 THEN REAR ENDED V1 CAUSING V1 TO BE PUSHED INTO V3. V2 AND V3 THEN CONTINUED ON WESTBOUND ON W. STATE ROAD 46. AN ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO TRY AND LOCATE THE VEHICLES HOWEVER THEY COULD NOT BE LOCATED. V1 MOVED OFF THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.LATER IN THE EVENING A 3RD SHIFT UNIT WAS DISPATCHED TO AN ABANDON VEHICLE. DISPATCHED ADVISED IT WAS A WHITE PASSENGER CAR WITH HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE. THE VEHICLE IN QUESTION MATCHED THE VEHICLE INVOLVED IN MY LSA. I ADVISED THE DEPUTY ON SCENE IF HE COULD SEND A PICTURE TO ME OF THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE AS I HAD A PIECE BELONGING TO THE SUSPECT VEHICLE. ONCE I RECEIVED THE PICTURE THE PICTURE I HAD MATCHED THE PICTURE. I FOLLOWED UP WITH THE TOW YARD AND MATCHED THE PIECE OF BUMPER I OBTAINED FROM THE SCENE AND IT WAS A MATCH TO THE VEHICLE. I TRIED CONTACTING THE REGISTERED OWNER SEVERAL TIMES HOWEVER WAS UNSUCCESSFUL. PICTURES OF THE DAMAGE AND PIECE FROM THE SCENE WERE TAKEN AND ADDED INTO THE CASE. I ALSO CALLED D1 AND ASKED HER TO LOOK UP A PICTURE OF A WHITE CHRYSLER 300 AND SHE ADVISED THAT WAS THE VEHICLE THAT REAR ENDED HER.

V1 was traveling southbound on S. Curry Pike behind V2 approaching the traffic control signal at W State Road 45. V2 was slowing down to stop for the red light at the intersection. D1 stated that he was distracted by the two small children he had in the car and rear ended V1. The crash caused minor damage to both vehicles.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING WEST BOUND ON EAST RHORER ROAD. V2 WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUND ON EAST RHORER ROAD. V1 CROSSED THE CENTER LINE AND DROVE INTO EAST BOUND TRAFFIC. THE FRONT OF V1 CRASHED INTO THE FRONT OF V2. D1 FLED THE SCENE OF THE CRASH PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL. D1 HAS NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED.

V2 was stopped in traffic on 17th street. V1 was traveling east on 17th street approaching V2 and the stopped traffic. D1 stated she looked down for a moment and didn't realize traffic in front of her had stopped. D1 stated she applied her brakes, but was unable to stop in time to avoid a collision. V1 rear ended V2.D2 stated he was stopped in traffic when all of a sudden V1 rear ended him. Neither D1 or D2 requested medical attention. Damage to V1 consisted of front bumper and hood damage. The front grill was also pushed up into the engine compartment. Damage to V2 was light damage to the rear bumper.Both vehicles pulled into the IUPD parking lot after the crash and the investigation took place in the IUPD parking lot.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling north on N Louden Rd. and V2 was traveling west on W. Ratliff Rd. Northbound and southbound traffic on N Louden Rd have stop signs and are to yield to east and westbound traffic on W. Ratliff Rd. D1 stated that she stopped at the stop sign and entered the intersection and was struck by V2 which came "flying" over the hillcrest westbound on Ratliff Rd. D2 stated that she did not see V1 stop at the stop sign prior to entering the intersection. D1 was unable to provide proof of insurance and also has two prior convictions for having no insurance accidents.

Driver 1 stated he was behind vehicle 2 traveling east on the SR 45/46 Bypass approaching Kinser Pk in the right straight lane. Driver 1 stated an ambulance with lights and siren on was entering the intersection and vehicle 2 stopped quickly in front of him. Driver 1 stated he wasn't able to stop in time and collided with the rear of vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated he had stopped for the ambulance and was hit from behind by vehicle 1.

V1 WAS SOUTHBOUN ON SR 46 AT THE INTERSECTION OF COLLEGE MALL RD/3RD STREET.V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID AS HE SLOWED BEHIND V2 HE LOOKED FOR ONCOMING TRAFFIC TO HIS LEFT. HE SAID AS HE LOOKED LEFT HE THOUGHT V2 WAS GOING TO CONTINUE ONTO E 3RD STREET SO HE WENT FORWARD ALSO, STRIKING V2.D2 SAID AS HE SAT AT THE INTERSECTION BEFORE TURNING RIGHT ONTO E 3RD STREET V1 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.

DRIVER 2 STATED SHE WAS HEADING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVENUE JUST NORTH OF KIRKWOOD AVENUE WHEN SHE WAS REAR ENDED BY VEHICLE 1. BOTH DRIVER 1 AND THE PASSENGER OF VEHICLE 1 EXITED AND GAVE DRIVER 2 INFORMATION, HOWEVER THIS INFORMATION WAS INNACCURATE AND THE PLATE ON THE VEHICLE IS BELIEVED TO BE FALSE AND FICTITIOUS. DRIVER 2 DID NOT PROVIDE FINANCIAL RESPONSBILITY AND HAD IMPROPERLY DISPLAYED REGISTRATION AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.

V1 was traveling south bound on I-69 at the 106.5 marker, when a deer entered the roadway from the west side of the road. D1 stated he swerved and missed the deer causing him to go off the roadway into the median on the east side of the road.D1 stated he then over corrected the vehicle causing V1 to hit the guard rail on the west side of the road. V1 then rolled and came to rest in the middle of both lanes on I-69.

D2 WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT AT SALE ST AND MAIN ST WHEN HE WAS REAR ENDED BY V1. D1 STATED THAT HE LOOKED UP AND KNEW HE WAS GOING TO REAR END THE SEPTIC TANK TRUCK IN FRONT OF HIM SO HE SLAMMED ON THE BRAKES AND RAN UP ON THE CURB HITTING THE TRUCK IN THE RIGHT REAR. D1 WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE PROOF OF INSURANCE ON THAT SPECIFIC TRUCK, HE STATED HE HAD JUST BOUGHT IT TWO WEEKS PRIOR. THE TRUCK WAS ALSO NOT PLATED, HE HAD A PLATE ON IT FROM ANOTHER VEHICLE. D1 WAS GIVEN TWO CITATONS AND HIS VEHICLE WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE DUE TO NOT BEING ABLE TO DRIVE IT ANYMORE ALONG WITH A POLICE HOLD PLACED ON IT.

Vehicle 1 was attempting to park and V2 was parked stationary.D1 said she was going to park in a parking space in the Jordan Avenue Parking Garage in the lower level in V1. D1 said she was turning left to park in a parking space in V1. D1 said when she turned she struck V2 on the front passenger lower bumper area with the front passenger side lower bumper area of V1. V2 was parked stationary in a proper parking space backed in, and was unattended at the time of the accident. Both V1 and V2 had minor damage. D1 said she took pictures of the vehicle. All information was left on V2 front windshield for when the driver returns.

V1/D1 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46 BYPASS, BEHIND V2 IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. AS I CAME THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION ZONE, I GLANCED AT MY RIGHT SIDE MIRROR TO MERGE TO THE RIGHT LANE, ALL OF THE SUDDEN I HEARD MY WIFE LINDA YELL, ALL OF THE SUDDEN V2 WAS STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY".V2/D2 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46 IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. AS I APPROACHED MONROE STREET, ALL OF THE SUDDEN THE VEHICLES IN FRONT OF ME CAME TO A SUDDEN STOP. I SLAMMED ON MY BRAKES. AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE WAS STOPPED 2 CARS INFRONT OF ME, IN THE LEFT LANE ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A RIGHT HAND TURN ON TO N. MONROE ST. THAT UNKNOWN VEHICLE TURNED SOUTH ON MONROE ST, AND I WAS REAR ENDED BY V2." W1 STATED "I WAS BEHIND V1, WHEN ALL OF THE SUDDEN AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE INFRONT OF V2 CAME A TO A STOP, AND WAS TRYING TO MAKE A RIGHT HAND TURN FROM THE LEFT LANE. V2 SUDDENLY SLAMMED ON THEIR BRAKES AND V1 REAR ENDED V2. THE UNKNOWN VEHICLE LEFT THE SCENE ON N. MONROE ST."W2 STATED "I WAS BEHIND W1, ALL OF THE SUDDEN V2 SLAMMED ON THEIR BRAKES DUE TO TRAFFIC SUDDENLY STOPPING IN THE ROADWAY. V1 REAR ENDED V2."INJURIED V1 LINDA TINCHER STATED "I WAS IN THE PASSENGER SIDE FRONT SEAT OF OUR CAR. I WAS LOOKING DOWN AT MY PHONE, WHEN I BACK UP, I NOTICE TRAFFIC WAS SLAMMING ON THEIR BRAKES INFRONT OF US. I YELLED AT MY HUSBAND BUT IT WAS TOO LATE, WE COLLIDED WITH V2".

D1 stated he was traveling east on Smithville Road. D2 was in front of D1 at the intersection with SR 37 S. D2 had pulled forward and D1 thought that D2 had entered traffic. D1 then proceeded forward and did not realize that D2 had actually stopped. D1 rear ended D2. D2 stated he was traveling east on Smithville Road. D2 approached the intersection with SR 37 S. D2 stated he began to enter the intersection however observed more traffic therefore he stropped. D1 was then rear ended by D2.

D1 stated that he was traveling south on S Rogers Street from the intersection of S Rogers Street and S Rockport Road. D1 stated that he was traveling southbound approximately 20-25mph, about 100 feet north of W Hays Court, when a deer walked eastbound out into the roadway from the west. D1 stated that he did not notice the deer until the front passenger side of V1 had already collided with it. D1 stated that after the collision the deer limped back out of the roadway to the west. D1 stated that he was not injured and did not require any medical attention. V1 sustained damage to the front passenger side including the headlight. The vehicle did not need to be towed and was able to be driven from the scene. Photographs of the scene and damage were taken and submitted.

D1, D2, and D3 were all headed E/B on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S Cory Ln. D2 and D3 then stopped in traffic at the intersection. D1 looked down at her cell phone to check her GPS and did not see the stopped traffic in front of her. V1 then struck V2 in the rear, causing V2 to strike V3 in the rear. D1 stated that she was headed E/B on W 3rd St, approaching the intersection of S Cory Ln. D1 stated that as she approached the intersection she looked down at her cell phone to check her GPS. D1 stated that she did not realize that traffic had stopped in front of her. V1 then struck V2 in the rear, which then caused V2 to strike V3 in the rear. D2 and D3 stated that they were headed E/B on W 3rd St, apporaching the intersection of S Cory Ln. D2 and D3 stated that they were stopped in traffic and waiting for the green traffic signal. D2 stated that he looked in his rear view mirror and saw that V1 was going to strike V2, at which point it did. The collision then caused V2 to strike V3 in the rear.

It was reported to police on 10/26/2019 that V2 was parked on S Fess Avenue, facing southbound, on the west side of the road just north of E University Street. The complainant stated that V2 was parked on the evening of 10/24/2019 and the damage was located on the afternoon of 10/25/2019. The complainant received a note from W1 on V2, stating that W1 witnessed the incident. At the time of this report I have been unable to contact W1. Complainant was told by W1 that a truck pulling a trailer hit V2 and left the scene. V2 has significant damage and could not be driven from the scene. The owner of V2 was not present as it was in possession of her brother, Jayce Boatwright. This incident is still being investigated as W1 still needs to be interviewed.

V1 and V2 were traveling westbound on East 10th Street at 30mph in congested traffic. D2 stated that she came to a stop in traffic when she was struck in the rear bumper by V1. D1 advised me that she was looking at her phone for directions to the Bloomington Hospital. She stated that when she looked up to the roadway from her phone V2 had come to a complete stop. D1 stated that she did not have enough time to come to a complete stop before striking the rear of V2. D1 said that she attempted to stop however, due to wet roadway conditions her vehicle slid before impacting V2.

THE WITNESS STATED THAT D1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON GARRISON CHAPEL AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED.HE STATED THAT THE DRIVER LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND LEFT THE ROADWAY GOING INTO THE WOODS. THE WITNESS ESTIMATED THE VEHICLE TO BE TRAVELING AT A SPEED OF AROUND 70MPH. UPON MY ARRIVAL ON SCENE THE VEHICLE WAS ON ITS SIDE AND APPEARED TO HAVE ROLLED.D1 WAS TRAPPED INSIDE OF THE VEHICLE. MY INVESTIGATION OF THE SCENE SHOWED THAT D1 LEFT THE ROADWAY ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD HITTING A SMALL TREE AT 3110 S. GARRISON CHAPEL RD. THE VEHICLE THEN RETURNED TO THE ROADWAY THEN RAN OFF THE ROAD ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY STRIKING SEVERAL TREES AT 3139 S. GARRISON CHAPEL RD AND APPEARED TO HAVE ROLLED FINALLY COMING TO A STOP ON ITS SIDE. D1 DID NOT KNOW WHERE HE WAS AND DID NOT KNOW HE HAD CRASHED HIS VEHICLE. D1 WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 east bound from SR 37 onto Smithville Road, D2 north bound on SR 37 @ Smithville Road. D1 failed to yield right of way to D2 resutling in a right angle collision. D1 suffered complaint of pain to the head and was wearing seatbelt with air bag deployment. D2 suffered a contusion and abrasion to left eye as well as complaint of pain. D2 was wearing seatbelt and air bag deployment.

At approximately 1055 hours on 10/24/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 at the entrance to 1414 N Jordan. V2 began to pull out of 1414 N Jordan, turning south, when V1 collided with them.D1 advised that he had been driving north on Jordan when V2 pulled out in front of them. He stated that he was driving no more than 5 miles an hour above the speed limit, but did not have time to brake and prevent the collision. There was damage to the driver side front tire well and surrounding areas.D2 advised that she had been attempting to pull out, heading south, on Jordan when V1 struck her vehicle. She stated that initially D1 claimed responsibility and was very hesitant about calling the police. D2 stated that she was inching forward, checked both directions and saw no cars, and began to pull out. She stated that V1 was approaching so quickly that she had no time to get out of the way. There was significant damage to the driver side rear tire well and surrounding areas, rendering the vehicle inoperable. D2 had the vehicle moved via a private tow.Neither party complained of injury or requested medical aid.On 10/28/2019 D1 met with me in the IUPD lobby to advise that he had remembered that D2 was taking a phone call while pulling out of the drive.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.D1 stated that he was in the northmost lane of travel on 3rd Street and had switched to the southmost lane of travel in order to make a left, southbound turn onto Swain Avenue. As he was making his turn, D1 alleges V2 struck his bumper on the rear, driver-side corner. D1 stated he was going approximately 10 mph prior to the collision. D1 was adamant he did not make an unsafe lane change and that D2 actually made the unsafe lane change. D1 also stated that he believes D2 was also trying to turn south onto Swain Avenue and did so at a speed of nearly 30 mph.D2 stated he was traveling westbound on 3rd Street in the southmost lane. D2 stated that he was attempting to turn southbound onto Swain Avenue. D2 stated that V1 was in the northmost lane and made a sudden lane change into his path of travel. D2 was unable to stop in time and collided with V1 with his front, right part of his vehicle. D2 stated he was not sure how fast he was going, but estimated his speed around 15 or 20 mph prior to the collision.EMS was not requested or needed during my investigation. Both vehicles were able to be driven from scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was in the parking lot of the Circle K gas station at the intersection of N Rogers and W Kirkwood. D1 stated that as she pulled out of the parking lot of the gas station to head west on Kirkwood, she did not look to see if any vehicles were coming from the east. D1 stated that she pulled out onto Kirkwood, and hit V2, who was coming from the east and traveling west on Kirkwood. The front of V1 collided with the rear driver's side fender area of V2.D2 stated that he was driving west on Kirkwood, when V1 suddenly pulled out of the parking lot of the gas station and collided with his vehicle.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.-V3 was traveling westbound on 3rd street and had come to a stop attempting to make a left, southbound turn onto Jordan Avenue. V3 had to yield to pedestrians that had the right-of-way.-V2 was traveling behind V3 and had stopped behind V3-V1 was traveling behind V2 and did not realize V2 had stopped.D3 stated the traffic signal had just turned green and they wanted to make a left, southbound turn onto Jordan Avenue. However, D3 was unable to make his turn because a pedestrian had right-of-way and was crossing the street. D3 was a complete stop. He was then hit by V2 into the rear of his vehicle. D2 stated he had come to a stop behind V3. While stopped behind V3, he was rear-ended by V1 which propelled him into the back of V3.D1 stated she was stopped behind V2 at the red light and the light turned green. The vehicles began to proceed forward. She stated she thought all vehicles proceeded westbound and she hit the accelerator. When she realized the vehicles in front of her only moved a few feet it was too late to stop. She then collided into the back of V2 which caused V2 to collide into V3.There were no reported injuries during the time of investigation. None of the vehicles needed a tow.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1/D1 STATED "I WAS LEAVING JO ANNE FABRIC STORE, I STARTED TO PULL OUT ONTO S. LIBERTY DR TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN, I DID NOT KNOW I HIT THAT BUS, ONCE THE BUS TURNED I PROCEEDED TO MAKE A RIGHT HAND TURN AND HEAD HOME. IF I WOULDVE KNOWN I HAD HIT THE BUS, I WOULD HAVE STAYED."V2/D2 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND IN THE 500 BLK OF S. LIBERTY DRIVE. AS I WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN INTO JO ANNE FABRIC COMPLEX, I WAS STRUCK ALONG THE DRIVER SIDE PANEL OF THE BUS BY V1 WHICH WAS TRYING TO MAKE A LEFT HAND TURN, THE ELDERLY LADY THEN MADE A RIGHT HAND TURN AND WENT NORTH ON LIBERTY DRIVE AND WEST ON 3RD ST. PASSERBY WAS ABLE TO OBTAIN THE PLATE INFORMATION. STATE REPORT ONLY, NO LSA.

V2 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON STATE RD 46 FROM N. KINSER PIKE WHEN APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF STATE RD 46 AND N WALNUT ST. V2 CAME TO A STOP, AND V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR.V1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON STATE RD 46 FROM N. KINSER PIKE AND STRUCK V2 IN THE REAR.BOTH VEHICLES SUTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Driver of vehicle 1 stated she was traveling north on N. Matthews Rd when she came to a curve and crossed left of center side swiping Vehicle 2. The driver of vehicle 2 stated she was traveling south on N Matthews when vehicle 1 struck the side of her vehicle. Vehicle 1 had damage to the driver side front and had to be towed from the scene. Vehicle 2 had damage all along the driver side of the vehicle from the drivers door to the rear bumper. Vehicle 2 was driveable but the driver of vehicle 2 complained of severe neck pain and was transported to IU Health Bloomington for evaluation.Witness Stephanie Powell stated she saw vehicle 1 pass her on a double yellow at N Matthews just north of Maple Grove traveling at a high rate of speed. The witness did not see the accident but came upon it.

V1 was traveling S/B on Patterson DR. V2 and V3 were stopped at the traffic control signal facing E/B at the intersection of 2nd St & Patterson Dr. V1 struck V2 and V3 causing damage to all three vehicles. D1 advised that she was driving W/B on 2nd ST stopped at the intersection mentioned above. D2 advised that when the traffic control signal turned green she proceeded through the intersection. D1 advised that she blacked out and could not recall what happened after that. D1 advised that she believed she had a stroke or seizure while driving. V1 traveling into W/B traffic colliding with V2 and V3 while stopped E/B on 2nd ST.D1 advised that she had a complaint of pain to her left knee and was transported to IU Health Bloomington for further treatment. D2 advised that he was driving E/B on 2nd ST. He advised that while stopped at the above mentioned intersection he was struck by V1. D2 advised that he was not injured. D3 advised he was driving E/B on 2nd St. He advised that while stopped at the above mentioned intersection he observed V1 collide with V2 and then struck V3. D3 advised that he was not injured.Due to the fact that V1 had a health related issue that caused her to blackout and enter E/B traffic on 2nd ST, V1 struck V2 and then struck and V3.

V1 AND V2 WERE ATTEMPTING TO LEAVE THE HIGH SCHOOL PARKING LOT AND WERE LINED UP. D1 STATED SHE PRESSED ON THE GAS TOO HARD AS THEY STARTED TO MOVE AND REAR ENDED D2.VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL

D1 stated she was traveling on S. Cory Ln. D1 stated a school bus was traveling north with the blinking lights on indicating it was soon to stop. D1 stated she was watching the bus for the stop arm to extend when she collided with the rear of V2 causing damage to both vehicles.D2 stated he was traveling south on S. Cory Ln. Approaching W. Bloomfield Rd. D2 stated he was stopped at the intersection waiting for traffic to clear when V1 collided with the rear of his car causing damage to both vehicles. D2 refused EMS, but stated his neck did feel "stiff" following the accident.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE NORTH BOUND FROM BLOOMFIELD RD, ONTO I-69 NORTH BOUND. FROM THE INTERSECTION, V1 WAS IN THE LEFT LANE, AND V2 WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE. WITNESS WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THEM.ON THE RAMP, THE LEFT LANE ENDS AND MERGES WITH THE RIGHT LANE, THEN ONTO I-69. D1 SAID HE WAS TRYING TO MERGE INTO THE RIGHT LANE BY PASSING V2, WHO WOULD NOT LET HIM IN.D2 SAID SHE WAS GOING STRAIGHT WHEN V1 CAME INTO THE RIGHT LANE, STRIKING HER ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE, AND THEN SENT HER INTO THE GUARDRAIL ON THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.D1 SAID HE THOUGHT THE WITNESS WAS BRAKE CHECKING HIM AS HE TRIED TO MERGE RIGHT, BUT WITNESS SAID HE WAS MERGING HIMSELF BEHIND ANOTHER VEHICLE.BOTH V1 AND V2 REACHED THE END OF THE LANES AND TRIED TO ENTER THE SINGLE LANE.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

V1 was traveling east on the 45/46 Bypass, in the northmost lane, near the IU Foundation and was attempting to merge lanes. V2 was traveling east on the 45/46 Bypass, in the southmost lane, near the IU Foundation going straight. V1 did not see V2 in her blindspot and attempted the lane change. V1 then sideswiped V2. There was paint damage to the passenger side of V1 and paint damage to the driver side of V2. D1 stated that she was attempting to change lanes and could not see V2 in her mirror. D1 stated she attempted the lane change and hit V2. D2 stated that same thing as D1. There were no injuries on scene and no vehicles had to be towed from the scene.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON W STATE ROAD 46, RAN OFF THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY AND CRASHED IN THE YARD OF 8807 W STATE ROAD 46. THE 1ST OFFICER ON SCENE, EV9, NOTIFIED CENTRAL DISPATCH OF POSSIBLE ENTRAPMENT. V1 HAD TOP END DAMAGE INDICATING IT MAY HAVE FLIPPED OVER OR ROLLED. THERE WAS A TREE IN THE YARD THAT HAD SCRAPE MARKS ON ITS TRUNK APPROX. 10-15 FEET OFF THE GROUND, ADDITONALLY A LARGE LIMB WAS TORN FROM THE TREE. THIS DAMAGE INDICATED THAT V1 WAS AIRBORNE. A WITNESS WAS TRAVELING WB ON W STATE ROAD 46 STATED THAT V1 WAS AIRBORNE.D1 WAS TRANSPORTED TO IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON FOR TRAUMA INJURIES TO THE HEAD AND WAS SUSPECTED OF OWI. A BLOOD DRAW WAS COMPLETED ON D1 AND RESULTS ARE PENDING.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 is an orange Kubota with a serial number of 30591 and a product Identification number of A5KC1HDAABG030591 and the type is RTV1100.D1 stated that he was driving down the alley behind Kappa Kappa Gamma (1018 E 3rd St.) approaching Faculty Lane. D1 stated that at the intersection there was a Jeep on the corner and he was attempting to look through the windows of the Jeep to see if there were any vehicles coming. D1 stated that he did not see V2 and pulled out on to Faculty striking V2. D2 stated that she was driving down Faculty Lane when V1 came out of nowhere and struck the front passenger side bumper of V2. D2 made a comment about the Jeep being in the field of vision as well for V1.
D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON W. COUNTRY CLUB JUST EAST OF S. ROCKPORT RD WHEN A DEER RAN IN FRONT OF V1. V1 STRUCK THE DEER WITH THE FRONT BUMPER CAUSING DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING WB IN AN ALLEY AT N GRANT ST. V2 WAS SB ON GRANT FROM 6TH ST. V1 TURNED LEFT (S) IN FRONT OF V2 AND THE FRONT PASS SIDE OF V1 STRUCK FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V2. V1 THEN LEFT THE SCENE.D1 NOT LOCATED FOR A STATEMENT.D2 STATED SHE WAS SB ON GRANT FROM 6TH ST WHEN V1 TURNED LEFT IN FRONT OF HER AND THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V2 AND FRONT PASS SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED. D2 DID NOT HAVE A DRIVER DESCRIPTION AND ONLY KNEW THAT THE OTHER VEHICLE WAS A TAN SUV.

D1 stated they were in the outside left turn lane on E 3rd St, in order to turn southbound on S College Mall Rd, when they thought the stop light turned green, at which point V1 rear ended V2. D2 stated they were stopped in the outside left turn lane on E 3rd St, in order to turn southbound on S College Mall Rd. D2 was then rear ended by V1.

V2 WAS STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF SMITH PIKE AND W SR 46 WHEN V2 STRUCK V1 FROM THE REAR. D2 ADVISED SHE DIDN'T SEE THE VEHICLE STOPPED IN FRONT OF HER AND COULD NOT STOP IN TIME TO PREVENT STRIKING THE TRUCK.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was traveling south on I69 and took the exit ramp to Fullerton Pike. D1 approached the round about intersection, looked left and right and entered the round about. D1 collided with D2. D1 stated she did not see D2.D2 stated he was traveling west on Fullerton Pike. D2 stated it was his turn to enter the round about and he entered the round about. D2 was struck by D1. D2 stated he thought D1 did not see him.
