D1 ADVISED HE WAS DRIVING WEST ON E. CHAMBERS PIKE WHEN HE APPROACHED A CURVE AND TURNED TO WIDE. V1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A MAILBOX. VEHICLE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 2 stated he was south on Williamsburg Dr approaching 3rd St. Driver 1 stated he was exiting the parking lot of Arby's going east. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1 was pulling through the Arby's lot quickly and did not stop at Williamsburg Dr and ran into the side of vehicle 2 as vehicle 2 was passing. Driver 1 stated he was pulling out to cross Williamsburg Dr from the Arby's lot and vehicle 2 was traveling south on Williamsburg Dr driving quickly. Driver 1 stated he pulled out and collided with vehicle 2. Witness 1 was driving north passing vehicle 2 in the opposite direction. Witness 1 said he saw vehicle 1 pulling through the Arby's lot towards Williamsburg Dr and didn't think he was going to stop. Witness 1 stated vehicle 1 proceeded into the road from the parking lot and collided with vehicle 2. Witness 2 stated he was walking east along the north side of the Arby's lot approaching Williamsburg Dr. Witness 2 stated he observed vehicle 1 pull out of the Arby's lot and collide with vehicle 2 which was south on Williamsburg Dr. Neither witness indicated that vehicle 2 was driving to fast. Vehicle 2 had the right of way.

D1 stated he was parked facing east in the parking lot of 300 E. Melrose Ave. D1 stated he began backing out and turning his wheel clockwise. D1 stated he felt his vehicle make contact with an object and stopped. D1 stated he exited his vehicle and noticed a scrape to the front driver side bumper caused by contact with a retainer wall on the north side of his parking spot.

D3 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WITH D2 BEHIND HIM WAITING TO GO THROUGH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT STATE ROAD 46 W NEAR UNION VALLEY RD. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS REAR ENDED FROM BEHIND BY A LIGHT IN COLOR MAYBE WHITE TRUCK, THE TRUCK LEFT THE SCENE. DEPUTIES FROM THE MONROE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE WERE IN THE AREA WHEN THE CALL CAME OUT BUT FAILED TO LOCATE ANY VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION. VEHICLES WERE MOVED FROM THE SCENE PRIOR TO MY ARRIVIAL.

D1 STATED THEY WERE DRIVING V1 WEST BOUND ON 3RD STREET AT S ROOSEVELT STREET WHEN THEY LOOKED DOWN FOR A BRIEF SECOND, LOOKED UP, AND THE CAR IN FRONT OF THEM (V2) HAD STOPPED. D1 THEN APPLIED BRAKES BUT REAR ENDED V2.D2 STATED THEY WERE DRIVING V2 WEST BOUND ON 3RD STREET AT S ROOSEVELT STREET WHEN THEY STOPPED FOR STOPPED TRAFFIC. SUDDENLY THEY WERE REAR ENDED AT SLOW SPEED BY V1. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THERE IS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF V2 BUT LARGER DAMAGE TO THE HOOD, FRONT BUMPER, AND GRILLE AREA OF V1. V1 IS NOT DRIVEABLE AND WAS TOWED BY PRIVATE COMPANY AT REQUEST OF D1.
V1 and V2 were south bond on SR 37 @ Victor Pike, when V2 was stopped or slowed for traffic and V1 rear ended V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated they were stopped at the stop sign, in the left turn lane, at E John Hinkle Pl and N Pete Ellis Dr. D1 stated that he was waved through the intersection by another vehicle, thinking it was okay to proceed into traffic in order to go south on N Pete Ellis Dr. V1 then struck the front driver's side of V2.D2 stated they were traveling southbound on N Pete Ellis Dr, passing near the intersection with E John Hinkle Pl. D2 stated that they did not even see V1 coming at them, but only felt the collision of the front of V1 striking the front driver's side of V2.

D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING NB ON SMITH RD.D1 STATED THAT A DEER RAN IN FRONT OF THE VEHICLE.D1 STATED THAT SHE SWERVED TO AVOID THE DEER LEAVING THE ROADWAY AND STRIKING A UTILITY POLE. D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS NOT INJURED.D1 HELD A CHINESE DRIVERS LICENSE WITH DLN-110102199907063320

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was backing out of a parking space, southbound, in the parking lot at 500 W 7th Street. D1 stated that V1 has a backup camera that she utilized when backing, however D1 stated that she did not noticed V2 coming westbound through the parking lot. D1 stated that she then collided with V2. D1 stated that she believed V2 was traveling at a high speed. D2 stated that she was traveling westbound through the parking lot at 500 W 7th Street looking for a parking spot. D2 stated that she noticed V1 backing out of its parking spot as she passed, and she honked her horn. D2 stated that right after she honked her horn, V1 collided with V2. Neither D1 and D2 stated that they were injured, and both declined medical treatment. Neither V1 or V2 sustained disabling damage.

See Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: The investigation was done both at the scene of the crash and at D1's apartment at 500 S. Muller Pkwy, Bloomington, IN. D1 was driving eastbound on 10th Street. D2 was also driving eastbound on 10th Street. D1 left the scene after the crash.After locating D1 at his in town residence, I was able to speak to D1. D1 stated that he was driving east on 10th street past the intersection of 10th Street and Fee Lane. D1 stated that traffic began to slow down after the traffic light. D1 stated he then slammed his foot down on his brakes to slow down in time and heard a loud noise, but did not think he had hit V2. D1 stated that once traffic began to move, he then drove around V2 after seeing no damage and then left the area and continued to travel east on 10th street. D1 stated that V2 then pulled to the south side of 10th Street which is just north of Wells Library. D1 stated that the damage to his front bumper was already present and not new. Photos of the front bumper were taken and are attached to the case. D1 was cited for leaving the scene of an accident, a Class B Misdemeanor, pursuant to IC 9-26-1-1.1. D2 stated she was driving east on 10th street past the intersection of 10th Street and Fee Lane. D2 stated she was stopped in traffic due to the traffic in front of her not moving. D2 stated she was then rear ended by V1. D2 stated she pulled over close to the south side of 10th Street. D2 stated that D1 then left the scene and went south on Jordan Avenue. D2 stated that D1 never exited his vehicle and never gave her any contact information. The Witness stated that he was standing on the south most sidewalk of 10th Street near Fee Lane. The witness stated he saw V1 traveling east on 10th street and then hit V2 by rear ending V2. The witness stated V1 was a grey sedan and provided me with V1's license plate. The witness stated that V1 then left the scene by heading east bound on 10th Street. I observed no damage to V2's vehicle. Neither vehicle was towed. Pictures of both vehicles were taken and are attached to the case.

V-1 was traveling north on SR.446 when a small tree about 8" in diameter fell into V-1 lane of travel striking the front of V-1.

D1 STATED THAT THEY LOOKED BACK TO THE WEST AS TURNING, AT WHICH POINT THE FRONT OF V1 STRUCK THE DRIVERS SIDE OF V2. UNION VALLEY RD AND STARTED TO SLOW DOWN TO MAKE A LEFT TURN. D2 SLOWED DOWN AND TURNED HER TURN SIGNAL ON AND V1 REAR ENDED V2.

On Saturday, October 26, 2019 at 11:14, I responded to a crash on State Rd. 48/W. 3rd St. approximately 317 ft. E. at the intersection of Gates Drive. At the time of the crash, the weather was rain and the road surface was wet.Vehicle 1, a red Lexus, was traveling west bound on State Road 48 going straight. V#1 had just came off of the exit ramp from south bound I-69 and exited to go west on State Road 48 when V#1 entered the right turn lane to Gates Drive and struck V#2 in the rear bumper. V#1 sustained minor front bumper damage. Vehicle 2, a red Ford van, was slowing or stopped in traffic in the right turn lane to Gates Drive. V#2 sustained damage to its entire rear bumper to include the tow hitch and the trailer light plug-in. Driver 1, Laura Patterson, stated she just came off the interstate from the south and exited to go west on State Road 48. She admitted to going through the red light, not knowing it was controlled by a "No Turn on Red" sign. D#1 said she was looking over her left shoulder for merging traffic when she came upon V#2. She was unable to avoid collision. Driver 2, Robert Harbison, was slowing or stopped in traffic in the right only turn lane to Gates Drive facing west bound on State Road 48. D#2 was then struck from behind by V#1. No injuries were reported. Both vehicles were drivable and moved from the roadway and the crash investigation was completed in the Wendy's parking lot.

V2 was parked in a parking location on private property and unattended. When V2's owner returned she found minor damage to the rear passenger side of the bumper.No information was received or found for V1.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON I69 NEAR MM 125 WHEN D1 STATED THAT SHE HYDROPLANED AND LOST CONTROL OF HER VEHICLE, CAUSING HER TO STRIKE THE CENTER GAURDRAIL OF THE INTERSTATE.

D1 stated that he was traveling westbound on W 17th Street approaching N Kinser Pike. D1 seemed confused about what color the light was when V1 entered the intersection. D1 could not seem to clarify whether the light was green or yellow, however he seemed more confident that it was yellow. D1 stated that he could not see what color the north/south lights were.D2 stated that she was traveling northbound on N Madison Street (prior to it turning into N Kinser Pike) approaching W 17th Street. D2 stated that she remembers the traffic control signal being green the entire time she approached and entered the intersection. D2 stated that as she was in the intersection, V1 struck the passenger side of V2. EMS arrived on scene due to the unknown nature of the accident, however no involved party was injured. Both V1 and V2 were towed due to disabling damage by Kens Westside Towing.

Unit 1 was travelling Southbound on I69, just passing the Sample Rd exit. At this point the vehicle aqua planed into the central median barrier. After impact, the vehicle pulled off of the road, onto the shoulder on the outside of the road and came to a stop approximately 1000 ft South of the Sample rd exit. No disabling damage to vehicle, just body work issues.

I RESPONDED TO AN ACCIDENT IN WHICH THE DRIVER FLEED ON FOOT FROM THE SCENE. I ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE THE DRIVER HOWEVER COULD NOT LOCATE. SEVERAL WITNESSES ADVISED THE MALE WAS INTOXICATED AND THEN FLEED THE SCENE. ONE UNOPENED AND ONE EMPTY BOTTLE OF ALCOHOL WAS LOCATED IN THE VEHICLE. WITNESSES ON SCENE POSITIVLY ID THE DRIVER BY A BMV PHOTO OF A KENNETH LAFAYET GENTRY DOB 10-30-1980.

V2 was traveling northbound on S. COLLEGE Mall Rd. when approaching the intersection of S. College Mall Rd and Eastland Plaza. V2 slowed to a stop in traffic as the traffic signal was turning red for north and south bound traffic.V1 was traveling northbound on S. College Mall Rd. when approaching V1. V1 was following too closely and was unable to come to a complete stop due to the road and weather conditions. V1 struck V2 in the rear, causing minor damage to the front of V1. V2 sustained no damage, however V2 has a rack or lift system attached to the rear of the vehicle via the trailer hitch attachment port. This device sustained minor damage.

Spoke to Adrianna and she stated V1 was traveling north on I69 in the area of the 122 mile marker. Adrianna stated she fell asleep and ran off the left side of the roadway striking a guard rail causing damage to the left side of V1. I observed tire marks leading up to V1 consistent with running off the roadway. V1 was wedged up against a guard rail. I observed damage to the windshield and rear view mirror consistent with the driver striking the windshield. There was a significant amount of blood in that area of the dash and leading out of the passenger side of the vehicle. There was also an odor of an alcoholic beverage in the vehicle. I also observed blood on the guard rail on the west side of the roadway consistent with someone climbing over the guard rail. I also observed blood on the ground on the west side of the guard rail leading away from the crash. Adrianna, who stated she was driving, had injuries from the crash but not consistent with hitting the windshield and mirror. Adrianna declined medical transport on scene. Alexis Miller was the other passenger in V1 at the time of the crash. Alexis stated she was asleep and didn't know what happened and that she, Trai, and Adrianna were the only people in V1 at the time of the crash. Trai Ervine was also a passenger in V1 during the crash and was not injured. Trai stated he didn't know what happened since he was asleep. Trai also stated he didn't know who was driving since he was asleep. Adrianna later stated at the ED that Trentin M Hollin, DOB 11/4/2001, was the individual who fled the scene. Trai and Alexis both had different stories about where they were in the vehicle at the time of the crash. Alexis Miller was intoxicated and pbt. Result was .17. all 3 were transported via patrol car to the ED so Alexis could be checked out for alcohol consumption since she was a juvenile. Adrianna was given a pbt the result was .00. V1 was towed due to disabling damage.Once at the ED Adrianna decided to be seen for neck pain. Adrianna also provided information that led to locating Trentin in a wooded area near the scene. Once Trentin was located I observed injuries to his face and nose area consistent with striking the windshield above the steering wheel. I did observe the odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating form his exhaled breath. Trentin was transported to the ED due to his injuries from the crash. Trentin stated he wasn't driving the vehicle. I advised him he was the only occupant with injuries consistent with striking the windshield on the drivers side of the vehicle. A search warrant was obtained for a blood draw and executed at the IU Health ED. Evidence was also collected form the vehicle and submitted to the state lab. Also located in the vehicle was a small amount of what I believe to be Marijuana under the drivers seat. Trentin was left at the ED to be treated for his injuries and left in the custody of his mother and step father. Due to Trentin's injuries, the lack of injuries to Adrianna, and the damage to the drivers side windshield it appears Trentin is D1.

Driver 1 stated that she stopped behind Unit 2 at a stop sign. Driver 1 said that she saw Unit 2 begin to move so she started forward when Unit 2 stopped again. Driver 1 said that she attempted to stop Unit 1 when her tires locked up and she slid into Unit 2. Driver 2 said that she was stopped at a stop sign when she was rear ended by Unit 1.

Driver 1 stated he was turning right onto West Rice Road and struck Driver 2 which was stopped at the stop sign at the corner on West Rice Road and Garrison Chapel Road

D1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON I 69 AROUND THE 114 MILE MARKER.D1 WAS THEN STRUCK BY A DEER THAT STRUCK THE DRIVERS SIDE OF THE VEHICLE ON THE REAR PASSENGER DOOR AND THE FRONT LEFT QUARTER PANEL. THE DEER WAS CROSSING THE ROAD GOING WB WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS STRUCK.THE DEER WAS NOT ON SCENE UPON MY ARRIVAL, HOWEVER THERE WAS DEER HAIR STUCK IN THE FRONT QUARTER PANEL.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was traveling eastbound on E. 6th St., when she attempted to pass through the intersection of E.6th St. And N. Washington St. D1 stated as she was passing through the intersection, she was struck on the driver side by D2.D2 stated he was traveling southbound on N. Washington St., passing through the intersection of E. 6th and N. Washington, when D2 observed D1 pulling out into the intersection in front of his vehicle. D2 stated that he did not have enough time to stop, at which time, D2 struck D1 on the front driver side of the vehicle.My investigation has yielded that D1, after stopping at the posted traffic control sign, failed to yield the right of way to D2, which resulted in a right-angle impact between D1 and D2.

On Sunday, October 27, 2019 at 15:49, NUNGESTER, RILEY responded to a crash on I69 Milepost 125.5 . At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. Vehicle 1 (2013, silver, Volkswagen EOS) was traveling southbound on I69, near the 125 mile marker, when the vehicle went off the roadway, striking the cable barrier and damaging the driver's side of vehicle 1 near the front (left) bumper and quarter panel, to include damage to the driver's side tire and door. The vehicle also damaged the cable barrier with approximately 40 feet of damage.Driver 1 (Lauren Mass} stated that she was traveling southbound on I69 headed to Bloomington in the fast lane. She stated that she felt the vehicle go off on the east side of the roadway, striking the cable barrier prior to coming to a stop. She stated that she didn't recall what happened during the crash. She stated she believed she fell asleep and came to when the vehicle went off the roadway. Witness 1 ( Amanda Golde) was sitting in the passenger's seat when the crash occurred. She stated that it was her vehicle that her Dad had purchased for her and she let Lauren drive it home from IUPUI. She stated that she was on her phone and messing with the radio when the vehicle went off the roadway striking the cable barrier. She stated she did not know what or why the vehicle went off the roadway. Witness 2 (Emily Kats) was sitting in the back, behind the passenger's seat asleep when she felt the vehicle strike the cable barrier. She did not observe the reason for the crash.All parties involved advised that they were uninjured at the time of the crash and were all out of the vehicle at the time I arrived just minutes after the crash. Trooper A. Deel and I transported the occupants of the crash to Bloomington where they were dropped off at their place of residence. While transporting Emily and Amanda, Emily stated that she wanted it to be known that her hip was bothering her but did not know what to do about it. I advised that I would contact an ambulance for check out and the denied the assistance and said they would take care of the injury at a later date if it got worse. It's this officer's opinion with the evidence of the crash and the statements made that driver 1 was fatigued and fell asleep behind the wheel. She stated that there was no reason for her to swerve or make any sudden change of direction and she doesn't remember the beginning of the crash. The marks and damage of the vehicle along with the damage to the guardrail are also indicative of the story that driver 1 advised. The vehicle was towed to Bloomington by Blands Towing. The driver and the owner's daughter were both given the crash information.RKN

DRIVER STATED HE WAS RIDING IN A GROUP WITH OTHER MOTORCYCLES WHEN THEY REACHED THE SHARP TURN, BETWEEN SR 43 AND W VERNAL PIKE ON SR 48, AND THE MOTORCYCLE SLID OUT FROM UNDER HIM.OTHER RIDERS IN THE GROUP STATED THEY SAW HIM START TO GO THROUGH THE TURN THEN STRAIGHTEN OUT BEFORE HE LAID THE MOTORCYCLE DOWN.

D2 STATED HE WAS PROCEEDING THROUGH A GREEN LIGHT WHEN V1 STRUCK HIM IN THE AREA OF THE RIGHT TURN LANE FROM W SR 45.

V1 was parked and unoccupied facing south at the residence of 4995 W Truesdel Ct., Bloomington, IN 47404. On Monday, October 28, 2019 at 21:30, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on I69 northbound near the 125 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry.V1, gray Toyota, was traveling north on I69 in the right lane near the 125 mile marker. V1 struck a deer with the driver's side of V1 and came to a controlled stop along the northbound emergency shoulder. D1, Marshall, stated he was travelling north on I69 in the right lane. D1 stated a deer entered the roadway from the median and he was unable to avoid a collision. D1 stated the deer struck the front driver's corner and side of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front driver's corner and driver's side doors of V1. Evidence shows the side curtain airbags deployed along the driver's side of V1. Evidence shows a deer was lying in the median near the area of impact.

V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON LIBERTY DRIVE, MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN INTO A PRIVATE LOT ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY, WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2.D1 STATED SHE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON LIBERTY DRIVE WHEN SHE STRUCK THE REAR END OF V2. D1 WAS SEEN BY AN AMBULANCE AND REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT ON SCENE. D2 STATED SHE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON LIBERTY DRIVE, MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN INTO A PRIVATE DRIVE, WHEN V1 REAR ENDED HER VEHICLE.

V1 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF 504 S BASSWOOD DR. IT IS A TRANSPORT VEHICLE FOR SPECIAL NEEDS CLIENTS. D1 AND ANOTHER CLIENT GOT INTO A FIGHT OUTSIDE OF V1. D1 GOT INTO V1 AND DROVE IT INTO THE 504 BUILDING IT WAS PARKED AT.WITNESS #1 ADV SHE WORKS FOR THE OWNER OF V1. SHE SAID SHE WAS STANDING OUTSIDE V1 TRYING TO GET D1 TO UNLOCK THE DOOR WHEN HE DROVE IT INTO THE BUILDING.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON STATE ROAD 46 BYPASS NEARING ENTRANCE 11 TO MEMORIAL STADIUM. V2 WAS ALSO TRAVELING WB ON STATE ROAD 46 BYPASS NEARING ENTRANCE 11 TO MEMORIAL STADIUM. AS V1 AND V2 BOTH WERE ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT INTO THE MEMORIAL STADIUM PARKING LOT, THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE OF V1 AND THE PASSENGER'S SIDE DOOR AREA OF V2 COLLIDED.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS ALREADY IN THE TURN LANE ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT INTO ENTRANCE 11 WHEN V2 STRUCK HER VEHICLE AS SHE WAS TURNING. D1 STATED THAT V2 ENTERED THE EB TRAVEL LANES AND CAUSED THE COLLISION.D2 STATED THAT HE HAD ALREADY ENTERED THE LEFT TURN LANE TO ENTER ENTRANCE 11 WHEN V1 PULLED OUT OF THE WB TRAVEL LANE AND STRUCK HIS VEHICLE CAUSING THE ACCIDENT.W1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING BEHIND V1 ON THE STATE ROAD 46 BYPASS AND NOTICED HER ABRUPTLY ENTER THE 2-WAY LEFT TURN LANE AND COLLIDE WITH V2. W1 STATED "THERE'S NO DOUBT THAT THE ACCIDENT WAS 100% THE WHITE TOYOTA'S FAULT."

V1 was backing out of a parking stall traveling south west. V2 was stopped waiting for a parking stall to open facing north. D1 stated she looked out the right side of her vehicle and thought it was safe to back up. D1 stated she was backing slowly until she struck V2.D2 stated she was stopped waiting for another vehicle to leave when suddenly she was struck by D1.V1 has damage to the rear driver side bumper.V2 has damage to the rear passenger side bumper.

Officer Weitkamp and I were traveling southbound on Indiana Avenue when we observed a box truck which got stuck under the bridge when traveling northbound on Indiana Avenue near 12th Street. Officers observed damage to the box portion of the vehicle. There were only scrape marks under the bridge where the box truck made contact. D1 said he was traveling northbound on Indiana Avenue, and thought he could make it under the bridge with clearance. D1 said as he proceeded under the bridge he heard the top of V1 box truck make contact with the under portion of the bridge. D1 said he realized V1 was stuck. We made contact with IUPD Dispatch to see if we had a wrecker service who was available to assist. Pritchard's originally was dispatched to the scene, but Blands later arrived on scene since they have a contract with Ryder and was able to get V1 out. Blands then towed the vehicle back to their shop. IUPD Dispatch requested the Indiana Rail Road to come out to check the bridge and foundation due to the box truck making contact to the underneath portion of the bridge. Mark Hiatt with the Indiana Rail Road arrived on scene and checked the area. Mark Hiatt 812-340-4327 said everything looked fine and no damage.D1 was given a crash number.Photos were taken and are available upon request.

D1 stated he as traveling north on Intersate 69. He stated he observed a deer jump the concrete median. He state the deer traveled in the path of his vehicle. He stated he was unable to avoid striking the deer.

Vehicle 2 (V2) was parked on E 8th Street in the area of N Lincoln Street. The vehicle appeared to be struck on the driver's side side view mirror area. I did not observe there to be any paint transfer or any type of evidence in order to identify Vehicle 1. V2 had been parked since 12:00pm on 10/26/19. The damaged was not observed until the evening of 10/28/19.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS STOPPED EB ON 7TH AT JEFFERSON. V2 WAS STOPPED SB ON JEFFERSON AT 7TH. V1 PROCEEDED EB AND V2 PROCEEDED SB. THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1 AND FRONT PASS SIDE OF V2 COLLIDED IN THE INTERSECTION.D1 STATED SHE WAS EB ON 7TH AT JEFFERSON. D1 STATED THAT SHE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN BEFORE PROCEEDING EB INTO THE INTERSECTION WHERE THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT PASS SIDE OF V2. D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT SEE V2 ENTER THE INTERSECTION.D2 STATED SHE WAS SB ON JEFFERSON AT 7TH. D2 STATED THAT SHE STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN BEFORE D1. D2 STATED THAT, AFTER D1 STOPPED, SHE PROCEEDED SB THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT, WHILE IN THE INTERSECTION, THE FRONT PASS SIDE OF V2 COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE OF V1.

D1 (cyclist) was bicycling south on S Rogers Street in the South lane when D1 was struck in the rear by a motor vehicle also traveling south on S Rogers Street. D1 was knocked to the ground but was alert, conscious, and standing when I arrived on scene. There was substantial damage to the rear of the bicycle. D1 advised they had a complaint of pain to the lower left leg. D1 was not taken to the hospital and did not require treatment. D2 stated they were driving South on S Rogers Street when they rear ended a bicycle traveling South on S Rogers Street. D2 advised they did not see any lights or reflectors on the back of the bicycle. D2 stopped immediately to assist D1. D2 was not injured. I did not observe any lights on the rear of the bicycle which it should have had to operate at night.

V1 was in the left lane on S. Walnut street and was going to turn left onto W. 2nd street. V2 was on W. 2nd street and was in the left turn lane stopped at the traffic light. V1 was turning left and went left of center and struck V2 in the driver side front bumper with the driver side rear area of V1. There didn't appear to be any damage to V1.D1 stated that he was turning left and as he was turning he didn't check his mirror and struck V2. He stated it was his fault and that V2 was stopped in his lane.D2 stated that he was stopped and waiting for the traffic light to turn green. He stated that as V1 was turning, he could tell he might get hit. He stated that he tried to back up to give V1 more room but there was a car behind him preventing him from backing up much. He stated he had stopped when V1 hit him.

D1 EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS IN THE LEFT LANE TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH COLLEGE MALL ROAD WHEN THE LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH COLLEGE MALL AND EAST BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD TURNED RED.D1 EXPLAINED THAT THE FRONT OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, WHICH WAS SLOWED OR STOPPED IN THE LEFT LANE OF SOUTH BOUND COLLEGE MALL.THE FRONT OF V2 DID THEN MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3, WHICH WAS STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH COLLEGE MALL AND EAST BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD.D2 DID EXPLAIN THAT HE WAS IN THE LEFT LANE TRAVELING SOUTH ON SOUTH COLLEGE MALL APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF EAST BUICK CADILLAC BOULEVARD.D2 DID BEGIN TO SLOW DOWN IN TRAFFIC AT THE LIGHT WHEN THE REAR OF V2 WAS STRUCK BY THE FRONT OF V1, RESULTING IN THE FRONT OF V2 THEN MAKING CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.D3 EXPLAINED THAT HE DID STOP AT THE RED LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION WHEN THE FRONT OF V2 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.

V1 was traveling South on South State Road 446 near Old Richarson Road. V1 while turning in a curve lost control of the vehicle and ran off the road into a ditch. V1 rolled and was inverted. D1 stated he wasn't sure what happened, he thought the road might have been wet. The road was not wet at the time of the crash. D1 was treated at the scene but did not want to be transported to the hospital.

ON 10/28/2019 UNIT 1 DRIVEN BY JAMES DIXON WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON NORTH BURMA ROAD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF WEST SIMPSON CHAPEL RD. UNIT 1 RAN OFF THE ROADWAY, THROUGH A DITCH STRICKING AND HANDICAP RAMP AND RAILING BEFORE SKIDDING OFF A LOCAL BUISNESS BY THE NAME OF SCHOLARS INN BAKEHOUSE. UNIT SUFFERED SEVERE FRONT END AND REAR END DAMDGE TO THE VEHICLES FRONT AND REAR BUMPER AS WELL AS THE HOOD COMPARTMENT. UNIT 1 HAD A PASSENGER LOCATED IN THE FRONT RIGHT SEAT. THE PASSENGER INVOLVED LATER IDENTIFIED AS ABDEL-HALIM KAMILLIAH COMPLAINED OF SEVERE LOWER BACK PAIN AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE IU HEALTH BLOOMINGTON HOSPITAL FOR MEDICAL TREATMENT AND EVALUATION. TEH BUILDING UNIT 1 STRUCK SUFFERED DAMAGE TO THE HANDICAP ENTRANCE AND RAILING AS WELL AS DAMAGE TO THE OUTER SIDING AND FOUNDATION. MR. DIXON SHOWED SIGNS OF IMAPARMENT AT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT AND WAS DETAINED FOR AN OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED INVESTIGATION. SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED THE PASSENGER SUFFERED INJURIES CLASSIFIED AS SERIOUS BODILY INJURY AND IS AT A STATUS OF POTENTIONALLY PARAPALEGIC. DRIVER WAS ARRESTED ON OWI SERIOUS BODILY INJURY A LEVEL 5 FELONY.

V1 was facing south in the Sigma Phi Epsilon parking lot attempting to leave parking space #19. V2 was facing south in the parking lot unoccupied in parking space #20. V1 attempted to turn west into the parking lot and did not leave enough space for the vehicle on its right. The rear of V1 then struck the front of V2. V1 had slight damage to the rear passenger side of the vehicle. V2 had moderate damage to the front driver side bumper. D1 stated that he was attempting to leave the parking space and the cars were all parked close together. D1 stated that he was scared he was going to hit the vehicle parking directly in front of him, so he turned to quickly and the rear of V1 hit the front of V2. V2 was parked and unoccupied. There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed.

V2 was southbound on State Road 45/46 approaching the 17th Street intersection at a slow pace. V1 was directly behind V2.D1 stated she was stopped facing south behind V2 on State Road 45/46 at the 17th Street intersection. She was driving V1. She stated that traffic began to move forward and she was looking to the east at a separate vehicle crash that had already taken place. D1 stated that she did not notice that V2 had stopped and she collided into the rear of V2.D2 stated she was driving V2 southbound on State Road 45/46 approaching 17th Street at slow pace. She stated that vehicles were slowing due to a crash in the northbound lanes. D2 stated that she stopped in traffic and V1 collided into the rear of her vehicle.There was heavy front end damage to the front driver side of V1. There was damage to the rear passenger side bumper and taillight area of V2. D1 is pregnant and complained of pain in her lower back and was transported to the IU Health Bloomington Hospital. There are no known complications with the pregnancy at this time.V1 was towed by Hawkins Towing due to heavy front end damage.

On Tuesday, October 29, 2019 at 23:17, I, Richard Klun, responded to a crash in a private parking lot to the northwest of the intersection of W 2nd St and S Morton Ave, Bloomington, Monroe County. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. Vehicle 1, white, Dodge Charger, Indiana State Police Commission # 2990, mileage 129,485, was being operated by Trooper Samuel Wagner. Trooper Wagner's emergency lighting was activated at the time of the crash. V1 was attempting to conduct a traffic stop on V2 and V2 was failing to stop.Vehicle 2, white, Jeep Grand Cherokee was fleeing from Law Enforcement and pulled into a parking lot. As the driver quickly exited the vehicle, V2 was placed in reverse instead of park, in which it then rolled backwards and struck V1 which was stationary at the time of the impact.Driver 1: Trooper Samuel Wagner stated that he was attempting to conduct a traffic stop on V2 when it attempted to flee and ultimately pulled into a parking lot. D2 then exited the vehicle and ran on foot while the V2 rolled backwards into his patrol car. D1 stayed with the vehicle as there were three other passengers in the vehicle. Driver 2: Christopher Brooks, who was later apprehended by Bloomington Police Canine, refused to speak with Law Enforcement.It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the primary cause of this crash is failure to yield and that Driver 2 is at fault. Driver 2 has been arrested and incarcerated.

COMPLAINANT STATED THAT V2 HAD BEEN PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT FOR APPROXIMATELY THREE DAYS BEFORE ANY DAMAGE WAS NOTICED. THE DATES AND TIMES IN THIS REPORT ARE APPROXIMATIONS. V2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE ON THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE AND AROUND TO THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE AT SOME POINT DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. IT APPEARS THERE IS BLACK PAINT TRANSFER ALONG THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF V2. THERE IS NO FURTHER INFORMATION AVAILBLE AT THE TIME OF WRITING THIS REPORT.

D1 advised she was traveling East on W. Arlington Rd. D1 stated a deer entered her lane of travel from the south side of the roadway, at which point D1 struck the deer with her vehicle. D1 contacted her insurance company who arranged for the vehicle to be towed. Kens West Side towing retrieved the vehicle and towed it to Bloomington Ford. D2 stated she was traveling West on W. Arlington Rd and struck the same deer that D1 had struck. It is my understanding that V1 hit the deer and it then continued North into the Westbound lane of travel where D2 struck the deer with her vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED HE WAS STOPPED NORTH BOUND IN A NORTH SOUTH ALLY THAT INTERSECTS WITH 3RD ST. D1 STATED THAT A MOTORIST HAD STOPPED WEST OF THE INTERSECTION TO ALLOW HIM TO ENTER THE ROADWAY. D1 SAID AS HE ENTERED 3RD STREET TO MAKE HIS LEFT TURN, HE WAS STRUCK BY V2. D2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD STREET IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE. D2 SAID THAT V1 HAD APPEARED TO HER RIGHT AND PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF HER. D2 SAID SHE COULD NOT AVOID COLLISION.

V1 was parked facing N on the S side of 1730 S Walnut St. V1 accelerated and struck the guard rail outside the building, causing the guard rail to strike the building. V1 then fled the scene and caused another accident. See accident #B1945600 for additional.

D1 STATED DEER COME RUNNING OUT FROM SIDE OF ROAD QUICKLY AND HE STRUCK IT WITH FRONT PASSENGERSIDE. IT APPEARED DEER WAS STRUCK PASSENGERSIDE FRONT FENDER AND WAS SPUN INTO PASSENGERSIDE FENDER AND FRONT DOOR ALSO BRAKING PASSENGER WINDOW.

V1 was traveling west on State Road 46 West near West Curry Pike. V1 ran off the road hitting a small ditch, causing the vehicle to roll. V1 rolled and came to rest on its tires. D1 stated she was going down the road and looked away for a moment, when she looked back at the road there was a truck slowed in front of him. D1 stated she turned to miss the truck and ran off the road.The two passengers in the vehicle were transported to Bloomington Hospital for minor injuries.

D1 STATED HE WAS AT THE STOP SIGN ON N RED HILL RD TO TURN WESTBOUND ON W WALEKR LN. WHEN HE STARTED TO MAKE HIS TURN, HE "PRESSED THE GAS TOO HARD" AND STARTED TO SPIN OUT. V1 THEN LEFT THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY ON WALKER LN WHERE D1 STATED HE OVERCORRECTED TO BRING THE VEHICLE BACK ONTO THE ROADWAY. THAT OVER-CORRECTION CAUSED HIM TO THEN RUN OFF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROADWAY WHERE HE STRUCK AN EMBANKMENT AND FLIPPED THE VEHICLE ONTO ITS SIDE.

V1 was just involved in an accident at 1730 S Walnut St. (B1945601) and fled S/B on S Walnut St. V1 began swerving between lanes and eventually ran off the road on the left side of the street, losing cargo from the bed of the vehicle. V1 ran down a grass hill into the parking lot of 105 E Winslow Rd; IU Credit Union. V1 ran over a curb and some shrubbery, before turning West to go through the ATM drive through at the bank. V1 struck a large metal box, tearing it from its concrete anchor, and dragged it across the parking lot. V1 then left the parking lot and fled S/B on S Walnut St.

Driver 1 (D1) advised that she was taking a right hand turn at the t-intersection in order to head northbound on S Muller parkway toward the exit of the apartment complex.D1 advised that she had previously been stopped at the stop sign and was facing westbound. D1 advised that as she made the turn the Vehicle 2 (V2) was attempting to make a left hand turn around her. D1 advised that she could see that both vehicles were close to each other, so she brought V1 to a complete stop. D1 advised that after she did so V2 kept attempting to turn and made contact with the rear driver's side of the bus. Driver 2 (D2) advised that he was heading southbound on S Muller Parkway and was attempting to make a left handed turn at the t-intersection. D2 reported that the bus had been stopped at the stop sign and began making the turn at about the same time that he did. D2 advised that as V1 was making the turn that had had to stop because he could see that the vehicles were going to make contact. D2 stated that he stopped, but advised that the bus kept moving forward and made contact with the rear driver's side of his vehicle. Witness (W1) was on the bus at the time of the accident. W1 advised that as the bus was pulliing out that V2 quickly attempted to make the turn around the bus. W1 stated that D1 stopped the bus because the vehicles were so close together. W1 reported that V2 continued going forward and struck the rear end of the bus. It should be noted that Chandler's towing was called on scene due to both vehicles still making contact with one another. Chandler's winched the rear end of V2 so that the vehicles were no longer making contact. D2 paid for Chandler's services. Both vehicles drove away from the scene.

See Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: The crash occurred on 10/29/2019 and D2 was not present at the time of the crash. I investigated the crash at IUPD station on 11/18/2019. V1 was facing southbound on the west curb of Jordan Avenue just south of Law Lane. V2 was parked on Jordan Avenue just south of Law Lane on the west curb facing southbound. D1 stated that she had parked her vehicle on 10/29/2019 at approximately 1500 hours on Jordan Avenue near the west curb just south of Law Lane. D1 stated she returned to her vehicle at approximately 1555 hours. D1 stated she began to reverse to attempt to continue traveling southbound on Jordan Avenue, when she suddenly struck V2. D1 stated she waited for approximately 20 minutes and did not see D2 return to her vehicle, so she left her information on V2. D2 stated that she parked her vehicle on 10/29/2019 at approximately 1545 hours facing southbound on Jordan Avenue. D2 stated she returned to her vehicle around 1745 hours and noticed that there was damage to her front bumper and that D1 had left her personal information on V2. D2 stated she had no idea what had happened because she was not in the vehicle at the time of the crash. I did not observe any damage to V1. Upon speaking with D1 I determined that there was no malicious intent to leave the scene of the accident. I did not charge D1 with Leaving the Scene of an Accident and no enforcement actions were taken.

D1 stated that she was driving north on N Lincoln Street, and turned west on E 7th Street. D1 stated that as she made the turn, she did not see V2 parked on the side of the road and ran into the back of the V2. The front passenger side bumper of V1 collided with the rear driver's side bumper of V2. D1 stated that she was very tired from arriving back in the country at 2am this morning, and being in classes all day.V2 was unoccupied at the time of the accident.

At approximately 1637 hours on 10/29/2019 V1 was southbound on the Bypass, approaching the intersection of 17th Street and the Bypass. Approximately 100m north of the intersection, the vehicle turned east, crossed the hard median, and ran off the road east of the northbound lanes. The vehicle ran over and knocked down a small vehicle, coming to a rest with the tree beneath the rear of the vehicle. Officer Botts and Officer Skaggs were in the area and immediately began to assist D1.Officer Botts advised that D1 was hanging forward in his seatbelt when they made contact. The vehicle was not overturned.D1 initially did not act lucid. He was extremely unable to follow any line of questioning, heavily slurred his speech, and had severe difficulty with motor functions. D1 was placed in a C-collar and moved to an ambulance where he was later determined to be competent enough to sign a release form. D1 complied and performed SFSTs, provided a PBT sample of .000, and ARIDE testing. D1 was determined not to be under the influence of drugs or alcohol. Over the course of approximately 30 minutes D1 very rapidly regained his composure, but continued to have difficult properly tracking a conversation throughout our encounter. D1 stated that he had been diagnosed with a panic disorder and claimed that a panic attack was the reason for his crash. D1 stated he took medication that would not impair his ability to drive. His mother later confirmed this but did not provide the name of the medication. V1 was towed by Chandlers. W1 and W2 both stated that approximately 100m north of the intersection V1 made a hard east turn, crossed the median and ran off the road. There were clear tread marks that match their account.

Primary Cause-Driver Factor-Following Too Closely: D1 should have maintained adequate distance from V2 to avoid colliding into the rear of V2.I69 is an interstate that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. SR48 is a highway that runs in a eastern and western direction. The crash occurred on interchange, Ramp (A), northbound from I69 at SR48. The roadway was dry and it was cloudy at the time of the crash.V2 (2014 gray Mazda6) was stopped northbound on the ramp at the Yield sign preparing to exit eastbound onto SR48. V1 (2010 white Hyundai Santa Fe) was northbound directly behind V2. V1 started to exit eastbound onto SR48 when it struck the rear of V2. {Driver Statements}D1 (Charles Aikman) stated he was northbound on the exit ramp and preparing to turn eastbound onto SR48. D1 stated that he was behind V2 and thought V2 had exited on SR48. D1 stated he was looking for oncoming traffic and started to exit when he struck the rear end of V2. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 (Alexandria Allison) stated she was stopped on the exit ramp preparing to make a right turn (eastbound) onto SR48. D2 stated she was waiting for eastbound traffic on SR48 to clear when she was struck in the rear by V1. She was wearing her seat belt. {Conclusion}During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the rear of V2's bumper area. I also observed front bumper damage to the front of V1. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the collision was Following Too Closely on the part of D1. This was determined by driver statements and damage sustained to both V1 and V2.

V1 was traveling North on South Harrell Road near the intersection of East Schacht Road. D1 stated she while driving a large truck crossed the center line hitting her mirror. D1 stated that the truck did not stop after the crash. D1 stated she wasn't sure of any other info on the truck.

V1 was in the north east most parking spot facing east. V2 was exiting the parking lot, facing north at the entrance. V1 was backing out of the parking spot. While backing V1 turned the wheel too sharply. The left front of V1 struck the right rear of V2. D1 stated she had the wheel turned too sharply while backing out. D1 did not see V2 waiting to exit. V1 had damage to the front left driver's side door. There was cosmetic damage and a dent. D2 could not provide any information as she did not see what happened because she was facing the opposite direction. V2 had slight cosmetic damage and minor denting on the right rear bumper. All parties denied medical attention.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was on US 45/46 going south attempting to stop at the light at 10th St and US 45/46. V2 was stopped at the intersection of US 45/46 and 10th St facing south.D1 stated she was going south on US 45/46 and when she attempted to stop as she approached the intersection her wheels slid on the wet pavement and she collided with V2.D2 stated she was sitting at the intersection of US 45/46 and 10th St when D1 collided with her rear bumper.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling North on South State Road 37, near the intersection of Old 37. V1 hit V2 in the rear end while V2 was stopped at the stop light. D1 stated she was unable to get the vehicle stopped due to the roads being wet.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: On Wednesday, October 30, 2019 at 09:30, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on I69 southbound at the 118 mile marker, ramp C. At the time of the crash, the weather was rain and the road surface was wet.V2, silver Dodge, was stopped in traffic in the right lane on the ramp. V1, black Chevrolet, was traveling south on the ramp approaching the rear of V2. V1 failed to stop behind V2. V1 struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. Both V1 and V2 moved to the emergency shoulder after impact.D1, Groover, stated he was exiting I69 and approaching traffic on the ramp. D1 stated he observed the traffic signal had changed to green and did not realize traffic was stopped. D1 stated he applied his brakes and began to slide on the wet roadway. D1 stated he struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D2, McFarland, stated she was stopped in traffic in the right lane on the exit ramp. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2 while she was stopped. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear of V2. Evidence shows it was raining and the roadway was wet during the accident investigation. ****Location of Collision**** Actual location is I69 - 118 - Ramp C. Map it feature within the report incorrectly identified collision location as SR37 - 100 - Ramp C.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON SR 45/46 BYPASS APPROACHING KINSER PIKE.V2 WAS STOPPED ON SR 45/46 BYPASS AT KINSER PIKE AT A RED LIGHT.D1 SAID WHEN SHE TRIED TO STOP FOR TRAFFIC HER TIRES SLID ON THE WET PAVEMENT AND SHE REAR ENDED V2.D2 SAID AS HE SAT AT THE INTERSECTION V1 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS S0UTH BOUND ON HILLSDALE, JUST SOUTH OF E 7TH ST. D1 STARTED TO BACK UP AND CHECKED HIS SIDE MIRRORS, BUT DID NOT SEE V2 PARKED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE STREET. AS V1 BACKED UP IT COLLIDED WITH V2. V2 WAS PARKED.

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. OLD STATE ROAD 37 JUST PASSED W. CHURCH LN. V2 SLOWED DOWN AS THERE WAS AN EMERGENCY VEHCILE APPROACHING. D1 APPLIED HIS BRAKES AND SLID INTO THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON S. OLD STATE ROAD 37 JUST PASSED W. CHURCH LN. AN EMERGENCY VEHICLE WAS APPROACHING SO D1 STARTED TO SLOW AND GET OVER TO THE RIGHT. V2 WAS THEN REAR ENDED BY V1.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE DID NOT REALIZE VEHICLE 2 HAD STOPPED TO TURN ON TO W 46 AND HE STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE REAR BUMPER. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS MAKING A RIGHT HAND TURN ON TO W 46 WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK IN THE REAR BUMPER BY VEHICLE 1. THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGETO THE BUMPER OF VEHICLE 2.

On Wednesday, October 30, 2019 at 12:00, Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a crash on State Rd 37 approximately 686 ft south of Zikes Rd. State Road 37 is a multi-lane two way road that runs primarily north and south. At the time of the crash it was raining and the road surface was wet. Traffic was light to moderate. Vehicle 1, a white Dodge Dakota, was traveling southbound on SR 37 in the right lane south of the Zikes Rd intersection. Vehicle 2, a gray Kenworth T680 (flat bed semi), was also traveling south on SR 37 south of Zikes Rd. V1 was traveling behind V2. V1 ran into the rear end of V2 at a high rate of speed. After the impact, V1 veered to the left across the left lane of traffic and into the grass median. V1 continued south in the grass median several feet before coming to a stop in the median. V2 continued south on SR 37 in the right lane for several feet before pulling over on the right shoulder. The Witness vehicle was traveling in the left lane behind the crash when it occurred. Driver 1, Ronnie Terrell, told me he was traveling south on SR 37 in the right lane. D1 said he saw V2 in front of him and tried to stop. D1 said he remembered his truck slamming into the back of V2 and his airbags deploying. D1 said he could not remember much after that. Driver 2, Roger Judd, told me was traveling southbound on SR 37 in the right lane south of the Zikes Rd. intersection. D2 told me that while he was driving the normal speed limit when he felt an abrupt jolt from behind. D2 said it was so hard it knocked things off the dash of his truck. D2 said he never saw V1 hit him, but he pulled over to the right side of the road. D2 stated he was flagged down by a witness who told him what happened. A witness to the crash, Stephanie Crow, was traveling southbound on SR 37 in the left lane behind V2. Crow said she watched as V1 slammed into the back of V2. Crow advised that it did not appear as if V1 ever attempted to stop or merge into another lane. Crow told me she watched V1 veer across her lane of traffic in front of her and into the grass median. Crow told me that when V1 went into the median it looked like it almost went into oncoming northbound SR 37 traffic but never did. Evidence shows heavy damage to the front end of V1. Evidence shows minimal damage and paint transfer on the rear of V2. Evidence shows tire tracks leading southbound into the median from the southbound lanes of SR 37. Evidence shows it was raining at the time and the road was wet.

On Wednesday, October 30, 2019 at 15:05, Steven Jordan responded to a crash on I69 northbound near the 122.5 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was rain and the road surface was wet. I 69 is an interstate highway that primarily runs north and south. This section of I-69 runs northeast and southwest and has 3 lanes in each direction separated by a metal guardrail. Vehicle 1, Chrysler, was travelling north in the far right lane when it swerved left into the center lane. The vehicle swerved back to the right and off the roadway. Vehicle 1 skidded off the right shoulder of the roadway, down an embankment and into a culvert coming to an uncontrolled stop. The vehicle came to final rest on top of the culvert.I asked Driver 1 about the circumstances leading up to the crash and how she lost control of her vehicle. Driver 1, Roberson, became agitated and advised me it did not matter what happened or how it happened because she was drunk. I advised her I try to be as accurate as I can in my reports so any information she could give would be helpful. Driver 1 stated that she had been drinking and was drunk, therefore it did not matter how she lost control of her vehicle.WItness 1 stated she was driving behind vehicle 1. She stated she observed the vehicle suddenly swerve left into the center lane. The driver of vehicle 1 over-corrected and lost control of her vehicle sliding off the roadway.I asked Driver 1 if she required medical attention and she stated twice that she did not. Trooper Julie Deel arrived to assist and conducted an investigation into Operating While Intoxicated. Due to Driver 1's level of intoxication an ambulance was called to check her out. Driver 1 was transported to Monroe County Hospital by IU Health ambulance number 1060.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Explain in Narrative:Other Location of Investigation: The incident occurred at 17th Street and Woodlawn Avenue, but the pedestrian did not report the incident until 10/31/2019 at Cedar Hall. I investigated the incident at Cedar Hall.D1 was traveling northbound on Woodlawn Avenue attempting to turn right at the intersection of 17th Street and Woodlawn Avenue to begin traveling eastbound on 17th Street. Pedestrian 1 was walking on the south sidewalk of 17th Street near Cramer Marching Hundred Hall traveling west. Pedestrian 1 stated that she was walking westbound on the south sidewalk of 17th Street attempting to cross the intersection of 17th Street and Woodlawn Avenue. Pedestrian 1 stated she hit the button to activate the pedestrian crossing signal. Pedestrian 1 stated that the traffic traveling northbound on Woodlawn Avenue had a red light on the traffic signal. Pedestrian 1 stated she was given the signal to cross and began to clear the intersection, when V1 suddenly began to turn right onto 17th Street to begin traveling east and struck her. Pedestrian 1 stated she was then struck and fell on her face, getting whiplash and scraping her elbows and knees. Pedestrian 1 stated she then got up and walked back east to the crosswalk. Pedestrian 1 stated that the driver then pulled on to 17th street and yelled at her, then left the area eastbound on 17th Street. Pictures of Pedestrian 1's injuries were taken and are attached to the case. I was able to locate camera footage that shows the whole incident play out. The footage has been attached to the scene. I was unable to get any plate information from the camera footage. However, it is clear that the vehicle was a light green Volkswagen Beetle. The only other identifying information in regards to the suspect is that the suspect is a female.

On Wednesday, October 30, 2019 at 16:55, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on S Clarizz Blvd at intersection of SR46. At the time of the crash it was raining and the road surface was wet. The vehicles moved to Pleasant Ridge Road south of SR46 prior to my arrival. V1, yellow Thomas School Bus, was stopped in the northbound right turn lane on Clarizz Blvd at SR46 ( 3rd Street). V2, tan Dodge, was stopped in the northbound left turn lane on Clarizz Blvd at SR46 ( 3rd Street) next to V1. V1 made a right, east, turn onto SR46. The driver's side rear corner of V1 struck the passenger side view mirror of V2 as V1 was completing the right turn. Both vehicles moved to Pleasant Ridge Road after the impact. D1, Rinnert, stated she was stopped in the right turn lane on Clarizz Blvd waiting to make a right turn onto SR46. D1 stated she made the right turn and began traveling east on SR46 when she was flagged over by D2. D1 stated she was unaware she made contact with V2 while completing her turn. D2, Aubin, stated he was stopped in the left turn lane on Clarizz Blvd next to V1. D2 stated V1 made a right turn onto SR46. D2 stated the driver's side rear corner of V1 struck the passenger side view mirror of V2 as V1 completed the right turn. Evidence shows damage to the passenger side view mirror of V2. Evidence shows damage consisting of a small dent on the driver's side rear corner of V1 along the lower bumper rail. The damage to the bumper rail on V1 is consistent with the height of the side view mirror of V2. Evidence shows the roadway was wet during the accident investigation. Evidence shows the traffic signal was operating correctly during the accident investigation. V1 is a Monroe County Community School Corporation (MCCSC) Bus, # 137. D1 indicated there were approximately 43 students on board during the collision. D1 indicated the students were released with the assistance of MCCSC Transportation Director prior to my arrival. ****Other (Vehicle): The rear corner of V1 rotated behind the center line of Clarizz Blvd as V1 made a right turn onto SR46.****

Explain in Narrative:Other Location of Investigation- The crash occurred in the Indiana Memorial Union Pay Lot 1 which has no address but is located in the 900 block of E 7th Street, but the report was taken at IUPD headquarters. Primary Cause- Because the other vehicle left the scene, it is unknown what caused the crash.Type Crash- Because the other vehicle left the scene, it is unknown what type of crash occurred.D1 Driver Factors: Because D1 left the scene, it is unknown what or if any driver factors played a role.D1 Environmental Factors: Because D1 left the scene, it is unknown what or if any environmental factors played a role.D1 Vehicle Factors: Because D1 left the scene, it is unknown what or if any vehicle factors played a role. D2 Environmental Factors: D2 was not in the vehicle, so it is unknown what or if any environmental factors played a role.D2 Vehicle Factors: D2 was not in the vehicle, so it is unknown what or if any vehicle factors played a role. V2 was parked in the south side of the IMU Pay Lot 1 facing east. D2 stated that she had parked her vehicle in the parking lot at approximately 1430 hours on 10/30/2019. D2 stated she returned to her vehicle at approximately 1530 hours and noticed that she had damage to her passenger side rear door and quarter panel. I observed white paint transfer to V2's rear passenger side door and rear passenger side quarter panel. D2 stated that she did not see any identifying information pertaining to the other driver on or near her vehicle. D2 did not complain of injuries. There are no known suspects or suspect vehicles at the time. The only known information pertaining to the suspect vehicle is that it is white.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS SB ON N HARTSTRAIT RD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF N HARTSTRAIT RD AND W RATLIFF RD. DRIVER 2 ADVISED VEHICLE 1 CROSSED THE CENTER LINE AS IT WAS COMING DOWN THE HILL LOCATED AT THIS INTERSECTION STRIKING VEHICLE 2.

V1 was traveling southbound on Jordan Avenue, north of V2, prior to the collision. V2 was traveling southbound on Jordan Avenue, south of V1, prior to the collision. V1 WAS TURNING LEFT OUT OF THE KROGER SOUTH PARKING LOT ONTO S OLD STATE ROAD 37. D1 STATED THAT HE LOOKED BOTH WAYS PRIOR TO TURNING OUT, HOWEVER LOOKED TO THE RIGHT (NORTH) LAST. V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE IN THE RIGHT LANE APPROACHING 1ST STREET.V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON COLLEGE AVE INTHE LEFT LANE APPROACHING 1ST STREET.D1 SAID AS SHE MERGED INTO THE LEFT LANE HER OUTSIDE LEFT TURNSIGNAL WAS ON AND THE WARNING SIGNAL DID NOT GO OFF SO SHE KNEW IT WAS SAFE TO CHANGE LANES. Driver 1 (D1) advised that he was traveling eastbound on E 7th Street. KINSER PIKE, WHEN ALL OF THE SUDDEN THE TRAFFIC INFRONT OF ME STARTED TO COME TO A STOP, AS I STARTED TO STOP AND SLOW DOWN I WAS REAR ENDED BY V1".V1/D1 STATED "I WAS BEHIND V2, EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46 IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. ALL OF THE SUDDEN TRAFFIC STARTED TO STOP, I TRIED TO STOP AND DUE TO THE STANDING WATER, AND INTENSE RAINFALL, I STARTED TO HYDROPLANE AND I COLLIDED WITH V2".

V2 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC BEHIND AN UNINVOLVED VEHICLE, WHEN V1 SIDESWIPED V2. D1 ATTEMPTED TO MANEUVER AROUND V2, BUT SHE WAS TO CLOSE TO V2. CONSEQUENTLY, V1 COLLIDED WITH V2.

V1 and V2 were driving westbound on 3rd Street from the area of Highland Avenue. Haluda went there and met with her to get her statement.No crash diagram was completed since all vehicles had been moved from the scene. Paths of vehicles and position of finalrest are unknown.

NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST BOUND THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF WEST ALLEN ST AND SOUTH ADAMS STREET. V2 WAS TRVELING SOUTH BOUND THROUGH THE SAME INTERSECTION. THE FRONT OF V1 CRASHED INTO THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2.BOTH VEHICLES MOVED FROM THE SPOT OF COLLISON PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

V1 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET NEAR S PETE ELLIS DRIVE BEHIND V2. V2 WAS TRAVELING WB ON E 3RD STREET BEHIND V3. AS V2 AND V3 BEGAN TO SLOW FOR STOPPED TRAFFIC AHEAD, THE FRONT OF V1 PROCEEDED TO COLLIDE WITH THE REAR OF V2 WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY CAUSED THE FRONT OF V2 TO COLLIDED INTO THE REAR OF V3.D1 STATED THAT ONCE SHE REALIZED THAT THE VEHICLES AHEAD WERE BRAKING, SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME BEFORE THE COLLISION. D2 STATED THAT HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND WHICH CAUSE HER VEHICLE TO COLLIDE WITH V3.D3 STATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED FOR TRAFFIC AT WHICH POINT SHE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND. BOTH D2 AND D3 STATED THAT V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1 WHICH INITIATED THE CHAIN REACTION ACCIDENT.

V1 was traveling westbound on 10th Street towards Indiana Avenue. V2 was traveling eastbound on 10th Street attempting to turn north onto Indiana Avenue. V1 witnessed the light turn yellow before he entered the intersection and continued to try and make it through the intersection. V2 was sitting in the middle of the intersection waiting for the light to turn red so she could complete her turn. The light turned red and V2 attempted to complete the turn. V1 continued through the intersection while the light was red and collided with the front of V2. V1 had moderate damage to the front driver side bumper. V2 had moderate damage to the entire front bumper. D1 stated that he was traveling straight and saw the light turn yellow well before he entered the intesection. D1 stated that he thought he had enough time to make it through the intersection and never looked back up to see if the light had turned red. D1 stated V1 then struck V2 as V2 was attempting to turn. D2 stated that she was waiting in the intersection to turn. D2 stated that she saw the light turn red and thought that V1 was going to stop prior to the intersection. D2 stated that she then attempted the turn and V1 did not stop for the light. D2 stated that V1 then collided with V2. There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed.

At approximately 1259 hours on 11/2/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 just east of the intersection of Overhill Drive and 3rd Street. V1 attempted to turn east onto 3rd, from Overhill, and collided with V2 who was travelling westbound on 3rd. Superintendent Hunter was flagged down by one of the drivers and I responded shortly after. V1 was travelling southbound on Overhill and stopped at the intersection of Overhill and 3rd. D1 advised that a large silver truck was blocking both westbound lanes on 3rd and he could not see if the turn lane was occupied. D1 advised that he pulled out, intending to turn east onto 3rd, and collided with V2. There was minor cosmetic damage to the bumper of V1. D1 did not complain of injury.V2 was westbound on 3rd in the center turn lane, approaching the intersection of 3rd and Overhill. D2 advised that out of nowhere V1 had turned and collided with her vehicle. D2 stated that she could not stop her vehicle in time to avoid collision. D2 complained of pain to her lower right leg. An ambulance was requested and D2 later declined to be transported. V1 had disabling damage to the passenger side front bumper and was towed by Hawkin's.

On Saturday, November 2, 2019, at approximately 22:10, I was dispatched to a report of a car/deer collision that occurred on State Road 37 southbound near the intersection of Smithville Road, in Bloomington, Monroe County, Indiana. I arrived at around 22:20 and observed a silver GMC Acadia parked on the right side of the roads with its flashers activated, leaking fluids heavily. A debris field was scattered across the highway to the north of where the vehicle was stopped. The highway in this area is a primarily north-south 4-lane divided highway, that connects the cities of Bloomington and Bedford, with a grassy center median. The road surface is asphalt, newly repaved, and at this time was dry and clear of any foreign substances. The lighting was dark due to time of day, with no natural illumination, and the weather was approximately 40 degrees Fahrenheit. The road has painted lane control and shoulders on both inner and outer sides, and is equipped with rumble strips (lane departure warning system). Vehicle 1 was a GMC Silver 2017 Acadia, bearing Indiana In God We Trust plates AAF784, driven by and registered to Bryan Staggs (DOB: 03/30/1984). The vehicle displayed massive front end damage, as well as damage to the undercarriage, both front quarter panels, and the hood. The driver's side door would not open and the vehicle had lost all of its fluids on the road. The driver stated that he was driving southbound on SR 37, in the left lane, just south of the junction of Smithville Road, when a large buck (male deer) jumped in front of his vehicle from the east (median). With no time to react he instantly collided with the deer. He then braked heavily and came to a controlled stop on the right shoulder of the road. He advised that neither him nor his female passenger were injured, and refused treatment.An investigation of the area showed marks consistent with striking the deer approxiately 100 meters north of where the vehicle came to rest on the west shoulder of the highway. A dead male deer was located in the center grassy median, showing marks consistent with having been struck by a vehicle. The driver phoned Mikel's towing in Bedford to remove his vehicle, which was non-drivable, from the edge of the highway. Based upon the evidence at the scene, It is likely that the following occurred: While driving southbound on SR37, a deer ran into the roadway, causing an unavoidable collision. As such, the driver is not at fault.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS EASTBOUND ON W VERNAL PIKE WHEN V2 PULLED OUT OF THE TRAILER PARK, INTO HER VEHICLE.D2 STATED HE WAS WAITING TO PULL OUT OF THE TRAILER PARK WHEN A TRUCK WAS COMING THROUGH. HE LET THE TRUCK GO THROUGH AND DID NOT NOTICE V1 BEHIND THE TRUCK WHEN HE STARTED TO PULL OUT. HE DID STATE THAT V1 WAS DRIVING WITHOUT HEADLIGHTS ON. WHEN I ARRIVED ON SCENE, THE VEHICLES HAD BEEN MOVED OUT OF THE ROADWAY. AS I CHECKED V1, I NOTICED THE PASSENGER SIDE HEADLIGHT AND ASSEMBLY WAS BUSTED AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT. HOWEVER, THE DRIVERS SIDE HEADLIGHT DID NOT APPEAR TO BE OPERATIONAL BUT I DID OBSERVE A FLASHING AMBER LIGHT.D2 WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE INSURANCE INFORMATION AND WAS ISSUED A MISDEMEANOR CITATION FOR OPERATING WITHOUT EVER RECEIVING A LICENSE AND AN INFRACTION CITATION FOR NO FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY.

Driver was south bound on State Road 37 South when a deer entered the roadway. Driver made struck the deer with the right front headlight area causing minimal damage. When the driver struck the deer she swerved to the left causing the vehicle to spin completely around coming to rest facing west bound in the median.

D1 stated he was heading North on Walnut and had just past through the intersection at 2nd street.D2 stated that traffic started to stop and he struck V2 in the rear.D2 stated she was driving North on Walnut slowing down due to a traffic back-up and was struck in the rear by V1.Both drivers advised they did not need an ambulance at first.D2 later stated that her head was starting to hurt so she wanted an ambulance to check her out. Ambulance arrived and checked D2 but she refused to go to the hospital and signed a medical release form.

V1 WAS BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPACE IN THE PARKING LOT OF 3583 WEST STATE ROAD 45. V2 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH BOUND DIRECTLY BEHIND V1. V1 BACKED INTO THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. BOTH VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

DRIVER STATED SHE WAS SOUTHBOUND ON SR 446 WHEN SHE NOTICED A DEER JUMP INTO THE ROADWAY FROM THE WEST. AS SHE ATTEMPTED TO STOP HER VEHICLE, SHE HIT THE DEER WITH HER FRONT DRIVERS SIDE HEADLIGHT AREA.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 is unknown as they left the scene.D2 stated she was not present when her vehicle was hit. D2 stated she had went to the auto shop to purchase items to repair her car when she received a call from her neighbor regarding her car being hit. D2 stated she returned home and noticed her car had been pushed towards the curb and her front bumper and hood had sustained damage.W1 ( Dale Jones) stated he was sitting inside his home at 1102 W. 12th St. W1 stated after he heard a loud crash he walked outside a saw a 4 door pale green Crysler bumper to bumper with his neighbors grey Chevrolet Lumina. W1 stated a young black male exited the pale green vehicle and saw the damage caused then entered back into his vehicle and left eastbound on W. 12th St.W2 ( Dennis Ludwig) stated he was sitting on his porch when a green 4 door car stopped in the middle of the road while traveling east on W 12th St. W2 stated the green vehicle collided with the grey Chevrolet Lumina that was parked on the side of the street. W2 stated a black male exited the green vehicle, looked at the damage, then entered into his car and left eastbound on W. 12th St.
Driver #1 stated he was driving north on 446 when several deer entered the roadway and he was unable to avoid hitting one.

V1,V2 AND V3 WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST AND AT THE INTERSECTION WITH S PETE ELLIS DR WHEN V1 STRUCK THE REAR BUMPER PORTION OF V2 WHICH THEN FORCED V2 INTO THE REAR BUMPER PORTION OF V3. V1/D1 STATED HE THOUGHT THE HEAVILY CONGESTED TRAFFIC HAD STARTED TO MOVE IN FRONT OF HIM, HOWEVER, UPON REALIZING IT HADN'T HE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID COLLIDING INTO V2 AS IT WAS STOPPED AND IN FRONT OF HIM. V2/D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED DUE TO THE TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HER WHEN HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V1, WHICH THEN FORCED HER VEHICLE INTO THE REAR BUMPER PORTION OF V3. V3/D3 STATED HE WAS STOPPED DUE TO THE TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE WHEN HIS VEHICLE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V2. V1 SUSTAINED HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE AND WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE BY AUTO MOBILE SERVICES. V2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO BOTH THE REAR AND FRONT BUMPER PORTIONS. HOWEVER, THE VEHICLE WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE. V3 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE REAR BUMPER PORTION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was driving west on Country Club road, and was approaching the intersection of S Rockport Road. D1 stated that as she approached the intersection, she was going to turn south onto Rockport Road. D1 stated that her traffic light was a flashing yellow arrow when she made the turn. D1 stated that as she made the turn, she did not see V2 approaching from the opposite direction, and collided with D2. The front end of V1 collided with the front end of V2.D2 stated that she was driving east on Country Club, and approaching the intersection of S Rockport Road. D2 stated that as she approached the intersection, D1 began turning south onto Rockport Road. D2 stated that she was unable to stop in time and collided head on with V1.D2 had a complaint of neck pain and was treated at the scene only. The two children in the back of V2 had small cuts on their lips from biting their lips at the time of the accident, and one child, Hongjie Lin, had a broken tooth.D2 had her driver's license from Taiwan, #19825105, as well as an International Driver's Permit.

D2 was driving westbound in the left hand lane on 3rd Street near the intersection of 3rd and Jordan Avenue when V2 was struck by a driver in the right hand lane. D1 left the scene of the initial accident, however due to the damage on the vehicle, it was evident that D1 had attempted to change into the left lane, hitting V2. I first spoke to D2 who stated that she was driving westbound on 3rd Street in the left lane going straight. She stated she had just been starting into traffic on a green light when the accident occurred. D2 stated that as she was passing V1 in the left lane, she noticed it appeared to have its turn signal on as though it was going to make a lane change. It was at this time that she realized V1 changed lanes, suddenly striking V2. I spoke to W1 who stated he works at Bear's Place. He stated that he was walking behind Bear's Place when the accident occurred. W1 stated he heard the accident as it was loud, he then went out to the roadway to make sure there were no injuries, and when he did, he witnessed D1 leave the scene. W1 stated he saw D1 get out of his car (which he noticed was a Mercedes Sprinter Van) and ask D2 if she was okay. He then saw D1 attempt to pick up debris from the accident. At this time, W1 lost sight of D1 as he was helping D2 get the vehicle out of the roadway. He then went to see where D1went and he noticed that D1 had left the scene, driven 1 block west turning left onto Highland. He saw that D1 had parked V1 in a spot off Highland, and at this time, he saw D1 driving southbound on some type of moped or scooter. D2 did not sustain injuries, however her vehicle was towed due to disabling damage.On 11/2/19 D1 came to IUPD to attempt to get his vehicle. I was able to get his information at this time, and at 2005 hours, I had D1 meet me at IUPD to speak with him about the incident the night before. D1 stated that he is from Elkhart, IN and was just in town for parent's weekend for his daughter's sorority. He stated the vehicle is a work vehicle, as he works for Midwest Automotive Designs, and he had planned to use it to drive his daughter around for the weekend. D1 stated he had been driving in the left lane, westbound on 3rd Street, near 3rd and Jordan. D1 stated he had planned to turn left just past the intersection to turn into the Village Pantry parking lot. D1 stated he had his turn signal on, and just after the intersection, he turned left to turn into the lot. When he did, all of a sudden, V2 "came out of nowhere" and the vehicles collided. Sullivan stated he believed that D2 ran into him initially. D1 then stated he got out of the vehicle and went over to D2, asking if she was okay. When she said she was okay, he then left and drove one block west to Highland and parked his vehicle on the side of the road. D1 then walked back to the initial crash scene but did not see D2 anywhere. He stated he had seen the bystanders helping her move her car out of the roadway, but he thought she had left as he no longer saw her. D1 stated he then went back to the van realizing his phone was dead. At this time, he grabbed a motorized scooter he had in his van, and decided he could drive it back to his hotel. D1 stated he went back to Village Pantry one final time looking for D2 but when he couldn't find her a second time, he then left. D2 remained in the area of the crash the entire time. At no time did D1 attempt to ask bystanders to use their phone to call police nor did he ask bystanders if they knew where D2 had gone. D1 also could not explain why there was no plate on V1. D1 stated he did not remove any plate from the vehicle. V1 is not a registered vehicle through Indiana, however I was given a dealer license plate and insurance information from Midwest Automotive Designs. The plate given that may or may not have been on the vehicle was Indiana Dealer plate 5740C. It is still unclear if there was ever a plate on the vehicle or if it was removed. Nevertheless using the dealer plate for perso

Vehicle 2 was parked facing south in the parking lot of 3204 W State Rd 45. There were no vehicles around the Owner's vehicle at that time. The damage appears vehicle 1 struck vehicle 2 when pulling into or out of its parking spot.I attempted to review footage of the accident at 3204 W State Rd 45 but was unable to witness the vehicle due to it being parked to far away.

Driver was south bound on Louden Rd going up a large hill when another vehicle was north bound. When the 2 vehicles met the driver of vehicle 1 stated the other vehicle swerved into his lane. Driver 1 swerved to avoid the vehicle and ran off of the west side of the road striking an embankment causing damage. The other vehicle did not make contact with Driver 1s vehicle.

D1 stated she was heading East on 4th Street approaching Walnut Street. D1 stated she stopped at the stop light due to it being red. D1 stated when her light turned green she proceeded through the intersecton and was struck by V2. D1 stated she believes D2 ran a red light. D2 stated he was heading North on Walnut Street approaching 4th Street. D2 stated he had a green light and was driving through the intersection when D1 ran a red light. D2 stated that he struck V1 in the passenger side. After V1 and V2 collided D1 lost control of her vehicle and went off the roadway and struck a light pole. Note:There is a camera pointing in the intersection.I am making contact with ITS with the City of Bloomington to get the video footage.Investigation is not complete at this time.

V1 was traveling eastbound on South Dr. at approximately 1:30am. V1 left the roadway and struck a gate and gate post. V1 then left the scene.A passerby did observe the crash scene later in the morning and called the police.D1 did call in approximately 8 hours later to report the accident as Officers were already at the crash scene. D1 stated that she fell asleep while driving and struck something. She was not sure of what she struck, maybe a gate, but did not think she struck anyone. She then drove home and was unable to find her phone for 8 hours.Officer Gilmore did follow a fluid trail to D1's house from the crash scene. D1 did call in as Officer Gilmore was about to arrive at her houseV1 did strike a gate causing substantial damage to the gate and V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE HAD JUST GOT GAS AT THE KROGER GAS STATION AND WAS DRIVING UP AN ISLE LOOKING FOR A PARKING SPACE. D1 WAS STOPPED AS THERE WAS A VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HER WAITING FOR ANOTHER VEHICLE TO BACK OUT. V2 THEN BACKED INTO V1 ON THE DRIVERS REAR DOOR. D2 EXITED THE VEHICLE AND TOLD D1 THAT SHE DIDNT SEE ANY DAMAGE AND GOT BACK INTO V2 AND TOOK OFF. At approximately 1120 hours on 11/3/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 in the northbound lanes just south of the intersection of 17th and the Bypass. V1 was travelling northbound in the far east lane and rear ended V2.D1 stated that the light at 17th and the Bypass had just turned yellow as both vehicles were approaching the intersection. She stated that she believed V1 would continue through the light, but they suddenly stopped. D1 stated she could not stop in time to prevent a collision. D1 stated that she was travelling approximately 30mph. There was very minor cosmetic damage to V1.D2 stated that they were sitting stopped just south of the intersection of 17th and the Bypass, waiting for the light to turn from red to green. D2 advised they heard V1 honk it's horn and then suddenly rear end their vehicle. There was damage to the trunk and rear bumper of V1.Neither party complained of injury, nor requested medical aid.

V1 STRUCK V2 IN THE INTERSECTION OF WALNUT STREET AND 2ND STREET.D1 STATED IT WAS HIS FAULT. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT NOTICE THE RED LIGHT AND PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND THEREFORE STRUCK V2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE.D2 STATED THAT HE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT AND WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF 2ND AND WALNUT. D2 STATED THAT HE PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND WAS STRUCK BY V1.
