On Monday, November 18, 2019 at 13:50, I responded to a one car, car vs deer crash at milepost 112.5 on I-69 north bound . At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry.Vehicle 1, a 2013 black, GMC Terrain, was traveling north bound in the right lane. A deer crossed into the path of vehicle 1. Driver 1 was unable to avoid colliding with the deer. Vehicle 1 struck the deer with vehicle 1's front bumper and grill. The deer then hit the left front fender of vehicle 1.Driver 1 gave statements supporting the above narrative.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1/D1 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46. WE HAD JUST PASSED THROUGH THE LIGHT AT N. KINSER PIKE. ALL OF THE SUDDEN V2 WAS SLIDDING TO A STOP DUE TO TRAFFIC STOPPING IN FRONT OF V2. I TRIED TO STOP AND SLIDE INTO V2."V2/D2 STATED "I WAS IN FRONT OF V1, IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL EASTBOUND. THE TRAFFIC CAME TO A STOP IN FRONT OF ME, I SLIDE TO A STOP AND WAS THEN REAR ENDED BY V1." ROADWAY SURFACE WAS WET, TEMP WAS 38 DEGREES AT THE TIME OF ACCIDENT. NO ICE PRESENT.

D1/D2 were headed S/B on S Curry Pike, approaching the intersection of W 3rd St. D2 stopped in traffic at the intersection. D1 failed to stop in time, causing V1 to strike V2 in the rear. D1 stated that he was headed S/B on S Curry Pike, approaching the intersection of W 3rd St. D1 stated that he stopped in traffic behind V2. D1 stated that he believed V2 began to drive forward, so he let off his brakes. D1 stated that he then realized that V2 was not moving, however at this time V1 struck V2 in the rear. D2 stated that She was headed S/B on S Curry Pike, approaching the intersection of W 3rd St.D2 stated that a vehicle in front of her was at the intersection stalled in the roadway. D2 stated that as she waited for the vehicle in front of her to clear the roadway she was struck from the rear by V1.

V1 was in the parking lot of 2929 S McIntire Drive after a doctor's appointment. While attempting to pull out from parking space V1 accelerated and collided with the building at the door entrance causing damage to both the front end of V1 and the door of the business.D1 stated that he was attempting to pull forward to allow space for a passenger to get in the vehicle and the brakes would not work when he attempted to apply them. D1 stated that V1 then collided with the front of 2929 S McIntire Drive.There was no video footage or witness accounts.Pictures were taken on scene.

Driver 1 was traveling westbound on West Sample Road approaching a hard right hand curve just south of North Canyon Court when he advised he ran off the roadway and continued straight through the curve. Driver 1 stated it was dark and he did not realize the curve was there and was unable to stop in time. Driver 1 continued through the curve and struck a REMC utility pole (number 18989018) breaking it in half. Driver 1 had complaint of pain in his chest and was transported by IU Health Ambulance 206. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy front end damage and was towed by Blands wrecker service. Vehicle 1 was moved prior to my arrival down the roadway into a residential driveway.

UNIT 1 WAS STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF S OLD STATE ROAD 37 AND W HOBART RD. AFTER COMING TO A STOP, UNIT 1 THEN OBSERVED UNIT 2 SOUTHBOUND ON S OLD SR 37 IN A PICKUP TRUCK AND TRAILER. UNIT 1 ADVISED THEY DID NOT SEE THE TRAILER THAT UNIT 2 WAS PULLING. UNIT 1 THEN PROCEEDED INTO THE INTERSECTION TOO EARLY, AND COLLIDED WITH THE TRAILER. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 2 STATED THAT HE DID NOT OWN THE TRAILER AND DID NOT HAVE ANY SPECIFIC INFORMATION REGARDING IT. UNIT 2 DRIVER STATED THAT THE OWNER WAS A MR. KEVIN LEECH AND COULD BE RACHED AT 812-272-3923. I WAS UNABLE TO CONTACT MR. LEECH TO OBTAIN THE INFORMATION REGARDING THE TRAILER.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH ROGERS STREET NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF PARGRAVE PLACE. VEHICLE WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 1, WHILE VEHICLE 1 WAS ATTEMPTING A LEFT TURN ONTO SOUTH ROGERS STREET. VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHEAST COMING OFF OF PARGRAVE PLACE STRIKING VEHICLE 2 IN THE FRONT DOOR ON THE DRIVER SIDE.BOTH DRIVERS WERE UNNJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT. BTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

Driver 1 stated she was westbound on SR 46 approaching the intersection with SR446 in the left lane. Driver 1 stated that a car had stopped in front of her to turn left at the intersection. Driver 1 stated she did not see vehicle 2 coming up along side her and changed lanes into the right lane to go around the turning vehicle, colliding with vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated she was westbound on SR 46 approaching SR 446 in the right lane. Driver 2 stated when she reached the intersection, vehicle 1 changed lanes from the left lane into the right lane and collided with her vehicle as she was going by.

V1 was parking to the east (right) of V2. V1 was backing up north and turned too sharply, striking the passenger's side of V2. V1 was facing north in the parking spot. D1 stated she just backed out of the spot and turned too sharply. V1's right front driver's side bumper struck V2's passenger side front door. D1 stated she did not need medical attention.

V1 was traveling eastbound on State Road 46. V2 was traveling westbound on State Road 46. V1 crossed the center lane into V2's lane of travel. V1 sideswiped V2 causing damage to both vehicles on the driver's side. D1 stated while traveling eastbound a deer jumped into the roadway. D1 stated he attempted to avoid the deer by overcorrecting to the left. D1 stated when he attempted to avoid the deer by turning left, he had a "back spasm" that prevented him from correcting. D1 stated he then struck V2. V1 had damage along the entire driver's side of V1. V1 also had a flat left front tire. D2 stated while driving westbound he saw V1 cross the center lane into his lane of travel. D2 stated he attempted to get to the far right as much as possible without driving off the road. V2 had damage to the front left fender and to one of the wheels. Both drivers denied EMS.

V2 was traveling northbound on N. Mt. Tbor Road. D2 stated that she was stopped in the roadway for a construction vehicle that was backing into a driveway along N. Mt. Tabor Rd where there is a new house being built. D2 stated that V1 was traveling behind her and attempted to go around her and sideswiped her vehicle and continued down the road. D1 stated that he was unable to stop before rear ending V2 so he attempted to go around V2 in the southbound lane. D1 stated that he did not realize that V1 made contact with V2 and that is why he continued on down the road. I took the accident report at N. Mt Tabor Road & W Megans Way, however the crash occurred somewhere along N Mt Tabor Rd near a new home construction site. I believe the crash occurred near the intersection of N Mt Tabor Rd & W Cowden Rd, however I am unable to confirm with 100% certainty. Neither vehicle sustained disabling damage in the crash.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON S ROCKPORT RD IN THE AREA OF THE INTERSECTION OF S VICTOR PIKE. THE DRIVER STATED THAT UNIT 1 BEGAN TO SLIDE SO HE APPLIED THE BRAKES, BUT THE ABS SYSTEM FAILED. THE UNIT THEN LEFT THE ROADWAY AT THE INTERSECTION, STRUCK A GUIDEWIRE ON A UTILITY POLE, AND BECAME INVERTED. AFTER COMING TO A REST, UNIT 1 WAS ON ITS TOP, FACING SOUTH. THE DRIVER HAD A SMALL COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HIS SIDE, BUT REFUSED TRANSPORT FROM MEDICAL.

Primary Cause- Environmental- Animal Object in Roadway- Vehicle#1 was traveling southbound on State Road 37 approximately 2640 feet south of Monroe Dam Road when a deer came from the center median and struck the front left side of Vehicle#1. State Road 37 is a four lane asphalt road with lane markings divided by a center grass median in Monroe County. The speed limit is 60 miles per hour. In this specific location of State Road 37 the roadway is level and straight. The area has no street lights and it was dark at the time of the crash.Vehicle#1 (Black 2017 Buick Envision) was traveling southbound on State Road 37 in the left lane approximately 2640 feet south of Monroe Dam Road, driven by Driver#1 Stacie D. Porter. A deer came from the center grass median and struck the left front side of Vehicle#1. After the collision Vehicle#1 came to a controlled stop on the west shoulder of State Road 37. Driver#1 declined medical attention offered by Trooper Cody R. Brown. Vehicle#1 did not have disabling damages and was driven from the scene by Driver#1. Driver#1 (Stacie D. Porter) stated she was traveling south on State Road 37 in the left lane traveling at approximately 66 miles per hour. Driver#1 then stated a deer came from the center grass median and stuck the front left side of her vehicle. Driver#1 said she came to a complete stop on the right shoulder and waited for assistance to arrive. I observed damage to the left front side of Vehicle#1. The front bumper was busted and the headlight was broken. Deer hair was located on the front left fender of Vehicle#1. No public property damage was located at the crash scene.

Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: On Tuesday, November 19, 2019 at 14:30, Ryan Miller responded to a crash on S Old State Road 37 approximately 500 ft south of State Rd 37. At the time of the crash, the weather was lightly raining and the road surface was wet. Old SR37S is a two lane asphalt county road. V1, red Chevrolet, was traveling north on Old SR37 approaching a right hand curve south of SR37. V2, silver Chrysler, was traveling south on Old SR37 approaching a left hand curve south of SR37. V1 traveled left of center into the southbound lane. V1 struck the front of V2 with the front of V1 in the southbound lane of Old SR37.D1, Frye, stated he was traveling north on Old SR37 approaching the right hand curve. D1 stated he attempted to slow but V1 began to slide on the wet roadway. D1 stated he slid across the center line and struck the front of V2 with the front of V1.D2, Harris, stated she was traveling south on Old SR37. D2 stated V1 traveled across the center line into the southbound lane. D2 stated V1 struck the front of V2.Evidence shows damage to the front of V1 and the front of V2 consistent with a head on collision. Evidence shows it was lightly raining and the roadway was wet during the accident investigation.

On 11/20/19 at approximately 10:30 A.M. I, Indiana Conservation Officer Bohbrink was at Bloomington Fish and Wildlife Office when State Employee Joe Caudell advised he'd been involved in an accident the night before with his state vehicle. Mr. Caudell stated on 11/19/19 at 6:02 P.M. while heading east bound on State Rd. 46 East he struck a deer with his DNR vehicle. The location was near the intersection of State Rd. 46 East and Gettys Creek Rd. Joe Caudell stated at the time of the accident he was wearing his seat belt and traveling approximately 50 mph. He indicated the road conditions were wet and it was drizzling rain at the time of the incident. He was the only occupant in the vehicle. He indicated attempts were made to slow down prior to hitting the deer but was unable to avoid it. Once the accident occurred he managed to drive the vehicle back to Bloomington Fish and Wildlife. Damage sustained to the vehicle was concentrated to the front end. Photos were taken of the damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated he was traveling north on S. Walnut St. and attempting to turn west into 2200 S. Walnut St (nissan Community). D1 stated one lane of south bound traffic was stopped and had created space for him to turn. D1 stated he turned left without regard of the second southbound lane of traffic. D1 stated as he turned, V2 collided with the back passenger side of his vehicle causing damage to both vehicles.D2 stated he was traveling south on S. Walnut St. D2 stated one southbound lane of traffic was stopped. D2 stated V1 turned west in front of through one lane of southbound traffic. D2 stated he was unable to stop in time and collided with the back passenger side of V1 causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that he was on S Walnut Street Pike, facing southeast, stopped at E Winslow Road. D1 stated that he came to a complete stop, and believed that the intersection was clear, so he proceeded south. V1 was then struck on the passenger side by V2. D2 stated that he did not see V2, and also stated that the construction made is difficult for him to see the oncoming traffic.D2 stated that she was traveling eastbound on E Winslow road, approaching the intersection of S Walnut Street Pike, when V1 pulled in front of her. D2 stated that she attempted to turn right to avoid V1, but was unsuccessful and struck the vehicle. W1 stated that he was behind V2, and saw V1 pull in front of V2 when V2 had the right of way. Neither driver stated that they were injured.V2 had smoke coming from the battery, so it was towed by Kens Westside for safety. V1 was able to be driven from the scene.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.3rd Street is a two lane, one way road that travels westbound.V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street in the northmost lane.V2 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street in the southmost lane (adjacent to V1). D1 stated that a vehicle was slowing down in front of her and she wanted to change lanes. She stated she checked her mirror and thought the lane was open. She then made a lane change and collided into V2. The collision caused damage to the rear, drivers side door.D2 stated she was traveling in the adjacent lane, and slightly behind, V1. V1 made a lane change into her lane of travel which made contact and primarily destroyed her passenger side mirror. In an attempt to avoid the collision, D2 went onto the southmost sidewalk and slightly collided with a telephone pole support cable. The collision with the cable caused no visible damage.There was no reported injuries during the investigation. Both vehicles were able to be driven from scene.

V1 was traveling East on State Road 45/46. V2 was traveling in front of V1 going east. V3 was traveling west on State Road 45/46. V2 was slowing to a stop due to traffic, V1 attempted to stop and collided with the rear driver side of V2. V1 then lost control and veered across the center median and collided with the front passenger side of V3. V1 then drove off of the roadway and came to a stop roughly 40 feet from the road in a ditch.D1 stated that he saw that vehicles were stopping in front of him and he attempted to stop but was unable to control the vehicle. D1 stated that he then hit the rear of V2 and then collided with the front passenger side of V3.D2 stated that he was almost at a complete stop when he felt a vehicle collide with the rear of his vehicle. D2 did not get a good look at the vehicle but observed the vehicle drive towards the westbound lanes.D3 stated that he observed V1 becoming out of control and he began to slow down. D3 stated that v1 then hit another car and veered over the median and into his lane striking the front passenger side of his vehicle.V1 and V2 were both towed from the scene due to disabling damage.V3 was driven from the scene.

D1-PARCELS STRUCK A DEER WHILE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 45 NEAR W HINDS ROAD. D1 STATED THE DEER RAN FROM THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD AND HE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID HITTING IT. D1 WAS ABLE TO DRIVE V1 TO A FRIENDS HOUSE NEARBY AT 8333 W HINDS ROAD WHERE I TOOK THE REPORT. THERE WAS FRESH DEER HAIR AND BLOOD ON THE FRONT OF V1.

V1 was driving west on 10th St approaching the intersection of 10th St and Walnut Grove Ave. V2 was slowing for traffic at the intersection of 10th St and Walnut Grove Ave going west.D1 stated she was driving west on 10th St approaching the intersection of 10th St and Walnut Grove Ave when V2 suddenly stopped in front of her. D1 stated that she attempted to brake but could not stop in time and collided with the rear bumper of V1. D1 stated that her tires did not skid but she just could not react fast enough.D2 stated that she was driving west and slowing for traffic at the intersection of 10th St and Walnut Grove Ave when V1 collided with her rear bumper.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE STREET, THERE ARE SIGNS THAT STATE NO PARKING. D1 WAS BACKING OUT OF HER DRIVEWAY AND DID NOT SEE V2 PARKED ON THE STREET. V1 BACKED INTO V2, THERE WAS NO VISIABLE DAMAGE TO V2. V1 HAD A BROKEN TAIL LIGHT AND REAR BUMPER COVER WAS DAMAGED. VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.

D2 came to the Bloomington Police Station on 11/20/2019 at 11:25 hours to report this incident, which occurred the day before. D2 stated that himself and D1 exchanged information on scene and did not want police. D2 then decided that a report would be needed and came to police. D2 provided me with the information he had on D1, however I was unable to make contact with D1. I only have the information provided by D2 and cannot corroborate any of the information given. This report is only an account of what D2 has stated. D2 stated that he was traveling westbound on the SR 45/46 Bypass approximately 300 feet west of the N Kinser Pike intersection. D2 stated that the construction in the area had the road down to one lane. D2 stated that as he was continuing westbound, he was struck in the rear by V1, causing damage. D2 stated that at the time of the accident he did not want a police report, but after getting an appraisal for $1,700.00, he decided to get one. I advised D2 that if D1 is able to contact the department and provide their statement, this report will be supplemented. Supplement #1: V1 information updated. D1 provided their account of this incident. D1 stated that they were traveling westbound on the SR 45/46 Bypass, just west of N Kinser Pike, behind V2. D1 stated that V1 experienced steering failure and the automatic emergency braking was applied. D1 stated that V1 came to a rest against V2. D1 said that she and D2 examined both V1 and V2 and did not see any damage, and decided to not call police. D1 does not believe that V2 was damaged due to this incident.

SPOKE TO D2 AT COMFORT INN AT 1700 N KINSER PIKE.HE V2 WAS WESTBOUND ON 17TH ST APPROACHING KINSER PIKE. HE SAID V1 BACKED OUT OF THE DRIVE WAY AT 320 W 17TH ST AND HIT V2.HE SAID AFTER EXCHANGING INFORMATION THEY BOTH HAD TO LEAVE FOR WORK/CLASS.I HAVE NOT SPOKEN TO D1 YET.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: UNIT WAS TRAVELING W ON W POINTE RD FROM THE INTERSECTION WITH S FAIRFAX RD. THE UNIT THEN LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A TREE ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF POINTE RD. THE DRIVER STATED THE TRUCK "GOT AWAY FROM HIM". AND PASSERBY STATED THAT UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING AWAY FROM THE INTERSECT VERY QUICKLY AND LOST CONTROL. THE ON CALL TOW COMPANY WAS CALLED, BUT AFTER THE TOW TRUCK WAS ABLE TO RETURN THE TRUCK THE ROADWAY, THE TRUCK WAS ABLE TO BE MOVED TO A NEABRY PARKINGLOT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON W. 2ND ST WHEN SHE WAS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S. ADAMS ST WHEN THE LIGHT WAS TURNING FROM YELLOW TO RED AND THAT SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION AND STRUCK THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON S. ADAMS ST NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH W. 2ND ST WHEN V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION ON A RED LIGHT AND STRUCK THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE QUARTER PANEL OF HER VEHICLE. W1 STATED THAT SHE WAS BEHIND V2 WHEN V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION ON A RED LIGHT AND STRUCK V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was traveling west on E. Winslow Rd. D1 stated she thought her side of the road received both a green light and a green turn arrow. D1 stated she did not receive a green light, just a green turn arrow. D1 stated she proceeded through the intersection and collided with V2 as V2 was attempting to turn left. D1 admitted she ran a read light. D1 was checked out by EMS on scene, but refused further treatment. D2 stated she was sitting at a red light on W. Country Club Dr. Preparing to turn north onto S. Walnut St. D2 stated she received a green turn arrow and began to proceed through the intersection. D2 stated V1 ran through a red traveling west through the intersection and collided with her vehicle head on. D2 initially reported she had no injuries, but prior to leaving the scene she reported her face, hip, and knee were all sore. EMS had already left scene so she was not evaluated.D3 stated he was sitting at a red light on W. Country Club Dr preparing to turn north onto S. Walnut St. D3 stated he received a green turn arrow and began following D2 through the intersection. D3 stated D2 began turn sharply and then V2 collided with V2 causing them both to immediately stop in the intersection. D3 stated he attempted to apply his brakes, but was unable to stop in time. D3 stated he did make contact with the rear of V2 causing damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1/D1 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. BLOOMFIELD ROAD APPROACHING S. OAKDALE DRIVE. I WAS TRAVELING IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL, I KNEW I NEEDED TO GET INTO THE RIGHT HAND LANE TO TURN RIGHT ON TO S. OAKDALE. I DID NOT SEE V2 IN MY BLINDSPOT, I STARTED TO MERGE AND COLLIDED WITH V2."V2/D2 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND W. BLOOMFIELD ROAD. I WAS IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. ALL OF THE SUDDEN V1, WHICH WAS RIGHT NEXT TO ME, MERGED INTO MY LANE. WE COLLIDED PRIOR TO THE INTERSECTION OF S. OAKDALE."NO INJURIES, NO TOW. NO CITATIONS.

Driver of Vehicle 1 stated he was traveling east bound on SR 46 when a deer jumped in front of his vehicle. He hit the deer forcing the deer into the west bound lane where vehicle 2 ran over the deer. The driver of vehicle 2 stated she saw vehicle 1 hit the deer but could not avoid the body of the deer when it came into her west bound lane so she ran over it causing damage to the front and side of her car. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy damage to the front of the vehicle and required to be towed from the scene.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS NORTH BOUND ON OLD STATE ROAD 37 MAKING A LEFT TURN INTO A PARKING LOT, WHILE V2 HAD COMPLETED THE TURN AT THE INTERSECTION OF FAIRFAX ROAD AND S OLD STATE ROAD 37 TO GO SOUTH ON S OLD STATE ROAD 37 WHEN V1 FAILED TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY TO V2 RESULTING IN A RIGHT ANGLE TURN.

V1 HIT V2 AS IT MADE A RIGHT HAND (SOUTHBOUND) TURN INTO A PARKING STOLL AT 200 N DANIELS WAY. V2 WAS BACKED INTO THE PARKING SPACE AND WAS STRUCK ON ITS FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE.D1 STATED THAT HE HIT V2 WHEN HE PULLED INTO THE PARKING SPACE.

On Wednesday, November 20, 2019 at 09:10am, I responded to a crash on 3923 W 3rd St, The Speedway Gas station parking lot. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was wet. I observed a white male sitting on the ground next to the kerosene pump. Vehicle 1, white Chevy van, had been parked at the kerosene pump. V#1 can be seen on the video surveillance backing up, pulling forward and then backing up again toward the pump. V#1 had struck a pedestrian.Driver 1, James Mask, stated he had filled his cans with kerosene and got back into his vehicle. D#1 said he remembered seeing the gray Jeep, but did not see anyone when he backed up in order to turn left and clear other parked cars that were in front of him. The next thing D#1 knew is he heard a banging sound on the side of his van. Vehicle 2, silver Jeep, was parked directly behind V#1. The driver and witness, Joyce Eakin, was out of the vehicle.The pedestrian and person struck by V#1, Douglas Dawson, was also a passenger of V#2. Dawson was out of the vehicle and began filling his kerosene cans instead of waiting for V#1 to leave. Dawson was bent over, filling the cans when the next thing he knew was he was being hit by V#1. Dawson stated he started hitting the side of V#1 to get the attention of D#1. Dawson complained of back pain and was transported from the scene to the Monroe Hospital by EMS. Witness 1, Joyce Eakin, stated she was outside of the Jeep and heard Dawson scream. When she looked up she saw V#1 had backed into Dawson. There was no damage to V#1. I could see smear marks in the dirt of V#1 where Dawson had banged on the passenger side of V#1. I could also see fresh smear marks to the bumper of V#1.

On Wednesday, November 20, 2019 at 22:45, Trooper Bartalone responded to a crash on Ramp A 103 (NB I-69 to EB State Road 46). At the time of the crash, the weather was clear, the road surface was wet, and there were lane closures for construction on both the EB and WB sides of SR 46.Vehicle 1, a 2000 Black Mercury Cougar, was traveling northeast on Ramp A 103 exiting northbound I-69 to enter EB State Road 46. Vehicle 1 was unable to stop in time and struck the back end of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 was pulled out of the roadway on the south shoulder of EB State Road 46 near the Arlington Road overpass. Vehicle 1 was driven from the scene with front end damage.Vehicle 2, a 2008 Red Toyota 4Runner, was slowing at the end of Ramp A 103 from northbound I-69 to enter EB State Road 46. Vehicle 1 stopped at the end of the ramp to wait for a break in traffic to merge onto EB State Road 46 when it was struck from behind by Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 was pulled out of the roadway on the south sholder of EB State Road 46 near the Arlington Road overpass. Vehicle 2 was driven from the scene.Driver 1, Jael Lampkins, stated he was exiting I-69 onto EB State Road 46 behind Vehicle 2. He stated Vehicle 1 slowed as it was traveling up the ramp and he looked to his left and could see oncoming traffic traveling on State Road 46. When he looked back forward he saw Vehicle 2 had come to a stop at the top of the ramp and was unable to stop in time to avoid the collision. Driver 1 and his passenger stated they were not injured in the accident. Both occupants were wearing their lap and shoulder belts at the time of the collision.Driver 2, Leisa Farmer, stated she was exiting I-69 onto EB State Road 46. As she came to the top of the ramp, she came to a stop as there was oncoming traffic on State Road 46 and no area to merge into traffic. Driver 2 stated as she was stopped at the ramp waiting for a break in traffic she was struck from behind by Vehicle 1. Driver 2 stated her neck was sore, but declined having an ambulance come to the scene. Driver 2 was wearing her lap and shoulder belt at the time of the collision.201900397459At the time of the collision, due to ongoing construction on State Road 46, the southernmost lane of EB State Road 46 was closed from west of I-69 to approximately Monroe Street east of I-69. Due to the lane closure, traffic exiting I-69 at Ramp A 103 merges directly into the northern lane of EB State Road 46. At the time of the collision, there were no yield signs and no area for vehicles exiting from Ramp A 103 to merge alongside traffic, forcing traffic to stop at the top of the ramp to wait for a break in traffic traveling EB on State Road 46. At the time of the collision, barrels were present on the dotted lane divider line with a break in the barrels at the north end of the ramp.

Unit 1 traveling northeast on North County Line Road West ( Monroe County) toward Gosport, just south of North Texas Ridge Road. Unit 2 traveling southwest on the same road, in the opposite direction of Unit 1. Unit 2 was pulling a Kar Kaddy behind the truck. Driver 2 stated he observed Unit 1 left of the center of the roadway as he was approaching the vehicle. Driver 2 indicated he took his vehicle off of the roadway in an effort to avoid a head on collision. As the vehicles passed by one another the front driver's side of Unit 1 impacted the rear driver's side wheel of the Kar Kaddy. During the investigation I located what appeared to be the point of impact location between the two vehicles. I observed the driver's side front wheel of Unit 1 was bent outward and broken. There was an obvious location with debris from the impact and markings in the roadway where it appeared the the Kar Kaddy impacted the asphalt after losing a wheel, and the bent wheel of Unit 1 also impacted the asphalt. Based of off this location, Unit 1 was left of the center of the roadway at the time of impact.

Driver of Vehicle 3 stated she was slowing down for traffic merging onto the road way when she was struck from behind by Vehicle 2. Vehicle 3 did not sustain any visible damage. The Driver of Vehicle 2 stated he was slowing down for traffic when he realized vehicle 3 was closer than he thought. He stated he only tapped the back bumper of Vehicle 3. There was no visible damage to the front of Vehicle 2. The driver of vehicle 2 stated he was struck from behind by vehicle 1 after he had struck vehicle 3. The driver of vehicle 1 did not realize traffic was stopping and was not able to avoid hitting vehicle 2 from behind. There was minor damage to the front of vehicle 1 and minor damage to the rear of vehicle 2.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1, a red Kia Soul, was traveling west on West Main Street near the intersection of North Constable Drive. As V1 entered the curve near the aforementioned intersection, D1 lost control of the vehicle due to speed too fast for the weather conditions and the roadway surface condition (wet). V1 traveled up and over the curb, up an embankment, struck two small trees, traveled down the embankment, and came to a rest sideways in the westbound travel lane.D1 estimated his speed as less than 60 MPH. A witness, Jeramiah Hall, told officers he observed the vehicle near the intersection of West Main Street and North Matthews Drive traveling at, what he estimated as, a speed of 60 MPH to 70 MPH.V1 had major damage to the front of the vehicle and the undercarriage. Photographs of the vehicle were taken and copies are available upon request.Copies of in-car and body-worn camera footage are also available upon request.No injuries were reported to me at the time of this investigation.Officer Dustin White (Unit EV26), Officer AJ Bohall (Unit EV06), and Administrative Deputy Chief Anthony Bowlen (Unit EV12) assisted me with this investigation.

V1/D1 STATED AT THE IU HEALTH HOSPITAL AFTER HE WAS MIRANDIZED BY OFFICER DAWSON AND OFFICER DECKARD, AND AGREED TO SPEAK TO OFFICERS. "I DO NOT REMEMBER WHAT HAPPENED, DID I CRASH THE CAR?"V2/D2 STATED "I WAS SOUTHBOUND ON S. ROGERS ST. I WAS IN AN ACTIVE CONSTRUCTION WORK ZONE, CLEARLY POSTED WITH SIGNS UP AND BOTH DIRECTIONS OF THE ROAD WAY CLOSED WITH SIGNS AND BARRIERS. I DID NOT SEE V1 SOUTHBOUND ON S. ROGERS, I DID NOT SEE ANY HEADLIGHTS ON V1. I PULLED OUT FROM 1606 S. ROGERS STREET AND WAS TRAVELING SOUTH TOWARDS THE CONSTRUCTION CREW, WHEN ALL OF THE SUDDEN I WAS STRUCK BY V1 ON THE DRIVER SIDE REAR AXLE. V1 FLIPPED AND ROLLED ACROSS THE STREET."W1 STATED "I WAS APX 50 YARDS SOUTH OF THE ACCIDENT, I WAS WAITING ON THE CONCRETE MIXER (V2) TO ARRIVE. I WAS LOOKING NORTH WHEN I HEARD THE CRASH. I NEVER SAW V1 HEADLIGHTS OR SAW V1 SOUTHBOUND. I SAW V2 PULL OUT FROM 1606 S. ROGERS AND START TRAVELING SOUTH, WHEN V1 CRASHED INTO V2. I DO NOT BELIEVE V1 HAD ANY HEAD LIGHTS ON. I APPROACHED THE DRIVER OF V1 ASKED WHAT HAPPENED AND D1 TOLD W1 'I DROVE AROUND THE ROAD CLOSED SIGN AND HIT THE TRUCK'. OFFICER DAWSON FOLLOWED IU HEALTH AMBULANCE AND D1 TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT FOR AN OWI INVESTIGATION. SEE CASE REPORTS

Chris Nunn, the witness, stated that he was sitting inside Cafe Pizzaria, which is at the intersection of E Kirkwood Avenue and S Grant Street, when his girlfriend made a gasping sound while looking out the window. Chris stated that he turned around and saw that V1 had backed into V2. Chris stated that V2 was parked on Kirkwood facing West, and V1 was attempting to parallel park into the parking spot in front of V2, but backed into V2 while trying to park. Chris stated that the rear bumper of V1 collided with the front bumper of V2, and put about an 8 inch crack in the front bumper of V2. Chris stated that V1 then pulled out of the parking spot and then left the scene.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON STARNES RD WHILE V2 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON RATLIFF RD. D1 ADVISED SHE FAILED TO STOP AT THE STOP SIGN ON STARNES ROAD AND STRUCK V2 IN THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR. BOTH DRIVERS DENIED INJURY ALTHOUGH V2 DID HAVE AIRBAG DEPLOYMENT, AND BOTH DENIED WANTING TO BE SCENE BY MEDICAL STAFF.AFTER BEING STRUCK V2 SLID OFF THE ROADWAY AND DAMAGED A HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT WARNING SIGN.

D1 stated he was traveling west on W. 3rd St when he received a phone call. D1 stated he answered his phone call and during this time he "crashed into her", meaning D2. D1 clarified when the vehicles collided it caused damage to both.D2 stated she was stopped in traffic facing west on W. 3rd St. D2 stated while stopped in traffic, V1 collided with the rear of her vehicle causing damage to both.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: D2 was traveling northbound on N. Lincoln St. in V2 when approaching the intersection of N. Lincoln and W. 20th St. V2 came to a stop and observed no cross traffic in the area and began to enter the intersection to continue northbound. As V2 entered the intersection, V1 approached the intersection from N. Dunn St. reportedly traveling at a high rate of speed. V1 was observed applying its brakes but was unable to come to a stop, ultimately impacting V2 in the rear passenger side. V2 was forced off the roadway on the northwest side of the intersection, sustaining heavy disabling damage. V1 fled from the scene, reportedly sustaining heavy front end damage. W1 confirmed D2's statements and stated that V1 was travelling at a high rate of speed prior to the collision.

Vehicle 1 parked north bound and V2 was parked in the alley east bound prior to my arrival. Both parties declined medical attention. D1 said she was traveling east bound in V1 on Atwater Avenue and was directly behind V2 who was also traveling eastbound on Atwater Avenue. D1 said V2 turned left to go north bound on Ballantine Road and so did she. D1 said V2 did not signal when making the left turn. D1 said V2 then immediately swung left into the other lane then immediately turned right to turn into the alley way behind the Delta Upsilon Fraternity House. D1 said V2 did not have a signal on when making the right turn. D1 said when V2 swung wide to go left she thought V2 was making a left turn to go into the parking lot area south of the Music Practice Building. D1 said she went straight which caused her to strike the passenger rear and front door of V2 with the front driver side bumper area of V1. V1 obtained damage to the front driver side area. D2 said he was east bound on Atwater Avenue in V2 and made a left turn to go north bound on Ballentine Road. D2 said when making the left turn he used his turn signal. D2 said he then had to swing wide to make a right hand turn into the alley way on the south side of the Delta Upsilon Fraternity House due to a telephone pole and vehicle parked in a proper parking space. D2 when he turned right he believed he used his turn signal. D2 said V1 then struck V2 on the passenger side front and rear door causing damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 STATED SHE WAS PARKED AT THE 4-WAY INTERSECTION OF S. COLLEGE MALL RD. AND EASTLAND PLAZA DR, ATTEMPTING TO TURN SOUTHBOUND FROM THE EAST SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT SHE SAW THE GREEN ARROW ON THE TRAFFIC CONTROL SIGNAL WHEN SHE ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO S. COLLEGE MALL RD. D2 STATED THAT D1 THEN ALSO TURNED AT THE SAME TIME, SIDESWIPING HER VEHICLE ON THE RIGHT FRONT PASSENGER SIDE, CAUSING DAMAGE. D2 STATED THAT D1 THEN FLED THE SCENE FURTHER SOUTHBOUND WITHOUT ATTEMPTING TO STOP AND PROVIDE INFORMATION.BASED ON THE DAMAGE DONE TO D2'S VEHICLE, MY INVESTIGATION HAS YIELDED THAT D1 FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY PASSING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF S. COLLEGE MALL RD. AND EASTLAND PLAZA DR, STRIKING D2 IN A SAME-DIRECTION SIDESWIPE, CAUSING DAMAGE, AND LEAVING THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.V1 was traveling northbound on Highland Avenue and had stopped at the Atwater Avenue stop sign.V2 was traveling eastbound on Atwater Avenue and approaching the Highland Avenue intersection. V2 was stated to be traveling at approximately 20mph.D1 stated that she came to a stop on Highland Avenue at the Atwater Avenue stopsign. D1 stated that due to a fence and trees to her left, she was unable to fully see oncoming traffic. She then proceeded several feet forward in order to get a better look at oncoming traffic. This put the front end of her vehicle partially into oncoming traffic. D1 stated that she then noticed V2 traveling towards her to which D1 accelerated in order to make it into the lane in time. V2 then collided into V1. D1 stated she thinks V1 was traveling a little too quick but was not sure of an estimated speed. Of note, Atwater Avenue, when approaching Highland Avenue, begins a hill with a relatively steep decline. This hill has a history of causing issues for traffic on Highland Avenue.D2 stated she was traveling approximately 20 mph as traffic on Atwater was heavy at the time. She stated that when she crested the top of the hill, she noticed V2 attempting to turn into her lane of travel. D2 stated that as she approaching V1, V1 pulled into her lane of travel. D2 was unable to stop in time due to the decline of the hill and wet roads.There were no injuries reported at the time of the investigation. V1 needed towed due to disabling damage. Towed by Kens Westside Towing.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 NORTH BOUND FROM CONTENENTIAL/SMITH PIKE AT W SR 46 V2 WEST BOUND ON SR 46 WHEN V2 DISREGARD TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE AND RIGHT ANGLE COLLIDED WITH V1. D2 STATED LOST CONTROL TO WET ROAD CONDITIONS AND THOUGHT D1 GAVE HIM THE THUMBS UP AS IN DID NOT NEED TO STOP.W1 STATED V2 DID NOT STOP AND WAS TOO FAST FOR ROAD CONDITIONS AND STRUCK V1.

V2 is was parked in the roadway of ShadyBrook Dr to block traffic foe Duke Energy who was repairing a downed power line. V2 was not occupied and did not have anyone directly around it. V1 pulled up beside V2 on the right side and was denied access and was asked to back up and turn around due to the road being closed. V1 was delivering a package to 5473 Starnes Road when D1 unsafely backed into V2. V2 was parked in the driveway unoccupied.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver of V1 stated that he was driving North on N. Morton St. Driver of V1 also stated that he did not see V2 proceeding through the intersection and continued driving his vehicle through the intersection, therefore V1's front end struck V2 in the passenger side.Driver of V2 stated that she was driving East on W. 7th St. Driver of V2 also stated that after she stopped at the stop sign, she proceeded through the intersection. According to Driver 1, it was then when V2 struck V1 in the passenger side.

V1, V2, and V3 were all traveling west on 3rd street, in the right lane, approaching the intersection of 3rd street and fess avenue. 3rd street is a two lane, one way road in that location. V1 was behind v2. V2 was behind v3. V3 was following another unknown vehicle. The vehicle in front of v3 came to a sudden stop in front of swain hall, located on 3rd street. V3 then had to come to a sudden stop. V2 then had to come to a sudden stop, but barely bumped into the back of v3. V1 then had to come to a sudden stop, but did not stop in time, and slammed into the back of v2, causing heavy damage to the back of v2, and heavy damage to the front of v1. D3 said the vehicle in front of her came to a sudden stop in the roadway to pick up someone who was standing on the sidewalk waiting for a ride. D3 said the sudden stop of the car caused the accident. D3 said the vehicle pulled away too fast for her to get plate information, or a description of the driver. D3 said she stopped in time to avoid hitting the unknown vehicle, but the cars behind her could not stop in time. D2 said v3 suddenly stopped, and she was able to get stopped in time to avoid hitting v3, but she barely bumped the rear end of v3 with her vehicle. D1 said v3, and v2, both came to a sudden stop in front of him, but he did not have enough time to react, and slammed in the back of v2. V1 had heavy damage to the front end of his vehicle.V2 had heavy damage to the rear end of her vehicle, and little to no damage in the front end. V3 had minor damage to the rear end.

Driver of V1 stated that she was driving her vehicle south on S. College Mall Rd. and attempted to turn East on E. 3rd St. She also stated that V2 was located in the right lane from her, and was turning to the same direction. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Thursday, November 21, 2019 at 17:20, I responded to a crash on N Walnut St approximately 100 ft south Fritz Dr. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was wet. Walnut Street is a two lane two way local asphalt road with a marked bike lane along both the north and southbound shoulders.V2, silver Honda, was stopped in the northbound lane of Walnut Street south of Fritz Drive while waiting to make a left turn. V1, silver Kia, was traveling north on Walnut Street approaching V2. V1 failed to stop behind V2 and the front of V1 struck the rear of V2.D1, Martin, stated he was traveling north on Walnut Street when he observed V2 waiting to make a left turn. D1 stated he attempted to slow behind V2 but V1 began to slide on the wet roadway as he applied the brakes. D1 stated he was unable to stop and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1.D2, Bortka, stated he was stopped in the northbound lane of Walnut Street with his left turn signal activated while waiting to make a left turn. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2.Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear of V2. Evidence shows the roadway was wet during the accident investigation.

V1 was traveling in the right hand lane westbound on e 3rd st and at the intersection with s grant st when a vehicle in the roadway was attempting to change into V1's lane of travel which caused D1 to apply the brakes causing the vehicle to slide off the roadway due to the surface condition. V1/D1 stated a vehicle wanted to change lanes so to avoid a collision he applied the brakes, causing his vehicle to slide off the roadway due to the roadway surface condition, striking a curb and coming to a stop against a tree.V1 was towed due to disabling damage to the front right bumper portion of the vehicle. There appeared to no visible damage to the curb or tree.

On Thursday, November 21, 2019 at 18:25, I responded to a crash on I69 - 123 - Ramp C, locally referred to as the College Avenue Exit. UNIT 2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH IN THE AREA OF S FAIRFAX RD AND E ALEXIS WAY WHEN SHE OBSERVED UNIT 1 TRAVELING SOUTH. UNIT 1 THEN BEGAN DRIVING LEFT OF THE CENTER LINE, ULTIMATELY STRIKING UNIT 2. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 (D1) advised that she had stopped at the stop sign on E North Drive and was attempting to take a left hand turn in order to go north on S Henderson Street. D1 advised that she did not see Vehicle 2 (V2) until she had pulled out into the intersection. D1 advised that when this occurred V2 struck the driver side of her vehicle. On Friday, November 22, 2019 at 22:48, Trooper Bartalone came upon a crash on State Road 46 / E Matlock Rd at the intersection of N Dunn St. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. Two vehicles were involved in the crash and both were driven from the scene.Vehicle 1, a black 2013 Mercedes Benz E Class, was traveling westbound on State Road 46 / E Matlock Rd approaching Dunn Street in the left lane. Vehicle 1 failed to slow for stopped traffic at the light and struck the rear of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 suffered minimal to no visible damage and was driven from the scene. Vehicle 2, a black 2014 Dodge Charger, was stopped at the traffic light on State Road 46 / E Matlock Rd at Dunn St in the left lane. As it sat at the light, Vehicle 2 was struck from behind by Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 suffered minimal to no visible damage and was driven from the scene. Driver 1, Nicholas G West, stated he was traveling westbound on State Road 46 / E Matlock Rd in the left lane approaching Dunn St. West stated as he approached traffic, he began to slow but also applied the gas, causing his vehicle to lurch forward and strike Vehicle 2. West denied being injured in the crash and drove the vehicle from the scene.Driver 2, Ernest Johnson III, stated he was waiting at the stoplight westbound on State Road 446 / E Matlock Rd at Dunn St. Johnson stated he could see Vehicle 1 approaching him from behind and did not think it was going to get stopped in time. Vehicle 1 then struck the rear of his vehicle. Johnson denied being injured in the crash and drove the vehicle from the scene.

V1 was EB on 3rd street approaching Cory in the left. She stated that another vehicle flashed their lights at her. She then went to check her lights as she was approaching the intersection. She stated that the light was yellow and she was looking down at her vehicle. V2 entered the intersection NB from Cory onto 3rd. D2 stated that he had the green light and V1 was trying to beat the light. V2 the struck V1 at a Right angle.

D1 AND V1 LEFT SCENE.OWNER 2 STATED HE WAS PARKED IN THE PRIVATE LOT OF 2401 W 3RD STREET AT WORK FACING EAST. OWNER 2 STATED HE WAS STRUCK BY AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE (POSSIBLY GOING SOUTHEAST WHILE BACKING). NO INJURIES, NO CAMERA FOOTAGE.CRIMINAL CASE COMPLETED. END.

V2 WAS PARKED IN THE 100 BLOCK OF NORTH WASHINGTON STREET FOR APPROXIMATELY 2 HOURS WHEN AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE BACKED INTO THE FRONT OF V2.THE OWNER OF V2 DID NOT WITNESS THE ACCIDENT AND V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D1 stated that she was traveling eastbound in the north lane on W Bloomfield Road approaching S Oakdale Drive. D1 stated that she was approaching the stop light and V2, which was stopped at the intersection. D1 stated that she attempted to brake, but that V1's brakes failed to operate correctly. D1 stated that she tried to swerve V1 to the right, but that it was too late and there was a collision with V2. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

V-1 was traveling north on State Road 37 Business when it ran off the roadway. According to D-1 he stated that while he was driving he saw flashing lights then doesn't remember the accident. V1 and V2 were heading North in the parking lot East of Memorial Stadium (701 E. 17th St.). D2 stated that he was waiting, with his turn signal on, for a vehicle to drive past him so he could turn left to drive to Memorial Stadium when V1 rear ended him. D2 stated that when he spoke to D1 that D1 stated that he was at fault. When I started to speak with D1 I noticed that his eyes were red and glossy, both signs that D1 had been drinking. I asked D1 if he had been drinking to which he stated that he had not. I then asked for another officer to assist me. Officer Khan arrived to assist. Officer Khan performed SFSTs on D1 and stated that D1 showed clues during the tests. D1 was then asked if he would give a preliminary breath sample, the PBT had a result of .095. Officer Khan then transported D1 back to station. Officer Khan advised that D1 had a chemical test result of .098. D1 admitted to drinking alcohol the night before. There was damage to the front end of V1 and damage to the rear end of V2. V1 was then towed by Pritchard's Wrecker Service due to the OWI investigation.

D1 stated that he was following V2 west bound on SR 45W when V2 suddenly slowed down due to the vehicle in front of V2 stopping suddenly. V1 WAS STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION OF W 14TH STREET AND N WALNUT ST. V2 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON N WALNUT ST. V1 THEN ATTEMPTED TO CROSS N WALNUT ST AND CONTINUE ON W 14TH ST. V1 CONTAINED A PASSENGER THAT DEVELOPED COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN HER HIP AND WAS TRANSPORTED FROM THE SCENE BY EMS.

V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the right lane. VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF ARLINGTON ROAD. WHILE MOVING IN SLOW TRAFFIC VEHICLE 1 STRUCK VEHICLE 2 IN THE REAR END. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were both traveling south on N College Ave when V1 was attempting to change lanes and struck V2. V1/D1 stated he was attempting to change lanes and struck V2 as it was heading south on N College Ave. V2/D2 stated she was traveling south on N College Ave when V1 attempted to enter her lane of travel and struck her vehicle. V1 sustained damage to the front left 1/4 panel area of the vehicle. V2 sustained damage to the right passenger side 1/4 panel as well as front passenger side area. Both vehicles were driven from the scene.

According to D-1 he was traveling in the parking lot of Kroger located at 4025 S Old State Road 37 when tried to slow by pressing on the break, however he pressed on the gas peddle which caused him to speed towards a parking lot divider. D-1 stated that he thought he was on the break even though he continued to speed up until he hit the divider. D-1 stated that once he hit the divider and drove over it he freaked out and pushed the peddle more causing him to speed even faster at which point he said he froze and could get himself to stop V-1. As D-1 speed through the parking lot he struck D-2 in the rear, which was parked unattended. D-1 never let up on the gas peddle causing V-1 to push V-2 into V-3. V-1 continued to push V-2 into V-4 which caused V-4 to be shoved into V-5. All vehicle were parked and unattended with the exception of V-1. Deputy Fuller conducted an OWI investigation of D-1 and prior to D-1 being transported to the hospital Deputy Fuller was able to obtain a preliminary PBT result of .23. D-1 was jail on the criminal charge of operating while intoxicated. Vehicle owners were located for V-2, V-3, V-4, V-5 and informed of the damage to their vehicles

V1 was parking on private Dr at 219 S Walnut St (FIRE STONE). V2 was stopped at the traffic control signal at the intersection of E 3rd & Walnut ST. V1 backed into V2 causing damage to both vehicles.D1 (FIRE STONE EMPLOYEE) advised that while working at the above mentioned location, he attempted to back V1 off private Dr. D1 advised that while backing, He collided with V2. D1 advised that he did not see V2 parked due to the fact that it was dark outside. D1 advised that he was not injured. It should be noted that I attempted to make contact with the owner of V1 but was unsuccessful. It should be noted that the accident report was left inside the of V1. D2 advised that she was stopped at the above intersection. D2 stated that, while stopped at the red traffic control signal, she felt the impact of V1. D2 advised that she was not injured.

V1 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the right lane. V2 was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the left lane.D1 stated that he was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the right lane. D1 stated he went to change lanes and did not see V2 next to him. D1 stated that when he changed lanes, he collided with V2. D1 stated he looked prior to changing lanes and did not see V2. V1 had damage to the rear driver side bumper.D2 stated she was traveling westbound on 3rd Street approaching Swain Ave in the left lane. D2 stated that V1 was parked in the roadway dropping an individual off. D2 stated she got into the left lane when V1 began to re-enter the right lane. D2 stated that she was next to V1 when V1 indicated a lane change by turning on his left turn signal. D2 stated that V1 suddenly changed lanes and collided with her vehicle. V2 had damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle. V2 had previous damage on the rear of the vehicle on both the driver side and passenger side.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE NORTH BOUND ON ROGERS ST, APPROACHING KIRKWOOD AVE.V2 ENTERED THE LEFT TURN LANE WHEN IT STARTED, AND WAS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION IN IT.V1 ENTERED THE LEFT TURN LANE ABOUT HALFWAY BETWEEN THE START OF THE LEFT TURN LANE AND THE INTERSECTION, STRIKING V2, WHICH WAS ALREADY IN THE TURN LANE.BOTH DRIVERS SAID THEY WERE TRYING TO TURN LEFT AT THE INTERSECTION.NO REPORTED INJURIES.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
Traffic Control: RR CROSSING GATES AND MEDIAN BARRIER
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling N/B on Elm ST. V2 was traveling E/B on Kirkwood AVE. D1 failed to yield and collided with V2.D1 advised that she was stopped at the intersection of Elm ST & Kirkwood AVE. D1 advised that while stopped, she attempted to proceed N/B on Elm St. D1 advised she pulled out into traffic, when she collided with V2. D1 advised that she was not injured.D2 advised that she was traveling E/B on Kirkwood Ave. D2 advised that while driving, V1 pulled out into traffic into traffic.D2 advised that she attempted to swerve, when she collided with V1. D2 advised that V2 struck the utility pole , before coming to a complete stop. D2 advised that she was injured.

On Saturday, November 23, 2019 at 13:36hrs, M/Trp. E. C. Nash responded to a crash southbound I-69 at Milepost 106.5. At the time of the crash, the weather was overcast with rain and the road surface was wet. I-69 is a 4 lane interstate highway that primarily runs north and south. This crash occurred on a bridge that was concrete construction.Vehicle #1 was traveling south on I-69 just south of the 106.5mm crossing a bridge when the right front wheel came off of Vehicle #1. This caused Driver #1 to loose control of Vehicle #1 causing the right side of Vehicle #1 to strike and slide along the wall of the bridge.Vehicle #1, (black 2018 dodge challenger), was traveling straight southbound on I-69 just south of the 106.5mm when it struck and slid along the wall of the bridge it was on.Driver #1, (KRISTY D. TRUELOVE) indicated she was just driving along when she felt the right front of Vehicle #1 drop and at that point she was unable to maintain control of Vehicle #1. Driver #1 indicated she was trying to stop Vehicle #1 when she hit the wall of the bridge and felt Vehicle #1 bounce. Driver #1 indicated Vehicle #1 traveled a little ways after striking the bridge wall before coming to a stop. Driver #1 indicated when she got out of Vehicle #1 to see the damage she realized her right front wheel had separated from the vehicle which caused the front of the vehicle to drop and her to loose control.Witness #1, (MANUEL MEZA) indicated he was right behind Vehicle #1 when he saw it kind of drop to the front and it went right to the the bridge wall and bounced. Witness #1 indicated he thought Vehicle #1 was going to bounce over the wall of the bridge but it stayed on the roadway. Witness #1 indicated when the vehicle bounced he saw the a wheel bouncing behind Vehicle #1. Witness #1 indicated at first he thought Vehicle #1 hit some ice or or hydroplaned causing it to hit the bridge wall.The right front wheel came off Vehicle #1 causing Driver #1 to loose control and strike the bridge wall. Driver #1 was wearing her seatbelt and there was airbag deployment on the passenger side of Vehicle #1.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELLING SOUTBOUND ON S. LEONARD SPRINGS RD. THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF LEONARD SPRINGS AND WALNUT LEAF DR, LOOKING AT HIS CELLULAR PHONE, WHEN HE STATED THAT A RACCOON RAN INTO THE ROADWAY. D1 THEN STATED THAT HE TURNED HARD TO HIS LEFT TO AVOID THE ANIMAL, RUNNING OFF THE ROAD, AND STRIKING A TREE. D1 SUSTAINED INJURY TO HIS HEAD, AND APPEARED TO BE DISORIENTED AND WAS SUFFERING MEMORY LOSS ON SCENE. D1 WAS THEN TRANSPORTED FROM THE SCENE TO IU HEALTH HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT.BASED ON THE DAMAGE TO V1 AND D1'S INJURIES, MY INVESTIGATION YIELDS THAT D1 WAS DISTRACTED VIA USAGE OF A CELLULAR DEVICE, AND SWERVED UPON SEEING AN ANIMAL IN THE ROADWAY, STRIKING A TREE UPON RUNNING OFF THE ROAD.

V1 was found unattended in the roadway at the intersection of S. Madison and W. Prospect. V1 sustained extensive damage to the passenger side with the front passenger wheel breaking from the front axle. V2 was found unattended in an adjacent parking lot located at 319 S. Madison St. V2 sustained heavy front end damage, consistent with the damage and markings on V1. Both V1 and V2 sustained paint transfer onto one another.Neither vehicle owner was located. Attempts were made to contact both and were unsuccessful.

V1 and V2 were both traveling southeast (eastbound) on West State Road 46 near the intersection of North Jacob Street. D1 indicated D2 came to an abrupt near complete stop causing the front of V1 to collide with the rear of V2. D2 indicated D1 was following him too closely and he purposely came to a abrupt near complete stop resulting in the collision. The roadway surface condition (ice) likely contributed to the collision.V1 had major damage to the front of the vehicle. The airbags in V1 also deployed. V2 had no visible damage, but a license plate light did come loose from its fixed position. Photographs of both vehicles were taken and are available upon request.Copies of in-car and body-worn camera footage are available upon request.No injuries were reported to me at the time of this investigation.

V1 appears to had been traveling East on State Road 45 West. V1 ran off the roadway hitting a ditch causing a large amount of damage to the yard. It then appears that the vehicle went airborne flying over a couple bushes. The bushes were not damage at all. V1 then hit the drive at 5996 W State Road 45 finally hitting a tree and coming to a rest on its side. During the crash V1 also struck the mailbox at address 5996 W State Road 45 destroying it. The driver of the vehicle left the scene of the crash. I was able to make contact with the owner of the vehicle a Gary Clark at 1540 S Curry Pike. He stated that his son was the one that was suppose to be driving the vehicle. I was unable to make contact with the driver or know for sure who the driver was. Also a search of the area was conducted from the the scene to 1540 S Curry Pike, all units were unable to locate anyone walking in that area. I also spoke to a neighbor, she stated that she heard the wreck from inside her home but did not see anyone leave the scene.

D1 is unknown as they left the scene.I located a city street sign that had been struck and destroyed no the east side of the roundabout at W 17th St and N. Monroe St.W1 stated she was traveling west on W 17th St when she saw a grey vehicle stuck on top of a street sign facing east. W1 stated the car was spinning its wheels and eventually got off the sign and continued traveling east. W1 stated she tried to turn around and follow the vehicle, but could not locate the vehicle when she turned around.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling southbound on I69 just past the 123 milemarker. As V1 was crossing a bridge, V1 lost traction and went off the west side of the roadway striking a guard rail and flipping before landing right side up in a ditch.D1 stated she was driving when V1 lost traction on a bridge due to ice. D1 could not recall what happened after that. D1 had minor bleeding from her nose, mouth, and left arm. D1 was treated on scene by EMS but refused to be transported. V1 has heavy damage over the entire vehicle. Photographs were taken off the scene.V1 was towed from the scene by Bland's Towing.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Sunday, November 24, 2019 at 13:10, I responded to a crash on S Fairfax Road at the intersection of E Schacht Road. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. Fairfax Road is a two lane two way asphalt county road that runs primarily in a north/south direction; however Fairfax Road runs in an east/west direction at the location of this collision. V3, silver Chevrolet, was stopped in the southbound lane of Fairfax Road behind a vehicle that was waiting to make a left turn onto Schacht Road. V2, black Ford, was stopped in the southbound lane of Fairfax Road behind V3. V1, gold Honda, was travelling south on Fairfax Road approaching V2. V1 failed to stop behind V2 and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. V2 moved forward after impact by V1 and struck the rear of V3 with the front of V2. All vehicles came to a controlled stop in the southbound lane of Fairfax Road.D1, Blendin, stated he was traveling south on Fairfax Road when traffic slowed suddenly due to a vehicle making a left turn. D1 stated he applied his brakes to slow but began to slide. D1 stated he was unable to stop and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D2, White, stated she was stopped in the southbound lane of Fairfax Road behind V3. D2 stated V1 failed to stop and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D2 stated V2 moved forward after impact by V1 and the front of V2 struck the rear of V3. D3, Bomba, stated she was stopped in the southbound lane of Fairfax Road behind a vehicle that was making a left turn onto Schacht Road. D3 stated V2 struck the rear of V3.Evidence shows the roadway was dry during the accident investigation. Evidence shows significant damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear of V2. Evidence shows damage to the front of V2 consistent with an impact with the reese hitch receiver at the rear of V3. Evidence shows no visible damage to the rear of V3; however the reese hitch receiver at the rear of V3 is consistent with the marking on the front bumper cover of V2. V1 was unable to be driven from the scene and D1 indicated he would make arrangements for a private tow at a later time. A 7-yr old white male was sitting in the right side middle passenger seat of V1. The passenger struck his forehead on the rear of the front passenger seat during the collision. D1 indicated he did not want medical assistance for the passenger and agreed to seek treatment from family physician if needed.

Jason McConnell came into the Bloomington Police Department on 11/25/19 to report the leaving the scene of an accident report. Jason stated that his father owns Vehicle 2 (V2) and advised that the truck was parked facing southbound in the parking lot of 350 N Gates Drive; Lowe's from approximately 2:00pm to 2:30pm. Jason advised that when he returned to V2 that he observed there to be damage to the rear bumper of the vehicle on the passenger side. Jason advised that there was not a note or anything left on the vehicle and that he did not have any suspect vehicle information. I then observed V2. I did observe there to be damage in the area described. I did not observe any paint transfer and only observed there to be mud and debris in the area of the damage. Photographs were taken and uploaded as evidence per policy and procedure. I later spoke with Lowe's staff who advised that there would not be any video footage that would have caught the accident occur.
Driver 1 said that he was traveling east on E SR 46 when a deer ran into the roadway. Driver 1 said he tried to avoid the deer and collided with the guardrail face.The deer was not struck.

V1 was in parking lot at 2424 S Walnut street and was preparing to back NW, out onto an access road. V2 was EB on the access road. V1 backed up and struck V2 in the passenger side of the vehicle with the driver side rear metal bumper of his vehicle. D1 stated that he was going to back up onto access road and checked his mirrors and back up camera and did not see anyone. He stated he continued to back up and the struck V2.D2 stated that she was EB on the access road and was hit in the driver side of the vehicle.

For purposes of this accident report, V1 is the "victim's" vehicle and V2 is the unknown offending vehicle. The owner of V1, Chalea, advised that she had returned home the night prior on 11/24/2019 at approximately 8:30 P.M. Chalea stated that her husband left for work at approximately 8 A.M. On 11/25/2019 and did not see anything or mention anything to Chalea in regards to the damage to her vehicle. Chalea stated that she came outside her home at approximately 11 A.M. And discovered the damage to her driver's side mirror and a small scrape on the front left of her fender/wheel-well (driver's side). Chalea stated that she did not hear a vehicle strike her vehicle during the night or in the morning hours. The conditions of V2/offending vehicle are unknown and it is unknown the direction of travel and/or cause of the accident. It would appear that the offending vehicle sideswiped V1.

V1 WAS SOUTHBOUND ON PATTESON DR AT 2ND ST.V2 WAS EASTBOUND ON 2ND ST TURNING RIGHT ONTO PATTERSON DR.D1 SAID AS HE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION THE LIGHT TURNED RED AND HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE GOING THROUGH IT. HE SAID WHEN HE ENTERED THE INTERSCTION HE HIT V2.D2 SAID AS HE TURNED ONTO PATTERSON DR V1 HIT HIM.WITNESS #1 SAID THE NORTH/SOUTH TRAFFIC LIGHT ON PATTERSON DR WAS RED. HE SAID V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION ON A RED LIGHT AND HIT V2.

Driver 1 was traveling souhtbound on South Strain Ridge Road approaching East Monroe Dam Road. Driver 1 stated he then began making a left hand turn to begin traveling eastbound on East Monroe Dam Road. While making the turn Driver 1 stated he saw the boat that was on a trailer leaning on its side. Driver 1 stated he was unsure of what happened or what causes this and the boat continued leaning until falling off the trailer. Upon arrival I observed the boat described as a 2017 Bennington 24SSRX HIN: ETWE0282J617 completely upside down. Driver 1 stated that vehicle 1 and the trailer sustained no damage. Driver 1 was able to upright the boat the right side up and get it secured back onto the trailer. I observed minor damage along the right hand side of the boat and the top of the boat, the steering wheel and other items as it was an open top boat.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: According to the pedestrian (unit 2) he was crossing the street, eastbound, with the cross walk sign stating he could walk. The pedestrian stated as he crossed the street, the vehicle (unit 1) was turning northbound onto South Walnut Street and struck him. The pedestrian stated he ended up on the hood of unit 1. The pedestrian then stated unit 1 left and did not stop.The pedestrian stated he was not injured, however, there was damage to his cell phone which was in his pocket. The pedestrian estimated the damage to his cell phone to be approximately $1200.00. The pedestrian could only provide me with a white four door sedan and nothing else about the suspect vehicle or the driver.It should be noted that the pedestrian was walking to work at Kroger and that is where I met him to speak with him about the accident.Photographs were taken and uploaded into evidence.

Driver 1 said that he was traveling north on Kirby Rd when a deer ran into the roadway. Driver 1 said that he was unable to avoid colliding with the deerDriver 1 did have an in car camera and I reviewed the footage and it confirmed Driver 1's statements. Driver 1 was given a PBT the did not indicate the presence of alcohol on his breath.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was on E Buick Cadillac Blvd facing westbound. D1 stated she was in the left turn lane stopped at a red light. When D1's light turned green, she began to make a left turn to head south on S. College Mall Rd. D1 stated she was in the inside lane, and while making her turn struck a pedestrian. D1 believes she hit the pedestrian with the front passenger side of her vehicle. D1 advised she was not injured. The pedestrian was unable to give a statement due to their injuries, and was transported to the hospital for minor bleeding from a laceration to the head. Officer Byerly spoke with a witness of the accident who's account of the accident matched D1's.D1 did consent to a PBT and the results were .00

On Monday, November 25, 2019 at 10:53, I responded to a crash at the intersection of SR48 and the I69 northbound exit, I69 - 118 - A. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. The intersection is controlled by an automatic traffic signal and it was functioning correctly during the accident investigation.V1, blue Dodge, was stopped on the exit ramp from I69N to SR48 in the number 2 left turn lane. V2, blue Mitsubishi, was traveling east on SR48 in the number 1 straight lane. V1 began to make the left turn and entered the intersection. V2 struck the driver's side of V1 with the front of V2. V2 came to final rest in the intersection facing east near the area of impact. V1 continued to make the left turn after impact and returned to the scene by stopping behind V2.D1, Lake, stated she was stopped in the number 2 left turn lane on the ramp waiting to make a left turn onto SR48 (3rd Street). D1 stated the light changed to green and she began to make the left turn. D1 stated V2 struck the driver's side of V1 as she entered the intersection. D1 stated she continued to make the left turn after impact and stopped behind V2. D2, Carrico, stated she was traveling east on SR48 (3rd Street) in the number 1 straight lane. D2 stated the light was green and changed to yellow as she entered the intersection. D2 stated V1 pulled in front of her vehicle as she entered the intersection and she was unable to avoid collision. D2 stated she struck the driver's side of V1 with the front of V2. W1, Martin, stated he was stopped on the ramp behind V1. W1 stated a tractor-trailer was also stopped on the ramp in the left lane beside their vehicles. W1 stated the traffic signal was red for the traffic stopped on the ramp. W1 stated the tractor-trailer began to move forward slightly and V1 accelerated into the intersection while the light was still red. W1 stated V2 struck the driver's side of V1. Evidence shows damage to the driver's side of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front of V2. Owner of V2 arrived at the scene of the collision and stated V2 did not have a valid insurance policy. Collision occurred due to V1 disregarding the traffic control signal failing to yield the right of way to V2.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: At approximately 0850 hours on 11/25/2019 V2 was travelling southbound on Woodlawn Avenue, approaching the intersection of 8th Street and Woodlawn. V1 was travelling westbound on 8th, stopped at the stop sign on the east side of Woodlawn. V1 entered the intersection, colliding with the driver side of V2's front bumper. D1 advised that he had been sitting at the stop sign, saw no one, and entered the roadway. The passenger side front bumper of V1 collided with the driver side front bumper of V2. There was minimal paint damage to V1.D2 advised that she had been driving southbound on Woodlawn when suddenly V1 pulled out and collided with the driver's side front bumper of her vehicle. There was significant body and paint damage, but the vehicle was operable.Neither party complained of injury or requested medical aid. D1 was unable to provide proof of financial responsibility and was cited.D1 later contacted me and changed his story, stating that his rear passenger side bumper had been hit by V2. D1 maintained this story, despite his earlier story. This was not logical and did not make sense with the obvious damage to the front passenger side tire area.

Driver #1 stated he was driving south on I69 near the 105 mile marker when a deer entered the roadway and was struck by his car. Driver #1 lost control of the vehicle and crossed into the median, then went across the north bound lanes and struck a guard rail.

D1 STATED THEY WERE TARAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON S PETE ELLIS DR, BEHIND V2, JUST BEFORE THE TURN OFF TO THE NEARBY MCDONALDS RESTARUANT. D1 STATED THAT V2 HAD THEIR LEFT TURN SIGNAL ON, SIGNALING A TURN TO THE EAST, AND THEN ABRUPTLY CHANGED THE SIGNAL TO THE RIGHT TURN SIGNAL, IN ORDER TO TURN IN TO MCDONALDS TO THE WEST. D1 STATED THEY ATTEMPTED TO GO AROUND V2 ON V2'S RIGHT SIDE, AT WHICH POINT V2 TURNED RIGHT (WEST), AND STRUCK THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR OF V1. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON S PETE ELLIS DR, AND ORIGINALLY INTENDED TO TURN EAST OFF OF S PETE ELLIS DR NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH E 3RD ST IN TO A STRIP OF BUSINESSES. D2 STATED THEY THEN CHANGED THEIR TURN SIGNAL TO THE RIGHT (WEST) IN ORDER TO TURN IN TO MCDONALDS, WHICH THEY ATTEMPTED TO DO, AT WHICH POINT THE FRONT OF V2 STRUCK THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR OF V1.UPDATE 11/30/2019 1653 HOURS: CHANGED PRIMARY CAUSE TO IMPROPER PASSING TO BETTER FIT CIRCUMSTANCES

Driver Two was eastbound on SR46W approaching Hartstait Road and slowed down to a semi that was changing lanes. Driver one who was also eastbound did not realize that driver two slowed down and struck the rear end of the driver two.

I69 is an interstate that runs in a southern to northern direction in Monroe county and is a multi-lane roadway with a concert barrier in the median. The accident was approximately 100 ft south of the 118 mile marker. The road condition was wet with debris on the roadway. The roadway is straight with no grade. Weather conditions at the time of the crash was rainy and dark but there was street lamps to light the roadway. V1(2010 White Chrysler Town and Country) was traveling southbound in the left hand lane at approximately 55MPH. V1 drove over debris in the roadway and was unable to avoid it. A piece of debris then punctured the oil tank on the vehicle. V1 came to a controlled stop on the right shoulder just past the 114 mile marker. D1(Alex Toy) stated that he was traveling southbound I69. He stated that he observed the debris in the roadway but it covered both lanes and was unable to avoid it. D1 struck the debris and pulled over further down the road and notice oil leaking out of the vehicle. During the course of my investigation I did observe a large puddle of oil under the vehicle. I did not see any other damage on the vehicle. I went back to the scene and observed the debris on the roadway and it appeared to be a box spring mattress that was broken and it cover both lanes of the road.

Unknown V1 appeared to be traveling west on N. Curry Pike from W. State Road 46. V1 appears to have went off the north side of the roadway before striking a speed limit sign and tree. V1 left the scene of the accident. There are no witnesses and no suspects. Damage from the vehicle, including a Buick emblem, was found on scene. A 40 mile per hour speed sign and a small tree were hit during the crash.

D1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN LEFT FROM W BELLE AVE ONTO THE NB LANES OF S CURRY PK. D1 STATED SHE DIDN'T SEE V2 COMING SOUTHBOUND. D1 ATTEMPTED HER TURN AND THE FRONT OF V1 STRUCK THE PASSENGER SIDE OF V2. WHEN V1 HIT V2, V2 SPUN AROUND.V1 HAD HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE AND V2 HAD HEAVY PASSENGER SIDE DAMAGE.D1 DID COMPLAIN OF A LITTLE BACK PAIN AT THE END OF MY ENCOUNTER WITH HER HOWEVER REFUSED AMBULANCE, STATING HER BOYFRIEND WOULD TAKE HER TO THE HOSPITAL IF SHE NEEDED TO GO.
DRIVER 1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TURNING AROUND IN THE CUL DE SAC OF E LORELEI WAY NEAR THE ADDRESS OF 3808 E LORELEI WAY. DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS BACKING UP AND DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 AND BACKED INTO IT.

VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF WEST VERNAL PIKE. A WHITE FLATBED PICKUP TRANSPORTING A TIRE WAS WESTBOUND ON WEST STATE ROAD 46. WHILE DRIVEING THROUGH A CURVE, A TIRE SLID OFF OF THE FLATBED OF THE PICKUP AND INTO THE ROADWAY. THE TIRE STRUCK VEHICLE 1 IN THE FRONT WHILE VEHICLE 1 WAS TRAVELING IN THE ROADWAY. THE WHITE FLATBED PICKUP DID NOT STOP. VEHICLE 1 WAS DISABLED AND TANSPORTED TO BLANDS BY BLANDS.DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL ATTENTION.

UNIT 2, A PEDESTRIAN, WAS WALKING WESTBOUND IN THE LEFT HAND EASTBOUND LANE OF TRAVEL AGAINST TRAFFIC ON THE SR 45/46 BYPASS APPROXIMATELY 300 FT WEST OF MONROE ST. UNIT 1, A VEHICLE, WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND IN THE LEFT HAND LANE OF TRAVEL ON THE SR 45/46 BYPASS JUST WEST OF UNIT 2. UNIT 2 STATED THAT SHE WAS WALKING WESTBOUND IN THE LEFT HAND EASTBOUND LANE OF TRAVEL AGAINST TRAFFIC ATTEMPTING TO GET A RIDE. UNIT 2 OBSERVED UNIT 1 APPROACHED AND ATTEMPTED TO STEP TO THE RIGHT, OUT OF THE ROADWAY INTO THE MEDIAN WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK BY UNIT 1. UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING EASTBOUND, HE OBSERVED AN UNKNOWN OBJECT IN THE ROADWAY HE BELIEVED TO BE AN ANIMAL, WHILE TRAVELING THE SPEED LIMIT. UNIT 1 THEN BEGAN BRAKING FROM 50 MPH UNTIL HE WAS TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY 15 MPH, WHEN HE REALIZED THE OBJECT IN THE ROADWAY WAS A PERSON. HE ATTEMPTED TO SWERVE TO THE LEFT INTO THE MEDIAN TO AVOID HER HOWEVER, HE STRUCK HER WITH HIS FRONT PASSENGER SIDE BUMPER.UNIT 2 DID RECEIVE A CITATION FOR WALKING IN THE ROADWAY INSTEAD OF USING THE SHOULDER AS STATED IN THE INDIANA CODE BOOK.
V1 WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF THE VILLAGE PANTRY. D1 SAID WHEN SHE GOT IN V1 BEGAN ROLLING BACKWARD TOWARD THE GAS PUMPS. SHE SAID SHE WAS NOT ABLE TO GET IT STOPPED BEFORE IT STRUCK THE PUMP.

D2 SAID THAT SHE WAS HEADED WEST BOUND AND THAT TRAFFIC HAD STOPPED AND SHE DID NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE STRICKING THE REAR OF V1. D1 SAID HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN V2 STRUCK REAR OF HIS VEH, VEHICLES MOVED PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling North on South Leonard Springs Road near the intersection of Maybury Mall Road. V1 hit standing water in the roadway causing him to hydroplane and lose control of his vehicle. V1 than ran off the roadway hitting a concrete sign for an apartment complex. D1 stated that he was traveling around 30 MPH when he hit some standing water and hydroplaned. D1 had a cut on his hand and complaint of pain in his neck. Woodland Springs Apartments concrete entrance sign was destroyed during the crash.

I spoke with the witness whom stated both V1 and V2 were parked facing eastbound side by side. V1 was in the parking spot directly to the right of V2. According to the witness, as he approached Target he heard a crunching noise. When he turned around, he observed V1 backing out and side swipe the rear passenger side of the unoccupied V2. The witness stated V1 paused then fled the scene. I observed damage on the rear passenger side of V2. I later spoke with D1. D1 advised he was backing out his vehicle and must have cut the wheel too soon causing him to side swipe V2. I did observe damage on V1 matching that of V2. A local investigation was conducted. Please reference B19-49615 fore more on this.

V1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON NORTH THOMAS ROAD. D1 STATED HE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE WHEN THE TRAILER BECAME UNSTABLE AS HE WAS TRAVELING DOWN THE HILL. V1 LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY. A BUCKET FROM A FROM A LOADER FELL FROM THE TRAILER CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE ROADWAY.

D1 stated that she was driving West on W State Road 46, just west of the I-69 N exit ramp onto W State Road 46, when a deer ran south and out in front of her vehicle. D1 stated that the front passenger side bumper area of V1 hit the deer. D1 stated that the deer then ran back from the direction it came. The deer was never found.
D2 WAS HEADED W ON VINE ST WHEN D1 PULLED OUT AND STRUCK D2. D1 STATED HE DIDN'T SEE D2. VEHICLES WERE MOVED PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
