NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS NORTHBOUND IN THE PARKING LOT OF 200 NORTH DANIELS WAY. AFTER STOPPING AT A STOP SIGN VEHICLE CONTINUED INTO PARKING LOT STRIKING VEHICLE 2 ON THE PASSENGER SIDE DOOR. VEHICLE 2 WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND INTO PARKING LOT OF 200 NORTH DANIELS WAY.BOTH PARTIES INVOLVED WERE UNINJURED, AND REFUSED ANY MEDICAL TREATMENT.BOTH VEHICLES WERE DRIVABLE AND DRIVEN FROM THE SCENE.

V1 was parked in a street parking spot in front of Switchyard Brewery when it was struck on the back right quarter panel by a black 4 Runner, V2, causing damage. V2 then backs up and leaves the scene without attempting to provide insurance information. I obtained video footage of the incident but was unable to get a view of the license plate.
V2 WAS CROSSING STATE ROAD 46 FROM UNION VALLEONTO OUTBACK DRIVE WITH THE RIGHT OF WAY WHEN V1 DISREGARDED THE RED LIGHT SIGNAL AT STATE ROAD 46 AND STRUCK V2. V1 WAS EASTBOUND. V2 WAS SOUTHBOUND.

D1 WAS STOPPED IN THE AREA OF S LEONDARD SPRINGS RD AND W MAYBURY MALL FOR INTERVIEW. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS BACKING UP IN THE PARKING LOT OF KROGER AND THAT D2 STRUCK THE REAR OF HIS VEHICLE. D1 STATED THAT D2 WAS BEING BELLIGERENT THEREFORE HE LEFT THE SCENE.D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PARK IN KROGER PARKING LOT. D2 STATED THAT ONCE SHE TURNED NB DOWN A PARKING ROW, V1 (WHO WAS PARKED ILLEGALLY) REVERSED WHICH CAUSED THE BACK OF HIS TRAILER TO COLLIDE WITH THE FRONT OF HER VEHICLE. D2 THEN STATED THAT PRIOR TO D1 PROVIDING INFORMATION, HE FLED THE SCENE AFTER STRIKING MS. ZIKES WITH HIS VEHICLE.

V1 was traveling westbound on E. 7th St when approaching the intersction of N. Walnut St. D1 stated that she was not paying attention to the roadway and was looking at her phone. D1 was using her GPS function on her phone to navigate.V2 was traveling northbound on N. Walnut St. While stopped at a red light at the intersection. Once the traffic light turned green V2 entered the intersection and continued northbound.Both D1 and D2 stated that D1/V1 failed to stop at the intersection for a red signal and entered the intersection at the time that V2 entered the intersection. As a result, V2 struck V1. Both V1 and V2 sustained disabling damage. D1 sustained no injuries. D2 sustained injuries, a complaint of pain in the chest and abdominal area, and was transprorted from the scene for further treatment.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Wednesday, November 27, 2019 at 10:25, Clephane, Mark responded to a crash on State Rd 46 at intersection of W Arlington Rd. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry. The power was out around most of the West side of Bloomington and as a result the traffic signals were also out so people were treating the instersections as a four way stop. All vehicles had been moved prior to this unit's arrival.Vehicle 1,a white Toyota was traveling East on SR 46 West of Arlington Road. Vehicle 2, a gold Pontiac was turning left from the bank parking lot at Arlington Road onto Westbound SR 46. V-2 had stopped at the intersection. As V-2 proceeded to make the turn V-1 came into the intersection without slowing down and the front of V-1 struck the left side of V-2 according to the only witness.Driver 1 stated that she was coming up to the intersection and the lights were out, however she did not see anyone at the intersection and therefore saw no reason to stop. Driver 2 informed me that he had stopped as the lights were out and when it was his turn, he pulled out and was struck in the driver's side by V-1.Shannon Poole, the only witness to this crash, told this officer that he was behind V-1 at the time of the crash. Poole stated that V-2 had been stopped at the intersection as he and V-1 approached, and that V-1 never even slowed down and certainly did not stop at the intersection. Poole agreed with the drivers and this unit's observation that the traffic control lights were out. The evidence in this crash indicates that the traffic control devices were not functioning, therefore all drivers should have treated the intersection as a four way stop. D-1 did not treat the intersection as a four way stop and also did not yield to V-2 as it turned left through the intersection thereby causing this crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE WAS TURNING LEFT OUT OF THE SPEEDWAY GAS STATION LOCATED ON N SMITH PIKE NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF N SMITH PIKE AND W FORREST PARK DRIVE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED SHE DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 AND TURNED OUT INTO THE SB LANE OF TRAVEL STRIKING VEHICLE 2.VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SB ON N SMITH PIKE WHEN VEHICLE 1 TURNED OUT FROM THE SPEEDWAY GAS STATION LOCATED NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF N SMITH PIKE AND W FORREST PARK DRIVE STRIKING HER IN THE FRONT DRIVERSIDE OF HER VEHICLE.

V1 was traveling west on 3rd Street in the right lane approaching Swain Avenue and began to merge into the left lane. V2 was also traveling west on 3rd Street in the left lane approaching Swain Avenue.D1 stated that she was traveling west on 3rd Street in the right lane approaching Swain Avenue in V1. She stated that she began wanted to turn left further down the road. She stated that she thought she was in the left lane, but was told by D2 that she was in the right lane and began to merge. D1 stated that she collided into the passenger side of V2.D2 stated that she was traveling west on 3rd Street in the left lane approaching Swain Avenue. She stated that V1 was in the right lane and began to merge into the left lane. D2 stated that V1 collided into the passenger side of her vehicle as she attempted to avoid the collision by veering to the left. There was damage to the entire right side of V2 and to the rear driver side quarter panel of V1. The damage and nature of the vehicle's final resting place are consisted with V1 colliding into V2 as it merged from the right lane to the left lane. Neither vehicle was towed and there were no injuries.

DRIVER 1 STATED SHE WAS DRIVING NORTH ON I-69 N NEAR MILE MARKER 119.5 WHEN A DEER RAN ACROSS THE ROADWAY AND IN FRONT OF HER VEHICLE AT WHICH POINT VEHICLE 1 COLLIDED WITH THE DEER CAUSING DAMAGE. NO INJURIES.

Unit was traveling southbound on N Russell Rd, passing the intersection with Commodore rd and entering a sequence of downhill curves. Whilst proceeding through a curve in the 2500 block of N Russell Rd, a white truck, traveling northbound, came around the same curve. This vehicle was over the center line and speeding. At the point of passing eachother, the drivers side door of the truck swung open. The door impacted with the drivers side of unit 1, causing damage to the headlights and front end. Driver of the white truck left the scene.

V1 was traveling east bound on Sample Road at the Wayport Road round about at a high rate of speed. D1 was failing to stop for MCSO and was fleeing from the police. D1 entered into the round about and due to the high rate of speed could not maintain control of his vehicle resulting in running off the roadway being ejected from the motorcycle. D1 was wearing riding gear such as a helmet and jacket.
D1 WAS DRIVING EB ON E SR 46 AND STRUCK A DEER IN THE ROADWAY. ALL AIRBAGS DEPLOYED AND VEHICLE HAD FRONT END DAMAGE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Friday, November 29, 2019 at 09:30, I Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a crash that took place at 3228 W Jacobs Dr. Bloomington, Indiana. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry. 3228 W. Jacobs Dr. is the address for the Office Depot in the Whitehall Crossing Shopping center. The crash took place in the drive in front of the store front (east side of building). Vehicle 1, a blue ford Asp, was traveling west in a parking lot attempting to turn left to go south in front of Office Depot. Vehicle 2, silver Chevrolet Avero, traveling north on the drive in front of Office Depot. V1, struck the rear passenger side bumper of V2. Both vehicle's came to a stop after the hit. D1, Juan Carlos Cedeno, told me he was traveling through west through the parking lot in front of Office Depot. D1 told me he stopped for traffic that was traveling north and south in front of the store until he could turn left (south) in front of the store. D1 told me a truck that was traveling north on the drive stopped and the driver inside motioned him to go ahead and make his left hand turn in front of him. D1 told me that he went ahead and started to turn left onto the drive. D1 said he saw V2 start to pass the truck, that was now stopped, on the left hand side and continue north on the drive. D1 told me he tried to go between the truck and V2. D1 struck the rear passenger side bumper of V2 with the front passenger side bumper of his car. D2, Alexandra Holt, told me she was traveling north on the drive in front of Office Depot. D2 said as she was traveling north V1 struck her car on the rear passenger side bumper. D2 said V1 also almost truck another vehicle before hitting her car. Evidence shows blue paint transfer on the rear passenger side bumper of V2. Evidence shows traffic in the parking lot was busy (due to black Friday shopping).

V1 was traveling north west on the State Road 45/46 Bypass in the northern most lane. D1 stated while traveling north west on State Road 45/46, he noticed something out of the corner of his eye. Before he was able to fully assess what he saw, he struck a deer. V1 has damage to the driver side front end. Due to damage, the vehicle was towed from the scene.

D1 WAS IN PURSUIT OF A MOTORCYCLE THAT FLED WHILE ATTEMPTING TO STOP IT FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION. WHILE TRAVELING SOUTHEAST IN THE AREA OF THE 1300 BLK OF FOUNTAIN DR, D1 WENT OVER THE RAILROAD TRACK CROSSING AND V1 BOTTOMED OUT CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE SUSPENSION AND UNDERCARRIAGE AS WELL AS POSSIBLY THE OIL PAN/MOTOR AREA. IT WAS DETERMINED AFTER THE PURSUIT HAD TERMINATED THAT THE DAMAGE HAD OCCURED TO V1; IT WAS TOWED BY BLANDS.DAMAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON TODAYS DATE; 12/02/19 AFTER BEING INSPECTED BY MONROE COUNTY HIGHWAY GARAGE.

V1 WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVENUE. V2 WAS DRIVING EAST ON 3RD STREET. V2 WAS CROSSING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AFTER THE LIGHT SIGNALED GREEN FOR EASTBOUND TRAFFIC. V2 ALSO CONTINUED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. THE FRONT OF V2 THEN COLLIDED WITH THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF V1. CAUSING NON-DISABLING DAMAGE TO BOTH VEHICLES.D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT REMEMBER COMPLETELY BUT HE BELIEVED THAT HE HAD RAN THE RED LIGHT. D1 SAID THAT HE BRIEFLY SAW THE LIGHT BEFORE THE COLLISION OCCURRED. D2 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING STRAIGHT AND OBSERVED THE LIGHT WAS GREEN SO HE CONTINUED THROUGH THE TRAFFIC LIGHT. D2 SAID THAT AS HE WAS ENTERING THE INTERSECTION HE OBSERVED V1 DRIVING INTO THE INTERSECTION. D2 STATED THAT HE ATTEMPTED TO STOP BEFORE HITTING V1 BUT WAS UNABLE TO AVOID THE COLLISION.

DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE WAS BACKING OUT OF HER PARKING SPOT IN THE KROGER PARKING LOT. DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE NOTICED VEHICLE 1 SUDDENLY START TO BACK OUT. DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE STOPPED AND HONKED HER HORN BUT VEHICLE 1 DID NOT STOP IN TIME BEFORE HITTING THE REAR END OF VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS BACKING OUT OF HIS PARKING SPOT AND BACKED INTO VEHICLE 2.

D1 STATED THAT THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH S CLARIZZ BLVD AND V2 WAS IN FRONT OF V1. D1 STATED THAT HE OBSERVED A VEHICLE IN FRONT OF V2 ABRUPTLY ENGAGE THEIR BRAKES, AT WHICH V2 WAS FORCED TO ENGAGE THEIR BRAKES AS WELL. D1 STATED HE DID NOT HAVE AMPLE TIME TO STOP BEFORE STRIKING THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THAT THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E 3RD ST NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH S CLARIZZ BLVD WHEN TWO UNKNOWN VEHICLES IN FRONT OF THEM SUDDENLY ENGAGED THEIR BRAKES. D2 STATED THEY THEN ENGAGED THEIR BRAKES IN ORDER TO NOT STRIKE THESE VEHICLES. D2 STATED ONCE STOPPED, THEY FELT V2 GET STRUCK FROM BEHIND. D2 STATED THAT SAFETY FEATURES IN THE HEADRESTS IN THE DRIVER AND FRONT PASSENGER POSITIONS IN V2 HAD BEEN ACTIVATED DUE TO THIS ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass passing through the intersection of 17th Street. Vehicle 2 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass just south of the 17th Street intersection in front of Vehicle 1.Driver 1 stated she was traveling south through the intersection and stated she was distracted. Driver 1 advised she was crying and looked down to turn her heat off. She stated that when she looked up it was too late to stop and rear ended Vehicle 2. Driver 1 advised she was going approximately 45 MPH and did not see anything before the collision occurred.Driver 2 stated she was stopped at the traffic light at the 17th Street intersection. Driver 2 stated when the light turned she began driving but had only made it to approximately 20 MPH just south of the intersection when Vehicle 1 collided into the rear of her vehicle.No one involved complained of injuries.There was damage to the front bumper, grille, impact bar, and radiator of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the rear bumper.

On Saturday, November 30, 2019 at 22:30, Trooper Bartalone responded to a crash on I-69 SB at the 114 Exit Ramp. At the time of the crash, the weather was foggy and the road surface was wet. Vehicle 1, a Silver 2007 Toyota Corolla, was traveling southbound on I-69 in the left lane of the ramp from I-69 Southbound to State Road 37. As the ramp curved southwest, Vehicle 1 failed to negotiate the curve, drove through the painted divider, left the roadway damaging an INDOT exit sign and a speed limit sign, and continued to travel through the ditch for approximately 60 yards before coming to a rest due to disabling damage. Vehicle 1 was towed to Spencer at the driver's request.Driver 1, Justin Wiley, stated he was traveling southbound on I-69 nearing the 114 exit. Wiley stated his windshield was foggy and could not see the roadway, causing him to leave the roadway and drive into the ditch. Later, Wiley stated he attempted to change lanes too quickly, causing his vehicle to hydroplane on the wet roadway, which caused the vehicle to leave the roadway and travel through the ditch before coming to a rest.When I arrived on scene, Wiley and his female passengers were hysterical, agitated, and seemed confused. Both were checked on scene by paramedics but refused treatment. As I continued to speak with Wiley I became suspicious he was under the influence of illegal drugs. Wiley later admitted he had taken Suboxone earlier in the day and that he had a prescription for the medication. However Wiley could not produce a prescription for the medication. I read Wiley the Indiana Implied Consent Warning and he consented to a blood draw. The blood draw was conducted at IU Health Bloomington Hospital and the results of that test are currently pending.

ON 11/30/19 UNIT 1, DRIVEN BY DRIVER 1, IDENTIFIED AS TYLER DIXON, RAN OFF THE ROADWAY TRAVELING WEST ON EAST RHORER RD AND STRUCK A UTILITY POLE. UNIT 1 SHOWED DAMAGE TO THE FRONT GRILL, BUMPER AND HOOD PORTION OF THE VEHICLE AS WELL AS BROKEN WINDOWS IN THE FRONT AND THE REAR OF TH VEHICLE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1/D1 STATED "I WAS NORTHBOUND ON I69 PASSING EXIT 117 WHEN ALL OF SUDDEN I HYDROPLANNED, SPUN AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY. I STRUCK A 55 MPH SIGN AND CONTINUED DOWN THE DITCH."

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: On Saturday, November 30, 2019 at 07:05, I responded to a crash in the southbound lanes of I69 near the 125 mile marker. It was raining and the road surface was wet during the time of the accident investigation. I69 is a multi-lane asphalt roadway that runs primarily in a north/south direction and is separated by a guardrail median. V1, black Hyundai, was traveling south on I69 in the number 1, left, lane. V1 began to slide on the wet roadway and traveled off the right side of the road. V1 struck the guardrail face along the southbound shoulder and came to final rest facing northwest along the shoulder. D1, Blessing, stated she was traveling south on I69 in the left lane. D1 stated she lost control of V1 on the wet roadway and began to slide. D1 stated she struck a guardrail along the right, west, side of the roadway. Evidence shows minimal damage to the guardrail face along the west side of I69. Evidence shows damage to the front right corner of V1. Evidence shows it was raining and the roadway was wet during the accident investigation.

On Saturday, November 30, 2019 at 10:38, I responded to a crash on State Rd 45 south of Martin Drive. It was raining and the roadway was wet at the time of the accident investigation. SR45 is a two lane two way asphalt State Road that runs primarily in a northeast / southwest direction. V1, maroon Ford, was traveling south on SR45 south of Martin Drive. V1 began to slide on the wet roadway as it exited the right hand curve. V1 slid across the northbound lane and struck an ATT utility pole along the south side of the roadway. V1 impacted the utility pole along the passenger side of the vehicle at the rear of the extended cab. D1 initially left the scene prior to law enforcement arrival. W1, Lee, stated they were traveling south on SR45 just after V1 struck the utility pole. W1 provided a digital image and license plate number for V1, TK409NSX. W1 stated V1 was occupied by two white males. W1 stated the driver was utilizing a cell phone after impact and spoke to "Mark" indicating he had a collision. W1 stated D1 and the passenger returned to the truck and left the scene along a gravel drive north of the crash scene. I checked the gravel drive described by W1 but was unable to locate V1. A records check identified the truck as a maroon 2003 Ford Ranger. The truck is registered to Mark Blevins, Morgantown, IN. I contacted Morgan County Dispatch by telephone and requested they contact officers from Morgantown PD to attempt to locate the vehicle. I was contacted by a Morgantown Officer at approximately 1225 hours. The officer advised he located the vehicle and driver. I spoke with a male subject who identified himself verbally as Zackery Blevins. Blevins stated he had been driving V1 when he lost control and struck a utility pole. Blevins identified the passenger as Dustyn Merriman. I instructed Blevins I would meet with him on Sunday, 12/01/2019.On Sunday, 12/01/2019, I traveled to 140 S. Morton Street, Morgantown and made contact with a white male who identified himself with an Indiana driver's license as Blevins. Blevins stated he was traveling south on SR45 along with Dustyn Merriman. Blevins stated an unknown dark colored van or SUV was traveling left of center as he entered the right hand curve. Blevins stated he swerved to the right to avoid the vehicle and the passenger side tires left the roadway. Blevins stated he lost control of V1 as he exited the corner and began to slide. Blevins stated he struck a utility pole along the south side of the road with the passenger side of V1. Blevins confirmed he did not contact law enforcement after the collision. Blevins stated he returned to Morgantown until he was contacted by Morgantown PD. Evidence shows damage to the passenger side rear corner of the cab of V1 consistent with an impact by a round pole. Evidence shows the utility pole was cracked in half from the collision. Evidence shows the roadway was wet during the accident investigation. D1, Blevins, was summoned into court for leaving the scene of a property crash accident.

V1 WAS HEADING EAST ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 IN APPROX THE 5900 BLOCK WHEN A DEER RAN OUR INFRONT OF THE VEHICLE AND D1 HIT IT. VEHICLE WOULD NOT GO INTO DRIVE OR ANY OTHER GEAR AND HAD TO BE TOWED FROM THE SCENE.

Uint 1 was traveling eastbound on ST RD 45, approching the intersection with Elwren Rd. At a curve in the road before the intersection, unit 1 ran off the roadway, crossing into the westbound lane and impacting with a tree approximately 15 feet off the roadway on the north side. Driver of unit 1 was transported for medical treatment. Driver suffered bruising to left knee, bruising to head, abrasion on left thigh and laceration on left knuckles. Driver could not remember what happened as to reason why vehicle ran off road.

V1 and V2 were both at the intersection of E 3rd St and S Dunn St when V1 attempted to stop and struck the rear right 1/4 panel portion of V2. V1/D1 stated he was coming up to the intersection and applied his brakes due to the red traffic light and vehicles stopped on the roadway in front of him, however, his vehicle was unable to stop and slid making contact with the rear right 1/4 panel portion of V2. V2/D2 stated she was stopped at the intersection due to the red traffic light and the vehicle in front of her when her vehicle was struck from behind by V1. V2 sustained damage to the right rear 1/4 panel and was driven from the scene. V1 sustained damage to the front right 1/4 panel and was towed by Rick's due to the damage.
D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING ON Brummetts Creek Rd when the deer entered the roadway, in the path of his vehicle. D1 was unable to stop prior to hitting the deer.

V2 WAS PARKED ON THE WEST SIDE OF WALNUT ST, AT SMITH AVE, FACING NORTH. OWNER WAS STILL SITTING IN IT, ADVISED A FULL SIZE BUS GOING NORTH BOUND ON WALNUT ST IN THE LEFT LANE STRUCK V2'S PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR, CRACKING THE PLASTIC HOUSING. V1 CONTINUED NORTH BOUND WITH OUT STOPPING. UNKNOWN IF IT SUSTAINED DAMAGE OR KNEW THE CRASH OCCURRED. NO INJURIES REPORTED.

D1/D2 were headed E/B on SR 46, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D2 stopped at the intersection due to a red traffic signal. D1 did not stop V1 in time, causing V1 to strike V2 in the rear. D1 stated that he was headed E/B on SR 46, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D1 stated that as saw the red traffic signal ahead and V2 stop at the intersection, at which point he attempted to apply his brakes. D1 stated that his brakes felt "mushy" and did not stop the vehicle in time, causing V1 to strike V2 in the rear. D1 also stated that he felt the wet roadway also contributed to his inability to stop his vehicle in time. D2 stated that she was headed E/B on SR 46, approaching the intersection of N Kinser Pike. D2 stated that she stopped at the intersection due to a red traffic signal. D2 stated that V2 was then struck from the rear by V1.

D2 STATED HE WAS SLOWING DOWN IN TRAFFIC ALMOST COMING TO A STOP WHEN V1 REAR ENDED V2. D1 STATED HE NOTICED PEOPLE WERE SLOWING DOWN IN TRAFFIC HOWEVER GOT DISTRACTED AND DIDN'T REALIZE PEOPLE WERE COMING TO A COMPLETE STOP AND WHEN HE LOOKED UP HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP V1 PRIOR TO REAR ENDING V2.V1 HAD HEAVY FRONT END DAMAGE.V2 HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR AND WAS ABLE TO DRIVE AWAY FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Driver was traveling north bound on SR 45 E when he entered a sharp left hand curve. Driver was traveling too fast for the rainy weather conditions and lost control of the vehicle. The vehicle slid across the roadway and up a small embankment. The vehicle came to rest on the embankment damaging guide wires of a Duke power pole on pole # 100.

D1 STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON SR 48 FROM THE GREENE CO/ MONROE CO LINE, WHEN V1 SPUN OUT OF CONTROL, HITTING THE DITCH. D1 SAID THAT THE ROADWAY, THAT WAS WET, SEEMED SLICK. V1 SUFFERED HEAVY DAMAGE ALL AROUND AND WAS TOWED TO CHANDLERS TOWING. D1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT WANT AN AMBULANCE BUT DID COMPLAIN THAT HIS CHEST HURT.

V2 WAS AT THE STOP LIGHT TO GO SOUTH ON SOUTH COLLEGE AVE FROM THE STATE ROAD 45/46 BYPASS. V1 REAR ENDED V1. V2 LEFT THE SCENE AND DROVE TO THE BLOOMINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT. D1 DID NOT KNOW SHE HIT ANYTHING AND CONTINUED TO DRIVE TO THE ST PAULS CATHOLIC CHURCH ON EAST 17TH ST IN BLOOMINGTON. I MET WITH BOTH DRIVERS AND THE WITNESS WHO OBSERVED. THE CRASH. INFO INCLUDED IN THE REPORT.

THE OWNER OF V2 (PARKER) REPORTED THAT HER EX-BOYFRIEND (BLACKWELL) CAME TO HER WORK AND THEY HAD AN ARGUMENT. HE THREATENED TO HER THAT HE WAS GOING TO DO SOMETHING TO THE CHRYSLER PT CRUISER IN THE PARKING LOT. ANOTHER EMPLOYEE (GEORGE) SAW A BLUE SUV CRASH INTO V2 IN THE PARKING LOT THEN LEAVE. PARKER THEN REPORTED TO ME THAT BLACKWELL IS THE CO-OWNER OF V2, AND ON THE SAME INSURANCE. HE ADMITTED TO BEING AT THE BUSINESS, BUT DENIED CRASHING INTO V2. BOTH VEHICLES DID HAVE DAMAGE TO THEM.NO INJURIES REPORTED.

DRIVER 2 WAS WB ON W WAMPLER RD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF W WAMPLER RD AND N LIBERTY HOLLOW RD. DRIVER 2 ADVISED SHE WAS NAVIGATING THE TURN AT THAT INTERSECTION WHEN VEHICLE 1 STRUCK HER.DRIVER 1 WAS EB ON W WAMPLER RD NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF W WAMPLER RD AND N LIBERTY HOLLOW RD. DRIVER 1 WAS ATTEMPTING TO NAVIGATE THE TURN AT THAT INTERSECTION BUT WENT LEFT OF CENTER STRIKING VEHICLE 2.

ON SUNDAY, DECEMBER 1, 2019 AT 7:10 P.M., TROOPER IAN MATTHEWS RESPONDED TO A CRASH ON MILEPOST 123 I-69 . AT THE TIME OF THE CRASH, THE WEATHER WAS RAINY AND THE ROAD SURFACE WAS WET.VEHICLE 1, SILVER\ALUMINUM DODGE GRAND CARAVAN, CHANGING LANES. VEHICLE 2, BLACK HONDA PILOT, GOING STRAIGHT. VEHICLE 3, WHITE KIA FORTE, GOING STRAIGHT. VEHICLE 4, BRONZE BUICK REGAL, GOING STRAIGHT. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS GOING STRAIGHT ON INTERSTATE 69 AND TRAVELING SOUTH BOUND WHEN SUDDENLY HE REALIZED THERE WAS A LINE OF TRAFFIC IN FRONT OF HIM THAT WAS COMING TO A STOP. DRIVER 1 EXPLAINED THAT BECAUSE OF THE SPEED HE WAS TRAVELING AND THE WET SURFACE OF THE ROADWAY, HE DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO STOP HIS VEHICLE AND INSTEAD SHARPLY TURNED RIGHT INTO THE ADJACENT LANE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED THAT BECAUSE HE HAD TO TURN ABRUPTLY INTO THE RIGHT LANE OF TRAFFIC, THE RIGHT REAR OF HIS VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH THE FRONT LEFT OF THE VEHICLE BEHIND HIM (VEHICLE 2). DRIVER 1 THEN ADVISED THAT HE CAME TO A CONTROLLED STOP JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA OF IMPACT, OFF THE ROADWAY. AFTER SPEAKING WITH DRIVER 1 I SPOKE WITH DRIVER 2, WHO EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS GOING STRAIGHT IN THE FURTHEST RIGHT LANE WHEN SUDDENLY THE VEHICLE IN THE LANE TO HIS LEFT (VEHICLE 1) ABRUPTLY TURNED INTO HIS LANE. DRIVER 2 ADVISED HE ATTEMPT TO SLOW VEHICLE 2 AND TURN TO THE RIGHT TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH VEHICLE 1, BUT WAS UNABLE TO DO SO, DUE TO HOW CLOSE THE TWO VEHICLES WERE IN PROXIMITY WHEN VEHICLE 1 CHANGED LANES. DRIVER 2 ALSO ADVISED THAT AFTER MAKING CONTACT WITH VEHICLE 1, VEHICLE 2 ALSO SUSTAINED REAR IMPACT FROM THE VEHICLE BEHIND HIM (VEHICLE 3). DRIVER 2 ALSO ADVISED THAT VEHICLE 2 MADE CONTACT WITH THE GUARDRAIL, WHERE VEHICLE 2 CAME TO A REST. I THEN SPOKE WITH DRIVER 3, WHO ADVISED THAT SHE WAS GOING STRAIGHT WHEN SHE NOTICED VEHICLE 1 ABRUPTLY CHANGE LANES AND MAKE CONTACT WITH VEHICLE 2, WHO WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER. DRIVER 3 ADVISED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO AVOID THE COLLISION WITH VEHICLE 2 BY APPLYING HER BRAKES, BUT SHE WAS UNABLE TO AVOID COLLIDING VEHICLE 3 INTO VEHICLE 2, AS SHE WAS ALSO STRUCK FROM THE REAR BY VEHICLE 4. DRIVER 3 ADVISED VEHICLE 3 CAME TO A STOP BEHIND VEHICLE 2. LASTLY, I SPOKE WITH DRIVER 4 WHO ADVISED THAT SHE OBSERVED VEHICLE 1 ABRUPTLY CHANGE LANES, COLLIDING WITH VEHICLE 2 AND THE SUBSEQUENT COLLISION OF WITH VEHICLE 3. DRIVER 4 EXPLAINED THAT SHE ATTEMPTED TO APPLY HER BRAKES SUDDENLY, BUT WAS UNABLE TO AVOID COLLIDING WITH THE REAR OF VEHICLE 3. DRIVER 4 ADVISED VEHICLE 4 CAME TO A STOP OFF THE ROADWAY DIRECTLY BEHIND VEHICLE 3. THE EVIDENCE SHOWS A CHAIN REACTION THAT STARTED FROM VEHICLE 1 CHANGING LANES IN AN UNSAFE MANNER, AS VEHICLE 1 WAS FOLLOWING TOO CLOSELY (THE LINE OF TRAFFIC AHEAD) WITH SPEEDS TOO FAST FOR THE WEATHER CONDITIONS. AFTER THE ABRUPT RIGHT TURN INTO THE ADJACENT LANE VEHICLE 2 WAS UNABLE TO STOP OR AVOID THE COLLISION, DUE TO BOTH VEHICLES BEING NEARLY SIDE-BY-SIDE PRIOR TO THE LANE CHANGE. THIS CREATED THE CHAIN REACTION THAT LED TO BOTH VEHICLE'S 3 AND 4 TO COLLIDE IN A REAR END CRASH, WITH BOTH UNSUCCESSFUL ATTEMPTS TO SLOW OR AVOID THE COLLISION. THE EVIDENCE FROM THE SCENE SHOWS FRONT END DAMAGE TO VEHICLE 2, VEHICLE 3 AND VEHICLE 4. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE REAR OF VEHICLE 1, VEHICLE 2 AND VEHICLE 3, AS WELL. ALL DRIVERS AND OCCUPANTS DENIED MEDICAL TREATMENT AT THE SCENE AND ALL VEHICLES WERE DRIVE-ABLE AND DID NOT REQUIRE A TOW.

D1 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E ATWATER AVE NEAR THE INTERSECTION WITH S SWAIN AVE IN THE NORTHERN-MOST LANE. D1 STATED THEY OBSERVED A VEHICLE EITHER SLOWING OR STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT S SWAIN AVE, SOUTH OF E ATWATER AVE. D1 COULD NOT PROVIDE A VEHICLE DESCRIPTION.D1 STATED THAT THIS VEHICLE EITHER RAN THE STOP SIGN OR DID NOT OBSERVE V1, AND ENTERED INTO THE INTERSECTION, HEADING NORTHBOUND ON S SWAIN AVE. D1 STATED THAT THIS ACTION CAUSED HER TO VEER TO THE NORTHEAST IN ORDER TO AVOID THE VEHICLE. D1 STATED THAT SHE DID NOT KNOW IF SHE WAS ACTUALLY HIT BY THE VEHICLE, BUT STATED THE VEHICLE'S ACTIONS CAUSED HER TO RUN OFF THE ROAD INTO A CULVERT ON THE EAST SIDE OF S SWAIN AVE, NORTH OF E ATWATER AVE. THERE WAS NO VISIBLE IMPACT DAMAGE ON V1 FROM ANY OTHER VEHICLE. TIRE TREAD IMPRINTS IN THE MUD AND LEAVES WERE OBSERVED AS BEING PERPENDICULAR TO E ATWATER AVE, AND LEADING IN TO THE CULVERT IN WHICH V1 WAS SEEN POSITIONED IN. PHOTOS WERE TAKEN ON SCENE.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: I WAS UNABLE TO SPEAK TO D1 SO I SPOKE TO HER GRANDDAUGHTER. HER GRANDDAUGHTER STATED THAT D1 WAS GOING DOWN THE HILL AND STATED SHE ATTEMPTED TO AVOID A BRANCH IN THE ROADWAY AND THAT IS WAS CAUSED THE ACCIDENT. I WAS TOLD THAT THE BRANCH WAS REMOVED FROM THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO MY ARRIVAL. THE GRANDDAUGHTER WAS DRIVING IN FRONT OF D1 AS D1 HAD JUST PICKED UP HER CAR FROM A FAMILY MEMBER SO THE GRANDDAUGHTER STOPPED AND WAS THE ONE THAT TRANSPORTED D1 TO THE HOSPITAL.I AM UNSURE OF THE INJURIES TO D1. THERE WAS ANOTHER CALL TIED TO THIS WHICH WAS AN INFORMATION CALL WHICH WAS THE CALL THAT CAME OUT AT 1308 HRS.DUE TO BEING UNABLE TO SPEAK TO D1 AND THIS BEING SOME TIME AFTER THE ACTUAL CRASH TOOK PLACE I AM UNABLE TO SAY DEFINITIVELY THAT A BRANCH DID FALL OR WHAT HAD HAPPENED. THERE WERE MARKS ALONG THE SIDE OF THE ROAD FOR APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET THAT THE RIGHT SIDE TIRES WERE OFF THE ROADWAY PRIOR TO GETTING TO WHERE THE CAR CAME TO REST.

D1 was driving V1 south bound on Fee Lane. D1 advised V1 was behind V2. D1 advised he thought V2 was going to make the turn east bound onto Law Lane but V2 did not make the turn. D1 advised he attempted to stop but did not have enough time, causing V1 to crash into V2.D2 was driving V2 south bound on Fee Lane. D2 advised he was waiting for the road to clear before turning east bound on to Law Lane. D2 advised while stopped in traffic, V1 crashed into V2.

D1 advised that he was traveling S. On N. I-69 exiting on the N. College Ave. exit when the right rear tire of V1 malfunctioned causing D1 to lose control of V1. V1 then traveled off the roadway into an already damaged guardrail end and came to rest approximately 15-20 feet away. I contacted D1's mother given he is a juvenile. She advised that she would arrange for the retrieval of V1 at a later time. The vehicle was not in the roadway and was not impeding traffic. However, on 12/03/2019 I overheard the Indiana State Police request a tow service for the vehicle. I do not know who or where the vehicle was towed to. I have since contacted Heather, D1's mother, and advised her of what I overheard on my police radio and the telephone number for the Indiana State Police Post.

All 3 vehicles were traveling west on E State Rd 45/46 in the left hand lane. Vehicle 3 was in front followed by vehicle 2 and then vehicle 1. Traffic was stopped at the intersection of State Road 45/46 and N Dunn because of a light. Traffic was backed up several feet away from the intersection. The 3 vehicles stopped in the traffic. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that she thought the vehicles in front of her started to move. She then began to accelerate and looked down. When she looked back up she noticed the vehicles were not moving and attempted to stop. Driver of vehicle 1 was unable to avoid colliding with the rear of vehicle 2. This impact then pushed vehicle 2 into the rear of vehicle 3. Vehicle 3 has very minor damage to the rear. Vehicle 2 has very minor damage to the front and moderate damage to the rear. Vehicle 1 has significant damage to the front and was towed from the scene due to damage. No injuries were reported from this accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling north on S Walnut St. Vehicle 2 was traveling east on Dodds St. At the intersection of Walnut and Dodds, vehicle 1 was attempting to travel east through the intersection and vehicle 2 was attempting to continue north. Vehicle 2 is not required to stop at the intersection, however vehicle 1 is. Driver of Vehicle 1 stated he stopped at the intersection and did not see any vehicles and proceeded into the interesection. When pulling into the intersection, driver of vehicle 1 failed to yield right of way to vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 then struck vehicle 1 in the passenger side door. Both vehicles then went off the roadway before coming to a stop. Vehicle 1 has significant damage to the passenger side with airbag deployment. Vehicle 1 was towed due to damage. Vehicle 2 had significant damage to the front and air bag deployment. Vehicle 2 was towed from scene due to damage. No injuries were reported.

Driver 2 stated he was traveling eastbound on West Arlington Road. Driver 2 stated there was a vehicle in front of him, he came to a complete stop at the intersection of North Rajumi Drive. As Driver 2 continued after the vehicle in front of him turned he began approaching the intersection of West Stoutes Creek Road when he observed Driver 1 in his rearview coming up to him at a high rate of speed. Driver 2 stated he was unable to avoid the collision and Driver 1 collided with him in the rear of Vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated that Driver 2 slammed on his brakes and he was unable to avoid a collision and rear ended Driver 2. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy front end damage and was towed by Surgis Towing. Vehicle 2 sustained rear end damage. Both driver's declined medical personnel. An OWI investigation was conducted on Driver 1 who showed a reading of .102. Driver 1 later showed on a certified breath test the reading of .096. Driver 2 was arrested for OWI under 9-30-5-1 and 9-30-5-2.

AN UNINVOLVED VEHICLE ATTEMPTED TO MERGE IN THE WEST LANE BEING OCCUPIED BY V1. TO AVOID A COLLISION WITH THIS OBJECT IN V1'S LANE, V1 MERGED WEST INTO V2. V2 WAS PARKED IN A METERED SPACE AND UNOCCUPIED AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION. V1 AND THE UNINVOLVED VEHICLE DID NOT COLLIDE. V1 WAS TOWED BY RICK'S WRECKER SERVICE.

ON 12/02/2019 UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON OLD ST RD 37 NORTH. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1, LATER IDENTIFIED AS DAVID WILLIAMS WAS TRAVELING NORTH WHEN A DEER ENTERED THE ROADWAY CAUSING UNIT 1 TO RUN OFF THE ROADWAY, INTO A DITCH STRICKING A TREE. UNIT 1 SHOWED SIGNS OF SEVERE FRONT END DAMAGE TO THE HOOD, GRILL AND WINDSHIELD AS WELL AS DAMAGE TO THE CAB OF THE VEHICLE.

Spoke to D1 when I arrived on scene. He advised V1 was traveling east on W Sr 48 about a half mile west of W Vernal Pk. D1 stated when he was attempting to negotiate a 90 degree curve he lost control of V1 and V1 spun around and rolled into a ditch on the north side of the roadway landing on its drivers side facing west. I did note that the road didn't appear slick at the time of my arrival but the temperature had been fluctuating between 31 degrees and 33 degrees and the roadway may have been slick at the time of the crash. I observed V1 in a ditch on the north side of the roadway on its drivers side, at the exit of the curve, consistent with D1's account of events. D1 stated he was not injured in the crash. V1 was towed due to disabling damage.

V1 left the scene prior to my arrival. D1 left the scene prior to my arrival. V2 was traveling northbound on Rogers St approaching 7th St. V2 was attempting to stop when V1 attempted to pass V2. The driver side mirror on V2 was then struck by the passenger side mirror of V1. D2 stated that she was traveling northbound on Rogers St approaching 7st St. D2 stated that she was attempting to stop when V1 passed her causing the passenger side mirror of V1 to hit the driver side mirror of V2. Through my investigation I have determined the D1 used unsafe lane movement causing the passenger side of V1 to hit the driver side of V2. D2 did give a plate number of AHU496 but could not describe the vehicle. A vehicle with damage to its passenger side mirror and no tire was located within 7 blocks of this accident. The plate number on that vehicle was AHU486. I do believe this to be the suspect vehicle in this case but I was unable to make contact with the driver.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 WAS HEADING WEST ON WEST MAIN ST (WEST STATE ROAD 46) IN THE NOTHERN LANE WHEN V1 SIDESWIPED V2. D1 STATED THAT HE HAD HIS SIGNAL ON TO GET IN THE RIGHT (NOTHERN) LANE AND THOUGHT HE HAD CLEARED V2 BUT HIT V2.12/6/2019-UPDATED INSURANCE INFORMATION FOR V1.

V2 was traveling eastbound on E. 3RD ST. When entering the intersection of E. 3RD ST. and N. High ST.V1 was traveling northbound on N. HIGH ST. and stopped at a red signal.As V2 entered the intersection, V1 began making a right hand turn and entered the intersection. V2 struck V1 with the front driver corner, striking the passenger side of V2.

THE OWNER OF THE RESIDENCE AT 6161 NORTH SHUFFLE CREEK ROAD IN BLOOMINGOTN INDIANA CALLED THE MONROE COUNTY SHERRIFF'S OFFICE DUE TO AN ACCIDENT IN HIS FRONT LAWN SOMETIME DURING THE NIGHT OF 12/1/19. THE VEHICLE HAD LEFT THE SCENE. THE VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH BOUND ON NORTH SHUFFLE CREEK DRIVE WHEN IT RAN OFF THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROAD. VEHICLE 1 STRUCK A PRIVACY FENCE, TAKING OUT APPROXIMATELY 6 POSTS. VEHICLE 1 ALSO DAMAGED SEVERAL ANTIQUE WHEEL FRAMES AND LANDSCAPING.THE VEHICLE AND DRIVER WERE LATER FOUND ON 12/2/19. DRIVER 1 WAS UNINJURED, AND CHARGED WITH LEAVING THE SCENE OF AN ACCIDENT.VEHICLE 1 WAS TOWED BY STURGIS TO STURGIS.

Driver 1 was traveling westbound through the Walmart parking lot, located at 3585 West State Road 45. Driver 1 stated he approached a intersection within the parking lot that used to have a stop sign however had since been removed. Driver 1 stated he proceeded through the intersection turning southbound through the parking lot when he had a brief vision issue and struck a concrete pole. Driver 1 stated he thought he had made the turn however could not see for that brief time before the collision as his vision became blurry. Driver 1 was out of the vehicle upon my arrival. Vehicle 1 sustained heavy front left damage and was towed by Surgis Towing due to the damage. Driver 1 declined medical personnel. Driver 1 was administered Field Sobriety testing, passing and submitted to a portable breath test showing a result of .023.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that he was stopped and facing west at the intersection of E 3rd Street and S Kingston Drive, waiting to turn south onto S Kingston Drive. D1 stated that his traffic light turned yellow, and he began clearing the intersection. D1 stated that as he made the left turn, the rear passenger side fender was struck by the front bumper of V2, causing V1 to spin around and hit the front bumper of V3 with the rear driver side fender.D2 stated that she was driving east on E 3rd Street when D1 suddenly turned south in front of her. D2 stated that her front bumper struck V1 in the passenger side fender area.D3 stated that she was sitting at a red light, facing north, at the intersection of E 3rd Street and S Kingston Drive. D3 stated that V1 suddenly stuck the front bumper of her vehicle, but was unsure how it happened as she did not see the accident.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 and V2 were both inside a paid parking lot. V1 was turning left (northwest) from a parking aisle onto the main exit road. V2 was on the main exit road approaching the occupied pay-gate traveling westbound.D1 stated that she was turning left (northwest) from a parking aisle to the main exit road in order to pay and exit the parking lot. D1 stated that when she went to turn left, she did not see V2 in front of her. D1 stated that she made the turn and collided with V2. D1 admitted to me that it was her fault. V1 had damage to the front-end of the vehicle and the front passenger side of the vehicle.D2 stated he was traveling westbound on the main exit road when V1 turned into him and collided with his vehicle. D2 stated that V1 approached the turn at a high rate of speed and collided with the driver side of his vehicle. V2 had damage to the driver side of the vehicle.Both vehicles were towed.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.Other Participant (OP1) had come to a stop at a fully marked crosswalk in order to allow a bicyclist cross who had right-of-way.V2 had come to a stop behind OP1.V1 was approaching V2.OP1 stopped at a crosswalk and allowed a bicyclist to cross. She did not witness the accident that occurred behind her.D2 had come to a stop behind OP1. D2 stated she saw V1 approach her from the rear and saw V1 try to avoid colliding into her. D1 stated he had glanced down at his phone in order to send his friend a text. D1 stated that when he looked back up at the road he saw V2 in front of him that had come to a stop. He attempted to avoid the collision by braking and swerving to the left of V2. D1 was unable to avoid the collision and collided into the rear, driver side quarter panel of V2 with his front, passenger side quarter panel. D1 stated he was traveling approximately 15 mph prior to the collision.There were no reported injuries at the time of the accident investigation. V1 and V2 had moderate damage to their respective areas; however, both vehicles appeared able to be driven safely from the scene.Of note, D2 was driving a rental car through Avis Car Rental. The provided insurance information in the car was insufficient and the phone number provided on the rental agreement went to an Avis rental location that was closed for the night. D2 was advised to contact Avis as soon as she could and let them know of the accident.

Driver 2 reported he was slowing in traffic that was backed up from a stop light and was rear ended.Drive 1 reported was driving and saw a car move into the right lane in traffic, causing vehicles to slow down rapidly and she rear ended another car

THE WITNESS, NIKOLAI DEAN, DID SEE V1 BACKING OUT OF A PARKING SPOT AT THE VILLAGE PANTRY LOCATED AT 275 EAST WINSLOW ROAD.NIKOLAI EXPLAINED THAT A WHITE MALE WITH A GOATEE, DARK TABOGAN, AND HOODIE, WAS DRIVING V1 AND THAT V1 DID BACK OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT UNTIL THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER OF V1 DID MAKE CONTACT WITH THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE CORNER OF V2.V2 WAS PARKED AT GAS PUMP 1, FACING NORTH. THE OWNER OF V2 WAS INSIDE THE GAS STATION AND DID NOT WITNESS THE ACCIDENT.BOTH V2 AND V1 DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT. V1 DID THEN LEAVE THE AREA, DRIVING NORTH ON HENDERSON UNTIL COMING TO A STOP AT 2374 SOUTH HENDERSON STREET. NIKOLAI DID NOT SEE THE DRIVER AFTER THE TRUCK WAS PARKED AT 2374 SOUTH HENDERSON STREET.THE OWNER OF V2 DID NOT WITNESS THE ACCIDENT, BUT WAS CONTACTED BY NIKOLAI AS HE CAME OUT OF THE GAST STATION.

V1 WAS PULLING OUT OF 528 S COLLEGE AVE PARKING LOT GOING SOUTH ON COLLEGE AVE.PED #1 SAID SHE WAS WALKING ACROSS COLLEGE AVE GOING TO 528 S COLLEGE AVE.PED #1 SAID V1 HIT HER AS AND SHE FELL DOWN AS A RESULT. SHE SAID D1 WAS A WHITE FEMALE WITH LONG BROWN HAIR. SHE ADV THE THINKS V1 WAS A BUICK RENDEZVOUS.OTHER LOCATION OF INVESTIGATION WAS IU HEALTH EMERGENCY ROOM AND KROGER.I AM WAITING TO HEAR FROM KROGER SECURITY FOR ANY VIDEO THAT MAY HELP WITH THE INVESTIGATION.
Drive 1 was heading eastbound on SR 46 and struck a deer just west of 8045 West SR 46, Ellettsville

D1 stated that that he was going southbound on Roger Rd near the 2500 block of South Rogers St when the vehicle on him slammed on the brakes. This caused him to over correct and drive off road into a house. V1 was traveling southbound on Rogers St near the 2500 block of south Rogers Street when the front of V1 made contact with the rear of V2. This caused V1 to swear off road, through a fence and into a house. D2 stated that he was traveling southbound on Rogers St near the 2500 block of south Rogers St when the front of V1 made contact with the rear of V2. V2 was traveling southbound on Rogers St near the 2500 block of south Rogers St when the front of V1 made contact with the rear of V2. Through my investigation I have determined that V1 was following to closely to V2 causing the accident. D1 was arrest for Operating while intoxicated. Damage to a fence was done to 2503 S Rogers St by V1. Damage to a fence and the side of a house was done to 2505 S Rogers St by V1.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.3rd Street is a two lane, one way road that runs westbound. V2 is a shuttle van. V2 had stopped at a designated passenger pick up location on 3rd Street and was picking up/letting off passengers. V2 was in the northmost lane.V1 was behind V2 and was attempting to change lanes into the southmost lane.V2 had been stopped for approximately two seconds. D2 stated that he had turned his flashing lights on about 1 block earlier in order to warn traffic behind him that he would be stopping soon. After he had stopped he was struck by V1. V2 sustained damage on the rear, driver side quarterpanel.V1 had seen that V2 had stopped. D1 stated she was looking over her shoulder and was looking for an opening so she could change lanes into the southmost lane. D1 then began to change lanes but was closer to V2 than she realized. She then struck V1 with her front, passenger side bumper and quarterpanel.There were no injuries reported during the investigation. Neither vehicle needed towed due to disabling damage.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED HE WAS NORTH BOUND ON LANDMARK AVENUE, JUST NORTH OF BLOOMFIELD ROAD, STOPPED TO WAIT ON SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC SO HE COULD TURN LEFT (WEST), INTO AN ADJACENT PARKING LOT. A DRIVER IN THE SOUTH BOUND TURN LANE MOTIONED FOR D1 TO TURN LEFT IN FRONT OF HIS VEHICLE. D1 DID NOT SEE VEHICLE 2 APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH. AS DRIVER 1 TURNED LEFT (WEST), V1 CROSSED IN FRONT OF V2 AS IT TRAVELLED SOUTH. V2 COLLIDED WITH V1. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED HE WAS SOUTH BOUND ON LANDMARK AVENUE, JUST SOUTH OF ARCH HAVEN DRIVE. SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC WAS BACKED UP FROM THE BLOOMFIELD RD IN THE TURN LANE, BUT V2 WAS ABLE TO PASS THE BACK UP ON THE RIGHT DUE TO THE WIDTH OF THE ROAD. AS V1 CONTINUED SOUTH, V1 TURNED IN FRONT OF IT. V2 COLLIDED WITH V1.

Unit 2 was driving East bound on Temperance St in Ellettsville IN. When Unit 1 pulled out of the shell gas station. While unit 1 was pulling out she struck a curb, which made her swerve into the outside lane and made contact with unit 2's vehicle. When I arrived on scene unit 1 wasn't able to provide an insurance policy number. Later in the day the female driver of unit 1 was able to provide the insurance policy number.

At approximately 1125 hours on 12/4/2019 a collision occurred between V1, an unknown blue 4-door sedan, and D2, who was on a bicycle. D2 was in the bicycle lane on the north side of 10th Street, travelling west toward the intersection of 10th and Jordan Avenue. V1 turned north, colliding with D2 and knocking his bicycle over. D2 stated that V1 stopped and confirmed that he did not require his information before leaving the scene. D2 had moderate scraping to his left knee from impact with the asphalt. D2's bicycle had minor damage to the left pedal. D2 advised that he required a report for his employer, Jimmy John's, as he was working at the time of the incident. This was not a hit and run, only marked this way because the ARIES would not allow V1 to be left blank unless marked as such.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was parked approximately 1000 feet east of Fisher Court on Jordan Avenue facing east. Vehicle 2 was traveling east on Jordan Avenue just west of where Vehicle 1 was parked. Driver 1 stated she began exiting her parking spot but had to stop and back up to continue exiting the spot. Driver 1 stated she then exited the spot and drove down the road for roughly 5 seconds before being struck from behind by Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated she was traveling down the roadway when Vehicle 1 began pulling out in front of her. Driver 2 advised it occurred so fast she didn't have time to react.Driver 2 advised her wrists hurt from the airbag deployment and that she hit her lip but stated she was fine. Driver 2 declined medical attention from the ambulance. No one else involved complained of any injuries.There is damage to the rear driver's side bumper of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had damage to the front passenger side bumper as well as airbag deployment causing windshield cracking. The damage is not consistent with Driver 1's statement that she was completely in the roadway before being struck.On 12/05/2019 I was contacted with the corrected insurance information for Vehicle 2.On 12/05/2019, Driver 1 contacted me extremely upset after reading the report. She stated that she was completely in the roadway when the accident occurred. When I stated this would have required Vehicle 2 to be completely in the oncoming traffic lane Driver 1 stated this was extremely plausible. Driver 1 advised she wanted it noted that Driver 2 was heading to work and was running late. Driver 1 stated that Driver 2 must have been speeding or not paying any attention. When I explained to her that Driver 2 had advised she just left her parking spot several spaces down and could not have been speeding, Driver 1 then changed the story stating Driver 2 was probably texting and asked that I check Driver 2's messages. She later stated that multiple male friends of Driver 2 showed up to comfort her after the accident and coached her through what to say. I asked her what evidence she had to support this and she did not have any. She advised she believed this probably happened.

UNIT 2 STATED THAT AFTER LEAVING THE LIGHT ON THE WEST STATE ROAD 46 OVERPASS TO TURN ONTO THE ON RAMP FOR INTERSTATE 69, UNIT 1 LEFT HIS LANE, AND ENTERED UNIT 2'S LANE, STRIKING HER VEHICLE. UNIT 2 STATED SHE TRIED TO GET OUT OF THE WAY OF UNIT 1, BUT WAS ULTIMATELY FORCED TO THE EDGE OF THE ROAD WHERE SHE WAS STRUCK ON THE REAR DRIVERS SIDE PANNEL. UNIT 1 STATED THAT HE DID NOT BELIEVE HE LEFT HIS LANE, BUT STATED THAT THE UNITS "JUST COLLIDED" WHILE ENTERING THE ON RAMP.

Traffic was stopped eastbound on E. Bethel Lane just off of N Old State Road 37 due to Reed and Sons Construction Company having traffic down to one lane on E. Bethel Lane. They did have a flagger present. V2 was stopped in traffic on E. Bethel Lane. V1 turned right onto E. Bethel Lane from N Old State Road 37 and was unable to stop before rear ending V2. V2 sustained disabling damage from the crash.

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 ADVISED HE WAS EAST BOUND THROUGH THE PARKING LOT OF MUELLER PARKWAY. D1 DID NOT SEE ANY VEHICLES IN HIS LINE OF TRAVEL. HE LOOKED DOWN AT HIS CELLPHONE AND WHILE HE WAS LOOKING AWAY FROM THE ROADWAY, HE FELT THE IMPACT WITH V2. DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS IN A PARKING SPACE IN FRONT OF BUILDING 502 ON MUELLER PARKWAY. D2 BACKED OUT OF HER PARKING SPACE AND SHIFTED V2 INTO DRIVE. AT THAT TIME, V2 WAS STRUCK BY V1.

V3/D3 STATED "I WAS EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46 BYPASS, I HAD JUST TRAVELED THROUGH THE LIGHT OF N. KINSER PIKE, I WAS IN THE NORTHERN MOST LANE OF TRAVEL. ALL OF THE SUDDEN VEHICLES IN FRONT OF ME CAME TO A STOP, I STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY, V2 BEHIND ME WAS ABLE TO STOP, AND THEN WAS STRUCK BY V1 WHICH THEN PUSHED V2 INTO MY VEHICLE. I AM NOT HURT OR INJURIED, I HAD A HEADACHE THIS MORNING."V2/D2 STATED "I WAS BEHIND V3 EASTBOUND ON W. SR 45/46. ALL OF THE SUDDEN V3 STOPPED. I SLAMMED ON MY BRAKES AND STOPPED, AND THEN WAS REAR ENDED BY V1."V1/D1 STATED "I WAS GOING ABOUT 30 MPH ON SR. 45/46. I WAS BEHIND V2 AND V3. ALL OF THE SUDDEN THEY BOTH STOPPED. I WAS UNABLE TO STOP, AND I REAR ENDED V2 WHICH THEN STRUCK V3."

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: At approximately 1635 hours on 12/4/2019 a collision occurred between V1 and V2 at the intersection of State Road 45/46 and 17th Street. V1 was travelling southbound in the far east lane, approaching the intersection of 45/46 and 17th. V2 was at the intersection of 45/46 and 17th, waiting in the turn lane to turn west. Both vehicles entered the intersection near the light change and the passenger side front bumper of V1 collided with the passenger side rear tire and bumper of V2.D1 advised that he was southbound on 45/46, approaching the intersection at 17th. He stated that the light turned yellow, he briefly decelerated, and entered the intersection. D1 advised that as he was entering the intersection, V2 pulled forward from the turn lane and attempted to turn in front of him. He stated that he initially tried to steer right around the vehicle, realized he would be unsuccessful, and then attempted to steer left. He advised he was braking the entire time this manuever was taking place, but could not slow down enough to avoid collision. There was damage to the passenger side front bumper and headlight of V1.D2 advised that she had been northbound on 45/46 and entered the eastern turn lane to turn west onto 17th. D2 advised that she and another vehicle entered the intersection while the light was green, the vehicle ahead of her turned and then she saw V1 slow down as the light turned yellow. D2 stated that she believed V1 was stopping, so she attempted to complete her turn. D2 advised that V1 rapidly accelerated, causing her to be unable to avoid collision. There was damage to the rear passenger side bumper and tire well of V2, making the vehicle inoperable.Neither party complained of injury or requested medical attention. V2 was towed by Chandlers Towing.

BOTH UNITS INVOLVED WERE BACKING OUT OF PARKING SPACES WHEN THEY COLLIDED. UNIT 2 DRIVER STATED SHE WAS ALMOST ALL OF THE WAY OUT OF HER PARKING SPOT AND READY TO PUT THE UNIT INTO DRIVE WHEN SHE WAS STRUCK. UNIT 1 STATED THAT SHE COULD NOT SEE THE REVERSE LIGHTS OF UNIT 2. A PASSERBY STATED THAT UNIT 1 BACKED OUT VERY QUICKLY AND THAT UNIT 2 WAS ALREADY MOVING WHEN UNIT 1 BEGAN MOVING. THE PASSERBY UNFORTUNATELY LEFT PRIOR TO ALLOWING ME TO OBTAIN HIS PERSONAL INFORMATION.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N STATE ROAD 46 NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF E 7TH STREET. V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON N STATE ROAD 46 AT E 7TH STREET INTERSECTION. V3 WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC FACING SB ON N STATE ROAD 46 AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 7TH STREET. AS V1 WAS APPROACHED SLOWING TRAFFIC, SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE COLLIDING WITH V2. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 WHICH THEN SENT THE FRONT OF V2 INTO V3.D1 STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING SB AT THE INTERSECTION OF N STATE ROAD 46 AND E 7TH STREET AND COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2. D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS SLOWING IN BACKED UP TRAFFIC WHEN THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK BY THE FRONT OF V1 WHICH THEN CAUSED THE FRONT OF V2 TO COLLIDE WITH V3.D3 STATED SHE WAS COMPLETELY STOPPED IN TRAFFIC WHEN THE REAR OF HER VEHICLE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY V2.

V1 WAS WESTBOUND ON 3RD STREET JUST WEST OF JOHNSON AVE IN THE RIGHT LANE.V2 WAS DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID V2 HAD TAILGATING HER AND THEN PASSED HER. SHE SAID SHE THEN FOLLOWED HIM TO THE PARKING LOT AT 3400 W 3RD ST WHERE I MET WITH THEM.D2 SAID AS TRAFFIC AHEAD SLOWED HE BRAKED AND V1 HIT HIM FROM BEHIND.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

DRIVER OF VEHICLE 1 STATED SHE WAS WEST BOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD, STOPPED AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT LEONARD SPRINGS RD, DIRECTLY BEHIND VEHICLE 2. V1 REAR ENDED V2.DRIVER OF VEHICLE 2 STATED SHE WAS WEST BOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD, STOPPED AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT LEONARD SPRINGS RD. THE TURN ARROW FROM WEST BOUND BLOOMFIELD TO SOUTH BOUND LEONARD SPRINGS ACTIVATED, BUT THE WEST BOUND LIGHT WAS STILL RED. V2 WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.

D1 WAS WAS TRAVELING SB ON S STATE ROAD 37 NEAR THE SOUTHBOUND ENTRANCE RAMP FROM E MONROE DAM ROAD. D1 SAID HE SAW A PALLET IN MIDDLE OF THE ROADWAY NEAR THE RAMP AND TRIED TO AVOID IT, BUT COLLIDED WITH IT. THE PALLET SHATTERED INTO NUMEROUS PIECES ACROSS THE ROADWAY. D1 PULLED OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND DISCOVERED THAT HIS FRONT DRIVER SIDE TIRE HAD POPPED. HE THEN CHANGED HIS TIRE.D1 DID NOT REQUEST A TOW, AND WAS NOT INJURED.THE LARGER PALLET PIECES WERE REMOVED FROM THE ROADWAY.

V1 AND V2 WERE TURNING WB ON W 3RD ST FROM THE NORTH BOUND RAMP. D2 ADVISED V2 IN THE MOST LEFT TURN LANE. D2 STATED AS V2 WAS TAKING THE TURN, V1 ATTEMPTED TO PASS V2 ON THE LEFT AND STRUCK V2 ON THE REAR LEFT DRIVER SIDE TIRE ON THE SEMI'S TRAILER. THIS CAUSED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR TIRE. D1 ADVISED V1 WAS IN THE FAR LEFT TURN LANE AND ADVISED V2 WAS IN THE RIGHT TURN LANE. D1 STATED AS THEY TOOK THE TURN, V2 SWERVED INTO V1'S LANE OF TRAVEL. Primary Cause-Driver Factor-Unsafe Speed: V1 was traveling to fast for the conditions. The conditions were that V2 had to stop suddenly in traffic. V1 should have driven at a reduced speed to avoid colliding into the rear of V2.Curry Pike is a local roadway that runs in a northern and southern direction through Monroe County. Woodyard Rd. is a local roadway that runs in a eastern and western direction and intersects with Curry Pike 950ft North of where the crash occurred. V2 (beige 2005 Nissan Murano) was traveling northbound in the left lane of Curry Pike and was attempting to stop in traffic. V1 (2014 black Ford Fusion) was traveling northbound on Curry Pike directly behind V2. V1 failed to stop and collided into the rear of V2. W1 was traveling northbound on Curry Pike in the left lane directly behind V1. {Driver Statements} D1 (Michael Gundolff) stated that he was traveling north on Curry Pike when V2 stopped suddenly in front of him. D1 stated he applied the brakes but did not have time to stop and collided into the rear of V2. He was wearing his seat belt.D2 (Wayne Warthan) stated that he was traveling north on Curry Pike in the left lane when traffic in front of him came to a sudden stop. D2 stated he applied the brakes in an attempt to stop when he was struck in the rear by V1. He was wearing his seat belt.{Witness Statements} W1 stated that he was traveling northbound on Curry Pike in the left lane directly behind V1. W1 stated that traffic in front of him stopped suddenly and V1 did not have time to react. W1 stated that V1 struck V2 in the rear.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the rear bumper area of V2. I also observed heavy damage to the entire front end of V1. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash. {Conclusion}The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash was Unsafe Speed on the part of D1. This was determined by damage sustained to both vehicles and witness statement.

Driver 1 was traveling eastbound on West State Road 45 near the intersection of South Harmony Road. Driver 1 stated after passing the intersection he hit a bump in the roadway which caused the trailer hitch to come undone. Driver 1 was able to move into the driveway of 7265 West State Road 45 as the trailer hitch lodged underneath the rear bumper causing minor damage. Driver 1 declined medical personnel. Vehicle sustained the minor rear bumper damage and was able to dislodge the trailer not requiring a tow service.

D2 stated that he was traveling eastbound on W State Road 46 just west of the I-69 South exit. D2 stated that he saw V1 driving recklessly in his rear view mirror by aggressively weaving in and out of traffic. D2 stated that he was traveling in the left lane as V1 approached him from the rear, V1 was also traveling in the left lane. D2 stated that V1 attempted to switch lanes abruptly attempting to take the exit on the right hand side to I-69 South and sideswiped V2 with the front passenger side of V1 causing damage to the rear passenger side of V2. D2 stated that V1 then left the scene of the accident. D2 was able to provide a license plate number and description of V1, as well as a description of D1. I was eventually able to make contact with D1 who stated that she left the scene of the accident because she was scared.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: I was dispatched to the area of 11th Street and Fee Lane for a personal injury crash. I arrived the same time as IU Bloomington Health Medics 2164. Upon arrival both vehicles were facing south bound on Fee Lane. V1 was directly behind V2. Both parties involved in the crash advised they did not need medical attention and they were fine. I was advised the crash occurred at Law Lane and Fee Lane. D1 said she was in a rush to get to the hospital and was traveling westbound on Law Lane in V1. D1 said she came to a stop at the stop sign where Law Lane comes to a T intersection with Fee Lane. D1 said a vehicle was traveling north bound on Fee Lane. D1 said she let the vehicle pass and then pulled out to go south on Fee Lane. D1 said as she pulled out she did not see V2, which was traveling south bound on Fee Lane. D1 said when she pulled out she struck V2 with V1 on the driver side front door. When speaking with D1, she repeatedly kept saying the accident was her fault and she needed to get to the hospital. D2 said she was traveling south bound on Fee Lane in V2. D2 said V1 pulled out onto Fee Lane from Law Lane and struck V2 with V1 on the driver side front door. I asked D2 if she observed V1 stopped at the stop sign prior to V1 pulling out, D2 said she was unsure.

No other officers assisted with the accident investigation.Type of Crash (other explain in narrative) - Collision with concrete support beam in parking garage.Sequence of Collision Events (other pole/post or support) - Concrete support beam in parking garageV1 was parked in a valid parking stall that was next to a concrete support beam inside a parking garage.D1 stated he began backing out of the parking stall and was turning his steering wheel. D1 turned too sharp and V1's front, driver side bumper became caught on a square, concrete support beam. The momentum of the vehicle then pulled the front bumper off of V1. There was no damage to the support beam.D1 stated he was going to leave his car parked in the parking stall and may call a tow truck in the morning.

D1 stated they were driving east on W 11th Street when they came to a complete at the stop sign with N Walnut Street. D1 stated that the next thing they remember is pulling onto N Walnut Street and being hit by D2 in the passenger side door, and rolling over. D1 was initially trapped in the vehicle but was removed shortly and taken to the hospital by Officer Southern.D2 stated they were driving north bound on N Walnut Street approaching West 11th Street in V2. D2 said they observed V1 traveling east bound on W 11th when V1 did not stop at the stop sign. D2 said they applied their brakes but could not stop as V1 ran the stop sign. V2 collided at a right angle with the passenger side of V1. V1 then rolled over onto its driver side. Both V1 and V2 were towed due to disabling damage by Ken's West Side towing.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 advised he was facing south on a private lot preparing to make a right turn onto E SR 45 46 Bypass. D1 stated traffic was stopped so he peaked his nose out. When he thought it was clear he pulled across all four lanes to attempt to get into the left turn hand lane. As he was pulling out V2 struck the rear driver side of his vehicle and caused the rear passenger side to swing and hit V3. I observed damage to the rear driver side and rear passenger side of V1. D2 stated she was traveling westbound on E SR 45 46 Bypass approaching the N. Walnut St intersection. D2 advised she was in the middle lane and merged left to head into the left turn lane ahead. After she merged over V1 pulled out in front of her causing her to hit the rear driver side of V1. I observed damage to the front of V2. D3 stated he was facing westbound on E SR 45 45 Bypass stopped at a red light. Suddenly he was hit in the rear by V1. I observed damage to the rear driver side of V3. All parties advised they did not need medical assistance.

Driver 2 stated that she was facing West, and stopped at the traffic light located at E. 3rd St. and S. College Mall Rd. She also stated that V1 was also stopped at the light, directly to the left of V2, facing the same direction, and . Driver 2 mentioned that Driver 1 did not stop, turned north on State Rd 45/46 Bypass, and left the scene.The witness stated that he was directly behind V1. According to the witness, V1 was in the left turn lane, however, it suddenly attempted to merge into its immediate right lane, and struck V2 in the front right corner. The witness mentioned that V1 did not stop after the collision, and left the scene northbound on State Rd 45/46 Bypass.

V1 WAS EASTBOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD ARRPOACHING WEIMER RD.V2 WAS DIRECLTY IN FRONT OF V1.D1 SAID WHEN V2 STOPPED FOR TRAFFIC AHEAD HE COULD NOT GET STOPPED BEFORE HITTING V2.D2 SAID WHEN THE CAR IN FRONT OF HER STOPPED SHE ALSO STOPPED. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stated she was stopped on 19th St waiting to turn right onto Walnut St. Driver 1 stated a car in the right lane of Walnut St was turning onto 19th St. Driver 1 thought it was clear to turn onto Walnut St and proceeded to pull onto Walnut St. Driver 1 stated she immediately went into the left lane of Walnut St and collided with vehicle 2. Driver 2 stated she was north on Walnut St passing 19th St in the left lane. Driver 2 stated vehicle 1pulled out from 19th St and collided with her car. Driver 2 had the right of way.

Walnut St. According to Driver 2, Vehicle 1 was in the left turn lane, and was approaching the intersection from east. Driver 1 stated she was traveling eastbound on East State Road 46 approaching the intersection of North Brown County Line Road. D1 advised he was driving north bound on State Road 46. D1 advised while driving V1 north bound a deer ran into the roadway from the east side of the road. D1 advised when the deer ran into the roadway V1 crashed into the deer.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was traveling eastbound on E Rogers Road, preparing to enter the roundabout at S Sare Road to then continue northbound on S Sare Rd. D1 stated that she yielded to oncoming traffic in the circle and pulled into the circle, D1 stated at that point V2 entered the circle from her left, coming from the north, and struck V1. D1 believes that V2 failed to yield to her. D1 stated that she was not on her cell phone and that she was paying attention.D2 stated that he was traveling southbound on S Sare Road, and entered the roundabout at E Rogers Road to continue south on S Sare Road. D2 stated that as he was already traveling in the circle, V1 failed to yield, coming from the west, and collided with V2. D2 stated that he believes D1 was on her cell phone at the time of the accident. Based on the position the vehicles were in when they came to rest, it appears that V1 failed to yield the right of way to V2, resulting in an accident. Both drivers stated that they were not injured and did not want an ambulance.Neither vehicle needed to be towed from the scene.

D2 stated that she returned to her parked vehicle, in front of 631 N College Avenue, when she noticed a note that was left on her windshield. D2 stated that the note was placed on her car by some residents at the 631 N College Avenue address, informing her that they witnessed the accident. D2 stated that she talked to some of the residents, and they informed her that a black truck backed into V2, got out and looked at the damage, and then left the scene.I spoke with Joshua Ahdoot, a resident of 631 N College Avenue, who stated that the individuals who witnessed the accident were not currently home, but that he did see a black truck leaving the area after the accident. Joshua stated that one person tried to record the license plate of the truck but was unable to do so.The birthday listed for D1 was only inputted to validate a driver, and is not the actual birthday.

One vehicle property damage accident off the drive area upon a sidewalk. Driver two reported she was slowing down for traffic and pedestrians in the roadway and she was rear endedDriver one reported he did not see traffic slowing down and rear ended the other vehicleDriver two was going to be transported by personal vehicle to seek medical treatment.

Driver 1 (D1) advised that he was heading southbound on N Walnut Street where it turns into N College Avenue at the intersection of W State Road 45/46. D1 stated that he believed the light to be yellow as he went through the intersection. D1 explained that as he went through the intersection that his vehicle struck Vehicle (V2) who was attempting to turn westbound On W State Road 45/46 from N Walnut Street. D1 denied needing any medical attention on scene. Driver 2 (D2) advised that he was turning left in order to head Westbound on W State Road 45/46 from N Walnut Street. D2 advised that he had the green arrow when he made the turn. D2 advised that D1 ignored the stop sign and struck his vehicle in the intersection. D2 denied needing any medical attention on scene. Both vehicles were towed from the scene due to damage.

Primary Cause-Driver Factor-Failure To Maintain Lane: D1 failed to maintain her lane and V1 crossed the center lane traveling into the westbound lane of oncoming traffic. Contributory Cause-Driver Factor-Unsafe Speed: D1 was traveling to fast for the conditions. The conditions were that the roadway surface was wet and D1 should have driven at a reduced speed to avoid losing control of V1.SR48 is a highway that runs primarily in a eastern and western direction through Monroe County. Vernal Pike is a county road that intersects with SR48 950ft east of the crash. In the area of the crash the roadway is curved/level and the surface condition was wet.V1 (2004 tan Dodge Durango) was traveling eastbound on SR48. The rear of the vehicle slid in a counter clockwise direction, spinning 180 degrees and crossing over into the westbound lane. The front of V1 was facing southwest as V1 traveled backwards off the roadway into a ditch located on the north side of SR48. V1 came to rest in the ditch on the driver side (inverted) of V1.D1 (Donitta Pfaff) stated she was traveling eastbound on SR48. The rear of her vehicle began to slide and she lost control running off the roadway. She was wearing her seat belt.W1 (Levi Coleman) stated he was traveling westbound on SR48. W1 stated that V1 was traveling eastbound and slide counter clockwise crossing over into his lane and then traveling off the roadway.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the entire driver side of V1. I observed tire tracks in the mud leading into the ditch from V1. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash was Failure To Maintain Lane on the part of D1. This was determined by driver and witness statements and damage to V1.

V1 was east bound on SR 48 when due to unsafe speed, D1 ran off the roadway colliding with a tree. D1 sustained minor eye injury and was wearing her seatbelt. As a result the vehicle needed to be towed from the scene, and D1 went to the hospital for treatment.

D1 WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 446 APPROX 1000 FEET SOUTH OF E SWARTZ RIDGE ROAD. V1 was traveling W/B on Bloomfield RD. V1 rear ended V2, which caused damage. D1 advised that she was traveling W/B on Bloomfield RD. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 2 was traveling south on S Walnut in the right hand lane. Vehicle 1 was traveling north on S Walnut. Vehicle 1 moved into the center turn lane to turn west into the parking lot of 2424 S Walnut utilizing the south entrance. Driver of vehicle 1 stated that the vehicles in the left hand south bound lane had stopped and left an opening for her to drive through. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling north on SR45/46, and then got into the left turn lane at the intersection of SR45/46 and 17th street. V2 was traveling south on SR 45/46 approaching the same intersection. The traffic light at that intersection was yellow, about to turn red. V1 proceeded to turn left onto 17th street. V2 proceeded through the intersection at the same time. V1 struck V2 in the driver side door, with the driver side front bumper of V1. D1 stated the light was yellow, and about to turn red. D1 thought V2 was coming to a stop, so she proceeded through the intersection. D1 said V2 didn't stop, causing her to strike V2 in the driver side door. D2 said the light was yellow, about to turn red, so he proceeded through the intersection. D2 said V1 then struck his vehicle in the driver side door. D2 had the right of way. D1 should have let the intersection completely clear before proceeding.
