The driver did not believe the vehicle was damaged from the deer and I was unable to see any damage to the vehicle in the dark. I met with the driver at his residence on 12/11/2010 and the driver had located damage on the rear drivers door from the deer.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EAST ON STATE ROAD 45, APPROACHING JOHN WILLIAMS LANE WHEN A DEER RAN OUT INTO THE ROADWAY. V1 STRUCK THE DEER NEAR THE INTERSECTION CAUSING FRONT END DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE. THE VEHICLE WAS MADE DRIVEABLE AND NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.

Narrative By Chief Deputy William Jay HumphreyEllettsville Police DepartmentDecember 10th 2019Report #19E-06775Driver #1 Shania KilgoreDriver #2 Castro Fernando (Republica De Costa Rica) was driving Rent A Car From Hertz Corporation. Driver #1 Vehicle struck rear of Vehicle #2 on Harstrait Rd. / Ratliff Rd. This took place on hill on Harstrait Rd. Vehicle #1 driver at fault.Note....Driver of Vehicle #1 said she started coughing right before impact to Vehicle #2

V1 was traveling W/B on Dodd's ST. V2 was parked on parked DR facing N/B. V1 backed into V2 while parked.D1 advised that she was traveling W/B on Dodd's St. D1 advised that she attempted to reverse traveling N/B on private drive. D1 stated that while attempting to dropped off of a student in the area of 718 W Dodd's St, she backed into V2 while parked. D1 advised that she thought that she had enough room to back up. D1 advised that she was not injured along with any of the students on the bus. V2 was parked backing N/B on private drive unoccupied. V2 was damaged on the rear passenger side.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling Westbound on Country Club Drive at the intersection of the drive to CVS, located at 2650 S Walnut Street. Vehicle 2 was traveling Eastbound on Country Club Drive at the same intersection. Traffic was stopped at a traffic light ahead of Vehicle 2.Vehicle 1 turned South in front of Vehicle 2, who was continuing East, around a stopped bus. Vehicle 1 was struck by Vehicle 2.Driver 1 stated that the stationary bus driver waved him to turn in front of it. Driver 2 stated that Vehicle 1 came out of nowhere and the collision could not be avoided.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: UNIT 1 STATED THAT THEY WERE TURNING OFF OF N SMITH PIKE ONTO WOODYARD RD. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THEY WERE PAYING ATTENTION TO ANOTHER VEHICLE IN THE ROADWAY, AND WHEN SHE ENTERED THE INTERSECTION, SHE FAILED TO SEE UNIT 2.THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE FRONT BUMPER OF UNIT 1 ON THE DRIVERS SIDE. UNIT 2 HAD DAMAGE TO THE TIRE AND WHEEL WELL AREA ON THE REAR DRIVERS SIDE.

V1 WAS BACKING UP IN THE PARKING LOT OF 301 N GATES DRIVE AND STRUCK V2 THAT WAS PARKED ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE PARKING LOT.D1 STATED THAT A SILVER FORD PICKUP TRUCK ENTERED IN THE WRONG ENTRANCE OF THE PARKING LOT, DROVE THE WRONG WAY THROUGH THE LOT, HONKED AT HER, WHICH CAUSED HER TO BACK INTO V2. THIS WAS A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR IN THE COLLISON, HOWEVER D1 ULTIMATELY BACKED INTO V2. THE OWNERS OF V2 GAVE A SIMILAR STATEMENT AS D1.THE SILVER TRUCK DID NOT STRIKE ANY VEHICLE AND DID NOT REMAIN ON SCENE.

V1 was traveling E on SR 45 and continued through the intersection of Industrial Blvd. V2 entered the intersection to turn left and travel west on SR 45. The front of V1 then collided with the front driver side of V2 causing disabling damage to both vehicles.D1 stated that as she was driving through the intersection she had looked in her rear view mirror and did not realize that the light had turned red. She said that she realized later that the light was not green when she entered the intersection. D2 stated that she observed the turn lane traffic light turn green and she accelerated into the intersection and was struck. D2 stated that she did not observe V1 before the impact.

V2 was traveling South on Jordan Ave at Law Ln. V1 was traveling West on Law Ln and entered the intersection against the red automatic traffic signal and into the path of V2. V2 struck V1 in the center passenger side of the vehicle. No injuries were reported at the time of the report. D1 said that as she was driving West on Law Ln she did not realize that she had a red light until she was already in the intersection and was struck by V2. V1 had significant damage to the passenger side.D2 said that as he was driving South on Jordan Ave, V1 disregarded the red traffic signal and into the intersection. D2 said that he could not avoid the collision. V2 had damage to the front of the vehicle. Witness 1 said that he was stopped for the red traffic signal facing East on Law Ln. W1 said that V1 drove into the intersection while the traffic signal was still red and was struck by V2. V1 did have side airbag deployment on the passenger side, although the driver requested to park the car in a valid parking space rather than have it towed.

On Wednesday, December 11, 2019 at 16:45, I responded to a crash on Welmir Drive at Runkle Lane. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry. Welmir Drive is a local (private) roadway that runs primarily east/west through a shopping center. Runkle Lane runs north/south from SR48 (3rd Street) to Welmir Drive. Runkle Lane intersects with Welmir Drive as a T-Intersection with a stop sign for traffic traveling north on Runkle Lane. V1, gray Pontiac, was traveling north on Runkle Lane attempting to make a left turn, west, onto Welmir Drive. V2, white Buick, was traveling east on Welmir Drive approaching Runkle Lane. V1 failed to yield the right of way to V2 and made a left turn onto Welmir Drive. V1 traveled left of center during the left turn and struck the left front of V2 with the left front of V1.D1, Thomas, stated she was attempting to make a left turn onto Welmir Drive from Runkle Lane. D1 stated she stopped at the stop sign and did not observe V2 traveling east on Welmir Drive. D1 stated she struck the front of V2 with the front of V1 as she made the left turn. D1 advised she did not possess a valid driver's license, rather only a learner's permit. D2, Easterling, stated she was traveling east on Welmir Drive approaching Runkle Lane. D2 stated V1 traveled across her lane of travel then struck the front left of V2. Evidence shows damage to the front left corner of V1. Evidence shows damage to the front left corner of V2. Evidence shows D1 was operating V1 in violation of her learner's permit.

On Wednesday, December 11, 2019 at 18:10, I responded to a crash on I69 northbound near the 111.5 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear, the road surface was dry and there is no street lighting. A trailer was stopped across both northbound lanes of I69 due to a previous incident, 201900421340. V1, silver Honda, was traveling north on I69 in the right lane. V1 struck a trailer that was stopped across the northbound lanes. V1 came to a controlled stop along the northbound emergency shoulder. D1, Sexton, stated he was traveling north on I69 in the right lane behind another vehicle. D1 stated the other vehicle activated its emergency flashers then swerved to the right. D1 stated he observed a trailer stopped across the northbound lanes. D1 stated he attempted to slow but was unable to avoid a collision with the trailer. D1 stated he struck the trailer then came to a stop along the emergency shoulder. Other Participant: Timothy Ray Woodcock, 251 Beechview Drive, Greenwood, Indiana. Operating a red 2007 Ford F150, Indiana registration TPO555, towing 1990 Unknown Trailer, VIN 00000000008982183, Indiana registration TR336ZND. Insurance: Progressive, Policy 910382795, Telephone 800-776-4747. Trailer became separated from vehicle, struck a guardrail then came to final rest across northbound lanes of I69. OP advised he stopped and activated his emergency flashers in an attempt to warn northbound traffic. OP advised an unknown motorist stopped after V1 struck the trailer and assisted him push the trailer into the median. Evidence shows damage to the front and undercarriage of V1.

On Wednesday, December 11, 2019 at 18:05, I responded to a crash on I69 northbound near the 111.5 mile marker. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. I69 is a multi-lane divided interstate that runs primarily in a north/south direction with a grass median in the area of this collision.V1, red Ford with trailer, was traveling north on I69 near the 111.5 mile marker. The trailer became separated from V1 as V1 continued north on I69. The trailer moved off the right side of the roadway and struck a guardrail face with the passenger side of the trailer. The trailer then rotated clockwise after impact with the guardrail. The trailer came to final rest across both of the northbound lanes. D1, Woodcock, stated he was traveling north on I69 while towing a trailer. D1 stated the trailer became separated from V1 as he was traveling north. D1 stated the trailer traveled off the right side of the road and struck a guardrail. D1 stated the trailer came to final rest in both of the northbound lanes of I69. Evidence shows damage to the passenger side fender of the trailer. Evidence shows damage to the guardrail face consistent with an impact by the trailer. Evidence shows no visible damage to the rear of V1. Evidence shows the ball hitch was still locked into the tongue of the trailer but the retaining nut was missing. Evidence shows the trailer was struck by a vehicle that was traveling north on I69, Crash # 201900421300.Cause of this collision was the retaining nut of the ball hitch became loose while installed on V1. The trailer separated from V1 and struck the guardrail face.

Both drivers blamed the other party being responsible for the accident. Drivers stated that the vehicles did not collide with each other. Drivers stated that both were traveling east on W Woodyard Road with D1 behind D2.D1 admitted that she tried to pass D2 (illegally) on a double yellow. D1 claimed D2 was traveling under the posted speed limit. D1 claimed that D2 intentionally tried to run her off the road. D1 ran off the roadway to left side. D1 continued off road and side swiped a traffic sign with the vehicles right side mirror. D2 claimed he was traveling at the posted speed limit and slowed down for the approaching curve. D2 stated he observed D1 passing him in his driver side mirror. D2 admitted he traveled left of center but claimed this was because was looking at D1 in his driver side mirror.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 MADE AN EB TURN ONTO W WOODYARD ROAD FROM N SMITH PIKE AND STRUCK V2 THAT WAS TRAVELING EB ON W WOODYARD RD. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS FOLLOWING A VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM AND DID NOT SEE V2 UNTILL IT WAS TOO LATE.D2 STATED THAT V1 STRUCK HER VEHICLE.BOTH VEHICLES MOVED FROM THE POINT THE COLLISION OFF THE ROADWAY AT AN ADDRESS OFF OF W VERNAL PK, THEREFORE NO DIAGRAM COMPLETED.

Driver, one who was westbound on state road 46 near the intersection of Smith Pike, came up to the light. Driver one stated that he tried to stop and hit the breaks, and when he did, he heard a pop, which caused the brake pedal to go all the way to the floor and would not allow him to stop before he hit Driver two. No diagram vehicles moved prior to arrival.

V1 was traveling South on I69 near mile marker 121 when a deer ran into the roadway. V1 hit the deer head on causing damage to the front end of the vehicle. D1 said that he did not see the deer prior to hitting it. V2 was traveling South on I69. D2 said that he hit the deer in the roadway after V1 hit it. D2 said that his car was disabled because of the deer. D2 said he had a friend coming to tow the vehicle.

V2 was traveling West on Third Street approaching Jordan Ave in the left lane. V1 was traveling West on Third Street approaching Jordan Ave in the Right Lane. At Jordan Ave, V1 attempted to turn left from the right lane striking V2. As a result of this collision, V2 ran off of the roadway and struck an ATM owned by First Financial Bank and a Sign Pole owned by Village Pantry. V1 sustained minor damage to the front driver side corner and wheel, V2 sustained damage to the entire front half of the vehicle and undercarriage. D2 said that she was driving West on 3rd Street while in the left lane. She said that D1 was beside her in the right lane also traveling West. D2 said that D1 then began to move into her lane and she could not avoid the collision. D2 said that she could not stop in time to avoid running off of the roadway and into the ATM structure and sign post. D1 agreed with D2's statement and confirmed that she was trying to turn Left onto Jordan Ave from the right lane of 3rd Street. D1 said that she did not see V2 beside her.

On 12/12/2019 at approximately 1800 hours I arrived at the State Road 45/46 Bypass and Range Rd in regards to a traffic accident. I spoke with D1 who stated that she didn't brake hard enough and rear ended V2. D1 was traveling in the left lane of the 45/46 Bypass traveling southeast. D1 stated she was trying to stop behind V2 and did not apply enough pressure to the brakes and rear ended V2. V1 sustained damage to the hood in the center. The hood had a large dent in it and that front grill of the car was also cracked.D2 stated he was also in the left lane traveling southeast. He stated he had been at a complete stop in traffic for about 30 seconds and was then rear ended by V1. V2 sustained damage to the rear end where the spare tire is. He stated the tire was loose and he had to tie it down because he was afraid it would fall off. D2 also stated the tire itself might be damaged but he would have to look at it.

D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION OF S WALNUT ST AND W COUNTRY CLUB DR IN A LINE OF CARS, HEADING EASTBOUND. D2 STATED HE WAS SUDDENLY STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY WHAT LOOKED TO BE A GOLD COLORED CHRYSLER CONCORD BEARING PLATE BNH218. D2 STATED THAT AFTER BEING STRUCK, V1 STOPPED FOR APPROXIMATELY 15 SECONDS, THEN WENT ON IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL AFTER D2 TURNED OFF. THE PLATE NUMBER GIVEN DOES NOT RETURN TO THE VEHICLE D2 DESCRIBED.

MCSO WAS DISPATCHED TO AN ACCIDENT IN THE AREA OF W KETCHAM RD AND S OLD STATE RODA 37 INVOLVING A VEHICLE ROLLOVER. DISPATCH THEN ADVISED THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 HAD GOTTEN INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE, AD LEFT THE SCENE. UPON ARRIVAL, WE LOCATED A VEHICLE THAT HAD ROLLED AN UNKNOWN AMOUNT OF TIMES, LEAVING A PATH OF DEBRIS APPROX. 50 YARDS LONG. DUE TO THE MARKS LEFT ON THE ROADWAY, IT APPEARED AS THOUGH UNIT 1 SLIGHTLY LEFT THE ROADWAY ON SOUTH OLD STATE ROAD 37 ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD. UNIT 1 THEN RETURNED TO THE ROAD, BUT NEVER MAINTAINED CONTROL, AND LEFT EH ROADWAY ON THE WEST SIDE AGAIN, STRIKING A TREE AND ROLLING MULTIPLE TIMES. UPON SOME DEBRIS LEFT ON THE ROADSIDE WAS MULTIPLE PIECES OF MAIL RETURNING TO THE REGISTERED OWNER, OTHER DOCUMENTS WITH OTHER NAMES, AND A CASE OF BEER MISSING SEVERAL BOTTLES. PHOTOS WERE TAKEN AND SUBMITTED INTO EVIDENCE AT THE MCSO. THE WITNESS STATED THAT THE DRIVER WAS A WHITE FEMALE AND APPEARED TO BE STUMBLING WHEN SHE EXITED THE VEHICLE. THE WITNESS STATED HE COULD IDENTIFY THE DRIVER IF NEEDED. THE REGISTERED OWNER WAS UNABLE TO BE CONTACTED DUE TO A BAD ADRESS. NO DROVER WAS IDENTIFIED.

V1 was turning from southbound S Fess Avenue turning eastbound onto E Atwater Avenue. P1 was crossing at the east crosswalk from north to south at the intersection of E Atwater and S Fess. D1 stated that he began to turn V1 from S Fess to E Atwater, when V1 struck P1. D1 stated that P1 was in his blind spot and he did not see her crossing.P1 stated she was already crossing in the intersection when V1 turned into her. P1 had a contusion/bruise to her right ankle. P1 was not transported by the ambulance but her husband transported her to the hospital. P1 also mentioned that she had hit her head on V1, but had only complained of pain.There was no damage to V1.

V2 entered the parking lot and began to back into a parking space at the Southeast corner of the parking lot. As V2 was backing into the space, V1 began to back out of a nearby space striking V2. Minor damage to the rear driver side corner of V1 and minor damage to the driver side just behind the front wheel.D1 said she began to back out and did not see V2 before the collision. D2 said as he was backing in, and he did not see V1 before the collision.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was faced southbound and stopped at the stop sign located at the intersection of South Union Street and East 3rd Street. D1 stated that he was having difficulty seeing traffic traveling on East 3rd Street due to the weather conditions. He stated that he looked east and west before attempting to make a left turn onto East 3rd Street. D1 said that as he pulled onto East 3rd Street V2 struck the left side of his vehicle. V2 was traveling westbound on East 3rd Street at 33mph. D2 stated that as he was traveling westbound he observed V1 pull into the intersection of East 3rd Street and South Union Street. D2 said that he "slammed" on the brakes in an attempt to avoid a collision with V1. However, due to the wet road way conditions D2 said he could not come to a stop before striking the driver side of V1. D2 complained of pain in his left forearm and the front passenger of V2 complained of pain in his right wrist and nasal area. Both subjects were treated by EMS on scene and released.

Vehicle 1 and 2 were traveling eastbound on West Tapp Road approaching the intersection of Kegg Road. Vehicles in front of vehicle 2 began to slow to a stop for vehicles that were yielding to westbound Tapp Road traffic before turning northbound onto Kegg Road. Vehicle 2 was nearly stopped while vehicle 1 was unable to stop before colliding with the rear passenger side of vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 sustained damage to the driver's side front quarter panel. Both drivers stated they were uninjured. No other vehicles were contacted/damaged during this collision and no other witnesses remained at the scene or contacted law enforcement during this investigation.

Narrative By Chief DeputyWilliam Jay HumphreyEllettsville Police DepartmentDecember 12th 2019Report #19E-06823Driver #1 Daniel HesterDriver #2 Janice Payne Driver #1 Vehicle struck rear of Vehicle #2 School Bus on Temperance St. Both Vehicles going East Bound . This took place approximate 30 FT. From Ridgesprings Lane.Note Driver #1 possible had illness before accident. I done follow up at Bloomington Hospital Driver #1 did not remember the crash or what happen. List of Kids on bus checked out by Ambulance Crew.Elijah ChuppPeyton ChuppAnna LoydHayley ScottElijah LirotMason BartlettLily BrownAva KaleKadance ParrishDriver Janice Payne

On Friday, December 13, 2019 at 13:00, I responded to a crash on State Rd 46 (Bypass) approximately 100 ft north of E 3rd Street. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry. V2, blue Honda, was traveling south and was stopped on SR46 in the number 2 left turn lane. V1, silver Jeep, was traveling south and stopped on SR46 in the number 2 left turn lane behind V2. V1 moved forward and struck the rear of V2 with the front of V1. D1, Anderson, stated she was stopped in traffic behind V2. D1 stated her foot slipped off of the brake pedal and V1 rolled forward. D1 stated V1 struck the rear of V2.D2, Cusick, stated he was stopped in traffic on SR46 in the left turn lane. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2 while he was stopped in traffic.D1 advised she previously struck a deer while operating V1 which caused damage to the front of V1. D1 reported no new damage to the front of V1 as a result of this collision. Evidence shows no visible damage to the rear of V2. Primary Cause: Driver Distracted: D1 reported her foot slipped off of the brake pedal resulting in V1 striking the rear of V2.

On Friday, December 13, 2019, I responded to a crash on I69 southbound near the 117 mile marker. Both vehicles continued south to a private address located at 5556 S. Rockport Road, Monroe County, where they remained until my arrival. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry.Other Participant (OP) Information: Driver: Brandon S. Stone, Indiana OLN 1340-22-2437 Vehicle: white 2011 Chevrolet Express Van, Indiana registration STX407 exp 2020, VIN 1GAZG1FG1B1116245 Registered Owner: Capital City Building LLC, 10079 E. Buffalo Trl, Odon, IN 47562 Trailer: gray 2013 AMH two axle trailer, Indiana registration TR532AQP exp 2020, VIN 5N6200E20D1038241 Registered Owner: Capital City Building LLC, 10079 E. Buffalo Trl, Odon, IN 47562 Insurance: Hastings Mutual, Policy ACV988227004, Telephone: 812-254-1987OP was traveling south on I69 near the 117 mile marker in the number 1 lane. V1 was traveling south on I69 in the number 1 lane behind OP. The driver's side rear tire and wheel assembly broke free from OP and rolled across the southbound lanes into the grassy area along the west side of the roadway. Debris from the broken wheel assembly struck the passenger side of the windshield of V1. Both V1 and OP continued to 5556 S. Rockport Road, Monroe County until law enforcement arrival.D1, Suits, stated he was traveling south on I69 in the left lane behind OP. D1 stated a wheel assembly broke free from the trailer being towed by OP. D1 stated unknown debris struck the passenger side windshield of V1 causing a crack.OP, Stone, stated he was traveling south on I69 when the driver's side rear wheel assembly of his trailer broke free from the axle. OP stated he was unaware that debris struck V1. OP stated he continued south to 5556 S. Rockport Road, Monroe County where he parked the damaged trailer. Evidence shows a small crack along the passenger side of the windshield of V1. Evidence shows the driver's side rear wheel was missing from the trailer of OP. Evidence shows the missing wheel assembly and tire was located in the grassy area along the west side of I69 near the 117 mile marker. A passenger in V1 provided cell phone video of OP and trailer as the wheel assembly broke free along I69. The video has been included as an attachment to this report. Primary Cause: Other (environmental) Debris from OP struck the windshield of V1

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was in the parking lot at 2307 E 2nd street and was headed west, toward the exit. V2 was on E 2nd street and had just turned right, into parking lot at 2307 E 2nd street. V1 failed to yield the right of way to V2 and turned left in front of V2. V2 hit V1 in the driver side front with the driver side front of her vehicle.D1 stated that she was in the parking lot and was turning left to get to the exit of the apartment complex. She stated that D2 pulled into the parking lot from E 2nd street at a high rate of speed and hit her as she was turning. D2 stated that she turned into the parking lot and then V1 turned left in front of her. She stated that she was able to get stopped and saw that V1 was still moving forward to make her turn. She stated she put her car in reverse to give V1 more room and V1 still hit her in the driver side front.

I was dispatched to 1075 N. Jordan Road for a property damage accident. Upon my arrival the vehicles had parked in different parking spots so that the circle drive would not be blocked for traffic. Both parties advised no injuries occurred. D1 said he was backing out of his parking space in V1, and there was van to his left making it hard to see. D1 said when he backed out V1 struck V2 which was traveling south west in direction on the drive way. D1 said V1 bumper fell off the vehicle, due to rust underneath. D2 said she was pulling into the drive in V2 and was south west in direction. D2 said about time she saw V1 was when V1 was at her vehicle. D2 said she tried to merge to the right to avoid V1 striking V2. D2 said V1 struck V2 on the driver side front bumper area.

D1 ADVISED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING EAST ON COUNTRY CLUB, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF SOUTH WALNUT STREET. D1 EXPLAINED THAT SHE DID NOT REMEMBER TRAFFIC BEING STOPPED, SHE SNEEZED, AND THEN THE FRONT OF V1 MADE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2.D2 EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, FACING EAST ON COUNTRY CLUB TOWARDS WALNUT STREET WHEN THE FRONT OF V1 MADE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V2, CAUSING THE FRONT OF V2 TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.D3 SAID THAT HE WAS AT A COMPLETE STOP IN TRAFFIC WHEN THE FRONT OF V2 MADE CONTACT WITH THE REAR OF V3.THE AIRBAGS WERE DEPLOYED IN V1, AND THEN V2 AND V3 SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.D1 HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER LEFT KNEE AND WAS TREATED BY AMBULANCE STAFF

D1 stated she was traveling westbound on W. 3rd St at the SR 37 overpass intersection. D1 advised the light was green and traffic was moving when suddenly V2 stopped. D1 stated she was unable to stop in time and rear ended V2.D2 stated he was also traveling westbound on W. 3rd St at the SR 37 overpass intersection. D2 stated the truck in front of him stopped so he had to quickly hit his brakes. When he did this, D2 stated he was rear ended by V1. The passenger of V2 did have a complaint of neck pain.

Driver 1 stated that she was driving Vehicle 1 northwest on S. Walnut St. Pike, and was approaching the intersection of E. Winslow Rd. It should be noted that the above intersection limits northbound traffic to turn east only, using a curb raised median. Driver 1 explained that, her GPS instructed her to go straight, therefore, she drove her vehicle over the median.

V2 was parking at 1525 S Rogers St on private Dr. V1, backed into V2 and left the scene of the accident. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 advised that she received a note on her vehicle on 12/14/19 at 10pm after leaving the above mentioned address. D2 advised that the note stated that V2 had been struck. D2 stated that she arrived at the above mentioned address yesterday around 3:00pm from a community service event. D2 stated that before she arrived, V2 was not damaged. D2 advised that she left around 10:00pm last night when she noticed the note on V2 and later saw the damage to the rear driver side of her vehicle.I later contacted the W1 via telephone. W1 advised that on 12/14/19 he was in the parking lot of the above mentioned address. W1 mentioned that while standing in the parking lot he observed a white Chevy pickup truck driving erratic in the parking lot. W1 stated that the unknown male driver, put the white pickup truck into reverse and started doing circles in the parking lot. W1 stated that the male then attempted to back into a parking spot next to V2, when the male driver of V1 back into V2 causing damage to the rear driver side. W1 advised that he was able to capture a photograph of the white pickup truck bearing IN plate (TK198MPR).

V1 was traveling west on Tapp Road near the intersection of I69 North ramp. D1 stated that he was traveling in the right hand lane. D1 stated that a red Ford F150 crossed over from the left hand lane and hit him on the drivers side. D1 stated that the F150 left the scene of the crash. D1 stated that the he got the plate of the truck. I have not been able to locate the truck at this time.

V3 was stopped facing north on Jordan Avenue north of Linglebach Lane preparing to conduct a U-turn. V2 stopped behind V3 facing north. V1 was traveling north behind V2.D1 stated he was traveling north on Jordan Avenue north of Linglebach Lane in V1. He stated that V3 was in front of V2 and stopped on the east side of Jordan Avenue and V2 stopped in front of him. D1 stated that he could not stop in time and collided into the rear of V2 and V2 then collided into the rear of V3. D2 stated she was traveling north on Jordan Avenue north of Linglebach Lane in V2. She stated V3 was in front of her and stopped on the east side of Jordan Avenue. D2 stated she stopped behind V3 and V1 collided into the rear of her vehicle; forcing her to collide into the rear of V3.D3 stated she was traveling north on Jordan Avenue north of Linglebach Lane in V3. She stated that she stopped on the east side of Jordan Avenue and was preparing to conduct a U-turn so she could park in a parking space on the west side of Jordan Avenue. D3 stated that while she was stopped waiting for southbound traffic to clear, V2 collided into the rear of her vehicle. There was heavy front end damage to V1, rear end damage and front passenger side damage to V2, and rear driver side damage to V3. Neither party initially complained of pain; however, just prior to clearing the scene, D2 stated she felt nauseous and would probably visit the hospital to be checked by medical staff. She did not want an ambulance.

V2 was parked and unoccupied in an angled parking spot facing southwest in the parking lot of the College Mall, south of the Target/mall entrance. V2 was struck on the driver's side front door by V1. V1 left the scene without providing contact and insurance information. It is unknown how V1 struck V2, but based on the damage, it appeared that V1 was backing out of the parking spot the south of V2 and sideswiped V2 with the passenger side front corner.There are no identifiers for V1, or suspect driver information.

Vehicle 1 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass just north of the 10th Street intersection in the right lane just ahead of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass just north of the 10th Street intersection in the left lane just behind Vehicle 1.Driver 1 left the scene of the accident.Driver 2 stated he was traveling south on the State Road 45/46 Bypass no more than 100 feet prior to the intersection when Vehicle 1 quickly switched lanes in front of him, cutting him off. Driver 2 stated he attempted to brake but struck the rear driver's side bumper with the front passenger side bumper of his vehicle. Driver 2 stated he believed Vehicle 1 was possibly wanting to move into the left turn lane last minute. He advised that after the crash, Vehicle 1 immediately drove away turning west on 10th Street. Driver 2 stated he followed Vehicle 1 but realized he needed to pull over due to the damage on his vehicle. Driver 2 described Vehicle 1 as a dark colored older model small pickup truck. He advised it was possibly a Chevy S10 or similar style. No one involved complained of injuries.The damage to Vehicle 1 is unknown. Vehicle 2 has a large amount of damage to the front passenger side of the vehicle. Due to vehicles being moved and Driver 2 being unsure of his exact location a diagram was not completed.There are no leads or suspects at this time.

V1 was traveling eastbound on Atwater Ave approaching Woodlawn Ave when the front of V1 struck the rear of V2. D1 stated that he was traveling eastbound on Atwater Ave approaching Woodlawn Ave. D1 stated that he looked at his in car computer when the front of V1 hit the rear of V2. V2 was stopped at the interstection of Atwater Ave and Woodlawn Ave. While stopped or slowing moving forward the rear end of V2 was struck by the front of V1.D2 stated that she was stopped at the intersection of Atwater Ave and Woodlawn Ave. D2 stated that the front of V1 then hit the rear of V2. D2 stated that she didn't know if the light was still red or just turning green. Through my investigation I have determined that D1 was distracted causing the front of V1 to hit the rear of V2.

D2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING NORTHBOUND ON N WALNUT ST. D2 STATED SHE WAS STOPPED AT A STOP LIGHT IN THE MIDDLE LANE. SHE STATED THAT V1 HIT V2'S PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR WITH V1'S DRIVERS SIDE MIRROR AND THEN FLED THE AREA. D2 WAS UNFAMILIAR WITH THE AREA, BUT AFTER SPEAKING WITH HER IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE ACCIDENT OCCURED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E 10TH ST AND N WALNUT ST. D2 LATER DROVE HOME, AND THEN MET ME AT 220 E 3RD ST FOR THE ACCIDENT REPORT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was on Summit View place and was at intersection with S. Henderson street, headed WB. V2 was SB on S. Henderson street approaching North drive. V3 was EB on North drive and was stopped at Henderson street. V1 failed to yield the right of way and drove across Henderson street in front of V2. V2 was unable to avoid striking V1 in the passenger side with the front of his vehicle. V1 then continued WB and struck V3 in the front driver side bumper with the rear driver side quarter panel of his vehicle.D1 stated he was crossing Henderson street and just did not see V2 coming. He said he pulled out in front of V2 and was struck. He said he then continued across the intersection and struck V3.D2 stated that he was SB on Henderson street and he saw V1 out of the corner of his eye. He said V1 pulled out in front of him and he was unable to avoid hitting him.D3 stated she was stopped on North drive and was waiting on V2 so she could turn left onto S. Henderson street. She stated she watched V1 pull out in front of V2 and V2 struck V1 in the side. She stated V1 continued across Henderson street and struck her vehicle in the front driver side.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: On Sunday, December 15, 2019 at 18:10, Matthews, Ian responded to a crash on Milepost 127.5 I-69 739 ft N at intersection of Norm Anderson Rd. At the time of the crash, the weather was snow and the road surface was ice.Vehicle 1, black jeep patriot, avoiding object in roadway. Vehicle 2, black nissan pathfinder, going straight. Vehicle 3, blue mini cooper s hardtop, going straight.Vehicle 4, blue audi a4, going straight.Vehicle 5, gray mercedesbenz cclass, going straight. Vehicle 6, copper ford fusion, going straight.Vehicle 7, white ford ranger, going straight. Vehicle 8, white mazda cx-5, going straight. Vehicle 9, white honda crv, going straight.Vehicle 10, red chevrolet malibu, going straight. Each of the 10 vehicles were traveling south on I-69 approaching the 127.5 Milepost. Vehicle 1 was the lead vehicle traveling in the left lane, as a pickup truck was attempting an illegal "U-Turn" at the crossover near the 127.5 Milepost. The pickup was directly in front (south) of V1 and partially in the left lane. V1 attempted to avoid colliding with the pickup by abruptly braking, turning into the right lane and subsequently losing control on the ice-covered roadway. V1 then traveled back into the left lane to correct its course and collided with the guardrail. V1 finally traveling back across the roadway and collided with Vehicle 2. After colliding with V2, V1 then collided again with the guardrail, just south of the previous location, before being struck in the right rear of V1 by Vehicle 3. V2 was several vehicles behind V1 when it attempted to avoid colliding with all of the vehicles sliding on the roadway. V2 was struck on the left side by V1, as V1 bounced off the guardrail face. V2 then came to a controlled stop south of the area of impact. Vehicle 3 was also behind the V1, as V1 abruptly braked and veered into the right lane. V3, attempting to avoid colliding with V1, abruptly applied the brakes and spun out south of the crossover, before turning 180 degrees and facing oncoming traffic. As V3 came to a stop in the roadway, facing the wrong the direction, it was struck head-on by a braking Vehicle 4. After the initial collision sustained to the front right of V3, the vehicle spun around facing southeast and collided with the back right of V1 and came to a disabling stop V4 was north of V1 when the vehicles in front of it were abruptly braking and sliding all over the roadway. V4 was traveling in the right lane and sliding on ice when it encountered a stopped V3 directly in front of it, facing north. The front right of V4 collided with the front right of V3 and came to a disabling stop after colliding with the left guardrail face. Vehicle 5 was behind the initial area of impact and avoided being in the initial collision, coming to a controlled stop just south of the first area of impact, behind V1 and V2. V5 then sustained a rear-end collision by Vehicle 6, sending V5 forward and ultimately coming to a controlled stop just south of the area of impact. Vehicle 6 was north of V1 when the vehicles in front it were abruptly braking and sliding all over the roadway. V6 attempted to avoid colliding with the vehicles, but eventually struck the rear of V5, before colliding with the left guardrail face and coming to a disabling stop just south of the initial area of impact. Vehicle 7 was north of V1 when the vehicles in front of it were abruptly braking and sliding all over the roadway. V7 then slowed before being rear-ended by Vehicle 8, after V8 had lost control behind V7. V7 came to controlled stop just south of the area of impact.V8 was north of V1 when the vehicles in front of it were abruptly braking and sliding all over the roadway. V8 attempted to brake, but spun out (180 degrees) and the left rear of V8 collided with the rear of V7. V8 continued sliding and subsequently made contact with V9 and hitting the right guardrail face. V8 ultimately came to a disabling stop just north of the are of impact, before being struck hea

V2 slowed to avoid an unknown vehicle that lost control. V2 spun sideways while attempting to stop.V1 was unable to slow an hit V2. V3 was traveling behind V1 and struck V1, causing V1 and V3 to spin sideways.V4 that was following the others, hit both V3 and V1.Roadway was snow covered with approximately 2" of snow. Heavy snow was occurring at the time of the accident.***UPDATE***Upon further review, V3 was the rear most vehicle of those involved. V4 was struck in the side by V1 after V1 struck V2. V3 then struck both V4 and then V1.

Vehicle 1 was traveling south on Curry Pike. Due to the snowy weather and very slick roads the vehicle started to slide. The driver was unable to keep control and the vehicle slide off the roadway and struck a tree stump. After striking the stump the vehicle flipped up onto the drivers side. No injuries were reported from this accident. Vehicle was towed due to damage.

V1 was traveling emergent, with its emergency lights and sirens activated, west on W. Bloomfield Rd. just west of S. Weimer Rd. V1 was traveling behind two other first responding vehicles, IU Health Bloomington Hospital ambulance and Bloomington Police Department patrol vehicle, which were also en route to an accident with an inverted vehicle with an entrapment. V1 was passing slowed and stopped traffic, began to fishtail on the snow covered roadway, and struck V2 on the driver's side rear corner with the passenger side rear corner of V1. V1 recovered traction and moved to the side of the road.D1 stated that he was driving emergent with his patrol vehicle's emergency lights and siren activated west on W. Bloomfield Rd. en route to an accident with unknown injuries. D1 stated that as he was passing slowed, stopped, and pulled to the side vehicles, V1 fishtailed on the snow covered roadway. D1 stated that during the fishtail, his passenger side rear corner struck the driver's side rear corner of V2, which was pulled and stopped at the side of W. Bloomfield Rd. facing west.V2 was traveling west on W. Bloomfield Rd. when it pulled to the side of the road due to emergency vehicles traveling emergent behind it. V2 was struck on the driver's side rear corner with the passenger side rear corner of V1.D2 stated that he was driving west on W. Bloomfield Rd. when he saw emergency vehicles approaching him from behind. D2 stated that he pulled V2 to the north side of W. Bloomfield Rd. so the emergency vehicles could pass him. D2 stated that he saw an ambulance pass him and another emergency vehicle, and before he began to travel again, he noticed another emergency vehicle approaching from behind. D2 stated that he just stayed where he was, but the emergency vehicle must have lost control because it struck his vehicle, but then pulled to the side of the road.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: IT WAS EXPLAINED TO ME THAT UNIT 3 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON SR 48 IN THE AREA OF GARRISON CHAPEL RD. WHILE TRAVELING UP THE HILL, UNIT 3 STATED SHE HEARD SOMEBODY HONKING A HORN, WHICH SHE UNDERSTOOD AS THEY WERE SIGNALING TO UNIT 1 TO SLOW DOWN. UNIT 3 STATED UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING VERY FAST DUE TO THE WEATHER CONDITIONS. UNIT 3 THEN BEGAN TO SLOW DUE TO TRAFFIC SLOWING DOWN FOR THE WEATHER. AT THIS POINT, UNIT 3 STATED HER BUMPER WAS CONTACTED BY UNIT 1, SENDING UNT 3 OFF OF THE ROADWAY AND INTO A DITCH ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD. UNIT 1 THEN STOPPED IN THE ROADWAY, WHILE UNIT 2 WAS APPROACHING THE AREA. AFTER UNIT 2 GOT CLOSE TO THE AREA, UNIT 2 WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME FOR UNIT 1 AND COLLIDED WITH THE REAR END OF UNIT 1. UNIT 1 AND 2 WERE ABLE TO BE MOVED TO PROPERTY OFF OF THE ROAD AND WERE TOWED AFTER I LEFT THE SCENE DUE TO THE WEATHER AND LOCATION.UNIT 3 WAS ASSISTED OUT OF THE DITCH AND DROVE HOME. THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 EXPLAINED LATER THAT UNIT 3 WAS TRAVELING BEHIND UNIT 1, AND THERE WAS NO CONTACT BETWEEN THE TWO UNITS. UNIT 1 EXPLAINED THAT UNIT 3 LOST CONTROL AND SLID INTO THE DITCH ON THEIR OWN. AFTER UNIT 3 SLID INTO THE DITCH, UNIT 1 THEN CAME TO A STOP IN THE ROADWAY. UNIT 2 THEN CRESTED THE HILL BEHIND UNIT 1 AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME DUE TO THE WEATHER, STRIKING UNIT 1. UNIT 1 ALSO WANTED TO MAKE IT NOWN THAT THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE FRONT OF UNIT 1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS PULLING OUT OF A PARALLEL PARKING SPOT ON WEST KIRKWOOD AVE, JUST EAST OF SOUTH GENTRY ST, AND V1 PULLED OUT OF V2, WHO WAS WESTBOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVE, CAUSING V2 TO STRIKE THE REAR END OF V1. V1 STATED SHE WAS PULLING OUT THE THE PARKING SPOT WHEN V2 STRUCK THE REAR END OF HER VEHICLE.V2 STATED SHE WAS WESTBOUND ON KIRKWOOD AVE WHEN V1 PULLED OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT IN FRONT OF HER AND SHE STRUCK THE REAR END OF V1.

Driver 1 stated she was backing out of a parking spot near 335 Brownstone Dr. Driver 1 stated she didn't see vehicle 2 parked in the drive behind her and she backed into it. Vehicle 2 was parked unoccupied along a yellow curb on the main drive of Brownstone Apts.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: At approximately 1738 hours on 12/15/2019 V1 and V2 were northbound in the west turn lane of State Road 45/46, approaching the intersection of 17th Street and 45/46. V1 was following V2 and attempted to brake, but was unsuccessful because of the weather conditions. There was snow and slush on the roadway.D2 stated that he was northbound in the turn lane, slowing to a stop, when he was rear-ended by V1. There was impact damage to the passenger side of the rear of his vehicle, rendering the vehicle inoperable. D1 stated she was northbound in the turn lane behind V2. She stated she was not travelling quickly and applied her brakes as soon as she entered the turn lane, but the vehicle continued forward in motion as a result of the weather conditions. There was impact damage to the driver side of the front bumper and driver side headlight.Neither party complained of injury or requested medical aid.

D2 STATED THAT AS SHE PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION OF W BLOOMFIELD RD AND S ROLLING RIDGE RD, WESTBOUND, V1 REAR ENDED HER.D2 DESCRIBED V1 AS A NEWER SILVER AUDI, FOUR DOOR. D2 STATED V1 SIGNALED LIKE THEY WERE PULLING OVER BUT CONTINUED WESTBOUND ON W BLOOMFIELD RD. V1 WAS NEVER LOCATED BY OFFICERS.V2 HAS VERY MINOR DAMAGE. PHOTOGRAPHS OF V2 WERE TAKEN AND UPLOADED INTO EVIDENCE. D2 DID NOT COMPLAIN OF ANY INJURIES.

Sometime between 2100 hours on 12/14/2019 and 0800 hours on 12/15/2019 V1 was parked in the Blue Lot and struck by an unknown vehicle. There was collision damage to the driver's side of the front bumper. No information is known about the other vehicle involved.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V2 was driving westbound on 10th street just west of Jordan when it lost traction on the snowy road and slid onto a nearby drive. V2 was driving behind V1 westbound on 10th west of Jordan and when V1 lost traction, V2 tried to slow to avoid hitting V2 but was unable to avoid a collision. I was called to the parking lot behind SPEA (1315 E 10th Street) to meet with the two vehicles reference the accident that had occurred. They had pulled into the SPEA lot so that they would be out of the roadway. I spoke to D2 first who stated he had been driving westbound on 10th St.west of Jordan, D2 stated he had started to brake prior to the turn and median in the road, when he suddenly lost traction and slid. D2 stated that when V2 had lost traction the back end of the vehicle slid out behind him. At this time, he stated he felt the sudden jolt of V1 hitting him while he was stopped in the roadway.I then spoke to D1 who stated that she had been driving westbound on 10th Street west of Jordan. She stated that she noticed that V1 had slid off the road due to the bad roadways. At that time, she applied the brakes on her vehicle, however the brakes did not work due to the slick roads. She stated she attempted to swerve out of the way, however that was when V1 slid into the rear end of V2. V1 sustained damage to the front bumper and V2 sustained damage to the rear bumper.

D1 was traveling northbound on S Harmony Rd during a heavy snow. D1 came over a hillcrest, and saw a car sitting the in middle of the road at the bottom of the hill. D1 applied her brakes, but slid in the snow. D1 steered herself into the ditch to avoid a collision. When V1 entered the ditch, the front bumper and possibly some of the undercarriage collided with the ground near the top of the ditch.Vehicle was stuck, but D1 did not want to call a tow truck until the next day, when the roads/conditions have cleared up. The vehicle was off the roadway. No injuries were reported. The driver of the vehicle that was stopped in the roadway did not stop to render assistance.

V1 struck V2 in the rear while both vehicles were traveling southbound on Liberty Dr. from W. 3rd St. intersection.V1 & V2 were removed from the roadway and D2 attempted to collect information from D1. D1 did not provide D2 with truthful or valid information and left the scene.D2 was given this agencies, criminal and state crash report #.The criminal investigation is pending.

D1 stated he was plowing the parking lot in a city owned plow truck.He began backing his truck heading south. D1 stated he did not see the unoccupied V2 and struck the rear passenger side of V2, with the rear passenger side of his V1. I did observe damage to the passenger tail light on V2. No injuries reported.

Driver 1 reported she was driving south on Union Valley and started sliding in the snow, and her driver's side mirror hit the plow truck plowDriver 2 reported he was driving north on Union Valley and vehicle 1 lost control and struck his plow causing on damage

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was merging onto northbound Interstate 69 from the 45/46 Bypass and was unable to immediately merge due to a tractor trailer occupying the right-hand northbound lane. Vehicle 1 then lost traction as its passenger side tires traveled into fresh snow along the right side of the on ramp. Driver 1 states that vehicle 1 began to slide and impacted the guardrail face on the east side of the interstate just north of the Arlington Road overpass. After striking the guardrail, vehicle 1 was redirected back into the northbound lanes of I69 were it collided with the rear under-ride bar on the trailer as vehicle 1 slide westbound across all travel lanes before colliding with the center guardrail separating the north and southbound lanes. Both occupants stated that were uninjured and were not able to identify or describe the commercial vehicle that they collided with during the collision sequence. No other vehicles were involved in the collision sequence and a collision did not occur prior to vehicle 1 losing traction. Photos available from Monroe County Sheriff's Office Records Division upon request.

On Sunday, December 15, 2019 at 18:16,I, Trooper Cory Knight, responded to a crash on S Old State Road 37 10 ft N at intersection of State Rd 37. At the time of the crash, the weather was snow and the road surface was snow/slush.Contributory Cause-Driver Factor-Unsafe Speed for weather conditions: Driver #1 was traveling too fast for the road conditions.The conditions were there was heavy snowfall and the road surface was slick. DrIver #1 should have reduced his speed to avoid losing control of his vehicle, running off of the roadway, and striking another vehicle.Vehicle #1, 2000 green Toyota Corolla, was traveling northbound on State Road 37 in the right lane approaching Old State Road 37. Vehicle #2, 2017 silver Ford Edge, was stopped at a stop light on Old State Road 37 and State Road 37 facing west. Vehicle #1 ran off of the right side of the roadway striking the front driver's side of Vehicle #2.Driver #1, Matthew Post, stated that he was traveling on State Road 37 approaching Old State Road 37. Driver #1 stated that he lost traction while traveling straight. Driver #1 stated that he drove off of the right side of the road, struck Vehicle #2, and came to a controlled stop in the eastbound lane of Old State Road 37.Driver #2, Andrew Risen, stated that he was at the stop light on Old State Road 37 and State Road 37 facing west. Driver #2 stated that he observed Vehicle #2 run off the road but was unable to move out of the way before vehicle #2 struck his vehicle.Evidence shows tire marks in the grass where Vehicle #1 ran off of the road. Vehicle #1 and Vehicle #2 were both able to drive from the scene. Neither Driver #1 or Driver #2 complained of any pain.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: On 12/15/2019 at approximately 5:41pm, I was dispatched to a property damage crash at Union Street and E. 3rd St. Upon my arrival both vehicles were stopped in the roadway. The Ford was directly in front of the Toyota. I asked all parties if everyone was ok. Everyone said yes. I then spoke with the drivers of V1 and V2. D1 said she was traveling south bound in V1 on Union St. D1 said V2 was stopped at the stop sign waiting to pull out onto E. 3rd St. D1 said she went to stop, but was not able to due to her brakes and the snow accumulation on the roadway. D1 said V1 then struck the rear bumper of V2. D2 said he was sitting at the stop sign waiting to pull out onto E. 3rd St in V2. D2 said V1 then rear ended V2 causing damage to V2's bumper.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling west on East Moffett lane. While approaching the intersection of Fairfax and Moffett. D1 stated that he was unable to get the car stopped and entered the intersection hitting V2. V2 was traveling North on South Fairfax road. D2 stated that he saw that V1 was not able to get the car stopped however he was already in the intersection and was hit by V1.D2 stated he did not have active insurance on his vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 PULLED OUT TRAVELING WESTBOUND ONTO E MOORES PKE FROM N. OLCOTT BLVD IN FRONT OF V2. D2 ATTEMPTED TO AVOID A COLLISION WITH V1 AND HIT THE BRAKES OF V2, THE ROADWAY WAS SNOW COVERED AND HAD NOT BEEN TREATED BY CITY UTILITIES. V2 THEN WENT SIDEWAYS AND THE FRONT OF V2 STRUCK THE FRONT OF V3 THAT WAS TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON E. MOORES PK. AFTER THE IMPACT WITH V3, THE RIGHT, REAR QUARTER PANEL STRUCK THE LEFT, REAR OF V1. V1 WAS DRIVEN FROM THE SCENEV2 WAS TOWED BY BLANDS TO MINTONS BODY SHOP DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGEV3 WAS TOWED BY AUTOMOBILE

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON I-69 JUST SOUTH OF THE 120 EXIT LEFT LANE. V2 WAS TRAVELING SB ON 1-69 JUST SOUTH OF THE 120 EXIT IN THE MIDDLE LANE. AS ANOTHER UNKNOWN VEHICLE BEGAN TO BRAKE DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS, V1 BEGAN TO BRAKE AS WELL. DUE TO THE SLICK ROAD SURFACE, V1 SLID INTO THE MIDDLE LANE WHILE BRAKING CAUSING THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1 TO COLLIDE WITH THE REAR PASSENGERS SIDE OF V2. D2 DID COMPLAIN OF HEAD PAIN FROM HITTING HER HEAD ON THE WINDOW, HOWEVER, REFUSED ALL MEDICAL TREATMENT AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was traveling south on Jordan Avenue approaching the stop sign at 7th Street. V2 was traveling south on Jordan Avenue slowing or stopping for the stop sign at 7th Street. V1 applied her brakes but was not able to come to a complete stop due to snow/slush on the roadway. V2 was able to come to a complete stop at the stop sign at 7th and Jordan. V1 then slid into the rear of V2. There was moderate damage to the front end of V1. There was scratch/scuff damage to the rear of V2. D1 stated that she tried to stop but was not able to due to the snowy condition. D1 stated that she applied her brakes and her vehicle continued to slide down the hill until V1 struck V2. D2 stated that she had came to a stop at 7th and Jordan after sliding for a short period of time. D2 stated that V1 then slid into the rear of V2. There were no injuries at the scene and no vehicles had to be towed from the scene. There is nothing further at this time.

I was on routine patrol heading north bound in direction on Indiana Avenue when I observed two vehicles stopped in the road way from a crash that had just occurred a few minutes prior to me arriving in the area. V1 had damage to the rear driver side door and V2 had damage to the front passenger side bumper area and was leaking what appeared to be window wiper fluid. I asked if everyone was ok, and was told by everyone they were fine. I then spoke with the two individuals standing by who identified themselves as Adam Fahd and John Hurley. Fahd said he was in the back seat of V2 and Hurley said he was in the front seat of V2. Both Fahd and Hurley said D2 was in the left lane traveling northbound on Indiana Ave, and that V1 was in the right lane right almost even beside V2, but V1 was slightly ahead. Both Fahd and Hurley said V1 made a sudden left hand turn without signaling into V2 lane of travel to enter the alleyway on the north side of the Penn Station. Fahd and Hurley said that's when V2 made contact with V1.D1 said she was north bound on Indiana Avenue in V1. D1 said she went to make a left turn into the alleyway that's north of the Penn Station and V2 struck V1. I asked D1 what lane of travel she was in when she was north bound on Indiana Avenue prior to making a left hand turn to go into the alleyway. D1 said said she wasn't sure originally. I then walked up to the end of the sidewalk with D1 and pointed to the two lanes of travel and asked were you in the right lane or left lane. I told her based on the damage to the vehicles it would appear she was in the right lane of travel. D1 then said she believes she could have been in the right lane. D2 said he was north bound in V2 on Indiana Avenue and in the left lane. D2 said V1 was in the right lane. D2 said V1 goes to make a sudden left turn from the right lane with no turn signal across the left lane he was in. D2 said he applied his brakes, honked his vehicle horn, and swerved to avoid striking V1 with V2. D2 said V2 then struck V1.

THE DRIVER OF UNIT 1 STATED THAT WHILE SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON S OLD STATE ROAD 37, SHE LOST CONTROL OF THE UNIT DUE TO THE WEATHER CONDITIONS. UNIT 1 THEN LEFT THE ROADWAY AND STRUCK A MAILBOX AND A DECORATIVE CONCRETE DRIVEWAY MARKER. THE PROPERTY OWNER WAS NOTIFIED AND THE TRUCK WAS WINCHED OUT AND ABLE TO BE DRIVEN AWAY FROM THE SCENE.

UNIT 1 WAS TRAVELING W ON W EVANS RD APPROCHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S BURCH RD. THE DRIVER STATED THAT SHE STARTED SLIING DOWN A HILL, AND SLID THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, AND INTO A TREE. THE VEHICLE REMAINED ON SCENE FOR THE NIGHT DUE TO THE EXTREME WEATHER CONDITIONS AND EXTENDED WAIT TIME FOR A TOW TRUCK. UNIT 1 WILL NEED TOWED DUE TO DISABLING DAMAGE.

DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE WAS TURNING AROUND IN THE LOT OF 2237 S CURRY PIKE. DRIVER 1 ADVISED HE DID NOT REALIZE THAT WHEN HE WAS TURNING AROUND THAT HE STRUCK THE GUTTERING AND THE OVERHANG OF THE BANKS DRIVETHROUGH. BANK EMPLOYEES ADVISED THEY WITNESSED VEHICLE 1 TURNING AROUND IN THE PARKING LOT AND THAT IT STRUCK THE DRIVE THROUGH OF THE BANK.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: At the time of the crash it was snowing and 29 degrees. The roadway was snow covered and slick. THe location of the crash in the northbound lanes if I-69 at approximately the 127MM. Two lanes run north and two lanes run south and are separated by a cable barrier and grass median.Vehicle 1, silver mazda, was in the left lane of I-69, traveling north. V#1 then began "fish tailing", then rotating clockwise striking the concrete barrier on the east side of the interstate with the front right corner. V#1 continued to rotate clockwise and struck the concrete wall again with the left side bumper. V#1 continued to rotate clockwise and struck the concrete wall again causing damage to its rear driver side bumper.Driver 1, Jinger Utterback, stated she north bound in the left lane of I-69 when all of the sudden she lost control of her vehicle and and began to slide and "fish tail". D#1 said there was nothing she could do. D#1 was able to safely maneuver V#1 to the east side shoulder of I-69 underneath the Chambers Pike Overpass.There were no witness or other vehicles around at the time of the crash. D#1 was not injured.

Driver 1 stated he was traveling northbound on Interstate 69 near the 128 mile marker. Driver 1 stated he was in the right lane and began changing into the left lane, at that time Driver 1 stated he began to spin and lose control of the vehicle. Driver 1 then ran off the west of the roadway into the cable barrier. Vehicle 1 sustained damage along the driver's side and the front bumper. Vehicle 1 was towed by Chandler's Towing. The roadway was slush and snow due to the sleeting rain and prior snow.

V1 was traveling S/B on Dunn St. V2 was traveling W/B on 7th St. V1 disregard the stop sign and struck V2. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 advised that he was traveling W/B on 7th St, stopped at the intersection of & 7th/Dunn. D2 stated that after he come to a complete stopped and proceeded through the intersection, he was struck by V1. D2 advised that V1 disregarded the stop sign. D2 advised that D1 left the scene. D2 was not injured. W1 advised that he was at the work (400 E 7th St, Bloomington, IN 47405), when he observed the accident occur while looking out of the window. W1 advised that he saw V2 stopped at the stop sign W/B on 7th ST. W1 mentioned that as V2 proceeded through the intersection, V1 struck V2. W1 advised that V1 did not come to a complete stop at the stop sign S/B on Dunn ST.

Driver 1 was traveling northbound on Interstate 69 near the 122 mile marker. Driver 1 stated possibly hit a patch of black ice and lost control of her vehicle. Driver 1 stated she then ran off the west side of the roadway striking the guardrail. The guardrail sustained damage from the collision. Vehicle 1 sustained front bumper and driver's side damage. Driver 1 stated she continued to spin around after striking the guardrail and came to rest on the shoulder east of the roadway. Driver 1 did not require medical personnel. Vehicle 1 was driveable and did not require a tow service. The roadway did have slush and snow due to it sleeting and the snow from the day prior.

Prior to the accident D1 was turning south onto N Jordan Avenue from E 10th Street. D1 parked in the IU parking lot north of E 10th Street and N Sunrise Drive after the accident. This is where I met with D1.D1 said he was driving west on E 10th Street, then got in the left turn lane to turn south onto N Jordan Avenue and stopped because the light was red. When the light and turn arrow turned green, D1 began making the turn south. A pedestrian wearing dark clothing then ran into the crosswalk in front of V1. The front passenger side corner of V1 struck the pedestrian, who went up onto the hood and windshield. D1 said the pedestrian then got off the car, said he was fine, and walked away east along 10th Street. D1 then parked, called IUPD, and located the pedestrian still walking down the sidewalk. The pedestrian again said he was not injured and did not want a report. Dispatch then advised D1 to stop following the pedestrian and let him walk away. V1 sustained damage to the middle of the windshield and one windshield wiper blade was broken. The pedestrian was no longer in the area and could not be located for a statement. Based on D1's statement, the pedestrian failed to yield the right of way and the crosswalk signal said to stop.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON MORTON ST APPROACHING 9TH ST. D1 INDICATED THAT A TOW TRUCK WAS STOPPED IN THE SOUTH BOUND LANE TO LOAD A DISABLED VEHICLE. D1 SAID SHE LOOKED FOR ONCOMING TRAFFIC AND ONCE SHE DETERMINED IT WAS SAFE TO PROCEED, SHE BEGAN TO PASS THE TOW TRUCK. D1 SAID AS SHE STARTED TO PASS 9TH STREET SHE WAS STRUCK BY V2. D2 STATED HE WAS STOPPED WEST ON 9TH STREET AT THE INTERSECTION OF MORTON STREET. HE SAID HE LOOKED BOTH WAYS BEFORE ENTERING TRAFFIC. D2 SAID AS HE EXITED ONTO MORTON HE WAS STRUCK BY V1 THAT WAS IN HIS LANE OF TRAVEL.

Primary Factor: SPEED TOO FAST FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS
NARRATIVE: V1 was N/B on N Walnut street passing E Blue Ridge and approaching N Old State Road 37. There was snow falling and the roads were wet. V1 lost control and ran off the roadway. V1's rear end slid into the ditch on the shoulder and the vehicle skidded along the roadside, leaving gouge marks on the pavement. V1's rear end struck a tree and the vehicle came to a rest on top of a guard rail end, with the front end of the vehicle partially in the roadway. D1 had collected some parts and fled the scene.***Supplement*** The collision occurred at the Old 37 intersection North of E Blue Ridge Dr

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was exiting the drive to Kroger (1175 S College Mall Road), traveling West. Vehicle 2 was traveling South on College Mall Road, approaching the drive to Kroger.Vehicle 2 began turning into the drive to Kroger (traveling East) when it was struck by Vehicle 1. Vehicle 1 was turning out of Kroger, South onto College Mall Road when the collision occurred.Driver 1 stated that traffic was heavy at the time of the accident.Driver 2 was unsure if Driver 1 saw him prior to the accident.
V1 WENT OFF THE ROADWAY IN THE 5400 BLOCK OF NORTH THOMAS ROAD. V1 STRUCK SOME TREES THEN WENT ACROSS THE ROAD WHERE V1 WAS LOCATED.

V1 was traveling North bound on I-69 in the right lane. D1 stated that is when V2 went to pass on the left hand side of him in the left lane. D1 stated that is when V2 lost control and drove under the trailer of V1. D2 stated that he tried to pass V1 on the left side when a gust of wind came and D2 lost control of V2. D2 stated that is when V2 went under V1 trailer.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was entering traffic from the gas station located at 3585 w state road 46. D1 advised he believed that d2 was allowing him to enter traffic in front of him and d1 pulled v1 out of the parking lot and into traffic causing v2 to strike the passenger side door of v1. D1 was driving on a learner's permit and did not have a valid driver in the car with him, he was issued a citation for learner's permit violation and when a valid driver arrived on scene the vehicle was allowed to be removed from the roadway.

DRIVER 1 AMY HASKELL WAS DRIVING WESTBOUND ON BLOOMFIELD RD.AMY ADVISED A DEER RAN INTO THE ROADWAY.AMY COLLIDED WITH THE DEER. EXTENSIVE FRONT END DAMAGE.VEHICLE TOWED BY CHANDLER'S.AMY HAD A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HER LIP AND LEFT SHOULDER.DECLINED MEDICAL.

State Road 446 at Knightsridge Road is a straight and level two lane highway. Vehicle 1 a white 2002 Ford Tarsus was traveling south on State Road 446 at Knightsridge Road, when the vehicle hit a patch of snow/slush, lost control and left the roadway to the north where it struck a tree. Driver 1, Velasquez stated he was traveling south when he lost control of vehicle 1 due to the surface conditions.Primary cause of the crash was speed too fast for weather conditions by driver 1.

VEHICLE 1 WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN. ROAD WAY WAS VERY SLICK. ROADWAY WAS ICE SNOW AND SLUSH MIX. WHEN VEHICLE RAN OFF ROADWAY, THE VEHICLE MADE CONTACT WITH A PLASTIC GUARD ON A POLE. THE PLASTIC WAS CRACKED BUT REAL DAMAGE. VEHICLE 1 HAD NO DAMAGE AND STATED THAT HE WOULD NOT TURN INTO INSURANCE

D1 STATED HE WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON N. MT TABOR RD AND HE BLACKED OUT AND RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND V1 STRUCK A TREE. ON SCENE D1 WAS CONFUSED AND STATED HE DID NOT KNOW HOW HE RAN OFF THE ROADWAY. D1 WAS CHECKED OUT BY EMS ON SCENE AND RELEASED.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

As Vehicle 1 turned West onto Grimes Lane, it was struck by Vehicle 2.Driver 1 stated that the light was yellow when she turned West.Driver 2 stated that the light was green when the collision occurred in the intersection.There were no witnesses present to determine the traffic light color.

V1 was traveling southbound on S. Leonard Springs Rd. when approaching the intersection of W. Mayberry Mall.V2 was traveling southbound on S. Leonard Springs Rd. and came to a complete stop at the intersection of W. Marberry Mall in preparation to make a left hand turn. V3 was traveling northbound on S. Leonard Springs Rd. when approaching the intersection of W. Mayberry Mall.V1 struck V2 in the rear, forcing V2 into the northbound lane. V2 struck V3 as a result of the impact from V1.
V1 WAS TRAVELING SB ON S SHIELD RIDGE RD, RAN OFF THE ROADWAY AND HIT SOME TREES AT 7035 S SHIELDS RIDGE RD.THE ROADWAY WAS SLICK AT THE TIME OF THE COLLSION DUE TO A RECENT SNOW.

D1 stated the he was headed east bound on Victor Pike when he came to the intersection of South 37 and Victor Pike. D1 stated that he looked down at his cellular device to change music. D1 stated the light at the intersection was red when he went through it resulting in a right angle collision with D2. D2 stated that she was headed south bound on 37and she did have the green light and was unable to maneuver out of the way of V1. D2 stated V1 did have a red light. Manner of Collision: HEAD ON BETWEEN TWO MOTOR VEHICLES
NARRATIVE: VEHICLE 1 WAS NB ON S ROCKPORT RD NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF S ROCKPORT RD AND S HARMONY RD. PASSANGERS IN VEHICLE 1 ADVISED THE VEHICLE HIT A PATCH OF ICE AND TURNED SIDEWAYS IN THE ROAD TRAVELING OVER THE CENTERLINE AND STRIKING VEHICLE 2.DRIVER 2 ADVISED HE WAS SB ON S ROCKPORT RD. DRIVER 2 ADVISED VEHICLE 1 APPEARED TO LOOSE CONTROL CROSSING CENTER LINE AND STRIKING HIS VEHICLE.

V1 was traveling south bound on S Leonard Springs Rd toward the intersection of W Heatherwood Ln. V1 began loosing traction as it crested the hill just prior to intersection.D1 attempted to slow V1, however the braking system failed due to the weather/roadway surface conditions. V1 went off roadway through the intersection, striking the stop sign.V1 sustained minor damage to front driver corner of bumper.Stop sign was destroyed. Stop sign belongs to private property.

W1 INDICATED THAT SHE WAS STOPPED WEST ON 3RD STREET WAITING FOR THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL TO TURN GREEN AT KINGSTON DR. SHE SAID THAT THE TURN ARROWS WERE GREEN FOR KINGSTON EAST AND WEST BOUND TRAFFIC AND OBSERVED V2 ENTER THE INTERSECTION EAST BOUND, COLLIDING WITH V2. SHE SAID V2 WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN ONTO 3RD STREET FROM KINGSTON. W2 STATED SHE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD STREET IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE. SHE INDICATED THAT THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT KINGSTON HAD TURNED RED AND SHE WAS SLOWING TO A STOP. W2 THEN SAID THAT V1 HAD BEEN TRAVELING BEHIND HER IN THE SOUTHERN MOST LANE AND VEERED LEFT INTO THE NORTH LANE. SHE SAID V1 THEN PASSED HER VEHICLE AND RETURNED TO THE SOUTHERN LANE AND ENTERED THE INTERSECTION OF KINGSTON, DISREGARDING THE RED TRAFFIC SIGNAL. SHE SAID AS V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION IT COLLIDED WITH V2 THAT WAS TURNING LEFT ONTO 3RD FROM KINGSTON.BOTH W1 AND W2 INDICATED THAT D1 CONTINUED EAST BOUND AND WAS UP ON THE SIDEWALK AT SOME POINT. BOTH W1 AND W2 FOLLOWED V1 IN AN ATTEMPT TO STOP THE ELDERLY DRIVER WHO SEEMED CONFUSED. THEY WERE ABLE TO MAKE CONTACT WITH D1 AND STOOD BY UNTIL I HAD ARRIVED. D1 KNEW HE HAD AN ACCIDENT BUT COULD NOT PROVIDE AN ACCURATE ACCOUNT. D2 INDICATED SHE WAS NORTH ON KINGSTON DR AND BEGAN TO TURN LEFT ONTO 3RD WHEN THE SIGNAL TURNED GREEN. D2 SAID SHE WAS STRUCK BY V1 WHEN ENTERING THE INTERSECTION.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

Owner of V2 stated that he parked his vehicle in the parking lot of 2317 S. Brandon Ct., at approximately 09:00 am of 12/17/2019. D1 WAS APPROACHING INTERSECTION OF W ST RD 48 AND FIELDSTONE BLVD, WHERE V2 WAS STOPPED. D1 ATTEMPTED TO STOP FOR THE STOP SIGN AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AS ROADWAS SLICK, AND STRUCK V2 ON THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE. NO INJURIES REPORTED.

V1 was east bound on W SR 46 when D1 ran off the roadway for an unknown reason colliding with the mailbox at 9355 W State Road 46 and the mailbox and post at 9315 W. SR 46. D1 also went down the embankment through the fence into a grove of pine trees at 9315 W. SR. 46. V1 came to rest approximately 200' from the roadway. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V2 was traveling South on SR 45/46. As V2 entered the intersection of SR 45/46 and 17th Street, V1 turned left in front of V2 and collided with V2. V1 sustained disabling damage to the front of the vehicle. V2 sustained disabling damage to the front of the vehicle as well. D1 said she was in the Northbound lanes of SR 45/46 attempting to turn left, or West, onto 17th Street. D1 said that the traffic signal turned yellow and she began to turn. D1 said that V2 did not stop and struck the front of her vehicle. D1 was checked by EMS but was not transported. D2 said that he was traveling straight in the Southbound lanes of SR45/46. D2 said that the light turned yellow as he was entering the intersection and that V1 turned left in front of him. D2 said he veered to the right in an attempt to avoid the collision but was still struck. Passenger 1 (P1) was a passenger in V2. P1 agreed that as V2 entered the intersection, the light was yellow and that V1 turned in front of V2. P1 sustained an abrasion to his right wrist. P1 was checked by EMS at the scene but was not transported.Photographs of the scene were taken and are attached to the case.

V1 and V2 were parked at 220 N Morton ST. V1 struck V2. D1 left the scene of the accident. D2 advised that he parked his vehicle at the above mentioned address at 8:50am. D2 advised that he departed at 5:45pm when he noticed that V2 had been struck on the rear passenger side. D2 advised that V2 was not damaged prior to parking at the above mentioned address. It should be noted that I did observed a scuff mark to V2.

On December 17th 2019 at appoximately 03:45 hours I was dispatched to 600 E MILLER DR; UTILITY CENTER in reference to an accident in progress. Upon arrival, I observed V1 parked facing west in the utility drive that runs east to west just north of the fire station on the east side of Henderson Street. The driver's side "cheater stick" that was connected to the snow plow was bent from the collision. I observed V2 facing southeast on the east part of Henderson Street in the grass between the road and sidewalk. V2 had damage to the passenger rear of the vehicle. It appeared that V2 had been hit in the passenger rear and spun around to the position that it was parked in facing southeast. D1 explained that he was exiting city utilities when he looked both ways at the entrance onto Henderson Street. D1 stated that he did not see anyone coming, but then realized that he had collided with V2. D1 stated that he realized that he had struck the vehicle with his plow that was partially in the roadway of Henderson Street. D2 stated that he was driving northbound on Henderson Street when V1 did not stop before entering traffic onto Henderson Street. D2 stated that V1 continued onto Henderson Street colliding with the rear of his vehicle. D2 stated that V1 did not stop prior to colliding with him. Due to D1 failing to stop at the stop sign before entering onto Henderson Street resulted in the collision between V1 and V2.

V1 was traveling East on 10th Street behind V2. V2 came to a stop in the intersection of 10th Street and Fee Lane due to a traffic backup. V1 was unable to stop in time striking V2 in the rear. Although there was very minor damage to the exterior of both vehicles, the airbags in V1 deployed.D1 said that as he was following V2, it stopped abruptly in the intersection. D1 said that he tried to stop but was unable to do so and rear ended V2. D2 said that traffic in front of her was backed up and stopped. D2 said that as she stopped she was struck by V1.

V1 was backing east from a parking space in a private lot. V2 was traveling southbound in the private lot. While backing V1 struck V2.D1 stated that she was backing from a parking space and did not see any other vehicles. As she backed and started to turn the wheel, she struck V2.D2 stated that she was traveling through the parking lot when V1 back and struck her.V1 did strike V2 causing damage to both vehicles.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: SR48 is a multi-lane roadway that is undivided and double yellow lane control lines to separate the two-way traffic. SR48 primarily travels east and west. The location of this crash is an overpass over I69. Vehicle 1, white ford fusion, was traveling westbound and turning left. V1 entered into the path of V2, a tan toyota corolla, that was traveling eastbound in the northern lane. After V1 spun V2 and it continued to travel southbound, V2 was struck by V3, a dark blue, ford fusion that was traveling eastbound in the southern lane. V1's initial impact into V2 was with the front center of V1 into the driver's side of V2. V3 then struck the right rear of V2 with the front center of V3.Driver 1, Breonna Charles stated that she was traveling westbound on SR48 and that she was attempting to turn south onto I69 form SR48. D1 stated that she began her turn when V2 hit her. When asked about what color her light was, D1 stated that she had a flashing yellow arrow. Driver 2, Steven Mcatee stated that he was traveling eastbound in the northern lane when V1 turned into the side of his car. He stated that he is unsure of what all happened after that and that he came to a stop sideways in the roadway. Driver 3, Megan Sipes stated that she was traveling eastbound in the southern lane and that everything happened so quickly that she was unsure of what had happened. But markings on the vehicles would indicated that after V2 struck V1, V2 continued southbound into the path of V3 and V2 was struck by V3.It is the opinion of the investigating officer that the primary cause of this crash would be failure to yield and that D1 is at fault for both impacts.

Spoke to D1 and she stated V1 was traveling north on S Old SR 37 in the area of the 5000 block. D1 stated a deer jumped out in front of V1 from the west traveling east. D1 stated she could not avoid striking the deer with the front of V1. The impact with the deer caused damage to the front of V1 but V1 was drivable. D1 was not injured during the crash and she drove V1 from the scene. D1 continued to work and called for a report.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: When I arrived on scene, the vehicles had been moved from where the crash occurred. The crash involved a silver Volkswagen (V1), driven by Jing Zhao, and a beige Toyota (V2), driven by Lindsay Feske (D2). None of the parties involved in the crash complained of any injuries. D1 stated that she was driving west on Lingelbach Lane approaching Jordan Ave and came to a stop beyond the stop sign as V2 was attempting to turn left onto Lingelbach Lane from coming southbound on Jordan Ave. The front bumper of V1 crashed into the driver side rear wheel/fender of V2.D2 stated that the windshield of V1 was not defrosted at the time of the crash. When I arrived on scene, the front windshield was mostly clear but the other windows were very frosted and were not clear to see through.V1 sustained moderate damage to the entire front bumper and headlights. V2 sustained minor damage to the driver side rear wheel and fender/bumper.Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene.
V1 REAR ENDED V2 WHILE BOTH VEHICLES WERE ATTEMPTING TO TURN NORTHBOUND ON SOUTH STATE ROAD 37 FROM SOUTH VICTOR PIKE ROAD. D1 ADMITTED FAULT

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D2 STATED THEY WERE TURNING LEFT TO GO EASTBOUND ON W BLOOMFIELD RD FROM THE I69 RAMP. D2 STATED THEY HAD THE GREEN LIGHT TO TURN LEFT, SO HE WAS IN THE PROCESS OF TURNING LEFT, V1 CAME OUT OF NOWHERE AND SIDESWIPED V2.
