V1 REAR ENDED V2 AS BOTH VEHICLES WERE TRAVELING WB ON E SMITHVILLE ROAD APPROACHING S SR 37. THERE WAS SAND ON THE ROAWAY FROM THE PREVIOUS DAY'S SNOW HOWEVER IT DID NOT PLAY A SIGNIFICAT ROLE IN THE COLLISION.D1 ADMITTED TO REAR ENDING V2.

Primary Cause-Driver Factor: V1 was parked next to V2 in a church parking lot. D1 observed a traffic violation on SR48 and attempted to make a traffic stop. V1 traveled forward and struck V2.The crash occurred in the parking lot of Cross Roads United Methodist Church located at 6030 W. SR48, Monroe County.V1 (2014 white Dodge Charger commission #2514, mileage 117,763) was parked next to V2 (2010 white Dodge Charger commission #4666, mileage 115,410) in the Cross Roads church parking lot. V1 was facing south and V2 was facing north. V1 began to travel south through the parking lot and sideswiped V2 on the driver side rear door and fender area.D1 (Allen Deel) stated he was parked facing south next to V2. D1 observed a traffic violation and started traveling forward when he struck the driver side of V2.D2 (Julie Deel) stated she was parked next to V1 facing north. V1 began to travel forward and struck the driver side of her commission.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the driver side front fender, door, and rear fender area of V1. I also observed minor damage to the driver side rear fender and bumper area of V2. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: DRIVER 2 STATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING V2 EAST ON E. 17TH ST. SHE ALSO STATED THAT WHEN SHE ARRIVED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E. 17TH ST. AND N. LINCOLN ST., V1 ENTERED THE INTERSECTION FROM THE SOUTHBOND LANE OF N. LINCOLN ST., THEREFORE V1'S FRONT END STRUCK V2 IN THE DRIVER SIDE. DRIVER 2 STATED THAT SHE HAD RIGHT OF WAY AND DRIVER 1 HAD A STOP SIGN.DRIVER 1 STATED THAT HE WAS DRIVING V1 SOUTH ON N. LINCOLN ST. HE EXPLAINED THAT V1'S WINDSHIELD WIPER WAS NOT FUNCTIONAL, THEREFORE THE WINDSHIELD HAD SOME ICE ON THE OUTSIDE. DRIVER 1 ALSO STATED TAHT HIS WINDSHIELD ALSO HAD SOME CONDENSATION INSIDE. ACCORDING TO DRIVER 1, WHEN HE ARRIVED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E. 17TH ST. AND N. LINCOLN ST., HE FAILED TO SEE THE STOP SIGN DUE TO THE SUNLIGH CREATING A GLARE ON HIS WINDSHIELD. DRIVER 1 MENTIONED THAT HE THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION WITHOUT STOPPING, WICH CAUSED V1'S FRONT END TO STIKE V2 IN THE DRIVER SIDE.WITNESS STATED THAT HE OBSERVED DRIVER 1 PROCEEDED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, WITHOUT STOPPING AT THE STOP SIGN, AND CAUSED V1 STRIKE V2.

V1 and v2 were both traveling west on 3rd street, approaching the intersection of 3rd street and swain avenue. V1 was directly behind v2 in the left lane. 3rd street is a two lane, one way road in that location. V2 had to come to an abrupt stop to avoid hitting another vehicle. When v2 stopped, v1 struck v2 in the rear end. D2 stated she was traveling west in the left lane of 3rd street, approaching the intersection of 3rd street and swain avenue. D2 said there was a vehicle in the right lane just ahead of her. D2 said the other vehicle made a left hand turn from the right lane onto swain avenue, cutting across all the traffic in the left lane. D2 said she had to make an abrupt stop to avoid hitting that vehicle. D2 said when she stopped, v1 struck her in the rear end. D1 said she was traveling in the left lane on 3rd street following v2. D1 said she saw a vehicle try to turn left, and then V2 came to a sudden stop in front of her. D1 said she didn't have enough time to react, and struck v2 in the rear end......I eventually spoke with the driver of the vehicle that made the left hand turn. The driver said she was traveling in the left lane, and made a left hand turn. The driver said she then heard a crash behind her. The driver said she did not turn left from the right lane.

V1 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON INTERSTATE 69, JUST SOUTH OF TAPP RD.D1 EXPLAINED THAT SHE FELL ASLEEP WHILE TRAVELINGD1 STATED SHE STRUCK THE CONCRETE BARRIER MEDIAN, WHICH CAUSED HER VEHICLE TO SLIDE SIDEWAYS TOWARDS THE WESTV1 THEN SLID ACROSS THE SOUTHBOUND LANES AND FURTHER ACROSS THE OFF RAMP OF TAPP RD. ONTO INTERSTATE 69, WHERE V1 CAME TO RESTV1 WAS REMOVED FROM THE ROADWAY

D1 is unknown as they left the scene.Owner of V2 stated she was working from 0600 hours until 1400 hours. Owner stated she returned to her vehicle and noticed her vehicle had sustained damage to the drivers side door and drivers side rear quarter panel. No video footage was available for review.

WHILE TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD ST, V1 REAR ENDED V2 WHICH PUSHED V2 INTO V3. WHILE TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD ST, V2, WHICH WAS SLOWING DOWN, WAS REAR ENDED BY V1 PUSHING IT INTO V3. WHILE STARTING TO TRAVEL EAST ON 3RD ST, V3 WAS REAR ENDED BY V2. D1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING EAST ON 3RD ST, SHE COLLIDED WITH V2. D2 STATED THAT WHILE SLOWING DOWN FACING EAST, SHE WAS REAR ENDED BY V1 PUSHING HER INTO THE REAR OF V3. D3 STATED THAT WHILE BEGING TO TRAVEL EAST ON 3RD ST, HE WAS HIT BY V2.

DRIVER 2 STATED THAT AT 07:30 PM OF 12/18/2019, HE PARKED V2 IN THE PARKING LOT OF 1800 N. WALNUT ST. ACCORDING TO DRIVER 2, WHEN HE CAME BACK TO V2 AT 09:00 AM OF 12/19/2019, HE NOTICED DAMAGE MARKES IN THE PASSANGER SIDE OF V2. DRIVER 2 SUSPECTED THAT WHILE HE WAS AWAY FROM V2, AN UNKNOWN VEHICLE (V1) HAD ATTEMPTED TO PARK NEXT TO V2, AND STRUCK IT IN THE PROCESS.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated that she was traveling northbound on S Henderson Street and came to a complete stop at the intersection of E Grimes Lane. D1 stated that she believed the intersection was clear and began to proceed, however she then realized that V2 was already proceeding through the intersection eastbound on E Grimes Lane. V2 attempted to slow but V1 still collided with the passenger side of V2. D1 stated that she believes V2 did have the right of way, she just did not see it.D2 stated that she was traveling eastbound on E Grimes Lane, and continued eastbound through the S Henderson Street intersection after coming to a complete stop. D2 stated that as she was most of the way through the intersection, V1 failed to yield and collided into her vehicle. D2 stated that she did not notice V1 approaching until it was too late, so she was unable to swerve away. Both drivers advised that they were uninjured and both declined an ambulance. Neither vehicle suffered disabling damage and both were able to be driven from the scene.

DONALD HODZIC (VEHICLE1) WAS TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON WALNUT ST, APPROACHING SR 45 46 BYPASS.VEHICLE 1 FAILED TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY TO TRAFFIC TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON BYPASS.VEHICLE 1 TURNED EASTBOUND ONTO BYPASS AND COLLIDED WITH VEHICLE 2.VEHICLE 1 LEFT THE SCENE.VEHICLE 2 WAS EASTBOUND ON BYPASS. VEHICLE 2 WAS STOPPED AT RED LIGHT AT WALNUT ST. ONCE LIGHT TURNED GREEN, VEHICLE 2 CONTINUED EASTBOUND ON BYPASS.VEHICLE 2 WAS STRUCK BY VEHICLE 1 (NORTHEAST BOUND) WHO DISREGARDED LIGHT.

BOTH VEHICLES IN THE KROGER PARKING LOT, 528 S. COLLEGE AVE. A CUSTOMER REPORTED TO SECURITY THEY THOUGHT THE TWO VEHICLES MADE CONTACT IN THE LOT AS V1 WAS LEAVING. THEY LOOKED, AND FOUND DAMAGE TO V2, AND RECOGNIZED THE OTHER VEHICLE AS A FREQUENT CUSTOMER, AND PROVIDED ME HIS NAME.I LOCATED D1 AT HIS OFFICE AROUND THE CORNER, AND HE HAD NO IDEA THE CRASH HAD OCCURRED. HE SAID HE WAS TURNING RIGHT OUT OF THE PARKING SPACE AND DID NOT FEEL / HEAR THE CONTACT. NO REPORTED INJURIES.

V1 WAS A TRASH TRUCK PICKING UP TRASH. D1 STATED THAT HE WAS BACKING UP FOR TRASH REMOVAL AND STRUCK V2 WITH THE REAR STEP OF V1 CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF V2. THE DAMAGE WAS NOT SEVERE AND IT ALSO POPPED THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE TIRE. V2 WAS UNOCCUPIED, PARKED AND NOT RUNNING. I LEFT A DRUVERS EXCHANGE FORM AT THE ADDRES THAT THE CAR WAS SITTING IN FRONT OF FOR THE OWNER OF THE V2. THE TRASH TRUCK HAD A US DOT # 2835875 BUT IT DIDNT COME BACK TO ANYTHING. NEITHER VEHICLE NEEDED TO BE TOWED FROM THE SCENE. D1 WAS FIRED BY THE TRASH COMPANY FOR REPORTING/ HAVING AN ACCIDENT.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Thursday, December 19, 2019 at 07:15, I Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a property damage crash that took place on S Rockport Rd at the intersection of W Tapp Rd. At the time of the crash, the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. It was dark outside and traffic was moderate to heavy due to morning rush hour traffic. Vehicle 1, a tan 2006 Ford Taurus, was attempting to turn left from south bound Rockport Rd. onto Country Club Rd. Vehicle 2, a red 1996 GMC Sierra was traveling north on Rockport Rd. approaching the County Club Rd. intersection. North and south bound lanes of Rockport Rd. had green lights at the intersection. V2 struck the passenger side of V1 in the middle of the intersection. Both vehicle came to stop in the middle of the intersection. Driver 1, Thelma Flynn, stated she was attempting to turn left to go east on Country Club Rd from south bound Rockport Rd. D1 told me she thought she had the right of way because the light was green and bus directly in front of her had just turned in front of her. D1 said as she was turning through the intersection she could see V2 coming at her. Due to the limited space at the intersection D1 had no where to go. D1 told me V2 struck her in the passenger side of her car. Driver 2, Anthony Roberts, stated he was traveling north on Rockport Rd. as he approached the Country Club Rd. intersection. D2 said he saw a bus turn in front of him but because he had a green light he attempted to travel through the intersection. D2 said he saw V1 start to turn east onto Country Club Rd. directly in front of him at that time he tried to apply his brakes but was unable to get stopped before hitting V1 in the passenger side of the car. Evidence showed heavy damage to the passenger side of V1. Evidence showed damage to the passenger side bumper of V2. Evidence showed the traffic light at the intersection was fully operational at the time of the crash. *At the time of the crash, I was at the north west corner of the intersection. I did not see the impact but I did hear the screeching of tires and a short time after the loud sound of vehicles colliding. When I look over to see what had happened, it appeared as if V2 had collided with the passenger side of V1.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: V1 was turning right from the parking lot of landmark collision to travel west on 3rd st. V2 was completing a u turn to travel west on 3rd street as well. The front driver side of V1 collided with the rear passenger side of V2 causing minor damage to V1 and disabling damage to V2.D1 stated that she was unsure what color the traffic light was at the time but she had checked traffic traveling in the westbound lane and began to drive since the lane was clear. D2 stated that she felt an impact on the rear left side of her vehicle.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Vehicle 1 was traveling south on Rose Avenue approximately 210 feet north of Jones Avenue attempting to make a left turn, heading east, into the circle drive of Willkie Quad at 150 N. Rose Avenue. Vehicle 2 was traveling north on Rose Avenue approximately 190 feet north of Jones Avenue.Driver 1 stated there was a truck in front of him as he slowed to turn left into the drive. Driver 1 stated he had his turn signal on and was close to the sidewalk on the west side of the road. He stated that he began making his left turn into the drive when he was struck on the front of the passenger side by Vehicle 2. Driver 1 stated he never saw Vehicle 2.Driver 2 stated she was traveling north on Rose Avenue when Vehicle 1 turned in front of her without warning and she struck the front of the passenger side. She stated she never saw Vehicle 1 use a turn signal. Witness 1 stated she was walking down the sidewalk on the west side of the road just south of the crash location. She advised she was heading north when she witnessed Vehicle 1 turn left in front of Vehicle 2 with no turn signal or any warning. Witness 1 stated Vehicle 2 immediately struck the passenger side of Vehicle 1.Witness 2 stated she was in a vehicle behind Vehicle 1 and witnessed Vehicle 1 extremely close to the curb on the west side of the road. Witness 2 stated Vehicle 1 did not have a turn signal on and turned right in front of Vehicle 2, causing it to strike the passenger side of Vehicle 1.No one involved complained of any injuries.There was damage to the passenger front door and rocker panel, as well as scrapes to the frame and back wheel of Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 had heavy damage to the passenger side front end.

V2 was parked and unattended. When D2 returned to vehicle, D2 found that V2 had been struck by another vehicle.V1 was no longer on scene, did not provide information and has not bee identified.

Primary Cause-Driver Factor-Unsafe Backing: D1 failed to make sure she had a clear path during the entire time she was backing and struck V2.The crash occurred in the parking lot of Melton Orchard Country Store located at 4445 W. SR45, Monroe County.V1 (2015 green Subaru Forrester) was attempting to back out of the parking stall traveling north. V2 (2015 black Chevrolet Silverado) was stopped behind V1 preparing to travel onto SR45 facing north east. V1 struck the right rear passenger fender of V2 with the rear right bumper area of V2.D1 (Jane Vandenberg) stated she was attempting to back out of her parking stall. She looked and saw no vehicles and proceeded to back out. D1 stated she never saw V2 until she struck the vehicle.D2 (Timothy Cook) stated he had pulled into the parking lot of Melton Orchard to turn around. D1 stated he was stopped waiting for traffic to clear to enter onto SR45. D2 stated that V1 struck him in the right rear passenger side fender.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the right rear bumper area of V1. I also observed damage to the right rear fender area of V2. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Unsafe Backing on the part of D1. This was determined by damages sustained to both vehicles and driver statements.

On Friday, December 20, 2019 at 12:26, I Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a crash on SR 48 near 7701 W SR 48, Bloomington IN. State Road 48 is primarily a two lane two way road that runs east and west. At the time of the crash it was daylight outside and it was clear. The roadway is made of asphalt and it was dry. Vehicle 1, gray Ford Explorer, was traveling east on SR 48 approaching the 7701 W SR 48 driveway. As it made its approach V1 lost control, crossed the oncoming traffic lane, then ran off the roadway heading north east. V1 continued down the short embankment until it hit a power line pole next to a fence. V1 came to a stop against the pole and fence. Driver 1, Aaron Lewis, told me he was traveling east on SR 48 approaching the 7701 W SR 48 driveway. As he was coming around the corner D1 said a dog ran in front of his vehicle. D1 said he veered his vehicle to the left to avoid hitting the animal. D1 said he missed the dog but then lost control and ended up in the ditch on the left side of the roadway. D1 said after going down the embankment his SUV struck the power line pole and fence. Evidence shows heavy damage to the front end of V1. Evidence shows heavy damage to the base of the power line pole. Evidence shows damage to the fence. Evidence shows the roadway was clear at the time of the crash.

The owner of vehicle 2 advised that he had left his car parked in the 200 blk of Varsity Ln on the west side of the lane, facing south. He advised that sometime overnight an unknown vehicle collided with the front passengers side bumper of vehicle 2 and left the scene without providing information.

D1 WAS HEADING WEST ON WEST STATE ROAD 46 NEAR N. JACOB ST. A DEER RAN OUT OF THE WOODS HEADING NORTH AND HIT D1 IN THE DRIVERS SIDE. D1 WAS UNABLE TO OPEN HER DOOR. DAMAGE TO FRONT BUMPER, FRONT FENDER, AND DRIVERS DOOR.

Gifford Rd. is a local road that runs primarily in a eastern and western direction in the area of the crash. Apple Tree Pl. runs in a northern and southern direction and intersects with Gifford Rd. 950ft West of the crash. V1 (2002 maroon Buick Le Sabre) was traveling eastbound on Gifford Rd. V1 traveled off the roadway and into a ditch on the south side of Gifford. V1 traveled approximately 200ft in the ditch before coming to rest in a 5ft drop off into a culvert.D1 (Marilyn Sater) stated she was not sure what happened, but thought her vehicle may have slid, causing her to run off the roadway. She was wearing her seat belt.I did not observe any tire marks on the roadway to indicate that the vehicle lost traction. I did observe tire tracks in the ditch indicating the path V1 traveled. I observed damage to the right and left side of V1. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Failure To Maintain Lane on the part of D1. This was determined by the location of the vehicle at rest and tire tracks in the ditch.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY

D1 said he was attempting to turn Left onto Woodlawn Ave and that the traffic signal was displaying a flashing yellow turn arrow. D1 said he thought that V2 would be stopping, so he turned left and was struck by V2. D1 said he was driving between 5-10 mph.D2 said that as he was traveling East on 10th, V1 turned left in front of him and he could not avoid the collision. D2 said that he was traveling 25-30 mph.D2 has a conditional license to include traveling to the Grocery Store before 8:00 PM. D2 said he was driving to the grocery store. Proper paperwork was provided.

D1 was traveling W/B on 7th ST. D2 was traveling N/B on Indiana Ave. D1 disregarded the stop sign and struck V2. D1 advised that she continued through the intersection when she collided with V2. D1 advised that she and her passengers were not injured. D2 advised that he was traveling N/B on Indiana Ave, approaching the intersection of 7th & Indiana Ave. D2 advised that he come to a complete stop, and checked the intersection additionally for people crossing. D2 advised that he then proceeded through the intersection, when V2 was struck by V1. D2 advised he and his passenger was not injured.

V1 was traveling east bound on 11th street when the vehicle went left of center and struck V2 on the back left fender causing disabling damage. On Friday, December 20, 2019 at 16:43 I responded to a crash on State Rd 37 southbound approximately 500 ft north of S Victor Pike. D2 stated V1 struck the rear of V2.Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows damage to the rear of V2. **Local Address for D2, Bailey, 5671 W. Gunnar Court, Bloomington, IN 47403**In the same area I had stopped a car hauler to conduct an inspection, We were off of the traveled roadway on the emergency lane. V2 was traveling straight in the right hand turn lane of Southbound SR46. V1 attempted to change lanes into the same turn lane striking V2. V2 sustained minor damage to the passenger side of the vehicle. V1 sustained moderate damage to the front and driver side of the vehicle. D1 said that she was in the right lane that is designated as a left turn lane. D1 said that she thought V2 was in the left lane that is designated as a left turn lane. D1 said she thought that V2 veered into her lane striking her vehicle. D1 said she was traveling less than 40 mph. D2 said that she was in the right lane that is designated as left turn lane. D2 said that V1 was in the left straight lane and changed lanes into her lane causing the collision. D2 said she was traveling less than 40 mph. Upon arriving at the scene, prior to speaking with either driver, I noticed vehicle parts from the collision on the solid white line separating the turn lanes from the left straight lane. The location of this debris in relation to the damage to the vehicles indicates that the collision did occur with V1 in the straight lane. Both Drivers complained of glare from the sun when the crash occurred. D1 was cited for expired license plates. D2 was cited for no proof of insurance. When I arrived, V2 was in a private parking lot. V2 was parked in a space and not towed.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Tuesday, December 24, 2019 at 9:10AM, I Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a crash on SR 37 at the Victor Pike intersection. State Road 37 is a four lane two way highway that runs primarily north and south. The intersection at Victor Pike is run by a fully operational traffic light. At the time of the crash, the weather was foggy and the road surface was dry. Traffic was light to moderate at the time of the crash. Vehicle 1, a silver Chevrolet Avero, was traveling south on SR 37 approaching the Victor PIke traffic light. Vehicle 2, a white GMC Savana van, was traveling west on Victor Pike at the SR 37 intersection. V1 went through the intersection at the same time V2 went through the intersection. V1 stuck the front passenger side bumper of V2. Both vehicles came to a stop in the middle of the southbound lanes of SR 37 in the middle of the Victor Pike intersection. Driver 1, Eric Miller, stated he was traveling south on SR 37 approaching the Victor Pike intersection. D1 told me he thought he had the green light but wasn't sure because he couldn't see the light due to the glare from the sun that morning. D1 stated he continued through the intersection and struck V2. Driver 2, Tyler Gadberry, stated he was traveling west on Victor Pike traveling through the SR 37 intersection. D2 told me his light was green so he was attempting to cross the intersection. D2 said while he was going through the intersection V1 struck his van. D1 said that after he was hit he tried to pull his vehicle to the southwest corner of the intersection to get it out of the way of traffic. Witness 1, Clayton Southern, stated he was sitting in his truck at the light on Victor PIke at SR 37 facing east. W1 stated he watched as V1 traveled though the intersection and hit V2. W1 said that the light was red for V1 when it went through the intersection but it appeared as if it never tried to stop. Evidence show heavy damage to the front end of V1. Evidence shows heavy damage to the front end of V2. Evidence shows that the traffic light at SR 37 and Victor Pike was fully operation at the time of the crash. Evidence shows that W1 was at the traffic light at the time of the crash.

V1 stated he had a lot on his mind and just didn't see the sign. V2 was traveling north bound on Rogers when it was struck on the right passenger side by V2. Neither vehicle were towed from the scene.

When I arrived on scene, I observed an older white male standing over a black female who was laying in the roadway next to her car. I immediately moved them to the nearby sidewalk. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Thursday, December 26, 2019 at 08:56, I responded to a crash on Curry Pike approximately 1100 feet north of Profile Parkway. At the time of the crash, the weather was cloudy and the road surface was dry. V1, Chevrolet, was stopped on a private drive along the east side of Curry Pike preparing to make a left, south, turn. V2, Freightliner, was traveling north on Curry Pike in the number 2, right, lane. V1 moved forward while checking north and southbound traffic. V2 struck the front of V1 with the right side drive axles of V2 as V2 passed V1. D1, Lindauer, stated he was preparing to make a left, south, turn onto Curry Pike from the private drive. D1 stated he moved forward while checking both north and southbound traffic. D1 stated he believed the front of V1 was partially in the northbound lane of Curry Pike. D1 stated V2 struck the front of V1. D2, Cullison, stated he was travelling north on Curry Pike in the number 2, right, lane. D2 stated there was traffic traveling north on Curry Pike in the number 1, left, lane. D2 stated he observed V1 moving forward as he approached the private drive. D2 stated he was unable to move to the number 1, left, lane due to other traffic. D2 stated he struck the front of V1 with the right side drive axles of V2. Evidence shows damage to the front of V1. Evidence shows rub marks on the tire and a small scratch on the wheel of the right side front drive axle. No other damage was visible on V2. ****Correct Location is Curry Pike approximately 1100 feet north of Profile Parkway*****

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: On Friday, December 27, 2019 at 07:50, I Trp. Matthew Harris responded to a crash on S Victor Pike at intersection of State Rd 37. Victor Pike is a two lane two way road that runs primarily east and west. The intersection at Victor Pike and SR 37 is controlled by a traffic control light that was fully operational at the time of the crash. It was cloudy out at the time of the crash and the road surface was dry.Vehicle 1, a black Ford F150, was facing west on Victor Pike at the SR 37 stop light behind Vehicle 2. V2, a gray Chevrolet Equinox, was facing west on S Victor Pike at the SR 37 stop light getting ready to turn right onto SR 37. While V2 was attempting to turn onto SR 37 V1 rear ended V2. Both vehicles pulled over to the northeast corner of the intersection of the strike.Driver 1, Collin Todd, stated he was sitting behind V2 facing west bound on S Victor Pike getting ready to turn north onto SR 37. D1 said V2 was started to roll forward to turn right onto SR 37 so he started to move forward as well. D1 said he briefly looked down but that when he looked up V2 had stopped. D1 told me at that time he ran into the rear end of V2. Driver 2, Jonathan Karty, stated he was sitting facing west bound on S Victor Pike at the light getting ready to turn north onto SR 37. D2 said as he was sitting there getting ready to turn left he was struck from the rear by V1. Evidence shows minor damage to V2. Evidence shows no visual damage to V1. Evidence shows the traffic light was fully operational at the time of the crash.

D1 STATED HE WAS TRAVELING WB ON ST RD 48 JUST WEST OF VERNAL PIKE.D1 STATED HE CAME AROUND A BEND IN THE ROAD AND LOST CONTROL DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE ROADWAY WAS WET.D1 LEFT THE ROADWAY AND WENT INTO THE DITCH ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE ROADWAY.D1 STATED HE WAS ABLE TO DRIVE HIS TRUCK OUT OF THE DITCH AND PULLED OFF TO THE SIDE OF THE ROADWAY.UPON MY ARRIVAL THE VEHICLE WAS MOVED FROM THE CRASH SITE.THE DRIVER COMPLAINED OF BACK PAIN AND WAS TREATED ON SCENE.THE DRIVER WAS NOT TRANSPORTED AND THE VEHICLE WAS ABLE TO DRIVE AWAY FROM THE SCENE.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Primary Cause-Driver Factor-Failure To Yield Right Of Way: D1 attempted to make a left turn out of the gas station lot onto 17th St. D1 failed to yield to V2 which had the right of way and struck V2. D1 should have made sure that there was no oncoming traffic before making the left turn.17th St. is a local road that runs in a eastern and western direction through Monroe County. College Avenue is a local road that runs in a northern and southern direction and intersects with 17th St. 158ft east of the crash. The roadway condition was wet at the time of the crash.V1 (1993 green Jeep Cherokee) was attempting to enter onto 17th St. from the Circle K gas station lot. W1 was stopped in traffic and was letting V1 exit the lot. V1 traveled north in front of W1 and started into the westbound lane of 17th Street. V2 (2009 red Cadillac) was traveling westbound on 17th Street and was struck in the driver and rear passenger side door area by V1.D1 (Dezaray Christenberry) stated she was attempting to travel onto 17th Street to go westbound. D1 stated that W1 stopped and was waiving her out of the gas station lot. D1 stated she could not see V2 and traveled onto 17th Street and struck V2 on the driver side. She was wearing her seat belt.D2 (David Williams) stated he was traveling westbound on 17th Street when V1 struck his vehicle on the driver side front and rear door. He was wearing his seat belt.W1 (Allan Headley) stated he was traveling eastbound on 17th Street and was stopping in traffic. W1 stated he stopped far enough back from the vehicle that was stopped in front of him to let V1 exit the lot. He waived to V1 to exit, but stated D1 did not look to see if any vehicles were oncoming.During the course of my investigation, I observed damage to the driver side front and rear passenger door of V2. I observed new damage to the right front fender and bumper area of V1. V1 already had front end damage to the grill, and bumper area from a prior, unrelated crash. No injuries were reported as a result of this crash.The crash investigation showed that the primary cause of the crash is Failure To Yield Right Of Way on the part of D1. This was determined by both driver and witness statements and damage sustained to both vehicles.

AFTER SPEAKING WITH THE DRIVERS ON SCENE, V1, V2, AND V3 WERE ALL TRAVELING EB, RESPECTIVELY, ON W STATE ROAD 46 BYPASS APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION OF N KINSER PIKE. AS V2 AND V3 BEGAN TO BRAKE FOR SLOWING AND STOPPED TRAFFIC AHEAD FROM THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL, V3 CONTINUED FORWARD AND WAS NOT ABLE TO STOP IN TIME TO AVOID THE COLLISION. THE FRONT OF V1 COLLIDED WITH THE REAR OF V2 WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY CAUSED THE FRONT OF V2 TO COLLIDE WITH V3. D1 STATED THAT AS HE BEGAN TO BRAKE, HIS VEHICLE BEGAN TO SLIDE DUE TO THE WET PAVEMENT AND HE COULD NOT STOP IN TIME.

D1 stated that he was driving the car, but then stated that he was not driving the car. D1 did not give a statement to what happen during the accident.W1 stated that he knew that D1 was driving V1. He stated that he saw him drive the car in the parking lot but did not see the accident. V1 was located facing Southwest in a ditch. This ditch was located in the South West corner of the address of 1933 W Curry Pike. It appeared that D1 drive the car South West into the ditch where the vehicle got stuck. D1 was transported back to Bloomington Police Department to be investigated for Operating While Intoxicated.

W1 then stated he went to get someone to file a report. When he returned he witnessed V1 leaving the area. Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: Driver 1 stopped at the intersection of vine and sale was distracted trying to put on his seat belt after seeing a police car and entered the intersection striking a vehicle traveling south.Driver 2 said she was driving south on sale and as struck by a vehicle from the sideTraffic on Sale Street has the right of way and there is no traffic control for vehicles traveling on sale street at vine. Vine street has stop signs.

Prior to the time of the collision, a stop sign at 10th and Park Ave (which stops northbound traffic on Park), had been hit and had fallen on the ground where it was not visible for oncoming traffic. D2 had been driving westbound on 10th Street near Park when D1 struck D2 as D1 was heading north on park. D1 did not stop for oncoming traffic while heading north due to the downed stop sign. Prior to my arrival at the crash scene, an ambulance (2164) had been driving by and saw the vehicles on the side of the road after the crash. EMS stated they stopped to ensure there were no injuries. They checked out both drivers and stated both refused treatment. I first spoke to D1 who stated that he had been driving northbound on Park attempting to cross 10th Street and continue north. He stated he did not see any stop signs indicating him to stop, so he kept driving northbound crossing the street, when all of a sudden the front end of V1 struck V2. I then spoke to D2 who stated she was driving westbound on 10th Street near the intersection of 10th and Park Ave. when all of a sudden she saw V1 drive out in front of V2. She stated she was unable to stop in time to avoid a collision from occurring. She stated that it was also difficult to see the road due to the rain and weather so that his reaction time to attempt to stop may have been slower than usual. D2 stated that she had specialized driving privileges due to a previous OWI offense, however, D2 was able to show me all the required documentation as well as proof that she was driving home from work at Chili's. Damage to the front end of both vehicles was severe. V2's airbag deployed. D2 initially stated she did not have any injuries, however, she stated that once the adrenaline wore off, she noticed her face was hurting due to the airbag deployment. After she cleared the scene, she advised she was going to the IU Health Bloomington Hospital to be seen. While speaking with D1 near V1, I noticed the odor of marijuana emanating from the vehicle. I then asked D1 how long ago he had smoked marijuana, and he stated two hours prior. I then performed SFST's on D1 to ensure that he was not impaired on drugs. I saw no signs of either drug or alcohol impairment after performing the tests. I then searched his vehicle and only a small amount of marijuana residue was found. D1 did not sustain any charges.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: At the time of this collision, a temporary traffic pattern was in place to direct vehicles exiting onto the 45/46 Bypass from the Indiana University Basketball game. Vehicle 1 was exiting the Indiana University Athletics parking lot from Gate 11 located in the 800 Block of East State Road 45/46 Bypass and was intending to exit westbound onto the 45/46 bypass. Vehicle 1 was required to cross the two eastbound lanes to enter the center turn lane which had been set up to function as an extended acceleration/merge lane into the westbound lanes. However, at the time of the collision, the basketball game was not yet completed and therefore limited vehicle traffic was present, therefore law enforcement officers along the bypass were not yet actively directing vehicle traffic. Specifically at Gate 11, Deputy Bennett Dillon and Deputy Michael Ruiz had recently completed cone placement in preparation for post-game traffic and were not directing vehicle traffic.As vehicle 1 prepared to exit gate 11, it was following a white SUV that briefly stopped prior to crossing the eastbound lanes to travel west. Driver 1 later stated that he believed that Deputies were directing vehicle traffic and that when the white SUV proceeded it was doing so under law enforcement direction. As vehicle 1 followed the white SUV across the eastbound lanes toward the center merge lane, vehicle 1 came to a stop across both eastbound travel lanes. Vehicle 2 attempted to stop using maximum braking, however ultimately collided with the driver side front bumper, quarter panel, and wheel/tire assembly.The collision resulted in extensive front end damage and air bag deployment to vehicle 2 and extensive bumper and wheel damage to vehicle 1. Driver and passenger of vehicle 1 did not sustain any injuries during the collision. Driver 2 initially stated that she was uninjured, however later complained of mild head pain from striking the airbag during the collision. Driver 2 declined to be evaluated by an ambulance at the scene and stated she would consult her doctor if the pain did not subside. Driver 1 made private arrangements with a towing service and driver 2 requested the on-call towing service for the Sheriff's Office to transport the vehicle to Kia Motors in Bloomington, Indiana. Video footage of the collision was captured by dash mounted cameras in both Deputy Dillon and Deputy Ruiz's vehicles and is available upon request to the Monroe County Sheriff's Office Records Division. Photographs of both vehicles were also taken.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON E DISCROLL DR, APPROACHING THE INTERSECTION WITH S WASHINGTON ST. D1 STATED THEY STOPPED AT THE STOP SIGN AT THIS INTERSECTION, AND PROCEEDED TO ENTER THE INTERSECTION. D1 STATED THAT WHILE TRAVELING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION, THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE OF V1 WAS STRUCK BY V2, WHICH THEY CLAIMED WAS SPEEDING. D2 STATED THEY WERE TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON S WASHINGTON ST, APPROAHING THE INTERSECTION WITH E DRISCOLL DR. D2 STATED THEY OBSERVED V1 PERFORM A "ROLLING STOP" AT THE STOP SIGN, AND PROCEEDED IN TO THE INTERSECTION, STILL HEADING WESTBOUND. D2 STATED THEY ATTEMPTED TO AVOID STRIKING V1 BY SWERVING OUT OF THE WAY, BUT ENDED UP STRIKING V1 WITH THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF V2.

V1 WAS TRAVELING EB ON E AZALEA LN FLEEING FROM POLICE. D1 ADVISED AS V1 WAS TRAVELING EB, V1 RAN OVER A MEDIAN, THEN LOST CONTROL OF V1 AND RAN OFF THE ROAD STRIKING A TREE JUST WEST OF 1103 E AZALEA LN. BOTH DRIVER AND PASSENGER THEN LEFT ON FOOT.THERE APPEARED TO BE MINOR DAMAGE TO THE BARK OF THE TREE AND NO DAMAGE TO THE MEDIAN.NO ONE WITNESSED THE ACCIDENT. NO INSURANCE INFORMATION WAS LOCATED INSIDE THE VEH.PASSENGER ADVISED HE HAD A CUT ON HIS WRIST AND HE A COMPLAINT OF PAIN TO HIS HEAD AFTER HITTING IT OFF THE REAR PASSENGER DOOR.

Driver 1 was traveling east bound on SR 46 in the right lane of the roadway. Driver 1 slowed to turn into 5621 W. SR 46 approximately 200 yards prior to that address. Driver 1 stated she activated her turn signal as she slowed. Driver 1 stated as she approached the entrance of 5621 W. SR 46 to begin her turn, she was struck from behind by Driver 2. Driver 1 was pushed forward approximately 25 yards and was struck a second time by Driver 2. Driver 1 then came to a stop. Driver 1 exited her vehicle to check on Driver 2 and found him semi-conscious. Driver 2 was transported by ambulance to the IU Emergency Department; both vehicles were towed from the scene. Neither driver appeared to be under the influence of drugs or alcohol.

Primary Factor: FAILURE TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY
NARRATIVE: D1 stated she was sitting at the stop sign at Stonelake Drive and 45/46 Bypass waiting to cross the intersection to head East on the Bypass. D1 stated she thought it was clear to cross the intersection and did not see V2. D1 stated she struck V2 in the driver side rear. D2 stated he was heading East on 45/46 Bypass.D2 stated that V1 came through the intersection and struck the driver side rear of his vehicle. D2 stated he lost control of his vehicle and it spun around and entered the West bound traffic and his vehicle came to a stop on the North side of the road. Witness 1 stated she was at the Quality Inn and witnessed V1 pull into the intersection and strike V2. W1 stated that V2 spun around several times and his vehicle came to a stop on the opposite side of the road.

V1 was traveling southeast on SR 45/46 approaching N. Headley Rd in the left lane. V2 is traveling southeast on SR 45/46 approaching N. Headley Rd in the right lane.D1 stated he was traveling southeast on SR 45/46 approaching N. Headley Road in the left lane. D1 stated he went to change lanes and did not see V2 in the right lane. D1 admitted that he switched into the right lane and collided with V2. V1 had no damage to the vehicle.D2 corroborated D1's version of events. D2 stated she applied her brakes and attempted to avoid the collision but was unable to do so. V2 had damage to the front driver side of the vehicle.

BOTH VEHICLES WERE SOUTH BOUND ON CURRY PIKE IN THE LEFT LANE.WITNESS WAS BEHIND VEHICLES, SAID V1 REAR ENDED V2, WHICH WAS STOPPING FOR ANOTHER CAR TRYING TO TURN LEFT INTO THE SPEEDWAY GAS STATION.D2 SAID HE WAS STOPPED IN TRAFFIC, AND WAS REAR ENDED BY V1.D1 SAID SHE CROSSED THE INTERSECTION, THEN SAW V2 STOPPING, TRIED TO BRAKE, BUT REAR ENDED V2.NO INJURIES REPORTED.
